comment.text:
This coffee shop is inside Oculus, pretty neat! Ordered a cup of coffee and it was alright. Also ordered a sweet (forgot its name) and it tasted pretty good. I guess an alright and good balances to be OK

Will definitely come here more often and give more tries

Located in the Oculus, seating available- pick from the individual tables or at the long communal table. Lots of choices for baked goods/pastries. Had chocolate croissant, gluten-free walnut brownie (dense and rich) and blueberry cheesecake (fresh berries, light and not so sweet). Priced between $4 - $6. Lavazza coffee brand, had decaf latte.
Service can be improved though. Easy ordering at the counter then pick up when called, but the 2 people there last Saturday were straight-faced, no smiles.
A bit on the expensive side but I loved my caramel latte. They used lavazza coffee beans which gave my drink an intense flavor balanced by caramel syrup.

We got macarons and they were yummy! All the macarons come with a crunchy, airy crust with a nice variety of fillings. Macarons are not the cheapest though at 1/$3 or 4/$11.

Vanilla - nice, cream filling. Not too sweet. My favorite!

Lavender - very fragrant and floral. Cream center

Pistachio - my second favorite. the nutty flavor really comes through.

Rose - a little more mild and less floral than lavender. I wished the flavor of the rose is stronger.

Passion fruit - it had a sweet-tart "jammy" filling. Nice

Blueberry - another one with a "jammy" center. It tastes more like grape to me somehow. Not my fave.

All of the macarons were excellent! It's a matter of preference which flavor you like more.

REFINED French cakes and pastries, excellent croissant and coffee.  Better than the surrounding cafe's for monring coffee.  however recently they have b egun to play modern pop music,  repetitive and loud,  and if they continue,  this will make it the worst of the cafes.  Need alittle quiet in the morning,  soothing music like old jazz or even... fifties or anything but modern radio music please.
Rickie Lee Jones,  tory amos,  carine bailey raye and all the jones sounding singers are nice early.  or dean martin and crooners.  or the ramones.  but please no modern hammerheads.  

Great food though.  some of the servers are better than others.  all it takes is a smile or a friendly word

Disappointing on all food items - pastries and sandwiches. Tried their macarons, tart, salmon sandwich, dessert pie, etc. and all were average or below average. I loved the Daniel fine dining, but pastries don't seem to be their strong suit. Does not live up to the Boulud name.

The WTC Oculus and the storied Boulud name both deserve better than this sad, corporate coffee shop has to offer.
My chai latte's principal flavor profile was aquatic, and my husband's coffee was so sweet he gagged on the first sip.
The cinnamon scone was solid, but uneventful.
At least they're keeping the prices low for such a tourist-adjacent area ($13.83 for both drinks and the scone.) But then again, with this food, they'd better.

This is my favorite bakery I stop by when I'm walking outside of the city and into the city. It's kind of my safe haven if I have to kill some time. Their coffee is good and their pastries are very good, I usually get a macaroon or almond croissant which always tastes fresh. And you can sit have a view of the oculus while contemplating your next steps or I usually wait for my friends to meet me here. They also have actual food and alcohol if you need something more Hardy.

Ordered some cakes today and it was just exquisite . They had a raspberry syrup / flavor inside . Tasted soooo good . Chocolate filling was so good . Was soft inside and very good taste . Almost tasted like black chocolate   good service and quick checkout . They also have other stuff like tarts , croissant etc . Good overall

Conveniently located in the Oculus right by the PATH entrance, Épicerie Boulud is a great place to grab coffee on the go or a snack. The shop is beautiful and bigger than it looks. They have a lot of food options, from salads to sandwiches and pastries. It is usually busy as this area is not only packed with tourists but also commuters (Fulton St subway station also accessible through Oculus) but I always end up finding a seat when I need. The workers are nice and checkout is super quick. They also have a bar inside. They do a great job at keeping the shop clean considering the volume of people that come in and out. On my last visit, I had a small Cobb salad that I really enjoyed. I usually come for coffee so don't have much to say on the food.

If you just want a quick drip coffee in the morning, skip this place. The drips aren't a quick grab like Starbucks. You have to wait along side the specialty drinks. I waited 18 minutes for a drip. Boo. Learned my lesson quick.  

Food is also kinda bland for the price you pay. I say skip this place and head to Starbucks upstairs or the other local eateries instead.

Even though you're in the oculus, it's not an inviting place to sit either. It feels like sitting in a bustling transportation hub, which is essentially what it is.

They gave a wrong drink for what we asked for

Way overpriced

Rushy and not the best quality of place
Worst ever

To the very unhappy, rude cashier: I'm sorry that you hate your job so much. Look around; there's lots of places hiring.

To her coworkers: I'm sorry you have to put up with her. If she talks to paying customers like that, I can only imagine how she treats her coworkers.

To future customers: order your food and enjoy it. Usually the places with the worst customer service have the best food. You know that, though.

It was a pricy coffee and cakes because of the location.  The store is right at the corner before people can get on the PATH train.  Now, the seating is back and you can enjoy your coffee.  You must try their cake when doing high tea.

This morning I ordered a drink and a water. Matcha typically takes them about 4 mins to make. After being cashed by the tall, dark woman I went for my water and then stood by the waiting area. The other African woman asked me if I had been charged for the yogurt and motioned towards my bag. I asked , "what?" until she asked what I was waiting for then I told her my drink and she left me alone. Seeing that the short, slim woman had just started my matcha, I went downstairs to refill my card. Afterall, the woman who cashed me and the other African woman know that I am waiting for a drink.
I come back 3 mins later (I'm aware of the time because there is a display for train departures and I'm watching a specific one) and there is no drink and the lady is not making it anymore.
I had to ask 3 times before the other African woman said that no one answered when it was called and turned away. I had to ask again then she said they would make me another one. I told them i would come back tomorrow as I do not have time.
But, after reflecting on this morning's experience, I will go back for a refund and never patronize this business again. The other African woman in the striped shirt asking me if I was charged for the yogurt, insinuating that I had stolen yogurt out of the refrigerator. Then knowingly tossing my drink when I was the only person waiting for one at the time is a perfect example of poor customer service. To be passively accused of stealing and then spitefully inconvenienced by someone who shares the same race as I is extremely disheartening and disrespectful. Also, how could it trust that something not be done to my drink in this environment where the other African woman was so comfortable with different unprofessional behaviors?
*I watch every morning as numbers are called and drinks sit because the call goes unanswered.  There was no reason my drink could not sit for less than 3 minutes.
I will be coming Thursday or Friday expecting my refund. And I do not have my receipt because when the tall darker woman asked me, I declined. Will include screenshot of my proof-of-purchase in this review.

Let me end by saying, the tall dark African woman has never given me reason to complain or write a review. This should in no way affect her.

I come here quite often for my morning coffee on the way to work. I usually get the cafe au lait and their chia seed pudding. Their chia seed pudding consists of oats and chia seeds soaked in coconut milk, with puréed mango and goji berries. The flavor combination is just so perfect and is the perfect portion for a quick breakfast or a treat. The service here is generally pretty quick and friendly. Their baked goods are also really good, especially their chocolate chip cookies. They do also have items that are made to order, but I have yet to try that. Would recommend!

The food is fresh, delicious and reasonably priced. We had extraordinarily friendly service from the bartender and left feeling that we'd had more than a delicious meal--we'd had one of those terrific New York moments.

Simple cafe off to the side in the Oculus (near the Apple store). Basic breakfast and lunch items with deals for happy hour for the after-work crowd.

Thursday morning, placed an order for pickup to beat any work-time rush, so was able to skip the line once I arrived. Ordered the Jambon de Paris and an Iced Cappucino ($14ish total). Breakfast sandwich is a combination of ham patty, egg, and cheese all inside a warm brioche bun. A bit on the greasy side, but overall fine flavor. Iced cappuccino didn't actually have any ice in it for some reason, although the drink was cold.

Okay option for breakfast, especially if there is no line. Something to try for grab and go items as well.
Horrible service and horrible coffee. Do not come here decided to give it a try and ended up just wasting our money. SMH

Was looking for a coffee and a cake/ bun/ treat somewhere warm and dry. In the age of Covid and no sitting in cafes this can be tricky.
Walked a few extra blocks to this spot, and ate in their "outside" area which is in the main section of the Oculus.
We had cappuccino, drip coffee, chocolate croissant, warm bread and jam. The warm bread and jam was excellent and made us both smile.

Worth dropping in if you need a civilised tea / coffee and snack and are taking a break from train / Path.

This review is based on their catering and not the in restaurant experience. For the last two years I have ordered the side dishes for Thanksgiving from Épicerie Boulud and not the turkey.

They have a very low overall rating on Yelp which is surprising based on the standard of the owner. I frequent the main restaurant Daniel and know the standard of food and service they hold themselves to. It looks like most of the low star rating reviews are based on the coffee, latte or the prices. If you want quality food you need to expect to pay the price. I can say very comfortably that I've also been extremely happy with the food and never got sick or felt uncomfortable from any of Daniel Boulud's establishments.

We ordered the Mac n Cheese, Chestnut Stuffing,  Pom's Purée ( mashed potato ), Green Beans and Mushroom Fricassee. The prices per dish run from $36 to $42 and each one serves at least 6 or 7 people in my opinion. The food is outstanding and the sides give a different flavor and experience to the meal.

You could cater your entire dinner or event if you want. Everything is pre-cooked and just needs about 30 to 40 minutes of reheating. I would highly recommend them for catering and hope most people use their common sense when deciding on trying them for everything else

I've frequented this place because of the proximity to work. I've tried their almond croissant, fresh squeezed juice, a Cuban sandwich, and their parfaits. Everything seemed pretty average at best, but the prices are high for sure - too high for what they actually are. But the convenient location works for me, so I keep coming back when I'm late to work and feel that I don't have many breakfast options.

But with average food and high prices, at least the service is always quick, the staff is always friendly, and the dining area is clean. So I'll continue coming in when I'm hungry and short on time.
I really love and recommend their cappuccino and pain au chocolate. Was very disappointed however with their caneles. Tried one and could not taste any rum in it.

I had a pistachio macaron and pain au chocolat.
The macaron wasn't too sugary, the texture was nice, but it wasn't as light as I hoped.

I would normally get a plain croissant to get an unbiased idea of the pastry quality, but they were out which was odd. The chocolate croissant had Nutella in it, so I enjoyed it thoroughly. The pastry quality itself was good, but not as fluffy or flavorful as I had hoped. My top pick for a croissant in NYC is still Maman.

This place was good for the US, and the price was reasonable for the quality, but they definitely weren't up to par with common Parisian standards (which is what they seem to be hyping themselves up as). I would've rated them higher if not for the hype.
Cashiers are terrible. They don't even know how to package a dessert. For a place that charges $3 a macron, one wild expect they'd at least know how to box the damn thing.

I saved up enough to get the Breakfast sandwich for lunch. It was served up within minutes of ordering, as I looked up from my phone, i was notified my sandwich was ready. Served on a really nice brioche bun. The egg was not runny, but even with that, it was delish. Thank you, Monsieur Boulud!

I was really hoping to have enjoyed the experience at Epicerie Boulud, but I did not enjoy the coffee or the croissant. The service is very good, but maybe next time I will just stick with the coffee.

They are in a great location - neighbors to the Apple store. Oh, and the best part is they're in the Oculus where there are plenty of other food shops and shopping.

This was a nice place to sit down and grab a bite to eat. I was waiting around for an Yelp event to start and decided to come here to see what I could get to snack on, or eat. To my surprise they had it all with reasonable prices. It was also happy hour. I was able to eat my chilli at the bar along with the drink I ordered. They had they own lil menu that you could order from, but I pick up from a hot food case, they had inside the store. They had other tables you could sit down at as well.

The glass of wine I ordered went well with the chilli, and the piece of bread I received with it was yummy as well. My chilli was hot and very meaty. It had black beans rather than red, I was ok with that, black beans are the best to me. The wine was a nice red Malbec, and for a small lil bar top, I found a seat quickly. The staff was awesome, and very helpful. If your in the area, or about to hop on the path, grab a bite, I would again.

Epicerie Boulud is not your typical fast food spot. Michelin-starred chef Daniel Boulud is the mastermind of Epicerie Boulud so the food is better and more creative than the usual food court fare (and of course the price reflects it). Epicerie Boulud has a good selection of beer and wine as well. If you were a fan of Boulud's now shuttered DBGB Kitchen & Bar, Epicerie Boulud has a great DBGB Hot Dog worthy of the name.

Complicated name for a rather simple fare served with reasonable pace. Busy location so it's setup to handle crowds but the seats get occupied fast by patrons and non-patrons alike. It's fairly small inside but has a bar, barista station, food (see pic for menu), and a grab-n-go (after you pay) shelves. Tried their veggie panini and it passed the dorm-room test (viz- you are in a dorm room without a proper kitchen and you need to make a panini that you are willing to eat).

I asked for an almond latte and was given a large cup of warm almond milk. Sensing my dissatisfaction, the kind ladies immediately addressed that they do not have almond syrup and if I'd like something different. Yes, a hazelnut latte super hot. This time it was hot (because no matter how extra hot you say *eye roll* the barista usually just ignores that and 95% of the time its barely that) and sweet and good.

I had the braided white baguette in the form of little fat leaflets, because it was the first time I'd seen the white one- usually its the pretzel one sitting by the register. It was nothing like their crusty soft, moist baguette that has been the object of my affection to my chagrin and the precarious shrug of my attending barista. Unperturbed, I asked to switch it out for the pretzel and they pulled the manager. Good thing, because while I wasn't going to mention my latte nincompoop.. I had it in my arsenal if I needed it.

She was the kindest, most soft spoken lady just like she looked- concerned she listened. I told her of how fond of the demi baguette I was and she stated it was the way its formed that maintained its moisture and promptly switched out the bland pretty thing I'd bought for the pretzel version and said if I didn't like it to let her know. We both looked at each other and I took a bite of the pretzel- meh. It was also subpar compared to what I know EB can do. I'll just take the demi- which she addressed in a flash.

That is service. While I don't mean to be such a bread or any food snob, I could not for another instant (because I have before, we all have), stand by and be unhappy with my order when it can be so easily amended. For over $8 for a cup of joe and a piece of bread, I hope that you would say so too if you are unhappy with your purchase. That was a big reason I buy into more locally vested and boutique/ gourmet bakeshops and restaurants, for their product and service as opposed to having someone heat up a poptart at Starbucks and pay over the moon for it. Not that there's anything wrong with that because I do that too. Often as a convenience or just  because you can't compare everything.

EB is still an amazing pastry shop, some beyond stellar creations but because it's so frequented it does drop its ball once in awhile (as far as I can tell). The staff- I'm not going to go there because while a lot of them look and act like they are on a service line, there are some genuine sweet people I've encountered thus far.

I need to get a cup of coffee while waiting for some friends on the day of my visit. It is the only coffee spot located in the center of Oculus  - the advantage of this place is that it is close to everything that Oculus has to offer.  A perfect meeting place. As expected the price of their commodity  is higher because of its location.

It has good seating plan - has good view of the commuters and tourists that are going either   way ,a  perfect stand to be a witness to  all that is happening.  Clean and modern  coffee shop . Wifi is free.

Exquisite quiche. Ordered the quiche Parisienne which was oozing with gruyere and hearty chunks of ham and veggie in a fluffy egg pie! Flakey, melt in your mouth crust. It came with a nice side salad in a lemony vinaigrette. I also enjoy their iced matcha lattes which are large in size (the small) with no added sweetness like at Starbucks. Would highly recommend this spot -- I believe they host happy hour too. Be warned that the prices here are high, but it is a French pastry shop in FiDi so no surprise.

The food may look good but it's not worth the wait and aggravation.
I decided to pick up something sweet after lunch so keeping it simple, get one of their desserts.  It's in the display, all ready, just need to put in box, put in bag with utensils and maybe some napkins and it's good to go...
NOPE...not the case....I've waited 6-7 minutes....the cashier had to tell the staff 3 times to pack the coffee cake to go...but the staff were busy filling up the sauces and packing things away.  The line to order was getting longer...

After I got my cake, the lady just handed to me in a box with a fork to go.
I guess no bag was needed for to go orders..good thing it's a small item so I can hold it in my hand...but can you imagine shoving a sandwich, a drink and dessert and THEN asking if you need a bag?

It seems like only 2 people running the show at 2pm so maybe better to go when it's super busy as they might be quicker...or super slow with less people.

And the food...the coffee chocolate gateau was rated 1 star out of 5 as it's only a mediocre cake with a hint of chocolate and coffee.  It's not worth $6.50.  It's worth more around $4.00 and I expected better quality for $6.50 so my rating is graded based on that bracket.

We had coffee and a chocolate croissant. That was it. Prices are outrageous, as are all things in the area, but that's what it is. My husband had a mocha latte, I had regular coffee. He loved the chocolate croissant.

One thing I will say is that even though the place was dead, it took forever to get the mocha latte.

Popped into this location last Tuesday with an out of town guest, to grab a nice glass of vino after a long work day. This is one of several locations in the city, in The Occulus Mall downtown.

Has a nice French Chardonnay, Manoir. Great price for the glass. Our server Steven was very professional and attentive. We ordered a quick appetizer. Bread with a simply fab olive/marcona olive tapenade, I am craving it right now. Yummo!!

I wish they sold the tapenade to bring home but would be a seriously addicting problem for me.. I'd end up broke and probably gain a gazillion LBS.

Highly recommend if in the area, quality food and great service.

We only had desserts there, and loved both of them. The pecan pie was good and the chocolate mousse was really great! Everything else looked heavenly and the  sweets especially are so carefully made and look special.

The staff needs improving or better training.  Was once served lukewarm coffee; another time waited an unreasonably long time for a beer because the bar person was trying to open a bottle of wine and didn't know how; and the cubano was unreasonably sticky.

To be fair, the coffee was ultimately fixed and the beer was good. And this place is a relaxing retreat from the hustle.  Hence the 3 star review (counts both good and bad).
Baguette was hard to see/find but the service there was great. Everyone loved the baguette.

Ugh. I have a love/hate relationship with this place.
First thing's first, the food is amazing. All the baked goods; cakes, cookies, croissants, everything. I've had every single sweet thing on the menu since they've opened and every item was nothing short of stellar.

HOWEVER. The service is absolutely terrible. There is no queue so everyone stands around or cuts you in line. The staff is awful. Half of them are rude, the other half is clueless, and maybe 1-2 people are actually helpful. I'm typically very patient but my god, I HATE going here. Nowadays, I just order ahead on an app (Ritual) just to avoid all the nonsense. I've had wrong orders, been skipped in line, selectively ignored, had my card snatched, been charged the wrong items. You name it. Clearly an under-trained and underpaid staff. The turnover is ridiculous too. I see new faces every month. It's unfortunate because the prices are rather high so I'd expect experienced and decent service.

But nevertheless I still go every week and deal with the bad service because I know the baked goods are incredible. My family adores the cakes and croissants. My fiance loves their basque cake and I think their croissants are top 5 in the city. I really do wish they'd just get their act together. Sometimes I have to force myself to walk past the bakery because I don't want to ruin my day with their terrible service.

Wanted to grab a quick late lunch here. Ordered the Suckling Pig Cubana. Waited 22 minutes and hadn't gotten it yet. Followed up on my order. Waited another 5 minutes, then finally got my sandwich. I really wanted it to be good given I had to wait nearly half an hour for it, but it was just super average (or even a little below average). I would not purchase again. I would have given 3 stars, but will give this place 2 stars instead because of the long wait.

The location is stunning and the chairs have super comfortable cushions. I feel like I am sitting in the future. Literally the view underground is breathtaking. However, food is expensive. I know location  location...drinks are OK, but food is a bit overpriced.

They have a hh Monday to Friday 4-7 so that may be worth checking out. Great place to grab a cup of coffee and enjoy the stunning building design of the Oculus!

They have ALWAYS messed up my coffee ! I gave them many chances.. first time they totally gave me a different order , second time they put whole milk instead of almond and thirdly they gave me an iced macchiato instead of hot which I had asked them . Overpriced and the people working there are clueless or rude  with zero customer service. Never again !

Conveniently located on my way to and from work. Stopped in a few times during HH for reasonably priced food and drinks. Nothing exciting but was really going for the ambiance. Place kept clean and staff were friendly enough. Self service if you would like to use their "out door space" as in the space outside of their bar area which is not outside. This after all is in a mall of sorts.

Oily oily oily. Mr. Boulud, have you even tried the foods being served from this namesake?

Been meaning to check this place out since it's always crowded. What a mistake. We got the Cubano and the Jamon sandwiches. Warmed up and just sopping with oil.  I wish I took photos but my fingers were so oily!

The seating is also hit or miss. Lots of tourists sitting just to chill.

Pass.

I came here for dinner on a Wednesday night.  I ordered a glass of Chardonnay white wine at the bar since they have happy hour 4-7pm Monday-Wednesday.  Wines (red, white, rose, cava) are $6 and beer is $5.  We also ordered a Cobb salad, paprika steak sandwich, an epi baguette, and a pear chestnut St Honore dessert at the counter.  The chicken in the Cobb salad and the steak in the sandwich were both bland.  The epi baguette was a bit stale.  The only delicious thing was the dessert - pear chestnut St Honore.  The cream puffs were crisp on the outside and had delectable chestnut paste inside.  The food was okay but not seasoned well and the portions were small for the price.  I would just skip the food and just have dessert.  The drinks for happy hour were decently priced though, $5-$6 so having a drink here before your commute back home to NJ is not a bad idea.

This review is for the bar only.

The person who came up with happy hour must've been a teetotaler. What's the point of having happy hour for only 3 days a week -- from Monday to Wednesday? Happy hour options are very limited, $5 for a pint of Stella Artois and $6 for white, red and rosé. If you wanna get other draft or bottled beer, be prepared to pay at least $9-11. I'm sure you think ppl who work in this area do have disposable income, but I can guarantee you will not get any returned customers cuz of your ridiculous pricing.

Patrons, do me a favor. Save your money and get out of The Oculus. There are tons of great bars out there in FiDi. Better yet, get a six pack of any beer cuz it may be cheaper than drinking here.

This is a pretty pricey lunch spot, but one of the only few places to eat in the World Trade Center transit hub.

I think what I ordered was a meal for ants... The half a sandwich was closer to the size  of a quarter of a sandwich and the soup portion was equally small.

The food was very good but I left hungry... so if you have an appetite you may need to order two lunches.

Pastries: Top notch, couldn't be better. Do I really need to tell you that? I've sampled many of them. Best croissant in the city.

But the one star is removed because the coffee is poorly done. I asked for a small iced latte, they drowned a single short shot of espresso in 16 ounces (a small should be more like 12 - that would allow just one shot of coffee to affect the taste more) of 'regular' milk, which was either half and half or whole milk. Other coffee shops would call that a medium.

For the record, the default cow milk for lattes is 2% at every other coffee shop I've worked at or been to, because it's a less overwhelming flavor than whole, and because it's easier to steam to froth.

I felt like I was drinking an enormous iced cafe breve, with half of the coffee that should have been used for the cup size.

Stopped in after getting off Path train. The coffee was flavorful and strong, just like I like it. The almond croissant was loaded with almond paste. Can easily be shared with two or three people. Would definitely go back. Service was courteous and quick.

Get the Thai style pork chop! It was delicious and actually reminded me of the way my mom made pork chops growing up. It was a large portion and the staff were so friendly upon pickup. Will definitely be back.

SO GOOD! Not the fanciest interior, but the vibes were nice and the service was friendly and fast! I wish I had pictures, but we got the coconut soup, the hot and sour soup, and the curry puffs. Everything was delicious!! I wish I lived in NYC because I would 100% become a regular customer at this restaurant. I highly recommend :)

Hidden gem in Fidi. Literally hidden... in a basement. I came in with a colleague otherwise I don't think I would've found this place. Great spot for lunch. Make sure to ask for their lunch especial when ordering. I had the tom yum soup noodles and it was delicious.  My colleague had the pad Thai and it looked yummy too.

Love this place! I order take out from here often but came into the restaurant for the first time today. It's beautiful! Very spacious and kind staff. I usually get curry puffs, green curry, spring rolls, and chicken satay. All are delicious. Got the Thai Iced Coffee today and was a big fan. I wasn't aware that it would be strawberry flavor but was pleasantly surprised. Will be bringing friends for dinner soon!

I don't have my degree in Yelp Psychology yet, so I can't say for sure whether I was influenced at all by the 2.5-star rating that I saw after I ordered but before my Zuccotti Park picnic.

The papaya salad was dreary, with few flourishes and no spice. But I'd return for the massaman curry, which had a kick that was decent if below Queens level, and a respectable variety of fresh vegetables. Hope to report back soon on the pork chop(s).
Great food. The service is very efficient and quick. The location have a great environment and decor.

Nasty server. Screwed up the order then started yelling at the customer instead of fixing it. I stopped going there years ago when they'd failed their health inspection. Same ole shit. Much worse w attitude.

PS after I confronted her on the peanut sauce dish not being cooked in said sauce she claims it's not a thai restaurant  why the fake name then?

Super tasty, fast and affordable deliciousness! Get the $12 chicken green curry extra spicy lunch special that comes with a lovely tofu, greens and glass noodle soup. Ignore the dingy surrounding and get it to go.

It's great that they got a food order in on time for an office meeting my company had on semi short notice but 2 big things to address:

1. Tips are NOT required by law and someone needs to tell the delivery guy that you don't get to extort tips from people by withholding their food.  Businesses can call in tips and it's not a good idea to go bother support staff, interns or other people who aren't management about matters of tip.  This alienates people who you're supposedly happy are PAYING CUSTOMERS & can lead to unemployment because the business has to close from bad press.

2. The menu should list hot items as it's not self-explanatory or listed online.  I ordered the cashew chicken and it was very spicy.  It was good and I finished it but not easily and I'm not big on hot, spicy food.  A warning would have been a huge help.

If these things were corrected, then this place would be much better.

This place is a no fuss, quality for the money Thai food. I went here in a party of two and we both had an incredible time. Start dinner off with a nice Thai beer and rode that bad lad into the entrees for a great evening.

The serving size was excellent for dinner. I finished my meal and was able to help my company who had a little left on their plate afterwards. The setting is no frills and the service is fast. I will eat here again for a quality meal.

I ordered off this place using Uber Eats pickup since this is quite close to my office. I ordered a little before 12pm and my order was ready within 5 min! Food was delicious and pretty good portion too. I ordered fried tofu app and massaman curry with chicken. My first time ordering that curry and it was so flavorful and tasty! Cleared my stuffy sinuses immediately. Tofu was good too. Crispy with the sweet sauce. Will definitely be ordering from them again.

My review is going to be mainly based on the service of this establishment and while I think the food was great and I really did like the massaman curry with chicken that I ordered- it's what happened, leading up to my food delivery that I really want to highlight. So I ordered using seamless and for whatever reason (long day, I was exhausted!) I didn't double check the delivery address and had the order confirmed for a different address than my house. My office! I live pretty close to work which is why they're both in the delivery range for this restaurant. I didn't realize my mistake until I got a call from my office lobby, on a Tuesday evening once I had already left work- asking me to come down to the office lobby to grab my food. Once I realized I requested the concierge to pass the phone to the delivery guy and after a brief inconclusive back & forth he hung up. Within minutes I then received a call from the restaurant and the lady (assume manager/owner) basically asked me for my correct address and out of the kindness of her heart said they will send me a new order!!! The previous order had been left in my office building already and so for no extra cost to me she offered to prepare a fresh order and send it over to my apartment this time! And get this, this the part that truly won me over- she says it'll be a bit of a wait so just want you to be aware of the delay and any inconvenience because of it....no words. I thanked her and sure enough within the next 20 minutes my food was dropped off at my door. Situations like this are really an opportunity for a business to show their customer service and compassion- everyone makes mistakes and while they could've charged me for a new order, they chose not to! I'm impressed :)

Me and my friend ate here and the food was delicious. However the server was nasty and told me "here in New York and in America they tip".  Me and my friend did tip but it wasn't as much as she wanted. I would've tipped more but I didn't have much money and wanted to eat good food. I've lived in New York and America my whole life. Me and my friend paid and got a nasty attitude for a tip. Never coming back here again.

Dang... I forgot to check Yelp again and didn't realize I ordered from here a year ago. I also ordered the exact same thing and it was just as bad as a year ago. Maybe I ate year old food. Food was bland and I didn't even the majority of the shrimp, that's how bad it was.

Lots of places are suffering during Covid 19 and I will pary for many business owner especially a restaurant to be able yo open the place again. So many places don't have outside seats and the inside seats just allow to open. Wish that De blasio won't close down the city again.

My friend and I was in downtown Manhattan for a  her business and after meeting we went to 22 Tgai Culsine for food. We had Bangkok fish cake for start and had lunch special, pad Tgai shrimp, Pad see ew ans Sweet basil. Food are tropical Tgai -American food. Service is nice and friendly. It seems like only us in the place at that time. Just so sad how this pandemic affects the NYC lives.

Honestly, if I could give them zero stars I would. The food was terrible. We got a pad see ew and a pad thai. It was bland and had a bit of a weird aftertaste. We didn't finish our food. On top of that, the delivery guy was so rude and demanded a bigger tip. I'm a small female who gets intimidated so I ran around my house trying to find some cash. Luckily at that time I did have some cash (I never do). So I handed it to him and he gave me the food at that point. I've never seen that before. I had given him a tip already and he demanded more. Safe to say, I will never order from them again. Everyone please avoid this place.

22 Thai cuisine is to die for! First time coming back after the pandemic and was so happy. Staff follows covid guidelines and place is clean. I've been here multiple times and I always get the massaman curry which comes with a side of white rice. We love our waiter and all staff. This is my favorite place in New York City for curry!

This Thai spot is just decent. The pad thai that they have doesn't have much ingredients in it and actually really little of bean sprouts/egg with some pieces of meat (of your choice). The noodles weren't seasoned that well either. I tried their Thai angel wings as well which were pretty good. They were big pieces of chicken wings and pretty crispy. It came with sauce but it really didn't need it. Overall, good prices for decent quality food.

I randomly stumbled on this place. I work nearby. I have been here twice already.  the chicken satay, is so fresh and airy. Pulls apart easly. The beef pad se ew was divine. The peanut lover is a crispy choice of protein in a bed of steamed broccoli and a side of white rice. It come with peanut sauce to pour over. I must say the peanut sauce was one of the best I ever had. Non of the food was super greasy and it all tasted fresh  don't mind the decor ( needs and upgrade) but stay for the food. Come hungry.

I work near this restaurant and go there for lunch all the time. The place is big and always has empty tables, food is good in my opinion, the problem this restaurant has is one hostess/waitress in particular (everyone else is so nice and friendly). She is so rude, I have never come across anything like it in NYC, and I have lived here all my life and have been out to a lot of different places all over the city, including outer boroughs. First, when I and my lunch companion paid with credit cards for our lunches, she stood there while we were signing the receipts and demanded we indicate the tip on the receipts not knowing that we were going to leave the tip in cash and when we left it in cash, she said that it is too little. I told her that she has got some nerve to first demand tip and then demand a bigger tip. I have not been back to that place in several weeks because of this and when I went back a few times, everything was great with other servers I had. Then, I came there when this young/blonde server was there again and this time she threw us out of the restaurant after I complained that we had waited 25 minutes for the soup that comes before the meal while our lunch hour is only 1 hour long. She started loudly asking other patrons at the restaurant what time they all came there saying "because this lady thinks she has been waiting for her soup too long." They were all stunned and shocked at her behavior.  I can only assume that her behavior means she is related to the owner of the restaurant to allow herself to throw people out of the restaurant for something like this, she forcefully grabbed my arm too. She is lucky I did not call the police on her for assault as I had to get back to work for a meeting. One can say that this is just some odd incident one person had with this young woman, but I have read other reviews saying people got rude service at this restaurant and since I eat there all the time and never ever had any issue with anyone else but her, I am pretty sure their negative experiences are stemming from the same woman. All I can say, if you go there, don't piss her off.

This place has gone seriously down hill.

Flavorless, dry and seriously overcooked. Chicken pad Thai was overflowing with tasteless, seemingly boiled chicken. Sauce is no where to be found. Rice noodles are so overcooked they fall apart when you try to pick them up

Somehow tofu found its way into my Thai pineapple fried rice (vegetable), which was also mushy from being overcooked. The vegetables that were included were all a dull/flat color from also being overcooked

The only reason I'm giving them one star is because they're supposedly refunding me...by sending one of their delivery me to come PICK UP my food in order to credit me

NASTY!!!!!!!!

I ordered tofu panang curry and I got tofu with a small drizzle of curry. Like the ratio is just horrifying. My kids were scared that they would turn into tofu. This is inedible. I WASTED MY MONEY NEVER GO HERE BOOOOO

They say there's no bad food in NYC, well unfortunately we found it. Ordered the panang curry and the chicken was rubbery. Vegetables were cooked well, but sauce was watery. Got fooled by the Google reviews, should have checked here first. Hated that we wasted one of our meals on this. I'm reviewing so that hopefully that doesn't happen to anyone else!

I came here couple times! I find they moved to new location in 59 Nassau st ! Have be under the new mangerment! But I saw still have same chefs!
I am so happy ! I ordered same before! Tom yum soup.it was so good !
I come here often for the Sam Rod's Chicken meal (boneless sweet chilli chicken with broccoli and white rice); $11.98 well spent!

Customer service was terrible. Picked up 2 orders and they did not come with rice.  Called the restaurant and they said what should we do? I mean least you can do is offer to replace it. I will not spend any more on this place
The delivery person was very rude and would not give me my food until I gave him a tip. Furthermore, the place messed up my order. I asked for chicken and received shrimp.

It doesn't surprise me to see other poor reviews from my fellow Yelpers on this one.

I ordered pad thai and and green curry, two things that I think are pretty reliable when ordering take out. Well, apparently not... from 22 Thai Cuisine at least.

I placed a delivery order on Seamless at 1:45pm, and my food didnt arrive until after 3:30pm. Around an hour after I placed it, I called the restaurant to ask if there was some type of problem. The woman I spoke to said it had been delivered already, so I walked downstairs to ask my doorman if someone dropped it off. Well, there was still no food. About 30 minutes later I get a door buzz from the delivery man. Maybe he got lost?

By this time I was starving, and had a bite of the green curry, which I thought was excellent. I  warmed up the pad thai since it was cold by now, and it is the worst pad thai I have ever had. Seriously. Literally no flavor, overcooked and starchy noodles... just absolutely awful.

Very disappointed.
So good food and very friendly service. I recommend this place . I think you should try if you like Thai food and go to downtown Manhattan.

I got the pad kee mao and really enjoyed it! The noodles were incredibly soft and tender and not at all mushy. I also really enjoyed the sauce which was not spicy at all (a plus for people who can't really deal with spiciness). We also got the mango stick rice. Though the rice portion was small, the mangos were fresh. Lastly, the staff was friendly. Given the food quality and price, I'd go back for a work lunch or after work meal

It was a busy day at work and I forgot to Yelp this place before ordering my lunch on Seamless for delivery. I was craving some spicy noodle soup so I ordered tom yum noodle soup with chicken from their regular menu. The noodles and the soup came together in a quart sized container and I'm sure you guys already can guess.... Of course it was soggy. I don't understand why they do not separate the noodles and the soup... I would never order from this place again. I finished it and I was still hungry. What a wasteful $16..

Hair in the food and MSG poisoning

My first mistake was to accept another plate of the food when I found a hair in my meal and brought it back to the food server.  They did not seem surprised and just asked if I wanted a replacement. I was still hungry, so I accepted. I ended up in the emergency room that evening due to a sever reaction to what the doctor thought was MSG related chest pain. I will never go back there again.
Passing into this  restaurant, the waiter's service  is awesome, very friendly. Recommend this pork chop thai style and It's  tender and juicy, really delicious!
Everything i have ordered from this place has always been delicious.Definitely a favorite.They are also very courteous,prompt,super friendly.Love this place!
Good spot with good food.  The food was ready when we got there. Tasty and variable spices available.

I definitely will not be going back to this place. It was my first time trying it, so I played it safe with the chicken pad thai. Well, at least I thought I was playing it safe. While the serving size was large, the food was completely bland. There was no seasoning or spice in the noodles whatsoever.

Also, the person answering the phone did not tell me the minimum for credit cards was $15. Luckily, I had cash before I came.

This spot is literally garbage. I wish I could give it ZERO stars. I feel like I'm wasting my time writing this review, but I want the people who will read this to NOT waste their hard earned money like I did.

There are no other words that I can use to describe their undercooked rice and undercooked noodles. They served us the oldest rice I've ever tasted in my life. If you're gonna use old rice, at-least add water to make the rice soft again, maybe leave it on the heat a bit longer? The Pad Thai was flavorless, undercooked and tasted just as bad as the fried rice. I gave the rice and noodles back the same way I got it, and the server didn't even ask me if the food was good because she KNEW it was GARBAGE. If I could curse on this post, I literally write how bad this food was. I'd rather starve to death before I ever take a bite of this place again.

People are too harsh with their review! This place deserves more than the rating listed. Or maybe people don't know Thai Food and have extremely weird expectations. I've been to many Thai restaurants and had authentic thai food from family friends. The shrimp pad Thai here had all the tastes that a pad Thai should have. Penang curry was coconuty and delicious. I only wished for more basil leaves. The staff was nice and checked on us frequently, the place was clean. I will definitely try again and the price is pretty cheap compare to other Thai restaurants in the area. You're paying low prices, you can't expect fine dinning. The price and the food in my opinion is just right!

Good food but ridiculous to charge $2.00 to add eggplant to a VEGGIE & tofu curry. A whole eggplant costs like $1.00 at the grocery store, and many (most) green curries already come with eggplant, so what's the big deal adding a couple pieces to a red curry? Any other Thai restaurant I've made this request to has never charged anything because it's just silly. $1.00 would be annoying but semi reasonable - but $2.00? Seems like a small thing but it's quite irritating. Please rethink this.

Never coming back here again. First of all, the waitress was not even serving us. She left a bunch of forks and knives on a random napkin and expected us to pass them around to each other.. so what am I tipping you for? Regarding the food, I got the Mint Thai Fried Rice and it was so bland. The chicken tasted old, dry, and unflavored at all. There was no sauce and the oil tasted old. Normally I am not that picky and always end up finishing my food but I couldn't with this dish. Also, my coworker ordered the same dish and for some reason his portion was twice as big as mine. Angel and Evil was not a lunch special but my coworker enjoyed it. The mussels were a good portion and the shrimp tasted fresh. The food took forever to come out and we were on our lunch break. The chicken broth soup tasted like water and the silverware was old and looked unclean. Everyone in my table felt that this meal was not authentic and lacked flavor beside the seafood dish. I'm disappointed. This location used to be a Chinese restaurant that was so good and I'm upset we can't come back here for good food.

Beware. I had an upset stomach when I got home.

I ordered for take out and the order was incomplete. The taste is bad and the service is even worst. I called about the missing items and they wanted me to waste my time going back. Terrible service ! Never again !!

This is my goto spot for lunch/dinner especially when its a rainy or cold day. Ive dined here but i would really prefer taking it to go. Restaurant is located in the basement level with plenty of tables. Theres a japanese sushi bar on the side, havent tried yet. The girls at the register are always nice and quick w taking ur order. I love their curry, usually get the 22 thai curry which comes w mushrooms, red peppers, baby corn and ur choice of protein.. i usually pick tofu w it. Ive had their pad kee mao noodles and it was very good! My gf had their pad thai and raves abt it. Solid spot for lunch or dinner if ure craving thai!

We thought the food was exceptionally good. The green salad, the vegetable crispy rolls, the pork chop, the angel wings, and the pad Thai rice noodles and the pad see Ew--all excellent. We shall definitely return for another excellent meal.

The place speaks for itself-- my dad always taught me, if the restaurant is empty during lunch hours in a busy neighborhood, don't waste your time.

The food was not good-- for some reason, the Pad Thai was super sticky.. which I have never seen before. The salad with the orange sauce tasted like it came out of the freezer.

Overall, I DO NOT recommend this place due to the taste of the food I ordered.

It's Friday, lunch time. I gave in and ordered the Pad Thai noodles lunch special (includes chicken broth). Boy oh boy. SOOO disappointed. It tastes more like Chinese food than Thai at a Thai restaurant. Using Chinese ingredients to imitate Thai flavors. SMH. PLUS, it included a wedge of lemon. It typically includes a wedge of lime. C'mon, price of limes have decreased.

I've had its Pad See Eww. Ditto. Disappointing.

A good Thai restaurant and can accommodate large number of people. The food is good and the employees are kind. Loved Pad Thai noodles and Panang Curry.
Must visit.

I normally get the paradise shrimp which is great. Today I had the pad Thai, insanely dry and no flavor at all, just tasted like noodles with no sauce. I literally think they forgot the sauce.

And they didn't even include chop sticks....

I'm not the type to write bad posts of restaurants because I know it's hard to survive in the city and I want to respect someone's livelihood. But this was the worst Thai food I have ever had.

First things first. Pad Thai. A staple of Thai cuisine. It is how most people are introduced to Thai food (including me). A lot of restaurants don't have authentic pad Thai, and I'm not complaining, but wow I have no idea what country this restaurant's pad Thai was inspired from.
Their Pad Thai tasted like it was only flavored with soy sauce and had weird flavorless pieces of what looked like brown sponge. It wasn't sweet or savory. It was palatable after drowning the noodles in Sriracha. Btw I ordered a chicken pad Thai and let's not even go into the mystery chicken meat territory.  

Chicken salad is I guess their version of larb gai. It lacked flavor, the ground chicken tasted off, it had huge chunks of mint leaves still attached to the stem, and had only 1 leaf of napa cabbage (it would taste so much better if it was on top of lettuce).

By no means am I a professional food critic, but I have had my share of pad thai and larb gai. Pleaaaase do not order from here.
Love this place.The order so far has always been correct,Come SUPER quick and of course del

If you're looking for the world's worst chicken pad thai. Well, folks, you don't have to look far. It was so awful that I had to throw it out. The delivery guy has no sense of direction or knows how to read delivery instructions. And that's why you didn't get a tip, which is not just solely based on the fact that you fisted the receipt in my face while yelling. SMH never again. ****Warning**** this place is garbage!!!! Anyone that knows how I review places know that I don't give bad reviews, just honest ones. Just so you know that 1 star is a really a big fat ZERO!!!!!

Great quality pizza at an affordable price! This spot is closeby to many competing pizzerias in the area and decided to check it out during my stay in the area. The pizza slices here were only $1.50 (what a steal!) for their cheese.

Pizza Slice: Decent size cheese pizza slice. Great quality for what you pay for. Perfect for something quick in the area.

This spot is more of a takeout spot as there's limited seating. Overall, a recommended spot for cheap eats in the Financial District area.

2 slices with beverage of choice for $3.99
Honestly the best bang for the buck!
The pizza is nice and cheesy, the crust is crunchy.
Highly recommend!
Service is super quick, you get the pizza basically right away. Ambiance wise, no seating area so it's to go style.

This was our first stop in NYC after checking into our hotel. 2 Bros is catacorner from our hotel (The Artezen) and although we had other NY pizzerias bookmarked to try out, we didn't know there would be a hole in the wall like this right across the street, so we had to try it!!

2 big slices of pizza and a soda for $3.99! The line moved quickly and we stood outside at one of the 2-3 standing tables on the sidewalk and gobbled up our pizza. This whole experience set the tone for our visit because coming from Texas, we're used to people sitting at their own table or otherwise in their own space. Not in NYC! A guy walked up and threw his plate of pizza and soda right on "our" table, didn't bother speaking, and just continued his phone conversation while eating. And don't get me wrong. We were not at all offended. We didn't expect any sort of southern courtesies because...we were no longer in the south!!

Great pizza and we returned another day.

Decent quick pizza. I got the supreme and it tasted like a Costco supreme with a crunchier crust. Cheese and toppings easily fall off and doesn't hold well when you fold it in half which was a little annoying. Spent $4

They were very disappointing for a pizza joint in NYC. However and I underline this, if you want cheap pizza this is your place. I got 4 slices of pizza and a canned soda for $10. So inexpensive but not tasty at all.
The best experience is the owner at the cashier. Tells you exactly how he feels about your order, if you made a mistake, or if you forgot to ask for something beforehand. Lol. New York sass at its best. Love it

I came to this 2 Bros Pizza location as I was in the area and wanted something convenient and fast. It tasted as what you would expect, cheap and on the bland side. Got the 2 slices of pizza and a can of soda for $4. Different assortment available but stuck with the cheese.

Overall, it's a cheap slice of pizza, you can't expect too much.

After seeing the long line at Joe's Pizza, we backtracked to 2 Bros Pizza. What a great decision that was. 2 Bros Pizza had no line. We walked in, picked out our slices and drinks, paid, and ate on the sidewalk. From our vantage point, we could watch them toss the pizza dough as we ate. The slices are large and reasonably priced. They don't have seating. Overall, we enjoyed our lunch and recommend this pizzeria to others!

I was strolling around late night and noticed they had a deal for $4 which includes 2 slices and a can of soda. Figured I give it a try but I was a bit disappointed. The cheese to sauce ratio was a bit off and the crust wasn't as crunchy as I would like it. Pepperoni was actually good but there were only a few pcs on my slice. Service late at night was standard NY haha and the interior was more just like a order and p/u window. No place to stand and eat. But you can take it to go in a bag. But honestly, if you don't want to splurge on pizza, this is your spot
Solid $2 slice of nyc pizza . Perfect for a late night city snack. Definitely would recommend
Cheap pizza near wall street. Ok nothing impressive. $3.99 for cheese pizza and a soda.
Complete trash. Rude customer service. Incorrect charges on my card. Don't go here. Joe's is trash too. I recommend Little Italy.

Line is never too long. The guys are super helpful. Pizza and a drink combo is priced super well. The pizza is definitely amazing as well. Ready in minutes. Would definitely recommend and would definitely go again!

Well...the price has gone up to $1.50 from a dollar, but that's pretty much everything these days.

The taste of this inexpensive pizza is consistent with other locations around the city. A little "sandy" consistency of the crust.  More cheese than sauce.  and a heavy garlicy or salty taste to it overall.  It's ok in a pinch or when you're really on a tight budget but wouldn't be my first choice.

Staff was friendly and helpful.  Conveniently located.
Convenient pizza location in fidi with typical nyc pizza - quick service, although a bit sad the price of a slice has gone up from a dollar a slice (but what hasn't)
A great stop for a cheap slice of pie. Only $1.50 for a slice of cheese and they are huge. There are high tables to stand by on the sidewalk
This was a fine piece of pizza - VERY inexpensive -- so a great deal but nothing remarkable about the pizza.  It was good and did the trick and easy on the pocket.

2 Bros is one of the cheaper ways to eat pizza in New York. However, I'm not sure if I'd recommend this for the true New York pizza experience.

I had the pepperoni slice and it was around $2 which is really cheap compared to all of the other pricey options in Manhattan.

That being said, the cheese on the pizza tasted a bit odd and the pepperoni on the pizza was tasted plasticky.

We've been going to Joe's pizza down the street multiple times and having to wait in crowds for a good pizza. 2 Bros has no line, cheaper and taste just as good but different. More cheese, a little less sauce but still good for a quick and easy slice. 9 year old and wife approved.

Good pizza, consistent bad attitude. I'm from the neighborhood and am in here regularly - at least once a week. The guys never smile, say hi, nothing personal at all. Barks at customers to tell him their order. I actually dread going in but the pizza is good so I still go. New management would serve this place well.

guy at register who is the owner was constantly checking out my girlfriend the whole time we were there and they sass you for no reason when your trying to purchase!! other two bros locations are alright but this one is going down the tubes

Okay pizza at 2am when you are on your way back to your hotel after a night out in NYC. Decent prices and good selection. The fact that they are open late was awesome and we were so glad to find something to eat at that hour!

These guys are making some of the best, thin crust pizza in Fidi! Look at their selection of different pies behind the counter and salivate. Supreme, Meat Lovers, Veggie ,White, Regular, Mushroom&Pepperoni, all are GREAT! Open late & great value. Highly recommended!

I've been there about 3-4 times already and let me tell you. The guy making the pizzas is always looking at the female customers with eyes that make you want to run out the store, so uncomfortable when he's by the way he looks up and down at you, females only..... and when he's not doing anything his hands are in the cheese playing with it..

Let me start by saying I went to war for Jin's. I used to work 3 minutes away from Jin's, and became known at work as the guy who always wanted to eat Jin's, to the point where it probably affected my credibility in suggesting restaurants to coworkers. Whenever a group of us were deciding where to eat that day, I became synonymous for being the Jin advocate; they wouldn't even need to ask what I wanted to eat.

But all along, I think I was probably overcompensating for the fact that I knew it wasn't going to be a popular choice among my coworkers (who represent New Yorkers at large).

Why?

Jin's Asian Empire tries to be the jack-of-all-trades, and gets a bad rap in a city that demands its restaurants conform to the unwritten rule of specializing or narrowing yourself to one cuisine. New York is a city where boutique ramen bistros, dumpling houses, and meatball shops can exist, and even thrive. New Yorkers disdain the big conglomerates and the business owners trying to offer it all.

That explains why Jin's currently sits at a 2-star rating on Yelp.

But let's be honest; this place isn't half that bad. Doesn't everyone crave the familiarity of going to a place that gives good bang for your buck and has lots of options? Eating here 40+ times, I don't think I ever had a repulsive experience; it was always consistent. Sure, it wasn't the best food in the area, but for a weekday lunch it was what I wanted when I didn't want to rack my brain thinking about the perfect lunch. Even in NYC, there is room for a place like this, and we should be happy it exists. Slow and steady wins the race.

Having successfully convinced my coworkers to come here 10+ times (with parties larger than 5), we probably gained a lot of aggregate utility  from every person being able to pick the cuisine they were most strongly craving that day (whether it be Japanese, Chinese, Thai). That is not to be overlooked.

While I don't work in the area anymore, I will continue to go to war for the Empire. I hope Jin follows in the steps of other Asian empires, like Genghis Khan's, and doesn't stop at Japan, Thailand and China. March onward! Maybe one day they'll even go the way of the Silk Road and offer Italian food.

Let me tell you, 10 Jin's Empire Asian Cuisine is simply rather darn cool. It's in a great location and we were really pleased with our experience. Every single thing that I have already tried has been rather delicious. Everybody that works there is always very helpful. I can not wait to return!

OMG, 10 Jin's Empire Asian Cuisine was really incredible. Definitely an interesting vibe. I really have no words that can possibly describe how outstanding the items that I got were. Fantastic. Very good service and staff. Definitely recommend! Would return for sure!

Yes, Jin is a bit too ambitious. The owners probably had BIG plans for this establishment judging by the decor and menu. Jin wants to be the Jin of all trades but turned out to be the master of none. The Thai and Japanese dishes are not remarkable or authentic. However, the Chinese dishes are actually above average. Then again, if you want really authentic Chinese food, go to China, not Chinatown. Of course, Chinese food in Chinatown is generally better compared to Jin's.

Jin is the only nice Chinese food restaurant in the area. The decor is modern, clean and spacious. I think the lunch menu specials are reasonably priced. Portions are not too bad. The food tastes delicious - as one would expect for Chinese food in NYC. Obviously, the prices are cheaper in Chinatown but if one doesn't have the luxury of going there - Jin is a safe bet.

10 Jin's Empire Asian Cuisine you are really remarkable, I had an incredible experience here yesterday. The atmosphere of this place is great and so inviting! These guys got a phenomenal menu too. The workers were really good. I have to come back to 10 Jin's Empire Asian Cuisine.

Good place if you want all you can drink sake and Coors Light for $35 with a couple of friends.  

But if you want to eat AYCE sushi, I would suggest going elsewhere. I know of many AYCE sushi buffets in Brooklyn for less than $20.00 per person (ie: Sake and Daizen).

I went there for a friends Birthday celebration and although it was completely empty on a Saturday night around 7ish. It started filling up with large parties shortly.

On the AYCE menu, they only offer a small selection of sushis and special rolls. No sashimis, or appetizers, or soups. Service is also quite slow.

If it came down to service, I would give them one star. The waitresses here barely speak English and sometimes we had a hard time understanding them. But since it's cheap and I left very full, I give them three stars.

I came in for lunch and they're actually very busy. They do this lunch special that's less than $10 for soup or salad + 3 sushi rolls. That lunch special also applies to Chinese dishes and Thai dishes. The Boyfriend got an entire Bento Box worth of food for less than $10. The salmon was lukewarm but it tasted like your standard takeout Japanese bento box.

I have to say, they do pretty well in their Chinese dishes. The shrimp in lobster sauce tasted delicious with a bowl of rice. I can't say that it was amazing or phenomenal but for the price, I can't complain.

Points for being the only thing close to a Chinese restaurant within walking distance of my job, but really a case of a place that tries to do way too much in the Asian fusion department, and winds up making all the food taste pretty much the same.  The whole point in serving Thai, Japanese, Chinese, etc, is to accent the huge DIFFERENCES in the cuisines.  Sure, there are similar beats in all of them, and that's why they complement one another, but they each have a voice of their own, and this place doesn't really do a good job of illustrating that.

2 stars instead of 1 for at least making the decor look much nicer than it needs to be, but really in the future, I'm just gonna tell my boss I'm taking a longer lunch and walk up to Chinatown.

When I signed for my Seamless Web delivery order, and the delivery guy just left my food on the floor for me to pick up, I knew that this was going to be a rough dinner.  Is there any way that can be considered not to be rude?

It all seemed simple enough.  Take-out Chinese does not have a huge range in quality, and kung pao shrimp ($11.95) is kind of hard to mess up.  This should have been decent comfort food, perhaps memorable, perhaps not.  Well, it was memorable for the wrong reasons.  To begin, the meal was nearly vegetarian.  I have never seen so many diced carrots and so much chopped celery in one entree before.  It was all that I could find, well, nearly anyway.  There were also two small slices of red pepper that somehow made their way into the dish, a gelatinous sliver of something or another that also crept in, a few peanuts, and, oh yeah, a handful of shrimp.  The shrimp were decent, but I mistakenly ate the ones on top right away thinking that there would be more to be found interspersed throughout the dish.  Nope.  That was all I got making for a lot of rabbit fare ahead of me.  The binding sauce was thin and flavorless offering me no mercy either.  I basically paid $12 for 5 shrimp, 5 carrots, 5 stalks of celery, and 5 peanuts.  Definitely pass.

Let's just call a spade a spade, shall we? This place does not serve Chinese food, it serves Food Court food. The portions are ok but lets be real, there really is no cooking involved here. It's like they have big bags of frozen chicken that they defrost and dip in vats of different syrups then throw in a couple stalks of undercooked broccoli for good measure.

Also the Japanese food here is terrible. As someone who is part Japanese, I am amazed how many Chinese people cook Japanese food in this city without any regard to what Japanese food really is. That would be like having Greeks opening all the Pizzerias.

And if its Food Court food you want, you can eat better tasting food at New China Red on Chambers Street for half the price.

I would cut this place some slack if the woman behind the counter didn't treat you like the enemy of the f'cking state. Jesus lady! Go smoke a cigarette or take a xanax and come back after you blow off some steam because I don't know what I did to you besides order a meal but you got me checking my won ton soup for spit!

We should have looked at Yelp before we ordered here via delivery.com
Worst experience ever. After 2 hours and 3 calls, where 'the food was on its way to arrive in 10 mins' we are still without food. Never again. I wish I could chose 0 stars.

A friend and I ordered lunch delivered and it was ok.  I would probably give it 2.5 stars.  I had  Massaman Curry Lunch Special from the thai menu and Coconut Chicken Soup.  The curry was ok but the soup was watery.   Everything tasted fresh but it was nothing special.  The flavor profile was slightly off and on the bland side.  My friend had the  Beef w/ Broccoli Lunch Special and was not impressed.  Seamless had this place rated pretty high but I'm in agreement with yelps more realistic and honest 2/3 rating.

They were a wild hit on Seamless but I was less than impressed. The sushi was actually the most edible thing, or maybe the curry puffs (I've never ordered these from a non-Thai restaurant but they were not terrible here). I got the spicy popcorn shrimp bento box and the shrimp were neither 'popcorn' (huge, greasy, non-crunchy tempura shrimp, more like) nor spicy (but came with spicy mayo). The shumai and CA roll it came with were edible, but the salad and soup looked pretty gross and remained untouched. Stupidly we had ordered an appetizer of fried rock shrimp, but these turned out to be the same size and style of shrimp as my entree.

If you're in the area, head to Sun Cafe for your sushi needs (or Takahachi if your price point is higher) and maybe just hoof it to Chinatown to avoid these shrimp. I'm sure somewhere better will deliver to you.

I was worried about the menu the minute i laid eyes on it. Chinese, Japanese and Thai...too many flavors mixed together did not sound like it was going to be a success.

Dining in-doors was not a pleasant experience. My friend and I were given soups at two different temperatures, one that was scolding hot and the other was cool.

When our food arrived our waitress' finger ended up in our dishes.

The food overall was okay, but for a place where the ambiance screams better than average, you might as well check out a cheaper option in Chinatown which only a hop skip and jump away from here.

Definitely a place worth a SKIP!!!

I ordered delivery from 10 Jin's Empire on seamless.com. The reason I selected it was because it had a decent, moderately priced menu and a short delivery time of 20-35 minutes.  I placed my $50 order and decided to give a little extra tip since it was wet outside.

1 1/2 hours and two phone calls later, I was still waiting for my food.  The woman I spoke to on the phone swore up and down that it was on its way, but a delivery order should NEVER take this long to arrive.  I finally got my food just short of 2 hours after placing the order.  The miso soup was lukewarm and the sushi was mediocre, at best.

I will NOT be ordering from 10 Jin's Empire ever again.

Horrible experience- ordered delivery. After 45 minutes called to get a status update and was told ten more minutes. After fifteen minutes I called again and was told the driver had a problem and needed ten more minutes. The food arrived 25 minutes later. The woman on the phone was clearly lying through her teeth. The food was some of the worst Chinese food I've ever had. Very bland. Save your $$ and go somewhere else. Would give it zero stars if it were possible.

you know how when you peek in, the restaurant looks busy enough and all fancy like, you stroll in with a "fck yeah attitude".
well.............. if you're hungry and feenin' for some good grubbin, run out the restaurant...

My first dine:The Pad Thai tasted like bland cantonese chow fun.
So I'm like "alright, forgivable, they're prob using a Chinese chef to cook thai, very common. and he prob assumes sprinkling some peanuts will make it pad thai. whatever".

Second time, i order a Chinese dish- Beef & Broc. i spent half of my lunch break scooping out the msg/oil while the waiters watched in horror. BOO!

I work on the block but I'm easily convinced that CHINA RED on Chambers is still the way to GO,.....if and when I'm too lazy to walk my ass to Chinatown.
And for thai food, a bit of a trek but down on fulton- Benny Thai 88 fulton, banging cheap lunch specials and they're GOODDDDDDD
And japanese- shinjuku sushi right on church st (right around the corner from empire) btwn park place and murray...

just sayin...
Very bad manners. The food is also overpriced. The cashier was also sleeping during the job. Honestly, I would never go back.

When they just opened i said great now i can order padthai and not get it from the buffet place that doesnt taste that good. the place looked good and clean. the girl behind the counter however was very nasty. when you order and when u ask her a question, she would reply with the nastiest attitude like you just asked her how many heads does she have. the food is more than average.

they must first change that girl in the front because i hear about a lot of complains about her and they are definitely losing a lot of customer because of her.

Yesterday I happened to randomly walk past this place. I guess it just opened...anyways the place didn't have many customers but in due time I'm positive it will be a hit! Surprisingly the sushi was no doubt some of the best I've had in a long time. I also enjoyed the variety of Chinese fusion food. Perfect for people like me with a well-rounded palate :)
Oh and it's reasonably priced!!

WORSE service EVER!!! I called in for a delivery order and questioned about the menu. When I  received the order, the order was wrong.  I then called to tell them the mistake, she was NASTY about it and blamed it on "a new employee". She FINALLY told me she would take back the order, but when I told her I took a bite, she NASTILY asked, "YOU ATE THE ORDER? I cant take it back". Not only was she not apologetic, she inisisted that I should pay for the WRONG order because I took one bite. When the delivery guy finally sent me the replacement, he just shoved it into my hands with his back turned and stormed off.

The tuna was not fresh at all. I would NEVER order from this place again and I surely would not recommend it to anyone.

I was on my way to Whole Foods for a Quinoa salad, but upon realizing I couldn't afford the loan repayments I would need to make that purchase, decided to drop $7.95 on the lunch special. It was probably worth all of $3. The miso soup had nothing in it and the shrimp and broccoli dish had literally 3 shrimp. 3. Shrimp are like $.02 a pop I expect a reasonable number of them in my food (source: indexmundi.com/commoditi…).

I ate at this place when it first opened and have to agree with the reviews already posted, marginal at best....however, I decided to try it again.  It was awesome!  They supposedly got a new chef and boy did he blow me away.
The new chef has completely revamped the menu and I had one of the best asian fusion meals I've ever had.  I had the pad Thai, the noodles were perfectly cook (al dente), and there was just the right amount of sauce, not too much, with some nice peanuts, and celery root - fabulous.  My girlfriend had kung pao chicken - again the perfect amount of sauce, great flavor, not too salty.  All in all a fantastic meal.  I will definitely go back!
Not what i expected . The waitress was rude everyone in there looks mad like really don't work with that face !  And the food ehhhh could have been better . ! totally not going back .

NASTYYYYYY.  Avoid at all costs. My "salad" was 5 small pieces of lettuce. I was then served undercooked chicken, didn't touch it after my friend and I both had a small bite and felt sick (tasted slimy).  they refused to take it off of the bill. I was incredibly polite, despite the fact that it was the worst service I've ever had at a restaurant, and the woman just said "no" when I asked her to do something about the bill. Worst dining experience I've ever had in nyc. I had to pay for that horrifying experience and then went and bought another lunch at a nearby deli right after. Someone should send a health department person here ASAP.
I'd also like to note that I made a yelp account just to rate this restaurant. It needs to be shut down.

The sushi here is decent, though not spectacular. The menu is a bit cluttered, since they offer Japanese, Chinese, and Thai dishes. The Pad Thai is decent, though I've had better. The Chinese dishes are very salty, and they don't give enough rice alongside it to mitigate that. Their drink menu is somewhat small compared to their main dishes, but the Thai Iced Tea is satisfactory. Their ice cream is ok, and they give a really large serving compared to most similar places.

Average, not out of this world and I have had better.  Just make sure if you order general tso chicken that you look to see if it is well cooked.  My order seemed well cooked until I realized the REDISH-PINK color!

The waiters told me next time ask for white chicken not dark.   Okay, but even dark chicken is NOT REDISH-PINK.  They didn't even apologize out of common courtesy.

Then as I paid the cashier seemed to have had a problem, it wasn't like I was being rude to them.  Not a good look for a "Grand Opening."
Food was disappointingly mediocre. Whether you're looking for good chinese food or a quick bite, this place isn't good for either. Please, just don't go here.
Service is very poor. Lady taking order is not very polite and rude. I would not recommend anyone to order or eat at this restaurant. If I could I would rate this zero star. Eat at your own risk!!!

Yuck! The tuna in that sushi was inedible. Threw it out after the first bite because I wasn't sure it was fresh, plus it was very stringy. How can this place have a five-star average on Seamless??? Unacceptably bad quality.
I ordered a delivery today to try their food. The delivery guy calls me and states that he wants bigger tip. I will not be ordering from them for sure

Fresh out of Macao Trading Co, which had my pockets on life support, we decided we needed some dessert. Even with my pockets fighting for every last breath, I spent $14 here and wasn't even mad.

I FULLY LOADED my bowl with 3 flavors of yogurt: vanilla, cookies and cream, and birthday cake.

Upon putting the birthday cake on, it was a deep artificial yellow which was a major cause for concern. However, upon trying it, I had to eat my words. It was delightful. One of my best personality traits is to admit when I'm wrong. I'm sorry for judging you based off your artificial coloring, birthday cake flavor.

They have an abundance of toppings, honestly any kind of topping you could ever wane for. I decided to go with crushed vanilla wafers, oreos, and one gummy worm on top for purely aesthetic purposes. I am an artist.

The crushed vanilla wafers were the MVP of the bowl, tying the whole thing together making it ELITE. It made me oddly reminiscent of how Steve Nash tied those Phoenix Suns teams in the mid-2000s. People love to forget about Steve Nash smh. Don't worry Steve, I won't let them forget.

I DEMOLISHED this bowl like Sheldon Brown DEMOLISHED Reggie Bush on that swing pass back in 07. Drew Brees lowkey set Reggie up tho smh.

This is EASILY my favorite frozen yogurt place in the city, but granted I haven't tried THAT many.

One star off cuz it's kind of dirty in there and as others have mentioned, the price is pretty steep lmao.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__
