Yogurt is ok but no more outside area. Solely used for people to smoke. No need to have it if not intended for it's original purpose. How can the manager of this place allow this to continue?

Highly recommend 16 Handles Tribeca location. Very pleasant experience.

May seem confusing when you enter but the staff is very helpful.

Must get a cup by the register. Everything is charged by the weight.

Various choices of dairy, vegan, or frozen yogurt. I chose the vegan ice cream, which was absolutely amazing!!!

My inner fat chic had me try one side heath toffee, the other side Oreo topping.

As you can see in the pictures posted there is a wide variety of toppings.

You will also find cozy, clean, outdoor seating to enjoy your ice cream.

I went there for the first time, and the customer service was terrific. I met an employee there who was really nice and kindly showed me the flavors and recommended the euro tart and birthday cake.  10/10 experience and would go back again. They have some new flavors called rocket pop and orange creamsicle, it was amazing.

Store window says that they are open until midnight on Saturday. I showed up at 11:06PM, and was told they were closed. So, you know, it's random whether you can believe the things their signs tell you, I guess. 1 star.
if I could do no stars I would.. what a rip off and the yogurt is awful. completely artificial. over $9 for what would be considered a kiddie cup..: ridiculous

16 handles is by far the best frozen yogurt place!!! They have frozen yogurt and soft serve ice cream! Also vegan options as well. The toppings are insanity literally the best! The best topping are the brownie bites they are soooooo good it's a must when you come to this place. The best combo in my opinion is the raw edible chocolate chip cookie dough, brownie bites, Mini m&ms and resses  peanut butter cups! Need to go to this place

Went to 16 handles looking for a healthy froyo treat. I was pleasantly surprised. The froyo was delicious and creamy. Many toppings choose from. They also sell water.. overall great vegan frozen yogurt.

If you love Vegan or any type of FROYO 16 handles is the spot. Come one come all for the best customer service and product in the business. Comment here with your pictures as this is the place to be in Tribeca for a great little savory treat!

Several vegan options, vanilla or Chai if you're looking for something creamy. Toppings... are kind of sloppy... but that's more of a customer fault. Labeling which are vegan or gluten free could be a little more clear. Employees seem friendly enough.

Your average soft serve narrow retail location. Nothing special - sugar and cream. pricing is absurd - 8 bucks for 6 ounce of blob coming out of a handle. One - if I wanted fancy i would go get shakes at black tap - amazing shakes not comparable to this ordinary Blob machines, two if I wanted a sundae - i would go get ice cream and make it myself for half off. This biz is gonzo soon or figure out a way to price lower.
The worst tasting ice cream I have ever had- for 15 dollars! Tasted like water. Ordered a large and could barely eat 1/5 of it. Horrible

We are very happy that 16 Handles is now in the neighborhood. The ice cream is delicious and there are many options for toppings. The pricing is comparable to other ice cream places in Tribeca, Noho and Soho. What is different is the service which has been excellent. Everyone working there is friendly and courteous. I hope this business continues to hire well or even better, retain the people who are working there now.

Jeremiah is the GOAT. My partner and I have been to many 7th Stree locations all over Manhattan and a few multiple times, and always the meals are consistently up to expectations - we always leave full, satisfied, and indulged. Great non pretentious ambiance to enjoy a good greasy burger.

The FiDi location has been our favorite - the customer service, regardless of who we've interacted with, has always made us feel welcome and excited to come back. Always receptive to feedback on the menu and talking shop of what could be "secret" menu items. Always fun while we wait.

Can't wait to go back and see what else they come up with!  Loaded fries - as always - were delicious!

Was recommended by a friend to try 7th Street Burger while I was in N?YC, so since my hotel was only a few minutes away, I had to make a stop here.

The Food: I ordered the "Double Cheeseburger" for my meal. The burger was hot and tasty. Delicious flavor with each bite. It only comes with grilled onions, American cheese, pickles and their house sauce though. So with little toppings, it makes for a basic burger, but very delicious. I do wish there was a little more to the patty, especially at this price, but its not the end of the world. Overall, a quality burger, just a little pricey for what you get.

The Service: Service was good here. Ordered at the register and the staff was very fast and quick with getting orders out. The menu is small and gets straight to the point as well.

The Atmosphere: Small space that doesn't have a lot of indoor seating. It seems more of a takeout spot than anything. However, the place is very bright and white, with minimal decor.

Overall, a 4.5/5. Burger was absolutely delicious! Had tons of flavor and service was fast and easy. I'll be visiting 7th Street again when I'm back.

3.5/5

Pretty solid burger joint - I think it is a bit overhyped though :(

The fries are amazing but the burger lacked flavor...maybe it's bc I'm not a ketchup person so it didn't hit the spot? But I felt like it needed some sauce to be accompany the meal with - the house sauce in the burger was not enough flavor!

I've recently become aware of 7th Street Burger, this year. The hand few of times, I've been very pleased with it. I came to this new location and like another location, I immediately noticed the lack of seating. It was very warm and uncomfortable outside and decided to eat in the park.

The burger itself was great and the fries were just okay. The counter man was friendly and for that, I tipped pretty well. Im a fan of their burgers and service, but the lack of seating is something to keep in mind.

If I still worked in lower Manahattan, I'd patronize this location, but as in Midtown, it would be one of their other locations. I'd recommend to others, though!

Classic ultra-thin, smashed, slightly-caramelized and crispy patties are always a good start. I like the very soft bun, and American cheese as well. It's a crowded landscape right now, and this is a solid version, though I would say not necessarily different than other versions, and not as good as the very best ones. That said, at 7-10 dollars (for a single vs double), it's a good value for a Manhattan restaurant.

Sooo if you expect a pretty burger then don't come here. The burger is a smash burger that's somewhat messy so you should eat in the restaurant.

The menu is pretty simple. I ordered a cheese burger and fries and tried the 2 side sauces. One was spicy and the other wasn't. The cheeseburger was good, but I did add ketchup which gave it more flavor. The cheeseburger didn't come w ketchup, only the sauce. The fries are medium cut and had good flavor. They are really good when dipped in the side sauce.

The staff was really friendly but the restaurant needs work. It's a big space that's not utilized well. They have 4-5 long tables that 4-5 ppl could stand around, but because of that your standing with strangers eating. They could make more room by adding 2 top tables with seating, or even a counter along the wall with seating. There's zero seating and standing while eating isn't really my thing.

They were playing hip hop so the vibe is cool, the restaurant is clean it just really needs more tables and chairs.

Lol. Tiktok and Instagram will be the death of me.  This place went viral on both platforms and I was both happy and surprised to see a location opened up near my job.  Of course I had to try this place out.

So I found the food to be just ok.  The burgers remind me of White Castle burgers with McDonalds' secret Big Mac sauce.  Nothing amazing.  

Got the cheese burger and fries. Again just ok to me.  

I wish this place well - although I'm baffled why this place is a hit.

My favorite 7th Street Burger of all in Manhattan. Ample room to dine for all unlike other locations where the space is a bit cramped. Clean place, everything looked well maintained. Proper ventilation! You should imagine how the other locations were since I'm specific about these.

As always, I had the impossible burger with impossible loaded fries. I had the regular fries too. Eat them hot. That's doing justice to the perfect fries they make. I can go on and on about their regular fries. They are just perfect. Not  over crispy.

Also nostalgic to get those Mexican cokes with wall openers.

I've said it before and I'll say it again. I love 7th Street burger. Best burger I've had in NYC and I'm so glad they've opened a location in FiDi.

Very clean atmosphere, friendly employees, and delicious food as always.

Make sure to order the loaded fries! It's not on the menu, but it's definitely worth getting.

Given all the hype I'd read about 7th Street Burger lately, my expectations may have been set too high. I felt my meal was just fine, considering the price tag: a double cheeseburger with fries (no drink) rang up to around $18, including tax and tip. It's a bit more than I'd anticipate for a quick takeout lunch -- especially one of the greasy-spoon variety.

I'd say the burger itself was like a messier version of an In-N-Out double double. Their fries are fatter and floppier than In-N-Out's, though. I prefer this thicker-cut style, personally (although I'm not about to turn down some shoestring fries, either -- a spud's a spud and it's pretty damned hard to make a potato not delicious).

As far as I can tell, there's no seating in this venue (nor an obvious bathroom to wash your hands, either). If you're planning on dining in, I wouldn't consider this an accessible-friendly venue. Also, the R&B music was cranked way the hell up, possibly to hearing loss levels. That's great if it's your jam, just don't anticipate having any casual conversations.

I'm never mad about enjoying a decent burger. I don't plan to come back -- at least, not to this outlet. Perhaps other locations warrant the rave reviews.

My love and I came here for a quick bite before the Burna Boy concert. If you're looking for a sit-down place, this isn't it as there are no chairs in the place. They also best hip-hop music which makes it hard to hear the person you're standing across from.

We both ordered and loved the impossible burgers. They were juicy, flavorful, and a good size for a single. But the star of the meal was the fries. When I looked in the bag after taking the burgers out, I just knew they were going to be delicious. They were cooked and crispy to perfection, not too thick and very flaky.
Stopped by after a show at pier 17. Their spicy loaded fries are absolute perfection!! Super friendly service too. Definitely plan on returning the next time I need a post-concert snack!
It tastes like a better quality McDonald's cheeseburger. Pretty delicious if you ask me although docking off a star because it's so small

Such great fast food (and I never say that) I honestly rarely ever eat fast food too

The service was outstanding. Incredibly friendly and accommodating!

The ambiance is okay. Standing room only and has about 4-5 tables to stand and eat at.

Burgers are sooo yummmy and the fries !

I ordered pickup and my order was completed within 10 minutes! The cheeseburger is delicious and the house sauce kicks it up a notch. The house sauce is $1 but well worth it. The fries are pretty standard but pair well with the burger. There is no seats and only tables so you have to stand up to eat. The line gets long so ordering online is the way to go.

Great casual meal. The usual burger, fries and soda combo makes its way to FiDi and is a nice and convenient spot to go to near the Fulton Center. The burger is tasty, the fries are crisp and the Mexican Coke is refreshing. The ordering was quick and easy and this location has a good amount of standing space to eat your meal inside in the AC. This is a great addition to the FiDi area for something fast and casual.

Not an earth-shattering burger (and yes, there are such things). As someone who does NOT go for a thick, red-in-the-middle patty; I'm predisposed to like the cooking method of this small and new downtown chain. Smash that meat flat, and fry it up quick! But I think the  end product could get better, IMHO. A bit more char or crispy edge on the meat would have been nice. This might have offset the sweetness of the potato bun. The bread was also a bit too soft, but that could have been because my to-go burger was consumed at home, 10 minutes later. Normally I'm all about the potato buns. Love em'! Finally, I made error of asking for less house sauce. I think the full condiment squeeze would have helped. Overall, this is not a BAD burger. But its' small size and high-ish price point ($6.50 for a single) work against the friendly staff and quick service.

The menu options gives you a straight to the point meal.  Burger, fries and drinks are the option.  Very homemade taste and tasty.  It's a place that I would come back to eat at again when I'm in a burger mood.

I love a smash burger in general but this place is really top notch! The burger is juicy and cheesy and has a great sauce and a pickle, just everything you would want in a burger! We also got their fries which are hot and crispy every time, we got them loaded and oh boy were they loaded!! Christian was behind the counter and he was so nice, helpful on what to get and friendly going around talking to everyone in the restaurant! Love it here!

Gave a 3 but really is more like 3.5. Location is absolutely not desirable however the burger and fries were solid. Came here compliments of Yelp and enjoyed my early evening dinner. Guy at register was super friendly and our food came out relatively fast. No seating just standing tables so I think concept is grab and go. I will say for this to be a relatively new place it wasn't really that clean. Overall enjoyed it but probably won't come back unless I'm in the area.

Joseeee Santos my guyyyyyy lol. He is the cashier at this specific location. Upon arrival Jose greeted me with a huge smile and welcome, he's such a great person who I enjoyed chatting with . Once again 7th Street burger doesn't owe me a damn thing lol. Consistent great burgers and loaded fries , and Cokes with stellar customer service. The establishment is clean and well kept, it wasn't to busy for a Saturday afternoon at all. I will always be a patron of 7th Street burger. They never disappoint, and always have the best staff. Thank you for a great experience Jose.

Great place to grab a bite to eat. Always playing awesome music while you wait for your food. The guy at the register is very stylish, and very friendly. You can stay at the place to stand to eat and enjoy the music playing. I normally just take it back to my desk. I love every bite of the cheeseburger and fries. Very delicious. Highly recommend.
Tasted soooooo good! Parking was very hard, but service is nice and clean environment. Double cheese burger is the best.

Dropped by at 5pm and no wait for this new spot in financial district. Right across the street from Wendy. Good addition to the area. I like the fact that there is space to eat inside and strong AC. Only stand up No seatings. Eat and then you go. Burger was good. Bun was fluffy and buttery. Fries were nice and on the spot. Grab a coke and you are all set to go. Service was quick. They will call your name when your food is ready.

Everyone here is super friendly, when I was waiting for my order by the door, the cashier brought it out to me. The burgers are juicy. Ordered a double cheeseburger, loaded fries and Sprite in a glass bottle. The bottle openers are able the trash and recycle bins. There's four tables which you can stand next to eat. Would highly recommended coming here.

The best impossible burger in the city! If you live under a rock, you probably wouldn't know but 7th Street Burger has been all the type in the last year or so (rightfully). I put it to the test finally this weekend and I can totally see why everyone is raving about it. Just everything about it - the bun was perfectly warm and buttery, just the right amount of toppings inside (onions, cheese, pickles) and the house sauce! Wow I could drink it. The fries were done so well and so crunchy perfect to dip into the sauce. I'm so glad they are open all over the city now making it easily accessible to try it! You'll be hooked.

Great for take out!
Burger 4/5 smashed and cheesy, I really enjoyed it. The place as a whole is not very welcoming, very basic with a couple for standing tables so if you want to dine in, this is not the place.

This is the best 7th street burger location that I've tried so far!

They have the classic menu items--I got the double cheeseburger and it was cooked great. The bun is soft and the toppings of onions and sauce is great. You can get loaded beef fries as well, which is a secret menu item. It comes as fries with a beef patty on top and the classic burger toppings.

The staff is also very friendly. The manager was periodically checking in with everyone to make sure we had everything we needed. Even though 7th street is supposed to be a fast casual spot, we felt really taken care of by the staff. I would definitely come back!

Solid meal here - I got the double cheeseburger, fries, and Mexican coke. No frills fast eat spot with standing tables only. The burger itself was great and I loved the onion sauce with additional onions! I wished there were other greens in the burger, as it could be a hodgepodge of mushy meat and sauce after a while. Fries are delicious as well - crispy but still potato-y if you know what I mean. Can also top with their special sauce!! Would come back if I were in the area

This new restaurant must have just opened when I visited. not much on the walls. And pristine clean walls. We had the cheeseburger and fries.  Love the burger. Potato roll with a great burger with the works. Really enjoyed the burger. Not too sloppy and great flavor combination. Fries were crunchy and a huge portion. So happy to see they had Mexican Coke also. Also love that they have an impossible burger as an option for the vegetarians.

Jose our counter server was great. He covered so many order while we were there and was calm and focused.  

My only complaint was that the music turned up once we started eating and we couldn't hear each other talk while we ate.

Huge disappointment!  The burgers are soggy grease bombs, and tiny.  It's similar to White Castle, except much sloppier, greasier, and hugely more expensive.  Can't understand why anyone would go here.

Surprisingly good burgers and fries. Essentially a smash burger, with some pickles and big Mac sauce. Fries were nice and crispy. Definitely not a bad place to go to grab a quick bite. Nothing fancy here.

Another solid 7th St location with SPICY loaded beef fries with a nice kick.  The staff is friendly and the smashburgers still a great value and among the best in the city (and as close as you can get to In & Out on the East Coast).  Worth a stop if you are craving burgers and fries in the FiDi right by Fulton.
Team and good both 5+ stars. Couldn't be more excited to have a top burger down in Fidi. Take your food down to the seaport for the perfect views.

Service is phenomenal. Came for the yelp event and I love thay they are expanding all over the City. I am an In N out fan being from california but this hits just as good on the east coast for the price and the best smash burger you will have

Great burgers that remind me of the Big Mac with the thousand island dressing. Pretty good fries but could have been less soggy. The food overall is super greasy (relative to burger joints) but well done. Friendly service and nice ambience.

Not much of a fast food burger guy but I've tried them all and this one stands out great service and inexpensive without nailing you for add-ons. My double cheeseburger was moist and tasty and the fries were pretty good too. Friendly fast service no thrills join.
Love these 7th Street Burger events! They're also very welcoming and accommodating and this location was no different. Great customer service.

Great burgers - their smash burgers are a tad greasy but always hit the spot with its flavor. Also a huge fan of the loaded fries. Love that there's one in this location. They're popping up all over the city now! Loved the experience but only wish they had chairs.

I'm a huge fan of 7th street burger. That said, mixed feelings about this newest FiDi location. Set up: good number of standing only tables with hooks for coats/bags. Thoughtful. No seating, no restroom. Not a deal breaker. Ordering: the guy at the reugister didn't take a name, said the wait was 10-15 minutes, which is standard for 7th st burger everywhere. We grabbed our sodas from fridge and then found a spot and waited.... And waited... and waited... until we, as well as 2 other tables of patrons who ordered before us but hadn't gotten food either noticed: the food was coming out from the back in white paper bags and being neatly lined up by the window/counter behind the staff at the register, but he wasn't turning around to check at all, and - didn't seem to care? Thus he wasn't calling out any orders when they were ready- but then again- he's not taking names down, so who is he going to call? Everyone eventually got food. Saw that one of the tables got their bag of food but then moments later saw the guy from the register come up w a diff bag and ask them to swap because he'd given them the wrong order. If you're familiar w 7th street burger hospitality, then you're also aware that their staff are usually great at remembering who ordered what and never mix things up. Now the food: this is quite possibly the greasiest I've ever seen a 7th street burger. The wrappers were literally dripping oil? Definitely had to dab away at it with multiple napkins like we normally for for a pizza slice. The burger patty was more burnt than other locations. Onions, pickles, and sauce was great. I love 7th street and prefer it over shake shack and five guys, but likely not going to come back to the FiDi location anytime in the near future. Favorite locations so far: LES (orchard street) and 7th Ave (good seating). Maybe today was a fluke day?

TLDR: this place will satiate your burger craving. The cheeseburger comes with pickles and grilled onions but I wish it also came with lettuce and tomatoes. Patty was not juicy which I do enjoy because it's less oily and feels healthier. If you've ever had In N Out from the west coast, 7th St's sauce is similar to In N Out but it's more liquidy. The fries are very crispy on the outside and very soft on the inside - quite meaty which I like but it's a bit too salty for my Asian taste buds. The black pepper on fries - I added it at home. I do like the size of the burger, just right for me and doesn't leave me too full. For $11 before tax, it's a pretty decent price for a meal in NYC. 7th St is a place I would go to out of convenience if I'm craving a burger that's ready quickly.
Tasty for reals. Bun soft...sauce creamy...cheese melted...burgers crispy...like, "Oh my goodness!"
Chris made our service ENJOYABLE! Chris is the best! The cashier Chris made our time very nice. Thank you! Great food, service, and conversation

went on a Saturday Night, was busy but line moved swiftly !! short & sweet, no frills menu makes for quick ordering.
the front Man, Jeremiah, was so great !! Amazing customer service, so knowledgeable & sweet !!
boyf got 2 double cheeseburgers, they accommodated substitutions.. he didn't want Pickles .. he Really liked .. onions were grilled then smashed & cooked w the patty
we got 3 orders of Fries ... I like my fries Burnt but they can't accommodate tht since they fry them in Batches .. totally ok bc I jst double fried at Home ..
they have 2 sauces, a Regular & a Spicy.. they don't label them so I couldn't tell which was which But I did enjoy one more thn the other .. guessing it was the spicy .. but Not completely sure ..
The restaurant was very clean (hand sanitizer Everywhere .. LOVE !!) and it was bright !! Lots of Lights ..
the tables are high made for standing, they don't have chairs but we took our food toGo .. so it didn't really matter ..
we def recommend !!
Big thanks 2 Jeremiah !!

I really loved the cheeseburger I had here, food is really satisfying. The reason I am not giving 5 stars is because I walked in and there's this AWFUL techno rap crap played at an obnoxiously loud level... I could barely hear the counter person when I placed my order, and he was only standing a foot away from me! Ate my burger at one of the tables while being subjected to that deafening junk... they could have toned it down a bit, it's not a club. Will DEFINITELY go back for the burger, only next time I'll get it to go and spare my ears!

If you're looking for a good burger minus all the fluff 7th Street Burger is your place! I happened upon this location after checking Yelp for a good burger spot. The moment I walked in and smelled the aroma I knew I made the right decision. I ordered a Cheeseburger with fries and a coke and I devoured the entire thing in one sitting. The burger was delicious, the were freshly done! I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Heads up there are no chairs just four tables, but that wasn't an issue for me I had my burger standing up and had nooo regrets . Service was prompt and straightforward again no frills just a good ass burger with fries. If you get the chance pop in, you will not regret it!
Delicious! Food was fast and the bun for the burger was so good. I saw this place on TikTok and I'm so glad I did. Definitely worth a visit!

A simple, classic smashburger that, while unassuming, tastes wholeheartedly American. The toppings are minimal, but provide a balance that is hard to replicate. As a person who isn't usually fond of pickles on sandwiches, the bread and butter pickles used add a great crunch without spreading their pickle-y taste throughout the burger as a whole. The sauce? Subtle but a stunner. I wish I had asked for an extra bit on the side for my fries.

The burger itself is just the right amount of greasy and leaves minimal transfer onto your hands, thus limiting post-meal regret (and greasy bag shame). The fries are a can't miss, honestly some of the better fries I've had in my day. I want this exact meal the morning after an incredibly heavy night of drinking, as I'm almost positive it could cure even the most severest of hangovers. However, I would remove 1/2 of a star for no Diet Cokes on the premises, because cute gals need a little bit of DC to wash down a burger lunch. Other than that, exceptionally solid and pretty difficult to f*ck up (I would imagine).

10/10 would recommend sitting outside while eating this burger, maybe even throw on some yacht rock while you're at it.

7th St Burger opens New Location Near Fulton Transit Center.

7th St Burger, a popular burger joint with several locations in New York City, has opened a new location near the Fulton Transit Center. The new location offers a simple menu of burgers, fries, and sodas.

Burgers are the star of the show at 7th St Burger. You can choose from a single or double patty burger, and you can also get an Impossible Burger if you're looking for a plant-based option. All burgers are made with fresh, high-quality ingredients and are cooked to order.

Fries are another popular item on the menu. You can get regular fries or loaded fries, which are topped with cheese, burger patty, and onions. If you're feeling adventurous, you can also get your fries spicy.

Sodas are available in glass bottles. There are several different brands to choose from, including Coca-Cola, Pepsi, and Dr Pepper.

Seating? There are no chairs, only tables.

The new location is open seven days a week from 11am to 10pm. It's a great place to grab a quick bite to eat before or after catching a train at the Fulton Transit Center.
Music is too loud. Food is great, I hope they will not change the taste of the burger.

Amazing brunch and live music on the top balcony, it's quite a nice vibe. It all comes together with the decor, country farm house vibe with modern touches, never could resist green palm fronds wallpaper. Amazing service, great quality food, bar worth of its name, overall a top notch NYC brunch.

Love it :)

Specifically chose this place because the website boasts life music every night and has an intricate calendar
Got here on a Thursday night (Sep 7) and the waitress tells me they no longer have music every night. We're not compensated in any way for this inconvenience.
Feels like false advertising and super disappointing

Overall rating: 4.2

I'm a bit particular when it comes to NOLA restaurants in NYC. I have been searching for a charbroiled oyster that tastes exactly like New Orleans for the last 6 years. I've been close to finding a spot in LES, but the price was outrageous.

I've been here at night for a drink and it's very lively and cute. Coming back for food at lunchtime was a bit of a different experience.

In my opinion, the Mac and cheese was not seasoned well. Had a nice little kick, but def needed some salt and pepper and maybe old bay  didn't love it, didn't hate it.

The charbroiled oysters were good. The seasoning was very good! That said, they could have been broiled a bit more. It was missing the char taste I've been longing for.

If you haven't been to New Orleans these are very good. If you have, they're still good, but they are not it. The space is soo pretty and I feel like this is a great spot to hang with a group of friends. Not sure if the pricing is worth it to me, but I can see why it's crowded with tourists.

Food, decor, and ambiance were absolutely PERFECT!
Service: Our server was attentive, quick, friendly, and even remembered my drink order and my name (that's always a sweet treat).

Food was delectable, robust in flavor, texture, and freshness. A1!

Decor: sexy and romantic. Perfect for dates or dinner with a good friend. Not too loud so you can actually have a conversation without raising your voice.

Yes, I will return soon!

Great espresso martinis and a delicious grilled chicken sandwich.  I would def recommend improving on their char-boiled oysters, $20 for half a dozen tiny oysters was absurd.  I had to send them back and ask that they look at the oysters they sent.  The picture below shows what they gave us after we asked about the size.  They also weren't tasty at all.  The best thing was that chicken sandwich.  My guest ordered a side car and also wasn't impressed.  I would come back to give them another try if I'm in the area.

I came to 1803 for a Meetup event after work. The outdoor seating is spacious and long, with a covered terrace with artwork and additional seating near the entrance. Inside I was greeted by the hostess who asked if I wanted to sit upstairs or downstairs. They entitled it was like a speakeasy, so of course I said yes. It's a dimly lit area except for the bar, which was fully stocked and presented beautifully. It has an antique feel downstairs, with the various mirrors and clocks. Even the furniture gives way to a classy lounge feel.

They have happy hour until 7, which is $2 off all drinks and there is a happy hour food menu. I ordered The BC French 75, and what intrigued me were the ingredients: Dorothy Parker Rose Petal Infused Gin, Boulard Calvados, Cognac, Grenadine, Absinthe, lemon garnish, Faire La Fete Crémant Brut, lemon Juice & lemon garnish. I had to ask the bartender and waitress what some things were, but the drink was spectacular. Each sip made you realize that you were drinking something unique and well-made. It wasn't too sweet tasting, nor bitter.

For dinner, I ordered cajun rice and buttermilk fried oysters. The Creole spices were prevalent and thoroughly enjoyable. The fried oysters paired nicely with the aioli sauce. I look forward to trying more of the menu when I finish my vegetarian summer.

The bar is stinky like that old sour beer smell and should have tipped me off. Bartender poorer beer and had to spill it a few times to clear the foamed head. Then ordered eggplant parm and it was apparent then heated up a frozen square of eggplant in the microwave. The cheese consistency was off and off and the eggplant rubbery. Can't understand how they have good ratings.

This is such a cute place with both indoor and outdoor dining.  I was here celebrating with a group of colleagues and the food was amazing.  They have an extensive happy hour menu and impressive cocktail list.  
I took away one star because the service was friendly but a little slow in terms of ensuring we had refreshments and refills.

we also tried the escargot and the grilled oysters both of which were good but not the best I've had.  we also tried the spinach artichoke dip that had a little kick to it, but before we could finish the waiter removed the chips leaving us just the dip.
I loved loved the bouillabaisse with all the clams, mussels, shrimp and pieces of fish.  If I weren't with colleagues I would have drank all the broth and licked the cast iron pan.
I will definitely be returning.

Came here on 10/5/2023 for a quick bite before an event with my husband and was initially impressed by the atmosphere. The decor was lovely and I adored the tall windows, floral wallpaper, and intricate balcony on the upper level.

We specifically came for happy hour and it noted on the menu that it was the "best happy hour in Tribeca" but alas - I must admit that it was not. The drink 'specials' were noted as $2 off everything on the menu. That does not an impressive happy hour make. Also, the food prices were not that discounted either. They had mini sandwiches and small bites that again, weren't impressive price-wise.

The only reason this review is getting 4 stars instead of 3 is that gosh darn gumbo. That was GOOD. It was a lovely roux mixed with crab, sausage, shrimp, chicken, and oysters. And as good as it tasted - I do have some qualms. 1) I didn't even know there was chicken in it until I grabbed a bite (there was 1 small piece) 2) There were only 2 shrimp 3) The rice it came with was horribly bland 4) There was WAY too much garnish of green onion and 4) It was mainly andouille sausage. However, note my 4 starts. This gumbo is GOOD. I just wish it showed up more for $20 worth of soup and a side of inedible rice.

Now time for the staff: aloof, uninterested, bored, dismissive, [insert other adjective here]. You can tell when somebody actually cares about you and your experience and likewise you can tell when somebody is just doing their job. They were just at work. We had to ask for everything, flag them down, etc. We, as customers, were just another invisible person who happened up on their day and seemed to annoy them. It wasn't great to feel that way.

Long story short - I would return for the decor and gumbo and hope they improve upon their staff, prices ("best happy hour in Tribeca"????? not by a long shot...) and content within said gumbo (more seafood, less garnish!)

Came the first time and liked it but that was a year ago. Wanted to come back and try it again but everything was different. The food, the ambiance, the music and the service. I was very excited about their biscuits which I had before and made me want to come back.
However, they decided to put cold toast as replacement instead of letting us know they didn't have biscuits and give another option to choose from... when we asked the waitress about it, she never came back to follow up. Food was overall really just ok and honestly not worth the price even in NYC

First of all, I've been 1803 a couple of times and I've loved it every time. The food, ambience and the drinks are always amazing. The food portions are huge and the food is delicious. So why the 4 stars? Well, it was because of my recent visit here. I wanted to go to Bon Courage and made reservations on the phone! When I arrived there, the host told me they were having a private party and seated me at 1803. This put me off! I really wanted to try Bon Courage. They could've just reached out ahead and mentioned that they had a private event and rescheduled. Anyhow, our waitress was attentive and sweet! Overall, it was a good experience, but I'm still sad that I couldn't get to go to Bon Courage!

I ironically booked a reservation here to take my guests that were in town & realized it was in my Yelp collection but more importantly that I accidentally came here with the gals late one night after my show right before they closed so super happy to mark it off my list! Soooo cute outside & in. We were seated immediately. We were surprised by live gumbo jazz & then the dj who transitioned in was great.
I decided to order the gumbo this time & it was amazing! Perfect level of spice. I also ordered the beignets because how could I not?! And, yes did I stuff a couple of them with the strawberries served with it...so yummy! I absolutely plan to return here for the gumbo & the beignets again.
The catfish sandwich was good as well but not the best I've had.
Go, enjoy!!

I will concede that Cajun cuisine is perhaps not the easiest to make vegetarian friendly, so I applaud the effort. The environs are lively on an otherwise desolate portion of Church Street that used to host the much-beloved Pakistani Tea House (R.I.P.).

The appetizers of the meal were the highlight for me. The cauliflower tacos were an excellent rendition of the dish - I hate when restaurants bring a sad piece of roasted cauliflower sandwiches between a tortilla, and these were deep fried as they should be. The brussel sprouts and artichoke dip were also delicious.

As for the vegan jambalaya, it left something to be desired. For starters, I'm not certain why a vegan preparation necessitated substituting cauli-"rice" for actual rice. Vegetarianism is often mistakenly conflated with a distaste for flavor and calories. The spices also seemed a bit underwhelming, and I couldn't help but feel disappointed.

The bread pudding for dessert was probably the best item of the night, so save some room for that.

I had brunch here over the weekend. The restaurant is cute and they had a live band playing so that was a nice vibe. I had a sangria, charbroiled oysters to start and gumbo with Cajun rice. Sangria was delicious. The oysters were good but a lil on the pricey side for what you get. I enjoyed the gumbo though it was a lil bland and I thought it could be thicker. It was ok but not great. I've been to New Orleans so obviously the gumbo is better there. The only annoying thing was one guys who I guess picks up the dishes when you're done kept coming over asking if he could take our plates away. However our server who took our orders was pleasant.

This place gives Tribeca some much needed fun. It's a Cajun New Orleans themed restaurant (with a secret speak easy) that has great raw bar, cocktails, full entrees...and a happy hour? It may only be $2 off drinks and apps, but it's still helps when you live in NY.  

Drinks: 4/5. Tasty and decently strong, and most come with a giant Ice cube. The small touches stand out. However, they are still close to $20 so you remember you are in Manhattan

Food: 4/5. My wife liked their jambalaya and I enjoyed all the apps I tried. Oysters are fresh and big, worth having as you sip cocktails

Value: 4/5. Not cheap but an excellent value for that upper middle meal. Think it would be a nice happy hour pick or second date kind of place.

Ambiance: 5/5. we went a few times in 2021 during Covid and enjoyed both the outdoor heated seating and the indoor vibes. although it does get crowded, it's not overwhelming with people bumping you. Try eating upstairs for a better view!

My friend suggested we come here, we came in & were seated right away once seated we ordered drinks.
Drinks , we had Three muses & Oh the Places You'll Go these were both good.
Boudin in a blanket for appetizer , not bad at all these were very tasty.
Main dishes we went with Braised short Ribs, wow this was delicious great taste to the meat very good over all, also tried the  XO Noodles, good noodles they seem to be a favorite here & I can see why nice tasting noodles with some seafood not bad at all.
Nice atmosphere, fun decor .. Music wise u got the band playing gives the place a nice feel to it, service was good & prices are normal to the area, we enjoyed our our time & meal.

Our family arrived for dinner and was quickly seated.  The restaurant is very lively and jazz band was great. Reminded of me of New Orleans and being in the French quarter. But other than the band I didn't see anything else that told me this was a Cajun restaurant.

Being from the gulf coast we know Cajun food.  So finding this place was exciting.  Upon browsing the menu I would say this was some type Cajun - Japanese fusion ?? Not true Cajun.  
Yes they do have gumbo and jambalaya. But the flavors are not true Cajun. How are XO noodles, Mac& cheese, fried chicken , honey chili Brussel sprouts etc on the menu but not shrimp and grits or red beans and rice or a po boy ? But you have steak frites. Makes no sense. The cocktails were not even Cajun inspired.
I will say the fresh oysters were good.

We were just really disappointed in the menu, if we came wanting a fusion that's different but the restaurant states on their website that they are a Cajun restaurant.
The food we had was ok but not Cajun.  

The service was rushed when ordering after we told our server we had never been there before. We had a party of 7.  The whole experience was disappointing.
If you are looking for Cajun fusion come here if looking for true Cajun go elsewhere.

One of my brothers friends suggested this place after we walked the Brooklyn Bridge. The place was packed and I did not think we would get a table as most people had reservations but they found us a table upstairs. 1803 is a great place for a date, after work, or a casual dinner. I really enjoyed our waiter as she was knowledgeable but also had a sense of humor.
The food was amazing but I think my favorite was the Brussels sprouts. There is something about NYC and how they can not only make great food but amazing drinks as well. All of our drinks were made perfectly with the I don't taste liquor but oh my this drink is strong lol.
Next time I'm in town I will stop by again to try out the rest of the menu.

While we really enjoyed the ambiance and live music, the portion size of the food for the price was just not worth it. I got the French Toast Beignet and was still hungry after, even though I tend to leave brunch with leftovers.

WOW. I was blown away by the ambiance & food here. I could not put my spoon/fork down!

I came here at the perfect time because they are New Orleans inspired so they have tons of events and fun decor to celebrate Mardi Gras!

The vibe in here is super my scene. Dim lights, fun decor. I like that there is an upstairs location too with lots of seating.

It was pretty crowded when we got here but it didn't affect our great service. There was also a live band playing and we had the perfect view and seat.

There were tarot card readings & a drag show as well!

Like I mentioned before, the food was so good, I couldn't put my fork/spoon down! The gumbo was out of this world! So much flavor, the perfect amount of spice & the rice that was served with it had a kick but wasn't overpowering.
The fried chicken was some of the best I've ever had. It fell right off the bone with how tender it was but the outside was still crisp and packed with flavor.
The only thing I'd skip is the Mac & cheese. I wasn't a fan but probably only because I don't really like rosemary and it is topped with it.

Other than that, everything was phenomenal and I'd highly recommend!

I came here for dinner. The place was rather empty at about 6 PM and it started to fill up at about 730. They have a really cute space and it looks smaller in the photographs that it is in reality.

Downstairs they have hightops and booths and upstairs they have smaller patio tables which look like they are for lunches. There's a real new Orleans feel about the place as well. I love the plant wallpaper!

I came here with family and was seated near the window. I had the herbal Bourbon cocktail which I enjoyed a good deal, and I also tried the fried brussels sprouts, spinach and artichoke dip, fried green tomatoes and bourbon sweet potato purée. out of these I would say the fried green tomatoes were on the more disappointing side because they were not crispy enough and not light on the inside. I would say the first round of brussels sprouts was excellent and the second round was kind of soggy so we had to send it back. However when it did come back it was delicious.

I would say most of my family did not have the best time at the restaurant because the wine pours are on the smaller side and there was inconsistencies with food preparation. I would say the food is truly very tasty and delicious, but they do need to have some consistency in the preparation. I will come back to try more of the dishes.

I sat at the bar it was very lively lots of large groups celebrating birthdays. I'd definitely go back on a girls night. Drinks were great except the bartender forgot ice so my first drink tasted a bit off the second ( sangria) was way too sweet. Food was fantastic we had the fried oysters ( meh) the gumbo was delicious and the fish was so good I cleaned my plate. We had the beignets with chocolate sauce for dessert and I was tempted to order some to go.

Love it such I cute place.

I have visited this place once before and didnt eat but enjoyed their lovely mocktail selection and bar banter so much I had to come back and try out their menu . I love the bright airy decor while hearing Prince "sexy m.f " blaring through the speakers . The waitress was cute and the food came fast . We ordered some drinks began to dig in . The gumbo was delicious, so was that bouillabaise seafood dish he ordered (he swapped whatever bread it came with for garlic soudough , excellent choice because it went well with the seafood . I loved our drinks and entree's but not in love with the charbroiled oysters. They were good but almost tasted like pizza sauce and it definitely wasn't authentic Nola charbroiled oysters. Will it stop us from returning? Nope ! Whenever we can we will return for another go round .

I would give it a 3.5 but let's round up to 4. Visited on a Thursday after work, pretty packed both inside and out but was seated promptly with my reservation.

I enjoyed watching the live band and the atmosphere was very lively. Waitress was attentive. I had a hurricane mocktail that was good. It was happy hour so $1 off appetizers-- we tried the baked Oysters, Brussel sprouts (favorite of the night) and the shrimp.

For entrees I had the fried chicken which came with Mac and cheese and cold slaw. Wasn't the best I've had and under the breading the chicken was dark which I was turned off by. My friend had the jambalaya and enjoyed it!

Sorry I only took videos and not pictures

Found this spot from an IG recommendation. Decided to take a friend for a birthday on lunch. The service was pretty good but the vibe was quiets since it was just opening for the day.

The lavender gin cocktail was everything I thought it would be! I love duck everything so I knew I couldn't go wrong with the salad. Spinach dip was just okay and sufficed as an appetizer. The oysters and the escargot were on the salty side for me but tasty.

I would definitely come again during the afterwork/ early evening hours to try some other dishes.

Cute, charming and cozy! Dim lighting and a sexy ambiance. We popped in and sat at the bar to order a few cocktails before our dinner reservation at another restaurant. There was a live band and they were so good! I ordered the St. Expedite 18 because I am a mezcal lover! It was perfectly crafted and so delicious. It went down smooth and was packed with flavor.

My friend put me on to 1803 NYC a few months ago and I'm a fan. The ambiance and decor are really nice. They have a speakeasy downstairs, which is dope. I hosted a happy hour there once and the staff was accommodating and friendly.

I love 1803's charbroiled oysters -- I wish the dish came with more oysters because it's not too filling (I can EAT). However, this is one of their popular dishes, and if you're an oyster lover, you should definitely try them! I had the Garden Burger yesterday and it was pretty good. My friend had the Jambalaya and he loved it. I had a taste and it was good; it just needed a bit more seasoning IMO.

The drinks here are pretty good and strong too, especially the Hurricane. They also have a decent selection of beers on their menu.

Every time I've come here, the staff is always nice. I'd recommend 1803 for happy hour and dinner.

Great find! We were looking for a breakfast spot and came across 1803 NYC and it was excellent! Beautiful ambiance both inside and outside. The Bellini pitcher was completely worth it and the food was amazing. Everyone was friendly and attentive. Definitely must try.

Came on a Sunday early afternoon with no reservations for three. Was seated upstairs promptly. Ordered a cappuccino while waiting for the rest of our party. She took so long, we got hungry and thirsty and decided to order a carafe of Bellini. I ordered the cast iron Cajun frittata. Food was delicious. Service was courteous and friendly. Very chic, bohemian ambiance. There was also a jazz band playing. I will definitely be checking this place out again to try different menu items.

This place is super pretty and has all the vibes, music was dope, great drinks, and the secret basement area is perf for date night. Area for improvement would be the food. Felt like the jambalaya was dry dry. Gumbo lacked flavor. Mac n cheese could be creamier/cheesier!

Trendy and vibrant restaurant serving Cajun style dishes and fancy cocktails. I came here for lunch with a group of friends and had a great time. The Special Blend Burger was basically your normal burger but served on a brioche bread. Maybe I was extremely hungry, but I thought it was juicy and satisfying. They have plenty of vegan/vegetarian options. I was definitely eyeing the Vegan Jambalaya. It just looked and smelled delicious.  '

The staff was absolutely wonderful and attentive. The place is known for its live music and apparently they have a speakeasy bar in the basement.

Overall, 4 stars.
Came here on a whim and this place did not disappoint! Inside and outside decor was too cute and the food was delish! Will definitely be coming here again.

Was brought here on my birthday and it was such a beautiful place with really nice interior. It's a really huge place and I went on a rainy day on a Monday and it was still a nice and full crowd. They have a second floor for seating as well as outside the restaurant. The food was delicious, I had the Cajun Shrimp wrap and it was so good, along with some Oysters and couple of drinks. The waiting staff were so sweet and one of them overheard it was my birthday and decided to surprise me with a candle. I definitely have to come back here and try the rest of the menu.
Good food. Great drinks. Awesome ambiance. 1803 is a unique place for dinner and drinks, in a neighborhood overloaded with Italian restaurants and pubs. Check it out!

Lovely restaurant. Their Sunday brunch is super underrated. They have a live band come in and they add such a great twist to brunch classics. Our server was also very kind and attentive (could be because they weren't very busy for brunch but we appreciated it nonetheless)

My girlfriend and I went with a group of friends on a Tuesday evening. There was a band that was a bit loud but still great vibes. We ordered the fried chicken with Cole slaw and Mac and cheese as sides. All was amazing!

Definitely more of a "bar scene" or "bar vibe".
Very personal service, and fun !
With mediocre dishes.
Been around like forever.

Such a cute place!!! Makes me feel like I'm in New Orleans... and I've never been ahaha.

Drinks were on point! This is a great spot for a nice brunch, a little live music not too loud, lots of different faces, and yummy food.

Charbroiled oysters - gotta have em.

I tried my boyfriends chicken & waffles. The waffle yummm, the CHICKEN??? They should take that off the menu.

This place offers an irreplaceable vibe, love it!

1803 Nyc is a lovely place to have a bite or a drink. We went during happy hour, and there was no wait time. Once seated, we waited quite a bit to order our drinks, but my hot toddy was worth the wait. It was perfect! I had the boudin in a blanket which had a pleasing mild flavor, as well as the mushroom sauce. The waitress was amiable. The ambiance of the restaurant was cozy. Enjoy.

Great brunch spot with NOLA vibes and hearty food. We were lucky to have a live jazz band playing upstairs. I will say however that they were so loud that it was hard to talk. The food and vibes were good for a group!

We tried the escargot which was interesting - specifically the buttery sauce was phenomenal. For the entrees we tried the frittata and the chicken and waffles. The frittata was very cheesy but pretty tasty. The biscuit was hard and tasteless, but otherwise I enjoyed the dish. The chicken and waffles were a highlight. The waffles were sweet and crunchy all at once and went perfectly with the crispy chicken. I was very pleased with that dish.

Overall, fun spot with good and hearty food. Would recommend!

Came here with a group of girlfriends and we were all running late (lol) and they were very nice about it which is not typical of NYC places. The service was very attentive and the drinks were decent. Vibe was a little bridge-and-tunnely which is not my scene at all, but everyone was nice at least.

The food was fine but nothing to write home about. We shared the fried oysters across the table and they were more like oyster fritters but were tasty. None of the food really stood out to me so I opted to get a couple apps instead. The spinach dip, while not the most attractive dish, was tasty and they offered free refills on the chips which was nice. Fries weren't the best - just a little soggy and not super flavorful.

Overall, glad I tried it but I don't think I'd go back.

Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Experience: 5/5

1803 is serving some of the best Cajun-Creole food I've ever had. It's a pretty quaint space, but it has amazing vibes and there's plenty of seating available. My two friends and I shared the signature gumbo, which was absolutely amazing, as was the bouillabaisse, which I ordered as my lunch entree. Both dishes that I tried were incredibly flavorful and perfectly spiced. Even if you're not near Tribeca, 1803 is entirely worth the trip!

Very hip restaurant with fantastic music. They sat us pretty quickly after we had made a reservation earlier. Menu is on the pricier side but the food is rock solid. We ordered seafood based plates and they were very tasty. Drinks were okay, but our waitress was very nice to offer birthday shots for our friend's big day. Overall very happy. Will be back for more. The jazz music was a big highlight

Make reservations! This place gets packed during peak times. Call for a reservation, as online doesn't always show all available times.

Came here on a freezing, snowy Saturday morning with 12:15pm reservations. The place packed to the brim by 12:30pm.

Outdoor seating with heated lamps is available. Seat indoors to enjoy the pretty decor and great music.

Live music plays every weekend 12-3pm and 6-10pm. Really enjoyed listening to some incredible jazz. The musicians were super talented.

Service is courteous and quick.

The food was delicious. $15 gumbo was hearty and filling, with a good amount of seafood. Highly recommend.

$18 pulled pork Benedict was great. Biscuit was fresh, pulled pork, delicate.

$18crawfish cake was delectable. Well seasoned, tender crawfish cake. Could eat a ton of these. Home potatoes that were served with Benedict's were a bit on the bland side.

$4 cappuccino was on point.

Check out their website for a schedule of musicians playing for the days that you want to visit.

The gumbo(18) is excellent. It's thick and there is a fair amount. It's nice and filling. It's $5 more for rice, not sure if that's jambalaya but it's worth checking.

The mini chicken sandwich(12) during happy hour is tasty. It's mini, but honestly there are many restaurants that serve this size and call it normal. You really do get a good value here.

Decent Cajun food with great, friendly service. Unfortunately, the weather was incredibly hot and we were seated in one of the close in outdoor booths, which basically became a mini sauna over time. Would definitely advise sitting inside or at the open air spots if you're visiting sometime this summer.

We ordered several appetizers, the chargrilled oysters were the best along with the Brussels sprouts. The XO noodles were my favorite of all the entrees, and the jambalaya would take a close second.

Employees were great! Very friendly and our waitress even offered us a free drink that was going to be tossed otherwise :)

Lively spot for a boozy brunch, drinks, and live jazz music. I joined a few friends here for Sunday brunch, and had a great time enjoying New Orleans inspired dishes while sipping on a few cocktails. I ordered the Crawfish Cake Eggs Benedict, and although it looked small at first, it was suprisingly filling!

Fun, bright vibes all around. Make sure the check their schedule for live music - this would definitely be a cute spot for a girls outing or brunch date!

The food is so good! I came here for a bday brunch and they were so accommodating. The charbroiled oysters were perfectly seasoned and the crawfish cake benefit was delightfully on brand. My friend was visiting from New Orleans and she thought the food really good as well. The service and waitstaff were so sweet and they had a live band on Sunday! Would definitely come back!

Lovely Cajun brunch spot with live music! Came here with a friend and got the:

1) Jambalaya (5/5): So. Filling. You get a huge bowl of rice, chicken, sausage, and shrimp that's seasoned perfectly.
2) Cajun escargot (2/5): This was my first (and last) time trying escargot. Definitely not for me, hence the low rating, but escargot-lovers may feel differently.
3) Crawfish cake benedict (4/5): Pretty tasty, although you could probably forego the potatoes - they were dry and didn't have much flavor.

If you're in the mood for a boozy brunch and some live performances (check out their website to see who's scheduled), check this place out!

This spot was interesting. First, we came in and started at the bar and had to move outside quickly as the music inside was so loud we couldn't even catch up and talk with our friends easily. It was a bummer. We wound up outside, even though we hoped for music, but the sound was so jarring we would have wound up screaming. The food was good, but as someone who has spent quite a lot of time in New Orleans, this food wasn't firing on all cylinders. It was a bit disappointing. I love New Orleans and its cuisine and hoped this would bring me back to my many trips but it just didn't. We dined outside and were forgotten by the staff for most of night. Our drinks remained unfilled for awhile, hard to get attention about food/ordering, it was frustrating. Not going to venture back anytime soon. Was hoping for much more from this place.

94 Deli & Salad you are absolutely amazing, I had a wonderful experience here yesterday. The prices are very reasonable, especially considering its location. Their menu has every thing I love and I'm so excited to try it all. Staff are really friendly. They're accommodating, polite and always on their game. Really what more can you ask for?

The Newport Mall once had a "robo-burger" machine. It didn't get much business and in a few months it was gone. Not everything needs high technology.

77 Burger is a slower process than some of your favorite chains. But the fresh flame-broiled burgers are worth the wait. I've enjoyed the New Yorker, the Chipotle and California. The add-ons are impressive but I should probably try the plain next time, kind of like when I'm trying a new pizza joint I don't start with pineapple-and-ham.

The pickle is a nice touch for those of us who want five seconds of feeling healthy before consuming a massive amount of meat. The service is always friendly and the outdoor section has certainly been welcome in the Covid era.

I don't know the economics of how a homespun place like this gets by in an expensive, chain-dominated region, but it's a delightful outlier.

Delicious and easy to order from. Available to call in or order from grubhub or DoorDash. And food is ready within fair amount of time, and when they say it will be ready, it's ready. It's a small place, but they have a "bar seating" by the window for like 5? Maybe? and, an outdoor seating area. The burgers here as delicious and so are the fries! Someone told me their milkshakes are good. Have to try them next.

Stumbled on this in the FiDi area and was craving a burger. This is like a hole in the wall burger stand which has different variety of burgers and other finger foods such as sandwiches and hot dogs. I got the New Yorker which was tasty and the burger was juicy. Plus it came with a side of fries which were nice and crispy, all for $16 which is decent in the city. It's not really a sitdown place but sat on the little counter since i couldn't wait to eat haha.  Recommend to try!

Fresh 8 oz. Angus beef  patty cooked a nice  "MR" as requested.  All ingredients fresh.  Staff was very friendly.
    The only two things that didn't make it perfect were that the bun wasn't toasted and the crispy onions on the California burger were not crispy.  Next time I'll ask them to toast the bun, which I am sure they would be happy to do.

On a lunch break from touring the Wall Street area, I thought I'd give this restaurant a try since I had a limited time.  So glad I did.  

It's a no-frill restaurant.  The limited menu is very much to the point.  After placing the order, Bacon Cheese Burger with a Strawberry Shake, the cooked to order meal was up within 10 minutes or so.  

I sat in the "patio" since it was a warm spring day.  The burger was grilled perfectly while the fries were well seasoned.  The shake was thick.  

I would highly recommend this restaurant when you are in the Wall Street area.

The chipotle burger was not a tease-- it brought the heat!!

I was so happy to find this cute burger and hot dog spot with its outdoor seating off the corner of Stone Street. With reasonable prices (offering a number of items under $15) and 8 oz. burgers (fries included), 77 Burger is the place to go for a quick and scrumptious bite after a drink at Ulysses, or wherever the day/night leads you.

My chipotle burger was made ready quickly and included cheese, jalapeños, sauce, lettuce, tomato, and fried onions! There were fries and a pickle on the side. I'm trying to eat less carbs, so I ate around the bun with a fork and knife and skipped out on the fries (sadsad), but the burger paired with toppings was excellent!

As a spicy food lover who hates when restaurants falsely advertise spice, I approve of this burger's heat level; my mouth was burning (in the best way). Looking forward to stopping by again. I'd even consider trekking out from Brooklyn specifically for 77 Burger.
Angus burger and chilli fries were fantastic. Friendly service, now my go to burger place in NYC. Thank you
Excellent burgers and amazing fries.  Always reliable and fresh.  Friendly service.  A solid neighborhood gem!
It's a very good burger. Used to go here during work so decided to try it out the other day and did not disappoint.

I ordered a Chipotle Burger with onion rings.  Onion rings is my favor.  I asked burger to be medium.  When I got back to my desk.  I open my order.  The order is huge. Burger is more toward medium to rare.  I would rather have medium to cook.    Next time I know I will order medium well.  Overall the burger is really good and the price is good.  I will definitely go back again,,  Good burger!!!!

Yess!  Found another good burger spot in NYC.  Most places on Stone Street were closed at the time but but I got the Chipotle Burger (B8).  I'm still thinking about it.  For $16 you get so much food.  I've paid $23 for a burger here at NYC and this is still much better.

I'll be back when I'm in the area to try the Bison Burger that was ordered a few times after me.

I was very pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food and service.

This place is right at the end of Stone Street, so I had imagined it was a go-to drunk food spot. Far from the greasy expectations I generally have for drunk food, their burgers are made to order, and very fresh. They offer a huge selection of options and operate a sizable takeout business.

Their fries were crispy and perfectly well cooked. And the portions were more than I could finish.

They only have the capacity for two people to eat in, but there are plenty of places to sit and eat in the area, including a number of tables right in front.

Came here after going to some nearby bars last night to get some fries without many expectations. I thought it was a bit pricey for just an order of cheese fries, but they really did hit the spot. The portion size was pretty large as it filled up a whole to-go container. The fries had good flavor and were cooked just the right amount.
Excellent burger and fries.   Very fresh food indeed.  Epic drink choices   Very friendly service.

Best burger I've had in NY! Juicy delicious, great price. My girlfriend and I split the burger and curly fries sitting in Manhattan. 77 burger was open during COVID and was social distancing and using masks. Wish I was in Manhattan more just to try more burgers.
Delicious burgers and large portions! Got delivery and it arrived very fresh. My favorite indie burger in the neighborhood

It's $13 for a bacon cheeseburger and fries, and for that price, you can't really complain when everywhere else in FiDi is charging $15/16+ for just a burger.

Good comfort food, good service. Milkshakes are great too.
Great burgers! Made to order! Really big size! Good price, especially for the area. My boyfriend and I came here and loved the service and the food. Def would come back!

Went for pickup during the lockdown. Food was very good. Mexican hotdog was great and if you like nice crispy fries this is your spot.
Staff were really friendly and accommodating.

I have to admit, 77 Burger was simply phenomenal. Prices were right. Pretty much every item that we have purchased was very fresh and yummy. Every one was so helpful. Only wish I had found 77 Burger sooner.

Run, don't walk... away from this place. Burgers are so dry and flavorless (unless you like that fake charcoal flavor reminiscent of Sizzler) it's like eating an old sponge. Burgers are like pizza... a  fast food staple and really difficult to make a bad one. Unfortunately, these folks have succeeded. I've tried this place a few times thinking it'll get better. It didn't.
Amazing burgers & personnel! Really enjoyed this fresh hot food. Highly recommend the California burger & chipotle burger. We will be back!
Ordered mozzarella sticks and curly fries. Hit the spot perfectly for motz sticks and curly fries. Can't go wrong and the food came super fast.

It's obviously easy to find coffee anywhere in the city but if you're looking for an off label, high quality, customer service-oriented "hole in the wall" coffee shop then this is the perfect place to go. You'll see what the photographs of white array of coffee, selections, and even a swing to sit and sip your coffee while gazing out to the street.

The interior decorator for this coffee shop should also be commended. There are beautiful flowers, decorating the walls and chic lighting to help emphasize meaningful phrases in our every day lives. Coffee is excellent and I highly recommend this coffee shop!

Wonderful, bold, aromatic coffee  brought to New York City from sustainable farms in Puerto Rico + warm service with a smile!

#Boricua
#boricua_spirit

Cozy space & good coffee. I stopped by around 8am on a weekend and it was the perfect spot to catch up on some work before heading to a conference.

Found this spot since it was a 5 min walk away from my hotel. Pretty empty in the morning. Wifi is fast, plenty of outlets near tables. My order came out within 5 mins of placing.

MOCHA LATTE: Solid mocha! Rich, velvety, and super caffeinated. Coffee flavor is bold & strong. I played it safe since I'm not a coconut/cinnamon fan, but their menu's signature drinks were quite tempting.

CHICKEN EMPANADA: Toasty, shredded chicken, though on the drier/saltier side.

Staff are lovely! They're patient with questions and extremely attentive-- even with fewer patrons around, they still made sure to tidy up any tables and ask how folks were doing. Restrooms were super clean.

It happened to be in the area for an event and it was the wrong day. So, feeling a little defeated, I noticed there were different businesses in the area that I could check out from my lists. Lo and behold, right around the corner, 787 was there like a shining Beacon. I had my mouth set for a quesito and one of those specialty infused lattes that they're famous for.
The space was reticent of an old meets new cafes in Puerto Rico with a great vibe. The staff was super nice, offering a sniff of the alcohol infused beans to help make a decision for a drink. I went with a whiskey infused horchata Latte and it was robust and flavorful. $11 plus a tip is higher on the range for the little pouch, but quality is not cheap. Sadly enough, the quesitos were all gone. I will definitely be back when the even actually happens or when I'm in the area.
Cute coffee shop! It has a lot of tables and sitting space. It was a good place to work, though the music is a little loud. Overall the coffee and atmosphere was good, and I'll be back!

I came here for around 3 hours to get some work done, and that's definitely the weekday energy for this FiDi spot. It's probably between a 4 and a 5, because I enjoyed the creative Puerto Rican drink options (I got the Mazapan Latte, which was billed as a pretty nutty coffee) and I thought they were pretty good). The hours are great, as they close at 8 pm on weekdays which is incredible, and their wifi is pretty solid but not out of this world. The latte came out to ~$9 post tip, which isn't cheap but for a specialty in NYC, it's okay. Solid spot that I'd come back to to work with a friend for sure (lot of seating as well)!

I came here today and decided to try the Iced mazapan latte. It was so good! Staff was very kind to suggest this with empanadas and breakfast tacos as well.
Definitely has that Puerto Rican taste and vibe because of the peanut flavor.
Will definitely go back for their famous coquito latte and horchata latte. 10/10 :)
Had the matcha latte with oat milk, not the best we had in the city but a decent option

my favorite coffee shop in the area! absolutely love the ambiance -- perfect place to work at and the coffee is amazing. baristas are also really helpful and pleasant. not sure how they're able to make a basic americano with oat milk so delicious but they do. worth dealing with the strange IV bags

I really like this place! I love that the iced coffee cokes in this plastic bag. I had the dulce de leche latte which was amazing. My friend had the coquito latte, also pretty good! We had their quesito which I'm shocked was not sold out by 2pm. The place is super busy and there's seating to work inside or out.

A great place to grab a cup of coffee and get some work done.

The menu is pretty straightforward. The coffee is strong. There's free wifi. It is a little spotty, but most of the time, it works. There are outlets scattered about. The restroom is clean.

Most of the patrons do work in the cafe. The staff are amazing. They circled around the cafe and passed out glasses of water. They really push to make sure that guests can get the 5% neighborhood discount.

Great coffee shop to get some work done -- plenty of seating, wide and sturdy desks, and wall outlets to crank out whatever task at hand :)
Dogged the vibe as well.

My wife and I were looking for coffee shops with unique or seasonal drinks, which was actually pretty hard to find. Most places were only offering basic drip or espresso drinks. We were glad we found 787 Coffee!

We ordered the mazapan latte & hot coquito latte:

- Mazapan latte: It had a rich and sweet peanut taste. The peanuts gave the drink a smooth, balanced flavor with the espresso.

- Hot coquito latte: We loved the combination of the coconut milk, cinnamon, and nutmeg. It felt like Christmas in a cup!

Overall, we couldn't decide which one we liked more; they were both delicious. We'll definitely be back to try to the horchata latte and rum infused espresso!

I am in culinary bliss!. I had their Chicken Empanada  and their Coquito + Rum iced Latte! The food did come at a price but it was well worth it. The decor felt welcoming and the people were friendly.  The star of my morning was the food, on my last day in NYC I leave with a classy taste of Puerto Rico in my mouth and a happy heart!

Maybe New Yorkers are a mean bunch. Maybe you're just projecting? Because the young lady who greeted me this morning was pleasant and pleased to have me here as a customer. And I'm super pleased to be HERE and now down the street at the Green Siren people. Drink #LocalCoffee, my friends.

There's a neat welcoming vibe here at 787 in the Financial District. Music, comfy seats inside and out. Free wifi. Oh and my coffee was pretty darned amazing. Hooray for coffee shops that have a cortado on the menu.

Did I mention the cool air conditioning? It's super hot in August in NYC and it was great to get out of that today to write this and some other reviews.

How isn't that a five star experience?

[Review 17784 overall - 326 in New York - 1305 of 2022.]

787 Coffee offers consistently good coffee and customer service at each location. I'm not visiting this location anymore because I have a 787 Coffee closer to home. It's a great place to meet friends. If you are nearby try it.

I was in the area for an appointment yesterday and 787 looked like the perfect place to grab breakfast and coffee before the drive home.  I tried:

-Iced Coquito Latte: I was surprised that this was pre-packaged in a bottle in the cold case, but the barista asked me if I wanted it served over ice.  I said yes and definitely recommend getting it this way, as the drink is delicious served icy cold.  The first few sips hit me with a ton of nutmeg which was a little overwhelming at first, but as I continued sipping it mellowed out and I couldn't stop drinking it.  Loved how creamy and rich it was!
Sidenote: I'm not sure if they allow you to bring your own reusable cups, but you might want to bring one if possible to avoid a second plastic item if you get this served over ice.

-Chrozio and potato breakfast taco:  They have a rotating selection of breakfast tacos, but this was the only one they had left when I stopped in.  No problem for me as it's probably what I would have selected anyway.  Their website mentions that these sell out fast so get there early if you want one.  The taco was good, but it was pretty small.  What I thought was the best though was the hot sauce they served with it.  Definitely ask for a cup of this on the side as it was really good.

Service was good - there was one barista handling the line which was almost out the door.  There was also a decent amount of seating if you wanted to eat in.  All-in-all a cute cafe that I would return to!

Coffee AND Tacos!?! It can't get any better than this. I didn't get a chance to try the tacos since it was so early in the morning, but I'm sure they're delicious. I just love the hipster feel of the entire place. After grabbing my cold brew, I sat around for a bit just to check out the art work. I love the signs that they have all over the place. This place screams out, "welcome, you belong, inclusive, progress, art, no fu**s given". Love it!

Also, my cold brew was fantastic!

I love supporting local NYC ...
This coffee house is farm-to-table !
You can feel the warmth as soon as you walk in. Great coffee choices - they offer a Rum infused espresso - quite creative. The bakery selection is a great combo of sweet / savory.
There is nothing better than having a great brewed cup of coffee at a welcoming warm happy place!
Delicious coffee, vibrant colors, amazing culture, and good service. One of my favorite coffee shops in Manhattan.

I was in the area to visit my office and needed a coffee hit. Google lead me to 787 Coffee. There was a huge line at the counter, so I appreciated that they had an ordering station at the door. I opted to order at the station, which was fast.

However, I did notice that they have no creamer options besides almond and oat milk. I typically take a smidge of half & half with my coffee, as a little bit goes a long way. But that wasn't an option and other milk alternatives cost extra, even if it's just a bit in your cold brew. Didn't like that.

The coffee was fine, nothing to write home about. I think if you're in the area and you need coffee, go to Cafe Grumpy instead.

Lots of flies in the shop too.

If you can come to this place often, try EVERYTHING on their menu - drinks and food! This place is so good that there's ALWAYS a line. And it goes by fast because they always have a good amount of employees working. Mar is awesome! So if you ever get her to make your drink, she brings all the smiles and good vibes. I love how it's within walking distance of so many things so their location is convenient. Love love love their iced chai latte. Make sure to try all their pastries! You don't wanna miss out on the deliciousness!

Sadly underwhelmed. I'm an avid espresso drinker & paid 5.00+1 tip. Which I don't mind as long as it's worth it. But this amount is crazy. I don't see anything "Puerto Rican" like except for the names of the drinks/food items. I'm adding a pic of the untouched espresso. I'd rather go to Starbucks to get more & pay less. Also, the staff seems moody, felt like I was bothering them. I don't recommend.

At some point, the quality of coffee surpasses a threshold where it's hard to differentiate from shop to shop. The bar is set high for FiDi's busy office-goers, and 787 definitely meets it--quality ingredients, cozy interior, and super friendly staff!

First off, they source and grow their own coffee beans in Puerto Rico, making their coffee taste really unique and strong. I got a latte with almond milk and it was one of the best ones I've had in the area. The interior is spacious with lots of cozy chairs, funny signs, and overall plenty of room to come with a group and vibe for a little bit. The staff were also so nice--they offered a 10% discount for locals and also came around with some free chocolate while we were waiting!
