The only downside was that they couldn't warm up the guava cheese pastry we ordered, but we brought it home to toast up and it was delicious.

One of my new favorite coffee shops around!

We walked past this coffee shop and we walked in right away because of their super cute vibes!
Whenever you are searching for a place to find some creativity or focus on doing some work this is the perfect place. They have plenty of seating area paired with bites and coffee. You could easily spend all day here.
The girl at the coffee bar was super nice and friendly.
The only reason why I am giving them 4 stars its because their coffee was alright not the best I have had.
However, I can picture myself coming back to put-in some working hours and creativity!

Such a valuable coffee shop in FiDi! The baristas here put so much love into their work you can taste it in the coffee. I love the exquisite options and the coffee bean is so strong and delicious!

Prices are pretty good and very competitive for the area. Might I add they have some sweet options to go with your coffee that are unique like the guava cheese croissant or something. It was delicious.

The shop itself is so cute and sells funny t-shirts. There so much space to sit with free wifi and they have a printer for those city millennials!

This is such a lovely coffee shop with great vibes, ample space for working, great wifi, friendly employees, and a gender neutral restroom. I stopped by to get some work done in between appointments and was hoping to get a pastry. They were mostly sold out but the barista recommended their guava and cheese danish. The pastry was cold but delicious. The guava jam wasn't too sweet and dough was soft. However, my gripe is that the pastry cost a whooping $7.89. It wasn't even that big. I understand that their prices may be higher due to supporting fair trade coffee farms, but $7.89 for a small pastry is outrageous to me. I do love that their coffee is sourced from their own farms in Puerto Rico so don't let me dissuade you if their prices are within your budget.

Great coffee spot in FiDi. Found this place a while ago and I am glad to see people coming back to the area and enjoying 787 too. The coffee is Puerto Rican and they also have empanadas and other treats. Coffee drinks are on point, with non-dairy options available (oat, almond, soy). If you're in the mood for something sweeter but not overwhelming, highly recommend the coquito latte (iced!). Apparently they have tacos now, which is new to me but not opposed to the idea at all, since those are 2 things I highly care about - another reason to come back soon. Extra points for wall decoration. Baristas are super friendly and patient (I can be quite indecisive when deciding whether I should try a new coffee drink).
Great vibes for coffee break with coworkers and they have plenty of space to work/study if you need a change.

The coffee was ok, a bit too sweet for my taste. The person who took my order was nice, but the lady with curly hair making the drinks rolled her eyes at me because I am hard of hearing and needed her to repeat what the drink was. Usually baristas help me out by repeating the drink order when asked - didn't think it was such a big inconvenience for her.
I had the Iced Horchata latte with their rum infused beans, best coffee I've had. It's a cozy place and has very kind workers.

Loved the atmosphere of this casual and cozy cafe in Fidi. They offer interesting coffee specials like the horchata latte and maple latte (I ordered that one and it was delish). They also have other grab and go options including empanadas and packaged items. If you want a heartier morning meal, they do have made-to-order items for breakfast. There were plenty of seats open when I went around 11am and it seems like it's a gathering place for people taking a break to have conversations inside and outside.

Visited New York for a quick little weekend trip we were walking the financial district and wanted to grab a coffee when I found 787 Coffee on Yelp. Fun little spot and the coffee was delicious. I had the coquito and my husband had the mazapán latte. Would definitely make it a point to drop in the next time I'm in the city.

787 Coffee has a lot to offer: good coffee, ample seating, and positive vibes. I enjoyed my cortado; it was rich and delicious! I also appreciated having a place to sit and enjoy my drink (which sadly can be hard to find in many NYC coffee shops). Plus, I liked the positive, encouraging messages they have display across the shop (although, I would tone down the use of the f-word).
Popped in for some shade and iced coffee. Chill cafe with background music and wifi. Got a standard latte with oat milk ~$5.39. Friendly baristas. Great spot to cool down and relax a bit.

My friend and i loved this place so much. We both got hot Coquito Lattes, one with oat milk (mine) and one with almond milk. We also got the almond and honey cheese pastry as well as the blueberry muffin. Everything tasted amazing, and we adored the vibes and decor in there. Definitely recommend and will be returning soon.
Iced macchiato is strong & bitter, yummy, tons of ice, no straws given. Decor on walls includes curse words, inappropriate for kids & business meetings.

Came here in a whim, was just visiting NYC and was going for a walk. I was welcomed by the friendliest barista, I wish I got her name. I got their mocha for drinks. It was super delicious, loved the dark flavor of mocha with the coffee. I was only going to get a drink but was convinced to try their empanadas, and I'm so glad I did because they were so good! Freshly made and the filling was so flavorful and the crust was crunch and flaky. Super delicious! The atmosphere was very cozy, well decorated. Would definitely come back here when I visit NYC again.

Great coffee but I am forced to drink it out of a plastic zip lock bag to be "eco friendly". I have places to go and cannot be carrying around a $6 capri Sun of coffee around midtown Manhattan like a 15 year old child. This place needs to get a grip.

I decided to work from 787, with a co-worker. Coffee shops can be a hit or miss for working. It is difficult to do meetings at shops that are too loud. It became louder around lunch time, and so I had to take a few meetings outside. There was more than enough seating and we met a very friendly person who was preparing for their first job! The vibe is cool. Got a little chilly after a while but, it was pretty hot outside. The baristas we're playing show music in the back ground which was pretty fun. I had a matcha latte, with almond milk. It tasted fine, nothing to rave about.  

I would cowork there again.
Staff here is super friendly! There is other cold brew I like more in the area (cold brew is my go to), but their espresso is pretty solid. The interior is well decorated too.

I've been to several of 787's locations, and like all of them, love the ambience and lighting. There's plenty of comfortable seating, and I enjoy the coquito latte (around $7)--very sweet, with a cinnamon-gingerbread like taste. They also have a horchata latte, which my friend enjoyed, and was milder tasting.

Having worked in FiDi and being an avid coffee fanatic, I've been searching around for a good cafe to hangout in on my breaks. 787 is the perfect coffee nook I've been searching for!

The ambiance itself is super friendly, especially if you're trying to work. There's so many comfortable seats and such friendly service. There's even a printer in case you forgot about an important meeting!

Now onto the coffee! I have to say, it's a great and interesting cup every time I go. Between the rum infused espressos and various lattes I've never heard of, but would definitely be down to try! The best part is, their beans come straight from their own farm, and if you ask you can hear all about their story. Definitely my go to spot when I want to treat myself to a nice cup on a rainy day.
The Horchata Latte was amazing! They also have specialty espresso options. Highly recommend the horchata latte with a specialty espresso option.

AMAZING i would come back here again for sure. the coffee was amazing!!!! unfortunately there was no food available at the time me and my friends went (we went around lunch).  But i am definitely getting there earlier next time!

I love this place. We live in Staten Island so we come here before or after the ferry. The staff is so kind, the coffee is delicious, the vibe is great. I was in the city the other day and walked past so many others and ducked into 787 for a quick coffee before meeting my spouse for dinner. It was great. The barista was great, even when dealing with some very high need customers. I will always come back to 787. It makes me happy

BEST MOST DELICIOUS drink I've tasted at a cafe! (For a non-coffee drinker)

I usually don't drive coffee, but wanted tl try something new and different, so the Baristas recommended that I try Coquito (usually comes with a shot of expresso but I got it without)

Tastes similar to an horchata (cinamonny flavor), and I don't even like horchata.
I'd come back here just for this drink!

This is a great, friendly and local place in the Financial District. The place was has a vibe a bit like a coworking space--there are lots of motivational messages and similar things on the walls. The decor is nice and there is a good selection of shaded outdoor seating. I got an iced coffee, which was great, and a blueberry muffin, which was not great. The pastries generally looked and tasted a bit soggy.
Super cute place, nice vibe, seating. Staff is very pleasant. Quesitos is where it's at

This feels like a local homely coffee shop and Oscar and rest of the employees are great!

My wife and I go here all the time. My wife gets the mint cold brew and I (who is a lightweight with caffeine) typically get decaf marzipan latte or a caquito (sp?) both sweet drinks.

The spinach and cheese empanadas are pretty good and so is the breakfast burrito!

Support local!
Love the atmosphere and coffee is amazing! Coffee also came out really quick! Definitely deserves 5 stars

Really loved this place!! It's a quiet, low key spot, but both the service and food was amazing!

Food - I really enjoyed all the food we ordered. We got the general tsos tofu, veggie dumplings, and Singapore fried noodles. The general tsos was definitely the best, but the noodles were a close second. The tofu had great flavor, and though it was crispy/fried, the tofu was still silky/soft.

The staff was super friendly and kind.

Dine in is served in take-away containers, but didn't take away from the experience/food

I was in the area for an event and stopped in for dinner before I went ahead period I usually go to other locations of this chain and this was my first visit to this period the staff was a little more like a fast food version and you order at the counter and wait for your food. The kitchen door is often open as it is the entrance to the restroom. It isn't as clear/clean as the other locations (there are viewing windows to watch noodle pulls). It was very oily, but the flavors were still there. Not the best, nor the worst.

My partner and I stopped by the other day for dinner and really enjoyed the food. It was a rainy Sunday with a lot of people coming and going to pick up takeout (also quite a few dining in!).

The Hong Kong style fried rice was my favorite, with the shrimp wontons in chili oil coming in close second. The rest of the food delicious as well.

Service was friendly, but a little slow given how busy their takeout section was. Very understandable, given it's a small place and the food was great. Would return again!

Came in for a late night dinner. Sat down right away and ordered three plates. The wait was a little long but understand that some dishes might take longer than others. All the food came together so that was nice!

The shrimp and chive dumplings were my favorite. The soup dumplings were okay, not much soup inside  

This is my second location ive tried of three times and both were a good experience.
I am sitting at thr restaurant, while eating and writing this review. The food is amazing!  Location is good, service is soft, place is cute, clean and well lit (extra points). Can't go wrong here.

Good service and some good dishes, but overall it was just an ok meal. Scallion pancakes were pretty undercooked (no crisp at all), chicken soup dumplings weren't very juicy... if that's the right word... and Persian cucumbers were a bit more wilted than normal. Shrimp chili wontons were good though!

(Overall: 85% | B) - The servers are nice and attentive and the place looks great and can fit a large group of people! Overall, pretty reasonably priced and decent quality Chinese food.

(Garlic Chili Eggplant: 100% | A+) - The eggplant was the star of the meal! It was masterfully cooked such that it was tender on the inside and kept texture on the outside. It was well flavored with an addicting garlic chili sauce that wasn't too spicy that made this dish very desirable.

(Sauteed Chinese Broccoli: 77.5% | C) - The Chinese broccoli was correctly cooked but boring and needed garlic and/or oyster sauce to lift the dish.

(Chili Wontons: 95% | A) - The chili wontons surprised me in a good way -- they were meticulously prepared and presents itself as a delicate dish; the flavors had a natural balance -- it brought a nice saltiness without being too spicy that was pleasant overall.

(Vegetarian Dumplings: 55% | F) - The vegetarian dumplings did not hit the same notes as the wontons unfortunately. There was a strange combination of flavors in the filling that made it very displeasing to consume.

(Double Cooked Pork Belly - 65% | D) - The double cooked pork belly made little sense to me as the pork belly was very thin; cooking it twice simply reaffirmed that its overcooked and gave it poor texture despite it having good flavor development.

(Shanghai Noodles - 90% | A) - The Shanghai noodles were good, as it hit all the flavor and nutritional components. The point of improvement here is the presentation, but it is very well priced.

(Crab Roe XLB: 97.5% | A) - A soup dumpling with crab and topped with roe! The dumplings are delicately wrapped with an abundance of soup; the meat is very tender and pairs well with the dish; overall very good execution of the dish!

The person at the register was super attractive! The ambiance is neat and aesthetically pleasing. The food wasn't very good.

I ordered chicken soup dumplings and the braised beef soup. I've had both of these dishes before at other places, so I did come in with some expectations. The soup dumplings didn't have much flavor, I added some hot sauce and it helped a little for flavor but no real spice. The braised beef soup was the most disappointing of the two. The beef was chewy and the cuts didn't look well cared for. I definitely wasn't expecting the best cuts of meat but many of the braised beef dishes that I've had (around the same price $17) included tender chunks of beef. This beef wasn't tender. The soup was salty as well, I couldn't finish it.

The place was empty, but it was a warmer day so maybe people weren't looking for soup dumplings. Idk. I spent $31 on soup, dumplings and a drink.

Great, clean, organized restaurant. Great packaging and portions. Found them on MealPal although I have worked in the area for a long time. Amazing food and quality. Highly recommend

Gentleman who attended me was very pleasant

Was craving some shanghainese last night so my partner and I decided to try a new spot in the neighborhood, and it did not disappoint! We wanted to try a little bit of everything (all looked good as we watched them make the orders), but stuck with soup dumplings, wontons in chili oil, fried dumplings, scallion pancakes and Shanghai noodles (and as much as we tried, couldn't finish it all!). I thought they were all winners (fav wontons), but I'd prob try a different noodle / rice next time.

We walked in for pickup and they were super quick and friendly. Good to know there is another great option in the neighborhood for my dim sum cravings!

Great option for lunch, I recommend ordering ahead if you can. The food is made and can be 10mins wait but we'll worth it.

The kitchen is open, so you can watch the chef work. Staff is friendly.

Pan fried dumpling- overall delicious,

Pork soup dumpling- served hot! The broth is light and refreshing

To die for! Flavors were on point. Chicken was insanely good and the perfect numbing spice level. Loved the shrimp and broccoli and dumplings... Lots of food. The only thing that was not ideal was the use of disposable paper products for dine in, could be short staffing so understandable, but hate to see more waste than needed.

This place looks basic, but there's nothing basic about their food. I was staying in the area and needed my fix. I had the steamed pork buns and spicy eggplant. It was just the perfect amount of food for one person, plus some leftover. May even be enough for two if you're not too hungry  The pork buns arrived hot and tasted so gooooood! That first bite and pop of the bun is always the best. Eggplant has always been one of my favorite dishes, anywhere. This spicy eggplant was great too! Was great with the side of rice.

Service was fast and friendly. I was pretty much in and out, but that's exactly what I wanted.
It was so delicious! I expected a bland taste for some reason ! But it was just right ! The price was a bit much, quality over quantity I get it. I'll be going back and trying some dumps.

Have been meaning to try 3 Times since they opened the restaurant in the Financial District and finally made a takeout order and was happy with the meal.

The Pork Soup Dumplings and Shrimp Wontons were excellent starters. Though it didn't particularly stand out compared to similar dishes from other restaurants, the Fried Rice Noodles with Beef was still very good. Our favorite dish though was the Double Cooked Pork Belly which though we asked for not spicy was still very flavorful.

Definitely expecting to be ordering more takeout from 3 Times in the future.

This is that hole in the wall place that they talk about. Small, not fancy. You eat out of plastic containers. But the food is spot on and it comes out super fast and it is hot and tasty and exactly what you want. Just say yes.

I've never been so happy to find a good dim sum spot in FiDi.

Ordered takeout with hopes of filling a soup dumpling craving and 3 Times delivered. The soup dumplings were in tact, warm, and deliciously made. Perfect dough to pork ratio, and lots of soupy-ness inside.

The Dan Dan noodles were also a huge hit. Delicious Sichuan flavors, I just wanted slightly more meat on this dish!

We also got a side of green beans, Chinese broccoli, and scallion pancakes. The veggies were perfection, crispy and bright broccoli and perfectly sautéed green beans. My only not so favorite were the scallion pancakes. Just a little too greasy for me.

Overall, will definitely be ordering from here again.

We tried this spot when we were exploring around Financial District in the summer. I heard their dishes are more authentic and tasty, so we decided to go and try some of their dishes. The inside was rather small, but cozy and clean.

Since we didn't really know the size of each dish, we started with three orders: Fried Rice with Shredded Pork, Shrimp Wontons in Chili Oil, and Pan Fried Pork & Crab Roe Buns. Fried rice was just a-ok, but we enjoyed the wonton and buns, especially the silky wontons. The items with red pepper on the menu, indicating "spicy" were not that spicy, but had a nice kick to it.

After that, we added Shanghai Fried Noodles with Shrimp, and Sautéed Eggplant with Garlic & Chili Sauce. The noodles were a-ok, nothing really special. Eggplant was a pleasant surprise. It looked beautiful, and we received mountain of them. They had great flavor, and just melt in your mouth. So good!

The female staff at the ordering counter was very friendly and polite. The price range for this spot is a bit pricier, but you have to consider the location. I still think it is very affordable for Financial District location. Also, I thought it was great that they serve their food in takeout containers, so that if you don't finish eating them, you can simply ask for some lids, and you are good to go!

Ordered the beef noodle soup for takeout. I think the broth was definitely flavorful but in a very one dimension kind of way. The portions were pretty good, enough for me to split into a meal and a half.
I had originally wanted the mustard and pork soup noodles but they unfortunately didn't offer it that day.

After a long day exploring NYC, we got back to our hotel and were hungry. There wasn't really much around us, so we got DoorDash from this spot.

We ordered:
- Spicy Soup Dumplings
- Dan Dan Noodles with Minced Pork
- Fried Rice Noodles with Beef

I know takeout isn't the same, but I was pretty disappointed. The Fried Rice Noodles were the best thing.

The Spicy Soup Dumplings were pretty bland somehow and the Dan Dan Noodles had literally no flavor and were really mushy. I've never had any that bad before.

I'm hoping it was just an off night or that takeout somehow ruined it.

It's so hard to find Shredded Pork and Mustard Greens Noodle Soup. I took it for granted as a kid, and it was one of my top 5 noodle soup comfort bowls. Got a B+ on a test? SP&MG noodle soup. Lost the game by one point? SP&MG noodle soup. Got accepted by Yale but not Harvard? SP&MG noodle soup. You get what I'm saying.

I used to have a reliable version in Midtown from Evergreen Shanghai, but their quality declined right around the time they stopped delivering through Seamless, so I was a sad lotus flower once again.

Until 3 Times. They make SP&MG noodle soup, and they make it well. They make it the way Grandma made it. FRESH mustard greens (none of that pickled, canned, fermented sh*t). Meaty, fatty strips of pork (the collagen adds flavor, my pretties). Thick, chewy Shanghai noodles (the way Buddha intended; thin noodles are for the weak). Glory be and praise the Monkey King: I've found my NYC SP&MG noodle soup place!

We also got Shrimp Wontons, which were fine but forgettable. I'll probably try other menu items one day, but everything else will have to take a backseat to my bowl of SP&MG noodle soup heaven.

Soup Dumpling dough is a little thicker for my liking but still juicy enough inside.

Spicy Soup Dumpling one was pretty good. Crab Roe Soup Dumpling doesn't have much flavor which was odd.

Chinese Broccoli was really good.

Mustard Green & Shredded Pork Noodle Soup was not bad.

Nice location, good addition to the neighborhood.

Good dim sum, everything came out fresh and steaming hot.  The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because it was a bit pricey and a lot of the buns/dumplings had similar tasting fillings.  Otherwise was a good spot to grab some dim sum outside of Chinatown.

It's great to see that 3 Times is having success and expanding into other districts of NYC. I stopped in with my gf for lunch.

We ordered two of the Combo A ($15). This came with Sweet Potato Noodles & Beef Soup and a choice between Pork Soup Dumplings (6pc), Pan Fried Pork Buns (4pc), and one other item I don't remember. The Sweet Potato Noodles & Beef Soup has a hint of spice to it, bearable to most consumers. Pan Fried Pork Buns are a solid choice, but 3 Times pride themselves on soup dumplings so the Pork Soup Dumplings are the way to go. Make sure to remove them from the container carefully to avoid them from breaking.

We also ordered Truffle Soup Dumplings (6pc) ($14). If you love truffle as much as I do, this is certainly an item to order. Unfortunately, as careful as you can be, half of the dumplings skin broke on me. Not sure if it's how it was made or what, as it was super fragile. This would be my only complaint.

Ordered an assortment of items off their menu to-go, which included:
- Pan fried pork dumplings (top center of photo)
- Pan fried veggie dumplings (top left of photo in green)
- Shanghai pan fried pork buns (top right of photo)
- Pan fried chicken dumplings (bottom left of photo)
- Veggie and pork wontons in chili oil (bottom right of photo)
- Crispy duck (bottom center)

Of these, the only ones that were "okay" to me, were the wontons in chili oil although it didn't really taste like chili oil...

The dumpling wrapper for all three types of dumplings above were a bit too thick/doughy to me and with not very much filling or seasoning (could be because it was later at night?).

And the crispy duck tasted like it had been sitting in the kitchen and reheated a few too many times, waiting for someone to eventually order it, which was sadly me.

Overall, I was disappointed with my experience. The staff was super nice to us but at the end of the day, I would not recommend and don't see myself returning. Maybe we just ordered the wrong things, at the wrong time and would've had a better experience if we had dine-in. Personally, you're better off taking the trip to Chinatown if you have the time to.

My friends and I were craving some noodles on a rainy day in FiDi. Luckily we stumbled upon 3 times. 3 times is definitely quality Shanghainese. We ordered the pan fried pork buns, pork soup dumplings, spicy wontons, Shanghai fried noodles,  Chinese broccoli with garlic, and hot and sour soup. The food here had so much flavor. Definitely add some of their chili oil and the vinegar for the dumplings. We did not expect any Asian food to be this good in FiDi, but we loved our experience here. You can't go wrong with any of their soups, dumplings or entrees. The dumplings and soups came out super hot. Our food came out rather quickly and the staff were great at making our dining experience amazing. The local Yelpers definitely got it right here. This place was recently rated as review of the day as well. Make sure you come here for some qualify food.
Great!  Very convenient and the soup dumplings are wonderful. Trying the chicken wings now.

We've been to the other location in lower east side and food was delicious, so I'm glad they opened a location closer to me. We came here on an early Friday afternoon, it was pretty empty with two people sitting outside. We chose to sit inside for the AC. We ordered the beef noodle soup, Dan Dan noodle, and spicy chicken wings. All came out quick, full of flavors, and popping hot. Definitely will be back.

Welcome to the neighborhood.  Just ordered takeout and I think it arrived before I pushed the send button.

Ordered 3 items (in honor of 3 Times):

1) Crab soup dumplings -- beyond great!  Not scalding hot which is key.  They even travelled well.  
2) Shanghai pan friend pork bun -- Excellent!  Now I have 2 places to get this in FiDi
3) Scallion pancake -- Well done -- no grease

Looking forward to trying some of their main dishes next time.

Decided to stop by for a quick meal, didn't realize it was a pretty small restaurant. Ordered the lunch special, the shrimp siu mai and the 6 soup dumplings. Coming from the bay, I did expect something more, either a bigger menu, more flavor and something unique but did not get that here.

Ordered take out and overall the food was good. Would power rank the dishes I got as 1. The fried wings 2. The fried dumplings 3. The noodles. The wings were awesome and probably taste even better if dining in versus take out!

It's a tiny little place but food comes out quick. We got spicy pork and pork soup dumplings, chicken and broccoli, sesame chicken, and shrimp har gow. The chicken dishes were pretty flavorful albeit a bit too sweet. The soup dumpling skins were too thick and didn't have enough juices in them. It's a good place for a quick fix but the quality can definitely improve. Overall, a decent place to fill up on the go.

Saw strong ratings and decided to try out this place today evening. Food was great! There were 3 of us (all vegetarian) and we ordered the fried rice, sautéed string beans, sautéed Chinese broccoli, and pan fried dumplings. Everything tasted delicious. We dined in, location is small but there were a handful of tables. I imagine the food tastes a lot better for dine in, as it was piping hot when it came out. Everything tastes fresh. Prices are moderate for FiDi, but portions are also on the smaller side. But every hiring we ordered above was more than enough for the 3 of us. I will definitely be back to this place- we had a great dining experience!

Pretty good. The siu mai was ok, not as condensed/ fat to meat ratio wasn't as I prefer. Deep fried chicken had a little too much salt, had a nice kick to it. My boyfriend liked the pork fried dumpling (beef was out when we got there). We both loved the beef fried rice. Staff is friendly and it's very clean. Might stop by before leaving to try the soup dumplings.
Great food. Place is tiny but comfortable and the staff was lovely. Scallion pancakes were a bit too greasy but everything else we ate was delicious
A nice little restaurant. A gem in the financial district. Portions are great. Prices are reasonable. When I return to NYC I will try other items on the menu. Can't wait.

How nice to have a decent and authentic Chinese restaurant in FiDi! My friends and I dined in and as we were a large group (10+) most of them sat outdoors. Those of us who don't want mosquito bite ate indoors. The service was efficient and attentive even if they were very busy. The food we ordered were nice, especially highly recommend the steamed vegetable dumplings. They put a wide mix of quality and tasty stuffings which is rare for vegetable dumplings. The string beans were tasty too with nice garlic umami. The scallion pancakes didn't have scallion and was too crispy for my taste. Overall great place to have a quick meal and I look forward to trying more things here!

Dan Dan noodles were spicy minced pork. Strong flavor.

Spicy beef noodles and pepper as advertised.

We tried a pork bun which although the outside was good the meat inside was like grounded up hamburger.
Great service and food!  I tried it for the first time when I started working on that side of town a few weeks ago.  I've been back twice since, and they don't disappoint!

Food was excellent, my son got the crispy wings- and I got the crispy chicken with peppers  10/10
Someone even brought my son and I over some water (which was very thoughtful)
Looking forward to trying other menu items next time!!!

Been here twice and enjoyed it both times. Granted I got the exact same thing... I really do need to mix it up. Just moved here from the south where the inky place to find soup dumplings is in the Trader Joe's freezer aisle so I'm happy to have a place serving them 2 blocks away! I got the pork soup dumplings (although I like spice I'm too afraid to try the spicy ones although they sound delicious) and rice cakes with shredded chicken. The dumplings are everything I want them to be and the rice cakes and chicken are perfectly sauced. All in all I'll be back and may even try something new if I dare!

Similar menu to their Clinton street location,
Solid soup dumplings. Consistent quality of food.
Recommend their Shanghai pan fried baos, soup dumplings, porkbelly and chili eggplant and string beans.

The food here never disappointed! I've tried half of the menu already and find myself order take out back to back many times. The crispy hot chicken is my favorite! I always order it extra hot. Dumplings and  wontons are average. I like the sliced beef dish too. I don't think you're getting a good deal from lunch special, I'd just order from their regular menu. The delivery fee is very expensive though. I try to walk over and pick it up when I can.

3 Times? More like 1 time! Ordered the pork soup dumplings, spicy pork soup dumplings, and the sticky rice siu mai. These were by far the most disgusting dumplings I have ever eaten. The sticky rice siu mai was bland and tasted like nothing, and the soup dumplings were VERY undercooked (see picture). Seriously this is food poisoning waiting to happen.
Ordered the shrimp and pork soup dumplings and the fried pork buns, both came out super well made and tasty. Server was very welcoming and attentive. Would recommend for college students!

Very clean place with simple, comfortable decor. Robust menu with just right amount of variety. Ordered about 9 items for 4 adults to share. Quality and taste were great. Fresh green beans were notable. Still crunchy and not over cooked a variety of dumplings were also tasty. A gem!

Financial District doesn't have a lot of good Chinese spots (at least not that I've found). I was stoked when 3 Times came to the neighborhood because it really helps to scratch that itch on a weeknight. The soup dumplings and pickled cucumbers are divine and the service is great!  Try the pork dumplings with crab roe. You won't regret it.

I was psyched to see this open in the neighborhood as I had previously ordered delivery from their other locations and had a good impression of their food. Their menu presents a fairly eclectic mix of casual Chinese food - there's a good amount of dumplings and dim sum style dishes and a variety of noodle and rice dishes. When I dined in person, I tried the pan seared egg and chive buns, pan fried vegetable dumplings and pan fried mustard greens and shredded pork noodles. Everything came out piping hot because we were the only diners there and I think also because of that, service was very attentive. Though there's nothing inventive and extraordinary about the cooking, the food all tastes good. It's all a very home style of cooking but sometimes, that's exactly what I need when the craving hits.

Ordered the Shanghai noodles and it was delicious. Really happy to see this restaurant option in FiDi. Sure, the prices are higher, but that on par with the area. I will definitely come back.

Ordered on yelp and it was ready at time of pickup and still warm. Very crowded at lunch time since it is pretty small space.
Great food, everything tastes really good. Professional and friendly service. I highly recommend this place.

I really loved this place.......
it was the best place i have been able to find in recent years in new york..  
i wish i could get here every week......

Was looking for something quick to eat because I was running around that day, and needed something fast and easy.  So I saw this pizza place which looked decent enough so I gave it a shot.  If this pizza place was on Long Island, I'd give it four stars all day.  Crust was pretty good, plenty of topping, and ingredients tasted fresh.  Since I got two slices (mushroom and margherita) they obviously weren't made to order, however it didn't taste like it sat long which is good.  However for a NYC slice, there's PLENTY of competition, and other great pizza spots that are better caliber.  Overall reliable, and won't disappoint.

Working in the area, this spot is conveniently located to me and even though the pizza is average and expensive at $5 a slice, I've always stuck to it.

However, as other reviews stated, some staff are so damn rude. Recently, I asked which one is the teriyaki pizza and the cashier had the most vulgar attitude. "Obviously the one with the teriyaki chicken and broccoli", and then he rolled his eyes at me. First of all, teriyaki pizza never has broccoli cause that's a nasty combo, how do you expect anyone to know that? It's disgusting that this man went out of his way to talk to me and roll his eyes. Honestly ruined my mood and after a year of crappy pizza, I'm permanently done with them.

I ended up getting the buffalo chicken slice that day and as per usual, it tasted horribly acidic and gross. There's just no winning at this place.

We were tired of driving around looking for parking spots so we decided to grab a quick bite close to our parking spot.

We chanced upon 5 Boroughs Pizza. There was a line inside and some of the customers seemed to be regulars. We figured it was worth a shot.

A tiny hole in the wall, there were very few seats so we stood at a counter to wolf down our pizzas before driving back to Virginia.

We had the Pepperoni Pizza and the Pepperoni, Bacon, and Ricotta Pizza.

Way better than the average pizza in Northern Virginia (although that's not saying much), it was cheesy, topped generously with ingredients, and left a film of grease on my fingers and paper plate.

This is a great place to grab a bite but not quite worth making a detour for.

My wife and I spent the day in Brooklyn (home of great pizza) but we needed to get to Penn Station to catch a train home. Due to subway construction and weekend hours, various transfers were necessary and we didn't have too much time left for dinner. But, we wanted to try NYC pizza (and not Sbarros!). As luck would have it, while transferring subway lines near Canal Street we stumbled onto this place.

It is a tiny hole in the wall, but it had a counter to sit at and a dozen types of pizza available by the slice. I had the Hawaiian, my wife had the sausage/pepperoni, and later we shared a BBQ chicken slice. It was decent, but not great. Her's wasn't heated all the way in the oven, and all the slices lacked salt. There were no public bathrooms (which I can understand), but I wish they had Handi-wipes or something to clean your hands with after spending hours in grubby subways or public parks.

It was tasty and filling, the staff was pleasant, and we made our train just fine.

Everyone has their favorite place to get a slice, and this was our favorite of the trip.

Flavor options were fun and my classic Hawaiian was outstanding.

Good prices and combo deals---but don't count on getting a seat

Just your typical hole in the wall pizzeria so don't expect much. This place is tiny. It's more or less, a grab and go with only a few seats along the wall. I ordered the pepperoni pizza for $3 and it was delicious, so bad for you, but yet so good. It was fresh and hot out of the oven, generous in size and filling with lots of grease. Overall, 3.5 stars rounded to 4 stars.

This place is terrible, I couldn't even finish my pizza, staff is friendly tho

#doesnotslap

Big appetite: A+
Value: B-
New Yorker: F

$3.75 for a massive pepperoni and sausage slice. Tasted fine. Not NY style. Always confused when I see broccoli in a pizzeria.

Best pizza place I've found while traveling to NY. Prices are fair and big slices with premium toppings. I'd eat here any day over the overpriced pizza you find in mall. Highly recommend you give this place a try.

I am from LA, Cali...was so expecting the best pizza ever, but this place does not live up to the "New York has the best pizza ever!" hype....this place is sadly disappointing...so upset I chose this place to have my first NY pizza experience...Don't eat here, pizzas just sit and then their re-heated once you order...blah

Decent slice, especially when you're having a craving at 5 AM on a Saturday and nothing else is open. Mind you, it's absolutely swimming in grease, so you gotta be into that (or prepare plenty of napkins)! Wouldn't call it an "NY" style pizza though -- the crusts don't have that oomph. Still, slices are big, prices are fair.
Pizza was good, but the service was bad and the man who served us made multiple rude comments. Would not go back.

I ordered 4 pizzas for my office, and they came without pizza holder.  The cheese pizza got all messed up and cheese are all on the box.  Call the restaurant and asked for a replacement but they said it is the delivery guy's problem and delivery guy is from Seamless.  Kept asking me to call Seamless, and refused to send replacement.  Seamless refunded that one pie eventually.  But what we expect is to have 4 pizzas for people to eat.  Bad experience.  Never order again.

Pizza was delicious.  But NEVER ordering delivery again.  Hour and a half and I had to walk over myself and pick up a fresh pie.  Owner was nice but 9fold online delivery service THE WORST.  Seriously the worst.
Found this place by accident near my hotel. What a pleasant surprise! Great service, great tasting pizza, great price! I love this place! Definitely making sure I come back next time I'm in town!
Very good, crispy crust and tons of fresh veggies on my vegetable pizza. Great value at $3-4 for a huge slice.
Very good pizza for low price. The garlic knots are also very good and defenitely worth the try. Would eat here again.
Prompt and courteous service. About 10 varieties to choose from of generously sized slices. They all looked great and were served quickly, piping hot and crispy from the oven.
Me and my friends came to get good pizza. But it was too soggy and filled with too much sauce. I ordered a buffalo chicken and ranch pizza and we could barely eat half of it. Never coming again

It's hard to compete with $1 pizza when you're a hole in the wall serving regular greasy pizza for $2.50.

At lunch time, the pizza came out right away and felt fresh. Compared to the dollar joints this is thin crust and the slices are large. Still, the dough was very soft without any crunch. The cheese was ample but very greasy, and even after draining some of the grease there was still a bit of the bitter greasy taste. The sauce was obscured by the cheese, but that's not necessarily bad. All in all, Five Boro is better than dollar pizza  but still a classic NY pizza shop slice.
Got 2 slices to-go on a Wednesday night. Staff was friendly and the place looked like a true NYC pizza place. Came home and found out that both slices had a long strain of hair each.
Great pizza the sloppy tasty pizza with great toppings. Always fresh since the place is always packed selling out slices so quick

Went here last night around 8:30pm and the guy there was extremely rude when I asked one simple question. My group and I just left to find food somewhere else. Horrible, rude service which sucks because all we wanted was pizza.

The man who worked at the cashier tonight October 13th was extremely rude to the point where myself and my 5 friends left without buying anything. Customer service negative review if possible. Won't go again.

Avoid at all costs! Unless you're a tourist who likes the taste of cheese covered cardboard. The people calling this "New York Style Pizza" make me realize how naive people outside NYC really are. You're being scammed if you think this is authentic! Service was super slow, and the guy working the register was unbelievably snide and rude to us. He pulled a slice directly from the display case instead of heating it up first, and we didn't know if it was warm. So we asked him, "can you heat it up please?", definitely asking loudly and within earshot. He completely blew us off despite there being no other customers there at the time. We asked three more times and were still ignored, but on the fifth time he shot back "it's already warm,". Pizza was very greasy and garlicky, with no flavor balance. Crust hardly tasted cooked, it was a mushy mess. I regret stopping by. Champion's slices taste much better, they're cheaper, and you get your meal in half the time. I rarely give anything less than five stars if you check my profile, but this time it was definitely warranted. Should have stuck to my regular. Skip!
Good pizza and the staff is chill, guy up front notice my pizza was slightly burned and offered to get me a new one and I hadn't even noticed
This place has the best chicken bacon ranch slice in the TriBeCa area. The guys who work here rock and don't judge when you make fun of your friend.
The best plain slice ($2.25) and 20" pie ($16) in lower Manhattan
Pizza is sooo good, flavorful, and cheap! Whenever I'm in the city we stop at this place
Guy was really nice.  Gave the special's price even though I didn't specify it.  Really good NewYork pizza

An upscale-ish neighborhood bodega.

Pros: Pleasant, efficient cashiers, attractive interior, better-than-usual snacks, beer, and frozen selections. Good staples. Nice coffee bar/pastry section near the front. Hard-to-find Israeli candy near the registers. Tiny ice cream treats in a case near the door.

Cons: Poor dairy, fruit/veg selection. The prepared foods have given me reason for suspicion; be careful here. Uncommunicative staff does the stocking (maybe it's a language problem). Flowers are reasonably priced, but, like all bodega flowers, are not long for this world.

I just shopped there. No meat department. Awful. No lamb at all, just one cut of cheap steak. Nothing. The worst meat department in the city.
Also, practically no toilet paper. Just Scott Tissue that's all.
Terrible! I ordered a delivery and an hour later, when I called to ask about it, they said sorry we're too busy

I won't go here ever again and you shouldn't either-they are stealing from you. I just walked by and saw this $32.50 floral arrangement... Which is very expensive for flowers anyway. I went up to the register and the man put in $35 plus their fee (came out to $38.11 with the taxes) He added $3 dollars onto an already UBER expensive mark up just to cheat me.

I like supporting local business so have a shop there ever since I moved into this apartment four months ago and spent well over $1000 there. I had my suspicions that something was wrong but I've never only bought 1 thing when I do so it is harder to check. I watched as the man put in $35 in the credit card machine look down at the arrangement and take off the orange tag that said $32.50. Then I asked for my receipt and he ignored me. They knew what they were doing when they cheated me out of my hard earned money.

I will be going to CVS from now on. And telling everyone else to do the same. I don't like being cheated and scammed out of my money but I HATE the fact that I go there multiple times a day and they have been doing this to me... a loyal customer that always says please and thank you. Imagine what they do to you if they don't know you.
Paid $10 for strawberries and they were moldy!! LOL (I was rushing and maybe I should've looked closer but for $10 they shouldn't be moldy anyway)

I like a well cared for sidewalk. Its always clean around this corner. It's nice when a business keeps the area clean and has a fresh new awning. I'm mostly familiar with the flowers sales people. The men are very nice to deal with. The flowers are always fresh. This store has been here as long as I can remember. I'm always walking by.
Like I said I just buy flowers. I'll have to spend more time seeing what's inside one day. I'll update my review then.

Stopped here to get some fresh flowers for a baby shower, I got a couple of colors of spider mums and green and white hydrangeas. The guy there put them into a nice bouquet for me for just under $20 and they were a hit! Thanks 3rd Avenue Garden.

This is possibly the worst store to go to!! Basically I came in here to get a butter bagel, I walk in on the cook wearing gloves and a mask. I then see the cook TOUCH HIS FACE WITH THE MASK AND GLOVES ON. I ask if he can please change his gloves before he starts cooking my food. He gave me such an attitude and was throwing my food around. I was completely shocked by the amount of disrespect I received from him. The guy I'm talking about is a white old man and he is nasty sloppy guy. He puts EXCESSIVE AMOUNTS OF BUTTER on the bagel and its ridiculous. This place is unsanitary and you SHOULD NOT COME HERE. I WILL NEVER COME BACK HERE AGAIN.

This place has the rudest cashier I have ever felt with,I order sandwich's three time a week and he continues to tell me he has no white onion,I go there often enough to no he does,so I went there and called him out he said nobody gets white onion on there sandwich. ( I just ordered it) so what he's telling me a 50 cent onion is worth more then a ten dollar sandwich. Unbelievable I will never spend another dollar there.

I personally would not come back here again though I can see why you would. My reasons are:
1. It is over priced but then again, what do I expect, it comes with the area.
2. The attitude of the owner is not welcoming. I personally don't want to feel I am trespassing if I am paying for goods.

Pros:
1. Large selection of regular and craft beers so if you are going to a house party nearby, you have ample options.
2. There are organic food/healthy options you can bring to the house party.

Been in business for 30 years in that location. Used to be called Hannahs. I get delivery several times a week from breakfast orders, sandwiches and household items and medicine. They have everything you need random stuff like nail polish remover. A little pricey but when you are in a crunch and need laundry detergent delivered or toilet paper its my go to..They deliver 24\7 both the day and night workers know my address by heart and they deliver quickly. One time I had a birthday to go to and they delivered a beautiful bouquet for 20 bucks.

Decent bodega on the UES. Nice flower selection. Carries some upscale types of groceries, and hard to find items. Open 24 hours. Always has self serve hot coffees in the front, usually a plain and flavored type. Has a dairy/fruit section and also a prepared foods area. Quality is iffy at best. Prices are a bit higher then supermarkets, but that is true with most bodegas.

**My review is solely for their flower section**

I came across 3rd Avenue Garden when I was looking for flowers to buy for the apt. They had a huge variety of flowers and not too badly overpriced (as most places on UES seem to be). At one point I needed flowers that were in the back that I couldn't reach...the guy who was SUPPOSED to be working and dealing with flowers was lazy and chatting to his boy on the sidewalk...but when I went in to ask for help the owners promptly made sure that someone helped me. This I liked.

I paid for my flowers and was excited to come home and make several bouquets. Although the flowers looked beautiful that night I can't say that for the next day. The roses started dying shortly there after and flowers that can usually sit in a vase for 2 weeks began to wilt on day 3.

Although the flowers are pretty and might catch your attention don't expect them to live too long.

I used to frequent 3rd Avenue garden regularly. While the prices were higher, I liked supporting local business. However, over the past year or so, the selection has truly gone down hill, as has the staff. We bought a package of cookies, only to get home and find someone had already opened it and taken out over half of the cookies. We brought them back immediately, and were told it was a frequent problem they were having. If this was a one off, I could ignore it, but it felt like EVERY time we went there, one of the items would be bad or damaged.

To make matters worse, the staff started getting really rude. The cashier commented to my husband once that he shouldn't let me by cookies and ice-cream if he wanted me to stay looking fit. Sadly, this type of comment was almost a REGULAR occurrence. I understand if the cashier was trying to be cute or make a joke, but it is totally inappropriate to make this type of comment to ANYONE. I am a fairly fit and trim woman, so I didn't let the comments get to me, but I couldn't believe that this was a type of harassing culture that was promoted and perpetuated! Disgusting!

The final straw came a few months ago, when I went in to grab something quickly. At the checkout, the line was a giant cluster****. There was a long line. My husband had asked me to grab him some gum while I was out, but it was next to the register, so i was waiting until i was up to grab it. I got there, put my items on the counter, and he rang me up, I said "one second, I'm grabbing gum" as I handed the cashier a $10 bill and reached to grab a pack that was right below the register. The cashier put my purchases aside, and took the man behind me with his two six packs of beer, and told me to go to the end of the line until I was ready. I got pissed and told him he had my cash in his hand, and all i was doing was adding a pack of gum. The  cashier then proceeded to chastise me for wasting his time, and the time of the paying customers behind me. Again, to be clear, this was because i reached to ADD a pack of gum.

In short, I have not been back. I will never go back. And if you are a wise individual, you shouldn't go here either. I'm giving my business to establishments that DON'T sexually harass and berate their customers, or sell products that are past their due date, and damaged.

Great neighborhood place when you can never make it home before whole foods closes.
Sweet people working there- impressive selection of beer -and- any organic, gmo/gluten free cookies you could ever think of!

Nice people, but way overpriced.. and they sell old food. One more than one occasion I bought items in their freeze section that were freezer burnt and completely inedible after cooking. Can't buy their food anymore.

I frequent Third Avenue Garden quite often. It's usually where I shop for milk and eggs, items I forgot to order from FreshDirect... and last minute snacks and frozen items. It's tiny but seems to have almost everything from baking soda to tomato sauce. The prices are a bit higher than supermarkets but I suppose I'm paying for the convenience! They have deli style meats and cheese, along with fresh produce and pre-made salads and entrees. They used to have Toffuti coffee flavored popsicles but I haven't seen them in the freezer section in a while. Oh and they are open 24 hours! Which is great for late night runs for whatever it is that I'm craving or wine.
I just moved to the UES and was glad to see a 24 hour bodega nearby for my beer runs.  $10 for a 6 pack of coors light is just ridiculous.  I won't be returning here.

a truely terrible place, disgusting service. First time i got a smoked tuna salad from them it was sour and spoiled. another time i bought chicken salad it was so salty, i could not eat it. i asked for the manager and the guy was so obnoxiously rude to me. they pocketed my money twice for that garbage

I love the place. Nice people, good selection, and they have some weird things (good cheeses, fancy cookies) to surprise you. Of course it's pricey -- it's a 24-hour place on UES, people -- but you can pretty much get what you want when you want it. And the people are nice.

As a supplier to this store, who has trouble getting them to pay their bills (I no longer supply them), I can verify that the store owner feels comfortable overcharging for items because he feels the nearby consumers have no choice for convenience. As the reviews here show, more people are deciding that this is not a store where they should give their business.
Overly priced and poor customer service.  I've lived In the neighborhood for a while and have given it quite a few tries but same result every time unfortunately....

This is not a bad store; great selection, even for vegetarians and vegans. Horribly overpriced, of course. The reason I am not giving this place more stars has to do with the repeatedly bad quality of their flowers. The roses, while reasonably priced, are often not fresh; I have on several occasions witnessed roses disintegrate and fall off their stems as soon as I unwrapped them. Once, I went back to the store, requested a refund or another fresh bouquet of flowers. The staff person who interacted with me was unfriendly, but agreed to let me replace my old flowers with a new bouquet. In summary then, while this store generally has good quality items (except for the roses), due to the overpricing of most things, there is a consistent sense that one is being cheated.

This place is SUPER overpriced. Like, extremely so. Except for the produce, I'd say thats about average. Their sandwiches are pretty good, their pre-packaged food is pretty crappy(DON'T eat the sushi). They do have a good range of stuff and healthy items and gourmet stuff, etc. But going anywhere else will save you a pretty penny!

So many options for breakfast, lunch, snacks and shakes. The staff are so kind and the turnaround time is around 10-15 minutes.

You can easily eat here 100 days in a row have something new everyday. great salad options too, a ton of variety for drinks as well.

The prices are also super reasonable. Love this spot
Every time I order from this deli my order is always wrong or missing an item. The food is okay but I rather not go there unless it's for something quick that is to grab and go.

I ordered online only to be told by the owner on arriving to pick up my order that "they don't pay me", meaning the third party payment people. My credit card was charged and the owner did not want to honor my payment. I explained to him that when I search online and click to order from HIS website, this is the vendor associated. The website for HIS business clearly states it was powered by Menustar.
When I called Menustar, I was informed that they could not reverse the charges because I had already contacted American Express who told me because the charges were already pending that I would have to wait and see if the charge appeared.
What a clusterfuck. The owner seems to plead ignorance. I can't help but think someone is running a racket.

Massive sandwiches, super friendly staff, very reasonable prices. I'll be back :) The signature sandwiches come with a soda and mine also came with a couple pickles on the side (not sure if that's for everyone or they were just nice but either way lovely)

I've tried to like this place but the food doesn't seem fresh. Then on Uber eats they have this business listed under several different names with no difference in the food, which is sketchy. They have gotten me by thinking "oh empanadas, let's try this place we haven't ordered from" then see tracking says it's from across the street from this place. It's seems okay if you need a quick meal.

For many years a married couple I was friends with would meet me here every morning before work about 5am for breakfast. We all retired and went our separate ways. Since then it also changed hands and all of the employees I had come to love were gone. I was fond of the owner too. It's a walk up hill from where I live. Plus in the dark I don't feel as safe as I did in the past. All that said, I went back recently when I was going to spend the day in East Harlem. I found the new employees to be very smiling and friendly. I found the prices are still very reasonable, and quality of the food hasn't changed. Menu offering do change. It's pretty basic deli stuff now. While I was there I chatted with others that live in the neighborhood and remembered the old set up. We are all disappointed there isn't more seating. The window seats are all that's left. Get there early if you plan to eat there. Most customers grab and go. This place serves a lot of Mount Sinai employees. They still open at 5am which is great. Bagels are good and coffee isn't bad either. I'll be back!

the food is good but the prices change every day. i can come on monday and get one meal then come in the next day and get the same exact meal and its between 50 cents to a dollar extra.  
they need to be more consistent with pricing and not charge whatever they feel it for that day

I Really Loved This Place When It Was Sammy's Gourmet. The Owner Or The Guy Behind The Counter Is Really A Butthead, Not Helpful, And Rude. Some
Of The Cooks Are Pretty Good And Food Is Pretty Okay.
Best sandwiches of any upper east side deli. Been going there for years and have only had good experiences. The staff is friendly and works hard to get food served quickly.

Inconsistent. Subpar.
Usually order the veggie burger with fries and it's generally the same thing - a veggie patty sandwiched between two buns with lettuce, one tomato, cheese, onions, pickles, etc., However, sometimes, if they switch people in between shifts, you may find yourself with just a veggie patty slapped between two buns with nothing in between. So if you like dry sandwiches and if you don't specify exactly what you want in it (like lettuce), then expect to only get exactly what you ask for. Just the veggie patty on a bun. Literally. Honestly, this is frustrating and disappointing. They don't ask if you want lettuce, tomatoes (etc., on it) when you order, so you're expecting the whole works.. sigh.

Frustrated and disappointed.

This place rules. Highly recommend the Almond Latte Shake. The sandwiches are thoughtfully made and come with a free can of soda. I've been here three times in two days And can't wait to explore the menu further.

The food is amazing, the prices are amazing and the juice is freshly made in front of you which is very amazing! Has been my favorite deli for a while. Also the owner/manager, Sam, is one of the nicest people I've met in my life!

i bought a cuban hero sandwich, was absolutely delicious. also got a salad, outstanding taste. highly reasonable prices and quick and pleasant service. cashier offered me a free drink with my sandwich too!! definitely see myself going there on a daily basis!!

Wait I am so shocked that I discovered a favorite breakfast spot in ues?

when you walk it in its peaceful, no music at all which I love, and not busy at all. Had a lovely diner breakfast on a friday morning w great service. You can get hot coffee almost immediately and a shot of fresh OJ! The OJ was a really nice touch. tasted freshly squeezed!(although not sure)

I got the Irish breakfast platter(?) and it was just the way I would have hoped them cook, no oil dripping, clean cooking, and perfect proportion for a hungry girl. It does come w toast on the side which I did not get. I'd definitely get this again a couple times more before I try something else.

Perfect spot to have a park view while enjoying a good ol' bagel and smoked salmon sandwich! Our server helped us decide on the smoked salmon, it is served with a side of lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes and onion slices and olives. Breakfast is served with a side of orange juice.

Still an old school reliable locals diner to grab a bite.

Nothing fancy, just basic comfort food fare and plenty of daily specials which rotate each week.

Clean and comfy with nice service. The weekend breakfast specials menu offers a large selection to choose from with coffee and juice included.

They still also have their outside seating area set up on the side street.

Best diner in the neighborhood. Not fancy or anything but yummy food. Just got a waffle & side of bacon delivered. Fast delivery.
Waffle is amazing- perfectly crisp but soft and delicious. I've had the turkey club several times. It's good and usually not busy to dine in. Most reasonably priced in Yorkville!

food was decent, ordered some poached eggs with a bagel. Simple diner, service was ok. Nothing special, will see if I try something else next time. They do serve breakfast and lunch menu and it is really extensive. We also did not have to wait to be seated.

I stopped by this diner today for some breakfast. The place is small, i ordered some eggs and home fries which were very good. The eggs and home fries were not greasy which was a plus for me. The coffee was very good, and the price was standard for manhattan. Overall I would def come back here when I want some breakfast.

The service is great! I went in the morning 9:15am on a Thursday -  the servers were so warm and kind, they checked on me constantly. That's really important to me whenever I eat out. I got the whole-wheat pancakes with bananas. It came with a coffee and the old school small orange juice that I remember from Greek diners in the 90s as a kid. The ambience is a simple diner style, nothing fancy or showy --- and super affordable! Fresh flowers at each table and laid back, I usually leave full as the plates are very generous with food!

Live right next to 3 decker and finally got the chance to try em. One weekend i went and it was a beautiful day but oddly the only had 2 outdoor tables. Another time i popped in and it was closed (definitely spoiled by the 24 hr diners in the area).

Today was a perfect day and they had tons of outdoor seating. The menu, like any other diner, was massive. I had the mexican omelette which featured fresh jalapeno, tomato and cheddar. It was a solid portion and the home fries were crisp. My buddy got the mexican style scrambled eggs with rice beans and tortilla. Also a massive stack of chocolate pancakes. Service was decent but honestly the prices here can't be beat. This is probably my new omelette spot .

I found this to be a lovely dinner with very friendly service, great food, and the option of outdoor dining. I had a wonderful tuna melt, with toasted whole wheat bread, as per my request. The side salad and fruit salad tasted fresh and delightful. The portions are decent for sure and the prices are unbeatable for this neighborhood.

TLDR: flavorless food in small portions

I ended up going here because a lot of the previous reviews had mentioned that the portions were big- well safe to say for my meal, that wasn't particularly true.

I got the spare ribs special (14$) while my friend got the half-roast chicken (14$). For my meal, it came with a side salad (which was perfectly average) and a side of sweet potato/spinach (that had zero seasoning whatsoever).

On to the ribs, I was extremely disappointed- I was served only a quarter rack of ribs, and worst of all, they weren't tender and the sauce was painted on. In other words, the inside of the ribs had zero flavor and were hard to chew since they were not smoked. It was pretty obvious that whoever made these ribs tossed them plain in the baking oven and then painted on some barbecue sauce right before serving. And to make it even worse, the  sauce they used looked and tasted more like ketchup than actual smoky barbecue sauce. Being completely honest, I probably could have made much better ribs myself or gone to Boston Market and gotten the exact same meal for much cheaper.

Verdict: no reason to stop here unless you're craving cheap, mediocre American food

This restaurant is good for "short order" food.  Anything above that (specialties of the day etc) reminds me of "mama's cooking" but mama was not a very good cook.
Their prices are very reasonable and if you order a dinner it comes with a complemantary glass of wine.
It's local for us; we go there often....but I'll be sticking with salads.

I am all about supporting small businesses but this one I will no longer support.

Not only is the food not that great for the $ but the owner always double parks in his big red Yukon on 91st and side swiped my car last week.

I showed him video proof of him pulling off my front bumper and he will not take responsibility for his actions. He told me to sue him.

Watch out for the big red truck and take your money elsewhere!
Consistent Good Food-Priced Well-Old Fashioned Atmosphere--We keep coming back!!
Immediately greeted and seated. Server was over in seconds. Food was delicious, hot and their prices are great! Love it here

I've been coming here for years. I don't know how I forgot to review. Old establishment with a huge menu. Old fashioned diner feel inside.
Today I was seated immediately. If you're alone it's easier to get a seat. I told them my order without needing a menu. I barely sipped my water and my breakfast arrived. Fast service.
The food is like eating my mother's cooking. Nothing fancy. Just the way I like it! As soon as I was done the check appeared and table cleared.
Sign says leave tip at table and pay at register. That's what I did. For a Sunday at brunch I was Ecstatic. Service as smooth as a babies butt!
With tip my breakfast came to $10.20! Can't beat that with a stick!
I'll be back more often. I usually come for lunch with my daughter. Maybe I can get her to come for brunch or breakfast too. If not I'll enjoy alone! Food the way I like it. No frills. And complimentary OJ!

I really like this place.  The food is fine.  The service, depends on who waits on you.  The first time I went to this place, was for lunch. I had their meatloaf.  Yummy!  Meatloaf, mash potatoes plus peas and carrots.  I was in heaven.  Of course, I could not finish it all, so I had to doggie bag it.  The waiter was very nice.  The next time I went to the diner, I went for breakfast.  And I hate to say this, but the waitress who waited on me, must've worked the overnight or early morning shift, bc she looked miserable. I definitely put my big smile on and tried to be as pleasant as possible w/her.  Grouchy face.  The food was fine.  I wanted more coffee, but could not locate my waitress, so I asked the helper to refill my cup.  And when it was time to pay my bill, again,  the waitress was nowhere to be found.  The helper went to get her.  She came over to me and asked, "what did you have again?"  I repeated my order for her so she could give me my bill.  I left a 20 percent tip, but she did not deserve it.  I tipped the helper, too, who did most of the work.  I have gone back numerous times and got her as a waitress again.  Same impatient, grouchy attitude.  Today, I sat at a different location.  She was not there.  Thank goodness.

Decent place when you want something fast around the neigborhood.
We had minnestrone soup, chicken rice soup, eggs combo and philly wrap.
Soups tasty but bit small size cup.
Eggs dish, who can go wrlng with it?
And wrap was kind of disappointing, too dry and not enough melted cheese.
Will give another try

Real fast place with lots of regulars that were on first name basis with the wait staff -- must be a go-to place for the area folks. We are visiting town and wanted stopped for a 'brunch'. It's an "all American" (tho with several Mexican choices) Diner but don't think the "organic" craze has hit them yet (or they have decided not to be bothered with it). If you don't get to fancy with your teas and coffees then you would like this place. We certainly had good food served in generous portions at reasonable prices without much of a wait.

3 Decker has quickly become my favorite local diner. I wouldn't rave and say the food is amazing but it has a killer bacon and eggs breakfast. Each table is served with a water and a tiny OJ, which makes it very sweet.

Simple, local, and cute.
This is the quintessential New York City dinner. The food is good for NYC, the service is among the best you'll find in NYC (let's be real though, it's a low bar), and it's in a good location.

If you're looking for a cheap, filling, tasty meal, look no further. 3 Decker Restaurant has the diner atmosphere but far exceeds the taste of how it looks. I've only been for breakfast and lunch on weekends, but there's always ample seating and I've never had to wait. They give a small glass of orange juice with water which is perfect for me since I be ever want a big glass and it's free.

The food itself is really good but not amazing. Solid pancakes, waffles, toast, but I'd say the omelet a are their best breakfast dish. Not sure how dinner works here, but lunch food was available during breakfast and vice versa. Now the portions are huge! One serving of omelet is really for two. And what maKes me the happiest is that the price is more than reasonable.

What a beautifully perfect February day for a breakfast on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, NYC.  The stroll over to 91st Street and 2nd Avenue was a pleasure in the sunshiny morning, with temps in the low 50's! Just a great day to play hooky from normal work and enjoy what life offers on magical days.
3 Decker is a old line corner luncheonette/diner that has been slinging hash for around fifty years. The inside is fixed up with a small counter and spinners, with booths around the edges. The newer portion sits around the outside. It is one of those glass enclosures that juts toward the sidewalk and takes in all the streetscape as part of its atmosphere. We found a deuce right on the angle at the corner, and claimed it immediately!
Coffee arrived promptly, and after a few minutes perusing the large menu we opted for one of their breakfast specials, including two fried eggs, bacon, sweet potato fries and buttered rye toast; and some of their french toast (2 slices). While we waited, we began a conversation that continued the rest of the day. This cozy joint seemed made for talk as the world walked by outside.
The egg platter was substantial, but it was reduced to crumbs and egg stains by the time we were done. Special mention of the well lathered rye toast required. My pain francaise was a thick cut eggy brioche with nice vanilla/sugar mix.  While it could have been caramelized more on the grill, the taste was fine, and quite filling. Coffee was strong and plentiful.
3 Decker was a great way to start the day. It is easy to understand why it has been feeding the neighborhood all these years.

This place is in walking distance from our hotel. Although there was a crowd at the door when we arrived, we were quickly seated.

A few minutes from being seated, we had complimentary orange juice and water at our table. Not far from that, our server was there to take drink and meal orders.Our server was kind and helpful with the menu. Super fast service. Our food came
Out just as fast.

This place has a LOT of items on the menu. Not the cleanest place. But the service is kind and very fast. Food was very affordable as well.

I am very disappointed.  I live in the neighborhood and come here once in awhile. The basic diner fare is usually good and plentiful. The service is accommodating if not overtly friendly. Usually a good value. Today my partner came here for Christmas dinner. Her lamb was fatty and not cooked well. Watery mashed potatoes. The vegetables in my pasta primavera looked like they came out of a frozen food bag. Watery sauce. I was supposed to get a soup or a salad. They didn't bring either until I mentioned it to the waiter; then I got my salad.

My partner ordered a Christmas dinner special. The menu said it came with a free glass of wine, dessert, coffee or tea. Cake or pie would be $4.50 extra. When she asked what desserts came with the dinner, the waiter tried to get her to order cake or pie. He had to get someone else to explain that the dessert was the coffee or tea. Deceptive. Then they charged her for the coffee because she had the wine. The menu did not say "choice of coffee, tea, or wine." She was credited for the coffee but the whole experience felt like they were taking advantage of customers who don't check their bills. I felt they were trying to rip us off. Disappointing.

My boyfriend and I were searching for a quick, easy, no frills place to eat breakfast. We weren't in the mood to wait at Sarabeth's or any other fancy brunch spot. We put on sweatpants and uggs, strolled down the block to 3 Decker and were seated right away. Our food came out super quick (omelets, toast, home fries) and the coffee cured my sleepiness. I was actually surprised how good the ham and cheese omelet was. Best part of it all? Our bill was a whopping $16. We will definitely be back when we are in the mood for a super casual, basic diner experience.

I wouldn't go here again.
We came for breakfast, and I'm squirming thinking about my dish. Tasted terrible. And we also never got coffee refills. My brother got French toast, he said he'd get it again. But I wouldn't get eggs or the potatoes. They do give you OJ when you sit down which is a nice touch.
Very friendly service and great breakfast specials. Affordable and decent food. Plus it has awesome old-school diner vibes. It's a local favorite

This restaurant on the corner of 91st street and 2nd Avenue has been the most awkward experience. The waitress clearly did not want to serve me but had plenty of time to have side conversations what someone who was not even order.  The food was OK but I will definitely not be supporting this establishment.

#food #customerserviceproblems #racistpeople #dontsupport #growup

Great dinner at a local diner while in town. Service was prompt but not overbearing. I had chicken souvlaki "new style" and it was delicious. The family also enjoyed their meal of spaghetti and cheeseburger. The diner is located in a nice area across from a kids/dog park with a little splash pad. Perfect!

Old school no frills diner.  Amazing how they continue to run their operation this way amidst the evolution around the neighborhood.  It's as if they're in a time capsule and never left the 90s.  In a good way.

Don't expect much service.  You have to work to get the waiter's attention.  But once you put in your order, food comes out pretty quickly.  For weekend brunch, you get one complimentary orange juice and unlimited (pretty decent) coffee refills.

It's hard to come across a good, cheap, diner in New York City. For a while, I was going to the diner down the block from 3 Decker because it popped out to me more. It's easy to walk past 3 Decker and not realize that a great diner lays behind it.

I love diner food but refuse to pay the expensive prices New York City diner's charge, but was surprised to see how cheap and affordable the food is here. I got chocolate chip pancakes for around $8. I ordered a small side of bacon and with that, I was full. They have a bunch of other breakfast combinations for around $7-10 dollars. The only criticism I have is that the bacon seemed a little overcooked, but I didn't really mind it too much.

The food came out quick - within 10 minutes of ordering. The waiters were kind and attentive. This is definitely going to be my new weekend diner spot.

This place is really good I would definitely recommend 10/10 amazing burgers too.
Not is their staff nice but they have a lot of options for food and quick service

This place is absolutely amazing. I've walked by numerous times not even noticing it but it is the perfect greasy spoon joint in the UES (upper-east-side). The prices were amazing, a really great value. The waitress runs a tight ship, she seems kind of scary but she cares about her work and wants to do a good job. It was fun to watch her boss around the kitchen staff and tell them what was up if they seemed confused about a particular order.

- Attentive service.

- Great prices.

- Fresh and tasty food.

- Speedy service.

*Really good pickles and cole-slaw

Walking around and came across this cafe.  Quite the variety of omelettes.  Wes ordered the Italian (mozzarella, Italian sausage and basil). And I ordered Cleopatra - hah, feeling like a Queen today  (salami, peppers and muenster cheese). They must like omelettes on the brown side or the grill a little on the hotter side.  There was a lot of meat!  They sure don't spare expense on the meats here in New York.  Would I come back?  Probably not.  Coffee ok...not watered down stuff.  But willing to venture further out to grab morning grub.  The staff are nice and service quick.

Worst piece of crap diner in the neighborhood. Avoid this place. Service has gone way down hill over the last few years. This last visit they had the nerve to serve me a turkey ruben with burnt blackened bread and cheese. I waited 30 min for garbage and had no more time on my lunch hour. The female server put it in front of me expected me to eat it, the bread was like a brick of charcoal. That being said, if she had come to me and explained that they burned my food and needed to remake it, it would have been fine. But the kitchen sent it out and she knowingly served it. This diner used to be better. Trust me when I tell you it was charred and inedible. I've had many terrible experiences here in the past year or so and I've been going to this diner for a decade. Unacceptable. Better diners in the area. Avoid.
