The beauty of small American diners lies in its simplicity, quick and friendly service, and consistent food. And of course, your bottomless cup of joe. This diner has just that and I have never had a bad experience here.

I am aware that they don't have food to die for, but what they do have is amazing grits (hard to find in NYC), and all around solid breakfast options. The cute seating area with flowers at each table is a nice bonus! They also have the classic booths that you can find in any diner.

For brunch, you can usually get your food within 5-7 minutes of ordering, and the waiters come around frequently to make sure your caffeine needs are fully satisfied at all times.

The meal you get here is very affordable, and it's a great deal when you think about how much food you are getting.

Would highly recommend for breakfast/brunch, if you're in the area. If you're far away, I wouldn't necessarily travel here.. I'm sure you can find a comparable diner near where you are too :)

I went to this diner after the place me and my friend wanted to go to was closed, the diner was nice and clean. The waiter was nice and professional. I had the tunafish salad melt deluxe and my friend an omelette with home fries. My food was good though I don't like tunafish salad and prefer simply tunafish melt, despite that fact the meal was good. My friend on the other hand did not like her food very much, needed more seasoning and etc.

If I'm in the area again, I don't mind going back to this diner. Just have to be sure what you order if you're looking for something tasty, seasoning wise.

This is a solid all American diner on the upper east side. It's family friendly, and an old school diner feel. We were served by an old women and a young server. It felt wholesome to see a nice family dynamic going on in the restaurant. Helped me feel at home.  

Food-wise their pancakes are the fluffy and light while being completely filling. I would definitely recommend getting a cup of coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice to accompany your meal. It's a great pick me up to energize for the week!

Delicious, hearty, generous servings. A really good NY diner. We had a late brunch of poached eggs with bacon, omelette, pancakes. Everything was perfect. The service was fast and super friendly. And so reasonably priced. Can't wait to go back.
The menu is huge and the service is excellent. The prices are inexpensive and the portions are large. The food isn't amazing, but it's very acceptable.

An amazing spot to hit after a bender. Service is fast, prices are fair, and the coffee refills are on point. Love the window seats too. Perfect for people watching and making longing eye contact at dogs you wish you had.

Definitely go next door if you have to poop though.

Here's a haiku to express my true feelings:

Got a hangover?
Soup of the day with coffee
All hail triple decker

I came here to order takeout, the waitress was busy assisting another client when I walked in and I didn't mind waiting for her to finish but the manager took it upon herself to yell at me "what do you want" as if I was interrupting her by wanting to spend money in her establishment. I immediately left. Their are plenty other diners in the area to try.

Went here with a friend to grab a bite to eat for lunch on a weekday. The place had some customers, but we were able to be seated right away.

For my meal, I decided to get the chicken piccata with broccoli and spinach and a side salad.

The side salad came out first and was pretty much as basic as you could imagine a side salad being.

The chicken piccata came out a little while after. The flavor was not so bad, but the appearance was not great. The chicken was odd-shaped and the sauce had a film on the top layer. Also, the portion of the chicken was quite small considering the $13 price tag. The broccoli was fine, but the spinach was clearly overdone and lacked freshness.

Overall, this place seemed to take a long time for food to come out and the service was spotty at best. All of the wait staff was friendly, but the high prices and low quality and amount of food don't have me coming back any time soon.

Walking into 3 Decker is like being transported into old New York, the version of the city you came for, the version of society you wished you lived in. Ever seen a Martin Scorsese picture? This is where the director wrote "Taxi Driver," probably. From the stark linoleum flooring to the chrome-studded booths, 3 Decker embodies everything you want from a diner. The fishbowl views of the hustle and bustle of the city make for great entertainment as you wait for your meal. Ask me about 3 Decker? I'll tell you with pride and ease...the wait staff: attentive and stable; makes me feel like a sturdier human being. The price: reasonable and won't cut your pockets. The coffee: always full. 3 Decker decker is the ideal stop if you're hungover. Whether you're lost in life or on the right track, it's always for a great price-- the right price. Try the Mexican Omlet, if you dare.

Bang for your breakfast/ brunch buck here. Best omlettes & COFFEE on the upper east side! So many different combinations to choose from, you won't ever be disappointed. (And that rye toast!? )

Recos: carmine's omlette, hebrew omlette, and hungarian omlette

Cheap. Attentive. Fast. My go-to in my neighborhood. They like to turn tables as it's usually pretty packed but they never rush you to go. You can get a solid and filling delicious breakfast for $10. $20 for me since I add mimosas. Lol. If on the upper east side, definitely stop in. Full menu is great as well. A true New York diner.

Best deal in town for a wholesome and inexpensive dinner meal! Three of us eat there most Friday nights because we enjoy the "Friday specials" along with the quality and the quantity of food served. Portions are always good and substantial, most meals going home with us as leftovers for tomorrow night. Wait staff is friendly and professional. The atmosphere is old fashioned diner style, meaning comfortable and casual. You get a lot for a little, Can't be beat!
Very Good old school diner with good food and reasonable prices.  Service is good and seating is quick.

Ok, this place officially SUCKS!  If you want an old, freezer burned, half rotten burger, then go here. I should've known when the waitress didn't ask me how I wanted my burger cooked, that the meal was gonna suck. French fries cooked in day-old canola. AND THE BACON???!!! THE BACON TASTED LIKE AMMONIA!!!
Barrrrf! Steer clear!!!  
I gave this place 2 stars because despite the food being terrible, the coffee is actually good. And the wait staff is nice... but besides that... NEVER AGAIN!!

This has got to be the worst coffee shop I've ever ordered from in my entire life. Not only was a person on the phone extremely rude she blatantly lied to me. She told me I ordered beef sausage when I know I ordered pork. I've never ordered beef sausage in my entire life. The food is basically inedible. Very disappointed and I will never order from there again.

Classic counter service cafe. Pizza had a nice thin crunchy crust, lots of other options (soup sandwich salad etc). Only complaint is how old some of the pizza looked. The cheese was the only relatively fresh one. Limited seating available, more of a grab and go vibe. Quiet spot near the high line.
The one day I decide to cheat on my keto diet i get pizza from this place.  It tasted old and dry.  My coworker threw hers out.  I guess u get what you pay for.  Discusting
Decent Plain Pizzas. Fast delivery. Conveniently spaced location.  Reasonably priced. My go to spot.
AMAZING!!! Prices were phenomenal. Where else can you get a BLT and fries for only $8? Such a great place to stop and have lunch, and the service was great on top of it. We were very satisfied.

I can't even believe some people have the audacity to even complain about this place!!! For $10 I got this banging chicken gyro platter which he told me "comes with fries" figured meh why not I'm starving -- well he forgot to tell me that it also came with
-a cucumber salad
-rice
-tatziki sauce cups
-a warm pita!!!!!

Really LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!

Came here for dinner after walking by the place for over a year . Cool, simplistic little Pizza restaurant which is BYOB ( a plus) . The service was personal and very friendly as it is a locals spot. The pizza was good , a little burnt on the bottom . I looked at the other tables and they had some nice choices but a smaller type menu which is fine by me . Overall 3.75 . There are so many pizza options in Hoboken but certainly check this one out .

This place is an all around diner style place they make just about everything that being said the food is not spectacular but it's acceptable i had the cheese burger combo. The burger was well done the cheese that was out on the burger wasn't melted came with fries lettuce tomatoes and onions for $7 it won't break your wallet food is acceptable if your looking for a quick meal for under $10 great place to grab some breakfast the staff know you by name and even remember your order this morning I was greeted by one of the owners very nice gentleman

Ordered through seamless at 5:42. Was told delivery would take about 30-40 min. It's now 7:15 and still no pizza. I've tried calling the restaurant multiple times with no answer. I contacted Seamless who also tried to contact them and could not get through.  Finally had to cancel my order and will not be ordering from this place again.

0 stars. Ordered for delivery at 4:49pm and they said the ETA was 45min to 1 hour. At 7:15pm (2 hours and 26min later), I called multiple times to check on the status and no answer.

I decided to walk over to check in person. As soon as I tell the 2 guys by the front door what the situation was.. Andrew kept saying it's been busy... I understand that, however, it had been 2 hours and 16min since I called for delivery. Not once did he apologize or try to accommodate as clearly that is an error on their end, rather he decided to give me attitude. This guy Andrew should not be doing any type of work related to customer service.

In short, 1) horrible customer service due to the way Andrew reacted and he just suggested to cancel the order like a complete prick, 2) horrible delivery service, and 3) horrible management as no one answered my 6 follow up calls yet I saw their employees standing around with nothing to do when I got there.

Do not order from this place. They do not care about their customers and clearly was firm about it. Getting rid of Andrew should alleviate one of the many challenges they currently have. Just a horrible experience overall.

Ordered delivery at 11:50 with a 12:30 delivery time. Then it got updated to 12:50-1p. 1:25p and still no food. Called the restaurant 4 times no answer. Seamless called them - no answer. Walked by and saw workers not wearing masks inside. They used to be one of my favorite pizza spots, won't be ordering from them anymore

Angel was phenomenal! We dropped our pizza and he gave us a whole new pie. He acted as if it was his fault (knowing full well it was our own) and MCT us feel SO COMFORTABLE! The owner came us to us as well(with his perfect daughter) and made us feel like family. I will be back EVERY WEEK because of the amazing food and hospitality!

More than just pizza, 10th Avenue offers a more lengthy menu that spreads pretty wide, but not terribly deep.  I was here for a slice and a bottled soda after walking the High Line.  I sat at the bar while a few 2-ups were to my back in single file.  This place is narrow and they do what they can for seating.  The pizza was OK with crispy crust but a little lacking on toppings and hardly any sauce.   Overall, pretty average.

I order from here often and I am always happy with the food and the service. Yes, it is not the best Italian food that you can find in NYC, but it is good, the portions are large, and they always deliver the food quickly.
The best part about it is that often my meals can be stretched over two or three times which is great!
I've been going here for years and these guys don't disappoint! Dope energy and I usually order the chicken cutlet sandwich with lettuce, tomatoes, cheddar cheese and onions and it's banging.

The very nice owner reached out to me-the man who hung up on me was an employee not the owner, and apologized profusely, and offered a meal on the house to make up for what happened before. I was a restaurant manager in the past and my grandparents were chefs. I have to commend them on knowing the right way to deal with a problem like I had.

I'll be ordering again.
Fantastic, HUGE slices of pizza. Great breakfast sandwiches and they have Taylor Ham for the Jersey folks!

I live crazy close, so these guys have been my go-to for almost 8 years. I walk in and they ask "Hot or Iced" pertaining to my coffee. After November, they know its always hot until the snow starts melting again! The lady's who work the counter every morning are my absolute favorite!

Now onto food. Everything here is great is you know what to order. Do not touch Pizza. They make great french toast, awesome egg sandwiches, AMAZING home fries - if they have them, decent burgers, mediocre fries, beef patties are a-okay. Honestly, I probably could touch on all their menu items.

Either way, they have great customer service, will remember your name and order right off the bat. The food is good, and the cost is great for the area.

I had three slices of plain pizza today, July 3, 2016.  They may very well be the worst slices of pizza I've had in New York in nearly 30 years.  The crust was OK but the sauce was acidic and chemical tasting and there was no discernible cheese.  Needless to say, will not be back. $2.50 for a slice makes it 10 times the insult.

Update, July 10:  I had a frank conversation with the owner who very much wants to offer good and reasonably priced food. So I'm giving him another chance. By all accounts most of what he offers works for his customers.  I'll be back to try the pizza again later this summer and if it's better (or still the same) I'll have another update.  This is Yelp at its best.

This is a wonderful group of people at this cafe. They have s little bit of everything . Everyone in our travel party  began to order daily by text or through the normal apps as we worked in Chelsea .
The ownership understood our needs . The cook understood the required preparation for different tastes and diet choices . It is evident that a spoiled vegan from San Francisco can dine as easily as the art staff on pie or the drivers on heavy meat protein :)
If your production travel party is in the neighborhood or just you and your friends need a double cheese slice of pie and a falafel wrap with hummus maybe burger and fries .  Polite and friendly Owner ,Courtesy with a smile Prompt Delivery . The cook makes Yummy food .
Waltz on by four or five times before they dance :)
We come here everyday. They are so kind to my children. Sharif in particular makes my children laugh. Highly recommend. My son says it's the best pizza ever and we travel everywhere:)

A small pizzeria and cafe. My feet were hurting, the boyfriend was starving, we needed to sit somewhere asap. This place had no shortage of customers. I give credit that the entire restaurant was clean. This is more of a "eat and run" type of eatery, but at least you're able to sit down and take a load off.

The pizza itself was majorly greasy.

At least they had iced coffee.

I'll take the place for what it is. Like what the others have said, I won't go out of my way to eat here. However if I'm nearby and need food energy, I know where to go.
Pizza is okay compare to the other pizza places in New York. Really big slice tho for only 3.75

More like a generous 3.5 star. The food isnt bad. Its WAY cheaper than anything else in the area. I was looking for a place to get a cheap burger and fries without going past 9th (I work by the piers).

Pizza is okay too. Nothing spectacular, you get what you pay for and I'm more than satisfied with that.

Stopped by for a few slices with my husband and daughter. They were so incredibly nice to my daughter. Margherita pizza was delicious! We ended up going back later in the same day because my 3 year old wanted the carrot cake! That was amazing as well. This is a must stop when we are in the area. Excellent prices also.

Most inconsistent pizza ever!!
Some days it's decent, other days it's like "who the fuck made this"?

Their Gyros are good all the time tho.
And I like the chicken parm hero, and the sausage and pepper hero too.

The burger deluxe platter is nothing super spectacular but it'll hit the spot if you're hungry.

It all boils down to this: 3 stars for being an alleged pizza place, but the pizza not being the best thing on the menu.

Food is priced for its health, meaning its cheap and will likely give you some indigestion. $4 dollar falafel is a nice price, but they fry it with so much oil I get bloated and achy after.
They advertise wheat crust, but he two times I ordered pizza they were out of it. This place is not for the health conscious.
This place sucks, from the customer service to their food. Got a stale burger, which came with a bun bigger than the actual patty. Disgusting food, never again!

It's very close to work... it also has a variety of food to choose from.
Breakfast: the eggs and potatoes are good.  How can you mess that up right?
Lunch: Pizza- I had the fresh mozzarella slice... it was ok.  The crust basically crumbled when I folded the slice.  It had a biscuity consistency.  Not bad but weird.  
Eggplant parm- was not bad.  Also the sauce was different.  How to describe it but it smelled a bit like Indian spices were added.  Again not bad but weird.  
The service is great.  The ladies in front are on top of their game!
A decent breakfast spot on the west side. Great sausage,egg, and cheese sandwich with a large coffee, $5.00. The staff is friendly and helpful. Will visit again, fosho!!!

I stopped in here after work to have a slice and just take a breather.  It looks like such a cute place with exposed brick wall & a little counter to sit at!  Most of the pizza just looked OK so I got a regular slice which was, as expected, just OK.  They had a pretty small menu but with a variety of items ranging from breakfast to sandwiches to weird things I would never order there (crabcakes and spaghetti?)  

They had a few little pastries I was tempted to try but I resisted.  I would never go out of my way to go here but for a slice on the go its fine with me!

I know I can always grab a good slice of white or mozz and basil slice here. Comfortable place to chat. Good service if you're pleasant. The desserts are fantastic!
They have one TV w/ no sound that seems to always be tuned to a big soccer match or Wipeout.
Good food. I go there because its near one of my jobsites. Pizza is pretty good and their service is great!

I go at least once a week. The grilled chicken salad with avocado and the chicken gyro sandwich are my favorites. Service is top notch and the prices are reasonable. Good people and good food. What more can one ask for?

After living in New York for over a years and being pretty disappointed in most of the pizza around town, I finally had a perfect place to sit down over a pie with friends.  The line is worth the wait and they buy their

It's definitely not the kind of place that you would go out of your way to get to however, it is the kind of place that you'd end up if you weren't looking for a sit-down restaurant in this area. The prices are cheap, you a fair amount but to reiterate, only if you're on the run and starving should you really seek a meal here.

Humans of Chelsea

Price - Very reasonable. Chelsea overall has prices that are higher than the Local New Yorker average so this place helps reach that average for sure.

Location- Next to a Subways on 10th Avenue Mostly Surrounded by Restaurants. More of the go in and go out Atmosphere. Also next to the popular Growing HighLine

Food & Drinks- They have breakfast , Lunch and Dinner. I have never personally had their Breakfast but Sandwiches are fairly Decent. Pizza is as decent as it gets but careful as I had some Digestion Problems. Think twice. Coffee's are on point if anyone wants a local place before going to work.

Overall- Nothing to brag about but It's New York so it does Provide. It's Average on Everything but Subways is right next door. If you want a sandwich don't bother. If you have to save the few pieces of Lint in your wallet then this place is where it's at.

Most disgusting falafel I have ever eaten. There were pieces of hamburger in it, and the first bite tasted like a burger. Here's some news: falafel is vegetarian! 5 dollars wasted. If i wasn't at work I would go and get my money back.   Pizza is mediocre and has cardboard for crust.  Why is this the only place within reasonable distance of my office? Why?
AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
food is great. prices are very reasonable. i got a large portion of lasagna for like $6. delivery isn't as quick as other places though.

Not the best pizza in the world, but definitely not bad for the price.  Pizza for three people for 12 bucks!

The guys behind the counter were super friendly and seemed like they wanted to be there. Maybe it was the owner, but that's fine by me.

The line was not too long. Not sure how quick they can get you in and out after a game or something but it was fine for me on a random Saturday afternoon.

I stopped by at 4 Boys 99 Cents Pizza on my way to Penn Station. I was excited to try the pizza here, given the good reviews, but it's important to note there were only a few reviews posted. In short, I've had a lot better dollar pizza elsewhere. The sauce didn't have much flavor to it and the dough didn't have the right chew, but the pizza was still decent for the price. If you're going to get anything besides a cheese slice, you might as well go to another restaurant.

Beyond the food, I was impressed by the size of the place, given most dollar pizza spots I've been to have been more of a stand. There wasn't really room to sit in the restaurant, but it was nice that it wasn't too crowded. If you're looking for something quick and cheap before your train, this place is certainly an option.

Such a surprise and incredible find while waiting for our bus to leave Manhattan and heading out to Philly.

One of our bucket list was to find $1 pizza and it was literally right before departure. The pizza was thin, soft and also crunchy where it should be. The tip was dripping oil, which was a good sign and totally worth the $5. Got two cheese slice for $1/ea and one pepperoni at $2/ea

It's one of those locations with no seatings and you just walk in and order. Cash only!!! So remember to bring cash. Totally worth for your dollar. There's no music and just a quick and easy transaction.

Awesome pizza place next to Madison Square Garden! $1 for just cheese and $2 for one topping slice. They give you a TON of sausage which is worth the extra dollar. Unlike a lot of 99 cent pizza places which are soggy, this place bakes it more and actually has super crispy crusts! $5 card minimum. Obviously not the best overall pizza in NYC, but amazing for the price.
Can't beat $1 pizza. Quick and hot! Not to doughy and a good amount of sauce and cheese. $1 per extra topping. Very close to Penn Station subway and Train Hall.

My go-to 99 cents pizza place that I take my friends to and myself on late night or just for dinner. A slice of cheese pizza costs $1 and a slice of topped pizza costs $2 to $3.50. The staff are super kind (I once paid in all coins and they were so nice about it). If you're lucky, you'll get a slice fresh out the oven and it's just as good as pizza suprema - the shop right across the street that charges $5 for a slice of cheese pizza (no hate!)! 4 Boy's pizza crust has a bit of crispiness and chew to it, and the tomato sauce is very flavorful. This tops all the other dollar shop pizza places I've gone to.

This is the best 99 cent pizza in the city! Its my
Go to spot for when I'm driving on the weekends. It's cheap, quick and the flavors are there! I feel that it might taste better than a lot of regular pizza spots! But that is just my personal opinion from my personal experience. I have been here several times and they have not disappointed. Will continue to come back as long as they are serving great slices!
Pretty decent for what you pay.  No complaints at all, had the pepperoni.  Was intrigued the the shrimp one, but bailed at the last minute.  Owner was friendly and service quick.

Coming from a city with limited late night options, I definitely wanted to grab a late night slice of pizza while in New York. My hotel was close to here, and I got a slice of pepperoni, which was not 99 cents. It was $3! Three times the advertised price, and the $1 slice of cheese pizza I got on a second trip tasted better. The pepperonis were fine, nothing super amazing and not necessarily worth it for $2 more. However, I love the thin crust dough and the cheese slice was simple yet delicious, especially with some crushed red pepper added on top.

Is this the best pizza ever? No. But for a $1, it came out warm, cheesy, and fresh. It tasted good and satisfied my hunger. For those reasons, I'm a fan. And honestly, $3 isn't that bad for a slice of pizza if you want/need some meat too. However, I'd rather be more economical while also "carb loading" on three $1 cheese slices instead of getting one $3 pepperoni slice.

New York Style Pizza: Fresh. Hot. Tasty. Not Greasy.
And only $1 a slice! What's not to like... Sold!  

I think going to one of these joints should be a right of passage for one traveling in the city.
It's a simple, no frills, order at the counter establishment, take your slice to go kinda place.

Whether a quick snack or a couple of slices to satisfy the craving of a complete meal, I was happy with the purchase.  How can you really go wrong for that price?!?!?

After watching that 99 cent video, I got to finally try it!!! The 99 cent pizza only applies to the cheese slice. Pretty good and def worth it. During my visit I have tried two different 99 pizza joints and they both vary. One has lots of cheese and not much sauce, where the other ones have too much sweet tomato sauce and not much cheese. Overall it's def worth the $1 at any locations.
Wet. Undercooked. Doughy. Waste of a buck. Avoid if possible. The worst dollar slice I've had in MY LIFE.
Great spot! I highly suggest this spot to anyone visiting New York! However, make sure you come with an empty stomach because the pizza is amazingly good!

PIE HOLE IN THE WALL

The tip jar must
have once been full
of black olives,
pepperoncini,
maybe mushrooms
before it was
full of pennies
like a body-
less fountain,
despite the fact
this pizza is
actually
a whole dollar
(small but still false
advertisement--

who here tosses
stupid pennies
in as a tip
anyway? Rude)

We are all just
hungry, penni-
less, and bottom-
less pizza wells.
Please let's just be
together, our
pie holes ajar,
filled with sausage
or dollar bills
or whatever
else flies in.

Absolutely rude. Upon first seeing the place, me and my friends took a photo of the sign so we could save it. I mean $8 for an 18inch with free delivery is worth saving.

So I called up the store to place my order, and the guy said, "no delivery."

I hung up discouraged of course, but my friend said to call back and ask about their sign.

I called them back and said, "your sign in front says you deliver." I said this about 10 times because the guy kept saying that he doesn't understand me. I was going slower and slower each time, it made no sense.

Then he said, "oh ignore the sign," laughed in the background, and when I said, "alright then.. bye." He said RUDELY, "ok buh bye."

Would never ever consider this asshole again.

Pretty legit for $1 pizza.  They crank through pizzas left and right during the weekend daytimes.  If you come then, you'll likely have it pretty fresh.

Crust is very crisp with the right amount of cheese and sauce.  It's not greasy at all.  It was right down the street from our hotel so we stopped by once a day for a snack.

Good $1 pizza. Lunch special two slices and drink for 2.75

Nothing to rave about. It does its purpose: quick lunch while on the go.

However,  I will point out the cheese was salty and it could use more sauce.

I love 99 Cent Best and Fresh Pizza.  Especially when it's fresh.  Great snack for long days in the FIT library.  A lot of people in reviews complain about the .9¢ tax, bringing a slice to $1.08... let's just assume they all just got off the megabus at the stop across the street and don't understand that nothing edible in NYC is truly .99¢  

If u can't afford it try cup noodles ramen sweetie
Good pizza!! Tonight is our second night in NY and the second night we have this pizza.

This place is very good for no frills, fast and somewhat fresh pizza. Everything is super cheap. Pizza is only $1 a slice or $8 a pie. You can even get drinks for $1 and Red Bull for $2. Much cheaper than anything else nearby where a meal and a drink costs you an arm and a leg.

They have curtain specials that run certain times. I believe weekend pizza special for $6 a pie. They also have a 2.75 special for two slices and a drink.

Keep in mind this place is cash only and it's a hole in the wall. Couldn't fit more than 10 people inside the door but definitely good for the price. Was not over cooked at all like I saw in a previous review.

If you're looking for something quick to tie you over before or after Madison square garden, or just looking for something cheap, this place is great.
It's supposed to be dollar pizza and he tries to charge you tax. If you push back he won't charge you but that's garbage. A dollar is a dollar

Visited NYC for the first time with my wife and kids. I wanted to get a traditional NY slice of pizza and this place did not disappoint. In fact, it's all my kids wanted to eat  every evening for the three nights we were in town. I was happy to let them have their fill and was right along grabbing a slice for myself. One of the guys even began to recognize me and gave a "welcome back my friend!" I laughed. So much for that NY attitude i was always warned about. Saved this place as a spot too come back to next time I'm visiting.

It's $1 pizza....nothing to rave about, but gets the job done.  The 1 star rating is for the honesty of the worker.  The sign states "Daily Special $2.75 for 2 slices and a soda or water".  There is only one guy at the front counter collecting the money and serving the slices.  Everytime I pay, I never get the quarter back.  I always wind up paying $3 for the "daily special".  At first I thought he forgot so whatever.  This has gone on 5 times already and I will not go back.  For those of you who continue to go back to this place, remember to ASK for your change back, even tho you shouldn't have to.
So good. Fresh, efficient, clean, and friendly atmosphere. They could've easily charged $5 a slice and I'd still be back haha.
I very much enjoyed a slice after seeing Michigan win in Madison Square Garden. Simple and cheap, great for a snack between big meals. Nice little shop with a quick serve atmosphere.
I went in and got two 5 dollar specials and the pizza came out to be like pure charcoal from how burnt it was

Decent for 99 cent pizza, but there are better places. A little too bread-y for my liking, and not enough cheese. Tip: this place is super close to a megabus drop-off location, so if you need to grab a quick slice, you could stop by here.

The pizza was good, I ordered three slices. The guy friggin,,,, he puts three slices up and says $4.31. And my boyfriend, he says, "isn't this dollar pizza?" And the guy is like yeah that seems right. And my boy he says, he says "so it's a dollar per slice then." And the pizza man says "ok" and so my boyfriend is all like "so why is it $4.31" and the mans is all like "oi that is with tax" and when my boyfriend was just about ready to suplex him, the fear of god was put into me, and I says "my dearest boyfriend, it isn't worth it." And the pizza also wasn't worth it.

Give me my dollar back or perish
This place is nice! since I go to FIT I go here almost everyday and I always think the pizza is well worth your money.

Honestly, nothing bad to say about this place. It's your typical whole in the wall dollar pizza place. You get in, get your pizza, you get out. Can't believe I'm about to say this but...no need for spectacular, friendly customer service. Just hand me my pizza, I hand you my dollar, and we're all set. I love the way their pizza is made, here. Different than 2 Bros for sure, I prefer it this way. This is as simple as a quick nom gets, and I love it this way.

they have Parmesan cheese to put on the pizza which is kind of rare for dollar slice spots. That's really the only plus side though... They seriously need to turn up the heat on those ovens because it's floppier than an 80 year old man.

I love their pizza and the best part is that they have Parmesan cheese to put on if you'd like along with several other great spices. I go there because it's right by FiT so it's the perfect place to grab a cheap bite in between classes.

The guys who work there are super nice and friendly.

Two slices and a drink for only $2.75!

I consider this place a whole in the wall gem
Pizza was ok. You get what you pay for. Watch out for shady owner. Will try to overcharge you

When it's good, it's not half-bad.  But when it's not, like when it's been sitting there or they say it's hot so they don't heat it up, it's no more than mediocre...Be alert when getting your change...its advertised $2.75 for two slices and a can of soda cost me $3.00 today....

you cannot go wrong with this dollar pizza.

one may think dollar pizza is horrible by default, however this slice is actually very tasty. the crust is thin and crunchy, and it is always fresh!!

try it out!
Really awesome cheap pizza, great if you're not too hungry and need to grab a quick slice

Good, cheap pizza in a place where food is way overpriced for what you get. Skimpy on the toppings (cheese, pepperoni) but decent crust at a price that won't break the bank and the slices are huge compared to what they are in Michigan.
Delicious pizza, even better price. Add a little side Parmesan and let's call it a night. Only took 1-2 minutes total. Will go again

This "pizza" was primarily dough (crust) with a bit of tomato paste brushed on and a minute amount of cheese (even when hot it wasn't stringy as there was so little cheese).  If you're really hungry, find another pizza place because this won't fill you up.
Horrible!!! It felt like I was eating pieces of card board boxes. Had no ketchup, napkins or straws!!! Worst 10.00 dollars spent in my life. Also I didn't understand him.

The pizza here was good... the price was good... the service was fast.  Not the most cordial people... but hey.... it's a 99cent pizza hole in the wall place.... I wasn't expecting a maitre d to take my order.  I asked for pizza... I paid... and the pizza was good.... no complaints

This really was a perfect burger. It was a little greasy, the patty was perfectly cooked and slightly smashed with grilled onions, and the bun was super soft. The fries were hot and crispy too.

The place is small mostly with standing room to wait inside and outside there are two high-top tables outside. The menu is simple and straightforward so the ordering goes quickly and the wait was not long.

Too much growth too quickly. I loved the original 7th Street Burger and was excited to see them doing well. I thought it was one of the best and most competitively priced smash burgers in the city, far and away better than chains like Five Guys etc.

Well prices are up and quality is WAY down at their expansion locations. I think Chelsea is the newest and while the fries were pretty tasty the burger was straight-up bad, and they didn't put cheese on it (lol). The burger also looked like it had been run over by a car and then tossed in the Hudson River before being fished out which I would have given a pass on if I had gotten delivery but I picked it up.

Five Guys far surpasses this location now which tells you everything you need to know. Bummer.

Simply burger! World class delicious burger!

Heard so much about this burger joint, it even appeared in Yelp's 50 burger joints in 50 states list. Luckily one of their store is right next to my work, perfect for lunch takeout.

This store has a simple menu, burger fries and soda, that's it. No place to sit or dine, only to go.

Got the double cheeseburger. It took about 10 minutes to get the order. The burger was amazing. Soft bun, yummy paddy, perfectly cooked, mixed with onions and sauce. I'd have loved the burger to be little bit bigger for its price. None the less, it's a must try.

Ambiance : none ; but there is a beauty in a small place that gets to the point; order food and go .

Service : great , nice staff with quick service .

Food : Limited topping makes ordering super easy and the older I get , the more I appreciate the simple things and pleasures of places like this.

As for the burger, it melts in your mouth , perfect mix of juicy burger fat ( that I love in a burger ) and taste ! I personally loved the grilled onion smell as I open up the burger and the taste. Now as I ate it, I thought to myself this burger, it's  like Shake shack and White Castle had a baby and it's 7th street burger. I Would recommend if you are craving a burger on the go or are hung over !

If you're looking for a burger on your cheat day in a casual ambiance then you found your place.
They have vegetarian option, but other than that- not healthy for you in any way.
We ordered double cheeseburger, single cheeseburger, two fries, and two drinks and it cost $30. That is pretty pricey if you ask me. Tasty food. Although, we picked the food up(there's no seating available) and walked to Madison square park a block away and ate the food there.
Food came out in under 10 minutes, and employees were kind.
I would return back if I was in the mood for a greasy burger to eat in the park nearby.

Let's start with service. Girls were smiling, took my order and delivered quickly when ready.

23rd St is very small with only 2 stand up tables to eat at. Light music playing in the background.

Now for the meat and potatoes, no pun intended. Had a double with all the fixings. A little on the greasy side, makes for more deliciousness. Fries crispy, complemented with Heinz ketchup packets. Wish they had bulk dispensing since I like fries with my ketchup.
Finally, 7th Street Burger serves Mexican Coke and for the first time I've seen, Mexican Sprite.

Overall, definitely a good burger and fries.

Came here with my friend for burgers and this place was decent.

Pros:
+ Friendly staff
+ Great vegetarian burgers
+ Short wait
+ Fast turnaround

Cons:
- Limited selection
- No restrooms
- Absolutely no seating - There are a few nice parks you can stop by though
- Pricey for the service you're getting. This is just a take out place

IG: QueenOfAdventureNYC

This 7th Street Burger location is great for stopping in to grab a delicious burger and fries. The menu is pretty limited with a cheeseburger/double cheeseburger, veggie burger, and fries. I did find out while I was there that they do have a few items that are not on the menu like their loaded fries which are apparently pretty good. Though the menu only consists of burgers and fries, they definitely do these things well. The burger was the perfect amount of messy and greasy to make the cheat meal worth it. The fries were well seasoned and the crispy on the outside while still fluffy on the inside.

This location is small with no indoor seating at all and only two small tables outside where you can stand to eat so I would recommend planning on taking your food to a nearby park to enjoy it. The service was pretty good, they took our orders quickly and had the food out to us within 5 minutes.

If I am in the area and have a burger on my mind, I would definitely stop in again to grab one of these delicious burgers.

Oh, let me tell you about my delightful experience at 7th Street Burger East Village! This place is a true gem, offering not only mouthwatering food but also a cozy spot to unwind after a long stroll around the intriguing Museum of the American Gangster. Trust me, it's the perfect spot to refuel and recharge.

Now, let's talk about the food. As soon as I entered the restaurant, the tantalizing scent of the grill wafted through the air, beckoning me like a siren. I couldn't resist its charm, and I found myself channeling my inner Jughead from the Archie comic books, surrendering to the temptation of burgers and fries. Who could blame me?

Dominique, my gracious host, seemed to understand my weakness for irresistible flavors. With a mischievous smile, she suggested, "Let me order you an awesome burger and fries." And boy, am I glad she did! Every bite was a revelation; I felt like I had discovered the secret to eternal happiness in the form of a perfectly cooked double cheeseburger. The beef patties were juicy and flavorful, the cheese melted to perfection, and the crispy fries were an addictive delight.

Curiosity got the best of me, and I couldn't resist peering into the kitchen. Lo and behold, I was greeted by a team of cooks who seemed like culinary angels, diligently crafting what can only be described as God's Burgers. I swear, I even caught a glimpse of wings sprouting from one of them! It was a heavenly sight, and I knew in that moment that I would be coming back for more.

But here's the best part: 7th Street Burger East Village understands that life can get busy, and sometimes you just want to enjoy their delectable creations in the comfort of your own home. That's right, they offer takeaway options, so you can savor their culinary marvels wherever you please.

Now, let's not forget about the ambiance. The restaurant boasts a quiet atmosphere that has been praised by many visitors. It's the kind of place where you can unwind, catch up with friends, and savor every delectable bite without distractions. It's a haven for burger enthusiasts and food lovers alike.

So, despite being on a diet and knowing I shouldn't indulge in burgers and fries, the allure of 7th Street Burger East Village was simply too strong to resist. And let me tell you, it was worth every glorious, guilt-inducing moment. So go ahead, unleash your inner Jughead and treat yourself to a burger experience that will leave you craving more. You won't regret it!

BEST burger in NYC! try the vegan one and you won't be disappointed! the burgers are so fresh with lots of customization options

the cheese melts in your mouth with the onions and patty! the smashed patty truly is an experience you must try!

location is super small but new and they are more for takeout vibes so if you're working in the area, it's a good spot to stop by

Also the fries are AMAZINgggg probably my favorite EVER

Small shop but a great place to get a quick bite.  The burgers we juicy and  tasty.  The fries are crisp and firm.  The loaded fries were amazing!!! Love the toppings and sauce! You can add a burger on your fries too! They have bottled coke and sprite!  There were no tables in the store but they did have a few tables outside on the street. The only disappointment was that they did not get my order right. My burger turned out to not be a double cheeseburger.  One of the loaded fried turned out to be plain. . Hoping the next time it will be correct.  Willing to try this place again

The food at 7th Street Burger is delicious!  I ordered  the double cheeseburger and loaded chopped beef fries, they were both very tasty and cooked well. I really loved the loaded fries, usually there's not enough toppings for the fries, but this has the perfect amount and was very filling!

great spot for a quick burger & fries ..
very simple menu options
Boyf really likes their burgers.. the fries are good but they won't make them extra crunchy which is my only critique..
get Their spicy Sauce, it is So good !! the ghost sauce I believe !!

Out of all the locations this place makes the best burger! Meat is hanging over them buns, so gooddd. The loaded fries were also so fresh that they stayed crispy under the heaping pile of toppings. I'm a weirdo though and enjoy soggy fries (when and only when they have toppings lol). As always it you gotta get creative on where to eat if you don't plan on going home but we made it work!
7th street burger is a great place for a casual bite! High quality burger for a fast-food atmosphere and delicious french fries!

This is a great location to open up a 7th Street Burger! Very close to the high line and other great outdoor places to take the food to eat. 7th Street is always a reliable go to for burgers and fries. You won't be disappointed, their sauce is what really makes it stand out from other burger places.

I came to the 7th Street Burger in Chelsea for the Yelp Elite event last week. It was a little intimate spot where you can order your food to go. There is one table outside where you can eat. Food wise, they offered us free burgers, fries, and drinks for ourselves and a guest. The burger was flatter than I expected LOL but not sure if that's because it got smushed in transit. I also ordered a single. It was still pretty yummy though. The cashier was also super kind and understanding and even gave us some extra coupons for free burgers!

Cheeseburger & Soda. GOOD. I've eaten at a few SmashBurger places and I'd probably suggest someone try 7TH STREET BURGERS first 'cause they have 8 locations in NYC now. Opted for a single Patty today and spent the extra $3 on a MEXICAN COKE. Couldn't tell the difference. The Cheeseburger was more than satisfactory. RECOMMEND.

They've been quickly branching out. This new location is tight no seatings both inside and out. It's an order and go! Got a double cheese burger, loaded fries and regular fries. Food came out quick. Burger was hot and juicy. Fries were crunchy. Also got two Mexican coke. Everything is better when you wipe it down with a good glass of coke !

Got the chance to try the double cheeseburger and loaded fries and it lived up to the hype. The smash patties were crispy on the edges and tender in the middle, and they paired well with the onions and soft bun. The loaded fries were also good, super crispy and hot so they were definitely made fresh. Customer service was friendly and they got our order out fast.

Amazing smash burger! I forgot to take a picture but it was super flavorful and one of the better fast burgers in the city! I would also order the loaded fries, the spicy rendition isn't too spicy and really hits the spot. There isn't much seating at this location (two tables outside the shop to stand at) but it is right next to a subway line

The fast-service no thrills burger here is great. It's a classic smash burger that has a nice char on it. Comes with onion, pickles, sauce and cheese. Eating it hot and fresh is a must.

The fries here are also well-seasoned. They are a little bigger and thicker and remind me of five guys which I think is a good thing. The menu is pretty much just burgers and fries, and that's all they need.

There really isn't any seating at this location so be prepared to take your food to go or eat outside at a standing table.

Nothing at all has changed. Consistent great burgers, loaded fries and drinks from 7th street. I went in today around 1pm, there were 2 people ahead of me but the line moves very fast . As most 7th Street burger joints, they are small inside but the flavors of their food is always big. The establishment was very clean and smelled delicious. I got 2 double cheeseburgers 2 loaded fries and 2 Cokes and of course course tipped my good sis DOMINIQUE $10. I want to say a big thank you to Dominique for making me feel welcomed and warm. It was so good talking to her as I waited for my food. To see her as the face of the business as soon as you walk in is a plus for the establishment being her great personality and customer service. I will definitely come back and visit whenever it's a cheat day for me . Thank you 7th Street burger for always showing up for the community.

If you thought Shake Shack made the greasiest burgers, well now there's a new contender in town!  And in case it wasn't clear, it was 100% worth it and delicious.  The double cheeseburger featured two perfectly cooked patties covered in melted cheese.  The fries were so crispy that I thought I was eating potato chips the entire time.  One thing to keep in mind about this Chelsea location is that there's no indoor seating, so be sure to think about your eating location in advance (there's a standing table just outside).  Overall, the service was incredibly friendly and efficient, and I'll definitely be back to one of the many locations across the city for my next burger fix!

Came here for the first time after a buddy of mine recommended it. This location is new and seems to be slightly smaller with a reduced menu than the other locations.

Still, we came for the burger and did not leave disappointed. The cheeseburgers are legit - I love cheeseburgers and normally am not a fan of onions on them, but love the combination for these. Their special sauce reminds me of In-n-Out's.

French fries are delish - perfect combination of crispy and tender on the inside. Love that they stock Coke and Sprite's with natural sugar too, although I do hope they bring the banana pudding to this location. You are only a few blocks away from the park so grab your burger and go enjoy it in the park!

Definitely the best classic burger in NYC! Both the cheese and impossible burgers taste great but they're on the smaller side so I would recommend getting 2 if you're super hungry.

As a heads up, the Chelsea location doesn't have seating but other locations usually do.

The burgers are flavorful and delicious.  My bf and I went for impossible burgers  and they didn't miss a beat. He had a double impossible burger and I, a single, with loaded fries. Their secret sauce was made to be served on those buns. We will definitely come back for more and may even invite the kiddo next time, lol.
7th Street Burger is my favorite burger chain in the city and I'm glad they opened up another one in Chelsea! Service was v quick after ordering. Get their loaded fries - it's a must try!

Place is small and not a dine-in location. I've had 7th street burger and been underwhelmed each time. I decided to try their loaded fries. It costs about $11, which is around the price of a burger and fries. The loaded fries are a chopped burger mixed in with fries, covered in onions, and slathered in cheese and House sauce. To my surprise it was actually good. Way better then their burgers. The loaded fries redeemed 7th St Burger for me. I do wish it was bigger though.

This burger doesn't disappoint and always hits the spot for me. Just another locaation serving up solid burgers. Service is solid, and the space is kind of small, but you can just take these and eat down the street

What a joke; I've been hearing about this place on social media platforms for quite some time now and expected a good burger at the very least. This is the most mundane, blah burger possible. Compared to Shake Shack, Five Guys and even Wendy's it doesn't hold a candle. Total waste of $7! Hyped beyond belief . So sad how people rave about inferior food.
I am really happy this place is nearby. I get the Impossible burger which is delicious . The toppings are great. Love the fries as well Service is friendly and super fast.
my favorite burger spot just moved up the block!! their loaded fries off the menu are soo good

I took my son to this new location for 8 bit bites in Chelsea.  It is a small space  with several tables with old school games.   I loved the disco floor.

For food, we ordered from the kiosk, which had the secret menu.  Think cheat codes from different old school games you play, and you will find it.   We got churro from the secret menu, which is changed monthly.
From the regular menu, my son had a smashburger with bacon and cheese, which he readily ate. I had the Nashville chicken sandwich, which had the perfect coating of sauce covering it.   I ordered it with tater tots covered in cheese sauce. Next time, i would forgo the cheese sauce, which makes the excellent crispy tater tots soggy and has little flavor.

For games, we played Sonic the hedgehog, and my son learned how to hold a controller.

Service is great as the food was served pretty quick and hot.  I would go again with my son.

Tips: Even though it is small, they do have a bathoom.  Ask the front for help starting the game as the qr instructions are not very helpful.

The food was delicious! The portion size of the loaded fries was perfect for two people. Everything was seasoned really well. Luis (cashier/waiter), was very helpful and accommodating being that it was our first time. The location is new so it very clean & kid friendly. We will definitely be back

This place is full of great vibes as soon as u step in the doorway. Great music, great food, you could play sega, Nintendo, Atari etc games as u wait for your food or while eating. The service was fast. Didn't wait long for the food. And the workers there are very nice and very attentive! I had chicken strips mild and delicious. Their bbq sauce reminded me of a Korean flavor but delicious. Tartar tots a plus, i had seasoning in mine and there is an option if u don't want seasoning. I was playing Tertris 1988 version while vibing to kriss kross great vibes.

I have a love for "cart falafel", and this is by far the best I have had. After trying falafel combo platters from 5 different carts in the fashion district on my lunch breaks... This guy takes the cake!

I stopped here on my way to penn for my commute home... freezing my butt off and freaking hungry after missing my lunch break. Not only did he make the falafel right then and there (SO FRESH & DELISH), but you also get a choice between spicy or regular rice (SPICY PLEASE :]). Add some white and hot sauce and presto! The best $5 bucks you will spend on lunch (in this case dinner) in the city...

I usually go to a different halal cart on 8 avenue when I volunteer in the area and want lunch. However I got out of the subway at 7 avenue and 33 and I saw this cart. I decided to give it a try. I ordered a falafel on pita. The owner asked if I wanted any sauce. I asked for the White sauce and a bit of hot sauce.

The falafel came automatically with iceberg lettuce &tomato.

When I got to my volunteer location I was able to eat. The falafel was flavorful and didn't crumble. The vegetables were fresh. The pita was warm and soft.

Quality halal on my go-to work corner. Not sure how long this guy will be there due to the high truck turnover, but he offers spicy rice (+ points) and is very flexible with throwing in some falafel into my meat platters. Nice guy, good prices (guy across the street rips off tourists by charging $1-2 more for the same product). Check him out.

Located directly across the street to the hotel we stayed at.  We got in really late and was starving.  Decided to try their chicken over rice.  

Again, not the Halal Guys but it was definitely good.  What I really liked about this spot is they give you A LOT!!!!  Portions are huge and heavy...for $7.

They offer the Plantega menu here. All the Plantega "meat" is vegan or vegetarian so there are a ton of tempting options.

I ended up ordering the spicy chicken wrap with vegan mayo. It was a bit soggy and the mayo leaked into the delivery bag. Still, it was tasty. The chicken had nice firm texture and paired well with all the ingredients. It wasn't super spicy though.

I also got the bacon cheesy fries. Both the bacon and vegan cheese were very salty and the fries were not crisp or seasoned so I probably wouldn't order this again. The bacon did have a unique, crunchy-meets-chewy texture so it is worth giving that a try.

Looking forward to trying other menu items.

They have the vegan plantega menu here! They seemed to have raised the prices slightly but still a bargain! This place gets busy at lunch time! Also i like to watch them make the sandwich because i saw someone accidentally use the real mayo not the vegan one but we're all human. He remade it for me.

Ordered the prosciutto and Genoa salami combo sandwich in a spinach wrap from here today. It was $12.24 which I thought was pricey for a wrap.
They charge $1.25 more for the wrap.
I received a phone call from the guy at the store letting me know they don't have spinach wraps. I said oh a regular wrap is fine then. I didn't want the whole wheat but I don't want bread more. Why have it as an option if you don't stock it?
The prosciutto and mozzarella was not great quality, nor the salami. It was okay though. Also had tomatoes.
The lettuce was wilted in certain spots. I pulled it from the sandwich and it tasted better after that. It also had mayo on it, which I didn't know. Not needed.
The wrap was a decent size and weight for the price. Delivery was on time and I'm happy it was packed neat and included napkins. But I won't be reordering. Not worth it for me personally.

Good place I always go here for my stuff wish they had a lot more healthier options lots of processed meat and processed sandwiches the brownies is okay and the cinnamon roll is okay as well this is a good place to go to and they open 24 hours which is amazing this is how it should be
Can't tell you how happy I was to walk into a deli at 3 am and find an entire vegan menu- from burgers to breakfast sandwiches. Saving this place for the future!

I have lived in the neighborhood for over 30 years.   I have had a love hate relationship with this deli.  For years they always changed their prices.  The excuse is prices go up and down.  But this has been going on for years.   I don't know if they know who to do it to.  But this morning I had enough.   I order the same things for three days in a row.   One morning the girl charged me 5 dollars for an egg and cheese.   I didn't think nothing of it.  Second day I was charged 4.00.  Third day.   I saw 3.50 then a totally different guy said I need to charge 50 cent for butter.   I was like you know what.  You just lost a lot of business.   I have always bought beer, sandwiches, and cigarettes when I need them.  Such a shame.  Now whenever I see people go in there I shall say Buyer beware.  Today we don't need people trying to get over.   Who knows how many people they change prices for to put an extra couple cents in they pocket.  To the owner of this deli.   U should put prices on ur items.   Also put it on the menu how much an extra item would be on a sandwich.  Even if it is butter.

Was staying with a friend who lives in this neighborhood and I woke up with a craving for a bacon, egg, and cheese. What better place to go than BEC (Bacon, Egg, and Cheese, just one block up from this shop). As we were walking there, we passed this place and I decided I was way too hungry to wait another block for my breakfast sandwich. I ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel and it was $4! Absolutely delicious and ready in minutes. I probably saved myself some time and several bucks (apparently the same sandwich is $11 at BEC from some light Yelp research), so I recommend this spot.

I specifically ordered orange pineapple orange juice with banana pancakes the store clerk who answered the phone at the store SATURDAY MORNING 4/18  at 10:44AM said the order did not come across as banana pancakes. Only plain. I don't understand how that is true therefore I will be requested a full refund because the orange juice pineapple was not available they did not even called to ask me a plain orange juice would be OK this is unprofessional and horrible service. I told the clerk I would be calling delivery.com and he said do whatever you want to do and hung up on me.

At your own risk!! save your self the trouble and "go elsewhere" (as the manager/owner suggested) not my words but his.

Walked in for a sandwich on a Wednesday @ 4PM, simple Tuna Melt.  Ordered and come to find out they ONLY have Lettuce, Tomato, Onions.. ONLY!! (they offer salads too, with only those 3 ingredients too)

Order the sandwich, not happy that I didn't get to pick what I wanted in terms of veggies, come to the register to pay.. find out it's $7.50 for a tuna melt on a roll.. so I ask $7.50? the man behind the counter starts listing cheese, lettuce, onions, tomato, yes it cost $7.50.. so I say "i'm not coming here anymore"

The manager/owner was behind me, he says under his breath (that's fine, go somewhere else)..

As I'm paying for the food, I ask, any soda/water comes with it, at that point the manager/owner proceeds to get behind the counter and behind the register and ask me how much do I pay elsewhere.. So I tell him, I pay $7 at Square Deli for a Roll, $8.xx for Hero with tuna, spinach, cheese, and other premium veggies, bag of chips, and a bottle of water... so he tells me to go there then and not come here... to which I will respect his wishes and never to enter again.. Thank you sir..  

I've had a similar incident in the past at this deli during Breakfast.  Starbucks prices for iced coffee, might as well go to starbuck and get yourself better coffee.

Another time during lunch/dinner

Gave it many chances but falls short each time..

Bottom line, deli will have it's regulars, some will love it, some will like it, some will hate it.. I fall on the latter from my many previous experiences.

My business is not appreciated, neither do I appreciate their business conduct.  I will leave it at that.  Good Luck sir...

UPDATE/EDIT: The lettuce was rotten (reasons why I don't get lettuce + it has no nutritional value) lesson from this is never get veggies you cannot see.  Too much is entrusted in the hands of others this is how people get sick.  Never again will I visit nor will suggest anyone else to visit this place.

I want to start this review by saying I'm not even done with my sandwich yet.  I have devoured half of a sub with the other half on my desk while I type this...17th Street Gourmet is the closest deli to my job.  It's a rainy day and I don't feel like walking far to get food and wasn't up to Just Salad (they're next door).  

I came in here and it's a small little deli, but what a variety of sandwich combos they offer.  I ordered a "Rambo" off the menu - a lemon herbed chicken breast, bacon, lettuce, tomato and honey mustard on a sub roll.  The chicken breast is huge and the man behind the counter heated it and sliced it and arranged a beautiful sandwich.  This monster was only $7. That's right, you can get a great sandwich for a dirt cheap price.  The chicken has the most amazing flavor to it, I can really taste the lemon and combined with the other flavors is knocking it out of the park.

17th Street is a total gold-medal winner.

**EDIT** So I just noticed the sign over the door says 8 Ave. Gourmet Deli....

Went here to grab a bite to eat for lunch on my way home from work. After perusing the menu, I decided to go with a reuben wrap.

While the wrap was a good size, it definitely did not have a lot to offer flavor-wise, but was decent enough.

Nonetheless, service was friendly and food came out quickly and was priced well.
Possibly the best slice of cheesecake I've had in the city....I'll return for another slice SOON!
Friendly staff great food. Fast and better then the deli across the st from it that sells old $1 slice
Solid sandwiches, really nice people, and they deliver almost every hour of the week. What else could you need from a NYC deli?

If you want breakfast at a deli come here.

The pros:

-Cheap
-Fast
-Optionally Healthy

I get (six eggs + avocado) on whole wheat bagel w/ coffee for $8.50 which, though expensive, is a good deal for anywhere and more so for NYC.

They have great options like Turkey Bacon (if you are into the health stuff). This probably is not the best place for craft beer etc... because it is small but I will definitely vouch for the simple, fast, healthy am.
Bought 6 pack of beer and 3 out of 6 were different kind of beer. Maybe if 1 was wrong, then it's understandable but half?! That's just insane. Why not just sell beer by bottle then.
Probably the worst Italian sandwich I've eaten in my life super thick cut meat... With outside plastic still on it crappy cold bread ugh... The worst

Breakfast is best value on the block! Forget a processed bagel from nearby places. Have a fresh, fast, and cooked to perfection breakfast hero made your way. Deli has massive selection for space and great prices on everything.

Great slice! Quick, easy and tasty. Crust had a little crunch and no soggy heat lamp. And if it's late enough, who cares? It good and cheap. Pizza across the country is different depending on region, but nothing beats a NY slice.

It gets the job done! If you're craving a late night slice for $1.50 after tax... this is the spot! They have a huge menu, but they only serve what they have sitting out. During busy nights, they'll have a piping hot cheese pizza come out every 10 minutes. A slice isn't too cheesy and the crust is not bad. They give generously big sized slices!

This place needs to get their air conditioner fixed. OH MY GOD! It was burning hot inside. Combined with the humidity of the NYC summer, this was no bueno.

Best place to go on a drunken night to soak up your liquor with a bomb slice of your favorite topping or just plain ole cheese!
Been coming here for quite a few years after partying downtown. Can't miss the spot. It's on a corner and it's usually packed with people for good reason! Enjoy!

$1 a slice for a cheese pizza, yes please!
The line is always long but with the price, the price, that is expected.

You can get other stuff too. However, my husband wanted a pepperoni slice and there wasn't any. That was it, they didn't offer to make some or have him wait.

We spent under $5 for our four slices, pretty worth it.

Among the many businesses that call themselves $1 slice or 99 cents slice, 2 Bros still reigns king over them all. I've personally tested this out through its many locations.

This location is probably second best compared to their East Village location. This location also closes earlier than their East Village location. But both are solid places to grab that $1 slice of pizza.

For someone like me that eats $1 slices of pizza, one is never enough. Because when inflation is high and when many places close earlier and earlier in the night post pandemic. Your options for filling your tummy with food becomes more limited during the late night hours on the weekdays and weekends.

The savor and the brilliance of the dollar slice is that yes, you aren't getting the best pizza slice perhaps. No amount of toppings can help that (toppings cost extra at your own discretion). But for a good sauce, cheese and bread ratio that will tide you over until the morning or early afternoon, this really can't be beaten as an option. Short of having instant noodles/cup noodles at your house that you'll still have to boil water for.

Be wary that these two areas do tend to have more suspicious characters in terms of patrons often times than not. So I would suggest taking the pizza on the go and eating it.

FAN.

I was never sold on nyc pizza but 2 Bros Pizza was a pleasant surprise that might make me reconsider. I stopped by on a Saturday around noon and settled for a slice of pepperoni. Honestly didn't have high expectations to begin with because I've had my fair share of indifference for nyc pizza but wow, it shocked me how satisfied I was. What sold me was their dough. The pizza itself had a solid amount of dough that made each bite have a fluffy component. When I got to the crust, the dough stole the show because of its perfect ratio of fluff and crisp. Not only that, the pizza was not oily at all! A TRUE SHOCK.

Price point wise, you obviously can't complain because the slice was only $2. I went to go run some errands and the crust was living rent free in my head so I went back for the cheese slice and was not disappointed. I don't even like cheese pizza like that but the dough reeled me in. For $1 cheese slice, an even bigger steal! They have other pizzas as well if you were in the mood for more substance ($2-4 price range) Overall, if you want a reliable slice of nyc pizza, 2 Bros Pizza is it.
Good for what it is! $1.50 for the cheese. Bit thicker crust than a typical NY slice but it was good for a quick bite while in the neighborhood.

Pros
Clean location
Nicest location of all the Bros Pizza
Slice starts at $ 1.50

Cons
Mediocre pizza
Stopped in for a quick slice on a rainy morning. Pepperoni, Sausage and black olive pizza was delicious!!!  Fresh from the oven.

Definitely not dollar pizza worthy.  There are better spots with a taster dollar slice than this place .

I stopped in sat for a quick bite and got 2 slices.  Slices are hot and fresh, it's a busy location.

For me the cheese and sauce was off.  I don't know how to describe the taste , it was not something I have had previously.

It's a popular spot, but I won't go out of my way for it .

As the kids say today...'mid'. It describes 2 Bros to a tee. On the positive side $1.50 per slice and $3.99 for 2 slices and a soda is a pretty good deal especially these days. But, I guess you get what you pay for b/c the 2 Bros slice isn't up to par with many other NYC pizza slices. The dough is just too doughy and you don't get the nice crispy crust that is the difference between a tasty slice and a mediocre one.  As my teenage son said...it tastes like pizza you get at a kids birthday party at chuck e cheese. Not quite that bad but you get the point...Oh well...many other options to try in the area.

I recently stumbled upon this place on my way back home, and I was due for a cheat meal.  :)  Here's my 3x3 review:

1) Cheese Pizza:
Of course, the litmus test of any pizza place must be the tried and true slice of cheese pizza.  Given the size and the quality, it's not a bad way to spend a few bucks if you're in the area and in the mood for pizza.  If the "top" is Joe's, then this is not far behind.  

2) Buffalo Chicken Pizza:
I love buffalo chicken anything; so this is the other part of my personal litmus test for quick pizza.  First of all, it passed the eye test: legit chunks of breaded chicken cutlets with a nice balance between buffalo sauce and cheese; there were definitely no suspiciously uniform white chicken squares to be found.  Out of the oven, the breaded chicken and the pizza crust was a serious crunchiness combo.

3) Service:
Service here is quick, easy, and friendly.  Even if there is a long line, it actually did not feel like it because it's a well-oiled machine behind that counter; so don't let the sight of a long line deter you.  Shout out to the good group of guys serving good food.

Solid 4 stars!!

Super yummy! You can't go wrong with 2 bros in any of their locations! You get that typical New York pizza fast and hot! It's cheesy and the crust is chewy.
The pepperoni pizza is $2. Only the cheese pizza is $1

No frills pizza pace, perfect for a couple late night slices after an evening out. The plain slice is a reliable standard, the spinach ricotta slice is good too. The staff are friendly and are happy to reheat the slices to your liking.

pizza itself was delicious, but the signs were very misleading

the "$1.50/slice & $3.99 2 slice+drink" only applies to the basic cheese pizza.

1. none of their signs noted that. its very misleading. no asterisks to say conditions apply or select slices only.

2. the fact that we said we wanted to do the $3.99 2 slice+drink deal, they didnt mention to us either that its only cheese pizzas for that deal.

drinks are not cold.

we were not pleased w.the dishonesty.

Solid $1 pizza cheese slice. Stopped by after work. Had friends eat here. Took all of 10 seconds to say my order, pay, and get it. Nice and hot. Condiments like cheese and red chili peppers made it all the better. Walked away in a blink of an eye. Solid!

Fast service. Slaps when drunk, mid when sober. Stop by if you're fucked up. Food is fast and cheap. It's not bad but I can get better elsewhere. 2.75 for a drink and slice of cheese pizza. 3.5/5.0 star experience.

I can easily say that this pizza tastes much better than any pizza you can ever have in California.  However in comparison with some other spots in NY, the place is average.  
Their pizza didn't stand out than the other $1 around in the area but I can tell you that they are very generous with their cheese.  It's also on the pricer side in comparison.
Great pizza! Worth $1 for cheese. Service is a little slow but you get what you pay for... decent place!

2 Bros Pizza is a local chain of dollar pizza places, located on the corner of 25th St and Sixth Avenue. the space is smallish but relatively clean given the amount Tor foot traffic. there are a variety of pies and slices on display. there are tables to stand at and some seats outside. this is very much a grab-n-go.

stopped by here for a quick bite as i was running errands in Chelsea and 2 Bros is perfect for fast eats. the dollar slices are good for dollar slices in NYC but compared to regular slice joints...the pizza is fairly average. the slices have medium-ish soft crusts, the sauce is a bit sweet, and the cheese is a melty blanket. again, the pizza is quite average but solid for when you need calories in a saucy, carb-y, and cheesy package.

staff moves fast and cool.

drops mic cuz all pizza aren't created equal
i out
zzz

Dollar slices open late, and you get exactly what you paid for. It's honestly pretty tasty and the crust was perfectly crisp. The slices are huge and honestly one was pretty filling.

I would say the cheese slice is the best -- the additional toppings aren't worth IMO but they're not bad either.

2 Bros is probably still one of my favorite dollar pizza options in the city. For a minute I think they switched to $1.50 but I noticed after I came back to Chelsea slightly inebriated after a 3 year-old's birthday that they changed the prices back to $1. That's right, folks. It's still just a dollar for a cheese slice and I was like hey - maybe I should get one because it's only Wednesday. At least, it was a dollar that night and for now. Hoping it doesn't change. It was delicious and tasty as hell as usual. I panicked for a moment because these two girls in line ahead of me ordered 5 slices to go and that took the remainder of the entire pie and I was thinking to myself 'you fat asses couldn't just save me 1 measly slice, and now I'm going to have to wait 15 minutes for another pie to cook up'. Nope! They had shelves of steaming hot pies on these heating trays behind the counter. They know. Fresh pie cut up just for me. It was a wonderful moment.

So your in NYC, it's late and of course your hungry. What is there to eat? Whatever is in the little commesary at the hotel? Perhaps the bar (if your hotel is a little more better equipped. The last mint in your pocket? No.

There lives a great tradition here in the Big Apple. The late night slice of pizza. Right around the corner from my hotel was this place.

I saw a bunch of people coming and going and it was quite late. In the middle of the buzzle was a crew of Hispanic men, making pizza fresh and right on the spot.

It was fantastic. Not too expensive and you feel like a life long New Yorker. Grab a slice or grab the whole pie. Park your derriere on the curb or trek back to the hotel, either way you won't regret it.

2 Bros. Pizza is definitely one of the best pizza slices I've had in NYC! Incredibly fast service for a busy Saturday night! The pepperoni and sausage pizza slice was delicious! If you're near one, this is a MUST!
Average pizza in NYC, but when you arrive late at night and hungry this is what you end up with pizza!

Decided to try this pizza shop since it was walking distance from our hotel with no wait. We got two slices of their supreme pizza for $8 total. It was packed with toppings and made a quick bite. Our pizza was hot and fresh! They had lots of different options too. NYC pizza hits different!

This is a great spot to come if it's the middle of the night and it's right down the block from you. Pizza with ricotta worked out to 5 bucks a slice and it is super filling, but overall the pizza here is average compared to other local spots. Wouldn't go out of my way to come back with as many options as Manhattan has.

Tried there 1.50 slice of cheese...horrible..the dough taste like rubber..sauce and cheese had literally no taste...if u think buying really cheap bad pizza is a deal...send me your money and not waste time eating this stuff..grew up in queens and went to school near this place...this is as far away from true thin nyc pizza...sorry 2 bros but..it's bad..

Not the best dollar pizza granted I haven't tried dollar pizza in so long. If they skimped any less on sauce it would be cheesy bread. Cheese was mediocre as well. Definitely not the best New York has to offer.

Ahhh 2 Bros. Dollar slices of plain cheese pizza were my go-to when I was broke and in school. Decided to get a slice of white pizza for $3 since I'm rich now and it didn't disappoint! Much better than a more expensive slice of white pizza I had at another NY institution. My partner loves the BBQ chicken pizza here as well!
The cheese slice was really good, they still have the promo of 2 cheese slices and a soda for 2.99 which it's a price you won't be getting anywhere else in New York

Perfectly acceptable slice of pizza - nothing awesome, but nothing to complain about either.  Just your typical NYC slice of pie.  Numerous toppings are available, so you won't be disappointed on that front.   Would I go out of my way to get pizza here ... definitely not.  But if you need a quick bite and are in the neighborhood, you can grab a slice here with confidence.
Great every time we come to NY.  It's always hot and fresh.   Several options for pizza.
This pizza is trash. They're lazy and won't heat it up if you let them. It's overpriced and there's better options. Check out Rosas down the street
The $1 cheese pizza slice? I mean, you can't go wrong with that. Add a little red pepper flakes and some grated cheese and it's  enough said.

For $3, the Mr & I feasted on 2 huge slices & a soda & this was *much* more satisfying than the $135 we'd just left......lots of toppings combo from which to choose & they were baking up fresh pies as we walked in.

Can't go wrong here!

2 stars for 2 Bros.

I like that it's open late and the interior is more ventilated being on the corner with walls open.

however, not a fan compared to other 99 cent pizza places. the crust was nice and crunchy, not soft so I like that.

we got two slices, with one ordered later after deciding on what they wanted. however, both slices came out at the same time. so one was piping hot while the other was lukewarm. I would have preferred to have both be hot after waiting rather than be served lukewarm food.

pepperoni slice was good but bbq chicken has not enough sauce or chicken.

Look the pizza here is OK (its definitely edible) but its literally $1 a slice (tax) and the slice size is rather large vs other places. This branch of 2 Bros is in-line with other branches.
