Kudos to this branch for putting out decent tables on the street during COVID for outdoor dining. Note the restaurant is a busy corner in Chelsea where a lot of homeless and drug addicts loom, so you will likely be pan handled.

I like that it's nice, clean, and spacious in here and there's a fair amount of outdoor seating right outside the store. And they accept credit cards!

But the crust is overly doughy, the sauce is bland, and the slices are actually overly greasy and cheesy (coming from somebody who likes cheese). They can be surprisingly heavy, which can be good or bad, depending on what you're looking for out of your 99 cent pizza.

It's quick and cheap pizza, but you're definitely not paying for quality here. Worth a stop if you're hungry, otherwise try out some other 99 cent pizza place.

Solid for $1.50/slice of plain cheese pizza. Can't go wrong with NY pizza, but it's really not bad here as the crust is thin and crispy. Since the plain cheese is so popular with this pricing, they always have some hot and ready.

CHELSEA, NEW YORK, NY 03/29/19 DINNER

+2.99 two slices of pizza and a soda deal.
+Super cheap meals to grab while on the go/move.
+Late-night goodness after a long day of exploring the Big Apple.
+The sauce is light, tangy, and delicioso!

Popular spot in the neighborhood for a quick bite. Tried the cheese and the Spinach-cheese pizzas. They were alright. The guy at the front was a little weird though. He was on the phone/earphones. Wasn't really clear who he's talking to. But yeah, pizza was alright.

Decent place. Tables and chairs on the left if you need to chill for a bit.

Always a good place to go for $1 pizza. Since it is so close to my work, this is the spot I go to when I forget to pack lunch and don't feel like spending $15 on food around the area.

If you ask for them to heat up your slice, the pizza is extra crispy and delicious. I love the pizza and I feel like the slices are comparable in taste to other pizza spots like it.

There are a few standing tables in the front and a few benches in the back to sit. Don't expect to come here to enjoy a lovely meal. This is a spot to grab something cheap and fast.
I personally prefer the cheese slice over joes and it being cheaper is just another plus plus!!
The ordering process and pick up was easy and the staff was friendly. The pizza was meh. Edible but I wouldn't eat there again

For cheap, late night, New York pizza, this place is just fine. The "come on" signs out front tout $1 slices and yes, technically they do have $1 slices (but they are pathetic plain cheese slices with hardly any cheese on top). Go ahead and shell out an extra buck for some pepperoni and sausage.

This is by no means gourmet pizza, but it will hit the spot if you need a snack in the wee hours of the morning. We stopped by around midnight after a very late movie. The pizza on offer was fresh enough, and the guys working the counter will heat it up in the big ovens for you if you ask (this is how most NYC pizza is done -- it's pre-made and sitting out; you order and they pop your slice into the oven for a few minutes). There are a few tables where you stand and eat. It was really dirty but whatever, you can't be choosy when you're eating food this cheap.

There were lots of homeless people hanging around begging for money or food, so we bought a couple of the $1 slices for some guys out front. It's the least we could do.

Home of the dollaaaa slice!

Love 2 Bros Pizza for what it is. Nothing fancy, straight up, good plain pizza :)

I've tried their other slices with toppings (felt they were too heavy for the crust) and prefer to just stick with their plain pizza.

There's no seating but everyone typically stands at the high top tables and gobbles down their slices :)

Look, ya get what ya pay for. 4 stars here because price is incredibly fair for the food. Pizza to me didn't have a lot of flavor admittedly, but I only got two $1 slices of cheese so, I can't be mad. Great value, not the most flavorful, but perfect price per slice imo.

Tried this pizza late night and it was pretty valid. The crust was best part. It was perfectly crisp and had a slight, soft crunch. Despite not having a lot of sauce the pizza was still really good and worth the trip.

Whenever I am in Chelsea running an errand, I routinely swing by here for some dollar slices. It is not gourmand, it is not organic or whatever, but it's the simple pleasures of life that make it worth living, and sometimes all you want is 3 slices of carbs, tomato sauce, and cheese for a buck each. And this place delivers in that regard.

If you want to eat glatt kosher food in NYC for under $15 that's not a falafel joint and still have it taste good, you're shit out of luck. Each year we visit my husband's brother who keeps kosher and each year we get screwed. (Past restaurants that are abominations include Ben's Kosher Deli - worst knish ever, and Mr. Broadway - please no.)

But then this year my husband had the great idea to eat at the Google café. He works at the Mountain View Google headquarters, but that nice badge can get us into New York Google for free eats. Plus, we read online that they carry glatt kosher food. Score.

5 Boroughs Café is MUCH smaller than Hemispheres (the other Google café in the New York Google office) and has a smaller selection of food. Unfortunately 5 Boroughs is the only one that's open for dinner. It took us awhile to find the glatt kosher stuff, but when I did I excitedly ran back to our table to tell my brother in law who had started noshing on salad. They carry packaged meals from Abigael's, which is an expensive, well-reviewed glatt kosher restaurant. The Abigael's meals included a prime rib sandwich and an entire tray of cookies. There was a sign saying to not eat the Abigael's offerings unless you were actually keeping kosher. (Until I saw that I was tempted to take some.)

But enough about the food 5 Boroughs doesn't make in-house. Here's what I ate:

The good:
-Garlic mashed potatoes
-Couscous with raisins
-Salad with apple slices
-Orange cranberry nut cookies (REALLY good)

The bad:
-Turkey fricassee
-Spicy pineapple broccoli salad (this was a flavor combination that tasted as bad as it sounded)
-Rainbow sushi roll (fake crab - Mountain View uses the real stuff)

The mediocre:
-Grapes with walnuts and goat cheese
-Eggplant and green bean ratatouille
-Almond tea cakes with chocolate shavings

The inspiration for the 5 Boroughs décor is, duh, the 5 boroughs of New York. There are a few subway signs but nothing else décor-wise, which is unfortunate. The New York theme extends to the culinary offerings. They also carry Olde Brooklyn Soda - each bottle featuring a different Brooklyn landmark on the bottle. There was also a pickle bowl, like you'd find in a deli (but not the big glass barrel kind).

While you're at Google other things to check out:
-Google logo and Sergey & Larry's portraits made in Lego
-Ball pit
-GIANT ball you can lay across (take pictures like we did)
-Massage chairs
-Ping pong table
-Hemispheres Café balcony with great view of the city

My Google Restaurant Rankings (in Mountain View unless otherwise noted):
1) Pinxto
2) No Name Cafe
3) Hemispheres (New York)
4) Pure Ingredients Café
5) Big Table
6) Andale
7) Oasis
8) Cafe Moma
9) Slice
10) American Table
11) Plymouth Rock
12) Fourteen
13) Off the Grid
14) 5 BOROUGHS CAFÉ (NEW YORK)
15) Lunch Box
16) Charlie's (the main Google cafeteria)
Only for google ppl!!!'Spent my 30 mind to find and the security told me only for them!!!

33rd St And 7th Ave SW Halal Cart is just simply fantastic. The entire place certainly had a very cool vibe. Each and every single menu item that we have ordered was really fresh and flavorful. Service was great and everybody working here was very nice and helpful. A+ for 33rd St And 7th Ave SW Halal Cart.

Girlfriend was waiting for a bus to DC across the street and she wanted falafel. So, I run to the first halal stand I see, order a falafel sandwich, and hand the guy $10. He gives me back $2. "Sorry, I think you made a mistake, how much is this?" "Eight dollars." "Eight dollars?! For a falafel sandwich?!" "Yes."

Now, I've been to probably 20 different halal carts and they all sell falafel sandwiches for $4. I'd be OK with $4.50 for the Penn Station area, but double what everybody else charges? I only had a few seconds before my GF's bus left, so I didn't have to to tell him to f*** himself and get my money back. Also, she had a 5 hour bus ride ahead and no food. So, I took the sandwich back to the bus stop and guess what? No bus! She got on and they pulled away when I wasn't looking.

So, of course I had the pleasure of eating this $8 falafel sandwich. It was smaller than most, bland, and the white sauce tasted like mayo (I've never had bad white sauce...). Oh, and did I mention it was $8? I'm in the area often and I'll be sure to go to this stand frequently to show them my falafel sandwich from across the street (33rd and 7th NW Halal is MUCH better).

My go-to lunch spot for a sandwich esp. when I'm in a crunch.

In terms of value, you definitely get it here, especially since everything in this part of town is expensive. I always opt for the hero as it's significantly bigger and has more "stuff". As you go in, you might be daunted by the combinations of sandwiches here, but I've found my experiences with cold sandwiches better vs. hot. I consistently go for the C1 (chicken salad w/ bacon) option as it tastes fresh and could be split into 2 meals if you're not that hungry. Cost is less than $11. I've only gotten a breakfast sandwich here once, but don't think it's nearly as good.

Service-- you order by going to the end of the counter and usually someone is there to take your order. Just tell him the letter/number and what bread you want it on. Lunch rush hour may take a little longer, but if you come at off-times you won't have to wait too long (esp. for cold sandwiches). Overall, the process is pretty efficient.

No experience with the hot/salad bar in the back so can't comment, but overall good portion:cost ratio, esp. for its location.

I have to admit, 33 Gourmet Deli was certainly excellent. Good energy across the board. Every thing that we have purchased was incredibly fresh and tasty. All of the staff are extremely pleasant - you most certainly feel welcome and looked after. I 'd certainly return.

This deli is on the same block as my office and it's one of my favorite lunch spots around. Prices are extremely reasonable for the amount of food you eat and they have an extensive menu of both cold and hot sandwiches. For keto peeps out there, they will substitute bread/wrap for large leaves of romaine lettuce so you can eat your sandwich "protein style" and not worry about your carb count. They also have a self serve food bar, plenty of snacks and drinks, and they also serve breakfast sammies. This has quickly become a staple for me and I feel like there's 100% something for everyone here!

Average deli but also surprisingly affordable in mid-town.  I expected to pay $9-12 for a sandwich wrap but to my surprise it was only $6.  If you use credit card there is a $7 minimum.  They have sandwiches and a small buffet area.  They also have seating on a small second floor area toward the back of the store.

I would say this place is average and would come back.

I usually buy from this deli on mornings because it's close to my train, but this morning will be the last time I give this establishment anymore of my money. The incompetence of the Asian worker taking food orders (specifically breakfast on mornings) is unbelievable. I ordered a simple breakfast sandwich and he got my order wrong TWICE. Instead of apologizing, he decided to argue/cruse me out about the order. I was utterly disgusted and disappointed. Then he gave me a hard time about getting a refund. If you want quality customer service and your correct food order DO NOT COME TO THIS DELI. Save yourself the inconvenience and headache.
Thief's !! I gave a $20 they gave me change for 10!! I'm  reporting them to the better business bureau !

A great place to grab a quick bite (breakfast sandwiches are awesome and their lunch/dinner sandwiches are to die for!) outside of many offices and nearby MSG/Penn Station.

They recently renovated and it is exceptionally clean and bright!

The menu is fully customizable but they've got some great combinations, including sandwiches with grilled pineapple. Say no more, fam, I'm in Hawaii in my mind as I sink my teeth into this delicious sandwich.

A little pricey because of Midtown but well worth it!

I had to give this place another chance as work on the same block. So glad I did. For lunch they seemed to be much more organized. Still is a bit of a wait for sandwiches but much faster than breakfast. Not sure if it is different staff, or just more of it to make the whole process smoother.
I am a huge fan of the buffet. The salad bar portion and especially the fruit options are always plentiful and fresh. As for the hot items, they have a good selection of just proteins so adding something fun to your salad is always an option. I especially enjoy the grilled chicken and shrimp and broccoli. It's rare that this gluten free girl can get multiple hot items from a buffet, but I have plenty of choices to choose from. My colleges regularly get sandwiches enjoying the egg salad, and anything that has a chicken cutlet in it. Once they ordered the chicken teriyaki wrap with rice and got it again the next day because they enjoyed it so much.
They also have a ton of varieties of chips and snacks, and many of the options are gluten free. That always makes me happy! The location does smell like bacon, but seeing as this is Herald Square there are much worse things to smell like! Overall this place is clean and I am a fan.
What a nasty man this owner Kevin is. I would not by this food unless i was on the  diarrhea diet...Could never trust anyone with this type personality making my food...

I got hooked onto the vegetarian sandwich through mealpal and have had it quite a few times.  I actually usually love the sandwich itself.  Today I ordered it again and threw up within 15 minutes of eating it.  It was horrible I felt so sick.  Not sure what that is about.

My office is located right above the Manhattan Mall.  It is the epicenter of the culinary desert that is Midtown.  When it comes to nearby lunch options there isn't much.  33 Gourmet is really the only option if you don't want to walk a few blocks over.

It's a good, clean, no frills, deli.  Boars Head meat.  Fresh bread.  All the fixings.  Standard salad bar.

Also, it is affectionately known as Peep Show Deli around the office due to it's proximity to the Peep Shoe Adult Store.  Though juvenile, it does add a bit of charm to the place.
Ordered a chicken cutlet hero earlier today using Seamless for delivery.   Received a soggy bread hero.  Disgusting!  I will never order from this place again.

I used to like this place simply because it's fast and they make good turkey sandwiches.  However, the customer service is horrendous.  I had heard the rude girl that works there argue with patrons before, but I never thought I'd be on her venom list.  Today i decided not to purchase a very small container of fruit because i literally had 5 pieces of fruit and it came to $6.  So I decided to just purchase my sandwich instead.  The girl took it extremely personally.  Told me she'd have to throw it away, I'm wasting, how she didn't even want to sell me my sandwich now, and then to have a shitty day.  I have never been spoken to like that in my life! absolutely unprofessional and extremely uncalled for.  I told her I wouldn't be back. and she said they didn't want me back. Ha!! RUDE!

One of my go to delis in this part of town.  Been going there for over 11 years.  Counter service is great. The guys take care of you.  Honestly they make fantastic sandwiches and they don't skimp.  Great breakfast egg sammies too!   They just redid the place in the last year and it's so clean and looks great.

Went there at the recommendation of a co-worker. Ordered a Spicy chicken sandwich on the roll.  Waited 20 minutes and no sandwich.  Asked about my sandwich and the counter guys had no idea what happened to my order.  Wasted time and smell like old grease on my clothes.  There are better deli around
I've never been inside - just order through Seamless - but the food is delicious, portions are big, and prices are inexpensive. Delivery is quick, always even faster than expected

So I usually don't go this far west in the area, but I was meeting a friend and it was right there and more than anything it was the delicious looking breads that got me.

There were all these great looking loaves right there staring at me. I got the P6 (Turkey with fresh mozzarella, tomato, avocado and ranch dressing) and well....

1. Size - It was well portioned. More food than I needed. I wouldn't complain about a smaller sandwich for less $
2. Taste - was good. The only condiments on there was the ranch so it's what you'd expect
3. It didn't exactly go too well with the 2 block walk back to the office. It was a pressed sandwich so it was a bit juicy. Messy but not a deal-breaker.
4. Price - now here's the thing... it was $7.75 I think and came out to $8.17 all said and done. I gave the girl at the register $10.07 and I got $0.85 back. First of all, that's not right anyway, but when I asked her about the other $1 she looked so confused that I just left it alone.

It's crowded with all the foot-traffic in there but the people who go there seem to have their numbering system down and there's seating upstairs and that's all good and stuff.

Was my sandwich good? Yes
Was my sandwich $8.17 good? Maybe
Was my sandwich $9.22 good? No

But I'll give it credit for having a far better selection than other deli's in the neighborhood.

I'm torn about this place. It's close to my office and delivery is quick, but I had two very impressive experiences followed by a really awful one.

First two meals: The bibimbap here is actually good. A lot of these are odd in one way or another at various delis, but this is close to what you'd get at a cheap Korean or Japanese restaurant (in the city, anyway). From what I remember, the amount of chili paste they mix in is just right, but they'll give you more on the side in case it's not enough for you. A few weeks later, this was just as good.

Meal today: I ordered a DIY salad and tossed in a yogurt to hit the delivery minimum. The salad was disgusting. The tofu had a very strange chemical smell to it, and the beets were shredded and pickled. Why?! I was hungry, so I held my breath and ate half of the salad until I realized that food you have to eat in that way should not really been eaten. I don't usually throw out food, especially when I know I didn't pay a lot for it, but I just couldn't do it. So I opened my yogurt (they'd packed it in its own paper bag) -- only to find they sent the non-fat kind instead of the regular I'd ordered. I hate non-fat yogurt. It's always gross with that strong artificial sweetener taste.

Maybe the key here is to just avoid salads. Lunch should be actually edible and not make your stomach hurt... Or order well after the 12-1pm lunch rush, as I did today...

My go-to place for a salad when I don't bring lunch. Pretty standard Midtown deli. (By the lb salad bar, sandwiches, soups, beer).

My biggest gripe is the price. The SAME salad will be anywhere from $6-$8....

Huge menu of sandwiches, but again, carbs = the enemy.

The egg salad sandwich with bacon and pickles here is freaking delicious. My bus to DC leaves from here, and I get my dinner to go every time I make the trip. Seriously, the thought of one of these babies actually makes me look FORWARD to a BUS RIDE. I don't think there's another substance on the face of the earth capable of that.

Be warned though - the price moves way on up if you ask for any alterations or additions to their fixed options.  Little expensive, but worth it. The sandwich makers here know their stuff.

Spicy chicken!! Amazing.

The place is very organized and clean. Can not wait to go back and try out some more of their yummy combinations.

This deli is solid. They are my go-to for breakfast and the guys there remember my order. I can text ahead to save time waiting. The snack choices are a little on the high-end side, but they do have British candy which is pretty cool. Very efficient and tasty. I've never had food from the buffet, but I generally avoid buffets in most places.

My office isn't far from this place.  It's a Deli, sandwiches are good and of a decent size.  The place has a large board that has the listed sandwiches they offer, plus their buffet bar isn't bad looking either.  

The selections are pretty big and you can pretty much customize everything you want on your sandwich as they cook it for you right there.  For under 10 bucks, it's not bad.  

At best it's average and comparable to a lot of the other delis in the area.

DO NOT SHOP HERE! I paid with a $20 and they gave me change for a ten. I noticed right away and the woman behind the counter says "no you paid with 10!" I get my husband to verify that he handed me a $20 and then they say they have to check the tapes. The woman was VERY rude about it. So we miss our bus to the airport. I go back to check with the owner on his progress with the videotape. The owner comes out and is standing in the doorway (apparently no longer willing to check the tapes) and says "if you want them checked have the cops check them!" This place is ripping people off. There are a million other places to shop at in NYC, I would suggest you use one of them.

33 Gourmet is the best deli in Midtown. Unlike its competitors, the sandwiches are made fresh and not pre-prepared. The deli meat does not taste artificial like so many other deli spots in the area. The prices are cheap. They also have a large selection of beverages. 33 Gourmet Deli is a must-try lunch spot. Overall, I give 4 stars.

Great for the price. Breakfast is prepared if front of you, it's delicious and fast. The kitchen is clean. If you want lunch or dinner they have a small buffet at the back that its worth checking out.

This is my "go to" place for lunch, as my office is nearby. It's your standard, run-of-the-mill Korean deli. Buffet bar, with sandwiches up front. I really like their lo mein noodles. They have a good selection of sandwiches too. On par with Lenny's nearby.

The prices are okay. My one big gripe is their container of watermelon. $4 for not a huge amount. Kind of on the expensive side. Also, sometimes its a pain to fight through the Bolt Bus crowd outside, but it's not a huge deal.

I frequent this place for lunch and haven't been disappointed yet. To me and my coworkers it's "Stripper Deli" because of the Peep World next door.

They have a wide selection of quick order sandwiches or will make anything to order. They slice their meat to order and all toppings are fresh. Pretty cheap for midtown too. A long roll sandwich, chips, and a soda usually runs you about $10.

amazing customer service!! i come here during the work day once in a while. today they forgot to include prosciutto on my sandwich- when i came back to tell them, they immediately remembered me from earlier that morning and started making me a new sandwich (even though i was fine with them just plopping it on to my existing sandwich!) they are always super kind and helpful, and their food is great!

In a disappointing turn of events, after two and a half years of smiling and ordering mostly the same item from this place, I decided to switch things up and order a buffalo chicken sandwich. You, like, me... would assume this would be chunks of chicken, with buffalo sauce. I felt guilty ordering it. It's the type of meal you order every once in a while, knowing full well that you're going to be tasting that shit all day and breathing it all over co-workers in meetings. It arrived quickly, but my wrap was not filled with the mystery chunks of chicken and buffalo sauce I had been craving, it was filled with what looked like a turkey cold cut. Meh, honest mistake. Maybe I'll just eat it, it's prob good, I thought. Nah, I really want to taste that gross-ass buffalo chicken, I decided. And so I called to let them know there was a mistake and to ask if they could bring me the right one, no rush.

That's when this relationship took a turn. They insisted that I should have known to scroll further down to the wrap section and that by clicking on it in the sandwich section, I would get a buffalo chicken cold cut (who on this planet knows that monstrosity of a cold cut even exists?). I accepted defeat, especially since it was being handed to me with such "Absolutely no way we made a mistake" certainty.

Still craving that disgusting ass lingering taste in exchange for immediate satisfaction, I took another look at the Seamless menu. Nope, no where did it say that all items in the Classic Sandwich section are all cold cuts, in fact, there's actually a sandwich or two in addition to the Buffalo Sandwich that are not cold cuts. Unless there's a Chicken Cutlet cold cut (buyer beware).

I called back and this time reminded them that several of their wraps and sandwiches are not even listed on their Seamless menu. I let them know I order from them almost daily. They said they know. They know who I am. (Great!) They continued to get angry, refuse to acknowledge that their menu could be confusing and they also let me know that they can read English. Conversation over.

I called Seamless. They took a look at the menu. Agreed it was confusing. Agreed that the assumption that a person who orders a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich is expecting some Boars Head science project of a cold cut is absurd. Refunded my money. A nice, two-minute conversation.

A little customer service training guys, try it on.

This is my go-to spot in the morning. The workers know what they're doing, and now that they notice i'm a regular they don't even have to take my order to know what I want. The service is quick, the staff is friendly and although I can't say that I'm familiar with their lunch service/food, based on the menu which is both eclectic and vegan/vegetarian friendly, I'd say it's worth testing. Old reviews don't seem to be in line with how this place functions now, so I'd give it a first try or another shot if you've avoided it based on those reviews.

Anyone in the area that needs to get a good breakfast and be in and out quick and on their way to work, this is the place to be.

They work in synchrony, it's actually pretty cool to watch the process, from order to finish.

Enjoy.

Ordered a ham and cheese hero and not only was it delicious, it was humongous!!  Service was fast. Good selection of chips and other snacks.  Great place and pretty good prices considering where you are. Highly recommend!

After hopping off the bolt bus, this was the only thing that was open and I wanted a quick snack. I had their sweet and sour chicken, wings, fried chicken and plantains. The plantains were AWFUL it was as hard as a rock! The sweet and sour chicken was good though, the wings and the fried chicken were also semi hard.. If it wasn't late at night I'd probably have gone else where. This place is pretty mediocre and they charge a lot per oz..

Probably the worst bacon egg & cheese I've ever had. Bathroom is disgusting, saw an employee leave the bathroom without washing his hands. There are hundreds of better places to grab breakfast in NY...avoid this one.

If you live, work, or ever find yourself in midtown Manhattan, please do not patronize the 33 Gourmet Deli... They just ripped off my wife and I for 10$... They gave us 4$ change instead of $14, and then refused to fix their error... We waited 20 minutes for their "tape" to be checked,(missing our original bus) and then our next bus was about to leave for JFK (which they knew we were waiting for), so we had to go... I believe this is a common scheme they play on unsuspecting tourists... I asked for the $10 again before my wife grabbed me and said the bus was leaving, but they decided they would keep the 10$ instead... I have given this place hundreds and hundreds of dollars of business over the years visiting New York and staying close by, and for them to stiff us for $10, which was their error, was super low... I gave them a few choice words before I left, once I realized they were stalling for our bus to leave again, and that I was going to be out the $10... To add insult to injury, the diet Pepsi we bought there was almost a year expired and the date on the bottle says August 25, 2014(Only to be found out once on our way to JFK)!!!... I'll be calling the health inspector next...Please do yourself and your health a favor and do not shop here!

I had to think for a second to remember the "real" name of this place, because we just call it 'Peep' around my office, since it's next to one of those weird peepshow cinemas.
They upgraded their sandwich/salad process maybe about a year ago, which has made it more efficient. The sandwiches are quite delicious here and you've got a very wide selection. The Turkey Cuban has to be one of my favorites.

The main downside is that you probably have to walk through puddles and trash next to the Bolt Bus station, or tourists coming out of Sbarro, or past the Peepshow to get here. The service sometimes take longer than other delis, but given the wide variety of sandwich types I'd say it's worth it. The price is pretty standard for a Manhattan deli.

Nevertheless, it's one of the "go-tos" among my office buddies for lunch options.

I typically order from the place every morning because of the decent food.  Today I'm absolutely disgusted with this place.  I asked for my coffee to be made correctly and the MANAGER blatantly told me no! To make like easy I was going to order more stuff but she told me no and to order it on seamless.com.  How inconvenient is that? I spend good money here, but you will not get another dime from me! There is no reason for your customer service skills to be terrible.

I'm very angry.....Usually this place has OK food but today was an exception and I'm never going back.....

Ordered a simple breakfast sandwich while I was one of 2 people waiting.........after 10 minutes, there were about 10 of us waiting and complaining about the service.  I saw part of my breakfast sandwich just sitting there while one of the workers basically did nothing.  I finally said something and go tmy food.  was stuck there for 15 minutes, late for work, and I arrive to work and my breakfast sandwich basically had no egg, no cheese, and was all bread.  I paid $5 basically for 2 pieces of bread, waited all that time for an AWFUL sandwich, from AWFUL service.  WILL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I  In fact, I might ask for my money back during lunch.

And the CC minimum is an annoying $7

Cafe R around the corner will now have my business

great lunch spot! they make great sandwiches and have at least 8 different types of bread.  buffet is also awesome - it can get a lil pricey, so watch how many broccoli spears you throw in your container.
This is really good considering the price. $4 for two slices and a can of coke - you really can't beat it!

Most $1 slices of pizza aren't really that good. Some are just ok or barely edible. So when I happened upon this hole in the wall joint I was pretty surprised at how good this slice was.

Thick, fluffy, and chewy with just the right amount of crust. Good sized slice with sauce to cheese ratio. That was a delicious $1 investment.

Two slices and a can of soda is a deal at $2.99 here.

4 stars only because this isn't the best pizza you're ever going to have, but for 99¢ in NYC you're not going to find anything this cheap and something that will hit the spot. 4 slices and 2 sodas and walked out spending $6. They even gave it to us on paper plates with a few napkins. Lol
Great quick stop for Dollar Pizza. Nothing special but it's food! The cheese pizza is of course the way to go.

It's a small hole in the wall but it serves really good dollar slice pizza. If you are starving and you have $5, you can eat like a king here. The cheese and sauce and bread are all good and create harmony in your month
Soooooo delicious- crusty/fluffy dough with the perfect savory sweet tomato sauce. I spent $3 for two slices and a diet coke- a steal and truly one of my favorite NY pizza joints
Great place to eat, when I went there was no $1 pizza. However, there pizzas was good. I also tried there Philly cheese steak and it was super good. It would be nice if they offered parmesan. O

Right across from our hotel.  Great special for 2 cheese slices w/soda for $2.99
Got that plus a Hawaiian and pepperoni and sausage for little over $10 bucks!!
Brought it back to the hotel and had to wait for our room so the pizza got cold.  Pizza was still delicious with great crust and flavor.

5 stars for the price/taste ratio
I still remember this pizza, 12 years later. How do you good beat $1 slices?!? Near MSG, so good before a game.

$1 Pizza you are really amazing, I had a wonderful experience here yesterday. This place is a real treat whenever I visit the area. Everything I've tried so far has been great. The team was really welcoming and service is wonderful. Very recommended.

For 99 cents, you really can't go wrong! I can't believe they're still able to honor that price with today's inflation. The slice was hot, the cheese was stringy, the sauce had a nice sweetness, and the crust had a decent chew. Didn't get the chance to snap a picture because I scarfed my slice down very quickly.

Is it Joe's pizza? No. But it's really not that bad and does the trick in a pinch. Just be warned, you will probably have to eat on the go or rest against a little counter attached to the side of the building. Nevertheless, I always miss dollar pizza when I'm back in Boston!

Nowadays, almost all of the dollar slice places have increased their prices to $1.50. With inflation, it's understandable. We stumbled upon this spot (which is located right across the street from Macy's) and it is one of the only places that actually still has a dollar slice!

How is their slice? It is a decent size in width and length for a dollar slice. No complaints there. The slices are fairly crispy too which is my preference. They are very stingy on the sauce though so the slice is fairly dry. Overall though, they have a satisfactory slice and the price is right.

If you're near NY Penn Station and need a quick bite, 99 cent delicious pizza will do. I came here on a whim because I was starving and needed food before hopping on the train.

This place is a grab and go shop. They have a variety of pizza flavors but I just opted for a plain cheese slice. They are NOT lying when they say 99 cent pizza. I thought there might be a catch of some sorts but when the guy said $2 I was shocked.

The pizza itself ... is very mid. Definitely taste like Chuck E Cheese pizza but it's edible. If you're looking for legit NY pizza, this is not your place.

THIS IS JUST FOR IF YOU'RE STARVING AND DON'T WANT TO SPEND A LOT OF MONEY LOL

For the price I think it is worth it. This isn't a place to sit and eat though it's more of a grab and go. Fit what I needed I was in a rush just got a cheese pizza and then these other pizza appeared but anyway their cheese was still good.
I believe it was cash only? There's an atm machine there but you just need a few dollars for a solid slice of pizza.

First time trying this 99cents pizza. There was a decent line but it was moving fast. Just got a cheese slice to try it out. Theres not much you can buy for a dollar these days, this is definiteltly worth it.
Probably the worst pizza I ever had. The crust is super flappy. The pizza that they reheated was still cold. Throw it out. Even Domino's makes a better pizza. I guess you get what you pay for.

Creepiest place ever. Literally. Don't come here unless you enjoy being harassed. Me and my friend walked in and immediately two creepy men were talking to us and forcing us into letting them buy us pizza, despite us being CLEARLY uncomfortable they would not stop bothering us and the employee was LAUGHING IT OFF.  After they finally let us be i let him know that they were extremely creepy and he laughed and agreed, we even let him know that we were minors and he continued to laugh. DON'T COME HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO FEEL UNSAFE.

If you're in the Herald Sqaure area ans craving a quick snack this isn't a bad choice.

It's not a great choice either but at least it's cheap.

Heck, it's .99 cent pizza so you can't expect much. I grabbed a slice after shopping at Macy's a few blocks away.

They also have a two slices and drink for $2.99 deal which is really cheap. Just don't expect the pizza here to be amazing.

Plus, the foot traffic in thei area is nuts, a bit annoying, and kind of sketchy. No wonder this corner spot is grab and go with no seating.

I feel like this place is probably one worth it if you're ok with less than mediocre pizza, and only want cheese pizza. Otherwise, the slices are not 99 cents as advertised. I got a buffalo chicken and pepperoni with pineapple. They were still cold, and the flavor and texture was not good. However, maybe worth it if you're just wanting a quick bite on the go. Mine was $7.95 for 2 slices and a coke (can).
Small place but the pizza is delicious! Great for quick snack while heading to your plans. It's great for after too!

What's more New York than $1 pizza? A good slice of $1 pizza!
This is the spot to go to!! Worth the extra steps from the other locations near Times Square. Extremely fast service, and since they sell sooo much pizza you always get a fresh out the over (or rather hot) slice.
ONLY THE CHEESE IS $1, is funny to see the tourist faces when they get charge $3 for a veggie slice.
Doughy crust.  Chucky Cheese quality. No napkins.  No condiments.  But for 99 cents it's edible.
Very good pizza for price. Highly recommended as for 3 dollars you have a whole meal!

Rating out of 10: 3

Got a dollar slice pizza. Got harassed by homeless people begging for money- one lady was in the store trying to get money

The pizza looks better than it tastes... is soft, no sauce or real flavor

Would I recommend: no.
It's literally my new favorite dollar pizza spot. We went to a lot especially after concerts and conventions from the javits center. And THIS was by far the best dollar pizza

Delicious! We stayed at a great hotel just a few feet away, and we really wanted to try their $1 slice after driving past this place when we 1st arrived. We strongly recommend!! Will be going back tomorrow for sure.

Sad that the pizza here wasn't actually 99c hahah - I thought it would be, but pricing aside, I would say the food here is like 4-4.5 stars! The pizza was actually really good, but not consistently good if that makes sense. We had a *delicious* slice of their BBQ chicken - it was slightly thicker than a normal NYC pizza and crispy and had the best amount of sauce! Because we liked it so much we got two more slices after, but these were soggy, had wayyy too much sauce and were much thinner pieces as well??? ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ so it's hit or miss, but i'm glad i tried it out
Good $1 slice.  They give you Hella sauces .  Good service. Fair prices on drinks.  The workers work very hard to get the community what they need.

The pizza is good, if they actually make it for you. They have tried to scam me multiple times by trying to make me pay $50 for a pie. IT SAYS 99 CENT PIZZA ON THE NAME. I understand paying more for a pie but it should not be over $30.

Came here at 03/08/22 on a night out at around 1 am and these clowns thought they could take advantage of me by trying to charge me $17 for 3 slices. After arguing there was a "new sign" coming in they ended up charging me $6. Dishonest business that doesn't deserve to be here. Go anywhere else.
Best deal in NYC! Slices are huge and delicious! Open late and it's super quick to pop in a grab a few slices!
Got scammed as well. These guys are horrible. They charged me $3 for one pep slice. Don't go here.

Is it  great pizza? No.  Is it a decent slice you can buy at 10:30 am on a Saturday morning?   Yup.    Cheese slices for 99 cents, pepperoni slice, 2 bucks.   You can do a lot worse for a hot breakfast/brunch.    It may not win any awards, but it's a satisfying NY slice at the right price.

99 Cent Delicious Pizza is just wonderful. The mood, the service, the menu. Every single thing that we have ordered was extra fresh and yummy. The team is definitely a highlight of this place because they are always quick, polite, and provide service with a smile! I can not praise 99 Cent Delicious Pizza enough.
It's what you can expect from a cheap 24/7 pizza spot. The pepperoni steer clear of, it's insanely greasy. The other chicken ones were alright!

Wish I could give it negative stars. The only good thing about this place is the price! No flavor. Super greasy. You are better off with frozen Elios at home. That's just the pizza! You'll be fighting away homeless people asking you for money and change. You'll have to dodge the drug dealers that hang out on the corner also. Just skip this place. This is NOT real NY pizza!!!

You can taste the "love" in each slice than the more expensive pizzerias around. Don't try and get more fancy, this place is just as good, if not better than the competition. Each slice is worth your dollar(s).

rude ass workers... i'm a vegetarian and so are my sisters and all i asked for was a clean cut and they said it's halal and i said i don't eat any meat and they said it's halal it's okay and cut it. and then they asked if i'm indian and i said no pakistani and they said what? pakistani vegetarian? what is that? and continued to laugh and make jokes. the other customers just stared. they stopped the whole line to make fun of us. and the pizza tasted like shit too like that was too oily, lacked flavor, and undercooked. take ur money somewhere else fr. and the area was so disorganized and there was flies everywhere. u can find better pizza ANYWHERE. and they didn't even have the seasonings that every other pizza place has.
This is the onlygood shop here but i have one question is this 99 cent halal or no coz iam muslim.
best pizza in my fucking life at 12 in the morning after hamilton ‍. must get the cheese pizza fresh shit was delicious
It's really a great slice I enjoyed it a lot, especially for the price it's phenomenal. Try it, I like it better than Joe's.

This is literally my fav place for $1 slices. Thin crust, crispy, and delicious. Not as thin as joes but still the classic NYC slice.

If you're Muslim: this place is all halal so even their pepperoni is made of beef and not pork. It tastes amazing!!  

Meat slice $3
Chicken slice $2.50
Beef patty w cheese $3
Regular cheese slice $1

Cannot day enough good things!!
The chopped cheese here is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life and the team working there are so nice. Would give 6 stars if I could.

The name is a scam. Have been by several times and they never have the $0.99 slice, eve. Though it's now $1.50. I understand inflation and willing to pay the $1.50... but they never have them. Change the name!

An absolute bang for your buck. The prices are not only extremely affordable but the pizza is also delicious. For $8 you get a cheese pizza that fed my entire family of 5. The pizza was crispy and well prepared and only took 3 minutes. This truly exceeded my expectations for a $1 pizza.
Finest chopped cheese sandwich in the land.  More upscale establishments cannot match the culinary savvy of these guys.  Highly recommended.
Called last minute for a big group pizza order for a group and Abdullah and his team made it happen for us.  The pizza itself was great and reasonably-priced but the crew was also super-nice.

One of the better dollar slices I've had in awhile! I was debating whether to tough it out till I got home, but thennnnnnn I saw that 99cent sign and it was over. It was a good choice tho lol.

Service is fast and pretty nice. The server patiently explained directions to a random guy who walked in lol. Which is pretty human normalcy so you wouldn't think I'd be happy to see it, but... I digress!

It's a thin, nice and crisp slice. The cheese is a little dryer than normal, same for the sauce. It struck me as the Costco pizza at first lol, but maybe that's being harsh. It was sooo satisfying after, albeit a bit of a chew game toward the end. I actually found my jaw sore. Maybe I have a we

This pizza is so amazing! Walking into the place you see so many delicious food options. My family and I picked the big cheese pizza and the workers were so quick and nice with it!  The pizza is such high quality and delicious and made my expectations for .99 pizza so much higher! Highly recommend coming here!

This place used to be the "876 Market Deli" but they closed down months ago due to, I think, from the notices posted on the door, lack of payment to Con Ed.

Anyway, they reopened as "99 Cents Fresh Pizza and Deli" recently. The interior is completely rehabbed, new and clean. They added a pizza oven in the front, but alas, they have no liquor license at this time, so no beer.

But it has the same staff as the original place, and the breakfast sandwiches taste the same, so my original review from 02/24/12 still stands (as written):

I've been working in the area since 2001, and this is my hole in the wall spot for a quick breakfast sandwich to go.

Get the egg whites with turkey bacon on rye toast with raw tomatoes and onions, topped with hot sauce and black pepper. Aces.
Bloody delicious and fast as all get out. Absolutely hit the spot, great fluffy yet crisp crust and delicious cheese.

So...what started off as a good place to stop into at the end of the night while staying in a hotel nearby for 5 days that we were in NYC, on our last night we decided to buy a full  pizza to eat there and were RIPPED OFF and taken advantage of! Paid over $40 for a full pepperoni pizza and realize after the fact that the Bengali 1 mumbled something to Bengali 2 ...telling him to over charge us!
Let's call it like it is... rock solid slice for 99 cents at midnight no food poisoning! Love these guys!

I am impressed, 99 Cents Fresh Pizza and Deli was simply magnificent. The menu is great and I love the atmosphere. Every single thing was wonderful and tasty. Everybody at the 99 Cents Fresh Pizza and Deli was so nice and accommodating. But try 99 Cents Fresh Pizza and Deli for yourself and you decide.

Enjoyed and loved everything about my experience dining at this place. Food was amazing, service outstanding and a very open atmosphere. The worker who served me the food was very nice and understanding of my order, asked me through out to make sure that I got what I wanted. Overall very affordable place and very friendly environment.
The pizza here is so good. I got a whole cheese and the crust was crispy and the pizza wasn't doughy cheeseless bubbles.

Yo, this place right here? A 100% banger. I was out in New York for a week and came here twice. The pizza might be cheap, but it slaps. The employees are nice (at least they seem nice. Idk, we haven't really talked) and they warm that pizza up real well for you. Tourists, please don't be scared of that 99 cent sign. If that line at Joe's is hella long, you should just come here and show some love to the homies. I never got anything except for pizza, but I'm sure everything else goes hard, too. Straight up.
My wife and I go to NYC quite ofteb. She goes for anime stuff and I got for the pizza. This is such a great deal for delicious pizza.

I am SO GLAD I came here.  Wanted some of that cheap NY pizza and after an online list suggested this over 2 Bros, I didn't hesitate.  $3 for 2 cheese slices and a soda can, great deal and it was honestly GREAT cheap pizza.  Hit the spot perfectly.  Plus they have oregano, garlic, salt, pepper, and buffalo sauce for free.  I would ABSOLUTELY come back here any time I visit NY.  If you want a delicious $3 meal, I highly recommend this chain.
The pizza was a dollar and it was hot and fresh when I got off my flight. Nothing to complain about, it was exactly what you would expect at the price and time.

Pure Puerto Rican coffee is wonderful and that's what 787 serves. The have their own farm and roast their own beans!

I popped in at random while taking a long walk and Mya was very helpful and friendly. I sat for a while reading the owner's unique, direct, positive and controversial coffee table book. Check it out! I won't mention the title here for reasons that will become clear when you see the cover.

I brought my wife back later in the day and she tried both a horchata latte with whiskey coffee and a tres leches latte with rum coffee. Both were spectacular! Alex helped us and was also friendly and professional.

During our second visit, we shared the small sitting space with a backpack toting musician, artist and baker from Hungary! Having been to Budapest and totally enjoyed it, we struck up a conversation and ended up chatting for more than an hour! You never know what kind of caffeine fueled conversation you might have at a coffee shop but this was super interesting. Plus, we listened to his melodic techno music later that evening and totally enjoyed it!

Life is great with delicious coffee and fascinating conversation!
$7 Cold brew in plastic pouch and they use the worst watery oat milk, just get Oatly please

First off I come to 787 coffee often, after today I will not be returning. I got ice cream with the little girls I baby sit right next to a 787. There was a bench in-front of the coffee shop and they asked if we could sit down for a second. So we sat down. We were there for about 2 minutes before this man began staring at my girls and making them feel uncomfortable. He began to walk up to us and asks if I bought coffee. I hadn't at that moment so he told us we can't sit there. I apologized and said ok it was not a problem. The real issue began when we got up and started walking towards an awning (because it was raining) and this man CONTINUED to stare back at us with a look of disgust. He wouldn't stop doing so so I told him to calm down because I was with children. He then escalated everything by telling us "no I can't believe this." I replied to him that I'm with children and he needed to stop being so disrespectful, after all we got up with no hassle because I understood we couldn't sit there. He made a whole scene before he finally got in his car. It is unbelievable that a grown man would put me and two children in this situation. I understand why he asked us to get up but the way he acted after was crazy. I was so upset I wondered who this man was and to my surprise... it turned out to be the owner. I AM IN SHOCK!!!! So disgusting and strange for a grown man who has a successful chain coffee shop to be acting so upset and weird. Do not support this CREEP.

Walked pass this place and was so happy to find its new location. Delicious specialty coffee. Staff was exceptional. Cafe was clean and well maintained. Awesome location with indoor and outdoor seating.

3B Cafe is sparkling new. It was empty of customers at the time I visited. You can enter at 19th Street or by going into the Bed Bath and Beyond Store. It's hidden in the back on the first floor. There's a very friendly security guard standing nearby at the 19th Street entrance. He said the cafe is open at 9am and closes at 5pm. It opened in July 2021.

Today I passed on the food as I wanted a healthy meal. They have the usual pastries that go with your coffee. There was only one Scallion Cheddar Scone left and it was tempting. They serve La Colombe Coffee. The cafe employees were very nice and horribly bored. They were anxious to wait on me. I sure hope business picks up. They're counting on a boost during the holiday season.

I just want you to know this beautiful new cafe is available. Seating is for vaccinated customers only. You can stand at the window counter or sit at the tables and chairs. Enjoy a break while you're shopping. I would have except I was with my daughter. We took care of business and headed home!
this is NOT a cafe. it's a counter inside bbb. bad coffee. misplaced food tags. no guests at all. don't go!

I am not the biggest fan of cart food by far, but these guys are the real deal. Now for me, it's never only about the foods. It's customer service, the entire atmosphere, etc. To simplify, I'd say it's all about how I feel from hunger until I'm done and on my way.
I think about a year ago, I got halal from what I thought was the best halal cart (Rafiqi's across the street, which have been praised by a newspaper in the last few years).
I thought these guys were primo halal food. And they pretty much are.
But these guys (the owner and his children) made me feel like I was asking my uncle for food. Like it wasn't a bother at all. Like if they cooked the food specially for me.
To be fair, I'm a very personable person. You might not invite the owner to your wedding (I did). But, I can bet all the money I have that the owner, especially, will make you feel like you're part of some exclusive club in which you pay millions for membership. But in reality it cost you $6 a plate to feel like you're being cared for.

Rating out of 10: 5.5

Sharifs halal cart

Came here after work and was interested to try this cart out because of the reviews. I ordered lamb over yellow rice with white red and green sauce.

Regardless if you are getting chicken, lamb, or a combo, the price will be $7. Believe this place is cash only. 7 dollars is pretty standard for halal prices.

When I got my plate I walked back home and decided to chow down. Usually when I order from a halal cart I finish 50-75% and have some the next day. However, I finished my food all in 10-15 minutes.

They ran out of tomato when I went. The only vegetable they gave me was lettuce. Which was pretty sad,

This place is nothing special. I don't get the high reviews. The sauces were all watery and tasteless in my opinion. This place is the best but it's also not the worst.

I would not come back. I'm hoping to try rafiqis across the street for $6.

This food stand was my introduction to Halal food.  While I had heard about the food cart on 53rd and 6th Ave, 31st and Broadway happened to be right next to my hotel.  

I figured, why not give it a try?  It probably won't be as good as the one that has received 102 Yelp reviews, but I just got off the flight, I'm starving, and it's close.

IT WAS FAN-TA-BO-LOUS.

For the rest of my NYC trip, I reminisced how tasty and tender the lamb (I usually hate lamb!) and chicken tasted in the combo platter.  How spicy and creamy the white and red sauce was and how nicely the vegetables combined with the healthy serving of rice.

Cost?  $5.  Truly excellent.

Later in the week, I took two subway stops to try the "famous" 53rd and 6th Ave. Halal cart.  While admittedly I took the subway back (~10 minutes) and only ate once the food had gotten cold, I really think the 31st and Broadway cart was BETTER.  

And how many Yelp reviews does it have?  ZERO.  I could only find one Google mention on Chowhound.  

It's probably the location, but if you're down this way, definitely check this Halal food stand out.  It's easily recognizable by a large enclosed cart with two people inside and a humorous misprinted sign that reads "chicken sushi kebab."
Love this place. So delicious and abundance of food for the $6 price. Don't forget to ask for the hot sauce!!  yum!! I had the chicken, the lamb, and the falafel and they were all delicious.

One of the better run of the mill halal carts out there.  portions are regular sized. maybe even a little on the light side.  Hot sauce has a little big of heat to it.  Not a lot of heat but enough that you can go overboard with it and not kill yourself.  Very important to know when its not self serve hot sauce.  
They DO have bbq sauce.

Tip: you gotta ask for the jalapenos.

Conclusion.  Solid lunch choice and only cost 5 bucks.
WINNING

Find me a better meal you can get for $5. I wear this place is amazing! I got the lamb over rice and salad on the side with some pita thrown in as well. The flavors meshed so perfectly and would come back all the time but I don't think that would be the best for my health!

Considering I work literally around the corner; during the spring and summer it was almost a ritual to get halal from this specific place. (Not to mention everyone I knew started coming here as well)

Yes lines are long
Yes some of the other choices might be slightly more expensive then other trucks in the city

But not only does he treat his regulars like family, not only is he a jokester but the food is appealing and filling.
A ton of food for $5, and quite flavorful. The meat is cooked and seasoned well. One of my favorite go to spots for lunch.

Considering that I visited this place about 3 years ago and find that I still need to make a review says enough. I was outside chillin, waiting for a friend until all of a sudden, I guess their busy hour hit. People were lining up, eating in front of me, making it look all good. Selling the fact that my dollar pizza was not going to suffice as the only dinner I had for the evening. I caved. I ended up getting lamb over rice, with the bread on the side. Child. It was everything I needed and more. Smashed it. Try it out. You won't regret your experience. Service was sweet too!

THE BEST. Seriously. I can't believe it took me this long to find my holy grail lunch spot near work, but now I'm totally obsessed. Not as obsessed as some of my coworkers, who go every day, but it's getting damn close.

Mohammed is from Egypt and he's the sweetest guy, and somehow remembered my name and that I'm from Florida after just one or two visits. I've had some very uninspired halal cart food in my life, but his is consistently awesome. Lamb, chicken, or a combo over your choice of rice is $5, and comes with sauteed onions, a few random French fries, a crunchy little iceberg salad, and often a stray falafel. Let him slather on white sauce and hot sauce and go nuts.

This halal cart, labeled as Sharif along the top, always seems to draw a crowd during the lunch hours. The food looks fresh and plentiful, offering up lamb or chicken, and 3 types of rice: brown, yellow, and spicy. Two enthusiastic men and a kid were operating the cart at the time I visited this cart.

The grill was piled high with meat, divided into 3 sections with makeshift metal partitions. The very left contained the new food being grilled, followed by the chicken section being kept warm, and then the smallest of the three being the lamb meat which was being kept warm on the grill. Usually, I question how long the meat is sitting on the grill if I don't see them throw it on upon order. But because of the crowds and curiosity, I decided to order a Chicken over Rice ($5.00) with their spicy rice.

A styrofoam tray was immediately pulled out, piled with several spoonfuls of their spicy rice, salad, chicken, french fries, 1 falafel, and white sauce and hot sauce swirled on top in a spiral fashion for good measure. They are definitely quick, without a doubt. I was excited to see them throw fries and a falafel into my platter, one that I've been longing ever since the generous chef Omar left the Little Morocco halal cart (the owner has decided not to honor Omar's generosity to his clientele, and stick to just the basics: rice, meat, and an overabundance of salad).

Portions are decent, the biggest highlight being that the salad, consisting of just chopped fresh lettuce, only took up 1/4 of the platter, as opposed to the 1/3 salad portions that many halal carts have recently been leaning towards to. The salad was crisp without any sign of browning, signifying freshness. Then came the rice, which was not very spicy, but had a subtle seasoning to it that didn't overpower the palate but enough to make a presence. The chicken was delightful, seasoned well and tender, and mixed with vegetables (onions, broccoli, etc.). The unseasoned fries were soggy, but were a nice touch to added some extra carbs to the dish.  The falafel was tolerable, although dry due to it being previously deep-fried and just sitting in a tray on the cart, but it had a good spice to it. The white sauce was your standard mayo-based sauce, and the hot sauce had a hint of spiciness but nothing overbearing.

On my second visit, I ordered the Lamb over Yellow Rice ($5.00). The lamb is by far much better. The lamb is thinly shaved off the doner kebab after it develops a very nice sear on one side, making for a subtly crispy outside, yet still maintaining a moistness inside. The yellow rice is moist yet not overly wet, making for a standard yellow rice. So far, I prefer the spicy rice, but have yet to try their white rice which actually has a yellow hue, as if it were cooked with chicken broth.

Overall, it made up for a fairly good halal cart, especially with the recent drought of good carts in the Westside (Garment District/34th St.) area. Little Morocco is no more, Adham's Halal Cart no longer provides the quality that it once did, the two gentlemen on 34th St/7th Ave. providing a heavily cardamom-spiced rice have been replaced by two new gentlemen, leaving it open to whoever wants to take over that market. These guys on 31st and Broadway definitely provide one of the better halal carts in the area and you will definitely find me coming back again. And free fries and falafels included?! Thank you!!
Excelent choice when you're drunk!!! Halal, kosher, and I'm pretty sure ok to eat if you're a Christian as well! :)

He gouged the price. I handed him a $5, For the chicken kabob that is usually $4. Bill in hand he tells me,"whats this? $7 for kabob." Word to the wise, if the prices aren't posted prices are negotiable. Didn't want to fight him over $3 or ruin the mood, so I handed him another $5. Price gouging is not nice and I really wanted to have a great experience at your stand Halal Guys; the reviews on Yelp gave me high expectations.

$5 for some good falafel, veggies (sautéed and raw)
Good sauce, great spicey basmati rice
First cart experience since moving to NYC
I'm picky about quality of food
This passed the test for me

I was at 31st and 8th, next to the megabus stop at 1:30am. I assume this is the correct food truck, which moved two blocks over the attend to the bus crowd...

Me: So what is your most popular item on the menu?
Vendor: Well, everything is good! What would you like, big or small?
Me: Mmm, something small.
Vendor: How about something like a sandwich?
Me: Okay!
Vendor: Chicken or lamb?
Me: How about lamb
Vendor: Okay, I make something VERY special, JUST FOR YOU.

He made me a lamb gyro, which is not that special considering it's smack dab in the middle of the menu (and available at every Halal food cart in NYC), but he toasted the pita on both the metal plate and the fire grill and gave me generous amounts of lamb, peppers, and seasoning (which he grilled for a good 5 minutes, considering that no one was in line behind me). He also asked me what sauces I would like and how spicy...the most worthy $4 ever spent. It was NOT small.

Can't beat the $5 dollar chicken/lamb over rice platter. Very affordable and tasty. I have tried the combo platter which comes with lamb/chicken meat over rice and salad. Comparable to halal guys, I think this place has more flavor to their meat than the halal guys carts. The salad on the side also comes with corn, black beans, and lettuce which is different than the other gyro carts in the city.

My first halal cart experience was after going to blood manor, and it was outside Penn Station. The chicken and rice were moist, greasy and flavorful.   I can't find the location of this halal cart anymore; it seems to have dissapeared.

Fast forward to today. I read the review of this halal cart and I was expecting the same experience. Unfortunately, the meat, while tasty was kinda dry. The rice had a lot of flavor, but wasn't the bright yellow that the other halal cart had and it was also almost mushy.

This place was good but not great. Reviews are exaggerated but I still enjoyed the food. I got a 50/50 chicken & lamb plate and a felafel gyro... Honestly I liked the felafel best, with the chicken a close second and I just wasn't a fan of the lamb.

The chicken is juicy and packs some seasoning which is good. There's some peas in the  yellow rice adds which give the rice more depth. The white sauce is not watered down and holds up well.

If you want a comparison to the The Halal Guys on the corners of 53 St and 6 Ave, the Halal Guys' chicken is just dry and lacks flavor. I would rate them a 2 star in Yelp.

The 31st and Broadway cart gives you a greater bang for the buck.

the chicken gyro over rice.  5 dollars!   I'm trying to find a replica here in the bay.  I'm getting this stuff overnighted from a friend in NY.  

There must be a place here in the bay!

house of falafals on deanza boulevard is no contest.

I couldn't make it to halal guy this time I visit NYC, so I gave it a try to this place. The owner is super polite and nice. The food turned out to be very good, the lamb over rice with good amount of flavors and sauce. Their spicy sauce is very spicy. The only thing that is too different from halal guy is that this place has much smaller portion and still $5, though I can't recall how much it was at halal guy.
Best Mexican vendor I have ever had. 5 for chicken over rice. Decent chicken with peas, corns, tomato and lettuce.
The food is deeeliiiciiioouuss!!!!! I tried Lamb Over Rice. It was $6. And worth it!!!

The BEST cart! I make it a point to eat here every time I come to the city. You can't get better food for $5 in this city. The spices are wonderful and the portions are huge. My favorite is fish/tilapia day which is every Thursday. The service is fast and the servers are pleasant even at the end of a long day. I have to be honest and tell you that since I love this cart so much I decided to try them ALL, even 53 & 6th. There is no comparison. It is easy to grab a box of food and walk over to Greeley Park and people watch as you eat.

Freakin' unbelievable! Best value in the City! We checked in to the Doubletree in Chelsea,and my wife was hungry. So I started looking for places in the area, and saw all the great reviews for this place, so we the made the five minute walk and couldn't be more pleased! Food is absolutely amazing!!! Service was great too! We have already made plans to come back tomorrow for lunch.

This place is great! I knew I wanted a falafel for lunch but I'm new to working in this area and I'm still figuring out the food scene. After reading the great reviews I took a chilly stroll down the 31st to get a falafel sandwich and I was not disappointed! The men working at the cart were so kind taking time to ask me how I wanted my food prepared and chatting with me about the weather. It was quick and the sandwich was delicious - chock full of yummy falafel and veggies and of course the hot sauce was to die for. I love me some hot sauce. Love. It. And this did not disappoint, spicy to the max but not so spicy that I couldn't taste my food and wanted to die. And the best part? This gigantic sandwich was only $4! I'll definitely be going back.

This is a steal.  

The food tastes like it was cooked with love. So walk to Greeley park, sit down and enjoy it - you lucky mofo.

$5 Lamb over spicy rice, salad covering only a quarter of the platter - thankfully. The lamb is delicious and the rice is too. The vegetables are crunchy and the falafel  thrown in is superb.

Since I know some people are reviewing Rafiqi's and some are reviewing the other one across b'way from it, I just want to clarify that I'm reviewing the other one that's NOT Rafiqi's. Although Rafiqi's is very good and a good deal, the lines in the warmer months just aren't worth it. One day last summer, a bunch of guys in my building were raving about this one on the west side of b'way and as usual, Rafiqi's line was insanely long so I just figured... "why not?". Haven't been back to Rafiqi's since. The guys across the street though are super nice as well, with competitive prices. Whenever I ask for no salad, with my chicken and lamb over rice, they always give a healthy portion of everything, instead of leaving the styrofoam plate a quarter empty like many other carts do. Food tastes great. There's usually three different kinds of rice, white w/vegetables, yellow and spicy brown. I think the brown is spicy anyway. The main point of attraction though, the lack of a line. In a city where you can spend an eternity (every day) waiting for elevators, buses and subways to get where you're going, why wait on another long line if you don't have to? Plus, for the sake of laziness, this cart keeps me from having to cross another street. Less energy expended is a win for me.

Excellent food, excellent prices, excellent portions, and excellent dudes running the stand.

Chicken over spicy rice all day!

I finally tried this place and I'm so glad I did!! I got the combo platter with white sauce and hot sauce. The man warned me that the hot sauce has a kick so I said "give me extra the hotter the better "he proceeded to do so plus gave me a huge fresh jalapeno!!! HOLY DELICIOUSNESS the meat had such good flava and juicy and the rice was nicely seasoned . Perfect portion and cheap as hell.I have been going to the place on 53rd & 6th but not anymore. These guys are very nice, quick, and you don't have to wait in a huge line. The only thing is they didn't give any pieces of pita bread, but now I know all I have to do is ask :-)

I came here based on the reviews and I'm so glad I did! I got the lamb gyro with onions and extra white sauce....incredible. The pita alone was amazing but the lamb and veggies were the best I've had from a cart. The guys who run it are super nice as well. Definitely check this place out...you won't be disappointed!!

I love when I have an audition or some sort of business near this halal cart! BEST LAMB GYRO IN TOWN! And they jam pack it for 4.00! If you need a quick bite for cheap that's hearty and delish, then come here and get you a gyro STAT! The guy was super sweet. After reading some of these reviews I may try the lamb over rice although I am pretty loyal to Halal Paradise cart at the Atlantic/Barclays stop on Pacific.
I found this place and tried the lamb with spicy rice. It was good, but it tasted like most of the food from the carts around the city. Nothing special, honestly.

I think I'm in love! Can we see each other next time I'm in the area? I'll miss you. Next time, I'll get chicken only, as I favored it over the lamb. Your yellow rice and salad was bangin. The white sauce, I want to see less of, but, please bring your hot sauce buddy. He was tasty. Til next time..

Falafel on Rice!  With white sauce and red sauce!!  What more could you ever want, or need, in life?  Perfect for when you're about to hop on the train to go places.  Great for feeling warm on a cold miserable day.  Therapeutic for life's woes.  Supportive of life's highs.  And absolutely fantastic, at 4AM when you're on top, or bottom, of the world!  Who needs fancy pants drinks and meals when you could have some falafel on rice-with white sauce and red sauce!?  New York doesn't get better than this, period.

This is the famous, Rafiqi's ! This is my spot for lunch. Since I'm on a diet they offer falafel or chicken salad.  The taste is great with the whit sauce. This place always has a long line however worth the wait. Love this cheap food!  Their chicken and lamb is so tender that it melts in your mouth. Where can u get a falafel sandwich for $3? Or falafel custom salad for $4?  In the midtown or K-town is ridiculously inexpensive. Jacks 99 cent store is a block away and its followers wound up here. They love that hot green and red sauce. Too hot for me! Lol!
Don't mistake this cart for Rafiqis.  I wish I hadn't made that mistake the first time.
Eat here once a week for lunch. For 5 bucks, best halal food around.

So, the cart I went to was actually on 32nd and 5th Ave, but maybe this is the same one? It was fantastic! The owner was actually really friendly and didn't just grunt at me like a lot of food cart employees/owners (a bad attitude is totally understandable in the food service industry, but it was really refreshing to have someone be like, nice to me). I got a huge falafel for just $4 with "everything." Well everything included chopped and sauteed green peppers, onions, fresh cilantro, plenty of tomatos.  No stupid slivers of sad iceberg in sight. He also chopped & sauted the falafel rather than just frying a ball.  Super generous with the tzitziki (white sauce).  It was hella good, I definitely would go back.

FYI: I'm a huge fan of Shanghainese food

This place is like a second home to me and has a spot on my "JBW Top Hits" list. The waiters all greet me with a friendly "Welcome back!" and I don't even open a menu since I know exactly what I'm getting: the pork soup dumplings, sauteed string beans (gan bian si ji dou), and vegetable dumplings (eat these as soon as they arrive, since the skins will get crusty the longer you wait). To be honest, these three dishes have been my tried-and-true go-tos for so long; I've ventured a bit into the world of sauteed dishes and such, but I keep coming back for these.

Great restaurant with authentic dishes from Shanghai and surrounding areas!

Got couple classic Shanghainese dishes this time:
Shanghai Kao Fu (Tofu): Love the spongy chewy springy texture of the Kao Fu (it's actually gluten, not tofu), very flavorful. Also enjoyed the various textures with the addition of Shiitake mushrooms and peanuts

Noddle with Preserved Vegetables with Pork: Very flavorful broth, the preserved vegetables are just the right amount of savoryness and pickle*y texture (I don't like some of the other preserved vegetables elsewhere that are either too salty or too aged/mushy in texture). The noodles are thick with great chew to them.

Sweet Eight Jewel Rice: how I miss this iconic traditional shanghainese dessert and it's a true rare find! So glad they have it here! It's sticky rice pudding with red bean paste filling in the center, dotted with various dried fruits (dates, raisin, cherry, etc.) pressed in on top and then doused with generous amount of syrup with osmanthus in. What a delight! The rice grains were cooked to just the right consistency/texture: sticky chewy while still retaining the individual grain firmness. All the ingredients just come together so well - so many going on at the same time and yet harmoniously!

Would definitely come back to try their other dishes on the menu!

I haven't had the chance to try their crab and pork soup dumplings, but their pork ones are outstanding. It's less than $10 for 8 of them, and they are the best soup dumplings I've ever eaten. I can't recommend them enough!

Service is a bit slow, but they do a good job overall. I love the tea they serve with the meals too! They bring a teapot when they seat you.

The ambiance is casual, and the space is small. You might be seated closely next to another table, but if you get there on the earlier side, you'll have more space.

Amazing food. Great service. Service was quick and friendly. While the space is slightly cramped, it doesn't matter , bc you're at 456.
Soup dumplings are a must. Salt and Pepper Shrimp were fabulous.  Little Italy is next door for dessert. You won't be disappointed unless you're looking for a high end dining experience. If that's the case, 456 is not for you. It's perfect as is. Enjoy.

Visited this past week in Chinatown. We were walking around in 85+ degree weather looking for a place that was not cash only and stumbled upon this gem.

The lunch special menu with specials for under $8 is what sold us. We ordered the crab meat and pork bun soup dumplings and omg, these were amazing. I ordered the shredded pork with dry tofu after being torn between two items (the waiter recommended this over the other). The tofu in this was amazing, it tasted like chicken. I wish I could make tofu taste this way at home...I think I'd eat more vegetarian if so. The pork was excellent as well, super flavorful.

My boyfriend ordered the spicy double sauteed pork and this was so tender. The mushrooms in it were amazing and it had what I think were water chestnuts. I honestly don't know which dish I liked more.

The lunch specials also came with hot and sour soup which was flavorful and better than any Chinese takeout I've had. Service was quick and the food came out even quicker. I also liked that they give you an entire pot of green tea.

I'm already waiting until my next visit to NYC so I can come back for this spot!

Ambiance was very casual and normal. Standard stuff.

Food was also very average. Nothing special about the food and not particularly cheap as you'd expect in Chinatown. Food was decent.

A nice Chinatown option service authentic Chinese food and American Chinese food options.

Their pan fried tiny buns with pork are better than Shanghai21's - bigger and topped with lots of scallions. Only thing that could make them better is more soup.

Their soup dumplings are good and filled with soup although they're smaller and skin is a bit thicker than Shanghai21's.

We also ordered the wontons in spicy flavor (w/ peanut butter) which were delicious and the Spicy Shredded Beef which was also good but a bit oily. Scallion pancakes here are crispy but could use more scallions and flavor.

Was craving for soup dumplings and xame here on a Saturday afternoon around 1:30pm. It was pretty packed but at least there was no wait time compared to other Shanghai restaurants in Chinatown. Ordered the beef pancakes, soup dumplings and one of the egg dropped soup. Soup dumplings was juicy but skin was a bit too thick. Love the beef pancake and soup! Waiters were very friendly as well

We stumbled upon this establishment on a rainy NYC evening and needed some comfort food to warm us up! With so many choices nearby, this establishment had the most other diners, so we thought we'd check it out.

Unassuming dining room with plenty of seating! Nothing Instagran worthy about this location, but we'll let the food speak for itself! Service was very helpful and on top of things throughout our stay!

We got the Fried Pork Dumplings and Hot and Sour soup. Both were delish! A perfect warming snack for the dreary adventure-filled day. I'd definitely come back for more of their options!

We ordered the food to go, the servers were friendly. We had the steamed pork soup dumplings however, it doesn't taste as good, maybe it would be better if we dine in. We also ordered the chicken rice cakes and the fried tiny buns with pork. Maybe next time, we can dine in for the experience.

Stopped by with a few friends while on a yelp guided dumpling tour throughout China Town (and some LES). Was probably our favorite spot of all! We ordered a variety of dishes, all tasting fresh and hot, with our favorites being the shrimp dumplings and the crab & pork soup dumplings (some of the best I've ever had). Also their homemade hot pepper sauce was bomb, and definitely complimented all of our dishes nicely.

Staff was attentive and friendly! Will definitely be back and potentially try some of their other mouthwatering looking options.
