OK is a little rice shoppe serving old style Cantonese dishes with the standard cha siu (roast pork), glistening roast ducks, and a whole roast pig hanging in the window.  I would stack up OK's BBQ items up against any of the Wong noodle shops in Chinatown.  Most of their business is takeout at lunch time serving BBQ meats over rice as well as prepared foods such as grouper fillet, home style bean curd and vegetarian Buddha's delight.  If you're feeling adventurous, you might want to sample the jellied duck's blood.

The small adjoining dining room with wait service for about 6 tables cannot handle more than a family of 6, but with a little squeezing could handle a group of 8 if they were really friendly.  Being one of the most convenient places near my parent's apartment building, I've been coming here for years, but their prices have become a little steeper lately.  But if you're on the hunt for that unique "wok hay" flavor, set yourself down for some good Cantonese fare.

I have only bought the crispy roast whole pork to go here and found it amazing both times. This will now be my go-to for crispy roast pork - be sure to ask for the rib portion of the roast pork - it's the best part!

One only needs to find the place with numerous elderly Toisan (Taishan?) regulars to know that the traditional Cantonese cooked meat providers are still around and alive to ensure that the vibe of Chinatown isn't too gentrified. I really do love this place and hope it stays open for a very, very long while.

Can't beat a combo roast duck and roast pork on rice and cabbage for $6.50!  Free hot Chinese tea when you sit down and food comes in 2 minutes. No frills and no fillers! Gets the job done and curb the cravings!

No frills classic Cantonese restaurant! They have been around for a long time and have had kept its menus for years. Always come here when I need my fix of sam bo fan (three meats over rice) or any other Chinese food I may be craving. They are opened for dine in again which is a great plus! Nice and decently spaced area with plastic separators.

The "Peking Duck" is just a regular roast duck that cost twice as much but you do get a few onions and a few burrito wraps and sauce.
The Young chow fried rice is rice mixed in soy sauce and canned peas with frozen shrimps for $10.  Total rip off
Delicious, easy, cheap Cantonese food. Normally best for take out and the portions are huge for the price!

Note they sort of changed the name/ ownership to simply 218 Restaurant and dropped the "OK".  Even though that's what it was - OK.

First thing I noticed was the dirty tea kettle.  It's stainless steel and they can't wipe it down?  Tea was also too black so you can tell there's no QC there.  Plus side is that service is fast and the water gave a decent recommendation to a fish that needed to be steamed ahead of time.  It's also relatively inexpensive since mom and dad always like to be in Chinatown for pretty much all our meals.

So between the three of us, we had four dishes for lunch:
Shrimp with mayo/ broccoli/ walnuts.  Twas perfect.  I like it when they give plenty of broccoli and not too much mayo.
The Peking style pork chops was the biggest downer as they were over fried.
Bok Chow were simply stir fried with whole garlic.  Generic as they come.
And the fish (cod I believe), was slightly overcooked and the oil/ soy sauce lacked a particular depth as if there was ginger missing.

Nevertheless, it's OK.  I'd come back and try the roast meats.

WHAT HAPPENED TO THE CHICKEN THIGH??? =/
I ordered half a chicken to go and when I got home, I realized there was no chicken thigh. How can the chicken thigh be gone?? Did the person chopping the chicken eat it?? Damn this!! I love dark meat too!! Where is the ethics here?? How can they chop the chicken in front of you and not place it in the container?? This is soooo messed up!!! Never ever will I be coming back here!!
We came here from time to time for BBQ items. I remembered coming here for their three treasure rice lunch. Now we go to the Food Deluxe for BBQ items.

This place lives up to its name as an OK Restaurant. I went here today for a fast, cheap, and authentic take-out and it did not disappoint.

I ordered the roast pork on white rice ($4.25) plus a can of Coke ($1). They took my order quick and had the food packed and ready before I could put my change away. The atmosphere at the counter was hurried (even on this slow, rainy day), but polite.  

The portion of pork is generous and definitely filling. The pork is deliciously moist and saucy, and it's a nice mix of fatty and crispy parts (thought I wished it was more crispy). Its a little too much fatty pork for my taste, but that also didn't stop me from devouring the entire serving. The white rice was a little dry, the only sauce is whatever came off the pork. A little drizzle on the rice would have gone a long way. The cabbage got a little soggy as is unavoidable in a Styrofoam container, but was a nice compliment to the meal.

I wouldn't rule out trying OK 218 for some other dishes, although if I'm craving Chinatown pork I will go to Big Wing Wong.

If I can give this place 218 stars I would!  The food here is what my people say 平靚正.  Super cheap as the one dolla sign suggests, food is pretty, and damn delicious.  This place doesn't sugar coat anything so don't expect white glove service nor clean utensils.  Just expect 平靚正!

Came here alone for a quick sanbo fan meal. Seated with another stranger in a round table while there were other empty tables in the small restaurant. Served a glass of hot tea and received a bitter melon and pork bone soup with my order of a sanbo fan(Three meats with rice). The meal itself wasn't bad, roast pork was slim and meaty, duck wasn't very fat, chicken was good but I got a lot of the rather bony pieces. The complimentary soup was great as I tasted a very mild bitterness which was something I unexpectedly enjoyed.

Service is soooo bad here.

They charge extra for everything and don't even tell you before they charge it. How do you NOT have a portion of rice when ordering a dish of chicken or pork????

We had to ask for water 3 times before getting it and then when I asked for a straw, he have me a look and walked away. HOW RUDE???!??!!

I guess thats just how they roll here in New York.

So on to the food:

Our food plates are tossed onto our table, I mean they might as well just throw it to our table from the kitchen.

We ordered the spicy roast pork and they brought out a cold plate of bbq pork drenched in table soy sauce.

We ordered more things but told them to hold the rest and asked for the check. This review started with 2 stars but unfortunately ended with 1.

My apologies on a mistaken review.  I found this place to be an old style rice shoppe a la Full Kee in DC Chinatown.  The noodle soups were inexpensive.  I had the fish ball noodle soup.  I need to try a few other dishes.  I am sad that many of these old school Cantonese restaurants are becoming obsolete.

Chinese cuisine

A quick eats chinese place.  I've eaten here for several years now, even through it's last incarnation and renovation.  When I want to have a quick rice dish, I usually always come here first.  Their prices are very good and their portions are just right.  A nice menu full of different choices of rice dishes and noodles.  If you are not feeling rice or noodle dishes, you can always order any of the menu items as a rice dish.  You can also go up to the front and choose from the many laid out dishes that have been prepared for take out, to have on your rice dish, varying from tofu, sweet and sour pork, buddhist delight and various amounts of veggies.

I normally order the roast pork and roast pig over rice.  I've had the salt and pepper pork and salt and pepper squid here and it's good too.  And for those who like wonton noodle soup, it's good here too!  There isn't anything on the menu that I can complain about.

There is a waiter here that is very friendly and chatty with you, even with non-english speakers.  Mind you, I eat at this place alot because a distant uncle of mine works here, but it's not like the food is cooked special for me.

This place has the best roast meats in Chinatown. Go with the roast duck, soy sauce chicken, or roast pork. The fried rice is a staple and they have a wide array of seafood dishes as well (fresh steamed fish, cantonese style lobster). If you go for dinner, you get the daily soup on the house.

Whodaheck put a space between the O and the K? So obscure I almost had to add a business. Since I had a Curry Don for lunch today and BonBon Chicken for dinner the previous night, I needed some roughage. On the way back home, I glanced through the window here and saw some Jai laid out. Jai is what Chinese people call Buddhist food, as it's all vegetarian. Just what I needed..BINGO! They also sell some authentic Cantonese dishes such as sliced taro and fatty pork. Considering the fact that in the immediate area you can get 4 combos + soup for $4, this wasn't THAT cheap.

-Jai ($4) - wood ear mushrooms, cabbage, tiny mushroom caps, sliced carrots, baby corn, broccoli, fried tofu, water chestnuts, vermicelli, snow peas, it wasn't gourmet but it got the job done, at least it wasn't as greasy as I had imagined a la seeing my own reflection on the tofu.

Maybe I was just really hungry, but damn, that was some serious five star food. My brother dropped in here a couple of weeks ago to grab a bite to go, and when he got a pile of deliciously fatty duck slices over a generous mound of sticky white rice for only $4.50, I knew I would have to come back.

We got:
Peking style pork chop -- crispy but melt in your mouth tender, with a sweet red sauce. The perfect pork chop.
Deep fried crab -- small hard shell crab, but with plenty of meat. Crab innards are delicious. Just enough crispy batter. Hot and juicy. Yummy greens and peppers to go along with.
Shrimp fried rice -- Succulent baby shrimp and plenty of egg. Tasty enough to make me almost like peas.

The service was actually pretty great too. Prompt, but appropriately so. Friendly, even. This place isn't much to look at, but it's clean and the front kitchen is bustling, which is fun. Highly recommended for a meal that is super cheap, incredibly tasty, and totally filling!!!

It's been over six years since I first reviewed this place, and I am happy to note that OK 218 has been extremely consistent over the last six years. The owner, two-person regular waitstaff, the lady behind the take-out counter, and from what I remember, even the cooks have all not changed. In fact, this restaurant has got to be one of the few in Chinatown that has not changed much, if at all, during the last ten years.

Most importantly, however, the food has largely remained unchanged over the years. My favorite, the beef, egg, and tomato on rice, is, in my opinion, still the best of its kind in Chinatown. Their "Beijing-style" fried pork chops and salt and pepper crispy squid are also quite good. Even the "Western-style takeout" dishes, such as the iconic General Tso's chicken, are well executed.

The waiters also do not forget a face. While I am pretty much a regular, eating with family friends here several times a year, I once came in with a friend originally from Toronto who had only been to their restaurant once before, and the waiters remembered him. In fact, they found it profoundly humorous that two guys they've met on separate occasions, the guy who frequently eats with a family that speaks Cantonese but cannot really speak it himself and the guy who stopped by a month prior that originally hails from Canada, are close friends.

As a bonus, one of the waiters is a polyglot and speaks Spanish fluently.

All of the above adds to the homeyness of this establishment. If you have never been to this restaurant or the area in general, I think it is nigh time for you to walk the extra 10 or so minutes from touristy Canal Street and grab a table at OK 218.

This place serves homestyle cooking, steamed eggs with vermicelli, eggplant with salted fish, beef and broccoli, chicken...all was very good....

Very small seating area so you must be patient, we came here after Lombardis pizza and walking SOHO, with a different group of great friends and it was very good to the stomach....

Tables aren't  for large groups but for a few just looking for a place to munch on the basics of Cantonese style, not bad at all......
The carrots in my beef w broccoli was tasted awful. Beef and broccoli was good. Wait staff made me feel rushed to eat my food and it was kind of rude.

I ordered a sliced fish congee today since it was across the street from my dentist and it cost me $1.80 more than it does at my usual congee spot. Plus, it only tasted half as good.

If you asked me, $1.80 is a big deal if you're buying food in Chinatown. That's practically half of how much my congee would've costed if I went to my usual spot.

Absurdity. Never coming back here for congee again.

I can actually call this place my second dining room!  

I've been coming here w/ my family for years and it never disappoints. The service is exceptional; the staff treats us like we're part of their big family.  There is a pretty good selection of entrees and rice dishes. And right after they take your order, they will first serve you their daily soup --- just like a good home-style Chinese meal should be..

If you want something quick and cheap -- you can do a Pick 3 from their hot buffet-style trays out by the front window or roast meat over rice.  Fresh steamed fish is always good too!  If you crave a specific fish that they don't have fishing in their tanks, the waiter will actually go out to the fish markets on Mott Street to get it.  My mom loves their Peking pork; my dad is all about the steamed fish and my sister - loves the black bean snails and the scallion chicken.  As for myself, I enjoy their salt and pepper squid and pork...  

They also offer breakfast now... you can get congee, rice rolls, fried rice and noodles and macaroni!

and the pricing is just right for any sized wallet...

I've been eating food here for nearly fifteen years and without this place, I could not have become the healthy and strong adult I am today.

Here is why you should eat here:
- Menu is very diverse, ranging from seafood to Congee to Peking duck. The food here is very traditional; exactly the same as the food you would eat in China.
- Clean establishment.
- Waiters are very friendly and professional, fluent in English and Chinese. One of them  is also fluent in Spanish.
- Lighting is bright and air conditioning is great.
- Prices are very reasonable.

These are just some of the reasons that make this place one of the best in my book so what are you waiting for? Come and try it out!
5 stars for the tasty popcorn chicken and excellent service! They have some really well-priced sets and combos which we will come back for. It's strictly take-out only - no seats or tables.

One of the driest chicken I've had. I understand that they are new but I was very disappointed regarding how my chicken sandwich was not hot or warm when I was eating it. I just feel that at least have the chicken sandwich warm if it's not dry but they mad it dry and not warm. I was disappointed with my food.
Not a $1 noodle cart. Things are an average of $3-4 each. It is greasy and not very flavorful, but it's satisfactory for an under $5 lunch.

This street cart -- vaguely where 147 Centre St would be were that a real address -- serves up super greasy noodles, fried rice, egg rolls, and other such cheap fare for the shocking price of $1.  The quality is about what you'd expect for a $1 container of fried food, but it's a reliable lunch option, and always has a decent line around noon.
What would you expect from a cart?  Lots of food!  For $1!  I got the noodles of course.  For a dollar it was good and greasy.  If only she spoke english...
Prices amazing, Food Amazing. Super fun! Affordable, Reasonably priced hotpot and kbbq

Came here on a friday night in a big group (~9). We made a reservation the same day, but 8 PM was the only time available. We were able to sit down before our entire group was here which was very nice.

The restaurant is very large for downtown Manhattan, with booths that can seat 4 on each side. The large booths have induction cookers for both individual small hot pots or a communal large hot pot. It also has one smallish grill. You order most things on the phone using a QR code posted at the booth. If you come in a large group, only ~4 people will be able to reach the hot pot, and the other 4 will reach the grill.

There was a pretty large selection for both hot pot and kbbq, definitely more for hot pot but that also includes vegetables and other hot pot specific things. Unlike most of the other hot pot places I've been to in NYC, 99 Flavor Taste allows you to order as many dishes as you want at any time. This prevents waiting on the server to bring you more food and you can have bites of several different things at once, but makes it a lot more likely for you to overorder.

Another thing: if you come here on your birthday then its free! They also sing happy birthday to you too, we heard it several times during our dinner.

One of the first hot pot places I tried and thought it was more low key compared to other places. Not as big and didn't feel like a ton of options but still one to keep in mind if other places have way too long of a wait plus there are multiple locations.

There were lots of birthdays during our dinner so many songs were sang - probably at least 3-4 while we were there. I wouldn't recommend a big group here - we were just a party of 2 but I can't imagine doing more than 5-6 people.

Service was not that frequent - it's a lot of just trying to gather your dishes and flip the table as quickly as possible. I'd come here again if I needed a hot pot spot asap but not a top pick.

RATING: 7.3/10

PRO TIP: If you're looking for authentic and tried and true hot pot, this is it. I grew up eating here often in high school so this chain holds nostalgia.

DO: order multiple soup bases, try the fuzhounese fish balls (they are regular fish balls with pork inside), fish tofu, save room for condensed milk drizzled fried mantou (fluffy buns). A solid joint for all you can eat hot pot that won't necessarily break the bank. The quality is a self-ascribed "solid" and is a great introduction to hotpot. Everything is ordered via QR code and on your phone so everyone at the table can order things incrementally. Service was fast. Was able to get a reservation easily.

DO NOT order the boba (the tapioca pearls were hard and the brown sugar one in particular was just lackluster).

RANKING: GOOD
(terrible / bad / ok / GOOD/ great / excellent)

Great authentic spot for authentic Chinese hotpot and Korean bbq. We came here with a large group and we're attentively taken care of. What's great is you eat free on your birthday so it's the perfect spot to bring a group. They also have desserts like cheesecake and ice cream. I loved the variety of dishes they offered and also there was a mascot singing you happy birthday. Super fun spot! Would highly recommend.

Eat free on your bday!

Walked in at 5:30pm with no res on a Friday and we're able to get seated for two, but it gets busy so I would def recommend a reservation. They only do reservations for four people minimum. The inside is way bigger than you'd think for this lowkey extendido restaurant. There are two levels and some semi private rooms for large groups. This is a fantasy place to go to for a birthday or if you just have a lot of people.

We opted for the BBQ option over hotpot. I've never done BBQ style for Chinese food but it was delicious and the portions are big. It's $35/person for BBQ. The staff comes by and cooks the meat for you and takes it off when it's done. It's nice that it's semi service and they're very attentive. There's a sauce bar that you can get sauces at which is delicious.

You order what you want on your phone which makes it super easy for multiple people to join the order via their platform. We over ordered, got 17 things total for two people but probably could've done like 12 and still would've had plenty.

The meat was good and the seafood was surprisingly great too. Would definitely recommend the squid and muscles. The sweet potato was also yummy caramelized when it was done cooking.  

You eat free on the day of your birthday and they give you ice cream with a candle.

Bonus! They gave us mini mooncake at the end during the mid autumn festival time.

We are extremely grateful to the staff that took us as a walk-in really late at night. We don't know if they were just being nice or if we were within their walk-in period, but regardless we are grateful. We really enjoyed everything we ate here. The cheese corn had a garlicky taste to it that went so well with all of the food. To be completely transparent, the sauce station was a bit messy, but I bring this up just to inform you about the atmosphere AT THAT TIME. It is important to remember that we did get here very late so that area was just simply the aftermath of a successful day of business. Regardless, if you are looking for an ayce bbq place or just end up in the area, check them out.

I celebrated my 21st birthday at 99 Favor Taste, and let me tell you, it was an absolute blast! This gem of a restaurant in New York not only offers fantastic food but also creates an atmosphere that's bursting with energy and good vibes.

Walking into 99 Favor Taste was like stepping into a world of culinary excitement. The lively ambiance was contagious, and the upbeat atmosphere set the tone for a memorable evening. It's the perfect place for a large group dinner, and my birthday celebration was nothing short of epic.

Speaking of birthdays, 99 Favor Taste really knows how to make you feel special. They offer a generous birthday deal where you get to eat free three days before or after your birthday. What could be better than indulging in unlimited hot pot and Korean BBQ to celebrate another trip around the sun?

The food at 99 Favor Taste is an adventure in itself. The unlimited hot pot and Korean BBQ offerings are a dream come true for food enthusiasts. The sizzling Korean BBQ options are succulent and flavorful, and the variety of meats and marinades make each bite a tantalizing experience. The hot pot, on the other hand, lets you customize your broth and fill it with an array of fresh ingredients, creating a personalized culinary masterpiece.

While the food is undeniably fantastic, what truly sets 99 Favor Taste apart is the electric atmosphere. Laughter, chatter, and the sizzle of food on the grill create a symphony of celebration that makes every moment memorable. The staff add to the experience with their attentiveness and cheerful demeanor, ensuring that your celebration is nothing short of spectacular.

99 Favor Taste is not just a restaurant - it's an experience. Celebrating my 21st birthday there was an unforgettable journey into the world of unlimited feasting and vibrant vibes. Whether you're gathering with friends or family, this place knows how to create a memorable occasion. The food is top-notch, but the energetic ambiance is what truly makes 99 Favor Taste a fun and exciting destination. I can't recommend it enough for anyone looking for a lively and delicious dining adventure.

Food: 5/5 | Service: 5/5 | Experience: 4.5/5

This AYCE hot pot establishment is wonderful. They also have a KBBQ choice. The restaurant itself has the ability to host larger parties, and if it's your birthday, you get to eat free.

Each person gets their own hot pot to cook food in. The choices for meats are varied and good quality (there's beef, pork, lamb, etc). Everything that I would normally try to get at hot pot was there: pumpkin, taro, lotus root, fish roe, spinach, etc. The sauce station also boasted quite a bit of choice.

Service was really quick, and we ordered several times over the AYCE allotted period. At the end for my party of 7, we paid less than $40 to be stuffed with meat, vegetables, noodles, and complimentary yakult at the end.
Absolutely love this spot for hot pot! They are so fast at getting additional veggies or meat for the unlimited hotpot. I love sitting at the upstairs tables its fun to see the entire place.

Still the best deal in town, AYCE hot pot approximately $30 pp + tax + tip. Two hour limit but believe me, you'll be stuffed way before then.

Once seated, your time starts so plop your jacket down and start ordering on the app by scanning the QR code. Table # will appear and regardless # of people, everyone can order on the app separately on their own phone. It still knows it's one table and it'll show as a group order on the receipt.

Wait staff is pretty friendly, refilling water and the soup base as needed. Sauces and misc condiments available at a shared island in the middle of the restaurant. If you are seated upstairs, no fret... They have their own station up there as well.

Wide booths good for groups and a bunch of tables good for four. There are individual burners per person or a shared hot pot one for the larger sharing pot. They can put a separation if you want two different broths for the larger pot. BBQ service at your table as well should you wish, separate cost from the AYCE.  

Totally recommend this spot. Great selection of meats (pork, beef, lamb and chicken). Fish, mussels and bean curd skin was the favorite. My companions loved the variety of greens and mixed veggies available. We especially enjoyed the lobster balls, fish balls and stuffed seafood balls. Don't forget the Taiwanese sausage and quail eggs. So yummy.

I'm disappointed that all the great reviews on Yelp let me down.

This place definitely gets busy and you'll have to wait. But it's easy to track where you are in line through their system.

Was seated for hot pot and of course out of ALL the seats and options in the restaurant we get a side table that wobbles, a portable gas stove and not real seats (fold up chairs). If I'm playing the same price as everyone else I should be able to sit at a regular table and be able to get the same experience.

First of all you don't even get a waiter or waitress. No one tells you how it works or tells you where the sauce bar is. Had to figure it out on our own and wave down anyone we saw if we needed anything. The food came before our soup came and they was nothing we could do because we can't cook the food without soup. Asked the worker after 10 minutes of our food getting there if the soup is coming out yet, and I was given attitude.

The sauce bar is so messy and everything is sticky. Also the floor is so slippery so be careful! Wish the sauce bar had ponzu sauce.

The meat selection was decent. The meats itself weren't bad they were just avg. I had better meats at other hot pot places. The org broth is bland and the kimchi broth was not too spicy.

They give out HUGE portions! So beware when ordering. If you're running low on soup no one will help you, you have to try to find a random worker.

They do take card because I paid with card.

The restaurant as a whole just kind of feels dirty to me. Doesn't feel clean and the hostess was nonstop coughing and didn't cover her mouth once. Literally coughed by our table with out covering 10+ times.

I'm highly dissatisfied with the service, the food, and the restaurant as a whole for the amount of good reviews this place has.

I only had the hot pot, but I won't be back to try the bbq.

Really enjoyed my experience here! Been to both Brooklyn and Manhattan locations and it's always a good time due to the price for AYCE. Basically, you mix your own sauces at their station and then keep ordering meats that they cook in front of you. FYI: heavyyy pour for wine and it's just a yummy time. Def love this for a gathering with friends. Also, they took credit card so that was a happy surprise.

I always come to this place when I visit NY - you can do either kbbq or hot pot or both. It's a cheap option for AYCE and provides a variety of choices. They have a lot of seating but due to popularity, it still takes a while to get seated on a busy day. The meat quality is pretty bad Ngl but what can you expect out of an all you can eat?

The staff weren't exactly friendly, but were efficient in the way they work and they brought out our food pretty fast.

They have a good choice of sauces at their sauce station for you to make what you like.

It gets a little annoying when they play the birthday song every 2 minutes but hey free ice cream.

Just ok if you are within the area and every other restaurant is closed.

Staff weren't clear on who should be cooking, the guest or them. Also they seemed unclear as to who was eating from the grill (bbq) and who was eating soup (hot pot). Since I was the only one eating from the grill I didn't need all my items cooked at once. I was pacing myself, when on one of their walk bys they saw me cooking and decided to take it upon themselves to toss all my pork onto the grill and manhandle it. I said "I'm the only one eating bbq let's pace ourselves:)", they smiled and vanished. I took the pork's off when they were perfectly cooked. Right when I was about to grab one from the communal plate I set up (in case anyone wanted to try some) they returned and said "oh those aren't done". I said sure they are look, and cut one. "They chuckled and said "oh I can tell by looking, more time". While we were speaking they tossed them all back on the grill. Stood watch, cut all of them into unwanted super tiny pieces, and found one section of one piece slightly pink (fyi you can eat pink, not red). So now we had horribly overcooked rubber pork belly and only one guest at our table tried to eat it (they ate three pieces and called it quits. I tried one and after chewing for what felt like almost 20 minutes I was done). I proceeded to cook myself. At this point I felt as though I had to sneakily cook which made the experience tense :( I got pretty defensive like a mama bear protecting her cubs when they tried to touch my next protein. Luckily after that fiasco I got too eat well made chicken and lamb (they did attack our lamb and over cooked several of them but I managed to save 3 pieces). All drinks (tea, juice and alcoholic bevs) were disgusting and watery. A couple of items were missing, when asked about it and requested (several times) again they still never came. Oil for cooking was brought out at the tail end of the cooking experience. Music was horrible (unless you like pop mashups). Establishment was freezing. There aren't any vents so it got smokey fast (made me cough a few times). Walls are covered in grimey dust balls.

Overall if this is a hot pot joint that staff is to cook the food for the patrons then that should be made explicitly clear AND they must actually know how to cook. Seeing as this was not one of those spots it was highly uncomfortable. One and only positive note, their broths are pretty darn tasty (stars for the broth only.

My first time at 99 Favor Taste happened to also be my first time ever trying hot pot. This was years ago (pre-pandemic) and what an overwhelming, but worth while experience! For less than $35 you can do all-you-can eat hot pot. With fresh ingredients for soup available to order and a menu that is robust and caters to all tastes... what's not to like about that price and inclusivity!

Really great for groups with big appetites. Service is good and consistent. Always crowded, and a crowd pleaser.

This is a staple place for the NYC community of people who like food and a good deal. It's hard not to see why it's a NY gem after you have lunch or dinner with friends there.

Additional suggestion for your enjoyment: karaoke  post-meal is a must. There are a few spots in the area so you can get the full experience of overeating + celebrating  that you overate...

Caution  not for people who hate food or eating.

Came here last night with some friends (have been twice in the past) and continue to recommend this place to others. I've only been here for the hot pot (not yet the KBBQ) but their AYCE is an amazing price for both.

The establishment has updated their ordering policies so you use the QR code and order everything through the app which was seamless and super easy to use. Only confusing thing is that you can see previous orders from your table which threw us off but wasn't a big deal once we confirmed.

We ordered the pork bone base and the spicy base- both delicious. Notables in our order that we enjoyed were the beef, crab, dumplings, udon and lamb. The few things we tried and didn't care too much for were the chicken, the pork, and the daylily. Sauce bar was awesome as well!

Will be back

28-Dec-22, doing some site seeing today, so had to start here with the fam for some incredible hot pot and bbq. As good as it gets for me.

The iPhone ordering is such a simple thing and cuts out what used to be the issue of flagging down someone to place an order. If only we could pay on our phones on the way out, that would really be "frictionless" as the digital folks say.

Food was all good. I was impressed with the level of quality of the proteins for the money. Glad they replaced the grill, didn't ask, but it was getting Smokey with the marinaded meats.

Great experience. Highly recommend.

My friends and I came here because we heard great things about this place. It is a great deal for AYCE Hot Pot! We chose 3 different soup bases. I personally liked the Tomato one because it was on the sour side. Ordering the meats, vegetables, and sides were really easy through our phones and they have a huge sauce bar selection.

They have everything you want for hot pot. I would definitely come here again!

HIGHLY recommend this budget-friendly all you can eat hot pot option in Chinatown ($28/person)! My friends and I had such a lovely dinner here last weekend and came out with bursting tummies.

The hot pot can come in individual portions, which is nice if you're trying to be more sanitary. You can also get two flavors by splitting a larger pot with another person. I thought the meat was really great quality, and I loved getting the fish cakes with roe inside (a MUST try). I ordered lots of tripe and pork intestine because I'm a huge fan and they were not shy on portions.

Loved the yakult at the end as service and overall had servers check up on us pretty often. Such a good deal!

I've never had AYCE hot pot before, so I was excited to try this out with my friend. We came when they opened at 12 pm. I would recommend coming around opening to avoid waiting.

Meats/Vegetables we got:
1) Lamb
2) Spinach
3) Lettuce
4) Cabbage
5) Mussels
6) Squid
7) all the different types of fish balls
8) Mushroom
9) Tofu

It was such an interesting process to navigate. You order scanning the QR code. And you can continue to order however many rounds you want - which was nice.

However, all the sauces are located in the back and it's self-serve.

Service was pretty good, but there were moments where our order was placed but it hadn't come yet. So we had to gently ask the waiters where our meats/vegetables were.

I took my daughter here for her birthday. She loves hot pot or any grill spot LOL

But this place had an amazing buffet that you can order unlimited too and you will get stuff but the price is so worth it.

The sauce bar was so cool literally over 10 different sauces you can use for dipping or flavoring ur soup base. If buffet portion is alot but if you order appetizer they are good as well.
The birthday song plays alot so you will know the song.

The only con is the birthday jello is pretty disgusting.

Big, slightly chaotic restaurant. Suitable for big groups. Lots of options to order from, and you order on your mobile. Service isn't super friendly. Some food took a while to come out, to the point we "double ordered" because we thought they forgot. Then they brought out two plates of meat. They have a sauce bar.

It was just loud. And somehow there were like, 8 people celebrating birthdays while we were there. The restaurant plays on the speakers this loud and long birthday song each time.

But high energy, and food isn't bad.

Went here on a busy Friday night with a reservation for a birthday dinner. I liked the straightforward ordering via QR code (the whole table shares a cart) and the more intimate booth (hard to navigate in and out of) for a large party of 10 with individual pots. AYCE hotpot for $28 per person. The place is large and well suited for bigger groups. That's basically where the pros end.

The sauce bar is gross and messy - the "clean" dishes are in a bin but not thoroughly cleaned, and I saw a stack with bits of garlic everywhere. I had to stand and pick through for awhile to find one clean dish. Sauce drippings are everywhere and there's no climate control unlike some other hotpot chains. Not a large variety of sauces or add-ins either. Food quality is okay, not great (you get what you pay for) and I wish there were more choices for veggies and non-meat items. The staff are clearly working hard, but they are woefully understaffed and overwhelmed. It was hard to flag them down for more broth or water.

This 99 Favor Taste location needs to scale up their staffing ASAP and put more labor into cleanliness. I was genuinely concerned that I might get sick from eating here, and think it's a bit of a miracle that I'm fine the day after. I'd rather go to Hometown for $10 more a few blocks away.

Since Thanksgiving has the audacity of landing on my birthday every five years, I decided to forgo being chained to the kitchen and instead, go out to dinner with my family. By the time I made reservations, there were slim pickings, as I preferred to eat early but not too early. We opted for a 6p seating and headed into the city. No traffic...win. Parking spot right across the street...win. Minimal wait time for our table...win.

Our server was on point. He set us up and showed us the QR code so that we could order our meal. The one thing that threw us off was that on the app, we kept seeing orders from the table that dined before us so we had to make sure we weren't going to be charged for food/beverages that were not ours. My Little insisted on soup so she and I ended up sharing a hot pot and the boys with BBQ. Hindsight immediately kicked in as I realized the irony of not wanting to cook a Thanksgiving meal but still ending up cooking my own dinner. It was fun but to be completely honest, I would have preferred the BBQ. Our server cooked the BBQ for the fellas.

Little and I had beef, lamb and shrimp, along with loads of veggies and some noodz. Their sauce bar was scant my first visit but they restock often which as great. The best combo was mixing cilantro, scallion, chili, sesame oil/spicy oil and fresh garlic. It's a bomb combo and the only way I would get any spice since sharing the hotpot with a terror tot. The guys had duck, beef, pork belly, lamb, cow tongue and some veggies as well.

The BBQ was way better IMO as our hot pot burner kept turning off which was concerning. I will give it to our server, who was on top of it and when he noticed the burner was off, he immediately turned it back on and removed the lamb I had just placed on my kid's plate, returning it to the hotpot to cook. I had already begun eating it and hopefully I don't get sick (still good the day after) but that kind of turned me off to ordering any more red meat. The burner continuously turned off the entire meal so I had to make sure to watch for the blinking red lights, indicating that it needed to be turned back on. After the lamb fiasco, we had some orders of shrimp and called it a night.

I definitely could have eaten more but that burner turning off so often had me worried that the pot would not stay the temperature it needed to cook what was in the pot and to prevent anything already in the pot from causing us to get sick. I was not about to take the chance with the kiddo. We paid and left.

Since it was my birthday my meal was gratis which was nice. You're able to dine three days prior and three days after your birthday for your free meal as long as you're a party of four. I would like to try them again for BBQ but quite honestly, I prefer Korean BBQ with all of the yummy banchan condiments.

I loved this place! It was all you can eat and I paid $37 total. The food was pretty good quality, lamb especially were super soft and tender. The bottom section was kind of a bbq place where you cook your own. They also had a self-serve sauce bar were you make your own sauce on the bottom floor where it comes with complementary milk, buns, and condensed milk. I also saw jelly, but they ran out when I was there.

I really liked my section on the second floor because the room was really spacious (I came with a group of 11 lol) one thing is that you can order online and they bring you your food based on the order however, they are really slow with that and we ended up not getting some of the food we ordered. So you have to ask the waiter repeatedly for your food.

But honestly for the price, this place is a must try! Can beat it anywhere else. Oh an they give you 8% off if you pay with cash.

I really had a negative experience at this location a few months ago. We were there for my friend's birthday. She had made a reservation for 6. We needed more room, I let the girl at the front who was doing seating know we were there for a reservation and needed to add two seats and she said OK. It was a bit loud so I double checked and asked if it was possible and she said Ok Ok No problem. I also let her know we needed a table, or half booth, because  some of the people in our party would have a difficult time in a booth. At this time I also asked for permission to bring our own 2 Liter Soda botte. The Brooklyn location allowed us to bring our own soda when I had my birthday there and I wanted to double check, the same girl said it was ok.

When they sat us, they led us to....a 6 person booth in an elevated area. We tried to ask what was going on and explain, but they insisted we sit there, we managed to squeeze in but we werent too comfortable at all. One of our group was running late, and the other decided not to come when we let them know the table situation, but putting us into that situation was not professional. It became pretty obvious the girl at the front desk wasn't actually listening to what I said. When we asked for cups and opened our soda a manager came over to tell us not to, I explained we were given permission and the other issues with seating, he offered to move us, but at this point we were settled and had already ordered the first round of food, and it was pretty clear if he was going to move us to a larger table we'd have to go back up front to wait for them to clean it.

Finally, the food itself was alright, it wasn't really out of this world quality it was just normal acceptable food. Delicious. However ordering the food was a nightmare, their bar code system was confusing.

I also gotta say, there was clearly some racial tension in the air as I caught them giving my partner dirty looks and I saw an item they were serving other customers but claimed they didn't have. It was pretty obvious.

I love KBBQ and Hot Pot but I cannot in good taste recommend this location. The Brooklyn location is much better as far as customer service goes.

AYCE, order yourself on the phone hotpot for $30.. amaze deal!!

Standard hot pot and sauce options. Even had kimchi, sweet buns, fries, and fruit for free next to the sauce bar and free lil sweet candy and treats on the way out. Oh and a free yogurt digestive drink to cap it all off, great lil way to end the meal.

Can get busy, but can put ur name on waitlist and track it via website. Also lots of tables so waitlist moves quick.

We got the hot pot- three flavors and tray after tray of meat, noodles, and veggies. The ambiance was amazing so we rate highly even though we had no idea what we were doing (we didn't know you cook your own food here!)

(Overall: 95% | A) - 99 Favor Taste is a very unique restaurant in which you get free Hot Pot or KBBQ on your birthday if you bring a few friends along. The price is incredibly reasonable for AYCE hot pot in general, with an expansive menu and a large bar to make your own dipping sauce. Given the popularity, the service was a bit slow. The atmosphere is a bit cramped and if you are not here to troll your friends during their birthday, you might find the birthday song every 5 minutes a bit too much! Overall, I highly recommend taking someone here for their birthday -- it will be very memorable!

Usually come here for brithdays within the group as the birthday person eats free (on their birthday with no minimum of guests, or with a total party of 4 within 3 days before/after their birthday).

Good price for AYCE and there's a lot of options. Sauce bar also has good variety. There's seating upstairs and downstairs with some booths in more "private" rooms that fit larger parties.

I love that for hot pot everyone gets their own mini pot vs a big communal pot.

To order, you scan the QR code at your table and start selecting the items. Eveyrone at the table who scans is able to join the same "ordering form" and add to it in real time. I found it was easiest and best to have one person add all the orders.

The only complaint is that if an item is sold out, the ordering system doesn't tell you that. Our group would order 20+ items only for receive 70% of it and when asked where the remainder is, due to language barriers probably, the servers just point to the QR code and suggest we re-order. But when we do, the same missing items never arrive so we assume it's out of stock.

Great all you can eat spot. The restaurant is rather large in size and has two floors, which is nice. I like how you can choose between hotpot, bbq, or both. A good variety of tasty meats and veggies. You order on your phone. One person can order everything for the entire table on their phone. Just a note in case you double dip and get confused. It's easier to designate one person to order everything.

Don't forget that you eat for free on your birthday. A fun song plays while they bring you your ice cream birthday treat. Go on the weekend and that song will play at least 10 times while you're there lol.

Service is very subpar. They would forget things and you'd never see what you asked for.

Reserved a table for 9 online via google reserve. Pretty seamless process. We went there for an early dinner at 5:30pm. Place was half full already.  Because we were a large group, we were seated upstairs in a private like booth. It was good fun until it got really hot and steamy with the hotpot and bbq.

Everything was really enjoyable and I ate so much... would definitely come back here again.

FYI there are discounted rates for kids under a certain ages.

Unfortunately they removed the ice cream bar which was a bummer as we were looking forward to it afterwards.

TIP: have phone with enough battery. You order what you want via a website accessible from your phone.

The wait wasn't had on Saturday afternoon around 2pm. It's nice they seem to have made sure to kept all the tables socially distant. We got the all you can eat hot pot and it is literally all you can eat. Like other reviews said you will not get all that you ordered however it is easy to flag down a staff and they will bring out what you notice was missing. The staff was all very helpful.

The downside is the broth. We picked original and spicy. They both lacked flavor. The spicy wasn't spicy just looked like it was. It is nothing like the hot pot places in China's broth. Luckily, they did provided a good range of sauces we can pick from to give more flavor to the food.

Overall atmosphere and feel was very similar to China but not the flavor. I will need to try more hot pot places in search for better broth. It is worth trying.

food was really delicious! my friend and i got sat quickly on a busy sunday night. the restaurant wasn't overly loud. i feel like the cost justified the meal--i left sooo full.

one critique is to work on the vegetarian/non-pork soup bases! the veggie soup base was pretty bland when it arrived  but my friend was able to spice it up and make it tasty after adding seasonings and sauces from the bar.

but other than that, a great experience all around!

99 favor taste can help satisfy AYCE hot pot cravings for a reasonable price. You can eat as much as you like and the quality isn't too bad, but not amazing.

They have a hot pot, kbbq, and a hot pot & kbbq combo. I don't recommend the latter only cause you can go to an actual kbbq spot for that. I would choose hot pot and stick with that.

If I happen to be in that area and am craving AYCE hot pot, I would stop by.

This is my go-to hot pot place. For AYCE in New York City, this restaurant is incredibly affordable. The menu includes beef and pork options (they recently added in pork belly, much to my delight), seafood, veggies, noodles, and among other items. With their selection of sauces, you have enough to make yourself a nice little signature concoction.

I also appreciate the option to have individual pots (I like having my own, thank you!), which makes it easy for non-vegetarians and vegetarian friends to dine together.

The only aspect that could be improved here is the service. Mind you, this place gets VERY busy, which makes orders slow. Sometimes, orders won't come through their online ordering system, so you would have to re-order your items or ask the server for them again and again. But this one area of improvement isn't enough for me to quit this place. It's a go-to!

Second time here, with a five-person group, even though we'd planned to eat elsewhere that night. 99 Favor had availability for hotpot after a 30-min wait, and we were just too hungry to consider anything else. I'll keep this review shot (my previous one is longer). The service is good, and the price for AYCE hotpot over here cannot be beaten! As for the food itself, it's standard hotpot food, without being overly fantastic, but certainly hitting the right spot. The sauce making station over here is one the big plusses!

Fast and efficient service. All ordering is done via phone which made our meal even better. All you can eat is the best when it comes to hot pot!

The servers were super friendly and attentive.

The second we walked in, we were drawn by the wafting aromas of meat, fried vegetal protein, and deep rich broth. We had just returned to New York from the Dominican Republic and were craving hot pot while in customs, so we Ubered straight to here with our luggage.

99 Favor Taste is an iconic hot-pot staple in New York.

This place is cavernous compared to your traditional mom-and-pop hot-pot restaurants in New York City. Spacious and comfortable, modern yet a bit gimmicky with the intermittent birthday mascot, it doesn't take away any points for this popular joint.

It's also a plus that you can order hot pot and BBQ.

Service was quick, not all that personable, but sufficient for a hot pot restaurant.

The fried tofu skin, winter melon, caviar fish cake pockets, and squid are topping my list. We also had requisite lamb, beef, fuzhou and fish balls, fish cake, shrooms, vermicelli, tripe, etc. We opted for half spicy and half pork bone broth.

All in all, this is the best budget hot-pot that doesn't feel budget-y, but there are a few cons, as mentioned by other Yelpers:

1. The "clean" plates were not clean. I understand this restaurant's profit margins are thin, and they rely heavily on getting people in and out, but, unfortunately, sanitation was an issue here. Be wary of the "clean" plates they have set up by the sauce bar.

2. Some broth options (especially the pork bone) could be better. Avoid pork bone broth at all costs. As others mentioned, it's just water with a few peppers. Different from what we were expecting.

3. As others mentioned, don't expect high-quality meat here. Not a single bit. You'll get semi-frozen, bottom-shelf slices of beef. Vegetables? Honestly, not the freshest. But I can't ding them for that, given the price point. For under $30 per person for AYCE, this is, by far, the best you can get in New York City.

We landed in JFK quite late at night and only had a few hot-pot options, so we went with 99 Favor Taste. Will we come back? Likely not. Was it still worth it? Absolutely!

I'll be honest - I did not have particularly high expectations when I finally got around to coming here for a friend's birthday celebration but am very pleased to have been proven wrong!

Firstly, this place is HUGE. The restaurant goes pretty far back - there're a ton of seating options and even private rooms for larger parties.

The food was pretty good and came really quick. Unlike some other AYCE places which will scale their portion sizes to the size of your group (sometimes a good thing, sometimes bad), this place lets you decide how much of everything you want.

The ordering system is pretty good - you order via their website by scanning your table's QR code (don't worry if your cell signal drops, they have wifi). On the webpage you can add your orders to a 'cart' and 'check out' when ready as a table. You can have multiple people ordering at the same time. Just be careful to coordinate your orders so you don't accidentally double up.

Their selection was pretty decent too.

I recommend coming with a group of friends. Bonus points if you are celebrating a birthday as that person gets to dine for free (so long as there are 3 others).
My favorite Hopot in New York, The service is cool, and nice decoration, it's a fun places to eat here. I love the environment. I would Love to come back. Food is stasty.

Came here on a Monday night with a few friends. Convenient location right off Grand St. The restaurant is large and very busy but we didn't have a wait. For an all you can eat place for $30pp, it is a pretty good deal- I would just make sure to come hungry!

I usually go to hometown hotpot but my friends wanted to come to 99 because of its slightly cheaper price (~$4 cheaper for hotpot) and more options (seafood at hometown costs extra). We came on a Saturday at 5:30 pm and were promptly seated. There is a QR code at every table where you order the broth and food from. Everything came pretty quickly and the portion sizes are larger than most AYCE places. I like how each item had its own plate (most AYCE places I've been to just throw everything onto the same plate).
I thought my broth (herbal) could be more flavorful and the meat quality could be better but pretty good experience overall. Would definitely come back!

At 29.99 for AYCE Hotpot in NY, overall it is pretty worth it if you're hungry. However, they were out of stock of the one of the more meats, including the Angus beef. Inside, the restaurant is well air-conditioned, and the staff was busy on a Tuesday night. The interior is quite well designed and minimal. Depending on the table that you get, you can do multiple individual pots. Overall pretty standard and nothing really stood out to me but it's a good place to go if you're hungry for hot pot.

Food: I absolutely loved everything here. The meats were all fresh and tender, the sides were also really good. We got the AYCE BBQ & Hot Pot Set so we were able to enjoy both boiling and grilling our meats. The menu has a lot of variety which gave us an opportunity to taste everything. We also had variety with our individual hot pot broths so that we could try three different broths and everything was so good!

Ambiance: The ambiance is really chill and I love dim lighting in the place. It makes it feel a lot cozier which was exactly what I usually feel when having hot pot and/or barbecue. It definitely matched the food and made the overall vibe a lot better.

I only come here during my birthday to take advantage of the free birthday meal because of how much they have raised their prices.

Hotpot- 27.99
bbq- 30.99
Hotpot and bbq- 37.99

Besides that, I came here on Tuesday at 6pm and it wasn't busy at all. We didn't make reservations and was seated immediately. Staff and service was fast and friendly. Staff always came to check up on us and see if we needed more water or water for the pot. I highly recommend getting the seafood pancake which is really delicious! It use to be free and include in the ayce but now it's an extra $2, if you want it, which isn't too bad or expensive. For hotpot everyone gets their individual pot and you order on your phone through a QR code!
Can't beat a free birthday meal! Huge variety of sauces. Hot Pot broth was delicious. Gyoza appetizer very good also. Skip the KBBQ, I thought the Hot Pot was better.

It's hard to go wrong with an AYCE place, especially when it's reasonably priced! I'm happy to say that everything here was great both times that I came. They offer bbq or hot pot, and I did the hot pot option both times I went. The meat is all fresh, and everything is just really reliably good. They offer a free meal for whoever comes on their birthday, but I think you have to be in a group of at least 4 people (please double check)! Hot pot is perfect in the winter, and I'll definitely be back soon! Again, I recommend making a reservation because they get quite busy!

Solid AYCE hotpot location, serves big parties well and simple way to order and receive food through smartphone app makes a lot of sense. None of the flavors are too crazy or unique but all the broths and mix ins are exactly what you would expect. Price is also not unreasonable, fixed entry price around $20-25 per person.

We got 4 slices of pizza - 2 extra cheese, a mushroom and a pepperoni with a bottle of water for $6.75. First of all, that price is unbeatable. That's what I pay for one slice of pizza in the Bay Area.

Secondly extra cheese pizza was delicious. The pizza crust was so good, soft and tasted really fresh. It was perhaps one of the best cheese pizzas I've ever had.

Pepperoni and mushroom were also okay but extra cheese pizza is the showstopper!
One of the teenager's fav memory of NY! Pizza was quick, delicious, and one heck of a deal. Loved the crispy crust.
Good, cheap NYC pizza. Quick service, and it isn't trying to be anything more than it is.
Really convenient to have a $1 pizza slice shop right by the East Broadway subway entrance. They also sell soda, water, chicken wings, and some other fast food.

The pizza is fine. The wait however is interminable. There's always only one person working, and if you want anything more than whatever's out, you're gonna have to wait at LEAST half an hour. He'll tell you 10 minutes, but I've been waiting nearly 45 minutes for 4 pies (and they don't take phone call orders). This is the third time this has happened. You think I would learn.
Classic New York pie and so inexpensive.  Definitely worth your time.  You can get an 18" cheese pie for ten bucks for a great late night snack.

They're also known as BD NYC Pizza. I got the chicken pizza with white meat chicken. It was $2. It was very good and a decent sized slice. 10/10 would do it again. So happy that there's a place with good pizza and agreeable prices!

Completely unprofessional and lacking morals. The guy who served me my pizza also "helped" two women in front of me and said he knew them as "the skinny one and the fat one" to their faces even though they were reoccurring customers. It made me sick that someone would treat a customer who has paid good money at an establishment like that. I hope she takes her business elsewhere, because I know I will from now on. No one has the right to make you feel uncomfortable in your body.
Do better because this was just an embarrassing example of how we think we can treat women and people.

I order three cheese pizza on May 31 2021 for my family and me the worker or the boss selling me the burn pizza on the back when I take the pizza home and check on it. How can your make my pizza burn whole black like that worst pizza store! Don't go this. Place ever again go eat the burn pizza on u self or throw to the garbage fuc this place !

Food is decent but with other 99 cent pizza places around the corner the extra mile is so worth it as I've eat an there before, he put the pizza back in the oven after I told him my order so the bottom is a little burnt. 2 stars cause it is what it says it is just not the best around.

My favorite place in NYC! Best food vibes and drinks.
Always consistent service with the friendliest staff.
A must place in New York for brunch or dinner.

I made a last minute reservation for dinner here one night, and there was plenty of availability. The service was fairly fast and attentive when we arrived. We got the tomato garlic hummus to start, and omg wow. One of the best hummuses I've ever had. You definitely can't skip the hummus and fresh pita here.

For my main, I ordered the duck tacos. These had really great reviews, but I will say I wasn't super impressed by them personally. The duck was a little dry for my taste (but clearly it tasted better to others, so to each their own). I would still return, but I might try a different main next time.

Our visit to this restaurant for lunch was truly a delightful experience. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by a server who exuded warmth and cheerfulness. Throughout our meal, he made sure we were well taken care of, enhancing our overall dining experience.

As for the food, I opted for the spicy falafel burger, while my husband went for the chicken dish. My falafel burger arrived with a side of perfectly cooked fries, and every bite was a burst of deliciousness. The burger patty was cooked to perfection, with a medley of flavors that truly impressed me. The fries, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, were an excellent accompaniment.

My husband's chicken shawarma dish, which came with a side of salad, also received high marks. The flavors were on point, and he thoroughly enjoyed it.

Beyond the delectable food and friendly service, the restaurant's ambiance stood out. It offered a welcoming and eclectic atmosphere that added to the charm of our meal. If you find yourself in SoHo and crave a taste of eclectic cuisine, this restaurant is a fantastic choice. It encapsulates the essence of New York-style dining, making it a must-visit for those seeking a diverse and enjoyable culinary experience in the city.

Came here for a solo late lunch and sat at the bar. The place has a very fun atmosphere and it feels like you're hanging out at someone's house party almost. I had a delicious spicy passion fruit margarita and then the chicken skewer, which was amazing and very well seasoned. I had a great espresso after my meal (always good to know there is an espresso machine). Love this place for good food and fun vibes!

The place was very pretty. Thought it was odd they did cancellation fee considering it's just a normal restaurants. Services was good. Couldn't really tell what concept this place was going for they had Mediterranean items but also pasta. But really enjoyed the burrata it was creamy, sweet, spicy etc. the gnocchi was pretty good too and the chicken schwarma was okay. It was a very large pita but the flavors didn't stick for me. Then it's end up soggy.

We loved this place! Hummus, smoked eggplant dish, bread, falalfal, chicken skewers were all a 10/10. I got the spritz cocktail and it was delicious. Service was pretty good as well. This place is underrated! There's also a cheesecake place next to it to that's the best so that's a huge plus. I will come  back when I visit nyc again! Highly recommend!

This place is amazing!!! I rarely go to a restaurant twice in NYC unless I really enjoy it and I couldn't wait to come back. Items I've tried and recommend:
 - duck tacos (a must have!) so juicy and flavorful
 - chicken schnitzel (probably one of the best schnitzel I've ever had, even the mashed potato that comes with it is to die for)
 - gnocchi so good
 - their falafel!! Best I've ever had, truly. And i don't even like falafel but it was so nicely crispy on the outside

Came here for a family members birthday and we really enjoyed the food. We came on a Friday night (at 7pm) and the place was bumping and loud, so you'll definitely want to be mindful of that type of setting.

Food-wise, we got a few different dishes to split, with our favorites being the octopus, hummus with chicken, and the ramp carbonara special. We also got a few cocktails, and the table favorite was the Clover club.

The service was friendly but a little chaotic. The restaurant clearly didn't read my notes or even acknowledge that the reservation was made for a birthday (not expecting anything food / drink-wise, but a "hey happy birthday, we are happy you chose to celebrate with us" would've made the dinner feel more special).

Overall - would come back for a date night or fun night out to catch up with friends, but probably not for a special occasion.
An afternoon snack at one of my fa  We really wanted to try the Yemen duck tacos but I didn't have room.

Best dinner I've had so far in NYC!! First off, the staff is so friendly and welcoming. They were helpful with our questions about the menu and gave great recommendations. The restaurant was lively and overall a great experience, I will be coming back with friends!

I came here with a party of 4 on a Saturday around 11am. We were able to get seated but were given an hour to eat which was fine with us since we didn't have a reservation.

2 of us ordered the boureka and the other 2 ordered the hummus. I ordered the tomato garlic hummus and it was delicious!! I especially loved the garlic pieces. The pitas that came with the hummus (2 pieces per hummus) were warm and so soft. It was surprisingly filling because the hummus was creamy.

The bourekas were pretty tiny for the price point. It was definitely not filling for the other two so they had to get more food somewhere else. The bourekas were tasty but not sure if it's worth the price.
Excellent food and drinks, great location and ambience. Would definitely go back. Highly recommend!
Excellent nosh, on the small side but wasn't crowded when we got there (definitely filled up as the night went on). Would definitely recommend.

Randomly stopped for a light bite and drink before heading to a baseball game. The place is very cute vibe and staff is very welcoming. They have us two free falafel balls as an appetizer and I order the octopus salad which was cooked to prefection. It was a good portion and light to eat. My partner has a jack and coke and I had their red wine to accompany it. The ambiance is very chill and romantic, would recommend to others try.

The hummus is in fact delicious and comes with a generous portion. However, that's about the only thing they are generous with portion wise especially for the price. The mushroom cigar was $19 for one small skinny piece. You're essentially paying for the tahini. $37 for 3 small lamb chops that were average that once again came with a much larger container of tzatziki. All of this extra dip would be great with pita right? They'll charge you for extra. I also ordered the $22 stuffed sardine special but got a $26 dish of plainly fried sardines and fries.

The prices might be more reasonable for brunch but my group was very disappointed at the quality for the price point of dinner.

The hummus is what dreams are made of! My absolute favorite hummus from a restaurant. Fries & fatush salad are classics here! Vibes are great, service is fine but food makes up for it! definitely make a resy

Brunch at 19 Cleveland was everything!!! The staff are amazing, super friendly and fun. The food is unique and so mouthwateringly delicious. Ambiance is hip, bright and lively. I'd go back again and again, it was just that good!

I ordered to go. I got the burrata, ceviche, papardelle.
The burrata was okay. Ceviche and the papardelle was really good. I would definitely recommend eating here. I ordered over the phone and they told me 15-20 minutes. I got there at 20 minutes. But had to wait about 45 minutes or more. The food and ambiance seem great when I went to pickup. But I think they didn't do the order until I arrived to pay for it. I waited in front and outside for it. And the front person had to go check 2-3 times while I was there waiting the whole time. If I called in advance to pickup it should be ready. It felt like they only started it when I got there. A burrata and ceviche doesn't take long. You don't need to cook it. Only thing that needs to be cooked is the paradelle  which is pasta. It does not take 45 mins to cook that. I would come back to try the food in person. But that was ridiculous for the wait. The front staff at the counter was not that friendly. Just kept avoiding my gaze as I'm waiting. Or else I would have given the papardelle a 4 star and the ceviche also. The burrata was soso.

Great service and the food was delicious! Had the fish shawarma and duck tacos. Food came very quickly and the pancake like taco was incredible. Outdoor seating was really nice and you receive a scratch off card to win a prize at the ice cream shop next door! We won a free mini ice cream cone :) highly recommend

Noms:
Delicious Mediterranean at a cute place! Ordered the tomato garlic hummus which came with pita bread. The hummus was pretty good, but the pita bread was so so delicious and thick! Ended up filling me for 2 meals so the price was worth it.

Looks/Service:
Cute brunch place and perfect for bringing visitors/for tourists. Staff was friendly.
Cute lil restaurant with great service and great food for sharing! The hummus was soo good with a little kick of heat
We went to the place for lunch with our family and got served absolutely gorgeous! The waiter was super friendly and the food was great for a reasonable price. Highly recommend place!

TLDR: A fun and fresh spot for Israeli fare!

I highly recommend ordering the hummus with rotisserie chicken. It was absolutely delicious and packed a flavorful punch with every bite. The baba ghanoush was refreshing but wish that it was served with pita instead of stand alone.
Yummy! Highly recommend to check it out. Very close to authentic Mediterranean food. Great location in soho.

Was super excited to finally get a reservation at 19 cleveland and came with a friend! We ordered a mix of dishes to share which were kind of hit or miss. The hit was 1000% the rotisserie chicken hummus - the chicken was flavorful and juicy and the hummus was so so creamy and rich with amazing flavor. It was perfect with the warm pita. Would definitely go back for this dish only!!
We also shared the smoked eggplant which was their take on babaghanoush. It was definitely good but quite expensive.
We decided to share the lamb tortellini special ($28 for a tiny plate) which was not great. The pasta was thick and dry. The meat itself was also a bit dry and needed the sauce, which was pretty flavorful and good. Definitely not worth the price.
The space felt super cramped and small which I did not enjoy, but is cute. I would come back for brunch but maybe not dinner!! Will be thinking about that hummus, which is what bumped up the rating for sure.

Super cute spot in soho! Stopped here for lunch after a busy morning. The place is super cute, the weather was great so we sat outside. The ceviche was my favorite, super tasty and had lots of flavor. We actually enjoyed dipping the pita bread in it! The hummus has a beautiful presentation but it lacked flavor. It's very nutty and a little bland. The roasted tomatoes were a nice touch. The chicken was also very flavorful. Definitely on the salty side though. Regardless it was a filling meal for sure. We were very full. It's on the pricier side for a lunch spot since the portions (ceviche & hummus) were pretty small.
Vibe and staff are great. Salads and schnitzel are amazing. Cappuccino was tasty too. Came in with my dog and they sat us inside and were so welcoming. Loved it here!
The KINDEST and warmest people and the most fabulous food. The vegetables to the fish are outstanding, but you really can't go wrong.
Best Mediterranean in NYC and the staff is lovely. Make sure you make reservations. Suggestion is to order family style to try a little of everything.

This is my second time here for dinner. Food and Vibe is always amazing . Fun and friendly staff . They have a great dessert place a few doors down. Come check this place out if your around soho. Also lunch was catered from this place for my job. Didn't get to take a photo of the food but their burger is delicious and gnocchi is a must try !
Best Israeli food in the city - I love all of their dishes truly couldn't go wrong. Highly recommend the hummus and all of the meat dishes

At 19 Cleveland, you'll be treated to a celebration of vibrant flavors and rich traditions from Tel Aviv, expertly crafted to create an unforgettable dining experience. Get ready to be transported to the lively streets of Tel Aviv, as this restaurant captures the essence of this vibrant city right in the heart of Nolita.

I ordered the Chicken Schnitzel($27). It came with a very nice side salad. It also came with mashed potatoes. They tasted boxed, but not as good as when I make boxed potatoes at home. The chicken schnitzel was good. It was very thin and very crispy. The texture was perfect. I might be in the minority but I think it would be much better with some kind of side sauce. I just think it needed more of something for me to feel it was worth the $27, but the bigger issue is that it was just a lackluster meal.

I wouldn't order the Chicken Schnitzel again. If I ever do come back, it might be for one of their specials. Those seem to be well put together from what I noticed on other peoples plates.

But I do not think I will eat here again. Still, it's a nice clean spot that's probably worth eating at again if I'm in a pinch. They had some healthier looking meal options.
Incredible place, great food! Service is amazing and people are wonderful. Thank you so much!

Perfect place for a big group dinner. Fun atmosphere, fun drinks, easy shareable food. The hamachi ceviche and hummus really shined with my group while we finished off the evening with shots! The staff was very helpful especially in what seemed to be a more upbeat environment. We will definitely be coming back!

Need to know: perfect spot to start your evening before going out with a large group

Must order: hamachi ceviche, hummus
Outstanding food service and vibe!!! This is truly a staple in our house! Super fresh and always delish!

Went for a birthday with a large group of people doing a pre-fix menu. We split apps from humus, falafel, ceviche, burrata etc. Really loved the ceviche was nice and fresh! For mains had gnocchi, cauliflower, branzino, and schnitzel to split amongst the group. My favorite was the branzino. Lastly topped it off with a white cake. Overall was really lovely and enjoyed the food. Service was good especially with the group we had. Recommend

-cute atmosphere
- nice servers
- had the whole downstairs for large group
-preset menu
- lots of options on the menu which was great
- did 2 drink,1 shot with apps/dinner/dessert
-loved ceviche and branizo fish (fish person)
- other food was good too
- fast pace for amount of food dishes and coordination

19 Cleveland is a long-time favorite of mine and I've enjoyed several tasty lunches at this Soho gem.
 
The laid-back atmosphere and music are a welcome reprieve from the hustle-and-bustle of SoHo. The staff is friendly and relaxed but this doesn't diminish from a quick and efficient dining experience.  I have tasted several items on the weekday lunch menu and everything has been delicious.
 
My latest lunch selection:
Grilled Chicken Sandwich with a salad
- This is one of the most delicious grilled chicken sandwiches I have eaten

What a cool spot to have dinner! We made a res for Friday night and it was pretty packed with a super trendily dressed crowd (great place to get fancy). My lamb dish was on the drier & fattier side but they have INCREDIBLE hummus. Highly recommend to get it with the veggies, which are a variety of carrots, radish, fennel, tomatoes, etc. Drinks are great as well. They had a magician do tricks from table to table so that was a fun surprise!

I came here for apps and drinks and LOVED my food. The calamari is SO GOOD here! And the fries are excellent as well. And the vibe is great if you sit outside. A cool neighborhood, lots of people watching, seating is cute and comfortable and not crowded next to other customers. They also gave us each one falafel while we were waiting for our appetizers, which I loved. My drink was excellent as well. I will definitely be back here to try more food and re order that calamari! I highly recommend this spot.

This was a pretty solid place for Israeli fusion food, although a bit pricey for the portion size.  I got the cheeseburger which was actually cooked perfectly and my company got a schnitzel that also was nice and fresh.  The hummus was also great (we got
spicy garlic one to share) - had a nice kick and with the fresh pita it was a great appetizer.  The drinks were also good but very expensive - $17-18 cocktails is a bit pricey for the size.  Overall I would come back with friends, maybe for brunch to switch things up!

I've walked in a bunch of times here now-- always consistently good and vivacious energy!

We came after some shopping for a late lunch Sunday. I always get the same thing... chicken rotisserie hummus because it's so delicious. I need to force myself to change it up next time. We also got the chicken skewers which were cooked so perfectly I was quite surprised. Ooooh and the fries!!! You must order some.. perfect thin and crispy.

Drinks and food are reasonably priced. Will be back here many more times I'm sure

I was skeptical when I went to this place, but I was pleasantly surprised! The burger was very juicy and dense. I loved the flavors and definitely left full and content. The truffle fries were also delicious. Nice and crispy and well seasoned. The ambiance was fun but a little intense. The service is fine and didn't add or detract from the experience. I would definitely recommend this place for a solid juicy burger and good and casual time.

Visited 19 Cleveland on a Friday night around 630 PM. We had a reservation, and were seated quickly even though we arrived a little early.

The food was delicious - we tried the garlic tomato hummus, fried calamari, and spicy falafel burger. Everything was tasty and well-portioned, we especially loved the spicy falafel burger!

A star is docked here because the overall service was not up to par. We noticed servers/bussers continuously eyeing our table. Multiple of them came over and asked us if we were finished even though we clearly had a significant amount of food left, and had only been eating for 15 or so minutes! It felt like they were in a rush/wanted us to leave...which struck us the wrong way, especially since servers were stopping to take shots with other tables. The overall environment from this made us a bit uncomfortable, and for that reason, I'm probably not going to be coming back here.
Randomly came across this place today and was nervous to try, but it was AMAZING! This place is going to be one of my go-to's from now on. Can't wait to come back and try their dinner!
