Great food and cocktails - been here for brunch, lunch, and dinner! Lovely vibe inside, pretty small but great ambiance. For dinner I highly recommend the gnocchi Istanbul or the spicy falafel burger

It was my one day in Manhattan, and 19 Cleveland served up exactly the delicious Israeli Sunday brunch I've been craving.  So satisfying.  
Very cute Mediterranean-styled Soho cafe, hipster waitstaff.  It was easy to get a table on a Sunday afternoon, we didn't need a reservation.  Once sat, they were attentive to our every need.
Everything on the brunch menu looked soooo good, it was hard to decide what to order.  I went with Jachnun, a traditional Yemenite dish I always wanted to try, and the fish shawarma.  My brother got the roasted tomato hummus, which seems to be the restaurant's most popular dish, and short rib boureka Benedict.
Jachnun, flaky rolled pancakes served with a slow cooked egg and labneh, grated tomato, and zhoug, was a delight; the flavors of the accompaniments were so fresh and bright, zhoug gave a spicy kick.  
Fish shawarma was my favorite thing we tried -- fish was buttery, very well seasoned.  Soft strings of onions enhanced the spiced sauce, tahini provided a nutty creaminess.    I didn't notice any sumac as was listed on the menu, but it didn't matter, I loved the dish anyway.  I combined it with some of my bro's roasted tomato hummus, which was expertly done, great counterpoint of creamy and caramelized flavors from garlic and charred tomato.  
Wish I had appetite for dessert but we were pleasingly stuffed by that point.  I did try a cocktail that was a mash up of my two favorite cocktails, aperol spritz and mezcal Paloma, it was fruity and refreshing, graced with a playful striped straw.

Been here so many times, and one review wont be enough! Love the vibe, location and service. Friendly staff. Always try to get a resy! Walk-ins may have long wait or no luck.
Not always a 5/5 but average is still 5! Good place for vegetarian as well as anyone with some dietary restrictions. My husband loves the falafel burger. Our fav is the tomato hummus!
If you have a good appetite or have a larger group to share food, then don't miss the cauliflower. Every bite has oozing flavors!
I tried the pastas, but honestly not a fan of any of the pastas in this restaurant.
The eggplant appetizer is delicious but maynot be for everyone, if you are looking for babaganoush then this is not the right dish.

Kind of a vibey brunch spot that doesn't get a lot of traction; only a matter of time before it blows up. Food was solid enough for vegetarians, their falafel burger was pretty good. My biggest issue with this place is the service; super slow and very disappointing. Also, my friend and the waiter were talking and mentioned he was going to bring us out some Ouzo, implying it was complimentary but ended up charging us a bunch for it. Really disappointing. Food might be worth the trip but swerve if you care about service.

If I could give this place zero stars I would. I made a reservation for a Thursday night for 2 people at 7:15. I arrived and the hostess told me that the only tables they have are outside. I laughed because it was freezing and no one was doing outdoor dining there. I told her we'd probably leave but I'd wait until my friend arrives to decide (mostly since it was freezing out and I didn't want to leave).

My friend ended up coming from drinks with another friend who knows the owner of 19 Cleveland and her friend said he would help us get a table inside. I waited a bit for them to arrive and the hostesses kept glaring at me and made me feel very uncomfortable. i kept getting the feeling that because I didn't look or dress a certain way they didn't want me at the restaurant. One of them came over to say "what's up" while I waited and to remind me they weren't going to give me a table inside.. despite my reservation. Finally my friend arrived with her friend who immediately spotted the owner, and told him the situation- 20 seconds later he leads us downstairs and there are multiple empty tables!!! The hostesses looked SO angry as he led us to the table....

Once we were seated, the servers proceeded to rush us out - we left in a little over an hour. They were trying to clear our drinks and food before we were even finished. I asked for a to-go box and was in the middle of putting my meal in the box when they grabbed the plate from underneath me.

This was definitely my first and last time dining here. I've never encountered service so hostile before. Plenty of other better Mediterranean spots in the city.
Love this place - Great vibes, amazing tequila shots, good music. Great limes for the tequila shots!

Not particularity dive prices, but definitely dive atmosphere and decorations, unfortunately this goes for the odd/very forward and uncomfortable service as well. Interesting to see recent reviews and this has been brought up a bunch! Fine for a casual hang, get interesting and cute pics for a short amount of earlier in the night for the neighborhood where you can pop into somewhere better fast. There is a minimum for a credit card, but high drink/shot prices make this easy to hit I guess. I stuck to the canned beer options, which were pretty decent. Seems like more of a regulars kind of place.

Popped in on my own and enjoyed the scene.

Nice and knowledgable staff.

Would try again.

Tip: happy hour needs more love

This review is strictly for the Hurricane drink. It was my first time at 169 bar. It's honestly a really cool bar inside, your able to sit yourself. There are no waiters, so you just go up to the bartender and order your drinks.

The place would be a good if your into beers and happy hour. However being that it's New Orleans themed I specifically came here expecting to get a Hurricane that would resemble one in New Orleans.

The bartender who made my drink did a terrible job, the worst hurricane I ever had. Tasted more like an orange juice with some liqueur which was very acidic.

Very rarely do I leave a place feeling like I wasted my money however this was one of those rare times.

I only gave them a 2/5 being that the ambience was cool.

2/5 stars, hurricanes are bad

Went with a couple of friends for happy hour and got some beers. Bartender made some comments about our younger ages but that is understandable. Didn't seem like he wanted to serve us when I asked menu questions. After the first round he would not serve us because not everyone in our party tipped. It's a beer, that's not something that needs a tip. Refused to serve us after that. Even called us out- not professional at all. An attitude adjustment would probably lead to a better tip. Place was nice though- a bit divey. I'd come back if it wasn't the same bartender. Good happy hour for sure. So not all bad!

It's very divey, but very cute. The lighting is what attracted us here and the great prices is what kept us. They have a ton of drink specials and you can add a shot with any beer for $3

I'm just gonna say it, the pool table is weird. From afar it's a cool cheetah-print pool table and then you realize it's not velvet, but actually like wallpaper on the pool table? We didn't play, but it wouldn't be your average game...

There's a backyard too that was really cute

Overall great place to stop in if you're having a night out

The rare two star

How does a place even get two stars? I mean...

One star we all get. Something absolutely horrible happened, and the place was a dick about it.

Five stars, four stars, both make sense. perfect or damn close.

Three stars. Blah, nice enough and "at least you tried"

But 2 stars?

Nothing particularly horrible happened. I mean, did I stand there awkwardly as the one bartender talked to his buddies about some random vape and tattoo shit while the other attended to children illegally drinking at a bar? Yes, but whatever. Was the beer too expensive? I mean a, a little, but nothing crazy. I dunno, I guess this place sucked, really really badly, but just because they suck. They aren't dicks, they didn't do it on purpose. they're just bad at what they do, which given this is a dive bar is pretty fucking hard to do. Isn't that the point of a dive? Yes it's shit hole, but the bartender is cool, the beer is cheap and the music is good. This place is lacking in all three of those categories, but not on purpose.

If you're down here, go literally anywhere else, unless you're a fan of complete mediocrity. If you are, you'll love it here, say get to Chad the bartender (I'm not sure what his actual name is, but you'll know who I'm talking about, promise)
Nice bar, but the drinks are not dive bar prices. $18 for a jack and coke. They have a lot of cocktails to choose from their menu. Closer to a cocktail bar, in divey atmosphere
OHHHHMMYYYYYYYYGaUDDDDDDD this bar has a pickle martini and a $10 minimum for credit card and a cheetah pool table and it's incredible that's all you need to know.

One of the bartenders made me very uncomfortable tonight. It was extremely unprofessional & unacceptable behavior but seemed to be the general vibe behind the bar. I won't be coming back and will advise my friends to avoid.

Specializing in canned beer, picklebacks and a strong cast of characters in front and behind the bar, 169 is unparalleled in the city when it comes to entertainment value. There is something about the chaotic energy of this spot. Tip the bartenders and stay on Ian's good side.

There are so many other options for bars to go to in this neighborhood. We wanted to go somewhere basic that wasn't scene-y. We thought it was great when we scored a table outside, since the interior is so loud. But the bouncer had a large group of friends hanging out with him playing music on their phones talking over each other. The one bar tender we had was disgusting, used his gross dirty fingers to fish out olives for our martinis. Just total lack of care. And lots of attitude. Also change your door to the exterior from being a pull open, it makes it hard for people to walk out carrying more than one drink in their hands!!!!

Came in Friday, Sean was great!!! Was really annoyed by the fact that a co-worker there was trying to sell me his weird merch while I was trying to relax at the bar with my friends. Would only come back to this bar to visit the bartender.

If i could give 0 stars I would. THAT bar tender... and I am sure it is not difficult to figure out which one. Has the most disgusting and unprofessional attitude ever. My friends and I have faced several disrespectful encounters with that bitter man. I have attempted to give this spot a couple tries since it is so close to me, but at this point I'd rather walk to Europe than come here. This bartender has internal issues to deal and heal from. Wish him the best, however do not wish him employment at this establishment. P.S. this bar tender is the sole reason around 30 ish people i know, will not come here anymore. Stay blessed !
This bald dude there is cool as fuck he makes these really good drinks lol also there's always pretty girls there

This is a regular haunt for me.

Cheap drinks, eclectic crowd, good vibes all around. It's divey and a little broken on the hinges but there is so much love in this place. I feel that every time I walk in the door. (Which is super interesting given the bar's history- look it up if you're interested.)

Don't expect the best cocktail of your life, but that's not what 169 is for. Come for a good time.

4.8/5
Could be a cool dive bar, but run like a nanny state. No pool after 9 - bouncer has a go at you if you try to play. Don't order the wrong thing. Bad vibes
Had a blast coming here! The bar staff was hilarious and had us rolling, in between great drinks and affordable brews.

Cozy dive bar with great prices and cool vibes. Tati and Modesto are the sweetest and Sean is hot and got some silly dad jokes. Regulars are being treated like family here and everyone is welcome to join it .

When I first got here I wasn't quite sure why it's so popular. It's a very normal dive bar. The longer I was there the more I realized that part of the reason it's so popular is because everyone knows it's popular so then everyone goes there and then it's wonderful. It's a Ponzi scheme with no end, which is a good thing.
Quality dive even if the guy out front in the Supreme gear is a bit more holier than thou than necessary. The bartenders are nice. The beers are good and the shots are good too.
Rude bartender! Rude people!! We had an awful time yesterday!! Really bad vibes! They even turned a little racist towards my friends and I!
Horrible service, I tipped 20% and the bartender withheld my credit card because I didn't give anymore. As a tourist that's unacceptable, he humiliated me and my friends

Bar tenders are very rude, they don't give you your beverage even if you already pay it, they expect more than 20%, and if you don't give them that they don't give you your beverage, so the owners are loosing money with those type of bar tenders who treat really bad the clients.
The bouncer and the bartenders were both rude. Zero class. Will never come back. Cocktails also sucked.

169's team lost my credit card and then tried to deny that they did - so when I accessed and showed their team in my bank account, they saw a credit card transaction on my statements. This was while I was on my 2nd drink and was not what I ordered as I expected my tab to be open.

When I tried to figure out what happened the new bartender named Sean kept telling me my friends took it ( By the way- they didn't - I called them! )

Super weird to open a bar tab for the bartender to NOT REMEMBER OPENING MY TAB UNTIL I SHOW HIM MY BANK ACCOUNT TRANSACTIONS.

Great that he remembered after I was showing my transactions. But not great when he told me I had to cancel the card and was NOT nice about it after the mistake.

LOOK- I love 169. I have been here for over a decade as after hours being friends and my staff. And I live in the area. The venue has always been amazing. But the recent staff and with how they treat people ON BASIC professionally is going south and I would give it it more a better light a review I'd it wasn't such a horrible experience.
The place has a unique atmosphere and provides the opportunity for a pick into the local style. One consideration though is that it has a B rating for the kitchen facilities.
this is hands down the best dive in the city. the bartenders are the best, the drinks are strong, and vibes are always exquisite

Love this bar for so many years until tonight-- the bouncer working the evening of 11/21 started weird carding me every time I came in and out of the bar though I had showed proof more than once to the bar tender who was on shift before he was on shift -- meanwhile he smokes weed non stop right in front of the bar- who cares  no prob with the weed -- but when I was coming in to use the bathroom and my bar tender had my phone charging he still shouted "vaxx card" - bro how I'm gonna show you a vaxx card if my phone is charging with bar tender and who admitted me. if he was doing his job I've been there all night and my vaxx card has been showed numerous times tonight. Get rid of him man. You can get many big dudes to scare people, He can go smoke weed down the block with his big chunky self.

Everything else as has for years has been excellent but that bouncer he has one job and showing vax cards more than once with an angry arrogant bounce not worth it.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Would give zero starts if possible. Absolutely awful customer service. Everyone in here is extremely bitchy and the drinks are awful.

When my friend had made a complaint, the woman claiming to be the MANAGER threatened to be PHYSICALLY VIOLENT with her.

If you're in the area, go to Clockwork instead, where you'll actually receive good service and cheap drinks.

Just made it back to this place after almost 10 years and wasn't going to update my review but then I read a bunch of reviews recently they were very negative so I decided to get my two cents

Me and my buddy had an absolutely amazing time here just the other day and the service was great everyone was super friendly and the atmosphere was perfect we went on a Monday and it was busy but not too busy.

So I would encourage you to try this place for yourself. as the bartender said to me "if you love this place it loves you back"

I would have to agree

It's a small bar with good drinks.  Some folks refer to it as a dive bar but it really wasn't bad. (Assuming Dive bars are bad). Staff was quick to get your drinks and give you attended when they are empty.  We didn't have any food.

Decor is very unique and it's worth walking around and looking at it

Alright. The atmosphere is 8/10 but everything else is a solid 1. The service is wildly slow, buckle up for one drink every two hours. Steer clear of the Bloody Mary and the hurricane. Watery, weak, and made with cheap liquor. Come for the vibe, but leave as soon as soon you get there.

Place is super quirky. They have cheap drinks, dinosaur taxidermy, and a leopard skinned pool table in the back. The $3 beer and shot special makes it a great place to pregame.

This is a dive bar so don't expect five star amenities. You'll encounter all sorts of characters as the low prices attract all types of customers. I ordered a Malibu and pineapple which was good but tough to enjoy being in such a cramped space.

They're making efforts to modernize as you can text your order from the tables. The oysters were good and the strawberry daiquiri was strong. I'll certainly return.

Visited 169 Bar during Covid-19 and they have outdoor seating available. Gets pretty busy especially since the drink prices are fairly cheap for Manhattan. Counted 5-6 tables available. They didn't have a few things on the menu like Coconut Shrimp or anything else fried other than Fries. Service was amazing, the guy working was super attentive which is a plus since so many restaurants are limiting their staff too.

Great chill spot in Chinatown, worth checking out!

Loved this bar! Cheap drinks, great vibes, great food, great music! What else could you possible ask for. Our bartender Jade was a sweetheart and made our visit even better.

Now this is a dive bar, so don't come in with expectations. The place is grungy and falling apart but it has character and great people.  Next time I visit New York I'll be back for sure.

This is an amazing, reliable dive bar I've been coming to forever. There's always a special worth getting.

Text table service if you want it.

Quick bites if you want them.

Deals, deals and good vibes.

I enjoyed our stop here while we were visiting all the different bars. This is definitely one to put on your list if you're going to bar hop downtown New York. It was a cozy are decorated made you feel like you were in a very unique place. The drinks were fairly reasonably priced and the service was quick

I loved my experience at 169 Bar, but Blake the bouncer really topped it off! It's hard to find a bouncer in Manhattan who is serious about rules and regulations but is also incredibly nice and clearly cares that people have a good time. Blake was seriously the first notably positive interaction I've had with a bouncer in NYC and I will make it a point to come back just because of him!

Also, I made a few really great friends here, which I'm sure was as at least partly due to the positive staff they have! I hope the staff here are paid in a way that is reflects their great work, and I hope people tip reflective of that as well!

Very loud divey NYC bar. Terribly slow service - took forever for anyone to take our orders - but the hellboy margaritas were good! May have been a covid thing but heads up - there was no wine on the menu (it's a dive bar so not unexpected). It was also super dark, loud, crowded, and dirty inside.

It was a dark and stormy afternoon.  As the winds whipped up the rain outside, my friends and I sought refuge from nature's battering against our umbrellas and coats.  Like a mirage in a desert, 169 Bar's colorful sign called out to us and we quickly made our way into the establishment, huffing and puffing as we streamed in through the small entrance.

As we entered, the familiar dive bar combination of bleach and spilled drinks of the past hit our noses.  Dark corners abounded, others were lit by the various colorful lights set up throughout the bar.  Kitsch abounded.  To the right, a painting of a woman with strategically placed googly eyes.  Right next to the entrance were two wood mermaid carvings that looked like they once roamed the high seas in the front of a boat.  Towards the bar was a functional (and shockingly clean looking) water fountain, complete with a pile of cups.  The bar was very clean and organized and not exactly what you would picture when someone says "100 year old dive bar".  I appreciated the decor and sense of whimsy.

Our party had arrived at an odd time, so there were not a lot of people.  We only wanted to grab one drink and rest a bit and so we ordered.  The bartender was a friendly, easy going gent who seemed very at ease behind the bar.  I wound up ordering CC's Bourbon Mint Lemonade featuring Bulleit Bourbon, Lemonade and Mint.  This was served in a nice tall glass with bits of fresh mint in it.  The drink is nice and sweet but the Bourbon definitely gives it a bit of a kick.  It was also refreshing, and I could not help but think it would make a great summer drink.

We headed back out into the thrashing rain soon after, but our respite had been a welcome one.  Apparently the food in 169 is well thought of and I made a mental note to try it some time as I said a quiet goodbye to the wooden carvings near the door and exited.

So if there is such a thing as a perfect Oyster Dive Bar - this is it. Met up there for a friend's birthday. We had a large group and took over a couple of tables for the evening. The place is divey with eclectic decoration (umm bathroom has soap in Sriracha bottles). Even though tables and chairs and things are mismatched, it has a great vibe. The music playing was good although sometimes hard to hear - it's a good place for groups so it could get loud.

The drinks - we stuck mostly to the PBR and shot specials. Prices were good. Some tap beers, full bar. There was something for everyone. It was busy but the wait for the drinks was not bad at all.

The food was fab. Our group ordered the oysters. They scarfed them down real quick. We shared he shrimp po-boys, coconut shrimp, pork dumplings and some other stuff. She coconut shrimp was on point. Just enough coconut so it didn't get soggy, cooked perfectly. The dumplings were fried and full of delicious pork.

We hung out for hours and really enjoyed the place. This will become one of the go-to bars in the area.

This place is shit. Service always takes forever. Multiple encounters with rude management. People fighting and screaming outside, disturbing nearby businesses. Their house liquors are atrocious. There are few bars in New York that I've been to and had worse times then I do at this bar. Absolutely shit experience.
Ian -- is the MAN!!!! He kept the good vibes flowing and I haven't had quite a good night like this in a while. Keep him around all the damn time!!!
I have never tasted a paloma this bad. The grapefruit juice taste like it came out of a monkeys ass. Everything else was 'aight. Mule was pretty good. Paloma ruined the experience for me.

It's hard to describe 169 accurately. Calling it a dive bar doesn't do justice to the decor, relative cleanliness, cocktails and the fact that they shuck oysters.

Sure, there are still divey elements - like sticky tables, broken beer taps, and gaudy signs on the wall. They try really hard to nail the NOLA experience.

In terms of beers, they don't charge dive prices ($7 for a Six Point can? Come on, guys...). But they also have a cocktail menu. I couldn't go without trying the "169 Famous Bloody Mary". It was pretty damn good. Never thought pickled okra in a cocktail would make sense, but it does. Ours were missing the rimmed glass though, but can't place too much fault as the bar was pretty full.

Get there early if you want a seat. Otherwise, there's awkward standing room only because the area behind the bar stools is pretty tight.

Like I mentioned, there's an oyster corner listing the day's specials. Not too bad in terms of prices ($20 for a dozen). Went with the Kumamoto's and the Beau Soleil's. Not the greatest, but miles better than Blue Points.

I'm told some wild stuff goes on after hours, but what happens in 169...

3.5 STARS (Disclaimer: it was not my idea to come here - never knew it existed)

5 Stars as a dive bar for college kids and/or early to mid-twenties

Let me just say I felt OLD rollin' up in here. Place was packed but the bartender still took care of me and I didn't have to chase her down (rarity at some bars).

$3 beer & shot special

Happy Hour specials

Reasonably priced food

Hornito's straight seemed watered down - typical at a college bar

Self-pour water a win in my book!

Shrimp Po Boy:
- It was alright...probably would've been way more tasty if I was drunk
- Gotta give them credit for trying with execution and presentation
- Oddly enough the bread roll wasn't connected
- Shrimp breading wasn't what I expected
- It's topped with pickled okra which is interesting
- Hot sauce on the side was pretty good

TLDR: upbeat dive with affordable drinks, jazz music, and eclectic decor

Came here on a Saturday night around 2am with a friend. There was a 5 to 10 minute queue outside, but the bouncer was nice and we had no issues getting in. The blue and pink lighting, disco balls, 70's memorabilia, and leopard print pool table gave the place a technicolor hippie vibe. Most of the people in the bar had a carefree attitude to match, drumming along to the soul / funk music with chopsticks against the stainless steel tables.

Although the bar was pretty crowded, with loud jazz music playing in the background, it didn't take too long to order drinks and we were able to find a couple of open seats near the front window. We ordered cambodian mojitos (mint, malibu coconut & banana, midori, 151, pineapple juice) for $12 each, which were filled to the brim in beer-style pint glasses, generous for NYC cocktail standards. I enjoyed the mojito--it was reminiscent of mixed drinks served at college parties (a step up from cheap wine and beer), but it would be a stretch to equate it to a fancy cocktail found in one of NYC's many high-end bars. A unique aspect of this place was that there were traditional water fountains and empty glasses from which people could serve themselves water (always a nice touch vs. waiting to get the bartender's attention).

While there were people dancing on and around the small stage in the middle of the bar, most people were sitting and chatting at tables or near the bar. Overall, I enjoyed the vibe and drinks at this place and would recommend it for a chill night out with friends.
If you want to get roofied by the bouncer, and have your card charged hundreds of dollars that you didn't spend, 169 Bar is the bar for you.

Highly recommend this place for large parties. It's a chill, relatively roomy dive bar with super cheap prices. I had my birthday party here and had a great time! I made a reservation for ~20 people and got the area by the front window. There were only seats for about 12 people, but most stood anyway so it worked out. I'm glad we got the front window since the bar was pretty warm inside, so we cracked the window and it was great. The $3 beer and shot combos were a hit and the BBQ mac and cheese was delicious! The cocktails were also strong, especially the bourbon lemonade. Definitely a good spot for big groups who don't want to break the bank.

What's up with all the negative reviews for this spot? As I've said before with dollar pizza, you definitely get what you pay for - I mean sure if you want quality slices walk to prince street.

The next comparable spot is a couple blocks up and can definitely rival this place; for one, they have shredded Parmesan cheese which this place does not. However, the pizza here is consistently decent quality and does not mandate the bad reviews. They also have a lot of cheap sides/appetizers like garlic knots, cheese sticks, etc that you can buy for cheap.

This is not a fancy spot at all, but the food quality is fine and the price reflects that. All in all definitely recommend as a dollar pizza joint.

I'm so drunk and this is so sad.

It's far from fancy and I am nowhere near being a fancy man. Small, cramped, grungy and open late.

Drunk .99 cent pizza is better than no pizza I guess.

When you're wandering around in a drunken stupor after many many many speakeasy cocktails it's one of those places you hit up on the down-low. Kind of like that booty call who you hook up with during the middle of the night that you truly hate yourself for, and then sneak away afterwards doing the walk of shame and hoping no one you know saw you.

Even bad sex is better than no sex. Such was this pizza.

It's only .99 cents a slice though. I just hope no one saw me do this.

My soul is tortured because of this pizza. Yet, like that booty call you just keep going back because you know it's there.

I was walking around LES looking for a quick bite during a break. A lot of places around here are very expensive so it's refreshing to find cheap eats spot to satisfy your lunch cravings.

This place is literally a hole in the wall. Really small place in the middle of the block. The side represents old LES as it's run down with writing all over the place. Prepared to be transported to another time. I'm away it fits in with the graffiti around the area.

But it's not run down in a good way. It's run down in a "should I eat here" kind of way. Like your risking health by staying. I got pizza anyways because I was hungry. Lol

It's decent and only a Dollar. Will I come again? No probably not. Especially since there are cleaner dollar pizza spots in the neighborhood.

If you're looking for a quick slice, 99 cent pizza is always a great go-to.
This pizza was crispy on the bottom but still soft enough, with a good crust thickness and good amount of cheese.
Honestly, if asked to compare pizzas, I think I would've rated something else as the $1 counterpart based on quality since this one was surprisingly good.
Can't beat this deal, and even better that it's actually good.

3.5* Stars

Nothing special. Kind of a bland slice, but perfectly adequate and priced accordingly. 50 cents for each additional topping, which isn't bad. And they're one of the few cheap slice joints that will actually offer Parmesan topping.

They also have wings, beef patty's and mozzarella sticks- everything seemed to be priced pretty well, but I've only tried the plain slice.

Some specials:
Monday & Tuesday- 14" Full Pie for $4.99

Normally- 16" Full Pie- $5.99, or 18" Full Pie for $7.99.

Not bad for the money, but if you want a really good cheap slice, walk 2.5 more blocks to Hakki Champion Pizza; its worth the extra penny.

The reviews for this dollar pizza shop seems to go all over the place. Sadly, I have to put this place on the lower end of the review spectrum based on my own experience.

The pizza shop is very tiny and cramped but does have enough seating for about 5 people spread across two very small tables.  As with many 99 cents pizza place, it's really $1 a slice but unless you are the tightest of tight wads,  most people wouldn't really care about the penny difference.

Unlike a lot of dollar pizza places, there isn't any $2.75 for 2 slices and a soda deal.  The soda still cost $1 no matter how many slices you buy.  You could tell they used to have it but they kind of ghetto taped over it to cover up the deal on the board.

About the pizza, it's a bit smaller than the competition. The cheese is a bit thin but no worst than most cheap pizza places.  The pizza crust is a bit soft instead of crispy and is limpy when held up.  The dough does have a good slightly sweet flavor to it though.

The biggest problem is the pizza sauce.  They need more of it. It's so thin that I could barely taste it.  No balance of sauce to cheese ratio.  It's more like a dough cheese pizza.

This is probably the weirdest pizza I've ever had. I called for a delivery and the guy kept on asking if I wanted a drink even after I kept on saying no. When the pizza came, it wasn't even hot. Then I noticed that the pizza had no cornicione(the cheeseless ring around the pizza). However, the pizza was okay, but not the best. I'm never going back there again.
This is probably the best pizza spot in town. The owner is super sweet and the pizza tastes amazing. Be prepared to bring cash and have a great slice

Favorite 99 cent pizza in the city! The dough/crust is flakey and crispy, could use a little more sauce but the cheese and dough is great for the price. Bonus - it tastes 100x better when you're drunk after a long night in LES.

I paid with 20 bucks for some slices of pizza. Me and my friends were there eating. I never got my change back. When I asked for it I was told that they had already paid me and that someone else had taken my change. The waitress was basically making fun of me and I suspect they stole my money. Don't go to a place where thy try to take advantage of you. Sketchy place!
Went there this past weekend after midnight, they said the slices are $1.50.  I don't care paying the extra few cents, but when it's not advertised anywhere on there multiple signs, that is illegal.

$1 for a decent cheese and tomato slice. It was soft and the crust was thick, springy and maybe a tiny bit undercooked but I actually like it like that. The sauce was seasoned well- slightly herby. Gets 4* from me.

Weirdly also called Fahr Pizza on the awning. This is terrible pizza. Even if it weren't in NY it would be terrible pizza. Frozen grocery store pizza is better. Doesn't even have to be fancy frozen pizza like Amy's, even Red Baron will do. Gets an extra star for being cheap, the server being nice, and nothing going horribly awry. Williamsburg is better. Or (and I know this is heretical) go to Hackensack, NJ for the best Brooklyn-style pizza @ Brooklyn's Brick Oven Pizza. Seriously, Grimaldi's sucks. If you must stay in the city, Patsy's in East Harlem is worth the trek uptown.

Not as good as other 99 cent pizza places. The sauce isn't bad but the crust and cheese tasted like something that a cafeteria would serve. Even when I was drunk I knew that I wouldn't be able to eat it sober. They were open late though, after all the bars had closed, which was nice.

Not so bad, definitely not like other 99 cent places- pieces are half the size and not original NYC style slices.. Although I must say the pizza was pretty good at the time, mostly because I couldn't find another place. Employees were nice, it was fast, tasted good, just not what I was expecting..

The guy is a JERK. Dropped by to check out relatively new pizza place in the hood and i ordered the 12" pie. He said it'd be 5-10 min, okay great. While i am waiting, i casually play 2048 on my phone trying to ignore the music that is blasting in my ear.

After waiting a while, i looked up wondering how much longer my order would be, and i see him cleaning the display case.

He looks at me and says "you all set?" and i'm of course confused and said what do you mean? i am waiting on my order still. Then he says, "I called you, but you didn't listen to me, so that's not my problem."

So let me get this straight, he let me sit there for 30 minutes in the cold (door was open and it's still winter out) and music blasting in my ear because he couldn't call me to let me know my order was up? There was one other customer who ordered 1 slice, so it's not like he was busy- i was the only one there the majority of the time. He obviously knew i didn't hear him.

Then he told me not to come back.

Yeah, i'm just dying to.

I'm not comparing this to "regular" slices in the city. I'm comparing this to other "99 cent" or "dollar" pizzerias. This place is better than most. Some decent flavor in the sauce and crust. Again, this would probably be a 2.5 or 3 star if it went up against regluar pizzas but for 99 cents, i'll be here all the time in my drunken state after hitting the bars. They stay open late too. And they have specials. Unbeatable.

I came here with a party of 5 as a walk-in this past Saturday evening for dinner. Weather has been getting a bit nippy so I was craving for a nice bowl of pho!

The service was decent. Interior decor is definitely more modernized yet also welcoming. Here's what I ordered:

5ive Special Pho-regular
Viet Taco
Pandan Latte

The pandan latte off the bat, was really good! Pandan flavor and coffee was on point. As for the food, I got the 5ive spice pho special bowl. The broth, noodles, and meats were excellent. The viet tacos i ordered to share with a friend. Needless to say, our stomachs ordered the food and we may have over-ordered. Nevertheless, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. The portions are very generous. I would highly recommend this place!

We love Vietnamese food, but 5ive Souce just didn't cut it for us.  We were seated pretty quickly.  The ambiance is nice with painting of New York highlights on the walls.  Top hits are played and adds to the vibes.  The bathroom is behind a nice bookcase of plants and decor.  However, there is only one bathroom which is somewhat clean but there's quite a wait to use it.  

The  reason I gave the restaurant only 3 stars is because customer service was lacking after being seated, and we came here for an afternoon snack at 3pm.  We asked for water and never got it. Also, ordered a Thai ice tea which we never got, so we canceled it at the end.  Our pho was okay, definitely different.  Nice soup broth. Meats were okay.  We had to wait even for someone to bring us our bill and pay.  It was definitely not worth it.  The pho before tips and tax was $23.00.

I'm not the biggest Pho fan, so I typically stray away from Vietnamese, however 5ive Spice did not disappoint. We ordered the loaded the Pho and the broth itself was incredible. We also shared the wings and and Short Rib Tacos.

I preferred the short rib tacos to the wings, even though I'm typically a die hard wings fan.

I would definitely come back to 5ive Spice again, especially when places next door like Ruby's have lines so long you're afraid to ask the Hostess how long it would take to be seated.

The food is pretty good here! A little on the pricey side for the pho (5ive spice special pho $23) but the side of noodles for $4 was worth it. The rooster wings were nice and crispy with spices. We waited awhile for our food even though it wasn't busy at 2:30pm on Saturday.

Went here last Sunday to get some pho and I could say it was pretty up to par. The pho was very good and it had rib eye which added so much flavor and texture.

Service was pretty good and the ambiance there was pretty lively. I would definitely come back here for some good pho in Manhattan :)

Excellent excellent excellent. What a wonderful date night and meal. The service was fast, our server was okay but the food was quick so I didn't care. The tacos are delish!! Definitely recommend the fish tacos, great as an appetizer. The lemongrass chicken pho was top tier for me, they used lemongrass seasoned chicken breast, which I loved. I know most people may use thigh but it was great. So sooo good. The short rib noodle dish was delish too. Such a great experience and such great food.

Great service super friendly staff. Mango salad was well seasoned and tasty, wish there was just a bit more yellow mango in it. We got the Viet Tacos and Braised Short Rib Tacos. Both were good but the short rib ones were very flavorful. Taro crisps were super fresh and light and crispy.

Such a wonderful spot for Vietnamese food in NYC! Easy location to get to from SoHo or the West Village, inside you'll find some of the best Pho and Banh Mi available. The staff is attentive and friendly, and the dining room is charming without being overly packed.

There are several options for Pho, Banh Mi and Banh Xeo (Vietnamese tacos) on the menu, and everything has a helpful three level spice measure on the menu. The 5ive special Pho was the favorite, with just enough heat and an abundance of sliced beef, sausage and a spicy brisket to go with the noodles and standard accoutrements.

There is a full wine and beer selection as well as teas and coffees, so everyone can enjoy something.

For a city with not many Vietnamese options (please DM me if wrong), 5ive Spice is probably the best quality for consistency you can get. The menu is pretty simple, you either get a sandwich (Banh Mi), taco, or Pho. And there are selections of meat and combinations for each one.

I think everything is very good here, although I have to say that when I went last time I got my Pho soup pretty lukewarm, like probably at 110F, so it was not as enjoyable as I wanted it to be.

Stopped in for a quick beverage and was assisted and attended to like any other customer dining with a meal! Other restaurants will look at you funny cause all you want is a drink but everyone was so hospitable.

Tried the limeade, viet ice coffee and pandan iced latte. Crushed ice goes best with beverages in my opinion.

Didn't try any of the food at this location but if its anything like the other locations, id give it a chefs kiss!

This tasted very mild compared to the many times I've had Vietnamese food at friends homes and restaurants.

Also, the service was very poor. If you look at my many reviews, I very rarely call out bad service. It had to be extreme, I let the small things go as most of us do. But I felt like I was treated as second class during the entire visit. They did not tell us that they could not process credit cards until we heard them tell a neighboring table that it's been like that for some time. Also, no one checked in on whether our food came out correct. And they did not refill water until the very end(tipping time). And even then, they only filled the water halfway, despite the glass being empty. They pretty much ignored us the entire time.

So delicious! The peanut sauce with the summer rolls is some of the best I've had. Went with the shaking beef over rice noodles - great cook and flavor on the meat, and the Nuoc Cham is super flavorful too. Definitely would order again. Some indoor and outdoor seating, not ideal for a big group. They were doing a brisk take out operation so it seemed that was the move for most people.

Fair warning (which they tell you from the start) - cash only!!

Food and service were top notch. Absolutely loved everything we ordered. Food was flavorful . The restaurant is very cute inside and outside seating. Their bathroom is hidden in a book shelf that ass a nice fun touch.

I have one friend who really likes this place and another who thought it was ok. I am indifferent.

I came with my friend who does like this place. We came on a Sunday around 1:45 pm and were seated immediately in the back. The tables in the back are high top stools.

He got pho and I got shaking beef vermicelli noodles. I did enjoy my meal, but I feel like you could go somewhere in Chinatown at a Vietnamese restaurant for a more authentic and cheaper meal. The beef was flavorful though.

This is so random, but finding the bathroom is not easy. It's part of a hidden door that's camouflaged by this decorative door.

The girl in front of me was also confused by the bathroom door. I personally think the "hidden door" is dumb and should be more obvious. I saw the bathroom sign and I went around the corner but that just ended up being tables.

Delicious veggie bun/com vermicelli and veggie bahn mi. The soy protein in the bun/com was amazing and it was all so flavorful. This location has both indoor and outdoor seating and even though they don't typically take reservations, they accommodated my request for outdoor seating for a larger group when I called the day before which I really appreciated. The staff is very nice and accommodating. I definitely recommend!

I thought this place would be a more fusion-y take on Vietnamese, but the menu wasn't that crazy. I do think charging $15+ for pho is pretty high, especially since it didn't come in the giant bowls that you'd see if you went somewhere like a Pho [insert number here].

I had the tacos with lemongrass pork ($13). These were pretty good and had a lot of fun flavors from the fish sauce and the salsa, and the crepe held up pretty well with the amount of filling inside. But a single order of these tacos probably would not be enough for your average person.

There is also a hidden bookshelf bathroom that is nifty but annoying.

I've been sitting on this review for far too fucking long! 5ive Spice is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant! There I said it. It is my go-to recommendation for Vietnamese food. The pho is an absolute banger. The broth and meat are smokey and complex in taste and my friend's only complaint about it is it's a lot of meat. Do you hear that? Too much meat? That's a good problem to have! Go home to your child and say the opposite and see the tantrum unfolds.

I want to preface this with fuck the purists. I'm tired of my own people saying "Well it doesn't taste like the one back home." Yeah well neither does high speed internet or health insurance but I don't see you waving that right. Can we just agree we have different palates from different cultures and move on with our lives?

Anywho, yes, my palate leans heavily to rich and savory and yes, I like my phos like I like my whiskies: smokey af. What else do I like here? Pretty much everything. Everything we've ordered here was pretty above standard (except the coffee cocktail). I've yet to try the Banh mis but trust me, I'm already planning my next hangover meal here.

And this is for the meat bois: get the wings. Ugh it's sweet and savory. My friend comes back without me sometimes and I die a little on the inside.

No reservations here! Keep that in mind! I came here 2 times - one for a late lunch and one for dinner.

For my first time, I got the 5Spice Special Pho which was so tasty and flavorful! However, I thought it had too much meat! This is definitely good for a meat lover and has a bigger appetite- the meats were good though! I finished nonetheless because of how tasty this was!

In my second time, I got the Bun Bo Hue. Worried it'll be too spicy (2/3 spice level), my waiter kindly separated the hot sauce on the side. The noodles already came spicy, so the sauce on the side was super helpful otherwise I would have not survived the original spice level this was supposed to be! This was a mild-medium spice level, and if the hot sauce was added, it would have been spicy spice level. This was pretty tasty, however, it was little too oily for my liking, it made me not want to drink the soup because it was a bit too oily.

This restaurant serves a lot of other cool modern twists to traditional Vietnamese dishes, so I may come back again to try. This is definitely worth a try, but I may probably stick to my traditional Vietnamese restaurants.
The food was really good. The meshing of the flavors were great. The service was great as well. We sat outside so we didn't get to experience the the inside ambiance.

A friend and I had lunch here and we decided to try a few appetizers.  The wings are absolutely delicious and a must!  Five stars for the wings.
The taro chips are good also.  The mango shrimp salad is decent.  However, I would not recommend the braised pork ribs.  We found them to be tough and fatty, not off the bone as describe in some other reviews.  I was expecting the ribs I got at Morimoto Asia in Orlando, alas, these were not like Morimoto at all.  However, we enjoyed ourselves nonetheless.

I remember sitting at 5ive Spice BK near Barclays talking to the staff about them opening new locations; I later remember when the hostess finally told me they are opening on mulberry... I was excited but it seemed to still take me forever being a midtowner, to get there.   Enter the delivery services; I never go out, partly because I'm too damn busy and partly because I'm not a rich transplant 20something... but also mostly because I don't have any friends to enjoy that sort of thing with lol-  anyway, 5ive Spice is a long time fave and the new locations do not disappoint.  Get it, get everything, enjoy

My sandwich was super crispy on the outside and all the vegetables made for a tasty medley of flavors. From the crackly bread that seems to be made in house, or I'm hoping, to the sweet and sour carrots and the bitterness of the cilantro, it all works magically to create this flavor bomb of a sandwich.

It's hard to find banh mi done right in the states, as it's a street food known for its easy accessibility and price tag of $1 in Vietnam. But this place was pretty damn good, and enough to make me wanna have it a second time. I can't say that for every banh mi I've had here.

Great spot for a quick meal or last minute walk-in in Soho! The menu is vegetarian friendly and there are a lot of unique fusion entree options. Cocktails are also very reasonably priced. I got a crispy chicken banh mi, which was fresh, tasty and filling!

Would definitely recommend 5ive Spice if you're in the area and looking for a no-fuss meal!

I recently had the pleasure of celebrating my birthday at 5ive Spice, and it was an unforgettable culinary experience. The combination of Mexican and Vietnamese cuisine left my tastebuds delighted as the flavors actually complimented each other. For my visit, I ordered several dishes: Loaded Fries with Dip (side), 5ive Special (Pho), Shaking Beef (Vermicelli), and Beer Battered Fish Tacos.

Foremost, the pho at this restaurant was truly exceptional. The broth was rich and savory with a pleasant hint of cinnamon. It came with plentiful slices of tender beef and a reasonably sized piece of boneless short rib. The short rib itself was cooked nicely and was topped with a delicious, tangy garnish. The size of the bowl is a bit on the smaller side when compared with other restaurants that serve an "Extra Large Bowl" option. However, it is important to note that the menu did not provide any sizing information for this item.

The Loaded Fries was a delicious side. It came with several morsels of angus beef briskey and was seasoned with a blend of Mexican spices and Vietnamese sauces.

Although the Shaking Beef was a fresh and savory dish, it was less appealing than the 5ive Special. The shredded pickled carrots and radish were delicious and added a nice texture to dish along with the lettuce and pickled mustard greens. However, the portion of the beef was a bit upsetting. The beef itself was tender and flavorful, but it seems that the amount of vegetables overwhelmed the dish.

Lastly, the Beer Battered Fish Tacos was a mouthwatering fusion of Mexican and Vietnamese cuisine, as the flavors perfectly complimented each other. The tacos were served with a side of salsa and fish sauce. The tacos itself was topped with cilantro and shredded pickled carrots and radish. The flavor of this dish was truly distinctive, as it felt like I had taken a bite out of a "breadless" banh mi that was in the form of a taco. The fish was also well seasoned and cooked to perfection. Moreover, the taco shells (coconut rice crepe) also had a distinctive texture that really helped bind the dish together.

Overall, the ambiance of the restaurant was also charming, with a nice modern, bar-like décor that created an inviting atmosphere. The service was also attentive and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience.

In conclusion, this Vietnamese-Mexican fusion restaurant exceeded my expectations with its flavorful and delicious pho and creative fusion dishes. If you're looking for a culinary adventure that combines the best of both worlds, this place is a must-visit.

P.S. Their bathroom is integrated with their shelf. You may need to ask a server for directions because it did not look like a bathroom at first glance!

Perhaps it was a really off day or time because I've heard good feedback about this place. However the experience we had this time was quite negative.

Service (1/5): It looked like a good place, so I was super surprised at how bad it was when my friends and I came here. We walked in with a group of 6 and waited at the entrance for almost 10 minutes without a host or server coming up to us. When we tried to flag someone down, they just walked past and ignored us. When I finally went up to the billing/bar area to ask someone they dismissively told us to keep waiting at the entrance because there is no seating. This was even though there were two tables in plain sight that were empty. After waiting longer and still being ignored, we decided to go for take out and they fortunately allowed us to actually order. The food took a long time to make (20+ minutes) and when got it, we later found out they forgot some utensils and sauces. Not sure if it was an off day, but this was extremely disappointing service.

Venue (5/5): It looked like a nice place with great decoration, plenty of seating, and a cool bookshelf with a ton of decoration that swung into the bathroom. It also looked clean and modern. However, the terrible, cold and dismissive service was unbelievable making us unable to sit and enjoy the venue's ambiance. I don't recall being treated this badly before. We patiently waited for a long time and the duration we were ignored was unreal; it felt like we were ghosts.

Food (2/5): Perhaps because we got take out, the food was definitely subpar. We got and I tried the loaded fries, pork chop vermicelli with veggies, and beef banh mi. The loaded fries was soggy with tiny shoestring fries and the meat flavor was off. Meanwhile the pork chop vermicelli was OK but the meat was quite dry. The beef banh mi was not bad but not worth the $16 price point. Overall price for value and quality it wasn't good.

I found this place through Instagram and I originally came here for the banh xeo tacos and they did not disappoint. We order two different banh xeo tacos and then a bowl of pho as well. The flavor was there and reminded me of the comfort food I grew up eating. The ambiance of the restaurant is also great. They had a choice of outdoor sitting and indoor sitting.
One thing that I also thought was super interactive and interesting was their bathroom. They have a hidden door that was disguised as a bookshelf and apparently the idea of the door changes every so often.

5ive Spice is a neighborhood gem for anyone looking for good viet food with a trendier vibe.

Ive been here so many times but the summer rolls and the vegan pho are my go to order. I am pescatarian so finding a good veg alternative to pho is challenging. Most good Pho places suck at veggie pho (understandably so).

The service is consistent, friendly and efficient -- can't complain!

I had an excellent quick meal at 5ive spice and will definitely go back. Lemongrass chicken is fantastic, they let you add 2 eggs for $4 which is an excellent deal for the extra protein, the drinks are extremely affordably priced for the area, and the service is exceptional. Seriously, everyone was SO nice but also efficient and I didnt feel rushed or pressured at any point even as they started to get busy.

I go to the location by Barclays often before New York Liberty games and am glad to have a location closer to me now!

Can't get enough of this place. I've now officially tried a dish from every section of their menu in the LES location. (They also do takeout).

Crowd pleasers include:
- Bahn mi fish sandwich which can be made spicy and hits the spot when you're in the mood for something carb-y, pickled, salty and spicy, and crunchy and soft.
- Spring rolls with a side of lettuce and pickle cucumber and carrots... it's not bland, it's fresh and it puts other spring rolls to shame
- Pho (specifically the special with a variety of beef cuts and meat balls) has such a nice and warm broth with a nice balance of spice, salt and umami
- FINALLY, as French fries reminiscent of McDonalds and if you dip them in hot sauce... chef 's kiss!

Service is great too. Really responsive and attentive, and there's indoor and outdoor seating.

5ive spice is a cute spot with indoor and outdoor seating. My friend and I sat outside. I didn't love my food but I probably should have ordered the Pho. Also the bathroom was so cool - secret door and everything!

It is my first time at this location as I have been to the Brooklyn location in the past. Upon arrival on a weekday evening around 6:30pm for dinner, there were not many people so we were seated very quickly. There is also the option to dine out doors as well, but we choose to stay inside.

We ordered two appetizers to share, the green mango salad and loaded fries. The salad was light and refreshing and the loaded fries were delicious. For my entrée, I ordered the beef pho which had a good amount of beef to noodles. However, I felt that the noodles were a bit clump together so I have to stir it a bit to loosen it up.

Overall, I enjoyed the food here and would like to try the banh mi which is highly rated during my next visit. The interior is well quite spacious and minimal and it had a beautiful display shelf to hold décor and a surprise behind it.

Stopped here for lunch one weekend and it was relatively full. I've come here once before and the second time was all the sweeter. The servers were nice even though I came as a solo diner. I started off with the taro crisps and the rose lychee tea. The taro crisps were very crunchy but had a unique and delicious taste. From there I at the braised short rib tacos and they were the BOMB! The topping that came with it in the little dish was a nice touch to the dish and added to the depth of flavors. The bathroom is hidden inside what looks to be a bookshelf. Very creative! Overall great place and glad to have the opportunity to come in again.

Walking through Nolita and the Pho urge hit. This place is pretty solid for Pho. Spring rolls and limeade were tasty. Pho (for late in the day) was awesome and hit the spot. The accoutrements were extremely fresh and plentiful. Definitely will be back.

This location in Nolita places it above the usual pho spots we had been to, in and around Chinatown.

The place was fairly busy on this sleepy Monday evening after Thanksgiving.

I am not usually a fan of pho, but this evening was a bit blustery, and it sure hit the spot.

I had the 5ive Spice Special, and with a pepper icon it did have a bit of a kick to it. The braised short ribs were deliciously rich in flavor, even though they were sitting in the similarly rich tasting broth. It is excellent.

Had a pretty solid dinner here. Ordered the Viet tacos and they were very flavorful - loved how savory it was, the shrimp & pork as well as the slightly sweet sauce that came with. Servers are friendly and there is a good amount of room to sit indoors, in addition to some seating outdoors. My friend ordered the veggie tacos and was also a fan.

2nd time around and i went for the lemongrass chicken pho. this is a must get! the flavor of the broth was perfect. the chicken itself was juicy and had a great flavor. the serving was huge - had to take half of it home. we grabbed the loaded fries, but opted for the meat on the side. the veggie dip (more like a sauce) that came with it was absolutely addicting. it had a lot of indian cusine notes, reminded me of a curry. the housemade limeade was a perfect pairing for my meal.

great service, but they were so skimp with the napkins. we are messy eaters, and everytime we asked for napkins, we received 1 small napkin each.

Great spot for a good and filling meal. The drinks were very nice and i loveddd my veggie bun w. Soy protein- super flavorful and fresh w. Lots of crunchy veg. The taro chips were also very nice, my friends loved their banhxeo and banhmi w. Fish too. Would def come back

For what it is (modern take on Vietnamese / Vietnamese fusion food) this place is not bad at all! Just expect that what you're getting isn't super authentic and leave it at that and it's very enjoyable.

First, the service is top notch, the person who runs this place ensures that people are enjoying themselves! Second, I had the Andrew Banh mi sandwhich and it was incredible!!!!! When dipped in the sauce it's enough to make your head spin. Obvi not authentic Banh mi but the essence is there and I wouldn't compare this place to an authentic viet place anyway.

Pho was okay, it had potential but the broth wasn't very rich and fell more on the bland side. I know good pho doesn't exist in nyc but had high hopes for this one.

Ambiance is amazing and great for date night! I'd come here again to try other things and have the delicious Banh mi-esque sandwich. I love the vibe, and would return for the service.

BEWARE- THE CUPS ARE NOT CLEAN. If you take a look at my picture you can see how gross the cups are. The cup my partner received did not have these nasty marks on it.

Food- 1/5
5ive Spice Pho - $21 (1/5)
The broth was way too sweet for my taste. When we received the food, the bowl was cold and the broth was cold too. I doubt the temperature of the broth was hot enough to cook the beef inside of it. I left the beef within the soup and it did not cook. This is a stomach bug waiting to happen. I'm surprised there are so many raving received on mediocre food. Traditional pho I've had include more of a salty flavor, it seems this restaurant favors sweet over salty.

Loaded fries - $9 (1/5)
The fries were soggy. The slow roast on top was too sweet and generally did not go well with the fries. The fries tasted like it was unsalted and instead dipped into a tray of bbq flavoring. It reminded me a lot of the bbq pringles.

Service- 1/5
We came into the restaurant and was greeted by an older gentleman who was rude to us. We asked to have our seat swapped because the seat we initially got was by the door, we both have bad allergies so we requested a change. We were brought to a seat RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE AC. For the whole meal, my partner and I were freezing.

For the whole time, the waiter did not serve us and it was a combination of waiters. Towards to end, it was until we were ready to pay that the initial waiter attempted to give us any service and attention.

In addition to this, at the end of the meal when my partner and I were waiting to take turns for the bathroom, the waiter would come by every 2 seconds to see if we had paid, as if he deserved any of the tip we were going to leave.

Ambiance- 1/5
Cool bathroom.

Never coming again. Please save your money. The $21 for pho can be used at so many better mom and pop restaurants.

5ive Spice definitely deserves 5 stars! Craving some Vietnamese food, my husband surprised us with some Viet food! Upon initial impression, we were so impressed with how clean and modern the restaurant looked. Their bathroom is even a huge door covered by a shelf of plants! We ended up ordering the lychee cocktail and some banh xeo tacos for myself.

The lychee cocktail was incredibly sweet and tasted like lychee syrup - and for someone who doesn't handle alcohol too well, this was perfect for me! We even appreciated the whole lychee fruit added to the cocktail. This was probably one of my favorite drinks that I had!

The banh xeo tacos were pretty interesting! Normally with banh xeo, it's just one fried flour crepe filled with bean sprouts, shrimp, pork, etc. But these were like 3 mini tacos with the fillings! There was so much cilantro flavoring and flavor from the sauce, which we loved! The banh xeo got a little moist after sitting in its own sauce for a while, but still delicious nonetheless! 5ive Spice also made sure to give us plentiful helpings of the pork and shrimp - to the point of almost falling off as soon as you pick up the tacos.

Overall, such a great experience! I'm always down to have 5ive Spice whenever I am in the area and hopefully you will be too!

It took almost 30 minutes to find this place as I hadn't studied the surroundings well. The place looks like casual dining. There were several parties there enjoying their meals.

After telling the host that I was ordering takeout, I was brought to the bar counter to make my order. After making my order, another customer came over to make his takeout order.

After ordering, the order was ready within two minutes. Would come again.

food was not my favorite. too sweet for my liking, and it was overwhelming i had to squeeze lime (which i never do) into my pho. i got the 5ive special pho.

service was my least favorite part. server scoffed when i asked to switch seats away from door due to severe allergies, in a half empty restaurant. he didn't give us any service throughout and the only ones giving us service were the ones serving us food. no one came to refill our waters and we couldn't wave anyone down.

the only time he would give us attention would be when he was waiting for us to pay the bill and get out. never asked us how the meal was or cared.

Quick recap:

-          Food: Good
-          Portion size: Average
-          Service: Table Service
-          Environment: Modern
-          $: Average
-          Perks: the bathroom ;)

Overall?
Good food. Average portion. Nice service.

More details:
We have gone there multiple times. We have tried a lot of different things, from summer rolls ($8), chicken pho ($14), chicken bo bun ($14)... Everything is always good. It is not gourmet food but it is priced accordingly. The price/quality ratio is good. The service is quick, staff is nice and they are open late.
Good find :)

Summary:   A solid spot for a lunch on Mulberry.   Great atmosphere but missing that authentic hole in the wall flavor.  

Braised Short Rib Tacos lacked enough spice to be considered spicy but were otherwise tasty.  Great crunch of the carrots and bean sprouts against the richness of the short rib.

Shaking Beef vermicelli.   This came with the noodles hot and I really wished the noodles were cold.   Call it a preference I guess?   The flavor and seasoning and tenderness of the beef was excellent though and made me happy enough to take it back to the hotel as my late night (cold) snack.      

Vietnamese iced coffee was solid.   Service a bit slow.  

I debated between 3 - 4 stars so this a 3 overall.    

"Final Grade pending"
Overall good experience and yummy food! The summer rolls were great but the bun bowls were just average - still a good place though!

One of the best Vietnamese restaurants in NYC! Came to 5ive Spice Soho location again but this time I got the lemongrass pork pho (~$15). Even though I was the only diner outside, the waiters were very attentive and made sure I was not forgotten! The pho itself was a generous portion. I really loved the broth and my bowl had a lot of meat. Overall, I had a great time and I hope to try their taco items!

Almost a year later we are finally back! Took my friend here to get the braised beef pho of course. Another great experience. The staff was incredibly attentive! I don't remember this kind of attention the last time which was not to say it was bad the first time but I really felt taken care of!

The food came out quickly as well, the spring rolls even crispier. Idk man this is the spot to go to, I have not been disappointed.

Thank you again!

Been here a few times and it hits the spot so well! Will be back for sure! I've only ever gotten the Braised Short Rib Pho and it is to die for - the texture of the meat is so soft and almost just melts right off. The broth is super flavorful as well! The only con I have is this time the noodles snapped off a ton as I was eating them so that was the only con I had. I also got the watermelon limeade as one of the summer specials, which is made with real watermelons so there isn't any of the artificial flavor that a lot of places usually have in their watermelon drinks.

The first time my friends came they ordered the tacos which I think were good but not the biggest portion size - just for context.

The service is good and the restaurant interior is nice but nothing crazy. I will say the bathroom door is quite fun though since it is a hidden bookshelf type door.

Will definitely be back to try more things off the menu! And reordering the braised short rib pho again ofc!

So happy I got to check this place out! Got here around 6 on a Sunday evening and was sat right away as a party of 1! Super cute little Vietnamese spot with a great selection on the menu.

The watermelon lime-ade I got to drink was AMAZING! It really tasted so refreshing and I loved that they used pellet ice for it. I got the spring rolls as an app and then the beer battered fish tacos as an entree. These were both noted as customer favorites on their menu and I can see why! Very filling as the portion sizes were great. All the ingredients were super fresh and tasty.

I would definitely come back here!

Ok, this is a SPOT. The staff is extremely kind and the restaurant is so so clean which is SUCH a relief for the area because it is so hot and busy outside. We got seated immediately (6pm on a Saturday) and I ordered Vietnamese iced coffee, sauteed broccoli, and the veggie Bahn Mi. The food came within ten minutes (if that) of us ordering and was super fresh and hot.

The iced coffee was stronger (less sweet) than other Vietnamese Iced Coffees I've had before but still delicious and they even offer fantastic to go options for your cup. I got the sauteed broccoli and Bahn Mi to eat and they were both so aromatic and delicious. So many fantastic vegetarian options as well as the traditional options with beef/chicken/seafood.

Again, the staff was outstanding. Our waters never got below half full and it was so easy to speak to someone if we needed absolutely anything. I really hope to come again soon.

I've followed this account for a while on Instagram. They mean business. The ludlow fries and chickn pop were terrific.

Some of the softest chicken I've tried. Not crunchy and hard to bite down on. The sauces are amazing. Every fork stab was a joy to try.

The ludlow fries. Talk about good sauce. Loved every bite. Almost as much as the chicken. Salivating right now writing this.

Also, this food was hot 10 min after we got it. Big plus. Appreciate that and it's gooooood warm.

Quick bite spot! Not sit down.

Food comes out hot. Fun flavors and a variety of chicken. PB&J tasted more like Thai Peanut but it was still good.

The 375 Hot Chicken Sandwich was good too - juicy and comforting.

Quick service. Indoor-outdoor spot with some standing counter space.

Been hearing about this place a lot so we decided to try this place on our way out of NYC. Let me tell you, this literally left me speechless upon first bite. Service was prompt. Little to no seating area so be prepared to stand somewhere on the side of the road to eat.

We got the honey garlic and the 375 hot chicken. The chicken itself was marinated to PERFECTION, juicy and crispy. Its cooked well. The flavors were immaculate. So much spice with sweetness. The sandwich was dripping down my hands. The lettuce was crispy. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I wish they had this in the West Coast!!!

Overall, this may even be one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had in my life. They use high quality ingredients and really put time and effort into each sandwich. MUST TRY. WORTH EVERY PENNY OF MY MONEY!

The sandwiches are delicious. Truffle fries is a must try. It is expensive but I feel like it is worth it once you find the flavors you like. All are good but some might hit different which will make you go insane on how good it is

This place is a hot spot by my work so I decided I had to try it. I do need to try again, as I didn't order chicken, just fries. It is a small, "hole in the wall" with an order counter, kitchen, and little room for seating. The line daily goes out the door.

I ordered their truffle Parmesan fries. The portion was HUGE! I loved how they were topped with shaved Parmesan cheese and delicious. Not over oiled or cooked. I want to for sure go back and try some chicken now. I know they have a Nashville hot chicken sandwich, which is very popular.

Knowing nothing about the area, I just ordered this for a quick dinner for delivery on Uber Eats. Little did I know what a treat I was in for.

ATMOSPHERE/ARCHITECTURE: N/A

Ordered delivery.

SERVICE: 9/10

Very fast service and everything was neatly packaged with enough napkins and utensils. Excellent for delivery option.

FOOD: 10/10

Chicken Tenders - 10/10 - The best chicken tenders I have EVER had. They were moist, not hard or dry at all and such delicious chicken meat. Not over breaded either. This is how it should be done.

BBQ Popcorn Chicken - 9/10 - These were pretty good too. The sauce was sweet with a slight tang, overall pretty good.

Truffle Fries - 8/10 - This is a heavy snack on top of the chicken but it was still good! The truffle flavor was lighter than I normally have with truffle fries but I enjoyed nonetheless.

VALUE: 8/10

PROBABILITY OF RETURN: 10/10

I would if I could.

TO EAT OR NOT TO EAT: Chow down!

OVERALL: 9/10

I have been following this shop on Instagram for so long and I finally went today. I really want to love this but I can't.

* The fried chicken pop was very over fried - the chicken meat was so hard and dry it was exhausting to eat. HOWEVER, I did enjoy the sauces and the scallion cheddar waffles though.
* The sandwich's Patty also came out burnt (LOL an entire black patch).
* And while I appreciated the generous portion of sauce on the Ludlow fries, it didn't work together because the fries were all mushy.

Everything I've eaten from here has been fresh, flavorful, perfectly fried, and delicious. I'm really finicky about ordering chicken, because of a bad experience at another chicken joint (long story). So I've only ever ordered the chick n' pop, which is their popcorn chicken. But I am always happy with the quality.

The flavors are also pretty unique and super tasty. My favorite is the mango habanero. Their parmesan fries are also amazing. Everything is fried to order so you know it's fresh and hot. They have a good variety of dipping sauces as well.

It's a pretty small location but they do have a few seats indoors, and two small tables outside. Service is pretty fast and always nice. It can get busy but they're pretty organized with a number system for ordering. They're open until 3 am most days, so it's a perfect spot for a late night meal.

One of my fav snacks in the area is the chick n' pop. It's essentially popcorn chicken covered your choice of three sauces and topped with another sauce/dressing. I got the BBQ chicken which was topped with ranch dressing. I've also had the sweet chilli version which was chicken in a sweet Thai chili sauce then drizzled with a "Samurai" yum yum sauce. So good! These are the must tries of the restaurant.

Warning: small store front with no indoor seating. Small metal table outside - best to carry out and eat elsewhere!

I came here after a friend said that this was way better than other chicken sandwiches in the area. They have multiple locations throughout the city and this one has no indoor seating and only one or two tables outside.

I got the spicy chicken sandwich ($12) which was crispy but not as seasoned or flavorful as the one we had just eaten. There was more stuff in it but mostly all I tasted was the slight spiciness from the pickled jalapeños.

The chicken piece was way bigger than the bun which made it look great but it looked better than it tasted. I tried my friend's nashville hot chicken sandwich which had much more flavor so I'd want to eat that next time.

I didn't get to take a picture of my chicken sandwich but I got the honey garlic chili sandwich. I thoroughly enjoyed the meal. I didn't get to have a bite until 25-30minutes after, but it was still slightly crispy. Flavors were on point, not as spicy as I would have liked it though. The fries were krinkle cut, which I like personally...I got the jalapeño ranch which was solid but not mind blowing. I wish they'd give another sauce for free but I think they charge 1$ for extra sauce.

The shop itself is on the smaller end. There is some 2-3 tables/bar areas where you can eat. The food did take 30-40 minutes to come out and we only had 3-4 people ahead of us. Luckily we beat the line that came afterwards at 12am.

My friend got the PB&J chicken nuggets...It was better than I was expected. The peanut sauce was creamy and reminded me of an asian style peanut sauce. The jelly flavor wasn't too prominent which I prefer. I would come back to try something else!

The fried chicken here is so good. I ordered the PB&J Chick n' Pop. Though it may seem weird, it was actually delicious. The fries here are also good. Be aware that the place is small and there is basically no room to eat there. It may be best to order it and then find a place to sit. I went to the Essex Market. You can also get it delivered, which is probably easier. I want to come back and try their other menu items.

Only had the pb&j pop chicken here and loved it . Another great sauce maker in the city . They move super fast back there I wasn't waiting for long at all. This shop is just a window with stools but def not a place to sit in and eat . I'll come back late night for another round when I'm back !

10/10
The chicken was the bomb! I bought Buffalo Honey Chick n pop combo. It came with chick n pop, fries, a can of soda. They have so many choicest. It was hard to choose from. The Buffalo Honey Chick n pop wasn't too spicy. It has spicy mayo sauce and sprinkle of green onions. As I was eating the chicken, I thought a cup of cocktail would be a good pair.

What happened to their 3x cooked fries??? This used to be my absolute favorite place to come in the city for fries and sauces and I left today severely disappointed. I haven't been in a while and I don't know when they changed to freezer quality crinkle fries but it is not worth your time and money. I'm giving 2 stars because the sauces are very flavorful and can mask a shitty French fry.

Finally tried this joint after hearing my friends considering it one of the better fried chicken sandwich spots in lower Manhattan. I got the honey garlic sandwich and while it was good, it wasn't anything special considering the price. It honestly tasted pretty similar to a Chik fil A sandwich, but just slightly bigger.

Can't say much about the service since it's a fast food joint but i got my sandwich pretty quick (only waited about 5 minutes). It's a small shop with a few barstools for seating so it's more of a grab and go or delivery stop. In a really nice and bustling area of East Village though!
Sweet little spot. Fried chicken is crispy, well seasoned, not that "old oil" taste. Nice people behind the counter. Poutine is a must....

I have no idea what happened but I feel like the food isn't as good as it used to be or perhaps that upon having tried a few of their sandwiches and other menu items I'm finding that everything tastes the same.

I got triple truffle sandwich and I legit couldn't even taste one hint of truffle let alone three (okay I'm being dramatic I could taste the truffle when I got to the center of the sandwich but that was legit three bites).
