I've officially decided that the batter the chicken is in is bland as hell and boring. Like salt and pepper isn't seasoning. If there's anything else in there I sure as hell can barely taste it and any toppings going on it I barely taste too clearly since the truffle was nowhere to be found.

I'm definitely disappointed in this because I brought a whole crew of my brother's friends and my cousin visiting from another country and we were all let down with a rather mediocre meal. When I want my cousin to think of the food he had in America I want him to associate it with FLAVOR and there was legit nothing to be found.

I did LIKE the sandwich. It just wasn't spectacular and I wouldn't buy it or any other item from here ever again given that it's taste is comparable to the other burgers I've tried from their menu.

I am definitely saddened by this because I did really like this spot initially (I think I've been to both locations four times or so) but I think for the high cost I'm really not getting the quality or taste that I'd hoped for.

I just want to preface this by saying this place has been popping up on my social media for some time. So I decided to give it a try. It definitely has not disappointed. It's a quick grab and go spot, when I went there was like a picnic bench outside with a couple people eating but this is a grab and go spot. I ordered online which was easy and convenient. Parking is super limited, which is expected.

So I ordered the PBJ combo. Comes with fries and a drink. The PBJ sandwich was delicious. It can get a little messy if not careful. The fries actually were good to. I had some of the peanut dipping sauce with it. It wasn't a bad mix but next time I probably would of tried a different sauce.

When I go back I have to try the chick 'n waffle. That looks really good as well!

Fresh fried chicken will never go out of style for late night eats. This bright, counter service hole in the wall serves up crisp chicken with a variety of sauces in sandwiches, on fries, and topping cheddar waffles.

I went with a Hot Chicken sandwich: honey garlic glazed chicken, cheddar, chipotle mayo, pickles, and hot sauce. It didn't have the punch I was looking for, but it was a tasty sandwich

The side of fries were hot and crispy, with roasted garlic aioli a good side

By far one of the most amazing chicken sandwiches and fries my mouth has ever gone into!! I'm here in Michigan and wishing I was back to the garlic hot honey drizzle of heaven that I had. I'm actually really annoyed that I only ate it once. 375 you guys have rocked my world and fried chicken sandwiches will never be the same. Ever again

375 Chicken 'n Fries! We love this place! Although it is a small place and it was hard to get a seat, it is still worth stopping by and at least getting them to go and enjoy the chicken sandwiches elsewhere. We ordered their Triple Truffle Sandwich, Buffalo Honey Sandwich, Honey Garlic and Chili Sandwich, Raclette Sandwich, and Truffle Parmesan Fries. Don't ask us which ones were our favorite it's too hard to choose but if we had to it would be the Honey Garlic and Chili Sandwich. If you love garlic that's the one! The buffalo honey sandwich was perfectly sweet and hot at the same time. The Raclette was super cheese but worth it still. Overall, One of the best chicken sandwiches in the city. Would go back again for sure!

The cashier was very friendly and nice,
He was patient with me as it was my first time and the menu was extensive.

The sandwich was fried to perfection and the only reason it's not a 5 star is the sandwich was a little dry.

The PBJ was amazing. Fries perfect.

I'll go again and try something else and give a more extensive review!

Its a quick little grab n go spot which I don't mind. The wait wasn't bad at all despite it being kind of busy. The customer service was very patient with my many questions about the menu items. The fries kind of threw me off because I thought they were straight cut as advertised but they were crinkled, they were great though nice & crispy. The chicken pops were FIRE !! I like that they wasnt drowning in sauce & soggy. You definitely get your money's worth. Highly recommend.

DELICIOUSSSSSS!!!! The peanut sauce was creamy for the CHICK'N Poppers !! The fries are a big size, warm, and lightly salted. It was perfect!

As I'm writing this, I'm heading there right now lol!

This spot gonna be my Go-To when I go to the city :)

a friend suggested this place and i absolutely loved the food !! i'm very mindful of where i eat in nyc but this took me by surprise. not much of seating area but keep in mind that it is manhattan so it is not expected.

Finallyyyyyyyyyy!!!! I'm so happy that everything me and my teenager ordered was "bussin" lol.  She's super finicky, so to get her stamp of approval, 375 Chicken 'n Fries was on point.

My girl zeroed in on the Swiss 'n Bacon sandwich combo and I went for the Raclette sandwich combo to go.  Of course our food was cold by the time we arrived at home, and I'm unsure if she heated her food, nevertheless she said it was "BUSSIN" LOL.  AND she took a picture for YELP (insert smile).  

Anyhoo, the Raclette sandwich was big, well seasoned, crispy deliciousness.  The fries were also really good and crispy... even after re-heating.  We will definitely be repeat offenders! Too bad they removed the banh mi sandwich and the milk and chips from the menu.

I am so devastated that they removed the PB&J Chicken Sandwich. I just don't understand why they would do that. What was wrong with it? Upon request, even though it has been removed, could it still be made in their back kitchen? Well... regardless of then removing my favorite chicken sandwich from the menu, I ordered a PB&J Chick N Pop as a replacement. And it pretty much tastes the same as the chicken sandwich that they removed. All thanks to their sauce. I was tempted of going back for seconds. It's delicious. The texture is amazing. Not spicy whatsoever. Dining is currently not available and it does get crowded after 5 pm. I don't blame it. Their restaurant is small, therefore, it can be a bit uncomfortable and confusing at times. Despite that, I make it work. Their fries, something about it taste different than before. They are not as finger-licking as they were before. Maybe they are under new management? The fries are good, however. Overall, I would come back even though they have removed my favorite food off the menu.
375 served me the best chicken sandwich I've ever eaten. The sweet chili sauce was the clincher. Do not miss this place!

I absolutely fancy a good chicken sandwich. Only a few places are able to take the cake in a juicy yet crispy chicken sandwich. Seen some friends post this and gave them a try.

While quickly scanning through the menu I chose the BBQ Ranch Chicken Sandwich combo. The combination came with fries a choice of sauce and a can soda for $16 which is fair for a sandwich, side and drink (coke, Diet Coke, sprite or with $1.50 extra you could upgrade to a boylan soda).

Upon opening the box I could see a gargantuan piece of chicken breast which was surprising since most places skimp out.  With the first bite came an explosion of flavors in my mouth. With every bite I stuff the crispy French fries lathered in the buffalo honey sauce and couldn't stop til the box was empty. I was left extremely satiated with the large amount of food that was in the box. Very satisfied with my meal and would come here again but with wet wipes this time.

An Absolutely Amazing Culinary Masterpiece - The Best Sweet Chili Chicken Sandwich Ever!

I recently had the opportunity to indulge in the most incredible culinary creation I have ever encountered, the Sweet Chili Chicken Sandwich. Words simply cannot do justice to the heavenly experience I had while savoring every bite of this delectable sandwich.

First and foremost, the flavor profile of this masterpiece is unparalleled. The combination of succulent chicken smothered in a perfectly balanced sweet chili sauce was a symphony of taste explosions that danced across my palate. The harmonious blend of sweet and tangy flavors kept me intrigued and satisfied with every single bite.

Not only was the flavor extraordinary, but the texture of the sandwich was also truly remarkable. The juicy and tender chicken was perfectly complemented by the crispiness of the fresh vegetables, creating a delightful contrast that added an extra layer of enjoyment to each mouthful. The sandwich was expertly assembled, with every ingredient proportioned to perfection, ensuring a consistent and enjoyable culinary experience from the first bite to the last.

The presentation of the sweet chili chicken sandwich was nothing short of artistry. The sandwich was so visually appealing that I almost felt guilty disrupting its pristine display by taking a bite. From the vibrant colors of the vegetables to the glistening glaze on the chicken, it was clear that attention to detail was paramount in its creation.

Furthermore, the service I received while enjoying this culinary delight was exceptional. The staff was friendly, attentive, and well-informed, ensuring that my dining experience was nothing less than extraordinary. Their passion for their craft shone through in every aspect of this remarkable sandwich, making me feel like a valued guest throughout my visit.

In conclusion, 375 chickin n fries is, without a doubt, the best food joint i've ever had the pleasure of experiencing, and it will forever hold a special place in my heart (and stomach!). Its exceptional flavors, impeccable texture, stunning presentation, and top-notch service combine to create an unrivaled culinary masterpiece. If you find yourself in need of an unforgettable dining experience, I implore you to seek out this divine creation and prepare to be amazed.
-Owen Sontchi

I decided to try the "Buffalo-Honey" chicken sandwich combo which is initially $17, but being that I got a drink that wasn't included in the combo deal, my total came to $19 and change after tax. Without tasting the sandwich I felt as though the meal was way over priced. Once I received my order, my thoughts on the price were confirmed. The sandwich is pretty much a glazed chicken patty (the glaze being whichever flavor you choose) on a potato bun with cheese....that's it. There's no lettuce, tomato, pickle etc. Nothing to really make the sandwich pop and stand out flavor wise. If I'm paying $20, I'd like more items on my sandwich. Plus the fries were just regular crinkle fries that tasted like they came straight from my high school cafeteria, so that was disappointing. As far as taste goes, it was good but I didn't really care much for it because the sandwich was just bland. Not bland in taste, but bland in lacking complimentary factors aka other ingredients besides a chicken patty in sauce. Not to mention the sandwich was kind of soggy and the middle of the chicken patty tasted like it wasn't fully cooked all the way through.

Although my experience wasn't the best, I'd still like to come back and try other menu items before I decide to say that the restaurant is an overall flop. I just won't be doing it on my dime :)

I am so disappointed in this place...was happy to try them as they're a Muslim-owned business and I'm all about representation.  Long story short, the sandwich was fine- not bad but nothing to rave about.  So why the one star review?  Putting aside the fact that it's quite overpriced for what it is, can someone explain to me why it takes over ONE HOUR to make a fried chicken sandwich?  It was Halloween and there was a decent amount of traffic but I'm sorry an hour and twenty minutes???  And of course you can't cancel your order because they're "totally working on it then and there"...really ludicrous.  Albeit I would love to try this place again, I highly doubt I will after such appalling service and quite a lackluster sandwich.

Good chicken sandwiches.
No seating.
A bit pricy and barely get fries with combo.
Plus you pay extra for bottled soda which they do not tell you.

Okay experience.

After seeing lines of people waiting every time I drove by, I had to try this place.

As a lover of spice and fried chicken, I got the Nashville hot sandwich. The fried chicken was great, not dry but a bit thin. The part that did it for me is their sauce and the coleslaw. The cold coleslaw with the spiciness of the sauce was an amazing combo. Out with pickles and in with the coleslaw in sandwiches! The bums were pretty amazing as well. Very fluffy and warm.

They got plenty of different sandwiches to choose from but the down side is there is no indoor seating. They also has variety of sauces for your side of fries but for an extra prize. The fact there's no indoor seating means you need to get home to eat the fries or munch on it was you walk so they don't get soggy.  

I would definitely recommend trying their sandwich, not sure if the combo with fries is worth it since each sauce will cost you extra.

After seeing the long lines and hearing about this spot from Tiktok my friends and I had to try it!

Unfortunately the day we came it started to pour on us so their only seating available outside was out of service, unless eating in the rain is your thing. Nonetheless we pushed thru and made our way to the counter.

We ordered the Nashville Hot Sandwich (2/5). The sandwich was certainly flavorful but not spicy at all and nothing like the photos I've seen on this yelp page. Our chicken was very rubbery and not fun to eat. The breading was good and crisp but it separated from the meat entirely. The bun was extremely wet and falling apart, couldn't hold the ingredients together. Definitely not worth the hype. They seemed super busy however, so it could be due to how swamped they seemed to be.

Will definitely try a different sandwich when its less busy and see if theres anything different. But definitely left pretty disappointed.

This is not really my cup of tea. But I was driving by on the way because I was forced to turn down this street due to street closures for outside dining and I was really hungry and it caught my attention.

I'm not much of a fast food or fried chicken guy. But, I can see the appeal of this place and the appeal of the food for people who like that Popeye's/KFC with a bit of an upgrade to it.

They clearly use quality meat. The hot spicy is really hot and spicy. People definitely like this place. So who am I to say otherwise.

Finally made my way to check this place out, we came in & got an order of the Parmesan truffle fries, they were very good nice big portion great for sharing as we did.
very small location, probably best to avoid when there are large crowds not a lot of room small amount of seating & standing room.
Service was good, prices are bad we enjoyed our fries for sure.

Fantastic late night fried chicken sando option. Really can't go wrong with any of their sandos! Took off one star since their poppers and loaded fries are hit or miss (can be inconsistent with sauciness).

I worked around the corner from this place for years but somehow never made it there. Went Sunday and it's worth every penny. Wasn't disappointed, I had the Buffalo honey Chick N Pop and Ludlow fries.

Ummmm! Popped in here today to try this out. Was. Not. Impressed! I ordered the Nashville Hot Chicken and fries w/ a soda. Let me tell you for abt $23 (tip included) this was not worth it. The sandwich lacked flavor and most importantly spice, which is what I was afraid of so when I asked to switch the cheese for pepper jack instead of the munster cheese it came with I was told not substitutions sooooo I opted out all together!

The best thing abt the meal were the fries that I dipped in the buffalo honey sauce. I really wanted to like it, I even added a few splashes of the buffalo honey to give it flavor and spice... nothing could save this, took 3 bites of the sandwich before tossing it. I was born and raised in TN and I know all about Nashville hot chicken and 375's sandwich did not scratch the surface of what HOT chicken is.

The best fried chicken and fries I ve ever had . I've been to going there on a regular basis . I got the honey Buffalo chicken sandwich and truffle fries . They ve added a lot of items on to their menu over the years. I particularly liked the spicy chicken sandwich and Buffalo chicken. They also have pop corn chicken that are really good. Last but not least I also love the glass bottle sodas they have!

I was really excited because I heard a lot of great things. Slightly overhyped but the chicken was tasty! I tried the Buffalo honey popcorn chicken and the sweet chili popcorn chicken. Both had good flavor but the Buffalo didn't really taste like Buffalo, I don't think there was enough sauce. And the sweet chili was good but tasted kind of similar to the Buffalo. The food was a decent serving size so you won't leave hungry if you get a combo.

The chicken sandwich was alright. I was excited when I saw hot Cheetos as one of the toppings on the sandwich but it wasn't amazing. It's a good average chicken sandwich. I enjoyed the fries more than the sandwich. The fries were packed with flavor and I love all the special sauces they put in it. I would recommend coming here for an average chicken sandwich.

Went here on a Sunday night after a party and it was a great surprise...a lot of choices & combos to choose one I had the sweet chilli chicken sandwich with the fries and it was very very very GOOD..if you looking for a spot to grab a bite you will be happy..they not cheap with the portions either so salute to them..I will be back

I've seen this place all over social media platforms and had to give this place a try. I tried their bbq chick n pop with Parmesan fries. Both of them looked good but it did not taste good. the bbq chick n pop needed less tangy flavor in my opinion and Parmesan fries had a weird smell to it. Therefore, it didn't fit my taste buds.

Also, there was no indoor dine, there were about 2 tables outside both very dirty. Need some wiping down.

It was Late Night and we were hungry . He originally wanted empanada mama but the line was ridiculous. So I looked up other late night options on my food bible.(yelp)
375 popped up and I became instantly excited . It's a small place but it packs a hell of a punch. The staff was helpful, polite, and efficient. The best way to describe this spot is like a chicken sandwich shop with swag as far as the menu is concerned. With so many options I kept it simple on my first visit. I got us two classic combs with cheddar cheese. It came with the sandwich, fries,soda, and a sauce of choice. I order 3 more. They had so many options to choose from. I got the ranch, bbq, cheddar, honey buffalo and my new fav the garlic aioli. The fries were fresh and tasty. Not to greasy . All and All I would say it was definitely a successful late night food trip.

Would I go back ? would definitely go back just go the fries. N I want to try the spicy chicken sandwich.
Should you ?! Yes.
I got their chicken tenders and I've never had more juicy yet crispy chicken tenders in my life. Highly highly recommend

My initial review:

I placed an order tonight (10/10/2020) #138. You guys gave me everything except the Truffle Parmesan fries. I paid for sauces for nothing to dip in. Highly upsetting that I drove 45 minutes (each way) for an incomplete order and then can't reach your establishment via phone to correct this matter.

Update: The owner messaged me within minutes to resolve this matter. Shows me that He really cares about my experience. 5 stars is for the way the Owner handled my complaint. Yes, I would return to give it another try!

The food was great. I got the nashville hot chicken combo and my sister got the truffle burger combo. The nashville burger has the perfect kick while not being too spicy, the slaw went perfectly with the pickles and sriracha sauce. The fries were salty and crispy just like they should be. My sister liked her burger but she preferred mine, the truffle burger doesnt taste as much like truffle as it smells of it. The only complaint would be that the combo includes extra sauce and it wasnt written on the receipt but not added for either of us. They don't give too many fries and theres also no indoor seating. The store is quiet small so they ask you to wait outside and bring out your order, but its so cold these days to be standing waiting outside!

Nestled in the heart of the city, 82 Stanton Bar offers a vibrant and unforgettable experience. From the moment I walked in, the friendly staff made me feel right at home. However, it was our waitress, Regan, who truly took our visit to the next level. Her lively personality and attentive service made our evening truly exceptional.

Regan's warm smile and genuine enthusiasm instantly made us feel welcome. She expertly guided us through the extensive drink options, offering insightful recommendations tailored to our preferences. Throughout the night, Regan's attentiveness shone through as she consistently checked on us, ensuring our glasses were never empty and answering any questions we had.

What truly made Regan exceptional was her ability to create a great vibe among the customers. She effortlessly engaged with everyone, sparking conversations that made the bar feel like a community. Her infectious energy spread like wildfire, and it was evident that both the staff and customers adored her. Combined with the bar's eclectic decor, upbeat music, and impressive drink selection, 82 Stanton Bar is a must-visit for anyone seeking a lively atmosphere and outstanding service.

In conclusion, my experience at 82 Stanton Bar was nothing short of remarkable, thanks to the exceptional service provided by Regan. Her lively and attentive nature, combined with the overall great vibe of the bar, created an unforgettable evening. I highly recommend this gem to anyone looking for a memorable night out.

Pros:
+ The drinks at this place were absolutely amazing.
+ Amazing espresso martini
+ Friendly staff
+ Great location

Cons:
- However, the food was lacking. Garlic knots lacked a lot of flavor.

IG: QueenOfAdventureNYC
Good Beer, and it's an average bar in LES. Wouldn't say good or bad, just average. I order a Manhattan and it was okay.

It was my first time here a few days ago. I went for a fundraiser. Some of the drinks that were on the special fundraising menu were titos and soda and margaritas. I was pleasantly surprised at the taste of the margarita. The host of the fundraiser also ordered some pizzas for the table. WOW best bar pizza I have ever had! and they smelled amazing! Bartenders were all very nice as well.
One of the best spots in town!! Great for game day and for Friday and Saturday nights. Great spot for some day drinking tooo

I LOVE WILL HES THE BEST BARTENDER!! This place is better than an bar in the area
I love the music...there's no DJ but the song selection is literally a 10/10 there was a small line but tbh it was so worth it and it was probably the best fri night of the summer.
We were at another bar before around the corner but this bar blew it out of the water.
The pizza was insane and the drinks were all for a great price.
10/10 recommend and I really think I'll be back next weekend, if not, then definitely once more this month.
Go now before it blows up and the line gets too long
Carly was so helpful and attentive to our table as soon as we walked in. Super friendly,fun, and made us feel so comfortable. Very quick service and we're definitely coming back!

I like it a lot. I have become a regular / nuisance depending on who you ask. Dependable for great music and a good time. Good for 24+.

Hilarious and cute bartenders!

Nice chill bar with good vibes.  Only stopped in for a quick drink before dinner next door at 8282, but would definitely come back to try the food and other drinks. I got the Moscow mule, and you can tell they used a high quality ginger beer because of the spicyness of the fresh ginger.  My friend ordered the cold brew martini and said it was really good!

Definitely a cute location that's dog friendly. They have outdoor seating for the beautiful New York day. They were busy and only had one server. A little frustrating that people that came after me were serviced before me. I spoke to an an employee about the happy hour but they weren't able to assist. They strongly encourage you to put a card on tab. Overall maybe a good spot for a quick drink

Stopped by here for brunch when we were walking in the lower east side and saw a sign for $25 entree and 2 drinks!

At 3pm it was popping inside! Lots of loud music and people.

We were able to grab a table outside with the dog and enjoy the sunshine!

The drinks included in the prefix were nitro martinis, spicy margaritas, beer on draft and well drinks!

Went with the nitro martini to start and it was really good!

For lunch tried the brunch burger which had an egg and gravy on top! The egg was a nice touch but you couldn't really taste the gravy!

Service was a little slow but it was jam packed!

Overall good deal and nice outdoor seating!

5 stars all the way!!!

I looked near and high for a bar to hold my 25th birthday dinner, but being a December baby, everywhere had insane minimums and/or were booked for holiday parties.

Initially, a friend told me about 310 Bowery and that they had no minimum, and all I had to do was email them and let them know how many people. I reached out to Anthony, who runs the events at both 310 Bowery and 82 Stanton. He told me that they were more than happy to accommodate my party on Dec. 7, but they could only split the tab among 5 cards. I knew I was going to have about 40-50 people, so this wouldn't work. He then suggested the sister bar 82 Stanton. They had no minimums either, and everyone could have his or her own tab. This was perfect for me!

Overall, the experience could not have been better. Anthony and Devan (a manager at 82 Stanton) provided really stellar customer service and were incredibly attentive. The night of, they even had a bottle of Prosecco and a sign for me on our reserved section. I was worried at one point that something would happen with friends not getting in or the bar hitting capacity, but the whole night went so smooth. Thank you 82 Stanton for providing the best 25th birthday venue! I will most definitely be recommending this bar to friends going forward.
Fabulous happy hour, wasn't super packed so we could get a space at the patio. Loved sitting in the sun on a warm day! Hello spring! Margs are great! The kitchen was closed so couldn't get food :/

This place never lets us down. Made a reservation and they gave us a great table and put on the basketball game for us. The drinks were great and the food slapped. The everything but the bagel seasoning on their pretzel is a game changer it was out of this world. Music was on point. This might be my go to spot on Fridays.

I recently had the pleasure of stopping into the incredible establishment. The staff was nothing short of pleasurable and was nothing but nice  and on top of every table being served. My server was the sweetest girl ever named Rani. Best staff best drinks love it here 10/10 recommend

This was a nice chill bar after work on a Friday for happy hour. The music was good and it wasn't too loud so you can hear yourself speak and have a conversation. Come through if you're in the neighborhood.

Solid place.

The outside area is cute and has nice seating. They now have an insta-worthy wall on the side that I'm sure many "bloggers" will flock to.

They have some drink and happy hour specials that are definitely worth taking advantage of if you plan on stopping in.

I think this will be a nice spot in the neighborhood for drinks before you want to get LIT at HOD across the street.

I don't recommend coming with a large party, it can be difficult to conviene here and when there is a crowd, gets filled quickly.

I will definitely be back.

4/5

Came here with a friend for their happy hour specials which includes wine, draft, and margaritas under $8 and sliders for $3.

Their happy hour ends at 7 so we got there at 6:30pm and there was still a good amount of seating left. Snagged an outdoor table - love me a good happy hour and outdoor seating! Ordered a draft beer and sliders. The beef sliders were juicy and delicious! Had we not needed to go to a gym class after, we would've ordered more. Will definitely be back!
Amazing spot. I come here pretty often. Awesome company, bartenders are conversational and friendly. Drinks are poured well and worth the money!

Best bar in the world. Service is unmatched. Vibes are incredible. Drinks are strong. Food is tasty. Don't miss out on this sick nasty spot. Theo the manager is kind cute and British. Dylan has great energy. Makenzie, Rani, and Maya are sweethearts. James, Jared, Ray, Lake are kings of the bartending world. Don't think, just go.
Great place for happy hour drink specials and a bite to eat! The drinks and food were good. They were great with following covid regulations and it is very clean here. Definitely coming back again.

Found this hidden gem by chance. We were walking by and saw the specials listed and decided to give it a try. So glad we did. The drinks were amazing, I got the strawberry mimosa and it was delicious. The decor was fun as was the crowd and not to mention the bartender who was super sweet. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the lower east area.

Cutest, little dark spot...so cozy. The bartender was so sweet & made the cocktail to order. Great windows out to street with tables by them. Wide variety drink menu & food choices make it perfect for anything from happy hour to a late night drop in.

Love this as a local spot.. good people, great happy hour, and everything on the menu is dynamite!
Fried chicken is the best treat.
A neighborhood staple back in action.
Great service! Ask to be seated in Taylor's area. She's the BEST! Super patient and kind.

The entire staff that works here is like a loving family that gives great service to everyone and is THE PLACE to go eat/drink/hangout. The shrimp tacos are fabulous and they got outdoor seating in a lovely section in Lower East Manhattan.
Good vibes. Amazing shrimp tacos and only $3 on Tuesdays! I ended up ordering 6 ‍ but ughhhhhh I don't care

Wow! I cannot praise this place enough. We had planned to have lunch somewhere else but it didn't work out; thus, we looked up reviews for other places nearby and found this place! It was wonderful. A cute, quaint place that mainly has locals within. It had GREAT food, and a good happy hour. We stayed for more than we anticipated because of the good service, fair priced drinks, and again GREAT food. Highly recommend you check this out. It has a tiny patio but still...places to sit outside. The inside is super cute, and restrooms are clean. A MUST if you are in the area.
The burgers here since the combine with Mels have been amazing! Just the right size too. Also recommend the espresso martinis.

I live in the neighborhood and this is my favorite all time spot. The happy hour is off the charts cheap, the place is super cute, the music selection amazing and they just got outdoor seating! Highly recommend at anytime of the day. Staff is so cool, too!

What a revamp! The new 82 is almost unrecognizable from its Epsteins days, and all very much for the better.

The new cocktail menu is phenomenal (try the smoky spritz if you like mezcal) and the weekend brunch deal is a steal (try the fried chicken, its to die for). favorite bar in the LES!

I could not have been more disrespected at this bar. Some guy threw up on my friend's shoe, I calmly told the manager and he told me to "fuck myself" and continued to give this guy shots. I just wanted to make sure this man was okay, did not mean to disrespect him or the manager.
It's great spot, perfectly located and with a great happy hour!! I come here quite often and it's far better than the other bars around here which act either too pretentious or too trashy.

Okay first of all, Carlie is the best! we were the first people in for 3pm happy hour and she let us know of all the specials going on for a wednesday afternoon/night. THEN, once the place got packed she totally kept up on us, even after we paid! and of course we wants  second round of her delicious grapefruit margaritas! She made no problems of us, and accomadated all our needs. Thank you Carlie! You rock, well be back for thirds
This was the best place I've been in nyc. Good music. Good people. They make me very happy and i love it haha wahoooo

Shout out to Aj and Ray for great welcoming service. Last time I was here it was still Epstein's yet each time has been great here. It's an awesome atmosphere and great people al around. Nothing but good vibes. Peace and love

RATING: 9.3/10
One of my favorite meals so far this year.

PRO TIP: You literally cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. DO GET the LA iberico ham galbi and the dakgalbi. Michelin bib gourmand 2023 and you know what they deserve it.

YUJA PEAR PERILLA TEQUILA COCKTAIL
Good, and the perilla def comes through but not sure it perfeclty complements the yuja pear but ineresting for sure and love to see korean flavors take a role in cocktails.

LA IBERICO HAM GALBI ****
We thought this was so good and tender, we almost confused it for the steak. Everything is just so thoughtfully paired together, to the buttery, delicately crunchy oyster mushrooms, deliciously seasoned gochujang, tender tender TENDER pieces of pork, and skinned, hydrating chunks of cucumber. What a great bite again and again. Get this please.

CHEESY TTEOKBEOKKI
If you like tteokbeokki you'll love this. Not only is the texture perfectly QQ as it were, but it has a nice heat that's cut by the cheesiness and has pieces of chicken for extra heartiness, and those korean flavors you know and love are enhanced - bold, strong flavors but doesn't taste like your every day rice cake dish. It does have quite a bit of soup though.

8282 STEAK
We thought the iberico ham was tender, but so was this - really really juicy steak and huge portions. A great selection.

DAKGALBI KIMCHI RICE
Again, traditional korean flavors take the stage but are artfully placed in proportions that take you on a flavor journey that have you saying - yes, this is korean but wow this is on another level. you won't feel like you've been ovrercharged for something you can get cheaper. They're really doing something quite different and that's what I want from asian american places, personally.

FINAL CATEGORY: EXCELLENT
(terrible / bad / ok / good / great / EXCELLENT)

This is a small Korean fusion tapas restaurant that we heard a lot of good things about on TikTok. We came here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday while we were visiting NYC and the food definitely did not disappoint!  The food was flavorful and delicious. We ordered a total of four dishes with drinks and were given a free dessert for my boyfriend's birthday as well! I thought four dishes for two people was actually quite filling. The service was great and our server was really attentive. They even sang happy birthday for us! The ambience felt really cozy and intimate which made it a great spot for our celebration.

Food:
Tuna tartare + Kim Bukak: Had a deep and savory complex flavor while also being refreshing and super fresh. The fried seaweed on the bottom also gives it a slightly salty kick to it. Honestly my favorite dish of the night along with the littleneck soojebi for me, my boyfriend also enjoyed this dish! :D

Golden Beets & Kimchi Salad: Tasted light and refreshing, not heavy at all. Was delightfully nutty and paired well with the other saltier dishes we ordered.

Littleneck Soojebi: Savory, salty, and had little bits of small cut noodles and clams. Honestly loved this dish because of the broth, I would definitely recommend this.

Boneless KFC: The soy garlic sauce was delicious and the chicken was moist, tender, and crispy. Definitely some of the best Korean fried chicken I've had! Would have loved to try it without the sauce as well.

Drinks:
Blackberry Hongchu Kiss: This was a pretty great drink if you like sweet drinks, I love sweet drinks so I preferred it over the other cocktail we ordered

Yuja Pear Tequila Perilla: Personally it was not my thing, I thought that this was a bit too bitter for my tastes

Dessert:
Injeolmi Ice Cream: actually loved this dessert! I love injeolmi so this was something that hit the spot for me. Injeolmi kinda tastes a little nutty. I think the parmesan cheese also gave it a salty flavor to the dessert which I actually was pleasantly surprised by! It's a combo I never expected

Overall definitely a favorite I would definitely want to revisit and try everything on the menu! I'd love to come back as soon as possible the next time I am in NYC

My friends and I went around 10pm. We waited about 15 minutes and sat outdoors. The ambiance was chill. The staff was so helpful in recommending what she likes.

My favorite was the Dakgalbi Kimchi-Bap because it was a very delicious combination. The cheese definitely added flavor to the kimchi rice.

Also the grilled octopus with the very tender and the ricotta cheese was delicious and uniquely paired with the octopus.

I came here before a show at 5:30ish with my Uncle and had a fantastic meal! Their reservation system was weird since it said they were all booked up except for bar seating but restaurant was only about half filled by the time we left at 6:45PM so I'm not too sure why there weren't reservations available.

The service was great with all of the waitstaff continually filling your water and they were all extremely friendly and attentive.  The only issue I had with that was it seemed like they were a little on top of us and were constantly trying to take away plates before we were done and came up to us like 5 times before we weee actually ready to order so it felt a little rushed.

The food came out quickly and was absolutely delicious which is why I'd give this place 5 stars! We shared the octopus and the Jjajang bori-bap and both were perfectly seared and paired with delicious sauces!

I also got the aloe, it's me cocktail and it was so pretty and our waitress offered it to me less sweet which was perfect!

We both agreed we needed to come back again to try more of the menu!

8282 came with a lot of good recommendations so I was very excited to try it. And the food did not disappoint. My favorite is the 8282 steak. It was perfectly cooked- well seasoned and perfectly juicy. The scalloped paired beautifully with the jajang barley. And the littleneck clams were so good that I actually drank a couple of spoonfuls of the soup. The tuna tartare was an explosion of flavor. The only downside of the tartare is that I don't think the seaweed paired well with the tuna. The summer slushy (watermelon calpico slushy) was a little bit of a let down. I couldn't taste the calpico at all. It honestly just tastes like a watered down watermelon slush.

The restaurant isn't that big but the vibe was modern and chic. And the service is impeccable. I will definitely come again to try more dishes off the menu

This was my favorite meal on this trip! I loved all the dishes. The ceviche was lightly dressed and so fresh. The shrimp jeon was crispy and nicely flavored with perilla leaves. I loved the grilled octopus; it was perfectly cooked. The noodles with the perilla leaves was refreshing and tasted like comfort food. I ordered the blackberry soju which was nicely flavored but I preferred my friend's drink.

I loved this Korean fusion tapas bar! This space may be small but the ambiance is obviously fun and trendy.They offer really unique small plates and drinks. I came with a group of 4 people this is what I got:

Golden beets and Kimchi Salad (5/5): felt a little small to share amongst our group but nonetheless, it was very refreshing. Interesting contrasting textures between the beets, nuts, and puréed sauce. Beware if you're not a big fan of beets, but I enjoyed this as a starter!

Grilled octopus (5/5): I loved how tender this was, soo good!

Jajang Bori-bap (5/5): grilled scallops over bean sauce barley. The scallop was seared and seasoned soo perfectly. I'm usually not a fan of beans, but with the barley grains, I'll gladly take some more!

LittleNeck Clams (5/5): This was my FAVORITE of the night! I was literally scraping the bottom of the bowl with the clam shells tryna get every last bit. If you're going to order just one, get this!!

Tuna tartare: (5/5) - small, but refreshing and delish!

LA iberico pork galbi (4/5): seasoning was a little too sweet for my liking, but was cooked well

Dakgalbi kimchi-bap (4/5): the chicken was good. Tasted like a classic Korean kimchi fried rice with a bit of a cheesy twist!

I also got the chance to try their gochujang margarita and the hot girl summer! Love how fun and unique their drinks are.

Cute vibe, apparently known for their drinks but none of us got any! They recommend 2 dishes per person to share, but we decided to just get 3 and dessert for our 3-person group. It was plenty for us!

Tuna tartare ($25): topped with uni and bluefish tuna which slightly justifies the price. The bites were quite small and a tad bit salty, but still very tasty

Littleneck soojebi ($20): the broth was delicious and honestly my favorite part of the dish!

Perilla oil pasta ($20): you can choose to get uni which would've been an additional $25 at MP. We skipped it. This was my favorite dish, it was delightfully refreshing and the sesame seeds added great texture

Parmesan ice cream ($12): strong injeolmi flavor which I loved, but Parmesan was weird to me

Overall the food was pretty good, but the small portions and price will probably keep me from coming back.

TLDR: amazing korean food and delish drinks

This gem of a place truly also makes stunning, shining diamonds of korean food. Really can't go wrong with anything here but a few highlights are:

- GOLDEN BEETS & KIMCHI SALAD: super light and refreshing and what a great way to start off the meal

- LITTLENECK SOOJEBI: little clams with almost these mochi like bits - soooo delish

- YUZU MATCHA MAGIC: this is the matcha soju lemon yuzu drink that is just pure dynamite. if you like lightly sweetened and refreshing drinks, this is the one for you

Blown away! Just go!

Octopus - perfectly cooked, tender inside, not rubbery at all. With the perfect char on the outside and the sauces were divine. I could eat this all day.

Clams- I can see why everyone loves this, overall the clams themselves were big and meaty. But for us, just a smidge overcooked and not as tender as they could be. However, that broth wow! Both of us were taking spoonfuls. It's the perfect mix of rich, yet light, savory and a little tangy.

Scallops - super big and tender and cooked to perfection. But the star of this dish is actually the bed of barley underneath. It reminds me of a mix between a super rich mushroom risotto and Korean black bean noodles. So much umami. We both said all we needed was a giant bowl of this barley, even without the scallops. I'd pay for it anyday.

Pork Galbi - cooked to perfection, juicy inside with a nice char outside. The marinade was delicious and the toppings were refreshing to cut the richness of the meat.

We will def be coming back here often and I'm dragging all my friends with me.

In a city of great restaurants, this is some of the best and most interesting modern Korean I've had anywhere. Showed up without reservations (but early) and got a table by the door, but then they moved us to a nicer table and were incredibly friendly. Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the entire menu but we had already decided to order basically everything (which was the right call, although maybe we got one or two too many dishes...)

Highlight was the tuna tartare, but really everything was very good. Apparently they change the menu frequently, too.

Unfortunately no pictures cos I was too busy eating. It was some of the best korean food I've had - so good and I'm definitely going back.

I actually got to try a lot of the menu -- scallops, littleneck soojebi, fried chicken, octopus, oxtail noodle soup, steak, perilla oil pasta. everything was delicious but littleneck soojebi and perilla oil past may be my favs if I had to pick. the ice cream & pie were both good!

- one of the best meals either of us have had this year
- my dinner companion and I were both thoroughly impressed
- recommend: mushroom party, iberico pork galbi, dakgalbi kimchi bap, jjajang Bori bap
- 4 dishes btw the two of us was a good amount food, we were both moderately hungry
- neither of us are dessert people but were so impressed by everything else we went for it, Parm on icecream is a little weird but gave almost a coconut shred texture (he enjoyed it more than I did)
- the tea party cocktail was interesting, he also enjoyed this more than I did. It was sweet and familiar almost reminiscent of a creamcicle. Not a hint of alcohol of that's your thing, truly dangerous
- the waitress and vibe were both wonderful, would be good for most occasions

The food was good! Not my favorite contemporary Korean spot but for an early dinner and catch up with friends, 8282 checks most boxes.

We ordered four dishes for the two of us. Fried chicken, tuna tartare, soojebi and the pork galbi. We also ordered drinks which hit us pretty hard. My favorite was the soojebi which was served with clams. We got a bowl of rice to soak the broth and finish off the meal. The galbi is as also delicious. The seaweed chip on the tuna tartare didn't go well for me - I compared it to a toastada without the crunch that i was looking for

The waiter was attentive tho a little soft spoken. Food came quick!

This spot looked unassuming outside but lovely inside. It was small and cozy. The waitress recommended 2-3 dishes per person and everything tasted delicious.
- Tuna tartare + kim bukak: the tuna was fresh and the combination was so tasty
- Littleneck soojebi: the sauce was yummy and the soojebi was chewy. I don't usually find soojebi in the city so this was exciting. My fav!
- Galbi: the meat was tender and the sauce was yummy as well.
- Perilla Oil Pasta: this dish was ok, i hope there was more crab but overall and solid dish
I really enjoyed the food and would come back to try other dishes on the menu!
Food was amazing.  Space was small so it was not ideal for big groups but service was good and fast.

First visit:
Mind blown by everything I ate here.
Star of the show: Pork Galbi - my bf (who eats beef, because I don't) told me that this tasted exactly like how a good beef Galbi should. SO VERY tender and just perfect. Ordered 6 dishes for the two of us and we finished everything and was so satisfied.

Second visit:
The pork Galbi was not as good as the first time round but  the food is still good.

This is a VERY good date night spot! Also, the service is top notched - they are very patient with explaining each dish & the chef tends to give you a free small dish of food. Love the thoughtfulness, I hope they don't ever lose that touch.

Wow the flavors and textures, so good! This restaurant is quite popular so snagging a reservation on a weekend was pretty difficult; ended up with a 9:30 seating for four, but still very satisfied!

Favortie dishes of the night were the oil pasta and mushroom party. The pasta had a strong flavor that goes very well with the smooth texture; I was already getting full at the time the pasta came out and I still devoured it! The mushroom party was a dish we added towards the end, the chefs got so many different texture profiles and flavors from these shrooms, yum!

The service was brisk and polite, so went along well with the good food. Vibe was VERY loud though, particularly at the bar, but I think that might have been due to just one patron that night.

Had an amazing date night at 8282 in the LES a few weeks ago! They have a small menu, so not a ton of veggie options, but enough to leave with a full and happy stomach.

Golden Beets and Kimchi Salad - This was a unique fusion dish that I really enjoyed. I usually love burrata and beets anyway, but the combination of unexpected flavors was really nice.

Eggplant Bulgogi Japchae - This was a new (possibly experimental?) dish and I'm not sure if it's still on the menu, but I LOVED the Japchae noodles. They were perfectly cooked and had just the right amount of spice. My meat loving husband loved the noodles so much, he asked for a side of the noodles to go with his pork, and they very kindly obliged us (on the house!). The eggplant is intended to be a little chewy, but you can ask them to cook it more if you prefer. Also, I love that this comes with impossible meat, but I would personally prefer tofu.

The staff is amazing and they all seemed to genuinely enjoy working together, which made the experience that much better. Truly one of our best nights out in a long time!

Wowza. I came back a second time and the service was on point. Got complimentary cocktail shots and also the mushroom dish. Was blown away!!

The food was great again. This time, tried the rice dish and the sujebi dish. The sujebi was so good. The clams were big and the broth was flavorful. The fried rice was a little sweet but good amt of food and still tasty. The mushroom has a strong mushroom umami taste.

The drinks were fun to drink - secret garden is one of the top on the list. I tried the martini but i felt the lemon was a little overpowering. I think i'd honestly prefer that drink with no lemon at all (pickle broth instead of olives).

Will be back!!

Such a great spot!

My husband and cousin came here last night for Christmas dinner! Shareable modern tapas were all flavorful and delicious. Apparently this place is famous on Tik Tok though I didn't know about that.

Vibe: intimate eatery, good service, busy so make a reservation!
Cocktails: I enjoyed the matcha martini, and the guys enjoyed the beer options.
The real appeal: The food!

I would say my favorites were the scallops, the chicken over cheesy rice, and the KFC chicken was yummy too. The restaurant gave us a complimentary steak dish which was delectable also.

They also gave us two free rounds of shots, which was so kind and nice on a day where most other places are closed.

Would definitely recommend and would come back !

If you're in the mood for some Korean food with a twist, this place is for you! I've been trying to get reservations here for awhile but decided to stop by last minute with some friends for dinner on a Saturday night. There weren't any tables available but they did have some bar seating so we opted for that.

We ordered the:
- Dakgalbi kimchi-bap (4/5): This is your usual gochujang marinated chicken over some cheeeeesy kimchi rice - yum.
- Boneless KFC (5/5): Super juicy, tender, boneless fried chicken thighs in a delicious soy garlic sauce - SO GOOD. I thought this would be crispy (it is not - so if you're expecting a crunch, you'll be disappointed) but didn't mind at all.
- Perilla oil pasta (4/5): Pasta tossed in some soy sauce, oil, seaweed, and sesame seeds - light and simple. You can get this topped with uni but we opted not to.
- Jjajang bori-bap (5/5): MUST GET. This comes with four pieces of perfectly cooked scallops on top, which pairs beautifully with the jjajang bap. Wasn't sure about this combo but let me tell you - it works.

For drinks, we got:
- Tea party (4/5): Tastes like...tea, which I loved!! Super light and refreshing.
- Yuzu matcha magic (5/5): The BEST drink here - it's perfectly balanced with the matcha and yuzu. Highly recommend!

Definitely add this to your list, if it's not on there already. Food and service are excellent and their bartenders are so lovely (and on point with their recommendations!).

L.A. IBERICO PORK GALBI (Grilled soy-marinated Iberico, ssamjang, roasted broccolini with red pepper vinaigrette): The pork melted in your mouth and the broccolini was soft and tender. The char/smokiness evoked Korean bbq.

DAKGALBI KIMCHI-BAP (Gochu-jang marinated chicken over cheesy kimchi rice): full of textures like the crispy rice from the bottom of the skillet. This flavor-wise felt the most Korean of the ones we tried

CITRUS CARROT DUCK: one of the weaker dishes as the sauce was a bit overwhelming and drowned out the taste of the duck. There were chunks of black pepper in the sauce that masked the other flavors.

JJAJANG BORI-BAP (Seared scallops over barley mixed in black bean sauce & truffle paste): this dish was so good we re-ordered it - the scallops were perfectly cooked. Reminded me of a super elevated version of jajangmyeon.

BONELESS K.F.C. (Fried chicken thigh with Korean soy garlic sauce, topped with pickled chili peppers, served with pickled radish noodles): not as crispy as I had hoped but the acidity from the radish paired really well with the oiliness of the fried chicken.

TUNA TARTARE + KIM BUKAK (Bluefin tuna, sesame oil aioli, served with fried seaweed chips topped with egg custard): The nori chips had a bit of a kick to them and paired very well with the tuna tartare. It didn't have a strong tuna flavor because of the strong sesame and yuzu notes.

LITTLENECK SOOJEBI (Potato & pumpkin soojebi with littleneck clams, black pepper soy sauce, butter scallion, ginger, garlic): The clams were incredibly juicy and paired so well with the chewiness of the soojebi. This dish was very yuzu forward. Would recommend requesting extra rice to soak up all the extra broth.

Fun atmosphere, would visit again!

Honestly.... this has to be one of my top 5 fav restaurants in NYC. Service, ambiance, food, EVERYTHING was just top notch.

I made reservations beforehand because I know this is a hot place and it gets really crowded during prime dinner time. Servers were so friendly and on point, knowing when to check up on us and seeing when our glasses were empty. I love how they played k-rnb/chill korean music as I was just boppin and groovyin while eating. Plating of the dishes were beautiful, and the portion sizes were pretty big too.

The littleneck soojebi was my favorite. The Grilled Octopus was pretty good too as I loved the bell pepper puree that came with it, but the jjajang bori-bap I think requires a bit of an acquired taste (it also had a bit of a unique texture too b/c it was bori-bap). The 8282 hanger steak was also amazing, with the texture and seasoning. Wish it came out a little hotter and the brussel sprouts cooked a little more but it was still all so good!!

Lastly, PLEASE get the Tea Party cocktail! I was gulping this down in like three sips b/c it was SO good. Hands down the best cocktail I ever had, and I would seriously come back here just for this. I could have it all night..

This place is definitely going to be somewhere I recommend to my friends visiting NYC!!

I saw on tiktok that this restaurant recently opened and wanted to check it out! I managed to snag a reservation for 6 on a Saturday evening. 8282 definitely exceeded my expectations and I would consider it one of my faves in the city!

When we arrived, I was immediately impressed by the vibe and the service. My friend and I arrived first, and our waitresses were very friendly and had us seated as soon as we arrived. We ordered the YUJA PEAR TEQUILA PERILLA and YUZU MATCHA MAGIC while we waited-- both were great! probably on the lower ABV side but delicious nonetheless.

For a party of 6, our waitress actually said we could order one of everything on the menu! We decided to not order a couple items-- that said, I would definitely recommend coming with a bigger party so you can try everything on the menu!

Of the dishes we ordered, we thought you could SKIP: LITTLENECK SOOJEBI, PERILLA OIL PASTA. Not that these dishes aren't good, but didn't wow us as much as their other dishes.

Definitely get: DAKGALBI KIMCHI-BAP, JJAJANG BORI-BAP, L.A. IBERICO PORK GALBI. So delicious, I still think about the pork galbi to this day.

Overall: easily deserving of 5 stars for food and service! I saw their menu has changed since my last visit so I would love to go back to try their new dishes and get the pork galbi again!

Overall a decent dinner experience and wouldn't be mad if I came back but also wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

Ordered the Mushroom Party (5/5- they actually use at least 4-5 different types of mushroom which was very much appreciated and the chesnut sauce/puree was delicious) and Tuna Tartare (3/5- i love anything raw seafood/tartares and I can't put my finger on it but just didn't like this dish here) to start off with.

For our entrees we had the Chicken Kimchi-bap (3.5/5- some parts of the flavor was there compared to other Korean restaurants that serve this dish, and it was a good portion, but this was so sweet I contemplated on sending it back but decided to just eat it) and the Jjajang Bori-bap (3.5/5- scallops were cooked well and if the barley/sauce wasn't also ridiculously sweet I would've enjoyed this dish).

The cocktails we ordered were also nothing to write home about: Miss Persimmon and Yuzu Matcha Magic. I personally had the Yuzu drink and it tasted more like yuzu with the color of matcha (I love yuzu but would have liked a more balanced cocktail).

Service was great and if both my entrees weren't so sweet I probably would've rated this place slighty higher.

I read reviews saying to make a reservation because they do get packed and I did. I made a reservation on Resy for the floor (had options to book floor or bar) and was told that they didn't have any tables available so I had to be seated at the bar..

- bar seating during the winter with our heavy long coats dragging the floor on the tiny hooks for dining was pretty annoying, hence why I booked for the floor/table
- the food came pretty slow
- it was pretty pricey and honestly I was still hungry (party of 2: 3 dishes 2 drinks, total came out to be $75 each after tips)
+ our bartender was amazing, free matcha yuzu shots, lovely drinks, and great service (made our whole experience 10x better)
+ the pork galbi was super tasty, loved the sweetness and was not tough
+ tuna tartare was delicious, would recommend and I thought the scallop dish was alright

Big fan of 8282. It's like modern Korean tapas, and each dish adds a little twist yet retains Korean flavor or concepts. There wasn't an item that wasn't good. The jajang boribap and littleneck soojebi stood out the most. 8282's drinks, and even non-alcoholic drinks were fun and tasty. Service was on point.

Dined here with a friend for an early dinner. I would recommend having a reservation handy as it does get packed. Very Nice cute modern spot that's perfect for a catch up or a date night. For drinks I got the gochujang margarita which had the perfect amount of spice in it. For food we got the fried chicken, octopus and scallops. The fried chicken flavor wise was tasty but I wish the chicken was crispy as the skin was on the softer side and didn't give that crunch factor you would expect. I did like the addition of the pickled radishes but wish they were cubed vs thinly sliced. The octopus was cooked perfectly and I liked the pepper purée. The scallops were also well cooked. Overall solid experience with good service

8282 (Lower East Side, Manhattan)

Honestly one of @angelina_gao favorite restaurants in Manhattan!! Great spot for date night or groups since it's all small dishes to share. Small menu and every dish had very unique, rich flavors. Service and drinks were amazingggg!! On the pricier side but definitely worth it.

We ordered Tuna Tartare + Kim Bukak, Perilla Oil Pasta, Little Neck Soojebi, and Jjajang Bori-Bap (fav) as the dishes. For drinks, we got a Yuja Pear Tequila Perilla and Yuzu Matcha Magic (fav).

IG: @gaogirlsgrubbin

WOW i really loved this restaurant!!!! everything was super delicious albeit a bit expensive

- uni pasta was delicious
- clam soup was HUGE
- the pork belly was delicious
- loved the mushroom party (!!!) :')
- korean fried chicken!!!! yummmerzzzz

we ended up ordering 5 dishes for three girls and we had a bit leftover. they say 2-3 dishes per person, but i would think heavily about this before you order bc sometimes you end up with too much food. hahaha

i wish there was an in between rating bc i think this place is closer to a 4.2/5 stars lol

my two main gripes were
- the food sometimes came out a bit cold. i think if they could work on timing and heat it would have beeeen *chefs kisss*
- we were rushed out promptly at 9:30 w a warning that there was another reservation coming. le sigh

We ordered the Perilla Oil Pasta w Uni, Grilled Octopus, and Clam Soojebi.

Each dish we had was delicious!! If you want the uni, it is an add on for the perilla oil pasta. I definitely recommend adding it, it costs $58 for the dish in total.

The grilled octopus was super tasty, especially with the chili oil and sauce it came with. The soonjebi was also hit and a must get, even if you're not too into clams.

Overall, @8282nyc was a hit!! I would recommend getting a reservation as it was a little packed.

We walked in on a Sunday night and sat at the bar. The tables were for reservations only. Bar service from Cat was amazing and all the drinks were so inventive. I especially liked the use of perilla leaves which isn't commonly found in cocktails. Most of the bar menu was her creation and loved watching her work her craft.

The clams were probably the best bang for you buck option. For $20 we got 9 clams!! and the broth was to die for especially with rice.
The golden beet salad was light and refreshing with the fermented tomatoes and creamy burrata.
Angel hair perilla leaves was such a unique pasta dish that I've never had before. Sesame oil was a nice touch.
Scallops with barley and truffle was an interesting take on traditional zha jiang dish. Loved that there were so many scallops.
Kimchi BAP was another dish drowning in perilla leaves.

Loved how inventive this Korean fusion was and a refreshing take. Generally affordable dishes for the portion size and quality of ingredients.

Food - 8.5/10
Service - 8/10
Ambiance 7.5/10 ( a little loud for me)
Must get: tuna tartare, pork galbi, clams dish
Book in advance, space isn't too big
Highly recommend this place!

Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Was still hungry so we popped in for small foods and drinks. We thankfully were seated immediately in a 3 person area for the 2 of us. The place is dimly lit and small. They played good music if you like pop music. I was most impressed by the drinks. They were both fantastic! My yuzu matcha tasted like a drink with no alcohol. The blend of yuzu and matcha went well together. The pandan had some alcohol taste to it but the pandan flavor was very apparent. They did a great job of presenting flavors in both drinks. I've been to cocktail bars and have been disappointed. We ordered a dish of DAKGALBI KIMCHI-BAP. It came out quick and steaming hot of course. Remember to mix it up. We should have left it a little longer to crisp up the rice, but it was still very good. There was the right amount of cheese to keep the rice together. They didn't skimp out on the chicken. Well flavored thick ish cuts of chicken.

HIGHLY recommend coming to 8282

I have been here twice now and have had amazing experiences both times.

The staff are beyond friendly and kind. They made some great recommendations for both food and drink, and very attentive even when busy. Would definitely recommend making a reservation as every time it's been packed when coming (and saw people having to wait). Great for a date night or impressing out of towners.

Some of our favorite dishes are the tuna tartare, the ceviche, and our favorite is the jjajang bori-bap... the scallops are absolutely delicious!! Some good cocktails I had were the K-Melon Martini and the Tea Party (if you like sweet). My date enjoyed the Jeju Old Fashioned. Really wish I snapped some pictures, but take my word for it!

Please try and stop by, you won't regret it!

This place was so FIREEEEE . Came with the hubby for dinner. Seemed pretty easy to get a res for a Sunday night. The decor was pretty chill, low key vibes. We were told by the waitress to order about 3-4 things to share between us both. We decided on 3 things - was a bit worried I wasn't going to be full afterwards but I was truly stuffed.

We got the boneless KFC, the iberico pork galbi and the jjang boribap. All 3 dishes were so incredibly delicious!! Favorite was definitely the jjajang boribap (Seared scallops over barley mixed in black bean sauce & truffle paste) which I thought was a pretty unique dish, that had incredible flavors. The pork galbi and the boneless KFC was also really delicious. Would definitely love to come back and try all the other things on the menu!!

For my friend who loved The Meatball Shop that used to reside at this same location, I can only say (to myself,"Good riddance" and) that 8282 is one of the best restaurants in the LES neighborhood. As much as I love traditional Korean cuisine, I can really get used to the modern style of the combination of taste, texture, and presentation is always this brilliant. The menu is perfect in its simplicity and the photos by all uploaders can speak for themselves in terms of how beautifully they are prepared and presented.

For a party of two, the recommended 4 to 5 small/shared plates was spot on. Every dish has its own highlights and uniqueness such that when our delightful waitress asked for feedback, the conversation can really go on and upset others patrons who are waiting on us to get up and go. The four excellent dishes that we got to try included two smalls (Golden Beets & Kimchi Salad and Grilled Octopus) and two shares (8282 Hanger Steak and Jjajang Bori-Bap). The sweet potato fondant that accompanied the Hanger Steak was so intoxicating that we started dipping the scallops from the Bori-Bap into it. I can wax poetically about how great each dish was, but the main takeaway is how amazing the different purees for each dish really sets the tone in terms of the overall enjoyment of the dish.

Very much looking forward to future visits and to trying to entire menu! Thanks again to the wonderful wait staff and their attentiveness.

Intimate Korean restaurant in LES that just opened up in 2021. The naming isn't super intuitive, but it's a reference to Korea's country code and another meaning in Korean, which seems very sweet. It is a little confusing to find the restaurant since it's literally right next to a bar that also has "82" in its name, but keep an eye out for 8282's illustrated tiger head.

I came here for a special event (collaboration with Banh by Lauren) and had a really great meal. Even though it was a special event, most of the items are still available on their standard menu (except the desserts).

My favorite dishes were the perilla oil pasta with uni and crab, and the jjajang boribap. The seafood in all of the dishes was really fresh. The tuna tartare is OK but the seaweed chips that came with it were a++, I feel like I could've just eaten a basket of those.

The desserts by Banh By Lauren were super amazing and I hope they do more collaborations in the future.

Great little spot for food + drinks!

They serve dishes tapas-style and recommend ordering ~2 plates per person. That being said, I went with two friends and we were full after sharing 3 dishes between us (granted we weren't super hungry). We ordered:

-Spring Pea Crudo: Super fresh yellowtail, I love how the peas came both pureed and whole for some fun texture.
-Boneless KFC: Crunchy and tender chicken with a sweet soy garlic glaze. If you've ever had korean fried chicken, the flavors will taste very familiar. Not the most unique dish on the menu, but very substantial and filling.
-Iberico Pork Galbi: Super flavorful marinated pork and I love a good roasted broccolini.

The service was great - our bartender was super passionate/knowledgeable about the food and even made me a complimentary mini non-alcoholic Yuzu Matcha Magic free of charge after i said I didn't drink.

My experience at 8282 perfectly represents what I love about the NYC food scene. A friend of mine was having a party on the Lower East Side and I wanted to find a restaurant where we could get a great but not too upscale dinner nearby. I checked all of my saved businesses on Google maps and 8282 popped up. I had no memory of saving this spot, but I guess I just blindly clicked that little green flag one day and hoped it would benefit me in the future. Well, future me is proud of past me, because 8282 was exactly what I had hoped for, and then some. Creative, excellent food, an equally impressive cocktail menu, wildly fast service and the bill won't hurt your wallet too much. We got to the friend's party exactly when we wanted to, and I got to rave to all who would listen about the amazing meal we'd just had.

Made a reservation here at 7:30 on a Saturday night. The space itself fairly small, with probably no more than 10-12 small tables in there plus bar seating, It's very loud and chaotic, but not in a distracting or uncomfortable way. It's more like, this is the vibe, you get what you come for, sorry if you didn't do your research. Like I said, fun New York experience. We've been to a solid number of Korean fine dining spots (Atomix, Jua, Oiji Mi, etc.) so it was nice to get a relatively more casual experience.

The first drink I ordered (conveniently the only drink we tried not on the online menu was a gin-based drink with aloe and tea syrup. I asked our server to explain it to me and she said it was like a martini, so I gave it a try. It ended up being more like a gimlet-style drink but not a very good one (I found it kind of watered down and flat), so I sheepishly sent it back. I virtually never do this because it makes me feel like a very bad person, but they were nice about it. My husband, on the other hand, started with the Yuja Pear Tequila Perilla (Citrus splash of yuja & pear, tequila, lime, topped with perilla & perilla oil), which I did not try but he said it was one of the best drinks he ever had. I swapped my first drink for the Oiji Dirty (Korean pickled cucumber (oiji) brine, Rockey's botanical liqueur, dry vermouth, and Gray Whale gin), which was superb and a unique spin on your typical dirty martini. For our second round, my husband got the Secret Forest (Tanqueray dry gin, Rockey's botanical liqueur, vermouth, snap pea & green chartreuse syrup, lemon, thyme) which was absolutely fabulous. I got the Miss Persimmon (Persimmon, chai tea syrup, rye whiskey, bitters), which I thought was going to be like a Manhattan but was actually shake and served up (I had weird luck with drinks). That said, it was still super tasty.

Food-wise, you gotta share here. They recommend 4-5 dishes per two people, but I think that suggestion takes entree-sized dishes into consideration, because we only ordered small plates and we probably could've had one more after six. The food is creative, inspired, seasonal and fresh. Lots of bold flavors but overall, still a relatively healthy meal (obviously it depends on what you order). Eats, below:

Endive Salad (Organic Belgium endive, Asian pear, yogurt, walnut, parsnip): A
Super fresh, earthy, light and sweet, love the combo of the pear/yogurt/walnut which has been done many times but in this case it was executed perfectly

Tuna Tartare + Kim Bukak (4 pcs of bluefin tuna, sesame oil aioli, served on fried seaweed chips topped with uni, capers, and egg custard): A+
These were total flavor bombs and one of the stunners of the night. The seaweed chips were perfect crispy/salty vessels for the incredibly delicious tuna

Golden Beet & Kimchi Salad (Golden beets over gold and red beet puree, tomato kimchi, house-made burrata, pistachio, yuzu kosho vinaigrette, beet chips with green tea powder): A
Similar to my feelings about the endive salad, I think this was an elevated, super creative version of a class beet-cheese salad. The kimchi was a delightful touch and the yuzu kosho vinaigrette was light, citrusy and subtly sweet. Beet puree and beet chips made this beets three ways, yet it was not at all overkill.

Mushroom Party (Grilled king mushroom, grilled maitake mushroom, rosemary panko, cashew, yogurt, mushroom puree): A+
This was my other favorite dish of the night. Super flavorful, earthy, and inhale-able. Seriously, I found myself wishing we had gotten two orders of this.

Littleneck Soojebi (Potato soojebi with littleneck clams, black pepper soy sauce, butter scallion, ginger, garlic): A
Despite feeling wary about ordering the clams given that I don't always like them (my husband feels similarly), we really enjoyed this dish. Fresh/light but still with ample flavor/umami, and that broth was just divine.

Sole: A
For whatever reason, the sole is both the only dish we got not on the online menu, and the only dish I didn't photograph. But I promise it was very good! Light with delicate flavors, it balanced out the rest of our order nicely.

I came here with a friend on a Friday night for dinner.
We ordered  a few dishes to share: Tuna tartare, Littleneck soojebi, Perilla oil pasta and we added uni, and Pork GALBI. I would have to say definitely get the littleneck because it was extremely flavorful and the noodles was nice and chewy. We really enjoyed the pasta with uni as well. The pork GALBI was nice and tender. Honestly, the tuna tartare was our least favorite, it was a bit disappointing the flavor was bland, so probably skip it.

8282 was such an incredible and memorable dining experience!

The food is truly special. Growing up as third culture kid, I didn't always appreciate Korean food. Eating at 8282 was nostalgic yet new. Take the perilla oil pasta - I loved eating angel hair as a kid and perilla was often a summer staple from my grandma's garden.

All of the dishes were executed so well with perfectly balanced flavors! The perilla oil pasta was light and delicate. The little neck soojebi was so special too. The soojebi was al dente and the dish was so savory and buttery! The jajang bori bap was probably the most decadent dish of the mix. I am a huge fan of jajang but personally this dish wasn't my favorite.

I really enjoyed the injeolmi ice cream! The parmesan cheese and injeolmi was a grate combination ;)

8282's take on Korean cuisine speaks to my soul. I felt seen by this food! I will forever be searching for meals like the one I had at 8282. Can't wait to go back!

Food tastes really fusion and creative with a little twist. We ordered 8 dishes to share among 5 of us. The portion of each dish is not huge. Sort of tapas style. I strongly recommended Tteok-bokki, 8282 steak, grilled octopus, and scallops in jjiajang sauce. One star taken away because the restaurant is so small with too many tables. With that being said, you can't sit very comfortable away from other tables. Also my cocktail Yuzu matcha magic is not in a good blend. Advices for anyone who wants to try, make a reservation via Resy. Walk in is impossible to get a table. Please go there early to enjoy less crowded dinner.

Unique restaurant w modernized twist on Korean food. Ingredients are mostly deconstructed with a flair of seafood. Given I had a shellfish allergy, staff were very accommodating.

The salad (7.5/10) was fresh, a medley of vegetables. Overall fresh and nice way to start you palette, nothing ordinary though.

The scallops and black bean (9/10) was a modern twist to the korean black bean noodles you would typically get. Delicious with a strong flavor profile and nice balance of saltiness.

Pork Galbi (7/10) was alright. I expected more of a korena flavored marinade but was let down on how he sauce was basically gochuchang. The meat was well cooked though.

The KFC chicken (8.5/10) was standard for fried chicken, nothing particular unique with the seasoning, cooked well. The real star was the pickled noodles that it came with! Light, refreshing - wish it came with more!

I had the plum vinegar drink (10/10) which was refreshing and paired well with the tapas.

Flavors were sweet, sour, and spicy. I don't think they do spicy as well as the other two. Overall great balance of flavors, nice presentation, and fantastic service. They offered the bday girl free ice cream, so nice touch!

On the pricier side of Korean food for the amount you get! Approx $200 for 3 people including tip.

Great take on Korean fusion, my friends and I had a fantastic time here!

If you are able to, I'd definitely recommend making reservations or you may have to wait / sit at the bar. My friends and I sat at the bar, which was a little difficult in terms of sharing food & keeping a conversation going, but the bartenders in front of us were awesome and very attentive & friendly. 10/10 for customer service!

We ordered the Spring Pea Crudo, Snowcrab Bibim Somyun, Dakgalbi Kimchi-Bap, and Jjang Bori-bap for 3 people and that was a good amount of food for us to share for dinner. Our server recommended 2-3 plates per person which we didn't follow because 6-9 plates total sounded like a lot, and we were glad we didn't go by this as 4 plates proved to be enough for us. Our favorites included the Jjang Bori-bap and the Spring Pea Crudo, the Snowcrab Bibim Somyun was just alright and the Dakgalbi Kimchi-Bap did not really stand out either. My personal favorite was the Jjang Bori-bap, the scallops were definitely a nice touch.

The cocktails are a must here, I got the Gochujang Margarita and thought it was super unique & tasted great. My friends ordered the Yuzu Matcha Magic, which they thoroughly enjoyed as well.

All things considered, the food was decently good but not the best in my opinion but everything else (drinks, service, ambience, etc) was amazing so I'm glad I visited at least once!

All around really good Korean small plates. My favorites were the scallops and the clams. The complexity of the umami on both these dishes were out of this world.

1. BONELESS K.F.C. (Fried chicken thigh with Korean soy garlic sauce, served with pickled radish noodles) $15
2. TUNA TARTARE + KIM BUKAK (Bluefin tuna, sesame oil aioli, served with fried seaweed chips topped with egg custard) $25
3. LITTLENECK SOOJEBI (Potato sooejbi (hand-pulled dough) with littleneck clams, black pepper soy sauce, butter scallion, ginger, garlic) $18
4. JJAJANG BORI-BAP (Seared scallops over barley mixed in black bean sauce & truffle paste) $26
5. YUJA PEAR TEQUILA PERILLA (Citrus splash of yuja & pear, tequila, lime, topped with perilla & perilla oil)

Came here for a work dinner. I called to make a reservation for 5 on a Friday. Luckily they were able to squeeze us in at 530 since they mentioned that they don't usually take reservations for more than 4 people on Fridays and Saturdays. The venue is relatively small with only a few tables for large parties. We ordered a sampling of different entrees and apps. The food overall was all really good with interesting flavor profiles. My favorites of the night were the tuna tartare and scallops! Would come back again!

Incredible food and drinks! Cute atmosphere! This place is giving Thursday Kitchen a run for its money.

I came here on a Thursday with two friends and ordered 5 dishes (recommended 6-7) and was so so stuffed!!

The Standouts!!
- Fried Chicken
- Tuna Tartare (wish there were more chips with the tuna)
- La Iberico Pork Galbi

The scallops were heavily recommended by the server but I wasn't blown away by them in comparison to the rest of the dishes I tried.
