The drinks were also really interesting as well - no complaints from the table! The food seemed reasonably priced for the cost as well. Will be back as the menu changes!
Amazing! Came here following a friend's recommendation and loved everything we had. Every dish was light and flavorful.

This has to be the most tasty burger that I've ever eaten hands down.
On the weekend there's a line out the door.
Burgers are cooked to perfection and the cheese and pickles melt in your mouth especially with the soft juicy bread.
This taste just exploded in my mouth and I'm definitely a fan of the place.
The employees here are the coolest and the great selection of music is fun to listen to as you digest your meal

You can't go wrong with a classic smashburger from 7th Street when you want to quickly satisfy a burger craving. The cheeseburger has that salty, meaty, cheesy, greasy taste that you want to find in a fast burger joint. I also got the regular fries since I am not usually a fan of loaded fries; I think it just gets too heavy and clumpy.

7th Street Burger is a reliable, reasonably priced choice for a decent burger.

Solid smashburger spot, prices very reasonable for Manhattan. Burger was smaller than expected, however. I wish the patty had some kind of additional seasoning or that the sauce was a bit more flavorful, but that didn't keep me from enjoying my burger. It comes piping hot, as do the fries, so be careful before you bite. Fries here are also excellent, crunchy yet soft inside and pretty big. The drinks are overpriced but if you share with someone you can probably spend less than $10 here on ur burger, fries, and drink, with tax (and tip if you like)

Their menu has like 4 items (slight exaggeration), which I was not aware of before going in and was taken aback for a second. But I respect it; they keep it simple and keep doing what they do best.

Not much seating inside at all unless you want to sit by the "bench" on the window, otherwise you can be at one of their standing tables. Although it seems like a grab and go kinda spot  there are still usually people just hanging out and eating inside so if you plan to do that no worries

Bathroom is pretty clean for a public bathroom in Manhattan, very spacious. Doors are quite wide but unsure if it's accessible

Recommend :)

I was happily surprised by this spot! The simple menu kind of threw me off but it was phenomenal! I got the impossible burger with no cheese, and no house sauce (vegan this way) and I don't know how they cook their burgers, but it's better than any impossible burger I've ever had! I even got one to go for later. The fries are fire too. Highly recommend getting a burger and fries and eating them together in one bite. They also had a blowup figure that you could write your name on which was hilarious!

It's always a good time when 7th Street Burger is involved. They've opened up yet another location down in LES, in a prime location, sure to get plenty of foot traffic. They're open late, as to be expected in that area, so they'll continue to be the perfect spot for an after-hours refueling.

When we pulled up, Ben took our orders. I went with my usual...double cheeseburgers with spicy loaded fries. Our meals came with two drinks, a choice of soda made with real sugar, or water. I also ordered some extra for the others in the homestead. The food was prepared quickly and traveled well, considering. When we got back at home, we annihilated everything. These burgers are sooooo good and even with a limited menu, they're worth a visit because they do what they do very well.

Thanks again to the 7th Street family, Katey and Yelp, for setting this event up. We love this restaurant and it's great to see the growth.

always one of my favorite burgers in the city. I always get the double cheeseburger with the loaded animal fries. The cheeseburger is always savory, greasy, and oh so good. The bun is soft and pillowy and slightly sweet and incredible. The fries comes freshly fried with extra grilled onions and extra beef for that protein. The only con is sometimes there's too much sauce and you can't ask for less- but that's also me being nitpicky.

The LES location doesn't have seating unfortunately- there's some long tables and round tops. It's great for a quick bite though and fits the after drinking greasy munchies.

Stopped by for the Yelp Elite event yesterday! My partner and I each ordered a double hamburger and they were great! It also was not crowded for a Saturday lunch, which was really great because other 7th St Burger locations would get really crowded with a wait of a wait for food. We received our food within 1-2mins of ordering which was great -- fresh off the grill too!

Thanks to the Yelp team and 7th St Burger for putting the event together :)

It's a backyard ambiance. It is a laid back place where you stand up and eat. The music is loud, as if it's a backyard party. I like the vibe.

Staff were accommodating. They look for you when your food is ready.

Impossible burger was moist and delicious. I love the sauce that was drenched on it. The impossible fries were also worth it because it was drenched in that yummy burger sauce.

Two sodas available. Coke and sprite. Water too.

If you're looking for a quick but delicious bite, I would definitely recommend coming here! The burgers + fries + a drink will cost you around $11 and it is so worth it. I got a regular cheeseburger and fries -- tasty and filling! The cheeseburger came with pickles and onions, two classics that many other burger spots often don't consider putting in cheeseburgers so I was very pleased with this.

The Lower East Side location is popping. The vibes in there were so great -- good music and even greater service. They are still renovating the inside of the joint and do not have seating, only long tables to stand and eat right now.

I would definitely recommend checking this location out if you're in the area or looking for a spot to hang out with friends! I want to come back and try the double cheeseburger next.

This was my second 7th street yelp event, and I really enjoyed it! I ordered the regular cheeseburger and loaded fries, and both were great. The burger patty was perfectly cooked and the bun was really soft with a slight sweetness. Definitely pretty greasy but the pickles and onions helped cut through the richness. The loaded fries were also great - they basically just tasted like a burger with fries instead of the bun.

Thanks so much to the yelp elite team for putting this event together and I'll definitely be back when the burger craving hits!

This is the new location at the Lower East Side.

If you want a quick Shakeshack taste alike burger. 7th Street Burger's got you covered.  There is also an impossible burger for vegetarians. The price per burger is about $8.00.

Its's better than standing on the line for the Shake Shack burger.

The menu options are simple and so that makes the service quick and fast.  In addition, this location plays some really good music where you can jam and enjoy the meal!

7th Street Burger never disappoints, I'm so glad to see more stops popping up in different areas in NYC. It is such an easy grab and go spot or you can eat indoors.

My go to is always the double impossible burger with some ketchup. You can also never go wrong with the fries, we even got some cheese on the side which was a delight.

Everything came out hot and fresh out of the grill and the worker even came to ask how our food was! Definitely will be coming back whenever I'm in the area!!

If you're craving a burger, come here!! I ordered a double cheese burger, loaded fries (basically their burger deconstructed and added onto their fries), and a mexican Coke. The store has no seats, but they have tables for you to stand and eat.
Everything was delicious and I would recommend this place to anyone who just loves burgers and fries.

Came here earlier this week. Burgers are amazing. Customer service? Not so much.

Food-
Double cheese burger - 5/5
We opted for the double burger to experience the joint for their best of the best and boy were we glad. The beef was smacked and the bread tasted great in joint with the beef. The cheese melted perfectly in the burger and the amount of grease is just amazing.

Chopped fries- 4/5
The fries were good and the sauce and beef on it was good. My gripe with this item was the beef not being chopping up. It was hard to eat it with the fries. I also had a few fries that were more salted compared to the rest. My suggestion for this is to reduce the salt or spread it better before tossing it into the container.

I would compare these fries and burger to mr beast fries. They taste similar down to the sauce. If I were to pick which was better? I'd choose this joint.

Service - 1/5
Terrible customer service. The person who took our order looked so disinterested in their job and wouldn't even look at us when taking our order.

Ambiance - 4/5
Regular burger joint. Not that big but also not anything fancy. This place seems to be a place where'd you go when you're drunk. It's perfect for those late night grabs.

Prices are a bit expensive - burger + fries + soda came out to nearly $40 per person!

Never disappointed with 7th street. Came for the Yelp elite offer - and left happy. Much better than shake shack. They pepper their fries too, what an excellent idea!
Note though; grilled onions come on the burger - be sure to request an opt out if your boyfriend/significant other/you don't like them!

Always loved their burgers and fries and happy that they opened another location on lower east side. Ordered the same double cheeseburger with fries as I always do in other locations, same great taste and enjoyed it a lot at a nearby park on a sunny afternoon.
How can you go wrong with a smash burger on a martin roll?? Their fries could use some work but i'll still get them.

Perfect venue near chinatown. Not surprising, 7th street burger always comes through with a fantastic smashburger. Seared and flattened to perfection, the burger melts in your mouth.

Pro tip: always ask for the spicy sauce. It has the kick that you want!

"I'm unstoppable
I'm a Porsche with no breaks
I'm invincible"
Those Sia lyrics basically sum up the 7th street burger takeover of ... the world? Absolutely love this new location, and yes it may have been influenced by the fact that the entire time we were there, from ordering to inhaling food to departure, a tasteful playlist of Sia-only songs was blasting. I love how each 7th street burger location has a character of it's own that vibes w the neighborhood. Greasy as always, the double cheeseburger did not disappoint- actually, I think of all the locations I've been to, this one might have the best burger -the way I see it, if I'm going to eat a double cheeseburger, it's going to BE a damned good double cheeseburger, complete with the euphoric thought that "I'm invincible and can cheat a heart attack" that comes with each greasy bite. I am embarrassed to admit I did not ask the cashier for her/their (can't assume pronouns without asking) name, for service was delightfully friendly. Sad I don't live in this neighborhood anymore, but definitely dropping by the next time I'm in the area or drinking in the area.

Yum as always! This is one of my favorite fast food spots.

I went with my friend and we both got the double cheeseburger and loaded fries. Fries were cheesy, sauces and meaty. While they were soaked in toppings, they were still amazingly crispy.

The burgers are so consistent across all locations. I've been to about 4 locations and they all taste exactly the same.

The portion was also very filling. I think the regular cheeseburger is a little small, but a double double + shared loaded fries was perfect.

I like the limited menu, as ordering is fast and smooth. The food came out pretty quickly - within 5 minutes of waiting on a Thursday afternoon.

Overall, I had a great meal here and I would definitely would return for more burgers and fries.

Stopped by for the Yelp Elite event and couldn't be more happy! The staff were super friendly and kind. They explained the menu and we ordered the two cheeseburger with fries and drinks.

The burgers were delicious and cooked to perfection. The fries were perfectly crispy on the outside and warm and soft on the inside. It was salted nicely as well.

I would definitely come back again when I need a burger fix.

This is like an elevated McDonalds or a cheaper shake shack - If you want a fast, cheap, simple burger, this is the place to go! The burgers are simple, with a patty, cheese, pickles and a nice twist of caramelized onions. The patty could've use more salt and was quite thin though, so would recommend a double over the single patty. The fries were top tier, thick with a great crispy texture and salted (thought a tad too salty/not evenly dispersed). I like that they have a simple menu and have Mexican cokes! Came on Sunday around 12:45pm and there were no line to order, got our food in 5 minutes! Their outdoor tables are perfect to stand in eat during the spring!

A spacious stand and eat burger joint with a super small but perfect menu of cheeseburger, double burger, impossible burger, fries, and drinks. So already +1 for having vegetarian options for ppl who want to enjoy burgers too. The service was super fast and we got our food within 5 minutes of ordering. The burger looks super greasy and it was but it was worth it! Dripping with oil, onions, pickles and gooey cheese, it's a perfect serving size for one person. The fries are also as advertised: crispy, salty and delicious. Makes you have no qualms about being called a potato. Would come back esp if I'm in the area and craving a burger but since it's a chain restaurant, I would honestly just pop into any 7th st burger from here on out!
i rate it a 7/10. definitely solid for a burger but i prefer shake shack! the pickles were really good inside & i wish there was more veggies. the fries were good but a little too salty.

We ve been eating at 7th st since they opened their first shop in the east village. We love their burgers and their fries, it just hits every time. Except this time. It had been a year since we d visited since we moved back home and on our second day we decided to bring some to our airbnb to eat. Within a few hours my partner instantly got hit with food poisoning. He was non stop vomiting and heaving in pain. It was so bad that he was out for 4 days and is still suffering to this day. Idk what happened but the quality of meat just isnt the same anymore. It was sad because we only had 6 days in town and he spent most of his time sleeping or in the bathroom.

Shocked that 7th Street took this long to open a location in the LES especially since their smashburgers hit that perfect spot after a long night. I love that there is actual seating available because most 7th Street spots I've been to barely have any standing room, much less seating. I always recommend a double cheeseburger (the Impossible one is too sweet) and their regular fries  (loaded fries so super heavy so eat at your own risk), with a deliciously cold Mexican Sprite to wash everything down.
Slamin' burger!!!! Fries crispy! Good fast service ! Stand up eatery, high tables no chairs just how I like it!

the burgers and fries here are amazingggg. no frills, just wholesome cheeseburger and fries that hits the spot. I love the potato buns, makes the burgers so buttery and juicy. the fries were crispy and went perfectly with the burgers. prices were a steal considering how overpriced everything is these days. the staff here are also so friendly and sweet, such a great interaction. will definitely return!

So happy to have another 7th st burger in the neighborhood. This is currently my favorite burger in the city. Every burger (I recommend getting the double bc they're small) is made to order and is so juicy and greasy and it all gets soaked up in the soft potato buns they use. The fries are also on damn point. The woman at the register was so friendly and welcoming to us and the space is a bit bigger than the 7th st location. 5 stars all around!
Good burger, I like this place. Good smash burger one of the best in nYC and the sauce is good as well

Good solid burgers and quick service.   However they need to work on a few things as they are not in the same league as the other 7th street locations.   The fries were sad. Limp- not crispy and overly greasy.  One of the things I love about their fries in other locations is how well they travel and maintain their crunch.   This location either didn't prep the potatoes well prior to frying or skipped the double fry.   The other thing is the size of the fry serving. I ordered their loaded fries.... And the fries were only filled 1/4 of the box.  The burger toppings was adequate... but if you are gonna charge me 14-15 dollars for loaded fries... then it should be more filling than a small McDonald's fry and def bigger than the burger (double burger is 9-10 bucks).   Compared to the other locations they are not doing well in the French fry arena- I hope it's only cuz it's fairly new and they will be retrained correctly.

Its burgers, fries, drinks. The basics. Thanks to 7th street burger for keeping it simple, and delicious. Each bite is juicy, delicious, and their house sauce is the perfect condiment. Say good bye to ketchup. With so many locations too, you're probably within reach of at least one of their locations. Staff is great, informative, and service is fast. Can't wait to go back for more!

7th Street Burger is my favorite burger place to go to in NYC, and yes I mean all five boroughs. The sauce makes it. It's delicious and they have many locations throughout Manhattan and you should definitely try it.
This place is amazing. Lucky for me my friend is a Yelp elite and hooked me up with some free grub. Highly recommended especially after a night of drinking.
First time trying a 7th Street burger. The burger was great for the price, especially compared to the burger spot next door. The fries are amazing! Some of the best fries I've ever had.

7th Street sauce game is on point it. It adds that extra flavor to stand out from the typical burger joint.

They have music pumping which fits the vibe of the place. Making you feel like, you are at an outdoor cook out. They nailed the vibe they were looking to achieve. It really feels like a cookout. The glass soda bottles also adds to the cook out effect.

Definitely will be coming back.

They do not have seats just something to  be aware of if you are looking for a place to sit. This goes with the cookout vibes.
The true standard for what burgers should be. Food gets to you fast and fresh, bunch of flavor and not a disgrace like SMASHED.

If I could give 6/5 stars I WOULD. Best burger I've ever had. Reggie, the manager was super helpful and sweet. I went 2 days in a row because it was so tasty. Thankful for his service and vibe!! Will be coming back!!!

Place is full of shady folks.  Not sure if they're employees friends or what.  Several shootings right there, since they opened up.  Weed smoking , alcohol drinking, mask wearing, folks outside.  Why?????? Can't tell you if food is good or not, because who wants to take the chance ? Also, they throw garbage out all over the sidewalk inviting rodents to join the shadiness folks that hang out there.  Keep your burgers! I'll keep my life.
I enjoyed my burger I wish they had more toppings no bacon or lettuce tomato raw onion and other sides than fries
I got the impossible burger and loaded fries ( impossible meat) and it's so flavorful and amazing. Looks like I have a new lunch spot !

The burger is always fresh made to order the server was the best  I can't even lie he hooked us up lol fries was so fresh and hot and that sauce is EVERYTHING I WILL DEFINITELY BE GOING BACK the glass bottle sprite is way better then the bottle but I'm sure we all knew that already
Best impossible burger & loaded fries I ever ate in my life. Really something special. Service was great - they call your name & bring it right to you.
Pooooooooopeeeeee, queue the fart noise pfffftttttt, I love eating here, super gasoline

Came here after a concert on the lower east side. Loved that it was open late. Best burger i've ever had and the customer service was amazing. Perfectly smashed, melt in your mouth goodness. Fries were great too. Cashier brought all the orders out to people instead of calling names which I thought was great. Overall a great experience and highly recommend if you are in NYC.
the service was great; quick and easy. the burger was so good that i forgot to take a picture! the fries were also yummy. crispy on the outside and soft on the inside and seasoned well. 10/10

I went here every time I visited NY! It was in a convenient location in Times Square and I mean can you go wrong with 99cent pizza?

They have a simple menu with pepperoni and chicken and cheese options. They did tell us it was halal so that was a plus! Take cash with you as I believe it was cash only! They have so many deals going on and its always crowded.

Not gourmet pizza but ef worth it for what you're paying!
Fast cheap pizza and the crust is so good perfectly chewy and crispy! Definitely cheapest for a slice in the area.

I stopped at 99 Cent Pizza with some friends for a quick and affordable New York pizza. The pizza was warmed up in an oven and was great street food; however, it was not 99¢. It was 3$ per slice, smh (Shaking My Head). Tasty but not worth 3$. I still enjoyed the variety of sauces and seasoning displayed to spice up your slice.

Eh, it's .99 cent pizza. Not much more to say.

As with most of these joints it's a small grab and go spot. The slice was decent. More of a thick crust, good amount of cheese and sauce mix. Not bad for. 99 cents. After a 5 mile run I wolfed it down so I guess it was ok.

They have a variety of pies, other things to eat, and cold drinks. Still, this is basically a dollar slice joint.

ATM on site in case you need cash to buy a few slices, but be prepared to pay a fee.

Ok.  These places are everywhere.  Don't expect anything miraculous from a place called 99 cent pizza.  But be wary.  They advertise the price at 1.50, but charge you 3 bucks per slice because "they are all out of the $1.50 pizza". At least they are open late. And it's technically food.

You get what you pay for I guess.
No better than the pizza served in a middle school cafeteria.
3/10 only go if an emergency

The most generic name for a pizza place. Which is perfect because their dollar slice is the most generic pizza slice there is.

They have all sorts of other toppings, but I just needed something quick and cheap. This place is basically a hole in the wall. There's a tiny counter with all your oregano, chili flakes, etc. and that's about it.

Slice could've spent a few more seconds in the oven, but was otherwise serviceable.
Wow!!! For 99 cents this pizza is a steal! It is delicious all around and definitely coming back here in the future! Sauce taste is sweet. Cheese is perfect portion and the pizza dough is fabulous!!!

Noticed the sign for 99cent pizza and walked in for a quick snack. Was surprised to find out their pizza is actually really good!

The name is a bit misleading, as they do offer pizza for 99 cents, but just the cheese pizza. If you want another topping like grilled chicken (which is what I got), it's $2, but still really cheap. The grilled chicken option was tasty and a great value for its price. Seriously you can have lunch for under $5 here.

They do offer other foods besides pizza for fairly cheap but I wasn't able to try it. Also, this place is tiny. There's a small area to stand and eat but no tables or chairs.

Overall, a great spot for a cheap quick lunch if you're in the area.

This place worst pizza I ever eaten. The regular slices had almost no cheese dry to bread .  I told the owner just looked at me. Close inspection of their cheap pizza you  see what you paid for. Dont fold pizza ok it crack..stay away .. also enforces 5.00 min on card had to throw out the 3 rd slice not edible .. buyer beware

I have walked into this business for slices of pizza a few times during past New York City visits.  I consider this location as a good choice for picking up a good slice of pizza, which makes a tasty and quick lunch.

I describe the interior to be like most typical pizza parlors in New York City.  The difference with this one, compared to most others in the city, is that the lobby and the ordering area are small.  Sometimes, the inside can be difficult to navigate because it does not fit as many people as most other pizza parlors.  At times, it can feel slightly claustrophobic.  I realize that this aspect is nobody's fault.  This is just the way it is.

The employees appear to have a good eye on cleanliness and order for the most part.  The only times I have seen the lobby slightly disordered is during their busy times.  I realize that there is not much time for the employees to take care of these messes during such times.  Aside from that, they seem to maintain their cleaning and organizing duties.  Overall, I have always felt comfortable walking in here to order some pizza.

The employees are consistently friendly and resourceful.  They have never had any time to communicate with their customers much because of them being busy often.  This is not necessarily a bad thing.  They seem to make the most out the time they have with every customer to assure that they walk out happy, including me.  They are also great at answering any questions about the menu.  Therefore, I feel comfortable approaching the employees for anything I may need.

Even though the business name says "99 cent pizza", not every type of pizza costs 99 cents.  They have a vast variety of flavors of pizza for purchasing.  I have tried probably half of what they have to offer.  Some taste better than others, but that is a matter of preference, not quality.  The quality of the pizza are consistently fantastic.  Even on their busy times, I have never waited any longer than five minutes for my order, which I believe is reasonable.

When I am in the Manhattan area and in the mood for a quick slice of pizza, I will continue keeping this place in mind.  I feel like I can consistently count on them for customer service satisfaction.
Can't beat the price and the crust was, well, crisp and crusty! Quick service and big selection of slices. A lot of delivery truck drivers were pulling up to buy slices, which I took as a good sign!
Pizza slices were $3 not $0.99 and it was pretty much just a pile of grease. If that's what you're looking for go for it but if you want decent pizza this is definitely not the place to go
This is some of the best pizza I've ever eaten. When you consider what most pizza restaurants are charging in the city this is not just a great price but also great food.
perfect place for a slice. I haven't tried anything else on the menu except for their plain cheese, but it's my go to whenever I want a snack on the way home

Whatever, it's dollar pizza! That's my attitude whenever I go to one of these joints, and god yes, I do appreciate that there are like 4 within a block of my apartment. They do the trick: they're accessible, cheap, and filling, and if they're half decent then they're great to me.

This one has sprinkle parm which most don't, so extra star for that. Only real downside is that being on a major thoroughfare means they get traffic and not pleasant traffic at that. Be prepared to wait amongst the angry, drunk, and just downright crazy for your slice, but yeah - for dollar pizza this isn't half bad.

Glad it's on my corner. Will absolutely go back when the situation calls for it.

Even mediocre late night .99 cent pizza is a good thing after a night out drinking!

As with most of these cheapo pizza joints the space is tiny but there is some windowside counter seating which offers great views of the lower east side freak show stumbling by.

They offer a surprisingly diverse selection of pizzas, and their ice cream selection in the freezer was pretty impressive. Special deals, coupons, and delivery offered too.

Overall, a typical grimy bit of NYC to enjoy a cheap slice to help soak up the booze in your belly.

My bestie lives right around the corner from here and we love grabbing cheap, but good slices from here! My favorites here are the buffalo chicken and the white pizza. Both are awesome! The buffalo has tons of sauce and the white alway has lots of fresh ricotta. You can't beat the price! Definitely not the best pizza in NYC, but great for a late night slice!

I feel like my go-to dollar pizza joint when I walked by went up a dollar and panicked and wandered around in circles on the lower east side until I found this gem. Alright. . . . the pizza is just a-okay. The slices look slightly smaller than normal. The crust is kind of doughier. I've had some dollar slices and have been wowed. This wasn't wow factor but what was wow factor was that their specialty slices are only $2. In my fat ass inebriated state after having said dollar pizza I went in for the kill and took a buffalo chicken slice slathered in ranch sauce to go and fuuudge was it great.

Solid dollar slice joint. I've been coming here on the weekend recently. No thrills, solid slices, clean store, and they are friendly.

There's really nothing else to say lol. Not worth traveling too of course but worth trying if you're in the neighborhood and just want a quick bite to eat on the cheap.
This dudes are my guys. Always friendly and quick and to the point. Always a hit for me after a late night in LES.

99 Cent Pizza
NY Manhattan LES
3pm Thursday 3rd March 2016
Two Stars

Probably the best name for a dollar pizza place. This no-nonsense pizzeria served me a fresh piping hot slice of cheese for $1. The crust was chewy and buttery. The sauce was straight out of the can. The cheese was sparse but still burned the top of my mouth. It even had a pizza boil. Lastly, there was a customer trying to bargain down his specialty slice.
Great slice for the price! Can't beat a 99 cent slice of cheese pizza. Great service. Thanks!

Awesome place to go and get a good slice of pizza at a great price 99¢! At 4am after the bar this is just perfect. You'll meet some really interesting people and fill up before you go home for the night.

Best $1.00 slice within a few blocks of Pianos. My friends and I stopped by after a night of drinking and the slices satisfied our drunken cravings. Dollar slices only applies to cheese, so if you want a slice with toppings, it's going to cost you $2.00. Service here is fast, so expect to be in and out in about a minute. You won't really want to stick around to eat as the small place gets pretty crowded once the lines pick up. Come here instead of the other pizza place that are charging $3.50 and more for a slice.

Dollar slice solidly on POINT. I stop by here every time if I am out in LES.

Better than the other one around the corner across the street from Max Fish! This place always comes out with consistent slices, so hot and fresh that it literally burns the roof of your mouth that only the most satisfying of 2am slices would give you.

Totally worth it. And perfectly close by all the fun dive bars in the local LES area. Always jam packed in there, and everyone is super friendly and just chill weekend vibes~ Go go go!

I have never encountered anyone less professional than the staff who worked this past Saturday night (8/4).

We walked into the store and the employees were already screaming and fighting with another customer.

My friend ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza ($2) and handed the guy a $10 bill.  She only received back 7 singles.

My friend inquired a couple of times and the guy just gave her attitude.  Upon counting the money in front of him 3x, he finally gave us the correct change back.

I can't believe we got ripped off in such a blatant and unprofessional manner.  There was also no apology, just a ton of attitude.  

This place is a complete joke and I can't imagine they will stay in business much longer.

I tried the gluten free pizza here and boy was that the biggest mistake I made. I'm not 100% sure the crust was actually gluten free. Cross contamination is definitely a concern here. My stomach was not very happy about this meal. If you are gluten intolerant stay away!

This pizza is not much. Not much cheese, not much sauce, not much anything really besides crust. They should call it 99 cent crusts. Can't expect much for a dollar these days. Champion Pizza down the block is better. It was edible. I ate it. I didn't die. I lived to tell about it. It was filling for a few minutes and then I was hungry again. I wouldn't recommend it unless you are absolutely desperate and if you have the munchies late at night after hitting the bars in the area you very well might be.

Not bad! This place just opened up.

The pizza has flavor, isn't too doughy nor is it too weak and the establishment looks super clean.

They have your default plain pies as well as many other different pies; the usual suspects.

They have a fridge stocked with cans, bottles, red bulls, waters-- all the bells and whistles that you would come to expect from a pizza place. The fridge actually works too, which is cool! Can't begin to vent my frustration as to how many 99c pizza places serve hot sodas by the pound.

Slices are 99c, add .25-50c for toppings.
Canned sodas feel a little steep at $2...

Good to swing by and grab a quick slice if you're in the neighborhood and are craving a different kind of 99c pizza other than the familiar establishments.
A bit underdone but cheap decent pizza for .99. The inside was small but clean. The man working there was friendly and efficient.

quick
easy
busy
Access to Pianos
well lit

Waste of time and $1 eating a regular slice here. Bland, with almost no sauce. Even at $1, it's not worth it unless you're really hungry. Seriously do yourself a favor and walk down essex to Champion Pizza. Literally a million times better. Let's see how long this place remains open!

Terrible service. Had the mistake of coming here twice in one night. The first time he got my order wrong and blamed me, the second time he purposefully ignored my order and served the same slices I ordered to another customer to be vindictive about me "messing up" the first order

It doesn't look like much, I admit, but this is where I bought my Christmas tree on a random walk home, and I got the best deal ever.  Granted, it wasn't the biggest Christmas tree, actually looked more like a Charlie Brown Christmas tree, but it was plenty big for a New York apartment, came with the water bowl, and I negotiated for $25.  Other fun facts about this sometimes suspitious joint- they have Fresh Step Cat Litter and chocolate chip pop tarts.  I am not suggesting combining the two.
10000/10. Delicious, the right amount of oil and crust thickness, super quick as well. Definitely coming back again.

1000/10 for the price. Honestly better than most pizza places in the country. Probably a 7/10 on the New York pizza scale. But for a dollar a slice I believe this is the best deal I've ever seen for pizza. Crust is good. Plenty of flavor in the sauce and cheese.

Only downside is they only accept cash. So bring some cash or you will be disappointed.

Normally,  .99 cent pizza is barely decent if edible at all. Yet, I was pleasantly surprised with this slice.

After a 10 mile run tonight I found myself in the crazy crowed East Village. Didn't want to wait in line for any of the normal joints,  plus I was a sweaty smelly mess. Just needed a quick bite to refuel before heading back.

As with most of these spots it's small and good for grab and go. No seating. They offer slices, full pies,  and a terrific deal of two slices and a soda for $2.79. Large pie only $8. Also a beef patty for around $2. The slice was actually tasty, with a doughy crust, not dry, and a good cheese to sauce ratio.

I wolfed that sucker down! Just what I needed.
Pizza was pretty good for what you pay. $1 a slice. It's not Joe's pizza but it's good. Sauce is good too. Halal also great plus.

Delectable 99c slice of cheese pizza at a well-lit 1 buck location. These slices are a Brooklyn-size flavor import to Manhattan - though made right here at 71 Second Avenue across the way a few blocks from Washington Square.

The dudes who work here, are totally chill and offer $2 deals for a slice of cheese and soda likes there's no sunrise, an endless pizza oven and trucks by the Avenue who'll keep doing the delivering. Folks zip in and out all day and night.

The cheese is ample, milky, stringy and flavorful. All in all the 99c Fresh slice is thin and crispy and bursts in deliciously aromatic (and each time I was here - hot) flavors and nuances. Sauces has no chunks.

There are sweet drinks, teas, sodas, waters and all assorted sorts of spices, peppers, garlic, oregano and more to top of your slice, even ground Parmigiano. Once I go here my only trouble is, that I leave with not enough of the slices and end up kicking ourselves, that we did not just buy a whole 99c Fresh slice!

It's not the most glamorous. It is the most gangster 99c Fresh I've had in a while: hot, tasty, cheap, bright and always available.

Got a New York minute hankering? Come here. Staff is friendly, jovial and always in charge. No lines. No gouging. No bad manners. Just NYC pizzaiolos slinging gangster Brooklyn cheese pies for the City we all call home.

Rebel review: 5

I like to live dangerously.

Like running across the street to order an entire pie when my friends have just ordered an Uber back to Brooklyn.

And thanks to NYC traffic, I made it back in time.

And also thanks to 99 Cents Fresh Pizza for being real quick about it.

Is it the best pizza? Of course not. Was the pie just sitting around waiting to be reheated? Probably.

But was I also blackout drunk and annoyingly eating pizza in the back of a stranger's car? Oh, you betcha.

I give the guy at the counter a dollar and he gives me a slice of pizza. There's something beautiful about that.

I got the cheese slice for $1 which was just an okay slice. They have garlic powder and hot sauce for you to put on the pizza which makes it a lot better. For a dollar you can't beat what you get. If you're expecting gourmet pizza you're in the wrong place. It's a good place to go after a night of drinking to satisfy those drunchies. You meet some interesting people sharing the moment of standing around and eating a slice of pizza.

I don't know if it's cash only but since it's just $1 with tax included I would just be safe and bring a buck. Or two.

Yes, it's still $1 for a slice of cheese, and a terrific value.  Even beside the price point, I'd rather have a whole pie from here than from the big national delivery chains.  Unless you're there at a really quiet time of day, they sell enough that your pizza will be pretty fresh.  (In fact, you may have to wait a couple minutes.)

I'm always a bit skeptical of good dollar pizza these days because I always find it a hit or miss, but this 99 cents fresh pizza was definitely a hit. The regular cheese pizza is delicious - perfect ratio of cheese and sauce. I ended up getting seconds because it was so good.

The space itself is small so I wouldn't expect to sit down. It's definitely more grab and go, but still super worth it!

I was hungry and in a rush so 99 Cents Fresh Pizza had my name on it. I wasn't expecting much, because how can good pizza be that cheap?

I don't know how they pulled it off, but the pizza was legit hot and fresh. They had an appropriate cheese to sauce ratio.

You seriously cannot beat the deal of $2.75 for two slices and a bottle of water.

I was in, out and satisfied in a flash.

Alright, I feel awful even writing this review because I'm so for supporting businesses especially during a pandemic. But my gahd, I just need to tell you about my experience.

First, not gonna lie, my friends and I were drunk coming from another party. It was super late on a Thursday night and we were hungry and decided to grab a slice. Saw this place at 2am still open during the pandemic, not sure how or why, but not going to question it. Anyways, I had the pepperoni, which hit the spot and did it's job. BTW, nothing here is 99cents. Do people not care or know about inflation when thinking of their franchise/store names?

My friend ordered some sort of chicken pizza, I think it was the ranch chicken or something. It was awful, bland, tasteless, and soggy. I've had gym socks that were better tasting and better seasoned than this.

Second, as we were eating it outside of the shop, the guy working there was like making super strong eye contact at us and seemed like he was yelling. I believe he was speaking arabic, so it sounded like he was cursing at us infidels. Turned out he was on the phone and had wireless headsets on.

Third, there was a huge rat running in and around the store. The guy didn't care at all, and neither did we as it's pretty much expected here in NYC. Probably adds a little bit of unique flavor with the rat hair and poop! I survived one pandemic, I'm well prepared for the plague.

Truly an authentic New York experience.

Delivered satisfaction on a drizzly Sunday night after a fun evening on St. Mark's Place. I had to wait a couple minutes for a fresh pie to come out of the oven but it was worth it to get a piping hot slice from a fresh pie. A fresh dollar slice can really hit the spot! Don't expect anything mind-blowing, just enjoy the moment.

I could have sworn that I have reviewed this place before because I know I've been here a million times. It's still somewhat decent dollar pizza. After drinking and walking to the f train this has happened on so many occasions that I have lost track in my life. Came in during the heat wave surprisingly sober for a slice and its still good. The slices are a little doughy. Sauce and cheese ratio is alright. It's probably still not the best I've ever had but it brings back waves of nostalgia and memories of happy drunk days to mind. Pizza is ready in seconds. He just keeps making those pies. Garlic, oregano, red pepper flakes, hot sauce off to the side.
Didn't know what to expect but it was so good. The crust was crispy but foldable. Cheese and sauce was great. It was also FRESH and food was ready within minutes.
Would have gotten 5 stars from when we went there last night, but tonight they charged us 50% more for no reason whatsoever. You guys were rockstars last night and then screwed it up for no reason.

Unfortunately really terrible. And cold.

Slices are truly $1. No taxes. No frills.

But they serve uou the pizza fresh from the pan, despite however long it's been out.

My pizza was pretty cool, cheese no longer cheesy. Crust and bread soggy. Oy

I was in here a few weeks ago to pick up lunch to go.  I ordered 2 slices to go.  Since there were no others there I didn't have to wait too long.  The slices had a nice crust, not too crisp or soft. There was a good amount of cheese.

Nick's Dolla Pizza Series--there's only 3 factors that matter when considering 1$ pizza. Here is the breakdown:

Taste: 3/5 - (sauce is pretty good, pizza hot. But cheese and dough quite bland. BUT with enough parmesan cheese available here anything could taste fine)
Size: 2/5 - (slightly smaller than most places)
Resistance to Pizza-regret: 4/5 (hardly anything).

Honestly one of the one's I could do without in my dollar pizza quest. But if you're with a group at ACE bar down the street, you'll be really popular if you bring a pie back to your drunk friends (all for less than a drink at that bar!)

I walk in, give the guy a dollar, and he hands me a slice. I didn't say anything, he didn't say anything, he just handed me the slice. That's a pro move. It's also some dang good pizza. After a night out, what we all want is some awesome food and this place provides. This place, unlike the others, also provides topping apparatus that have larger exit ports, thereby allowing for more efficient topping of toppings.

Great place, love the pizzaman.

I've had pizza for $15 that couldn't touch this place.

It's a grab and go kinda place. Only places to eat are on the sides of the ship (no table) but for what you get, it's a total steal.

I'm sure I'll get some heat for this but this is one of my favorite pizza spots in Manhattan.

Hands down the BEST dollar pizza place. Cheese is stringy, crust is sustainable, and the sauce is the boss. Free seasoning and toppings are only .50!! They have sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, pineapple, etc. The perfect spot to hit up after a night out or pregame before you head out. Beware there are some homeless people that ask for change but you'll find that everywhere in the city. Obviously cash only.

Wowo. I'm a lactose intolerant pizza snob which means I'll only eat it if it's really worthwhile. This was a 99 cent slice which left me with no regrets. Hot, fresh, simple, cheap. It's not gourmet organic hydroponic pizza but it does its job well.

I dunno man, I think people are a little harsh on this place. Obviously it's not the best pizza you're going to have in NYC.

That said, I thought it was pretty tasty (and I wasn't even drunk) and it costs a dollar. The guy behind the counter was also nice. That's five stars from me.
Maybe I'm an idiot and don't know what real pizza is. BUT, what I do know is that this pizza is f***ing delicious.

I've lived in NYC for 7 years and this is the best dollar slice you can find in the city! They are constantly making and dishing out fresh pies every few minutes. This is a place that doesn't reheat old pizza. It's also a solid spot at the end of a drinking night to load up on your carbs and sodium to prevent that hangover! If I wasn't vegan now I would eat here all the time. Stick with a simple cheese slice, top it with hot sauce, and fold in half. You'll want to go back for a 2nd, I promise

I stepped in the store this morning ordered a slice of pizza. The guy A told me 3 mins while eating his leftover slice. So I paid a dollar first. Then another guy B came took over his shift. He ask me did I pay already? I said yes. The guy A said he didn't pay. Alright, I walked out headed to work.

Just be careful with those people.

I was introduced to this pizza shop on the way home from a New Year's Eve party and it hit the spot. The slices were a dollar so the name is inaccurate but I'll let that slide.

Service was quick and friendly and the pizza hit the spot. The slices were average sized and greasy in a good way. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to go here during the day but would definitely come back after going out in the East Village.

Good pizza and I've been a faithful customer for two years now but the staff is rude as hell and incompetent. Would rather go elsewhere. Today was my breaking point when it comes to dealing with the disrespect.

Great pizza, and how can you beat the price ...especially in the heart of the East village!!??

I was especially impressed when an elderly woman, walking the streets; collecting cans out of the street recepticles...walk into the storefront and began picking up lint off the floorm

If you are looking for a reliable, pretty good, CHEAP pizza for a quick lunch or snack, this place is what you are looking for. Very cheesy slice, decent size, and unbeatable price, you know, a dollar slice. 2 slices and a drink only costs you $2.75. If you go at a right time, the pizza can be very crispy which is so so so good. But even at its worst, it tastes fresh for a dollar pizza.

Check this place out

I admit I was a bit skeeved out by this place on first glance - it's a tiny, florescent-lit storefront on a side street in the East Village that's probably not big enough for more than two or three customers to occupy at a time. Also, 99 cent pizza? I mean, come on. This has to be too good to be true. I imagined one of those triangle graphs where the viewer can only pick two qualities - here it would have to be "cheap", "fast", and "tasty". WELL, I was sure in for a surprise when this place delivered on all three of those fronts! The pizza, while simply prepared, was served fresh and piping hot, smothered with melted cheese and flavorful sauce, and supported by a crisp yet chewy crust. And all this for 99 cents! Wow. I was (and am still) quite amazed by how great this place is, and regret almost passing it by! You won't want to miss a great slice for cheap at arguably the greatest 99 cent pizza spot in NYC!

Pizza for a buck. Yep.

While some other pizza places may still cost more than a buck, 99 Cents Fresh Pizza still just requires one small bill. They've crammed an entire restaurant in here, and by entire restaurant I simply mean they can cook food in there, not that you can sit down or do much. There are some side counters you can stand at and throw that oregano on your pizza slices but that's about it.

Quick, simple, and cheap. What more could you want? A chair?

Seriously it is not bad. I know, it's 99 cents but it is hot and fresh. Obviously it is not a typical 5 star place. But it gets 5 Yelp stars because it achieves its purpose with 100% success. It is a cheap fresh slice of pizza for 99 cents. Well, really it should be called $1 pizza because they don't give you back a penny in change. That said, I have never actually asked for my penny. Maybe you should try and see what happens?

Great pizza slice for 99 cents. I wished I could eat an entire pizza.
There was only 1 slice on their pans waiting for an order, and there was another person in front of me. Guy is waiting and the slice is waiting. Probably he did not want to have it as he wanted a new pizza from the oven. I said let me get that slice, how old it could be, 10-15 mins max, not more.
The pizza guy put that slice back into the over for 30 secs for me. That made the bottom of the slice crunchy and the top was heated just as needed. It was one of the best pizzas I had, end it was only 99 cents. Wow.

While I was eating my slice, the guy took out a new pizza from oven, and it was so appealing. I wish I could have it all, but did not have room and I could not carry it for sometime later.
Best dollar slice place there is. Can't recommend this place enough. Quick cheap food pretty satisfying. Great for what it is.

With 99 Cents Fresh Pizza I fed my whole family for under $10 . Visiting  from Angeles the closest bargain we  have is Costco Pizza! The gentleman behind the counter reheated all my slices and the quality was really good! Us from California do say the best pizza comes from New York and Chicago!!! This place beats our Dominos Pizza Hut and Papa Johns back home !! If returning this area we will visit again!! Good bang for the buck !!

It's definitely not fresh pizza, but it's cheap. It was served "fresh" out of the oven after being reheated, but the ingredients aren't fresh as well. The pizza did do the trick after a night of drinking and dancing. I had the BBQ chicken. It wasn't 99 cents but it served its purpose.

For a dollar pizza, it's actually pretty good! For a broke college student like me, $2.75 for two slices and a drink is absolutely perfect. The dough is also a nice combination of crunchy and chewy, which I personally really like. Would definitely come again!

Delicious pizza! For $2.75 you get 2 decent sized slices of cheese pizza and a can soda. I don't like cheese pizza and this was definitely the best I've had. Super small, no where to sit. But for $1 pizza, what you pay for is what you get and it was well worth it
They are no Two Bros but still a nice little quick pizza stop when you're on the go. The quality has gone way up since they first came here and have a nice atmosphere. Great deal.
Just had the best dollar slice I've had so far in NYC. It was done well so the cheese was browned, and was super satisfying.
Nicest guys ever, some dude just dropped his pizza on the floor and they have him a new one. BEST GUYS EVER
Never had a better 1 dollar slice, been in NYC for 3 years. I don't understand how there are non-5 star reviews for this place. Maybe I just got a bomb slice. I will be coming back here frequently.

I've been around good pizza all my life. I have had slices all across Manhattan, Long Island and New Jersey. This is hands down the best slice I have ever had. I mean everyone likes their pizza different, some like a lot of cheese, some like a lot of sauce, etc. So everyone may not agree, but to me, this really is the tastiest pizza I have ever tried. Perfect crust, perfect flavor, perfect slightly gooey but also crunchy cheese! AND FOR $1!!!! I am so happy I found this place.
Unless you are drunk to the point that you dont know what you are consuming $1 is a lot of money for so called "pizza".
I've had better plain slices at other $0.99 pizza places. The pizza/cheese seemed old
Friendly fast service. My kids favorite because it ALWAYS fresh and fast. OH and they have hawaiian punch ,our favorite vice.

For the price you are getting a pretty solid slice of pizza late into the evening on a drunken night out with friends. Whenever some is craving pizza while we are out in the eastvil we swing by this location. You don't come here if you are looking for an amazing NY slice. We have never had to wait long or ever gotten cold pizza so it is a good go to for a late night drunken snack! Of course it isn't the best pizza in NYC but it takes care of that late night hankering! 3stars because it hits the spot but isn't the best.
This is a good spot for 230am cheap, yet decent sliced pizza. 99 cents (extra for topping), $2.75 for two plain and a drink. It's really all you need.
Best $1 pizza I have had. Always fresh, always good. Best deal is 2 slices and a soda for $2.75./ Birna is the man!

Perfect spot to take kids because it's all food they'll like, and obviously, there are video games to play at every table.

The food is way better than it needs to be, including great fries, tots, chicken fingers and burgers. The draw is definitely the fun game systems though, which have nearly all the classic games you can think of to play. As long as there are free tables to play, this is a good time and an easy spot to eat with the family.

Like my review on the Chelsea location of 8 Bits Bites, its description and my opinion has not changed. The food is excellent, milkshakes are very yummy, the staff are both very friendly and welcoming, and you can play video games during and after you eat. The setting is great for friends, gamers, and people who want to have a great time exploring the city and have a somewhat local arcade experience. My video game recommendation? Street Fighter 3rd Strike. That will you help learned the fundamentals of fighting games

Pizza is worth the price you pay. They're on display and once you pick which one you want, they put your slices in an oven and will bag it for you. Very fast service and pizza doesn't taste cheap. When I visit New York again I'll definitely come back.
GREAT dim sum! The orange chicken was a little mid- but the dumpling and buns were so so so good

The place is nice, yet super casual. You order what you want at the front and serve yourself water. However, because of this and the somewhat mediocre food, I don't think it's worth the price.

The dan dan noodles were reasonably sized, but I felt like they were lacking in flavor. They were basically just spicy noodles--I wish it had more to it than that.

We also got chicken soup dumplings, pan fried pork dumplings, and the thousand year egg with chili sauce, which were all pretty much what we expected. The pan fried dumplings definitely could've been crispier though.

For all of these four things, it came out to about $50.

I went to 3 Times and I gotta say if you like dim sum, go here!! They had some yummy Chinese food! Nice outdoor area too! We shared
Shrimp Dumplings
Crispy Duck
Chicken Su Mai
Pork Soup Dumplings
Dan Dan Noodles
Everything was so good and I felt full after the meal.

3 stars for 3 times ‍ Overall the ambiance isn't bad, but probably won't come back for the food.

We ordered:
- Pan fried buns (3/5): These didn't have much soup inside, and had a more pillowy bready exterior. I thought the bottoms could've been more fried, but the overall the flavor just tasted oily.
- Pork XLB (3/5): You can tell these are frozen and
not handmade based on how easily the skin rips and the uniformity. Flavor not bad though.
- Cucumber salad (4/5): This was more like pickles, not fresh cucumber salad. Not what I was expecting but very tasty!
- Shanghai spring rolls (4.5/5): I liked these! You can't find these easily, but oddly enough it was served with chili sauce and not vinegar like it's supposed to be?

The waiter didn't bring out any vinegar or dipping sauce with anything until we asked, and gave us black vinegar (not rice vinegar). I think that the prices are really reasonable though, so could be a good cheap spot.

Came back for our second visit and was a bit disappointed in their Xiao Long Bao. The skin was too thick and the filling was dry. Not sure what happened since they were really good the first time we came.

Their Sheng Jian Bao was still the best thing we had. The Hong Kong fried rice was really nice with bits of crispy rice. The sautéed green beans were nice and crispy and flavorful as well. The shiu mai was nice and hefty. Overall, great food, but quite highly priced for what you get!

I've been here many times for dine in and take out. Unfortunately, it is apparent that it's no longer the same chef based on the food pics I posted. Hot and sour soup was just ok. I was scared to eat the spicy cucumbers. It looks like it's been pickled and stored in a fridge for awhile. It's definitely not freshly cut and marinated. What happened to the Shanghai fried noodles!!! It was plain! I know everything is more costly due to inflation but there was no mushroom, broccoli or red onions. I order it many times and it always came with it. I went back to check the yelp pics and nothing matched what we ate today. Im very disappointed. There is a reason why we were the only table there during dinner time tonight. I really hope I went on an off day. I'm not sure if we will return because my husband was more disappointed than I was!

I came to the LES location of 3 Times because I had a gift card from an Instagram contest. The space is clean and spacious, and there was no wait time to walk-in. In regards to food, we ordered the following for lunch:
Soup dumplings: chewy thick skin
Dan dan noodles with minced pork: generally bland, only flavor was chili oil, barely any pork
Crunchy pickled persian cucumbers with garlic sauce: only decent dish of our meal
Snow pea sprouts and shrimp dumplings (chiu chow dumplings): steamed too long so the skin was soggy, fishy tasting filling

We also had a bizarre experience with service. We had ordered pork soup dumplings and the server brought us crab soup dumplings by mistake. When we noted the error, we opted to keep the order to avoid any hassle, to which he responded "these are better any way," and made no attempt to just charge us for the original pork dumplings ($2 cheaper). They also didn't know what to do with the gift card, and had me place a duplicate to-go order on their website to pay, which just felt very unprofessional. I would recommend just walking a few more blocks over to Chinatown and getting dim sum/lunch elsewhere.

The food is always so good and fresh, I love the decor here its very clean but the consistency of the quality of food never disappoints. There's always only one server here, but he does his best with the overwhelming amount of takeout orders, and the indoor isn't really packed for seating, but they do well with what they have and it's worth the wait because the food is so fresh.

According to google this spot current says temporarily closed but we ate here 2 weeks ago without issue (March 2023). It's definitely less authentic vibes than some other china town dumpling spots but we realllyyy like the soup dumplings. Tasted fresh and delicious. Nothing to complain about and seemed reasonable price wise!

Tried out this dim sum spot in LES for the first time recently and overall enjoyed my experience, came in around 6:30 on a Friday night and it was empty but more people trickled in throughout the time I ate.

The inside is more spacious and modern than you'd expect from a "typical" dim sum spot (think crowded dim sum carts -- which of course has its own charm but this won't be that!)

We ordered a number of items which included a cold cucumber appetizer, scallion pancake, beef & tripe in chili oil, stir fried rice cake with pork and mustard greens, and truffle soup dumplings (xiao long bao). Overall, the restaurant hits on all the classics as you'd expect them to taste. My favorite was for sure the beef & tripe in chili oil.

Also had to knock a star because the table I was sitting at while clean and spacious had a good amount of flies/gnats around when the food came out and it was hard to avoid them!

Very disappointed with my last visit on 1/3/23 . The service and the food was horrible . The Hong Kong fried rice which is usually delicious, the sausage was burnt also the serving size was much smaller than usual.

I've been here twice and have been surprised by how empty the dining room is because the food is REALLY good? (Although my brother says it is much busier on weekend evenings, and we see a LOT of delivery folks picking up food so the kitchen remains busy even if the dining room isn't.)

3 Times first landed on our radar about a year ago because it was being touted as one of the best soup dumpling spots in the city, a huge claim for this city! We came back this summer because we needed a place to eat with nice outdoor seating and surprisingly they had added some very lovely tables outside since our first visit, big vibes with lights and all.

I will admit that both times, I didn't expect much of the food and both times, I was like wow why is the food gone I want to eat more of it??
+ Soup dumplings (xiaolongbao) are really good, definitely deserve to be shouted out as standouts for the delicious broth. The pork ones and the crab ones are both solid XLB
+ Shanghai fried noodles are such a satisfyingly thick noodle with an incredibly delicious sauce? This wound up being my favorite item and I ordered it our second visit even though we already ordered enough food without them, I just wouldn't leave without having them. So tasty, I always wish there were more!
+ Scallion pancake wrapped w/ beef is another simple dish done really well, the flavors and textures are a great balance
+ The veggies here are also done well, they're seasoned nicely and disappear quick, always a good sign!

Honestly, I wasn't sure what to expect from 3 Times but they exceeded my expectations. They got my mom's seal of approval from China and I'll definitely be back, if not here then to one of their other locations.

We came with a big group to get dim sum for dinner! Thankfully they were able to accommodate our large group even though there was a bit of a wait while they had to push tables together. The food came out so quickly and the price was very reasonable!

Update: I went back to 3 Times the next day (I was coincidentally in the area), and Paul was so nice! He instantly remembered me and my beef and broccoli lol, and he got it prepared as soon as he could. In addition, I got white rice, and this yummy jar of seasoning to go along with my beef and broccoli.

The beef and broccoli was much better than the previous two dishes. It was tender and saucy, though still pricy compared to your average Chinese takeout beef and broccoli. The service here is amazing, though!

This is my favorite 3 Times location, and it's open the latest! A really awesome spot for their soup dumplings alone - the pork classic is always my go to. They come with 6 plump dumplings an order for about $9.

My favorite dishes to order with it are the pan fried pork buns 4 for about $11 and sometimes the dan dan noodles. The dan dan noodles definitely need some quality control because each time I order it it comes out different (sometimes saltier, sometimes soggy) but the first time I had it it was so good. $11

I always love the soup dumplings!

Very solid dim sum restaurant. I love the decor here-- very tasteful and elegant, and their outdoor seating is also set up well. Dim sum is good but nothing too noteworthy. Soup dumplings tasted fresh and had a ton of soup inside, and the skin was the perfect thickness. Service was pretty attentive. However I can't say that anything was too memorable to me.

I was checking out places to eat for lunch on the entire Clinton Street and only found this and another worth going to.

I found out this is closer to Delancey.

The menu looks good.  But I just wanted
A quick bite.  I had the crab and pork soupy bun (xia-long-bao) and cold steamed
Duck.  The soupy bun was very good although it seemed to be more pork.  The cold duck is unusual.  It was more like an appetizer.

Place looks clean.

I ordered shredded pork with hot green peppers. 85-90% are onions. Only a little pathetic shredded pork that you almost can count with two hands. This is not the first time I order this dish from 3 times, sometimes there's more pepper less meat, but none of those experiences are as ridiculous as this time that deserves my time to leave a review on yelp. I wouldn't recommend order delivery from this location; you never know if you will get shredded pork with green pepper, or onion with onion.

Okay, what happened?

Maybe it was covid or maybe they changed chefs, but given I haven't been back physically, I did do an order of one of their dishes through an Asian grocery delivery app and I don't remember it being off.

They are no longer using the nice paper composable napkins and the restroom is decent, but it wasn't Jesus clean anymore.

I wanted to go eat Vietnamese, but didn't realize that restaurant has different operating hours on certain days and the other place I wanted to go to also only opened for dinner.

I decided to come here because I remember this place being clean and had good food.

I dared to order the scallion pancakes again, because I believed when the owner commented on my review that he was going to talk to the chef regarding the few sprinkles of scallions in the scallion pancakes. Well he must have said DON'T include scallions at all in these scallion pancakes because guess what? THERE WERE NON EXISTENCE. Did covid hurt their scallion vendor, nopes - I found scallions as a garnish on the wonton with chili oil. I am SUPER disappointed in these pancakes. Even if they had scallions, these pancakes had absolute no chew at all. It was just crispiness/flakiness and I don't mean it in a good way. Scallion pancakes should have a 1. Scallions. 2. Good Chew.

I checked in here and saw I got a free milk tea, nopes - they no longer have anything like this besides soda.

I didn't try this because I am not into Shanghai Pan Fried Pork Buns - the filling didn't look great and A just tried one and was like these aren't great and also agreed regarding the filliings.

Fried Dumplings - the dough is so thick and filling looked exactly liked the pan fried pork buns. OMG, how can you mess up dumplings when this is an Asian establishment? This didn't taste like it was before.

Soup Dumplings - pork and shrimp. The shrimp tasted and looked sad. The dough wasn't delicate anymore.

Wonton with Chili Oil - the only thing that was good here.

Also, the only waiter here didn't wear his mask properly, if I can see your nose then you're obviously not wearing it right. Or if you go on a smoking break and come back missing your mask.....why bother?

There were also crackheads sitting in their outdoor seating area drugged out.

I am beyond disappointed I wasted my lunch here. I should have gone somewhere else. I could have gotten bad Asian food near me.

3Times has a hit on it's hands. I truly enjoyed my dining experience overall. Honestly, it can be a bit of a challenge finding great places that stay open late and still deliver exceptional service and food after hours. I believe, I've officially found one such place. The first thing I noticed about 3Times is how bright the restaurant is, I love that. It was almost as if the restaurant was saying, ha ... come on in, we have nothing to hide and everything to offer. I would agree.

As I mentioned, my first dining experience was fantastic. I enjoyed some pork soup dumplings and a plate of spicy shredded pork with a side of rice. I know right - starch heaven! It was freaking good tho. The staff was very friendly and added a bit of fun to the overall experience. The good thing is that it's right down the block from Regal theater and so I definitely know who is going to get my after movie dinner moolah!

Everything was great, will go again.

Made a reservation at LES location (only option for RSVPs) and recently had Sunday dinner here with friends. We sat outside and were socially distant from other tables.

Staff was efficient and friendly.

Food was bomb.

Not much more to add... just go ahead and try it if you're in the neighborhood.

Pro tip: check in for free [Milk] Tea

I came here recently because I was craving the pan fried noodles but, I also wanted fried rice. I ended up getting both and they made a delicious pairing especially, with the extra soy sauce and hot oil.  Definitely will be getting this pairing going forward.

Came in on a weekday because I wanted my soup fix, and surely I was disappointed. We ordered an order of soup dumplings, and 5/6 of them were popped. So when we ate it, there was no soup in the dumplings! However, the meat filling was good, hence the extra star.

We also ordered Dan Dan noodles, and it was a plate of noodles with a SMALL (the size of two quarters) scallop of meat. There wasn't a lot of sauce for us to mix the noodles, and when I ate it, the noodles were really bland. We also ordered the beef noodle soup, which is one of the specials of the restaurant. Super bland, kind of tasted like poorly flavored soap water. I had to add lots of chili oil to make it taste ok.

Overall, it can be a great place but maybe I came at the wrong time. It's just not something I would try again.

This week I tried 3 times for the first time. Some of my favorite menu items I tried are:

1. Seafood chili oil wontons
2. Shanghai noodles
3. Eggplant with garlic and chili sauce
4. Chinese broccoli
5. Scallion pancakes
6. Veggie dumplings

I can't wait to go back and try more menu items!
Top 5 Chinese restaurants so tasty & fast! Love I've tried a bit of everything except things with pork. Nothing has ever failed.

Stopped in today and the man at the front immediately come over to ask how he could help. When I told him I was there for a Yelp Elite event, he said I had the option of take out or ordering in if I ordered more off the menu.

I decided to take the soup dumplings to go but did appreciate the cute dining area!

The 4 pork soup dumplings were pillowy soft, filled with a large amount of meat, and the broth was light yet extremely flavorful!

I hadn't heard of this restaurant before but I'm glad I could be introduced. I will be back to dine in!

This is an amazing fresh dumpling place.
Came here mid pandemic, and it is impeccably clean.
I wish the best for this place! Wish we were closer.

I visited this restaurant about a year ago - I believe they had recently opened. Let me start off by saying that the service was not the best. The restaurant itself is inviting and really nice but when I entered to order my food the server didn't even look up. Hopefully it has gotten better. At the time they had a smaller outdoor area so we opted to get takeout. I had the shrimp fried rice which was just ok, kind of bland. The portion size is big for what you pay; I had some leftovers for dinner. I actually reheated it with soy sauce and it tasted a little better. The scallion pancakes were my favorite thing and really delicious. They also gave us red bean puffs complimentary but I wasn't a fan of the texture. Not sure I would rush to try them again.

3 Times was a lovely experience!

We walked up to the cute little place on Baxter St. It had bright and open outdoor dining area. We walked it to a kind waiter who showed us in to dine. The space was modern and open and refreshing.

The menu was large! I loved all of the choices. Especially all of the steamed dumpling choices! My boyfriend and I shared the braised pork with steamed buns, scallion pancakes, and 4 of the steamed pork dumplings. The braised pork came out first and wow. It was so tender. The ratio from fat to meat, the soy glaze, the steamed buns - all fantastic. And the scallion pancakes! Not too greasy which can sometimes be a problem at other places. And the steamed dumplings - lots of flavorful pork in a thick broth. Each of these took a while to get to our table but only because each dish was hand crafted and homemade. I could really notice a difference.

Something off putting though was the cartoon graphic on the wall. It doesn't fit the restaurant and is a "white savior" story. I think it should be taken down. It is embarrassing. It has nothing to do with the service or food I experienced.

A great relaxed spot in the lower east side!

The decor of 3 Times is simple and the ambiance is cozy. The staff was friendly but too aggressive for us. We ordered 7 dishes for a group of four and we thought it's more than enough. However, she kept recommending us to order more and more. We felt pressured and ended up packing leftover home.

Their food was overall delicious and authentic especially the Beef Brisket Stew w/ Potato ($26) and Sautéed Shrimp w/ Salted Egg Yolk ($27). The brisket was well braised, so flavorful and tender. The salted egg yolk sauce was creamy, rich and perfect with fried shrimp.

However, we might be hesitant to visit again due to their service or we will consider doing a take out order if we are craving for their food.

I ordered off of Door Dash on a Friday afternoon and I received my food pretty quickly (much earlier than the estimated time). The food was also still warm when I started eating which was a great discovery.

I ordered:

--DAN DAN NOODLES: Very average taste. The veggies that came with it were a good compliment to the noodles. And the noodles themselves were very well cooked.

--PORK SOUP DUMPLINGS: Good flavor and broth. My only complaint is the skin was slightly too thick and I wish there was more ginger that came with the sauce.

--Green Beans: Great flavor and a hefty portion.

All in all, a good lunch and great option for delivery.

I had high expectations for the spicy beef noddle soup since it looks really appetizing in the pictures. Def not as flavorful I thought it would be and was a bit too bland. I had to keep asking for more chili oil to even have any flavor.

I got severe food poisoning from 3 Times. It's the most sick I've been in my life. We believe it must have been from the chicken soup dumplings as I ate one and it tasted terrible, and my husband decided not to try them - he never got sick. I'm not sure if the chicken wasn't cooked or what it could have been but please look into your kitchen practices so no one else has to feel the way I felt.

20$ beef noodle soup after tip and tax

soft noodles in any asian soup noodle dish
especially if its over 15$

instant 1 sorry but the truth must be told
to the masses

Had a hankering for a meal made up of veggies and it was late enough that most restaurants around me were closed, save for the late night kitchen at 3 Times. They're a multi location Chinese restaurant billing itself as a place to get dim sum, xiaolongbao, and everything in between. I opted for two simple dishes-- eggplant in garlic sauce and pea shoots. The eggplant was pretty good and I especially liked the pieces of wood ear mushroom in the dish that nicely soaked up all the sauce.

Biting into the pea shoots was a record scratch moment for me. It was full of sand. I tried to power through it because I was famished and this was my only meal of the day, but biting into sandy vegetables is quite unpleasant. Their vegetable washer dropped the ball on this one.

- fabulous service
- open late (1:30am)
- no alcohol
- gets very busy after 10:00 pm
- rnb soundtrack
- crispy duck is tasty and well made, but kind of dry
- brisket soup is the truth
 It gets all the thumbs up
- dumplings take awhile to come out
- crab/pork soup dumplings are delicious!
- Shanghai dumplings are superb

The soup dumplings, which I was the most excited for, were really good albeit the "special dumplings" were not very special. I could barely taste truffle in the truffle XLB, and the salted egg yolk one was a bit better but the amount of salted egg in the actual soup dumpling was pretty minimal.

Also forgot the dan dan noodles which were good but not special, vegetable wonton with chili oil. The scallion pancakes were a bit disappointing, the beef and pepper was quite delicious. Overall, the meal was good but nothing too special!! Also recommend eating the soup dumplings as soon as you get them.

I swear I left a review for this location a long time ago but I guess it disappeared periodisappeared. I absolutely love there stir fried noodles with chicken! They are the best handful noodles I've had in the city. I've brought a few friends and family here and they love it just as much. I've also had the Spring rolls and bring rolls and shrimp fried rice, both are delicious.  My friend tried the soup dumplings when we went the last time and she enjoyed them thoroughly thoroughly. The vegetable dumplings were pretty OK we have them steamed. The period the wulong green tea comes in a giant French press and probably gives you about 5 cups of tea. Extremely extremely fragrant and fresh. I know I'll be returning soon.

I came here for dinner with my boyfriend and we shared beef and tripe, dan dan noodles, pork soup dumplings, and string beans. We really enjoyed the dishes, but did think that the dan dan noodles were just alright. However, we especially loved the string beans. Also, the service was extremely fast. We were able to place our order quickly and the food came shortly after. The waiters were really attentive and it was easy to get their attention. I highly recommend this spot!

We really wanted soup dumplings!! First things first we did not make a reservation we just walked in and were sat immediately.

The Dan dan noodles were good and are served cold, so FYI.. not really for me but I can appreciate the flavor. The beef soup was amazing and was blending so well.. the soup dumplings are amazing and that why we came!! You must try!! The dumpling were amazing too! We did the platter so we had a variety we loved them all!!

The service was outstanding and everything came out super fast!! The prices are good and they get two $$ from me. I highly recommend this location!! You must check it out!!

Great happy hour specials, which is why I stopped in. Happy hour lasts until 8pm!!! Those are several happy hours every day (including Taco Tuesday specials). $6 margs, discounts on beers, $3.5 on select tacos.

I made a reservation through Yelp, which was so easy! Staff was ready for us when we arrived. Service is quick to help, take orders, and keep your drinks full.

The Pollo happy hour taco was spicier than I expected, but the Mushroom taco was SOOO good. The guac was very flavorful.

The elote wasn't my favorite (tasted like parm cheese).
