It can get quite loud in here, just FYI.

The food was OK. I did like the Mushroom Taco alot, the Pulled Pork taco wasn't bad either. The guacamole was OK, I did find a hair on the chips so that was kind of discouraging. The frozen margaritas were on happy hour for $6 and they were just OK as well.

The place ambiance was OK. We sat inside and it was way too hot, there's no air conditioning only in the bar not in the area for dining. Nor do they have any fans inside. We moved outdoors to maybe get air from the fans that are placed outside and it was still no circulation.

The service was just OK as well. The female server seemed to not want to be working and wasn't really attentive at all. She just seemed to be annoyed.

Overall I don't recommend this place. There's so many Mexican restaurants to choose from that will have better service.

345 blew my expectations out of the water! My partner and I were looking for a new happy hour spot to try and found this gem pop up on yelp. We were able to grab a resy the same day.

Their happy hour has deals on sangria, frozen margs, beer, and of course tacos (pastor and chicken). We also ordered a few items off the regular menu too - the queso fundido with chorizo was incredible (pro tip, ask for chips instead!). I also really enjoyed the shrimp (camaron) taco! All in all we really enjoyed the food/drink here.

Atmosphere was cool too, with a lot of neon and comedic signs inside. Not too much indoor seating but there is an outdoor area which I'm sure will be nice as it warms up.

This place has a great Happy Hour, great margaritas and good service. The tacos are inexpensive but the other drinks on the menu leave something be desired. My friend enjoyed his arepas, it was a casual Sunday afternoon brunch.
The only issue is the drinks are sweet so if you're sugar sensitive I would ask for a less sweetened drink, half the sugar would be a great fit. They have outdoor seating and will bring you a tin for the dog. The frozen margaritas are definitely sweet but they have a really good HH from 4-8 daily. A great casual spot.
These are the best nachos in nyc. Get the chorizo. Cheap, delicious, lots of food, and fast service. Amazing. Couldn't recommend more highly.

Y'all are snoozing on this place! It was super easy making a Yelp reservation for 14 people and we had such an incredible time here for happy hour! Definitely recommend it for large parties. Frozen mango / passion fruit margaritas, tequila shots, and tacos. What more can ya ask for?

Such a cute place! Came here for my 30th birthday and it was the perfect spot. Festive, colorful, not too loud, and everyone who worked there was sooo nice. Good drinks, the signature drink was a bit sweet but good, and came with an awesome skull shaped ice cube. The nachos and chips and salsa were good, salmon was fine, and they brought complimentary champagne, flan, and churros which was super sweet and appreciated. Very good customer service and they made it a special night.

This is my favorite place for Taco Tues and I'm  currently living in Texas.
The Tacos are superb at any price and I particularly love the White
Sangria. My partner drinks the frozen sangria.
Next time we go, i'm having a regular meal so I can report back, but
go for the taco's as soon as you can. Did I mention they are $3.50?

We came for the Happy Hour and it lasts until 8 pm - which is great.

I had the Paloma for $7 and a frozen Margarita with strawberry for $8 - both were good.

I had 1 each of the Happy Hour taco choices at $3.50 each - they were good quality and tasty.  I chose one of the daily specials - which was a ceviche for $15 - it was delicious.

We had a nice visit at this friendly place!

We had a great time at the cute Mexican
restaurant. There were 9 of us and everyone really enjoyed their food.
The burrito bowl was delicious! Drinks were awesome !

Chicken de la abuela and beef tacos were both very delicious. Great cocktails. Guac was good.

Staff was very cool and accommodating.

We started with their chips and salsa (it's pico de gallo) and left without wasting any time worn the food. I'm from Cali... and I have heard good Mexican food is hard to in NY... after tasting the pico, I'm just going to trust that rumor and save my money.

Being Mexican and raised in Texas, the hardest part of moving to New York has been the lack of good Mexican food here. I stumbled on this place and was so impressed by the great food and deals! I wish we'd gone when I was hungrier because I wanted to try more of their menu. Can't wait to go back!

Welcome to 345 Cantina in the East Village!
A Slightly new spot on what used to be Indian row.
Here you will find the best Mexican happy hour in the neighborhood. From the $6.00 frozen margaritas yes, I said six dollars margaritas, not a typo!
The are not only delicious,  they pack, a punch!
So watch out when you stand up. If you have more than two of them, you've been warned!
You can't go wrong with any of the flavors they are all delicious!
. Now  for beer drinkers listen up!
One the  newest things I've ever seen yet ...... they have a HUGE-GLASS BOOT of BEER!
that's right ... the kind that you put on your with your trousers,  but this one's made of glass!
For a mere $13 at happy hour,  you can choose from any of the many beers they have on tap.
If you're hungry, or just in the mood for some snacks get the guac and chips or any of the tacos.  My favorite happens to be the pork!  YUMMY!
The space is very festive and the service is laidback,  neighborhood friendly. It's now my my go to place for a cheap fun happy hour!   Bring a friend or bring a group.

Alright, so I've spent a large chunk of my life in Texas. Moving to NYC was a treat in terms of the variety of international cuisines that are prepared top-notch in this city.... except Mexican food. For some reason, Mexican food is sorely underrepresented and when it does exist it's generally not very good.

Enter 345 Cantina.

Wow. I'm in in love. This is truly excellent Mexican food.

Everything from the tacos and margaritas to more hearty plates are all done really, really well and taste genuinely like Mexican food, not some weird bland version of what someone thinks Mexican food is.

You should absolutely come and eat here. I will be upset because my secret neighborhood spot has blown up, but I will be happy for them. They deserve your business, and you deserve to taste their excellent food.
Love!! Delish margs and quick service. The quesabirria has no business being that good.

Amazing! Staff/service are great! Everyone should try the Mac & Cheese w/ chorizo....it's the star of the show. I had the burrito bowl and it was fresh & delicious. My niece had the quesabirria & hibiscus mule signature cocktail and she raves about it. 100% recommend it and can't wait to come back!

Nice ambiance... tacos are good and prices are reasonable and competitive; attentive customer service ....new business so I assume they are working on menu and drink lists ... but our food and drinks were well received. A place to return too - with family or friends or a date!

Good food, good drinks, good vibes. Only thing was we were one of two parties there and it still took almost 40 mins to bring the food out let alone taking like 25 mins to make the drinks? Would go again just hope they get a bit faster with the drinks!

I have been coming to this Cantina for Brunch since it opened..
Food was excellent! Recommend the steak and eggs...delicious!
Very attentive Service and unique decor.
Great Ambiance!

AMAZING new spot in the east village. AMAZING service and food. I never leave reviews but can't get over how incredible of a place this is! Come here for drinks with friends, authentic Mexican food, everything!!! Can't recommend highly enough. Thanks for a wonderful evening!!! Looking forward to visiting again very soon

This is an EV hidden gem! The BEST happy hour every day with amazing margs and sangria. Food is also amazing - love the nachos. Some of the most authentic Mexican food I've found in the city. Staff is so kind and helpful! This has to be your new happy hour spot! Cannot rave about this place enough !!!
Cocktails are fantastic and the scenery is amazing. People who work here are really trying to bring this new place from the ground up. Give this place a shot for drinks

This iplace is enchanting !! Yummy tacos, the steak ones especially,  amazing cocktails too, so many to choose from  !!  The service  is really good , I felt so welcomed Overall a wonderful experience

This place was great! Delicious food. We came for happy hour and this place felt like they really tried on their frozen margaritas. Most places typically don't try too hard for frozen margs but they put a bunch of effort. Great spot. 10/10

Love this place! Always very polite.
The guy that makes the food is always nice and prompt with my food.
Lots of variety throughout the store, it's a little dinky in the back (that's my only issue)

I used to order stuff from the deli here,i stopped when I got an everything bagel with butter which tasted like Nutella - the guy wasn't cleaning his knife. A couple of days later I notice the pastries on display are growing mould. They remained in the display for the rest of the week.
In summer this year, the fridge at the back broke. They didn't even acknowledge it, they just kept letting people open the fridge to get hit in the face with a wave of hot air which smelled like stale asshole. Truly disgusting.
We bought a tub of ice cream around this time from the separate freezer thinking it would be OK. We opened it to find it was completely gross, I'm guessing melted and refroze. Now tonight i dropped in and stupidly took a look on the ice cream fridge - there are ice creams in plastic packets which are completely flat. They've melted and refroze and the store just doesn't give a fuck.

Summary; don't buy anything from here, not even the packaged stuff.
Beyond awful. I actually had to spit out my food. And it was a bacon, egg, cheese sandwich - how can you mess that up ? I guess by using stale bread, fake bacon, and uncooked cheese. Just horrible.

The menu on Eat24 said Grilled Chicken wrap with Bacon, Muenster cheese, tomato and lettuce. When ordered and delivered wrap only had chicken and lettuce. Called and complained and they didn't care. Fine for ordering groceries but stay away from prepared food.

When it comes to a quick snack, and a unique taste, try 3 Little Pigs Toast. You can eat them plain, or with cheese, or any other type of food you may enjoy. These are the best. They even look like little pieces of toast! LOL
I saw these at the grocery store a while back and knew by looking at them that they'd be good, and they are. I've eaten them plain and with some cheddar cheese. Other people slice up some Pepperoni and eat them with that.
They're a bit expensive, but they are worth it. I paid $4.29 for a pack.

The rice rolls are great. And reasonably priced. Quick service.

Neighborhood gem.  I would come back.

Clean, New, and nice upstairs seating area. I just made a beeline for cozy rice. We showed up early so we were the only ones there, but I was just imagining how it must be with a bigger crowd. The hallway is somewhat narrow so if the place really catches on a midtown lunch crowd could get challenging but will see. The place is not done yet with an empty stall and a section waiting to be built out. I'd come back for cozy rice.

This new food hall is still half under construction but the freshly made rice rolls from Cozy Rice are YUM!!! Got shrimp with scallion (free veggie with each roll) and the fried dough rice roll with cilantro, both were sprinkled with sesame seeds (they ask if you want them). Will definitely be back! Great prices and they take Apple Pay/Google Pay etc.

There's a Kung Fu Tea right at the entrance and a sushi place right across from Cozy Rice. There's space for more and hopefully more will open soon.

Really hate giving 2 stars to a place with friendly service and a buffet that makes my son happy, but this place looks dirty and needs some serious cleaning and a paint job.

My son and I love going to buffets at bodega type stores all over the city. Among the best bonding time after our appointments NYcity - wide.
First few times here we were on the go, grabbed from the buffet and ate at the tables outside not too far from but far enough away from Times Square congestion - an escape from the Times Square crowd that was great . Buffet food: fruit, interesting salads, meatball, chicken, various other things - all good...

The most recent visit was too cold to sit outside so we went upstairs ... The woman semi (warned?) that there were men drinking a beer upstairs as my son went for the stairs. Confused I joked, "just a beer? ... That's fine; if it gets too rowdy we will leave."

But when upstairs, (really, do not go upstairs)... My son went to the bathroom, I was looking around and noticed the walls were dirty... ew dirty .  I realized a scrub or magic eraser would clean the dirty walls ---  Started feeling skeeved.... Walked to the bathrooms to alert my son ... it only got dirtier...  dirty graffiti covered doors...  knocked on the door and said buddy? (Because I'm a mom added: "Don't sit down!") ... Opened the bathroom men's door and saw a black garbage bag over a of toilet seat in one of the stalls. Reading my repulsed look he said: "I was in the other one." Me: good lets get out of here . Was feeling skeeved took a look around the floors and carts holding the buffet downstairs -and the closer I looked, well, the place really needs a bleach cleaning, floor and paint job.

Walking to subway, feeling skeeved, I said to my son, "that place was really dirty". He shrugged indifferently. I said you don't care? If the visible parts are that dirty who's to say if their food prep areas are  sanitary. Smart son says: they don't make the food there; they have it brought from somewhere else . Me: probably; still gross. Probably won't go back.

I feel bad giving 2 stars when people try, are friendly and provide decent food, but I believe  a business owner should expect and provide a clean and sanitary looking place.. serving people food that should be an expectation.

It isn't hard to get bleachy clean..   Hire a crew or do it yourselves. I  managed a 5 story Victorian house / property in grad school and single handedly cleaned it to spotless with some TLC, TSP and  bleach-  in just a few weekends... so surely a business owner could take the same care of their own place so it looks and presents clean and sanitary for people getting food there .

Two stars only for looking dirty. I don't mind even a hole In the wall as long as it's a clean sanitary hole in the wall. Hope they clean up so I feel comfortable going back.

Small store with no tables. Standing area - just eat and go! No wait and quick service. Cash only.

.99 for a cheese pizza slice with a thin crust to satisfy my late night drunkchies -- yes, please.

This should not have a legal right to be called pizza. It's is hot bread that looks like pizza and has no cheese and no sauce. It's not made on location, it's not even pizza dough
I'll give props that you can satisfy the cravings of pot heads and drunks and you keep the cans of soda at 1.00
Service is fast and rushed to keep the lines moving as it's a very small spot
Place is a hole in the wall as it should be
Pass it up but if you are feeding homeless or raccoons then by all means indulge
The chain 1.49 pizza actually has sauce and cheese on it

Open late! The breakfast pizza was delicous. The price is a little high and the "99 cent" sign is a bit deceiving, but overall pleased with what we got. No seating and a very small area to stand in line.

Ok worthhhh it. We didn't want to wait in line for pizzas near the area so we found this place with a short line. The pizza is still a yummy NYC pizza. If you need cheappp but good NYC pizza then this is a good pit spot. I believe pizzas are not 99 cents anymore but start at 1.25 which is still a steal! The place isn't fancy at all but the food is what matters.

When in NY, you gotta have at least one slice of the infamous $1 pizza and this is the place to do it. This is definitely not the best pizza that you will have, but it checks the box for the NY experience.

I ordered one slice of the cheese pizza and one slice of the mushroom pizza. The cheese pizza is great bang for your buck! I would pass on the mushroom pizza if I had to visit again because the mushrooms were a little sus (see pic for reference) and looked like they straight-up came out of a can.

A slice of cheese pizza is $1. 1-topping pizzas are $1.75 and premium pizzas are $2.50/slice.

They also offer a variety of condiments to jazz up your pizza (red pepper flakes, oregano, and hot sauce).

99 cents for a fresh slice of NY pizza? Um, yes please! The sign caught my eye, and I was glad I stopped by. Took off a star because it's cash only and kind of a shit show to order. Like a little chaotic, especially this location because it's essentially in Times Square. But it's super fast. And the pizza is good! Took it to-go and had a very NYC experience just munching on a cheap slice of delicious pizza while walking amid the crowd in Times Square. Oh, by the way, only the plain cheese is 99 cents, but the other slices are still cheap!

I ordered an 18 inch cheese pizza and pepperoni pizza. The pepperonis were super oily, a bit more than the usual NYC pep slice. Overall it's a good deal, $8 for the cheese pizza and $12 for the pepperoni and the slices freeze well.

Service was quick, I only waited maybe 10min for fresh pies. Be aware that it's cash only.

If you want to stop by for a quick slice, there's narrow planks on both walls for you to eat your pizza there.

I'm proud to announce that I've tried the infamous 99 cent New York pizza! Shoutout to my bf who said we had to get a slice before leaving even though I was extremely stuffed from dinner. It's not good pizza but I would go for the experience -- there's nothing like fishing around your pockets for loose change and then proceeding to inhale a thin (almost cheese-less) slice of pizza right outside the shop at 2am

Oddly, this place has decent pizza. Now, I wouldn't rave on and on saying that this is the best pizza that I've ever had. However, you can get like two slices and a soda for $3.

It's a great way to grab a quick, cheap bite for lunch when you don't want to sit down or spend a ton of money.

I never thought I'd say I recommend a place like this, but the Yelp review were right. Give this place a chance!
One of the best pizzas in midtown! Waited a bit, but the two men working were so fast! Good slice in the city!

$1 cheese pizzas, $2 pepperoni, $3-5 for the more fancy pizzas like margherita or white cheese.

It is cheap, it is fast (Although lines can get long-especially in this busy area). You also get alot of commotion and crazies that walk in or homeless asking for money.

The pizza comes out hot, it's tasty and gets the job done. It doesn't have the rich flavor of prince street, but it is still a tasty pizza.

Came here to grab a quick bite for lunch on a weekday. Service was really quick, and pizza was indeed $1 a slice! Toppings are an extra dollar. I got chicken, so I paid $2 for a slice.

There were several people eating their pizza in the store, but there are no tables/chairs.

This is pizza that gets the job done. Incredibly cheap prices. Keep in mind this place is cash only.
One of the few places that won't have a line and there are two locations cross from each other. A good slice and a cheap pie!

This is likely one of the busiest 1 dollar slices usually with a good amount of tourists, locals looking for quick grub, and commuters going to Port Authority who aren't passing the 2Bros further west or north. I prefer the nearby 2Bros on 39th even though their slices have gone up 50 cents but it gets the job done and it's hard to argue with the price unless you're in Flushing or Chinatown where there are 30 better options. The best of the 99 Cent spots is at W4th which is abnormally consistent being hot and fresh but this one is alright. Don't bother adding toppings as putting generic store bought pepperoni or other things only hurts your wallet and makes you wonder why you were at the cheapo spot in the first place.

Tiny shop with no tables.

Our $2 slice,
Dry tasteless crunchy crust!
Dry tasteless cheese!
Dry tasteless pepperoni!
Dry tasteless sausage crumble!
Cash only!

No thank you!

$1 a slice.
Time Square-ish.
1:43 a.m.

Walk the block and slumber the hunger with the cheapest pizza-ish food you can find in NYC ... cause it's ...
* Open
* Quick
* Cheap

Oh, it's not good pizza.
It's cheap pizza.

I'm not sure about the "fresh" part in the biz name, but because of the "quality" ... I am pretty sure you couldn't tell either way if it was or wasn't.

In fact, I'm genuinely hesitant to even call the bready-bottom a "crust" ... the red liquid a "sauce" ... or the gluey white stuff "cheese" ...

Regardless ...

It's 1:43 am.
Near Times Square.
It's cheap.
It looks like pizza.
This place has way to high of a rating for what it is. Pizza wasn't great in part to the toppings being tossed on top of a cooked pizza without much reheating

If you visit NYC and don't eat a dollar slice, we cannot be friends. I have never ate here before, but got a pie to share with a few of my friends. The slice was well baked with light cheese & sauce. Delicious.

Can you walk in, order 2 to go, slap 2 bucks on the counter and walk out with 2 hot slices of pizza in a bag in less than 30 seconds?  I did.  If I were really hungry, I probably would have made those 2 slices disappear in 30 seconds as well.  It goes to show the diversity of a city where you can be dining out on $100 steak one night and 99¢ pizza the next day.  Everything in the universe has a balance.  And there is no shortage of high end steakhouses or dollar pizza joints in Manhattan.  You might even find them on the same block.

So how do these places make bank in the middle of midtown, where rents are as high as the skyscrapers you ask?  Here is the secret.  They hand you a slice, you hand them a dollar and you walk away happy, right?  Remember that the sign says 99 cent pizza, not $1.  They just got a 1% boost in profit from you.  Next time, hang around after you've given them your hard earned dollar bills, with your hand out and see if you get your penny change. EOL

Yummy!!!! So glad Joe's pizza had a ridiculously long line! I walked around the corner and found this little gem. The gentleman working the counter was extremely kind and calm. Pizza was delicious! The dining room was busy but organized.
the best pizza in the city hands down. on top of that, alex will give you the best service in the town. stop what youre doing and get a pie now. You will never regret it. 12/10 !!!

It's cheap pizza and honestly it's good, got a cheese and a slice with pepperoni and sausage. They were both good! Cheapest meal we had in NYC after a late broadway show! Guys at the counter were pretty funny too!
Nope. This is not real pizza. Tastes like frozen pizza. Not something to get when you're in NYC and it's filled with great options.

I stopped in here on the way home from a mets game, plain slice was 99 cents and the pepperoni was $2. small place inside no seating at all. Pizza was decent, wasn't the best nor the worst. nyc known for this stuff and it's a good experience

Horrible place ! Miss genders and cold nasty pizza !
Wish he wouldn't call girls guys and be laughing about it
Great pizza only wish a little bit more cheese but for the price can not complain. service was fast and friendly

99 cent pizza. NINETY NINE CENTS. God bless America, God bless this pizza shop. Not necessarily fresh pizza, but definitely serviceable. I went right after Joe's Pizza to compare, and it shockingly is close. Try both to see for yourself.

Two stars is generous, one star seems a little harsh.
The flavor is there, kinda? No crunch or crisp or anything in any of the crust other than what could be Subway yoga matt bread. Which begs the question, what are you actually putting in your body for $.99?
Economical? Yes. But you're on yelp, which means you can afford WiFi/cell service (and you can read) - so you can do better.

Kudos for oregano and pepper on the counter. No garlic powder/salt to be found.
If all ya got is $1 then, it is what it is. But if you want a slice of pizza and can afford, do yourself the favor and keep going. For anyone who truly believes this is 5star pizza...May God have mercy on your soul.
WOW! Pleasantly surprised! The name kind of scared us, but we were so amazed by the flavor and portions! Definitely recommend! And don't forget to tip!
Yeah it's 99 cents, but there was piece of metal in a slice. Could have really hurt my daughter. Went back and showed them. They, of course, didn't seem to care. Eat this at your own risk.

Did I really, really want Joe's Pizza around the corner? Yea. Was I going to wait in the insane line after a long flight & train ride? Absolutely not. This place was around the corner and not busy but not empty either. I got there as they were putting out a fresh cheese pizza. I got two slices and a Coke for $2.75 cash. Note: it is cash only! I'm giving it 5 stars because it accomplished the goal of the name of the restaurant: it was cheap and fresh. With how inflation has been lately, this is the cheapest meal I've had in a very, very long time.

Just like my "2 Bros Pizza" review, pretty much the same!

Honestly what can I say, do you have any other options this late at night. If you're ready this you probably don't.

Yeah it's not the world's greatest pizza, but it's definitely better then what you paid for. Came here ever night while visiting NYC lol!

Tastes good, gets the job done and puts you to sleep.

5 stars for being as good as it is.
Yes all day. You can't beat the price or the experience. Make sure you are the right place- there is a competitor on the corner that is more expensive and has a small name.
Very good pizza!! Way better than joes pizza! Super cheap but CASH ONLY. They're super fast and it's always good! Highly recommend! Only a dollar for cheese slice!
I first found this spot in 2011, I don't live in NYC, but I come here for proper NY style pizza whenever I'm in town. Literally perfect hot slices everytime.
Decent New York pizza at a great price. Got our pizza fresh from the oven. Guess who work there very nice. Ask for napkins when you order.
Good food. Might go again another time. It was near my hotel so I don't need to spend too much money for pizza
#1 independent 99c pizza spot. Plain and simple. Cheese solid, crispy crust, always a good crowd, light sauce - it's perfect.

Went there this afternoon. First New York pizza. Honestly made my day. Lowkey not mind blowing, but it's $1 and after spending way too much on everything else in this city, it made me so happy to get good quality food for a good price.

After a long, long day of traveling from Florida to New York we were starving! The location relative to our hotel was really the only factor in our decision to have the boys go grab some slices for us while we got ready to go out. The pizza tasted very similar to that of CiCi's pizza (the buffet chain) so do with that what you will. If you like CiCi's, 5 out of 5 stars. If you don't, keep walking. The price is what bumped up this review from a 3 star review to a 4; 7 slices of pizza (4 cheese, 3 various ~flavors~) for only $12. That is cheaper than one bottle of water near central park these days. Not exactly 99 cents, but close enough for me.

It's a perfect place to have a delicious pizza at 2am or anytime you want. I love how the bread is just perfect and the amount of toppings are great. I was coming from a long flight and hours on the wrong train until we finally got in our hotel, soo hungry, so we found this place and we headed there, honestly THE BEST choice we could make that night. Can't wait to go back to NYC and have this again.

The best pricing for a pizza slice on the go. They had a little area to stand and eat your pizza on.

I don't think they have a restroom. It's just a cool place to go pay a dollar, be fed, and go like a taco truck. I can't even complain with the price.
Can't beat $1 a slice. Fast service and tastes good.

There's a fine line between being thrifty and economical, and just being straight up sketchy...

During my most recent visit, I got 2 regular cheese slices, handed the cashier a $5 bill and expected to get $3 back. Simple.

However, he proceeds to hand me back $2 and a quarter. Oh, so out of dollar bills - that's alright. The rest of the change please? "Oh you wanted soda?" Nah man, never said that.

Then he drips another quarter into my hand, like a stingy salt bae. Uhh, where's the rest? "50 cents for box! You asked for box right?"

Man, since when did y'all erect a new sign with the box tax! Also, I just wanted a paper plate anyway... "Too late, I already put in box!" He then proceeded to stare straight through me like I no longer existed. I had nothing left to say - he had scored a KO, and I had no dignity (or quarters) left to claim.

Yes, I know a few quarters doesn't make a big difference, but it's the principle of the matter and being lied to that was unnecessary.

However, the slices are consistently above average (for the price) and they get through lines pretty quickly, so there's that!
I think this is a must try while in new York! It's actually 99 cent pizza for a big side of pizza. Pizza was really good, line went by super fast!! I highly recommend it!
really good and cheap, it's really oily but the crust is really crisp and nice to chew into. it's good-- a dollar for a cheese pizza and 2 for pepperoni

Stop by before I went home , it's in the middle of the block ..just grab a slice for a buck . Yea it's a dollar slice .a bit doughy but still worth the price in midtown. No seating inside but your near outdoor seating near the corner . Cheese Pizza by the Slice.

99 cent for one slice of cheeeeeeeeeeze pizza.
0.50 cent for additional topping.

$1.50 for a pepperoni slice.

Super fresh and bomb diggity for $1.50! The owner/employee is friendly. The interior is not the most welcoming...got nothing going on and...nothing.

Stand and eat. Walk and eat. No chairs or tables.

Came at 12:30 am and they were busy. People were buying like three slices each and standing around eating and some buying more after finishing.

Hollllaaa for a dolllaaaa.

A dollar pizzas a dollar.. so it's not gonna taste like
The best pizza you've ever had. But this really isn't bad at all. I kind of liked how it tastes. The crust is thin but not as thin as Italian pizza. Great place for a quick cheap slice or for drunk munchies.

Cheese pizza: alright. Not horrible not amazing.

They offer seasonings on the side, like pepper flakes. Wish they had oregano tho. Overall it was a good pizza because of taste and experience. I would actually go again.

Tourists always assume NYC is such an expensive place to live and eat.  Not true at all.  $1.00 pizza? YESSS!!!  It exists!  It is not a myth.  People just have to know where to go to find cheap prices, yummy food, and big portions.

I love this place, and all their locations in NYC. Every time i am in Time Square and have a pizza cravings, i always come here.  Hands down.  Their pizza is the best.  Because they have such high traffic and demand, the pies are always made hardcore fast on rotation.  Always fresh.  If not, just wait for the next pie.

I always come in determined to only have 2 slices and a can of soda, but for some reason i always end up walking away eating almost a whole pie.  Their pizza is so addictive.  Its because the bread is so soft.  I just wish they would add more cheese to it.  Their beef patty is also really good.  I get that as well.  I don't care if the cashier thinks i am eating my feelings.  

I really hope they make it past the pandemic.  I miss this place so much, and i don't care if the Indian man behind the counter doesn't speak English and doesn't understand a word i say.  He always throws singles at me even when i tell him not to (after i give him a twenty dollar bill).  Please support them.  I 'll be back as soon as a vaccine and over-the-counter meds are produced.

The combination platter (rice, salad-- chopped lettuce, tomato, onion-- grilled chicken and lamb with hot sauce and white sauce) for $5.50 is an inspired choice for a filling and hearty mid-town lunch.

Curse inflation-- this gem used to be $5 not long ago.  Alas, we all must pay the bills.

update 3/1/09
Big recession benefit-- lunch is back down to $5.  Pocket that $.50 for a rainy day.

HALAL HALAL HALAL...NY has gone HALAL Crazy.
I love it.  You can now get a hot dog, and/or a halal shis kabob served in a hot dog bun.  Who does that...?  Who does that???  I saw them on every corner, one trying to differetiate itself from the other.  Some stated they had falafels, but I never saw one.  You could order meat over rice, in a hot dog bun, or plain.  

Awesome.  Even AwesomeR at 1145PM.

I had a chicken, while my pal ordered a beef kabob. It was awesome and a nice twist to a hot dog.  I loved it...and can't wait for the trend to come to San Jose.  Cheap eats indeed. Cheap eats! Check out my pics!

Came here when I was searching for a chicken and rice cart by my work, and after reading all the positive Yelp reviews, decided to give it a shot.

The person at this cart was very grumpy, as if he didn't want anyone to buy his food. Finally after I got him to speak, I decided to order the lamb and rice. It was ok. Not too spicy or flavorful.

I went to a street cart for the first time a couple days ago and was disappointed. But after hearing about how one cart can be dramatically different from another I decided to try my luck with this one.

I have to say that I am very happy I did. $4.50 for lamb over rice and it was amazing. Well, better than the other cart anyway. I liked this one so much I went here for lunch 2 days in a row. First day was chicken over yellow rice. It was good but the chicken was lacking in flavor, although the rice was very good. The next day I went with 3 other people from my office after I told them I ate here and they were surprised to see me still alive. I got the lamb over yellow rice and was blown away. I never thought you could find such a great meal for only $4.50 (besides my favorite deli). My coworkers loved it too. Well, not one of them, but she got red sauce on accident and that can change the taste drastically. Personally I love both the red and the white sauce. And lots of it.

This place has even inspired me to start a list and try and find the best lamb over rice from a street cart.

Whoa, whoa, whoa, people! Check yo-self!

This is not a special halal cart. The only thing special about it would be the location if anything. I've tried both the chicken platter and the sandwich, and they were bland and ordinary. So dump on the white and hot sauces if you want to taste anything!

Food trucks are generally place to grab a bite and go, and so we did. We ordered a falafel which isn't a food from any of our ethnic backgrounds. We discovered that there are two different types of food carts. One that serves breakfast and the other that serves lunch. We tried the falafel gyro and to most of us it was not bad. You could taste the difference in ingredients which was like nothing we've ever had. The pita bread was slightly sweet but reminiscent of sourdough in softness and the falafel was crispy and slightly bland with a taste of tamarind and other spices.
   Besides the man terrible attitude the food truck seemed clean but the food took longer than we expected. The good part is that he made the food in front of us, and also it was fresh and the price was under $5. We would recommend this truck to anyone who wants to spend less money and isn't in a rush to get somewhere.

I don't get why this gets the ratings it does but maybe it's people from out of town and fancy this kind of eatery. But the many times I've gotten various platters of food from them, was usually out of desperation and lack of choice at the particular hour in the night. That being said, there's usually a line and to boot, I honestly think the food is always way too salty. And I always ask to have the sauce on the side or less sauce. The last time I ate there I also gotten sick so that was the last time I ordered something from them. There's definitely something to be said about food trucks not having grading like all the other NYC restaurant establishments. I would be curious to know if any of them can / will pass with a decent grade!
We tried many carts but this guy hands down was the best chicken & rice of them all.  When you go there, tell him to make it just like the way he'd like it. He'll hook you up.

Having spent a weekend in NYC and eating at both fancy places and not so fancy places, I do have to say my favorite food was the felafel on rice at this cart.  Warm rice and seemingly fresh felafel with white and red sauce on a cold Saturday night: what more could you ask for?  At 5 bucks, the quality, quantity and overall efficiency of this type of meal is fantastic.  You do realize that in most cities you'd have to actually make an effort to find a middle eastern restaurant to find food like this?  Ya'll New Yorkers are spoiled.

Worth the wait. Headed to the airport figured we'd grab a quick snack, talk about hot and ready. Owner told us 10 minutes because they were already sold out of cheese pizza slices at 10:46AM!

Each bite was tasty and left me thinking how hot should have gotten 2 slices instead of just 1!

Visiting NY for the first and one of the must-dos on our list was to try really good local pizza. So, this place (specifically) was strongly recommended by our local born and raised tour guide who claimed that this is the absolute best NY pizza ever, and it sounded like he knew his pizzas. He also made doubly sure that we came to this 99c pizza hole-in-the-wall vs any others. So off we went to try the "best" pizza NY had to offer.

We ordered a slice of Veggie pizza and a slice of Ricotta pizza. Ok, so the veggie pizza was definitely tasted good.....for a very plain and boring veggie pizza. What my wife and I totally agreed on was that the Ricotta pizza was absolutely over-the-top delicious, and the best pizza we have had since we arrived.....and we had already tried 2 or 3 other highly recommended places. Yes, the crust is not as firm and crispy on the bottom as others we'd tried, but the ingredients were so fresh and went so well together.... and with that yummy hot and fresh just out-of-the oven crust ....wow.....d'lish!

We really enjoyed trying the pizza here, but we noticed that every time we passed this place, the lines are always quite long, but it moves fast though, and being a hole-in-the wall there is no where to sit....so we found a concrete block at the side of the busy street and enjoyed our pizza there :)

No thrills, no sit down, just grab your quick slice of NY pizza and go.
We hit a couple of spots and honestly this was the best place we had and it's very reasonable in pricing.

When I get back to NY it's gonna be a first stop.

The prices can't be beat and the flavor of the pizza is pretty great!  

Service however is lacking. They were very busy and we got skipped in line and ignored while ordering.

Definitely a good place for a quick cheap bite when looking for pizza.

Don't let the name fool you though, only cheese is 99 cents, but everything else is very reasonable still.

For 99 cents (technically $1), I really can't knock it. We stumbled on this pizza shop in passing and ordered the $1 cheese slice for a late night snack. While there was a line, it went quickly and we gobbled our slices on the side of the street. There was a panhandler panhandling at the shop, but the owner was quick to address the situation and take care of his customers. The pizza was hot and ready and is everything you need a slice of pizza to be at it's most basic. It hit the spot!

A pepperoni slice is $2. A whole pie (cheese only) is $8. They also have a meal deal of 2 slices of cheese and a can of soda for $3. All in all, a solid stop for the classic $1 slice.

Pizza is one of my pet peeves. It needs to be NYC pizza not gourmet not chicago not too raw not too whatever. The pizza here is relish. It's packed at night. Close to theater district. And relish and CHEAP!  Had the white and the cheese. Both great!  Defy one of my favourites in the city. Just know what you want before you walk in and don't dilly dally because they will just pass you up!

For $1 pizza this place was pretty darn good. I liked it better than some of the other known places in the time square district. The crust was soft and buttery, if I lived here I would be eating here often

What is that white stuff on my Pizza ?  It looked like The Halal Guys White Sauce, but no it was ranch dressing,  I ordered the Chicken Bacon RancH Pizza, who would have known.

It was Ok, the flavors actually matched up only there was not enough Chicken or Bacon, I think they over drizzle the pizza to hide that fact.

But that didn't stop the customers from coming here there was a line for the 99-cent plain slice. And the place did look a bit better than some of the other 99-cent pizza joints in the neighborhood.

Wanted a quick bite so why not get a quick slice? Stopped in, got the regular 2 Cheese Slices and a Bev for 2.99, can't really beat that. The pizza is never a miss, always hot and ready to devour. Usually fast service as well, line moves quick if there is one! Staff is always friendly and ready to serve the next customer! Thanks for the business!
Pizza was cold, not the best. The best thing going is the price.  Only got it out of convenience...probably won't try again.

Wow - blown away.  6b is an awesome place to get a healthy, fresh, affordable lunch.

It's on the street level of an office building right across the street from Grand Central Terminal.

A huge variety - grilled salmon, sushi, salads, Chinese on the buffet, hot sandwiches.

We were really surprised at the huge variety and how good everything was.

I said to my wife "if I worked in this building, I'd eat here EVERY DAY...!!!"

was excited to try out their buffet but sorely disappointed by the limited options. great if you want fruit / yogurt, not so great if you are looking for a nice salad with veggies and fresh options. They did have some hot food options (10 or so) but all greasy / fried - no salmon, or grilled chicken.  Better off going to Essen which is a block away and has a ton to choose from.

I have eaten here before and was satisfied, perhaps I thought it was a little expensive. I stopped by the other day and tried the buffet.  I had a small piece of cod in a miso glaze sauce that was freaking Dynamite. I also tried a small piece of soul or flounder franchise and it was delicious. Had some bock Choy and a few pieces of sesame chicken.  I was absolutely amazed with the quality of the fish and the flavors of the food. It's completely obvious the food was made by a professional chef and not some deli guy.  It was as good as any expensive restaurant that i have had. Actually excited to go back on Monday.

While this is not a mind-blowing eatery, you CAN get a healthy meal here for under $10, which is extremely difficult to do in this neighborhood. The food here can be a hit or miss, depending on the day and what time you come in, but sometimes, they have really good food, such as fresh grilled salmon and a nice variety of fresh vegetables.

This place was kind of hard to find, but once I found it (in the lobby of the office building across from Grand Central station), it was a huge relief to go there for lunch compared to the countless other places nearby which only offer high-carb/high-calorie lunch options for no less than $15.

I almost ate there everyday when I worked in the building. Both breakfast and lunch were great. Very broad selections of yogurt, fruits, meat, fish, carbs, etc. I prefer the food from hot/cold bars to the made-to-order counter. Sushi was very fresh and tasty. Bagels were okay but cannot compete with many other bagel stores in the city.
Be careful how much you take because the price adds up very quickly.

MealPal: Beef Burrito Bowl

Ground beef, salsa, shredded cheese, romaine lettuce, seasoned rice with corn, refried beans, salsa, guacamole and sour cream.

The bowl is packaged very nicely separating the salad from the cooked contents.  

Monday, April 23, 2018

6b is a solid choice for fast and decent lunch in Grand Central.

Pros:
* Spacious food court. When we go around 1-2PM you don't have to wait for a communal table.
* Lots of food options. I personally go for the sushi where you can try a medley of different rolls from Tempura Shrimp, Spicy Crunchy Tuna/Salmon, regular Tuna/Salmon, eel and crab rolls. 6 rolls and pinch seaweed salad for under $7. The freshness of fish and fish-rice ratio is great!
* Also love the Shumai and Sauteed Mushrooms.

Make sure to watch how much you're putting in your box because it can quickly rack up to over $15!

I work in the same building that 6b is located in, so it's a huge bummer that I'll never step foot in there again.  The food is a solid 4-star rating, with a great variety of cuisines that are always fresh.  The space is open and clean and there's a ton of options to choose from, from their buffet bars to food from the grill.  All good on those fronts.

Now for the negative.  Almost nobody in my office (of 60+ people) goes there anymore, and it's for the same reason; the terrible attitude of the management/ownership and, to a much lesser extent, some of the staff (which is undoubtedly due to management directives).  On a few occasions, the manager was observed yelling at his workers.  Not only is it disrespectful to the worker but the customers always seem visibly disturbed by the behavior - justifiably so.  

The pricing of the food is also so frustratingly inconsistent.  I went in there nearly every day to get an omelet and the prices never seemed to be the same 2 days in a row.  At first it didn't bother me because some days the price would be $.50 cheaper than it should've been, followed by $.50 higher the next day, but after a while it continued to be completely in their favor.  And when I questioned it, the owner/manager gave me attitude about it - and that was the last straw for me.   This is midtown Manhattan so you can't go 100 feet without finding a place that makes a decent breakfast.  I don't need anybody to kiss my rear end everytime I order a meal somewhere but this place also lacks any real customer service.  

Oh, and before I forget: these guys will threaten to charge you extra if you put hot sauce from the condiment area on your food from the grill.  Apparently there's a cheap version of hot sauce packets behind the counter that they'll give you.  That's a joke.  The fact that they'd make a big deal out of taking 5-cents worth of hot sauce on an over-priced $7 omelete should tell you all you need to know.  So even though this place is insanely convenient for me, I'd rather head to a nearby deli in the cold/rain/whatever than give them my business.  And I know I'm not alone feeling that way.

This place is super convenient being that I work right here. Awesome variety of delicious food, yet to try it all hehe. My favorites are usually the Shrimp Fried Rice (way better than Chinese take out), avocado salad and veggie spring rolls.

The only downside is that the place runs a be pricey, but then again it's The City! Specially recommend this place if you work here!

The breakfast here is seriously excellent. There have been lots of changes lately - many new breakfast items. Chief among there are an excellent variety of lox roll ups and tuna roll ups; a build your own avocado toast bar with prosciutto, ham, turkey, lox, medium and hard boiled eggs and more; a wide variety of grab and go egg sammies and the addition of several varieties of scrambled eggs and egg whites. My favs are the roll ups. Seriously there is so much here, at a reasonable per pound price that I can't cover all that I like. Also made to order egg sandwiches and omelets. If you haven't been for a while you should give it a shot. I appreciate the value, speed and variety. I do have some quibbles - sometimes the scrambled eggs are too runny and the grab n go sammies too cold, but overall it's excellent.

Hands down my favorite place to get a quick lunch in midtown. Don't be intimidated by the long line during lunch rush hour as you walk in, it actually goes by very fast because they are super efficient. As for the food, they have so many options. A salad bar, hot food bar, a large selection of soups, sushi, and a sandwich making station. Personally I LOVE the Mac n cheese or any pasta they have. They also have great Asian food, like the fried rice, lo mein, and sesame chicken. I come here at least 3 times a week and I will continue to come back!

Just like other pay by pound buffet places. A special thing about it is that they have sushi selections as part of pay by pound too. Hot dishes were great. Salads were not as much as Whole Foods. The location was great very quiet and won't run out of seats even at noon time. A bit pricy but still a good business day lunch spot.

There is simply no better place near my company to get a my lunch.
My colleagues have been raving about this place, so I opted for the buffet.  It's huge selection of all kinds of snacks, sandwich and buffet food, etc.
Prices are pretty standard for the area.
Service is very quick and efficient, and they also have seating area is nice and clean. They're catering to office events, it was nice for company meeting. I'm definitely going back to explore the menu a bit.

Great place for lunch with lots of fresh hot and cold food from Turkey to Sushi - there is something for everyone.   The lines move fast because they have a few cash registers with friendly staff.   My only issue is when they weigh your plate - the prices could be lower per ounce.   There is seating inside if you like to eat, but all and all great place for a quick bite.

We were not sure what to eat  while running errands in NYC so found this place on yelp. It was hard to find because it's inside the building. We grabbed a little bit of everything like salmon, mozzarella, grilled chicken, asparagus, avocado, shrimp salad, spinach, couscous salad with salmon, black bean rice, Mac and cheese and the best part is the sushi tasted so fresh we had the turkey wrapped spicy tuna and tuna salmon wrap no rice. 11.50/lb not that bad.
Everytime I go here I leave full.  The price is always right and the food is clean. I'm best place to get food in the area.

This is one of my favorite lunch spots in midtown Manhattan. It's right near grand central which makes it a terrific option. It's hidden away downstairs in a corridor by 60E 42nd street which makes it not well known. But when you go inside this place it's like a mini goldmine. Tons of options, sushi , Asian style food as well as salads. Buffet style too if you're into that. I prefer the buffet and steamed veggies because they're always fresh around lunch time. Also the Mac and Cheese is delicious from 6b. Trust me you can't go wrong here. They also are doing MealPal promotions as well. Recommended!!

Okay buffet deli place in Grand Central area for busy office workers.

The place is hidden in a building between 41st and 42nd on Madison and I couldn't even see it's name until I walked out and was still in disbelief to see 6b (what kind of name was that?!).

The buffet area was really big and had a couple of sections: salad, side dishes, meat and SUSHI! I was a fan for sushi and the sushi here was not bad and they had my favorite EEL SUSHI. The rest of things were nothing special but standard for a quick lunch.

The checkout line could be really long during rush hours and might take 3~5 minutes to get to the cashier. The price was slightly higher than other deli places in the area (somehow)... Don't think I will make the hike to this place again to meet the big crowd while paying more, when I have cheaper and as good options available just under my building.

MealPal/6B - SIXTH BURNER
I'm glad to eat at a place that understands MealPal provides an opportunity to restaurants to attract new customers. I never would've thought to enter this building nor eat at 6B- Sixth Burner. I picked up the Fried Fish Burrito Bowl and it was fresh, crispy, and tasty. I purchased several other items from the salad bar because of the generous portion size of the MealPal, the 6b food variety, and helpful staff. I'll definitely return to eat here again.

The food at 6B is alright and there is a good variety, but hella expensive compared to other deli's in the area, I guess rent must be high in Grand Central. Come here if you need a quickie (of food, I mean) or if you have a business account, but if you're not in a hurry, there are other options.

There is room for seating, which is a plus, if you want to have a lunch date with that special someone, but seriously, she will dump you if you took her to 6B on a date.

The place is hidden from the outside but inside there is everything from snacks, coffees, salads, sandwiches, fresh pressed juices, even beer to hot buffet style food that changes daily. Very good value and quality for lunch. I like to pick up their breakfast wraps in the morning on my way in. Oh Lunch hours can be pretty crowded so be aware especially if you are in a rush. Would be nice if they have self checkout.

This is a gem hidden away in the lobby of 60 East 42nd Street.  It's not visible from the street.  To get there, either walk past one or two elevator banks in the lobby or through the Chase Bank ATMs on the ground floor.  

This is your basic Korean-owned deli/buffet place.  I have not yet tried the sandwiches, but the hot and cold buffets are very good.  The food generally is more Asian-oriented.  Their spicy Korean BBQ pork is pretty good, as are their spring rolls and shumai.  I recently tried their pot roast with mushrooms and onions.  The meat was super tender and fell apart as my fork went into it.  They usually have a decent variety of hot and cold veggies.  The spaghetti squash is pretty good.  The steamed veggies aren't overcooked, which I love.

I recently tried the creamed mushroom with truffle soup.  The taste may be a bit too rich for some, but I thought it was AMAZING.  I loved the frothy texture.

6b is located in Midtown, so, yes, it can get pricy, especially if you decide to go all out, which I am guilty of doing.

One thing: because of its physical location, there is no cell or data reception.  In order to check in with Yelp, I had to go out into the street after my lunch.  So, if you are expecting an important call, you may not want to eat here.

The place is clean, and I noticed one worker quickly clean up a spill.  The cashiers are pretty quick and efficient.  They definitely run a tight ship here.

The seating area is pleasant.  During one visit, somebody was playing a keyboard.  I've only seen this done once, so it is not a common occurrence.  Usually they are playing some light music station.

All-in-all, this place is a great find.

I've been wondering for the longest time if this place had a yelp page, just so I can rave about it! Indeed 6b is a hidden gem!

For the past year, I've been hitting this place up for breakfast/lunch at least 3-4 times a week. Food is NEVER hit or miss. The buffet offers such an eclectic and creative variety. They get slaphappy with the kale and quinoa, but at least it's healthy.

Their best hits are the Chinese food, fried soft-shell crab, and pesto filet mignon. On Mondays and Tuesdays, they'll have guacamole and pico de gallo with chips. (No extra guac charge, since it's buffet style. You can just fill up your box with those bad boys.) Alternatively, the salad bar is always very fresh and delicious.

Most importantly, their prices are relatively fair. A New Yorker knows what an $8 buffet box feels like. I'm never taken by surprise when my box is weighed.

Hidden gem, buried in the basement of One Grand Central Place! It's one of the best midtown buffet/deli lunch spots - and less crowded than the others. The space is contemporary and uniquely designed with for-sale art pieces on the wall.

6B offers a wide variety of hot and cold lunch buffet items, which are fresh, delicious and reasonably priced. The menu changes daily but some highlights include: build you own salad with 15+ ingredients, fried soft-shell crab, croquettes, and salmon ceviche. I haven't tried the made-to-order items, but I would expect it to be just as good as the other items.

La Colombe Coffee is sold here, too!

Mealpal lunches here are terrible here. Got the sashimi poke bowl.. this was more like ground fish from yesterday's good sushi in a shredded cucumber and rice bowl. So many regrets about today's lunch.
Very conveniently located in my office building, near Grand Central. Their coffee is fantastic, and so are their bagels with cream cheese. The buffet bar is also pretty good for a quick lunch.

Slowly but surely 6B is turning into a dump. I've noticed a few bad health ratings recently, but I saw they were back to A status so I stopped in to get a sandwich (which are usually great). Today, I ordered a panini.... what I received was NOT a panini. The sandwich was not made with panini bread, but with warm pita triangles - not even toasted or pressed. Sloppy, soggy, floppy and pathetic. I gave 6B a shot at redemption and was proven wrong. I will not return - Go to TableTime across the street. Same gist of a lunch spot, but way better.
Hidden gem in Mid-east, Like a deli version of speakeasy. Their craft sandwiches are always satisfying my craves

I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap from the deli bar which was delicious, fresh, and very filling. Generous portions and very friendly staff. Clean restaurant to eat-in. Also meet with the owner whose very pleasant and friendly! Highly recommend!

First of all, their food is great! And I also like the clean and large space. They have sushi by pound, which is pretty unique and I think it's a great deal. I also tried the sandwiches which were delicious. This is going to be one of my regular go to lunch places.

Super convenient and always clean! I stop on my way to work to pick up some omelettes and breakfast sandwiches. I haven't stopped by for lunch yet but they such a large range of food. Unlike other hot food bars, the food actually looks appetizing.

Pricey but worth it! By 2PM the best stuff is usually gone. Might not have the widest selection but there are plenty of options for everyone and quality far outweighs the rest.
Sushi isn't bad and chefs are making rolls fresh and regularly repleneshing rather than huge trays sitting out. Perfect if you want a few pieces.They also will make a specific roll on the spot if you ask.
Their chinese section is actually pretty good, and they have really tasty vegetable options. The fish is always fresh, salmon is skin on and AWESOME. The food in general is never greasy nor salty which would be my complaint for every other buffet style place in the area.

To get there from chase/42nd St side: walk through the doors where chase is on your right and take a right into the hallway. The place is the first door on left, across from the newsstand and there are pasta making machines in the window display.
From 41st St- through the revolving doors, down the steps and its the first semi-hidden door to the left (back entrance).

Wow, what a find. When my colleague said "hey i found a decent sandwich shop", I didn't expect this! Located on the bottom floor (lobby) of One Grand Central Place, this place isn't something you'll find just walking by on the street.

The sandwich station is where it's at. A really good combination of variety sandwiches with many different types of breads, not just rolls/heroes or wraps. I had "The Boss" sandiwch, bulgogi with coleslaw, smoked gouda, and sauce, for $6.95!! You can't beat that. I've tried a few of their other items off the buffet and it's also really good and fresh. I'll definitely be back for the sushi as you can tell they make it fresh and it's not all rice either.

Good find!
I just had their beef burrito bowl ordered from MealPal, it's by far the worst meal ever. The beef isn't real beef, and rice was soaked with water fe

This place has a great selection of food.  I love it when they have soft shell crab and grilled octopus.  They even serve lobster sometimes!  It can get busy during the lunch rush, but the lines move quickly.  They also have a nice, spacious seating area.

So I work next door to the restaurant and a co-worker Of Mines Went To get a cup of hot water and lemon for me 3 times in one day and he didn't pay anything and when I went the lady told me $1.09 and a co worker in my office also refills her coffee at the restaurant for free and when another co worker went to get a refill they told him $2 I just don't understand why do they do this. && the price is really high $1.09 for a small cup of two lemons and hot water and I asked her why so much and she said I have to pay for the cup like really ? It's ridiculous !
Great service and best food!! I especially enjoyed the salmon and sushi. They also have a pressed juice section and freshly squeezed orange juice as well. Don't want to miss out if you're in NY :)
Quality food, this spot is a hidden gem. Food is always fresh. I did recommend this spot to my colleagues and they come here often.

Love this place!The Manager and staff at 6B will treat you like family, great food, my favorite is the salmon there, you must try it :), good coffee, very convenient for busy office workers since they don't have to leave the building, the place as well has some seats so you can hang out and get your breakfast or lunch there, overall the place is really great, they deserve more than 5 stars, I do recommend you go there and try it.

Absolutely horrible establishment. Over priced and underwhelming. The staff is quite rude and disrespectful and continuously disappoint. Countless breakfast orders have been messed up. The staff is unhelpful and charges you for simple items such as cutlery. Food quality is abhorrent and you're better off going to the Chik-fil-a next door. Even if this place is near by, I'd recommend turning around and walking the other direction. Home style deli on 41st is significantly better and cheaper. These guys suck

my first yelp review  is for one of my favorite lunch place . There is always a long line but they move quickly.
The food is fresh and flavorful. The kitchen is open style so you can see how they prepare the food. One of the BEST self service buffet style restaurant in the city.

Fresh quality food, excellent lunch spot with wifi. Wide selection of buffett, hot and cold. They also serve raclette! The only minus is their price point. Quite expensive but not terribly unafforadable.
Hard to find, but worth visiting. So many options to choose from and reasonable price for delicious foods. I would definitely come back again.

I love the vast selections of foods here. From sushi to chicken to fish to salad bar. With lots of snacks laying around too - chips, cookies, Asian snacks, and drinks. It's a more upscale buffet place when compared to Essen. The modern decor and spacious eating arrangements made me fall in love with the place. It's located on the bottom floor of the One Grand Central building. Although it can get pricey if you start grabbing everything mindfully, it is totally worth it!

#2 Hidden Gem Places in NYC

This is my second review of Hidden gem places in NYC series.

A real hidden gem in Midtown. The best deli place I have ever been to. The quality is so good that I don't want to call this place a deli. It's better than any restaurant around Midtown. The food is as close to food from Michelin star-ed restaurants.

Not many people come here despite its location. And I hope it stays like this forever and doesn't get crowded. Hope they don't advertise this place too much. Haha

The menu changes everyday. They put out only the fresh items. They clean the dinning area so well. Highly appreciate fast cashier line.

I work in the building so I go to 6b for convenience.  The food is pretty good.  There's decent variety on the meat side of the hot bar and enough new things to keep from getting bored.  But vegetables are always the same and always just so-so.
6B only gets 3 stars because of the horrendous customer service.  Their cashiers rarely stay more than a couple of weeks, so they are usually confused when dealing with general things, but especially Corp accounts (which we have).  Every now and then a friendly, intuitive cashier will pop up, but they never stay.  It's very weird.  Contrast that with Essen where ALL if the cashiers are top notch and most have been there for years.  Management at times has seemed helpful, but they really need to fix their basic staffing problems.

I work in the same building and going to 6b is convenient.  I often buy tuna salad on a roll but the last 2 times the bread has been so stale it cuts my palate.  I'm sure the guy preparing the sandwich knows this when slicing the bread.  Not sure if management is being cheap of workers don't know better.  Either way...not good for business.

As other reviewers said, this is a hidden gem - and truly hidden, there are no signs outside the building so you may have a hard time finding it.

I used to work across the street, and I was going there 2-3 times a week for breakfast and another 2-3 times a week for lunch. I am missing it quite a bit these days!

At first glance it looks like just another of these buffet place where, let's face it, food is usually plain disgusting. This is not the case. Whatsoever.

The first thing you notice is that it's clean, kinda classy even, there is at times some hipster music playing, and it doesn't even smell gross. The second thing you notice is how creative the buffet dishes are. I mean it's almost ridiculous. It changes every day, some items are always there (staples like rice or veggies or chicken or caesar salad), but salads and meats rotate quite a lot. It is not uncommon to find salmon ceviche (in a buffet place?! you kiddin' me??), or some very exotic salads with ingredients you have never heard of unless maybe you live in Williamsburg or Portland.

There is also a DIY salad station, and a made to order sandwiches station. You can also order some pretty nice smoothies and juices, but the cashiers make them and it can take a while (it is clearly not their job). Also this is kinda random, but the selection of chips and candies they have is like nowhere else. They also serve La Colombe coffee.

The breakfast selection is OK, usually there is a whole selection of sausages and meets, scrambled eggs, frittata, pancakes, oatmeal, fruits, yoghurts. They also have pastries like croissants and danishes from Balthazar bakery - they are pricey but so damn delicious. I can't remember where the muffins are from but they are really, really good too.

There is so much choice its almost overwhelming.  I had a little quinoa salad, some avocado tomato salad, roasted asparagus, salmon sushi, carved turkey, cashew chicken, etc.   I loved that I could have a little of each flavor in one lunch.  This place is very hard to find.  People who work here know it but we wouldn't have found this gem if it hadn't been for yelp.    Hint, its behind the chase offices.  Look for the teeny sign.

I've been getting breakfast or lunch from this place for a while as my office is in the building which is very convenient when crappy weather will keep me from leaving said office/prison. Most times the egg sandwiches are fine (I was thankful when they installed a griddle to make fried eggs as opposed to the pans over stovetop) though I've crunched on some egg shells a few times. They also have on occasion left out the ham in my ham/egg/cheese sandwiches. I think asking for a vegetable in the sandwich throws them off. They get pretty busy during breakfast hours so I'll let the flubs slide because they're generally very nice guys behind that counter. But for the record, know that I don't like hamless ham eggshell sandwiches (regardless of how much calcium are in those shells).
There are some select rude female cashiers though who have given me the hairy eyeballs sometimes. They rotate so I do manage to get some nice cashiers. One of the nice ones ended up finding a job in an office on the floor I work on so hey professionalism does pay off.
Lunch offerings provide a pretty large (but not the largest compared to others in the neighborhood) selection with the decent salad bar, fresh fruit (sometimes still frozen), grilled vegetables, salmon, soups, sushi rolls, chicken/broccoli, fried rice, etc. I am thankful they finally learned how to cook white rice because it used to be somewhat dry and crunchy, practically undercooked.
Though it is overpriced overall, it's there for my convenience and in line with prices of other buffet places. Just be cautious of those egg shells.

A nice quiet place to stop for a quick bite and for something a little different as well as delicious.  When Boulud is on the front, you know you are in for something very special.

I took a latte to go and was very happy with this stop. Very much a tourist destination, but I did not mind at all.

More like 3.5

Got their southwest chicken wrap with chili rubbed chicken breast, fresh corn, roasted red peppers, pickled onions, cilantro, arugula, and lime juice on a flour tortilla. Very flavorful.

I was hoping to pick up a salad, maybe a soup, but no such luck because the display case containing all of the grab and go food is blocked by an immovable island that makes it impossible to access if you use a wheelchair because the space is well narrower than what the ADA guidelines call for. These guidelines have been around for over 30 years and the store is a brand new construction in a shiny new building, simply unacceptable.

Additionally, the security guard who works here is uniquely unhelpful. He did not open the accessible door for me and stood in the way when I used the button to open it for me. Then he took his sweet time to let me out when it was obvious that the automatic door opener was not working from the inside.

Avoid the beverages here. I've had the espresso drinks before and not particularly enjoyed them, but am currently drinking the absolute worst, weakest, most flavorless chai latte I've ever had in my life. Despite the convenience of this location I've now pretty much decided that I won't be coming here again.
Never disappoints!!   Highly recommend coconut chia pudding -  healthy, creamy, delicious .  The service is top notch and I love the little blue bag.

I expected more from this place.

First off the lady behind the counter was lovely.

Second the Cobb salad was excellent.

Heard, the bread was excellent.

Hey, but when I got up to go to my meeting, I noticed that they had paint underneath the counter, which is on my pants, and it was something oil based, which ruined my suit pants...and I had to go to my meeting like that.

The guy behind the counter at that point is not the same any sort of just shrugged it off, but when I asked, he got me a wipe...not sure what they should have offered more, but I definitely something, and more of an apology...I walked out very unhappy.

Dear Daniel, a French chef cannot put out pastry like this! The scones are the abomination. Please fix it. If you want to know what a good scone is, please go to Montreal and try Cardinal Tea Room. If you want to try a good croissant please try the Tin Building. C'mon!

Daniel Boulud's new addition to the 1 Vanderbilt building is this adorable French café. It's right next to Grand Central Station, making it convenient for commuters to grab a coffee and a snack on the go. It's also convenient to my job.

A great new find at the 1 Vanderbilt Building, next to Grand Central Station. Daniel Boulud's take away coffee shop. Delicious French pastries, coffee, lunches / service was fast, restaurant was clean! Highly recommend!

I walk past this shop every day from Grand Central. Few times so far I have tried their pastries and they are okay (better than our average NY pastries).
But service is always slow and ordering  espresso based drinks is never a good idea here.
PS please train your employees what Flat White is. Anytime I ordered is different, but never right.
Nice, fancier addition to the area. Not for those on a budget. The cannelés are really good (might even be my favorite in the city), but sell out early.

As perfect as you can get for French pastries by chef Daniel Boulud!  :-) and breakfast.. That Croissant breakfast with ham, cheese and egg is a must try! We had it 3 days straight!

The quiche was delicious with arugula and that Spanish egg were both  so tasty!

Too bad they are closed on Sunday! :-(

Right next to the Grand Central Station!

If you are here don't forget to visit the stunning restaurant Le Pavillon on second floor, an oasis of modern NYC.

Ive been to this place a few times and every time I have a bad experience. The attitude of the staff is ridiculous and I learned today that they cannot take Mastercard (really Daniel Boulud?). Each time I have been made to feel it was my card that was the problem and turns out its been their terminals NOT ACCEPTING MC?!  Not only has it been uncomfortable (and the staff rude regarding the decline) its actually embarrassing that this has been an ongoing issue for them and has now caused them to lose a customer. As a matter of fact, a young girl was so rude to me once due to this payment issue I decided to just leave. Before leaving, she did the same thing to the customer  behind me until a more experienced clerk assisted and then the payment went through. At this point I was so annoyed I didn't care to try again with the other clerk.

On top of it all, the coffee is subpar at best. I am so unimpressed considering I worked across the street from Daniel and have been there long with his other establishments before. This is not the representation of quality staff, experience or food I am used to from this world renowned chef.

What a welcome addition to East Midtown, the coffee choices are wonderful. I'm partial to their chocolate croissants,  or what they call pain au chocolat.
The cafe is super clean and bright and offers a breathtaking view of grand central terminal. Lots of natural light makes its way into the cafe because of the glass facade.
The prices are comparable to Starbucks, expect to spend between $3.00 and $5.00 for a pastry. Expect to spend roughly the same on your drink.
I plan on coming back to check out their salmon sandwich. They offer a decent spread of sandwiches, both hot and cold.

Big and international city like New York sometimes you wonder why it is so difficult to find proper French Baguette like Paris, London, Tokyo.
Baguette can be quite a criteria how I evaluate a French bakery and so far I havent found the impressive one here in NYC.
Found a article that recommends this bakery so here I come to try their baguette.
To be honest very disappointed. Not crunchy outside, holes are relatively small inside. You dont really smell the baguette.
Compared to the baguette the honey apple cake is quite yummy. strong cinnamon, well seasoning, soft and moisture inside. the apple tasted just right inside.
The macaron is not too bad. would be better if the caramel flavor is stronger inside.
Basically a good one but I am here for the baguette so... see the room for improvement.
Good service yummy pastries and nice location , small spot. I love the macaroons in here. They also have salads and drinks.
Officially my all time favorite bakery.   Everything was so good.   My favorite was the apple "pie" that tastes like a cake.   So good!
I had the almond croissant and ham and butter sandwich.  Both were yummy and high quality.  Will definitely try this again when I am in the city next.

A new establishment at the new Grand Central terminal. But their iced coffee is way overpriced and tasted burnt. Croissant doesn't have that flaky crunch.  Service is somewhat slow but I assume they were still training their new staff. Given that many other coffee shops seem to have closed down due to COVID and lack of foot traffic, I won't be surprised if they will next to bite the dust.

New location opened up right across from my office and I went into take a look. Ordered a cake and a tart which looked tasty. Unfortunately, they packaged it in a box way too big for them and as a result, the cake and tart shifted freely from the short walk back to the office. Would be nice if they had a smaller box for just 2 small desserts (or even just something in there to keep the pastries from shifting around. Not looking forward to trying to keep these things steady during a train ride.
I like the idea of getting Boulud for lunch.  But it's expensive for microwaved quiche and handful of arugula

I came in this morning before work and I was impressed with the food and drinks that I ordered.  I had the pleasure to chat with manager, Dorian I believe was his name and he was just wonderful.  His presence lit up the room and was very professional and helpful.  I definitely will be coming back to this location.
The team since to be having a great time, which is wonderful. But when you order as a customer you'll have to spent 15 min waiting for ONE sandwich since everyone is too busy chatting.

My new favorite to-go spot in Midtown. The salad and sandwich selection is pretty amazing (try the jamon beurre and ask them to toast it - you won't regret it). The staff there is very friendly which is very difficult find in Midtown lunch spots. I will try the desserts and sweets next time.

Two stars for the flourless choco mousse. Had two cortados. One decaf and one regular. The drinks didn't taste like anything. Very watered down.  Very strange and very expensive to be discarded. Basically $7 in the trash. Literally. Avoid if you can. Not worth it.

Super friendly service from the host, hostesss, and bar tenders
Excellent Crafted cocktails .
Amazing rooftop bar with expansive views of the city .
Small bites available - limited selection
Alphonsoe, the bar tender, really enjoys his craft. Creative & delicious drinks are served up professionally.
Tell him what you like , he will give you his recommendations.  Try the drink with the watermelon red bull !

My friends and I met here for after work drinks. We got there around 5pm (no pun intended) so it wasn't crowded but as time went on they got busy. First thing of course if the beautiful view and I wish it was warmer that day so we could have sat outside but it was still a great view from inside.  For appetizers we ordered the Wagyu sliders, truffle fries and the tuna tacos. The food was great and the drinks did not disappoint but I have to admit, the prices are a bit on the high side. The staff is great and accommodating and the atmosphere is upbeat. Overall, we had a great time. I hope you visit and enjoy!

This place is an underrated midtown spot! I came here with coworkers for after work drinks and, despite the downstairs bar being packed, the rooftop was practically empty.
