Though I do not drink, they have a pretty interesting cocktail menu that is more than just margaritas. They are pricey, but not out of the range of what you would expect to pay for drinks at a touristy hotel in midtown.

The views were also amazing! If you are just visiting Manhattan, it's worth stopping by for a drink just to take in the sunset views while it is still warm outside. I will probably not be back but would definitely recommend!

This is  great and very underrated rooftop bar here in Manhattan! This is a newer bar so it's not as crowded and reservations aren't required! The views are amazing and they have a DJ who plays pretty good music!

The drinks are on the pricier side ranging from around $17+ but it's pretty expectable for Times Square. The service was great both times I went and everyone is kind! My boyfriend and I spent around $70 for 3 drinks and fries.

Definitely check out this rooftop bar if you're looking for a nice view and good time!
Not sure where the bad bartender reviews come from. Ask for Tristan. He's on point. Great views. Yeah drinks are $20 but it's NYC. Look up NYCfoodiedrinks on insta for Happy Hour deals in the City.

I tried this place for the first time. It's definitely a vibe.  Wide spectrum of ages. All races. All cultures. Great music. Amazing view.  Bartender - Hakim- Omg, so nice. And fun. He mixes drinks and dances and songs along to what's playing. Super fun. Place serves good. But by the time we got there. Around 1 am. It wasn't available anymore. It's inside a hotel Margaritaville.  It has its own entrance. Just take elevator to the 31st floor. Not 32nd. Which is last floor. You would think it's roof top. But. No. 31st.  Enjoy. It's def a nice spot to visit if in nyc and out late night.  Enjoy.

Gross specialty drinks
Seems like it was a party headquarters.  Weird elevator access

A couple friends and I decided to check this out on a lark after MoMA and another cocktail bar in the area.  We walked up to this Jimmy Buffett bar named after a relaxing vibe to discover a man wearing a suit serving as bouncer on the ground floor.  We were then turned away *from a Jimmy Buffet bar* for wearing shorts in the summer, apparently Margaritaville now has a dress code!  Keep in mind these were nice shorts, with a nice shirt, on a warm evening - but apparently Jimmy is OK with his brand in NY being attached to the deplorable snooty bouncer culture of NYC (I say this as a 16 year NYC resident).  If you're looking to find a slice of Margaritaville in the city, this is not the spot.

We then walked 1 avenue block past this bar to one of the best high-end cocktail bars in the city situated on a higher floor with a better view, and presumably much better cocktails - this bar of course had no problem letting people in wearing shorts in the summer.  In retrospect, maybe it's good 5 o'clock turned us away.

Food and Views are off the hook. Would never have thought something like this existed in the middle of Times Square. You need to enter at Jimmy Buffet's Margueritaville entrance and take the elevator up to the 31st floor. Jesse was so nice and fun and the Bartender's were great too !!!
Korean Meatballs and Yucca Fries were Holy $hit good !!!

save your time and money and choose a different spot to spend your money in NYC!  the view is great but that's where the greatness ends.  the server took our order and we waited...and waited...and never got our drinks, it was steady but not packed and most people had their cocktails  when we looked around. We decided to leave, stopped at the bar where the server was and let him know he was like oh what 3 drinks did you have again? shoot, I didn't put those in!

Also while on the far end of the patio a table became available that I figured myself and friends could move to from where we were. Out of nowhere a hostess comes and is incredibly rude for no reason.  "you cannot sit here I have it reserved for someone! if you're in the bar you need to stay in the bar!" Well, it was all part of the bar patio.

Don't give this place your hard earned money

This place can be hard to find, but once you find the entrance with the elevator, you'll know where to go. It's a vibey area with good music. If you're non-alcoholic, you can get a Bud Zero as your drink. I had a good time with my friend, just catching up at this rooftop. The views were amazing, and it wasn't crowded. Great place to relax for the evening.

Just  want to thank bartenders Jennifer and Hakeem for the fantastic service they provided. what a great team and really made our experience first rate! The bar food was excellent, the view fabulous and can't wait to return to see the best bartenders in NYC!
Cool bar in nice hotel. Good drinks and good service. Rooftop section with a view if times square area. Food looked good but I just drank my food.

Amazing. The view is spectacular! You can see everything. The nye ball in Times Square, the edge, freedom tower. Views everywhere. Our server Jeimar is amazing. Pays tons of attention to detail and is very friendly. Food tasted great. Drinks flowing. Times Square is all of that.  Nyc is back. It's beautiful here. Seats soft, vibe on ten. Definitely come here I'll certainly be back.
Great no smell  and nice service best in town my fave there was many nice things to list and one thing is that the hills food is good and worlds best cat litter

It was sooo fun and what a great rooftop experience!  Went there after eating at Landshark and took a lot of beautiful pictures!  There was also a live performer singing and playing his instrument and then after his set there was a dj playing music for the peoples entertainment.  It was a good vibe and good experience!

TERRIBLE and likely won't be back which is sad because I was hoping to make this the summer after work spot since I work close by. Went Wednesday 5/10 first the elevator looks like the service elevator and was slow hot and gives anxiety. Then the rooftop has an amazing view but the server was slow and inattentive. Our drinks while they were good took forever to come. My first margarita came in a plastic disposable cup and was barely half way full for $20+. I asked for the next drink to come in a different cup as I bartended before and understand portions and to serve a drink in a cup you know won't be full with the portions isn't ok. We ordered the meatballs charcuterie board sliders and yuca fries. The yuca fries were fried in oil that had fish and tasted so fishy... I hate fish. The sliders and meatballs were good and the charcuterie would've been perfect if the Italian salami didn't taste like someone sprayed perfume by the food and the grapes should've been washed. The entire time we were eating we didn't have drinks even though we ordered another round and the server checked on the table next to us three times nor did we have any water. The bus boy would grab stuff before you were done and without asking. I complained to the bus boy and asked if I can talk to someone who cares because he clearly didn't. He didn't get us water but was quick to snatch our almost empty cups. I complained to the server and she got a manager. The bill took 15-20 minutes to come and it wasn't that busy. The manager I also felt like didn't care. The best part was leaving and reuniting with a stranger from the event on the 31st floor to ask about his experience and he shared the same exact lack of service. The elevator leaving was nice but there was margarita spilled on the floor. Leaving there was people saying welcome to us as we were clearly leaving. Really should've tried the roof top across the street everyone there looked to be having a good time. Can't wait to give it a try!
This was a great find!  Relaxing evening over Time's Square!   Great way to end our time in NYC!  Staff was amazing so were the views!
Service was horrible and I would check your drink to see if they actually put any alcohol in them. Good view and that's where it ends
Went for the views but stayed for the hospitality. Jen A. made delicious cocktails and had us laughing. Really enjoyed our time and her wit! Thanks, Jen!

the drinks here were well thought out and DELICIOUS. i wish we would have ordered food, but we had already eaten, so next time. and we will definitely be back because the views were AMAZING! they even had a dj later on in the evening. the real highlight was the beautiful people they had working. dez surely has the right team to do an amazing job. we loved our tenders tristan and hakeem. it is definitely worth noting how exceptional the staff is because they really made our experience fun and personable. we got lucky finding this little gem! (don't think you can enter in maragritaville, unless you're staying there) there's an entrance on 40th street.

Jen, the Master Mixologist is amazing... awesome classics and special requests. Food was great too... and the view is breathtaking. Our first time here, but we'll be back real soon with more friends.

Reece Rosser

So unimpressive...Incredibly expensive for a really long wait time and completely mediocre drink. Rooftop isn't even that nice? Chairs are too low to see any view. What you would expect for a Times Square place but still disappointing.

Me and my close friend went to this rooftop bar on the 31st floor and it was some of the worst service that I have ever received. When we arrived it took about 10-15 minutes before we were acknowledged and asked what we wanted. It then took about 30 minutes of waiting before one of got the food we ordered, which was good but was overpriced for such a small portion size. My friend didn't even get the food that she ordered cause we had waited so long that we got fed up and cancelled the order. I understand working in the service industry isn't easy but it wasn't even busy when we came in and there was no valid reason why over an hour of our time was waisted
Jen and Allen are amazing bartenders. The small plates were great and the view amazing. Definitely recommend.

We were there at vacation time, and picked this place because of interior!) Good service, nice atmosphere!)
Come with friends there and you'll be happy!)
Amazing outdoor sunset view and live music with cool breeze. The place has a great cheese platter and the pinapple drink was pretty good. Starts to get busy around 6pm.
Definitely enjoyed the view from the rooftop and the delicious beverages. Ada was super helpful and excellent!

Update: When they leave a comment telling you to email them about your concerns they don't actually respond to you when you send an email explaining what happened. I sent them an email after they responded to my review. I waited 7 days just to give them time to respond. Just overall a horrible place. I would give 0 stars if I could tbh.

So a few things about this roof top bar and it could've just been a one time thing or something. But coming in everything was great. The security guard and hostess were so nice and directing us where to go. Our server seemed very busy which I totally understand. Things get hectic & being a former server with 7 years of experience I understand. But this entire experience made me & my other 9 friends feel disgusting and embarrassing. My boyfriend and I waited 30 minutes at our table before I went up to my server to start a tab. While the rest of my friends got there. We had seen our server go up to multiple other tables so I assumed he would make his way to us. (I was wrong) We waited maybe about 15 minutes for our drinks. When my friends arrived they put in their drink orders & they waited even longer than 15 minutes for some cocktails. My friend who ordered a beer waited longer than 15 minutes for his beer to get to him. My other friend ordered some bites for the entire group. The two charcuterie boards got to us but the wagyu sliders never made it.

At this point everyone felt uncomfortable and realized that our server clearly did not want us to be there or just didn't care to take care of us. Then the security guard came out of nowhere to ask if we were doing okay which we thought was strange because the security guard was placed on the level floor and not the 31st floor. And as he walked away he didn't seem to bother any other tables but ours. Not too long after that our waiter rudely and loudly accused us of smoking weed. When we confirmed that it was two tables that were behind us smoking and not us we all decided that we didn't want to put up with it anymore. We cancelled our order of sliders and 2 cocktails (that we had been waiting on for more than 20 min) and asked for the check.

The check comes & we were so shocked that after being treated so rudely and terribly that automatic gratuity was still added onto the bill. As a former server I have never come close to treating my own clientele the way we were treated. I get that things happen, it's finally Sunday and we as servers are burnt out from Friday and Saturdays fiascos. But holy shit.

This is just a fair warning to any future clients of this rooftop bar. Like I said it could've been a one time thing & I hope it is but Jeeze.

Got a table immediately! And then no one acknowledged us again. A table was sat behind us 20 mins after us and immediately got their drinks. We never even got to order waters.
I did speak  with a hostess (I think) who assured me someone would be over immediately... but no one came.

Prenominal service!  Go see JENN!  She was beyond Awesome. Gave my friend a drink and said, If you don't love it let me know and we will make sure you have something you love"  Extremely knowledgeable.    We asked for other suggestions around the city and JENN was spot on.  If you are looking for somewhere to go!  Go check it out!  Great views of the city and a super cool place.  We will come back just to hang with JENN.

My boyfriend and I ventured up to the 5 O'clock Somewhere Bar to pregame before a football game. We went to the 32nd floor bar and had the best experience!! Our bartenders, Jen and Josh, were the BEST bartenders we've ever had!! Great service. Great drinks. Great conversation.  I was sad to leave. We will definitely be back to visit with them soon!

Found this gem taking a long walk to a further train station. This is on the 32nd floor so you have to talk to someone at the front - she was friendly and directed me where to go. Walking in, you can't help but taken aback at the view. Sitting at the bar still gives you a first hand look of the Manhattan skyscrapers and all the pretty lights. Jen was the KINDEST bartender ever. She may have been the best part of it all. She was attentive (but not over the top - gave me space but talked to me), sweet, and super inclusive. She made sure I knew what my drink tasted like before ordering and told me my burger had bacon (which I didn't mind but others may have). Had a great time here after work - 5 to 8 pm is best if you don't want to be in a stuffy environment. Reasonably priced drinks for a times square location but worth it because the drinks are.. really ... freaking .... GOOD! Wagyu sliders were perfect. Already told my friends we need to visit!!
definitely a spectacular sight with good service from the bartender and a good drink I love this rooftop.

I just have to say i truly had an amazing time,the vibe was great, there was a dj,the and the views were amazing... also our bartender jen was awesome, amazing personality, and so attentive to us and everyone else ,,a+++++ to her. ...great times i would absolutely go back..

Everything about the bar was amazing. They were able to accommodate my large group outside and it was warm from the heaters and open window to the bar despite it being less than 40° out. Jen and Tristan were our bartenders and they were both great. We somehow managed to stumble upon this place and I'm so glad we did, will definitely be coming here again the next time we're in NYC. View was incredible too!
The bartender Jen was amazing she made sure our drinks was filled and check on us and was doing good she amazing

Great spot to relax, have a few drinks and enjoy the view.  All of the service staff were great, especially our bartender Jen!  Definitely stop by this spot if you're visiting the city you won't regret it!

The line was long but moved very quickly. Each slice was $1.50. They were all served warm and had a crunchy crust. For that price I honestly can't complain. If I'm in the area or walking by I would come back for a slice!

If you don't have a lot of money. Just simple in between checks. Just getting off a flights with your hotel being hear here like myself. Getting a dollar slice from here is good.
I'm not fully here if I will go back here next. I got two dollar slice cheese pizza. But originally I wanted the meat lover and when I asked him if I could get it he said no. I was okay with just wanting for it. He just didn't want to make it.
The pizza was very crispy and cheap. So you get what you pay for. Very small place so don't go in with a lot of people. Didn't have a lot of sauce and cheese on it. Ihad to add a lot of season on it after. If you not on your last dollar don't go here. But if your on a super fast lunch break or just simple don't have a loft of money. Be My Guess

We were hungry and were kind of lazy, this place was the closest and always had a line but they were moving pretty fast.

I tried the supreme and bbq pizza, the toppings in the supreme pizza were pretty nice but the sauce in the pizza was very bland.  I think the bbq sauce in the bbq chicken pizza actually saved the slice from being bland.

My friend had a cheese slice and a ricotta broccoli slice, she ate the cheese but one of the broccoli slice and she was done with it. It really had no flavor

We ordered a combo pizza and their special 2 cheese pizza with drink for $4.50.
The pizza was greasy served on a very thin plate.
The cheese pizza was not that good.
I don't understand the high reviews.

When you see a steady long line moving like a Henry Ford assembly line you know you're on the right track. When you ask someone in line "is this the stuff?" and they respond "this definitely is the stuff", you're almost there.  When you bite into some great pizza at a great price, boy you are there! I was the envy of my conference room when I got this for lunch while everyone else ate the provided lunch.  I haven't been to to NY in 5 years so I had the pizza itch and this place scratched it. If you need fast lunch and you're in the area hit this spot up. The End.

Very good pizza. I really liked the thin crust that it had and the pizza was very flavorful.

There is usually a long line here, but the line goes quickly. Staff is very friendly.

I though the pizza was a little expensive - it ended up being $6 for the slice i got.

BLUF: it's good pizza at $1.50 a slice in the middle of midtown. Nuff said

So, I'm in New York City for a brief business trip and hoping to find some good New York style pizza. I live in the south right now and grew up in New Jersey so I'm always longing for a place that has pizza like I grew up with. Someone recommended this place to me as the last place in New York City you could get pizza at a dollar a slice. Well inflation bit even this guy so now it's $1.50 a slice.
The pizza isn't amazing, and it's not the best I've ever had. But it is damn good. Nice crunchy crust and a decent size. Hit it with a little oregano and garlic salt and it was great. So no nothing fancy. But in the middle of midtown New York to find a good piece of pizza for $1.50 a slice is to me pretty great. Go and give this guy some of your business because we need people like him around.

Got a cheese slice that came out freshly hot. It got a little cold too soon though. The meat slice was cold the whole time, even though they heated it up. This is a problem I've been running into in New York, all the reheated pizza is still cold. Not fun.

Both tasted great. Great crust crunchiness. Cheap 4 slices for $10.50.

2 Bros Pizza instantly caught my eye as I walked down 46th Avenue from my hotel towards 5th Avenue. I knew that once I returned on that same route, I would make an attempt to stop in for a slice of pizza. Having A slice of New York style pizza was one thing I just had to have while in Manhattan, New York for the weekend.

I ended up ordering a slice of cheese pizza for takeout. One thing I adored was the server to customer interaction as I waited for my slices to be cooked. These pizza servers in New York really have a way of interacting with customers which appeared so genuine.

There were no disappointments in both of the slices of vegetable pizza ordered. I was satisfied with the visual appeal of both, along with their taste which was slightly crunchy yet still satisfying.

I had a pleasant ordering experience with 2 Bros Pizza. And as stated, I enjoyed both of my slices and would surely order from again whenever staying in the area being that it was my first taste of New York style pizza.

~Have courage. Be Kind. ~

Thomas G

I'm in New York and on a mission. Tank is on empty....Not the gas tank, my stomach tank ‍.

1 Star = It's Not Good
2 Stars = Something's Missing
3 Stars = It's Ok
4 Stars = It's Good
5 Stars = it's Bangin!

It's a $1 slice of Pizza. Dollar menus don't even exist anymore. However, even with the Pandemic, 2 brother has maintained a "$1 slice of pie." 2 brothers have every right to be a mediocre slice of pizza, but it's not. It's good. Easy 4 stars. There's nothing special about it and at the same time, there is NOTHING BAD about it.

A lady in front of me in her New York accent "I want it extra crispy!" as if, if it's not crispy, we got issues. It's my turn to order, I get a slice of pepperoni Pizza and ask for it to be....."Crispy." The wait wasn't long.... I get it, and it's surprisingly good. But 1 slice left me wanting more, and for some reason, i didn't feel it was hot enough (temperature) for me.

I get in line 1 more time, "let me get a dollar slice EXTRA crispy (In my Chicago accent). As expected it took longer than my first order. "1 cheese pickup!" The man yells. Excuse me, excuse me, politely as possible navigating through New Yorkers and tourists. It looks amazing! Bite.....yam yam yam....wait a minute.....Can it be...........it is!

It's Bangin!!!

It's a dollar slice, and it taste good, how can you give it anything less than 5 stars.

I am Critic

Ordered the 2 cheese slices and a soda combo for $4. The pizza itself was decent but if you factor in the price and location, it's a great value. Crust was thick but sturdy - no droop! Wished I got mine warmed up a little bit more for some crunch. Would recommend adding their available seasonings (garlic powder, chili flakes, oregano)

Store was somewhat busy and had a lot of other great options! Great seating options outside.

The pizza is delicious, they have a special for 3.99 which includes 2 cheese slices and a can of soda. This is a great price if you're not picky and wanted topping. I opted for a slice of the white and veggie, it came out to 6.50 total. They took the slices and threw them into the oven. The service was pretty quick, only took about 5 minutes or less. As you walk past this pizza place where the tables are it shares its space with another restaurant. They play bachata music which is really nice, it's a great vibe and place to hang out. I saw them singing and dancing inside which made it like you were insides someones home. I would recommend to come here for the experience !
Cheese slices for $1.50? Can't beat the pricing in this area. Also ordered some more expensive slices $3-$4 and it was delicious. Service is super quick and they even take credit card.

So check this out, this is  a good but not great pizza place in the Time Square area. If you're in the New York area as a tourist looking for some really really good New York style pizza this is not the place you want to visit. However, if your local or if you're in a hotel nearby need something to eat real quick may be played at night displaces perfect.

We flew into town from Southern California and we wanted to find a place that had a really really good New York style pizza and again this place was good but it was not great.

Sometimes $1 pizza tastes like $1 pizza. Or in this case, $1.50 pizza tastes like $1 pizza (yes, prices have increased). We came for a quick dinner slice around 8:30pm. Service was quick and the pizza was hot, but it didn't fully satisfy that New York slice hankering.

The dough was undercooked and soggy. The cheese and sauce ratio was also off - too much dough and cheese; hardly any sauce. I've definitely had better $1 slices elsewhere, but for the price, it's always hit or miss. Prices ranged from $1.50 for cheese - $4+ for toppings. There's also a meal deal of two cheese slices and a can of soda for $4.

Garlic powder and red pepper flakes were available to spice up the pizza. A few seats and counter space were available to quickly dine in. This was my first time trying 2 Bros; based on this experience, I won't be going out of my way to grab a slice from them again.
I had to have a bite before taking a photo of our pizza. I couldn't resist the smell but it's a-OK pizza. No place to seat and eat

Off from the main streets by Times Square, I was hungry and walking to my hotel.  I was craving for NY style pizza and bumped into this place. I hesitated at first as it looks a bit dingy but there was a line and the pizza looks good ...and super affordable.  Went in and got two huge ass cheese slices and a coke for $4.  Unreal!  

They had other options too. The place needs to be a bit cleaner but the cheap pizza here taste better than the other cheap 99 cents pizza place.   I actually enjoyed the pizza here more than at the famous Joe 's Pizza  place

Very nice spot right in the middle of a busy street but with a decent seating area and no line on a weekday afternoon. It's been great to grab a slice of pizza  and chat with friends. Service was fast. Pizza is only $4.50 a slice and $30 per full size. They also serve soup by the bowl  $7.40 for 12oz or $8.40 for 16oz. Overall a good deal! Seating area is nice and spacious. Lovely ambiance.
This NY pizza joint is really good. We loved our slices ordered at the counter and reheated quickly in their pizza oven. Great sauce and cheese.

Happened to pass by and was attracted to the sign with $1.50 for a slice of pizza. That actually was not the case but only for a slice of plain cheese pizza. Even though, their pizza was average good. We got a combo slice to go for $4 a good size slice. The place was kinda dirty though. They could sweep up the place. There was no where to eat as there was only two tables inside and it was occupied when we came in the evening. Good thing our hotel is across the street. Good pizza for a late night bite since they close like 2am?!  I like that the city has places like this to go to for night owls like us! [61st R]

pizza itself was delicious, but the signs were very misleading

the "$1.50/slice & $3.99 2 slice+drink" only applies to the basic cheese pizza.

1. none of their signs noted that. its very misleading. no asterisks to say conditions apply or select slices only.

2. the fact that we said we wanted to do the $3.99 2 slice+drink deal, they didnt mention to us either that its only cheese pizzas for that deal.

drinks are not cold.

we were not pleased w.the dishonesty.

Came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday night since we were around the area and wanted something small. We got 2 cheese slices and a soda for just $4.5 and they were pretty good. I wish they were a little warmer but I won't ask for too much given that these were only $4.5 in total. I think this is a good place to go if you would like to have the dollar pizza experience in New York!
Amazing pizza and kind staff! Definitely recommend the curry pizza! If you are looking for authentic thin crusted pizza, this is the perfect place for you.

TLDR: solid pizza, nothing to write home about

-    Taste: pretty doughy but enjoyable, I got a standard cheese slice
-    Price: $1
-    Ambiance: nothing special, 2 tables to stand and eat
-    Return: if it's the closest option I'd return! It was close by to the Fairfield

2 bros  pizza  wasn't bad at all. My wife was determined to try their pizza. Of course, I tried the pepperoni and bacon  for $3.50, and I was impressed with the flavor. The crust was cooked very well rich, flavorful pepperoni, even the bacon had a nice crisp crunch every bit. This I recommend if you are looking for a quick bit, it's well worth it.

Place isn't closed as of 11/24/2022, not sure why it's marked that way. Price is still $1.50 a cheese slice, or $3 for 2 slices and a soda. Line was only 10 people long on a busy Thursday on a holiday week, but went through fast. Can't really beat the price, the pizza was serviceable and very oily. But with the complimentary garlic and chili flakes added the flavor it needed.
Thin, crusty, and chewy crust.... Classic NY pizza that you can fold in half.  Service was quick. Recommend getting multiple slices instead of ordering whole pies.

The pepperoni was a great classic NY style pizza! The bbq was really good, simple but awesome flavor. Just missing my ranch or marinara for dipping but they did have oregano, garlic and crushed red pepper to add!

Cheapo spot to grab a quick slice of pizza.

Can't eat inside but this is not the kind of joint you sit at for for fine dining. Grab and go to eat as you wander into Times Square. Or take a few minutes to slam down your slice at one of the tables on the sidewalk.

For $1.50 a slice, or two slices and a soda for under $4.00 it does the trick.

We came here for a quick bite when visiting New York. Everyone was saying we needed to try the quick New York pizza so we stopped. The place was pretty dirty with trash on tables and not wiped down, and seating was limited. They had lots of different options of pizza to choose from. They get customers in from the sign they have out front with the deal, but this just included a regular cheese pizza, no toppings. I ordered two with toppings, and wasn't very impressed. They were good, but kind of bland. I honestly needed more sauce on it. I could really just taste bread and cheese, and the veggies. They were about $4 each, so it was still pretty cheap so I wasn't that upset about it but I am sure there are definitely much better places to get pizza in NYC.
This establishment is always reliable and there is a nice variety of pizza to choose from.  Overall, service is fast and consistently good pizza is served here.

No trip to New York City without a slice from 2 Bros Pizza! We got there just as they opened. The mushroom pizza looked so good, and it was. But honestly, the regular cheese slices are simply the best! Fast service, cheap yummy slices.

When in doubt, eat a slice ! I absolutely love this pizza - Juicy, crisp, the sauce has so much depth and its a dollar. What more can you ask for. Definitely one of the best dollar pizzas in the entire Newyork city.

Amazing pizza. I got the $3.75 special which was two slices of cheese with a soda. Perfect for a quick dinner. The interior is a bit grungy looking. But the hole in the wall feeling is made up a lot by the tasty pizza! Simple options. Totally recommend. Hopefully it gets cleaned up a bit.
Very good pizza and great prices.   I completely recommend.  Very friendly staff !!!!
Dropped by here on my last visit to NY. What else can you say, $1 for a slice of pizza. I understand the price has gone up some, but the pizza was good and hit the spot.

The food is great most of the time, I came into the shop and wanted a half cheese half everything pizza. I politely asked the worker for the pizza and asked for it fresh I was willing to wait. He then gave me a cold pizza that has been sitting out for display. I asked for a box but then he started cutting up the pizza and putting on individual plates. I was so confused and was starting to get mad I wasn't going to walk back and fourth so many times to get my individual pizza to my table. Then I realized that the pizza was cold I asked them if they could just make me a new one but instead they took the pizza back and put it in the oven again. They gave it back to me overcooked and burnt.

So close to five stars!!  Ordered three slices and a coke.  Cheese slice was perfect: crispy crust and just the right amount of sauce and cheese. Pepperoni slice was good but the crust slightly less perfect. Pepperoni/ham/sausage slice Creasy was soft and weak. My new theory is that the more tons there are, the worst the crust is.

Lots of space to eat. The normal condiments:  peppers/oregano/garlic powder.

Owner happened to be there and was tidying up a lot around the eating areas.  I like that!

Mediocre NYC pizza. There was almost no sauce to speak of, and the pepperonis were spread very sparsely across both of my slices. I feel like you could walk into any "New York slice" type chain and get a slice like this. The most unique thing about the pizza here was that it was the first slice of pizza that actively dripped grease down my arm while I was eating it. I should have gone to Joe's Pizza 0.4 miles away instead.

Just visited 2 Bros! 1 dollar pizza joint!
Grabbed 3 pieces and they are really good and portioned the same as 2 or 3 dollar pizzas you get anywhere else. You can get special pies for 3 to 4 dollars also.
My 4 star is for the neatness of the place. They have radon kitchen equipment they don't use and just sit there. They should sell it and get more ovens.

They also take card! That was a surprise also!

Recommend them def!

Signs say $1 pizza, but pizza prices ranged from $2-$4. The pizza was great, albeit a bit too greasy for my taste. Crust was not too thick, or too thin. Just the right amount of sauce! Service was not amazing, but also was not awful. I did not see red peppers anywhere, however only regular black pepper.

Note: this place can sit maybe 20 people, but people are in and out in a flash! I would return! If you're looking for a cheap meal, this is it!

Some of the best pizza I have had in New York. Every time I have stopped in over the years, the service has been very quick (even when they are super busy). The price points are great, and the pizza is seriously delicious. There are a handful of small seating options; I have typically found that there are at least a couple of seats available every time I stop in.
Quick and fast pizza place around time square. Good price for the pizza in the NY city!
Awesome pizza, fast service and reasonably priced! The guys were slammed yet were so funny!

Whew! My boyfriend and I did a lot of walking while in New York and we passed by MANY pizza spots and stopped at this one because my boyfriend saw a sign that said pizza and soda for $3. The deal was actually just for a cheese pizza and a drink but we still got a really good deal on our slices and it was served PIPING HOT (which is my favorite). It was great for a pit stop and would recommend coming here!

Solid dollar slice and everything you can want from a $3 combo. Have not had this in a while but this definitely hits the spot. Service is great. The bread is thick and sauce robust. The mozzarella is also quite good equating to a pretty solidly average NYC slice. But at this price point I have to give it 4.5 stars because the amount of food you get for the cost of a metro ride is crazy!

Great value. Quick service and great food.
Just wish they had a bathroom for customer use.

This place was fast and tasty which is exactly what I needed before making a pit stop in Times Square. If you get cheese it's $3 for 2 slices + a can of pop. Or you can go big like I did and get the fun pizzas, I wouldn't say it's the best pizza I've ever had but it doesn't have to be! For the price ($3.50 for fancier slices?? Don't quote me...) efficiency and taste it's worth a stop on your next trip to NYC.
Love the very generous cheese and mushroom toppings! It was a loaded pizza. Wished it was cooked 20-30 seconds more as the last bits of the pie was a bit doughy.

In a city of constant change and rebirth, sometimes it's nice to have something consistent to set your compass to. Skyscrapers go up and old bars come down, yet 2 Bro's continues to offer their slices of pizza for a buck a pop. An incredible deal when the rest of the city went up to $2 a slice, and now looking like the steal of the century with slices hovering around $3.

Long a staple of the end of a night out drinking, 2 Bros fulfills the axiom that you can have it either cheap and quick (but not good), cheap and good (but not quick) or quick and good (but not cheap). While by no means inedible, slices here will not hold a candle to anything that others pizza places serve up, nor anything comparable to a sit down Italian restaurant. Overly doughy crust, topped with a sickly sweet tomato sauce, cheese that sits limply along is all topped off with a pool of grease that can never be dabbed away with napkins. Sure it seems unappealing, particularly when sober at lunchtime, but to get a slice turned around in less than a minute for less than a buck, most of it's sins are forgiven.

P.S. For some reason there's also a chicken and rice stand in the front of the store. Not sure who goes into a pizza place looking for fried chicken with their slice, but if that's you, this can be your new favorite place.

Costumer service was great , very fast and attentive. The loaded fries are pretty good , really well seasoned but gets kinda gross towards the end so use ketchup. But overall the first 2 bites are amazing. The burger on the other hand was a bit underwhelming , not as good as I hoped - very greasy but still tasty.  So if you don't have high blood pressure like myself I say I would recommend.

I wanted a quick bite after a drink, and the cheeseburger was perfect. Greasy, decadent, everything you want in a fast food joint burger. Perfectly crispy, sweet onions, tangy pickles.

If you're hungry, get a double cheeseburger.

In the Top 5 Smashburgers I've ever had! We visited for the first time late night after a concert at MSG, the line moved fast, snagged a place to seat immediately & got our food quick!

From the first bite I was in love, the sauce and onions made the burger! I wouldn't change anything about it. Just be sure to eat this burger right after you get it because it can get soggy if sitting for a while.

The fries were also delicious, they were crispy and had great seasoning! 7th Street Burger is the perfect stop for a great fast Smashburger.

I fell in love with 7th street burger one drunken night on McDougal street lol. I was shocked to find out there was a Timesquare location close to work. I had to come try it and of course it was just as good!! My only complaint is I've been twice since discovering and had the loaded fries both times with my coworkers and both times the fries were burnt! Like hard crunchy burnt not sure if they are just not paying attention because there's so much going on but pretty please stop burning the fries!

They also have banana, ube and Oreo puddings from a local vendor. Mexican sodas are on deck! The place is clean but small. I always go during lunch and it's packed but organized!! I will be back!

I loved these burgers! They are the thin patty style, similar to what you'd find at a shake shack or fast food joint, only much much better. What really sets this place apart are the potato buns they use, grilled onions, and healthy amount of seasoning. If you're in Times Square this is the spot to grab a quick bite.

This location is convenient when i go to the movies but now it's become a big teen/instafamous hangout and tourists. The have a restroom (a yad  gross, wet & greasy floors) and some seating  (decent) which is a great option. The  other times I've come, everything was hot  and delicious, until my last  two visits. I'm so sad it has turned this way.
The food seems like it's now rushed it doesn't have the same quality as the  other locations. The doubke cheeseburger was a little dry and more  like 2 incomplete patties tossed  together. The fries were average, not hot & crispy like usual. Next  time ill just visit another location for the best burgers in the city.

Quick service, best burger for the price, clean restaurant.

This is my third time coming to 7th st burger for lunch this month. Soft buns and juicy patties. Their fries are also perfect. I find myself keep coming back. I will be back soon.

The way y'all hyped this burger up. [Insert side eye]
The best parts were the super crispy delicious fries and that special sauce were banging. The burger needs salt, it's thin as hell (yes I know it's a smash burger but it's like paper thin) and the overall burger is just missing something, can't put my finger on it. I thought it was gonna change my life reading these reviews lol but it's very much regular.

Hm, this really isn't time square, but they provide a good product at a fair price.

I'm glad they're popping up all over the city because you never know when you have a craving for a burger and fries.
One of the best smash burgers I've ever had. The meat was perfect and the bun just put it at over average.

Yum! I got the impossible loaded fries. These never miss. $13 for a decent sized meal that will probably fill you up.

The special sauce is to DIE for. I forgot ketchup but that really adds to it as well.

Nice server and nice restaurant. Some seating available which is better than some other location.

Amazing burgers and fries. If you get a chance, get either the Banana or Oreo pudding. Such a wonderful treat - save the calories for this and get a bottle of water instead... or both!

Love that they have Mexican coke.

Service is super quick and friendly. Bonus is the seating area inside. There are multiple locations around the city, with more coming online. Honestly, this place is better than Five Guys and is my new go-to for a burger in Manhattan.

Seeing other reviews where people say to come only when drunk, or the burgers are too thin, they're not wrong entirely, but I will say it's what a burger is really meant to be. A quick bite that fills you up, and for the price point, certainly better than the overpriced mediocre restaurant burgers I've had. Don't write off this place - come try for yourself.

Came here for all the raving reviews and hype.

We got one regular single burger and one impossible burger. Both were solid burgers. We did not think they were spectacular but we thought they were solid. It had pretty good flavor, lots of onions. They were small so we were still hungry after. Next time, I may consider a double patty.

The inside was spacious with enough seating for people to go in and out of. Overall, I would come back here when in NYC. Thin and not too overwhelming.

I recently ordered delivery from 7th Street Burger and was very satisfied with my meal. The loaded beef fries were impressive, with a well-balanced mix of onions, pickles, beef, and a delectable sauce. It was incredibly filling and the perfect choice when craving some quality fast food.
The burger, though small in size, was well-flavored and cooked just right. It felt like a mix between Five Guys and McDonald's.

This is a burger you want if you're drunk, simple as that. Tasty, cheap, and greasy the three things I look for when I've had a few drinks.  Fortunately I was not in an altered state consuming this burger. I just couldn't imagine eating this burger at any other time especially lunch. They are open late into the night which is good news. Customer service was also fantastic.

A no frills burger spot. Menu is simple, cheeseburgers and fries but sometimes that's exactly what you need. Their Double Cheeseburger was made fresh, super cheesy. I could have done with a bit more cooking on the patties for some char flavor/crispy edges but it's decent nonetheless.

Their fries were crispy and hot through and through. Nothing to complain there.

Place was popping at night, really good late night eat energy.

This is an awesome place for the pricing of the burger. I appreciate that 7th street burger adds the caramelized onions, and the patties are super juicy. However, my one downside is that the burger is slightly oily.

The service was fast, even though the store was packed. Chill environment to hang out, and even tables outside to eat in this nice weather.

Good food, convenient location, limited seating.

There are tables inside and there was at least 1 tall one outside without chairs. First come first serve seating. We ordered and then waited for 2 seats to free up while waiting for our food.

The food seems to be made to order. 2 ppl, each ordered a cheeseburger and fries, also added bottled water, bottled Sprite and a baonanas ube banana pudding (from the fridge where the drinks are.)  There was no label on the banana pudding but I knew what it was because I saw that baonanas has ube flavor on their Instagram (and that they are at 7th Street Burger locations.)

There was a 10-15 minute wait for our order, and during that time we waited for other diners to leave so we could get seats.

Everything tasted great! I rarely have burgers or fries and these were worth the splurge.
The banana pudding was even better than expected.

The burgers are smashed so they are always cooked to the same temperature.

There is an Impossible burger option, which I would get if I go again (I don't eat beef burgers often.) This place is good for a quick bite, but not somewhere to hang out and chat because of the limited seating and the crowd of people waiting to sit.

This restaurant is takeout format. I'm curious as to how other locations are set up, i.e. if more seating, and if others have more baonana offerings besides the little takeout container version.

I prefer somewhere I can sit without rushing and be able to catch up with friends, and also not having to stand around in a crowd waiting for food to be ready so that's why 4 stars instead of 5.  Came after work on a weeknight around 7 and it was pretty packed at that time. Most people came in groups of 2 and shared tables with strangers.  2 of us of our party of 4 arrived first so we ordered and started eating first and the other 2 had to wait for another 2 seats to open up. One table in the back has bench seating, which was not efficient in this type of space because if a party of 2 people is sitting there (which was the case) instead of 4, you don't want to sit in a booth with strangers so I think it's a waste of space compared to having smaller tables/individual chairs to have more seating available and less people waiting.

It's a glorified Whitecastle burger with cheese.
It's decent don't get me wrong.
If you want a burger super fast without the fast food name then go here. Fries are okay, they're crispy yes. I got the double burger and I swear it tastes exactly like a White Castle burger but bigger but without the guilt.

If you like that then you'll enjoy it here

I went to 7th Street Burger on a Saturday night, it was busy but I was still able to find a seat. The double cheeseburgers are very tasty and filling, they also come with grilled onions and their sauce, which is a nice touch!  The fries are pretty good as well, I definitely want to try the off the menu loaded fries next time I go!

The restaurant was pretty clean and the staff was very nice. The food was fresh  and the wait was not too long either.

I have got to say that this is the best 7th Street burger location that I've been too and I've been to three different ones. It is conveniently located in between Penn station and time square, and the venue itself is nice and clean! There are booths there that the other locations don't have, and they're quite spacious. The food has always been good, so no complaints there. That special sauce they put in there really hits the spot.

I honestly may go back to be honest and bring a few friends, this is a really great spot. The Magic Hour roof top is also directly next to it, making it an even better spot for post-lituation drunk foods :)

Also, I have a thing for bathrooms being clean, and it was clean so that's another plus  :)

Ty Yelp NYC team!

Finally a solid grab and go burger joint has arrived walking distance from Penn Station and less than 2 blocks from my office.

In that area it's typically all fast food which can be maddening when you want a solid burger but 7th Street has saved us. Quality ingredients and tasty food at a non-crippling cost. Welcomed addition to the neighborhood.

The menu is simple and straightforward. A single or double with the option to order fries. No frills. Just the necessary basics. The burger is as solid as you can hope for while the fries are nice and crispy. Definitely get their in house special sauce for dipping.

The service and staff is friendly and warm but try to avoid the lunch rush as sometimes you'll have to wait ~20 minutes for your order.

Definitely lived up to all the hype and then some! Everything about the burger was perfect. The fries were also so good and super crispy!! I especially loved the side of sauce for dipping! Small interior with a some booths and some small tables but perfect for a quick bite and they even play great throwback music. Everything comes out pretty quick too!

My friends really like this burger joint. I stopped by here this past Friday evening with them. Unfortunately, I ate dinner already so I only ate some of the fries and the phenomenal sauce (creamy aioli? with some onion bits?) they have here. I am still thinking about that sauce two days later. Apparently it reminds them of In-N-Out sauce?

The burgers are more like snacks and the patties are thin. Very greasy. Definitely great late night food after an evening of fun or a snack throughout the day. I'll have to try it sometime. Great local fast food option. Good luck finding a table here.

This location of 7th street burger has got to be my favorite of them all! It is spacious and has ample indoor seating with two outdoor standing tables. Their menu is exactly the same as other locations, offering smashed burgers reminiscent to that of in n out burgers. They have a vegetarian option as well which is a plus! I've tried both their double cheese burger and their double impossible burger - both (though they don't look it) really hit the spot. Their loaded fries are also a must get! Think animal style fries but with a burger patty (or impossible patty if you're vegetarian) inside topped with their signature sauce and grilled onions. Grab a Mexican Coke and your burger and fries set is complete!

Check out my foodsta @chiuventure for a closer look at my dining experience here as well as other establishments in NYC and around the world!

7th Street Burger gives In-N-Out Burger a run for its money. Fries were good but didn't taste fresh cut. Still a great place for a late night snack after being delayed and not getting to the hotel until 11pm. Will definitely be back.

7th Street Burger is a new burger spot located in the heart of New York City, and it's already making a name for itself with its delicious offerings. With a simple menu, I ordered the double pattie burger with fries, which is absolutely delicious. The burgers are cooked to perfection. While the burgers are pretty expensive based on their size, the ingredients' quality is well worth the price.

One thing that really stands out about 7th Street is the speed at which the food is served. The burgers are made fresh to order and are served quickly, so you won't have to wait long to get your hands on one of these delicious burgers.

Overall, I would give 7th Street Burger 4 out of 5 stars. While the burgers are a bit pricey for their size, the quality of the ingredients and the speed of service more than makeup for it. If you're looking for a delicious burger spot in NYC, 7th Street is definitely worth checking out.

A welcome addition to the midtown corridor that lacks good, fairly priced grub. Place is very clean, well lit, and serves up a simple menu of burgers, fries, sodas.

We ordered a double impossible burger AND a double regular burger. Both tasted great - not too oily or sloppy like other burgers in the area. Mexican soda was just a bottle Coca Cola... haven't had regular fountain soda in a minute so can't speak to the different flavor notes between them. Pro-tip: ask for their spicy sauce to accompany the fries - basically a chipotle aioli w slaw

As a non burger person, I thought the star was their normal fries. Well seasoned, perfect crispy/potato ratio. One serving good for 1-2 people.

Loaded fries are very delicious. Huge portion, probably good for 2-3 people. Not sure if it's worth the significant added cost.

I came with my boyfriend and our friend, both burger aficionados, and they both agree that the cheeseburger here is one of the best in the city for its price range. They really loved the exceptionally beefy, juicy smash burger, and agree it's *way* better than shake shack.

We all agreed that the burger would be greatly improved with some added acidity, either from more pickles or onions, as the beefyness/creamyness of the burger is overpowering and leaning towards one-dimensional taste. That said, we will be back next time we are craving a great burger!

A Burger + coke + fries will run you around $20.
Disclaimer: meal was comped by yelp!

7th Street does it again. All of their locations turn out incredible smash burgers with fantastic french fries and a refreshing, cold glass bottle Coke.

Their double cheeseburgers are amazing. The meat is super thin and chard and crispy, the cheese melts perfectly, the caramelized onions add a delicious crunch and flavor, and all of it is packed with an a super soft bun.

The fries are well seasoned, and crispy. You can eat them playing if you want, however, they do have packets of ketchup as well.

I highly recommend any of their locations around New York as you will leave here thoroughly satisfied with an excellent sandwich at a reasonable price.

Pro tip: ask them for their special sauce is. They have two sauces that they keep in the back: one spicy, one savory. These go great as dipping sauces for the fries and burger.

This is definitely my favorite 7th street burger location! It's spacious with ample seating. We got two of the double cheeseburger and two loaded fries and a ube banana pudding.

The double cheeseburgers were amazing. Super juicy and flavorful with lots of sweet grilled onions. I also loved the slightly sweet, buttery buns. Definitely greasy but worth every calorie.

The loaded fries were smothered in the sauce, chopped up patty, and grilled onion. Fried fresh on the spot and oh so crispy. Amazing. Between the three of us, the two burgers and loaded fries were enough with leftovers.

The ube banana pudding was also delicious. It was super light and fluffy, although I didn't taste too much of the ube. I loved the wafer and bananas inside. A little pricy but a pretty big tub all things considered.

Service was fast and friendly.

I am obsessed with 7th Street Burger - easily one of my favorite burger spots in NYC. This location is bigger than others and has a bathroom in the back!

This location also offers pudding (Ube, banana, and Cookies and Cream).  I got Cookies and Cream and it was super yummy!

First time here, even living a hop and a jump from the East Village outlet. I've passed it up because of the long lines and now I understand why they're there.

If you're looking for a greasy yet tasty burger then this place has you covered. My best description is if a shake shack burger and a smash burger had a baby, aside from that being an interesting thing wildlife documentary, it might be something like this with some special sauce on it. At any rate, put the burger together with some sufficiently crisp fries and voila. I'll see you again.

I've been to several of their locations around Manhattan as part of multiple Yelp Elite events (which allow me to try their menu for free). I usually have a good experience, but this time their food wasn't as great as usual.

Like usual, I got the double cheeseburger, loaded fries, and a coke. The coke was pretty standard and tasted good. I think they also had sprite and fanta as options. I feel like the double cheeseburger has gotten smaller compared to their first several locations, but it's still filling enough to be eaten on its own. The loaded fries were disappointing though. They're basically fries with onions, a burger patty, and sauce on them. Usually they're good, but for some reasoning, there were several pockets of large salt pieces scattered throughout. It made those bites really unpleasant, both in terms of flavor and texture. Otherwise, I was pretty satisfied with what I got.

This location is a lot better than the others in my opinion. The ambiance feels much nicer, since the ones I've been to, you can either sit outside or stand inside, but this location has actual tables and booths inside. It's much more spacious and has a cleaner interior than the others. The service was also decently fast.

In terms of value, I would rate it the same as my prevous visits to other locations. It's a bit pricey ($11 for a double cheeseburger) and I'm not sure it's that great if you're going for value. However, it's a pretty good quality burger if that's what you're craving.

-
Tasty burger very simple and hits the spot. Overall tasty when in a hurry. I just got a regular cheeseburger but their fries looked good. I will probably try those next visit.

I'm not sure what the hype is about this place! The hamburger was OK. The fries were not good. However, the service was quick! The restaurant is crowded with very little seating. i'll be honest I wasn't impressed! But if you want to give it a try please do! You  just might like it!

Awesome burgers
Quick service
Good music

I will come back again

Locals eat here as well

Saw this place on TikTok and put it on my "Must Hit" list. Got the double and wasn't disappointed. Juicy and flavorful smashed patties with simple extras (onions, cheese, pickles). Loved the simplicity of the store and the menu. Will definitely hit again!
Amazing burger!! Reminds me of In-N-Out burger but the smashed burger version ahah but still equally good!! Got the double cheeseburger and a side of fries. DELICIOUS!!
This place was alright. I went here a couple months ago. Pretty standard burger. If you need something in Times Square, this is going to be pretty good if you need something fast.

The food was so good here that I forgot to take a picture before hand. The place is small but we were able to get a seat. The staff were super friendly and we got our food quick. The burger was so juicy and flavorful. Make the Pattie's a bit bigger. Fries also crisp and flavorful. Their house sauce was good too.

OMG SOOOO GOOOD

PERIODT

The selection is limited but the burger is absolutely delicious! I do not even know how anyone can go anywhere else for burgers.
great food, fast service. Busy Saturday night crowd, party atmosphere. Fries crispy, and cheeseburger juicy and done to perfectio.
No table here but a good $9 double burger. They make everything fresh so you have to wait but it's worth it. The staff are friendly. The burger is nice and crispy and juicy. Great tasting!

Really good food at a busy location. I went to this location of 7th street burger and enjoyed the food and the space. This location has seats and bathroom which is great for someone who has been shopping all day and wants sit for a burger. The burger and fries lived up to their 7th street name. I got the loaded fries and the were so good. The even made my loaded fries with an impossible burger Instead of a traditional one. I was presently surprised! And the ube banana pudding... bomb. It is purple but you definitely want to get it while you're there

I recently ordered a meal at this location and I must say, the cashier was really knowledgeable and helped me choose the perfect meal for me. He was very patient and took his time in getting my order. I was also impressed with his friendliness and excellent customer service for a fast food restaurant. The food was great and it was made exactly how I expected it to be. I noticed that the cashier paid attention to details which made my experience even better. Overall, it's an excellent place to dine in and I will definitely come back soon.

Came here for my first Elite Event of 2023 and it did not disappoint! The boyfriend ordered their standard burger and I got an Impossible burger. We both loved our burgers! Mine totally hit the spot. All burgers come topped with pickles, lettuce, special sauce, onions, and American cheese and you can subtract toppings as you wish to make the burger vegan.

I'd love to come back for these burgers. My boyfriend pronounced his burger a "perfect fast food burger." I'm still thinking about the fries though...they were perfect. If you want a great straight cut French fry, these are the best since I've had since McDonald's. There...I said it.

Service was very polite and prompt. I now appreciate places that have a menu of just one or two perfectly executed items, removing the doubt that accompanies picking between several appealing options when there are almost always one or two "right answers." Rest assured here that the menu is small but so worth it.

Delicious burger joint in a pretty busy area. Yes, it's a bit greasy but dude, that's what burgers and fries are all about. Pretty reasonable prices for what you get. Sufficient seating at this location. Would definitely come back if I'm around that neighborhood.

props to this locaton: they have bathrooms to use, theyre super clean, and about 10 tables and booths to sit at. service is quick. they never have desserts!  but the double veggie is always a hit and fries are always crunchy.
Solid burger and for the area it's a nice change then tourist food or chains. This seems like a place locks would go. Prices are pretty good too

had a friend visiting from france and street food carts is his joy and today the halal cart on 36th and 7th ave will also be my joy or my demise. the aroma in the air coming from the food cart is nice and so are the prices for lamb platter with rice , chicken with rice , falafel sandwich, and more. i took a semi risk from ordering from a street food cart and overall it was well worth it for less then 25 bucks for two large plates of halal food. frenchy is happy and yours truly is happy cause the chicken with rice was good and did not bring me to my demise.

Absolutely horrible even for lousy dog slob like they serve that is way overpriced solid and hot bar looks nice but very deceiving noticed cockroaches size of my big toe crawling around the floors food is lousy... to say the least

The Korean broad the works the register is nasty just wanna look at horrible Rowan even a hyenas appetite
She must be the owner or something because when I asked for extra napkins she ripped them in half and only gave out half napkins!!!!Cheap Koreans no wonder they include cockroaches with your meals.
they  water down there iced coffee six dollar egg and home fries sandwich that after two bites had to throw to the pigeons...... and now my stomach is gonna punish me with unstoppable diarrhea thanks to 48 deli
Start going to Ect...ltd on 46 st & Madison has much better fresh food clean like a hospital and half price faster service you won't be sorry!

Quick update today passing by there  another victim has fallen to their demise after eating at the hot food bar...... I noticed someone was rushed by ambulance from food poisoning.

This establishment is extremely racist. A black man tried to get in with two friends, the man who seemed like the owner told him to get out. As he was leaving he asked why and the owner who had bad English why and he said something about closing despite it being a 24 hour store. After leaving the establishment the man saw there was other people on upper floor. He sent in his friend (who is white) back in, he came back out telling the two guys (who are black, one with dreadlocks and the other with a high top fade) that they were not allowed in because they were black. You could see the other workers in the store were looking at each other in disbelief. I would not recommend it purely on the fact that they are racist in 2017. All I have to say is #joyconboys

I love ordering from a place and it actually shows up! Lol
I ordered delivery from here tonight for the first time. I ordered a cheese quesadilla, small French vanilla cappuccino, and the Canadian Breakfast Wrap (w/o onions). Everything arrived hot and was packaged neatly. My order is correct! Yay!! It also was delivered earlier than expected; always a plus!!
The French vanilla cappuccino was sweeter than I thought and syrup-like in texture. I'm thinking it's from one of those powder cappuccino machines. I wouldn't get that again but it was good as a dessert for me!
The cheese quesadilla was larger than I expected and was melted to perfection! Soo good! Cooked perfect. The sour cream was fresh. The salsa had zing to it; not really for me. I like spicy salsa. The quesadilla is very filling! Worth it.
The Canadian Breakfast Burrito has eggs, bacon, and cheese. I asked for no onions and they left the onions out!! Great job guys!!! I appreciate that they pay attention to detail here. The burrito was much larger than I expected and sooo worth the price! Very, very filling. Bacon crunch in the right places, eggs scrambled perfect, and the cheese stretchy and melted. Delicious!!
I'd order from here again!! Great prices, fast delivery, efficient!

Pastrami Sandwich (3/5): It was massively stuffed and served warm inside a soft roll. Could have used some sauces to moisten the bite since it was a little dry but for $8 was a solid late evening choice.
This place is GOOD!!! I've ordered twice before i start work and it has been perfect. The staff is also friendly as well which i do love.

We came to NYC for the week and visited this market daily not only do they make good food but prices are reasonable, they are open 24 hours and they delivery. I went there every night for a piece of cheesecake it was do delicious and Luis is the best, most helpful so friendly and was a joy to chat with. This is a must go to place for everything you need while visiting short term or long term

I came in the store to order sandwiches and while waiting for my food I saw alive cockroaches crawling in the glass croissant display. When I told the owner he clearly denies it and started yelling at me then told me to leave the store without giving me my food. PLEASE BE AWARE OF THAT PLACE AND THE FOOD YOU ARE GETTING!!!!

Done with this place!  4th time getting my order incorrectly in the last 2 weeks.  It's not just delivery it's also when you go in.  

They don't listen when you give them and order.  They need to Listen and not multi-task.

The place is small but has a lot of different food items, I think anyone can find something they'll like. I went for the tuna wrap, it was huge, and only cost $7. There are also many different ice creams, sandwiches, energy bars, fruit, coffee, etc... Cute staff as well.

I use to order A LOT from this bodega as it is only 2-blocks from my apartment. For quite a long time, they were very reliable, quick, and the food was always hot and good! You can also order beer and have it delivered, which was a plus. However, things over the past several months have been absolutely horrible! Orders taking an hour or longer (and I'm 2-blocks away), and the food arrived cold and very often prepared terribly! Tonight is the very last time I will ever order from 5 Brothers again - and it's their loss because I've easily spent either near or more than $1,000 over a years time on delivery (I don't cook). I've included a picture of a chopped cheese sandwich - and you tell me that's how it's supposed to look! Over an hour late, ice cold, dried out, and missing most of the ingredients/toppings of a traditional NY chopped cheese sandwich. Save your money (and valuable time) and do not order from this place. They've become far too unpredictable on what you're going to get.

Been my neighborhood deli for about 4 years now, so figured I should probably write a review while I'm still around. Open 24 hours daily with a guy behind the sandwich station ready to make any order you can come up with.

Sandwiches are large and they never skimp on the meat, usually ranging between $4-8. Over the years they have significantly improved their craft beer selection, especially on the seasonal items (i.e. pumpkin, christmas, summer ales). Got an ATM inside, coffee all day, and soup during cold afternoons.

Guys behind the counter are professional despite all the weird things you see in the area late at night (and the morning). Obviously I'm biased since I live closeby, but know I'll miss it when I eventually move.
I ordered a burger and fries from here on Seamless. It was okay, about what you'd expect. Unfortunately, it was over an hour late, hence the pretty low rating.

Overall: So-so.

Ordered via GrubHub, 5 brothers delivered.

We ordered an Italian sub, meatball sub, Philly cheesesteak, and a lamb gyro.   We also ordered two large fries, a strawberry cheesecake, a carrot cake, and a diet Pepsi.

The goods: Food was delivered reasonably fast. The cheesecake and the carrot cake were very good.

The bads: The order was delivered minus one Italian sub (called them, they made it and brought it over in record time and comped us another drink and a cinnamon muffin which the kids said was good).  All of the sandwiches and gyro were just ok, not bad but not worth getting again. For satisfying our hunger they got the job done. I didn't care for the  fries but the kids devoured them.

So all that to say that I'm happy with my first GrubHub (app) experience but I'd pass on giving 5 Guys a second chance.

UPDATE: I moved out of the neighborhood, but stop by to say hello the other day and they have seriously upgraded the facility... I am so happy to see these guys flourishing!

Open 24 hours and always on point. This is the best bodega in the neighborhood. Always clean and friendly. Carlos in the morning is fast, friendly and efficient and Fernando at night is the man!

Bacon egg and cheese all day. Reasonably priced too. Check out their smokeshop across the street on 47 next to DBL for all your smoking/vaping needs

Do not order here if you want ice cream. They will constantly send you the wrong one without calling to ask if you would like another flavor, if one is out of stock. (It's not out of stock the delivery guy isn't looking for it) The delivery guy doesn't speak English or pretends not too. I've had this happen as a regular customer at least 5 times. Beyond annoyed. I don't eat mint, you can't just bring any flavor you want!!!!!!

Used this deli as well as a few others in hell's kitchen area for a short trip. I think the staff here was very professional (behind the counter), and there is a good selection of very high quality products.

We really enjoyed the Coney Island Mermaid Lager, it is amazing. Very good selection of beers and non-alcoholic drinks but basically no wine.

The bagels were good, and many of the sandwiches and other eatery options they were serving up were very good. Good neighborhood place with professional staff.

They will appreciate if you use cash.

It's extremely cheap and very convenient as it's opened 24 hours. I also love their customer service! They completed my order despite it being a little unique ( a muffin with cream cheese) and didn't question it. Great place!

Shout out to the locally owned business a block away from our hotel. The exact opposite of a tourist trap. Really good food for a really good price. Great customer service. Met all of our deli, grill, and bodega needs.

This used to be a good place but recently they've really jacked up their prices and charge a fee for using credit cards. I bought something that was off and they refused to give a refund. There are better places a few blocks away.

Phenomenal Deli! Old school, real fast service. Not fake BS. Straight up expeditors and order takers. Great prices, very convinient, neighborhood gem, fresh ingredients and cool staff! Viva Cinqo Hermanos!

Sandwiches
They have a large selection of sandwiches. Sampled the Cubano and Italian. Unfortunately it was premade (don't know when it was prepared) and heated up to serve. The sandwiches are served with Tostitos chips. Another customer order a hot chicken type sandwich: they microwaved the chicken breast prior to making it a sandwich. Both the Cubano and Italian were okay noting really to note except for the price, which was decent. They also have a large fresh salad selection. Service was friendly and quick.

This is a great place to grab a sandwich that is well-priced and great-tasting.  It's definitely a local joint, which I like, and the two other customers that were in line in front of me both were talking familiarly with the guy behind the counter.  I stopped there on my way to a friend's place in Clinton, and I'm glad I did.

I got a toasted turkey sandwich, chips, and a drink for about $4.50.  I had to wait a little while, since there was just the one guy working, but it is a nice little place with lots to look at.  There isn't a place to sit down, you'll have to grab and go.  They also sell many items you'd find in a convienence store.

I wouldn't go out of my way to go to 5 Brothers, but would go back again when I'm in the area.

Came here one night after I failed to make a boat reservation and when I first tasted the food, it was like I was meant to miss the boat ride so I could end up here for this food. Absolutely delicious! The pistacho goat cheese appetizer was my favorite! The scallops are also incredible! The server was a bit pretentious and made me feel a little judged but other than that it was great. Awesome vibe and amazing food. I recommend going here if you're in the mood for a nice pricey meal thats worth it!

Yum! Such a pretty and quiet atmosphere and food was delicious! Love the abundance of fresh veggies added to every dish.

I had the Lobster taco and the sole - I recommend both! My friend had the scallops and pistachio tilapia - both excellent too!

Ran out of time for dessert but the menu looked awesome - I def want to come back and try one.

44 & X can best described as New American Cuisine. What first caught my attention were the brown T-shirts that the servers wore. The front says "Heaven" while the back reads "Hell." Pretty funny, yet appropriate as they're right on the corner of 44th Street and 10th Avenue right in the middle of Hell's Kitchen.

It' was a party of 6, unfortunately our group couldn't be seated indoors when there was already a reservation for 6 at the same time. Our group was the only ones dining outside and it was extremely hot and uncomfortable being fanned with hot recycled outdoor air. I will say, I love the ambiance and decor both indoors and outdoors, for sure next time I will want to be seated inside.

For my first time here, I was previously recommended by a local to try out this place for dinner as it's really popular and a must try. My work colleague had also suggested we all meet up this past Wednesday afternoon for early dinner.

If you're familiar with Broadway Shows, their cocktail menu has references to popular musicals that are in season or popular shows from the past. They also change their food menu seasonally, so you may or may not have the same dish twice.

I ordered something that I usually like to eat, For starters, I picked their roast chicken quesadilla with pico de gallo and avocado relish. Another person in the group also ordered the same. For my main, I ordered the pan seared filet mignon with potatoes au gratin. Me and the others in the group was surprised by the size of my filet mignon! For what I picked, both were really good! The portion size was very large, I didn't eat my carrots, nor did I eat all of the potatoes, much so I could have had leftover vegetables to take home.

Javier was our server, he was pretty darn good at what he does here. While the entire menu both drinks and food menu looks good, I'm already interested in coming back to try out more. None of us got dessert because we were all full.

It's always a scene here in Hell's Kitchen. Dressing up is optional, but if you want to impress your friends and dinner company, why not?

Gayle and I recently got together with her friend Glenn who lives in NYC, but worked with her at the Contra Costa Times several years ago.  She hadn't seen her Jewish friend for years, but soon after we sat down outside at 44 & X Hell's Kitchen, they easily picked up where they left off.  We met for what turned out to more like a Happy Hour before Glenn and a out-of-town friend of his headed over to see a revival performance of "Little Shop of Horrors".

The cocktail menu was clever, featuring names taken from famous shows.  I enjoyed my Tequila Mockingbird, while Ginberly Akiimbo and Shucked-Up were also ordered.  Service was friendly and attentive and as maybe a couple hours effortless flowed by, other delicious food (Hamachi Sashimi, Goat Cheese Souffle, Roasted Chicken Quesadilla, a Starter Special and finally  the 44&X Cookie Plate) came and disappeared.  It was a fun evening out.

The only downside was that we walked with Glenn and his friend over to the Theater to see if we could get tickets, but unfortunately they were sold out.  Maybe and annual Theater trip to New York is an idea we need to explore to remedy this bit of disappointment?

At the same time, the big highlight for me that evening was Glenn turning to me saying:  Are you Jewish?  You have this Aura about you that way!  I was thrilled, while Gayle was stunned!  The background here is that I'm a convert (since 1980) and over the 18 (Chai) years I've known Gayle, I've heard "You're not really Jewish" from her way all too often.  Maybe so in Orthodox eyes, but I'll gladly insight like this any time!

We went on a slow rainy Sunday evening. The service,therefore, was excellent. The drinks were prepared well. I had the filet mignon. It was one of the best steaks I have had. The portion was large as well. This restaurant is warm with tall ceilings. It is a romantic place. Which makes the meal that much better. I would visit this one. It's all good.

Stumbled upon this place on a random Saturday afternoon while stuck in crazy NYC traffic. Been going back ever since. I've had brunch, lunch, and everything in between. Always love the food here!! Service is always top notch, and I've never had to wait. To top it off, the bathroom is super cute !!!

Came here on  Sunday night foe some drinks and shareables. The interior is super cool, their drinks were amazing!! We tried their mezcal drink with jalapeño, tequila drink with rose and the manhattan. All were so good. We also got their goat cheese with pistachios appetizer which was great and their hamachi which wasn't that good since it was bitter.

We spent the first half of our meal pondering what "44 & X" meant, only for one person in my family to realize that it was "44th and Tenth", as in the intersection that this place is located at. THEN we were like "why do their shirts say hell on one side and heaven on the other" and I was like IT'S BECAUSE IT'S HEAVEN IN HELL'S KITCHEN. Anyway, that's just in case you, too, were wondering.

My family came here for Mother's Day brunch, and we were super lucky to be seated. The space is really beautiful and open and the natural light comes in in a way that makes you feel like you're in this huge pavilion.
