The food is for sure on the pricier side, but I went with the french toast which came to $18 (definitely one of the more reasonable numbers on the menu).

What I liked about the toast was that it was a generous portion AND it came with ham. I'm the type of person who likes to balance the sweet with the salty, and usually that means I have to order eggs or something on the side, but in this case I didn't! I should mention though that the ham tasted stale. The toast itself was surprisingly airy but still rich. However, I like choice. I love syrup but I love choice. I think they put the syrup on for the sake of presentation, but because they put so much of it on, it was able to seep into the toast and make it entirely too sweet (and not to mention soggy) for me.

Big fan of the space itself, but not sure if I'd actively recommend going to brunch here.

I'm so sad to see the negative reviews because I had the best time here. Everyone was so nice and the food was so yummy! Even the muffins for the table were good! French toast was crispy and fluffy and not soggy. Eggs were perfectly poached. We got a dry piece of ham but we were given a new order right away.

Whenever I pass by this restaurant during my daily evening walks, I always see it packed and always try to put a note in my head that I must check it out. Today I did with some friends visiting from out of town and must say loved the food. Even though I made a reservation for inside, my friend insisted we sit outside in this chilly weather. Definitely a cute place, and the food was delicious. We ordered the mahi-mahi, sea-bass, scallops, Dover and the burger. Minus the burger all of our mains were great. The desserts were great too.  Forgot to photograph everything but overall the experience was great and looking forward to coming back to try the other dishes.

Met some friends here for a Sunday brunch before seeing a show.   It's a nice place and very lively.  I liked the decor and the layout.  It wasn't too crowded when we got  there but it was packed when we left and it was loud.  

We were seated quickly at our reservation time and took a quick look at the menu.  The service was very efficient but I wouldn't say it was warm.  The food came out quickly....we arrived at 12:28 and were seated at 12:30 and we had the food on our table at 12:41.   Like I said... it is very quick!  

I had the crab cake, which was just okay.  It was very bread-y.  I would have been fine if it had been smaller but more crabby.   Poached eggs were great.   Also, they brought a basket of muffins and those were tasty.

We were finished before 1:00 and got the bill and paid and were out of there shortly afterwards.    

Overall it was a decent experience and the food was fine but it felt a bit like being on an assembly line.    If there was more of an "experience" I would rate this higher but it was a very impersonal dining situation.

First time coming here!  Food was good!  I had the Mac and cheese, it was very good but pretty rich due to I believe truffle.  Everyone in my party seemed to enjoy their food.  Service was very good although I do wish they would have refilled my coffee but also realize I didn't ask.  We sat outside which was lovely!

Here's a brunch spot we went to on a causal Saturday  It was a busy Saturday for the restaurant , so the service was a little bit slow but totally understandable!...The food was okayyy, not bad, a bit overpriced -- $7 for a normal quality cappuccino , $20 for a small portion of granola & yogurt ... Overall, great outdoor sitting area, not the best spot for great quality brunch food, but our server was pretty friendly with a good smile .

Service: 5/5
Ambiance: 4.5/5
Food: 4/5

My friends and they had a great time at brunch on Sunday.  It was raining, so we all had to cram indoors.  The table of 2 next to us was so close that they may as well been part of our party of 5.  Despite that, the service was fantastic and the food around the table seemed to be well received.  I ordered the herbed scrambled eggs with cheesy grits which was good/solid.  I would definitely like to come back and try a different dish.  But definitely had a great time with my friends and enjoyed our brunch time get together at 44x10.

44&X has a great thing going with the Mediterranean chop salad, all creamy feta and firm, mildly pickly hearts of palm. And a pretty okay thing going with their very sharp-cheddared and layered mac and cheese, though it was on the cusp of too al dente for me and even gave a few crunches.

But then, under the crisp curl of its tasty sea bass, lay a broth that tasted like a swimming pool. All chlorine. The broth was supposed to be mussel and saffron, which is an incredibly brave broth to attempt given that both spoiled mussels and cheap saffron can taste like chlorine. So if you're going to offer that combination, better make sure you've got a tight handle on your ingredients. Because the broth ruined everything. I could only eat the food that was above the broth line - everything else was unsalvageable.

I didn't want to admit to my dining partner that her favorite restaurant had done this, so I asked for a to go box. They gave one to me but didn't seal it. So when I got home, my whole purse was coated in chlorine mussel saffron broth. Will the broth's influence never end?
Really great food and nice service.  I would highly recommend the Mahi Mahi and the pan-seared filet mignon.  For dessert, try the cherry pie!

Adding dinner review to this! Popped by on a Wednesday for dinner with my boyfriend. Place wasn't packed which was really nice. Waiter was super attentive and the waiter was super attentive. The dinner menu was sooo good - pricey but goood! To start we got this goat cheese, pistachio soufflé was incredible! so soft and airy. The smoked salmon was delicious, just wish the sauce was a bit thicker so it would stick to the salmon bite better. The chicken my boyfriend got was also really good. Loved this place, glad i came back for dinner as well.

Been here for dinner and love the menu especially all their fish dishes .  Every time I pass the restaurant, it's always buzzing no matter what time of the day .  

I've been wanting to try their brunch and finally did on Sunday .  As usual , the hostess is welcoming and attentive.  Because they're busy , as most restaurants, your party doesn't get seated until the party is complete .  There is a bar are where one can wait.  I had some salmon sort of Benedict with some potatoes .  I must admit , I'm not much of a brunch person hence i can fully comment other than the fact that it tasted good .  My favorite part was the "bread" they serve at the table which are mini muffins (and they' are delicious ).  Our server is also friendly which made the dining experience more fun !  I'll be back for dinner ..
Fun selection of drinks! They also have outdoor dining. It's a solid spot for a date and usually looks 3/4 full most nights. Worth checking out even if you don't live in the area.

44 × 10, is in the heart of Hell's Kitchen. Located on 44th Street and Tenth Avenue (hence the name). Serving classic American dishes, fine hand-selected steaks, and great amazing seafood. Good choice after or before a Broadway play. Perfect location! Fun Fact: At the bar you will find a list of Broadway-themed cocktails.
How was it:  I love that they have a seasonal menu. When the seasons change, so does their menu. However, one thing remains the same. And that is what I came for, their signature dish. But before the main event, I started with "The MJ Musical" cocktail. A cucumber spiked cocktail. And the autumn season special appetizer. A soup made with artichoke puree, truffle oil, and topped with crab meat. Then I had the main event. Grilled braised short ribs, Vermont white cheddar mashed potatoes, with black truffle port wine reduction. I wasn't a big fan of the wine reduction. But the short ribs were priceless. Perfectly cooked and tender aka "falling off the bone". Can't wait to eat the rest for lunch tomorrow

I came here for New Year's Eve and I have been here before and here is my review.

Ambience:
The place is packed and airy and classy.
It is centrally located on the corner and you can't miss it.
The stuff is constantly on the go and working very hard.
The tables were very close together because it is such a popular place so they're packing people in.

Food:
As a vegetarian, I was happy with my food selection. I started with a salad and it was a big salad then I had the pistachio soufflé, which was amazing. I should have had this as my entrée instead of a starter. I also had a delicious mac & cheese, and it was just too big for me .

In a nutshell: Pretty from the outside kind of restaurant you always make a mental note to checkout at another time... only to be utterly underwhelmed when you do.

GOOD
Fast to be seated, although the restaurant was not busy as they never are on Monday nights, I always appreciate it even if gently nudged to seat on the bar... NOPE, I want to have a dining experience after waiting to be here for so long.

The young attractive waiter uniform (and the rest of the waiters for that matter) are just slim fit shirts and jeans to feature their body... for me is evident the clientele they're looking to attract. The service was adequate, I'm going to have to start questioning my latest habit of asking waiters for their recommendations assuming they eat there and can give a frank opinion based on my dietary restrictions... this time, it didn't work out. Nonetheless, it was an adequate service, not as splendid as one would expect from a restaurant that charges 5 stars prices for "cuisine take" on rather ordinary American dishes.

BAD
The wine tasted worst than a waterdown drink because all the ice melted, I have tried 5 dollars a bottle TJ rosés that have actual taste than this insipid spirit. After having the wine with the food, even the meal couldn't save such bad drink.

WORST
I ordered the terrine as an appetizer and that was enough for me to cut dinner short and ask for the check. I did ordered the macaroon sample to go, only the lemon shortcake bites and the chocolates were good, but not good enough to compensate with the bland and soggy macarons overall not worth the price. The terrine flavors and temperature were lukewarm, in the way is served you're not a 100% sure on how to eat it, then you have a lot of what you don't like and not enough of what you do. For the pretentiousness of the menu prices, one would expect getting more out of your money if not for the overall dining experience... no good music, no ambiance, bland food served by a t-shirts & jeans  wearing staff is just a big NO.

Had brunch here. Service is wonderful. Cute place. The herbed scrambled eggs were good. Nothing out of this world. The sausages were very hard chewy and overcooked. But they were the tastiest part of the dish. I asked for chopped jalapeños and got hot sauce.... The reason for 4 stars is that the Belvedere Bloody Mary is spectacular. Filled to the rim. Very strong and delicious. I would go back just for that!
The food was exceptional as well as the service! Wonderful dinner spot and the energy was so fun!
I had a delicious lunch today. A very chill experience, and the staff are adorable, and very accommodating.

Sad. Place use to be one of my favs. Leaving brunch now and need to review while it's fresh. Waiter took order. Food came half hour later medium temp (ok fine, was good). Drinks came AFTER food. Was told "bartender was new" only after asking where drinks were 45 minutes into sitting, no proactive explanation as to why were sitting at an overpriced brunch with no drinks. Asked for the drinks to be comped, they took one drink off. We told the manager we honestly liked it there but we can't understand paying for drinks that we're 45 minutes late with a weak explanation. (Late drinks two two well drinks, a glass of wine and a fountain soda,  nothing crazy).

Manager THROWS OUR CREDIT CARDS AT US and tells us to never (f*cking) come back if it was so bad.

WHAT? Mortified.

Girl bye.

This is brunch in Hell's Kitchen in the summer, train during the week or get your bartender more support.

Was super clear we were not the only people complaining or Miss Thing at the front desk probably wouldn't have snapped that quickly and thrown our cards, but this is not our problem.

We came ready to spend money and have nice drinks, we left cussed out with our credit cards thrown at us like we're really trying to make a dollar on 44 & x....

I can't imagine a world where I thrown stuff at people when my job gets difficult..

Shame - place is cute and food is good, our waiter wasn't bad either -- but 44x if you're reading this get rid of that strung out manager, he should not be customer facing and just cost your customers !!

New York City, NY

44 & X Hell's Kitchen has to be one of my favorite restaurants that I have been to. Not only does it have such a fun and summer-y atmosphere, the food is some of the best I have had at a restaurant and the menu is also very creative.

As an appetizer, we ordered the Goat Cheese and Pistachio Soufflé. When I read the word "soufflé," I was imagining puff pastry enclosing the goat cheese. But to my surprise, the soufflé was just made of warm goat cheese that was so airy, it seemed more of a thick foam. I took an endive that had balsamic glaze on it, placed some of the asian pear slices on top, and spread the goat cheese over it. Such an amazing appetizer, I could have ate the whole thing by myself. The crunch of the endive, along with the tangy pear and warm goat cheese made each bit a wonderful experience.

For my main course, I ordered the Orange Dusted Main Lobster, which is not listed as a salad on the menu, but that's how the waiter described it to me. It was one of my favorite meals eaten at an American restaurant. The vegetables that the chef chose all complimented the lobster very well, not to mention the slight orange flavor I got from the lobster - how creative! The fava beans were the second most interesting part of the dish (after the orange dusted lobster), as they were so soft and melted in my mouth. I have never seen these types of beans as part of a vegetable medley before.

My dad ordered the Crispy Sea Bass, which in my opinion, had a very salty and fishy taste to it. However, he really liked his choice. My mom ordered the Pistachio Crusted Tilapia, which had an interesting addition on top of it: a jumbo crab ravioli. I couldn't figure out why a single ravioli of a different seafood was added on top of the fish, but I really liked it.

Now, the dessert. Absolutely amazing. We ordered the Banana Split, which is an unusual order for my family as we tend to veer towards a chocolate-based dish, but the waiter was so adamant that the Banana Split was the best so we gave in and decided to give it a shot. Best decision ever. The banana had a brûlée on top of it, giving it a sweet crunch to contrast its mushy texture. Pair that with a small bit of the toasted marshmallow and any one of the three gelatos included, and you have a bite made from heaven. I initially thought that the homemade marshmallow would make the dessert way too sweet, but it was actually perfectly made, as it simply added a nice chewy texture.

To tell you how much my parents and I enjoyed this restaurant, I asked them which of the 3 entrees they liked the most. Everyone said that their own was the best - and that's exactly the kind of restaurant you want to go to, because everyone leaves the happiest they can be. We even started debating why OUR dish in particular was better than the others. I have to come back to this restaurant and try something else because not only are there so many options but I know for a fact all of it will be delicious. 20/10 recommend this restaurant.

TL;DR: Amazing restaurant and atmosphere for the price. The crisp white decor and fairy lights have a
non-pretentious date night vibe with equally charming food.

My friends and I have always passed this place and wondered what it was like - especially since it's one of the more upscale restaurants in the Hell's kitchen area. We finally went Wednesday night!

While it was still pretty busy, our waiter indulged us in the restaurant's history. It's been around for 22 years, well before Hudson Yard's development.

I ordered the pistachio fish and my friend got the short ribs. Both were fantastic, but especially the short ribs... tender and drenched in a smoky sweet marinade balanced with mashed potatoes. It tastes like something my mom would have cooked if she was three times a better chef: comfort food but with more gourmand slant.

The fish was also good - the cream was excellent. I can say that this restaurant does any sauce well.

So good I cleared my plate before a photo! I would highly recommend this place if you're in Hells kitchen.

I've been a loyal patron of 44th&X for more than 20 years. The food has never disappointed. (I think I've probably eaten 100 lobster tacos over that time.) Everything on the menu is creative and alive with flavor. The servers are always cheerful and accommodating (checking your timing if you are headed to theatre and even providing a take away cup for my coffee when I miscalculated). Love those "between heaven and hell T shirts,"a long tradition. Bright space, hot bar scene. Scott runs a marvelous enterprise at 44th&X; the whole team provides a consistently memorable experience.

Came here for lunch on a weekend. The place was super packed both outdoor and indoor but they could seat us by the bar so we opted for seating there. The service was friendly and there were alot of food options (very egg heavy).

They gave us muffins for the table which I thought was such a special touch. But, once we were seated at the table - it took a very long time to get silverware, napkins, water etc. (in fact we didn't get those until we had placed the order for the food and the food came out). The service was a little slower than I had hoped for given we were seated at the bar.

The food was pretty good, french toast was sweet and decadent but not too overwhelming. The eggs and bacon was a huge dish and definitely satisfying for appetite.

Overall - the portions were great and the muffins were a nice touch but the quality of the food was okay. I think the service could've been a bit more attentive though. The other thing that really bothered me was that at the bar seating, we could smell the clothes that were at the other side of the bar so that definitely impacted the overall experience quite a bit.

What a magical night. I was a longtime fan but with the last three years of Covid. I was worried that my dinner last week would be not what I Remembered.
I was so wrong. We were lucky to have Ray has our waiter he made sure we were not only happy but we felt loved and respected. The food was so good the lamb has never disappointed in almost 18 years of coming here  the drinks amazing and Ray getting the entire staff to sing happy birthday at the top of their lungs brought tears to my sister. You guys knocked it out if the park. Thank you thank you. Life long fan. Greg.  The place looks so pretty too.

We had a WONDERFUL brunch here! It was just a few blocks from our hotel and we were lucky to get an outside table right at 11A when they opened. They were busy!

They serve everyone some to die for small muffins to start. They were spectacular! I had an excellent spicy virgin Bloody Mary. I had the huevos rancheros but also ordered a side of potatoes to share. It was quite a bit larger than expected and I didn't manage to finish either. Their huevos is made with scrambled eggs but the waiter mentioned this in advance so I wouldn't be unsurprised. I'm not sure how they make their scrambled eggs but they were so fluffy and silky. It came with a lovely warm tortilla wrapped around a serving of perfect guacamole.

My teen co-diner went for the burger but it was HUGE! It was served on an English muffin but the burger, muffin and toppings was so large she could barely take a bite out of it. The fries were super crispy and hot.  The plates coming to neighboring tables made me wish I could come back a few more times! We finished it off with a perfectly made cappuccino.

The inside was beautiful. If I came again I'd try for a reservation and a table inside.

I cannot say enough great things about this place. First, the service is impeccable. You never want for anything. The food was amazing (Sea Bass was delicious, and the crusted Tilapia we surprisingly delicious). I also got the banana split for which was unlike any other and I'll dream of it forever. The immediately ask if you're going to a show so they can ensure your on time. I can't imagine visiting NYC ever again without having at least one meal here. Highly recommend!

tripadvisor.com/ShowUser…

Sadly, my friends and I will never dine at this restaurant again and will never recommend it to anyone.
We went for brunch on a Saturday at 11am. There were *maybe* 8 tables full. We put in drink orders after the waiter came over to us 15 minutes after we sat. I ordered a Diet Coke, one got a glass of wine and two well drinks....the drinks arrived after our food. We asked the waiter a few times to check in on the drinks and we were told the bartender was new and the restaurant was packed. Again, we sat when less than half of the tables were full and I ordered a fountain soda...
The food was lukewarm for half of our group. We asked for the bill, asked the waiter to comp the drinks since we finished our food before the drinks arrived. The manager came over to us and was completely condescending and plain rude and wouldn't even let us speak he just cut us off every time we tried to say anything. We told him in a nice but firm way that we didn't feel it was appropriate to have waited so long for such simple drinks and he ripped open the checkbook and THREW our credits cards at us and told us to "never f*cking come back".
If I owned this restaurant I would take a hard look at the manager they have working there. We were shouted at and accosted for questioning why on a Saturday when hardly anyone was there the bartender couldn't make 4 drinks prior to us finishing our entire meal...sad to see such a great HK staple fall so far.

I've heard 44 & x Hells Kitchen was a great brunch spot but I honestly thought it was OK. Went on a Saturday and had late brunch so not that many people were there because the kitchen closes at 3pm I think?

I do like decor and it is bright but I thought the food was OK and the portion as well. It wasn't something I would die for (got the salmon benedict). The service was OK as well. Took a while for the server to get our drinks.

Stopped by for brunch last Saturday and i had the Stacks of silver dollar pancakes, Blueberry butter, and Vermont maple syrup. I skipped the breakfast sausage that it normally comes with. The pancakes were so so soft and good!!!! The Blueberry butter was heavenly! I personally do not like a lot of syrup with my breakfast, so if I had known they'd drench the pancakes with the syrup, I'd ask to get it on the side. But the syrup definitely looked better on top for the picture

My friends had the Maryland crab cakes, Hazelnut brioche French toast, and smoked salmon. Everyone loved the food!

Would love to come back again and try their other food and drinks!

What a cute restaurant. Love the decor.

Service was great and they wear shirts that say "Heaven"; when asked, they'll tell you that you've found 'Heaven in Hell's Kitchen!'  I think they're right!

Ordered the short ribs, which were to die for.  Two pieces served on some mashed potatoes.  Didn't even need a knife to separate the meat, it was that tender.could have used some veggies, but still the best short ribs that I've ever had!

Ordered the gelato plate primarily for the espresso gelato, which was delicious.  Served with a couple pieces of meringue, which was a nice touch.

Food was ok. Drinks took 35 minutes to come out. Arrived AFTER we finished our brunch. We asked for the drinks to come off of the bill and the manager threw our credit cards at us and said to never come back.  Terrible behavior from a manager.  I used to love this place but refuse to be treated as such.
Food was delicious - shower rib and cheddar mashed. But the portion of meat was very underwhelming. A very small short rib - singular. Would not rush back.

Cute brunch spot that was fun to go to, but probably not a must-see or a repeat location. Right near Times Square so a pretty busy area, this brunch spot is actually really cute with some pretty good options on the menu. It's a bit fancier in fare but not in style so you don't have to worry about dressing up too much. While the food was all quite tasty, the prices were really high and the service was pretty strange. Everyone was extremely nice but we had like 4 or 5 different servers so they were often confused and forgot something we said or handed over the wrong thing because wires were getting crossed. Overall, the food wasn't enough to write home about that I would go back, even though the experience was enjoyable and location was nice.
Nice atmosphere, great service, and unique preparations of breakfast classics for weekend brunch.  Had Huevos Ranchero.  Bueno!

This place easily could have gotten 5 stars but the service was lacking. The food tho was very delicious. They messed up my friends order, she wanted shrimp instead of chicken and they told her they would bring her shrimp on the side and NEVER did. Also they couldn't wait for us to leave it was a little uncomfortable. Sadly I won't be back.

I popped into 44 & X and was greeted by a warm & courteous host. He seated me immediately and my server greeted me almost as soon as I sat down. I had their amazing bisque and a glass of rose. The food was delicious, the presentation was beautiful, and the atmosphere was lovely. I will definitely return!

I was in Hell's Kitchen and walked past 44th and 10th. There were many people eating outdoors but I sat indoors being that there was AC. The restaurant had Simple and clean decor with light jazz music which set a great Friday after work vibe. The music man drink had ginger in it which was very refreshing. The appetizers were fantastic! The seafood ravioli was my favorite! It was absolutely delicious! I regret not ordering another one. The restaurant should totally consider making it a bit larger as an entree. The lobster taco was good but I don't think I would order it again. I wasn't fond of the sauce they used for the lobster taco. The terrain of roasted beets was wonderful. For my entree, I had the crispy sea bass which was fabulous. My waiter was a young man named Moses and he was extremely Hospitable. His suggestions were awesome. He greeted me with warmth and made me feel welcomed. I might try brunch here sometime this weekend or the next.

Incredible food, even better service! Mark was beyond exceptional! We will absolutely be back and will be requesting Mark as a server. I am above and beyond guy.
We went before Broadway, Mark was super on top of making sure we were in and out on time.  The food from the apps to the drinks to the amazing banana split style desert... amazing!
10/10 recommend.  Best experience at a restaurant to date!

I have lived on the same block for a while but tried their dinner menu for the first time tonight. We ordered the goat cheese soufflé, filet mignon, and steak frites. The soufflé was very light and savory. The steaks were cooked perfectly and all the side were very yummy!
I've had their brunch which is also very good. Great service and the outdoor dining space. Highly recommend.

Meh. I've been here a couple of times and this last time, the brunch was just meh. We were sat fairly quickly, but we had to share a space with another group. We were basically at the same table.  Food was not made fresh but placed on warming plates. The plate burnt my hand. As for seasoning, the meals were underwhelming and I was surprised. It was definitely better the last time. Don't think I'll be back.

I would give zero stars if I could. The owner of this restaurant is straight up verbally abusive and yells at his customers. I have never been so insulted in my life and this man needs serious anger management therapy. He screamed at my friend to the point of tears over a late reservation. DO NOT COMING HERE. DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESS.

Tl;dr decent brunch

Came here for brunch, it was alright. Got the eggs royal which was like eggs Benedict over salmon. Pretty good but nothing stand out for me.

OMG the food here is phenomenal. Great outdoor seating, great service. The pistachio/goat cheese souffle I will dream about until I am back here again. Desserts are also fabulous. We also got the bacon wrapped meatloaf which was full of flavor. Will be back to try brunch.

THE BEST BEST BEST PANINI IN NYC!!!!!!
Great customer service the owner always gives great energy. The food is AMAZING!! The Panini ingredients are top notch using the best Veggies and meats! And the cheeses are always Gourmet!!!
BEST BEST BEST DELI IN THE AREA!!!
Try all the PANINI's if you want your taste buds to love you!!!!

I work a block away from this Deli and it is my favorite (go to, in and out quickly) place to get something on the run. The place is clean and the guys that work there are pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place for good sandwich-making for those who are on-the-go and need a quick bite.

Hotel Security

Lovely clean corner deli. Good for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Plenty of snacks, drinks and whatnot to choose from. Prices are reasonable considering it's location in Hell's Kitchen, ~$7 for a sandwich with chips and pickle, ~$2 for a drink or snack. The staff are friendly and the store itself is clean. They recently rebuilt the front entrance and it looks sharp! They have 3 tables with some chairs, but it's more of a carry-out focused place. Compared to Skyline this place is gold: cheaper and way better customer service. Great for a quick bite and fast becoming one of my favorites for lunch when I'm working in the area

I've come here a few times now because it is close to work and the food has always been great. The service however is so slow. Our waiter stood by or around our table for about 30 minutes after we were seated without taking even our drink order. I didn't even know he was our server until he did finally come over and then I was just annoyed that it took him that long. Anyway if you have a couple hours (no joke and there were only 3 of us) and want a good grilled cheese sandwich I'd give it a try but just be prepared for the wait.

Hands down....ALEX makes the best Grilled cheese in NYC. I only live a block away but I would go if it were 20 blocks away.
....And service with a smile!!!
We loved this place the egg sandwich was so good... very friendly and fast. We will be back before we leave to go home.
The sandwiches haven't been as good lately. The owner cooks good but the Spanish guy can't cook

One of the highlights of 375 Chicken is the extensive selection of sauces available. From classic to zesty buffalo, there's a sauce to suit every palate. The variety adds an extra layer of customization to the dining experience, allowing customers to tailor their meal to their specific tastes. Additionally, the waffles offered as a side dish are a delightful twist on the traditional chicken and waffles combination, with a light, fluffy texture that complements the savory chicken.

What sets 375 Chicken apart is their dedication to frying the chicken to perfection, resulting in a consistently crisp and flavorful product. They are not open very late though which I think is interesting given the location.

My wife and I really enjoyed our sandwiches at this fast casual chicken spot!

Food: there are a lot of really good options to choose from between sandwiches to tenders, there something for everyone. The honey garlic sandwich was delicious. The breading on the chicken was light and crispy (not too thick) and the chicken itself was really juicy. The pickles and the sauce were delicious as well. I also loved the crinkle cut fries!

Service: it's the type of spot where you walk up and order yourself. The guy at the counter was nice and our food came out relatively quickly.

Ambiance: it's a fast casual spot. Nothing to write home about. Not too many tables inside and definitely good for takeout.

Overall, solid spot with really flavorful chicken.

One of my go to places in Hell's Kitchen when I lived in the area. I usually would get the classic along with an order of classic fries and a drink when I went.

The Chicken Sandwich was also really solid; juicy and a good amount of crisp along with interesting sauces to choose from. Fries were also good; not too salty and pretty crispy.

I usually would order for take out; service was always fast and attentive. I definitely recommend it as a quick bite if you're in the mood for a Chicken Sandwich.

This spot is great for a quick bite. I got the bbq ranch chick n pop and the value was there and it was very tasty. I also got the ludlow fries and they were great but a little bit too saucy. The service was good too - they were busy but got our order in and served to us within 15 minutes. We got take out but there were a couple tables and stools to eat inside if you decide to eat in.

Hopefully one day we will visit the main establishment, but for now food delivery , I must say deliver person was very helpful , food was well packed and was exceptionally taken good care of , you see the pictures the food looks awesome & definitely delicious and will do again but change it up a little , til we meet again ,

4 stars because the fries are legit! Hot and crispy and perfect amount of salt. It made the meal.
The sandwich was flat - the Cheetos were nonexistent and i got more honey then Buffalo - the chicken itself was crispy and moist so i would come back but order something else - maybe something more traditional.
Really wanted to like this place. Their signature sandwich was sad. A few shreds of cabbage, very thin chicken and undercooked fries.
Food was gross and service was worse. Would not do anything about me not liking my food. Completely ignored me and employees continued to use their cell phones.

This fast-food concept in LES is definitely poppin'!

My favorite meal to order is the BBQ Chick'n Pop Combo. It comes with a flavored chick'n pop of your choice, small fries, and a drink (and $1.50 extra for Boylan Soda).

The food has always been consistently flavorful and the portions are filling. It's a decent price too.

It's typically pretty quick to receive your order, depending on how busy they are. Even when they have been busy, I think the longest I've ever had to wait after ordering has maybe been 10 minutes or so.

I highly recommend eating here!

Hot tip: they have very limited seating available outside, so if you're looking for a place to sit down, I'd recommend going to the nearby Essex Market (just make sure to look up their hours).

I got the spicy chicken sandwich and it was really good! However it was the Chick 'N Pop that stole the show. When I saw it was like biting into a little piece of heaven, it's no joke. Disclaimer: all of our clothes smelled like grease from the deep frying, so personally recommend getting it to-go.

Not quite fast food, since it seems to be made-to-order.  But you still order at the counter and the limited on-site seating is very fast food like.  A good choice when you want a no frills quick meal option in Hell's Kitchen.

Classic Chicken Sandwich: Not quite like Popeye's and a bit pricier, but pretty solid for a local neighborhood spot.  The chicken was well seasoned and crispy, with a moist inside.  The potato bun was just the right texture to add some chewiness to the mix.  Only complaint would be that they should have used more pickles.

375° Hot Chicken Sandwich: Like the classic, but dunked in a hot sauce and covered in cheese.  The wet chili sauce did add some nice flavor complexity while the chicken still managed to stay crispy.  This is definitely a nice upgrade.

Fries: Pretty standard.

Samurai Sauce: Creamy and a little spicy.  Much more exciting dip for fries than ketchup.

This place was not even packed for the time or date it was was, I decided to place an order online and pick it up. My fiancé and I decided to it try it out of randomness. When we went to pick it up, it wasn't ready but I do think we came a bit early.  I asked the cashier if he knew around what time it would come out and he said four minutes. NOT EVEN FOUR MINUTES and the food came out almost a second later. I also purchased the strawberry milk shake and it was a lil too sweet but nonetheless delicious if you have a sweet tooth. THE CHICKEN, FLAVORFUL. MY FIANCÉ AND I COULD NOT FINISH IT CAUSE IT WAS TOO MUCH FOOD. Well seasoned and I will be coming again. 9.5/10

PB & J Chick'n Pop. EXCELLENT. Popcorn Chicken with a Grape Jelly glaze tasted AWESOME. A bit spicy but not hazardous. The thick and creamy Peanut Sauce provided separately in a small container could always cool down the slight heat. This is the BEST tasting Chicken I've ever had even though it's not Rotisserie, a Fillet or Tenders. RECOMMEND.

I really thought this place was going to blow my mind but it didn't. The flavors of the chicken were good but nothing new. The chicken could've been crispier and a bigger portion. Maybe I ordered wrong so I would try again but I was a bit disappointed.

Cuisine: 6
Service: 4
Decor: 7
Value: 7
Overall: 6

I really want to like this place. The menu is interesting, the decor was fun, but ultimately taste and service was its downfall for me.

What makes a good fried chicken sandwich?

1. Batter - This one was more crunchy, brittle and hard. See my picture how the batter falls off in chunks. Maybe the least enjoyable part of the sandwich. I was mostly eating the batter separately from the meat.

2. Chicken - This they got correct. Very tender and dripping with juices. Without the batter, the meat was a 10 and only reason why I would revisit this restaurant.

3. Bread - This was ok, though nothing special.

4. Condiments - The truffle flavor in my sandwich was barely existent, overpowered by the white cheddar. Other than that, the fried shallots and lettuce were fine.

The sandwich as a whole did not work. Maybe I would be willing to try the restaurant again, but that batter really bothers me a lot. Lol

Average experience deeming it 3/5 stars.

The first time i got the small nuggets which had great flavor but not the best crisp on them.

The second time i got the chicken sandwich which was a bit disappointing. Again, not crispy. Also, the flavor combo wasn't breathtaking and overall quite average. Would recommend other chicken sandwiches in the area over 375, but this place isn't that bad.

(This is a review I forgot to post from months ago so it might be outdated but all information below is my thoughts from when I had had it back then.

I've never tried the burgers at this spot so have zero idea how they hold up to the ones at the other location so this review is specific to the loaded fries and waffle menu items. If you see my updated review of the ludlow location, you'll see that I'm not very pleased with the burgers as I used to be.)

I'm so glad that they got indoor seating at this location because this food is the kind you need to sit down and enjoy. I so appreciated that these guys did not hold back with all the toppings on the Ludlow fries (I mean you're paying legit 10 bucks for fries so they better not but some places really do skimp. These guys do not thankfully!)

for anyone that is Muslim, the bacon is not halal, so be sure to request that it is removed from the ludlow fries.

The jalapeno waffle was soft and warm and the jalapeno sauce on top was delicious. The popcorn chicken was just okay. I wish it was juicier the way the chicken is in the sandwiches.

Incredible quality chicken sandwiches. The chicken was tender and cooked to perfection. The bun was soft, fresh and I loved the sauce. They weren't stingy with the pickles either--always a bonus. Overall great spot if you want quick fried chicken sandwiches that are guaranteed to be excellent.

Save yourself the time and just go to raising caines. The food here is just terrible! It's probs good if you're not sober but Fr tho this restaurant feels like a tourist trap. Tbh it's my bad for thinking there would be good fried chicken in HK.

We had this restaurant on our radar for a while so when we finally got the chance to try it out we were ecstatic. But. I will say. I may have expected too much lol. It's really just fried chicken tossed in a sauce. So I don't think I'd come back necessarily, but I do think it's worth a try! The chicken was very good but I don't really remember much on what I ordered specifically.

Small neighborhood chicken joint with some quality chicken! I got the Triple Truffle Fried Chicken Sandwich ($12), which was delicious with juicy chicken. The chicken was nicely fried to be crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The truffle and cheese flavor was unique and tasty. I also got the Sweet Chili Chick 'n Pop ($10), which had similar chicken to the sandwich with a nice sweet chili flavor. However, it would've been better if these chicken pieces were larger and a bit crispier. The prices here are in line with expectations.

The interior is quite small with only a couple of tables. The decor consists of white brick walls and an LED chicken sandwich sign. The service speed is okay, and the lady at the counter was average friendliness.

Overall, if you're in the mood for a chicken sandwich and want something a bit better than Chick-fil-a, then I think this would be a great spot for you.

I have walked by 375 a couple of times and finally popped in recently.  I am so glad I did.

The chicken and waffle are amazing. Spicy chicken was just like I like it.

The Strawberry n Loops milkshake was good.  It was really a strawberry milkshake with froot loops.  There were fruitloops at the top bit it was like they were ground in there and worked well.

I think this place was an unexpected pleasure.

Made a close to midnight run to this place based on a recommendation from a friend. Was not disappointed as the sandwich was delicious.  I took an order of the truffle chicken sandwich which was hot, juicy and very flavorful. The truffle did not overpower the friend chicken so there was a very good balance.

I wouldn't write home about the fries but they did the trick and complemented them with the garlic aioli dipping sauce.  

Do try this place if you are ever in the area.

I go here when I'm craving for fry food.
Their original sauce and French fries, very good.

Thanks, Stephen for getting back to me promptly regarding my food allergies inquiry. Woohoo, I finally popped my 375° Chicken 'n Fries cherry!

I came here today for lunch to try the Momma Mac sandwich. I told the cashier to take out the Buffalo-Honey Glaze because of my honey restriction. There are a few tables for indoor dining at this location so come early! The cashier verified my NYS Excelsior Pass and Photo Id then I sat down to wait for my food.

Luckily, the Momma Mac sandwich was still piping hot after my photoshoot. You must try this sandwich because it was so yummy. I absolutely loved the flavor profiles.

Great collaboration between 375° Chicken 'n Fries and China Mac to show support for his mom's cancer battle!

加油, Momma Mac you are a strong woman!

Follow China Mac
instagram.com/chinamac
chinamaconline.com

Interesting menu , never had the combination peanut , jelly bacon chicken sandwich. Chicken must have been just cooked it was served hot nice and crispy. I didnt really taste the jelly part but a good taste still.

Since landing in Hell's Kitchen I've ordered delivery twice from 375's second location. This Instagram-famous fast food joint serves up hot and delicious chicken sandwiches, popcorn chicken, and french fries. They prepare the food fast and it's always hot and crispy upon arrival.

The Nashville hot chicken sandwich is easily one of the best in the neighborhood. I also enjoyed the oh-so decadent Ludlow fries, topped with cheese sauce and an abundance of savory favorites like bacon and pickled jalapeños. Perfect for sharing with friends.

Then you've got the chicken bites (popcorn chicken). They've got a few different sauce options to suit your fancy; I liked the honey buffalo the most. The chicken pieces are super fresh and crispy, obviously cooked in clean oil. I'm not used to getting this level of quality food in such a generous portion size for such a reasonable price. The game has changed.

As if Hell's Kitchen didn't already boast some of the finest restaurants and bars in the city, 375 is holding it down and adding to the diversity of options in the neighborhood. Try it, 'gram it, gush about it on Yelp. This is the way.
Good chicken sandwich. The potato bread is great. Sops up the different sauces, yet the chicken is still crispy. The fries are on point.

With the quality of 375, I could eat here for 365 out of the year.

I ordered my meal online, but from what I've seen and heard this place looks very trendy and up to date with the interests of the youth. Bright, colorful, and attractive, which is a lot to admire. I ordered the Peanut Bacon n Jelly chicken sandwich with Ludlow fries for around $23.

The Ludlow fries were loaded with the typical cheese fry ingredients, but there were subtle differences that made this set of fries stand out to me. When it comes to what makes the cheese fries fundamentally enjoyable, this dish checks off all the boxes. Good quality cheese, satisfying portions of protein (which was what I believe to be bacon in this case), and the jalapeños with scallions garnished the fries pretty well. What stood out to me was the quality of the fries themselves. They didn't get too soggy under the sauces, which had great flavor on their own and agreed very nicely with the other ingredients. Each fry held a good amount of potato and the outside was particularly crispy, which I loved. Against the abundance of cheeses and sauces, the texture of the fries was memorable to say the least.

When it comes to the chicken sandwich, I was a bit skeptical with the whole PB&J idea but I'm so happy I took the chance. The peanut mayo is very potent and it gave a beautiful earthly undertone to the sweetness of the jelly and the largely seasoned flavor of the chicken. The soft bun also helped with providing some extra texture to the tender bite of the chicken and holding all the sauces together. There's certainly some creative initiative on this sandwich and I wish they made them bigger! All the more reason to go back for another one.

Overall, this is definitely a place that should be on your list of places to visit. A handful of friends recommended this place to me and I see exactly why.

The chicken pops were good, but not as good like people make it seem. The garlic chicken sandwich was flavorful just chicken was really thin. Over my favorite was the truffle fries. If I went again I will go just for the truffle fries.

Tried this place for the first and last time. First off the guy at the register acts like he does not want to work there. He's better off working at an MTA booth with his attitude. Inattentive and had his AirPods on. I had to repeat myself several times when ordering. Later I came back to ask for more napkins. He was looking at his phone and wasn't paying attention and had to ask again what I wanted.

The food itself was ok. But my stomach felt terrible after. Later found out I got food poisoning. I wish I checked how well cooked the chicken was. It was the only thing I ate that day.

Place looked appealing enough to stop in and try the food. But service and food quality was extremely disappointing.

Great chicken sandwiches. And their loaded fries are worth getting.
A little on the salty side bc of how much sauce they put on everything.

I realize this might not vibe with the idea of a fast food establishment, but they should really consider doing salads with their chicken poppers on top. I took leftovers home and made a salad with my honey BBQ poppers and I didn't even need extra dressing bc their sauces were just that flavorful. Would recommend trying for anyone who wants a touch of health.

I've gotten food from here several times and the pb&j chicken pops and the truffle fries are my favorite. I love the truffle mayo. However, last time I came to pick up my food I saw the B health score rating on the window, mostly hidden by a sign. Now I'm nervous about eating here again until they get an A. I don't know why they got a B but hope they are working towards getting an A so I can eat here again.

First time customer won't be my last very delicious chicken different types of levels of spices I've got the Nashville hot very delicious with a side of fries could have been better but in the end very delicious food
Love the food and service is good too, only thing is they don't have seating, but it's a great place to grab and go!

Ordered delivery and it arrived promptly and was correct. Got the classic sandwhich and sweet chili chick n pop! Both were very good, the sandwich had a lot of sauce and so did the pop chicken. Not too greasy or heavy feeling but I was definitely full. Heavily breaded the way I like but plenty of chicken to bite into. Will have to eat inside sometime soon. Was not disappointed!

Ordered delivery from 375 on several occasions and it is consistently delicious! The popcorn chicken is my go-to, all of the flavors are good you can't go wrong. I prefer to order them with the secondary sauce on the side (for instance the bbq sauce with the ranch on the side, rather than drizzled). This helps maintain the crisp and personally I just don't like my chicken toooo saucy. Same applies for ordering the chicken sandwiches, get one of the sauces on the side to preserve the integrity of the sandwich. A game changer especially for delivery.
The delivery is so fast and they always get the order correct. Huge props to them for being so consistently on point.
Also, pro tip, I loveee their fries. Just the plain. When you order a large, they just fill a paper bag with fresh crispy fries. Heaven!

The popcorn chicken is perfect, I could eat it every day. The sandwiches are also perfect in their own way, but messy and decadent - I probably couldn't do more than one a month, as a special treat. If you're looking to splurge and to try flavor combinations that you won't find anywhere else (PB & J & bacon, the combo that killed Elvis), definitely stop in.

Also, thanks for clueing me in to China Mac!
I felt like it was a typical chicken spot. I may have gotten a bad batch of the popcorn chicken because it was mushy. I do like the spice of the BBQ sauce on it.

I was so hyped up for 375 chicken n fries! I ordered the Buffalo and honey pops and a couple bites in I found something plastic like in my food! Not too much of a problem because I also ordered the Classic chicken sandwich! But was also a little disappointed that the breading didn't stay on the chicken. All in all i think the chicken was better than some of the places that were out here that I've tried (not to mention any names but sticky's - unpopular opinion?)
If I were to be in a concrete jungle where dreams are made of I would eat a chicken sandwich here

My husband  and I found this place after ice skating. We ordered the honey bbq chick pops . At home we call it popcorn chicken ,lol . The pops came with Sriracha mayo sauce . We also added the comeback sauce . Both were flavorful. The fries filled half our bag which made sharing even more better . Customer service A1 ! Check em out

I was actually astounded by this place. We got deliver and it was delicious so I can only imagine what it tastes like right from the back. This is definitely a "5-star for its category" kind if meal, it is 100% fast food, but worth every cent. Lots of option, I would pass on the spicy loaded fries (Ludlow Fries) again, they were too spicy for me, and my sandwich was filling on its own, but my roommate didn't hate them.

Let's talk about the chicken sandwich here. The chicken itself is a bit thin; flavor is good with different options but the coating is not crunchy like poppeys, it's soaked in the sauce so it take away the texture of deep fried. I personally feel like there are too much sauce for so little flavor. The potato buns are soft and fresh but when they packed it tight it all smashed together. I was dining in not even for take away. The fries on the other hand is crunchy; the truffle Mayo was really great. Love the strong truffle taste.

Honestly amazing chicken sandwiches! I was blown away by how good it was. I had been craving a spicy chicken sandwich, and this more than satisfied that craving. Aside from the chicken sandwiches being really tasty, the truffle parmesan fries were also a pleasant surprise. I was a little suspicious of what truffle fries from a fast food joint would look and taste like, but they were actually pretty good! I'd definitely go back the next time I need some cravings satisfied!

My friend and I love fried chicken spots, so we were pretty excited to try this one. The spot is cute and clean, and not too far from Times Square. A nice walk. We got the Buffalo honey chicken popcorn and the classic chicken sandwhich. The popcorn chicken was delicious. It was nice and saucy, juicy, and hot. However, the sandwhich was so disappointing. The breading wasn't even sticking to the chicken, it lacked flavor, and was basically on some cold bread. If you're a chicken place, your chicken should be able to taste good without all the sauces. This was not it. I wouldn't recommend except for the popcorn chicken.

I normally use more sophisticated adjectives, but this place is AWESOME. I am in love with the savory honey garlic chicken sandwich and the truffle mayo sauce oozing over their amazing hot fries. I happen to be a nighttime eater, and I love a friendly kitchen staff at 11pm. From the outside, it may not look like much, but it rocks. The food was so bomb that I am still thinking about it the next day!!!!

375 is always timely with service and has the best fried chicken in the area. You can tell that the ingredients are top notch quality from the freshness of the chicken. I got the honey and garlic sandwich and the bbq chicken pops. Both of them hit home with full flavor. I'm a big eater but even I was full after eating both.

This place is great!

Tucked away on 9th ave, it's a small, but brightly lit shop with the usual character of a new-age fast-casual joint. Came here on a Sunday evening and the staff was nice enough as they took our order.

We ordered the buffalo chicken pops and it was surprisingly good! The food was tender and flavorful, the exterior maintaining its crisp. There were a few other items on the menu including the spicy chicken sandwich and the truffle chicken sandwich that looked pretty appetizing and will be next on my list to try from this place!

Will be back! This place is a def try.

The food here is great. They have some interesting options as far as the menu goes. They are pretty quick here as far as making the order goes. The restaurant is pretty small so there isn't really much seating or a lot of room to wait
great place for a quick snack, staff is really friendly and food is great, also the pastries are delicious!

The delivery on door dash is fast, they don't add condiments when asked to add butter for the toast or ketchup. The drink size is literally the same size so don't waste your money getting/paying for a 20oz. The food is good tho, i would order again just make sure you have your own condiments like ketchup and butter, jelly, etc
Mold on the Napoleon and nothing tasted good except a bagel with cream cheese. Definitely would not recommend this place.

I ordered a chicken quesadilla, BEC on everything bagel, potato salad, and macaroni salad from here - everything was ready when I arrived for pick up. I really liked the macaroni salad and the potato salad - they tasted really fresh and I inhaled those after arriving home. The chicken quesadilla was not bad, and I'm glad they included salsa and sour cream. The bacon/egg/cheese I saved for the next morning, but it was delicious like a classic bodega BEC. Staff were very friendly here.

Visited for smoothies and a few bags of chips, so I'll try the sandwiches and other food in the future. Anyways, only positive experiences from each visit - the person working the POS counter was friendly, fresh fruits were used, extra smoothie was poured into a second cup (free), and the total time in-and-out was short and convenient.

Sofwan Qaid's 7 Brothers Famous Deli in Hell's Kitchen is the official #YangGang Bodega HQ! You have to try their Chop Cheese and pick up Andrew Yang's Green Tea & Bananas!

If you haven't seen Yang's two tweets from 7 brothers you are in for a treat.

Here during Covid to drop my daughter at college . Ordered for delivery . Got a panini (minus the meat and added extra veggies to make it vegetarian.

Around $8 fro panini , a drink a chips ! Food arrived quickly and hot !

Loads of options from hot foods to smoothies/juices to snacks you would normally find at a deli. Location is convenient and store is kept clean even late at night! Prices are higher than grocery chain stores, but understandable due to small business and low supply. Owners/workers are friendly as well!

They are great if you go in, but do not order online. I visit this deli often because it is a few blocks from my apt, and have good options. I usually order the same exact thing. Chicken Cesar Salad & a pint of ice cream. When I come into the deli it's always great, but now for the 3rd time I've ordered online I've gotten a legit half bowl of the salad & it's $7.  Three ingredients Lettuce, Chicken, Croutons, takes all of 45 seconds to put in a bowl and mix, & they consistently rip you off unless you are there to watch them. POOR QUALITY.
The restaurant worker called me threatening that he knew my address and was sending someone over. I have filed a police report. Do not order from this establishment.

I ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwich in a spinach wrap, an iced coffee with almond milk, and  slice of the carrot cake. The delivery was earlier than expected and the wrap was hot. Everything was packed nicely. There was no straw for my iced coffee. The carrot cake was okay, but I've had way better at Sweet in Hoboken. So I won't be ordering that again. Expensive for just ok. Didn't taste great and icing was very soft. The bacon egg and cheese spinach wrap was delicious!! I'd order that again. Worth it. Bacon was perfectly salty. The cheese melted to the egg and the wrap. Egg cooked perfect. The iced coffee was also just ok. I like that they have almond milk as an option. You pay for what you get here.
My bagel order arrived wrong but my imported chocolate looked like it was 150 years old

Horrible experience, waited close to an hour for my delivery, just to get a call from the delivery guy saying he couldn't find my hotel. I called the delivery guy 5 times to get no answer, even called the store & the cashier responded "I don't know where he is he's not answering" I Ended up having to walk 6 blocks to pick up & upon arrival I realized the sandwiches I ordered were extremely cold so I asked if they could be remade the cashier gave me a nasty look and replied "i could give you a refund instead" in a vicious tone of voice, absolutely horrible customer service. To make matters worse she had her mask below her nose during a global pandemic, this is unacceptable, I advise everyone to stay away from this establishment.
Had to throw away my chicken fingers after one bite. And I absolutely love chicken fingers.
Solid deli with reasonable prices, quickly becoming my go-to for an inexpensive salad. Ingredients appear to be fairely fresh and there's never a line, which meets most of my requirements.

I went to Seven Brothers to grab a quick lunch, and overall, it's just a normal deli that doesn't really stand apart from any of the other ones.

I will say that they have a wide selection of offerings, from paninis to sandwiches to salads. The Cordon Bleu panini that I had was just OK and wasn't really packed with cheese like it should be.

Prices on the rest of the stuff like drinks are a bit more than the supermarkets, but it's important to shop local.

Don't bother. Wrong orders delivered, phones not answered, incomplete orders and cold food. So many other mediocre options to choose from in the neighborhood. Choose any other options. My last outreach to the store through delivery.com included the employee hanging up.

Does this look like a bacon cheeseburger to you?
Monica makes the Best smoothies and fresh juices! Ask her to make your fresh juice into a slushy!!!!! It's the best!!! Especially in this heat wave!!!

Only 1 star because of the girl in the morning.  The guys are GREAT AT NIGHT! I've complained and complained about her. She tries to build herself in a tip buy charging 50cents for a plastic bag (she doesn'tring it into the register, she's been there so long, she know the prices, so she gives a verbal receipt), she's inattentive even when it's not even busy, and her attitude is HORRIBLE. She's miserable! She's lucky to have a job even so many amenable, hospitable,happy people need jobs.

The woman at the cash register is not wearing a mask and they are literally located right next to an urgent care Covid testing center. When she saw I was clearly uncomfortable and I mentioned something she still did not put on a mask and she rolled her eyes.

Good neighborhood deli to get a quick bite to eat, some snack or lite groceries.  The fruit bowl ($5) was good but the croissants were dry and stale tasting when we came here.  Got a cappuccino here for $2 but it was from one of those machines and not freshly made and too sweet.  Better to go down 49th to the Starbucks if you want a fresh croissant and cappuccino.

7 Brothers is a quality bodega with great variety. I ordered a bbq chicken hero and they did not skimp on the meat, cheese, or most importantly bbq sauce! Compared to others in the area its one of the better spots

I love this deli. great selection of sandwiches and drinks, also they really don't skimp on the meat!! they consistently will put so much pastrami on my sandwiches without me even having to ask. it's amazing

Best deli in Hell's Kitchen. PERIOD. Has always been my go-to, and everything I've ever ordered off their menu has been amazing. The staff is always super nice, and the food is great! Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area!

Foods great. Love the staff..my little guy always gets love when we go there. Weekday mornings  you're sure to come across lines when ordering breakfast, but those guys back there are so efficient you're out of there in no time!  I wonder how they do they do it at times. Thank you!

THIEVES! Will look you in the eye and argue advertised and displayed prices while charging you more! I've never witnessed such blatant thievery!

Ordered two small 16oz juices, clearly advertised right behind the counter at one price, guy rings up another price and then proceeds to tell me that the price that's advertised behind him is for the smoothies ... and the price for the smoothies to the right of that is for ... wait for it ... smoothies. It turns out that fresh juice comes in two forms, squeezed and squished ... yeah, I know, right?!?!

In any case, I don't care so much about the couple of dollars, but do care about being robbed!

BEWARE!!!
The guy at the counter making sandwiches doesn't listen.  He's rude and I'm done coming here.  A lot of competition in HK to have a jerk treating people the way thus guy does.

After having a few at Mickey Spillane's, we headed across the street to get some food as they're open 24/7!

THE DELI:
It's a convenience store & deli.  They sell burgers, tons of deli sandwiches, as well as  liquor & beer.  I'm not sure what time the liquor sales stop but I purchased beet at 1:30am.

FOOD:
California Panini - They're per made and refrigerated.  Chicken, avocado, mozzarella cheese & ranch dressing.  Flavor was good, price was $7.

Egg Salad Sandwich - This thing needed salt and more mayo.  The eggs were roughly chopped and piled high on the bread of your choice, but was so bland.  Pass.

SERVICE:
Fast & friendly.

OVERALL:
Pretty good food, huge menu, and open 24/7.

This place is really hit or miss. What I do not like about 7 Brothers Deli is that their prices go up-and-down depending on the person who is behind the counter.

Their subs, at $8 a piece are very expensive. The guys behind the counter and friendly and quick and I would recommend if your in the area and need a fast bite to eat. They have no sitting area so you will have to take the food to a park near-by.

Ordering over the phone, good luck! I only tried it once and my order was wrong!
I've tried it twice now and there's not a sandwich there that isn't incredibly dry. I also got the cheesecake and it tasted spoiled. Do not recommend.

The people who work here during the day are super nice. I've been here multiple times from 11 PM -the early AM and they change the prices immensely. Food is fine at best depending on what you get. DONT buy beer or alcohol from here after 11 pm, as the guys who work then will overcharge and overtax. Is a 40 ounce of beer at 7 Brothers $4.99 or $6.99?? I'll never know because it changes every day. Pounders they charge $3.50 during the day and $5 from 11 pm on. A real s**t show of a deli if you ask me.

For the first time looks so nice and clean . But the burger they cooked was like stone and disappointed very very much. I ordered and was in a rush so I picked up and left. Than few minutes later I realized that it's impossible to eat ;(((((( so just pay attention when you get your meal. Will not go there anymore

My go to deli for quick delivery (probably more times than I'd like to admit) for literally everything from a hangover breakfast, really good fresh juices,  ordering paper towels when I'm too lazy to leave the house. Every time I have ordered delivery they have been much quicker than the delivery estimate and orders have always been perfect!

This place is so good I almost don't want to write a review so I can keep it my secret! I lived in the nabe for many years and while there are many NY delis - this is hands down my favorite. They've got great, fresh food, smoothies, and the best paninis EVER. (Seriously...EVER).
Super reasonably priced, especially factoring how close they are to the theater district! They're even complete with a bodega cat (it's shy though).
Like I said, I used to live close by, but now that I live over a hundred blocks away? I still drop by for the chipotle panini. So good!

Wowwwwwww just had the worst Super Bowl food delivery of my life tell me how I'm here waiting for my order so the waiting game begins 1 hour passes by I'm like okay understandable is the super bowl they probably loaded 2 hours passes by and I'm now my mind is in disbelief the food taking really long.. so I decide to call the deli and this AH tells me that I had the wrong number that they attempted to deliver the order but couldn't get in touch and that they disposed it now and to call Grubhub and clicked on me, don't buy here they are scammers this happened with the night shift Sundays 11pm NEGATIVE 5 stars. BUY FROM 5 brothers way faster and accurate
This is by far one of my favorite bodegas in nyc! Great food and great prices, always ready when I get there, and never mistakes :)
The perfect neighborhood deli! They have everything you need with fast delivery and great food. We always order bagel sandwiches and they're always spot on.

This place used to be amazing! BUT! Things changed since a new guy is working there, he's unbelievable terrible, 1.- I called for delivery, I waited 40 mins & called back & he said they don't have a delivery guy, SO, why he didn't tell me since the start? Or at least call me to let me know? 2.- when I go to the store He rush me, he didn't make me find what I was looking for, he makes me nerves, he screams laud to the other workers, that man is crazy, my friend & husband told me the same thing. This store used to b awesome but since that man is there is horrible service.

Love there burgers, Chicken cutlet and Smoothies!
I order for pick up and they always call me to confirm the order. Which is great!

We were desperate for some cheap late night delivery. The curly fries were good, the bagel and lox was top notch, but the chop sandwich wasn't anything to try again. Overall, a decent place if you want something quick and love a good bagel and lox.

BEWARE!!
After numerous transactions here I have witnessed a substantial and wide ranging theft of customers.  On more than one occasion (closer to every other time I go in - more than 7/8 times) items purchased are not rung up and a ridiculous total is given.  When you bring it to the attention of the cashier (multiple cahiers)  they will laugh it off as an honest mistake and give you a different quote more in line (while still not ringing anything up). This has been so blatant I'm honestly shocked this has never come up before. If this has happened to anyone else please verify and add your complaint

I order from this place a lot either for pick up if I'm on my way home or delivery if I'm too lazy for pickup.

I use grubbing/seamless for delivery. They have a great selection of deli items on the menu, even brownies and ice cream  

If you order something they are out of, the store guy will give you a call for a substitute (most of the time)

There has been a few occasions where I did not get a call for substitutes they sent something different which I either keep or refuse and send back. A little inconvenient when they don't call but it is what it is.

I would have given this place a better rating if the delivery was better, to the owners I suggest 1) always call for substitutes when you're out of something and 2) if the delivery guy did not show up, call the person who ordered and let them know

Sandwich was more like a panini but still good, it came with a can if soda and bag of chips which was great. Had i known i wouldn't have purchased another drink. For the price payed overall very satisfied.

Their delivery is a joke. They forgot to make my order, then after calling to check on my order they failed to deliver it. Instead of calling the contact phone number on the order for me to pick it up in the lobby, they turned around and left with my order because security wouldn't let then up (no shit! hence giving a contact number).

Unless you like to wait 3 hours for an order to not be delivered and not even be told about it, don't bother. There's plenty of other delis to order from in NYC

Last minute party order for New Year day.
Call the guys told them what I needed for the next day. An it was there fresh and delicious
Seeing I was low on food called on New Year's Day and was able to add to my order
Everything fresh and fast delivery
Thank you guys for adding a great time to a new year

I had the turkey club panini.  Decent amount of turkey and nicely spiced with pepper jack cheese. My son had their seafood salad and he said it was good. Overall, not a bad sandwich for the price and the store was very clean. Nice.

placed order on delivery.com with clear simple instructions that could not be followed. When I called the deli to inform them my order was not followed correctly the guy was extremely rude and proceeded to argue with me. food sucked I have made better eggs at home. avoid wasting your money with these idiots!

Average deli. Clean, cheap prices. I work nearby so I've picked up both breakfast and lunch on many occasions. Took stars off because some of the guys who work there aren't super friendly, and sometimes the breakfast sandwiches are burnt

As I walked around Hell's Kitchen looking for lunch with my good friend and colleague Indecision,  I happened upon 7 Brothers Famous Deli. "Sure", I say.

As soon as my eyes came to rest upon the wraps menu, my mind was made up. Right there in big bold black letters read "TURKEY CLUB WITH BACON AND CHEESE--$5.95". Remember this. It'll be on the final.

I place my order and in no time my wrap was awaiting payment. I grabbed a bag of funyuns (right??) and proceeded to pay.

"$8.17".

Wait. $5.95, plus like $1 for the chips equals $6.95, throw on a little tax and that's like NOT $8.17. Reluctantly I handed over my cash. After all, math was never my strong point and maybe those chips cost $2...NO! No this isn't right! So I inquire. Here's how THAT went down:

Me: Wasn't the wrap $5.95? How is it over $8?

Cashier (C): No, wrap is $6.95.

Me: But the menu right there clearly says $5.95...

C: No. The turkey alone is $6. You had bacon and cheese.

Me: BUT the MENU states (and i read it out to him) "TURKEY CLUB WITH BACON AND CHEESE--$5.95"

C: It's $5.95 on a roll only.

Me: What?? But it's listed right there with the wraps. It doesn't say rolls. It says wraps. (Mind you, this is a completely separate board that says wraps, not one of those confusing boards with everything on it that you have to deduce. This is clear as day).

C: Sorry. Turkey alone is $6.

Frustrated with this man's clear ignorance and greed, I decided the situation wasn't worth the extra $1 I was being robbed.

Luckily, the wrap was quite good, but nowhere near good enough to deal with annoying delis like this. 7 Brothers, if you need that extra dollar so bad, you can keep it, but you won't be getting another cent out of me.

Hands down - this is the best deli in HK. Prices are cheap, food is phenomenal. Their cold-cut sandwiches are so god damn good... I recommend the Smoked Turkey w/ everything on a roll- 5$.

KEEP IT UP I LOVE YOU GUYS

I had never Vegan Chili Tacos before I did enjoy them. I would suggest adding something to them to give it a little bit more diverse texture. I loved the Vegan Cauliflower Bites they were perfectly crispy and the sauce was delicious. Also, the vegan cauliflower bites are on the happy hour menu, they were 1/2 off. I appreciate it have finally chopped everything was in the Asian Crunch Salad. I could tell the ingredients were really fresh.

The server we got was a little bit awkward, and didn't believe that we were all over the age of 21 once we had shown our IDs. He kind of made a scene about it. That being said there was no wait to be seated and the food came to us quick.

We went pretty early because we were seeing a show that night on broadway.
Food was good...came out fast, burgers were exactly as described. Very messy. The onion rings were excellent.
We sat outside, which as expected in NYC was quite loud, and great people watching.
Waiter was friendly and efficient.
The bathrooms were clean, and had the hand washing station outside the bathroom, which I actually like...easier access to the sinks/soap before eating, and after...no need to enter the bathroom.

I met one of my friends for lunch here it was our first time. What attracted us was the 2 for 1 mimosas. We ordered a round, hot wings, the onion ring tower and Parmesan truffle loaded fries. As my friend went to serve herself the fries there was a long hair embedded in the cheese. GROSS!! We immediately informs the waitress who neither apologized or rectify the situation. The way it was handled seemed to be as this is something normal. Then she has the manager come over to take the payment from us which I didn't understand either. As the manager he also didn't address the hair that was in the food. Needless to say I won't be back and do better with your customer service!

*UPDATE*

I tried calling the phone number 212-575-2277 provided by the GM however, it is not in service. So I don't believe they take these matters seriously. Enough said! As I stated I will never patronize this place again due to their lack of customer service skills.

I don't know why locals hate on this place so much. It is a very solid spot that you can also always walk into. Prices are generally a tad under many of its competitors. I will say the atmosphere is more "nice diner" like than classy restaurant, but it's still a great spot for a quick bite.

Staff is almost always friendly. You occasionally get a tough server, but that's rare. Noise level is moderate. Outdoor seating along 9th ave.

Can't go wrong with any of the burgers, but I will say that they do tend to be a bit salty. My favorite has Swiss cheese and caramelized onions. Would not recommend the wings there. They consistently miss on those.

My favorite thing though it's their Greens and Grains salad. Then I add salmon. Ends up being like $26 bucks, but salmon is always excellent, and the salad is a healthy (big) size.

Good service but the burger was just "okay". Never liked the grilled onions.

The restaurant has a nice layout, although it's a bit noisy. Lots of seating outside too.

Staff are very friendly.

Heard a lot about how they have one of New York City's best burgers so I had to go in and try.

CLASSIC FIVE NAPKIN BURGER
The meat was definitely melt in your mouth, and buns were soft, but nothing to write home about. It was quite gooey and cheesy, and the meat was very moist. Unfortunately, for quite the pricey burger, it does not come with fries, and we had to order it separately. I would say that, while this was a pretty good burger, I would be hard-pressed to call it New York City's best burger. In addition, if you're not a fan of overly greasy food, this may not be for you.

The sweet potato fries and onion rings were good, but nothing to write home about. If burgers are your thing, you should def come check this place out and check it off your list. It is definitely a great burger in New York city.

Delicious happy hour!!

They also have happy hour on Sun - Thurs from 9 pm to close. We got so much delicious food for a great price! The food came out pretty quickly, hot, and fresh. The 5 napkin burger was not part of the happy hour menu, but WOW was it juicy and delicious. The garlic aioli was so flavorful and the carmelized onions have such a great touch.

The service was fantastic. Our waiter was so attentive and he made sure we were doing great. It was lively in the restaurant, so shocked because it was a Tuesday night! All seats were taken at 9 pm all the way to closing.

Would definitely recommend coming here!!

5 star burger spot! Two of us had a sidewalk table lunch so we could watch the world go by. We each had different burgers and we also got the charred broccoli. All were excellent. Everything was made even better by Teal, our server, who helped guide us and was very friendly,  prompt and attentive.

This is one of my favorite restaurants to visit every time I'm in NYC. I typically come here for dinner because the burgers are so good; but due to time constraints on this trip, we went for brunch. I did make a reservation because I knew this was a popular spot and I'm so glad I did.

When we got there we were immediately seated. We were starving and excited for good food. I knew I wanted the pancake breakfast but couldn't resist the opportunity to have the Parmesan truffle fries. OMG THEY WERE EVERYTHING! I also saw that they had mimosas 2 for $10 and obviously had to indulge. They were scrumptious. My boyfriend opted for the breakfast burger and said it was awesome.
