I have been here before and had different appetizers as well as shakes and I have found that everything on the menu is delightful. The restaurant is fun, does have TVs at the bar for sports, seating isn't too close to others and has a cool vibe.

I will definitely return on my next trip!

After a day of walking, we don't want to venture too far for dinner. Found this place on Yelp and able to reserve a table at 8:30pm at 6pm on Sunday night.  Wasn't too sure since we could still get tables at a decent time this late on Sunday.  But, I am also thankful that I could get a table. I am sure you know what I mean.

Onto the Resturant review!!  We have Ally as our server. She is super nice and helpful. 5/5

Onion ring tower - 5/5

Korean BBQ wings - 1/5. It's way too salty. It only have 6 wings for the four of us.  We didn't finish it.

Truffle burger - 5/5. I really enjoy it.

Cheddar bacon burger - 4/5. Kiddo thinks it's just ok.

Special burger - pastrami burger - hubby thinks it's 4/5. He gave me 1/3 to trade half of my truffle burger.  I think it's 1/5 as the pastrami is too dry.  I had one bite and gave the rest back to him.  So sad he has already finished my truffle burger. There is no opportunity to reverse the trade.  

We also got an order of fries which is fairly standard. Kids
also got black and white shake 5/5 and cookies and cream shake 4/5 (way too sweet)

Overall, it's a nice meal and it definitely fits our burger craving!

Got the patty melt! Very Delicious. Inside was clean, clean bathrooms, staff was super friendly. sides (french fries and mac and cheese were average). Highly recommend the patty melt! Would go back for it! Would love to go back sometime soon for an updated review.

A friend and I came here specifically for the Trinibad Burger by Chef Picky. It was available only during Caribbean Heritage Month (June 2023). The burger was DELICIOUS. Literally unlike any burger I've ever had. I think the tamarind added a flavor that I've never experienced before in a burger. I had mine medium and it was perfect. The cheese was melted just right. I hope they'll decide to make it a permanent part of the menu, or at the very least, bring it back again. The tamarind ketchup on the side was also divine. At $18.50 for just the burger (no fries, no sides) it's pricey but the taste helps make up for the price tag. The watermelon margarita was also very good.

I know there are soooooo many burger spots to choose from. Especially spots that are not close to the theater district. However, sometimes you just want consistency and 5 napkin stays consistent!!

I always sit at the bar when I come. The bartenders are usually very pleasant and make a pretty good cocktail. Other staff that I've encountered have also been equally nice.

In terms of food I usually get the 5N patty melt, with fries and onion rings to share.

You seriously can't go wrong w/ this place.

Great American restaurant with tasty burgers and other American classics. I ordered the Truffle Burger ($19.50), which was very high quality- cooked to a nice medium as requested, with perfectly melted white American cheese. The mushrooms were tender and good, and there were also some nice crispy chips in there to add some crunch. There was not that much of a truffle flavor though. The price is a bit elevated for a burger, but I suppose that's what a lot of other higher end American restaurants are charging too.

In addition to the burger, I ordered a Cookies n' Cream Shake ($9 for a non-boozy version), which was delicious. It was thick (in a good way) but still creamy and easy to drink with a straw. There were lots of tiny cookie bits in there, with classic whipped cream and a cherry on top.

The place has a classic nice American restaurant kind of vibe. It is pretty large with lots of seating, although very busy and lively even on a weeknight. Despite this, we were able to get a table with no reservation (probably would need to get a reservation or wait on a weekend day though). The staff are friendly and attentive, and the service speed was pretty good.

Overall, 5 Napkin Burger is a solid option for quality American classics. It seems to always be very busy around dinnertime, and rightfully so.

Amazing food, burgers were made ask requested, crispy fries and cold beer.
We sat outside and enjoyed the cool evening weather, each table has a small heat lamp to keep you warm. This is a must have, don't miss it!

The main downside is the service..... not only they mess up with my order. Beer was not fresh.
But when I mentioned that the food is wrong - onion rings doesn't not sounds like Mac and cheese . And my husband ordered completely different burger
the server -( I assume his name -Liam)
Has came up with attitude face ....
Common u made a mistake - or kitchen whatever. Just say sorry and fix it ... it's good that that manager or whoever it was showed up
But the biggest plus was the food - excellent truffle burger & fries . Perfection

In a nutshell:
The still popular burger joint that does not fail when it comes to flavors, BUT, service and experience are NO consistent.

THE BAD
Rainy Friday night at 7:00 PM at this point, if you want a table you must wait for 15-20 by the bar, no problem because by the time I came from the restrooms, the table was ready for me. Shortly after, a couple was sitting next to me and we both were waiting awhile for at least a glass of tap, while one scans the menu. The waiter showed up, she nicely answered a question regarding the Vegan chili over fries. She was "that's it?" Perhaps she was expecting me to eat more or spend more but I didn't think much about it until after the passing of time, I notice she was a transactional type of server.

At this point, I've lost count of how many times I've come here, and as my former review shows, and yet a waiter that often works with me ignores me. At first, I thought he is just busy or thinking about, he is just looking straight ahead but at least three times that was where I was in his peripheral vision pretending I was not sitting there. Maybe is the frozen margarita that is skewing my perception but other than being annoying, but just strikes me odd someone who appears to be nice and smiles would go a 180 degrees change without any reason whatsoever. Experience-wise, I felt a downgrade, even if everything else was well done. Even with the mediocre service, after I tipped and had my coat I wanted to say thank you and she was like, you can leave the check at the table is fine. And I am OK, no problem, this was just a transaction for you. Bye.

THE GOOD
You get consistency in the food, which is excellent! A ROUND OF APPLAUSE TO THE KITCHEN! Busy or not, the flavor, texture, and temperature are just beautiful! I did have to add salt to the Vegan Chili-Cheese Crinkle Fries because if there's a good vice to have is to salt to the perfect point. Actually, the salt DID bring the flavors together, because unless you LOVE bland food the right point of salt makes it YUM! The Frozen Margarita with Volcanic salt at the rim tasted pretty good, even if the presentation was fugly...

THE BEST
There is this tall lady, in her 50s, the one who brought me water (not my waiter, this time) and then always kept refilling. This lady, was so attentive, removing plates or if an object was obstructing, she would go ahead and take it out of the way. I mean, I truly hope that the tipping structure in this restaurant is pool based because I tipped focusing more on what she did to make things perfect. Something I truly appreciated from this lady, is seeing in her semblance an acknowledgment that "I've been there before", so THANK YOU!

5 Napkin Burger is straight up good! With multiple super nice locations and a sizable menu, this burger destination really does it all. With spectacular drinks and even better burgers, I was very happy with everything I tried! Definitely deserving of its recognition as a staple burger stop in NYC!!

Good vibes, welcoming atmosphere, food was ok. Ordered the 5 napkin burger which was rather messy and overloaded with rosemary aioli and gruyere cheese. The patty was pretty average on flavor. Also ordered the onion rings and sweet potato fries which were good. Probably would not return

During a quick overnight trip to NYC to see the tree and the Rockettes, we we were looking for a dinner spot that was low key but also would give us a good meal. Knowing that Hell's Kitchen has all the good restaurants, we found 5 Napkin Burger. With a family of burger lovers, this was perfect.

We had reservations but after spending some time in Times Square we decided we were looking to get out of the cold and off our feet sooner than we expected so we went to the restaurant to see if they could squeeze us in early (an hour early). Fully prepared to be told no, we were pleasantly surprised when they made it work! I ordered the 5N Burger as I had read a bunch of reviews recommending it. To me it was okay. Gruyère cheese is a bit mild and it was messy. Not just from the cheese but the burger was greasy. It had an overall sweetness to it. I don't regret ordering it. I guess I just had higher hopes given the great reviews I'd read.

My husband got the Bacon Cheddar burger. Sadly, he didn't like his as much. He said it was too greasy for him and no sauce of any kind just had him underwhelmed. My son got the regular cheeseburger. He enjoyed his but again, would have liked to have some sort of sauce. Was dry (other than grease) without it.

My daughter got the kids crispy ranch chicken and OMG! It was so good! You could tell the chicken had been freshly breaded and fried. It was nice and flaky. They cut the fillet into pieces like tenders and provided ranch for dipping. The ranch was on point! If the chicken sandwiches on the main menu are made this way I think I'll choose that next time!

Service was great, the ambiance was causal yet hip. It was a really nice vibe/spot. And just fine for a family. Oh, and the roasted pineapple margarita was pretty tasty!

Overall we will definitely give this place another chance. A couple of our orders were misses this time, but that doesn't mean they all will be.

I do not have to complain. Environment is very cool and staff very friendly.
This was the best spinach dip I've eaten, the crispy Parmesan on top was delicious.
Truffle burger was amazing, we add a egg and bacon, spot on!
The original burger was very good, juicy and delicious.
The 5 Napkin Burger is one to die for. Probably the juiciest burger I've ever had. Make sure to have a reservation ahead of time, as it gets quite busy during dinner time.

My mother was in town for mothers day weekend. We went to the #Bridgerton ball experience on Mother's Day and didn't want to walk too far for food afterwards. We were both craving burgers, so I pulled up yelp to find the nearest spot that had gluten free & vegetarian bites. I called to double check and the person on the line was awesome! They knew exactly what I was talking about (celiacs).

We got there and were seated very fast. The decor is super cute (except the meat hooks on the ceiling! Scared us a bit! But then again, we were tipsy lol)

We had an absolutely AMAZING waiter! Even though he was def busy with the late night show crowd he chatted with us & gave us great menu recommendations. Totally elevated an already amazing evening.

Prices are also excellent (esp for drinks) in Hells Kitchen.

I super recommend if you're in the area for theater, sports, concert events etc...!!

I haven't been to a 5 Napkin burger in ages, so when I realized a show I was going to was right down the street- I thought this was a perfect opportunity to revisit.

I went with the classic 5 Napkin burger and onion rings.

I don't want to be rude, but this burger was not good- at all. The aioli sauce was lacking any type of flavor and it looked like I was just eating yellow gunk on a patty. The burger itself had no seasoning. I ended up scrapping off any of the toppings and nibbling on the bun as I had to eat something before watching a 2 hour show.

The onion rings were just a bowl of oil, tasted like old oil too. I struggled through eating more than one.

The service was good. I had asked for extra sauce and was happy that my server remembered to bring it.

The interior is cute, it feels like a fun place to eat. I just wish the food had been better.

Honestly, won't be back.

2/5
The food was delicious, and they had vegan options! Really delicious vegan options! The service was a little slow, if not somewhat neglectful. The ambience and the food were perfection!

After a trip to the pier on a late Wednesday night we walked around looking for a place to eat and ended up at 5 Napkin Burger.

Food:
- Cheeseburger, Fries, Onion Rings, and a cookie ice cream shake. I got a cheeseburger with blue cheese and it was quite good. The fries and onion rings were also very good and certainly items I would order again.  The milkshake had a good flavor.

- Atmosphere: A+ for the location. Lots of outdoor and indoor seating. The restaurant was clean and the outdoor seating was nicely set up.

- Drinks: The roasted pineapple margarita was a nice change in flavor combination.

- Service: Reason for only 4 stars. Our server almost seemed annoyed with us. I understand we showed up 30 minutes before closing, but the vibe was not warm and welcoming. He was rushed to take our order which make me feel anxious and rushed.

Good stuff. Probably not the place for a quick lunch though.

Went with a group of coworkers. Service was friendly and accommodating, but slow in general despite not being very busy at the time. I ordered the BLT burger, which is part of their seasonal menu. While I requested medium, it came closer to medium rare, which is fine by me (I'd rather have it less cooked than overcooked). Piled heavily with BLT toppings and an herb mayo that was yummy, the whole thing pretty much fell apart as I was eating. Overall enjoyed it, although note to self, way too messy for a work lunch. Also, I wouldn't choose it over the signature 5 Napkin Burger, but nice to try once.

Came here a couple of Saturdays ago to grab a meal in between seeing some shows on Broadway. Was immediately seated and helped, and I really enjoyed my burger melt and beer. Not a huge fan of the onion rings, I didn't really like the batter, but they were nice and crispy! The servers were very attentive, and I was in/out in maybe an hour. I would definitely return!

The establishment is very clean, the atmosphere was energetic. Service was prompt and our reservation was timely seated, especially for a group greater than 5. There wasn't a long wait for the food and the food was flavorful and plentiful. Well ran throughout. Would definitely recommend

Five Napkin Burger Theater District
Friends came in from out of town. They wanted to get together before they went to a Broadway Show. I'm not a fan of Five Napkin but I had a good time. Here's the scoop:
The service was really good. My friend had made a reservation which was smart. We got there just before five and it wasn't too bad but there was a half hour wait by the time we left just before seven. This whole area is a nightmare with tourists!
The food was good and big portions. We shared the fries. There is a Classic Cheeseburger and for the young at heart the Bacon and Egg Burger! That late in the day I had the Lifestyle Burger and ate half took half home. My friends had drinks and we all tried the Milk Shake which was fun. My photos look delicious although rushed. I'm trying to be polite when I am with my visitors.
I'm recommending this location if you go early enough, and make sure you make a reservation first!!

Ended up walking across midtown -- through restaurant row and still kept to my plan of eating here. Restaurant week made the selection REAL easy: loaded truffle fries, 5 Napkin Burger, and a brownie sundae.

Nothing disappointed! I asked for dipping sauces and got what I think are the best in house: ketchup, a hot sauce that was tasty but doesn't leave you thirsty for 20 minutes, and an aioli sauce, scrumptious. The Coney Island Pilsner helps too :D

And the burger: juicy tenderness, and the cheese blend is on point! The caramelized onions are a perfect touch--adding to the flavor but not overly done (a la White Castle).

Finally the sundae was the perfect size with the right amount of brownie and ice cream, plus the cherry on top.

5/5 would do again. The "saddest" part was the candle they put on my table blew out minutes after being put down--which, is totally insignificant

Loved everything about this place! The ambiance is an upscale old meat market meets subway station but in the best possible way. The service was friendly and helpful for us tourists. And the food was scrumptious. We especially loved the burgers and onion rings. They had just the right spices and not over done. There really wasn't anything my group of 9 Texas folks didn't love.

This is a great low cost option in Hell's Kitchen.  They have a great happy hour & plenty of deals on the regular menu.  

I ordered a cheese burger (mozzarella, pickles, & burger - I'm simple...).  I wish the pickles had been dill or bread & butter.  Also, French fries do not come with the burgers and are between $4-6 extra.  

I went here with my mom and she got one of their all-day brunch options.  
She ate two eggs over easy, toast, bacon & hash browns.   I was upset when she was served because the hash browns were two triangle (clearly frozen) hash browns.  These should have been fresh potato's.  I felt she was short sold.  

We got brussel sprout's which were burnt and overpoweringly tasted like lime.  They gave you extra lime to squeeze but it was so full of citrus already!!

For the cost this establishment is worth it, but it's still expensive ($17-20 for a burger + fries).

Overpriced burger ($20 for a burger that doesn't come with a side?) that was not great.

We split the 5 Napkin Burger and the Avocado Ranch Burger and thought both were just OK.

We also got sides of onion rings and sweet potato fries which were both very greasy.

I actually felt a bit sick after eating here. Disappointing because the location is very convenient!

Tavern Onion Ring Tower 9/10
- crisp and hot
- comes with 5 Napkin and blue cheese sauce
- very popular appetizer and came out quickly

Crinkle Fries 7.5/10
- reminds me of Shake Shack fries, plain by themselves
- ask for some 5 Napkin sauce!

5 Napkin Burger 7.8/10
- loaded w/ cheese and caramelized onions on top of a thick patty
- juicy/greasy, on the sweeter side, and heavy
- average imo

The onion ring tower was a great starter. I think a classic burger would've been a better burger pick for me personally. Staff was very friendly but felt like we had to flag someone to get anything extra. The first time we asked for sauce/add ons, they forgot our request, but we asked another waiter who brought it to us quickly.

A recognized place of burgers, they actually DO medium rare and that is not frequent.
Cool decorations (they added the rail and hooks, was not previously a meat packer as you might think).
Burgers have generous layers of onions and cream, and were quite tasty. May be not as much as other places but still very good.

This is definitely one of my favorite burgers in NYC. We had these burgers delivered during the pandemic and have been to this location twice. The ahi burger is also great. I would order that one rare.

I have to say the quality of the burgers are great either way, in-person or just getting them delivered. Same for the ahi burger.

The portion size of the fries are huge! So one large is definitely good for 2 people.

It does get busy here and if you go at peak hours service does kind of get slow, like tonight, we didn't get condiments that we wanted until we finished eating our meal.

Despite the spotty service, the quality of the burgers are still king, so still giving them a 4 star review

The beginning service was pretty good and fast up until the end when they had a shift change. We didn't see our waiter or new waiter for like 7 minutes. But that was ok we got one it.

The burgers were great, shake was really good, the Mac n cheese was really good and the fries as well. We would definitely come back again. This is my second time at a 5 napkin and I was happy with it.

It was me and my friends' first time coming to Hell's Kitchen and we tried this place out. The hostess and the servers who helped us out did a great job! They made us feel welcomed and gave us good food recommendations on their menu. Additionally, they did not waste time getting our food ready so I really do have no regrets and would love to come back here!

I'm a little late on this review but wanted to give them a thanks!
I sat at the bar and Billy (I think that was his name, I know he was a Sagittarius haha) was great and super friendly! I was traveling alone so he was nice and made me feel welcome which you don't always get in NYC! :)
Anyways, cute atmosphere and kind of has a more upscale vibe than I expected so good thing I wasn't dressed like a scrub.
The chicken and waffles were delicious and it was a giant plate of food haha I felt bad wasting it buuuut I also had to go out afterwards so..
Great place and great service!
(I wont even talk about parking like I usually do,because it's NYC obvi)

A step up from a diner for a fast casual meal.  Plus, who doesn't love a burger!?  

5 Napkin generally isn't a go-to place for dinner, but it does have its purpose.  The food is good, service is good and it's fast.  

Given it's location, a good place to get food post/pre show or just a nice place to get a quick meal with friends in midtown.

I gotta say though - burgers are very good (and juicy).

A staff member dropped ketchup that sprayed all over our table and all of us.  Nobody was going to do anything about it.  The manager had an attitude and was a total jackass.  We will never step foot in here again.  The food is average and the service sucks.

Heard good things going in, but overall were very disappointed with our experience. Apart from the short wait for food, there's not much good that I can say.

We were misled about pricing from the beginning, and the service was lacking overall. Our waiter was not attentive and even put up his hand as if to say "chill out" when we tried to get our check. We were automatically given large fries with no indication as to size options or prices, only finding out when the check came.

The food also wasn't good. The burgers were boring and kind of bland, and we found hair in both orders of fries. Not a good experience and definitely wouldn't recommend it.

Listen I was trying to come here years ago. I honestly like a good healthy burger every now and then.

Once I bite into the burger I had the cheese was just oozing out my mouth in I was a little embarrassed  I usually keep it pretty neat and clean when I eat a burger but fuck it we grown lol
Food was not good. Burger meat did not taste like it was good quality and the brussel sprouts tasted very strange.

As the reviews here are pretty mixed, I didn't go in with high expectations. But the burgers were fine. I had the plain ol' cheeseburger -- it was cooked to how I asked. It was fine. The kale salad, also fine. Husband's bacon cheeseburger, fine. Guests had avocado ranch and a cheeseburger, hold everything -- and everything came out as ordered. The onion rings weren't great. But the service was fast and attentive, and everyone walked away happy and full. So a win.

Stopped in for brunch on a Sunday. Probably should have just ordered a burger - it's literally called 5napkin burger. I ordered the breakfast burrito and it was just okay. I wouldn't order it again - it wasn't bad but it wasn't great. Stick with the burgers and fries and you will be fine. Ny husband had the burger and said it was tasty.

I do not understand why people keep coming here. Okay ... in their defense (the people's not the restaurant's), Five Napkin is literally located on the most desirable and business corner in Hells Kitchen. So, I'm not sure that people keep coming here for the food as much as the convenience. Either that  or they've had so much to drink that they don't remember how bad the food actually is.

I used to (only under dire duress and a lack of time to find some where else) go to the location by Union Square. That was just awful. And they've since (understandably) closed.

But I thought maybe this location seeing how busy it is would be better, despite an ill-fitted visit three years ago. (See hubby's review below this)

On this occasion I ordered take out because I was craving a burger and my husband ordered from the restaurant next door.

One, HOW HARD IS IT TO GET THE TEMP and the CHEESE on the order correct? Especially when the person who took the order allegedly checked to make sure. I LOATHE the cheese they used which was NOT the blue cheese I asked for and paid for. I also asked for a burger cooked RARE. What I got was a well done burger with mozzarella or something.

And the crinkly fries (my favorite kind) were soggy, undercooked and disgusting.

But I was already home when I discovered this and ended up just packing it and giving it out to a homeless man we often help.

With so many good burger places in the city, this one should be skipped and will be from here on out.

Delicious food. Burger was so amazing and juicy. Breakfast was good. The watermelon margarita made everything even better. I love the truffle fries. I am craving those right now. Waitress was kind. I highly recommend & I will return next time I'm in New York.

Been dying to give this place a try, so one night after a movie my spouse and I popped in for a quick bite. We were seated fast but meal took over an hour. The restaurant was packed, servers were clearly exhausted and appeared understaffed. What didn't help though was watching our waitress have a five-minute conversation seated at another persons table. I get it that hospitality matters, but given how slow everything was running, this seemed ill-advisable.

My burger was just alright - I've had way better in Hells Kitchen. Honestly, in the months since I've eaten here I am still surprised to see it full whenever I walk past. Maybe we the night we came was just an off-night experience, but looking at total reviews it seems there are double the 4 and 3 star reviews combined than 5 star.

I'd go elsewhere.

Best New York Pizza ever
I stop here every time I'm in New York
The butteriest crust! Don't miss out.

How can you hate on a place that still serves a slice of pizza for $1.50? Is it the largest slice? No. Does it use the freshest mozzarella and tomatoes? No. Does it taste like NY pizza?

HELL YEAH!

Then there's the $3.50 deal which simply cannot be beaten.

In 2022, a Big Mac is $9. A Wendy's Double is $10. Even a hot dog at Gray's Papaya or Papaya King is $4. And yet somehow, you can snag TWO slices of pizza and a real Coke for $3.50!

The dude behind the counter was pretty quiet and chill. We splurged for a brownie and he was kind enough to throw it in the oven without even being asked. BTW, the brownie square was $2.50.

The four of us wound up dropping $9.50 for four slices, two cokes and a brownie.

I was gonna take off a point because it's not the greatest pizza on earth but then I remembered that McDonalds and Wendy's are charging $10 for something so far from the greatest burger on earth that to deduct a star just seems grossly unfair.

An average slice of pizza in NYC will run you $4.50 and trust me, that's not the greatest pizza on earth either. Therefore, I offer up a full FIVE STARS for being the most affordable meal one can have in Manhattan.

$1.50 Pizza is still the undefeated Champion of NYC!

It's a dollar for a large cheese pizza slice, how can you complain? I guess if you order the specialties, but then you're at fault. Why not go somewhere higher quality for specialties when they're similar prices ($4-5) a slice?

My friend asked for one slice of cheese and was charged $2 so I was like oh, I might as well get some pepperoni for $2. Turns out they thought he wanted two slices so he won with two large cuts of cheese versus my one pepperoni for the same price. The worst part is the pepperoni is literally a cheese pizza with three pieces of pepperoni and those three pieces adds another dollar.

If I'm only rating the cheese pizza, which is the fair option, this place is above average. I'd visit here any day for a quick bite especially at that price. It's not like they skimp on the cheese either, there's a fair amount for the price.

Crust is soft and not crispy, but its alright, again it's a dollar. I'm pretty holistic with my judgment and won't knock a place down because I know it's low quality and I'm expecting it to somehow be more.

Came here during Pride. They stopped selling plain cheese slices meanwhile had pizzas with toppings coming out hot. I thought there was wait for plain slices so I asked them how long for plain sliced. They told me they were sold out and were only selling their topping pizzas, which were going for $4 a slice! Your sign says $1 pizza where is the $1 slice!?! And people were going for it because they didn't know any other $1 spots in the area! Such a shame! If you were selling $1 slices someone would've ordered an entire pie! Because people are high & drunk and will eat!

At times there not much more you can expect from a $1 a slice pizza joint.

Yeah, it's a bit worn looking and grimy inside as many of these places are. Service is gruff and not too happy. The sign on the wall proclaims it's the best $1 cheese pizza slice which is laughable.

At least there is a table outside the front door to eat your mediocre $1 slice of pizza. Kind of dry and tasteless.

What do you expect? It's a $1 slice of thin cheese pizza.

Classic $1 pizza trip!

Satisfies any and all late night cravings, and was the best snack after a long day. Classic quick service and fresh pizza! Love the crust. Pizzas were almost the size of our face

Tl;dr crispy crust, meh pizza

If I judged this place just on crust it's be a lot higher. However if you're only paying a couple bucks for a slice of pizza you gotta lower your expectations. All in all not bad for the price but there are better places.
For only 1$ their pizza is way better then some that are sell 5$ a slice back in Montreal I did loved it and definitely recommand this place
My favorite $1 pizza spot! Open late so you visit after a night of drinking. Nice crunchy crust, yummy sauce, and gooey cheese. Can't get much better than that!

After going to New York me and my brother were hungry and decided to go to dollar pizza. When we went  in they had a short line but a long wait time it took 15 minutes for our food to get ready. It was quiet but they had no chairs to sit on only tables. When I ate it then undercooked it a bit and I had a stomach ache from it. The only reason I went there is because the pizza is cheap and I didn't have much money on me at the time

Yeah, 3 is about right. It is cheap, so there's that. The pizza was lukewarm and fine in flavor, not NY great at all. Did I mention it's cheap? (Actually $1.50/cheese slice.) Sorry, no pic. It looked like pizza.

Browsing through the internet to find the best $1 pizza and a random website recommend this so off we go. Well, it's the typical NY pizza with thin crust and cheese. I don't try the other pizza so I can't comment much or compare it with other place. I would say overall it's okay. Nothing spectacular, but not bad either. The crust is not dry, but the cheese wasn't to the degree that you can do a cheese pull. The size is decent, depending on how hungry you are, in general 1-2 should be enough. Regardless, it's pretty wonderful that we can still find something to eat with just $1 in a city as fierce as NYC

Never mind the $1.50 price on the pizza. We purchased just about every slice that had, and each one was flavorful. In fact, I wanted to go back and get so more after eating the first two slices. The service was perfect and I have no complaints about it. I will definitely be back.
I really liked the pizza. It's made fresh all day long. Plus, they had this amazing little meat pie. I would come back to try more of the non pizza foods they have here.

The cheese slices looked pretty awful so I opted for some of the specialty slices; 1 buffalo chicken, 1 BBQ chicken, and 2 meat lover's. Total was $15, which is a humongous ripoff, but I was too deep in the game to back down. Much regret! Low-quality ingredients, not fresh at all, did not agree with my digestive tract. There are good and bad dollar slice joints, and to me, this place clearly belongs to the latter category.

The cheese pizza here is not a dollar late night. That isn't something they are going out of their way to advertise. The slices are very big, and the slices with multiple toppings have a very thick crust. Overall pretty good, but there are better options.

It's a dollar. It's a slice. It's pretty damn good for a dollar. You fold it and the paper plate it comes on. Bliss. Although it may look a little light on the cheese and sauce, once you bite in you'll find, as has been mentioned elsewhere in these reviews, the ratio between these and the crust is close to ideal. (This isn't a "blot-off-the-grease" kind of slice.)

A lot of times I'll find myself wandering around the neighborhood wondering what to get for lunch, and a quick nosh here is like the perfect Hell's Kitchen appetizer for, well, anything. Also, perfect late-night snack.

The place does a booming business, so your pizza is likely to be very fresh. Even the slices with extras look enticing, but then they're more like $2 or $2.50 slices, and drifting into Amadeus Pizza territory (bigger, more excellent, but more expensive). Service is always quick, don't forget to give a decent tip. You might consider avoiding around three in the afternoon when local schools let out. Just a suggestion.
Super reliable spot for a late night snack. The slices are pretty big so 2 or 3 should fill you up. I've never had to wait more than a few minutes and they have all kind of seasoning there.
Friend and I went there last night and ordered a few slices. We woke up this morning with food poisoning.

Dang good pizza, especially for a dollar! No frills, just good pizza for a good price. It's a small place with no seating that I saw, but we just ate right out front. The crust had a nice chew, there was a good balance of sauce and cheese and the sauce wasn't overly sweet.  $1 a slice for cheese pizza.

Any real New Yorker knows not to eat in these dollar "pizza" spots. The inside is dirty, pizza is tasteless, and the third world staff are rude.

Pay extra and eat in a REAL pizzeria.

DONT GO.

Cheapest slices are $2.75.
Deal for 2 cheese slices and one drink = $3.50.
Minimum $5 on card.
We asked for Ham & Pineapple ($2.75) and Sicilian ($2.75). The man charged me $6.75 instead. I asked why and he said it was ham, bacon & pineapple so it was $4.00 instead of $2.75.
Are you kidding me?? A few extra bits of bacon and he's charging and extra $1.25? I may as well get another slice from somewhere else.
Next morning found out he had charged me twice on my card. Had to clear it up with my bank.
The pineapple pizza tasted bland. But we were all starving so we were fine with it. But probably would not buy it again. One pizza was $20

It's my first time in New York so it's imperative that you get a New York slice! Slice  
 
Pros:
*Its a Dollar!
* Its more like a stand and not and not a place you can go inside.
*short line
* quick service
*huge slice
*two slices and a can soda $2.99
*Did I mention it's a dollar

Cons:
*the first slice I had was cold but it was the last slice of the pie. The second one was much better because it was fresh out the oven
*only the cheese pizza is a dollar but you can get toppings for $3

Not sure what's going on but tonight was the second night I have come and they don't have the dollar slice. The first time I bought another more expensive pizza which was okay but tonight it feels like a way to make people order a more expensive pizza. It's not the price but it feels shady. Hopefully tonight was coincidence. If it's not I hope this isn't a new thing. You advertise and are known for great $1 slices.

The pricing at this place is just ridiculous. The people in front of me ordered a pizza and it was $32. They were shocked because this place advertises a dollar a slice. Well, be aware that's just for the cheese that's usually not even on display. Misleading and can't recommend. The pizza is *ok* and will do in a pinch if it's late and not much else is open, but that's about it.

Not sure about the bad reviews of this place. We grabbed 2 cheese slices and were charged 2.50 total. They were out of the cheese (which is reasonable since it's the most popular) but we literally waited about 30 seconds and the guy brought us out fresh slices from the oven.

The pizza here is your standard, NYC pizza. It's delicious and a great experience. If you want to try authentic NYC pizza, this is as good of a place as any.

If you come here before midnight without having consumed copius quantities of alcohol, it's probably not going to be as good. But a 2a slice of foldable pizza is just what the doctor orders at that hour, and this place delivers. There was a floutist, a homeless guy, a young couple, and a youngster panhandling for money for hormone drugs for his sex change operation (literally had a sign that said that), all coexisting in this space while we were there. It was perfect and quintessentially New York.
Solid slice, so cheap! Good filler when wife is hangry. Good ratios, mine was steaming it. Wiuld definitely go back!

LEGIT!

My go to spot for pizza near my mi casa. For a buck you get an evenly cheese to sauce ratio slice. They also serve pizza with two toppings ( pepperoni & mushrooms) for $3.50 and beef patty (don't forget the cheese!) for $2.50.

But the dollar slice is the most bang for your buck in Manhattan!

Never again, I placed an order through grub hub at 8:30, they accepted delivery. 10:15 comes still no foOd, I call and they are closed. You should of never accepted delivery, and now I must wait 5-10 business days for my money back.  Don't waste your time!

Love this place...whenever I'm in the mood for a quick and tasty slice, this is the place to go! Crust is crispy, sauce and cheese tasty...can't ask for a better slice. 2 slices and a soda or water for 2.75$...cheap tasty dinner!!
Dollar pizza! Nothing much else to be said. $1 flat, tax included for a thin crust slice of cheese pizza, great for a snack.

So I was here the night of Thursday, 11/21, but at 1:12, so essentially the early morning of 11/22. 1 (One) Dollar Pizza was already closed, no lights with the front gate down; I had presumed they'd be open until 2-3am such as on Friday's and Saturday's (actual hours are until 4am on those days) -- thus, I had hoped they'd have similar hours on Tuesday's and Thursday's as well. On a different night, two or three times, later in the night after I had left a bar or something of the sort, I was charged more than the menu price -- only after I had returned later, did I realize. When it's late at night, just ensure you're paying the menu price and not what you're told at the register. But this is just an example of a common institutional problem within our global economy: the concept of profit maximization reigning supreme over that of promoting a minimum level of well-being for all humans. We all know there exists a certain price for a slice in Manhattan, depending on the quality. However, we're all still willing to pay more for more influential/visible brands, such as Papa John's over a dollar slice shop. But that's just part of the problem, people buying/using a brand due to an image rather than what the company stands for (outliers such as Patagonia do exist though, when it comes to addressing environmental impacts). Single use plastics have the potential to be, and are already, devastating to modern society. For example, the Great Pacific Garbage Patch ( whose description I'm linking here, and don't worry I read the entire article before posting it, ( nationalgeographic.org/e… ), is just one way in which we're hurting our world, especially since we're not utilizing a regenerative economy/society. Not sure how to end this, cause I love the pizza here [especially if it's fresh] and it's still cheap as hell, so all in all, a good deal.

Sincerely,

A centrist who believes in climate change and the necessity of social initiatives.

Dollar slice pizza is a New York City staple. Right up there with subway delays, trash smells and police sirens that are synonymous with NYC. It was to my dismay, starting in 2018 that 1 Dollar Pizza started charging $1.25 for their cheese slices. I understand that the cost of living may increase over the years. However, an establishment cannot name itself 1 Dollar Pizza. Do not be deceived New York. Save up those quarters if you're having the drunken munchies and are looking to turn to this sub-par slice of greasy za.

Gave me cold pizza and didn't even bother heating it up. Be sure to ask to heat it up; this pizza is cold and gross. And it's not even a dollar anymore
It's a $1.25. But you know, when you're drunk in HK, fine. But maybe try a different place. :)
I used to go here but they aren't open very late and they will leave the "open" sign on while closing but won't serve anymore pizza. So I started going to the one down the street .
Prices are unbeatable and the food is OK. Nice place to stop for a quick lunch when you are in a rush
I mean, it's $1 pizza. Not anything to write home about, but it's not trying to be anything special. Solid quality. Bring cash, as cards carry $5 minimum.

After eating at Curry Ya and still being hungry, I popped in for one slice, figuring it would be junky cheap pizza. I ended up having two slices because it was surprisingly good. No, not the best in the city, but much better than many places charging regular prices, and this was only $1.00/slice.

Next time I am in the neighborhood, I will stop in again.

THE WORST $1 SLICE EVER!

I was starving after work and decided to give this a try since it's fast and cheap. Worst mistake I could have made! The cheese is revolting I threw the slice away and I was starving mind you.

Stick to 2 Bros where the dollar slice never disappoints.
Decent neighborhood pizza place. Prices are reasonable, but slices are slightly small. But there's always the option for $1 cheese slices.

This is a shady enterprise, one that is perfectly willing to post one charge, $1.00 a slice, and then find ways to charge twice that much when the slice is ready. They will argue with you about your order and why it doesn't qualify for the $1.00 price. This happened several times to my friends and I. We decided we'd expose them.
Best pizza place in the city!!!! Best spot to go after clubbing when you drunk poor and hungry. Or just hungry. Pizza is really yummy and just for 1$

How can you knock a $1 Pizza slice?  If you were inebriated at 2am, you would probably pay $1 to lick peanut butter, which wasn't on the menu.

Nevertheless, I came for the $1 pizza which WAS on the menu, but it wasn't available at the time I popped in.  There were 3 - 4 guys seemingly working on fresh pies, but there wouldn't be one ready anytime soon.  

Here comes the dilemma at these $1 joints.  If not the star of the show, you are left with choosing from topping slices.  Somehow 8 pieces of pepperoni or mushroom justifies a 200% surcharge per slice.

No it doesn't!?

We still bought 4 slices: two were gross, cold, and dry "Margherita" slices and the other two didn't matter.

At the end of the night, know that you were pursuing "$1 soak up the alcohol." in a relatively ritzy area and so I hope that you get your hands on the good stuff, though YMMV.

Wednesday afternoon. Advertising $1.25 for pizza. I got 3 plain slices. $3.75. Paid cash. Correct change in return. Done. Simple. Pizza. Cheap.

CARD MINIMUM IS $5

So the sign out in front of the place says "The Best $1 Slice Pizza", not the actual name of the place, a much more trumped up "The Best Pizza" which they surely aren't.

But it's a dollar a slice! Not $0.99 plus tax or whatever, but ONE DOLLAR. You hand them a George Washington and they hand you a slice of pizza, the novelty of it was so amazing I had to do it twice. And it's not that bad! Sure it's not gonna win any awards, but it's far better than you'd get at any sort of chain.

So why 4 stars instead of 3 for "not that bad"? The value of it all overwhelms me.  Of course if you wanna get fancy with various meats or vegetables on your pizza then things change, but why would you do such a thing when there's free shakers to dress your slice(s) with garlic, red pepper, and oregano?
Chicken, bacon and ranch. That's all I gotta say. Eat here ! Try that one ! Small spot and good food

Well for the 1st thought I was really concerned on getting vegetarian options as I had really struggled to get a variety of Vegan pizzas... but this place has a good number of options for Vegans too.. though to start with I ordered plain cheese pizza... I must tell you that it was really yummy... Definitely willing to try more Vegan options in days to come
This pizza is really quite good, especially if you catch it right when it comes out of the oven. Sure, it's kinda' dumpy digs, but who cares. The pie is tasty and the guys are nice. Eat up!
Fast easy reasonably priced and friendly service. Perfect for a slice on the run or a gyro for a satisfying dinner.

Not far from Circle Line, the prices are far more reasonable than restaurants on the pier.  The menu is Greek and pizza and the portions sizes huge.  I had a gyro platter with a Greek salad.  The gyro meat was dry and the sauce was surprisingly indistinct.  

Pizza was good but not great but the options still made it a superior choice over establishments on the dock.

Total RIP-OFF!!   My mother went in with my sister and got 2 plain slices and 1 Snapple and were charged over $18.   Unfortunately I was in the car and did not know until afterwards. I wonder how often this happens as it's right next to the Chinese embassy and perhaps they are ripping these older people off because they don't know how to complain.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
Simple.  Clean. Clean bathroom. Bright atmosphere. Friendly staff. Well run Greek diner away from the busier center of town. Affordable. Thin slice pizza was tasty. Nice spot to take a break, refuel.
The owner is extremely rude.  Food is overpriced.  Terrible service. Do not visit this place
Great restaurant near pier. Salad was refreshing. Waiter was nice. Had a medium size pepperoni pizza which was so tasty and flavorful. Coffee was delicious. I paired it with the cheesecake. :)

Passed by after finishing up a Circle line tour and thought it was just a pizza joint hole in the wall but we were quite surprised to find a nice little spot that served excellent Greek food.  The owners were pleasant and helpful, followed all COVID protocols and the food was excellent.  Highly recommend.

Si glad we tried this place once, and now keep coming back. Always clean and great service. Owners are a lovely couple. Love the food. Pizza is great. Sandwiches always fresh (love the vegan triple decker, even though I'm not vegan!) and the fries... your perfectly-made diner fries. Give it a try.
Really love this place.  Family owned since 1937. Super friendly staff and the food is awesome.  It's like eating in moms kitchen. Highly recommend.

WARNING ALERT!
They get the order wrong EVERY time. This time they forgot the milk for the coffee. On top of it they hardly speak English. We live across the street and after taking over an hour to get bacon/egg/chess/coffee, they forget the milk. So I called & her excuse was were so busy here. I said but this happens all the time & even when your not busy. So, after they bring the milk this lovely messages was attracted. More proof of their terrible communication and unprofessional people skills. And you don't wanna go there in person as their place looks like a dump. NEXT!

Open on Memorial Day. Friendly service! Their menu has a large selection of choices which included pizza, breakfast, sandwiches, salads, pastas, etc. The food that I ordered was okay- not the best, not the worst. I ordered a chicken souvlaki which came with fries, Greek salad and pita bread. They put the pita bread on the bottom of the chicken which made the bread soggy. Overall, an okay place to eat when you're hungry. The wide variety on the menu made me question what their specialty was. But anyways, the staff was nice and friendly and very accommodating. Food wasn't the best but that's okay.

Great place , amazing pizza dough and all employees very friendly !  I ate a delicious pineapple slice and the dough tasted amazingly fresh , fresh ham and pineapple !!
   Very CLEAN SPOTLESS PLACE.

 Ignore the irritated NY locals who have left some negative reviews out of typical jealousy and must revenge attitude !!

I have lived next to this place for many years and had the pizza a handful of times. I can't stress to you enough how awful this pizza is. From the taste to just the way it looks, it's a disappointment to all NYC pizza establishments everywhere.
The other night I had gone to a friends place for pizza. From the first bite, I knew it was from 42 without even having to ask. The sauce is sweet and watery, the crust is limp and soggy. The area between the crust and the sauce is slimy.   Out of politeness I had a few bites and put it aside.
There are a million other options out there, including Dominos. Try all of them!

It was a pleasant hole in the wall dinner that I ran into on my way to a fairy ride. Pizza didn't look great but the gyros and fries where really good. If you need a quick bite to eat in the area go there. We where in and out in 25 mins!
The food was amazing. plenty of options for food for picky eaters and those that enjoy more flavorful cuisine. Staff was extremely happy and friendly. Highly recommend.

An awful experience.  The pizza was vile.  When I sent it back and explained how bad it tasted the man asked me "what do you want me to do with it?" In a sarcastic tone while holding my rejected pizza in his hands-- offering no other solution.  They also refused to serve tap water requiring me to purchase a bottle of water despite the fact that I had just purchased a soft drink.  THEN we go to check out (no credit on the check for uneaten, inedible pizza) and they required a cash payment stating they had no credit card machine-- but failed to tell us of this fact prior to ordering.  They had a sign taped to the register directing patrons to use THEIR ATM machine located in their store.  And THEN it began raining-- and while waiting for our uber to pick us up--the manager LOCKED THE DOOR to keep people from coming in to escape the rain--apparently because only 2/3rds of the clientele were ordering food.  I had to instruct him NOT to falsely imprison me in his yrestaurant.  Totally unbelievable behavior.  

Rude management, poor food, desire to maximize profit without concern for their patron.  AVOID this place--it will ruin your day

A great little place with a welcoming smile from the Greek family who runs it.
We stopped here briefly on our first day in NYC and came back for more one night for dinner. The food is great quality, fresh, hearty and yummy, we ordered mozzarella sticks, zucchini sticks, the gyro was amazing, my fussy Son was asking to return!
would recommend you stop by.
Remember it is a diner not 5 star dining, but for a diner, it is a good one - not the traditional diner feel, more like a 1970's Sydney milk bar.

I am a dog walker in the neighborhood and this is my new favorite place to sit down, relax, and have a few slices of pizza. I was greeted with a warm, genuine smile and served quickly. I loved their Christmas decor/music, family photos on the walls, and the pizza was affordable and delicious.

I moved to the city from the Midwest a few months ago and have learned this caliber of customer service is nearly unheard of in Manhattan. They treat you like you are family sitting down at their dinner table, I love this place.

Total ripoff! Went in to feed two hungry kids some lasagna and picked up a check of $60! As we didn't want to just order for the kids out of politeness, we ordered some fried calamari for us (the parents). You'd expect you'd get a little more than 10 meager pieces for $18. Tip included every small piece of calamari cost us $2!

When I made a remark about this at the end of the meal, no reaction but a meager "I'll tell it to the manager".

Don't come here.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Not a single soul in there cares about your business. It is gross, run-down, and overall... just sad. They are a cash-only business with absolutely no signage. They will then prompt you to use their ATM that is conveniently located in the dining room. I ran in for a quick snack:  ONE slice of pepperoni pizza and ONE can of coke. $9... yes, you heard that right. It was a whopping $4 for a single (dry, old, & floppy) slice, $2 for a single can of coke, and a $3 ATM fee. Seriously... just don't go. Even if you live in one of these nearby sky-rises. Just go to Gotham West Market for your pizza. Cheaper and a million times more delicious.
Perfectly good place. Very nice people. Food good and solid reliable quality. Superduper clean. Very fast service. Very reasonable prices. Nice hot tea after a chilly boat ride on the circle line!

Just had an uncomfortable experience. The second you walk in the waitress offers you a menu and asks if you want anything to drink. I asked for water (expecting tap) and she gave me a water bottle. Then she watches you as you look over the menu. Literally stands over you, and you feel the pressure lmao. I said fine, I'll have a slice of pizza, and then she said cash not credit. I told them thank you, but I don't have cash and sorry. Threw in a "have a good rest of the day", and as I was walking out I could hear the guy behind the counter talk crap "how does she not have cash? Everyone has cash". You couldn't wait until I was out the door?

Great little hole in the wall place. I ordered a large extra cheese and a large pepperoni. They did not disappoint! Great crust and attentive to what I wanted. Close to Javitz where I was working and I will definitely be back next time I'm working in the city.

Great little pizza shop 3.25 a slice but owner uses fresh cheese I asked LOL unlike the  dollar pizza that gives you blood clots. Delicious GYRO and service was good. Nice mom and pop place to go after a long boat ride. Will come again!

I paid $33.82 for 2 orders of chicken fingers and fries and 1 bottle of Gatorade to go. The place isn't air conditioned and the workers look miserable while trying to appease who I assume to be the manager (who later refused to give a mother some water and insisted she purchase bottled water because their tap water "wasn't clean"). There's 3 bland and unseasoned 3 inch chicken fingers with fries and lettuce, tomato and onion. Never in my life have I paid this much money for chicken fingers and fries. And never would I think I could be upset with chicken fingers and fries. If you can't do this right then that's appalling.
Great local place to grab some pizza to have over in Hudson River Park.  Friendly staff and delicious food!

This place has bad reviews for a reason. The menu says that if you want to order breakfast after 11:30 AM there is a two dollar additional charge. We came in for brunch at 1pm and they would not serve us breakfast, even with the two dollar charge. Walked out. They didn't care.

The pizza is just phenomenal! Always fresh and extremely tasty. Aside from how delicious it is, the customer service is outstanding! The owners are very welcoming and friendly and the delivery guy is such a sweetheart. I will remain a regular at 42nd street pizza corp!
Literally the worst food place in the world do not come here please do yourself a favor and run I'm serious runnnnnnnnnnnmn

This place was empty when we walked in and overall got a bad vibe. When we asked for water our server acted like we had just committed a crime. However, their food was decent. Definitely should stick to Greek food though,  and 100% don't recommend it.

Pizza tastes worse than a frozen pie. Don't expect much on the service end either. You have to pay for water, and the staff will basically ignore you. Just go find another place to eat..

Overall bad food, slow service, and pricey.
Absolutely delumptious food. Had an incredible meatball pizza. Highly recommend. GREAT service and kind workers. The place has a really homey feel. If I could rate it 6 stars I would.

We walked by looking for a quick slice of pizza, and one of the employees standing outside ushered us in. We were still considering if we wanted to eat here when she pressured us to order. We felt rushed to order and she seemed extremely irritated when we couldn't make a decision. We ordered a few slices which were about $4 each (what??). So we received our pizza and it was absolute trash. I ordered a combination pizza, which was literally just a pepperoni pizza with BOILED mushrooms placed on top and falling off. They didn't even bake it with mushrooms on, but just threw them on top of a pepperoni. Similarly, the buffalo chicken pizza was just a cheese pizza with tiny buffalo chicken bits thrown on top. You're better off getting a $1 slice somewhere else!

The owner/manager(?) and all the employees were VERY nice! The manager was a dark haired woman and made sure we had a pleasant experience. The pizza was great, slices and the large pie we ordered were smaller than traditional New York slices. I had to remove a star for the bathroom experience. We were told that someone was on the bathroom and so my husband nor son could not use it. Truth was, they would only unlock it after we placed our full order. We all finally get to the bathroom and it was not worth the wait, the bathrooms unfortunately smelled badly and  were not clean, not to mention the weird setup on the ladies room. I'd go back if I was in the neighborhood, but would be sure to use the bathroom elsewhere before coming in.

The best eggplant pizza in the city.

I've had a few things on their menu and everything I've tried is good but nothing has wow'd me. Well nothing besides their pizza, specifically the eggplant pizza. It's the only one I ordered and it's just so good I have no reason to try anything else.

I would recommend giving it a try!

food was not terrible. if you need to find a place by the pier this would be an easy place to go. it's not just pizza it's a whole greek restaurant but you can only sit in the front section if you are having pizza. the greek part is owned by the same people but it's in the back. the pizza was kinda good and so was the greek food. the bathroom has 2 toilets but no stalls to separate them. they are cash only.

The only thing this place has going for it is its proximity to the West Side attractions and Chinese consulate. I ordered a fish fillet that had a terrible off-taste like fish well past its prime. My husband ordered the spaghetti with clams, calamari, and shrimp. The dish too was unsavory.

There are signs in the restaurant that the rest rooms are out of order, but they are open to customers. There are also signs that the machine accepting credit cards is out of order, so diners must pay in cash. We wasted about $60 on this sub-par fare. We would have done better at a restaurant further east during its restaurant week specials. This is no way to run an establishment.

2 of us stopped here for a quick appetizer and to cool down before doing a boat ride. The pizza looked and smelled really good, but we just weren't hungry enough. We ordered mozzarella sticks and cheesy fries. Both portions were large and left us fuller than we probably should have been. Neither of the foods were anything to write home about, but they hit the spot.
The only main issue was the language barrier. The young girls seemed to be Greek (or possibly from somewhere else) and didn't understand or speak English very well.
Nothing special, but I'd definitely try the pizza next time!

This place has the best gyro's in the city. The gyro's on the food carts on the streets have more bread in the mixture. At 42nd Street Pizza the gyro meat is great with a good mix of spices. The fries are also very good. Not too crispy and not too soggy.

While called 42nd Street Pizza the menu is actually closer to that of a NYC Diner, with dozens of different items on the menu. So if you go there with a group there should be an option for everyone. The prices are in line with most of the other diners in the area.

As mentioned, this is a real family owned and operated restaurant and it shows. The place is spotlessly clean, and the owner and his wife are very friendly.

My only negative is that I wish they had Coke Zero so I don't feel as guilty when eating the Gyro's and baklava! (They do have diet coke.)

WOW~~ HAND DOWN AMAZING EXPERIENCE~~

It's feels like I am back home in Greece. The atmosphere is so cozy and AUTHENTIC.
The smile on the staffs' faces brings warmth to this BIG Touristic City.
I am always so Satisfied and Happy to eat GREEK FOOD that's delicious but
here I also get the full experience of being home in Greece.
Again I would like to say a heartfelt THANK YOU for continuing to serve our community here with the BEST menu on EARTH. I'd highly recommend it if you are in the area.

I never write reviews but god this place was awful! Ordered a chicken souvlaki platter to go:

Chicken was basic chicken with pepers and onions - not skewers
Tzatziki sauce tasted like watered down ranch dressing
Greek salad was the best part to be honest - but i would hardly call it a greek salad

and for $17 i expected to get a much larger portion but again, i was disappointed.... what a waste of money.

During my 7 day stay in New York City in June of 2014. I have been searching around New York City for the best pizza joints!!! During that time we have just finished a free boat ride from the City Sightseeing Of New York!!! As I got off the red beautiful boat me and my family decided to a long walk from Pier 83 towards the 42nd street area... As I passed by many fast food joints along the way in 42nd street area of New York and then by accident I discovered the 42nd Street Pizza Restaurant!!! I said to myself hey I wanna try this Pizza Joint... As I walked in for the first time to the 42nd Street Pizza Place... And then I said to myself once again this is it!!! I found a good pizza place of New York City to eat at!!! And now this is what I ordered it was a large sized sausage pizza and wooooooooow it tasted really good!!! 42nd Street has a good selection of pizza slices to choose from... And if I ever do go back to New York City in the near future I definitely would wanna go back to the 42nd Street Pizza!!!

First of all, the restaurant was empty on a beautiful Saturday afternoon. Thinking back, I should have assumed there was a reason. A friendly looking hostess was standing on the sidewalk so we decided to give it a try. We thought "Hey, let's support a locally owned restaurant!" The menu is very pricey for the casual, Greek diner atmosphere they provide. We decided to get a slice of pizza each, but she continued to try and up-sell us to salads and full meals. When we told the waitress we were sure we only wanted pizza, her attitude turned a bit sour towards us. Our pizza arrived and it wasn't bad - it was just very simple and generic, and not worth the $3.75 price tag for a plain slice.

This place doesn't cater to New Yorkers. It's clear they are more interested in price-gouging the tourists. The $0.99 pizza places serve better slices. I would recommend you go there instead. (FYI to the waitress - just because I'm only ordering pizza doesn't mean I'm not going to leave a good tip. No need for the attitude!)
The worst pizza and cost you 5.5 dollars for a slice( even worse than the dollar pizza). I rather walk 10mins than come here next time!

The customer service at this place is ABSOLUTELY ridiculous. I was in NYC visiting for Fleet Week. The Navy was very welcomed by many restaurants but this was not one of them. We were on duty (meaning we cant leave the ship) so we decided to order pizza from here for delivery. After an attempt at ordering I noticed that their hours stated that they werent open on Sunday and so I didnt think anything of it. I then received a phone call telling me that the delivery guy had been waiting for 30 minutes outside my door... 1. They didnt call me to tell me that they were there. 2. Someone went down to the pier immediately after they called to get the pizza amd no one was there. And 3. Ships dont have doors for you to knock on.... The delivery person stood outside of someone elses door for 30 minutes with our pizza after I gave the exact address to the pier, the pier number and the name of the ship. If you can miss a 844 foot ship, you dont need to have a job! During all of this, instead of picking up the phone to call me, they proceeded to email me and tell me I am to blame for the delivery guy missing many other orders and losing business for them. They never refunded my money, never responded back to my emails and I definitely didnt get my pizza. NEVER EAT AT THIS PLACE. IT IS A HORRIBLY RAN BUSINESS.

UPDATE: After I posted this review I was emailed and informed that I was unfair and that once again it was my fault that the pizza was never delivered to me. Never. Never. NEVER order from these people.

Stopped here with my boss after attending an event at the Javitz center.  I've got to say... It was more than I expected for a tiny little diner on a quiet street.  The food was pretty good, the prices were reasonable... the bathroom was a little scary... but so aren't all the bathrooms in NYC...

Stopped here after the circle line. So-so.Small burgers, pizza was Ok. Service was pretty good. Won't be making any special trips here. $11.00 for cheeseburger deluxe-small burger. Hey,It's manhattan!

This is a cool little spot in front of pier 83. Family stopped in to eat when we too the full cruise of the island. I like Greek but my family had never had it. They liked the food and was a nice friendly staff.

The food here is terrible. I had the lamb souvlaki platter. It was $15 for only a few slices of lamb. The store is almost completely empty when we entered. There were 6 of us in our party and we said we wanted to check out their menu to see if there's anything nice. But when we saw the prices on the menu, everyone except me decided to only order a drink. The shop owner scolded my mother for lying and breaking their rules. They had a rule that people eating only pizza and having beverages need to sit at the front of the store. 1 of us had food from the menu but they were unhappy. If their prices weren't that high, we might've gotten more food. Not only was the food terrible, the way they talked to us was unacceptable. We are never coming back for sure

The food was bland at best. They would not give me tap water and said I needed to purchase water. The other people in my party had purchased beverages, and I just wanted an ice water. Also they would not take credit cards, only cash. This would have been good to know before we sat down to eat. I would not recommend people eating here.
Amazing food! Amazing service! I went by myself before a show and had a great time! Highly recommend the cheese platter.

Decided to try this for pre-theatre dinner and drinks.  The location is super convenient to the Broadway theatres on 44th, 45th, and 46th Street.  The decor is lovely and reminiscent of an actual French Bistro.  

Unfortunately, they just don't hit the mark on food, cocktails, or service.

Cocktails first: a nice looking menu with decent cocktail prices (for the neighborhood).  I tried a classic Old Fashioned and then switched to a Manhattan.  Both were below average.  Too much vermouth, cheap well whiskey, and those cheap bright red cherries that look like little pieces of plastic.  My partner had a cocktail (I forget which one) that he seemed to like, but then he's not really much of a drinker.

Food was forgettable.  The server kept saying the short rib burger was their most popular, so my boyfriend tried that.  It was fine but nothing special.  I tried the mushroom risotto--it was bland and boring and could have easily come from a package in the grocery store aisle.

Service: the hostess was extremely casually dressed in what looked like workout clothes and wasn't very friendly.  The waiter was nice enough but a bit inexperienced.  Definitely not the professional servers you can often find at other area restaurants.  At one point we saw a busser watching a customer at an outside table get harassed by a homeless person.  The busser did nothing to help the customer and instead turned away to scroll through the Spotify playlists on the host stand iPad.  Speaking of Spotify, the music choices were very odd.  

I think maybe this bar is trying to look upscale while actually being a place for young tourists to get drunk and pretend they're at a fancy NYC restaurant.

Stopped in for a quick drink after a show. Great place to grab a night cap and watch the bustling city. The menu featured a ton of drink options! Our bartender was awesome and accommodating for our party. Highly recommend stopping by!

Comfortable seated restaurant right by Broadway.

Fast service for the area. Food was good and location was convenient.
Good local Italian spot in Hell's Kitchen. Had delicious pasta specials with shrimp and green salad. Asked to share and they brought on 2 plates, which is very nice touch.

Came here on a weekend without any reservation and no problem (I don't recommend tho...maybe it was a luck)
We walked past by this restaurant at first and the food looked appetizing so we decided to come back and dine. It was the best decision we ever made. I personally love seafood so I decided to go with seafood linguine...less calamari and more of the mussels. Not only this tasted super flavorful...and I kid you not...this is BEST "seafood pasta" I've ever had!!! Great location. Amazing food. Good service. Highly recommend
Can't wait to come back.
Best happy hour with fresh Long Island oysters served perfectly and the cute little bar ... loved it.

From the appetizers to the drinks, this is one classy joint.

They have an extremely comfortable bar to belly up to and offer a great wine menu. The staff are excellent, the appetizers are great if you're looking for a small plate to go with your drinks.
Cheers!

It was a cold day and I felt that it was time to have a late lunch early dinner. I was in the mood to have a steak and fries and passed by Bistro 46 and looked over their menu. It looked appetizing and they had just opened for dinner so I went in and was seated. There were a few people seated at the bar having drinks. A tall glass of water arrived shortly after I was seated and I already knew what i wanted [although I did think about their burger with carmelized onions for a short time-next time!]  i placed my order and within a short time, my steak [medium well] with herb butter and a side of french fries in a little basket with a handle arrived at the table. The steak was delicious and the fries were the perfect end of a great meal. The restaurant is a large square with the bar facing 8th Avenue. There is table seating throughout the rest of the restaurant. It was very clean, the staff was accommodating and it is reasonably priced for the theater district. I would recommend and return. [I have to try that burger!]
Wandered into this bar at the end of the night and I'm glad I found it! Grabbed a great espresso martini as a pick me up. The service was kind and the interior was nice and clean.
Maten kom med 20 minuters mellanrum i ett bord för 4. Restaurangen behöver lite putsning. På kvittot står det extra dricks. Dricksen har de redan inkluderat på notan

One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. Wine we ordered was undrinkable (and pretty sure the server/bartender poured the wrong wine because it was the wrong color too).
Food was inedible. Wife got raviolis that appeared to be frozen and reheated but were in a soup? Not a sauce, a watery soup. My salad didn't have dressing and was basically lettuce with breadcrumbs. Zero flavor whatsoever. I will not be in again.

12/9/22 -- I went to 46 bistro for a night cap with a friend. I ordered an expresso martini while my friend ordered a cosmopolitan. While the staff were nice, it took about 20 minutes for us to get our drinks. I wasn't a fan on their expresso martinis, but my friend did enjoy her cosmo and said she would order that drink again.

I usually don't like going to the same place twice when I travel! Man I'm wrong for that, I would have missed this beauty!  Wow it feels like Cheers here where the bartender knows your name, makes your drink like he cares and the whole staff provided a level of service you feel at home.  They work so well together.  The food is creative and simple, nice mix and match of flavors, awesome way to say Goodnight!

A gem waiting to be discovered! Excellent service, food, & ambiance just a short walk from Times Square & most major theatres. Open late -- we stopped in for coffee & dessert after midnight and the staff cheerfully accommodated our requests even when not on the menu. We'll definitely be going here again!
(Some confusion about the name, 46 Bistro or Bistro 46, so just go to the corner of 46th Street & 8th Avenue in Manhattan. You won't regret it!)

This was the worst place I have ever been. We have lived in New York almost 20 years and eaten at everything and this takes the prize of worst overpriced meal.

We were heading to a 7pm Broadway show and we walked into our first choice and it was boiling so we walked up the avenue and saw this spot. We had never eaten at the restaurant it used to be and figured it was near the theater, why not. We like trying new midtown spots for pre-theater.

I got mushroom cheese ravioli and my husband got a kale Caesar. We ordered Sauvignon Blanc. My blood is almost fully Sauv Blanc and what the bartender poured was a Riesling or Moscato, it was dark and orange and honeyed. It was not SauvBlanc. We exchanged for Prosecco which was fine.

My ravioli was floating in water. Literal water. Not butter. Not cream. WATER. It was clearly heated from being frozen and covered in what appeared to be canned mushrooms. My husbands salad had no dressing, was warm and basically chopped romaine with breadcrumbs. It looked dirty honestly.

We never complain but this was inedible so we said something. The bartender was apologetic and talked to the manager. They still charged us for the salad even though he didn't eat it and the two glasses of Sauv Blanc which was more expensive than the Prosecco that we actually drank.

This place is a joke and not worth anyones time. I felt I'll after eating the two raviolis I did. It's gross and overpriced and I regret stepping inside.

We took a quick walk off Times Square and found this restaurant. The ambience is very nice and wait staff was friendly..

I wouldn't recommend the martini but the Vodka soda was good..

As for food I got the steak and fries and it was perfectly cooked and I loved the side sauce. My 13 year old daughter got the cheese ravioli and also enjoyed her meal.

I would recommend to stop in for a quick meal.

Dropped in for bunch. Nice interior. Odered the Eggs Benedict. Won't make that mistake again. The poached eggs were cooked solid, the Canadian bacon was tiny compared to the English muffin, the hollandaise sauce was ok, but must be in short supply as there was a small drizzle on each egg. It was accompanied by abundant but seriously overcooked and sloppy potato/onion/pepper that look like it had been sitting in a warming tray for the better part of a day. The onions and peppers were mush.

Wonderful experience! We had a pre-theatre dinner iand ordered the short rib blend burgers, and I may never be able to find a better burger as long as I live! The service was excellent, we weren't rushed, and we returned after the show to listen to music at the bar and had a blast!!  Five stars!

Good pasta and service. Just don't order a steak and expect it come out cooked more that rare. Ordered medium rare and both of their attempts where red except for a couple of millimeters on each side.

It shocks me that I'm the fourth review of this place. We had a fantastic time here and just took a risk and tried it with so few reviews to go on. So glad we did.

The onion soup was really good. Great broth, the right cheese, good bread. And EVERYTHING else was really good too. The salmon poilé and even the side mashed potatoes. Just all surprisingly good.

Our waiter was also very charming.

Went to this restaurant in December and when we were in NYC this weekend we went back again.  It was perfect just like in December.  We went after a play on Friday (St. Patrick's Day) and they had a gentlemen singing and he was the best.  The piano player was great  also.  They made the night so much fun.  The food and drinks were on point.  The employees were  so nice and friendly.   This will be our go to spot whenever we are in NYC.  Thank you to the team.
Great stop after seeing a broadway show.  Food was good and the staff was great.  Recommended.  Perfect location

My family and I were celebrating my mom's 42nd birthday and were around times square so we decided to pop into this small bistro. It was pretty much empty, and although we didn't even get to ordering food, we could see why. Our server who took our drink order was very kind but 10 minutes in, we were told to 'SHUSH' by another server. It was extremely rude and if this business wants people to actually come here, they should reevaluate their idea of what it means for a good customer service experience.

I was with my mom eating gelato from another place and she wanted to sit down. We saw the outdoor seating and asked if we could sit and the waiter/host Jesse said we could. He was so nice and even brought us water. We were willing to get a coffee even though we didn't want it and he said don't worry don't pay for a coffee you don't want just sit relax. Usually you are not able to sit and do that at a restaurant without buying something. Jesse was so kind. Beautiful restaurant and will definitely be going back soon! It's in a beautiful area too.

My wife and I travel to New York twice each year to see live theater and visit museums. We had just finished "The Music Man" and had a few hours before an evening performance of "Company". We were walking down 8th Ave. and saw 46 Bistro that we had never visited in previous trips. We realized we were ready for an early dinner and walked in. Because it was early, we were seated after a few minutes. It was quiet, the menu was French-themed and we relaxed as soon as we sat down. Our server, Tasha, came over and greeted us with a friendly  smile and described several good dinner options. We had a cocktail and then ordered Steak Frites and Risotto, both of which were excellent. We very much enjoyed dinner as well as the conversation with Tasha and with the Host who gave us several good theater options we had not  considered. We will return to 46 Bistro and if you decide to go, you will not be disappointed.
