I highly doubt it was Kobe beef it kinda seemed like it was a frozen patty. I ordered my burger medium and it came out pretty much well done. It was also supposed to come with truffle aioli that was absent from the plate entirely and crispy onions that were not crispy at all. We also had sweet fries with the burger that weren't completely terrible just a little over cooked. As our second entree we ordered terrific steak. I cannot tell you how this was because we received the skirt steak that had so much garlic in the chimi sauce that would warn off any vampire in the vicinity. Since we were given the $16.95 skirt steak we should have been charged the price for the skirt steak but no we were charged the $18.95 for the terrific steak. Not so terrific....

Also, not only was my diet coke expired they brought out bottles of ketchup, brown mustard, and mayo. The mustard was expired, the mayo had some of the label ripped off so I can only guess maybe it was expired, and the ketchup looked warn and old.

All in all the service was poor and the food was even more poor. I will not be back or recommend this establishment to anyone. Unless you want to go and order water, bread, pita, and wonton chips (those were the only decent things we had).

I'm surprised to see the negative reviews.  I ate there last night & thoroughly enjoyed it!  Charming place, fine service, gentle prices, and, most importantly, delicious food!  I had the pasta with shrimp (and tomatoes, garlic & spinach) special - large portion & very fresh & tasty.  My friend raved over her fresh tuna.   We'll definitely go back!

The prices were great and the burgers were delicious, though, I ordered mine Medium Well and it came more towards the Medium side. Other than that, the delivery was prompt and the food was hot. Had the burger been cooked the way I asked, it would be a 5 star rating. Definitely worth the money.

ZERO STARS

I worked in the restaurant industry for over 13 years and this was the WORST experience I have ever had.

My wife and I sat down to have our 1st  anniversary dinner in New York after a LONG day.  As we were looking at the menu, and couldn't decide, we asked the waitress to start us a Goat Cheese Salad and then we would order the rest of our meal  as we figured it out. We were FLAT out to0ld NO, that we had to have our entire order ready prior to ordering as to not UPSET the COOK. (I refuse to call him a chef. )  Who tells a customer that they cant order an appetizer and then their meal because the poor guy in the kitchen might get mad???

After basically forcing us to decide, (which is when we should have left) we ordered the salad and a couple entrees. The salad came in 20 min, with about 1oz of cheese and a TERRIBLE thick vinaigrette.   We ate the salad and the stale warm bread.  WE then WAITED 45 more minutes without any food coming out.  There were 4 other tables in the place and only one had food. After not seeing the waitress for 20 min straight, NOT even one time, we decided to leave. I put  $20.00 on the table for the $6.00 beer, $8.95 salad and my wife's $2.00  diet coke.  We walked around the corner to Matt's Grill and had an awesome bleu cheese burger and great service.

DO NOT , I repeat DO NOT WASTE your time and especially your hard earned money on this HORRIBLY run establishment. There are too many choices to do so.

this place just opened up right around the corner from our office, and its fabulous! its a small place, but great for a lunch or dinner with a few friends.

the guy that runs the place is an absolute character, and totally aims to please.  he's super friendly and is always coming back to our table to make sure we don't need anything else, more food, napkins, drinks, etc.

the food here is really, really good. for those of you who like burgers (myself not included) there are ostrich burgers, regular burgers, ribs, chicken burgers, veggie burgers, salads, and much more.  the fries are homemade and have this special sauce that's so good. and the cheesecake is one of the best i've ever had.

I came here a few weeks ago with some of the people I intern for. We came in at about 12:30, expecting to leave around 1:30. There were six of us -- three of us ordered salads, two ordered the portabello mushroom entree, and one ordered a burger. It took over and hour for our food to arrive -- one of my coworkers even had to leave! (side note: there were probably four other people in the restaurant, so it wasn't like the place was busy).
For the most part, it looked like everyone enjoyed their food. I, on the other hand, did not. I ordered the beet salad and it was disgusting. The beets were canned and tasteless, there was barely any cheese, walnuts, or lettuce, and there was absolutely no dressing. I understand that it's called a beet salad, but if you're going to make the beet the star, they shouldn't be canned.
Next time (if there is one...) I might order something else. But to be honest, Vizio might not get my business again.

I ordered lunch for my office (5 orders or so) today from Vizio via delivery.com. In short: we were all pretty disappointed.

My veggie burger, while pretty big and full of veggies, also came with some kind of wood chip buried in the burger. Ouch! And the fries were a soggy mess by the time they arrived with the delivery. Undercooked, underseasoned. There's nothing worse than a cold, limp fry.

Two colleagues who got salads complained of both brown and dirty lettuce. One salad was so wilted, it was inedible. I felt terrible when pulling that sad salad out of the delivery bag and handing it to her. Since I made the order, I felt responsible. She didn't say anything to me directly, but the look on her face, something akin to, "what the hell did you do to me??! Can't you see I am HUNGRY!" said enough.

On the bright side... the diet cokes were awesome.

Our very attentive (and cutely-attractive!)
server tried to convince us that the name, "Vizio,"refers to the "vice" of loving food, but the room is also quaintly and eclectically appointed enough that the ambiance at least borders on the romantic side.  Okay, maybe not darkly romantic, but let's be broad minded about vice in general.

The menu sticks wisely to simple dishes, but there is plenty of variety.  Our choices, dover sole and shrimp Parmigiana, were cooked perfectly and almost too generously-sized to finish (only almost!).  Both of our salads were crisp, large, attractive, and tasty. And, priced at well less than $20 per entree, Vizio seems a real find between Columbus Circle and Times Square.

In addition, the wine list, while hardly vast,
offers all its selections by the glass or by the bottle, a handy habit for those of us who like to "graze" in the oenophilic sense.  The Nero d'Avola and the Montepulciano were just fine, particularly at an $8.00 price!

This attractive spot deserves a lot of additional attention.  I have been eating on Manhattan for fifty years, and we just lucked into it because it was referenced on the NY City Center website for before an Alvin Ailey performance.

And, our server and the kitchen were happy to accommodate my request for no garlic in my tomato sauce.  High marks for both service and flexibility do a lot to have me wind up content with simplicity and rate Vizio with four stars.
The burger part of the burger was PERFECT, but the bun left something to be desired... I also got the sweet potato french fries, which were divine--light and fluffy, crisp...

wow, I'm really impressed. I personally am not a fan of burgers. I am not a masochist I do not believe in punishing myself. The fat on these things are killer but they really are delicious.I went light tonight- grilled chicken havent tried it yet- to be determined tomorrow, but looks awesome. An order of 10 was ordered and all liked, its been defined as a keeper. I also got a banana smoothie to keep healthy- really really good.

We found this restaurant off of the NY City Center website.  Knew nothing about it but were looking for something a quick walk back to the theater.  More than pleasantly surprised.  We have been highly recommending the restaurant.  Staff was attentive, wine list very good and food excellent.  Loved the tilapia special.  Even a dish as simple as spaghetti and meatball was remarkable.  Will be back!

So yummy! I went to this place for a quick lunch and I got so much more than I paid for. Not only was the service fantastic, but the menu had so many different types of burgers. I would certainly recommend this place and I'm sure I'll be there again soon.

I was in NYC for business looking for a good place to eat by myself. When I entered Vizio, I was instantly impressed with the decor. I felt right at home. The service was amazing and the food just as good. I opted for the meatloaf (yes I know) and was not disappointed. The entire experience was great. I left my leftover bag on the table by accident, left and walked two blocks toward my hotel when I heard someone calling me. I turned to look and it was my waiter Jose bringing me my leftovers. You cannot go wrong at Vizio. Very intimate setting and a great place for a date as well as alone.

i don't get it-- what is the draw of this place?  it has 4* on yelp and 5* on seamlessweb! i've ordered from here twice and both times they screwed up my order and my burger bun was all soggy! blech.  also, they have a $15 minimum for delivery, which is just unacceptable.

first time-- normal hamburger.  other than soggy bun, totally acceptable, other than the fact that they forgot my coke and sent onion rings instead of sweet potato fries.   2nd time, ostrich burger.  is it real ostrich? i don't know.  but it tasted like tofu... that is to say, like nothing.  i had to put 2 packets of mustard on it to even feel like it was worth my nine bucks.  once again, onion rings came with.  i mean, i like onion rings as much as the next gal, but not at work people.  i have SOME self respect.

maybe one must actually go inside this place in order to find those extra stars.  but i'm lazy and don't really have a lunch "break" per se, as much as i get 10 minutes to scarf down some food that is hopefully nourishing at my desk.  and when one only has 10 minutes, it better pack a punch.  and so vizio, i strip you of your stars.  huzzah!

Yeah don't get the eggs benedict here.  I broke a cardinal rule: order what they're known for.  This place was known for their burgers, and I didn't order a burger...and I paid the price.  I was won over by the possibility of eggs benedict with a side of mimosa for brunch!  What could possibly go wrong?  Well, for starters, the mimosa was way too sour.  Then the hollandaise sauce was also too sour.  To rub it in, I got a taste of my friend's burger, which was good enough for me to deeply regret my decision.  Lesson learned, don't be seduced by a cheap deal with mimosa!

This place is amazing! We popped in here on a whim because we were seeing a Broadway show, and we couldn't have been more happy. The food was amazing and the service was. Incredible! Between the three of us, we explored the menu. Great burger, panini, salad, and the appetizers were badass. And if you're lucky, maybe Josuey will be your waiter. He really made the experience that much more enjoyable. Check it out!

While I've yet to actually visit Vizio in person, I have ordered from there twice via delivery.com. Both times, my burgers were burned and the buns were stale. I even tried ordering my burger more on the rare side the second time around, thinking I could beat the system--but no, still burned.

As far as delivery goes, you can get better.

I went here with my roommate a few years back. Maybe it's improved since then, but we both ordered burgers and were extremely disappointed with the quality. Tasteless and chalky. Only highlight was we could draw on the tablecloth thing.

every time I visit nyc (annually), I make it priority to have almost a daily slice of cheese pizza from two bros. one of my favorite parts of nyc is the authenticity and this place has it :) plus who can beat $1.50 for a slice this big?!

It's cheap New York pizza but the staff is quick and communicative. The price can't be beat. Only issues are limited seating and everytime I visit I'm badgered by a homeless person which makes the dining experience less than extraordinary. Absolutely loved the bbq chicken pizza.
Quick pizza by slice place offering 5/6 vegetarian options and the line moves quickly so you won't have to wait more than 5 minutes. I'll recommend trying their cheese slice and mushroom slice.

Wandered in here after a long day of sightseeing the city as it was close to our hotel.   The line out the door confirmed it was a good option.    The lovely pizza smells were also reaffirming to our hungry stomachs.  

I got 2 pieces of cheese this crust and a soda for a whooping $3.99!!    

Pizza was tasty and fresh!

So good! Pizza by the slice, hot and fresh, for a dollar fifty!
You walk in and are swarmed by smells of ovens and cheese and tomato sauce. They have a dining area inside, outside, and a counter to order out /to go.
No Parm cheese out but they did have oregano, chili flakes and garlic salt. It was a perfect snack to tide us over as we were walking around the city.
Super fast and very fresh, yummmmyyyy

I'll keep it simple with what you probably want to know.

- Can I really get a decent slice of NY pizza for $1.50? Yes - you absolutely can. No frills, no questions, just good value.

- Don't the signs say $1/slice? They do, but...inflation. $1.50 is still unbeatable value.

- Is this the slice I should get for 'real' NY pizza? Probably not, it's there to satisfy craving that won't break the bank.

- How are the non-cheese slices? They're fine, but you can definitely do better for non-cheese slices. Move along.

We got here around 5 PM on a Sunday and there was already a line of people eagerly to get a cheap and quick evening meal. It was cool watching the staff toss the dough around before topping it with ingredients and toppings. One of my friends from the city told me she only thought the cheese and pepperoni pizza were worth it here, so I got one of each.

CHEESE PIZZA SLICE - 1.50
This one came fresh out of the oven so I was really excited to eat this slice. Sadly, it wasn't anything special and very much felt like I was eating food valued at $1.50. The cheese wasn't super stringy or tasty, the tomato sauce was just mediocre and the dough wasn't too memorable.

PEPPERONI PIZZA SLICE - 3
This was definitely better and the pepperoni definitely gave it more taste, but it was super oily and also not the freshest slice. I'd probably get this again if I came back to 2 Bros Pizza.

Overall, it was just OK. Nothing phenomenal. Food is food, and we needed something quick for dinner that evening and it did the job for a fair price of $4.50.
Fast hot and crispy crust. If staying at doubletree, Fairfield, or Distrikt it's about 1 min away in the same street.

We got there and it was not busy, I ordered 4 slices of Pizza and paid. Once I got my order from the manager I asked if they had cheese and he said they didn't, but one of the guys making pizza added
" No cheese, ketchup or mustard, this is NY". It was definitely really rude comment, but I didn't say anything, I just left and was just really excited to give this pizza a chance.

The pizza wasn't great like the other pizza I had at 1435 Broadway, I should have just walk my lazy self down the street to the other place. Lesson learned
Can't beat the price. $1.50 for cheese slice. $3 for pepperoni slice. 2 cheese + soda is $4. Slices are hot and fresh, crispy on the bottom. Good amount of sauce and cheese.
We had the most perfect thin crust pizzas from here! Not sure if we just extremely hungry for walking 3 hours all over Times Square but in any case, the pizza was delicious. And the slices are huge!

Fav pizza spot in the city. Can you best fresh $1.50 cheese pizza with quality?? No you cannot.

It might not be those Italian fancy hand thrown up the sky for 10 mins type of pizza, but it's sure a pizza that represents NYC and it's what I love about NYC. We visit the city often for this no joke!

Great place to come in for cheap pizza. You can still get a slice of cheese pizza for $1. And the size of the slice is generous. More if you get toppings. Quick to get food. Filling. Nothing fancy but the price is right. Employees were friendly too.

Certain things are synonymous with New York City. One of them definitely is pizza. But to be specific, there's simply an allure of the $1 slice pizza that you can get at nearly any hour of the day or night.

2 Bros is emblematic of the $1 slice pizza. While it's not open at the wee hours of the evening, it does serve the purpose of quick and cheap pizza that can easily be consumed before getting on the bus from Port Authority back home to NJ or up north to Boston or down south to Washington DC.

Asking for high quality pizza isn't the priority here. It's simply that for $1, you can get a slice of pizza. 2 slices + a soda is just $3. With inflation the way it is, the one thing that hasn't changed is the cost of a slice.

The place is pretty simple and straightforward. You line up alongside a narrow walkway to grab your slices and go. The only thought would perhaps have been to flip the cashier to be closer to the tables (so that once you pay, you can go to a table inside rather than loop around from outside to inside), but that's being nitpicky.

They do have fancier slices now, but nothing beats a simple slice of cheese pizza. 2 Bros fits the bill.

I've had 2 Bros before, and I thought I remembered it tasting better.

I returned to get 2 cheese slices and a white cheese slice. I asked for well done and they didn't listen, they just wanted to get everything out of the oven as fast as possible to keep the line moving.

The cheese slice was very bland. Not much cheese, only tasted the overly sweet dough. It's hard to describe, but it tasted like a sweet loaf of bread with sauce, not a slice of pizza.

The white cheese was even more bland than the plain cheese, and what sucks is that it was $3 for the specialty slice. Wasn't a "specialty" in my opinion.

The employees are also rude. They don't speak much English and they just want to keep the line moving and they get mad at you if you ask a question. I don't want to support these guys any longer.

There's better tasting pizza places out there, so don't be cheap and go to Joe's perhaps.

You really cannot go wrong with 2 Bros. I used to frequent the East Village location at ungodly hours, back in my youth. Now that I'm all grown up, I no longer stay up late but instead, I wake up early. After a 9 AM movie at the AMC nearby (yes, 9 AM), we wanted a quick snack but not a whole meal. I remembered there was a 2 Bros in the area, so we stopped in at around 11:30 AM on a Saturday. There were only a few customers but they seemed be already busy churning out pies. Slices are still $1, which I'm super grateful for given the rising costs of everything nowadays. I thoroughly enjoyed my $1 slice and as long as the quality/price remains consistent, I will forever be a 2 Bros fan.

We came here thinking the pizza slices were only $1 because it says $1 pizza but I guess it was just for the Cheese pizza. Lol. We were a bit surprised when we paid the bill but it made sense because it was too good to be true to have pizza that cheap! Anyways, it was still a pretty good deal because their pizza slices were huge!! I had two slices and couldn't finish them both. I had the supreme and hawaiian but I like the Hawaiian better. My sisters had the hawaiian, supreme and the barbecue with what tasted like chicken nuggets. She also liked the Hawaiian and the barbecue chicken ones. It's probably not the best pizza in town but not a bad deal for the amount of food and the taste wasn't all that bad either.
Quick and yummy. Garlic in sauce. Crust is perfect texture...not too crisp not to soft. Only giving 4 stars because it's the first pizza we have had so far.
What's not to love. A corner pizza joint with slices in Hell's Kitchen. It was quick and hot and delicious. Good place for a slice
The best.  Delicious, affordable pizza with fast service.  Just have to put up with being constantly harassed by the homeless there :/

GOOD EXAMPLER OF NYC SLICE
It's not easy to find a good NYC slice anywhere near Times Square. But this ex-patriot New Yorker still has a nose for a good slice. Literally, smelling my way by sticking my nose in every pizza joint I passed while walking downtown on 8th Ave. Till...I found 2Bros with a line of locals outside waiting to order their slice of a pie.

Giving a brief sniff I knew I was on to something. There were many specialty pies from BBQ chicken to old fashion pepperoni. To my pleasant surprise, they were selling the cheese slices for only $1.00 each!  Amazing!  Of course, the best way to test a NY slice is to order a "cheese slice".

So I got on line. It moved quickly. One staff on the register, and another behind the counter leaned over to ask what I wanted. "Cheese slice" I said.  When I got to the register 2 cheese slices were waiting for me on a paper plate. "Two?" I thought? Oh well at $1.00 each I didn't complain. Then I noticed they were the last 2 cheese slices from the pie. And before I even picked up my plate, another whole fresh pie came out of the oven to replace the empty pie plate that my 2 slices came from. "Hey" I said. "Can I please swap these out for two fresh from the oven slices?  Looking at the fresh steaming hot cheese pie."This os such a tease...". I lamented   To my surprise. They did. Without even the hint of a protest. They immediately swapped out my slices for 2 fresh ones out of the oven.   When does THAT happen? Thank you 2Bros.

Now many of my Yelp friends have heard me tout NYC pizza from Brooklyn as the bar to which ALL claimed "NYC  style pizza's" MUST be compared. It still is, but you will get a
Lot  closer to that bar in Manhattan than say Seattle or Los Angeles. (Pssst 3 Guys in LA across the street from the Egyptian Theater in Hollywood. ) I digress.

This pizza passes the NY crust test. Thin, crispy but still foldable without cracking. The sauce, can be subjective. I like mine thick and a little sweet but from the tomatoes. Not sugar.
Then the oil test. Once folded, you should get an orange stream of oil from the cheese. Not too much, but some. This slice had a little less than I like but it is still an enjoyable and satisfying slice of NYC.  

Not quite the gold standard of Brooklyn slices but possibly the closest you will get anywhere near midtown Manhattan. So for those reasons, I am awarding four stars.

BTW, aside from the pointers I noted in this review, if you are looking for a good NYC slice in New York, and you walk into a pizza joint and no one is waiting for a slice and the guy says "This is the best pizza in New York City..." it is not.  Look elsewhere. If you're good, you don't have to say it.
Excelsior
What can I say $1.50 a slice. Hot and fast. Staff was friendly and welcoming. definitely will come back next time in I'm in New York.

This was my first time and it did not disappoint!!!  I ordered the veggie pizza and added pepperoni.  Although it was turkey pepperoni, it was still delicious!!!  The price was very reasonable and the staff was friendly!!!  I will definitely go back! N

This place has a large variety of pizza and very unique pizza combinations. Their cheese slices are $1. Ordered the buffalo chicken pizza. It was reheated in their oven for a little too long, so the crust was too crispy. The flavors were good, but the crust was a bit too tough and cheese didn't taste too fresh. Not bad for pizza, but there's plenty of other better pizza places in NYC.

For smaller, quick spots, I don't expect great service at all- just great food to compensate.

The value on their cheese slice is amazing. Since there's usually a decent amount of people waiting for a slice, the piece you'll get will probably be relatively fresh. When I got it, the bottom was the perfect amount of crispy- approaching flaky.

That being said, I'm not anywhere near a pizza enthusiast (pizza head? pizza snob?) and I enjoy Domino's garlic crust pizza, but this slice tasted good to me. If you aren't looking for the finest pizza in NYC, this is the spot for you. And if you are... this might also be the spot for you?

When you and a few friends are in the final stretch of a 26.2 mile virtual marathon around NYC and you don't care about pace or overall time you take a few minutes to refuel with $1 pizza!

We did just that is past October. Typical $1 cheese slice that you will find at all their locations. We saw this location on our trek and the $1 slice sign, and knew this was our carbohydrate calling!

Sure, the staff can be a bit rude and gruff. The pizza is not the greatest, but our slices came from a fresh hot pie they just had pulled from the oven, so it was all good to us. Don't expect greatness from a $1 pizza joint and you'll be ok.

This pizza doesn't take like what you think it does when you think of NYC pizza. It was pretty tasteless and cold I might add. Only reason it had two starts and not one is because they deliver late night. I wasn't a fan.

Usually if I'm at time square area, I would grab  2 slices and a drink at the 2 Bros next to the bowling alley on 9th Ave. They have the best pizzas I believe.  Since my friend and I came across this location first, we ate at this location. We were hoping to get some fresh slices and our chances of getting fresh slices were promising since it was a long line. Unfortunately we got the last 2 slices of the pie. This location is gross. No place to sit and the bums were just walking in to occupy the eating area. The flies were all over the place. Thank God we didn't feel ill after the pizzas.
How can you lose? It's $1 cheese pizza slices. Open late for late night carb fillings. The line and service is quick. Add oregano and garlic powder, it'll satisfy your pizza cravings.

Sometimes you just want a good, simple cheese pizza-- this place gets it! I always saw people walking around with a box of pizza from this restaurant, so my boyfriend and I decided to check this place out. We came by an hour before closing on a weekday, and there was a long line that lasted around 15 minutes. I ordered the pineapple and ham pizza with a Dr. Pepper Cream Soda and my boyfriend got the cheese pizza for to go. They placed the slices in a bag for us to carry back to our hotel, but I wish they gave us a box instead so the pizza could've stayed warm. The cheese pizza was still decent, but the pineapple and ham pizza was not it. The Dr. Pepper Cream Soda hit the spot though, and I was super surprised seeing that they carried them. Definitely grab the cheese pizza and one of the cream sodas if you plan on grabbing a cheap bite here.

This place is open late and $4 for a slice of Hawaiian.... That's about all the good I can say about that. Pizza was doughy and tasteless. It was good to soak up alcohol at midnight, but that's about it.
W bros always coming in clutch. Huge slices, bomb pizza and ice cold sodas for 2 bucks a pop. What more do you want? What more do you need?!

Pretty sad to come across pizza this disappointing in New York. We got the cheese pizza, and it basically tasted like reheated frozen pizza. There was nothing that really stood out to us. If this pizza was served to us during school cafeteria lunch meals, I would be like, "Yeah that tracks" just based on taste alone. Dough didn't really have the slight chew that pizza has and it kinda tasted like a cracker. Cheese itself was kinda disappointing as well. There wasn't really any grease on it (which is a plus), but somehow, it was basically flavorless. Consider other places in NY if you're looking for outstanding pizza. 2/5 stars.
$1.50 for a great cheese slice. Classic New York pizza. Normally a line, but moves fast.

The most New Yorker thing you could do is eat at this place. Imagine eating your $1 cheese pizza on a dirty table surrounded by crackheads and big black garbage bags . If you want to feel like a real New Yorker come eat this place.

When I wasn't busy living the sex, drugs, & rock & roll lifestyle of a librarian living in NYC & sniffing cocaine off the bellies of prostitutes, I was busy trying to afford rent for my crappy Bronx apartment.

So I'd often be on the lookout for bargains, whether it was the many opportunities for free entertainment the city has to offer, or cheap dining options, like this place.

You've got to love this chain. Cheap, fast & decent. And pretty widespread throughout the city.

Worse outlet of this chain.consistently under cooked pizza and mostly cold
Even when I ask for hot slices
The one on 40th and ninth worth the walk
Help in there own little world which definitely not NYC
Tourists on a tight budget seem to be only ones who enjoy

We had to get a slice of cheap NY pizza. This place was surprisingly cheap - $4.25 for 2 slices of pizza and a soda. We had the classic pepperoni which had a nice thin crust. It was a little oily from the pepperoni. Not overly cheesy. We also had the cheese pizza which had a thicker crust. The cheese was good but it was too much. I would recommend to take the classic pepperoni or pepperoni and mushroom as it's not as rich as the cheese pizza. Taste was good. Perfect pick me up slice of pizza after a shopping spree. Service was friendly and super fast.

Short Wait 5/5
Ambience 5/5
Food 5/5
Drinks 5/5
Service 5/5

The line is long always but always goes down real quick. The pizza is so good & the service is fast.
Great Pizza and fast service as always! Love coming here after a late night or when I need a quick meal on the go.

Honestly what can I say, do you have any other options this late at night.

Yeah it's not the world's greatest pizza, but it's definitely better then what you paid for. Came here ever night while visiting NYC lol!

Tastes good, gets the job done and puts you to sleep.

5 stars for it being what it is.

In NY for the first time. Wanted to try some pizza. What a mistake. Judging from the other great meals I had there, I obviously chose poorly. Don't waste your time, yes it's pretty cheap but you definitely get what you pay for. Would have gave it 1 star but since it was my first time in NY...

This is a no frills take out pizza place. Great location in the heart of Manhattan. The pizza is some of the best we've ever tasted. Now we understand why people make a big deal out of NY Pizza! Friendly staff, quick service.

This was a while ago before the pandemic, but here's my review anyways.

I personally thought the pizza was overrated. The staff was super rude. It was advertised outside that the slices were $1 (not specifying that it was cheese pizza only), so you'd assume that everything would be. When the receipt came out, it was TRIPLE the amount I expected. So I asked, "Wait what?" And then the workers ROLLED HIS EYES and FACEPALMED saying "Oh my god..."

HOW RUDE!

New York City like most big cities is constantly changing so it's nice to have something consistent that you can fall back on. New buildings go up and old ones come down, however 2 Bro's continues to offer their slices of pizza for a $1.75 for cheese and pepperoni.  An incredible deal when  you think about it.  That's where our story starts.

My better half and I was painting this town red and we got a little hungry but we already spent a grip eating and drinking.  So we were on the hunt for something cheap, fast and good.  That's where 2 Bros fulfills the saying that you can have it either cheap and quick (but not good), cheap and good (but not quick) or quick and good (but not cheap).  Now I'm not saying that 2 Bro's Pizza is the best of the best pizza that we've ever eaten but for the value, speed and taste, you can't beat it.  My better half got the pepperoni ($1.75) and I got the meat lovers ($4.00) a slice and that includes tax. What a steal of a deal.

So if you want some pizza quick, fast and pretty good,  then stop by one of their many locations and grab yourself a slice or get a while pie.

This isn't meant to be or compete with the gourmet staples in the Pie world of NYC. Once you understand that, then you grow such a respect for their offerings. It is
good pizza tjat they undervalue at the price of $1. Their late night availability makes them even more attractive. The slices are still large and the combo of 2 slices and a can beverage for $2.99 is bomb. It does need to be eaten as soon as possible however. It does not retain heat as long nor does it reheat back to its original state. It's not the purpose of the pie. It's purpose is immediate satisfaction of the moment. Respect that and enjoy a good slice.

Not a bad slice IMO. But there are better out there. For the money and convenience it's worth it. Just don't go here expediting a lot. They push whatever's made on you leaving little options if you missed the last cheese slice when you walked in. I agree with the other review " what's more Ny than eating a cheese slice off a dirty table surrounded by crackheads ?"

After stumbling through a YouTube video featuring the storyline behind 2 brothers pizza I had to give it a try. First and foremost, their claim to fame is their 1 dollar slice, which held true when I bought a regular cheese slice. That, in it of itself, is something truly to be marveled at in the center of a busy Manhattan street. With high overhead costs and competition roaring through the city, I can respect a slice costing only a dollar.

As for the pizza itself, you get what you paid for, and a little more. The pizza was actually not bad. Very plain simple slice with a well made thin crust. Can't ask for much more for a simple one dollar cheese slice.

Service is very fast, and I was in and out of there like no time. Would definitely revisit for cheap eats especially if it's late at night. Really hope they can maintain their cheap eats!

Great place to stop for a quick bite when you've had a night out bar hopping and you're on route back to Penn Station. No flop to the pizza (iykyk), but that's because the dough isn't the same as traditional NYC/NJ pizza. I tend to classify places like this as "fast food" pizza.
Good food fast and cheap. I was looking for a late night treat for family and was able to find exactly what everybody wanted just to block from where I was staying
Hand over a dollar and they'll make you a hot slice of cheese pizza! Simple and cheap, and was pleasantly surprised by the quality.
Best pizza in New York!!!There super fast at taking your orders and getting the food back out to you.They do stay packed but I swear it's worth the wait.

Awful service and food.

Ordered before 5 yesterday to have in time for students leaving on a nighttime field trip.  Received a text at 5:10 saying food was out for delivery, which was fantastic because we are TEN BLOCKS (streets, not even avenues, so it was incredibly close) away.  I called after about half an hour and the man who answered was incredibly rude and said IT'S OUT FOR DELIVERY - without knowing who I was or what I ordered or to what location, so definitely an uninformed response.

At *5:50* the delivery man showed up.  The pizzas were gross, partly because they had been steaming in their cardboard boxes and became a soggy mess.  But the flavor and cheese were....just no.  I was ashamed and embarrassed to have had to feed that to my students.
Great food at a great value. Everything is 100% halal here, making it that much more delicious. Excellent customer service as well!

Best burger and soda for $2.99 I've ever had! This is your basic bodega but it is clean and the cook is nice and neat. The cashier is friendly. They play merengue and you can chit chat with the other customers. As Harlem becomes gentrified, I'm glad to see such a place survive. It is also known as West Harlem Deli.

Zero Stars. I'm writing an update to explain the horrible treatment my aunt received going to this store. I didn't know she was going here otherwise I would have warned her on how disgusting this place is. The man at the counter cheated her by charging her an extra 50 cents for something clearly marked 99 cents. The price was PRINTED on the bag by the manufacturer. He told her it doesn't matter what the bag says.  After she told him he wasn't allowed to do that, HE TOLD HER TO GET THE FCUK OUT. Seriously, how disgusting.

It looks like every other bodega in the city. But you walk in and you find staff that treat you like the most important customer in the world. Grill cooks who remember your order when you come in. It's places like this that make me love New York. Whether I'm getting my weekday morning bagel, a quick afternoon snack or a late night munchie fix, the guys at 292 are always there to help and make you feel like this is your neighborhood. And the lunchtime paninis are PACKED so full they're like two meals in one and they're so cheap I don't know how they're making any money off of them. Seriously - they say don't judge a book by its cover, I say don't judge a bodega by its storefront. This place is an asset to the Harlem neighborhood.

First things first :
Rockstarr & Deanna behind the bar are top tier customer service connoisseurs!

Be mindful they take cash, but don't let that stop you from having a good time.
The team at 2 sisters 4 brothers was extremely attentive as well kind to me during my visit.
If you want to have a good time that's drama free, with great food and even better vibes, I highly recommend 2 Sisters 4 Brothers in Harlem.

Very fun. No card. They take cash.
Good DJ. Fun crowd. Nice manager and staff. Strong drinks.  Lively

This place is complete trash. To start, the drinks are ridiculously overpriced!  A rum and coke in a small cup cost $18. The food is horrible

2nd, I came here to watch the Errol spence vs Terence crawford boxing match on July 29, 2023. They charged a $30 cover to view the boxing match. They were using a terrible streaming service which had ads that kept popping up in the middle of the fight and cutting the fight off multiple times. Clearly, they were being cheap.

The one good thing I can say about this place is the DJ was good but other than that, I would not recommend going there unless you want to spend a boat load of money for under served drinks and bad food

Food was cool . Buh it ain't the same with out Rockstar . Bring Rockstar back or in will take my team else where respectfully  .
Because idk who this cheese and his crew is very disrespectful and very slow working .
Bring RockStar and Deanna back to the bar .
We want the old 2 Sisters & 4 Brothers back idk what y'all got going on in there now but it's no longer good vybez

I've been going there for a while now it's cool or what ever but I can agree with rainy . Without Rockstar and Deanna it's kinda wack the vybe is off and I notice it's been nun but secret drama in there since I believe his name is cheese been there . Bring the old 2 sisters 4 brothers back

One of my favorite cafes that I've been to. Truly amazing ambiance and relaxing environment as well as the extremely friendly staff. Thank you Yusuf for always making my very specific coffee order. All their baked goods / sandwiches are beyond delicious. Clean cafe with a perfect menu. One block from home so I take all my guests there for breakfast or afternoon coffee break. Never disappoints, always consistent which in my opinion is the best compliment an establishment can receive.

I don't know what anyone else thinks but a cafe in a hardware store doesn't seem very sanitary. I pass by all the time but never went in until recently when I was in the hardware store and realized it was the same place

Tucked away inside Mushtari, a plant/hardware store, this tiny coffee shop serves espresso with Café Grumpy beans. The air inside is lush with all the plants around you. Nice barista, fast service. To-go cups only, but there is some limited seating.

Real cute cafe. I found myself in Harlem and googled Black owned cafes near me and this gem popped up. At first I thought I was lost because I opened the door and saw a plant/ garden shop. One of the workers saw how confused I was and let me know I was in the right spot and that the cafe was further inside. Comes to find out this cafe is in fact located inside the Mushtari Hardware and Garden Store.

As a plant lover, the plant shop/cafe vibe really works. It's unique and a really cute spot to work from elsewhere since they have free wi-fi. It wasn't packed and the music was good. I was able to chat with one of the co-owners, Hamza, who was very friendly and gave me recommendations.

I opted for the hot hibiscus tea which was delicious. It was mixed with other herbs and spices that was perfect for a rainy day. I also got the hash brown and egg burrito which was very filling. They also have coffee and an assortment of other pastries.

If I'm in the area I'd definitely stop back. I might even pick up a plant or two ;)

Really adorable place with awesome staff ! I told them I hadn't been before and they gave me recommendations, I got the matcha latte with honey. They even offered to make me a different free drink if I didn't like it, but it was delicious, perfect balance of sweet honey and bitter green tea. The space is relaxing with TONS of plants because its inside a garden shop. Clean, bright, smells sweet and fresh from the plants, even the music playing was good. Will absolutely be returning :^)

9 Tails is a hidden gem. You walk through what feels like a tropical jungle to find an unassuming counter.

The coffee (black, drip) is excellent. A lovely cup of chocolatey joe that will carry you through the day. While we were there, they brought us some fresh, warm croissant twists that were just heavenly.

I will definitely be back and maybe I'll walk out with a plant or two next time!

I've tried a lot of hidden gem cafes around Harlem, but this is my favorite!! Idk what kind of coffee they use, but it's always a perfect balance in my latte. I usually stop here most weekends. The ambience is nice as well with plants covering the walls. I would not recommend working from here though as outlets are hit or miss. Pro tip: I recommend coming here for coffee and then heading to super nice donuts for the perfect pairing!

I happened upon this spot while I was in the neighborhood for work! Love it. Nice and chill, great vibe. When you first walk in, you may think you are in the wrong spot because the entrance is a plant shop.  Menu is limited, but that's okay, everything else makes up for it.

I love plants and they had a great selection.
Incredible coffee, incredible team, amazing vibes. This is literally what every neighborhood coffee shop should be like. It's like Cheers but 9 Tails.

Delicious honey oat latte, pricey at $5 but it seems like coffee is this expensive everywhere these days.

There is NO wifi despite what Yelp says... It is a small coffee shop inside a store that sells potted plants, really cute. Not the most comfortable seating, but nice music and very clean.
I stumbled upon this café recently, and it's a coffee lover's paradise! The cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, and exceptional coffee make it a must-visit spot.

Among the most interesting coffee shops I've been to and there's been many that are quite so but this is coffee gonzo. It has such an unusual location. 9 Tails is located inside a hardware store. For real. The expectation is the coffee would taste like grass or something like that but that would be wrong.

Coming here was another case of getting off the subway at some random stop and checking out cafes around it. It was a bit of a walk from the 125th Street station and it was super confusing finding it at first because we thought it couldn't be the correct place. The address is Mushtari Hardware, a hardware store. Only did we know it was the correct place after we read the sandwich board. This said something about coffee and to go that way. Getting to here is by two options. The hardware store has a main entrance on 125th and the back entrance is on 126th, which is the address listed here and on the business website. On 125th you enter on the main floor, while on 126th you enter in the basement. The basement is where you'll find the coffee shop. It has a small counter. This is purely for takeout. A drip coffee is one of the choices. It's $3 for a small. The coffee tasted fresh and not like it's been there a long time. It wouldn't be unexpected with it being so hard to find. They also have some non dairy milks like oat. Get some breakfast burritos. Many locally made and one is vegan. Each of us got a Vegan Breakfast Chorizo Burrito. It's $7 and while it's not big it packs in a lot. This has bell peppers, caramelized onions, Impossible chorizo, pickled daikon, and refried pinto beans and it's all vegan. Good burrito. They also have some croissants and muffins and a few are vegan so pretty good plant based choices and healthier options.

Amazing this is in a hardware store but it yes it's possible to pick up a hose in the same place as coffee. It's better getting here early. They quickly run out of pastries.
Better than five stars!!! This spot is amazing!! It's nestled in town and the apple turnovers are addicting! Our barista made each morning special  during our NYC visits.

I came here and I must say it was quite interesting. The inside of it is quite beautiful and peaceful. I had the iced drink and I remember it was quite strong. I am not sure what I ordered but I do remember the cookie. We had the chocolate cookie and wow that cookie was quite tasty. I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu.
9 Tails is a true neighborhood spot! Great coffee and pastries, and the baristas are very friendly. Plus, coffee surrounded by plants is certainly a way to brighten up anyone's day.

Update: there are no electrical outlets, so make sure your device is fully charged if you intend to do work here.

9 Tails Is a small coffee shop that recently opened on West 126 Street in Harlem. I've stopped in a couple times recently. At the moment, it appears as though they are serving basics like coffee and lattes. A small coffee will run you $2.75. The staff is very friendly. They are selling a small assortment of homemade pastries, as well. There are few tables and chairs where guests can sit work or just relax. There's a lot of natural light that enters the café space through the large, glass exterior doors that face toward 126 St. My only suggestion to the owner is to put a sign outside on the sidewalk to lure more street traffic inside. At the moment, it's very easy to walk by and not even notice the cafe.

Love this place!  I was in town and waiting for my AirBnB so searched for coffee and this place came up,  The reviews are spot on.  The vibe is great, coffee good and I love plants.  Those that have been know what I mean about the plants.

I've been going to this coffee shop off and on since it opened, I really love the staff here, and the food and coffee are excellent. I especially love their baked goods, a lot of thought is put into the recipes and you can definitely taste it. Now that they have merged with the hardware store, the coffee shop actually rests in between 125th and 126th streets, surrounded by beautiful plants. Overall a very nice vibe and definitely worth a stop!
The best of the best!! Great drinks, great pastries, and great staff! Wonderful upbeat environment inside of a hardware store and plant nursery. This shop is always me go to!
This is a very cute place and so glad to have another coffee shop in the neighborhood! It has a very modern feel. My only complaint is the menu is very small and was hard to find.

Very cool use of space between a garden store and hardware store. Coffee was fine, they only have oat and whole milk. Barista was in a very bad mood and let everyone know it, even loudly saying how annoying all the customers were. Her attitude was the only real negative.

I love coffee and this is the best coffee I have ever had.  Now lets talk about that delicious blueberry lemon loaf.  WOW.  Feel the love.  That loaf is super juicy and the blueberries are amazing and add to that moist flavor.  Please make sure you have that every day.
Great spot! Beautiful space where you can get great coffee and sit and relax or work while listening to dope music surrounded by gorgeous plants. Wish I lived closer so I could visit more often

Great local place for coffee. I stopped in a few months ago and made a note of that they serve Tandem Coffee, which is a coffee roaster based in Portland, Maine (my hometown)!  I've also tried the baked goods and have yet to be disappointed.  I did find it a little strange that they didn't have almond milk as an option, but an oat milk matcha latte works just as well. It really is takeout only, there's a tiny bench in front but it's really only enough room for two small people or one large person.

Got an iced matcha latte yesterday - it was delicious! The matcha was blended in really well - no sediments at the end. I think this place also has plants and is connected to a hardware store...? Anyway, it all contributes to a great vibe. I'll be back for sure. They also have oat milk for my fellow non-dairy folks.
Loved all of the plants in the space and the fact that their espresso was very strong

As a black female who have been to this cafe twice I would not recommend unless you are white or an "uncle Tom" (conforming to be accepted by white people)... I'm an educated black female who grew up in NY & love going to coffee shops seeing I work from home. I went to this place twice the 1st time I was a little taken back the barista (non black & hispanic) was nice and talkative to everyone under the sun except for me...  mind you I was the only Black person. I was like damn to myself.. I tried.. but I guess she see's my skin color in HARLEM... CHILD...  so Because i was starving & liked their vegan breakfast wrap I went back today.  The barista was a white male this time. I also notice he was nice & talkative... but not to me... just said high & high key rushed me to please the white ppl who were waiting behind me... CHILD. He was so nice to them.. I tried to be nice & all. Got the wrap I wanted. Wanted another sauce that came with it. asked him politely for another one... we only have one per wrap..with an attitude btw like how dare you ask for another. I was so taken back that I stood there without moving or saying anything to take it all in. The white girl who was waiting to order noticed.. I had to keep my cool & eat the damn wrap I didn't want at that point. If I said anything I'm sure I would of been labeled as the angry black girl..the tittle they're waiting for.  I love my home; Harlem... but Harlem this is not it for black people. Not to offend anyone but... It's not worth it.. They treat black people like they are less than & white ple like gold to get a dime.

DO NOT SUPPORT IF BLACK!
Awesome little cafe in Harlem. Great coffee drinks and the best assortment of baked goods around!
Delicious coffee, excellent service, cool space - also open right after a big snow storm - thanks guys!

I live on this block and was pleasantly surprised when I noticed this place yesterday. My son and I gave it a try this morning: delicious lattes and cookies, though I wish they also served more substantial breakfast items. It's still brand new though so plenty of room for tweaks. I was also hoping to check out the area with plants that other online reviews have mentioned, but that was in the back and off-limits to customers.

Service was great. There was only one person behind the counter but they were efficient and cheerful. Music was instrumental blues and not too loud for conversation. I'm very happy to have such a nice cafe near my place, and I look forward to coming here and watching it get better and better.
Just reopened in the neighborhood post Covid and a really lovely experience. Excellent espresso, had an oat milk mocha and it was decadent. Also has a selection of baked goods. Great for a stop-in.
Stumbled by this beautiful place when walking around the neighborhood. Loved the nice, quiet atmosphere, the owner was very sweet and the coffee was delicious!
9 Tails was magnificent. Such a great ambience and pleasant staff. Superb flavor. The service was also excellent and everyone was friendly. I would highly recommend 9 Tails.
Great little spot for the introverted coffee aficionado. Simple, straightforward, good vibes here. No WiFi yet, but they say they'll have it in a month.
Wonderful in every way -- staff is great, everything is delicious! Weekend breakfast burritos are very yummy.

Great coffee and tea options as well as in house baked goods.  Everything is fresh and delicious.  For something really refreshing try the hibiscus iced tea spritzer.  And anything baked is a safe bet! Love this place. John is super friendly and takes real pride in this quaint little spot.
Great place to grab coffee and some pastries. We got the cold brew and it was pretty good. Wanting to come back and try the matcha latte!
Price gorging  at its best. Prices go up and down for the same item depending on who is working. Over charging customers daily.

I didn't know if you order a steak sandwich it's just meat on a bread. Chicken look busted up. Garbage, I know it's not supposed to be restaurant style but I've bought the same sandwich in other store deli's sure wasn't plain nasty caca doodoo like this store just sold me.
Food is good they take their time and they don't rush it and they are respectful also kind
rude as hell and disgusting attitudes!! especially from the cooks!!! i will not be going back here and neither should you!!!!

There's something charming and comfortable about this spot. All your basic deli goods, nice staff, neighborhood regulars, and an awareness and friendliness toward customers. Always a great place to stop for a breakfast sandwich on the go.

Gourmet may be a stretch, but this place has everything that you will need from a local bodega - shady customers, a wide array of candy and chips, a touch of ignorance, various types of pipes, cheap food, and funny workers. I usually stop by almost every other day to pick up some random items.

Note: If you are very impatient, I would warn you not to visit during a morning rush. The line will be really long, and random, self-centered folks always cut the line.

This business needs to MOVE. Its a smoke shop more than Gourmet anything. By far one of the worse eye sores on 125th. Reasoning being all the addicts hang out here and frequent in and out  all day. I cant imagine anyone else eating or shopping here. My concern is the safety as this place is right outside of the train station on 125th and EVERYTIME I come outside of it to go to work i have to dodge addicts or who appear homeless to get to my office. And they are all hanging out HERE. This has to move. Its is unappealing and a strong reason to leave the neighborhood for employment and residential reasons. its too close to public transit. Im debating to leave my employer just because of this daily encounter coming into work as my office relocated during the pandemic. Today a man blew his nose on the sidewalk infront of me and the image is on replay with disgust. Im sick of it.

This place just opened up in my hood near the Red Rooster and Starbucks. This place is clean, the people are nice, the food comes quick and I only paid $3 for a sausage, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel at 1:30pm on a Thursday! I would consider this an excellent basic hood deli with great value. Oh, and they also have quite the selection of cigars and hookah paraphernalia.

Delicious specialty coffees and awesome ambiance. Friendly staff, plus places to sit with outlets and wifi. I got the Tres Leches coffee with rum infused espresso. 787 is a great place to go if you are looking to get out of the house and be productive.

I've been to one other 787 location downtown and didn't know there was a location up here until I stumbled on the sign the other day (it's easy to miss otherwise). My barista, who was super friendly and attentive, mentioned that they'd opened up shop about 7 months ago.

I was planning to get my usual iced latte, but he convinced me to try the dulce de leche instead. I don't usually go for flavored coffee drinks, but this really hit the spot and felt like an extra treat, without being overly sweet. I took my coffee to go, but there's a decent amount of seating for a small shop, including a table or two outside.  

As I expected from my visit to another 787, the coffee is great, just pricey. My latte ran me just over $8 before tip, including an upcharge of .75 for oat milk, and .25 for ice. It would have been even a little more expensive, but there's a 5% discount for those who live or work in the neighborhood.

787 coffee is a true gem that I'm glad that popped up all across NY. The coffee is great, the empanadas are so yummy and the vibes are all cozy at each location. The service is always nice and helpful and glad to know they have one close to my job! I hope this place stays at is is a bit hidden in the block with construction. This place always bring me a little piece of Puerto Rico

9am on Sunday (today) with no customers inside ​the barista left me unserved standing at the counter for 10 minutes. She did acknowledge me and was doing... something. Their coffee is good and the empanadas and breakfast tacos tasty. Unfortunately 10 min to take an order is either incompetent or micro aggressive. Hope the owners of this promising coffee shop fix this. The neighborhood can't wait for a reliable successor to Lennox coffee.
Bad service , over prices , dont recommend at all, they don't even fill the cups always ,there was a hair in my hot chocolate. Horrible place overall.

If this is the same halal cart I think it is, situated right near Joe's Cafe in the glass building,  it houses the best halal lamb I've ever eaten. Crispy, spicy and delicious, especially mixed with the jalapenos and olives they were always creative enough to offer with their platters. As a Columbia student I was a frequent visitor to this cart and always received the warmest, friendliest service here. 53rd and sixth might have the famous white sauce, but this cart has the best lamb over rice!

Ordered the falafel with rice. Likely the worst falafel I've ever eaten. Very dry, not crispy, tasteless. The rice was also pretty bad.

Service is very fast and the food isn't very expensive.

It's a halal cart and damn good if you ask me. Friendly fast service. You can go upstairs to Joe's coffee and get a $5 single origin ristretto shot or you can get a big plate of meat from these guys. You know what to do.

Quickly becoming my favorite quick-cheap lunch spot in the M'side area.  Typical, satisfying Halal fare: meat over rice or wrapped in a pita.  I usually get the chicken or chicken and gyro combo over rice ($5 and $6, respectively).  Service is friendly and extremely efficient, and the food is mighty tasty (not quite 53rd & 6th tasty, but tasty nonetheless).  Offering extra red & white sauce to-go or at least having bottles on the side of the cart might earn them an extra star.

I ordered the wings, burgers,fries,onion rings,banana pudding...from this place twice on two different occasions.
My burger and wings were decent....banana pudding was a waste of money...
the guys at the register were friendly.
This place is good for a quick, hungry fix but not something I would order frequently.

Idk why Everytime I order you guys jus always forget the one thing I repeat multiple times to put and still don't ...idk how many times I gotta order from u guys for u to still do the same thing so fucking dumb
Amazing customer service! Always great food at reasonable prices. Fast on delivery without messing up.

I ordered from here on Uber East and received completely disgusting inedible food. I ordered a Sausage and Pepper Hero with onions, marinara sauce, and cheese and received luke warm under cooked sausage with raw peppers on a soggy roll. My friend got the 1/2 Lb cheesesteak with peppers, onions, and mushrooms and it didn't have any of the toppings. Also we got the 5 star fries which are supposed to come with mozzarella, white cheddar, and bacon, but it came with no cheese. Terrible terrible place I made sure to get a refund from Uber Eats
Their prices have gone up and have gotten cheaper with the food....not acceptable. I always used to love ordering from them but not anymore.

This place can be a hit or miss with certain items. I love their Philly cheesesteak, they give you a decent amount of meat for the price. I also like their personal pan pizza and wedge potatoes. However, their pastrami has fallen off badly, waited awhile and gave it another try, giving the benefit of doubt, to having a bad order day. That last one was the last never again (lesson learned), the pastrami was so dry, and they overloaded with lettuce, and melted the cheese to the bread, rather than on the meat. To the owners / cooks, if you're gonna name your place  
5 Star, ALL the sandwiches need to be that, not just the cheesesteaks.

Your ad says fri-sat 10am -11pm
Well I just called and they told me your closed takes for false advertising

I've only ordered from here a bunch of times via Seamless and have not visited the physical location. I traditionally order the cheesesteak, the eggplant parmigiana hero, hot pastrami hero, turkey hero, and once ordered the burger. I really enjoyed each of those food items. The cheesesteak is loaded with onion and peppers and I loved it! The eggplant parm is absolutely delicious! It's not too greasy, and is loaded with cheese. I looooooove it! Delivery times tend to be a little early or just on time. Food arrives warm and as ordered. No issues with the delivery.
Very good fast food place. Employees are polite and always with a smile on their face . The pizza , the 5 start loaded fries are the best. I will be ordering from here.

I am writing this review for the guy that takes the orders.. His name is Richie! He is amazing. Always friendly and he knows my order. Best customer service when i order from this place. Pleasant and always gets my order accurate! He deserves a promotion! I literally know when he takes my order that my order will  be correct and that's why I am giving this place 5 stars because of HIM!

Pretty decent for having a name that screams "don't try me." I can't speak on the 5 star cheese steak and my wings were worth maybe 2 stars but the personal pan pizza was delicious. I got the house supreme. They were also timely which has been a mega issue lately with seamless. So, yeah. I'll try it again.

This was my favorite place to order from until Saturday March 30, 2019. I placed my order as I normally do asked the female taking the order to add a 3 dollar tip. She reminded me that I can do it on the credit card slip. After 40 minutes I received a call from a delivery man, telling me that I had to go outside to pick up my order because 5 star had given him a huge order to be delivered to 125th st. I explained that I am handicapped, he started yelling at me then proceeded to tell me I would have to wait 30 more minutes for him to deliver to 125. I called spoke to Antonio explain the situation and my food was delivered immediately.  Upon opening my apartment door, this man ranted at the top of his voice about his deliveries on my apartment floor. I decided then that he wasn't worth a tip. I just wanted what I ordered, not a man yelling at me because of his job.
A short while later, I received another call from Antonio asking me why I didn't tip the delivery guy. I explained what had transpired and he insisted that the reason the delivery guy didn't want to come up was because I didn't tip. I have been ordering as well as my son religiously from you for over 3 years till yesterday.I asked Antonio to pull my information on my account and check each and every receipt because I always tip more than they deserve...Not only am I NEVER going to go through such anxiety to order food from here . My neighbors knowing I'm handicapped knocked to see if I was ok and who was it. I told them who and we all agreed that this is a business that we prefer not to do business with ...After several panic attacks and massive heart palpitations I threw away that food and placed another order Peedee's and it was excellent....

This is probably the worst pizza I've eaten since suffering through pizza at my high school's cafeteria it really is that bad. Actually, it is worse than that pizza. They deserve an award for making pizza that is so so terrible but doesn't cause you to throw up. I feel like an ass because I bought two large cheese pizzas for my friends for lunch as they helped us move in. I feel like such an ass as they suffered through this pizza as they dripped sweat in our un-airconditioned apartment after hauling boxes up multiple flights of stairs. I don't think I can ever make this right.

Pros-
+Quick delivery
+ Didn't shake up the two-liter bottle of soda

Cons-
- Horrible no good very bad pizza
- Not so much pizza as horrible bread

Kennedy Fried Chicken type place. The food that I tried from here was actually not as bad as other people's experiences. The buffalo wings were a little hard but overall tasted okay - they were covered in hot sauce but were still not spicy at all. I also had some sweet potato fries from here. They were of the supermarket frozen food section variety, but perfectly edible.
Food is okay but they don't have cheese whiz. How can you call yourself a cheeseteak joint and not have whiz?

Love this place! My favorite place in this neighborhood.
The staff is very friendly and their food is very good, we've tried everything, cheeseburger, burritos, pastas, sandwiches, cookies... and we love them all!
 

My favorite is their chocolate mousse cake, it's so good!!!  love it!
Crappy cheesesteak. Crappy tiramisu.  Totally inedible banana pudding. Learn from my mistake. Just don't.

Great place to grab some quick food to go! I tend to swing by once a week and also enjoy what I order. I try to mix it up every time but if you're currently sitting in you apartment hungry looking for a place to eat, just order from here.
Great food and great people, I would recommend everything on the menu, whatever you're in the mood for it's all top-notch, oh and you gotta try the desserts ;)

Well,  it came,  But it came 1 hour late. Then it was warm,  because they give the delivery guys multiple deliveries at once,  plus,  they've forgot my soda,  I asked for 2 liter of diet coke and they gave me 20oz.
I paid,  almost $50 bucks,  and and gave them almost $10 dollar tips. Then the delivery guy,  looked like he wasn't concerned of how I felt. Did,  I mentioned the FOOD was warm til cold. So they've lost a customer,  and this was the 4th time. But,  quality of pizza,  eh...its not so great. Maybe good if you're drunk,  and need to eat to sober up,  it'll be perfect but quality of pizza,  and I'm a pizza man,  and picky with pizza places and quality. They should not put too much burden of deliveries on to one person. One day I'll come back...if under new management. We'll see. Pizza not so great. Worse and poor example of a pizza place,  food sucks,  breads and dough,  not good. They need real pizza makers,  don't sacrifice quality for quantity. Sometimes you have stretch your wallet,  and know you have to spend money to make money. When you see this place,  keep walking,  go somewhere else. I guess that's the price you pay for convenience. It's an embarrassment to pizzas all around.

Extremely low quality food and terrible service. Kennedy Fried Chicken is adjacent and much better on all levels, especially service. Once, they failed to include the side of fries that I definitely ordered. No big deal, I was happy to pay for them separately and move on. The only problem was I did not have any cash, and had already paid for the initial $17 order on my debit card. The fries were $3 and the guy refused to take my card again due to the price being less than $10. I tried to tell him that it was his mistake, and if he had included the fries to begin with we would not be having this issue. He refused, even with two other customers who were in line with me backing me up that I did in fact order the fries.

The food was gross and the guy was a dick.

Go elsewhere. Cafe Olin is just a block away and is amazing. Dave's gourmet is a few blocks south and is also much better.

Quite bad.  Very bad indeed.  We, for some ungodly reason, ordered a pizza from this place.  It was terrible, we threw it out.  I tried a burger from there, not very good and the fries were cold.  I wouldn't order from this place again.  You can do better in the area.

The counter-people are always really friendly and the food is good. I have mostly ordered sandwiches, fries, cheesesteaks, ect and they've all been delicious. I particularly like the buffalo chicken cheesesteak. I've never done delivery but they're really fast when I call for pickup orders.

The worst manager in history. As a loyal customer, you'd think he'd  would not be so rude, but after they are paid by seamless..apparently there's no filter to what he will say to you on the phone. Funny how most the reviews that are bad is about the manager, and his attitude.
 I will be writing a review about them in our local paper!!!
The food was disgusting and not worth the hour wait $20 down the drain. This business does not deserve even a 1 star!
I placed a large order of pies and buffalo wings for a church event and everyone loved the food. My only complaint is that the delivery arrived late. I will definitely order from them again.

At this point I can't give it a star at all! I ordered Baked Ziti with Chicken Parmesan for delivery last night and was ready to throw my clothes on and march over to the store with much attitude! First thing I noticed was that the chicken was burnt! The portion was skimpy and there was hardly any cheese on it! I had been a customer from the time this place opened up! The food was so delicious then and the owner was present and involved! I don't know if it changed owners , but the quality of the food is lousy! I was also annoyed at the fact that they thought it was alright to bring a customer that mess! The side salad was an insult! No more for me!
Ordered a cheese pizza. Delivery came within estimated time but pizza tasted old and was cold. The cookie was so hard I had to use all of my strength to break it in half. Never again!

Disgusting!  I think that anything tastes good when i am really hungry, so i was starving and their menu was on my door. I ordered 20 buffalo wings "hot",a buffalo chicken "cheese" steak and a caesar's salad. I am 100% sure that the wings were cooked "at least" a day or so ago and were put into a freezer for another day. They were so freakin dry and tasteless! The hot sauce was 70% oil and chunks of uneven spice. The celery was authentic but the blue cheese sauce was Mayonnaise with chunks of blue cheese in it.   A nightmare! The "cheese" steak sandwich did not have a drop of cheese on it! I called and the guy said "no" only blue cheese goes on that. Sure it does. And so does "cheese cheese". Oh! The chicken on that thing was dry as athe Mojave desert ! As far from fresh as you can get! Hey! What are you going to do? I didn't bother to explain past 2 minutes because he obviously had no clue what a cheese steak is. The Salad was dry and soggy at the same time. The caesar dressing was "hell" I don't know what that was. They didn't mess up the sprite! I seriously feel sick right now. And i mean in every way.  In closing. I have to say that the delivery man was very nice. Please do yourself a favor and stay far far away from this place!  I paid $30 and learned a lesson.
They screwed up my order then refused to make good. The place was mediocre on quality and the next day i often felt sick. I only recommend this ghetto dive if you like the runs.

I lived around the corner from 88 for 2 years. I became a regular customer and ordered many times.

Being in Harlem should be taken into consideration for this place. I have gone in to pick up food on many occasions and seen what these people have to put up with. Very often, they respond  with to a nasty customer with attitude of their own. I always get a kick out of it when I walk up and be polite and nice and they reciprocate. Despite the fact that 6 nasty customers just went before me.

Oh yeah, the food. I think if you are ordering just to get something to eat, you'll be very pleased. They are quick, the food is always right, and the prices are decent. If you are a chinese food critic, then this may not be the place for you to eat. Of all the chinese places that I have been a regular at in my life, these guys are probably the most consistent I have experienced.

Went recently for the first time. It was good to me. I gambled and had a large order of beef and broccoli, not knowing what it would taste like.  It was tender, broccoli was fresh. sauce had a good flavor. I like how illuminated the business is. But bruh, who charges tax on Chinese food, and why are fried chicken wing prices so high? aaah-aaaaaaaaaaaaaaah
Food was greasy over cooked chicken was nasty

It's your traditional hole in the wall Chinese takeout restaurant. There service is very quick and very clean looking. They give a pretty hefty portion size on the combination plates. It is a cash only.

What I like about this place is that they were so quick with their delivery. NYC delivery is so slow but this place definitely was number one with delivery. Also I like that it's cheap. We got two combo that included spring roll for dinner that totaled to $16.95.

The food was ok. It was everything you'd expect from a cheap dinner. The General Tso was good. The chicken and broccoli was ok but both didn't have a lot of meat. It was mostly rice which wasn't satisfactory.

It's open again with safety precautions. The egg rolls are big and perfect. If you order a certain amount of food, you can get free sodas or other items. My 12 year old daughter loves their Chicken and Broccoli and disses any attempt to make it by another restaurant. Only downside is the sweet and sour dishes. I have not had it recently, but the previous times I ordered I regretted it. Needs some peppers with it and is usually fried to unsatisfactory dryness. I hope they find a better way of doing it.
Messed up my order twice, and this time my egg foo young tasted gritty like if dirt was in my food so I threw it out

I just moved to New York from LA and this was by far the worst Chinese restaurant I have ever been to in my entire life. The woman at the counter was extremely rude. I do not recommend anyone to go here. They are extremely racist!
Excellent Chinese food all around but when you're getting delivery the Chinese man is extremely rude and sometimes demand a tip.
I love their food, I eat from there all the time and I will continue to eat from there. The only thing that I have an issue with is why do they charge you if you want extra condiments.

I probably won't be ordering from here again. They have free delivery and are a few blocks from my apartment so I ordered from them after I found a menu slipped under my apartment door. The food is decently priced and you get extras if you order over $13 or $23.

The delivery guy couldn't find my apartment and called me literally yelling and speaking in incomplete sentences, he was at the building down the street. I tried to clarify my apt number but after several attempts he simply couldn't understand. I ended up calling the store back to clarify. Another 15m before my food came. The delivery guy seemed extremely stressed out. Also some of the sausage had leaked out in the bag because it was jostled.

All this is forgivable but the food itself lacked flavor and was all in all a bit disappointing especially after the whole delivery ordeal.  I ordered the egg food young and the portion size was fine but the gravy was really bland and sort of oily.

Hole in the wall, great food, great price! I'm convinced that Chinese food in New York is so much better than Massachusetts. Mind you, born and raised in Massachusetts! I will def come back here next time I'm in Harlem!

My favorite take-out Chinese spot in Harlem thus far.  If you order to pick-up, your food is almost always ready in 10-15min.  They are always polite and accommodating, so long as you're polite in return.  Lol. I usually go with the general-tso chicken or chicken and broccoli (never disappointed.  Their sweet tea and spare rib tips are A-1 as well.

If you are looking for inexpensive American style Chinese food, 88 Chinese is a good option. Food is made to order and tastes good. I normally order the shrimp with garlic sauce with pork fried rice. Portion size is good, normally lasts me two sittings, and the lunch special is only $6.50 and comes with a drink. The ladies taking the orders can be a little curt, but who really cares so long as your order is correct and your food is good! It's not fine dining, it's fast food. 4 stars :-)
I love the ginger chicken and broccoli in garlic sauce. Pretty quick and good NYC Chinese food joint in Harlem.

I've lived in this neighborhood for the past 9 years and this is only American Chinese takeout I will order from in Harlem. The prices are reasonable. The food is tasty. And they accommodate substitutions if you pay the difference, if any. One of my favorite dishes is the Ginger Shrimp. It's actually Ginger Chicken on their menu, but I ask to substitute the chicken for jumbo shrimp and pay a few dollars more.

It's not the best but it's not the worst.  You can give them specifics and they follow it through till the end.  They have nice pop/soda options and compared to the "chinese food" places in Harlem proper, 88 is the best and the most efficient.

It's worth a try.

Last night it was my friends birthday, there was a bunch of us here at the apartment and we decided to order Chinese food. We ordered a ton of food, but after an hour of nothing we called. The woman on the phone said the food was on its way. We went downstairs to wait for the food, but nothing. We called again and again, no answer. Finally around midnight (when they closed) we realized we were NEVER getting our food. This morning at 11, we called them to let them know we never received our food. The woman on the phone began laughing and said someone received the order, but we clearly did not get it. We began getting agitated since the woman kept laughing at us saying now that we ordered with another restaurant. We had the menu right in front of us, clearly marked with everyones orders on it in black sharpie. We ordered from them. Clearly this place does not care about customer service and hire incompetent people. She then hung up on us.

All we wanted was our food.

One of the few Chinese restaurants with an A cleanliness rating. I always spring for the sweet and sour chicken. Avoid the chicken fried rice, it lacks flavor and had leftover chicken bits for some kind of flavor. Will be back.

I call and ask if they deliver to me, they say yes and take my order. They didn't ask for my address, but when I gave it, she didn't understand. An hour later, they call, and still don't understand even though I was talking to different person. I give them a cross street and end up texting the delivery guy.
