Then and only then they tell me I'm too far for delivery.  An hour of my time was wasted bc the girl on the phone wouldn't take the time to listen to me, or find someone who could understand.

As good as it gets in Harlem.  There are sometimes language problems, but in over 5 years of ordering from them our experiences have been very good.  Healthy options.  Fair prices.  Quick delivery.  The same guy has been delivering for them for years - always friendly.  No complaints!

This resturant is UNSANITARY one of the workers SPAT in the sink where they prepare the food and when my co-worker saw that she cancelled her order and was told not to come back "HOW DARE YOU" YOU TAKE MONEY FROM THE PEOPLE IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD AND TREAT LIKE THAT.......DON'T WORRY MORE PEOPLE WON'T COME BACK THERE

I used to visit the store.  Though I heard of accidents or theft cases at Harlem area by New York' s News TV, I didn't happed to encounter them.  Well, it was convenient of me to use it because it was opened at from 7:00am to 12:00am and it had various foodstuffs I needed.  When I stayed at this area, a name of the store was 7th Avenue Harlem Food Corp, but it was renewed in 2019 and changed the name into 7th avenue mike food corp.

7th avenue mike food corp has a variety of beverage.   They serve some coffee, beers, wines, etc.  the staff friendly answered questions about the menu and will take food and drink orders.

I love their variety and curated selection. They are so friendly and helpful in store too. Also the smoothies are absolutely insane. And the hot sandwiches as well!!! There is nothing I have to complain about with this deli. Also they are very CLEAN
The food is a waste of money at this place. The smoothies are definitely worth it. Lesson learned.
This place is horrible. They give horrible customer service, and they always get the order wrong! The food isnt even that good go somewhere else. Don't waste your time!

I ordered from this place on Monday morning and half of my order was missing. It was late so I didn't have time to eat. I called Columbia deli and told them what the situation was, they offered to give me a credit on my next order. Thursday morning, I called and all they were offering to give me was one sandwich and one Coke. I asked if I could have a coffee and they told me it would cost $1.50. These were all things that were missing from my order originally. This place is a rip off and they don't care about customer service. I will not order from them again.

My burger was old, my fries were not cooked all the way and my onion rings were white and cold. I ate some fries and instantly stopped because I did not want to get sick. The restaurant refused to give me a refund for food that I had to throw out.

This is a great deli! They are open 24/7 and have a huge assortment of hot/cold foods from the grill for Breakfast, Lunch, & Dinner. Tons of snacks, drinks, & essential items. The items are reasonably priced. The late night delivery guy is quick, efficient, & very friendly. This is always my 1st choice. Highly recommend.

This deli is open late, so it's perfect for people in the area who are out late.

Avoid their gyros! The meat wasn't flavorful, just salty. There were no vegetables, and it was lacking a good sauce. I couldn't finish the one I ordered.

However, I've ordered their Chicken Parmesan sandwichs a few times now, and it has never disappointed. The 109 Spicy Special on an onion bagel is also delicious. The flavors just work perfectly!

The sandwich prices are reasonable for their size. I will come here more often!

I picked up a bacon and egg on an everything bagel from here - it was not bad and what you would typically expect from a corner bodega. They did throw cheese into the sandwich as well which was nice. I pre-ordered the meal, but there was quite a long line just to get to the counter to pick up my order.
Great deli... always friendly.  The place is constantly cleaned and the food is amazing.  Definitely a neighborhood recommended choice
Terrible. Never got my order. And i live two blocks away stopped answering their phone. Scumbags.

I've ordered delivery of breakfast items from Spicy Gourmet on and off for a year or so. I have to say that this place is pretty reliable in terms of food quality and delivery speed. To date, I have not had any issues with this deli. Although there is not a delivery fee, the restaurant does include a service fee through Grubhub.

I love this deli.

Reliable and fast delivery,
Good classics.
Lots of options.
And pay attention to notes like no cheese and stuff like that. Since COVID they might send me the wrong brand or flavor of things but I'm not complaining cuz I really appreciate them and know shipments are limited on shit.
Just letting you know so you don't bug out on them.
Food is good but everytime I order  a sandwich/wrap they take it upon themselves to add condiments that are not in the item description

So grateful!

Trauma unit in St Luke Hospital was freezing.  So glad that this deli was open at 4am and I was able to get hot coffee to warm my body.  AND it was very good coffee.  

Price is VERY reasonable in NYC.  Got two medium coffee and a egg roll and total price is $5.35.

Countless times have I ordered from here. Late night/early morning/afternoon snack.. my go to is the spicy special with bacon. Sometimes I'll grab a bacon egg and cheese. Cheap on the wallet, filling for the stomach, and always there for me (open 24 hours).
Best Lamb or Chicken over Rice around. High quality
These people are rude and racist. Go to another Deli . They talk amongst each other about the customers wouldn't be surprised if they play with people's food. Evil place
Best egg sandwiches and hero's. Super fast delivery. Couple of great craft beers. Always open

The Dirty Bird is incredible. It's one of the best sandwiches that I have had. Prices are very reasonable in here. The Dirty Bird is $6 for the large hero sized sandwich and $5 for the roll. The rest of the bodega has the essentials. Give this place a try.

Food wasn't bad but they've just lost all of their hospital business because not only wont they enforce masks, their employees won't wear them either.   I don't like it any more than the rest of the world, but I'm not gonna get sick for an egg sandwich.   Shame too, they really were the best deli food around.
Chicken cutlet and philly cheesesteak are both super delicious. Price is also reasonable.

Rude and inattentive staff. After waiting for 10 minutes and one staff member walking away and the other to busy on the phone to be bothered I finally was told to go to someone else to place my order. Finally got my order of a large black coffee placed to get home and realize the order was incorrect. Upon returning to get it corrected. The guy wanted to argue with me that I didn't order what I ordered. A large black coffee doesn't mean I want half and half and sugar in it. I am allergic to dairy and was very specific with my request. I understand an error occurring but don't argue with me when I am simply asking for you to correct your mistake. Glad I experienced it now because I am happy not to return!!

Amazing!! They always answer the phone and are extremely polite & respectful! Ordered DoorDash from here and all my special instructions were paid attention to and my food came perfectly! I even requested a different soda from the one on the menu and they did! The chopped cheese are 2 DIE 4! So pleased. Great job!
Fast delivery, have a lot of basic variety. Excellent local business. So happy to have this place in the hood!!

Really a 3.5. This is a good spot if you're  drunk or starving for sandwiches -- they do it quick and pretty accurately. I've probably ordered from them well over 10 times. I won't say it's the best sandwich in the Upper West Side, but it does do a good job and is reliable to provide the same service each time. If you're going, go for a spicy special or chopped cheese!

I wish I could give this deli 0 stars. By far, THE WORST breakfast I've ever had in my 30 years on this Earth. The pancakes were lukewarm, and thin. Tastes like Bisquik pancakes, which I could have made myself. But they definitely would've tasted better. Shall I continue? This sausage looks and tastes like rubber. I wouldn't feed it to my dog, that I don't have. Lastly, these eggs. My God.... what did eggs ever do to you. So thin,and at this point, I wanted to throw the whole box against the wall in frustration. You're a disappointment all around and have ruined my Saturday Morning. May God have mercy on your deli.

This place is good for a sandwich after a night out.  They deliver, too, which is awesome and they deliver late at night.   The food is decent.

My only compliant is that the place is just ghetto.  The service itself is nice, but the clientele in this place is just, beyond words.  

So, my advice:  get delivery!!!

I usually get delivery from here, their cheeseburgers, curly fries, and mozzarella sticks are delicious (esp the sauce that comes with the mozzarella sticks). I'm not sure what seasoning they use for their curly fries but it's pretty amazing. Delivery is free and comes in a timely manner. Food is still usually hot when it arrives. Give this place a try!

I decided to try this deli because everyone on yelp was ranting and raving about the "109 spicy special" so I ordered that and a bacon egg and cheese on a wrap (I actually ordered it on a tortilla but got a wrap). I couldn't have been more displeased!

My bacon inside the BEC wrap was so dry and over cooked, I'm pretty sure it was burnt turkey bacon. So I was charged $5 for that not to mention they said I was charged that amount because it's like a hero but no where as nearly big as a hero and there was very little egg in it as well. When I called someone answered with a "hello" as if you were calling their house. Then he continues a conversation with someone else while I'm on the other line waiting for him to respond, dude just left me hangin for about a minute

Oh and about This AMAZING "109 spicy special" ITS FREAKIN PEPPER-MILL TURKEY with cheap white American cheese. There was no actual sauce in the sandwich that makes it good or spicy. It wasn't terrible either but I felt a little ripped off. The people writing the reviews must me be very retarded if they don't know that and it not even spicy!!!!

You want a good sandwich that's going to be more bang for your buck go to the deli on 105 and Amsterdam next to the beauty supply store. They sell the BOMB grilled Chicken sandwich on a hero for $5.00 and it includes a free soda can! If you want it spicy ask for a little jalepeno grilled with your chicken. The sandwich usually comes with lettuce, tomato and mayo. If your not picky Just ask for everything including a little bit of jalepeno for that kick and you will be very pleased! As for this place  NEVER AGAIN, SAVE YOUR MONEY!
One of the best philly chesse stakes i had in a while. The flavor of it was amazing, food came fast as well. Best part was that the fries were soggy compared to other places.

I like this place - this is where I stock up on beer. They have Modelo in a can and Presidente in bottles.  Sometimes you gotta fight your way to the register, but this place is usually pretty quick.

Plus it's cheap. A big-ass coffee will run you a $1. Toss in a couple of quarters and you got yourself some Swedish fish.

Go early in the morning, and you'll probably run into a few owls. If you've got a kid with you, this may be a time for earmuffs. There's a lot of shit-talking that goes on in here. But it's mostly just show.

I've never tried any of the sandwiches, but some of the locals seem addicted to them, so they must be tasty.

This is the closest store to my house, and while the '109 Spicy Special' is indeed awesome, I think the assessment can be broadened for all of their sandwiches.  I had the 'London Bridge' and was very happy that it fell down my throat.

The overall score is lowered because of the overwhelming feeling that you are about to be punched in the face by some of the frequent visitors to this small convenience store.  However, the sandwiches are priced to make it worth the risk.

I had just spent 30 dollars in the store and saw they forgot my fries so when I went back they gave them to me and while I was putting it in my bag I let my smoothies fall that i bought from there by mistake they refused to make me new ones and siad it wasn't there problem at 12pm fri

The spicy special is amaaazing.  The perfect late night food when koronets' pizza gets boring.  They've got a good selection of vitamin water and other beverages (cheap beer!) to wash the sandwich down and pepperidge farm cookies for dessert.

Sure it's incredibly sketchy, but that's part of the unique experience!

I once saw someone order the spicy special with 2 eggs and bacon..try it sometime for a change.

I have a deep appreciation for the spicy special, especially on nights when I visit neighborhood bars like 1020.

Columbia students call 109 deli an affectionate name: "Crack Del".

This is just because often times there are sketch characters standing outside possibly dealing drugs or loitering in a way that makes everyday people feel uncomfortable.

However, the place is totally safe. Young clientele, often well heeled, visit this place to grab cigarettes and Spicy Specials.

I personally usually grab a Spicy Special with hot peppers, but will entertain if they have something like buffalo chicken with melty goodness of mozzarella on top.

Many people don't understand the Spicy Special (including food critics who have checked out what we're raving about), but maybe that's because the flavors go especially well with a cool Yuengling. That, or, when you are inclined to get a SS, you are halfway out of reality.

I've done the SS mid-day, and I'll say maybe it's the cook, or maybe it's just like having chicken wings without blue cheese, dipping veggies, a cold brewsky, and a game on...

Serious Eats New York has said: "The sandwich consists of Cajun turkey, pepper jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, and "spicy sauce" (i.e. mayo and spicy mustard)." The statement is true to some extent--the spicy sauce is not mayo and spicy mustard, because it's got an orange tinge in it too, so I suspect more cajun type seasoning (perhaps akin to Tony's?) and perhaps some small quantity of russian or catalonia dressing. Also, it's a SERIOUS mistake to get the sandwich cold. Minus two points for forgetting to ask for hot peppers.

The fact that this bodega gets this exposure is a testament to the power of a site like yelp.

In short this is my local bodega and as such I buy mostly beer and sandwiches from here. The sandwiches are the best value in the neighbourhood and some are so well known they've now been named after the street : "109 spicy special". I would like to think that buying this particular sandwich for the last 3 years has helped....
Ordering at lunchtime can be fun when a crowd of school kids surround the counter and you have to shout your order over the top of them but your sandwich always seems to appear a couple of minutes later. The service is generally fast and they have a big enough turnaround that none of their deli meats hang around for too long. A cold sub costs $3.50 and hot $4.
The breakfast bacon,egg and cheese for $2 is also a great deal. The coffee is 50c but really only tastes like "bodega" coffee.

The staff are friendly enough but not over-flowing with pleasantries. I've seen them take some real abuse in my time so I think they've built up immunity to normal civil conversation. Some reviewers mention the sketchy characters but there really aren't too many. These blocks used to be much worse than they are today and thankfully they still retain some of the local characteristics but without the dangerous element.

Could I be one of the sketchy characters..?

I'm bummed to see this place only has 3.5 stars.

109 Deli is affectionately known as "crack del" to Columbia students because of the sketchy dealings nearby.  Scary clientele or not, the "Spicy Special" is one of my favorite sandwiches...ever.

No one quite knows what's inside but no one ever questions it either.  It has pepper jack cheese, turkey, lettuce, and some mystery chipotle sauce.  It's amazing. And to top it off, it's only $4.  This place is the best at 4am after a rough night.

Cheap beer is also a plus! (They deliver it too!)

Yes it is true.  The "spicy special" is awesome.  I've ordered it 4 times now and it is consistently good.  It comes toasted and warm, though it maintains integrity after cooling down.

If you call ahead and order 10 minutes before pickup, they'll have it ready for you.  So you cut down on the time spent hanging around the store.  Then, walk across the street to the sculpture garden next to St. John's Cathedral.  Unwrap your sandwich and enjoy the moment~!!!!

This is a great sandwich to pick up on your way to the park, the airport., or wherever. Transports easily for a meal on the go.

I love this place. Its really cheap (Marlboro lights are $9 as opposed to $10 everywhere else) and fast.

Deli wise I always get the 109 Spicy Special. They make it to order and a hero is only 3.50!! I also get chicken breast here for my salads and it usually costs me about 1.75 for two lemon glazed chicken breasts. YUM!!

Cheap food and made very quick.

The spicy Special is worth the 4 dollars.

~Egg and chesse sandwiches are great, but they don't always have eggs!

Great Deli right on my block! Always coming to bring me items well under their 10$ delivery minimum. For the most part they are super quick and get the order right but they get alot of kids from the school in the mornings and when they get out so your best bet is to order around those times or youl wait over an hour for a hero.

The only reason this place exists is to provide Spicy Specials.  Christened as the "Crack Del" by legions of students, the name comes from the hundreds of cracks in the asphalt sidewalk out front.  errrrrrrr maybe not...let's just agree that the sketchiness of this corner location harkens back to the Nino Brown-ish days of yore.
Regardless, the Spicy Special is awesome.  Very straightforward: a pressed turkey and jack with lettuce tomato ans some sort of mayo/mustard mystery sauce (probably just mayo and mustard).  It's really way better than it has any right to be.  In fact, just writing about it now makes me crave one.  Easy to pick up on the way home from work.  However, not going there at 4AM.

Mention of Spicy Specials and sketchy characters abound, I experienced only the latter (don't eat meat). Nothing but white bread, but they have no need for it; got a few cheeses on a roll for $3.50. Their Boar's Head sandwiches are very well-priced, and the service is a bit distant, especially if they don't know you. On that note, make sure you speak up and assert yourself, or you'll get stepped over. Toss-up between this & AGD across the street IMO.

This review is only for the gourmet deli "spicy special" sandwich.

It is the best sandwich for 4 dollars in the Columbia area.  The deli itself is a tiny, sketchy convenience store frequented by lottery addicts, smokers, drunkards and Columbia students - or drunk Columbia students.  In any case, the cajun turkey, pepper jack, lettuce tomato and spicy sauce make for a delicious sandwich.  When inebriated, the sandwich only tastes better.  The sandwich also goes well with Campells chicken soup.

The Spicy Special, extra spicy, will run you $4 and it's actually really good.  

This place is referred to as "Crack Del"... not sure whether or not it's because the Spicy Special is so addicting or because people might actually be dealing right outside the door.

Either way, $4 for a good sandwich is worth it in my book.

"Crack Del" is essentially a little mini-market and deli carrying tons of different beers and home of the "109th spicy special" that some Columbia students rave about. It's open 24/7

Atmosphere: 1/5 to 3/5 - Depending on how late at night you go, you'll run in to straight up sketch balls or really drugged out/drunk ladies rapping at you. Pretty neat. But super sketch some times.

Service: 3/5 - You order, they deliver.There's usually a tip jar out and I noticed if you tip, the food is a little better. Also, the younger guys make better sandwiches.

Food: 4/5 - Spicy special! A fantastic sandwich for a mere 5 dollars consisting of chipotle turkey, some spicy cheese, lettuce, tomato, and a ton of mayo and spicy sauce on top of it. Pretty damn good. I've tried a few other sandwiches and they are decent too. Well worth your 5$

This is my go-to deli for coffee and a bagel in the morning. It's nothing special, but the prices are very reasonable, and the service is usually good. There are some interesting characters that frequent the deli, but the staff are friendly and helpful. My regular bagel w/ cream cheese and small coffee is only $2.50. Can't be beat!

my fav deli and not just because it's a block away from where I live.
They use Boar's head for their sandwiches, which is extremely important. A sandwich is not the same without quality cold cuts.
2nd, its made to order, cheap (3.50) for a sub and (3.00) if you want it on a roll.
Aside from the cheap delicious sandwiches, I get my coldcuts by the lbs here... 6.99/lbs for boars head, yes please@

Yea, it's gross looking. It's filled with all sorts of questionable characters at all hours of the night. Suck it up and go in and ask for the "spicy special". All you need to know is that it's a hot pressed sandwich and leave it at that. Pretend like Ryan T. didn't ruin the surprise for you and don't ask what's in it because that's what makes the "spicy special" so special. Enjoy!

Never order from here late at night.

One might think that a place that prides itself on 24-hour delivery would live up to its namesake.  I just ordered at 3:30 am.  Got only half of my order.  I didn't want to be a dick about it considering it's raining and late, so I called the guy asking for him to just change the amount on my credit card.

After about 10 minutes of ringing, during which they were probably trying to avoid picking up, I get an unenthusiastic "hello." The guy was extremely rude, acts like I'd be asking for something absurd by asking him to deliver the other $10 worth of my order, and says I'll have to call campusfood to change the price.  I was extremely courteous, said I didn't want him to have to send the guy again, and he just says "ok" and hangs up.

I never thought I'd be yelping about a corner deli, but damn! I ordered the spicy special and wooooah mama was it good! Good and cheap! I don't know how this place stays in business, but hot diggity dog, I like it!

SPICY SPECIAL. Amazing. Hot pressed sandwich on a hero for only $4. Perfect drunk/late night food.  Bacon egg and cheese sandwiches for only 2.50, cheap beer, and 25 cent bags of chips (I didn't know they existed anymore). Staff is a little rude and place is a little dirty, but they recently renovated it so it's not so bad. Best of all, THEY DELIVER! A 30-rack and a bunch of spicy specials delivered right to your dorm at 1am is the perfect end to any night.
Great place...relatively.  Delivers beer (40s and 30-packs) and food.  Which up here is fantastic.  If this were 30 blocks south, 3 stars--just your average deli.

I like this deli, However when you ask for delivery you don't always get what you pay for, sometimes they forget something or put something wrong in the bag, I enjoy their sandwiches but sometimes the bacon egg and cheese doesn't have enough cheese.

I would not use this Deli.  I kept calling to place a nice $200.00+ order and when I try to speak to someone to place my order they must have caller ID they hang up on me.  I guess we have to bring out business somewhere else!

Super solid independently owned dollar slice joint that also has hot dogs - as their name very accurately described. Seems to have opened recently within the past few months. On Avenue A between St. Mark's and 9th.

Their $2 topped slices are delicious and really hit the spot. I had a chicken bacon ranch slice, which was a perfect 4pm pre-dinner snack (yeah I'm fat). There's a number of other tasty looking options on offer besides pizza and hot dogs - chicken sandwiches and beef patties.

Open late until 5am, 7 days a week. Cash only under $5, ATM inside. Give 'em a try!
The guy working there tried to trick me paying for the pizza slices twice. Pretended to forget that I just paid. There was no one else there too.
came here drunk & realized the next day they charged me $13 for 3 slices of pepperoni pizza....lol "dollar slice".
Have been going since i was a little girl, excellent service and great prices for an amazing NY Deli Sandwich

Place is decent, delivery time was mediocre and food was alright.  I wouldn't order in from there as I had to call to make sure the guy was on the way and it ended up being a half hour past what their max delivery time said on seamless. Wings were pretty good though and the variety of the sauces and sides was still impressive. I don't know what the ambience or decor is like but I'm sure the experience would probably be better at the restaurant in terms of food quality. Not sure if I would repeat although I say it's worth trying out if you live in the neighborhood.

They don't deliver.

Don't get me wrong, they say they deliver. They even take your money. They even say they're en route with your food. They just don't happen to actually deliver it to where you live. Which is frustrating.

For a menu that boast 'freakin amazing' and 24hr delivery service, my first experience was far from even satisfactory. They seemed far over priced but I decided to take a chance anyway. I placed my order but was then informed their debt system was down. Fine, that happens. On my way up to my 6th floor walk up  from getting cash I get a call back, apparently their ONE delivery boy's bike broke and they wouldn't be able to fulfill my order. In a city with this much competition that won't cut it in my option.  You've lost my business 'freakin disappointing chicken.'

This place actually doesn't deliver.   Not sure how seamless hasn't picked this up yet,  but they post 15-30 minutes on their site.   It's been an hour and a half,  called twice,  it's been "on the way" for an hour, but now the phone is going to voice mail.   Screw these guys
Over 1 hour to deliver 20 wings, forgot sauces, dry tasteless wings. Their days are numbered...good riddens

A place that calls itself a "wing place" and runs out of wings during the Super Bowl. GREAT PLANNING.

It has so far been 3 hours since we ordered. After the first our they said they ran out of wings and would substitute "popcorn chicken". Upon calling 3 hours later, they said "yeah sorry we realize that sucks". Oh. I'm glad you agree. Amazing customer relations.

The least I expect is an extra order or fries or sodas to make up for it. Games already over.

I will never order from this place again, regardless of how the food tastes when they finally get here. Superbowl party ruined.

i dont want to give this place a star.....  worst customer service ever! first of all i ordered via grubhub which took an hour and another half hour for the guy to find my apartment so you do the math. the delivery man then explained to me he wanted "casssh" when in fact we already paid through grubhub  with a card already.  we had the unfortunate luck of ordering the wings with the caribbean sauce. before you order the wing lick and old man that hasent showered in a week and if you enjoy that then by all means order the caribbean sause wings. but my advice would be to lick the old man because i dont think he'll charge your $40.00 for a  taste test.  to top it off after i called the store and explained they dissatisfaction we had with the quality of our food they did not even attempt to understand us.  we ended up giving our wings to a homeless person. atleast one person would not have to go to bed hungry even if its me for today.

The NY equivalent of In and Out.

Simple menu of smashed burgers and fries. Open super late and it's always poppin no matter when you go.

Get the loaded fries (cheese, secret sauce, onions and beef on crispy fries) which are not on the menu but 10/10 must order. They put it in a takeout container and the portion is huge. Probably like 800+ calories but who is countin.

Ohh boy my first time here and I will be bacc!!

Lowkey the burger gives a mixture of all your favorites. It's smashed down like (Shake Shack) grilled onions have a snap and crispy bite like (White Castle) and their special sauce gives (McDonalds) Mac sauce a run for its money!!

No seating so prepare to eat on the side walks of NY. LOL

yum yum!

as a native californian, in n out can never be replaced but this place shaves the cravings down for a good burger as much as it can these days.

greasy, oily, guilt inducing smash burgers with melted cheese. smushy and comforting kind of burger!

a little steep price-wise so i wouldn't say it's affordable or anything.

the staff are always super chill, talkative, and just great people to be around.

great when you have a hankering for a simple burger but too lazy to cook!

The smell of the burger place is what pulled my friend and I in. It's a really small hole in the wall and we saw so many people lined up. There was a seating place outside but you could also stand and eat the burger. My friend and I decided to take it home.

Honestly, I think this place is overhyped. Don't get me wrong, it's a good burger, but it's not the best. I felt like it was way too oily and it was missing the umf. I've had some people say that it's not good because we took it home but honestly, if it was a good dang burger, it would've been great cold.

The service was really great tho! They were really helpful since it was our first time. I want to come back and try it fresh to see the difference but honestly I think I'll have the same reaction.

Best. Burger. Ever.
Seriously. Fuck off with that other shit.
The bartender at The Library told us that this burger kicked the shit outta Shake Shack and she was right. Honestly the only place that comes close is the one at JABS in Toronto.
The lady who served me was cool and fun and gave me a knowing nod when I looked to her after my first bite. The vibe is cooler than you'll ever be. The he dude manning the door might've been the coolest dude I've met. Maybe the guy running the door at Katz might be the only guy cooler.
But this burger in all its perfect crunchy, greasy, flawless goodness is the best burger I've ever had.
Wow these burgers are just perfection and simply amazing ! It reminds me of an in and out burger. I will be going back many times as it was served fast and the burger tasted fresh !

I came to 7th Street Burger Yelp Elite Event to claim a free burger and fries. Even though this location is a bit small, the staff member was very accommodating and flexible with my order. I especially liked how there were limited menu options. It eliminates a lot of the decision paralysis, limiting you to a cheeseburger burger which  was far from basic!

My burger was moist and delightfully complimented with a tasty mayo sauce. Surprisingly, the fries were slightly crunch and soft, a perfect combination. After eating the burger and some fries, I wasnt uncomfortably full or weighed down. This meal was truly unique and enjoyable.

Even though 7th Street Burger stands out for its food and service, the ambiance isn't as praiseworthy.

This was a wonderful experience and I will come here in the future if I'm craving a burger and fries! :)

If you haven't heard of 7th Street Burger by now you're living under a rock. Smash burgers have been trending for a bit and they've been killing the game. To be honest, I do like my burgers with all the toppings. Lettuce, tomato, onions, jalapeños, ERRTHANG. Hold the sauce though cause I hate when it gets soggy but this spot reminds you that sometimes simple is better.

They have both beef and vegan options. I went vegan and was not disappointed. Their fries though...SO GOOD. Crispy. Fresh. Just get extra cause you're going to be mad when it's over. Small spot and limited seating but it's a quick meal so can't expect much. Staff was also super friendly and helpful.

Check. Them. Out.

Check the menu out before going in to order cause I definitely didn't so don't be like me.

We came on a road  trip to try specific things.  One of them was the 7th street smash burger.

Thin, greasy burger with their special sauce and lettuce and tomato on an extraordinarily fresh bun.  

Sounds underwhelming?

It was d e l I c I o u s!!!!

Check it out.  Just a note. We only had a burger cuz it was on our list.  Next stop Joes pizza. Lol

This is such a great burger place it's not even funny! They literally have 4 items on the menu and they are great at it! The banana pudding is to die for. Just be careful where you order because they have multiple locations.
I accidentally ordered for pick up at the wrong location but they were super nice about it and helped me with my order. It was ready within minutes.
I wish I had photos but I inhaled the food XD
If you are looking for a good flat top greasy all american burger, this place slaps! My roommate was raving about this place so we ordered in one night and it was sooo good!

I'm a 7th Street Burger addict! Perfect thin patty with cheese, pickles, onions, and house sauce, and the fries are PERFECT!! Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The store is tiny and you line up outside to place your order, but it comes out within minutes. Friendly people and great food. Burger and fries is about $12 which is pretty good in Manhattan. Try it!!

I'm going to be honest, these burgers should probably be considered sliders. They are probably the same size as a regular McDonald's cheeseburger, and on Uber eats they are charging seven dollars for one. Better bun sure, better beef, sure, still really small for a single patty cheeseburger. Next time I'll pass.

We found it popular on social media and ordered the delicious double cheeseburger with fried onions, gooey American cheese, tangy pickles and a special homemade sauce that makes it simply amazing. Check it out here and treat yourself to a juicy burger

The shop opened right on time and there we were, circling like sharks around it with a bunch of hung over 20-something guys. The burger did not disappoint. The melted cheese MADE IT and the fries were pretty addictive. I like the small amount of choices on the menu and the tiny set-up of street tables which we used and got very hard, and it was like a greenhouse in there but I'm still very grateful for the seat. I liked the menu item of the Mexican Coke to wash it down with. I've plan to come back to New York and eat at every 7th Street Burger as a way to explore each neighborhood.

This is GOOD BURGER in real life. Complete with Ed's secret sauce.

Their secret sauce "house sauce" is pretty good. Similar to a sriracha aioli putting that on a burger is a secret worth keeping.

This place may look small on the outside, but it's bigger on the inside... #doctorwho especially in the flavor department.

You get more than your moneys worth out of this place.

This is the burger you're looking for. No Jedi mind trick required.

Tasty fast food. No frills, hole in the wall establishment.

No indoor seating. An outdoor wooden bench and three small metal tables are available for those requiring respite.

Friendly and efficient staff. Super quick service: you'll get your order in a minute.

Double cheeseburger is juicy and satisfying. The patties are smashed, with tons of crunchy onions, butter, and cheese in between. It's been a while since I've enjoyed fast food burger this much.

Fries come out crispy, which is great. Don't be afraid to ask to make them extra crispy.

Late nights, there's always a line waiting for a greasy fix to support additional alcohol consumption.

I originally tried 7th Street Burgers at EatsCon and really loved their style of smash burgers. I recently went to their EV location and was equally as impressed. Their secret sauce & fries are great as well. The menu is small, but I can respect that since they do everything so well.

The food came out quickly & was really fresh. They don't really have any indoor seating, but they do have some outdoor tables available.

Absolutely delicious burgers. If you're in the area and need a late night meal, this is the place to go.

I will say that the line can seem daunting, but it goes by rather quickly. Once you order, the burger comes out quick too.

The burger itself is pretty small, so I'd recommend getting a double or maybe even 2 burgers if needed.  The burger bun is unbelievably buttery, and the sauce they use compliments the flavors very well. The fries are also a nice side; for its price, the portion size is fair.

I'm still thinking about these burgers and I can't wait to go back.

Omg this was so good. I got the impossible burger and the impossible loaded fries. WOW. So delicious. I love impossible burgers in general but the house sauce with the onions on both the burger and fries really made it too notch.

The fries are a LOT of food so I'd probably just get that if I went back, but the burger was also amazing.

Very nice worker! Small storefront, no seating, it's a grab and go joint.

Why are there only 4 items on the menu at 7th street burger? Probably because they make the best cheeseburger (and double cheeseburger) in NYC. Don't @ me.

Service, which could be mistaken as an afterthought when we're talking about the best cheeseburger in New York, is excellent. Everyone in there is super friendly and they always bring your order out with a smile. Patrons are also smiling because they tend to be return customers that are stoked to crush their double cheese burger and loaded fries. You might not see a menu but loaded fries have burger in them!

There are places outside to sit but also great to get on the run if you want to sit in Tompkins or go back to the apt.

Because of all the hype I decided to try! I thought the burger was good but not exceptional.
Would have appreciated it to be less dry yet And the meat a little bit more flavored

Smashed-style burger done well (well, not well done lol)!

Small takeout counter with a simple menu focusing on cheeseburger and fries. Ordering and getting our food was pretty quick. The cheeseburger was cooked and seasoned just right. Loved the grilled onions! The fries had a slight coating on it, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.

Overall, a very solid smashed burger and will return for sure!

Can I just say wow and leave it at that?

If you're a burger fan and haven't tried this place you're truly missing out.

My only complaint is that it was a tad small, I'm glad I got the double patty!!

Served hot and juicy on a soft warm bun with grilled onions and cheese.  

I can see why the people in line with me were ordering an extra one to take home for breakfast (I'm not kidding)

Grab a couple and make your mouth happy!!!

7th Street Burger, as the name implies, is a burger shop on 7th Street. And that's about all it is! There is a menu (burger: beef/not beef, fries, Coca Cola and water) and a cash register. The kitchen is directly behind and you can see them frantically cranking out burgers. On the left and right are refrigerators with precisely two options, Coke or water.

If you read my other reviews, I rave over restaurants with simple menus, this will not be an exception. They have a short menu that they execute to perfection, with the smash cheeseburgers on a potato roll being nearly the perfect cheeseburger. The fries are great as well, though they do not stand out quite as much as the cheeseburgers.

Both times I've been have a Friday night, when the place is busy, but the wait has never been too long. Once you order you are directed to wait outside for your name to be called. This usually takes about 10 minutes, during which time you can find a seat in the dining shed or on top of any other flat surface you can find.

It's a popular spot for a reason. If you find yourself in the area, you could do a lot worse than 7th Street Burger.

Cant pass up a classic cheeseburger. What I love about this place is how simple it is. Nothing fancy about this burger but it certainly hits the spot. Their fries are delicious too. You know this place is good when there's a line out the door. This location had a small area outside where you could sit but that was quickly taken up so we ended up walking down the block and sitting at a park. This has become one of my go-tos whenever I'm in new york now!

After a evening at a nearby bar, I tried 7th Street Burger for the very first time and it was surprisingly good. The cheeseburger is juicy and flavorful. It was so good that I had to order a second one. What really took me by surprise was their fries. The fries were perfect. Crispy crunchy texture, good color, good thickness.

Verdict - little outdoor dining shed, great spot for a quick bite after a night out. Would love to see more of these in other boroughs.

The definition of what a cheeseburger should taste like. Perfectly melted cheese, smashed burger, pickles and their homemade sauce (reminded me of the big mac sauce) was *chefs kiss*. (A bit on the pricier side but then again its nyc lol)

You place your order inside and they will call your name when it's ready. They have limited outdoor seating with heaters!

*tip- the bottle opener is on the left side of the outside seating area ON the wall

Stopped by for some smash burgers and it did not disappoint. It was a bit greasy but it tasted pretty good. The buns were great like shake shack buns. The fries were fresh, crispy and nicely salted. I really enjoyed the burgers and would come back again. we did not have to wait long after ordering. There was a lot of space to eat your meal, standing or sitting.
The best smashing burger in the world. I'm not playing. It will change your life. The burger is the burger of all burgers. Perfectly cooked. Gooey cheese. Melts in your mouth.
Don't freakin miss this place if you're in the East Village. The loaded fries are stuff of dreams. Pair it with a Mexican Coke and finish with the banana pudding. You're welcome.

OMG! What a delicious burger! And their Loaded Beef Fries were to die for! Which we almost did, as we visited this fine establishment in truly bone-chilling weather! (So worth it!)

The burger bun is so soft and buttery (though not sure it's buttered). Truly one of thee most delicious cheeseburgers around town! The Loaded Beef Fries were amazing! I could drink the onion drenched sauce for days! What I love about their sauce is that it's loaded with a lot of chopped onion, BUT it wasn't overpowering at all!

I will forewarn you, there's only outdoor seating, so if you plan on visiting during the winter, layer really well or plan on eating in the car like we did! :0)

So worth visiting again and again! See you there!

Don't Mind The Photos.

I Was Feed My Nephew.

These Are Some Great Tastying Burgers.

Well Worth The Trip To Manhattan.

Quick Service & Cool Staff.

I Will Definitely Be Back.

We were super excited to try this place after seeing it all over social media. We came on a Friday night and not surprisingly there was a pretty long line and crowd of people waiting for their food outside. Luckily it moved pretty fast and we were in and out in about 20 minutes. The burger was pretty good for fast food but definitely does not compare to restaurant-quality. Also, at ~$8 a burger, it's about the same price/slightly more expensive than Shake Shack which I would argue makes a better burger. I think if we came back, we would probably try the double cheeseburger as this would improve the meat to bread ratio as some other yelpers have noted. The chopped loaded beef fries were pretty good and definitely a solid imitation of In N Out's animal style fries except that they cost about 4 times as much so I'm not sure that's a fair comparison.
Best smash burgers in the financial district hands down. Staff is always on point and fresh Mexican coca-cola in a bottle, what more could you ask for.

7th Street Burger, a smash-burger spot in the West Village. Fun Fact: They're open until 3am.
How was it?: That's a burger !!!!! SOOOO GOOD!!!! Cheese, onions, and a special house sauce. Hot, fresh, right off the grill into the bag. The grill mark on the bun does no justice to how crisp the bun really is. And it's juicy. Never tasted nothing like it.

The loaded beef fries are SO GOOD! I would definitely come back again to order those. You def need to try the loaded beef fries. The fries are perfectly crispy and the sauce + beef add such a nice flavor to them. The burger is delicious as well, one of the best ones I've had in New York
Excellent burger. Maybe the best burger in New York. No seating at all (in any of the locations I've been to) so recommend it as a take out lunch spot. Got the double cheeseburger with everything.

Decent smash burger and great fries! I'd suggest getting the double patty though since the burger to bun ratio is a little off with only one patty. I asked for the special sauce on the side so I can eat it with my burger and dip in my fries.
Really good burger (definitely get the double bc these patties are THIN) but thoroughly enjoyed for the speed and price point. YUM.

Awesome burger spot! I came around opening on a Sunday and a line quickly formed. Cheeseburger and fries were both amazing.

They had limited outdoor seating when I visited in November 2022.

7th Street Burger definitely lived up to the hype and it is quite a tasty smash burger.  I got the double cheeseburger and enjoyed it a lot.  However, do note that it is a very small burger and honestly I could eat two and still be hungry after (granted I do eat a lot).  That is the only reason I knocked off one star- but I will be back!

This place always hits right. Man. It was so good. It put me in a delicious food coma. That potato burger is always yummy. The loaded fries were terrific. Only yelping now do I remember that I didn't eat meat in this meal. The impossible is just as good. So yum. Love adding ketchup. Really nice workers

I've heard a lot about this place, so was very eager to try it. I'm happy to report that it didn't disappoint one bit. The double cheeseburger was cooked to perfection. The one thing I HIGHLY recommend is getting the beef fries. They are next-level good and the sauce on top of them is deliciously mesmerizing! I went to the location in the East Village and the customer service was really good. Pro Tip: it's super limited seating outside, so we took our food and walked to the Tompkins Square Park and ate it there.

Very yummy burger. The single is small but maybe that's sort of what makes it good. I've had my fair share of burgers that were entirely too massive. You taste the yumminess in each bite here. Anywho maybe try the double. All burgers have grilled onions, American cheese, pickles, and house sauce. The bun in soft, the sauce adds pizazz as well as the toppings. Fries are good. I started with one single burger but ended up with 2 single burgers and fries and felt full. Next time I'll do a double and fries. Service was quick and efficient.

What a nice little burger joint! There is a big screen to your right when you first enter and you can order there or at the register. I came on a rainy Monday night, so I couldn't eat it fresh when it came out but despite the 30 commute back to Brooklyn it was still pretty tasty!

I got a double cheese burger and beef loaded fries. The patty on the burger has a mashed consistency which I liked, and the sauce was tangy and was reminiscent of a mix between big mac sauce and whopper sauce. My bun was a little soggy, but the 30 minute commute probably was a big factor for that.

What stole the show for me was the fries! They give you the option to get them spicy or regular. I opt'd for spicy and it was delicious. Reminded me a lot of a poutine but burger style. Would definitely come back for this! I didn't take any pictures because my food did not look pretty after the commute, but the taste was immaculate.

Taste like shit. Over price. But staffs are funny.
I'm sure people giving positive reviews just because of the funny staffs who working here.

The workers were friendly and service was fast. Unfortunately the burger just wasn't good. I could see the potential the sauce was ok and the buns were pretty nice. But the actually burger itself bland no seasoning no flavor nothing couldn't even taste salt . Because of the actual burger it tasted like a boring hamburger from McDonald's which atleast for the price I would have got fries and a drink . 7$ for this burger ehhhh not really worth it.

The simple menu here makes it really straightforward to crave and order just what you want. The burger is reminiscent of shake shack with a super soft bun (10/10), and the smashburger style beef, pickles, and sauce make it a tasty combo. I've already come twice in one week.
Absolutely the best burger ever.  Great vibes service is cool and quick. Limited menu which makes everything even better. Go there now.

I live right down the block of this Deli and I am a loyal customer to Sal's Deli! The guys who work here are always joking with their customers which is very welcoming :)

Their deli sandwiches are always reasonably priced, and I never feel like I'm giving them an arm and leg for a simple BLT.

Anytime I want to get a sandwich before going to work, I ALWAYS stop by Sal's.

This place likes to skim aka overcharge. Usually I've been overcharged an extra .25 or .50 but today they overcharged me a dollar. When shopping here count the total in your head or using a calculator or just pay for everything one by one.

Walked home late night by this deli...looks like new ownership.

I went into ordered a pastimi sandwich...straight meats and bread.  They only asked for $7.00.  Good buy.  Tasted alright.

Not a bad place!

Will come bad.

First Impression: medium sized but Wow! They were very accommodating and friendly over the phone when we had to make some last minute changes for my birthday party.

Parking: there are a few parking lots near by and street parking is available. Depends on if there is construction in the area.

Our waiter was attentive which we appreciated. The appetizers and drinks came out in good timing. The main course took some time after that.

But baby! When I tell you that my Black Panther Ink Noodles were the best meal I've had this year. Wow!  It had a Perfect balance of flavors, seasoning and spice. The curry, the coconut milk, the vegetables, the beef oh my gosh the beef! I'll definitely be coming back JUST for this dish.

We ordered appetizers to share i enjoyed my crispy chicken poppers with the sauce it comes with. My favorite was the IKA SANSAI: Sliced squid salad seasoned with Japanese vinegar, ginger and pickle.

I loved that with a party of 12 pple we could hear eachother speak. The music wasn't loud it was the guests lol.

Please be in mind that the most popular drink is the one that goes up in flames - literally and leaves cinnamon all over the floor. You can feel the heat from fire a few tables down.

I came here to celebrate my sister's birthday, and we had found this restaurant via Instagram. The decor was very nice and so was the ambience. The drink menu is what attracted us to this restaurant as well as the variety of food options and the prices.

When we arrived, the restaurant was on the quieter side and ad it got later the restaurant got louder and more busy. The service overall was great only until the ending. We felt rushed and the waiters kept coming over and asking if we need the table to accommodate others waiting to be seated.

Lastly, the food was flavorful and the drinks were creative and tasted good. A lot of them were sour but overall the party enjoyed themselves and didn't have too much complaints.

I would come back here and it's a good place for a birthday dinner

This was a fun place to check out in the East Village. It is loud in here and can get busy--definitely a scene on the weekend.

The food is a mix of small plates, entrees, and a few sushi options. It seems to be a combination of both Thai and Japanese flavors. I had the Soba noodle Pad Si Ew and enjoyed it. My friend had a few of the small plates. We enjoyed our food and cocktails.

There are a few gimmicky drink and food items that either have smoke or are lit on fire...good for Instagram.

We came here to celebrate my love's birthday. They call this restaurant a speakeasy, but I wouldn't. The colorfully painted walls leading upstairs to the restaurant prepares you for an authentic Asian inspired ambiance. Once inside, you see more stunning artwork and tigers galore.

We were a party of 13 and it was somewhat busy. Our drinks and appetizers came out a reasonable time, but the entrees took a while.

My Udon meal was super spicy and flavorful. The dumplings were cooked well and crispy. I enjoyed my Tiger Killer drink. I plan on coming back for the food mainly.

I had their omakase recently and it is so good! This is not your typical omakase. It is a Thai style omakase. They offer $79 Omakase 11 course menus and $97 Omakase 14 course menus, including dessert and 2 sakes paring. It is amazing! I love the tiger in hot spring, it is an uni piece that is in this Thai style soup. You can get high quality and creative pieces at a reasonable price. I love the decoration as well. You can see tiger elements everywhere. The service is great. The only thing is we have to move around a bit. We were seated at a normal table before seating at the counter and had to move to a regular table for dessert. Overall, a good experience of a different type of omakase.

There's definitely more aesthetic going on here than anything else. True to its name, there's tigers everywhere and a wooden everything. We waited at the bar before being seated.

I'd say this is more for the ambiance and drinks than the food for sure. There's an extensive list of cocktails and beverages. I came for dinner with a large party so that probably played into the experience, I couldn't really hear the waiter or my friends over the music.

I personally didn't love my steak, it wasn't very tender but it definitely looked pretty.  The curry dish with steak was better. Lobster ramen wasn't bad and the appetizers were decent as well! I would stick to going with a group of less than 6.

Did you know 11Tiger has a 14course omakase? I didn't before yesterday after I went for they'd 7pm reservation. Firstly the ambiance is everything tiger print and as someone that enjoy a good theme, I love it. This restaurant does a good job of tying together Japanese and Thai cuisine in a creative way. It was evident with their menu. The omakase was so good. You could taste the high quality of the fish, eel and wagyu the chef service. This was such a great experience .

Not to mention the cocktails are amazing!

I love the Black Panther Curry the most!!! This is really a delicious perfect curry! It's creamy, little spicy, perfect match with noodle or even white rice!!!
Tom Yum Ramen I felt little salty, and the steak is too chewy.
Their drinks are very good! Recommend Bad Kitty on Fire, which is their signature I guess. Many people order it. I also ordered a non-alcohol one. It's lemonade base, but not sour at all. Setting the fire caught all the eyeballs. People can obtain visionally and gustatory delights.
Besides, they have really good atmosphere, it's a good place hang out with friends. Since it's not in a busy area, I can also find parking easily.

Loved everything about this place - super cool speakeasy esque vibe, though not actually a speak easy. As the name suggests, the place is filled with tiger themed art - but like, high-end, not just kitschy. Great drinks menu for delicious cocktails - we had a few, certainly helps to be there during happy hour.  

Food was FANTASTIC, I dare say amazing. You must get the oysters which come in threes, are large, and bursting with flavor having added salmon eggs, scallion, and other sauces. Black Panther Curry is another must - I was miffed that it was being shared around the table, coming back to get a bowl for myself. Deliciously thick curry soup. Tuna tartare was excellent, as was their little salad appetizer. My second favorite was the Uni Pasta, even though I am not the biggest fan of uni, the chef does a great job with the complimenting sauce so that you aren't overwhelmed with uni flavor.

My only hang up was the service which was often slow and required chasing down a waitress. Our original one seemed to preoccupy herself with other people, so we only saw her at the very beginning. Then the new waiter would spill water everywhere on the table, and on the food. Like dude, pick up the glass and pour individually. Could definitely use improvement here from a training perspective.

Overall, I'd say it's worth coming here and I look forward to returning for the food. Fingers crossed service has improved.

New Japanese & Thai Fusion Speakeasy in East Village! 11 Tigers does a great job of combining both these cuisines within their dishes  From the decorations and pretty food I was worried this place would be just aesthetically pleasing but the dishes hit the spot. My favorite was definitely the Tom Kha Ramen with Chashu- it was like a creamy Tom Yum ramen. The minute I took a sip of the broth I knew the kitchen knew what they were doing. You can taste the authentic Thai flavors just from the broth  The meat was tender, the broth was creamy, flavorful, spicy and acidic. I specifically loved how they don't use egg noodle and they use a higher quality noddle. I honestly loved every item and I'd come back. Even the drinks were so good

*Tom Kha Ramen
*Crying Tiger Steak $28
*Hoy Yaki Oyster 3pc $16
*Stone Grill Wagyu 1 pc $16
*Yakisoba $17
*Pink Panther Cocktail $16
*Tiger Killer Cocktail $16

Deeeelicious. Service was attentive and friendly. Ambience is cozy and hip. The sausage, chicken karaage, and our entrees were divine. Everything is on the spicy side. Drinks were great. Highly recommend.

Second date with a very sweet guy and I picked the place. I saw this place all over instagram and had to give it a try. We went at 4 pm because I cannot wait till later to eat and it was not a place for that. Would say this place is more of a night life moment and I would probably go here with friends if I lived closer. Getting there and back is a bit of a hassle for me. I got the Tom Yum ramen and it was pretty good. The huge prawn was a bit messy but it was so good! I do not think I had a prawn the size of a lobster ever. Wish I wasn't on a date so I can suck on the heads and really get the most out of it, but it is what it is. I got the Lychee drink and it was pretty good. My drink came with a sparkly rose petal that made my day. The service is pretty good here and they are patient. We sat around a bit after we paid and were done eating/drinking. They did not come and ask us to leave so that was nice. A bit of a tip. Not sure if it works because we totally forgot to use it, but if you check in on your Yelp app, you get 20% off. Do let us know if that is a thing. We forgot to use it.. after I was excited to use it. The one thing that I was a bit suspicious of was that my water tasted like soap. I had my date try my water and he agreed it was a bit off. However, we are alive and my second glass tasted like water so I guess it is fine? May consider going back for a girls night out, but maybe when it isn't so cold and dark out.

Love love love 11 tigers! The ambiance is great, tigers and big cats everywhere as decor. Very cool and instagram worthy! Service was great - everything was quick and our server was very attentive. They even included a discount for checking in on yelp (helpful hint)

Food was exceptional! Lots and lots of flavor. It was hard to make a decision looking at all their options. Decided on the gyoza which was incredible. One of the best I've ever had. It was packed with flavor and perfectly crisped. The unagi don......simply yes. I love eel, but you never get that much when ordering sushi. This was my first time truly eating eel meat like this and it was sooo tasty. I definitely recommend getting this if you like eel. The wagu steak don was good, but not worth it because it barley comes with any meat.

The pink panther drink was addicting. Everyone at the table ordered 2 (even the guys)

The place was on a 2nd floor and looked pretty unassuming outside. The indoor decor was cool. We ordered 3 dishes
- gyoza: it was good but not memorable
- black panther curry: the curry had good spiciness level and the beef steak was tender.
- 11 tigers mentai with uni: the uni was a bit fishy, the rest of the dish was creamy. However since we already had the creamy curry, the creaminess of this dish made the meal too heavy.
Overall, the food here didn't impress me as much, but it could be because we didn't order right. If you visit, just order one out of these two creamy entrees.

Serving Japanese and Thai cuisine, 11
Tigers is a new fusion restaurant with spicy, flavorful food and yummy cocktails. I remember this used to be a speakeasy called Pouring Ribbons and it still looks a lot like a speakeasy. They play heavily on the tigers theme and the whole place is decorated with tiger plushies, tiger murals, tiger print, and more. I thought the names of the cocktails were really clever and the food portions were decent.

1 star off is because these drinks be SMOL. they are small my friends. they are so yummy which hurts for them to be so small, they're gone in two sips. i forgot to savor it. and they are so pricey which lead me to think they might be bigger but silly me.
aside from that the interior of this place is super unique and exciting to look at. i like the overall theme and the food i peeped from other people's tables looked great too. will come back to try the food one day so this review is just for the drinks.

Very fresh Uni and scallop,
I love the Tom yum ramen,
The downside is the portion is small and the price is a bit high

The restaurant is dark and with lots of tigers
Can be a bit scary lol

I picked this spot out Saturday night to have a girls night. I can tell you that this is a little on the pricey side but definitely worth checking out with Asian tapas. It's kinda hidden and my girl friend and I were the only few inside.

The food though was amazing. Yakisoba was packed with flavor, tuna rice rolls were soft yet crunchy with good quality tuna and the wagyu I had was so soft and literally melts in your mouth. We also got the pink panther cocktails that were just sweet enough, came with lychee but not superrrr sweet.

Inside they played very good music suited well for the night and service was very sweet and accommodating to us. I would definitely come back here again for a good night starter. 10/10 :)

Although we didn't get to make it to happy hour in time, the prices seemed very worth. It was a cute lowkey place and after going up, the restaurant had a nice theme to it, not too packed. Staff were super accommodating and kind. Everything we got was delicious and we're excited to come back to try the happy hour menu!

Starting off the right thing, the FOOD. They are amazing. The menu isn't big but everything is very delicious. They have happy hour until 7pm, some appetizers are a little cheaper. My favorites are scallop chin, and stone grilled ribeye topped with uni. They have top 5 main, but literally it's just 5 of them. I tied four out of 5 the only one I think it's over priced is the wagyu steak, it only come with very small piece of wagyu. Take advantage of their happy hour for the oyster; they come with 3 in each order and they are huge and delicious only for $9 during happy hour.

The service definitely needs improvement. The guy refilling water kept spilling water everywhere every time he came to refill, splash over the table and in the food, not once but every time. Our waitress who took our order was nowhere to be found after our first order, we had to find someone else when we wanted to order more. The service was very unpleasant.

The whole place is super cute, dark tone and a lot of cute decor and mural, tiger toys and decor everywhere.

This place is pure happiness - if you love flavorful food and great drinks. If we weren't in a public space, I would have literally licked my plate clean. I was very impressed with the service - 'caring' is the way I would describe it, more than anything else. Our waiter kept making sure we knew what we were getting into, what we should expect from the flavors (and what not to expect!). None of this was in a condescending way, mind you, just making sure we were ordering things that would suit the flavors we craved. Can't wait to come back here.

Fun spot in Alphabet City.

*Tom Yum Prawn Ramen : pretty good to give it a try.

*Tuna Larb : love the combination, it was really good but also I'm usually a Larb-lover.

*Rib-Eye Steak : pretty good but the first two dishes were better.

Cocktails were good.

Would come back! They also have Happy Hour!

Came here a couple months back for the first time but they were so unorganized. We put our food order in but didn't get anything for at least half an hour and when we inquired, they told us they didn't have most of what we ordered. I looked at the table next to us who seemed to have gotten everything we wanted and the waitress said they got the last of the items. Super unprofessional especially if you're trying to promote your business. Anyway, I decided to give it another try because I did enjoy the atmosphere of the place. It gives speak easy vibes. This time, I came on a Wednesday night, 5 minutes before 7PM. The waitress was sweet enough to come over to tell us we can still order from the happy hour menu, which made our experience so much better. Cocktails were $12 each for HH. We both got the Pink Panther and it was so good! Not to mention, everything was so aesthetically made.

My fave dish had to be the Hoy Yai, which are fresh oysters with ponzu, fried garlic and ikura. Delicious! We also got the tuna rice crackers - I would skip, nothing special. The scallop ikura handroll with gold flakes wasn't on the menu but I saw it on Yelp photos and asked for it - definitely pretty although I wish it had tasted as good as it looked. Lastly, we got the dish they are most known for on Tik Tok - the Black Panther curry with squid ink noodles and beef. It was packed with flavor and didn't disappoint!

My friend and I almost missed this place. The entrance is tiny like an entrance to a decrepit walk up apartment building except the walls are covered with tiger paintings. I could see why one would think it's a speakeasy. Once you ascend the stairs, you are welcomed into a warm dim rectangular space.

Their unique cocktails were around 16 a glass. I liked my 2 mezcal based cocktails while my friend had the pink lychee one not once or twice but three times.

The menu felt a little overwhelming. There seemed to be too many options that sounded very similar written in a tiny font. The online format is easier to read. We went with our waiters recommendations.

The karrage tasted good with the sauce but it is NOTHING like karrage you would get at a Japanese place. It tasted more like fried chicken balls/nuggets than actual karrage.

We got the hoy yai, which came with three raw oysters topped with ikura, fried onions and siracha. They were very good! A little spicier than I anticipated.

For the entrees, the mentaiko cream udon was nothing really to write home about as I felt that it needed more flavor than cream while the short rib curry was bomb!

BEWARE! When you split the bill, the tip box on the receipt calculates tip options for the whole bill and NOT the split bill. So be careful when you're tipping. It seems DECEITFUL that marking the 20 percent box is actually 40 percent.

The restaurant is located next to stuytown in East village. It is extremely hard to find this restaurant  it is a small store front that eventually has a staircase that leads to the actual  restaurant. The restaurant is pretty big and it seems like it would be more fun later in the night for it's bar as well.

Service was great! Very friendly staff. As for the food... I would not recommend. It is extremely pretty and appetizing. However, the uni pasta was very soggy, maybe because it is made with ramen noodles rather than actual pasta noodles. The garlic fried rice was also not very flavorful and the rice grains were mushy. The tom yum was probably my favorite dish out of all 3.

Hope this helps!

Such a great speakeasy (if it falls in that category!) The waiter is so nice and attentive, and always answered all the questions that we had about the menu.

I went to this spot many times and all their drinks blew me away. The presentation, garnish and flavor was amazing. All drinks are super spot on, my favorite is their tiki drink. Definitely tastes like a coconut milk tea.

Food wise, all of their fried foods were delicious and I really liked their sushi. It was always really fresh and I always end up wanting more.

Came here after seeing a reel on instagram promoting it, and this place did not disappoint!!

It was pretty empty when my friend and I got here on a Tuesday night, prime dinner time. We were seated right away and the table setting was so cute (little tiger to hold the chopsticks). We ordered the Pink Panther and the Leopard for cocktails, and the Pink Panther was so good that we ordered more throughout the night.

The shishito peppers could have been seasoned a little more, but they were still a good balance while eating the other two dishes, the 11 Tigers Tom Yum Ramen and the Black Panther Curry.

I HIGHLY recommend getting the Black Panther Curry as it was our favorite!! The flavors were so authentic and the steak was a great balance for the curry. We also enjoyed the 11 Tigers Tom Yum Ramen, but we loved the curry so much we started putting some of the ramen noddles into the curry to eat more of it!!

Service was great, place was clean, and I would love to come back here and try their other dishes!

Came here on a reservation for 6- two of our party had to come late but luckily we were able to be seated as long as we ordered food and drinks. Although each reservation is for a 90 minute block, we were allowed to stay longer because we kept ordering more rounds.

The cocktails here are AMAZING. For a place that serves both food and cocktails, I usually don't have much faith in the cocktail program. Every cocktail we had here was excellent (we ordered the Bad Kitty, Come Get You Tonight, Pink Panther, Tiger Killer, Sua Dum) but my favorites were the Tiger Killer and Leopard.

For food we got the
- Tuna Rice Cracker
- Stone grilled ribeye
- kee Mao Tiger Udon
- 11 Tigers Mentai
- Black Panther Curry

Our favorites were the Kee Mao Tiger Udon! The others were okay (I would probably skip the stone grilled ribeye since it's overpriced for what it's worth and the black panther curry didn't stand out among other curries I've had), but the tiger udon was EXCELLENT. Thick, chewy noodles in a savory sauce and the steak on top was super tender and flavorful. Would come back and order this and other plates. Portion sizes were generous luckily, and not izakaya sized.

The menu is so extensive I'm sure there would be plenty to try if we were to come back!

I went on Valentine's Day. The restaurant was really trying to promote themselves, so we were surrounded by photographers and staff dressed in all red. If you're looking for a quiet dinner experience, go somewhere else. I felt like I was in a photoshoot (not really a positive thing, at least for me).

Drinks are on the sweeter side. However, the ones I had were very enjoyable. The knockout tiger is very spirit forward and has a velvety mouthfeel. The bad kitty on fire was, well, on fire. I wonder how this place doesn't set off the carbon monoxide detector considering the amount of arson going on in here. My bf's drinks were too sweet for my taste. He got the sua dum & sua klan. They're nice if you like tequila (I do) and a more tropical, fruit-forward flavor (I don't).

Food was a hit and a miss. I was most excited to try the tuna crackers, but unfortunately the cracker part tasted like those crunchy sweet rice rolls you can get at the Asian supermarket. I liked the tuna on top. The fish balls were delicious. I'm someone who enjoys the spongy texture. The uni pasta was kind of meh. I thought the uni on top didn't go very well with the overall dish itself. The uni made it overly fishy in an abrasive way. The pasta itself was also on the drier side and quite hot, so the cold uni on top was a jarring contrast.

Overall, I wouldn't come back

There really are a ton of tigers here, they really stuck with the them. It was a super fun vibe and a little hidden gem in the area. The food was so flavorful and I never had anything like it

Juicy octopus 4/5
If you love the texture of octopus, this is the move. I thought it was a pretty good starter

Black panther 5/5
I have never had a dish quite like it. The flavors were super unique and the spice was perfect. Both noodle dishes made me want to come again

11 Tigers ramen 5/5
Sooo good, the prawn was pretty but kinda hard to get the meat out of it. I got medium spice and it was a perfect spice level for me

Would definitely go again! Perfect for a group too

It's a bit of hike but well worth the commute.  It has a speakeasy feel but is a restaurant decorated with ... tigers (hence 11 tigers ). The venue is spacious with high ceilings , nicely decorated .  

We had pre dinner drinks at the bar served by attentive bartenders who recommended the drinks .  All are Asian inspired flavors ( ie. With lychee or the old fashion Asian style ) some served in a theatrical way .

The food was good though the servings are on the smAller side .  Make sure to order ample .  The dishes that we ordered were: dumplings , oyster shooters, scallop with uni , curry noodles to name a few .  

The place has a party feel with loads of energy and patrons who are dressed to party .

I enjoyed the experience as it's a combination of a tao feel but in a much smaller setting ( on the east side of Manhattan ).

11 Tigers was such a fun dining experience. During Halloween they had themed drinks and decor that showed great holiday spirit.

The food was also quite good. I really enjoyed the seared rib eye in panang curry with squid ink fettucine and the hoy yai oysters were super fresh. Some of the misses were the 11 Tigers Mentai and the tuna cracker.

The 11 Tigers is in a neighborhood that I just gawk at. I came here because it was lizted as a "speakeasy" on IG. I didnt get that vibe but the ambiance is nice and intimate. The servers were attentive and helpful. At one point my dinner companion felt she was being coerced into NOT ordering what she wanted but that was resolved rather quickly.
The food was just okay.

I had a great timing catching up with friends at 11 Tigers.  This place has a mix of a bar area and the dining room.  

The bad kitty on fire is definitely the cocktail to order if you want to see a great presentation,  the secret is the cinnamon powder.  I am not going to ruin the surprise, but you can refer to my picture. It's definitely a drink on fire.

There's another drink called Knockout Tiger that would come with smoke and a Thai prosperity cloth, but the taste is too strong for me.

The tiger killer cocktail is sweet and tastes like a tropical beverage.  Come get you tonight is served in a tea cup and it's very balanced if you like tea and alcohol.   We tried almost all of the cocktails and we like most of them.

Onto the food, the sauce for the karaage is good, shrimp tempura was okay.  Oysters come with sirarcha, garlic, shallot and crispy onions.  They are not your regular east coast oysters, these are large Suratthani oysters.   Highly recommend getting them, but make sure to order the correct ones.

The grilled rib eye with uni consists of 1 bite, we were all excited, but the dish was cold, it was just weird to taste cold grilled meat.  

The crying tiger steak comes with a spicy sauce, it's good, but the Black panther steak has a lot more flavor to it due to the curry sauce.  It is interesting that the crying tiger steak comes with a side of rice (vs the black panther steak) because the black panther steak definitely would need some starch to absorb the sauce and fully enjoy the dish.

The place has tiger masks for people to put on to take pictures.  We did not do it because we are all germaphobe.  

Overall, this speakeasy located on the 2nd floor is worth visiting.  We did not hear loud music when we were there, so we're able to have a nice conversation.  The food and cocktails are good, you just have to make sure you order the recommended items.  When I visited, they did not have the jewel box, which was a disappointment.  

Will definitely return next time I am in the area for some giant oysters and cocktails.

We came here on a busy evening so everything was very hectic. We got seated at a super tight table for 4 people. Could barely move in my seat.

The food was meh. The mentai udon did not impress, I thought it would be better but it just tasted like cream udon. Couldn't really taste the mentai. The gyoza and ramen was ok as well.

Service was not that good. Probably wouldn't visit again. Only recommend if you have no other options.

Decided to check this place out after coming across some photos on instagram. The restaurant has semi-bar like atmosphere yet cozy. We decided to get foods from their top recommended menus and got Tom yum ramen and crying tiger steak. I personally liked ramen and recommend getting it if you like Tom Yum soup. Unfortunately, the tiger steak came out cold, and nothing was too special about the steak. Overall, good restaurant to consider to hang out with friends

The food here was actually quite good (the black panther curry was wonderful) and so were the cocktails.

Atmosphere isn't often very important to me, but this was notably not the place for me (or at least not what I was expecting for a dinner spot). If you are looking for calm dinner, this is NOT the place. I was disappointed with how rowdy this place was (it was loud with a lot of yelling about taking shots, huge sparklers, and cinnamon being tossed everywhere and lit on fire). I'd come back if they toned it down.

This is a place that SEEMS like it's a cocktail-focused establishment but in reality is a cramped restaurant with good food but mediocre drinks.

Came here because the drinks looks interesting (particularly their tiki drink that I didn't end up getting and the Knockout Tiger). Their food also seemed pretty delicious - I love the concept of Thai and Japanese fusion.

I saw this place on Tiktok (great place to find visually appealing restaurants) and was pleasantly surprised to see it also had high rating on Yelp. I was sure this place was going to be a rising hot bar and bites place.

If I were to rate this place on food alone, it's actually pretty tasty! I enjoyed both of the food items. I was looking for something soupy, so I got the Chashu Tom Yum Ramen ($18), extra spicy. This was exactly what I was expecting - soup had the sour flavor I was hoping to taste, the ramen noodles were standard.
