Food: the popcorn chicken is a must have! Loved the honey glaze. Pairing that with the notorious tfc was a mistake though! The chicken sandwich is first of all huge and very fried! I would come back and order a rice or noodle dish instead! But it was tasty and I really enjoyed the cabbage especially

Price: very reasonably priced especially given portion sizes. I ended up taking some food back with me!

Ambience: I like the set up of this place! It has an intimate and interesting vibe with all the vibrant colors but overall dark room

Service: good service! I'm happy that they were not pushy and let us take our time with the meal

Modern takes on taiwanese classics. While the soju cocktail was just okay, the price and portions here are hard to beat. The wait for tables usually moves quick. Loved the beef roll the most! Nice chewy wrap with savory veggie and beef filling. The popcorn chicken is a good shareable but nothing special.

Fun ambiance and great spot for a quick bite and some drinks.

Cute date spot or for dinner with friends! The interior design is to die for- make sure to take some selfies in the bathroom.

We got the scallion beef pancake, lo ba beng, beef noodle soup, and seaweed fries. I would say the seaweed fries were my favorite. It was a nice twist on fries and a good snack to munch on. The serving was pretty big, it correlated to its cost. The beef noodle soup was good in terms of noodle texture and broth. I do wish the beef was a bit more marinated. I've had cheaper at bo ky and it was much more flavorful there. The beef with the pancake was really soft and the outer pancake part was perfectly crisp. Lo ba beng was a popular pick as well. I recommend doing family style, which is popular in asian culture. I would love to come back do the alcohol challenge!

Located in the St. Marks area, 886 is small restaurant that does a modern take on many classic Taiwanese dishes. The spot is trendy, yet it brings you back to Taiwan where you sit at these little tables; nothing fancy. My friends and I went for lunch on the weekend and there was definitely a wait, but luckily we didn't have to wait that long since the food actually came out pretty quickly.

As for the food, we got:
- Honey Glazed Popcorn Chicken - it was crispy fresh and delicious. I wish the order did come with more pieces for the price though.
- The Notorious T.F.C. - the chicken was so crispy and the batter was light. The chicken pieces were bigger than the sandwich itself, so I'm glad they gave a knife to help cut it. It was good, but I felt like it was missing some flavor.
- Lo Ba Beng - delicious with a good mix of rice and meat. It comes with an egg, which was seasoned and cooked to perfection.
- Sacha Black Pepper Beef - I think this was my favorite. There was so much flavor and I would describe this in a Cantonese phrase, "wok-hei". While it was being cooked, the fire was big enough to give that delicious charr.

Overall, I had a nice meal. Although it is more expensive than I expected, I think it's still worth the visit.

Pretty good!

Overall pretty faithful renditions of some Taiwanese classics with some interesting twists thrown in.

What we got
Beef scallion pancake rolls- executed well. The ratios of beef, veg, and pancake were good (which is often where people screw up with this dish). The addition of mayo was interesting (and very non-traditional) but it worked.

Three cup chicken- classic dish prepared in the classical style with no creative liberties taken. Solid.

Pork belly stir-fry- a bit salty for more taste, but probably fine with rice.

Fried chicken- I really liked this. They used Sichuan peppercorn, which is unorthodox but meshed surprisingly well with the sweet sauce, which wasn't too sweet as I feared. Chicken was very crispy as well. I'm surprised this worked as well as it did.

The vibe is very hip and modern. We were also pleasantly surprised when we saw the bill too, as the damage wasn't too bad.

Tasty Taiwanese street eats (and drinks) in a funky & cool restaurant with neon lights. To be honest I don't understand why this place is so popular and people are posting it on their IG stories, because it was just okay and I kind of wish I just ate at home. Don't get me wrong like everything was pretty good and I ate most of it because I was starving, but I think it's just overhyped and oily/salty and I felt bloated and chunky after.

We got the popcorn chicken, lo ba beng, hakka stir fry, and scallion pancake beef wrap. I guess I'm just not super into everything being super fried and oily, but if you are then you would love it. To be fair I didn't try any of the drinks, so maybe those are bussin and that's why everyone loves it. It's also like not cheap. If this meal was $10 I'd be saying great things about it, but it was not so I'm going to speak my truth.

The restaurant interior looked really cool but the tables were small and sticky. We also sat next to a couple on a first or second date and those are my favorite people to eavesdrop so that was cool. Their conversation was very awkward. I'm not really sure why someone would bring a first/second date here (unless it was both of their first times here and they didn't know), but who am I to judge.

It's hard to find good Taiwanese food in DC where I live, so I always try to stop by 886 when I'm in NYC. Everything about it reminds me of the motherland, from the name of the restaurant to the plastic stools at the outdoor tables to the canned apple cider (iykyk).

My favorite dishes are the scallion pancake beef wrap and the beef noodle soup - can you tell I love beef? Even though the beef wrap isn't entirely traditional, the szedaddy mayo is soooo good. And the beef noodle soup honestly just tastes like home. The Taiwanese sausage fried rice is delicious too! My partner never had Taiwanese sausage before I took him here, and he couldn't stop talking about it for a whole week after. I was also surprised to see they have some lesser known dishes like fly's head (sounds horrible but is delicious on its own or with rice) and pig's blood cake (I actually hate this but I appreciate bringing the culture to the states hahaha).

The staff are nice and friendly, and I've even seen Chef Eric out of the kitchen bringing food out to tables several times, which is super exciting as a fangirl. Whoever is in charge of their IG is also hilarious LOL def check them out. One of my fav spots to get my taiwan food fix!

Great ambiance and friendly service. Came here for happy hour with some coworkers, and there was ample seating. The waiter came by to refill water multiple times, and the food arrived in ~10-15 minutes after ordering.

The drinks were a good price, and the food had l good portions given the prices in NYC!

We sat near the window with a view of the street.

The food was pretty good as well. The "Big Plates" come with rice and salad, so the Korean Beef was a good deal.

I love going here to pregame. The drinks are all $6-7 and they work for sure. The appetizers are under $5-8 for HUGE portions. My fav is the Tater Tots ($5) and Calamari ($8)!
There's a 3.99% credit/debit card fee so bring cash if you can.
We ordered the Adios and Strawberry Mojito for drinks and we got Tater Tots, Calamari, and a Kimchi Fried Rice to fill ourselves. We underestimated the portions and couldn't finish it all. The place isn't the cleanest/cutest inside but the food is bombbbbb especially for the price. The only thing I don't really like would be how packed and loud it is inside but that just goes to show how popular it is!

This place is awesome! 212 Hisais has strong drinks, great prices, and unique asian fusion food. The restaurant is clean, the staff is so friendly, and I have become a regular patron in just one month of being in the city!

I would highly recommend their steak which comes in an insanely large portion. Their asian tapas are also very impressive. It's super fun to sit by the bar and watch the bartender work! Enjoy 212- Especially on weeknights where you can avoid the weekend crowds!

Perfect, and perfectly priced with authentic J pub food: Run by Hisae, an older Japanese from Hokkaido who's had a number of her own establishments in NYC prior to this place. Go here for J curry, not those chains. The service is good: It's run by a J person so no fooling around in that department! The clientele veers young (weekend nights NYU students during the school year) though there was a working-class Gen X couple near us as we arrived. One star off for the excessive use of plastic straws (all drinks including the water) with no option to refuse and the limited vegan/vegetarian selection.

Gosh, where do I even start talking about this godsent spot from the heavens. The prices here alone are insane and you really get so much for it. Any craft cocktail is gonna be ...putrid but what do I expect paying $7 for an old fashion haha. They're mad strong and get the job done. Good portions are quite big definitely shareable or even an entire appetizer for yourself. Incredibly attentive staff who was always checking on us and keeping the liquor flowing. Place is loud and trendy love the dark lighting and ambiance. 212 you have my heart forever

If you're looking for strong and cheap drinks, this is definitely the place for you. We came on a Friday night and there was a wait to get in, but we were able to skip the line since we were okay eating outside.

The drinks are huge and have lots of alcohol in them, so be careful of how much you're drinking! We were able to order a Lychee Mojito ($7), Strawberry Margarita ($6), Long Island Iced Tea ($7), Bahama Mama ($7), Green Tea Shots ($4 each), and Lemon Drop shots ($3 each). The flavored cocktails were decent, but the alcohol taste is definitely overpowering. The basket of fries were also pretty crispy and were a nice bar food to eat with the drinks!
Extremely rude staff. Staff catcalled my friends and I when trying to use bathroom and yelled at other people trying to sit with their own party.

My sister has medical issues that she needs accommodations for. She came to the bar with her friends to have a fun night and the bartender took away her emergency food. She has a similar disease to diabetes so this incredibly dangerous. She has severe allergies and cannot eat any of the food on the menu. She tried to explain this to the restaurant but the staff was incredibly rude and took away her food despite her visible medical bracelet. Absolutely disgusted at the lack of respect for disabilities. Staff was also especially rude to women in general. Never coming back here again.

Came here because i saw reviews saying the food was cheap and kimchi fried rice portion was huge, and I was not disappointed. I got takeout for the first time two days ago and had to bring my friend back the next night to try their drinks- the drink prices looked great so I had to come back to see how they shaped up. The drinks were excellent- we got lychee and mango mojitos and they were strong without tasting it! There were many people hanging out and drinking and the vibe was very fun. The kimchi fried rice is my new fave and the ginger shrimp was also delicious. The bouncer was very helpful and nice and I was able to order takeout from him directly! Great food and drinks all around- will definitely be making this our regular spot!

If you're looking for cheap drinks, tasty food, and a good time, this is the place to be! They have a line that goes out the door so would recommend coming slightly earlier in the evening. The crowd tends to run younger and the decor inside isn't anything special, but it does what you need it to do.

The restaurant is good for smaller and larger groups, but I would suggest coming with a smaller party to be seated quicker. They have Asian bar food that's filling before a night out and a ton of tasty drinks, too!

I got the Kimchi Fried Rice, Egg Rolls, and Fries to share and everything was honestly delicious! I especially loved how flavorful the fried rice was. Even with 2-3 drinks per person, this place didn't break the bank and it was the perfect start to our night!

I love coming here when I'm looking for a cheap drinks spot. Drinks are large but sweet - not consistent on the alcohol amount though I think. I've had nights here where the drinks are super strong and others - not so much.

Food is cheap and satisfies those junk-food-post-drinking cravings. The line gets pretty long so start your night early here.

Dark ambience, feels kind of like a college bar, and it's loud.

Drinks: The most affordable drinks I've ever encountered in NYC and probably anywhere else. Cocktails were $7 and shots ranged from $3-4. They taste pretty good but the alcohol sneaks up on you once you've move through 2-3 rounds. Definitely the best place to hang out with friends if you plan to go out later in the night. My favorite drink was the mango mojito.

Ambiance/Service: Not the most aesthetically pleasing bar but gets the job done if you're goal is to get drunk! Volume levels are moderate considering this place is usually pretty full. We came here twice during our NY trip and had a super cool server who made our experience even more fun.

Time: June 2023

I went here with friends on a Saturday night around 7:30pm and the line was already out the door. The wait for a table of 8 was around 20-30 minutes, which was not bad most of your party had to be here in order to be seated. The inside was dark and loud, and tables were a little dingy, but it was passable. Service was great, but the food and drinks did take a while to come out (it was really busy though).

We got food and drinks, all of which were incredibly affordable! They also had a huge selection of drinks and a sizable list of food options. All the shareables/food was $8, and mixed drinks ranged from $6-9. Shots were only $3!
- Kimchi fried rice: the rice and flavoring was okay, but the kimchi was great! There was only kimchi and a light sprinkling of onions as toppings. It was a good filler before starting to drink
- Potstickers: the dough was pretty thick and the filling was smaller, but the taste was decent!
- Calamari: this was made pretty well and I loved the sauce that you dip into. The dipping sauce was more savory-- like sweet & sour sauce with an accent of soy sauce. It was fried well (crispy, but not overly crunchy)
- Shots: lemon drop (strong, sweet), green tea (medium strong, sweet). I estimate the drink strength based on how much of the alcohol I tasted.
- Cocktails: tom collins (weak, but less sweet; although brownie points for having that on the menu!), lychee mojito (strong, but the lychee masks it well), tokyo iced tea (medium strong, very sweet)

Overall, I'd say the food is okay, and the drinks were good (slightly watered down). I would come here again (and again) because it is a great spot to pregame and not break the bank.

Strong and cheap drinks. Not necessarily good but their drinks were extremely cost effective and get the job done. A fun pregame spot with a group of people, definitely the cheapest alcohol prices I've witnessed in the city. There's a line to get in on weekend nights but it moves quick as they have a 1 hr limit per table. Didn't try the food.

Came here for cheap drinks and food before an event and it did not disappoint. The line was so long to get in - it is across the street and it grew longer down the street as we waited. I got kimchi fried rice which was huge for under $10. Drinks range from $3-$7 which is also insane because they would've been sooo expensive elsewhere in the city. The vibe with the loud music, dark lighting, cheap drinks reminded me of a college bar haha. There's an H-Mart around the corner if you want to buy snacks if you get hungry in line. I'm guilty of buying a pack of kimbap while waiting haha. My friends and I had a great time here and then we went on our merry way to the event!

The drinks were cheap and the food was good! I was impressed with the chicken sandwich . The service was good too. It's a great pregame spot. Go on the earlier side though because there's usually a line.
This place serving generation to generation of college kids and on budget adults. Not saying they offer quality but most definitely offer variety!

I have no complaints. Unbeatable price. Our server was FANTASTIC. He was so sweet, chill, and impressionable. Portion is JUMBO. This place is a high key throwback to college with the price and portion. The atmosphere is casual and Asian fusion. I love the vibe. The fries are absolutely fantastic and well salted. I can't wait to come back and try everything else. The drinks are totally up my alley since I love sweet and honestly a great size for what your paying for.  If I had to nit pick it be that I wish they would use reusable cups and utensils... the paper waxed cup and plastic utensils is quite odd to me but very wasteful.

By far the cheapest drinks I've seen in NYC! All the alcoholic drinks were $5/$6 and shots were $3, which is a great deal for the city. However, the drinks do taste cheap and come in plastic cups so be warned. My friend ordered a Moscow mule and I could taste the cheap ginger ale. 212 Hisae's doesn't pretend to be a classy place but is a great place to get a bang for your buck.
The best hole-in-the-wall restaurant i've ever been too! Drinks are cheap and the food is amazing for the price. Run don't walk! PS it's always busy and they operate on a first come first serve
Absolutely amazing location to meet up with friends. Food tastes great because of the great price.  The line can get pretty long on a weekend night. Definitely try to get here early.

It was my second time here

I am here for only one thing, and one thing only. The CHEAP drinks. I have a few secret spots that you can score cheap drinks and this is one of them.

Are the drinks amazing ehhh but I'm not going to argue with $3 shots and $6-$7 drinks. I haven't been here enough but I think the key is finding out what drinks you like the best and sticking with that.

Some of the cheapest drinks in the city, young crowd but hey don't care. This is the perfect pregame place or after dinner.

4 stars
Amazing value

Came here because a friend wanted to get blackout drunk and this place had cheap drinks and food. We ordered a bunch of drinks and appetizers and everything came out incredibly economical - I've honestly never seen alcohol so cheap in my life in a major city. I can see why friends tell me this place is dangerous; even though the cocktails are like $6 or $7, they are mixed with a generous portion of hard alcohol.

Highly recommended place to start your night out if you're not looking to pre-game at someone's apartment.

If you're looking for a good pregame or hanging out with friends then this is the place for you.

This is definitely for a younger crowd (located near NYU) so if that's not your vibe then I'd get it.

I heard about this place because my other friend said that there were really cheap drinks and boy was she right. While the tequila shots were $3 and was about as bad as swallowing medicine, the mixed drinks were pretty tasty at around $5-7. You'll definitely feel it depending on what you get. We got the mojitos.

When my friend and I came it was around 9 and jammed packed. We thankfully were sitting closer to the end because it was so loud. Don't be here for a first date because you won't here a word they're saying.

They had some pretty decent food that was also well priced which I wasn't expecting. They had tapas as well as full plates. We ordered the tapas which were honestly full plates and thank goodness it was because for $5 we got more than one thing!

Service was pretty average considering how busy it was. But they were helpful.

I'd recommend it overall. 212 will get you to where you need to be, whatever that may entail.

This spot is a no thrills cheap spot to enjoy some alcohol and food. I'll give you an example of what I mean, the wine comes in a little plastic cup.  I mean it's got to be one of the cheapest and best deals in the city. If you're looking to get smashed for cheap, then this place is for you. If you want some food with good portions at a cheaper price than most then this spot is definitely for you. Look... this place is loud, cramped and nothing special to look at but it gets the job done. Think HH prices but the entire day! Expect to sit close to other tables, eavesdrop on other conversations and ask the person or people you are with to repeat themselves a few times but come here for what it is.... A fun spot with good service where you can drink and eat for cheap.

Can't go wrong with 212s.
It used to be the spot back when I was in highschool and it has remained one of my go tos now that I'm an adult.

You can't beat their prices, the drinks are strong and cheap. Those bartenders do not skimp. Only reason I took a star off is because they took the edamame off the menu, the fried calamari's recipe must've changed and our waitress had a stank ass attitude. You really shouldn't be working in a bar if you can't handle a few intoxicated folk. Rolling your eyes at paying customers and quite blatantly too, is far from cute. You never know who's watching. Anyway, their tada chicken is my favorite thing on the menu and the best drunk snack. Solid spot.

Popular spot to grab drinks with your friends. Line tends to get long at 6PM especially towards the end of the week. The drinks are good and affordable. I think their main highlight are their small bites and food. For a place to grab drinks their food is pretty delicious. There is a time limit seating of 90 minutes.

Love this place, it is alway my go to spot when I want some drink, the drink is cheap and good along with their appetizers especially the fried calamari, their dish like meal I don't recommend ordering because it isn't really great just so-so.

An interesting spot to come for cheap drinks! Paired with some great appetizers made this a great experience!

We came as a party of four and grabbed four cocktails! The drinks were alright, but were most importantly affordable. I wouldn't say this was the best alcoholic drink I had, but it certainly was strong enough.

Appetizers were nothing to write home about. We ordered fish and chips, BBQ wings, and karaage. Out of the three, the BBQ wings were the best. Decent in flavor and pretty value especially in NYC. The fish and chips were alright, but it was great to snack on while drinking. And the fried chicken was decent, but you can find better at other restaurants.

This place fills a certain niche for me: a place to grab cheap and have something to snack on. If you're looking for a place that also fits this niche, this is a great place to come.

Value: 6/5
Taste: 3/5
Ambiance: 3.5/5

This bar is one of my favorite gems here in the city. The service and the staff are absolutely amazing. The food is always on point and the drinks are absolutely fantastic. If you want a girls night out or date night you should consider coming here and enjoying a Friday or Saturday evening here you won't regret it.

*4.5/5

Take me back!!! Finally some cheap (but not nasty) alc!! 212 Hisae's officially got me hooked on amaretto sours. The line is long on a weekend night but it's worth if you tryna have fun but not break the bank. My teenage brother can make a way better kimchi fried rice than the one I ordered but no one comes here for the cuisine anyways. Fries were good tho. Pairs great w the $3 shots here. I want to go back

Like literally every other review, I'm gonna praise Hisae on their drinks. They get you completely smashed for less than ten bucks every single time and to do that despite COVID + a looming depression... this place is a real gem. Food's okay, salty. Drinks are wonderful and I plan to try the entire repetoire eventually.

One thing I want to add that I don't see others talking about is the environment. It's small, bit cramped, and people are loud, the menus are made of cheap paper and microsoft paint. The crowd's age is around 18-24. You won't feel classy coming here, and honestly, you shouldn't care - Hisae is for getting messed up on a budget of paperclips and lint -- embrace it!

I was so excited to try this place out, but the experience was so terrible, I truly would never go back again. Just because it's a strong and cheap drink doesn't mean you should put up with ridiculous service

First, you wait outside for an hour and a half in the cold. Whatever, but after the "it'll be 45 minutes" doubled, can't say I was too happy

We go in, after 15 minutes someone finally decided to address us and we order drinks. I got the cosmopolitan first, and no less than 30 seconds later a server CRASHES into me, he falls and almost knocks me out of the seat. I get a cold "sorry" and he runs away, half my cosmo on the table.

Left to clean up the mess and half a drink gone, we waited another HOUR before our next round of drinks because there truly is no one there to serve you. We asked for waters, never got them. Ordered fries and dumplings, only got the fries. And then, 2 rounds of drinks in when we should been 3/4, they bring us the check. 4 hours wasted and not even a slight buzz. It's not worth the cheap drinks, or the terrible service.

Had a blast last night at 212 Hisae's! The drinks are both cheap and tasty. They were having an issue with the fryer last night but that didn't take away from the service or the tapas! I work very close and will definitely be frequenting this place for happy hour.
soooo good one dribk had me fucked up its soooo lit fome here to get fuckedddddd upppoppppp
Amazing food. Low key vibe, very interesting playlist. Service was pretty good too! Would definitely visit again.

I have come to this restaurant for years. I like the Asian and the American food entrees. I have come here with my friends and with my family members. The prices and portion sizes are very fair. The staff has always been friendly. I have usually been successful with regard to the ability to park for free on the nearby streets.

My group of friends and I came here on a Friday after school. It was busy of course, as any bar would be on a Friday afternoon! But, luckily we came in time and found a table. They do ID people so make sure to have your ID and vaccination card!! Along with my lychee martini ( I love lychee and this drink was perfect to end my week and forget about all the drama of this week ) I ordered the kimchi fried rice. This was a HUGE portion for the price which was good because I got to share it with my friends and we all enjoyed it. My other friends got the calamari which was good, it wasn't chewy, or too battered it actually fried really good and the sauce was okay it wasn't my favorite but it did add some flavor to the calamari if you did not want to exactly eat it dry. I preferred to eat mine dry though because I liked the taste more that way. They did have a table limit of about an hour, within that time we both finished our meals and drinks and it was more than enough time for us to eat and drink and leave feeling better than we came in. Service was quick being the amount of people of present & our server was so nice and kept checking on us and refilling our water! Overall we all had a good night, thank you guys for the good vibes! Keep up the great work!!

My favorite affordable drink in east village! Drinks are about $5-$6 here and shots are $3! Talk about a steal. The kimchi fried rice is also pretty darn good here. If you wanna have a good time or destress this is the place to be. They used to give edamame out but for my recent visit there were no edamames. They also changed their menu a bit but drinks are still amazing and you can definitely taste the alcohol. I love the lemon drop shots here and for such a low price you can keep downing them until you drop. Best place in east village!!

I've been to this place one other time. I had a minor issue about not being notified that there was a table limit for 90minutes and not being able to order food because the waiter only came back once to ask if we needed another drink. I went again on Friday, St. Patrick's Day, knowing it would be busy. I asked if there was any available seating for 3 and was told a line was formed across the street. The people I was meeting up hadn't arrived so I joined the line. Every 15minutes the manager kept coming to ask everyone how many people were in the party to see who can be seated. This was the same gentleman who told me about the line. I waited for an hour and I made it to the front of the line. One of my friends greeted the bouncer and checked to see how long the wait would be we were told 10minutes. After 20min he asked again because more then 6 people left so a table was available. We were told we could go in. The same manager who saw me outside waiting and told me about the line saw me enter and there was no issue. After sitting down a different manager (guy with braids) stated we needed to leave and tried to kick us out. He's ex's act words were " who told you you can sit here. You need to get out. Get out." My friend went to talk to the manager and the bouncer calmly to find out the issue. The manager claimed we paid the bouncer. I no way did we pay to get in. As that was going on a waiter came to the table and told me and my other friend we had to leave because someone claims I cut them in the line. Again I was at the front of the line, no one was in front of me and I spent an hour and 20minutes waiting. After resolving the issue with management they said we could stay. No apology from management for a problem they caused and nothing about the guys who made a scene. The waiter came back and gave us water as an apology and told us about a 60minute table time. We ordered our drinks and food quickly because we didn't want another problem. My friend ordered hot wings(all flats) and they were not great. We continued on and determined maybe we will try another time only because the music was good and drinks weren't bad. The waiter was polite and the only saving grace. We got the bill it came out to $123. I paid with a debt card and signed the receipt. We gave a tip in cash. The next day I saw a charge for more then the $123. I checked both receipts again the first one with $123 and the second one with $128. I saw a fee was added but no specifications on the second one. I thought it was a card fee but it wasn't. My receipt said card fee would be applied for a credit card and it would be three and change not $5. I am livid. Not only did we have a hard time to start but then you add a fee after you take the card. To charge an additional fee after the agreed upon amount is illegal.  I will not be going back. My friends will not be going back. The cost of a $7 drink and a $3 shot is not worth it. There are other places with better service.
Happy Birthday to me. Here's your check without asking for it and get out. "There's a line outside" Never coming back. Rude and horrible customer service.

-Cheap drinks and food.  
-Allows you to have a good time with your friends by getting you lit.  
-There's usually a long line so get there early and make sure your party is there.  
-The food is actually really good even though people mainly come here to drink.
-Vibes of the place are great.
-Time limit for when it's crowded and they will kick you out if you're not ordering anything.

212 is always a good time, $3 shots and $5 cocktails... can't complain about the major hangover and headache it gives you when they're that cheap.

The food is also unexpectedly really good, my friends and I always get the french fries, calamari and popcorn shrimp.

The line gets really long here in the summer, but worth it for the affordable drinks, a great place to pregame. But maybe not a great place if you do not want to be around a bunch of college and underaged kids.

If you're looking for a nice and fancy place to take your date on a Friday night, you're at the wrong place. This place is where you come with your group of friends on a random Wednesday night to get wasted for someone's birthday. This place has cheap (like $4 cheap) drinks and shots. It's dark, it's loud and it's kind of sticky (from all the spilled drinks).

Regardless of all those things, I LOVE coming here. It's a great place to be loud with your friends. If you want to try an assortment of drinks for cheap, you can choose from a lengthy list. They do not make you any custom drinks, so don't even bother asking. Their drinks are strong and if the mixed drinks don't mess you up, just take a $3 shot.

I generally stick with the mojito or the Long Island iced tea but I have tried many of the other ones. They're all pretty good. My guy friends tend to like the Adios M (previously known as Adios Motherf*cker). Most likely because of the name and the bright blue coloring of it. Don't expect a drink with lots of layers of flavoring, they are only $6.

For the food, I don't suggest getting anything that is not fried. I tried one of their dinner combos a few years ago and I was super disappointed. I can barely remember it because it lacked so much in flavor that I tried to throw the memory out.

My favorites are the cajun fries and the mushroom quesadilla. Usually we order a basket of the fries and keep ordering as we go on into the night. They are thin and coated in the cajun powder. So good! The mushroom quesadilla is a good option for your vegetarian friends. You can share the slices or eat the whole thing if you want. The fried calamari is okay, not my favorite but I'll eat it if it's in front of me.

Overall, a great place to come with friends if you want to get drunk. I come here probably like once a month or so with friends to catch up and drink. It's only a few blocks away from the 8th Street train station so it's really easy to get to.

Doesn't live up to the hype. Bouncer was extremely rude and asked for a bribe, while letting in others without even showing ID. Pretty pathetic. Bouncer is a rude ass piece of shit and let's in underage people with bribes.

This used to be one of my favorite places, until my recent horrible experience. I don't know if the management of this placed changed, but the waiting system is horrible. The lines are super long now and they do not care about the order they came in. We were 3 people and waited over and hour. They just kept calling groups of 2 and 4 and people who came waaaaay after us (in groups of 4) sat before us. HOW CAN YOU NOT FIT 3 PEOPLE IN A TABLE FOR 4. Do they have triangular tables that ONLY fit 3 people?

That was soooo unfair and everyone (host, bouncers) had a nasty attitude. At the end they called for a group of 6 and there was another group of 3 behind us of people we didn't know and we decided to go for it and hopefully get separate checks, nope, bouncer had to be nasty and say NO SEPARATE CHECKS (how hard is it to split a table into two or open the tabs and close them as it goes) at that point they were just being nasty. We left because even if we got in, I don't think I was going to enjoy my drinks.

Never again in my life. This place is just going downhill and is overrated now.

I wish I entered to be able to see their triangular tables for 3 people only.

Bad customer service, was giving disgusting looks while ordering food. Gave us the bill automatically when we only sat for an hour and had just ordered a round of drinks. Felt like they were trying to kick us out. Food is not that good but cheap drinks makes up for it. Wouldn't go back again.

I've been hearing about this place before I even hit 21, so I knew I wanted to check it out first thing when I turned of age.

To be honest, it was a disappointment.

There was a line for the place already at around 6PM on a Friday night. Right away, I noticed how dark and loud the place was, so take note of that if that's not your thing. The waiter serving us was really fast and accommodating. We actually had dinner here, as I heard the food was good! Well, that was a lie. We had the Calamari, Early Bird Special ($15 meal), and Kimchi Fried Rice.

Everything was pretty mediocre but that Kimchi Fried Rice was too much. It was dry, burnt, and inedible at some parts.

Now for the drinks. The drinks are indeed cheap, but that comes with the cheap quality! The drinks were all too strong, so go here if you're trying to get crazy drunk.

I want to actually enjoy my drinks, in a setting where I can actually hear the person in front of me, so this was definitely not the place for me.
I used to come here last year but it's gone downhill. The bouncer asked us for a bribe to get in on a Tuesday night which is pretty pathetic.
I got the worst food poisoning of my life from the chicken curry here. The wait staff was also extremely rude.

It's not bad. Not the best 99 cent pizza I've ever had, but brace yourself, yes, in 2022 it is still 99 cent pizza. So that deserves accolades alone. I ended up getting a plain cheese and a white slice after a drunken night out a few months ago. Not too much extra for a different pie slice. It's right in the prime area of east 14th street. Been around forever. Not too greasy. Not too puny for a cheap slice. All around one of the better ones.

Thin crust with a nice sauce and just enough cheese that makes this .99 cent joint pretty decent.

Just another grab and go spot for when you're craving a slice, or need a quick cheap meal.

Specialty slices are just $2. Mozzarella sticks and chicken wings among other snacks offered.

Cold drinks in the fridge and an ATM on site if you need some cash.

I can't believe I am giving 4 stars for a 99 cents pizza joint but this 14th st off 3rd Ave ain't bad and from the no crumbs left my work staff will agree . A slice is 99 cents,  topping slice 2 bucks , wings , sandwiches,  pasta dishes. Cookies,  etc, and the poor man's prices can't be  beat. 2 large pies , 14 wings , 2 pasta dishes and 12 cookies cost me less then 40 bucks and I will admit it was really good .I only had 2 slices and a few cookies so I can't cosign for the wings and pasta but my slacker staff sucked it all down and nothing was left and every one seemed happy.  I take back whatever negative statements I have made in the past about 99 cents pizza shops and if spending 40 bucks for lunch makes my workers happy and do actual work then count me in.
This place may have changed hands. It's now $1 a slice, $3 with mushrooms.This is not gourmet pizza, but it was hot and saucy considering the price. Service was courteous.

Pizza by the slice that isn't quite as bad as it looks, though it is not great either.  The sauce has some maturity to it, and I enjoyed it.  The crust was like cardboard, and the cheese was salty but otherwise flavorless.  The pepperoni was not memorable either.  Slices are advertised as $1.50 each, but in reality that only applies to a plain slice of pizza.  If you want a slice with a topping, and all of the ones I saw had toppings, then you pay the extra $1.  Service was quick and friendly.  

2.5 stars
A quick slice but definitely one of the smallest pieces I've gotten from a place like this. Furthermore, I feel like I got gypped out of cheese!

If you're in a hurry and don't mind trading quality over price, then 14th Street Pizza Place is the place for a quick $1.50 cheese pizza slice.

The crust was so-so not crunchy after it was reheated. At $1.50 its much cheaper than Frank's on 1st Ave but not as good so there's a trade-off you have to consider.

As Elliot had already mentioned, the store was very small with only 3 bar stools. There was only 2 selections: cheese and pepperoni. They had a deal for 2 slices & 1 soda/water for $3.75

If I'd never stopped inside and bought some pizza, I never would've thought this place was real.  
The 14th Street Pizza Place's sad little store front stares onto the street and nary a passer-by seems to notice.  I went in there one day last week, in the mood to "roll the dice" and came up with snake-eyes.  My slice of cheese was approximately 30% smaller than my slice of pepperoni; but I suppose that's okay, considering my slice of pepperoni also cost $1.75 more than my slice of cheese.  So if you're keeping score at home, pepperoni added to a slice of cheese pizza costs more than said cheese pizza by itself.  
It's not the worst pizza I've ever had...visit Hartford, CT or Amherst, MA...but by New York standards, it's pretty bad.  

I'd also like to add, that while standing waiting for my pizza I was fully expecting Pauly Shore to jump out from behind the pizza oven and say, "Elliott...you got, got!"

This place is one of those late night after too much beer, pizza places.  It's fine for what it is, but it's no gourmet slice.  It's definitely edible, but nothing to write home about.  Perhaps I can celebrate the cheap $1.50 price tag?  Then again, across the street at Crocodile lounge you can get much better pizza free with your beer.   At 3am I might recommend going there instead, and giving the beer away - assuming you've had too many already!

Maybe once in a while.

The Pizza Place is not something you would expect coming out of NYC, especially if you live in the city. This isn't the pizza you'd expect be the famous New York slice, but none the less, it is what it is. With that being said, the pizza here is nothing but cheap pizza. But at 1.50 a slice, can you really complain?

The pizza is very reminiscent of elementary school pizza. The dough was slightly chewy and soft, as if the sauce got soaked. The sauce was subpar, almost like it was canned. The cheese was salty, fairly rough, and felt like it was cheese on cold pizza. The only real redeeming feature is the price of the slice, for that, you get what you pay for.

As a gluten-free food fool, I'm a huge fan of arepas.  I've been meaning to try this cart ever since I saw it out of the corner of my eye, stumbling down the street packed to the gills with Shake Shack.  
Today it was only hot enough to boil lobsters, so I was able to make the walk over here without too much suffering.  It would be nice if Astor Place had a few shade trees.  The Astors were super rich, right?  A few well-placed trees wouldn't break the bank.  But I digress..
I ordered one chicken arepa and one beef arepa.  They aren't by name here.  The chicken was a classic Reina, cubed chicken breast tossed in an avocado-mayo slurry.  I've never tried a reina before because I'm afraid it's going to be green chicken salad, all mayo and very little avocado.  The beef kind is the Pelua, the spiced simmered shredded beef and some grated cheese on it.  I love a Pelua because it tastes like the beef they used in burritos and enchiladas of my youth, and in tacos before carne asada took over as the standard beef everyone expects.  At $6 for the Reina and $7 for the Pelua, the arepas aren't much less than you'd pay in a Arepa Cafe.  Arepas are a little small for the price, I can imagine needing two of them to get full. Luckily, I'm a small woman and can get by on one if needed.  Which is good, because the fellow either didn't hear me ask for the chicken one, or forgot about it.  I got $13 cash back on a $20.  I wasn't sure if I was being stunad and you actually got 2 arepas for the price shown, or if he miscounted my change, or if I'd only received one of the two.  But sure enough, I only got one.  Which is okay, I paid the correct price of $7 for the one I got, and I really don't need two sandwiches at lunch, I'm just greedy.  So the Reina remains untasted for yet another day, and this cart's Pelua I can officially rate as 5 stars.  It was poetry in my mouth, the cheese, sauces, and spiced beef against the dense arepa giving me the nostalgia for a Southwestern enchilada combined with that different South American taste that reminds me, this isn't Mexican food and this isn't the Southwest.  Unlike a regular hamburger-sized sandwich, the dense nature of an arepa makes this a filling meal, as it roughly equates to two tamales worth of cornmeal, meat, and sauce.  I will definitely be back.

I got the empanadas. It's 4 for $5!!!!

for less than $1.50 each, these were great!  Empanadas were crispy on the outside, moist and hot on the inside.  FYI, these are of the fried variety, not baked.

They sold 3 different kinds: shreded chicken, ground beef and cheese.  Flavor wise, it's not out of this world, but for near the $1 mark, its great. Especially as a cheapo snack. I've had empanads that $5/ea around here that were significantly worse.  I know where I want to go if I want  some decent cheap empanadas!

Service also great. Cart dudes were pleasant to deal with. They also gave me a bunch of napkins and sauce.

THIS IS NOT MEXICAN CUISINE...but that does not mean it's bad. Understand that this is south-of-the-border inspired fast food and not 'mexican food' look elsewhere for that. Just because the word taco is in the name doesn't mean it's mexican, for example "Taco Bell"...and if you think that's mexican, god help you; go read a book.

FIRST, some history:  If you haven't lived in one of the 5 boros for at least a decade, you probably haven't experienced what I believe to be the uniquely New York fast food known colloquially as (and I'm sure this isn't PC nowadays but don't kill the messenger) "Chino Latino" as these take out spots are owned and operated in large part by Asians and they served, as mentioned, food INSPIRED by, ironically, Americanized mexican food; tex-mex.

AKA The "Fresh Tortilla"; its the generic name adorning the signage of nearly every establishment that served these latin-esque dishes with the solid efficiency model of the other ethnically-non-authentic 'Chinese-Joint-With-Food-Pictures-As-Wall-Decor'. To wit; NOOOOBODY has ever written a review saying "THIS IS NOT CHINESE CUISINE", but I digress...

In any case, these fast food joints peppered the 5 boros from the 90's through the late 20-teen's. Nowadays there's a handful, in part because of wanna-be food critic wannabe's that patronize these places expecting carne asada, tripas and horchata. That's like going to McD's and expecting a Pat LaFrieda patty on toasted brioche with cornichons and garlic aioli. No sir, I don't care how long you've lived in So Cal, this is an entirely different animal that what you're used to. Stop comparing CA Valencias to NY Snapdragons.

Also, regarding the "iridescent green meat" in a previous review, there's this amazing thing called the World Wide Web that would inform one of that particular phenomenon. What, they don't have internet in Indiana? Or are Indianaesians too (insert appropriate adjective) to figure out search? since links can't be posted, just type "the Atlantic" and "beef rainbows" into any browser. Knowledge is power, sister...really.

With these nuggets of information digested and the other bone picked, let's move on to an actual review of this satisfying, affordable, but now hard to find cuisine.  

In not so many words:
It is everything you would expect from a chinese fast food joint making pseudo tex-mex.It's:
-served with the quickness (grubhub & seamless take note)
-tastier & healthier than most other franchise fast food
-not particularly sexy but not UN-desirable
-inexplicably addictive (like, you could eat this every lazy Friday night and not feel crappy about it)

AND it's surprisingly affordable. At least it used to be. I feel like the prices have AT LEAST doubled since the pandemic (a hard shell chili taco used to be a buck fitty, now it's like $5, steak tostada salad was around $12 now it's $&!%-you bruh)

Just like every chinese-food-pictures-on-the-wall joint, they all have the same menu and they're all consistently balanced between 'this is yummy' and 'this is yucky' depending on how you're bent. The chili taco is nothing to write home about but it gets the job done, coming and going.

My order consisted of a steak tostada salad. It's your basic lettuce, tomatoes, onions, jalapenos, shredded cheddar salad topped with steak fajita, grilled onions and green pepper, all cradled in a deep fried flour tortilla the approximate shape of an inverted lampshade.
Was it reasonably healthy? Check, the ingredients were fresh and crispy. Steak, lean.

Was it tasty and filling? Check, the proteins were not over seasoned and thoroughly grilled (maybe a bit overdone for my taste but, expectations, right?)

Was it pretty standard in comparison to other tostada salads?

This is where 211 keeps it real...NOT ONLY were the aforementioned ingredients present and fresh, but instead of diced tomatoes, you get a few cherry tomatoes. Additionally, the dish is kicked up a notch with red onion, two slices of cucumber and...are you sitting down?... A LIME WEDGE!! Holy smokes, 211 up in that food game bucking the status quo. All in all, worth the $12 +$5 dollar price of admission.
A notable absence was the weird tomatillo-esque sauce that's usually included with anything one orders from this type of establishment, but the lime wedge makes up for it.
A thankful absence was the runny sour cream that's usually included with everything one orders from this type of establishment...seriously you're gonna trust the white guy that started Taco Bell for pumping that crap into every menu item and your arteries, but not the Asian guy for doing their version of fajitas?

All in all a decent meal, delivered quickly but at a premium in price compared to picking up at the restaurant. Two thumbs, straight up...

I'll leave the naysayers with this: Where else can you find a pound of edible protein and three day's worth of accoutrements for under $25? looking at my next lazy weekend, yo... IMOUUUUT

Im from the west coast, I know mexican food to my core. I wont even go into detail because if you dine here youll learn why its bad. Just dont go. I walked by the day before I went and saw all the workers outside laying around, one was sleeping in the chair!!! No wonder though, their only business is likely from tourists who are desperate for some quick food and my bad review isnt gonna do nothin because every review is bad and if it does have a good amount of stars, the person leaving the review is also mentioning more bad, for example "if you go here ONLY order this or this or that" meaning theres few good options on the list, i mean how do you screw up nachos? Right? No one can screw up nachos so of course that has a good review, I was just being lazy and wanted something on my same block so I went here and all I have to say is, never trust Mexican* food from a completely Asian* staff.

I have to say I was satisfied getting 2 bean, 1 chicken and 1 shrimp taco here for under $11. It's a very pricey neighborhood so I came here for something budget friendly and I was full. There is a large selection of stuff and a few seats as well.

So I went in for an order, while waiting I samples one of those free mints, I thought it was good, so I grabbed about 4 more for later. I assumed because it's free it wouldn't be a problem...WRONG. The front woman grabbed me by my hand and said I couldn't have more. I mean no big deal, right. WRONG AGAIN
SHE AND THE Whole staff ARE RACIST AF!
She told me that I couldn't have my food and to leave the restaurant...... who does that anymore?! Apparently they do! I never felt so horrible about being myself...
Please don't go, and if you do take a bunch of mints on my behalf

I had 2 chicken tacos (hard shell), a cheese quesadilla and a Coke for $12.00.  The food is good but no sour cream to go along with your food. The sour cream will cost you extra.
The wait time was long to get my food. They must have had orders before me. Otherwise, it's a good place to eat.

I told the manager the steak was shining green of it she  told me it was supposed to be like that go on google and check it  out really ? Gave me a hard time about changing my order she said "I can't change it  if you eat everything " why in the world would I call you to complain about  the food eat it all up and then ask to exchange it !! When she finally agreed to change it for me she said next time don't order steak and hung up very rude and doesn't know how to satisfy customers!!

This is one of those tex-mex places that is run by Chinese immigrants. These places are all over the place now - because the Chinese takeout market was so saturated, they decided to move into a different cuisine.
This place has been here a few years. It is pretty much like all the other Chinese-run tex-mex places.  The inside looks like a Chinese takeout place. The prices are very cheap (a meal is $5 or $6). And of course, the food doesn't have an authentic Mexican taste, but it's cheap and fills you up.

What sets this place apart is that the people who work there are always very friendly. One time I was a couple doors down and requested a delivery. When she came, because I was so close, she refused to accept a tip. If you go there and order, the food always come out very fast. The meat is always good too. Sometimes, the meat from these tex-mex places is old and dry, but not here.
I came here yesterday close to dinner time after a day of running around and volunteering. I ordered 2 pinto bean tacos. These tacos were tasty. Creamy beans, hard shell. Salsa was amazing.

The food was repulsive. I rarely leave reviews, but I felt compelled to write this. I rarely ever throw out food, but I threw this away after eating half of it and I regret that I ate any of it.

This is not Mexican food. My burrito and quesadilla came on pita bread stuffed with frozen meat and frozen vegetables. Absolutely foul.

I don't know how the owners can take any pride in serving food like this. Tasted like awful Chinese food stuffed in pita bread with a diaper. No thanks.

I ordered food with my visa card which totaled about $8, I told them to just charge me $10. Food was delivered and delivered guy was rudely demanding a tip before I can sign the credit card receipt.  I grew angry and felt disrespected and declined the order. I called Tex Mex and let the restaurant know what occurred. I was promised a refund on my Visa within 2-3 business days and never was refunded. So i called back again the next week and they said that it'll take 10days and still nothing. I called again today and it been 3 1/2 weeks and I was hung up on and now when i call back i get some Verizon message. All I have to say right now is don't order from this place at al the customer service is the worst. I finally tasted the food from a coworker and the food is horrible, their not even Mexican and neither is the food. They are the worst!!!!!!!!  I googled the place and it looks like a whole in the wall, had I known this I wouldn't have done business with them in the first place. After writing this review I will be calling the better business bureau to report them as well.
Lousy food. Stay away from this place. The rice was hard and the chicken too salty. The salsa was simply tomato sauce. I will never order from them again.
Dear god this place sucks. Avoid at all costs. I can't believe a restaurant this bad is able to stay open in New York City of all places

Disgusting.. This place should really be closed down. I'll go into further detail why..

1. My wife and I come into the hole in the wall on 14th bwtn 2nd and 1st.( Don't go there just figure I'd tell you since it's not on the menu ) the lady yells at us off back PICK UP!! I should have turned away then but hey.. Munchies calls.

2. We decided to get the Mexican Rice with Steak(my wife's order) and I got the Chicken and Steak Quesadilla w French Fries. The lady in front started to throw my sauce on the tray so harsh and rude... I should have walked away. They gave us some skimpy ass Quesdilla with barely anything on it. The rice was so bland and dry. The only thing that was edible was the fries!!!!

The nerve of the slop to come out to an undeserved $15.80

I hope they don't get business,  the guy didn't even want my wife and I to sit at the table. Save your money and time.

211 has the BEST NACHOS THIS SIDE OF MEXICO!

Let me tell you, yes you, that I've had nachos all over  this city and they are terrible & overpriced. They have become a $15-$20 staple on restaurants menus and they are dog-mess! Cheap and just a money maker. No pride. If i wrote a review for every time I've had crappy nachos in this city I'd have carpal tunnel...

i love the chips at 211! the black beans are PERFECTO! the cheese is good too!

i love the Tex-Mex chili soft tacos. Tex-Mex chilli isn't for everyone but everything I've ever ordered I've been happy with.. FYI i don't eat hard shell tacos so i have no opinion on theirs.

super fast delivery has become somewhat of a lost art here in Manhattan these past several years... but these guys are great. The price is right and they are super consistent.

BUY ONLY SOFT SHELL TACOS AND THE NACHOS HERE. PERIOD.

You just have to know what to get here.. This is one of my favorite places because I'm a vegetarian and I don't eat sketchy meats (I don't have to) but otherwise this place is great. SUUUUPER cheap (like incredibly, its basically chinese takeout with mexican food instead).

Get yourself the Nachos with Guacamole and two soft shell black bean tacos. For like $8. I swear you won't regret it. I order from them all the time.. Its THE spot if you want crappy awesome mexican food.

Nothing special here. This place is an equivalent to Yummy Taco. The last time i had tacos they were Authentic mexican tacos, for some reason i expected something similar. I ordered chilli tacos here (work lunch break)and they were ok. I usuallly don't have time to read reviews before I decide what to eat for lunch. Wish i did. Probably won't be returning here. If you are in the mood for good tacos, this is not the place.

Disgusting ! Ordered lunch here today from seamless and their was a hair in my lunch ! I called the restaurant and they couldn't do anything but offer to send me a new order ...gross...why would u want a new order from such a gross place like this ? Never again ! They were unapologetic and downright unprofessional ...reporting them to the health department !

Love this place. My favorite is the steak platter. It comes with so much food plus a free drink. Under $10 bucks you can't beat that in the city. You also get fajitas on the side. The delivery is the fastest by far. You won't be disappointed!

It's actually really good and super cheap. Tacos are between $1-2 , Quesadillas are between $2-3. You really can't go wrong, plus they actually  give you more than a generous amount of fillings/toppings.

They are always busy (so it might take awhile to get your food 10-15 min avg, 20 or more for delivery), their ingredients taste fresh and for not being an authentic mexican place, they pull it off nicely.

Delivery is free ($6 minimum order).
I love this place. its definitely faux mexican fast food but it doesnt matter! Don't order here expecting a super great meal but its good for a quick bite!!!!!

After a hard day at work, I didn't really feel like cooking and was looking for a quick food pick up.  So in I walked ordered a couple of hard shell beef tacos and chicken fajitas.  Horrible mistake, the beef was disgusting, greasy, & tasted like it came out of a can.  The chicken in the fajitas were not fresh, dried overcooked chicken chucks that were hard to chew.  Disgusting, disgusting!!!  First & last time they'll see me in there again.

I will echo previous reviews in saying this is the worst take out I've ever had in NYC in my 20+ years of living here. I ordered the veggie plate and the guac tasted like it was out of a plastic bag and the veggies had no flavor whatsoever, the rice was like warm and the beans seemed like they had been reheated from a can. I also got heart burn for the first time on my life after eating this. There are a plethora of vetter Chinese delivery in Manhattan so I would HIGHLY recommend not wasting money here...

Chinese prepared 'Mexican' food-- Cheapest in the neighborhood. I love this place. Its unpretentious and filling.

Will they win any foodie awards? Probably not.

Will you get a bell full of fresh food on 6 bucks? Yes!
Yeah.... this is.... bad. Bad unfriendly service, bad setting (unclear and dim). Food is also pretty bad. Why does NYC just not have good Mexican food?

Horrible Food!! No taste ,no spice, cold Steak and Shrimp Tacos. Food was brought cold.  Steak was tough barely cut ,the soft taco shell was rubbery like a stale wrap. The tomatoes were not ripe.  I paid 40.00 for straight garbage.

Honestly, this is probably the worst take out I've ordered in my 5+ years living in NYC.  I ordered both shrimp and spinach "enchiladas". It was actually just boiled shrimp and boiled spinach thrown in a tortilla and slathered with something that resembles cheese. The rice that came with it was dry. Just pathetic. Don't bother ordering from the place.

With so many hole in the wall Mexican places in the East Village, not sure why you'd come here.

There is no reason why Chinese people can't make good Mexican food, but you are unlikely to sample great-grandmother's secret mole recipe either.

The "burrito" came folded like a soft taco - I think they used American Cheese as well.

Ordered enchiladas, got a gyro bread with cheese melted on it. No enchilada sauce, not even a Mexican tortilla. This is not a Mexican restaurant, it's fake Mexican food. If you are looking for Mexican food, stay away.

Good for a quick tex mex bite! Don't go here for tacos, burritos, quesadillas etc.  There are other places to get those foods.  Here u go for the tostada salads! I mean its either steak, chicken, shrimp, veggie etc. topped lettuce, tomato, cheese, jalapenos, onions and green pepper salad in a fried shell! Has Italian or French dressings on the side and all for under 7 bucks.  It's very filling and definitely worth a stop if on 14 St. and want a filling meal for cheap.  The ladies working here are nice, the place is basically no frills and its has a few tables but the majority of the business is takeout.  Try any of the tostada salads and you won't be disappointed!

They used to be good. But lately they have been heavy handed with the salt. The last salty fiasco was the Mex Pizza. I ordered a variety of things to go (which took a ridiculously long time and one of the delivery guys bumped his bike tires against my leg barely saying sorry), but the Mex Pizza was inedible. Would you like some food with your salt? Nachos are good as their burritos too. Their quesadillas are good but tend to be a bit dry, i guess they've never heard of butter. Not the greatest, but not the worst either.

LOVE IT! I can't help but laugh at the Chinese/Mexican references because they're ALL true.

Looks like a Chinese restaurant inside (Counter to order from, menu pasted to the counter, little stools to sit at and a few drink coolers.. and of course the typical "what to do if someone is choking" sign)... but they serve Mexican and it's great.

I mean it's not totally authentic Mexican dishes but what I LOVE is that a taco is only like $1.50 and it's LOADED. They don't skimp you. I order out and get it delivered, so the first time I ordered 2 tacos (tex chili = ground beef), a side of Mexican rice and some chips/salsa. That meal fed me for 2.5 lunches, no joke. Tortillas are of a decent, thicker quality too and don't tear, awesome.

If you get a side of chips and salsa they also give you a hefty bag of them, to the point where if you're eating a meal you won't finish them.

Only complaint is the "Mexican rice" is some GOOD rice, don't get me wrong, but it was like it was white, they fried it a little and threw in some peppers and onions. Now, this could be because they got my order wrong OR I just need to try their other rice. I was picturing yellow, Spanish rice to come out.

I will always order here when I want quick Mexican. Only $6minimum to deliver, too :)

I gave this a 2 because the food was seemingly edible as no negative side effects followed consumption besides sadness. I got a steak soft taco, chicken soft taco, and ground beef hard taco.

The soft tacos had no flavor and the steak was actually chewy. The hard taco broke apart in my hands, leading me to the conclusion that it was probably stale. The ground beef tasted like someone had ladled Ragu meat sauce directly into the shell.

I lamented the rest of my evening over the waste of money and space in my stomach it had cost me. Mcdonalds would have been cheaper and much tastier.

Stopped by after work one day and got two #1s (Al Carbon Grilled Steak Flour Tortillas) and one T8 (Black bean soft taco). Total was about $7 and was very tasty and very filling. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu. Small place, not much room there to eat but clean and no real downsides. The price was right!

Only in New York could one of my favorite Mexican hole-in-the-wall haunts be completely run by Asians. At any rate, I looooove 211!

I first stumbled upon this place the day I moved into my apartment across the street and, figuring it wouldn't be a total loss, decided to give it a try.

I was super hungry after a day of moving, so I ordered a cheese quesadilla and a guacamole taco.

Look, I'm not going to try to tell you that this is authentic Mexican cuisine, because you and I both know that isn't the case. But, man, is this place delicious! They're very generous with the cheese, and everything is fresh and made-to-order.

If you ever find yourself wandering around Union Square and you start craving tacos, give this place a try. I assure you that for the price, you won't find better!

Couldn't agree with Tyler more... this looks like a Chinese food place that one day ordered flour tortillas instead of egg roll wrappers and said, "hey, let's just make a taco place instead."

That being said, the food isn't bad and the service is good. It's certainly not authentic Mexican food, but for what it is, I dig it. Just consider yourself warned that you're not walking into El Cantinero or Mole.

Picture a taco food truck (like the one on Ave A and 3rd Street) with a store front and a few more options.

so bad. so bad. horrendous.
Ordered the hard shell black bean taco.
- gave her 5.40, expecting 3 in change, and she didn't give it to me.
- got my order wrong and gave me a soft shell taco
- taco barely had any seasoning and the beans were straight from the can, bland af
- im not picky with food but i really couldn't finish it. it was so bad
They have fast delivery and wonderful food. The service was superb. My favorite weekly treat.
Great tortillas and grilled chicken! Pretty good prices too.

This place looks like a dingy hole in the wall... but maybe that's why their Mexican food is awesome and CHEAP!  I've had this place a few times now and every time I'm impressed by the quality, quick service, amount of food, and the prices!  I'm pretty hard to impress with Mexican food (mostly because I love it so), but this place definitely foots the bill when I'm craving some good chicken tacos or my favorite of theirs, their Mexican pizza.  Actually, I'm craving one now!
My absolute favorite place for cheap, fast, no frills Mexican delivery. I crave it daily and am fairly certain that my patronage is paying the wages of at least one employee there....
3 stars. Ordered the chicken & steak burrito. It was better than expected with a good amount of flavor for being a hole in the wall place. Asians own it to and they cook Tex Mex. Thumbs up.

THESE PEOPLE ARE THIEVES, Please don't order from them ever. I ordered from them off seamless, and they never delivered my order. A rude, terrible customer service woman at the restaurant refused to simply redeliver the next night, told me to stop calling and hung up on me. I called back, she told me to call seamless. He said he would reimburse me after calling them, and then they had the nerve to HANG UP ON HIM! I can't get reimbursed and I feel violated. I actually filed a police report, because it was such an offensive dining experience. Hope these criminals loose their restaurant soon. I'll keep you updated on the police report.

if i could give them less than one star i would. i ordered a quesadilla with special instructions through seamless and they completely disregarded my requests. i called to ask what happened with my order and she said "we do not have steak, and it is too much to call the customers if we cannot fulfill their request" first of all, they do have steak. second, it should be courtesy to call if they cannot give the customer what they asked for, because i got a completely inedible quesadilla for delivery and i could not get a new one because they closed by the time i got my order. it came half an hour later than they said i would get it, and it was cold. absolutely horrible restaurant, never order from here.she was extremely rude to my on the phone, too. i wish there was something i could do to get my money back.

Like the other reviewers have mentioned, typical Mexican food that's fast on delivery, hot when it arrives, and not overly priced.  However, these positives do not necessarily outweigh some of the negatives.

Taste: 4 stars
Delivery speed: 5 stars
Greasiness: 3 stars

The fact that they forgot my side orders when they delivered the food... 1 star!  I would recommend that you check your delivery order when it arrives. Not great, but not terrible in my humble opinion.

I WOULD GIVE THIS PLACE ZERO IF I COULD.

Fast delivery/cheap food...now we know why: the best part? The sour cream and the chips...they didn't make either.
Went here for 2 quesadillas, and they were small, the cheese tasted weird, and the salsa was the only saving grace. Not authentic and not great for "cheap" prices

mmmm delish. i ordered the steak chimichangas entree and it totally hit the spot. they do good things with steak. it's well-textured and it melts in your mouth.

the only downside was that the delivery took ~40 min on a sunday night and the food came a bit cold. i have to say though that the delivery has been much quicker in the past, so i'd definitely take a bet on 'em again. the food is suuuuperrr (but i would just stay away from the nachos).

the place fills a niche. i'm thinking students, twenty-somethings staying up late studying, and jonesing for a good snack; if that sounds like you, this place will definitely meet your needs.

bottom line, my stomach is happy.
My first experience eating Mexican food made by Chinese. I got the chicken enchiladas. It was mediocre at best. Nothing special but fast and cheap.

Overall well worth the price.  I've ordered delivery from this place three times and have enjoyed everything I've gotten.  This includes a steak burrito, steak quesedilla, and a steak mexican pizza.  This food really fills you up and I love it despite it being quite unhealthy.  Definitely order from here, it's free FAST delivery and best of all it's cheap but delicious.

I actually really liked this place! I got two beef tacos and it was good portioned. My boyfriend had the same thing and we ordered the nachos. All very good. He, however didn't like it. He doesn't like ground beef on tacos while I do. Only complaint is that the food is greasy and you feel sorta guilty after you eat there, but you do feel full.
I try so many food carts and the city...I just order lamb over rice and it was good...

The food is horrible! We ordered spicy tuna, spicy salmon, eel cucumber, tuna avocado, shrimp avocado, eel avocado and a black dragon roll. And we ordered an order of vegetable tempura. The eel (which is just packaged) was chewy and fishy. I took one bite and I could not stomach another one. The fish did not taste fresh either. The tempura batter was disgustingly soggy and thick and oily.

We ordered all this food form grubhub and the delivery experience was also atrocious. The delivery man refused to bring it upstairs and lied that the entrance door was broken (we checked and it was not). When we picked up the food he was just sitting on his bike whilst smoking a cigarette...

Never again

this restaurant is not worth the hassle
i ordered sushi for delivery,they offered a $10 deduction for first order
they forgot to deduct it
for $10 they lost a good customer so rude
the worst customer service 4 calls and refused to help us
grub hub is the best
5 minutes later received my discount
bad service cost them a good client

What a disappointment. I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki Bento and it was awful. The chicken was dry and placed on top of a bed of white rice with almost no teriyaki sauce and the Sushi was drenched in a sea of soy sauce which made it so hard to eat. My other guest weren't happy with their orders either!! Chipolte would have been better!!!

A great no frills smash burger that's the perfect meaty meal to fill you up. I love that they have a vegetarian option for those that are vegetarian or would rather not eat meat and still eat a burger. Their impossible patties are every bit as good as their beef ones! I usually get a double cheeseburger and an order of their impossible fries and man does it hit the spot! Their house sauce is also AMAZING so definitely get it if you like your burgers with sauce. Their impossible fries have a patty (can be made with an impossible patty too!) cheese and is doused with their house sauce and grilled onions. Overall, it's a quick turn around with each burger made to order, great service, but limited seating! It's quite greasy but sometimes it's just what you need!

Check out my foodsta @chiuventure for a closer look and more details of my dining experience here as well as other establishments in NYC and around the world!

7th Street Burger on Third Avenue is a great place if you have a young palate that gravitates toward grease or you are in hangover recovery mode. I ordered the double cheeseburger with everything on it and an order of fries. I fortuitously asked for the house sauce on the side, but more on that below.

Let me first disavow anyone of comparisons to In n Out or even Five Guys. Yes they have their house sauce, which invites the comparison to animal style at In n Out, but that is as far as it goes. The fries here are not freshly cut as one finds at In n Out and Five Guys or at least they do not taste freshly cut by hand. The burger is a very greasy affair, well beyond In n Out and even Five Guys. The burger wrapper is soaked in grease and it soaks through the white paper bag. For those who have the palate for all that grease or if you are in need of such to recover from the previous night's drinking, well this is right up your alley. For the rest of us, it is a challenging affair and the bun, quality as it might be, is not up to the challenge and task of maintaining its structural integrity. This is a burger prone to falling apart and, for those who like that sort of thing, well have at it here at 7th Street Burger.

Now a word on the house sauce is warranted. I asked for it on the side after I ordered the burger. I was going to put it on the burger, but the burger and bun were already too challenged, as I mentioned above. However, the fries definitely benefitted from their house sauce. As best as I could tell, the sauce is mayonnaise or Thousand Island, mustard and some unami or truffle accord. I doubt if there is actual truffle oil, but there is some inescapable savory note in this sauce that works well with the fries. They offer their fully loaded fries from this sauce mixed with burger meat or Impossible meat. If it is not too greasy, that would be well worth exploring if you want to go all out here.

Friendly service, take out only, and three stars...

No wonder everyone is hyping @7thstreetburgernyc up cause it's that good! Toasted potato bun, slight crust from that smashing, grilled onions, melted American cheese, house sauce & pickles. I don't even like cheeseburger cause some beef patty gives out a stronger taste which I don't like but after they smashed them that's probably where it gets rid of that beefy taste!

For the location, it's hard to spot it right away cause I'm not sure why the big sign displays as Mexican food then you can found their small sign below it.

Quick and easy service. Everyone was really nice. I normally like impossible meat so I was excited for this burger. It honestly tasted great but I will say the serving size was a little small. I wasn't exactly full after eating the burger. There were a few tables for seating inside and then a standing tables outside, which is where I ate. I would come here again but maybe just order a little more. Next time I would probably get a second burger or a side like fries because I'm sure they would be tasty too.

Pretty good fast food burger, service was really quick, didn't see any seating indoors at this location so i got it to go. The burger itself was pretty good, the onions, pickles, and house sauce definitely elevate it over your average burger, but it wasn't exceptional to me. At this price point, I would still probably pick Five Guys over this but that isn't to say this isn't good. They had some interesting items that I didn't get to try, such as their banana pudding and loaded fries, which I intend to check out next time. Definitely stop by if you're near one and craving a good burger

I have no idea if this is the 7th Street burger that was all the rave last year. But bc I was in the city and that was ultra super random I had to try something. I look it yo and it's like 5 locations I was like oh boy and busted picked one.
This tiny office yes I said office had a heated eating area outside and a cute little 3 option menu in the window. I made a quick order of the burger with fries and a coke. Fries were cold. Burger was... Not bad at all. I like my burger made the way they make it like the original burger. A smashed patty with the melted cheese and onions. Grilled, not to juicy but not dry either. So if this was it. It was good. They also had $8 banana pudding but $8 no way. Not bad 7th street burger not bad.

7th Street Burger has been on my burger list for a while, and I was excited to finally cross it off the list.

This location is definitely no frills - you order at the counter and grab your drink (water or Mexican coke) from the cooler then head back outside to enjoy your meal at their street dining setup. It wasn't too cold out when I stopped by so I ate my meal outside just fine.

I ordered the single cheeseburger, fries, and Mexican Coke which hit the spot. The burger was warm and flavorful with gooey cheese, and the fries were also tasty - I inhaled every bite! Note all burgers are served with grilled onions, American cheese, pickles, and house sauce.

When I was checking out their website, I saw they serve Baonanas for dessert, which is a company who produces a Filipino style banana pudding. I am not sure if I knew about that connection and didn't recall seeing it on this location's menu when I stopped by so I'm not sure if all locations serve it or just some but if they did have it I'm bummed I missed out because I've been wanting to try that for a while. They're a Jersey City-based company but it looks like they have opened a location in the East Village that I need to check out soon.

Back to 7th Street Burger - the flavor is fantastic, and I can't wait to return to this location or one of their many other locations soon.

I ain't fryin' when I say 7th Street Burger is delicious!

As someone who only eats red meat once in a blue moon these days, I was appreciative to learn they offered vegetarian options with their burger and fries! I ordered a double stacked impossible burger and impossible style fries, and they both were overflowing with flavor.
