One thing I liked about the burger in particular was that it didn't have a weird taste to it, the way some other imitation meat does. It would've been a bit on the small side had I not ordered the double stack, but it was yummy!

When it came to the fries, they actually had a (vegetarian) patty included, so it was basically like a meal in itself. The portion size was humongous! If you like In N Out's animal style fries, just wait until you try these! These are probably my new favorite fries - 5 out of 5 stars.

The ONLY thing I wish is that they offered milkshakes. I did see they opened a banana pudding spot next to their shop on E 7th Street which looks delicious, so I'll definitely be giving that a try next time I go!

7th Street Burger is great!!

Their burgers are delicious!  Especially with cheese!! (Even though it's well-done only; one can forgive them)

Their loaded fries are also quite wonderful.  After we ordered/we're waiting for our food, another girl came in and ordered Just the fries.  She said she lives upstairs and is obsessed with them.  After we went home, we figured out why! They're soooo good!!

Also, they had Mexican Coke, meaning it's filled with cane sugar instead of corn syrup--always a win in my book.

Will definitely come back. Again. And again. And again.

This was my first time at 7th St Burger and I loved it!  

As someone who gets overwhelmed by too many options, I really appreciated how simple the menu was!  

I ordered the double burger, loaded fries and the Mexican coke.  They do all the orders to go as there's no seating inside.  My order came out about 5 minutes later.  

For the food, although the burger looks a bit on the smaller side at first, it's actually very filling. The burger was juicy, fresh and cooked perfectly.

If you ever had the animal style fries from in-n-out, the loaded fries here a bit better than that.  It was a tad heavy on the raw onions for my preference, but the fries were crispy and the special sauce was very good.  

There's also two standing tables and a small bench outside.

The guy taking my order was SO nice and friendly.  Definitely a great experience around overall and would highly recommend!

Delicious burger!! It was so good!

It's like fast food-style and reminded me of Five Guys. You're not getting a gourmet burger, but it's way better than anything you'll get at McDonalds! It was cooked perfectly, so cheesy, and had just the right amount of sauce. Very good flavors. It comes with grilled onions, American cheese, pickles and house sauce. This would be a great hangover burger, too.

For what it is, I loved it! I would definitely get it again.

I will always enjoy 7th St; it's perfectly sized, simple, straightforward and satisfying! Highly recommended to eat it immediately otherwise it may get soggy. Definitely a grab and go kind of place. There are some standing tables outside. If you need a place to eat, you can walk to 25th St btw Lex and 3rd and sit in the Baruch plaza.

I haven't tried the loaded fries yet but perhaps someday! I just feel like my core order of a single cheese burger and fries is SOLID and never disappoints.

Nice spot for quick burgers. Menu is pretty straightforward with burgers, fries, and drinks (for now they only have coke and water). It's a pretty small location with no indoor seating. They do have some standing tables outside.

The burger was a little on the greasy side but the fries were great. Decently sized portions and friendly staff.

TLDR: Classic diner experience with amazing burgers! The menu is truly no frills, but you get everything you'd want out of this burger joint.

Food: 8/10
I came here for a Yelp Elite event and it truly did not disappoint! Me and a friend both got burgers, fries, and a Mexican coke. Everything paired so nicely and the burger was dank!! I really enjoyed the food and it kinda reminded me of in-n-out, which made my west coast heart very happy.

Price & Portion: 7/10
Each burger is $7 but plus $3 if you want to add another patty. Overall it was a lot of food and a great bang for your buck. It's not the cheapest burger out there, but the quality is there, so no complaints from me.

Ambience: 6/10
There's limited seating and mostly outdoors, so I'd say grab an order to-go here or be ready for a quick meal indoors if the weather is lacking.

Service: 8/10
The staff is so friendly and quick! They're great to chat with and we got our food within minutes.

7th st burger is probably one of my favorite places to get a burger and fries on-the-go and I'm glad they opened up a location in this area. Their simple menu lends to New York pace, speedy, but their quality is not compromised!

I got the double, fries, and a Mexican coke. I love how simple everything is - sometimes too many options can be overwhelming but they make it easy to order. The burger itself is juicy and has the right amount of sauce with onions and pickles (you can exclude these if you don't love onions or pickles). As much as I love their burger, I think I possibly love the fries more! Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside - honestly pretty close to the perfect fry.

There's no seating inside but they do have standing tables outside - again, perfect on-the-go option.

Not sure if they're going to keep the awning from the previous place but if you're looking for 7th st burger, don't get confused by the old green awning

Ambiance: 1 out of 5 stars. They didn't even take down the side from their predecessor (Mexican restaurant).

Service 1 out of 5 stars. I asked for the menu and was told I need to go outside to where their bulletin is. Yes I understand it's a simple burger but they could have also said that

Food: 4 out of 5 stars. House sauce wins the crown.

Thanks to Katey and Yelp, I'm now obsessed with 7th Street Burger!
This is their fourth location in a year and that should speak volumes of how good the food is. Theirs is a limited menu - you choose between a cheese burger or a double cheese, French fries and soda. It's a smash burger - thin, juicy and nicely crispy on the edges. It comes with sautéed onions, pickles  and their special sauce and each bite is absolutely drool worthy. As someone who doesn't enjoy a thick burger patty this is perfect. The burgers are slightly greasy but equally satisfying. The fries is crispy on the outside and fluffy inside. The food is made to order and comes out fast. They have a few tables outside but no seating indoors. Next time you have a hankering for a burger definitely try 7th street!

I am not normally one to seek out burgers, but I actually enjoy the ones at 7th street burger. It's simple, convenient and tasty! I would much rather prefer coming here over Shake Shack or ordering a burger at a diner any day. My only tiny con is that it does seem to be on the pricier side, but that is just one of the many perks of living in NYC.

If you are a burger fan, you'll definitely love 7th street burger!

It's so good. And so naughty. Do you feel like you need to take a shower after eating the burger? Sure do. Do you also love every single bite you take and wish it would never end? Sure do.

The staff here was friendly, the wait was quick and the music was 10/10. Surprisingly the food traveled well and was still hot 20 minutes later. The napkins at the bottom of the bag were clutch, otherwise the grease may have ripped through the bag.

As for the food, the fries are perfectly crispy. The double burger is saucy and gooey and greasy and the perfect size. It's just all so delicious. The burgers are small so I'd recommend the double if you're hungry.

Keep in mind you can't stay here to eat, it's a takeout spot only. Which is for the best so you can this mess in the privacy of your own home.

Great spot for a burger! If you're into smash Pattie's like I am, you will definitely like it. I really enjoyed the toppings of the grilled onions and pickles (I added extra pickles iykyk). Overall a solid burger. Fries were crispy.

However, I ordered a double cheese burger, but it's sooooo small. I had to check if there were two patties. I honestly could have eaten two.

Will go back again. Waiter was friendly. Burgers came out quick. Ate outside in their shed. Not a bad experience.

Wowowow. I was full for the rest of the day. I went on a Saturday morning-- no line, and I enjoyed one of their outdoor standing tables. Service was also super friendly.

The fries were delicious, a meal in itself. Full of sauce, onions, and meat. The burger was also fantastic. While you can't add toppings like some other chains, the sauce, pickles, and onions are enough by themselves.

I haven't had a burger in a long time and to be honest, I was skeptical. How good could a burger be anyways?

I ordered two double cheeseburgers and the loaded fries. Ohmygosh- the cheeseburgers were heavenly. The buns were super buttery and sweet. The chopped onions and sauce were savory and complemented the two smash patties well. It was honestly a perfect bite and I couldn't ask for anything more,

The loaded fries were really good too. For the fries not touching the sauce, they were crispy and had a yummy seasoning on them. For the ones with the sauce, the ground beef was delicious and the sauce was oh so savory and good.

Definitely a greasy meal but honestly one of the best meals I've had in a long time!

Small hole in wall kind of burger joint. The menu is simple, single or double burger, fries and coke or water. We got the double burgers($9.5) and they were delicious and juicy! Flavors are good with diced grilled onions and pickles. Fries are fresh from when you order, lightly salted, perfect pairing with the burgers.
Interior is minimal, very small, no indoor seating. There are two tables outside with a bench on the sidewalk but it's mainly a take out/ quick grab and go spot.
Service is great, everything were made to order. The owner was friendly and brought out our food since we were waiting outside.

Perfect place to go when you are craving buttery heavy burgers!

Double Cheeseburger - $9.5 (10/5) This was sooo good. It was so buttery and juicy with the buns so soft and meat perfectly cooked. It was definitely on the greasy side but I loved it more for it. It's definitely not for people who want healthy tasting burgers but that was never me anyways! I savored every bite of it.
Loaded Chopped Beef Fries (Spicy) - $11 (5/5) This was actually huge. Me and my friend each ordered one and we ended up barely finishing one. There was a full patty on topped of the fries and there was generous toppings. I loved that the sauce was also spicy so it balanced out the greasiness. This alone could be a great meal!

The orders came out super fast and everyone was nice too. I will definitely be coming back when I'm craving a heavy burger!

7th Street Burger is on a role with opening so many burger joints.

Location wise, a five minute walk from 28th street 6 train stop. What was originally a Mexican joint became a burger spot and they never took down the sign to the previous store.

Easy menu. Got the double cheeseburger with the loaded fries and the good old Mexican coke. They made the burger fresh so the wait might be long. You order in the front and wait for your food preferably outside since it's tight in the front.

No seatings inside. There is a bench outside with two higher tables. The burger and fries were piping hot and fresh. Loaded up with a lot of meat and onions on the fries. A sip of that coke, and you have yourself a good meal.

Once our order was ready the cashier came out to call your name or you won't miss your order.

So glad they opened up another spot in Turtle Bay! The MacDougal st is always our late night MUST HIT burger. I love their impossible burger and now I can do a quick visit during the day also. You have to have their burgers and fries with their special spicy sauce. You can also grab a baonanas pudding from their freezer. Love that the menu is limited. These guys KNOW what they are doing when it comes to burgers! Welcome to the neighborhood!

7th Street Burger Kips Bay
After attending a Yelp Event at this location of 7th Street Burgers I've decided it's in my top three fast food burgers. They recently opened this location. I heard from my Yelp daughter Ellen that they're building a outdoor hut for seating. I'll definitely be returning and I hope to meet my Yelp friends in warmer weather!
Everything about this burger reminds me of the burgers when I was in high school only better. The fries were the taste and texture I remember from high school too. The fries are just the right amount of salt too. I love their special burger sauce. It's a business that keeps the menu simple and sticks to what they do best. I tried the double cheese burger but now I'm sticking to the single. The double burger was too much for me. The loaded fries are a meal by themselves. I get two or three sides of fries out of my loaded fries order. I still want to try the grilled cheese sandwich.
At the time I visited this location was best for takeout. They keep the burgers coming out fast. No issues with customer service here.
Can't go wrong with a solid greasy burger and fries. Would highly recommend if you're craving a burger. I've been to two locations and they're very consistent.

I dined tonight courtesy of the 7th Street Burger folks as part of an ongoing Yelp elite event, and it was my first time doing so. Having read up in advance I thought I knew what to expect, but that was absolutely exceeded. And it makes sense that it was outstanding; when you only do a handful of things, why not do them brilliantly?

I opted for a double impossible, regular fries, and a Mexican Coke; I also bought a double burger to try later for comparison, and was in no way disappointed. In fact, and I do not say this lightly, those fries were very likely the best I have ever eaten in this country. Granted, I don't usually order them in the better establishments, but this antiseptic little shoebox could be holding Heston Blumenthal hostage in the back. That good.

As for the sandwiches, they are simple and straightforward, sloppy as all get out, for me it was love at first bite. I may have even preferred the Impossible double to the genuine article, but they were very much level and nearly indiscernible from one another. The beef was of course slightly chewier and, well, beefy, but the difference in texture was very like that between a soft medium rare and a firmer medium well. I'm not sure what the sauce consists of because I ate a little too enthusiastically, but it works magic in this context.

So I'm going to be here a lot now. I will evangelize, I will proselytize, and since it is  about 12 blocks away, I will even get a little exercise. Thank you to Noah and the rest of the crew for your excellent service, and above all, for bringing some joy into my life. Well done, in a good way.
Perfect drinking food = greasy and delicious! Get the double bc the single is really small. Also whatever sauce they use is magic -- get extra for your fries!!

Really good burger spot that will hit any cravings! This is my 2nd time trying 7th Street Burger (first was the upper east side location) and still a solid place.  The burgers are a bit on the greasy side, but this place is perfect for a hangover! lol ... the loaded fries are ... LOADED.  A bit heavy on the sauce, but loved the overload of onions and cheese and was surprised to find a burger patty in there hidden underneath everything.  Will be back here for sure! The only downside is there is hardly any seating, so be prepared to take it home or eat it on the side of the street if you're lucky to snag one of the two tables they have outside.

Other burger joints tremble and cower with fear when 7th Street Burger comes to town. This new location, their fourth overall, is on 3rd Ave between 26th and 27th, just a short walk from Madison Square Park. It's a compact space best suited to grab-and-go, or you can just scarf down a burger right there on the spot. They're arguably best hot off the grill.

For me, a double cheeseburger with fries, washed down with a glass bottle of Coca-Cola, is both a vibe and a tasty meal. When that smash burger craving hits you, find the nearest 7th Street Burger and go. It looks like prices are higher if you order on the apps rather than directly with the restaurant; plan accordingly.

So excited to see 7th street burger in kips bay! I love their simple menu that they've mastered. Such a treat to have a cold coke in a glass bottle with a delicious burger and fries. This place is worth the hype!!! My only criticism is that there's nowhere to sit. Everyone was waiting outside and took the food to go. 10/10 on the food though!

Came to 7th Street Burger for the Yelp Elite event with decently high expectations and they knocked it out of the park. The burger was awesome and the fries got the job done. I like the simple menu and the glass bottle coke was a hit as well. Staff was very friendly. There is room outdoors to eat but nothing inside. Will definitely be back! Thanks for hosting the awesome event.

Small burger place that does it's job to satisfy your cravings. They only really have a single or double cheeseburger and an impossible burger on their menu. You can get regular fries or loaded fries and top it off with a Mexican Coke. The Cheeseburger was delicious and the fries are made perfectly. I tried the spicy loaded fries ($11) which has quite a kick to it but it was too much going on in my opinion. Loaded fries comes with toppings of onions, a patty and their sauce - this really reminded me of the in-n-out animal style fries. Staff was very nice and it should definitely be a staple no frills burger spot.

Don't let the signage fool you this is not a taco place. This is not their main location however I like this little pop up. Bringing St Mark's into midtown for some good eats at a good price. When I got here it reminded me of In-N-Out Burger Shake Shack Smashburger a lot of those types of burger places. But this place did not let down on flavor.
Thank you Yelp for sponsoring my first meal two doubles Fries and banana pudding and an ice cold Coca-Cola in the glass bottle. It tasted so good even though I had to wait a little bit and it's already getting cold. I can't wait to visit this hole in the wall again

***Delicious fries, Great service, Easy order***

With a small menu it's quick to decide exactly what you want. Their loaded fries stand out the most to me and are so delicious and filling. You can definitely have a light or full meal depending on what you order. Their burgers are small so I highly recommend doubling the meat. Their impossible meat is a must try!

Like there other locations - EXCELLENT!
Very simple concept though with top ingredients.
Patties are delicious, fries cut right and not too oily .
For a quick lunch or night crave .....
You can't go wrong here.

Highly recommended.

Definitely A Destination!

It lives up to the hype. I have been dying to try 7th street burger for over a year now and I finally gave in. It was incredible. I had a double cheeseburger. Obviously similar to a shake shack burger or any smash burger of sorts but by far the best I have had. I ordered in the store and the burger was made fresh right there and took no more then 10 minutes.  The sauce is incredible and goes so well with the pickles and onions. I will most certainly be back

Omg holy cow this was possibly my favorite smash burger in nyc!? It was truly outstanding!! There hasn't indoor seating just a few tables outside so you have to grab and go but wow. We got the double burger and the fries - the burger had a lot of cheese and sauce without being too messy and the fries were pure perfection. They were thick but still so crispy, would come back for just those as well. Every bite I had here was exceptional. The counter service was also super friendly and nice. You NEED to stop here if you are in the area.

Some of the best burgers & fries I've had in the city! Only drawback is that the burger was next level greasy. The cashier was super friendly & they have an easy, simple menu:
- single or double cheeseburger
- fries - normal or loaded (spicy or mild)
- coke or water
The loaded, spicy fries were dirtyyyy (in the best way possible). Reminded me a lot of In N Out Burger.

This is my first ever review so work with me on this

A straightforward fast food restaurant that has a small menu perfect for burger lovers!  They offer regular burgers and impossible burgers that can be matched with fries or impossible fries(fries with Impossible burger and house sauce in it).

Though the menu small the food is honestly good! Burgers are nicely cooked, fries came out hot and crispy. And the house sauce taste good but just have a lot of onions in it (would have gotten five stars if it wasn't for that)

Overall, would definitely recommend, especially when you are short on time and on the go!

A lot of people told me it was better than in n out but I personally loved lettuce and tomatoes in my burger so this place was good but the brioche bun was what really made it yummy. I do feel like things were missing but the fries were a great addition!

Very solid spot, no frills establishment. The food was really tasty - got the cheeseburger and fries. The server was kind and we got our food right away.

At this location, it's more of a takeout spot but they have 1 bench and 2 standing tables on the sidewalk.

I'd definitely try the other locations, too!

More like a 3.5 Really tasty sauce love that it has so much sauce and cheese on the double cheese burger. Smash patty so the burger is thinner but crisper. Size would be smaller then normal -Could easily eat 2 no problem-
In the same range price range as shake shack or 5 guys tier
taste wise compares with smash burger but there are more toppings and sauces available at smash burger. Worth a try to see what u prefer compared to shake shack /smashburger / 5 guys.
No seating area but a small table and bench outside

7th Street Burger is disappointing.
On 6/3/2023, I ordered online on their website:
1 Double Cheeseburger, 2 Cheeseburgers, 2 orders of fries and 1 House Sauce.  There was 1 order of friends, not 2 and no House Sauce.

About a month ago, I ordered the same thing and everything was cold.
Better to order from the Lower East Side 7th Street Burger and leave the Kips Bay 7th Street Burger alone.

Also, there phone listed on their webiste says that the mailbox is full, so there is no way to connect with the Kips Bay 7th Street Burger. The 7th Street Burger, Kips Bay location is doesn't have their delivery service and checking to make sure everything ordered is in the order delivered. They don't check. And it is difficult to get in touch with the 7th Street Burger Kips Bay location. I'm looking at my receipt where I have (2) Fries and 1 House sauce, those items are missing from the order, but not from the bill.

Had gone to the WSP location before and was excited for this one too!

Food (4/5) - Got the cheeseburger double and the loaded fries. Loaded fries are definitely worth it though also taste like a heart attack, which is exactly what you sign up for... Covered in ground meat, cheese and onions. Onions not too crunchy!

Had to finish the cheeseburger over two meals, kept pretty well. Decently juicy.

Price (4/5) - Pretty good deal for NYC; 10 all in for fries and a burger.

Service (5/5) - waitstaff were very nice, friendly. Your neighborhood laid-back bro very excited about grilled meats. Noticed that the demeanor of the staff at this location was really similar to the WSP one (consistent branding??)

Prompt even though it had just opened and it looked like they were completely overrun with orders.

Ambiance (4/5) - the WSP location had 0 place for you to stand and eat the food, there was a small standing area outside the storefront and a small bench where you could wait for your order.

Excited to see that after including another outpost 7th st has kept up the quality, as always. Had my first try of the loaded fries on this trip and phew! Wish this had been around when I lived in the area.

Overall, good service and quick production they have going on. The fries are good,little mealy, not soft or crunchy in any which way which some people prefer. The burger is great and is the perfect portion size I think when you want to hunker down on some greasy fare. The sauce (which seems like most places are modeling now after In and Out) is pretty conventional as is the rest of the burger. Just wish so much of the cheese didn't get stuck onto the wrapping paper

I really love 7th street burger, thin smash burger Patty, big pickle slices, a balanced special sauce, and cronchy French fries. Service is quick and the to-go vibe of this place is great for snagging a comfort meal after a busy workday or as a hangover preventative at the end of a night out. Don't sleep on the fries!! Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because our of the many times I have had this burger it has felt under seasoned somewhere around 40% of the time. Not under seasoned enough to not make me not want to return, but just enough to make me add some salt or even a little bit of ketchup. Highly recommend overall and will be back.

First and foremost, Evan is a mixology master! His masterful creations set the cocktails in this restaurant apart from most by brilliantly combining classic recipes with Asian-inspired ingredients!

The decor is unique with a warm and inviting vibe.

The short rib is a hefty portion with fall-off-the-bone tenderness. Can't wait to return to try the pho!

{Overall: 4; Food: 4} Atmosphere: 4; Service: 3.5

After Saigon Depp on 3rd Ave closed down, I was really excited to see that 5ive Spice had opened in the neighborhood. Compared to the other locations, this one is more upscale and trendy. The space isn't large, but they have a nice bar and several booths along the wall.

The 5ive Spice pho is really good and has a lot of meat. The ribeye is really tender.

I have clearly walked by this place without realizing it for over 2 years. It finally caught my eye a few weeks ago, so I decided to try it out.

I came during happy hour and had the chicken and goat cheese apps and the guava margarita. All items were flavorful and appetizing.  Menu is mainly Vietnamese and it was clear the restaurant has a following per the other patrons that were there.

They also had 90's-2000 R&B and rap to which random servers and customers were singing and rapping to. *huge smile*

The main server was friendly and informed me of an open bar that they did every Thursday this summer: $50 for 90 minutes w/passed hor d'oeuvres as well (to which I asked why they didn't do it on Fridays or Saturdays to compete with the other local businesses).

I'd come back for happy hour and have already let a few of my friends (who like Vietnamese spots) know that they should come here.

Much enjoyed.

I don't think I have ever had pho in New York. This place was worth a try.

The 5ive Spice pho is the way to go. The $21 price tag is worth it. If you check in on Yelp, you can get a free appetizer. We got the green mango salad, and I regretted it. We should have gotten spring rolls.

The pho menu does not have any tripe!

Surprisingly nice hot tasty beef broth in this Vietnamese fusion type sexy dark dining bar type atmosphere, it was quite on a Friday night.

The chicken wings were small, usually Asian fried wings, they would use the jumbo kind, but these were cooked well and juicy.

Tacos made from coconut rice, choice of short ribs, fried Swai, or veggies for the same price?  Of course short ribs!

The pho needed a bit more noodles, only 3 slices of beef, got it on the side is not enough either at $23 should be a bit more, but yes the short ribs were tender and nice in the pho.  I thought they had a bone in short rib or maybe that was another place and bone marrow?

Quick attentive service.  Forgot our banh Hoi but all good, enough food.

Absolutely love this spot! Came twice: once for their lunch, and once for dinner. Both times, the restaurant wasn't very crowded and was able to seat us immediately.

If you've been to their Soho location, the lunch menu seems pretty similar! They offer a variety of banh mi's, pho and banh xeo tacos. Got the banh mi and loved the flavors!

The most recent time, I went for dinner and was surprised that they had an entirely new dinner menu. The menu is seasonal, and this time around, I tried the 5spice pho (which was AMAZING) and was loaded with meat. Also tried the Thit Kho Tau, which was pretty tasty. Get the spring rolls!

My friend and I were looking for pho, and stumbled upon this restaurant through some Yelp searching. We decided to check it out since it was close. Ended up being the right decision for sure!

We arrived fairly early compared to the usual dinner hours, so we sat down right away. Since it was so early, the bar wasn't set up fully, so we were unable to try the lychee martinis. A bit disappointing as those looked really good, but we decided on a glass of white wine and that did the trick. Our servers were incredibly attentive too. Kept coming over to make sure we had everything we needed, and refilled our water glasses any time they looked even a little bit low.

We split the steamed chicken dumplings to begin. 10/10. For our main course, I ordered the lemongrass chicken pho and my friend ordered the short rib. When they came out, there was so much food!! For the price, this was worth it. The pho was delicious and we were absolutely stuffed by the time we left.

The space is very cool. One of the bathrooms is hidden behind a "bookshelf," which was really fun. The entire restaurant was incredibly clean as well, with fun lights decorating the tables and the bar. I'm really glad we found 5ive Spice; I would go back!

This is a cute, trendy Vietnamese restaurant with lovely decor, great service and delicious food! My sister and I were pretty hungry after a long afternoon of walking, and walked in around 7:30pm without a reservation and were able to get seated immediately. It got pretty busy shortly after we were seated, so we must have just beat the incoming dinner rush.
We ordered their lemongrass chicken pho and veggie pho, and we loved them both. The broth was perfectly spiced and the noodles cooked just right. I also thought the lemongrass chicken was just amazing and wish I could get their recipe.
On a slight side note, this place has one of the most interesting entrances to their restrooms that I've seen so far.
I highly recommend giving this place a try!

If you know me, you know that nothing and I mean nothing brings me back from a hangover like a hot bowl of Pho. The first thing I did after stepping off the plane from Vegas was get a super fast deliver of hot beef Pho and it did not disappoint.   Flavourful broth quality cuts of meat and delicious veggies. We also got veggie spring rolls and they were really fun because the lettuce was cut  perfectly to house all of the pickled dicon and carrots. I know that sounds like a weird thing but the lettuce was literally cut into a rectangle that fit exactly perfect with the Spring roll. That little detail really made my night and didn't have to fight with the lettuce in my hangover state of mind.  10/10

Came for dinner and had a nice meal, but I would recommend lunch instead as the lunch menu has way more options than the dinner menu (banh mi, vermicelli bowls etc).

The inside feels like an upscale bar and is quite dark. The service is fast and friendly and our waitress was knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered the boneless short rib tacos (entree) and summer rolls with shrimp (appetizer) as starters. The tacos were very good and I would order them again (3 per order so unsure how that is big enough for an entree, but maybe if you aren't that hungry?). The summer rolls were good as was the peanut sauce they came with, similar to ones we have had elsewhere.

For entrees we tried the 5ive special pho and bun bo hue. The meat in the special pho was great, very tender and flavorful (though we were not fans of the meatball due to its texture, almost rubbery). The best meat was the short rib, though the thinly sliced angus was superb too. I liked the thicker noodles of the bun bo hue, but overall the special pho was better (the pork patty in the bun bo hue was not my cup of tea in terms of texture/flavor).

The prices are as expected and the food is solid, I just wish they had the same menu for lunch and dinner.

The decor in this place is really something special. High-end Authentic Viet food!  Everything we had was amazing. From the drinks to the main course to the desserts!  You can tell everything was plated with care and tastes on point as well. Servers were attentive and knowledgeable as well. Their recommendations were great!  Appetizers came out on time and was hot!  A few of my favorite dishes were the tuna carpaccio and the bahn khot. Main course was good too but by that time we were stuffed from all the appetizers. We had the Pho and shaking beef.  The second one taste so good!!! Beef was nice and tender and the sauce!  Out of this world. Now the desserts are my favorite part. We had the cheesecake, ube ice cream and coffee creme brûlée. You can tell the chef too his time perfecting these. Absolutely delicious. Can't find this anywhere!  I'll definitely be returning to try other items on the menu and looking forward to new items they will be working on.

This location of 5ive Spice recently opened up in Kips Bay. They're definitely trying to go for a nightclub vibe based on the decor and all the instagram ads I get for their ticketed happy hour (?) events.

I stopped by to try the banh mi a few times. It's fine, though it's hard to mess up this dish. I did think the David dip banh mi was a little bland because there's a thick slab of plain fried fish diluting most of the flavor. The dip didn't really do much to save this sandwich.

They have different lunch, dinner, and take out menus. I was disappointed to see a lot of my favorites taken off the dinner menu. They also only take the yelp check in offer for lunch.

This has quickly become my favorite pho spot in the city! The restaurant offers a beautiful decorated, vibey spot with great music playing. The service is great, and I have yet to try a dish that I haven't loved. Absolutely recommend the beef pho and the spring roll.

The food is excellent.
The staff are friendly and attentive.
The atmosphere is pleasant tropical style.

I really wanted to like this place, but sadly it was a solid disappointment.

We made a reservation for 9.30pm after a movie on a Friday night, there wasn't a single other guest dining in.

We were recommended to go with the pre fix (60 dollars, 4 course) but we decided to go with 2 apps (wings and shrimp cups) and 2 entres (taco and pho) instead.

The shrimp came 15 mins after we ordered (the cups were still raw dough).

The wings came 30 mins after the shrimp (after we repeatedly asked where it was)

That was the end of all the food we received, because even after asking for the entrees repeatedly, even though there was only 1 other table occupied, even tho we only ordered tacos (?!) and pho (?!), one hour and 45 minute into our meal, still no food came out.

In the end we were too hungry to wait any more and just decided to leave. We stopped at the entrance to settle up our checks but even that was an issue, somehow they could not produce the check?! Ultimately it took so long that they also gave up and decided to "comp" the apps...

Bruh, a HARD PASS. I'm still hungry. NOPE.

I came here on a Friday night and it was pretty empty so  I would say it's definitely walk-in friendly. The menu is also pretty small so you're not bombarded with options.

My friend and I tried to check in on Yelp to get a free appetizer, but when we asked the waiter she said the promotion has ended (could be applicable for lunch though). I would keep that in mind if you're trying to get dinner. For the appetizer we got spring rolls and they were pretty good. I also got the tacos and they were the best things on the menu. The sauce was so good and the tacos were quite filling.

The food took so long to come out. After we got the appetizer, we waited another 40 minutes for the entree. However, they were kind enough to comp the appetizer since the wait was so long.

Overall, giving this a 4/5 because the food was good but not good enough that it was mind blowing. The price for Vietnamese food isn't really worth for the quality and taste. Good place for a casual dinner.

I love the 5ive Spice franchise and was very excited to hear that they've opened up a third location out in midtown. We stopped by Saturday night after catching a movie at the nearby AMC.

First of all, the Yelp check-in deal is an amazing one - you can get a whole app for free! We went with the Rooster Wings (normally $13) and they were delicious, fried to perfection.

For mains, we got the bun bo hue ($19) and bubba bun ($15) - have to say both were very good but nothing mind blowing. Just very solid viet food! However we also shared a porkchop banh mi ($13) which was definitely disappointing - porkchop was dry, not enough sauce and the bread was hard, perhaps over toasted. The pickled carrots, which are usually my fave part of the sandwich, weren't as pickled as I like them to be. I feel like I've had a better banh mi at the OG location.

I saw on ig that the menu here will become more elevated, so maybe my review will be irrelevant soon and there's going to be new things to look forward to. This location has more of a bar/club/nightlife vibe so excited to see what's in store.

I really love this elevated take on Vietnamese food. Their appetizers were all so so good, we got to try the Banh Khot and Tuna Poke Tacos. These were both so so good! Perfect appetizers to pair with drinks. We also got the shaking beef and pork belly as entrees. My only complaint was that they were both a little salty but paired with rice it was ok. I do wish there was another flavor (sweet, sour, spicy, etc) to balance it out better.  Overall gorgeous plating and pretty good food all around. The interior has a really cool vibe. I would definitely try their pho next time as well!

Before there was Luu's Baguette which sells authentic Vietnamese food and was cheaper. However, during the pandemic, it closed. Now 5ive Spice opened.

When I entered at around 3:30 pm, the place was empty as it was past the lunch peak. I order right at the entrance of the place. While waiting for my food, I saw a bartender preparing for the evening.

There was pop music playing in the background. By the time my order was ready, a party of three entered. Compared to other Vietnamese restaurants, the banh mi sandwich is quite westernized.

5ive Spice has opened a new location on 3rd Avenue in Kips Bay, close to Baruch College and near Madison Square Park and Gramercy Park. This new space is perhaps the loveliest of their three locations: spacious, with a big full bar, lots of tables and booths, and some trademark 5ive Spice secrets. (Could that be a hidden restroom entrance? Push and see!)

My girlfriend and I came in around 8 PM last Wednesday night, plopping down at the bar and ordering up a couple bowls of pho, plus a free order of egg rolls (thanks to Yelp for the check-in offer). We sipped bottles of ice cold lager and chatted with the bartender for a few minutes; our food arrived remarkably quickly.

My 5ive Special pho, loaded up with all the meats, was delicious. The short rib here is divine; I highly recommend trying it if you've never had it before. In conjunction with the beef brisket, rare steak, and meatballs, there's no shortage of protein in this bowl. I'd be remiss not to mention the broth as well. Super tasty. Even when I started filling up, I made sure to drink every drop of broth. Next time I'll ask for extra cilantro and jalapeno, maybe ease up on the beans sprouts. Pho is highly customizable, but this baddie is perfection.

The service was outstanding, we had a great first visit. I'm so happy to see 5ive Spice opening new locations, particularly since they get closer and closer to me each time! If you've been searching for a new pho connect in Midtown East ever since Sai Gon Dep closed, 5ive Spice will treat you right. I'm looking forward to many happy returns.
Food amazing, service immaculate, ambiance beautiful. Pho was so good. Been looking for a good pho place for a while and this place has hit my top two.  Thank you 5ive spice! 10/10
Good pho place the broth isn't that fatty so it's really good! Service is also friendly

cute interior with nice seating arrangements for the tables.

*5ive Special: my go-to pho dish at 5ive spice. the broth was so good and the meat was super tender.

*lemongrass chicken rice: very filling and the meat was very tender

*thai iced tea: super good, would get again

*my tips: be sure to bring cash since they charge extra for credit cards

would I go again? Yes

Outstanding food and service.
Really great taste. The food ratio was great. Drip coffee is also great!

This is a great pho addition to the neighborhood. It's not the best I've ever had, but it hits the spot. I really enjoy their chicken wings and combination pho but I do find their menu to be extremely overpriced. The bowls come with a bunch of meat, but I do find the broth to be a bit lacking and the noodles to be a little too soft. Otherwise, a solid addition to the neighborhood and a place I would return to when I don't want to travel far.

Food: Pho and Summer Roll sauce were highly flavored
Service: Excellent server and would constantly replace napkins without being asked!
Ambiance: dark and cozy, nice place for a good sit down dinner

YUM! I was so excited when I saw 5ive Spice was opening because I had heard amazing things. I just got take out for now but when I went to pick it up the vibe inside made me wish I just went and sat to eat. I had the shrimp summer rolls and they were some of the best I've had in the city - SO FRESH. And the veggie pho in beef broth and it was phenomenal. I loved the roasted mushrooms in it. I'll definitely be back to eat in the restaurant and try more of their fusion options.

This review is based on both dine-in and take out experiences.

Firstly with the good:
The take out is excellent. I would give 5 stars based on the take out alone. They have the same menu as the other locations. The food is consistently good, fresh, and quick. I love that I can order a side of broth when I'm feeling sick. They have a veggie broth option which is just as good as the meat based broths.

As for the dine-in, the space itself is decorated beautifully. It's a little more "upscale" than the casual vibes of the other locations.

Now the not so good:

I get the impression with the recent menu changes, that they're trying to establish this location as a more upscale dining experience. But currently it isn't there yet, there's still kinks to be worked out and it all feels a bit lost and confusing. The servers are polite enough but service is bare bones and doesn't match the upscale dining experience they're going for.

I would say that after my most recent dining experience, there's no incentive to dine-in at this location. Ordering take out will come to a comparable amount with fees and tip, so I might as well choose from a larger menu to the comfort of my own house.
Ordered takeout - the food tasted good and hot. Service was really nice and polite. And the spot itself looked cozy on the inside.

Great new neighborhood spot. Food was amazing and portions large.
Friendly and attentive staff.  Can't wait to go back.

I was craving Vietnamese food and decided to stop in with a friend. Surprisingly, I loved the atmosphere! They had good music playing and I was greeted and seated immediately on a Wednesday night.

The Bun Bo Hue was flavorful and had lots of meat! I asked for extra chili paste to make it more spicy. Overall I would say it had a pretty authentic flavor.

The Bahn Xeo Tacos were a fun app! It was loaded with lots of toppings! Not traditionally served but the flavors were definitely there.

Used to frequent the SoHo location, but this Kips Bay location is a little closer. Same great menu, solid service, and good food. The braised short rib's quality may have gone down slightly with fat to meat ratio increasing visibly. Other than that, always a pleasure to chomp on the spring rolls and tacos.
I love beef ribs and a beef rib on top of my pho is all I ever wanted in life. Everything else we got was good too, including the tacos and the appetizers. Can't wait go back and try more dishes!

Came here for the first time for early brunch and the food was amazing!! The servers were extremely nice and the setup was really cozy. We ordered classic banh mi's and their take on tacos. All were loaded and deliciously prepared! And the Rooster Wings were excellent! Definitely a spot to check out if you're ever around the area!!

A hidden gem!! Newly opened location  at Gramercy. Decided to come for dinner and it was such a good idea! The staff was friendly and our food came out super quick. If you're looking for the BEST spot to hang with friends while enjoying some small but delicious plates, 5ive spice is the place to go. I do appreciate the quality of the food they bring, like their shaking beef is so goddamn good and you can really taste the angus beef!! Also the soup base for pho was very tasty and not oily at all. Also, I didn't feel thirsty after I drank up my pho broth (no MSG!!!).

KEY POINT: their bathroom is hiding behind the bookshelf. You will never know if they dont tell you!

Working in NYC affords me the great opportunity to seek out new, funky great places to eat. Five Spice is just one of these places. Five Spice is a cool, hip little Vietnamese restaurant that serves up big flavor. My server was a very nice young lady named Melanie. She was very informative and even made some suggestions. I ordered the "short rib" appetizer and a Classic Bahn Mi sandwich. The short rib (2 per app) is so tender that you don't need the fork and knife. Just the fork. It literally falls off the bone. This is a nice size appetizer. Keep this in mind when ordering your main course. The Classic Bahn Mi is just that. A classic sandwich that hits all the marks. Tasty pork, ham and paté with the veggies inside. Delicious and they will accommodate the spice level to your liking. I will definitely be back to try some more menu items soon.

I loved the original 5ive Spice location, so I thought I would give the Gramercy location a shot. This location's ambiance was trendy and inviting, creating a pleasant atmosphere to enjoy a meal. The staff members were very polite and attentive and always checked up on us making sure everything was good. Something odd I noticed though was that they kept coming to change our napkins when we've barely used it..seems a bit wasteful. I felt like the food was just okay for the prices they were charging. To start, my group ordered their regular spring rolls as well as the vegetarian spring rolls. At $10 and $11 for the orders, I would've expected that they would give more rolls. The flavors were there but I didn't find it anything special compared to a mom and pop Vietnamese spot. The chicken wings were actually pretty good though; full of flavor and very crispy. 5ive Special Pho was pretty average; they definitely gave higher quality pieces of meat, but the noodles did not live up. It may have been overcooked because they broke apart so easily and the texture was a bit too mushy. The Banh Xeo tacos were a good modern twist to the classic dish. You have to eat them quickly though or else the crepes will get soggy. I felt like this location's menu was more limited than the original location; hopefully they will expand in the future.
Excellent food service and quality. I will be back next time I'm in the city. Really enjoyed the beef pho!
Great customer service and very tidy environment. I would definitely recommend to anyone in the area. The food smells amazing.
Love the Asian seafood ceviche, it's freshing and very tasty.  The service is also excellent.

A true gem! We ordered Vegetable Spring Rolls and Shrimp Summer Rolls for appetizers, both were very good. My son had the Braised Short Ribs. Best he has ever had he says. I had a bowl of Chicken Pho and it was definitely the best Pho I've had. I have not left a review in years but this place deserves it!
When they first opened, their Short Ribs were amazing, whether on the appetizer menu, or the pho. Now they're just full of fat, no meat. Sad

The food was good, not great. Service was great, ambiance was great. Wouldn't mind coming again but I've had better pho with better flavors. There's also not enough onions, etc placed in the bowl which I did not like.

My son picked this one out as it's right around the block from him.  Nice room, very nice room and bar.  V our bartender was cool, as we decided to eat at the bar.

Signature cocktails were really good.  My tequila/jalopena/fresh cilantro & mind with a slice of cucumber was delicious.  My son had the lychee martini which he had no complaints about.  

Ordered the shrimp summer roll, with the peanut dipping sauce being very very good.  We ate light.  I ordered the shrimp/pork tacos.  matchstick veggies on a corn tortilla was full.  Loved the fish sauce/fresh lime marinade.  My son had the classic bahn mi.  Every thing here is so flavorful and beautifully presented.  

We had a dessert cocktail with Viet coffee and Hennessey's . Tasty and a nice finish to our early dinner before we headed out to Brooklyn to whoop it up.
If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, then you arrived at the right spot. My second day in New York for business and I've eaten here twice because the food is that great.

First time here, and the service was amazing! The interior is beautiful. The servers, Eric and Jaya were very attentive in bussing the tables and catering to the guest needs. The owner, Alex, of was very welcoming and created a great environment for their guest. The food is amazing. I had Lychee drink was great! I had the spring rolls which are to die for and I had to Bun ho hue. So Tasty. Love it here! This is about to be my boyfriend and I new Vietnamese spot!

The SoHo branch is my fav Vietnamese restaurant in NYC and have now been numerous times.
This branch lost 1/2 star because at dinner they bring you a shorter and more expensive menu, and then only later reveal to you that they have the bigger cheaper one identical to the SoHo branch.
Lost another 1/2 because the shrimp in the Bubba had a vaguely charred/burnt taste and the vermicelli noodles a slightly artificial taste.
Staff is pleasant and attentive and the (over the top colorful) decor more classy.
Probably won't be back.

Great place to get some Vietnamese food. We got some short ribs which were tender, a bowl of Pho which had good flavor, and banh xeo tacos which were okay. they also had good Vietnamese coffee. staff and environment were decent and attentive. Would recommend.
The staff is really friendly and helpful. They are like noticing everything you need in no time. The pho is a little bit too sweet for me, but the ceviche we got is pretty good.

Recently visited this new location of 5ive spice and I can't say enough great things about it!
The customer service was great, which is a huge plus and the food on point - like all their other locations. Consistent. I've been going to 5ive spice in Brooklyn for years as one of my go to pho spots in New York. If it's your first time - I highly recommend their spring rolls - a home run.

Service: I had come to this place in its previous incarnation, KB Sushi Dumpling house, so I decided to give it another try.  I ordered salmon teryaki for a treat-myself dinner after an evening of late meetings, and it was waiting for my pickup when I got there 20 minutes later.  The restaurant itself is scrupulously clean, with cute fake-wood decor.

Food: Everything was neatly packaged in separate containers (came with rice and choice of soup or salad), and the portion was quite generous (2 pieces of salmon with some side veggies).  The teryaki sauce was flavorful but not too heavy, and the fish was well-cooked but still moist.  Rice was a bit off-tasting (like maybe a little rice vinegar got in it by accident) and miso soup was too salty, hence 4 stars.

Value: I could have gotten more food for a couple dollars more if I'd ordered the bento box, but I wasn't super-hungry so I figured this was enough (and now I have leftovers for tomorrow). I'd probably go back for lunch or something, especially since they have lunch specials and a 10% student discount (dine-in only).

You know those times when you go out and say to yourself that you're not going to really go looking for a new box to munch on, but then you see one that catches your eye and knew you would be going down on it anyway? Well, this was a tasty new box that I bumped into and had to take a few bites - I could not resist.

Hey, I'm always looking for a good Bento Box lunch deal and this one seemed pretty decent for only $8.50. As it was a bit past lunch hour I had the place to myself. It is a tiny restaurant but clean with a bright and cozy decor -  a few tables, small sushi bar counter, brick walls, and even mock trees on them. Kind of a fun setting.

My Bento Box meal was pretty darn good. Was it the best box I ever munched down on? No, but they all can't be amazing. Still, this made for a nice cheap lunch deal. Miso soup tasted good. My box came with decent shumai, ok California rolls, nicely cooked white rice, crisp salad, and a nice hunk of teriyaki salmon cooked just right with a few fresh veggies. Just the right amount of teriyaki sauce on it, and not swimming in it as some places do. I'm not a fan of going down on a gloopy box!  

Service was pleasant, and the whole meal with a soda came out to a little less than $11. Definitely a fair price and would go back again.

Man, I see a lot of haters here who have reviewed this place so far. Most of them seem to be about the Seemless Web delivery problems. I did hear the machine announcing a bunch of orders when I was there, so I am glad I actually went there to eat. My guess is that you don't order your box to be delivered but better to munch down on it there!

Chimi chimi cocoa pop, chimi chimi rock...

Seamless-webbing some sushi up for a late lunch, I probably should have been a bit more wary of the low prices on this menu. For $13 I scored miso soup, edaname, salad, 6 spicy tempura tuna rolls and 6 eel avocado rolls. I guess the strangest thing was that the edaname was $5 of that price tag. The rolls themselves were alright, though I would not call the fish "fresh" when it smells fishy. Both were bland and had to be soaked in soy sauce to be edible. The miso was tasty, I liked the little chunks of tofu though some of the seaweed pieces were a little too mushy if ya know what I mean.

Service was quick and friendly, but Chimi proves that age old adage true: you get what you pay for...

Wow whoever owns this place should be banned from New York. Their listing from seamless got removed because of all of the fake reviews they submitted for themselves. Well... there just happened to be a "new" restaurant that popped up on seamless called Abumi Sushi and it also has over 200 5 star reviews in a few weeks. It just happens to have ALMOST the same exact address. It is 209 E 26th vs. 207 E 26th St. These people are horrible.

Please call seamless and get their asses removed.

Newish spot in the hood, but really, if you give it a chance, I think you'll find it offers some pretty awesome sushi.  

I have to give this place 5 stars, because I honestly probably eat here 2-3 times a week, if not more often on some weeks.

The best things on the menu are the Unagi don, the snowcrab naruto roll - make sure you get it with chili soy sauce, the vegetable tempura roll, and the alaska roll.  I really like other rolls like the dragon roll, california roll and spicy tuna roll (not too much mayonaise).

I used to travel out of my way to eat at places like Takahachi and Airyoshi, but really, i've been finding myself frequenting this place more and more, and once Chimi notices that you're a regular, that's just how you're treated - like the diamond in the rough that we all are.  This place is just like people, there may sometimes be a longer wait than usual for food, and the sometimes you order something that is not exactly how you thought it would be, but more often than not, my tastebuds are always satisfied and my belly happy when I leave this place.

A great new sushi place in the Murray Hill neighborhood! It opened in early 2011 in an inconspicuous spot but that is easy catch cause of the swirly bright sign. It's a very small place good for casual eating with a whole range of menu. When I was there it appeared to be a bit understaffed since there was just one guy there handling both the cash register and the kitchen area. I think he was making the sushi too.

I like to get the regular sushi rolls before I graduate to the fancier house rolls so I tried out the salmon mango roll (yay! hard to find mango rolls anywhere) and the yellowtail avocado. The rolls were great! All the ingredients were very fresh and the rolls were big and fat with big chunks of juicy fish. I am very satisfied with the quality of the sushi and the speed of delivery. The server/cashier/sushi chef seemed eager to please and introduced himself and told me it was a new place just recently opened. I can tell this will be one of my favorite take-out places around!

Only thing I can complain about is there was a pungent oily stench in the air when I walked in and I would have walked right out if I were there to sit down and eat. Hope this was just a random occurrence, as it would be a pity if this place would have no dine-in customers.

I love this place. I'm so shocked that nobody yelped this place yet. I actually found them because I was searching Seamless Web which is a website that tells you the restaurants that deliver around your neighborhood. SO actually, I haven't been there yet but i order from them all the time and they are great.

The food always taste fresh and the price, you can't beat it. They are also very good with service and they try to accommodate you in every way.

Just try them once and you won't be disappointed at the food. I really love the spicy scallops. YUMMY TO MY TUMMY!!!!!!!

What I remember about last night*:
7 pm - gonna be a late night at the office.
Craving Sushi.
Highest rating on seamless and estimated delivery time of 20-40 minutes.
"he is on his way.  10 more minutes."
"he is on his way.  10 more minutes."
"he is on his way.  10 more minutes."
An hour and 45 minutes later my spicy tuna, yellowtail jalapeno and seaweed salad arrive.
Girl who answers the phone is unable to articulate a reason for the absurd delay.

*I became faint and suffered memory loss due to my prolonged hunger.

Don't know how this place got 5 stars on seamless web... The $14.95 dinner bento box was nothing special.  Came with 5 pieces of nigiri, a california roll, a weak iceburg lettuce salad, miso soup, and rice.  Acceptable, but certainly nowhere near spectacular.  Also ordered the tempura red bean ice cream- sounded great, tasted meh.  Will order something different the next time I stay late at work!  I will say- the delivery was quick though- I work over 20 blocks north and several avenues over from the restaurant, but everything was delivered in less than 30 minutes of my order.

Ordered the Chirashi.  It was average tasting.  It was
not bad but nothing worth really writing about.

very bland rolls...no spice whatsoever in the spicy tuna roll, and no jalapeño spice in the green river roll...yellowtail scallion roll had no scallions!

i've had better sushi from the deli at the grocery store.

also, delivery was SLOW...i was quoted 25-40 mins, and it took 1:15.

TERRIBLE.

Please learn from our experience with Chimi Sushi.  We waited almost 2 hours for our food to be delivered, which means that our sushi was warm, our soup was cold, and the gyoza was soggy.

I first called Chimi when it had been 1 hour to check on the status of our order since their page said it would take 25-40 minutes.  He said his delivery guy was five minutes away.

20 minutes later I called back, and was told the delivery man was one block away.

10 minutes later I called back, asking for a discount/refund and was offered 30% off my next order and was told that the deliver man was in the building.

15 minutes later, when the deliver man had still not arrived, we called Chimi once more, asking to simply refund our money/cancel the order.  He said that the delivery man would give us cash back for our whole order, we could have the food, and 30% off our next order.

5 minutes later the delivery man finally arrived, said he would not give us the 75 dollars cash unless we wanted him to take the food back.  He called Chimi who agreed.  So... we paid 40 bucks (after the $35 he gave us back) to wait two hours for soggy gyoza, tepid noodles, and warm sushi.

Had the food been the right temperature and fresh, not having been outside for an hour, it may have been mediocre/decent.  But, I would stay on the safe side and not order here.

Can't say anything about their rolls because I didn't get it. I had eel over rice. Their potion is very small, not worth $10 but the rice was very flavorful. My friend had the chicken katsu and it was twice my dish size so I end up eating some of her food. I gave them 3 stars instead of 2 is because student gets 10% discount.

MY man Chimi delivers the real deal dinner sushi that you crave after work.  Its now called Abumi because a sushi joint on the upper westside had the same name....either way Chimi (the head sushi chef) brings it.  I would suggest going into the restaurant instead of just ordering on-line.  It is BYOB and the chef always hooks it up...I'll be back...see you real soon, from Superman, Jake, and Tom

This is one of my go-tos for sushi, since I live close by. It's a cozy place that I've dined in several times, but primarily I order for pickup. Seems to be a better option than delivery since my order is always ready in ~10 minutes. Sushi is good, though not mind blowing. The Sweet potato tempura roll is my favorite - the balance of crisp tempura with the hearty sweet potato is tasty and filling.  Mango avocado roll is another good veggie roll - sweet and fatty. They offer very reasonable lunch deals. Don't understand all the hate on yelp for this place, but my experiences have always been positive.
I order from here all the time. The paella is on point!!! It's open 24/7, so after a long night I tend to find myself here from time to time. By the way don't forget to try one of the empanadas.

Absolutely disgusting and unsanitary.
Also seems like crack heads get a fix in the back.
I walked in to get a fried red snapper and some shrimp on a stick, it was a movie first they have a shell chandelier that looks like it has dirt and dust from 1995 it's disgusting right over the food. While waiting for my order I saw a train of crack heads exit the facility one decided to stay and converse (more like bother) customers who were waiting to order, the staff just looked and stayed quiet. After that I got up and left I felt extremely uncomfortable and it was too ghetto and too dirty for me. Sorry but I used to go to this spot back in the day and I don't know what happened to it. Washington Heights is becoming the gutter you see as many crack heads as you see rats roaming the streets at all time of day. Definitely a hard pass.

This used to be my number one location for fresh seafood and night craving. But lately the food quality has drop. Some times is even smells. Now to add to the list I order rice with shrimp and the rice wasn't cook right.

Fact: The best salmon in Manhattan.
This is not a lie people you have to try this place they may look like a regular shake but this place is putting love in every bite eve the steamed vegetables taste like sason (seasoning) it gets pretty busy and that is because us locals know what's up in warm weather you can catch me walking from 180 to this place past so many seafood spots just to get my salmon from this place always worth it

On Saturday September 11th, 2021 at 9:30pm passed by there to eat with a friend, we sat and placed our order, at first the waitresses, were very polite when they came to take our order. After 10 minutes we still had not received our drinks, until we asked. we sat there for another 50 minutes, (50 Minutes- more than 3/4 of an hour) waiting for our food. And even after all that time still no food. it got so bad that the waitresses seem to be ignoring our table. a couple of people sat on other tables, after we arrived and they received their food, but not us. I found it very rude especially when happening in my own neighborhood.   I've live in Washington heights more than 35 years, and every time things like this happen it's usually some form of discrimination, I am black after all, Dominican, but black.  This was my first time there, and I guaranteed it's the last time, no if, buts or maybe, about it. I sat there,  with bugs crawling over my arm and neck, roaches on the walls!!. I felt uncomfortable the whole time, but was willing to ignore the discomfort, just to try the food. I will never recommend this restaurant to anybody. And to top it off, I was given an attitude and over charged for the drinks ( chinola drink, ginger ale and a corona). NEVER AGAIN.    If I could give a negative star, I would, no hesitation.

This people are a joke. I was just there last night and the cook was making something so I asked what he was making he said shrimps fried rice. I desire to order the same thing but guessssss what the kitchen was closed meaning while he wasn't not even finish making the other order very poor customer service everyone that work there just seating in corner talking like nobody want to work .. never never never never again ...

This place is so unprofessional, zero customer service . I've been hear and have over heard many of the employees arguing with customers for 1 or 2 bucks. Food is pretty sloppy. Today I went with my boyfriend mother just because she wanted to give it  a try, so I ordered a shrimp soup when I get to my car I check and it's a seafood soup, I walk back inside and told the young lady it was wrong I ask for shrimps only so she gives supposedly the right one. I get home to eat my soup and it's a fish soup. I was so pissed off I got in my car and drive back and told her it wrong agin for the second time. So she tells me it an extra 3 bucks. How if the first soup you gave me is worth more then this one and they lady went back and forth with me. Poor poor customer service.
The grilled salmon was phenomenal and the empanadas were very good. They were busy however food was quick.
These guys are the best !!   Open 24/7 with a grill !!   Chopped cheese or a cheeseburger has saved my life so much!!   I don't know what I'd do in this neighborhood without them !!

I was waiting for my food and paid like every other customer and instead I was harassed, called slurs and discriminated against. I will not support places that are inhumane. Hope y'all can do the same.

I usually love my chopped cheeses from here; the shorter cook is a beast. He literally makes whatever you want, however you want.

However, I have noticed that they like to overcharge people. The last time I noticed, I called and the guy stated that next time I went, they would reduce the amount that I was overcharged from the new bill; he stated that all I had to do what explain what happened and say his name (Adele).

So, I tried that and the boy at the register (Ali) was like "Next time," because Adele is not here... like really? You think that I am going to lie about pocket change... like put some respect on my name. You possibly lost a "regular." I do not care about the money; it is about the principle.

I have now had two occasions of spoiled 2% milk from this deli. First time it was a gallon of milk and it had an expiration date 15 DAYS BEFORE. It really stunk. I usually check the expiration dates, but forgot this time. Sadly, I gave the gallon a swig before I caught the smell. = A night sick running to the bathroom.

Bought a half gallon earlier this week. The expiration was not for another 5 days. Still, it was spoiled.

Makes me wonder if they are moving other foods around without watching for temperature/refrigeration.  :(     :(
The man behind the grill is very good and the food tastes very good. Product selection is pretty nice and you can find pretty much anything you're looking for. Get a BEC its great
This boy is not good enough to assist the children. He spends it on his phone until 35 minutes wait for a salad
Got food poisoning here. Never go here, somethings wrong. I puked my brains out,  had a fever, etc hours after eating the deli food. Definitely eat somewhere else.

Unexpectedly good place to get flowers, convenient location right by the GWB bus terminal. Got roses for $15. They have other flowers including tulips for $10, mixed bouquets for $20 and a few small potted plants. Would have gotten food/coffee since they have a large selection at the grill, but there is no seating. Almost like a food truck with walls around it and a flower shop on the side.

This place has a great cheesesteak sandwich, unlike other reviews I haven't got food poisoned I guess it depends what you order. Downside is that they won't deliver and also I do agree with another user, it does have a strange vibe but it's a deli and the food is definitely decent
Sandwiches and wraps are great. Great customer service. Everyone is funny and friendly. A+
Pretty good deli here, the cook is on point with his sandwiches here, it's closely convenient location helps a lot too. I usually get the scrappy sandwich to go w Swiss cheese.

Meh it's a deli, they have soda and milk and you can get sandwiches, but...i cant put my finger on it but there's a weird vibe when i go in here. Which i why i normally go to Jin's or the nice Spanish bakery down the block.

This is the newest deli on the block, and I think they'll do well.  If only the place was a bit bigger!  The staff is friendly and willing to customize orders.  This is a great place to get a cold drink, some household convenience items, and especially deli sandwiches.  I have ordered the turkey & swiss hero with the works, taken it to the park for a picnic, and it's delicious and reasonably priced.  The newest addition is their outdoor flower market, and I must say, the beauty, quality and variety of the flowers is rather impressive!  The storefront has a huge, bright red sign, which you cannot miss.  The icing on the cake - they are open 24 hours.

My experience at Hudson Thai was great! I came for a farewell dinner with a mentee and their parent. Since I am vegetarian, I got started with the tofu pad see ew. The others ordered soup and drunken noodles, which looked delicious.

The lychee martinis were more lychee than martini, but still enjoyable.

I would recommend applying mosquito repellent before coming here and eating outside because they were silent killers, and left huge welts on the mom's legs. I try to keep in mind to wear mosquito repellent when choosing to sit outside and enjoy the weather. By the time I got there with the bug spray, she was already bitten.  She applied some of mine to prevent it from happening again.  

The ambiance was beautiful and the staff was super warm, friendly, and attentive to our needs when we needed more water and food even though we were outside.

The mango sticky rice was delicious however the coconut sauce had a little bit of a salty taste to it but I think that's the traditional recipe. The banana spring rolls were really delicious and paired well with the ice cream. I really enjoyed the tofu pad see ew needles and vegetables, but the tofu could've been seasoned better.

I would consider coming back again.

So far the best quick Thai place I've had in the area. I usually get eh drunken noodles and here they make them spicy. Also, the tofu is cooked very well and the flavor is really good. I recommend this place for some fast takeout.

Just FYI - this Thai restaurant replaced Tung Thong 181! The menu and seating areas (outdoor and indoor) are still the same, though. All the food seems to be prepared the same way, and everything tastes the same as it did when it was still called Tung Thong 181. I don't know much about the reason for the name change, but I'm glad this place is back! Service when I went was very nice, as they normally are.
Competent local Thai restaurant. Not many competent, comfortable, relatively quiet places like this to eat around here.

Cute spot with bar, indoor and outdoor seating. The space is pretty big and when we went there was one server for both so we made sure to order all that we wanted at once so as not to have to flag him down continuously. Husband and I got the brunch special with coffee, the turkey burger with a salad and sweet potato fries, honey habanero wings, and the chicken dumplings.

The dumplings were flavorful but had a tiny amount of stuffing compared to the casing. After one bite, the rest of the filling would fall out when trying to dip it in the sauce. The honey habanero wings were delicious as was the brunch and turkey burger.

181 is a fairly relaxed space where you can come for a lazy brunch, lunch or dinner. We definitely enjoyed ourselves and plan to come back for other items.

Really nice place. Atmosphere is chill and you can decide between a quiet outside or bar inside.

Came here after a run, was not disappointed. Nice, strong lemonade. Decent drip coffee.

Bacon was perfect.

Love this neighborhood gem!! This LGBT-friendly restaurant and bar is just what the doctor ordered way uptown!!

Cabrini features a bar with both bar seats and tables. We visited this area of the establishment yesterday for a RuPaul's Drag Race viewing night. We got there early before the show to make sure we had seats, and the bar table that we snagged was perfect for viewing the show.

We stated our night with Happy Hour drinks, which were priced right (the cosmos and margaritas were our favorites). We then ordered some yummy wings as an appetizer.

Later on, after probably too many drinks, we ordered dinner. I am glad to say that each dish we ordered was on point! The entrees we ordered were the Beef Burger, the Lamb Ragout, the Gnocchi Bolognese, and the Beef Goulash! I would re-order any of these!

The back of Cabrini features a dining room if you aren't in the mood for a bar scene, but i definitely prefer the front bar area because it's easy to chat with other patrons and socialize there.

Definitely check this place out if you are in the area!! You are sure to enjoy.
We went here for brunch and the food was excellent- filling and delicious, and reasonably priced. Their signature dishes are tasty! Service was friendly and very good.

This small local restaurant has a wonderful atmosphere, but more importantly, I have never had a disappointing meal here. Whether it's the fresh soups, breakfast choices, or the more extensive than you'd think choice of main dishes, everything is fresh, well-prepared, and served with grace.

Great neighborhood bistro in Washington Heights. Staff is very professional and friendly, bartenders are on their A game, and the bar has a great selection, especially the tap list. Menu has something for everyone and the food is excellent. I go to trivia hosted by Uptown Pub Quiz on Wednesdays whenever I can, but they have great events on other nights throughout the week that bring the most fun people in the neighborhood out.

We both had some most delicious Huevos Ranchero here.  We were on our way to the cloisters and some 'unexpected transit rerouting' landed us in the area.  We enjoyed every last bite.  Nice little neighborhood spot.
Great food, cute bartender guy and nice. The vegan option is basically avocado toast but it was done very well and tasted fresh

I feel bad cause the guy was pretty kind to us and was attentive but I should've known to leave when he said he didn't know how to make a whiskey sour. I ended up ordering a margarita against my better judgement and there was a roach frozen into the ice. I ended up taking a few sips from it. I didn't throw up everywhere because I had just gotten my food and hadn't tried it yet (THANK GOD).

The Jerk Chicken is delicious.

It is also hot.

As I ordered, the waiter warned me, "it's really hot. Are you sure?" This piqued my curiosity so I affirmed my intention.

While I eat a lot of hot food, I'm used to generally restaurants diminishing the Scoville scale so to avoid food being returned.  This was not the case.

Also I wasn't going to be that person: the one who says they can eat hot food, and then sends it back.  That guy happens a lot, and in those cases, deal with the pain, or order something else and pay for it.

The waiters will warn you.

Even for a seasoned veteran of hot food, it will be an enjoyable and nice surprise. Finally, a restaurant gets "hot," I thought. And they were nice enough to warn me.

The sauce was tasty, savory, and a hint of sweetness. It was a delightful dish, and I would definitely order it again.

The waiters were solicitous and kind, and glad that I could eat what they served.

The house wines were good, well respected entry level wines that will please most palates.
The tostadas are the perfect size for a light meal, and there are always tasty craft beer selections on tap. The crowd is friendly, especially at the Wednesday night Pub Quiz.

When the gods invented grilled chicken sandwiches, James's Zanny Chicken Sandwich was exactly what they had in mind. Pesto, sun-dried tomatoes and black olives with melted mozzarella on a grilled ciabatta: Perfection.

My guy had the French toast which was equally spectacular.

Acoustically, the outdoor seating is significantly quieter than the spots right on 181st. Ok, now go eat.

BRUH. Can we talk about their tacos?? I had the pork belly and the minute I bit into them, my eyes rolled to the back of my head in pleasure. These are so friggin delicious it's disrespectful!!! The vibe of the bar seems fun but unfortunately they aren't able to do bar service now (#fckRona). I am excited to go when we can!! Would definitely order again and loved the host (Robert..? Great eyebrows!)!
Had brunch outside in a light drizzle but my lord, our omlettes were steaming hot and delicious! Everyone should experience an omlette from this place. Do it.

Stopped in for an early lunch and was glad to see that they were serving salads at 1030am. Yes, I like having a breakfast salad at the bar.

I got an arugula salad with chicken, walnuts, grapes, and goat cheese.

Nice, quiet place! Definitely would come back again.
Nice little brunch place. Omelets were tasty, portion sizes were just enough without being overwhelming, and prices are hard to beat--$6 for a draft beer is unheard of in manhattan
Amazing food and drinks, very affordable. Good portion sizes. They close at 10 pm on weekdays due to covid.

3 stars for decently prepared, fresh food but the bottom line for me is taste. 2 turkey burgers with fries came with not one ounce of seasoning, even the most basic of salt & pepper. To sum it up... YUK and never again!
