Guys. We stopped in for a quick drink last Sunday night after a gorgeous walk through most of Fort Tryon Park. Full disclosure: we had intended to hit the local Irish bar but as live Irish music was happening there, nary a seat was to be had. The call of a cocktail was strong so we simply crossed the street and moseyed into 181 Cabrini. It was a happy substitution.

We ordered a simple vodka soda heavy on the fresh lime and settled into the bar to watch Massimo Bottura osteriafrancescana.it on the large flat screen go through his magic on Chef's Table netflix.com/title/800079… (seriously: do yourself a favor and watch every episode). It was a perfect moment.

The service was strong, our drinks solid, and the patrons, friendly and cheerful. I'm sure we'll have many more drinks there as the summer unfolds.

Pro-tip: that chunk of Manhattan is SERIOUSLY hilly so do wear appropriate footwear, no matter what your Sunday afternoon plans are.

A nice chill casual local spot. You order all your food at the bar. The lunch was good. Tomato soup was tasty and the Cuban sandwich had all the flavors of a traditional Cuban and was nicely pressed. The best was the coffee which was on the house with the meal.

I would like to start by saying The food was Good !  Highly recommend the steak nachos ! so great . also the chicken parmesan . We had great waiters ! Johnathan F ! And Andrew . so kind and helpful ! extremely respectful ! had such a great time .! 10/10 !
The Black Bean Burger is everything!!!! Great lunch spot, comfy outdoor seating and good beer selection!

Nice hipster eatery. Three of us had a late brunch inside. The table seating arrangement was comfortable and roomy. The three of us each ordered differently from the menu and enjoyed our meals equally. I liked that we all were given a bowl of fresh fruit to enjoy. Our waitress was pleasant and knowledgeable and we were not rushed at all to eat and leave. We all talked about our meal when we left and all agreed that we made the right choice today. I will be returning.

Oh my God, 181 Cabrini is rather darn cool. It is pleasant place. Absolutely delicious and also wholesome. The workers were really friendly, smiled a lot, felt genuine. Anyway, get here and enjoy 181 Cabrini!

Be aware that they don't take Apple Pay. I have no problem with this. I did have a problem when wasn't clearly indicated on the menu, and when the barista laughed at me when I noted that it was the only payment method I had at the moment. She did say "sorry" through her laughter. It wasn't very funny. It was quite rude. I took my business elsewhere.

Ahhhh, 181 Cabrini... my new little date spot! Why have I lived near Washington Heights all my life and never thought of passing Fort Washington Ave!? Shame on meeee... wow!

Back to the review for this amazing eatery... So I decided to bring my boyfriend here for his little birthday lunch since I had to go to work and could not go out to dinner at night... We got there around 11 AM, and were greeted with big smiles, given menus, and told we could sit anywhere . Even though there was only one other person there, being told we could sit anywhere we wanted was pretty cool; I say this  because we have been to some empty places and told where to sit!

Now to the amazing food! I had a Coca Cola, and my boyfriend decided to have a Cabrini Punch since he was the birthday boy! He said it was really good.... I had the grass fed burger with cheddar cheese and bacon, on a brioche bun!!!!! Brioche buns are my favorite buns!! I asked for the burger very well done, and thats what i got. A juicy... juicy burger... juice drippin... well done... burger wow! One of the best I've had!

My boyfriend had the chicken zanny, which he got on a toasted italian ciabatta bread, with sun dried tomatoes,  pesto , black olives and substituted the mozzarella for swiss and added bacon. One of theeeeeeee best sandwiches we have ever had... wow, simply amazing with so much flavor. He said he would want to try other items on the menu , but not ordering the chicken zanny every time would be pretty difficult, LOL.

Def. Will be back, amazing service... amazing food and amazing staff! Thank you for such a memorable experience!

My wife and I live around the corner from here, and it's one of our favorite local spots. We evacuated from NYC shortly before COVID got really bad there, and are coming back next week. We have been fantasizing about the food at 181Cabribi for months (the mac and cheese with the house hot sauce!) We've decided that this will be the first place we order from to celebrate being home.

This is one of the best restaurants/bar in the neighborhood. The food is good and reasonably priced. The bartender? She's awesome--remembers your drinks and nice!! If only they could offer a chili option the doesn't set fire to your mouth screaming 911!!!! Good sliders, calamari, etc. and excellent drinks.

they have not been open for delivery. I hope this us not their demise.
The music here literally always sucks and it's sooo loud. It's a shame because the food is so good.
We've been here a couple of times. Nice local place with GREAT Cuban sandwiches. Drinks are strong too.

This place is open for carry out during COVID. I'd always pass this place on my way to the part but never stopped in until now. I ordered a Cuban sandwich with a side of fries and oh my God, it was one of the best Cuban sandwiches I've ever had. The bread was this amazing thick bread and paired perfectly with the ham and pork. Perfectly savory and satisfying.

I'm definitely coming back to try the rest of the menu.

This is an absolute neighborhood favorite for my partner and me. We come here at least once a week for a weekend brunch and I often find myself coming for a weekday breakfast when I have the day off off from work, bringing a book or some school work to work on.

Coffee, service and food are all excellent and I'm happy to return every time.

The dinner theme (tacos, pasta, etc.) nights are also a great deal and a delight when I find myself out for a bite to eat locally.

Four stars because I wasn't absolutely blown away, but I really did like this place.  I keep forgetting that life & great establishments also exist north of my Heights apartment, & I'm glad I ventured up here for brunch with a friend!

A bright, inviting space & for a Saturday at 11, it was pretty quiet - no waiting for a table.  The hostess & server were very nice & also pretty attentive.  I ordered a bellini because "duh," but if I remember correctly, there aren't any mimosa or other drink specials for lunch.  But, at $4 a glass, you can't get too bent out of shape over that.

I also thought that the biscuits & jelly they brought out were phenomenal?!  I don't know anyone else who might get excited over the bread basket.  I try to contain myself, but deep down, this carboholic appreciates a good muffin.

I ordered the Eggs Zanny Omelette: pesto, tomatoes, & cheddar.  Yum, yum, YUM. My friend ordered the french toast, which she also seemed to enjoy.

I will definitely be back, and I look forward to exploring this area a bit more.  Thanks, 181 Cabrini!

I've been here before and loved it but will not be returning after today.
The food was really good but we found a black beard hair in our rice toward the end of the meal which totally made me feel nauseas wondering if I had ingested any other hair. When we pointed it out they didn't even apologize just quickly took the food away and no comp or discount or anything. I've worked in the service industry for a VERY long time and know that you should at least do SOMETHING when a customer finds hair in their food... Also, the toilet in the big bathroom isn't secured to the floor so it wobbles back and forth

This the worst food in the heights. Worst $34 ever spent, I should had gone to the deli and I would have had a better food for cheaper. They don't even take your order at the table. You need to go to the counter to pay and order. They want to act like a restaurant without giving you the serve of one. This is ridiculous !!!
Asked for French fries looked at me like I was crazy. So disappointed never coming here ever again. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME

I have been here twice for brunch and ordered pick up once for dinner.

Place is cute and vibrant.

Service: Good, no complaints

Food:  The food lacks flavor in here. I really want to like this place but they really need to learn about sazon (And when I asked for chorizo on omelette they were cheap with the chorizo).

I can't speak for the rest of the food but the "French toast" I just had was terrible. The menu said "oven baked challah" French toast. Which I'd had before at another place. I expected bread that had been soaked in batter, and then baked, so the I inside is soft tender and puddingy, and the outside is crispy. NOPE NOPE NOPE.
I am not sure why this is called "French toast." The bread was warned and crusty, but I detected no egg batter. The bread was dry. I ate it because I was starving.

So, this place has its ups and downs. It's basic food that is slightly overpriced. The Bruch is good but they serve everything with home fries. When I asked about substituting fries, they said they don't have fries till dinner. This is confusing.

The food is average and two major downfalls are:

1) The desserts are boring and it seems all are in the form of a brownie.

2) The chef needs to learn better Soup technique. They tend to be very watery and vary in taste quality.

The menus hasn't changed in over a year and the selection is boring and borderline diner-esque. This place has potential - just send the chef back to culinary school for some brush up classes.

Every time I come in with a stroller  the staff seem confused by what to do.  I arrived at 330 on a Saturday and the back section with tables and chairs seemed to be closed off.  I asked if I could in the area and they said "no".  I had to leave as the only other option was bar seating/high tops in the bar area.  

Teach your staff what it means to be a neighborhood business and learn how to make accommodations.  It wasn't busy.  Grow your business.
Bad food bad service. Service stinks!  This place rejected a man with a service dog from being in the tables outside! They said they had the right to refuse giving service to anybody they want!

I have never left a bad restaurant review.  Ever.  In fact, I have made it a principle to not do it as there is enough negativity out there and generally no place I have frequented in the neighborhood has routinely offended me.  But this place is special.  I have been here multiple times, pre pandemic.  I didn't notice the first time and we were there with a toddler, so ok; they were really great about that.  I think it was a love bomb, like what narcissists do at the beginning of an entanglement.  But the next time, the food was meh, the next, the server made a fervent recommendation about a dish that he clearly did not know when it came out per said rec, the next, another server refused to take the tables drink order until the final 1/3 of our party arrived to complete the table.  The next the order was wrong, and I want to say that was last fall as we were outside albeit it was quick and it was chilly.  Tonight.  One more shot.  The food was awful.  The dude delivered with no mask on.  We tried to get a refund, I mean it tastes like it came out of a can.   $60 for canned spaghetti and flat ass glorified chicken fingers.  There was no apology no nothing.  I get it, maybe they are just selling off what they can.  Times are rough, I'm really trying here folks.  The Brussels sprouts were banging though.  But, nah.

This is t my first time here despite the first check in...they have awesome breakfast sandwiches as well as a very nice brunch menu. Their pulled poet hash is actually my favorite thing to get after a nice run on the Hudson Greenway. I like to stop here for a nice iced coffee and grab whatever I'm in the mood for.

Staff is very attentive. Came here on a date night and will definitely come back to try out more of their food. I recommend for a coffee date, date night, or if you come with a group. I recommend the wontons as appetizers. They have a decent beer selection on tap.

They give a lot of food and it tastes okay. If I was Gordon Ramsey, I would say it's a 2.5/5 stars. If I was Guy Fieri, I would say it's a 5/5.

They have the worst taste in music. It sounds like ska without being ska.

What a fun place. Was there on Cinco de Mayo. The vibe is youthful, educated and diverse. Everyone of the staff is very friendly. Prices are good, cheaper than many in the City. Food is great with a wide variety and gives attention to detail. I have good feelings about places that cater to the neighborhood and have a broad spectrum of regulars. If you enjoy having a group of friends hangout and relax then I would recommend 181 Cabrini and hide gem in NYC.

Perfect for breakfast/ brunch. Charming little cafe with a comfy feel. Great food, lots of options and decent Portions.

You can pick your own table/seat but must place order that that bar.

Excellent food ! Great vibes from the restaurant Set Up to the vibes from the servers. It does cost above average in the area, but you get quality great tasting food and excellent service for it. So I do t mind at all. Would love to keep coming back here for sure !!

Highly recommended for casual Breakfast or Lunch.

The breakfast I got deserves a 1-star rating. But I am giving the restaurant two extra stars, one for a very pleasant bartender. The second star is simply because, in this neighborhood, we need to encourage any place which is not a deep-ethnic establishment and which is intended for an Anglo clientele. (Dominican food places are a dime-a-dozen here, but some of us don't particularly like this type of food.)

Anyhow, my vegetarian omelette was a pretty sorry piece of work. First of all, the cook was an hour late in showing up this morning. So we had to hang around and sip our beverages while he deigned to show. But it would have been better if he had not. The supposed 3-egg omelette was basically made with 1.5 eggs, then foamed up, then burned on the griddle. Absolutely nothing satisfying about such a meal.

Well then, how about the sides? Yeah, how about the sides? The menu says omelettes come with potatoes. Well, apparently they ran out of potatoes, since my omelette was served with a small bit of green salad. Very unsatisfying. To boot, no bread is served. You generally expect an omelette breakfast to include toast of some kind on the side, but not here. "You gets no bread with one meat ball!" That was a Depression-era folk song, but at 181 Cabrini, "you gets no bread with your omelette." Come on folks, quit being so stingy. Sure, some customers will want bread omitted, but you will make others unhappy if you have an across the board policy of no bread.

Another gotcha is that the Breakfast menu is not served on weekends. On weekends, you have to order from the Brunch menu, where the prices are jacked up. Well, if the food were good, we'd worry about the prices, but that decision does not need to be reached, since you won't get good food.

Conclusion: You are much better off going to Sugar Hill Cafe for your breakfast. Yes, you will have to take the A train for 3 stops, but that's such a short hop, and you will get a truly lovely breakfast.

181 Cabrini is actually a sister establishment to Buddha Beer Bar (yelp.com/biz/buddha-beer…) where you will find a strikingly similar menu for a slightly cheaper price. The main difference between the two is that BBB is a little bit more friendly toward non-regulars than 181.

In full disclosure, I was invited here by a friend who happened to work here. It was cool to see that everyone knew his name and vice-versa (how cliquey). What wasn't cool was the awkward stares from the other folks by the bar. "I wonder who that guy is...?" "I don't think he's from around here." Wow, kids, if I wanted to be judged, I would've gone down to a drag queen bar.

Fortunately, this attitude changed a bit when they realized I knew someone - yes, now I was vetted! The drinks were okay. The food was.... better at BBB. The service was more miss than hit. If it were not for my friend, I don't know when we would've received our order of sliders and fries. (He had to fetch them fro the kitchen himself). I was so hungry that the fries tasted amazing. The sliders were... okay; Nothing too noteworthy. The bar staff (of two) was so overwhelmed that there was no way they could be expected to take care of the 40+ people constantly trying to get their attention.

Moving on.

Big fan of 181 Cabrini. They really pick up the need for a neighborhood space for regulars as several longstanding places have closed over the years in favor of fancier chi-chi places. They have recently stepped up their plating on a few dishes to be truly impressive and delightful. Great happy hour. Nice weekly specials. The breakfast special is great. They could do better on vegetarian variety and being more generous with providing sides on a few items (e.g. tacos). The owner is friendly. Maybe 10 years ago they had live music. I would love to see that again.

This little deli serves great breakfast for cheap. The simple bagel toasted with cream cheese was simple but incredibly tasty. Good reviews on the omelet and other eggs ordered. Check it out when you're in the mood for something quick and yummy.

Been a long hiatus since my last review but currently here at 207 Prime Bar & Grill in the Inwood section of upper Manhattan. Very cool spot with Latin vibes but inclusion if you're not Dominican or Latin decent. Bartenders are attentive and a nice amount of TV screens to accommodate for sports games and such.

Haven't tried their food as of yet but will soon. As for their drinks...let's just say it won't take but much to get toll you feelin a bit nice. Currently here during happy hour and only had one frozen margarita and I will say, its got me feeelin a bit wooooo! lol. Had to get a water to even it out before the next drink. So far worth it to come here if you're looking for a happy hour spot or a spot for a group for an event.

Let's start with the parking...no nothing around cars double parked. They get 1 star for valet but it cost $20 and the Valet doesn't speak English.

We wne tfor brunch on Sunfay.

The atmosphere it looks nice inside but the music is ridiculously loud. You can not talk at your table. Shouting you can't hear the person next to you.

Hookah is free one for the table.  $20 for additional

The Sangria and Mimosa are weak. I did order a coconut mojito it was strong and decent.

The food. We had a table of eight...the only thing edible was the steak. Burgers, pancakes, eggs, chicken all horrible.

I would not recommend coming here.

First of all, don't walk but run to this spot! It is a very nice vibe, a Spanish spot with music bumping throughout the time you are there. The hookah was free for the first and then $20 for a refill. My best friend and I had the empanadas for an appetizer. For the entree, I had the steak and eggs and she had the Mofongo. No complaints. Our waitress was so nice and attentive. All of the staff was attentive as well. And the mimosas keep coming Hunny.

Also, if you can avoid driving please do. The traffic and parking are bananas.

RACIST! We went as a group and they charged the darker skinned people with us and didn't with the lighter or Spanish speakers with us.
Dykeman business owners, Dominicans in general need to know that YOU ARE BLACK! Cut the racism out...we are the same! Weirdos!

So Prime Bar & Grill should be renamed Prime Hookah Lounge. Although in my opinion, it's neither "fish nor fowl".  I came looking for a late dinner and to be fair - the kitchen was open! But the music was loud (couldn't hear my date or the waitress) and the service was so slow. This spot clearly is meant to have more club vibes - after hours all the waitresses put on stripper clothes.  But on the other hand the lights were still bright when we left so I didn't really want to dance.  The DJ is tight though.  Food is decent but salty. Sangria was nice and sweet.  Would consider coming back after midnight if the lighting is down

I asked the Valet guy to park my car he refused !! Then I asked him to move a car up no more then 12 inches so I can park myself he also declined!!  I went inside asked for the owner Ramon and spoke with the manager also spoke with another gentleman who was the "promoter" he then went outside and tried to talk to the valet guy who had a nasty attitude and started arguing with the promoter. What a scandal . I advised them I was moving forward with my money to Inwood around the corner. The employees have much more etiquette here. My first attempt there and last. I advise you not to go there to deal with a bootleg valet worker who wants to be the owner of street parking. Calling 311
Difficult to find parking
Valet would not park my car even with a space right under his nose. I then was going to park myself and he blocked the parking space with a cone! Wow Insane !! I moved onto Inwood around the block where I'm a regular !
Racist establishment!!!! It you aren't Spanish don't not expect any service!! NEVER EVER WILL COME BACJ TO THIS PLACE!

The service was pretty great, the food didn't take too long to arrive. We went for brunch and the dj great playing awesome music. Hookah service fantastic and the food had great portions. Will definitely come back here

I went for brunch for the first time here and I can tell you we loved it only 2 things I didn't like one it was so hot in there I had to keep asking someone to turn the AC on felt like we was going to pass out they turn it on for a min the off did they want to get people drunk faster or pass out dancing it was insane then I got my food was delicious but ate less then half of it asked for a to go box and was told they don't give to go for brunch but minutes later the party next to me asked for theirs to be packed and it was and given a brown paper bag so I'm like they pick and chose takes food home???? Besides those 2 things food drinks environment music were great I would give it a try again hope is not burning hot in there
Food is really good. I enjoyed the chicken empanadas, paella, and steak. The music is great they have a good variety R&B, reggaeton, Afro beats etc. They also have hookah.

Didnt like the service at all, first we ordered the special on a Tuesday they messed up our order food came late, nothing what we ordered, the drinks for the special is 2x1 they will charge for the other drinks so its not 2x1. The bill came put what is wasn't supposed too. Recommend to try another spot...
Zuleica was a great server. Not only did they offer a great ambiance l, but their drinks were amazing! Thank you for such a great time!!
My friends and I come on Tuesdays for their wing specials. Excellent service, very attentive staff, ice cold beers and delicious wings!
Not bad but not good as well,the behaviour should be more appropriate and professional..

if I could give it 0 stars I would the service is horrible they took forever to bring our stuff out then we order a pitcher of a margarita they over charged us charged us 80 the Pitcher tasted like nothing but syrup it was the worst experience ever if your going to have a good vibe this is not the spot it's ghetto they had kids running around the spot grabbing hookahs not recommended the girls bathroom toilet was disgusting

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I went here on 1/28/2022 for some drinks and hookah with my friends. The food was flavorless and not worth the price. I had two coconut margaritas (Only Two DRINKS). As I proceeded to go home, I was so drunk and out of it. There is no way, I should of felt like this after two drinks. I am convinced the bartender put something in my drink or gave us the cheapest tequila they could find. I was throwing up all night, severely nauseous and unable to walk. Please beware of this establishment. DO NOT COME HERE!

If I could give this lounge a -1 I would. This lounge is not for black people nor would I ever go back. The bouncers charged me $80 to get in and charged my Spanish friend $60 and he was a man. On top of letting other Spanish females in there for FREEEE!! In front of me!  I then said I hope your not charging me more than you charge other people and another guy proceeded to tell me.. "I'm lucky" because if it was him he would charge me $150. The only reason I went in was because it was my bestfriends birthday and she was already settled at the section.

Overall our bottle girl was great! But the vibes were trash. The other people at my section was ready to go next door because it was so boring. It looked like the people that were there was regulars.

All in all I give it a -1 would be -5 but the bottle girls were nice.

NEVER AGAIN!
They get my order wrong every. Single. Time. Been going here for years and i know if i go, i will get something i didn't order and if i point it out, they get mad and don't want to replace it.
I recently placed a seamless order two sandwiches waited an hour and half for it when I finally called them they said the order was never printed. Never ordering from this establishment again.
Best breakfast spot with perfectly made coffee and the chefs knocking out the breakfast sandwiches were super nice as well. A great team working environment.
Had a small bday get together here that went great! Good wine. Good little bites. Also took my mom here on another occasion for a quick drink. Kiki absolutely rocks!!!

Cute little bar with a nice wine list and some interesting plates to share. Speaking there of we had the charcuterie board, really enough for 3 or 4 to pick at, olives ( dam good ) and some deviled eggs. We sat at the bar and it was pleasant. I had 2 meh margaritas and my guest had 2 glasses of wine. I pulled a star because of the drinks. But it's a dam cute spot for a quick glass of wine

What a cute happy hour spot! We got a bottle of the Spanish red for $30, a cheese tray, and the arancini. So delicious. A perfect vibe for summer. Our server was sweet and knowledgeable as well, but there was a bit of miscommunication about our cheese tray. She said she would bring us the list of cheeses so we could choose, but she didn't come back for a while and then when we asked her about it, she said that the order is already in, so we didn't get to choose. It still tasted really good though so not too upset about that.
I came for NYE. Their prices are affordable and the happy hour wine is decent. I'd come back for wine if I were in the neighborhood.

A really nice, low key bar tucked away somewhere in East Village! My friends and I decided to stop by for a few drinks and snacks. I got the Con Job cocktail, and we got the baked potato tots and jalapeños cheddar arancini to share. All of it was delicious - I especially enjoyed the arancini, which had a light kick to it. We also really loved the waitress who served us, Kiki. She was so friendly and sweet, and she really made her time there really special! All in all, will definitely stop by again!

We stopped in to just get one drink and stayed for four. We initially stopped by because we had walked a lot and needed a bathroom.

The staff was amazing! And we loved the bacon wrapped dates so much we ordered seconds! We also sent the restaurant to all of our friends!

Our waitress Kiki was fantastic, and so are her floral arrangements!

Highly recommend!

Lively wine bar.
Our experience was subpar, sadly. It was a bit too crowded, too loud. The cold breeze and active air conditioning blowing upon us didn't help. The decor didn't work for us, with a half-open service area in the back left corner. The servers seemed overwhelmed that weekend night.
I gambled on an organic natural Nebbiolo and was not rewarded... too funky, astringent, and hard to drink. My wife didn't gamble on her white (forget which), but that wasn't a rewarding drinking experience either.
We got to watch some patrons stage some tiktoks in the back! That was funny.

I LOVE 8TH STREET WINECELLAR!!! So good, the crowd is amazing so lively in such a cozy cute space. The happy hour is until 8 pm everyday and is such a steal. Great options of white, red, and rose and all glasses are $8 or bottles are $28. You really can't get any better than that! The food was pretty good too.

We were staying across the street at the Marlton and decided to give this place a try. We were not disappointed as we went here 3 nights in a row!
The wine was great
The service was great / informative and attentive
Did not try the food but it looked good
And the ambiance was very cozy

Loved this little wine bar that's tucked away in the West Village. Everything is very reasonably priced! They have happy hour everyday, even weekends! We got a $28 bottle of wine to share at the bar. Kiki was our bartender and she was so fun to talk to. After 8pm, it was crowded! They have so many unique wines, I can't wait to come back!

Really enjoyed our time here! Service is prompt and super helpful. We stumbled into this candlelit spot by Washington square and decided we were going to have a lil girls wine night. We ordered off of the happy hour wine menu which was an amazing deal by the way. We got one white bottle and one red bottle. Everything was delicious, including the tots we ordered on the side! Would definitely come back again for another wine night.

Updating again because I cannot stress enough - I come here for Kiki. Such an intelligent, kind, patient woman AND she keeps me so safe with severe, severe allergies.

I will follow her anywhere and if 8th Street Wine Cellar is where she is, i'm there.

Blink and you miss it...seriously, it's in a basement! Took me a minute to make sure I knew where I was going, but I can't even dock a star for that. 8 buck happy hour till 8pm! AND bottles for 28! Let's go! The bites are nice to share and snack, and come on, charcuterie and wine are like milk and cookies  bring a date, bring pals, bring your cute self and a book.
The music isn't loud here either, or at least before 8 when I'm here. I'd definitely categorize this as a quiet bar.

Extremely disappointing to say the least... my friend and I walked in to get drinks and inquire about becoming servers at 8th Street Winecellar and the woman working at the time could not have been more rude, condescending, or dismissive. Not only would I never want to work at a place like this where the employees are the least bit welcoming or kind, but I will never be back as a customer.

I never post reviews but this was an awful place.

I came here for a happy hour dinner with my friend. We both had white wine paired with these delicious plates. We are OBSESSED with the Mac and Cheese. The patatas have a lovely chipotle aioli to contrast from their starchy texture. Our server Kiera was also so kind to us. The only reason this review is not 5 stars is because it got a bit loud and packed later into the night.
Awesome space; terrific wine list. Rented for private event - the staff was great...small plates were great too.

It's a Tuesday night. You've finally recovered from the weekend and it's time to have a post-mortem with the girls. How did Saturdays' brunch go with Doug? Did you stay over at Chad's? Is Chris looking to move in soon?

8th street wince cellar has great Happy Hour bottles at $28, which means for the price of a wax we can discuss all the sordid details from last week and plan this week's escapades. Amy said said the Montepulciano "tantalized" her tongue. Party sure that's what she described she did to Chris's d!ck last weekend

Give this place a try, but keep the tick-tockers away! No need to blow this spot up with Gen-Z

What is better than happy hour wine to celebrate a sweaty fun 305 fitness work out?

After our work out class, we quickly did a search for good happy hour deals around the neighborhood. This place is just a few stores down from the west village 305 fitness location.

It was semi-full for 5:30 pm on a Wednesday. There seemed to be only one person working, which wasn't an issue. We quickly got water and were able to put a bottle of happy hour wine in for about 28 dollars. The happy hour doesn't include food. The food options looked great. We weren't planning to get dinner here so we split the mushroom quesadilla, which was a great choice!

This will remain a great happy hour option post-305 fitness workout in the future.
I always have a good time at this establishment. They have delicious food, good wine (even on happy hour) and staff are wonderful. I come here a couple of times a month. Def recommend!!

Lovely and cozy place. Food is great, especially the cheese variety. Great place for friends get together, a date or even to have a drink alone. Oh, and happy hour until 8PM! Total win in the Village!

Came here to catch up with some GFs, ordered  oysters, charcuterie, bruschetta ALL 4, and of course a selection  of 4 cheeses for a cheese board!

BTW HH bottles of Wine for $25, blue point oysters for $1! HH until 8pm

Definitely  a place to come hang out, grab a bit, and chat!

I went here for a happy hour with a friend and the experience was beyond lovely (even though we were outside in the cold, because ya know... covid). We were given really warm blankets because we were sitting outside. Our waitress was fantastic and really knew her wines and cheeses. She was able to provide us with really coherent tasting notes for all the wines we asked about. Also $8 glasses for happy hour!

We ended up getting a cheeseboard and two different reds. The accompaniments on the cheeseboard were delightful and they rotate the cheeses so you can come back and have something different every time. Looking forward to coming more frequently once covid is over!

Haven't seen a friend from college since 2015. Since then I've been through three jobs and moved to NYC on my own! How time flies. We've always had major goals to hang out and catch up, but it did not happen until last Friday. My friend picked his place because she's been there before with her boy friend. Happy hour is 4-8 pm and you can get a bottle of wine for $27. We both had two bottles so... one bottle each? Let me tell you, happy hour was very happy. We also got the charcuterie board as well because I haven't eaten much that day. Let me tell you. It is delicious! Good company always seem to boost my ratings by one more star, but this place is a good place for a casual happy hour in the village. 100% recommend!

Happy Hour:
$7 for a glass of wine
$23 bottles of wine
Monday - Friday: 4pm - 8pm
After 8pm - 11pm: $1 oysters

What a gem this place is.
The vibe is GNO/Date Night/Group of friends catching up in a dimly lit room.
I came here on an impromptu date night and there were plenty of seats available at 7:30pm on a Friday.
The 5 different types of cheeseboard will run you $23, but easily shareable - and you can order more bread!
The tater tots - you can skip this because at $9 it's kind of a rip off. The mushroom sauce is what makes it decadent but I still do not feel that the price justifies the portion, and the fact they're just tater tots from a wholesaler.
I'm giving this place 5-stars purely off the fact that I had a really good time, with 0 crowds, pretty late HH specials, and moderate noise level.
Will I be back? Yes and I've already rallied my girlfriends to go with me.

Visited 8th Street Winecellar for happy hour on Saturday night. Delicious food, excellent wine, fantastic prices, and exactly the vibe you hope for when sipping on wine.

Quality: Decided to take advantage of a final happy hour before city restrictions set-in, so visited the wonderful 8th Street Winecellar. They had a solid list of wine bottles with happy hour pricing, of which we indulged in two. And as we enjoyed our wine, we also snacked on the Deviled Eggs and the Meat And Cheese Board. Both perfect dishes to share. The Deviled Eggs were extremely creamy and had a little piece of crispy prosciutto placed on top. The Meat And Cheese Board was a diverse selection of cheeses, meats, pate, and accoutrements. Perfect to play with as you enjoy some wine.
Quantity: The Meat And Cheese Board was impressive, and the affordable wines are easy to keep flowing.
Value: $9 for the Deviled Eggs. $28 for the Meat And Cheese Board. $26 for a selection of Wine Bottles during happy hour.
Ambiance: 8th Street Winecellar is located in Greenwich Village, just two blocks from Washington Square Park. The name is accurate, as it is very much a basement bar. And while you may hesitate upon first look, definitely take that journey downstairs, as the space is ideal. With a long bar on the right, a small kitchen on the left, and plenty of cozy spots to sit, it is everything you need for a fun evening. Candles flickered on every table, the music was a great mix of relaxing jazz, and even as it filled up, the bar maintained its laid back vibe.
Crowd: Quiet during happy hour, but folks poured in later on what many knew would be the last true Saturday for some time.
Service: Extremely friendly bartender. She made sure to take good care of us while also taking social distancing precautions.
Parking: Very limited street parking in the area.

This place is small and super packed during happy hour (4-8pm). That said, the deals are very good - so was thankful that I got a seat at the bar on a Thursday evening.

Again, happy hour special is solid - $7 glasses of house red or white and $24 bottles of various items. Settled on the house red and a plate of olives ($4). Pour is generous considering it's a sale price and actually strong. Olives come with a pot to throw seeds in, topped with oil and chili flakes.

Service is friendly despite the crowd, and never felt I needed to flag anyone down. If you can get a seat, worth the trip.

Great date spot and happy hour spot (4-7PM) for $25 bottle of wine! It's a sister restaurant from Bibi. Love the ambience and it has a dim romantic vibe to it too. The charcuterie board with the chef choice of meat and cheese were delicious! I'd definitely would come back here.

Years since my last review of this place and it keeps getting better. The mac and cheese still slaps. The mussels were excellent. Happy hour price has gone up $5 but still the best deal in town with a variety of really nice wines. On a personal note, my party had an unpleasant interaction with another customer recently. I was incredibly impressed by how quickly and professionally the waitress handled the situation and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort.

The wine is a reason to come, the exceptional service is a reason to stay.

Went for happy hour while waiting for our dinner reservations next door. $24 bottles of wine was a super great deal. Had a dozen oysters, which were great. Cheese and charcuterie board. Excellent. The service was good. Groovy tunes . It was quiet enough to talk to my friends. This was a totally worth while visit!!

Very affordable deals on shareable wine and cheese plates! Wait staff were very attentive refilling wine and water, and checking if we needed anything through our visit. Will definitely return for the cute atmosphere and affordable tasty treats!

Ok so I came back here after 3 years and I can truly say that this place has redeemed themselves in my eyes. I wanted to update this review in complete fairness because I had a totally different experience here the second time around. My friend and I came here on a Friday for happy hour and did the $24 bottles of wine. Rather than waiting for a table which could be time consuming we were lucky enough to grab chairs at the bar. We were hungry so we decided to order a few things; the mushroom quesadilla, the pork sandwich and the fish (tilapia) tacos. To my surprise everything was actually really good and I did not feel sick after as I did the first time I was here. Again, this was a much better experience and I would  definitely come back here especially for the happy hour.

P.S. I was intending to drink the Malbec but it wasn't rich enough for me so I went with the Chardonnay. If you are doing the happy hour bottles ask to try the wine first!

had the most lovely time here! perfect for a first date. incredible happy hour, the waitstaff was so nice helping us pick out which bottle to get. left feeling effervescent. can't wait to return again!

This is one of my favorite spots in the village. Great wine, excellent cheeseboard, standout happy hour. And the service is also outstanding. Special shout-out to Kiki who makes you feel like the only customer at the bar even when they're crazy busy. My only hesitancy is I don't want to build too much hype for this place so I can't get a table at happy hour! Highly recommend.
Just overheard a waitress cussing out a customer, also honestly terrible service and unsanitary. There was hair in my food and a roach in my drink. Absolutely disgusted.

I wish 8th Street Winecellar was by my apartment or maybe not because then I'd be a new member of AA with a belly full of cheese and cold cuts.   BUT, no matter how far this place is, I'll venture out for girls nights. Why you ask??? Because 8th Street Winecellar has the best best best happy hour!!! Their $23 bottle of wine tastes smooth and delicious. Pair the bottle with their meat and cheese board and you'll be a happy camper. Service was over the top and I cannot wait to go back to this place. Now go check out their happy hour and order a bottle or 5. Enjoy!

YESSSS. THIS PLACE IS SPECTACULAR!

I came here for the amazing $24 bottle of wine during their happy hour which ends at 8 PM. The service was impeccable and attentive. The waitresses made sure we always had water in our glass and our wines were filled.

We got two different bottles of wine, a Malbec and a 2017 wine (I forgot the name). Anyways, I'm definitely coming here more often because of the affordable wines. I came on a Monday night and it wasn't crowded at all.

Highly highly recommend this place to catch up with friends! It's also pretty romantic so a great place to bring a date as well.

I never knew this place existed. It's tucked away on a quiet street, and down a few stairs. If it weren't for their $1 oyster ad outside I would've never gone in. Glad I did.

Service and cocktails are great. I had some spicy version of a margarita and it was excellent. The oysters were Blue Point and also very good, ask for Tabasco.

Come here for their happy hour! My friend and I split a bottle, which they end up pouring 3 glasses each for us. Well worth the money.

Happy Hour: 5 - 8 PM Weekdays.
$7 for a glass of White/Red/Rose/Prosecco.
$23 for a bottle of White/Red/Rose/Prosecco.

We did not order any food as we had made plans to eat nearby. However, the table next to us got the fish taco and the cheese plate which looked great! I don't know how they would taste, though.

Overall, it has a nice ambiance and chill place to catch up with your friends or bring your date. We were here on a Friday night around 7:30 so it was quite packed and a bit loud but it didn't affect us from having a great time.

I will definitely visit this place again and next time, I will try the food here as well.
Best happy hour hands down. Male and female waitresses helped  us. My glass stayed filled. Great customer service with a smile.  Come here!

Happy Hour. 4-7pm daily. $21 bottle of wine / $6 per glass of wine.
Of course, I had to take advantage of this. I showed up on a Friday night around 6 pm and managed to snag a table with my girlfriends.
The wine is extremely reasonable, so we got a bottle of white and a bottle of sparking. We also had the potato skins which was not bad.
This place isn't loud, its very chill and relaxed. Perfect for dates, perfect for small groups who like to be able to hold a conversation without shouting.
Love this wine bar. It also has great happy hour daily till 8pm! Can't wait to come back soon.

This is a hidden gem. Came for HH which offers $25 bottles of wine and $8 glass on the wine of the day (one red and one white). Not at all crowded on a Hump Day Happy Hour, and cozy as can be. Great for a first date. We split a bottle of Carménère (12.50 a person...yassss) and the fig, bacon, and mascarpone app. Delish! Great spot to get away from the crowded happy hour spots in the village and the bartender always kept my water full. Would def recommend!

My wife loves this place. I came to check it out and found it to be very cool. This is a perfect date spot. As we noticed a lot of people were on dates.

This place has a chill vibe and good wine. Not much more you could ask for!

It isnt fancy either like some wine bars. This creates a great relaxing atmosphere which is something i like.

Enjoy!

Went here for happy hour with some girlfriends today to split a bottle of wine! Great deal with $25 bottles was able to give all 4 of us a decent sized glass. However the only thing they have is wine and beer with some appetizer foods.

The atmosphere was really nice although dark and loud from conversations since the whole place was full of people! I think this would be a great date spot.

Overall good experience.

I came back here again on Thursday night and had a much better experience this time around. The server we got this time was a lot more friendly and outgoing, and the staff who helped us made this experience a lot more pleasant. This time around, it was on par with Bibi.

The atmosphere was just as nice as the time before, maybe even a bit better because it wasn't nearly as crowded as when we went the last time (a Wednesday, a little early on in the evening).

I ordered the Cune Rioja, which is a wonderful bottle, and saw a couple of other bottles on the list I'm definitely interested in trying in the future. For glasses, I still say the Corvina is one of the best.

I'll be back in the future for some more bottles!
Great happy hour with $22 bottles. The food is all very homemade and as the night goes on you realize this is a very homy  spot that leads to great nights

Stumbled upon this place straight after a disappointing anniversary dinner at Amèlie. It was a pleasant contrast to my meal prior. The atmosphere was chill and dimly lit.

I ended up sitting at the bar and having Sam take care of my boyfriend and I. She was super friendly and funny, also made very good suggestions on the menu. We got a few drinks, the last of the $1 oysters special, and a S'more in a Jar to share.

My cocktail; Hot Nikkers was awesome. I loved that it was very very spicy, maybe too much for most people. You don't get much of the mango flavor from it but I didn't mind. Boyfriend got the Mary'ann and Ginger, the drink was like a dark and stormy. This one was alright.

Dessert was interesting, very gooey and I got the graham cracker flavor but the chocolate was in an unexpected form. This dessert is more like a crumbly cake with toasted marshmallow.

Next time I'm in NYC, I'll probably stop by again for the late night oyster special.

Pretty nice place for happy hour in Greenwich. We went there on a Thursday night, made it before HH which ended at 8. They have bottle of wine specials $22 each, with a handful of options. We had the sauvignon blanc which was pretty nice..

Pretty good vibe, my only complaint was the loud noise, I literally had to shout across the table to talk... maybe I should sit at the bar next time

Didn't get to try any of the food this time but I saw some cheeseboards and they looked yummy!

Super cozy and intimate spot for drinks! My friend and I found this place by chance while walking to another popular wine bar, and it's become one of our fave places to have some drinks and catch up. The vibe is pretty lowkey and warm, and there's plenty of seating. They have a ton of great wine options as well as cocktails. Our server/bartender was super helpful and patient with us because we couldn't choose what drinks and food to get, and she gave awesome recs, including 3 amazing cheeses for our charcuterie board. I love that there was no obligation to be rushed out, and it's a great place for a date or to hang out with friends!

We just happened upon this place by chance and boy were we lucky! The wine we had on happy hour was excellent, the cheese plate paired wonderfully, and the wait staff was charming and helpful. We would have stayed there longer if not for a reservation. We'll be back for sure!

Let me start off by saying, we had the most incredible time at Tres Giovani and I look forward to returning in the future. Before we even stepped foot into the restaurant, the staff made accommodations for our party of seven to arrive almost forty minutes earlier than our reservation which started us off to a great night. Throughout dinner, our waitress and other staff members attended to our needs quickly- checking in on us often and making sure everything was enjoyable.
For an appetizer, the table shared calamari and we all were wanting more. It was grilled instead of fried and was seasoned perfectly.
For entrees, I don't think you can go wrong with any of the dishes but personally, I felt that the ravioli and duck legs were the stars of the night- however, every dish was flavorful, beautifully presented with decent portions.
We ordered multiple desserts as well as espressos and enjoyed it all. The tiramisu was not overly sweet or heavy, which was the perfect treat to our night. The biscotti was also a nice finish.
Not to mention, the atmosphere was cozy and perfect for a family dinner. Our party was set up towards the back of the restaurant which allowed us a bit more privacy and space. As we did celebrate a birthday, the staff provided us a lit candle upon request!
Overall, we had a fantastic evening and left with full stomachs! Highly recommend!

I'd give this place two thumbs up and then some. The quaint location and decor of this Italian restaurant feels like a bistro straight out of Italy. Great service by the wait staff and the menu has too many excellent options to count!

Nestled in LaGuardia Place so if you're not looking for the bistro lights and Cafe tables outside, you'd miss it just walking by. But they are a neighborhood favorite and on my visit, plenty of regulars were spotted here. It was a solid lunch spot and I'm sure the dinner is something to be desired. Menu of appetizers have a little of everything - cheese plate, fig salad, crabmeat cocktail appetizer, grilled calamari (which I had and totally recommend), soup, and even eggplant.

For Entrees, there's a list of pasta dishes or proteins to choose from. I had a hard time choosing given so many tasty choices. In the end, my waiter made the final decision for me between the two pasta dishes - ravioli de fungi (mushrooms) was the winner (tagliatelle ragu was the second choice). I saw that they also serve pizza and it looked amazing.  I wanted pasta this visit so I'll have to return to try that. Our waiter was attentive and easy on the eyes. Wink wink

The place is a very cozy date night spot and the service is great. We started out with the Burrata which was delicious but the beets and pistachios did nothing to add or elevate the dish in any way would've even been better to just for a simple tomato and burrata combo at that point.

I was recommended by a friend and  I just had to order the Mushroom Ravioli and it was not bad but it was not memorable. It was very simple in flavor and very underwhelming.

My best friend got a special which was a Fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp and asparagus. We joked over how it felt that the chef got 3 shrimps cut it into tiny pieces and spread it around. I did like her dish more cause there was much flavor to her dish. But honestly it reminds me of the kimchi udon from Izakaya Mew.

We also ordered the duck legs but we thought they forgot about this dish since they had waited til we finished our pasta to serve it to us. Which sucked to realize since we had been eating super slowly waiting for the duck to eat with our pasta. We took a bite and it was just okay. The cranberry sauce is just cooked cranberries no sauce. It was giving thanksgiving Turkey honestly. We took the rest home but I i wish I had eaten at the rest because when I cut into it at home it was still raw.

We had the chocolate mousse at the end which was really good but very sweet.
Dinner was good but it wasn't great.

I very rarely give 5 stars, this to counter the one-star reviews left by mean spirited customers! :)

This was our second time here -

we ordered the vegetable pizza as an appetizer     4.5/5  - amazing
chicken marconi, in lemon butter sauce   4.5/5  -- amazing
the owner/chef brought us complimentary vegetable sides, and he came out to greet us. a cordial gentleman

the first visit I had gnocchi  3/5   - a bit disappointing
Salmon      4/5  -very good

friendly service. so yes, the wait staff is a big young, and service maybe not perfect, but very friendly and prompt. our young waiter looked like a model, eye candy for my girlfriend and daughter  :)

reasonably priced and good Italian restaurants are hard to find. this place is a hidden gem off the beaten path

We sat in their outdoor dining enclosure which had an overhead heater for each table so it felt cozy and comfortable. The service was very attentive and the food was delicious! Bread was offered with a spicy tomato paste and olive oil to start.

I ordered the mushroom ravoli and it was superb! The sauce was creamy and rich with flavor. My friends also enjoyed their pasta dish! Finally, we topped off the meal with an espresso martini, which tasted amazing. I would definitely want to come back!

Bottom line up front: Do NOT eat here!

How bad was our dining experience at Tres Giovanni?

Well, consider this:

Upon dropping our daughter off at her dorm and returning to our suite, my wife promptly prepared a bowl of cereal for herself.

We had literally the worst service ever experienced at a restaurant.

Granted, the wait staff looked like they were still in high school, and the servers couldn't care less about our requests.  But still - DO NOT EAT HERE!

I am not sure how and/or why this place stumbled upon a 4.5-star rating, but it was certainly NOT for the food...and it could not have been for the exceptionally crappy service.  Importantly... we noticed that other diners were quite peeved about the horrific service, too.

The chicken parmesan sauce tasted like a watered-down jar of Ragu. The chicken *AND* the penne pasta, though cooked well, suffered badly under the siege of such a bland, tasteless sauce.

The grilled salmon was actually prepared well.  However, the discombobulated veggies of chunks of avocado, halved grape cherries, and sliced red onions looked (and tasted) like a medley in search of a conductor; it was a dish that needed SOMEthing to bring it together.

And please, please do NOT order the watery, bland "creamy Yukon Gold mashed potatoes." My spouse actually took the cold, watery slush of a mess to the manager and asked them to be heated; he returned with a verbal warning to "Be careful with the hot plate."  He forgot to mention that, though the potato plate was a tad bit warmer, the watery, tasteless potatoes were as cold as they were when they first graced our table.  

Even if I were to half-jokingly consider myself a foodie, there is/was simply no excuse for the absolutely horrific service.  

Our waiter wrote down our respective orders, and a server brought the dishes out about 15 minutes later... and then we never saw them again.

They literally avoided eye contact with us for the next 57 minutes.  After I raised my voice to ask for our bill, after 15 minutes of nothing, my spouse had to leave her seat yet again to request our check.  There is simply no excuse for such poor service.

Overall rating: 1.5; the location/proximity to the university gets them a (1); the real gas lamp at the tables garners an extra half-star.

Bottom line: Do NOT eat here.

Excellent pizza and sword fish. We sat outside in the shell and our server was great. My LO was asking if we get a flower on our table and he gave us one from the neighboring table...lol
We got a sample of a black and white mousse cake and it was delicious

Really cute spot. Very intimate setting with limited seating indoors and small covered outdoor seating area. Beautifully decorated. I had pizza and a glass of wine. Pizza is personal size, thin Crust. Ingredients were very fresh. Almost felt like I was back in Italy. I really love this place.

Me and my mother  went here early September while Outdoor Dining only rule, it was Friday afternoon, not looked so busy nor hectic.
They open a few outdoor table in front of the window and  sidewalks where we can keep distance of  each customer.
Each table were clean and server has mask as well.

My mom ordered mushroom soup , I ordered  buffalo mozzarella caprese as starter. I actually was so excited since the his day's special was rack of lamb that my favorite, Their  Lamb was great,  really fresh and juicy, tasty.
+Please  see the pictures I posted as well+++
I was full but I couldn't skip dessert and we ate Tiramisu and panna cotta complete!

The atmosphere were really cozy neighborhood gem, My picky mommy satisfied  their service.
I recommend to go there for a change during lockdown.

+++
I think if ppl complain about  poor service, I know ppl like weekend brunch and will be packed everywhere, then people are gather limited area.  so we must be patient and consider  each other, respect esentiall workers otherwise lets avoid stressful situation and dine out for week day as much as possible.

This place is a hidden gem. Came for lunch , enjoyed the crab tartare and watermelon gazpacho soup. Both dishes light and refreshing. Yummy panna cotta  dessert . Coffee on point. Charming decor and waitstaff. Will be back to try the entrees another time. Highly recommend.

My experience here was absolutely awful. This is one of the worst "Italian" restaurants you can go to. I came with my friends and the service provided was absolutely horrible. I asked for water/ appetizer did not receive it. Eventually my food had arrived cold and undercooked. I was rushed to finish my meal being watched by the manager. The waiter than came over took my food away and gave me my check , implying I need to get out.

I can't believe this place is still in business. If you can do not spend a dollar here!!!!! I'm furious. Absolutely disgusting. If I could give this place zero stars I would.

Please save yourself the humiliation, discomfort and lack of respect from another human being at this restaurant. I will never come back.
Ate here with a group of friends and had a great time! I ordered the burrata pizza and it was delicious. The staff was friendly and the prices were reasonable. I'll definitely be back!

A friend of mine and I went to lunch and . It took a good 20 minutes for our pasta to arrive . My friends pasta has a hair in it and we showed it to the person who delivered our food, he apologized and   said that he would get another one . The manager never  came out to apologize. He  was standing inside playing with his hair . When she received a new plate of  pasta  we both started to eat and my pasta was not cooked , in fact  it was crunchy . This time we asked our server to please get the manager. She came back and said that the manager stated that he was too busy to talk to us. He was still inside playing with his hair so I picked up my plate and we went inside. He told me he was in a meeting and it would be 20 minutes. I said I would wait all day. He then became very irate and started screaming at us, grab my plate, threw it in the garbage and told us to leave the restaurant. He was  was actually scary as I thought he was going to physically attack us. We left the restaurant, making sure to tell everybody about the hair in our food. I stepped on the sidewalk to get a tip for the waitress, and he was screaming at me to leave immediately.  When I mentioned that I was trying to tip the server, he told me not to do it to just leave. Again, this man was scary. I really thought he was gonna attack me or throw something at me With the hair in the food, the uncooked pasta, and the crazy manager I would strongly recommend that you dine elsewhere . If he reacted like this over a compliant then I would suggest that you go somewhere safer to eat where they care about the customer and the staff

I made a reservation las minute for a special occasion. We were 12 people. They prepared a beautiful table. The ambiance was peaceful, sophisticated and perfect if you want to enjoy great company and being able to talk and listening.
The food is really great and it was served quickly. Also their wine selection is great!

Thanks to Leo for an amazing service and thank you so much to the all team for an amazing dinner.
I highly recommend this restaurant.

Delicious food but ......... they sometimes take reservations and other times not. I have been a customer since the restaurant opened and neighborhood resident. I've been told by the manager and owner with the ponytail who thinks he's gods gift to women with an entitled attitude DOES NOT honor your reservation when I took 7 people out of dinner. The bill would have easily been over $1k. My reservation was even confirmed.

Great food, terrible owner. The staff, servers, bar tenders and kitchen are lovely and professional. What can you do but take your money else where?!

Pompous nasty and rude.   Stay away from these nasty people.  Wait staff so nice but manager awful.   Simply awful.  
Pizza good food decent. But with someone as pompous and rude as him    There are other great restaurants   In the area
Came  from upper west side was highly recommended.  However  never ever. To many good venues Uptown and Downtown.Avoid. . Told the person who recommended and they too agree the Manager is nasty and rude     Doesn't take to any criticism either.

I had the worst experience of my restaurant life in Tre Giovanni. The manager was unbelievably rude, giving the two of us a table tucked into a corner although the restaurant was empty and remained largely empty while we were there. The manager said no in a rude manner when I asked if we could sit at a better table. In addition, the table he assigned was situated under the microphones and when I asked if he could lower the music at least until the restaurant was more crowded, he said that if we did not like the restaurant we should leave--again with a rude brusque manner. This is a loud restaurant, he said; don't try to change us, just leave and don't come back if you don't like it. Needless to say we finished the drink we had ordered and left.

Exquisite meal with a very pretty, exotic, and cozy vibe inside! I have a soft spot for places that clearly show that management put thought into their decor and vibe, and let me tell you, it shows here. It's not a huge place, so if you're coming on a weekend, perhaps it's better to make a reservation. On a weeknight though, it wasn't necessary. Tried a bunch of things here:

Iced tea - unsweetened and unflavored, but that's how I like my iced teas! It was a big refreshing glass.

Grilled calamari - not a big portion, absolutely delicious, and a good one to share.

Flounder - comes with a handful of wonderful veggies, the filet was a tad too salty for me, but was soaked in tons of citrusy lemon, which made me enjoy it to the max. Do people say "to the max anymore?"

Lamb - a larger-than-life portion, big enough to take half to go, and comes with mozzarella cubes and cherry tomatoes. The lamb was great.

Side of cannelloni beans - loved! A big portion for a side.

Only taking off a star because the service wasn't that friendly or welcoming, and they actually forgot our side until we asked for it. Otherwise, I enjoyed my time here. It's a great place for a date. Intimate to the max!

This place is lovely; decorated with art, mirrors, and roses at every table. The servers there were very cordial and attentive. The food did take a bit long to come, but it was worth the wait.

Ordered: 1 app, 2 pastas

Came with fresh warm bread and a tomato dip on the house.

Calamari: grilled squid in garlicky lemon sauce/olive oil
---------------------------------------------
This was fresh, lemony, garlicky. I really enjoyed it. I also soaked up the sauce with the bread that they provided. So good. It's light and pleasant.

Ravioli Funghetto:  ravioli in mushroom sauce
---------------------------------------------
This pasta was very rich and creamy. Delicious but it can feel a bit heavy after a few bites. The ravioli was stuffed with cheese and then the whole dish was generously coated in a creamy mushroom sauce. They also provide cheese grating and fresh cracked pepper for each pasta dish.

Rigatoni Buttera: rigatoni with pork sausage bits, green peas, in creamy tomato sauce
---------------------------------------------
Yum! I would get this again. It's bright from the tomato, spicy and sweet from the pork sausages (you can request beef sausages too), creamy from the sauce. Everything complimented each other very well. It was very flavorful yet not too heavy nor overwhelming that I could finish the whole dish. I soaked up the extra sauce with the warm bread they provided. Delish!

Passion fruit sorbet:
---------------------------------------------
This was a good dessert to finish off with. It comes with 2 scoops of sorbet; ideal for 2-4 people cause it's relatively big scoops and we were pretty full after all the food. It's light, sweet, and a bit tangy/zesty. I really liked it.

Overall, I would recommend this place. It's good for 2-4 people groups or even singles because the place is a bit small and there were only 2 servers. Very polite and very good service.

Made an outdoor reservation Thurs night for Fri night. Am a regular customer at this restaurant. Arrived on time. There was a vacant table and were told a couple with a dog had a reservation. Even though we had a reservation also and had arrived before them, we could not have the table. When we left the table was still vacant and I was told that I was being "entitled" because I wanted them to honor the reservation. Not fair. Luckily there are many italian restaurants better than this one in Greenwich Village. Won't return.

G

Came here looking for good Italian food during a trip to New York. We needed an Italian restaurant within walking distance of the area we were in at the time and it came up on Yelp or Google. Overall everything I had was average to good. It could also be due to what I ordered.

I had the chicken breast which was done pretty well. Good flavor and nicely cooked. It came with a small amount of potatoes and veggies on the side, just the right portion. I also got a side of mixed baby greens I think. I didn't realize other veggies already come with it. My friend had the lasagna. I tasted it and it was good! I may have secretly liked it a little more than my entree, but I was trying to avoid anything too heavy or with a lot of carbs that day. I didn't care for the bread and brushetta they served for our starter. The bread was hard and not good. I typically like toasty bread but there's a difference when its like toasty fresh and just hard. Plus, I didn't get much taste and thought the oily tomato paste spread would help some, but it didn't. Coming from someone who loves bread this was tough. We didn't do dessert.

The restaurant itself was really cute with indoor /outdoor seating and lovely decor. I loved the look and feel of it. Only wish the food I ordered matched that. Maybe I could've ordered a little better, but perhaps I ordered healthy. The service was ok, but nothing to write home about. I'll round up to 4 stars because the quality of food and the establishment still seemed up to par.

Ambiance /Location /Decor : 5
Food : 3.5-4
Service : 3.5-4

A horrible horrible experience! I would strongly and confidently recommend anyone to not go there, period! We booked a table for me, my fiancé and her family for a Saturday night dinner. We got there on time. However, that tall, long haired, shaved dude made us wait 15 min outside for no reason; even though out table was ready.  He had an attitude for us all night long. He was super rude for literally no reason. I would left the restaurant immediately; however, my fiancé's family was there and it was too late to book anywhere else. In the end of the night, I asked him the reason of his attitude to us; but this dude start yelling at me and cursing at me. It was such an horrific night. The worst dinner experience. I am not even gonna mention about their food- I am posting this review, because I don't want anyone else have such an experience.
Good service and good food. Everything tasted authentic. Glasses were kept filled and presentation was great.
Food Is consistently amazing as is the service. Even when I order for delivery. My favorite Italian in the west village area.

Hidden gem! Such a cute little restaurant , everything we ate was amazing. The burrata pizza and chicken martini are a must try. The waiters are attentive and friendly and reasonable pricing. Will be coming back!
The host was very rude. the services is very slow. They don't change the silverware between appetizers and entrees.
I visited for lunch. The Penne Rosé Carobonara is one of my fave Italian dishes in the Village so far! Friendly, attentive staff.

Good baby friendly food. The mushroom Raviolli was nice. Their Tiramisu is very good. The pizza and eggplant starter were ok, not too exciting. Actually, the stuffed eggplant starter tasted like an average dish you might get on a plane.

Given COVID, I haven't dined in person here, but my boyfriend and I have ordered pick-up twice and MY GOODNESS! Consistently al dente scrumptious pasta each time. The first time, I went a little too overboard and got:
- Melanzane Al Forno (starter): layered eggplant baked with tomato and mozzarella; not life changing but very good
- Polenta (side): made with gorgonzola cheese and truffle tartufata; I wasn't a fan but my boyfriend was smitten so what do I know
- Penne Rosé Carobonara: with prosciutto in a tomato-cream sauce; OH MY GOD this is where the lip-smacking comes in
- Taglierini Pesto: With a basil pine nut pesto sauce; similarly WOW

It had been a few weeks and we had a hankering for pasta again, and true to our memory, the pasta was perfectly soft-but-firm with flavor that complimented without overwhelming the dishes. This time, I swapped mine out for Rigatoni "Buttera" (with hot & sweet sausage, green peas, tomato-cream sauce). I was nervous because I usually am not a green peas gal, but honestly I'm about to reheat my leftovers for lunch and could not be more excited.

Plus, our order came with their signature bread (sadly not heated but I threw it in the toaster), cute little butter cups, and extra parmesan! Who doesn't love extra cheese.

I'm nervous about eating in person given the other reviews, but I probably will anyways because the food is just so good!

Literally don't come here. The waitress and the manager were SO rude and unprofessional. When we asked for the price of the family style pasta/salad options we were treated with hostility and condescension, as if we shouldn't even be eating there if we cared at all about the money we were spending. The manager promised us it would be cheaper than if we all ordered our own plates, but he still WOULD NOT give us a concrete number. I finally put my foot down and we all just ordered our own plates. We found out from another table that we would have been paying at least 20 dollars more per person had we listened to the manager, which would have been ON TOP of the 16 dollars worth of water we never asked for and were never informed cost money. I would prefer to believe he was just ignorant rather than deceitful, but either way, if you can't give your customers an accurate price for something after they literally beg you for it, you really should not be a manager.

Then to top everything off, most of us didn't even like the food we were already being overcharged for.

This restaurant is terrific now with wonderful staff and delicious food .  

They just need to go much easier on the sauce! I don't like rice pastored ruined by so much heavy heavy sauce so just ask them to be light on the sauce and you'll enjoy your meal!

I highly recommend it.

This is consistently the best meal in the Village. It is a small restaurant with 15 plus tables in the dining room and 4 outside. In the summer I love sitting out for a late afternoon lunch. I have three favorite dishes:
1) Any pizza! Bread and sauce outstanding
2) The ruccala salad adding sautéed mushrooms and tomatoes.
3) the chicken Martini. Basically a chicken piccata that is extremely tender and always delicious.

I often order the specials for an entree and have not had a bad experience. If the swordfish is a special, order it!
Finally, they make a great cappuccino. A wonderful way to finish your meal.
We enjoyed a great evening here for my wife's birthday. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Pollo Martini is very good. Cozy atmosphere.

3 Gio is so charming! Their waitress, Dory, is lovely and very thorough. The busser, Porfino, is exceptionally attentive and quick. And of course, the food is delicious! I highly recommend choosing one of their carefully curated nightly specials, indulging in a pizza pie, the salmon tartare and of course, a pasta dish. I have brought several friends here now and each one vows to be a regular. This restaurant is a must. 10/10

Spontaneously ended up at 3 Giovani on a Friday night with my boy friend. The staff was very friendly and the ambiance is romantic. They serve freshly made bread that is on the house -- it was warm, soft and came with a delicious tomato olive oil dip. We got a special pomegranate salad  that was very yummy too. The main courses however were average. We got the chicken parm and steak special. I asked for the steak to be cooked medium rare but it was over cooked and not juicy. Might go back at some point and try their seafood  options.

What a small gem.

The owner was awesome and manages to seat my friend and I even though it was a busy Saturday night and we had no reservation.

I recommend the mushroom ravioli; it's one of the best I've had. The bread and butter was so yummy. We also had the burrata salad which I highly recommend.

Wonderful service and overall lovely experience. I'm definitely returning.

I used to love coming here for lunch and dinner-until today. I was treated quite poorly by the hostess, acting as though I was going to use the bathroom and then run away, even though I have been to this establishment many times before. The tone in which I was talked to made me feel like I was a criminal. They have a great gluten-free option (Gluten free penne in place for the Cavatelli), but unless the treatment changes, I don't see myself coming back.

3 Giovanni is an absolute gem! We had to wait outside 10 minutes for our table and the waiter brought us a complimentary glass of wine which I thought was a nice touch. The service was excellent and food was brought it quickly (but not too quickly). Split a pizza, 3 apps, and 3 pasha dishes between 4 people and everything was delicious! Highly recommend for a date night.

3 Giovanni does NOT check for vaccination status of guests! After a British woman laughed about the NYC mandate with her European friends, we asked to be seated outdoors. Luckily it was a warm afternoon. Otherwise the food (pizza & fettucine with salmon) was good. Our waiter was attentive.

We had a good time at the restaurant. We enjoyed the food and the waitress was good. At the end of the night the owner had a quarrel with us. He was argumentative, demeaning and lacking any form of professionalism. I would never go back or recommend anyone to this restaurant, unless it is under a new owner. No one should be treated in such a manner.

Terrible staff! Our party of four was waiting outside the not crowded restaurant for 8 minutes without being attended, despite waitors being at the door. We asked for a menu several times and did not get one. Finally, I saw a waitor holding 6 menus and said Can I please get a menu? The waiter said Yo... no. It was in a rude way and we left. Very stuckup restaurant. There was a dress code outside the restaurant and we made sure we matched it before even asking for the menu and still were denied service.

Ran by nasty disrespectful men, I'm unsure if this is the owner or management and  I do not say this lightly but truly they just seem like disgusting people. I overheard one of the men calling himself the business owner and then proceeding to call a customer from the store next door trash when she kindly asked him not to smoke right infront of the bench they were eating on. When an employee from the nearby store intervened  he was still rude and unwilling to move. Next time go smoke infront of your own customers eating if it's no big deal to you. Wouldn't bother giving these disrespectful arrogant assholes my business and nor should you!

Had a horribly obnoxious experience. I called to check if there was any availability and they immediately told me "no, there won't be for the next two and a half hours." I was nearby so I went to go check for myself because it didn't seem right. When I walked by, all of the outdoor dining was empty, and only two tables inside were full. A woman approached me as I walked in the restaurant, I asked if she had any availability and she said yes and was about to seat us, and then her boss immediately came behind her and cut her off. He rudely looked us up and down and with a condescending tone asked "will you be dining here tonight?" We said yes, are there any tables inside? (It was 50 degrees outside) he said "no, all tables are taken for the next two hours" he was about to walk away and we had to ask about outdoor seating at least, to which he reluctantly said we could have a wobbly corner table outside that was not under a heater, meanwhile there were five empty tables under heaters. we assumed the other tables were reserved, but as we were eating we noticed another group walk in and he asked them if they would like to be seated outside or inside. It was clear because of our appearance or attire he did not want us inside his restaurant even though we were in decent dining attire, of course nothing like the pretentious fancy suit he was wearing. Throughout our entire experience no one came to the 'taken' outside tables under the heaters. It was clear there were no reservations and he purposefully sat us at the worst table. The waitress was not friendly or welcoming, did not say any words to us other than "hi." I will definitely not be bringing my business here and will be telling people about how rude and judgmental the owner / host is.

I really enjoyed my entire meal experience at Tre Giovani. The place is small and oh so lovely. We sat outside which is adorned with soft lighting and beautiful greenery. The linguini with clams, mussels and calamari was delicious though the best part was the sirloin steak which was cook exactly as requested. The bruschetta appetizer was pretty good though I didn't care much for the stuffed green pepper. I found it to be soggy and could have been better if breadcrumbs were added to the stuffing and baked instead of sautéed. The chianti and Pinot Grigio by the glass perfectly complimented our meal. The owner Gent was lovely, welcoming and treated us very well. The staff gets a 10/10 for pleasantness and attentiveness. Such a wonderful gem!
