Very cute small Italian restaurant. Our evening started out ok but as it got busier our server's attention to us plummeted. Did not receive one of the dishes I ordered. When I pointed that out he basically shrugged his shoulders. His assistant was much more attentive. My guest enjoyed the cod special. I had the rigatoni. Sauce was good but pasta too al dente (undercooked). Bread very good. Loved the octopus appetizer.

Five stars based on a short visit but already can't wait to go back! My friend and I stopped at 3 Giovanni for a glass of wine and a snack. It was late afternoon and I was a bit worried we'd be snubbed for just having some wine and a cheese plate. Quite the opposite! We were welcomed warmly and service was fantastic. We had a cute little table outside, which allowed for great people watching. Given the restaurant's location on LaGuardia Place it's relatively quiet and pleasant to sit out. The wine list was well curated and well priced. The menu looked fantastic but as mentioned we were just there for a snack. So on to the cheese plate. Basically I felt like I was in Paris or Rome. Delicious, varied cheeses, both hard and soft, mild and a harp. Grapes, nuts and honey as complements, and the bread was simply outstanding. I would go back just for the bread, that's how good it was. This place is a true gem in a neighborhood that's a bit of a dining desert. Can't wait to return.

We happened upon this restaurant for lunch one day, and we all agree that it was an incredible find!  Everything was so delicious and authentic.  Some of the dishes had homemade pasta, which was so yummy.  The service was impeccable, and it had a nice, upscale yet casual atmosphere.  I'm so glad I didn't plan lunch that day because this restaurant was not ti be missed.

I love the aesthetics of this restaurant, it's adorable. I've had their pizzas and pastas, both are great! Unfortunately, their service is horrible. We even made a reservation and the staff literally kicked us out after only being there for 45 minutes. Very rude:/

SO OFFENDED!
I was seated for at exactly the time of my reservation. AND THEN MOVED TO TWO OTHER TABLES, so that other parties could be seated. My final seating was by the kitchen behind a wall, rather than the table in the front, where I might be seen.

Surprisingly, even though the restaurant wasn't full, I COULD NOT GET A MENU, until other Diners were done with the limited number of menus available.

I asked to see the Manager, but he/she was TAKING A WALK DESPITE the sub-zero temperatures and gusting winds.

This is by far the most insulting dining experience I have ever had in NYC.

(Why did I stay? I was meeting Beau for dinner and dashing to nearby theater)

UPDATE - Manager returns. Supports Waitstaff's behavior.
Lesson here, 'Screw you to Single Diner'

One of my favorite lunch places to order from. I love the octopus, cooked to perfection. The salmon is great. Nicely cooked and served with avocado asparagus, cherry tomatoes and onions. The pasta is good too and the lunch special always has a nice potion of salad and very good bread and butter. I have only tried the butera though, enough to know they know pasta. My only complaint, but it is enough for me to sometimes not order from them is that their delivery guy always call telling me he left his ID and cant come up to deliver to the door. Kinda annoying!

This is one of the last $1.00 pizza places and also one of the BEST tasting pizzas I've ever had in my life.

Pros

- Unbeatable price
- Quick Service
- Better than any trendy Tik Tok spot
- Consistent
- Friendly Service

Cons

- there's only one location

Rating is solely for consistency. Otherwise it's the usual mid 2 like most dollar spots outside of a couple bad ones for the deal.

The is the best of the dollar spots. It's been around a while right in front of the subway and compared to most of them it's tiny and good. For the prices, they are abnormally consistent compared to every dollar slice spot. I have gotten bad slices from other spots but nope, never here. Yes there's likely 60 or 80 better places in the city but it is at least better than (in)Famous Ray's, Pizza Hut, and Sbarro's.

Great for a quick on the go bite. You can get two slices and a soda or water for $2.75. You literally can't beat that. In terms of taste, the crust is crispy, cheese was stringy and sauce was sweet and in the right amount. Great stop on an nyc trip!

You get what you pay for - super fast service and super unique. $1 = 1 piece of pizza which tastes great and probably better after that one drink I had at the bar next door (MACE). Overall just a solid experience and just feels like you got to stop by if you're in NYC for the first time. Might come back another time - the quality matches any other pizza I've paid 10x for before.

What more can I say? It's a .99 cent pizza slice.

Even when I'm strolling around getting in a long power walk I need a quick snack to refuel and carb back up. This slice of pie does the trick.

Just the right amount of crunch in the crust and cheesy grease on top.

Not bad for a buck a slice.
This pizza was simple and delicious!! Inexpensive (which is hard to find in NYC) but so good! Ambiance isn't great and no place to sit, hence the 4/5.

The place is a narrow hole in the wall on 6th Avenue with one guy churning out delicious pies and doling out all the slices for a buck each at lightening speed.

The $1 pizza trend has been ongoing in Manhattan for a few years and most all of them decent but this may be the best of the best.  Heck I'd put this perfectly crisp, delicious sauce and just the right amount of cheese up against most regular priced pizza joints.
99c pizza hot from oven, what else I can expect ? It doesn't have much ingredients just pizza sauce and cheese, thin crust, much to my liking. It's awesome especially when it's just out from oven.

I was in here Saturday May 22 shortly before 2.  I needed a light lunch to go.  I haven't been to the area since March 2020.  I ordered 1 slice to go.

The pizza is still as tasty as I remember. Crispy crust, not too much sauce or cheese.

I've strictly come to this place out of sheer convenience, as it's right above the train station. And even for a $1, it's somehow on the lower end of cardboard + cheese + tomato.

One Sunday ago, I find myself needing a snack and in the neighborhood-- "I can get a beef patty", I ignorantly whispered to myself. Come 99 cent Fresh Pizza, the cashier tells me he only sells patties in pairs... ok. A little suspicious but whatever, I can just have two beef patties.

A weird exchange of words occur as he's telling me the price that's inconsistent with the menu. I get it, it's a pandemic and prices go up, so it's 25 cent more than normal per pattie, coming to a total of $5.50. I give him a $20 and he hands me $14. My dude, where's my 50 cents?

I ask and he just keeps repeating it's $2.75. Yeah, I know; where's my 50 cents? He keeps pointing at the menu as if that explains where my money is and after about 5 minutes he says "tax". Yeah whatever. Times are tough but be honest.

When the beef patties come out, I ask to have them to go and he half-ass wraps them in tin foil INCOMPLETELY as one final indignity, as if provoking me not to eat at his substandard dumpster-in-a-wall anymore. Well, congratulations! You won. Cause I ain't eating here anymore. I mean, it sucks I'll go starving a little longer on the train home but the fact that he's losing on marginal sales will sustain me.
For a pizza that only cost $1 dollar man you cannot beat it anywhere not even little Caesars. Would recommend to stop by.

Yeasssss-- I wish places like this existed in alllll the states.

$.99 cents for a delicious, cheesy, crispy slice of pizza. I'm such a fan. I compared everywhere else I ate to here- pretty much nothing compared.

Super quick service. Such a classic, I will never regret eating here.

I like to try different dollar slices in NYC. Same old same old. I appreciated how they made their crust here. Good ratio of crust, cheese, sauce, and they provided the typical toppings of garlic powder, oregano, and crushed red pepper. Wasn't my favorite, but it hit the spot.

Was it the best pizza of my life? No. Was it extremely delicious and hot and topped with pepperoni barely holding on? Most definitely. It's insane that we paid less than $5 for two slices, a drink and it was delicious. Maybe I've been deprived of good NY style slices for a while, but this was the perfect touristy NYC experience. Ate it so fast we didn't get a pic, but as I lay here warm in my hotel bed I really wish I had a slice to enjoy!

While the pizza wasn't particularly that good, at $1 it's hard to complain. It's open pretty late too so if you're out late and want a cheap and quick snack it definitely hits the spot. They also have hot sauce as one of their condiments which I thought was pretty interesting compared to the regular oregano, Parmesan, and red peppers combo.
Pretty decent tasting plain slice commensurate with the price.  Smallish in size and thin base.
Its great for the price, the taste is good and service good as well, dont expect something fancy cause its not, but surprisingly the pizza is very good. They close late too which is always good.
Good pizza would recommend for the price too it is amazing and words words words to put enough characters to post

First of all..  The fact that the pizza here is still .99 cents after all these years is beyond me.  I'm a pizza lover and this may not be the BEST pizza but it's definitely the most affordable pizza.  This place has held me down on many occasions when my paycheck was running low and I needed some decent food for the low low on my lunch break.  This is the kinda place where you walk in, get your pizza and get out. I didn't give this place all 5 stars because they never give me my penny back when I give them a dollar, lol.

Racist establishment, please don't visit :(

I came in here with a friend who was hungry. First of all, the guy working yelled at my friend for accidentally taking too many paper plates (the plates stick together?). I tried to laugh it off because I genuinely thought he had to be joking. On my way out, I told the worker "Thank you, have a good night!" in OBVIOUS English. This man said "xièxie", which is Chinese for thank you. I suppose he thought because I am Asian that I'm Chinese? It was SO weird, racist, and uncalled for. I would have preferred if he had said nothing at all. I was only trying to be kind, because I know food service workers have it rough, but in return I received a racist retort. Will absolutely never come here again.

You get what you pay for and it rings true in the case of buying $1 slices of pizza as you run around Manhattan.  I stopped in here on a Thursday afternoon of just wandering the city and seeing what was going on.  

I've only been here once, and I doubt I'll be going back.  There's a spot just a bit away called 2 Brothers that has good pizza for the price point.  

I walk into the pizza shop and and its relatively small, even by NYC standards.  I ask what pizza they have and they say they only have cheese slices and nothing else.  It's clearly a volume business considering the price of the slice of pizza and the cost of living and running a business in NYC.  

Now it's not the best pizza in town, but its not the worst either for the price point.  Its a very thin slice of pizza that is pretty big for the price point.  The sauce is very light and the cheese is very light as well, essentially its $1 for a thin slice of bread with very, very light toppings on it.  

I will say that if you want authentic NYC pizza, I'd argue this is what it is.  It's not some fancy slice that costs a ton, its a cheap, thin, easy to take on the go slice of pizza.  But compared to the other options around town, if I was to decide to eat pizza, I wouldn't come here and instead go to a staple like Prince's Pizza.  However, if you want a quick bite and got a $1 in your pocket, this isn't all that bad.

Not bad for a $.99 slice. Full of flavor. Of course, it's greasy, but there was enough tartness from the sauce and the crust had a nice crunch. It may not be the best in NYC, but for a buck, this is better than any of the major pizza chains. I would say slices here are 70% of what a Joes slice would be. But, it cost less than 70% of a Joe's slice. So thats a win in my book if I want a cheap slice.  Remember, quality of food to price is not linear...  The key to most successful 99 cent places is turn over. If there's turnover, you got fresh pizzas rolling out every few mins. This place is one of them.
They hung up on me when trying to figure out if my yelp order went through they never answered the phone after that.

Pizza taste was pretty decent but the sizes of the slices were pretty small.
Nevertheless $2.75 for 2 slices and can of soda.. can't beat that for ny pizza.

With the tragic demise of the 8th Street Gray's Papaya (damn you, Liquiteria!) these guys are now the best bet in the neighborhood when it comes to dollar slices.  And they bake constantly, so you rarely have to wait for a hot slice.

Also, they're open 24/7, so they're perfect for those 4AM "is this breakfast or a *really* late midnight snack?" kinda of meals.

Five stars because I can't say it's not "as good as it gets" for dollar pizza. I live right in the neighborhood and stop by here probably twice a week.

Average dollar pizza tends to be sitting out for over an hour and has to be heated up, then is burnt and dried out.
This has almost exclusively been hot, fresh, not over-cooked, and I don't have to wait for them to warm it up because it's out of the oven 5 minutes earlier or less.

Sure, service is no-frills straightforward and maybe a little gruff, but they're working long shifts overnight in a hot small space for little to no tips--cut them some slack. They've always been polite so long as you don't jam up their line trying to pay $1.98 with a debit card or argue with them over the (clearly posted) prices.

If you think about the fact that they're in a neighborhood where average 1-bed rent is $4.2k/month, putting out dollar pizza of this quality is pretty great.

I'm honestly shocked this place isn't rated 5 stars across the board!? It's .99 cents and delicious ... can you get better? $8 for a whole pie - come on people. I legit will go out of my way to get a few slices or a couple boxes of this pizza on any given day. Randomly stumbled across them after a lash appointment and will never regret wandering in.

It's crispy with just the right ratio of cheese, sauce, crust! Always hot and service is friendly as hell. In my mind best pizza shop I've been to since moving to NY (and I've tried soooo many).

Kudos to this place!!! Move to Brooklyn where we'll totally appreciate you more

Here's the deal:  Basic cheese/tomato slice - no toppings available.  Plus, no seating & absolutely NO atmosphere - we're talking bright fluorescent lights that will scare you outta the place even if there was a place to sit!  Overall though, pizza is the best by far of the cheap pizza joints in the city.  

Usually a line & sometimes have to wait for a new pie to come out before you can get a slice.
GREAT 1$ pizza!! What else can you say! Open 24/7 and greasy just they way you want it!

Quick stop while I was working 1$ slices wow!! The slices were big for that price.

Not too hot not to cold but just done right. Will be stopping here more often glad I came around this pizzerria. Love it.

Will be coming here again habe to try everything else they have.

Very tiny spot you can barely come I  but it's worth the wait for a slice.

Pizza is always at least warm and service is consistently good. Not only is there always a few slices ready to go for cheap, the cooler drinks are also priced below average(water bottle $1/red bull $2).

I come here at least 3 times a week for a quick snack or hangover remedy but will go to Joes pizza down the street if I want a good meal.

2 Brothers do it better (not talking about incest).  When you want a slightly better quality pizza for the price, walk the extra couple blocks & find it there.  Otherwise, it's not horrible, but far from satisfying.

Nice place with good service and pizza.

You might have to wait in line but it's worth a quick cheap bite in a great location near Washington Square Park

The best $1 pizza.  Easily.

I've been to a lot of these. The people are nicer. They have parm cheese and the gross but delicious hot sauce. Yum.

This is my favorite $0.99 pizza. Minus one star for the rude employees. Today, there was a line and they were getting pies into the oven. An elderly woman in front of me had been waiting for a while. She finally got to the register with $20 in hand, but only wanted a slice. The man kept saying "small bills only, no change" ... but tons of people had just been in & out? Unfortunately, I only had $1 & $20 so couldn't pay for her.

i've had plenty of kinda shitty dollar slices. not here. the pizza is great every time whether i'm stoned or sober. not sure how they achieve this consistency. perfect crust texture, right amount of cheese and sauce, and it's a dollar. i'm eating a different pizza right now and i'm wishing i had theirs instead. i bring my out of town friends here and they always love it :-)

Not much to say here as I think you know what it is! Pizza is truly 99 cents and tastes pretty good! Looks like all they had was cheese pizza but I didn't care as I was hungry and needed to soak up the alcohol. After I smashed 1, I went back for #2 & #3!

What are you expecting? Its dollar pizza.

For the price its a steal! It hits the spot when you just need some melty cheese and sauce. They usually leave out grated cheese, garlic, hot pepper, but sometimes drunk people or some of our more... interesting... NYC characters go overboard and they take it away.

Buy a slice, hand them a dollar, and eat it on the go to your next location because you don't have TIME to stand around and eat.

For one dollar, its definitely worth it.

Fresh Pizza is right. We got three slices from a pie right out of the oven. It tasted exactly like you want NY style pizza to taste. Gooey and burn-the-roof-of-your-mouth cheesy. If you need some insurance at 3am to prevent a hangover in the morning, these guys are awesome.

The pizza isn't bad, definitely not New York's best, but not their worst either, and way better than some pizza hut or papa johns. I would say this a good place for some drunk pizza before you get on the train... something in your stomach to soak up the alcohol. It's a super tiny place, basically fits maybe four customers at a time.

Make sure you give them EXACT money. On more than one occasion, I have given them a $1 for my slice, only for them to tell me I didn't give them any money for my pizza. It's a dollar, if they really need to charge me $2 for my dollar pizza, whatever. But the last time, I made the mistake of giving them a $20. How do I know it was a $20, because I had just visited the ATM, and guess what, the ATM only gives out 20s! For the record, I was fully sober when it happened. The guy claimed I gave him a dollar. It was definitely not a dollar. It was late-ish, and I just wanted to get on the train and go home, so after arguing, I decided not to go all, 'when keeping it real goes wrong' and just leave and go home.

I'd find somewhere else to get drunk pizza from. Stumble down the block somewhere else. Or eat some leftovers in my fridge when I get home. I don't really feeling getting ripped off, but I pretty much got robbed here.

It's actually $1 a slice. Still a great deal!

Get two slices for yourself, one will never be enough, And you'll regret your decision while waiting for that damn subway train to arrive.
Another 99 cent fresh pizza. $1 a slice, really, cheap, and hot, and open pretty much all the time. There's not a lot of cheese, but it does satisfy for a craving and is a nice, cheap meal.

They are super mean. The signs say $.99 per slice, so I got two slices of pepperoni and he said $3. I turned to the sign and argued about the price and the Indian cashier started talking down to me asking me if I went to school or knew how to read.
I took my money and left immediately without the pizza.
Great value. Decent pizza at a cheap price and the staff is friendly and accommodating. What more could you want or expect for a dollar!
Actually closer to 4 stars on price alone. It's not the best pizza but it's not the worst. The dough is thicker than I like but really, it hits the spot for a dollar a slice!

As far as dollar slice joints go, this is definitely one of my top places. The crust is thin but not cracker thin, foldable but still with some body, and I absolutely love the end crust (it's the BEST part!). I like that they heat it up for you and have extra sauce and toppings readily available near the door, so you're in and out and on your way (that's what she said).

We inadvertently did a pizza crawl today and this was the last stop at 1 am. We basically tried it just to compare it to everything else we had today. It's a dollar slice so I have little room to complain but I'll do it anyway. Not my favorite crust- definitely the softest we had today and I'm a big texture person. The sauce could use more flavor but it's acceptable the way it is. Cheese is cheese is cheese to me. I did like the sauce-cheese ratio. I mean at the end of the day, it's a dollar and I'm sure 70% of their patrons are intoxicated and not likely able to discern between this and a slightly more expensive slice anyway.
I stopped in here one time, randomly. It was a okay slice. No amazing but not bad. Cheese slice is the only slice for 1$ not all slices are 1$ FYI.

Only pros are its open late and slices are 99 cents. If that's what you need, you're good.

There's nothing this place had to offer in the way of variety (i.e. toppings?) or taste. If you want better pizza, there's tons of places around but they won't give it to you for $1.

And it's a dollar a slice ... Don't expect a penny back.

FYI - its near the PATH (maybe 2 blocks) at 9th St, so it works for those of you trekking back to NJ. Although, if you want more, stop at one of the other places in that area for something more fulfilling.

It's a dollar (99c, whatever). It tastes like it. (Best description I think I read so far was: undercooked dough with little sauce & little cheese)

But what better when it's the end of a night out? They are open real late. One of the only places open after a night on the town, you spent all your dough, but have a couple scraps of change or a few wrinkled up dollars left in your pocket. 99 cent Fresh Pizza!

And to all those complaining that it ruined your diet, how good are Grey's Papaya hot dogs going to be for your diet?!
You can't really eat out clean and cheap on a diet at 3 in the morning.

Definitely a good Dim Sum option if you're in the area. The flavors and textures of the pork buns and dumplings are pretty good. These aren't my favorite in the city, but it curbs the craving when needed.

The service is always really fast and kind. The place itself is clean and never loud. I would definitely stop by if you're in the area, but don't worry about going out of your way.

I'm not sure what happened here but it's been a while since I've came to this location - the Clinton street location is closed temporarily I think.

It's just a random Monday night and there weren't a lot of other tables maybe like 3 other parties when we got there at about 8:15. Upon sitting down the utensils and dishes at the table weren't super clean, just like marks on the glasses and eh spoons and plates.

My first gripe was the food - we got two pork soup dumplings and a chicken fried rice to share. The rice came so weirdly fast but it was so unsatisfying - it had celery and red onions which is random, and it was SUPER salty. Then the soup dumplings came after a while and they honestly looked and tasted like the Trader Joe's microwaveable ones. They were definitely not home made. The soup was like water.

Then to make things worse, their closing time was 9:30 and it was like barely 8:45 and the waitress started spraying the table next to use with cleaning solution like WHAT. As we're eating?? It's barely palatable as is and now all I taste and smell is fake lemon scent. That's like a huge no-no.

I don't what know else to think but what a huge miss.

I would've given this 4 stars, but I'm not sure what to make of the restaurant's attempt to hide the "B" rating given to them by the NYC Sanitation Department. It's really not that hard to get an "A"-- every respectable restaurant should be able to get one. But OK, sometimes there are (forgivable) issues when the inspectors come around. However, attempting to put it in a narrow door that faces the wall of the building (so customers barely see it unless they're sitting in a specific position that enables them to see the sign) rubs me the wrong way. Clean up, and get the "A" next time. Trying to hide is slimy and probably says something about the quality of your food.

Food-wise, I had few complaints. The soup dumplings were on par with other places I've tried in Greenwich Village, nothing spectacular. I'd go here again, but only if the rating were fixed and the restaurant owned up to its rating. Everyone makes mistakes and deserves a second chance, but hiding these raises some pretty big red flags.

Order to go for my lunch. Soup dumplings are very good. Juicy and flavorful. Shrimp Shu Mai and sticky rice Shu Mai are good. Definitely love the red bean puff as dessert.

Lots tables inside. Very clean. Friendly staff. I'll come back to try other items!
Still the best crab pork Xiao Loong Bao in the world. Now that they have great authentic tea selections, you can't beat it.
Please don't go they're disgusting food and nasty it's not cleain   plz plz  if you have money to throw it, you can go

Really yummy dim sum!! We came for dinner and had no wait, and the staff was so friendly. Our food came out fairly quickly and everything was so delicious.

Rankings from most to least favorite (however everything was good and I would order all of it again)

-Pan fried pork buns: these were nice and crispy on the bottom with a soft bite into the dough on top. Filled with a flavorful meaty broth and there was a decent portion of meat inside

-Shrimp wontons in chili oil: another delicious dish, the shrimp was flavorful and the skin was cooked perfectly

-Pork soup dumplings: these were good, but they weren't the best soup dumplings I've had in the city (however I've tried a lot!). The skin could've been a little thinner and some of them ripped when we picked them up, but the flavor was all there

-Pork rice dumpling: this is the same as sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaves. Again, the flavor was there so it was yummy but I would've liked more meat inside.

Overall, I had a great experience here!

Had both take out and dining in experience, I like the restaurant is clean and pretty spacious for dim sum place. Service was also fast and good.

Tried veggie dumpling, shrimp dumpling, veggie bun, sticky rice shumai, and peashooter and shrimp dumpling. They were pretty standard, not outstanding but not disappointing either.

I've gone here a few times and have loved it each time. This is one of my go-to spots!

Their dumplings are delicious - I highly recommend the truffle soup dumpling and the pork dumplings. I've also had the veggie dumplings, which were good too. The texture and taste of the dumplings are on point. The beef scallion pancake is also delicious - well seasoned and quite flavorful. I also recommend the general tso or sesame chicken - juicy and delicious!

The service is great! The food comes out fast and the servers are friendly. The ambiance is chill - relaxing and welcoming. The price is reasonable, especially for the area and portion size. Highly recommend!

Me and my coworkers have ordered from here several times.  Overall, the services is ok and does not take that long to deliver.  

However, my problem is the last time we ordered my vegggie spring roll had a hard (like a stone) foreign object inside.  I'm just glad I didn't break a tooth on it.  See picture.  I'm highly disappointed and irritated because the food taste is good!  

Soooooo now I'm very nervous (I probably will not) order from here again. I will not be able to enjoy the food.  All I will be thinking about is someone is careless in the kitchen and what's inside???

*** 3.5 stars ***

Review for take-out from doordash.

I'm on a (seemingly futile) quest to find great Shanghai Fried Pork Buns in NYC, so I placed an order from 3 times and added the Chicken Mushroom Soup to round out the meal. Unfortunately the buns were just okay and did not satisfy my craving - the skin was not quite thick enough, the bottoms not quite fried enough, and there was barely any juice inside. They tasted closer to regular dumplings than Fried Pork Buns. The search continues.

The soup, with not quite as high a bar to cross, was good and satisfying. If I order from here again I'll pass on the Fried Pork Buns and try some other stuff instead.

Delicious lunch spot we came across. The food was good and so was the service. The soup dumplings were well-made, but nothing I haven't had before. The sticky rice dumpling was a first for me and it had a yummy, chewy texture but lacked flavor.

My favorites from here were the spicy chili oil dumplings and house fried rice. Both not pictured but delicious! I would come for these two items!

Meh.
Wouldn't go back
Food was ok.
Decor was clean but sterile, sort of felt like a cafeteria.
Not enough vegetarian options for an asian joint.
Spicy Beef Soup was outstanding!! The numbing spice is still in my dreams as I look to going back soon. Highly recommend! Great for groups. Good service, too!

more affordable nyc dim sum! the soup dumplings were amazing and the scallion pancake wrapped with pot stewed beef was also so delicious. the inside was very pretty and clean and the server was very nice!

I decided to give it a try after reviewing mixed comments on Yelp. Today is Chinese lantern festival so I want to have some Chinese treats to celebrate.
Luckily it wasn't busy at all on Sunday morning. We were seated right away and the food were served pretty fast too. My friend and I did not get big entree dishes, only dim sum size treats. Just to clarify, this restaurant is not Hong Kong style dim sum place. It's Shanghai style cuisine. Here are our dishes and my scoring and opinion:
- Noodles w. scallion oil (8/10): I had my doubt when I saw the plate. For the authentic noodle with scallion oil, the color is usually darker because of the soy sauce and the scallions are fried with stripe shape. I mixed the noodles a bit before eating and I was impressed after my first bite. The flavor is very authentic just like the way I had when I was in Shanghai. If the scallion flavor is stronger, it would be perfect.
- Shredded chinese radish puffs (9/10): The puffs are crispy outside and soft inside. They were freshly made and the radish inside taste so good. The only downside is a bit doughy right beneath the crispy skin.
- Sticky rice shumai (5/10): we were disappointed with the shumai. There's no flavor at all. It suppose to have shiitake mushroom pieces and ground pork to create the flavor, but I barely found those material in the shumai. It's just like rice ball in the wrap.
- Soup dumpling with pork (7/10): Neither impressed or disappointed. It is decent and similar to the ones in other restaurants.
- Cha siu bun (7/10): I think they are the frozen ones bought from supermarket. The filling is sweet but not much meat in it. It was all right.
The place is clean and nice. I think I would come back to try out some other items on the menu and hopefully I will discover more delicious dishes.

Was in the mood for a hot bowl of noodle soup and 3 Times looked like the best place to go to in the NOHO area.

House Special Spicy Braised Beef Noodle soup - hit the spot. The Sichuan peppercorn flavor was a bit too overpowering that I wasn't able to fully enjoy the soup flavors, but the braised beef was so tender and perfectly cooked and the noodles had such a good bounce to them that it allowed me to fully enjoy my hot bowl of noodles. If you enjoy the numbing spice, I do recommend! (4.5/5)

Sesame Chicken - you can taste how freshly made it was. Crunchy on the outside and the chicken was still juicy! (4.5/5)

Pork Soup Dumplings - came out hot. Great skin to meat ratio. The soup flavors weren't as good as the ones I've had before but nonetheless still good. (3/5)

Overall a great find and an affordable place to dine in compared to other places in the NOHO area.

For a food place around Union Square to be this price, it is quite a nice surprise. The dishes are pretty good, and is plated quite nicely! The only thing issue I would have to say would be the gnats! We basically were half eating and half swatting away the gnats during our entire meal! Food was pretty good, and the waiters were nice enough to allow my friend and I to sit down before the rest of our group came, and was very accommodating!

Maybe it's just our seat, but hopefully you will get to enjoy the food without the gnats when you visit.

I used to come here when they first opened up and used to love it (precovid). Prior to covid, the Dishes were all super authentic and had excellent xiao long bao and sheng jian bao, Chocolate Xiao Long Bao and all sorts of typical shanghai dishes. I decided to go yesterday after a while

They re-did the menu, most of the typical shanghai dishes are gone. Now they have your typical stupid general tso's chicken and all of your typical americanized chinese foods that you can find everywhere.

The quality of the food also went downhill, the xiaolongbao skin is now too thick and the shrimp wonton barely has any shrimp in it. The Shengjianbao had no juice inside of it whatsoever, it is supposed to have alot of broth inside.

Not going back.

My absolute favorite spot to go to in the city to have a nice calm meal with my partner. The aura is so peaceful and cozy, it's best to enjoy on a rainy day. The service is great never disappoints, honestly very sweet staff. I usually get the scallion pancakes w Shanghai fried noodles it's legit my Go to every time. We tried the sesame chicken it was crispy crunchy and delicious. Im honestly planning my 4th  trip there !! :))

Came by to have dinner a few times. 3 Times is located close by to Union Square and was a convenient meeting spot.

Interior is very clean but a little bare bones. The menu has a ton of dim sum / dumplings and some Shanghainese favorites. We got an order of the XLB which were very large and filing. They have a mix of other bun and dumpling products such as steamed buns. Other favorites included the wontons and fried pea shoots. Prices were fair for the portions. Food came out very quickly. Service was quick. The restaurant was busy but never completely full, and we have been able to get seating right away any time we've been.

This was some of the most authentic and fresh tasting food I've had in a while. The server recommended we try some other dishes outside of our typical choices and they were amazing: pork soup dumplings, Hong Kong style fried rice, double cooked pork belly, and hot & spicy wings were absolutely delicious. The drinks were just as good: lychee martini was my fav. Would def return and recommend you try it!

I'm so happy we stumbled upon this place. We arrived right when it opened. We ordered all of the soup dumplings and my top favs were spicy pork and truffle. They were all so good though!! We also got scallion pancakes and the cucumber salad. Everything was amazing, I would definitely come back!

Omg I've been here 3 times this week and I'm ordering again right now... don't judge! I order the hot and sour soup and the Shanghai noodles with pork. Sooooo good I haven't had a chance to try anything else because I'm too full! Always friendly, attentive, and prompt service. This is a go to spot for me

Good price and quality for dim sum in this area. Fast service and clean restaurant. The vegetable bun was good. Scallion pancakes were a little oily. Noodles and vegetable dumplings were fantastic. Would come back.

I was at this place a month ago. They follow Covid protocols properly as expected for most places in the area. The service was fine; polite in prompt; and they refilled the water when necessary. I decided to go with two dishes which I have had in several over Shanghainese places, stir fried rice cakes and pan fried dumplings.

雪菜肉絲炒年糕/Stir fried rice cake with mustard greens and pork. $12.95
Listed as fried rice cakes with mustard and shredded pork, this was a tasty version with a couple minor faults. The pork was properly cooked and there was a good amount of said meat along with the good amount of mustard greens. The portion size in short was adequate for the price. I personally like this dish a lot for the texture and my only complaint is that in many other places I've had this, the rice cakes were a bit crispier. In other words, I found the texture to be a bit too soft for my liking but this might just be a preference and overall it was still very tasty. The dish is also available with chicken, beef, or seafood.

生煎饅頭/Shengjian bao or pan fried dumplings filled with pork.
Listed as Shanghai fried pork buns, this came with 4 to an order which was fine for the price (for the area.) The dumplings were nice and light though I prefer the bottom to be a bit crispier (I see a trend here with my complaints.) The pork filling was very tasty, moist, and generous and I have no complaints. I also got some of the chili oil to have with it which is fine though nothing notable.

Outside of the lack of crispiness for the dishes which is more of a personal complaint, I don't have many issues. This is a good Shanghainese spot and it is nice to see a good one pretty close to Union Square. The service was prompt and friendly. Of course it's more expensive than going to Queens or Brooklyn but it's expected with the rent and the size of this place. Will go back to try some more things. 4.3.

3.5 stars. Hmmm I really liked the LES location. But every time I come to the union sq location I've been disappointed. Not sure if the food is just worse or what. The XLB at this location was not that good. Everything was fine. Would order the chive egg pancakes and red oil shrimp dumplings again.

A nice casual place to dine in or order takeout for popular Chinese foods. Some dim sum items are served here too!!!

We ordered the chili oil wontons, braised beef noodle soup, and sautéed snowpea shoots. All three of these fell within expectation of decent and traditional Chinese food. I would call out the braised beef noodle soup. The soup was rich and noodles had a little bit of bite.

This is a place I wouldn't mind grabbing takeout on the way home or doing a solo dining experience. A nice place to bring a friend or two just to casually dine.

Taste: 4/5
Service: 3.5/5
Value: 3.5/5

Farabe and I came here for a quick lunch while we were in the area. Upon entry, the restaurant was empty except for the employees. The restaurant was clean and had a nice modern aesthetic to it.

Towards the kitchen, you can see the staff cooking and making the hand pulled noodles. I ordered the seafood fried rice ($15) and was told it would be shrimp with crab meat. I was assuming actual crab meat but, was given a few flakes of intimation crab meat instead.  The rice itself was bland and had no flavor. I requested some additional soy sauce and hot oil and that really spiced up the flavor profile.

Farabe ordered the Shanghai fried noodles with chicken ($13). The noodles were delicious with the perfect amount of chew and saltiness. I would definitely come back again to eat this.

The service was okay. They were efficient but, not really friendly. They only stopped by to take orders, drop off food and check. No one really checked in on us to see if we needed anything or how we were enjoying our food.

Get the xiao long bao (soup dumplings, either crab or pork--you will not regret it. All the other stuff also finger licking good.  Open late and super nice folks--the kind of local business you want to support and will get fat doing so.
The food was SO good! We did takeout and it was ready super fast! The udon noodles were my favorite.

If you want to have some of the best Crab Xio long baos in NYC you must definitely go to 3 Times.  I have tried XLB at pretty much all NYC restaurants and I must say these were my favorite. I love how soft and thin their skin and all you taste is their delicious soup and the crab meat. Everything we tried here is phenomenal without being too greasy. The decor is simple and yet inviting. The staff is extremely courteous and very helpful with their recommendations which is exactly what we followed and we were not disappointed
- Crab Xiao Long Bao
- Pork Xiao Long Bao
- Shrimp Shumai
- Shrimp Dimsum in Chilli Oil
- Dan Dan Noodles
- Mapu Tofu

I'm not too sure whether this is a family run restaurant, but the younger gentleman there has to learn about what you actually sell. I asked specific questions about dishes and at 1st he was super helpful, but then everything went South when there was a shoe sale at 1 of the resellers on the block.

I was told there was jumbo shrimp in an item and it was actually the fishy little baby shrimp. No thank you. Thankfully the older employee got the dish fixed appropriately with a substitution.  It also took a significant amount of time to get the bill and to actually and to actually remit payment. Despite the weird little occurrences I will come back because the food was so good. I hope the service improves.

We were hesitant about dining in because it was empty.  
Only 1 guy was working and he was running around so busy with take out delivery orders.
Everything we ordered came out hot and fresh.  Xlb skin was a little thick but it was ok..had better ones...
Overall good addition to the hood.

Good pork soup dumplings. Better than most outside of Chinatown. Could be a little soupier. Shanghai spring rolls are pretty decent also. Decor is fine - very simple. Stone tile walls, with bamboo steamers and a few maps and photos hung. Simple wooden tables. Good cleanliness for a restaurant with.a B grade. Service is fast. The Mr Love videos on YouTube on the big screen are odd.

where do i begin? 3 times is by far one of the best dim sum restaurants i've ever been to.
first time i tried it was on my birthday about 3 years ago. my boyfriend and i were restaurant jumping to places we'd never been and ordering 2-3 small items from each place.
3 times was our 3rd spot (how fitting)
we ordered the pan fried pork dumplings, the shrimp and pork shumai and the southern pork bun. all of which were amazing, but what blew my mind were the shumai...i completely fell in love.
i immediately knew this would be a place id continue to return to. i wish id remember to check in every time i went but of course i forget to. so the amount of times i've been is unknown but i can tell you it's more than I can count in two hands.
3 times is where i tried thousand year eggs for the first time (they are DELICIOUS!!!!!!) they have delicious soups, soup dumplings, noodles etc. there hasn't been a single thing i've ordered from them that i haven't absolutely loved.
i actually love them so much that i've spent almost an entire paycheck on their frozen dumplings to take home (since i don't live in the city and it's not always easy to get there)
you can order their frozen dumplings online for pick up or delivery (depending on where you live) my favorite part about their frozen items is each package comes with exact heating/cooking instructions so that they come out perfect every time.
they really put a lot of thought and care into everything.
I absolutely recommend this place to anyone who wants delicious dim sum.

3 Times offers plenty of Shanghainese and dim sum dishes. Even when I ordered takeout, the food was still delicious without needing to be reheated. The xiaolongbaos were perfectly folded so they didn't tear when I went to pick them up. I had both the classic and crab roe & pork soup dumplings, which were filling but not too heavy for a weekday lunch.

They also sell frozen products ranging from dumplings to siu mai, which can be delivered in Manhattan.

I'm not sure if I just ordered the wrong things but we found the food disappointing. The chicken and pork/crab soup dumplings tasted the same with not much flavor. The beef wrapped pancake was not what I expected, I thought it would be a scallion pancake so that is on me but it was somuch bread and not enough filling in my opinion. My favorite thing was the vegetable spring rolls but they didn't come with any duck sauce.

They also didn't include chop sticks or napkins. Overall it wasn't my favorite and next time I'm this far uptown I would probably try something else.

Food was fairly priced. I had the chicken wings and the crab and pork soup dumplings. Service was great, when I came in it was Sunday evening and the place was pretty empty but seems they do a lot of take out orders. Overall food was average, hot and spicy chicken was not spicy and needed more flavor but was crispy and hot. Dumplings were solid but flavor wise nothing special, also very little crab.

Love that there is a Shanghainese spot 2 blocks from union square. They have a clear window inside where you can see the staff making the XLB and other  dishes from scratch.
Great that they have nice indoor and outdoor dining space. Perfect for lunch or a casual dinner.

Food: crab roe Xiao long bao- the skin was not too thick, very juicy. It's not the best XLB in NY, but pass muster. If you don't want to go all the way to flushing/chinatown, this is your spot.

Sautéed snow pea shoots was flavorful, not greasy or over salted. Nice balance when paired with the dumplings .
DONT do it. Food tastes off. Service is brash, they rush you out the door. Go somewhere else.

Food was just okay - not really authentic, with a few subtle misses. We shared the following:

- Pork Soup Dumplings: A tad gamey for my taste. Definitely could use more ginger.
- Shanghai Pan Fried Pork Bun: This was good. My fav of the night.
- Sliced Beef & Tripe in Chili Oil: Just okay. While I couldn't pinpoint exactly what was lacking in terms of flavor, I knew definitely should have had more peanuts.
- Scallion Noodles: The noodles were on the thicker side, which was strange. I thought the authentic dish should be made with thinner noodles, so the texture was a bit off to me. The scallion flavor was also too mild.
- Crispy Salt & Pepper Ribs: This was the strangest dish to me personally. I was expecting bone-in ribs, but instead we got huge, boneless, battered cutlets. That said, it was pretty good for what it was.

Our server was very attentive though! And I appreciate that they played Chinese pop music. Major throwbacks.

Ordered a Beef Noodle Soup togo. Very good and flavorful. A lot of meat stewed to very tender as well. Perfect for the weather.

Tried the Chive & Egg Bun as well, more like a Pocket than bun (which I prefer more!). Really good it reminds me those breakfast in asia!

I thought the food was definitely above average. When you check in on Yelp, you get a free fruit tea!

We came here after we failed to grab a spot at our favorite udon place. Then afterwards, we decided to dine at a place with an outdoor space that's covered.

Thankfully they had one, though placed on the street. We weren't too keen on the slowness initially. We weren't seated until later because no one was at the host stand. And because they had a bunch of pick-ups, we weren't served in a timely manner.

Though afterwards, (I'm guessing after the dinner rush) we got more prompt service.

We ordered some Xiao Long Bao which were really good and also the sticky rice siu mai are just what my boyfriend is looking for. I also ordered the duck which was a bit too cold for my taste and the Shanghai noodles would have been really good, but sitting outside made the food get cold really quickly.

Overall I really liked the food, but could have been better! Definitely one of the more authentic restaurants.

TLDR the food is authentic and they have great options for frozen orders of their menu items! This review is for a delivery order during the pandemic. So glad to have discovered this place and amazing that they opened during COVID times.

My boyfriend and I got the westlake soup, Shanghai style noodles, green beans, and sliced beef and tripe in chili oil. Everything was really good! It was a great taste of childhood for some good Chinese cooking. The Shanghai style noodles were the favorite. Really good quality noodles and flavor. The sliced beef and triple in chili oil was really spicy, just how I like it!

We even got a few frozen orders since they had such good variety in what you could order! Specifically we got the Xiao long bao, pork pan fried buns, and pork and sticky rice siu mai. It's so great and smart they offer such good choices for frozen food. Can't wait to try it just in time for the Lunar New Year and also to keep ordering from a new, local favorite.

You know what I love about New York City? To find a bad meal, you almost have to be actively looking for a poor experience. My visit to the Three Times location was completely unplanned, but ended up being wonderful in so many ways.

The Good: Food quality, speed and pace of meal, great service, extremely affordable

The Bad:

I stopped by this Three Times location on a weekday during early dinner service (5:00 -6:00 PM), and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't packed to the gills. I was immediately seated, and had my order taken within five minutes of arrival. Not 15 minutes after that, the food arrived. I was blown away at the quality of what I ordered (see attached picture). I'm a sucker for a great pork bun, and Three Times definitely delivered. Add up the four choices from the menu, and with tip, I left having paid less than $40. Good luck beating that.

I can't imagine what could have improved my experience that day. If you're in the mood for some great dim sum in the area, Three Times is certainly worth the trip.

Went here on 12/28 for dinner about 5pm. Wasn't too busy and menu looked to be good. We were sat right away and then we waited well over ten minutes without being acknowledged as the server ( who seemed to be all alone) was walking back and forth. We ended up leaving...

Dined here for dinner with a friend and enjoyed the variety of dim sum offered. We ordered the shrimp and pork soup dumplings which were delicious, the Shanghai pan fries pork buns which was good but the ratio of bun and meat felt off and I found the dish to be quite oily. We ordered the scallion pancakes which were also also good and we also ordered the shrimp wonton in chili oil. Out of everything my favorite had to be the house special spicy braised beef noodle soup as the broth was very flavorful and the beef and noodles were delicious. I would definitely order it again. Price wise this was reasonable for the portion and I enjoyed it.
Closed by the NYC Dept of Health. This place appears to have had multiple issues over time.

Listen.  I'm just gonna tell you. I'm gonna do you a solid here to save your time. Go straight to the truffle soup dumplings. Sorry, no photo cause as soon as I put one in my mouth I forgot the whole world. They gave me life. The other stuff we had was good but I don't even remember what it was. That's all. TRUFFLE. SOUP. DUMPLINGS.

I love this place. I've been coming here for football saturdays for the last 6 years now (hard to believe). Always a decent turnout, pretty clean, nice servers, and you don't have to wait long for a table (unless it's a big game). It technically a Purdue bar, but they never really show up.

Food is top notch as far as sports bars go in the city. The three items pictured below are my go-to items (nachos, wings, tots).

Daily rotating drink specials. The one I usually go for is Saturday $11 domestic pitchers.

Drinking games in the back (beer pong, Jenga, connect four). They have a selfie cam.

Upstairs is a big area you can rent out. Believe it is about $2k per 4 hours

Place can get a bit loud sometimes (both from people yelling and the music). Would be nice if for some games they put the sound on the loud speaker v music

First time at 3 sheets last week, met up with a few co workers. I ate beforehand but the drinks were on point! Bartender was attentive and gave us complimentary Shots of what we were drinking. Definitely good vibes, with the Giant Jenga... friendly people at the bar!

Will be attending again.

I love this bar! Came during a Wednesday for $5 off pitchers or $3 off beer ($5)
Rudy was so great I ended up spending more than I needed lol.
Come here for a vibe, even when it's hot it's cool inside, the beer on draft is SUPER COLD and refreshing. One of my favorites in the area!

This bar belongs to the same family as Down The Hatch, Jake's Dilemma and a few others. You can expect cheap beer, friendly bartenders and 80s, 90s and 2000s music. These bars also have delicious wings. I stopped by 3 Sheets last week and the atmosphere was great. Bartender Brian was also very friendly.

This is a great semi divey place to go to, especially when you factor in the drink specials. Be sure to check out their website for their specials, which change daily, and they offer some specials until closing.

The crowd was diverse and a mix of regulars, NYUs, and tourists. There are 2 floors and both were busy on a Saturday night.

The bartenders were great and did several shots with us. Awesome, skittle bombs shots.

As for the bar food 3 shots in, I knew I needed something to eat to soak up some alcohol to keep me going.  The Chicago dog i had was amazing they rivaled crif dogs in PDT;) I would try some of their other food.

For fun, they have giant jenga,connect 4, and beer pong.  There are many big screens around to watch games

The place is very loud on the weekend, but the DJ had us dancing at the bar with their mix of current, 80's, 90's, alternative, and hip hop.

So I've been coming here on Sundays after church usually around 1. They have beer specials during the day.   They also have specials throughout the week.

This past Sunday I was volunteering for AIDS Walk New York walkathon, on my feet for hours. Rather than going to a strange place near Central Park, I took the subway here since I knew I would be good.

Instead of my usual beer order, I ordered Tito's Vodka with ginger ale. Surprising to me when I look at the AIDS WALK  website later, they were a principal sponsor of the event. Great coincidence. I stayed for 4 rounds.  My usual Sunday bartender was there.

Ah, how many nights did I spend here as a grad student after classes? It was fun, they had tables set up for beer pong and additional fun. The lines are shorter these days, and I get the feeling it's a bit harder to run business after covid... but there are still plenty of dark seats and beers to be had here.

Upstairs you can reserve for bigger parties and get drink specials for a large group (they come with wristbands for entry), a couple bartenders managing two bars if you're a really big party, otherwise tends to be closed unless the ground floor is busier. Loud music, of course, and DJ running around some nights.

Let me tell you, this is what you call a funky good time! My mom wanted to go to one of the local bars in the area for her birthday, but it was super busy. So I walked around the corner to the block that I knew best when I worked in this area. Sadly my old faithful has become a comedy club, so we went next door.  From the time we hit the door everyone was super nice and accommodating. We've grabbed a seat at the bar and the fun began 4 beers and 6 shots later my mom was having the time of her life! We had so much fun with the bartenders and the staff we definitely go back when she comes in town again. Say hi to Camryn for me!

We went to 3 Sheets after enjoying 7th Street Burgers and Fries on Macdougal in Greenwich Village last month. 3 Sheets is on West 3rd near the A,B,C,D,E, F & M trains at the West 4th Train Station. Walk across the street and there it is close to the Blue Note Jazz Club, Groove and other hang-put spots. If you want a casual place...3 Sheets Saloon is definitely a good option.

There is security that checks your ID before you can enter the establishment. 3 Sheets has a laid-back, down-to-earth vibe w/ two floors and is clean including their bathrooms. 3 Sheets has Jumbo Jenga, Beer Pong Games and multiple large screen televisions. We were able to enjoy wathcing an NBA Playoff Game as we sat at the bar. 3 Sheets boasts a bubbly, lively  crowd that evening as well as friendly, wonderful staff. Fantastic 80's, 90's Hip-Hop, Pop, Alternative & R + B Music blared from the speakers.  Yes you know I was singing and dancing as I sat on my bar stool-lol. Hearing TLC one minute and then listening to Fine Young Cannibals the next was everything. Good Stuff.

3 Sheets has Happy Hour Specials everyday :
Monday- Friday - $3 off the entire bar & $5 off Beer Pitchers from 3pm-7pm.
Monday- $7 Deep Eddy Vodka drinks & $6 Jameson Shots from 7pm- Close.
Tuesday- $5 Modelo & $6 Blanco Shots
Wednesday- $12 Buckets Michelob Ultra and /or Miller Highlite Ponies.. $6 off all draft beers / $5 Well-Shots.
Thursday- $5 Bud Light Seltzer, $6 Whiskey Shots, $15 Bud Light & Coor Light Beer Pitchers from 7pm-Close.
Friday - $10 Beer & Shot Combo from 7pm-Close.
Saturday- 12pm-7pm - $6 Tito's drinks, Bud Light Seltzer, Blanco Shots, etc.
Sunday - 12- Close - $6 Drafts & Whiskey Shots. $15 Bud Light & Coors Light Beer Pitchers. Also $24 Mugmosas. We enjoyed our $6 Blanco Shots w/ complimentary Cranberry + Pineapple Juice Chasers.

3 Sheets also has bar eats that include Nachos, Chicken Fingers, Quesadillas, Tater Tots, Burgers, Fries, Hot Dogs, Wraps, Sandwiches, etc. Someone ordered wings and they smelled and looked delicious.

Website- 3sheetsnyc.com
Instagram- @3sheetsnyc
3 Sheets is open 7 days a week.
One can also book the 2nd Floor Party Room.for Private Events - 150 Person Capacity.

PURCHASED
· FREE drink tickets -- courtesy of the bartender

POSITIVE
· two-story spot
· public beer pong tables (2 upstairs, 1 downstairs)
· NYU bar

NEGATIVE
· not as crowded on the days I've been. Good spot to hop to and from.

IMPRESSION
· I've been to 3 Sheets twice in my life. The first time was 3 years ago when I first was invited by my friends fresh out of college. The second time was when I met the bartender handing out free drink tickets while at the Yankees vs. Red Sox game (I schooled her friend on the the average length of the vaginal canal being 3 inches. Long story short--a comment from her friend about the size of my Asian weiner came up. (Mine is 5.5 inches.) I think I impressed the bartender who gave me drink tickets after explaining the 3-inch fact. [If you require evidence, please refer to my ex in my profile photo :))

Briefly stopped in for a few car bombs with friends. 3 Sheets was good enough, though I would appreciate signs downstairs indicating when the upstairs space is closed for private events and stuff. Numerous customers kept walking up to be denied access, my parting included, which was a small but easily avoidable annoyance.

LOUD. LOUD. LOUD. Would not recommend this bar at all. Of all the bars/restaurants we have ever been to, by far the loudest. It was louder than a concert I went to last week. We asked the waitress about it but nothing could be done.

We came in to grab some drinks and watch the baseball game on a Friday night but it just felt so uncomfortable and unhealthy for my ears and head. Got a headache from this as the first floor is small and the speakers blast right in your face. The second floor is barely better. Best spot is the bathroom where the music is at a comfortable volume. We didn't stay longer than 30 minutes.

Would highly not recommend. Not sure about the other bars in the area but I would go farther for a better bar.
Very fun atmosphere and the bartenders were amazing!!!!!! Music was loud and energetic! 10/10
Great bartenders! Rudy (Go Pack Go), Gabe, and Emmy made for a great night! 3 Sheets will be a definite stop again next trip to NYC.
Standard bar buffalo chicken wrap. A lot of chicken, small amount of toppings.  Was good, but I'd probably mix it up next time.  Tater tots were great, warm and crispy.

Such a fun local vibe! Only reason it's not a five star, this one speaker is in desperate need of repair or replacement. The bass is nonexistent and sounds like a radio station from the 1950s. Other than that, so fun! Great bartenders and bouncers!

ON PRIDE. Literally the day of, a man who worked there was running the line to the bathroom, had the audacity to misgender my friend and try and force them to go into the wrong bathroom.  The vibes were not there.  Only good thing was the music.  Don't recommend.

We went to this bar while waiting for our comedy show to start and ended up going back after the show. The bartenders were very nice, we closed down the bar with the staff lol! Drinks were great and music was amazing! Very good prices for NYC and drink deals every day. Definitely visit if you are in the area!

Went here to watch playoff football game with some friends. They have plenty of screens to watch the game and put the sound on.  The drunks are reasonably priced. It was super packed so we just stood the whole time,  but it was very fun.  Place could be a little more clean.  A great bar for games.
Stopped here for a few beers while we waited for our show at the comedy cellar. Staff is nice and the beer is fairly priced. Great laid back spot!

This is a laid back dive bar. The staff are cool & the food & drinks are great.
Typical Covid rules, mask are required once you stand up & or walk. Once seated you may remove your mask, this bar is at the epicenter of West 4th area. It feels good sitting inside at a bar again.
Oh and we got free red bull, the tropical flavor is the best!

3 sheets saloon is a bar that my classmates and I have gone to a few times to celebrate the end of an exam or to celebrate a birthday. Though it has a little bit less space than nearby bars, the fact that it has a full bar both upstairs and a downstairs allows for enough space to accommodate a whole class.

The bartenders and staff are more than friendly (the bartender somehow remembered almost all of our names despite the bar being packed) and service was INCREDIBLY quick for both the food and the drinks. During happy hour, the price is almost unrivaled for the area. I was getting pitchers of beer for $10, as well as shots for around $4. Even the food, which was not a happy hour special, was pretty reasonably priced for what you were getting.

At some point in the night I got hungry so I ordered some nachos (and added in the optional pulled pork for an additional $4) coming out to a little over $16. At first I thought this was a lot, until I actually saw the size of my nachos. The plate could literally feed a small army, and I found myself offering food to my classmates.

All in all, had a great time, and I will be back.

Update a few years later

I had to knock it down a star due to the fact the last few years they got rid of the 1/2 price whole bar on the weekends.  Such a bummer. They still have beer specials 1/2 off, bit they did raise the beer prices a few bucks and they have $5 deep Eddy on sat and $5 tullamore due shots on Sunday. But it's not the same.  They still have the 1/2 price whole bar during the week though which is wonderful!  Me and my friends were coming here for the longest of times. Before it got popular. But I get it supply and demand haha.

It's still a good place to come for sporting events. And having a good tomw.  People are friendly in there. Bartenders are great. And the food is good bar food. Wings are amazing. One of the better wings I've had.  The bacon grilled cheese is simple but delicious and the tator tots are crunchy.  

Still a good spot but was better a couple years ago.

Celebrated my birthday here a couple of weeks ago where I met with about 10 friends. Didn't make a reservation since I knew they were all arriving at different times. We ate a bunch of nachos and ordered pitchers and had a great time. Loved the relaxed atmosphere, and no frills type of vibe. It was perfect for us.
A Bud is $8, seriously!? All their bars were sweet. Now they all suck. A friendly bartender would be nice.

I came here early on Superbowl Sunday with a friend to celebrate the end of my MBA. She'd raved about the buffalo chicken nachos here since we met and she promised me she would take me out for them!

I had a very different experience this time around than I did previously. The floor was not sticky with spilled drinks and the entire atmosphere was overall much less rowdy.

Even though tables were already reserved for the game, the staff was nice enough to let us take a seat given that we leave before the reservations started. We were lucky that the individuals that our table was reserved for didn't arrive while we were still there - as we saw quite a few other tables get displaced awkwardly.

Our nachos took a while to come out, but they were worth the wait. The cheese was baked onto the chips and the buffalo chicken, yet the chips maintained their crunch. There were also a ton of buffalo chicken pieces mixed in with the chips. NOMS. Overall, it was a fantastic $14 spent.

I noticed that 3 Sheets actually has some pretty awesome happy hour deals throughout the week as well. It would definitely be my pre-gaming bar of choice if I had to choose one!

Found this place with my friend because we were in the area and needed a place to watch a hockey game. They fit us in right away even on a crowded Saturday. Got seats at the bar and the bar tenders put on the game just for us. Great deal with 1/2 price beer Saturday's 12-8. Can't find a better price in the city.
I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap with the chipotle chicken. The fries looked more like fried pickles but they were good. I wouldn't get the chipotle chicken again (it didn't pair well with buffalo) but it was very good. It was a pulled spiced chicken.
Very good portion of food for $12.

Bartenders were phenomenal. Even though I'd change a few things about the food, the service was great and that's why I'm giving them 5 stars.

Will gladly stumble upon here next time I'm in the area.
One of the bouncers is extremely unprofessional and racist. Beware
trash service and the guy in the front was a terrible person

I mean, you walk in here knowing what to expect.

While I haven't been here on a weekend, I am sure it gets wild and loud. Even on a Thursday at 4pm it's loud and busy.

Why you ask? Because all of these sister bars are cheap and good. So if you've never been here; come in with that mindset and you won't be disappointed.

The service has always been good here, everyone is pretty friendly and efficient.

4/5

Here for beer (again)..

Good:
-happy hour prices
-lively crowd, but in a good way
-2 floors, drink where you choose to
-tons of TVs

Bad:
-none

I was visiting from out of town with a friend and the bouncer refused to let me inside claiming my drivers license was fake then began insulting me when I insisted he bring someone else for verification even a cop if he wanted! I am nearly 25 years old so I found it ridiculous that still at my big age I have to argue with someone that I'm old enough to get into a trashy bar. Didn't make any sense to me at all that he quickly accepted my friends ID who looks much younger than me? We are both over 21 with valid ID's and this really killed the mood for the whole night. If you can't even tell real from fake you shouldn't be working as a bouncer. He also began making fun of me with the person next to him so unprofessional.

Beer pong.  They have beer pong available upstairs.  Something I haven't indulged in since college but it's always fun when you have a girls night out with your old school crew - as long as there is no streaking involved.

Beware of the ping pong shark lest you end up behaving like Will Ferrell after losing a few rounds! Ma ma shark do do do do do do do still had it and someone definitely ended up 3 sheets to wind.

Alas, I digress.   It's a great place to make Snapchat memories.
Trash bouncers, trash food, overpriced alcohol. Better off going into bars on LES unless you're waiting to catch a comedy show in which case you should go into the many other bars around.

Came here for a high school reunion. This bar isn't bad.

Good amount of space, tables for beer pong, enough places to sit and stand, and big TVs for all the sport fanatics. Plus is that the drinks are pretty cheap and also the music was bumpin' when we went on a Wednesday night, so it must be even better/more fun on a weekend when more people are out and dancing. I don't think this would be go-to place, but it's a chill spot for drinks and to hang out.

Decent

If you're looking for a sportsy bar with drinks, then this is decent.

2 SPACES- upstairs & downstairs

vibe - packed. collegy.

dingy grimy bathroom.

prices slightly higher than normal.

We came to this bar because it was right next door to the one we were already at. The bartenders and workers were nice, nothing too crazy.

I loved that they had a charging booth for phones there. You can securely keep your phone in there and charge it without worrying about someone stealing it. I also loved the free photo booth they had where it would email you photos!

They had a big diverse selection of drinks, and they knew the drinks we asked them to make from time to time.

Would definitely come back here again!

I'm a big fan of this place & I'm a big fan of Dives and semi Dives, this place falls between, but the needle clearly points towards awesomeness.

The divometer must have affordable drinks and  this place has exceptionally affordable drinks especially during happy hours around $3 for domestic pints and specials all the time. I happen to fall into a group of Ironworkers the day I rolled in then, they were buying for all that chose to join them, mamma didnt raise no fools especially when it's free.  I noticed a lot of smiles and people enjoying them self which keeps pushing the divometer in the right direction.

The one thing for me that really stood out was the wonderful selection of alternative music that particular day. Many of the cutting-edge favorites such as my 80 faves like Depeche Mode but they were playing their new music that just came out along with the Red Hot Chili Peppers and a few other modern tracks that that I wasn't quite privy to. It really had a very cool feel as the night rolled from happy hour into the evening the same relaxed group of people replaced one another and the smiles continued into the evening.

The place was fairly clean as far as dive standards are concerned and the bar menu was exceptional with many of the usual offerings but made perfectly. Unfortunately nothing really comes to mind, I mean a chicken wing is a chicken wing, but these chicken wings rocked.

So, to sum it up, Omg so cool awesome music and priced right, warm and inviting. Yep this guys sold, baby!

Came here last night and had a blast. They have beer pong which is hilarious but I was more interested in the life size JENGA! So much fun. Also drinks are fairly priced and apparently they have happy hour with 50% off all drinks!
The bar tender is super duper friendly . The area is spectacular and the subway is close by!!!!

TERRIBLE. Ralph wouldn't let us in because of sweat pants shen the bar was dead and they are open for 45 more minutes. You can bring your scooter in, but can't come from work.  

Please don't support this shit hole.

I've been to many bars in my life. Never one like this. The manger was taking shots with costumers and forcing us to adhere to rules that weren't posted and made no sense. You are only allowed to stand in certain areas, but it is not marked so you just had to wait to either be spoken to (security though was kind) or the manger would tell you to move (not kind at all). Wouldn't not recommend, though it did seem popular so I understand my presence won't make a difference, I will never be back.
*also Long Island iced teas are $18.00*
*the only reason this isn't a one star is because the security was kind, NOT THE SUPPOSED MANAGER*

Super fun bar! Came here on a Saturday night and played beer pong and flip cup with friends. There are two tables in the back that can be used to play either flip cup or beer pong. The tables also have like a little diagram so you know how to set up beer pong or where to place your cups for flip cup.

There's an upstairs area with another bar and the bathrooms.

I ordered a Sam Adams seasonal beer in October.
They gave me the summer seasonal beer without asking.

The order requires a food purchase.  I ordered the nachos.  They charged me $4 extra for veggie nachos because they added tomatoes without me asking.

The beer is in a 12 oz plastic cup instead of 16 oz
Fire college bar with good drink deals. Service was excellent but expect a younger crowd and a tad grimy but roll with it. Lots of TVs to watch games.

My friend held an event in the second floor so we had a big area to ourselves. Second floor is pretty spacious and open. First floor seemed very crowded.

There's beer pong and tvs. Drinks were good, food was good. I had the McDowells Burger and it was cooked perfectly. I had a hard time finishing it because the portion with the fries is huge! Prices are little higher, but I enjoyed my time here.
I love the wings.  I had to get some for takeout. The drinks are okay. They seem strong enough for me. But my friend said they were weak.

I love this bar. And Tara is one of the friendliest, fastest, and most on-the-ball servers I've ever met. She and the rest of the Three Sheets team are what keep me coming back.

also the nachos.

This place gets going and I mean that in a good way.  They have beer pong, cheapish drinks, good folks working the bar and decent music pumping.  I havent been here in a minute but when I went back it got better than the last time I was here.  Its interesting that the crowd isnt super young, even though everyone is acting like it...again, I mean that in a good way. People just find a way to have good time while keeping it mostly under control.

Good stuff here.

Man this place is awesome. They have amazing happy hour drink specials and two floors to hang out in. On the top floor they even have beer pong tables set up. Great place to stop by after work for a drink and a quick bite to eat. I ordered the wings in a medium sauce and they were delicious. Staff is super friendly as well and the bathrooms were clean.

I'm not a big burger person but I always crave 7th Street Burger! Their burgers are juicy, flavorful, and the buns are cooked perfectly. The sauce really elevates it, I wish I can dip everything in it. Their fries are everything! They are crispy but also potato-y, if you know what I mean. May I say, their fries are better than McDonalds!

It's a small spot where you order the burgers at the counter and find a seat. Make sure you grab a bottle of Coke, really completes the meal. The people there are very nice, and the wait is never too long. I'm so excited they have opened up more stores!

7th street burger always hits the spot!

When you walk in you order at the register and then wait for your food. No restrooms and no where really to eat but the little counter space inside against the wall. It does get crowded inside and outside. It gets busy with people
Ordering and doing pick up orders so it could be a little of a wait.

The prices could be on the higher side but it's kind of avg as well

The cheeseburger is so good, so much flavor the sauce is like a tangy thousand island. The cheese is always super melty. I use to get cheeseburgers but I think the double is so much better lol

The fries always are made fresh and have the perfect crisp. I recommend getting a side of Their house sauce to dip the fries

The loaded fries are very filling on its own. Personally if I'm coming here I would
Only get the burger or loaded fries not both, it's too filling for both. But the double cheeseburger and fries combo is more filling than it looks.

This spot will forever be the go to late night!

There's a hot debate within my social circles about who's better: 7th Street or Smashed. I can't officially chime in yet but I can say I'd commit murder for a 7th Street Burger. Would I stop at one murder?

Am I a fan of the astronomical price? Absolutely not. Am I willing to overlook this and downplay this information when I speak to my financial advisor? Absolutely yes! I will look that man dead in the eyes and tell him I got robbed instead of enjoying the grease that pulls through the checkered wax paper on a double pattied charred by abundantly juicy burger.

I also want to point out that I may or may not have had a fresh burger made from YouTube's most notorious Burger Father recently and I'd still choose 7th street.
While delicious, was the greasiest burger I've ever eaten.  So much so that is was very difficult to eat and fell apart before I could finish it.

The burgers here are fantastic! They're freshly made, just a little greasy, but delicious throughout. The line can be quite long though - between arriving, order, and picking up my order, it probably took around 40 min. Individual counter seating is available, or take it to go to one of the neighboring parks or benches.

The atmosphere was a very young spot and it's a good spot for late nights when hanging with friends since it's open til 3am but the food is very average. It's nice that it has a vegetarian option but it didn't rock my world. Very run of the mill for late nights but not a bad option when you're searching for a good greasy meal :)
Service was standard!

Had a great meal here that was so messy and tasty. The double cheeseburger was especially good today. So much patty. The potato bun and cheese came together and it honestly felt like eating Mac & cheese.

The loaded fries were a little light tonight. I feel like past times they really load it up, but not this time. Light on the onions too. Still very tasty. Didn't know they are $11, a little expensive.

Got a water too so the meal came out to $23. Quite the price but the quality is really good.

The service was quite rude tbh. When requesting the loaded fries with meat, the guy said that was redundant and made me feel stupid (you can get impossible instead) and then another worker yelled at the amount of people in the store and seemed annnoyed at their booming business. There's a way to crowd control effectively.

Thank you to Katie, Yelp's Manhattan community manager for getting me HOOKED on 7th Street Burger Fries. Their customer base is the night crowd as they open at 4, so it's a great little, after-work or after-school snack.

They are delicious, always fresh, and perfectly crispy. For the most part, it's always burning hot once we get them from the cashier. Love them fresh fries! My friend who had the burger said their burgers are good, I had a bite, but I'm not a huge burger fan so I won't be biased about it. But it is a plain-looking burger. I do have to give them credit that it's made to order on the spot, thus fresh and warm.
