tl;dr - try the fries!!!

Looking for a burger joint that won't break the bank? Head on over to 7th Street Burgers on MacDougal St. The burgers are a decent size but won't leave you feeling stuffed like a turkey. Despite their smaller size, they're packed with flavor and feature tasty toppings like pickles, cheese, caramelized onions and a house-made sauce that'll make you want to lick your fingers (or the wrapper).

And let's talk about that bun - it's toasted to perfection and really takes the burger to the next level.

For those with bigger appetites, I highly recommend going for the double instead of the single burger. It's a bit more expensive, but the extra patty and toppings make it well worth it.

The fries are a standout here - crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and seasoned to perfection. And if you're a big eater, go for the double burger instead of the single. It's worth the extra cash for the extra patty and toppings.

Oh, and a shoutout to Kevin for being a friendly and prompt server. He's the burger MVP.

The only downside? The number of food couriers smoking outside the establishment. Some came into the restaurant smelling funky and taking up space. Not exactly the ideal dining companions. But hey, it's New York City - you never know what you're going to get.

Overall, 7th Street Burgers is a solid choice for a casual, tasty meal. And while the weed-smoking food couriers may be a bit of a buzzkill, the delicious burgers and fries more than make up for it. So go ahead and give it a try - just be prepared to deal with some funky smells on the way in or try their other location.

THE BEST BURGERS IN NEW YORK!

That's why they're now on their third locations and so popular. They don't try to fancy this up or have some bells and whistle type set up. They keep it simple and focus on what they should ... make the best, tastiest and most delicious burgers in all the land.

And their good people too, as they give back to the community, helping to feed the homeless and be a part of the NYC community.

Forget about all the other wannabes and should have beens. This is the only place in town you need to concern yourself with.

Don't walk, run ... and grab someone. Trust me, it'll be love at first bite.

Go.

Seriously, what are you waiting for. Just go!
Top burger in NYC this is the 3rd location I've been to and each one is just as good as the last which is so amazing! Best late night bites in New York!

This place has been getting a lot of hype and I can see why. I've hopped on the smash burger wagon. Their fries were nice and crispy and thick, kind of like crispier and thicker Burger King fries; potatoey in flavor and could be more salty but it's fine. They got a nice crunch in Italy with a brittle texture underneath.

DOUBLE BURGER
cheesy, gooey, American cheese fully surrounds two crispy, perfectly browned beef patties. The bread is greased and melts as soon as you bite into it along with the cheese and then you get that salty, savory, browned beef for that sharp umami. It all goes by so fast as the burger is a little small but it seems smash burgers tend to lean that way. Would come back for sure

Stopped by 7th st burger for the best burger I've had in a long time! It's located on Macdougal St. Macdougal st is a super busy street in Greenwich village. They only serve single or double cheeseburger with all the trimmings and house sauce. It was packed and well worth the wait! You can't go wrong with keeping it simple. Even with a packed house the guys stopped to take a picture with me. Genuine cool guys, the customer service is excellent. Burger 9.4

Holy Smokes!

Okay now, before I get ahead of myself and go crazy with this review. I have been so hype to try @7thstreetburgernyc for monthsssss now! Timing and availability just didn't make sense for me to visit but I finally had the chance this past week. I will say that the food, albeit simple, BLEW ALL MY EXPECTATIONS THROUGH THE ROOF!

I like to think of myself as an amateur burger connoisseur, and I've had many burgers across the world to baseline my review. Comparing 7th st's burger to smilar styles, it is far and few between the BEST burger or at least top 5 for me at the moment. Starting with the bun, it was incredibly soft and fluffy with the meat perfectly complementing every bite of that burger with a crisp meat crust and juicy patty. With every bite of this burger I was wanting more and more! The house sauce is thousand island style sauce but 100 times better! The burger was by far the star of the show. I was hoping the fries would be some of the better ones that I've had, but I was thoroughly disappointed. Fries were mid at best and in my opinion worth it to skip.

All in all, @7thstburgernyc is a must try! Go get that burger asap and let me know what you think.

Rating: 8.9/10

IG: @mrtravelfoodie

I LOVED LOVED LOVED this Elite Event!!!!
To be honest, I was shocked by this place and I'll explain why...

I decided to take a look at the reviews before making our way to 7th Street Burger and thought: "well... another "regular" burger place. Let's see what they have". The reviews were mixed but I noticed more 4 & 3 stars dominated when I first saw this place.

Let me tell you, the first thing that shocked me was the DELICIOUS smell coming from their kitchen when you step into the burger shop. Omg!!! It was like I was smacked from it!!! I love when all my senses activate by food and this was FOR SURE the occasion.
Ok, great smell but let's see how it actually tastes.

WOAAAAHHHH!!! Our palates were BLOWN AWAY!!!!!
The burgers are not huge, they are more like "ShakeShack|5Guys" size, but the flavor was like 1000 times more!!!!!! Woahhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

They season the meat very good, I don't know what they use but nothing was salty but it was salty enough for you to enjoy, if this explains what I mean...
Every little bite contained an excellent mix of seasonings and flavor and spices, I was literally shocked and was not expecting such deliciousness from the burger or the fries. The Double cheeseburger was literally a BOMB of TASTINESS packed in a burger!!!!!!

We both got: Double cheeseburgers + "Loaded" Chopped beef fries + Water.

Their fries were also to die for!!!!!!
I can't STRESS this enough: THEIR FRIES WERE THE CRUNCHIEST FRIES I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!!!!!!!!
Woahhhhh!!!!!!

As soon as I took the first bite I called my sister and told her:
"You have to try this place out!!!!!!!!!!
Their burgers are not huge but they will make you drool and die instantly!!!".

We're burger fans and this place became my First choice for whenever I'm craving one, the flavorrrrrrrrrrrrrr was HEAVENLY!!!!! I can't explain how good they were with enough words, mouthwatering, delectable, exquisite, all together!!!!!!

I CANT WAIT TO BE BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Forget Shake Shack, you have 7th Street Burger in the house. I brought my daughter with me to their Yelp Elite event and we were not expecting anything great as it's a simple small joint.  The minute we took a bite we were blown away. It's was juicy with full lots of flavor.  I haven't been to McDonalds in over 30 years but I remembered when I was a kid and thought it was the juiciest burger ever.  This was that kind of feeling. Now there are different kinds of burgers, we know that... This isn't a burger at a BBQ, or a thick juicy burger at Minetta Tavern.  This is a straight up, perfect burger that melts in your mouth with more flavor than most burgers. Hands down it's the burger you think of when ending your night out, or recovering from a fun night.  It's the type of burger you know is a bit indulgent because you've been eating clean but you just have to have it.  I'm definitely coming back!

This was a chill spot for a Yelp Elite Week event. I completely forgot I even RSVP'd for this event. Our dog passed away a couple of days prior and my family and I were just spending time together so this was a pleasant surprise and nice reprieve from our grieving. We all had dental appointments in the city and I figured a trip to the Village for burgers afterwards would be a nice reward.

They have a great location..smoke shop adjacent (hehe). The menu is extremely simple. My son nearly had a fit because he loves to customize everything but I've become fond of simplicity; I have found that if the ingredients are good, the end result will taste even better when there's less added.

My +1 was hubbs but they were super nice and comped us for three burger meals. They even threw in an Ube Boanana banana pudding, which I urge everyone to try post haste!

We ordered three double cheeseburgers with fries and we all agreed that the burgers were good. The fries were crisp on the outside and soft inside. The burgers were greasy, cheesy and meaty, and their house sauce was spot on. We ate everything before heading home and I'm glad we did.

Nick and Noah, the twins of this burger joint, helped us out and set us up. The wait wasn't long despite the amount of delivery orders they were banging out. I would definitely go back and grab another burger. 7th Street Burger is in the perfect spot for drunk eats, munchie eats, hangover eats and just plain in-the-mood-for-a-burger eats. I wish them longevity.

Thanks, 7th Street Burger staff, Yelp and Katey, for setting up this event...it's sweet to be elite ;D

Smashed burgers, like 5 guys, but delicious. I'm usually the person who orders the burger rare. That was not an option here. I usually don't like thin burgers. But this one was very good. They put together a great burger.

The bread was excellent. I'm not usually one to notice the bread, but they chose a great bun. It held together very well. This is a greasy burger, so the bun staying together was great. They put their sauce inside the burger. And I believe it was the same sauce they gave as a side to go. I will ask for my burger with no sauce inside next time. As it was a little too much in there. But still delicious either way.

The fries were great. Great texture. I don't know if they double fry these, but this has to be some of the best fries in NYC.

I loved that their menu is small and simple. I might return, the only thing holding me back is by the time you add the cost of fries, it gets real close to what I'd pay to sit down somewhere and get a rare burger. So it's just personal preference. But this is probably the best smashed style burger I've eaten.

This is my favorite burger joint in the city. I didn't know I loved smash burgers until I tried this place. Now I'm obsessed! I love that they don't assume a vegetarian burger needs to be gluten free or have freakin alfalfa sprouts. Just a solid, simple cheeseburger.

I always have two of the single impossible burger ($10.78) and my boyfriend always gets two of the double beef cheese burger ($11.40). He gets the Chopped beef fries ($13.20) and I get the Chopped Impossible Fries ($15).

My go-to cheat day spot--- I highly recommend!

Stopped by here on a rainy Saturday for a quick bite~

Super speedy & friendly service! My husband and I ordered the cheeseburger without cheese, fries and cokes. Everything was absolutely delicious, esp the patty they use - it's juicy, tender and mixed with lots of minced onion. For a fast food burger joint, 7th Street Burger has exceeded my expectations.

I will be back!

Doesnt look like much at first but such a great place to pop in and grab a quick bite.

The interior is a small place just to order food, there's a few bar stools on the left side of the restaurant. Super casual place you just walk up and order.

The burger reminds me of in-and-out burgers, had great amount of flavor and greasiness that just hits the spot. After a night out around the area this is the perfect place to hit.

Come get your late night fix here!!! This spot is open til 3 AM with some counter seats. You can sit alone or with a friend and have a delicious meal of burger and fries. The price for the quality can't be beat.

The cheeseburger is delicious and juicyyyy - grilled on both sides. The fries are top notch and you would be remiss to not order them every single time!

I got the double cheeseburger, fries and a coke. I loved how melted the cheese was on the burger, and how the onions were cooked in it. The patty was a little thinner than I expected, so I am glad that I did not get the single burger. The fries were still very hot and crispy when I got them, so happy that they were fresh.

This place feels like the perfect late night spot, and I will definitely come back for it when I'm out in the area. It tastes like a premium burger, and I think is worth what you'd pay for it. The cashier was extremely nice / friendly. There wasn't too much seating, so would probably take it to go. It's hard to eat outside since Macdougal Street is so crowded. Only suggestion would be to include more napkins in the bag - we took it to go to eat in a park and more napkins would have helped.

This burger place is on a busy and lively street near Washington Square Park. The burger place was busy when we went but the server there took our order and then within 5 minutes or so, our food was ready. The selection is simple and the food is great.

If you're looking for a guilty pleasure place to eat a nice, casual, greasy, classic American burger without all the fancy mumbo jumbo of fancy burger restaurants then this is the place for you. Shake Shack, Five Guys and others don't have anything on this classic and local spot for just a handful of items to choose from.

We got two double cheeseburgers, two fries and two Cokes. The cheeseburgers were greasy but delicious and the patties were flavorful. The fries were nice and crispy and perfectly pre-seasoned...no extra salt is needed. The Cokes were in the glass bottle and sweetened with cane sugar making it that much more refreshing.

The seating in the store is tight whenever there are multiple customers inside. Depending on what time you go, there's always lots of music around and weed and cigarette smokers. The restaurant is open with no doors so just make note of that depending on your tolerance. We went to the park to enjoy our meal instead. Bring extra napkins with you when you go!

I preface this with I am not a big cheeseburger and fries fan. The last time I had a burger was before the pandemic in 2019 so I rarely have any kind of burger to begin with. With that said, the burger was actually pretty good. When you walk in on the menu it automatically tells you what all burgers come with, so there is no customization. In a sense, that's kind of cool because you know it too expect. However, they do not include lettuce and tomato and I love my lettuce & tomato so that kind of sucks for me, but not a dealbreaker.

The Ambience
When I went, they were playing a lot of Mac Miller and I was very happy. This is on MacDougall Street, so you have to keep in mind that and NYU dorm is two blocks away. MacDougall is always very lively due to the bars and college vibe so if you're not used to it, prepare for it. As for seating, they have five stools and a table attached to the wall. Nothing fancy, but it does what it needs to.


The Food
I ordered the cheeseburger and the impossible fries so I could see if I could taste the difference between the meat and the impossible meat. I honestly could not, and that is absolutely genius and magic. When I come back here, I'm definitely going to try the impossible burger straight up because those fries with the impossible meat was so good, I argue better than In-N-Out Burger they have on the West Coast.

Overall
Though I'm not a big Burger fan, I'm definitely coming back for those impossible fries!

I'm genuinely surprised by how much I liked this place.

It's a fast, "cheap" burger place that is so, so, so good. It has the perfect balance of flavor and burger greasiness that brings me so much joy.

Also, the customer service is great. Dom provided recs (I hope I remembered his name properly) and he was very helpful and so friendly. He even happily answered a bunch of my questions about the origin story. A+ for Dom.

Now...on to the food. Get. It. All. But seriously. Do it.

Double cheeseburger: yum. I'm drooling right now thinking about it. It is somewhat reminiscent of in-n-out, but also completely different in some ways. The meat is delicious. Great grilled onions. The cheese is a great balance and didn't make the burger too salty. Their house sauce is good too.

Fries: these surprised me. I was expecting plain, boring fries but they were so crispy to perfection and had a great seasoning. I liked dipping these into their house sauce.

Mexican coke: good! Won't comment much since they didn't make it.

I will definitely be returning. There's a few counter seats inside, but the park is a close walk if you want to eat in nature instead.

Great spot for a quick, cheap burger. We got the impossible burger with fries. The burger was super flavorful and tasted great with the house sauce. Fries were very crispy and a good portion!

Our food took about 10 minutes to come and it was served hot. I think they're open late too, so it's perfect to come by after going out!

Located on the west village end. A few steps up and you will come upon a burger spot. Small spot with a few stools to enjoy your burger.

Got the double cheese burger and it was made on the spot, hot and fresh Greasy and juicy. The beef with fries was outstanding, much more flavorful then the regular fries. Also got the Mexican coke.

Service was quick.
Ni hi z oh Mc uni cls z go z mi zzjudkslahsjs shsusjmayxjrjejx in his uni is ji nxjxuxkxmzuu ji did niceeeee

I can't believe it took me so long to try this place. I'm so happy I finally did.

The place doesn't look like much. It's really small, and they only offer a couple menu options. It's because their entire menu is their specialty.

Their smashed burger easily became my favorite in NYC, as soon as I bit into it.

Patty ~ Perfectly cooked, perfectly smashed. Thin, but not underwhelming. Absolutely delicious.
Ingredients ~ The cheese is perfectly melted. The pickle is so sweet and a perfect addition to the burger. There aren't any other of the tipical ingredients you'd find in a burger (i.e. tomatoes, sliced onions), but the sauce honestly makes you forget about all that.
Sauce ~ The sauce... Wow. Chopped onions and pickles are mixed in. I heard people compare it to In n Out but no no... This is so much better! Although small, and it might not look like it, this burger is so juicy!
Bread ~ Yum! Perfect for this burger.

On a side note - you can order the fries animal style. They're so good!!

This burger is more than a 10/10!!! Go try it if you haven't already.

I don't usually like burgers but this one was to die for. My friend brought me along with her to their yelp event and I was surprised at the flavors it presented. The fries were a bit salty but other than that, the burger was made perfectly. I will definitely try out their many locations when I'm in the city next time.

Even just walking past this spot, you'll know it's the place to go when you want a traditional, greasy, fast food hangover indulgent burger. I've been to the other location on 7th street with friends, but never got my own. However, I was lucky enough to come here for a yelp elite event  and finally try it myself. I got the double cheeseburger no cheese, fries, and extra sauce on the side.

The burger: 9/10
I loved this burger. The bun is almost like a Hawaiian bun as its slightly sweet, yellow and soft. The beef is also very flavorful. I'd recommend getting a double since they're thin patties smashed down. The pickles were very tangy (love that) and the sauce was delicious too. I would say get the cheese if you can stomach it (I can't) as I felt maybe it was a tad dry without. I also like the sauce but I gotta sauce I'm an in-and-out sauce person through and through.

The fries: 10/10
These fries are in my definition perfect. Hot and fluffy inside, crispy salty outside. Not too thin, not soggy, not too hard or crunchy. Very dank.

The service: 10/10
Loved the friendly cashier! I appreciate nice service a lot and he was chatting about how this location is picking up speed.

Overall, good quality, greasy and delicious burger that I imagine would be perfect for a hangover, ending a night out, or a late lunch when you want something bomb.

Quick Service, great location, and tasty burgers.
My friend and I both ordered double cheeseburgers and fries. She loved the fries, the kind of fries that look like they've been double fried, yet aren't soaking in oil and are perfectly crispy.
The burger reminded me of the Pastis Burger I had a few weeks ago - double patty, smashed, melted cheese oozing everywhere and some ketchup/mayo with a pickle to top it all off.

We both finished our meals and said, yeah, I could eat another one! I only wish they served something besides Mexican coke and water, I was craving a diet coke to go with my meal!

Came by at 4pm on a Wednesday - there were a few people waiting. We put in our orders: double cheeseburgers and loaded fries.

There's something about their sauce... it's sweet, tangy. Kind of reminds me of In-n-Out. Their loaded fries basically had a slab of hamburger meat and their sauce on it. I appreciate the amount of sauce - the fries definitely weren't dry.

The burger was really good as well. The bun tasted a little sweet. Double cheeseburgers are $9.50 each.

Staff was SO nice. The guy at the register who helped us really made our day.

Shake shack, watch out. This little burger joint rocks.

This spot is an amazing quick bite. The burgers are incredibly tasty, with soft fluffy buns with a hint of sweetness, and loads of flavor in their sauce.

Wish there was an option to add some lettuce and tomato or extras to the burgers, but they're delicious regardless.

Their chopped beef fries are a generous portion, and felt reminiscent of in n out animal-style fries, though the fries were closer to the ones at five guys.

Go here if you are looking for a good old fashioned greasy American hamburger. The menu itself is bare bones simple which means they perfect their craft in one thing which is a dying breed nowadays. They give you the option of a single, double, or impossible burger, fries, and drinks - I love it. I got the double cheeseburger and it was just a classic feeling sandwich, almost like a mix between In-N-Out and Shake Shake. The staff at 7th Street was also friendly and made sure I had everything I needed.

Highly recommend checking it out if you're near one of their locations and want to support a local establishment!

My review does not align with popular opinion but don't diminish my credibility. The burger tasted fine, we paid $11.40 for the double on Grubhub and I'm not even mad at that BUT there was only ONE pickle! Forget the price and value for price, this particular smash burger has a larger surface area, to the point where it exceeds the size of the bun so picture this pretty large smash burger (2 Patties mind you) with ONE pickle. Even with the large half dollar coin sized pickle the ratio is completely off, in my opinion there should have been THREE slices of pickles. It doesn't stop there... im a west coast gal with a strong opinion about in n out burgers and the spread at 7th st is a bit too mayo-y and not enough relishiness (strike 2) not to mention the squished flattened bun with very little bounce back that tends to get kind of gummy when sitting on sauce and burger juice. I wouldn't say it's bad but it's definitely hyped and far from the best burger. It's tasty enough but it's no in n out. Side note: my boyfriend loved everything about this burger lol

There was a lot of hype around this hole in the wall burger joint!  My first impression was it's very greasy but my impression before that it is cheap.  The bun tastes sweet and the beef was good quality.  The sauce on the burger reminded me of a Big Mac at mcD's.   I was told it rivals the best burger in New York.  For cheap I would agree but not the best burger in my opinion.  But a solid choice.

I came here for an event before and was super impressed with the staff, following and food, so of course I brought my mom during her birthday trip to NYC. The non-descript front with its bright bay windows open up into a compact, lunch counter lobby and open concept kitchen. The staff here is phenomenal, and they even bring your order. We both had cheese burgers, fries and water. We snagged a couple baonanas treats after I told her it was really worth the calories, lol. As I told her, she agreed this is the best burger she's ever had. And be sure to get some sauce for your fries. You will not regret it.

I stopped by this place near NYU's campus. It is nestled between a bunch of local popular spots among students. Easy to miss the small location. Look for the Creperie's bright yellow sign and it is right next door.

This place gets crowded pretty quickly. There are about 6-8 stools if you decide to eat there. Napkins & hand sanitizers are a plenty. No restrooms. The vibe is like a hip hop nightclub. Loud hip hop music, an employee sitting on a trash can with Jordans on by the register felt like a bouncer at a club. Nonetheless the staff was friendly. Right outside there's a steady haze of cigarette and weed smoke sometimes wafting into the restaurant. I'd suggest taking food to go unless you like the cigarette infused fries.

I'm not really a burger person, but tried the impossible/beyond meat burger as a vegetarian. It comes with a house mayo sauce, cheese, & pickles. No vegan options unless you just do a patty with ketchup & pickles. I found the burger a bit too greasy for me. The fries are crispy and good even without ketchup. Oh yea - they didn't put any ketchup packets in my to go bag. I wish I checked before I left, but assumed it was a basic thing most places provide. Drink options were a classic coke or bottled water.

Overall, probably not a spot for those who like veggie burgers, don't want to go deaf from the music, or come out smelling like cigars/weed. But, the staff is friendly and the fries are crispy!

I was lucky enough to try this burger joint as part of a Yelp Elite event, and was glad I attended.  The ordering process was smooth, the service was quick (despite being relatively busy), and the burgers (did a double patty) were top-notch.  A few more beverage options and a little more outdoor seating (had to crash the neighboring spot's outdoor tables) would have been nice, but the food itself is worth the stop if you're in the village.

This place's burger is amazing!! It's so delish esp when they add the onion, cheese and special sauce! The fries are pretty good too, I think it's double fried because it's extra crispy with a hint of bbq seasoning flavor! Highly recommend coming here for your next burger fix!

The menu is super simple.  Get a burger.  Order some fries.  Maybe even grab a drink if you're feeling it.  Wait a few minutes for them to call your name.  Then, DEVOUR the food in all of it's cheesy and greasy goodness.  

The burger is delicious.  The fries (and dipping sauce) are on point.  This place is well worth checking out.

Oh.... Oh my. I think whatever I ate here violated my standards. Here's my review in poem form.

My partner and I, sick at home it would seem
We caught the damn 'Rona and must quarantine
She wanted some fries. I was vibing with her
A few clicks later and we ordered burgers
It quickly arrived and we prepared to feast.
But I was shocked at the grease. The grease. The grease!

Oh my God there's so much. An explosion of oil.
Everything I touched, my hands just got soiled
Officer, there's been a murder. And who is to blame?
This crime of meat juices puts five guys to shame
I almost said no. It's too much. I can't take it.
If I were to eat this. Could my weak body make it?

I gathered my courage and managed a bite.
The rest, I tell you, was a fucking delight.
The burger's so good. It's delicious and simple.
I made a dumpster out of my body's delicate temple
And I'll do it again. I have a crazy streak in my eye
This delicious, perfect sin will be the way that I die

I got a burger in the late afternoon when the place wasn't too busy. The burger I ordered was awesome and very reasonably priced especially for the neighborhood.

If I were to come back, I think I'd opt to get a double to enjoy the experience even more. The burgers fit the perfect greasy-spoon type vibe that the local neighborhood burger joint should have. This place fits more into a smash style burger, if that is your preference.

$6.50 for a single with cheese made for a tasty snack size bite.  True to the hype, you get a crispy griddle edge to your patty.  Underneath the squishy soft potato bun is some chopped onion and a disc of pickle, plus a big splash of big mac style sauce. This branch near Washington Square Park is on a block with a lot of options for relatively cheap tasty eats.

7th Street Burger is the most basic burger shop you could ask for. They only do a few things, and they do those things well. Your choices: single burger, double burger, impossible burger, fries. That's it. I love them for offering an impossible burger!!! That's what I ordered. Silly me ordered a single - definitely order a double because these are smash burgers (very thin). Damn, it was good. Juicy, greasy, delicious. And the fries were such crispy goodness. Their house sauce is to die for. The staff was super nice and efficient. The inside of the shop is tiny; not really designed for dine-in. This is the PERFECT drunk food takeout place. I'll be back.

Had previously tried this place for an event held here and I happened to be in the neighborhood for a work happy hour and I knew exactly where I was going to grab some food after drinks!  Came back to 7th St Burger, knowing their double cheeseburger and fries were a 5/5 for smash burgers!  Very simple burgers, but executed very well!  

Definitely a great burger joint that's opened up recently so stop on in here for a bite!

I came here with my friend because of a Yelp event and tried the Double Cheeseburger (with all toppings) and fries. I thought it was delicious - the meat was juicy and the sauces were great (kinda reminded me of the Big Mac sauce). The fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Definitely a good spot to grab on the go and when you feel like having a cheat day!

It's legit so good, I want to cry happy tears. It hits the burger cravings, and feeds the soul. Horrible for diet and waistline, but beautiful for the soul.

It has this small town vibe with familiar soft bun, and the edges of beef popping out. Like super casual. The beef had this meat loaf taste too. Not super beefy as some competitors but I don't mind. The sauce and little onions is what really makes it and brings it all together.

The fries with meat and sauce, which was more expensive than the double patty burger??????, was so good. It was so comforting. Felt a bit extra and excessive after a double cheese burger, but also at the same time, inhaled and ate ALL the fries and floating in the air because so happy about the little onions
Fulfilled every need. Thank you 99 cents village pizza it was so good Liza and I both thought so

Was feeling hungry mid afternoon but didn't want to spend a lot of money.

2 cheese slices and a water for $2.99. Solid slices - thin crust, good flavor. They had hot sauce, parm, pepper flakes.

Other specialty slices are about $3.50-$4 each.

Small spot, only standing room.

DONT EAT FROM THIS PLACE. Terrible customer service, I was given raw pepper on top of cooked pizza, I then simply asked the worker to put the pizza in the oven he proceeded to catch an attitude and just throw my pizzy in the oven. I tried to talk to the manager but he just simply brushed me off. DONT EAT FROM THIS PLACE
I was in here around 2 pm today.  I never noticed this place before. No other customer was there.  I went in and got one slice to go.  It was heated up and bagged quickly.

Good option for dollar slices in Greenwich Village. My friends and I ordered an entire pizza ($8) which was baked fresh and served hot out of the oven. Walked it down to Washington Square Park and ate it greedily. Thin crust, light sauce, just enough cheese to get the job done. For something so simple, it was surprisingly tasty.
Pizza tastes like NOTHING. $3 for cheese and a can of soda is a good deal for food and drink. BUT it's not tasty. It isn't gross it is just so incredibly bland. Basically just bread-like.
Great pizza slices and even better staff. The cashier was very nice and very helpful. If you ever get a chance please visit.

honestly my favorite dollar spot in the city.. out of all the 99¢ spots, this is the one! I wish I could post pictures but I always eat them too quickly. As for the pizza quality, it's not too saucy nor too cheesy and there's something about that crust holding it together that leaves me wanting for more. They have other more fancy pizzas, pepperoni rolls, garlic knots etc. They take cards and cards, have all the important pizza condiments, & a nice selection of beverages to wash it all down with. Come for the pizza, stay for the good times.
Very good pizza, especially for one dollar. The people are always nice and the store even has a couple stools to sit down.

Birthday Tour Dinner #1!

9 Jones is a vibe and was a great location for my friends and I to celebrate my birthday. Reservations are easily accessible via Resy. We went on a Thursday night and it was packed. By the time we left there wasn't an empty table in sight and even the bar area was full of people.

Upon arrival we checked in with the hostess who then showed us to our table towards the back of the restaurant. Our waiter was such a joy.... Making food and drink recommendations based on our preferences. Every dish that came to the table was enjoyed! For appetizers we had Greek Fries (we actually placed a second order, soooo good) and fried calamari. For my entree I went with the grilled branzino, sharing lemon potatoes and grilled veggies as sides. The sides are perfectly portioned to share.

Along with good food the vibe is vibing! Dim lighting, velvet seating, bottles popping and drinks flowing. We had a great time!

All I knew about 9 Jones was that it was somewhat "opulent," so I waited for a day where I wore a collared shirt to work before stopping in for dinner. Upon entering the completely empty restaurant, I grew a bit suspicious. Perusing the menu and seeing an outrageously priced lobster pasta dish reminded me of the tremendous failure of dinner at Sei Less, so I decided to stay on the cheaper side, not even considering my usual double entree.

I landed on the Santorini Burger--a $26 Greek-influenced dish that, thank the lord, includes fries, and features a patty made with a lamb and beef blend. This isn't the first restaurant to offer a lamb burger with a specialty cheese, but it had better be great at this price point.

As soon as the food had taken just a moment too long, I exchanged a glance with the bartender, and she acknowledged that it was time to check on the burger.

The burger arrived and looked okay. However, it was quickly established that it would be the most disappointing burger at an elevated price point that I've ever had. And it's funny that this category exists for me, but after I got fleeced on the $25 burger special at Jeffrey's Grocery up the street last week, it's really important to highlight that restaurants seem to half-ass their entry-level menu items when they think they can get away with it.

The bun was terrible. The top was cold--cold--to the touch. Meanwhile, the bottom had char marks on it yet wasn't warm. Weird. The consistency of the bun was three-day-old grocery store brioche. Grainy and actually cleaved a bit as I chomped into it. The menu lists "pita" under the description for this item, but this just adds to my confusion. The menu also lists "charred tomato" but instead my burger contained a thick cut raw tomato. Not just raw, but an icy cold, just out of the freezer slice. The red onions were also icy cold. And so was the inch-thick stack of arugula or whatever it was. Spinach would have been my first choice there. It was stacked too high to eat in a neat manner, and the unfurling springy arugula splattered the tzatziki sauce up my nose at one point.

The patty itself was overcooked and was just kind of sad. For a place that appears to be made for Instagram, the centerpiece of this dish was buried under inches of cold vegetables. At the angle of the picture I took, the patty was hidden by the shadow of the gaping brioche roll. Small patty that was cooked poorly, stacked laughably, and tasted badly.

I complained about the burger, about the coldness and doneness, and the bartender seemed to entertain my complaint and said she would share it with the kitchen. The truth, and I expressed this, is that it's just crazy to turn out such a low effort dish like this for $26.

Stepping into 9 Jones felt like I was walking into a Boutique hotel in London with a perfectly tucked away sophisticated speakeasy.

The drinks were perfectly chilled and flavorful.. The food was delicious; the seared salmon, carrot purée, and Horiatiki salads were beyond impressive. The sexy decor and ambience deserve their own 5 stars.
If you're looking for elevated Mediterranean food and drinks, this is definitely the place to go.

I can't wait to be back!

An absolute trainwreck. If you're planning to go to try their fixed fall menu, don't.

After making a Monday night reservation and then them cancelling it without notice, we decided to give it one more try on a Thursday night and try the fixed 4 course menu. We specifically made a 7:15 reservation experience for that. We arrived, sat down and were told they stopped doing that for the evening at 7pm, even though all of the items are on their main menu anyways (for 2-3x the price).
Slow service, unfriendly staff. An absolutely scam.

We left before ordering because the experience was so bad.

Skip. Made a reservation on Open Table. Confirmed the reservation the day before. Arrived with my guest and it was closed. The sign in the window indicated it was open on Mondays. The next evening, I went by and explained my experience and a waitress with an attitude said: "we are closed Mondays". No: "thanks for letting us know, would you like a drink at the bar and I'll show you our menu for next time..." Just rudeness. There weren't any customers, guess why? No thanks.

Very vibey restaurant! This is the place to go if you want to come have a fun night with good vibes. They also have belly dancers that come out at nights, that hyped up the ambiance. It's a great place for dinner parties. However, It's not one of those restaurants where you would go solely for the food. Love the decor and the presentation of their drinks and food. Imo their appetizers are better than the entrees. I really liked the beet salad (super cute presentation as well) and the tuna tartare. Desserts were great as well.

They have pretty solid drinks that have both cute presentation and recipes. I really liked the Smokey tequila (No.9) drink, and the matcha macho man and strawberry shorty gin drink. The latter two come in super cute glasses, great aesthetics. I didn't really like the emo kids in the 90s mezcal drink, thought that was a bit too much on the fruity sweet side.

Service: this is the one thing I feel can be improved. Service is generally pretty slow, maybe it was because we had a huge group.

The porn star cocktail was amazing. The Saganaki was so delicious with the addition of honey and sesame seeds. The tuna tartare was the best I've had in my entire life and I have it at every single restaurant I go to.

With that being said, the service was atrocious. As soon as we checked in for our 7 PM reservation, we were told by the hostess we only had the table until 9 o'clock. The restaurant was empty when we arrived so that was offputting to begin with. As time went on, Our service by Andre got worse and worse. He reminded us when he brought the bill that we only have a table for a few more minutes, but he took forever bringing the bill, never offered to refresh our drinks, barely checked on how we were doing. The truffle pasta was absolutely disgusting. I had no flavor and the truffle shavings were dry and flavorless. For $47 a serving I really wanted to send it back to the kitchen but my table was ready to go.

A star was deducted because of the 3.5% accommodation feel (more about that below). 9 Jones is a Greek restaurant with a supper club motif, '90s club vibe and a packed bar. In trying to be too many things, 9 Jones fails to do much of anything very well. The food and service are simply adequate. Not horrible, but nothing that would want to rush back. I was leaning towards giving them three stars but when the bill came there was a 3 and 1/2 percent "accommodation fee." No explanation. I asked our server what it was for and she had no idea so I deducted a star.

Food so salty we did not take more than a few bites. Completely empty until 9pm with music blasting and a weird smoky scent being pushed through the restaurant. Would not recommend and will not return.

An intimate Greek spot to grab drinks with girls/friends.
Getting a reservation was hard last minute. The food was actually really delicious, hard to believe that you can get this taste at bar but I guess they are keeping up with their supper club theme which is great.
The salad was full of flavors and delicious. I think they can definitely get better at drinks. Our drinks hardly had any alcohol

What an amazing vibe!  The food was unbelievable, the staff was warm and gracious. We loved the chef and our server. George Lambracos and Adrian Mitchell Carvajal thank you. I recommend 9 Jones restaurant for everyone, New York 9 Jones got it right!

Had some expectations for 9 Jones because of the events I've seen there and the people attending those events. Maybe there was a different chef or attention to food those nights.

Food: okay, not bad, not great. Tuna tartare was very fresh but no seasoning. Octopus was cooked well, great garnish, maybe more salty than necessary.

Santorini burger - not in a pita like written in the menu, but a huge bun. Not easy to eat and had to use life and fork to take bites. Taste of the meat was okay, maybe a little dry.

Would stop there for a drink. Those were great!

Agreed with the previous review. If I could give zero stars I would!  One of the worst experiences in a restaurant I have ever had!!!!  DO NOT GO!!!!!  Terrible service which was slow and unapologetic (we had to continuously ask for someone's attention).  There was no pride in serving decently edible food (cold, and subpar taste, and not worth the price). In addition, they were completely disorganized in our entire order.

The food took forever to be served, we had a 745 reservation and our mains came out at 930.  The fries were super soggy and cold (they wilted as soon as I lifted it) and the fish and steak were super cold. Totally not digestible all. We sent back the mains and along our side of potatoes. Our food didn't come back til 10 and without the complete order.... Was missing our potatoes. My medium ordered steak was a well done at this point and very dry and hard.  The fish had bones left in it- aka choking hazard.   It was totally disappointing and unacceptable.  

When we called the waitress over she told us that everyone in the restaurant had to wait for their food. Again unacceptable. When the owner came over he was totally  unempathetic, indignant, and entitled.  He told me 'we don't discount'.  I've never had my mains come out after two hours from a kitchen and not had an apology at a minimum.  He totally  did not care about our horrible  experience or customer service nor pride in being in this business.

Finally as a meager concession he offered dessert or a round of drinks.  We took the round of drinks but they came....much later....AND to add insult to injury we're the wrong drinks.  The waitress came over with a 20% off discount card. Lol. I thought the owner said they don't discount bills.

I would avoid this restaurant at all costs!  There are a 100,000 other places that are near by that I would choose in a heart beat over this crappy place.

I made a reservation for 4 for my birthday dinner(Wednesday 6/21). Upon arrival I told the hostess I may have 2 extra guest joining. Without even attempting to accommodate she said we don't have space for 2 more guest. I said okay and continued to our table for 4. They seated us all the way in the back where the wait staff and other patrons were constantly passing and bumping the 2 guest seating on the outside of our table. Before even sitting she gave a disclaimer that the chairs are wobbly and to please be careful when leaning back. Like what??? So now we are getting bumped and have to balance ourselves on the chairs. We spoke to the hostess/manager several times about changing our table and it just seemed like there was no urgency on her part until the last 20 minutes before I decided to leave.
We ended up just having drinks and appetizers and decided to take our business elsewhere.
My drink was good the apps were okay. The octopus was had a real charred taste but was still a bit undercooked.
I was really looking forward to the bar cart experience which we never got! I mentioned it from when were first seated and then again at the larger table and both times they just seemed like either they didn't have space for it or some other issue because they didn't jump on it! Disappointing.
The restaurant is small but cute inside.
It took them 2 hours to accommodate us with a larger table. By that time I was already looking for another place to celebrate because I surely wasn't enjoying it here! We ended up just going to Pergola for dinner and a good time!

3.75 stars. 9 Jones gives a dinner-club atmosphere that wants to serve overpriced lobster pasta and also have bottle service for girls in tight, short dresses.

My girlfriends went here on a Friday night and we enjoyed trying a variety of cocktails. It took ~15 minutes to get my drink. They requested our dinner order in the middle of enjoying appetizers which I personally find to be bad manners. We enjoyed the lobster salad but it was really small. Nothing in particular stood out to me and I probably wouldn't go back unless someone else was paying.

The place is dark and too noisy. I asked if they could lower the volume, and no one did. They said they would tell the chef and he did not lower the volume. I went to a back table and it was loud. Someone else said they'd lower the volume; they did not. I left and saw the chef outside. We talked about being Greek and I asked why he did not lower the volume. I forgot what he said.
This is not a big club for music to be so loud. Most would not enjoy dinner or be able to have a conversation. The espresso martini was okay, but I would have rather saved my money and head.
He showed me a photograph of his wife and himself, as if I asked for that or would not rather look at myself in photographs!

Not sure why people are giving two stars, but definitely not a 5 star either.  Here's where I'm at after my visit... I was very curious to try it given the team that opened it and the fact that I live a few blocks away, plus I am a sucker for a lobster pasta (photo included).  I went into expecting it to be a mix of Carbone and Jue Lan (in its current state) and that's about what it was.  The food was good but hideously overpriced and there is no explanation that can make me think differently.  The vibe was fun but acoustics were poor and the decor a bit forced.  Staff was super friendly and helpful but clear they could use a bit more training (not faulting them for that as they just opened but the priced demand better service like pacing the delivery of food, making sure wine arrives with your mains, checking in at the right intervals, etc).  Overall, I liked the food and there are other things on the menu I would want to try but I can't get past what they are charging for it.  Don't get me wrong I live in the West Village and have been to most of the popular spots in NY and aborad; no problem paying a lot for food that is worth it, this just isn't well matched.  Also we didn't go for the hyped cocktail trolley mainly because it was literally nothing more than bottle service at your dinner table.  I could see paying the $150-$200 for it if the bartender came over to mix them on demand or something but a small bottle of liquor with "mixers" and limes can't make a good cocktail.  

TLDR:
1) Overall good food that is worth eating
2) Way too overpriced
3) Too cramped and loud
4) Good staff

9 Jones is f%^# fantastic, I've been here 3 times only because I moved to CA, it's my first stop when I'm back in the city. Their Greek salad is literally the best I've ever had and I've been to Greece. Lamb chops-absolutely insane. I'm a big tuna fan and theirs is good but I don't love the level of onion flavor, it kind of takes over. THE WORST thing about this place is the time it takes to get a drink. It's the most ridiculous thing I've ever seen. I cannot figure it out. I mean I pretty much only drink wine and even that took beyond an exorbitant amount of time like 15 minutes, and the bartender was about 5 steps away. The weird 70s soft porn that usually playing doesn't bother me but get me my damn drink faster please. It literally makes no sense.
Food terrible,service,ambiance terrible,would never go back to this Resturant they need

Talk about mouthwatering combustion flavors take your pick the menu designed and won't disappoint  it Will bring you to the surface service On point point With a bump of caviar  Look no further concrete jungle New York supper club is here to stay with style And fashion  Welcome back to New York night out on the town much-needed Time to let the monkey out . Surface

Overpriced, rude wait staff, not worth the money.

I came here with a few girlfriends hoping for good service, good cocktails, and better food. We were met with none of the above. I know drinks are expensive these days, but these drinks were just not up-to-par. Their "most popular" cocktail; the "Dirty Disco" tasted like a $19 cup of lemonade. Do better. The food was eh! Nothing to write home about. Lastly, the waitstaff and service, horrible. You go to a restaurant to enjoy yourself and not feel rushed. Every 5 minutes, our waiter would come over asking us to order our food, and then come back a minute later asking again. It was extremely "annoying" to say the least. Lastly, it was a friends birthday, so we ordered a small dessert with a candle at the end of the meal. When the bill came, we were charged $12 for the candle. If that's not embarrassing, than I don't know what is.
Food and ambiance is A1!!! Perfect place to start your evening, absolutely love the tuna tartare

I had a 10:15pm reservation to get drinks. We showed up on time and were told to wait by the bar which was crowded and there was no space to get a drink. After 30 minutes, our table was still not ready. We then told the hostess that we would like to go elsewhere since we still hadn't gotten a table. I was then charged $160 cancellation fee. RIDICULOUS stay away.

If i could leave 0 stars I would. This restaurant ruined my birthday, 25th birthday at that. The service was beyond slow, my drink was spilled on me (without an apology to follow) and my food was cold. I was then told I needed to pay for the spilled drink (I refused) and the waitress then had an attitude and avoided my table. Other patrons got a dessert and sparkler for their birthday, I got nothing. Do not return here unless you want subpar service and cold food. Managers did not even come over and acknowledge or apologize for the situation either. Would not recommend what's so ever.
Horrible food. Horrible drinks. Horrible service. Horrible management. Stay away.  Loud, obnoxious and pretentious.

What an amazing restaurant! When we arrived, we were greeted at the door by a very courteous and happy host. We had a reservation for two. She sat us at a lovely table in the rear of the restaurant. Our server came to the table promptly and took our order. She made a ton of great suggestions and and really made us feel at home I ordered the Mood Swing which had rum and pineapple juice. My date ordered the Keeping up with the Joneses drink. It had Strawberries, basil with bourbon and ginger beer. Our drinks were awesome! We wanted to do the Trolley Experience but will save that for the next time we go back. I ordered the Grilled Octopus It was made to perfection. My date had the Pan Seared Saganaki. OMG!!!!! SOOOOOOOO Good! I had my all time favorite - truffle linguini with house made pasta, truffle butter, parmesan and fresh grated black truffle. It was like I was in heaven. It just melted in my mouth. You can tell the pasta was freshly made because it was perfectly cooked, slightly al dente. My guest ordered the Whole Grilled Branzino. The flavors just burst in your mouth. I'm not a fan of capers but it was so good I just dived right in. We finished off our evening with the Molten Lava Cake and the House made chocolate chip cookie. Both with Ice Cream. The staff was amazing, The service was on point and the food was beyond excellent. I can't say enough about how amazing the entire experience was. I will definitely be back.

First time in 9 Jones and YOU have to go! It's the sexiest little spot with amazing food. The lamb chops were to die for. IT WAS FIRE!! The service we received was amazing and we will definitely be back again. They made us feel welcomed and accommodated us in every way. Truly a dining experience not to be missed.
Nothing to write home about. Very expensive and the food mediocre at best. Not coming back

I went to 9 Jones for the first time after seeing it on Instagram. The service was very slow from the start; there were only 2 waitresses managing several tables. It took about 25 minutes to receive our cocktails, which did not have any alcohol in them. While we got our appetizers quickly, it took 1.5 hours to receive our main course, which was overcooked and had to be sent back. It took an additional 20 minutes to get the new entree. While the food overall was good, the combination of the service, cocktails, and length of time it does not make this restaurant worth it, especially given the price. I would not recommend.

I don't write too many reviews, but had such an amazing experience. First off, went with a larger group and they were very accommodating. The food is amazing. We had the lobster pasta, branzino and chicken. The food is phenomenal. We were stuffed, but opted for dessert. The dessert was amazing, definitely try the cheesecake. We had wine and dirty martinis. If you're a dirty martini with blue cheese olive person, this is a must. They have truffle bleu cheese olives I will be thinking about forever. The service was amazing, everyone is very friendly and managers touched tables. Will be going back asap!

I have very mixed feelings writing this. I really wanted to love it. It's definitely been hyped up and they've done a great job getting promoted. But here if our experience:

We arrived at 5:08 for a 5:00pm reservation. The hostess, who is arguably the rudest hostess I've encountered in my 17 years of living in NYC, told us that she would seat us, but we were late and they were going to need the table back as there are other reservations. We were 8 mins late, not 30 mins...that is such a ridiculous thing to say. So then the waitress came. As a party of 3, we ordered 4 appetizers - the octopus, crisps, tuna tartare, and saganaki. They were all quite good. Made us excited for the main dishes...however, they were mediocre.  We had the zucchini puttanesca (which was good), the burger (which was over cooked) and the lobster pasta (which had amazing presentation but fell massively flat...especially for $78!). They got one of our side dishes wrong. We then ordered 3 desserts...of which only two were brought out. No one knows what happened to the third. The cookie dish was very good; the other was okay. The cocktails were great (they really did this well). The wine was underwhelming -- they didn't have many of the bottles on their menu and jammed us with something mediocre (they didn't have several bottles from the menu we requested). The inside was a little loud. And then, after paying $800 for our dinner for 3...the hostess came up to our table with the opening line of "Hi, you've been at your table for 3 hours and have exceeded your limit. We need to give your table to someone else. But you're welcome to go to the bar." Now, we had just paid the bill (less than five minutes earlier). Look, there is a right way and a wrong way to handle that -- and she handled it horribly. Her tone. Her approach. Everything was rude. The whole beginning and ending of the evening was completely ruined by her.

We chalked a lot of their misses up to them being new (only open 3 weeks) but the level of service was the tipping point and the reason I feel compelled to share this review. Just a massive failure. I feel like to compete in the top tier of restaurants in this neighborhood (and city) you have to have that down...and this hostess was a rude jerk (PG version) and completely ruined our evening which is unfortunate.  We have no intention of going back and would not recommend it to any of our friends. I'm sorry -- but if you want to be successful in the West Village, you need to do much better. Hopefully they get it together.

Btw. We ate at Crown Shy last night. It was worth every dollar and was an absolutely amazing meal and experience (just wish it was in the West Village). We would 1000x go back to Crown Shy.
Average food quality, inexperienced service, and frankly, a misogynistic atmosphere/environment.

This place was so bizarre- I was super excited as upon entry the vibes were high, fun music etc. I had a 730 reservation and my party of 4 was not seated until 815. From the second we sat down my whole party felt rushed. We ordered a round of drinks, the drink we all wanted we were told they were sold out of as the cocktails are batch made. We asked if they could make a similar beverage and they said no as they don't have a lot of the ingredients on hand so we just ordered the Champaign/ caviar bump special instead. We also then tried to put in our appetizers and was told that the chef prefers the whole order at once which is fine as normally when a restaurant requests this it is to course out the meal , however that was not the case at 9jones. Our apps, entrees and sides were all dropped at once- there was so much food we could barely fit the plates on the table. Also we wouldn't even be half done and the waiters would come by and try to swipe the plates even tho there was so much food left on them and we were still picking. At one point I literally had to grab the plate back from them and say we are still working and not done yet. Once we were finished our waiter didn't even ask for desert or any more drinks and just brought over the bill. We were out of there by 910pm not even a full hour at the table and left just thinking how bizarre the whole experience was & how we will not be returning.

This new polished gem is located in the West Village just off the busy traffic of Christopher Street. The people behind this wonderful Greek eatery were nice enough to name it '9 Jones' in homage to 9 Jones Street. Its perfect orange glow from within creates a welcoming atmosphere. Soft dark blue velvet upholstery with black and white suggestive art looks quite fitting for the venue, a standout feature for its high-end clientele. As for the food, the presentation of the lobster pasta tells you how fresh it really is. Don't like seafood? Then there are the amazing lamb burgers and lamb chops that epitomize what it tastes like in Greece. On the other hand, I can see myself being very satisfied with the unique appetizers and cocktails they provide.

An iconic New York restaurant and probably one of the hardest reservations to get. It does live up to the hype and is pretty for special occasions.

Overall the food was good definitely on the heavier side as everything was pretty salty and greasy. However, the ambiance and service takes it to the next level.

The burger is a must order, the French dip and salad were also great! Their desserts are instagram iconic.

Service was five stars, food was just four stars. Overhyped, I'm sorry.

4 Charles Prime Rib was on my NYC bucket list before I moved, so I fought the online bots to get a reservation and succeeded.

The truffle mac & cheese was probably my favorite dish. It was a good side to pair with my meal, as eating it alone would definitely be a sensory overload with the cheese and truffle.

We also got the famous burger (with egg), but we cut it in 1/4s so I maybe didn't get enough to form a good opinion. It was good but it wasn't amazing.

The french dip was fun! I liked it more than the burger.

We tried the prime rib and the ribeye steak. Both were good, but not to the point where there's bots fighting to sell the reservations. I've had better prime rib and steak elsewhere.

Portions were average for the price. Eating all this split across 4 people, we spent about $100 per person.

Overall, food is overhyped.

I loved the servers though, so kudos to them.

Very small, tight, cozy restaurant. We sat indoors but the outdoor cabana has the same ambience, so don't fret if the only seat you can get is there.

Another great experience at 4 Charles!

Ambiance: Still carry's the old school New York feel which includes servers with suits on, dim lighting, Sinatra playing at low levels so you can still talk with your company. Don't have many tables inside so if you can snag one... awesome. They also have a few booths outside. Both require reservations. Good luck

Food: I can't come to 4 Charles and not order arguably the best burger in NYC. Suggestion: add bacon and egg. Depending on what else you order, one burger may be good to share between two people - as long as you get a few sides. I like the crispy fries and truffle Mac. The thick cut bacon is also a win. Also got the shrimp which came with garlic bread.

Drinks: strong and carefully crafted. They have a small bar but extensive beverage list. Includes cocktails, wines, and beers.

Service: "white glove" service. Very engaging servers with a focus on hospitality and experiences. I they do it right.

Overall, one of NYC's finest. Not a cheap meal but we'll worth it considering the food quality, service, and experience. Highly recommended.

Had the most incredible experience at 4 Charles!!
Could not recommend this restaurant more, we ordered the burger, ribeye bone in, creamed spinach, mac&cheese, prime rib, chocolate cake and gelato.           All of it was beyond amazing.

I feel like I've been waiting my whole life to eat at 4 Charles. I finally had the privilege of going this week and unsurprisingly, it was amazing.

I knew 4 Charles was a little restaurant, but I was surprised at how small it is. I loved it. It felt so warm, cozy, and charming - similar vibe to other hog salt restaurants.

We started with 2 orders or shrimp cocktail and 18 oysters, a crab cake, and a little gem salad. The shrimp cocktail was especially delicious.... I know it's just shrimp but they're performing some magic. The oysters were small (how I like them) and perfectly shucked, grit free.

We ordered the burger with the works, and this is something you cannot miss. Split it with another person so you have room for prime rib. It was RICH. Decadent. Order it.

We got 3 slices of the English cut ribeye which was perfect. Just enough meat to experience the perfection which is the prime rib. We also got the elote and creamed spinach.

For dessert, the must order is lemon meringue pie. The meringue is especially impressive, measuring a foot high.

The wine list is excellent, but I enjoyed two Tuxedo #1 cocktails.

Service is wonderful, they really make you feel at home. 4 Charles is a must visit.

I will start off by saying, that for me that 4 Charles  is better than Monkey bar.

Ambiance: Quaint , snug  and charming; outdoor seating , is the best I have ever seen.

Service: Very good

Food: This place is  one of the best restaurants I have been to ! We were a happy table of 4 , that kept talking about the food in-between regular conversation , smiling and ending up so content, and full  we couldn't wait to be home to digest  all the yumminess we ate.

Apps: Shrimp scampi's - a must have , it's  bold  perfection! Perfect amount of sauce that is very rich , buttery and perfect amount of garlic , herbs and lemon with a side of buttered , fresh and crunchy toast to devour all the sauce.

Oysters- fresh but nothing special Zou Zou's is my go to!

Now the next two items are not apps but with a table of 4 , we made the into our apps.

Burger-made me smile! Not only was the presentation there, but each bite was so flavorful and juicy , I mean it is topped with  a thick cut bacon maple black pepper  and yolk ; hands down the best burger I have ever had.

Fries- perfection , moist, crunch, freshness with my perfect sides of the garlic aioli and ketchup .

Prime Rib French Dip sandwich with the side of the French onion dip sauce and the special horse radish secret sauce combo, is perfection ; I would lather on sauce in anything !! It's a must try .

Main Course:

The sides you have to combine are Truffle Mac and Cheese, Cream of Spinach and loaded bake potato.

Waygu steak- well seasoned, perfectly cooked and perfection exterior crunch!  you have to order

Prime- Chicago cut  was very soft and buttery but I preferred the waygu steak.

Dessert - Chocolate Cream Pie- I mean Oreo crust, must i say more? with the Sundae Royal! See

This place serves the best food in all of NYC. Everything was perfect here in every sense of that word.

The french dip sandwich is the star of the show. Never in my life have I ever liked french dip sandwiches until I tried the one here. It's hard to put it into words but it's something you need to try at least once in your lifetime.

The burger was the second best item. It reminded me of a better version of Au Cheval's burger.

The prime rib was also delicious of course but by no means was it super memorable. Maybe they should should rename the place to be Four Charles French Dip instead?

All the sides were amazing - nothing served as filler food as everything served a purpose here.

The service was tremendous as everyone was incredibly classy. And the ambiance reminded you of New York back in the early 2000s.

While it's a bit hard to get a decent reservation time. The food was worth it. We had the burger with a an egg over easy and bacon. It was amazing. The staff is very nice and professional. We tried a meat sandwich, also a great choice. Don't know how warm will the outside seating would be in the good winter but it seems more spacious than the main dining room that seems a sunken living room. Overall will definitely will come back just got the burger.

Though I hate waiting in line, I can't help but admit I had a wonderful experience here.

Little gem (+crab cake) (4/5) This was super light and fresh! It went on so well with the salty meats
Wagyu bur (4/5) It's definitely a well-made burger. I'm not sure if it's worth $50 because I thought the bacon was too overpowering but it was worth trying
Prime Rib (5/5) The best prime rib of nyc! The 4 charles cut was amazzing, super juicy and meaty. The only thing I didn't like was that it was very very salty.
Rib eye (3.5/5) Surprisingly not a great steak. It was a good medium-rare but waay oversalted. It was still a decent steak cut.
Truffle Mac N cheese (4.5/5) Solid mac n cheese! It was super filling too.
Creamed spinach (5/5) I was shocked by how good this was. It was soo cheesy and buttery I loved it.
Lemon meringue tart (4.5/5) Perfect ending to a delicious meal! The meringue is huuge

Though it is very hard to get a reservation it was really worth it. I would definitely recommend!

Food 8/10
Everything was surprisingly very good, I was afraid it would be overhyped and for a second I thought it was but in the end it was not. The first slice of steak I got was mid but the second piece was solid and thankfully redeemed this spot. We got the 4 charles cut and i think the first piece was just unluckily tough, which is unfortunate, but I was also obsessed with the horseradish dip. The steak itself is quite tender and saltier than I had expected, but I did like the piece with some chew on it more. It soaks up all the juice too. The salmon caesar started off strong, a HUGE mountain of greens and salmon. It was 10pm at this point so maybe I loved it more than I would've because I was famished. The burger was fine but also I'm just not a huge fan of burgers so this is obviously subjective. The sides we got were charred broccoli, mashed potatos (i did not eat), and mac and cheese. They were solid too, but nothing crazy to rave about.

Atmosphere 10/10
I feel like I was transported to another era. Classic vibes and dim lighting make it feel very vintage. Love the art on the walls, the old-timey feels, and the mini chandeliers. It's not a big space inside, which is probs why it's so hard to snag a res.

Service 10/10
I felt so pampered

Walking into 4 Charles Prime is like finding the holy grail of steakhouses, tucked away down an unassuming street in the village, where you will undoubtedly have one of, if not the best, cuts of steak ever.

Is it hard to get a table? Yes, but it it worth it? Without questions.

The setting is an intimate basement dining room, dimly lit and cozy, old-school speakeasy vibes. The service is top notch, attentive but not too prim and proper, they're genuinely great people and make the experience fun.

I had the best cut of Wagyu New York Strip I've ever had and still think about it to this day. Perfectly cooked, flavorful but still melt in your mouth. Drinks were a lot of the classics but made to perfection in a way that makes you really appreciate a well made cocktail. Dessert is a must and honestly you can't go wrong with any of the options.

Summed up, 4 Charles is likely the best steakhouse in NY and is a must go!

When you enter, you're transported to a small intimate restaurant straight out of the 1950s.

Reading other reviews, we went with the classic: a burger with egg and bacon to share between two people for appetizer, 4 Charles prime rib center cut for entree, and truffle Mac and cheese for sides.  Everything was just good - not the best burger I've had and not the best prime rib I've had. Chocolate pie was decadent, a stand out for sure. Pretty let down because we waited 6 months for a reservation.

However, they do deserve four stars for their service alone. Our waiter was amazing - we didn't know if we wanted to order the side of fries as all the dishes we ordered were pretty heavy and he gave us an order for free. The showmanship of cutting the burger was fun and his recommendation of drinks were spot on.

Definitely go for the experience and the vibes, even if it's a bit overrated.

Second time here, friend had a rezie and couldn't make it.

Beyond the food and service being perfect, it's such an amazing vibe. Almost feels like a club. And to be so close to celebrities makes you a little giddy.

I'm not sure how a civilian gets into this place, but I can now check 4 Charles Prime one off my bucket list.

4 Charles was one of the most incredible dining experiences of my life so far. It took months to get a reservation, but all of the waiting was worth it!

Their outdoor dining doesn't feel like it's outdoors. It is temperature controlled and fully enclosed. Our waiter was so helpful in recommending dishes for our first time at 4 Charles.

The burger and french dip were incredible. The green beans and french fries were both very tasty. Our favorite item on the menu was hands down the bacon. Absolutely delicious.

For dessert, we had the Sundae, Lemon Meringue Pie, and Chocolate Cream Pie. All three desserts were amazing, but the Chocolate Cream Pie stole the show. I am not normally a chocolate dessert person, but I will be dreaming of the Chocolate Cream Pie for weeks.

Wow I'm in awe of the food and experience here! We had outside seating- the booth was so cute and the music was spot on for the ambiance.
We got served water (choice between distilled or sparkling). The servers were attentive and helpful when taking our order.

What we got:

- Little Gem Salad- nice presentation! The lettuce was so fresh and crunchy. Generous amount of lettuce and avocado. Very flavorful and slightly sour without the extra dressing, but it's there if you need it.
- Cacio e pepe- the server nicely plated the pasta on our plates. The portions were on the smaller side. It was a bit saltier than I usually eat. The egg was a great addition to this dish!
- Creamed Spinach- so cheesy and flavorful but a bit saltier and heavy with the generous amount of cheese. Such a yummy way to eat veggies.
- Mashed Potatoes- so greasy and smooth. Great garlic and herb flavors, a must try but it does get heavy and filling.
- Prime Rib (Chicago Cut)- wow sooo good and juicy! We got medium rare but I usually like it a bit more cooked. The extra salt was a nice touch but I think it was flavorful enough without adding extra (got a bit salty when adding extra).
- Cheeseburger- the server recommended adding bacon and an egg, get it! So much better with the runny egg and the thick bacon. This is the best burger I've had! Meat was super juicy and cooked just right! Def recommend trying it!

We also got a bottle of red wine but forgot the name of it. It was a nice paring with the meats!

Overall, such a great place for a meal! The staff were very knowledgeable and helpful while the food didn't disappoint! Each dish was unique and so flavorful.

The single best piece of meat I have ever had in my life, superb service, and a beautiful interior, with class and style. What an experience! Definitely an occassion spot to celebrate something, or just to have the best darn meal you can possibly have in the village.

To start off we had the burger. Dear lord was that good. They slice the egg yolk and drip it onto a nice juicy burger with bacon and cheese. Gluttony. Guilty. Worth it.

Then we had the 4 charles prime rib and it was cooked perfectly medium rare and was so delicious I can't use words to describe it. For sides we got the creamed spinach, mac and cheese, and roasted broccoli just to pretend we are healthy. All the sides were "fire" as the kids say.

Save up and get yourself here. You will not regret it, and you'll talk about it for months after.

4 Charles Prime Rib is a great experience and as much as I would like to give them two or three stars, I have to give them a full five stars. The food is outstanding and the service is great. We were made to eat outside, but despite our trepidations it was still good. Not as great as the dining room, but still very good.

Worth the hype and wait. I went a few weeks back with some friends and was seated in the outdoor dining area which was by far the nicest outdoor dining situation I've ever been in.
Service was fantastic- waiters attentive but not overbearing.
The food was truly excellent. Everything from the corn to the burger was perfectly cooked and seasoned. We left feeling SO full and can't wait to go back.

4 Charles is the type of place where you and your friends decide "yeah we'll order a cheeseburger as an appetizer why not?" The dining room is small, dark, and intimate with decorations that make the place seem much older than it actually is. The service was accommodating and they make you feel like you've been a regular at 4 Charles for years.

On to the food: it was incredibly rich and decadent but damn good. If you have the goal of sticking to a diet when coming here then best of luck to you. We split a few oysters, the 4 Charles cut, a French Dip sandwich, the cheeseburger, and the truffle mac and cheese. Everything was good but I'd wager the French Dip and cheeseburger are absolute musts.

While scoring a reservation here is an absolute pain after going here I think I understand why. I don't think I've ever been to a steakhouse that's like this place.

Sat outside patio again. Bright, comfortable, and well lit.
- burger as always is a must - juicy, a fun show, and large
- meat was perfectly cooked
- thanks for the fries + chocolate cake - very nice touch to try their dessert
- cocktails were superb: Negroni, Lemon Drop, Lillet Rose Daisy, and Espresso Martini (spot on)

Will be back again.

I had a great dinner! The location is very small which is why it's difficult to get a reservation. They only have 9 tables inside and 5 tables on the "patio". I'd say the patio is very comfortable - it's outdoor street seating, but they took the time to build a nice structure, they have fans inside, and they decorate it to make it look like you're indoors. It's very comfortable.

We ordered drinks to start - I gotta say the drinks are very strong and not my favorite. We ordered shrimp scampi - you can probably skip this. The shrimp were large and covered in a seasoned oil. The flavor wasn't that strong and the shrimp were a little dry. We also ordered the burger with bacon and egg, french dip, fries, and the 4 Charles Prime Rib. The burger was probably my favorite. It was so juicy and the flavors worked so well together. You can probably omit the bacon and egg because I didn't think it added that much to the burger, but feel free to add if you like bacon and egg. The french dip exceeded expectations. The prime rib was good but not blow your mind. We also ordered desserts. They were all delicious, but the best to least best was the lemon meringue pie, the sundae, then the chocolate oreo pie slice.

We were helped by Angie and she's the best! Such great energy and great recommendations.

We were unable to secure a reservation, so we attempted a walk-in. Thankfully, the rainy weather worked in our favor and they managed to find an available spot for us. The ambiance exuded a sophisticated, old-fashioned charm with its dim lighting. We kicked off our dining experience with the Wagyu cheeseburger, which was tasty but didn't particularly stand out. Next up was the 4 Charles cut, which was decent but not exceptional. However, the truffle Mac & cheese and creamed spinach were truly outstanding! On the whole, it was a positive experience with a friendly staff, but given the wait for reservations, I might reconsider returning.

Absolutely fantastic! We went early and they happened to have a table for us. We sat at the patio. Inside ambience is beautiful as well. Had the French dip and burger as appetizers - musts to try. Then shared dry aged ribeye with truffle Mac and cheese and elote corn. Everything was amazing. Our server, Daniel, was incredibly friendly and professional. This place is a true treat!

Given all the hype, I wanted this to be the best burger I've ever had in the city, and although it was good, I've had better at much easier to book places.
I went in Resy and booked this one month out in advance and was hyping myself up by watching dozens of influencers posting their favorite meals from the place. As you can see in the below picture, I got the burger with golden fries and a cold brew since it was a brunch based menu. Here's my breakdown of the food:
