Burger: the burger itself was pretty good - they basically made smash burger patties and each were wagyu based.  The patties were crispy and had nice lacing, and were well seasoned.  Unfortunately the burger took an hour for them to serve and in my opinion was slightly overcooked when it came out.  The aioli sauce they used on the burger honestly didn't have much flavor and the bacon was pretty chewy so it didn't add a lot to the bite.  In my opinion, Au Cheval is a superior burger (sister restaurant that is much easier to get into).  The burger was also ridiculously priced at $50 if you get the egg and bacon on top.

Fries: the "golden fries" were $11 and came with a nice garlic aioli dip.  They were basic crunchy French fries and were seasoned well, but nothing special.  Again au cheval has truffle fries at the same price and with the same aioli and have better flavor.

Monkey Bread: this was free because our food was taking so long and came out stale lol, not worth the ridiculous $17 for a small tray of this.

Coffee: my cold brew was $7 (insane) and came with coffee rinds in it which was very unpleasant. Don't get the coffee here.

Ambiance was very luxurious and posh which was cool, the servers were nice and prompt so I have no complaints there.

Overall - this place is worth experiencing once and that's it.  The food was good but nothing special and given how impossible a reservation is to get here, it was very disappointing.  I'm going to au cheval before I try to book this again for the burger.

I woke up at 6am PT multiple days in a row to get a reservation here a few weeks in advance of my visit to NY. It was totally worth it, and I'd do it again.

A group of 4 ordered the burger, the mushroom sides, the truffle mac and cheese, and the 4 Charles Cut of prime rib. Everything was tasty. For the burger, I'd highly recommend adding both the egg and bacon add-ons. The prime rib was tender and when eaten with the jus and horseradish sauce, was really delightful.

While the place is small, the outer patio (covered) was more than sufficient. It wasn't cold at all at 10pm inside the covering.

Service was good as we were attended to and weren't left waiting for any asks.

I randomly was awake at 4am and got the resy notification that same day brunch was available at 12:30 on the outdoor patio. Nothing is outdoor about the patio. It's fully furnished and temperature controlled. One of the nicest "outdoor dining" I've seen in the city. Me and the step bro ordered a Bellini, which was delicious. Service was attentive and friendly. We got the truffle Mac & cheese, and cream spinach. I didn't get a picture of the rib eye but it was so tender! The burger is a must. You just got to get it. I was very happy. While expensive, it was worth every penny. Don't let the brunch option fool ya - they have all the top choices you'd see on the dinner menu. Thank you 4 Charles!

This place has soooo much hype and I actually dined here fairly unaware of all of that. With that said, my expectations were "normal". I'm giving this 5 stars because I literally can't think of anything that was a miss - amazing service, nice ambiance, and of course the most important, delicious food.

Ambiance / Service: As everyone has said, it's impossible to get a reservation but I somehow got lucky. The restaurant is tiny. Perfect for a date, a special occasion, or just if you want good food. We dined in the outdoor hut, which was cute and intimate. There's a few booths - the decor matches the inside and even though it's outside it feels indoors (completely covered, warm). Our server was phenomenal. Super chatty and friendly. Our dessert took a little while to come out (which we didn't care about), but she comped it for us.

Food: we ordered the below and split between two people. It was too much food, but worth it.

-Cheeseburger: recommend! The "best burger in America"... you obviously have to get this. Highly recommend the bacon and egg add on. Literally white glove table service. The waiter pours the yolky goodness on the burger and then cuts the burger in half (in white gloves). It's a showstopper.

-Bone in Filet with Peppercorn: recommend! very good and flavorful.

-Buttery Mashed Potatoes: recommend! this actually was my favorite (lol). Soooo creamy and the pieces of garlic were amazing.

-Golden Fries: good, normal. We ordered sooo much food that we definitely could've done without. I liked the other sides more.

-Creamed Spinach: recommend! Everything you want creamed spinach to taste like.

-Chocolate Cream Pie: recommend! It wasn't too heavy or rich and even though I was stuffed I still ate it.

For all the waiting it takes to get a table here, I expected everything to be perfect and it almost was. There's obviously a demand to get a table but charging $5 per person just to make a reservation seems extra to me. We also had one person of our four person party cancel due to sickness last minute and unfortunate there's a charge for that! (Despite ordering well over the amount for 4 people). So we weren't the happiest people to walk in to start but we wanted to enjoy the experience nonetheless. Our table was delayed by 5-10 minutes because the party in front of us was sitting waiting for an uber and because there's no waiting area, it left us waiting in the snow/rain at 10:30pm.

We had prompt service once we sat down. Initially we were told they're signature 4 Charles cut was sold out which disappointed us further but then the server came back and said they had 1 piece left. We ordered the cheeseburger, the French dip, the 4 Charles signature cut, the chicago, cut, truffle Mac and cheese, cream spinach, elote, mashed potatoes.

Burger was tender and juicy. It was good but not sure I would go through the hassle of making reservations for it again. I did absolutely love the French dip. It was my favorite of the night and I would come back for it. Perfectly toasted and not at all soggy even with the jus. Between the 4 Charles cut and the Chicago cut, I preferred the Chicago. It was more tender and less salty. It focused more on the meats flavor rather than the seasoning of the 4 Charles.

Truffle Mac and cheese was super rich but delicious. The blue cheese in the cream spinach was an amazing touch but a preferred taste at Mt table. Elote didn't get much attention, it was a bit too sour. The mashed potatoes were smooth, it's hard to knock mashed potatoes.

The restaurant is small and quaint which was nice. It did get cold intermittently as the servers were going in and out to tend to the outdoor seating. Otherwise it was comfortable.

Overall I'm not sure I'd stalk getting a table here again unless taking someone else for their first time. I might opt for take out instead for convenience.

I finally snagged a table here! And I'm happy to say that 4 Charles really does live up to the hype. Everything from the decor, to the service, to of course, the food, was amazing. Let's get into the food!

As you can tell from my other reviews, I'm the type of person who loves to order a bunch of dishes to share with my party. Here's what we got.

Little Gem Salad ~ This was absolutely was we needed to start off a night heavy in carbs and proteins. The dressing is refreshing and the lettuce is delicious. You get subtle notes of onions which who doesn't love!

Cheeseburger ~ This is what why I tried so hard to get a table! This is one of the best burgers I've had (yes, in my life). The wagyu patties are tender and perfectly cooked. The bacon is thick, crispy, not too overwhelming, with a touch of sweetness. The egg is perfectly round and cooked (not sure how they get it so perfect every time). The bun is soft. The burger is absolutely delicious and so worth the price.

French Dip ~ This was not my personal favorite (I'm not a huge fan of french dips) but it won my table's heart! The sandwish is full of flavor and the sauce was surprisingly delicious.

Special: Wagyu Porterhouse ~ I would skip this. The meat was definitely tender and perfectly cooked but overall, for the price, I was disappointed with this dish. Maybe I expected more? For me, a porterhouse is good when you don't need any sauce/pairings to go with it, but here, we definitely did. It was definitely too expensive for what we got, I wouldn't order this again.

Truffle Mac & Cheese ~ Perfect side! The mac & cheese were EXTREMELY cheesy and the truffle was SO GOOD.

Mashed Potatoes ~ I have not idea what ingredients are in there but they are, without a doubt, my favorite steakhouse mashed potatoes. They are garlic-y and gooey, and the meats on top brings it all together.

I honestly never expected this restaurant to live up to the hype but our experience was amazing. Getting a resy is definitely worth the trouble!

Pro tip: Reservations are released 30 days in advance at 9AM EST on Resy. Be sure to log on and set some notifys to be able to come! Easiest party size is 2 or 4...

The burger was one of the best I've ever had.  The fries were excellent, especially with the garlic aïoli sauce.  The English cut prime rib was solid.

Angie and all the professional staff are what you should look for in world-class hospitality.  Food, service, and atmosphere were all top-notch.

After months of struggling to get a reservation, I will say it was worth the wait. We were able to get a last min brunch reservation on New Years and it's a great way to start 2023.

This place has old rich people vibes. Felt very comfortable. Started with an espresso martini, with the famous cheeseburger and fried egg with a side of fries and hash brown. The burger was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. The egg made it super juicy and a nice touch because I love eggs and can have it with anything. The folks here were super nice to us and allowed us to relax and take our time even though they were transitioning to their evening seating.

I would highly recommend this spot if you're able to get a reservation. May the odds be with you

Getting a reservation is pretty hard, but it was worth the troubles.

Known for their Prime Rib cuts (in the name lol), it was tender and delicious.

The burger was also amazing!  We smelled the table next to us order the grilled shrimp and we ordered it right after and it was next level!

We were seated outside in their outdoor dining section and it was enclosed with doors which made the experience better - better than sitting on the street basically.

Tip - if you want to get a reservation here, set an alarm for 9 am and don't hesitate, book first then figure it out later.

4 Charles is a charming, classic steakhouse and definitely worth a visit if you can figure out the reservation!

Been here twice so far and would recommend getting some form of the roast prime rib (I thought the King Cut was great), the French dip (trust me), elote style corn, and some additional side(s) like creamed spinach or the truffle Mac & cheese.

What I love about 4 Charles is it's the type of place where essentially anything you order is bound to be good. I've tried their seafood like the shrimp cocktail on my first visit and it was good, but second time around, I/party I was with skipped and focused more on prime rib. The King Cut prime rib is great to share with a party of four along with a few other sides/apps. Of the few sides I've tried, I thought all were tasty and nice with the steak (corn was most standout and tasty in my opinion) and same thoughts on the drinks available. They offer simple but effective drinks menu with a focus on martinis and old fashioned.

Can't wait till the next time fate brings me here.

So I went with some friends who been previously and they raved about how much they liked this place. So I took the opportunity to go with them since they knew the menu better and we could also order a variety of dishes. The restaurant itself is not a big restaurant, it is smaller than a restaurant I would expect of this popularity. The waiters are dressed up, the decor is nice, tables are surprisingly comfortable and roomy. I wouldn't consider this a fancy steakhouse but I also wouldn't come here in shorts and a T-shirt.

The food:

Little Gem Salad- Lightly dressed with avocado & fines herbes. It actually really surprised me how much I liked the gem salad. I thought the greens were particularly crispy and incredibly fresh. The dressing was OK, it was a little too acidic for me but man those greens. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Prime Rib French Dip- Swiss cheese, natural au jus. Oh man the French dip was better than I expected. The French dip actually was the best thing I had the entire meal. I was actually on the fence about ordering the French dip because it was $40 but it really was $40 well spent. The meat was super juicy and flavorful, and the bread, the bread was perfection. The bread was nice and crispy but had a nice chew in the middle, I really liked the bread a lot. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

10oz Double Wagyu Cheeseburger- Griddled and pressed Snake River Farms wagyu with American Cheese. I liked the burger but the burger surprisingly didn't feel as hardy as I was expecting and it came off a little plain. I was expecting the burger to be very substantial but the burger felt rather too light and airy, if that makes any sense. I thought the burger patty from Snake River Farms was good but it didn't offer a lot of flavor and it wasn't as beefy as I was expecting even though it was cooked like a Smashburger where it had crispy edges. I actually thought the burger at their sister restaurant, Au Cheval, was better.

The English Cut- Thin sliced & delicate. I thought the English Cut was very good, it was very tender, it was very juicy and was a very well made prime rib. This should be ordered. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Buttery Mashed Potatoes- Roasted garlic, chicken jus. I thought these were just OK, I thought the mashed potatoes, for me, were too salty and I didn't feel the potatoes were as luxurious as they should've been. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Creamed Spinach- Blue cheese, sweet onions. I was really hoping these were going to be good because I read so much about them and while the flavor was good I thought this came off incredibly rich and heavy. This was so heavy that after the second bite I didn't want to eat anymore. But the one thing I did appreciate, it was a new kind of creamed spinach because I've never seen cheese on cream spinach, I really enjoyed the crispy bits of the cheese on top, though. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Chocolate Cream Pie- Valrhona dark chocolate, Chantilly cream, chocolate shavings & Oreo crust. I thought the chocolate cream pie was made really well, I enjoyed how it wasn't overwhelming sweet. I appreciated the dark chocolate but I thought the dark chocolate came off incredibly rich. Overall this is a dessert to get, but it's a dessert that you have to share with someone else. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Lemon Meringue Pie- Lemon curd, toasted meringue & graham cracker crust. I thought half of this dessert was good but the other half I didn't care for and I would pass. I thought the lemon portion with the graham cracker crust was good but I thought the graham cracker crust should've been more packed in and had more of a crunch rather than a brittle crust. Lemon filling was nice and had a good tart flavor. The part I wasn't crazy about was the huge meringue topping. I didn't find the topping to be very exciting or appropriate. yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Super hard to get reservations at 4 Charles, but when you get one you won't be disappointed. Small space I can see why it's always booked. Service is great. Burger is cut table side which was really cool.
The ribeye steak 8.5/10. Super juicy and tender. Cooked to a perfect medium and had a good crust. Needed a tad bit more seasoning.
The espresso martini is delicious and strong. They were on the house because we had to wait after our reservation to be seated. 9/10
The double bacon burger with egg is really good. I could've done without the horseradish spread that came on the burger. 8.6/10
Last but not least the prime rib sandwich. Best thing I had and honestly an amazing sandwich. I should've gotten one to take to go lol. It was that good. 9.5/10
Overall great experience and would love to go back.

Have yet to try Au Cheval in Chicago (or New York for that matter), but I now understand the hype. In a dimly lit supper club in West Village, you can get that same scrumptious double patty burger but with some classic boozy New York cocktails.

Most people seem to split the burger as an appetizer and order a large prime rib and sides as their main dinner. Ordered the Chicago cut prime rib and can't say I was particularly impressed. To be fair I didn't try the 4 Charles Cut, but in all honesty, I would go all-in on the burger with the works (farm egg + bacon). The server will present the burger with an overeasy egg on the top bun, carefully pop the yolk and meticulously drip it onto the patty without missing a golden drop. Definitely a must try and one of the top burgers in the city!

Simply the only reservation I would take at 10:15pm at night. First, had to make the reservation EXACTLY 30 days in advance at 9:00:01am. If you wait even 5 seconds, you won't get a res -- it took me 17 tries.

Started with cocktails & I got the lillet rose daisy, which was perfectly sweet but not overkill. My friends liked their espresso martini & bourbon on the rocks but the cucumber martini was just straight vodka so could have used some other flavors.

We got 2 of the famous burgers with bacon & egg. For $50 per burger, it's insanity but you gotta do it because it is just SO GOOD.

It may be a hot take but we didn't think the Chicago cut lived up to the hype. On the other hand, the carbonara pasta exceeded expectations and was visually appealing with the perfect runny egg.

Lastly, sides and dessert, both of which were delicious. We got fries complimented with truffle mayo (yum). The mashed potatoes were also buttery deliciousness. But the winner was the creamed spinach -- best I've had. Finally, you gotta try to lemon meringue just for that impressive meringue topping & it was good.

Only small con was I will say our service was underwhelming. The server didn't advise us on what to order or help us apart from bringing out the food. We had a 10:15 res so maybe he was just tired from the evening.

Overall, a bucket list spot in NYC that I can now check off :-)

Still one of our absolute favorites. We got to try a few new things this trip: the gem salad, the carbonara, the ribeye, and the lemon meringue, all of which were outstanding, especially (surprisingly?) the carbonara. The regular standouts (French dip, burger, chocolate pie, sundae) were still outstanding as well.

I don't know where to begin with this review. WOW. Few times in my life will I stretch past my bedtime for a 10:30 dinner reservation, but if you get a spot at 4 Charles this is a must!

This is my favorite ambiance in NYC. You walk into a brownstone before entering what looks like someone's home...but chic and sexy. The space is small making if feel very exclusive. It's also super hard to a reservation so I was just glad to be there. I think they could have served me a Happy Meal and I would have loved it just the same.

What we ordered: Oh my. Where to start? Cocktails - everything we tried was amazing. Our server even took the lead and asked us about our spirit preferences before bringing back what he thought would pair well. He wasn't wrong! For food we did the famous burger (well worth it) with the egg, no bacon...we have the Carbonara, the french dip, sides of broccoli and finished the night with the chocolate cake. Would order the exact same things the next time we go! It was so good! The burger is worth all of the hype. I'm not even a big burger person and I couldn't pass it up.

4Charles should be at the top of everyone's list in NYC. It's truly a full experience and worth every penny!

4 Charles Prime Rib in New York, honey, is an absolute showstopper! From when you step inside, you're enveloped in an old-world charm that's as timeless as a Chanel suit. The atmosphere? Utterly enchanting.
Now, let's talk - their prime rib. It's a carnivore's dream come true! Juicy, succulent, and bursting with flavor, it's a mouthwatering masterpiece. And the sides? To die for!
But here's the kicker, their service is as impeccable as my favorite runway walk. Attentive, friendly, and always ready with a recommendation.
4 Charles Prime Rib is a must-visit for anyone who wants to dine like a true New Yorker. I'll be back for more prime rib and elegance, no doubt about it!

Good overall experience but not sure if it's worth the effort and hype.  

A tough reservation to get but my sister managed to get 4 for a weekend, though at 5:30pm.  Still had a few people try their luck as walkins, unsuccessfully.

I liked that we were able to sit ahead of the whole group arriving and get started with cocktails.  I really am starting to question why places make you wait if you have a reservation.  

The outside patio smells like the indoor dining room so it seems intentional, but that means they both smell a little strange.  My first thought was musty but it might lavender.  

Cocktails are fine. The star is the prime rib but we managed to tack on shrimp Scampi, pasta, lamb chops, a burger (along with the bacon, helpfully portioned for 4), sides plus desserts.  The prime rib sings with the horseradish cream or salt but definitely needed one or the other.  The shrimp scampi is fantastic, as the sauce is good to the last drop.  The salmon is surprisingly good but honestly you shouldn't be ordering this unless you had to.

I've had two absolutely incredible experiences here. Although managers AND servers were different each time, everybody went out of their way both visits to accommodate our preferences as well as our personalities. This is the kind of place where they actually look you in the eye and listen. They actually make you feel like they're making the experience about you, rather than smashing you over the head with a rulebook, rather than just completely ignoring you and treating you like an anonymous wallet. By no means is there any doting or cow-towing but it feels actually personalized. I emphasize this point because I full expected to feel SO out of place here, because steakhouses are typically my least favorite kind of restaurant... But they didn't ridicule us when one visit we only got one meat course yet ordered three vegetable side dishes... But they didn't patronize us when another visit we only ordered two sandwiches and two salads. So because the first visit they didn't try to upsell us or make us feel uncomfortable, we ordered a ton of cocktails and dessert, and then we fought to make a second reservation. And when they made us feel just as welcomed and appreciated the second visit, we ordered a ton of cocktails and dessert, and then we fought to make a third reservation. I can't even express how surprised I am or how grateful I am for a new place that I genuinely enjoy.

In order to get a reservation here, you must post up at 8:59AM for the reservations slots to open on Resy for an opening 21 days in advance!! Refresh quickly, be logged in with a credit card on file, and be versed with the positioning of what slot you want. I felt lucky getting a 10PM slot...
Ambiance (3/5): I got a text saying that my table was ready a half hour early but when I arrived, they must have given it away and we had to wait until our scheduled time. I was greeted at the doorway to get checked in. The inside is very small, dark, and decently loud. The atmosphere feels intimate and old school vibes. Bathrooms are up a narrow set of stairs.
Service (5/5): The service is attentive with the waiter taking his time to explain the menu in detail. Some of the dishes are served from a main dish right to your plate. I definitely felt welcomed and attended to. It took a while to get our orders in but it was fairly quick getting our first dish. The whole experience took about an hour.  
Food: They were out of the Charles Cut and chicken.
French Dip (5/5): Everything about the French Dip was perfection. The meat portion was generous, meat seasoned well, horseradish sauce on the side was a great complement to the dish, and the dip itself was very savory.
Chicago Cut Prime Rib (4/5): The meat was very tender and marbled which melts in your mouth. There's some seasoning that is meant for the rib on the side but I wish the rib itself was seasoned.
Truffle Mac & Cheese (4/5): The truffle flavor is wonderfully forward. However, I didn't think there was anything about this dish that I couldn't have had elsewhere.
Overall (4/5): I'm glad the food tasted so good for the effort needed to secure the reservation. I thought it was a great dining experience but the price point is steep for what you're getting. I would definitely want to come back to try the burger.

Snagged a Sunday night reservation and was thrilled  to make my first visit to the acclaimed restaurant:
-Gem Salad with crab cake was incredible. One of the best salads in the city.
- burger was a salt bomb - the meat is not showcased at all. The meat might be good - it might not. We'll never know. Just a lot of salt. I was also surprised it was smashburger. I expect classy joints like this to do pub burgers. I'd not order this again.
- French dip. Incredible. Better than the very famous French dips in LA.
- Elotè - very buttery and rich and again quite salty.
- courtesy of the dudes at the next table (!) I had a significant portion the Dover sole. Beautiful presentation. Delicious.
- music was GREAT
- service by Brandon was amazing
-clientele ..young dumb entitled and lame.
- martini ..pretty nice. Not amazing.

For me, restaurants like this usually start off with a demerit due to there pretentiousness. I don't enjoy the work involved in getting a reservation and usually find that I'm disappointed from the hype. This was partially true and partially untrue for 4 Charles. In short, I found this to be a good restaurant with great ambiance and vibes. In fact it was almost performative art between the decor, music and acting by the staff, which absolutely enhanced the experience.  Even the food and presentation of it was performative. The space is beautiful with dark wood, old paintings, dim lights, leather benches and takes you to a different era.  It is small, intimate and extremely enjoyable. Now for the food!  The food didn't taste as good as it looked. It was very good, but it looked beyond incredible!  The smash burger was our favorite; it was cooked to perfection and had amazing consistency but just slightly missed on delivering the "oh my god" I was hoping for. The same was true for the French Dip sandwich, which again was very good, but didn't make me close my eyes with every bite. The creamed spinach was a bit rich for me but I could see blue cheese lovers going crazy for it. The fries were the only thing that were actually mediocre. We finished off with the Lemon Meringue pie which was an A. I must reiterate that everything was very good, but expectations, hype, prices (very expensive) and presentation have an effect and in this case it was detrimental to my perception of the food.  In summation, this is a must visit.......once........type of place.  Like I started off, this is like a show and I recommend treating it as much. We had fun, we stuffed our faces and we left with good memories.  If it were more accessible and reasonably priced we would probably revisit, but that would probably deter all of those who gave this place 5 stars and have a Soho House membership.

I had some close friends in town and had the good fortune of securing a reservation at my favorite restaurant in NYC. This was their review....

All the staff was great, our waitress was super friendly and amazing. They coursed the meal perfectly and gave us two free items which was beyond generous. We never had an empty glass and were frequently attended to. The dinner was delicious and the steak was cooked perfectly as always! They heard it was three of our birthdays recently and made sure to wish us a happy birthday as well as bring out the dessert with three lit candles. We had an amazing time, it was an unforgettable experience as it was three of my friends first time! The patio outdoors was lovely as well, it felt no different from being inside the restaurant.

Thank You Emmylou!

i finally landed a reservation at 4 charles prime rib thanks to a friend and i totally understand the hype of this place now! the space is pretty small but definitely has an exclusive supper club vibe to it. the entire dining room has a moody ambiance and good conversations are happening all around.

i'll cut to the chase - their famous burger was excellent, but i probably wouldn't go through all the trouble of getting a table here just to have it again. au cheval and monkey bar have very similar (if not better) burgers and both sister restaurants are much easier to get tables at. having been to all 3, i'd say that the only major difference at 4 charles is the "white glove service". i mean, your server literally brings the burger to you and cuts it at the table with white gloves on. while that's nice, i don't need all the bells and whistles to enjoy my food, but that's just my personal opinion!

i would however jump through hoops to eat here again for the FRENCH DIP! this sandwich changed my life. the garlic buttered baguette and au jus are perfectly done and not overly salty like many other places. if you are lucky enough to dine here, you've GOT to order the french dip. trust me on this!

One star review simply for their POS reservation system on Resy. Woke up at 6am west coast time when the portal opened for our date, selected a time, secured a reservation and PAID for it. Only to be told after booking that it no longer existed. Maybe they should invest in better booking software.

It feels like a classic wood-paneled Manhattan steakhouse but really everything is a cut above the rest here! Nice to see someone offering classic Prime Rib dinner which is seemingly rare these days for reasons passing understanding. After eating here I understand why its so hard to get a reservation but its definitely worth the effort to come.

We had 4 guys and we shared the Chicago Cut, the Wagyu Strip, the burger and the french dip and it was a great way to go. They'll cut the sandwiches into fourths and pre-slice the steak so it makes for easy sharing.

I highly recommend the gem salad with crab cake as well, its definitely big enough to share and the crabcake is excellent full of lump crab like something you'd get in Baltimore.

Top notch service, quick cocktail delivery, no sitting around waiting with awkward pauses in food coming literally no complaints to make about 4 charles! I hope to come again some day.

4 charles is 100% worth the hype. If you're able to snag a reservation (9am 21 days in advance) you will absolutely not regret dining here at 5pm on a random tuesday. Shout out to our waitress Jessa who made our experience extra special

There is a reason this place is so popular. My best advice is to make a reservation and if you can't, it is well worth the wait.
The staff was extremely friendly and attentive, and paid attention to the details of allergies or food sensitivities. I unfortunately have a severe tomato allergy and they went above and beyond to make sure nothing touched tomatoes, and even made me my own side salad with cucumbers and onions only and can I just say it was a chefs kiss. Also, if you have to only get one appetizer, I highly recommend getting the halloumi the texture of the cheese alone is some thing that you can only dream of in the fresh garlic on top, makes each bite, completely irresistible.
The atmosphere is fun and inviting and makes you feel like you're part of a community when you sit down, which is all thanks to the incredible staff and the way that they treat you like family as soon as you walk in. If you were in New York City, add this place to your list now!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch, with a reservation. Despite the reservation, however, my group waited for 20 minutes. We could see our table, just sitting there empty, while we waited. We asked multiple staff members when we would be seated, and we were told to keep waiting.

The food is fine. I got the Israeli breakfast with eggs siniya. The Israeli salad and the dips were decent, and the beet salad was good. The eggs were not particularly memorable.

MacDougal is my favorite street in NYC to take a stroll down as it has such a rich history in just a 0.38 mile stretch. At the end of my 0.38 mile excursion, I always find myself running into a sidewalk FULL of people. So full to the point where I have to walk to the other side of the street or move like a prime Barry Sanders in traffic to get passed.

This Coachella-like gathering of human beings is waiting to get into 12 Chairs. I whipped out my cracked Iphone 13 Pro Max and did a quick google search and realized it was an Israeli spot. After being to Israel a few times, I developed an arguably unhealthy love affair with the cuisine. Israeli couscous is literally CRACK. Anyways, all this to say I knew I had to get to 12 Chairs.

3 of us came late on a Friday evening, praying to Cthulhu that we would get a seat. Much to my surprise, we were seated almost immediately. Thank you Cthulhu.

We sat on the heated outdoor patio and started with 4 small plates: Babaganoush, Falafel & Tahini, Matbucha, and the Beets Salad. All was served with warm pita bread that was to die for.

The Babaganoush ended up being a bit of a let down, but that Beets Salad came out of NOWHERE to save the day. It was oddly reminiscent of when Carmelo Anthony went down in 2012 and Jeremy Lin came out of the shadows and put the Knicks on his back for 2 straight months. "BeetsSaladSanity." Easily the best Beets Salad I've ever had.

I went with the Areyas for my main, which is pita filled with minced lamb. It was sensational, but was a little light on the portion size. The lamb is so juicy it kinda like squirts in your mouth on every bite. ahahahaha damn that was crazy phrasing but I really aint lyin.

Overall the quality of food here is to die for, but I find the portion sizes to be a little light for the price point. I wish I could give 4.5 stars, but will give 4 here and 5 on Google.

THANK YOU CTHULHU!

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

Delish food! Came for breakfast with my parents while they were in town. Made a resy in advance just in case, place wasn't packed on a saturday at 10AM which was nice. Service was great, they were quick and nice. The food was delicious. the pita bread was to die for. Freshly made, savory, warm, amazing. I tried some of my mom's pancakes and they were amazing, soft, yum. I got the Shakshouka and i loved it. Location is right by Domino park, indoors was cozy but not too crammed. I enjoyed myself, will def come back.

I think coming for nighttime when you can stand on the seats and use the tambourines would be the move. My friends and I came here for brunch and the service was kinda slow and the food was decent but I know there's better food out there. I kind of expected the Shakshuka I ordered and the hummus and falafel my friend ordered to be way more flavorful but they were kind of bland. The bread that came with the Shakshuka was okay but the table pita was the best. The pancakes looked good but I didn't try them. There's literally no walking space and we were shoved behind a pole that made it near impossible to get in and out of the seats!

Great food, good service, very popular place. Our first time here so wasn't expecting such a crowd and such a wait. We didn't have reservations but some other people did and they had a wait as well. They have a heated outdoor area on the street a main dining room and an adjoining building with a dining room that they use at times. It was pouring down rain, and unfortunately you have to wait outside under their awnings but still
Not ideal . I wouldn't want to wait during winter months outside like that . The  front of house  could be a little more organized with seating, gotta say. The menu  is great. Lots of vegetarian options. Staff was pretty attentive .food was nicely presented and very tasty.

Really authentic Middle Eastern/Mediterranean food!!!!! I was a huge fan of 12 Chairs. If you can, make a reservation a week or two (or more) in advance to make sure you can get in at a preferred time.

3 of us split 5 dips and it was plenty of food. We were stuffed afterwards. My favorite was their hummus & babaganoush. The hummus was soooo creamy & had a strong tahini flavor. The Tabouli was super fresh - also one of my favorites we ordered. They also brought us out a little dish with pickle and olives and it was a nice touch that went well with all the dips. The softest, yummiest pita bread came with everything. We had to ask for another basket because it went so quick.

They didn't have many drink options, just beer and wine.

Overall, I loved this place and would definitely go back to try other things the next time I'm in NYC!

DELICIOUS!! We opted for the small plates and they didn't disappoint! The Babaganoush and Falafel with Tahini were my FAVE!! The small dishes also come with pita and were more than enough for 2 people. We ordered the Shakshuka as well, and it was also very good!

The place is very intimate, so I suggest to make a reservation a week in advance to secure a table during busier times. 10/10 would come back to try some more!!

My recent visit to 12 Chairs in Soho was a journey into the heart of Middle Eastern cuisine that left me both satisfied and slightly sweaty. As a tip for future patrons, dressing for warm weather is a must, as the restaurant lacks air conditioning. However, the flavorful dishes offered a refreshing culinary escape that made the experience well worth it.

Walking into 12 Chairs, I was immediately drawn to the lively atmosphere and the enticing aromas that filled the air. The menu boasted a wide array of Middle Eastern delights, each dish promising a taste of authenticity and tradition.

The arayes were a standout introduction to the meal. These pockets of seasoned minced meat nestled within crispy pita were a revelation to my taste buds. The melding of textures and spices was an absolute delight, and I'm now a firm believer that arayes are a must-try for anyone visiting this restaurant.

The hummus and pita, despite the warm weather, provided a comforting and indulgent experience. The hummus was velvety and rich, and the warm pita served as the perfect vessel for scooping up every last bit. The hummus-pita combination alone could have made the visit worthwhile.

The schnitzel, true to its reputation, was a juicy and flavorful delight. The impeccable seasoning and cooking technique were evident in every bite, making it a dish that stands as a testament to the culinary mastery of 12 Chairs.

One piece of advice I'd offer is to come prepared for warm weather. The absence of air conditioning can make the dining area a bit toasty, so dressing accordingly can enhance the overall experience.

Despite the warmth, the ambiance at 12 Chairs was lively and inviting, reflecting the vibrant flavors of the dishes. The staff were attentive and friendly, guiding us through the menu and ensuring our dining experience was enjoyable.

In summary, 12 Chairs in Soho offers a memorable journey into Middle Eastern cuisine that's rich in flavors and authenticity. The arayes, hummus, and schnitzel are all must-try dishes that showcase the restaurant's commitment to excellence. While the lack of air conditioning might raise a few eyebrows, the warmth of the food and the inviting atmosphere more than make up for it. I wholeheartedly recommend a visit to 12 Chairs for a flavorful escape into the world of Middle Eastern gastronomy - just be sure to dress light and ready to savor the delicious offerings.

I have been wanting to try this place for a while! My roommate and I came for dinner and were seated right away. The ambiance was nice although it was nothing too special. I have heard its better for brunch but overall we enjoyed our food!

My favorites were the cauliflower and babaganoush with the fresh, warm and fluffy pita bread. The tahini sauce that the cauliflower came in was so creamy and delicious and I loved the strong eggplant flavor in the baba. We also ordered the chicken, which I thought was okay. It was quite flavorless and not very well-prepared. The sauces were interesting and the potatoes were also quite bland. Probably would not order that one again.

LITERALLY THE BEST HUMMUS AND PITA!!!! 12 chairs is a must if you love Mediterranean food. The servings are huge and it's not expensive. Came here with a group of 4 and we ordered the hummus, 2 sides, and the chicken kebab plate to share  and it was more than enough food. I would go back here for sure, everything was fantastic and very very fresh  

6/9/23:
Update- I came back here after nearly a year and I can attest that the food  here is still absolutely delicious. This time I also tried the lamb kebabs and they were really tasty. Perfect place to do a family style meal. Only complaint would be the hostess/seating process. They made us wait 10 min for our table even though we had a reservation and there were tables empty. Regardless, I'll be back because the food is simply amazing!

Large portion sides, very expensive, but yummy food! Great for large groups and birthdays. If you go on the later side, they play music in a very large room. Keep in mind if you go in a party on the large side- they won't let you order off the menu a la carte style. They have wine and beer only - no cocktails.

Everything we ate was delicious and by the time the plates with meat came - we were already too full from the appetizers. Service was pretty quick- they were constantly clearing our table.

Favorites were the warm pita, hummus, meatballs, arayes***, shipudim, shouk salad**, labheh, falafel *, cauliflower

Our least favorite items were the grilled eggplant & malabi (tastes pretty bland)

Good things to note: No air conditioning- would not recommend going here if it's really hot out, fixed price menu for large group, 20% tip included, and they make you pay for birthday desserts

Authentic, filling, and well above average for middle eastern food. It's hard to give restaurants "5 stars" in the heart of Manhattan with fierce competition but there were a few unique factors involved: the interior feels like a living room with legit pots, framed photos, and antiques sprinkled across the walls. The wooden floor adds a cozy feel to the overall experience. Couple that with the kind of food prepared and you have yourself a real bargain.

Another indicator of high quality lies in the hummus - smooth enough to feel like an army of chefs worked together for grounding the chickpeas into a true finished product. The tabouleh salad with drizzled tahini and chicken cutlet is also delicious and worth trying.

Open kitchen, outdoor space, packed menu with a series of golden dishes = A+. Every time.

We came on a rainy Saturday at around 8 pm and were immediately seated outdoors. Between the 3 of us, we had a light dinner by sharing the deal for 4 small plates. We got the falafel and tahini, labneh, babaganoush, and spicy platter. My favorites were the falafel/tahini and babaganosuh, along with the lovely garlic and smoky hot sauce in the spicy platter. We ordered additional pita because it was so good -- warm and fluffy.

Would love to come back to try their entrees!

I HIGHLY recommend getting the Shipudim. The chicken was so delicious, it comes in a long skewer with chopped potato's on the side. The chicken had some cilantro/tomato sauce (it was sooo good). We also ordered the shashuka (classic dish). The dishes came out pretty fast. Since this is located near the shopping district, it's quite chaotic and busy, so I wouldn't recommend coming to this place if you want to talk over the meal. Overall food is 10/10!

I came here yesterday on Wednesday for an early dinner with a friend. I had a reservation but waited for a bit to even talk to a host. Finally, we were seated outside, but outdoor seating is definitely a tight squeeze. You have to give the full order at once, which is a bit overwhelming. I ordered the Pita Sabich and the halloumi. The halloumi portion could definitely be bigger. The Pita Sabich was good but messy so be warned. I've been to the Brooklyn location, and I thought the food was better there.
It's SoHo, so the ambience is good, especially on a sunny evening. It started pouring rain all of a sudden, but luckily the outdoor seating is covered.

Had a reservation for 9 pm and didn't get seated until basically 10pm. Waited on the crowded sidewalk. It was a Friday night and it seemed like the place in town to be. Although I'm not sure why.

We had a reservation confirmed in advance for 11 people yet we were stuck in the corner and were packed shoulder to shoulder, squeezing multiple people in the bench spots to fit. Really really crammed and we barely had enough table space for our food and drinks.

The food was actually really good - we did the pre fixed menu ($75 pp) and ordered wine separately. We kept ordering rosé and didn't stop. Yikes for my wallet. I loved the third course especially, Chicken Skewers, Arayes, Lamb Kebobs, and Home fries. The meat at 12 chairs was deliciously tender and juicy! Our table did not care much for the israeli pickles and shouk salad in the first course. But all the dip was good and they actually gave a good amount of pita (vs. other restaurants).

They let you bring cakes and will bring it out and cut it for you for no fee. That's a plus. One funny happening is that we got brought the wrong cake. They were nice to fix it immediately.

Only 1 bathroom for the whole restaurant, so there was constantly a line.

Music was ok. Only like, 3 songs were bangers in my 2 hours there.

Fun to try once but not dying to come back.

Good Israeli food. We had labne, pita bread, pickles and olives and a chicken kebab.  This was enough for two to share, price reasonable etc.  I would recommend if you want good Israeli food in the city.

The most authentic Greek food I have very experienced! The hummus and mushrooms was amazingggggg! Not to mention the portions were so big I had food for days after!

The ambiance was so rich and created such a great energy in the heart of the city! I can't wait to go back!

Delicious EGGS SINIYA!

I came to have brunch with a friend. As soon I arrived, I noticed the place was packed, and the ambiance was vibrant.  

I asked the waitress for a recommendation for breakfast, and she asked me: "Do you prefer tomato sauce or tahini?" I said: "Tahini," and she recommended EGGS SINIYA. It was my first time trying it and I absolutely loved it. The salad and bread were fresh, too.

I absolutely recommended this spot for a fun brunch. However, the music is a bit too loud for a large groups. So I'd suggest going with a few friends to make the conversations manageable.

We came here for brunch, and the food was delicious and the waitstaff very attentive. I highly recommend the Vegetarian Couscous and
Shakshuka!

Pretty solid BRUNCH spot! The shakshuka was good but wish that it was a little bit more flavored. Their pita bread is THE BESTTTTT. Soft fluffy and truly the best CARB FOR BRUNCH :)
Advice is quick and attentive. There was a 20-30 min wait in a weekend.

Fantastic Israeli food. Everything was flavor-packed and tasty. Ordered the falafel hummus, schnitzel salad, and lamb.

Portions were much larger than expected!

Sat outside, which didn't have the greatest ambiance, but was fine. Would like to try indoor dining next time.

The staff was not friendly at all, actually sort of rude, but fortunately the food made up for it.

12 chairs offers everything you'd want for a brunch: great ambiance and great food. I was in the area on a Sunday morning and was able to walk in without a reservation (we sat at the bar). 12 chairs has cute decor and a cozy atmosphere.

I ordered the salmon eggs with Israeli breakfast. The  salmon eggs were everything you'd want: smoked salmon and scrambled eggs with capers over a bed of buttered bread. I'd recommend making it in Israeli breakfast to get all the little dips, coffee, and juice. My favorites from the dips were the yogurt and guac.

Overall, the service was quick and the food was great!

I heard a lot of good things about this place, so I walked up to the store on a Saturday around 11am-ish hoping to luckily grab a table as a walk-in. Although they didn't have any seats available inside (as they were all reserved), the host did offer to seat us right away in the outdoor seating area to which we agreed.

The outdoor seating has a few tables fairly well spaced apart. I didn't really feel squished at all. They do have some heating lamps on top. I felt warm despite being outside. There was a server that mainly stayed in the outdoor area frequently checking on the customers that were seated outside, which was nice.

My friend and I decided to share 2 dishes together to try a bit of everything. We opted to share the shakshuka and the shipudim.

SHAKSHUKA
The size of the skillet itself is slightly on the smaller side, so it's definitely not something to order by itself to make you full. The shakshuka is solid. It's exactly like what you expect - Tomato based sauce with 2 eggs. It also comes with Israeli salad and bread on the side, which was nice. The bread might help you get full, but overall, it's more of a side order or appetizer in a way. But, I did enjoy it like I had expected to.

SHIPUDIM
First of all, the presentation of the dish is 10/10. The way they placed the skewers on a wooden surface like a charcuterie board, the way they added the spicy cherry tomato salad on top with the tahini on the bottom of the skewers was so visually appealing. So that won points right off the bat!
Secondly, everything on the board was delicious. The meat slid right off the metal rod. I was pleasantly surprised how soft the meat was to bite into. The cherry tomato was as you expect. The way they made the salad "spicy" was adding thin slices of peppers, but it really wasn't too spicy at all. It added some nice kick, but nothing anyone can't handle. They also gave an abundant amount of potatoes with this dish. This alone can help you become full within minutes.

Overall, I loved everything that I had tried. Maybe it's because I think I ordered well for my first visit, I really did enjoy my meal as a whole. I think shakshuka is a solid and well known choice and it didn't disappoint. On the other hand, I was pleasantly surprised by the Shipudim. After my first taste, I highly recommend this dish. It can be a bit more pricey than some other dishes, but I think it's worth the price and won't disappoint.

What a treat to eat here while visiting NYC! This was seriously some of the best Israeli food I've ever eaten. We stopped in last night after a show, and the server was happy to seat us (despite the fact it was already 10:30pm). We surveyed the menu and placed our order quickly. Everything came out super fast, and we devoured every morsel. So freaking good! I highly recommend the Hummus with onions and mushrooms. Can't wait to come back again next time I'm here.

They have the best hummus ever!!! Everything here is sooo delicious and the people that work there are so nice!!
A little bit small inside with no ac so be prepared!

This place does not miss!! Some of the best Mediterranean food in the city with such a fun vibe! It is hard to get into, so be sure to set Resy notifications. My friends and I started with two bottles of wine. They only serve beer and wine here, just a heads up!! They have this great deal where you order 4 small plates for $30, so we ordered some falafel, pickles, babaganoush, and labneh along with an extra side of hummus and a Greek salad with schnitzel. Everything was incredible, and the pita is to die for!! Everything came out really quickly too! Can't recommend this place enough!

Really delicious food! We dropped by for Sunday brunch and I was blown away by how good the food was here. They have the most amazing hummus that they serve with warm, fluffy pita.

Hummus w/ mushroom and onions: 6/5 (SO flavorful and smooth!)
- Babaganoush: 5/5
- Falafel and tahini: 6/5 (perfectly crispy!)
- Shakshuka: 5/5
- Ja'chnun 5/5

Great food, service, and atmosphere. Massive menu that works for everyone. Portions are massive. Great spot to impress people with unique dishes who are visiting from outside the city.

Would definitely recommend

This place is worth all of the hype. The dishes here are out of this world amazing, and I don't ever crave Mediterranean food. Everything is perfect, truthfully. I eat out a lot for business and pleasure, and I would say this is the best restaurant in NYC.

Falafel and hummus? The freshest, smoothest concoction you've ever had.

Stuffed cabbage? Comforting, with an impressive blend of seasonings. Five stars for making this with chicken instead of beef.

Beet salad with goat cheese? You will never be the same. Sweet without being too sweet. Offset by a creamy cheese and pine nuts. Not overly pickled. If a beet can aspire to be perfect, 12 Chairs has made it so.

This restaurant has been on my list for a long time now. When my job ordered catering from 12 chairs, I was excited to sample their dishes. I reheated the chicken schnitzel the next day and ate it with toasted pita bread and cauliflower. The chicken schnitzel was light, airy and tasty. It didn't feel heavy or greasy s It tasted good in a sandwich with the pita bread. While I didn't try the all of their dips and salads, the food was colorful and looked interested. The cauliflower tasted good on the side and was slightly charred. I would like to come in person to try the food.

Brunched here - $25 (3/31/23) gets you a juice, coffee/espresso drink, bunch of dips and bread and an egg-based entree of your choice, including shakshuka and burek. What a great deal.

The food itself was good, but nothing mind-blowing. However it's worth trying for the Moroccan dishes you won't be able to find at other brunch spots.

Borek was crispy and surprisingly light, with runny egg and soft potato interior with a shredded tomato base and sour cream I think at the bottom. Delightful, and not too filling.

Shakshuka was good, but def have had better, and was on the lighter side.

I would say everything here will leave you feeling satisfied but not stuffed.

The bread and dips was just fine - the dips were a mix of random things like smashed avocado, pesto (the best one, just focus on this), sour cream, tzatziki, and tuna salad(?).

Their OJ is ON POINT! Freshly squeezed, with none of that tangy bitterness to it but a rich sweetness and thickness that reminds me of that good good orange juice you get at freshly pressed markets in Europe.

Some of the best Israeli food I've ever had. Literally as good as when I traveled to Israel. We went late at night after a comedy show, and they were still very accommodating even though they were closing in about an hour. The hummus with mushrooms and onions was to die for, as well as the falafel, labneh, and Israeli salad. If you love middle eastern food, you're not gonna wanna miss out on this one!

I was really excited to try this place, but it all honesty it was just ok.
I had the arayes which were ok, the menu mentioned it came with a tahini sauce, but it was actually tzatziki which I dont mind, but tahini would have been a lot better. Overall the dish was not as good as I was expecting and felt like they were a little burnt.
The place was packed so I recommend you plan ahead.
I did enjoy the overall flavor of the food, and I am willing to give it another shot.

Staff here is wonderful!!! Everyone has such a warm personality and they make u feel at home.
Food was pretty good and portions are more than enough. Inside in quite tight so u will be close to other tables.

They have a lot of options on the menu, this is def a place worth going to with a group so u can try more. I got the Shipdum (sorry if I spelled that wrong). Basically chicken skewers with peppers, and potatoes wedges. It was a bit spicy but tasty. Everyone here loves the chicken schnitzel but don't get what everyone gets. That's boring

I have been to 200+ restaurants in NYC and 12 chairs is my top 5!! I always bring family/friends here when they visit. The lamb arayes are stellar. Every bite was awesome and the spicy cherry tomato salad it comes with is the most perfect sort of salsa for every bite. Burgers, skewers, small plates are all awesome too. Sit outside though if you want to have conversation with family though as the inside gets loud!! Fun vibes though. Awesome awesome spot.

Follow me on TikTok @rynelly for more NYC food recs!

What a cute little mediterranean restaurant full of soul food. Came on a holiday weekend for brunch with my cousin and we were seated outside. We started off splitting the hummus for the table. the hummus was so creamy and savory - plus there was falafel inside for extra touches of savory. falafel was crunchy and moist inside. the side of pickles and olives paired nicely here.

for my main i ordered the lamb burger. it was a little dry but after adding some sauces and thinning the bread a bit it was so good - best part of the dish had to be the fries that were shaped as chips they were soooo soft yet crunchy and the perfect shape/texture fry.

when our server brought the main dishes we were 3 people sitting at quite a small table outside which was not practical for having all our dishes at the table. that was the only downside dining here - i heavily recommend you sitting at a proper table for comfort while dining.

A teeny bit confused abt the hype around 12 chairs, it was definitely good and had wonderful service but the food didn't blow me away. I also didn't try as much as usual. But i thought everything was nice, especially the falafel and tahini. The baba ganoush, tabbouleh, and labneh were all good qual but again nothing that wowed. The cauliflower was nice. Ive been spoiled by a lot of great middle eastern food in philly soooo this def comes at a bias.

When I arrived it was a very busy place. They had two outdoor sitting areas both were both full as well as inside. The service was decent. Expected for NY. I ordered the salmon sandwich along with the hummus and mushrooms. I really enjoyed both meals. Both meals were shareable. I would go back and try other things on the menu . They also have a brunch option as well.

Yum yum yum. Went on a Monday night and it was packed! They had a wait and do no take names, you just wait for next available table but it was worth it. We got a table in 5 min vs the 20 they told us initially. The hummus is freshly made, with some remaining chunks of chickpeas served with fluffy pita bread and olives. Lamb was delicious both kabob and burger. The greek salad was classic, I had them put chicken on it. Chicken was perfectly cooked and seasoned and light dressing. The cauliflower as a side was very good, came in some sort of yogurt type marinade. Food came out quick too!

Such a good vibe in here. Walked in with one friend around 8:30 PM on a Thursday night and got seated.

We ordered the hummus and falafel, baba ghanoush, and the cauliflower. Literally LOVED the hummus and falafel -- would def recommend. Baba was OK but probs wouldn't order again, and same with the cauliflower.

The next time I come here, I'll def come with more people (portions are hugeee). This is def one of those restaurants where you should bring a lot of people and family-style the food. Great restaurant!!!

Really good burgers. I can almost never have burgers outside (bc I don't eat beef), but they had this nice, juicy, coriander and fennel seasoned lamb burger. Also topped with the best chipotle mayo I've ever had. The fries were crispy and solid as well.

12 Chairs was a solid time with great food! I visited with a group of 8 for my friends birthday and we had so much fun!

We ordered a number of items for the table. The hummus was creamy and the pita very fluffy. I also really enjoyed the pickles and labneh.

For a party of 8 they squeezed us around 3 single tables which was pretty tight. But the staff was friendly and we had fun with all the music and food.

I'd go back.

This is a solid restaurant to dine at if you're wanting Mediterranean food. Some dishes are better than others though. I would highly suggest making a reservation as it gets incredibly packed. My friend and I had a reservation for two and even then we still had to wait! Prices are also reasonable for the area.

The babaganoush was probably my favorite dish and I would recommend ordering this! I ordered the eggs siniya because I wanted something new -- it's a bit too much tahini for my taste buds, but if you're a fan of the flavor, I think this would be the dish for you! The eggs were well poached and runny, but the moment the dish got cold, it was pretty rubbery. If I were to order this dish, I think I would've added on the feta cheese or merguez to counteract the strong tahini taste. I would also be more open to ordering the small plates more as well!

The con is probably the atmosphere. I went on a Sunday during peak lunch hours, so the service wasn't as attentive during this time. It took a pretty long time for my table to get going so I did feel pretty dismissed. Some of the waitstaff were also a bit rude or unwelcoming. It's incredibly loud at this restaurant, so if you're looking for a peaceful dine in experience, I wouldn't come here.

Good food and had a great experience.
Came for brunch this past weekend, and I'm looking forward in coming back.

The falafel were good, and I liked the labaneh and babaganoush with pita.

For entree I got the smoked salmon with eggs which was good but I probably wouldn't order again. The shakshuka was good and so was the schnitzel sandwich.

Only critique is that everything lacked salt.

Service was good! Hannah was very nice and the hostess was very nice too

Went here for Sunday brunch and the place was packed.  Make a reservation if you want to eat during brunch time.   The restaurant was very noisy but manageable from a conversation standpoint.  The food was good but not great.  Skip the French Toast it was very very dry like it had barely any been drenched in a egg wash of any kind.  The stuffed cabbage was very tasty and was stuffed with Turkey and rice filling which was well seasoned and flavorful.  Ask for additional sauce as mi w could have used more.  The sample spreads that we ordered for an appetizer were the star of the meal.  We could have just enjoyed the dips as our meal they were that good.

We were visiting NYC and a friend told me we needed to eat here so I luckily made reservations a few months ago. When we arrived at the restaurant, not only was it packed with people, but there were a ton of people waiting outside and we were by far the oldest patrons. It was also super loud and crowded inside and we thought it might not be a good dining experience for older folks like us. When we saw that people who had reservations 30 minutes prior to us hadn't been seated yet, we were contemplating going somewhere else. Thankfully we didn't!

The owner of the restaurant brought all of us waiting, drinks on the house, and the staff was so proactive about getting us all seated. We actually wound up eating only 20 minutes after our reservation time and we sat in the outdoor seating area which was very comfortable with the heaters.

We had an outstanding and personable waiter named Asef who really cared about our dining experience and conversed with us for a while at the end of our meal. We started with hummus and pita, which were outstanding, and we did request additional pita and we still had hummus left over! We had the 12 chairs salad which had a delicious dressing and the grapefruit was a nice touch. We both had the Moroccan fish that came with couscous. It had the perfect amount of spice and again a large portion. Even though we were incredibly full we opted to have dessert and the chocolate mousse with angel hair halva and pistachios was so perfectly rich! We didn't leave a drop. The tea nana (tea with mint) was a great end to the meal.

This was such a fun and delicious dining experience. Thank goodness we didn't leave!!!

12 Chairs is just not my cup of tea. While the food was okay, I'm not sure what the hype is. I decided to make a last minute reservation on a Saturday. Given how crowded it was that day, it seemed like a smart move. I greeted one of the hostesses upon approaching the restaurant, and she completely ignored me and continued on with her conversation with the other hostess. Seems like a great start so far.

I was completely overwhelmed by the atmosphere of this place that it ruined my taste for the food. The music was really loud, the crowd was loud, the tables were really cramped in there. We ordered a few things to share and each had a main. I'd say portions are on the generous side. We split falafel and tahini, grilled halloumi, and baladi eggplant. I had a western omelette and my partner had the Borek (cigar dough filled with potato puree and runny egg, folded into a pocket and fried). I thought the shareable sides were pretty good. I liked the eggplant, and it's an ample portion. The omelette here is gigantic, looks like half a skillet. My partner liked his Borek dish. I thought the food, while very generous, was good. It's just hard to justify my desire to return because of the atmosphere. I can't speak for a less busy time of the day. Service was okay, but I really thought the hostess was rude when I arrived. If it were this loud and crowded all the time, I'd probably pass.

12 Chairs serves excellent Middle Eastern food at reasonable prices. Their signature Arayes are a superb combo of perfectly cooked, juicy lamb mince and crunchy pita on the outside with a light tahini sauce and a refreshing spicy tomato salad. For us the standout dish was the cauliflower, which was perfectly balanced with a slight lemony tang, crunch and sharpness from the red onions and creamy tahini at just the right proportions.
Service was initially a little slow but they picked up their game and it ended being very friendly and quick.
The place is however very busy and reservations are a must if you want to secure a spot even early on a Saturday. It does get rather loud inside as tables are very close to each other and packed to the max. So be prepared to get cosy with strangers and bring ear plugs if your susceptible to noise.

one of my favorite spots!!! often crowded and the space is small so your chair will be against someone else's but personally i think this makes the experience even better.

i came around 3-4 pm on a weekend and we were seated pretty quickly but the restaurant was very happening. we got the pita with 4 small plates - labneh, baba ganoush, falafel, and matbucha. the pita was so warm and though i would honestly recommend all of the dishes, the labneh is a must-try.

we also got the hamin (available only in the winter - i went a couple months ago) that was served with couscous. great flavor but personally not as good as the other things we got.  

a busy spot but if you get a chance to try it, definitely do it! one of my favorite places in the downtown/soho area and the atmosphere of the restaurant makes it even better.

This place is hoppin at lunch time, and with good reason. Big but cosy salad bar, sandwich bar and good beverage selection. I've noticed this place for many years--it's always pretty as a postcard with all the flowers in the doorway along Prince Street and the fruit and veggies along Greene. As I went in for the first time today, a double decker tour bus was outside exploring SoHo and I hoped the people looked at me going inside the deli and knew Here was a Real Fantastic New York Experience. I had a delicious avocado sandwich for five bucks. I'll go back.

Such a cute coffee shop to grab a drink, a small bite, or settle in a corner to get some work done! They have ample seating from small circle tables to an 8-seat group table. If you plan on studying, there are a bunch of outlets available by each of the seats so you don't have to worry about finding the table closer to an outlet.

The cashier in the front was super helpful and informative about the options they have to choose from. I'm sad I didn't get to try their empanadas because they sold out!

I just grabbed a quick drink to go, the dulce de leche latte iced and mannn it was so good! It wasn't too sweet nor was it too bitter since I added another double shot of espresso. Will be back if I'm around this part of town!

Love 787! This is my second time trying their coffee, but at a diff location and the quality is still consistent! I got the coquito iced latte with oatmilk and it hit the spot! The coconut and cinnamon notes shined through with the richness of the oatmilk. They also have cute decor inside with enough seating.
Quite spacious hip coffee house with rustic-modern feel and exposed brick walls...I love the vibes of the place. Great music...Super cozy...Great selection of specialty drinks.
They have whiskey and rum infused coffee that is so delicious! Really great spot with wifi, outlets, good coffee, bathroom, etc, that most places don't have.
Warm and comfy atmosphere, with yummy drinks and a sweet proprietor. Welcome to the neighborhood!

Absolutely love this place. I have been coming here for years and it's the best place to stop late at night for a late meal. I've even come here tipsy and maybe even drunk and the workers are always the nicest and most patient guys ever. They don't judge. It's open 24/7 so when I'm coming home from a night out, this is my go to spot to settle down and get some food in my stomach. It feels like you're sitting around the family, just talking and relaxing while enjoying some delicious food. I'm Mexican as well so it's nice to come to a place where it still feels like home instead of just sitting in a business or restaurant and waiting to get served. They don't need to serve their customers like in a restaurant but they do it because they don't see customers, they see family and friends coming to visit. I've brought coworkers here who absolutely love the place, the workers and the food. It's just a nice cozy place where one can settle down for a bit, enjoy a good meal, and relax. I still come here while pregnant and the workers are excited to meet a new member to our community, that's how friendly and loving these people are. I can't wait for my little one to meet the people who have kept her well fed these entire 9 months.

This place is delicious!!! I finally visited and I am definitely coming back - or at least calling for a delivery on a regular basis.  The tacos are fresh fast and tasty.  Horchata is refreshingly creamy with wonderful cinnamon overtones.  This place has really great quality authentic Mexican food and I want to try everything.
4 brothers is just amazing! Food is full of flavors! The cook is always so kind and patient! This place will never fail you.  A must go to spot !
This place is bad, the food is undercooked and too slow to make, when I go there personally the guy on the grill Barely has a mask on when making the food.
amazing tacos.. ive lived in this neighborhood for 8 years and i haven't found anything close to these tacos

When you hear tacos, you think of Mexico. The tacos at this truck are made by two of nicest people. The tacos are the reason you will keep coming back. The quesadilla will make you want to stay and enjoy it on the spot. In addition, you have 5 toppings to your tacos after they're made. This is what Mexico tastes like. Lastly, the loaded nachos will make you wish they had a small tv you can watch the game on.
Excellent Mexican food and Tex mex food  ! Excellent service! Tasteful homemade juices! My family and i have tasted and ate their food for over 15 years ! We recommend 100% !

Best and most authentic Mexican street food in the area!
Yummy, good portions, reasonably priced and excellent service!  I recommend 100%!

The highlight of any long commute home in the wee hours is knowing that delicious, generously-portioned, cheap tacos await. I probably would not have survived the past 4 years if it weren't for this taco truck. The salsas and tops are authentic and flavorful and you cannot beat the price. The quesadillas are also phenomenal. You know you've discovered a great spot when people are already lining up before the truck has even opened yet.

This is the BEST taco in the city. Karla and Ernesto have run this taco truck for years and it's my FAVORITE. I visit multiple times per week. You will definitely get your money's worth. Highly recommend. Try the tostadas!!
Great tacos and a great price! A neighborhood gem. I've had the al pastor, carnitas, and plain chicken tacos--would recommend. Make sure to ask for extra green sauce though.

This taco truck is no joke! The tacos are amazing! As well as their other options - enchiladas, burritos, tostadas, etc. And the best part is the price! Super cheap but incredibly delicious late night eats. I would recommend this truck time and time again!

Woke up. Wrote some emails, stepped outside to grab some coffee and food. Snowy, cold morning. No tolerance. Ran back inside and got on Seamless.

Grilled cheese was really good. Kale juice thing actually drinkable for the sort of health conscious ( as a chaser to grilled cheese sandwiches).

Delivery too pretty long (over 1 hour), but that is what they advertise. Food made up for the wait. 8/10 will order again.

Low level of service, Rude and unprofessional. Counter lady demanded I pay before getting any items out of the store which I felt was completely unnecessary. Wouldn't recommend any get food from there as you can't see the food but you must pay before you get it.

They double charged me and refused to give me back my money. When I told the guy I was double charged he tried to embarrass me saying it didn't go through because there was no money in my account, which doesn't even make sense. I was a loyal customer, alway went on my way home. Never again. If I could give them a zero I would.

This is my fav deli in the area. You would think they'd all be created equal but yet I still crave these guys' breakfast sandwiches, hibiscus iced tea-- and they have a big variety of condiments like hummus, herb mayo, sundried tomato,
honey mustard, etc...(these little things make a difference to me)-- also really like the veggie quesadilla. I've had friends that have really liked their shrimp and grits. I usually am really lazy and order for delivery at least once on the weekend ;) little indulgences. Highly recommend!

This morning I went into this deli to purchase a breakfast sandwich. I have patron this establishment for over 7 years and have experienced nothing but great customer service. However, today the lady who usually is the cashier was extremely rude and used profanity when addressing me. She handed my order to someone else by accident and did not apologize but said that it was my fault. When I addressed her about it she became very defensive and said that she was not going to take any of my Bullshit. She already messed up someone's order earlier and I guess was not have a good morning. However that is not my problem. You should always keep your composure and provide great customer service. This was very unfornate because I will never patron this place again. And I would advise that no else should either.

The owner's wife is rude! It's dirty! Probably needs a health inspection! I used to go here but the service has gotten terrible and they don't seem to care. My sister had an awful experience with the owner's wife. Spend your money elsewhere!

This is one of my favorite spots to order from in the area. The wait is a bit long considering many of their food items are basic every day orders, but it is good nonetheless. The price is a lot better than most other delis in the area and their minimum is lower. When I'm craving it, I usually order a burger and fries or BLT with fries. The burgers are hot and fresh when I get them and the fries are crisp. The BLT on toasted wheat is perfection with an added slice of American cheese! Hits the spot every time. I recommend this deli to all my fellow yelpers who get late night munchies, like myself.

MY FOOD NEVER CAME! I ordered this past Friday and I even waited an extra 30 minutes before I called the store owner and he didn't even say the name of the store but started speaking another language so I wasn't even sure if I was calling the right place. I told him that my order never came. He asked me what I ordered and I told him. Then he said the store would make it now and I said no, don't bother because I was waiting for 30 minutes and it never came. He said ok, no problem and did not even apologize for it not coming.

A month before this, I came in the store and ordered breakfast which included a smoothie and they lost my smoothie and started taking other orders while they lost mine.

I WILL NEVER ORDER FROM THEM AGAIN!!!

There Are rats in that store that eat the potato chips. When you explain to the owners wife, she harasses you.  The owners wife is VERY rugmdwme. She will blame it on you if the employees make the wrong item. Spend your money elsewhere.

French toast is amazing! The wait is rather long imo for a place that's less than a mile away but the food makes up for it... I order the same thing every time and each time they never disappoint. I called to ask a question (about French Toast of course) and they were really nice.

Yeo,

This place is beat. Ordered a bacon egg and cheese on rye... it came on wheat. Im sure these guys don't know the difference. I also ordered that cob salad; even more beat. Came with some old ass lettuce devoured in some dressing. I didn't tell them to put dressing on it made the food real soggy. In conclusion I'm pissed, won't be ordering from here again.
Best deli in the neighborhood!!! Best French Toast around! Fast delivery. Great sandwiches and  burgers.Everything that I have tried has bee great....

I only cheat on Jimbos with this place when I don't have any cash on me. The food is always hot and tastes pretty good. I like that they offer an assortment of cheeses and their coffee tastes great. However, they are usually late with the delivery. Also, there are three items that I will never order from them again. The bacon is entirely too thin and its never cooked crisp, the corn beef hash is the consistency of baby food and the grits are entirely too lumpy.

If you want your food delivered on time, make it yourself. If you call to find out where your food is, the only thing they will say is "it's on it's way. Anytime now" but that doesn't mean anything. Never ordering from them again...just order from Mama Tina's.
Not to fond of the bacon but the French toast is very good and lemonade is extremely fresh.

I ordered a smokehouse burger and a bacon cheese burger and both orders comes with fries. It took an hour for the food to come and when it did my bacon cheeseburger lacked the one essential ingredient.....BACON. my boyfriend had the smokehouse burger and some parts of it were really good and the rest slightly over cooked for a medium rare burger.
