I called the place up about my burger and it took another hour just to send three icy cold strips of overlooked bacon that shredded right under my finger tips. I will never order from the this place again. First and last time!
I ordered delivery from this place and got a call an hour later canceling the order because they "had a lot of other orders". Are you kidding me? Don't order from here, your food won't come.
Love coming here, friendly atmosphere staff is awesome. Food is good but my overall experience is awesome, been coming here for years.

Took almost half hour to place order. The sprite taste like water with simple syrup (nasty), so we got a ginger ale (better). Friend said the coca cola was garbage too. Tried the yucca fries for first time and they were very good. The food is good but the drinks aren't. Place 2as unfortunately overwhelmed by a bike night (which I'm part of) but not sure if they were given the heads up of the amount of people and ordered. So give it a try as this may be a fluke of long lines, long waiting and bad drinks.. but definitely try the yucca or sweet potato fries

The place was cool. It was its own little spot by the water. The food was amazing I went with a friend, the food was delicious and unexpected. The service was good since it gives bar food to a different aspect. The ambiance was fun and playful and they had games to play.
The only thing I didn't like was there was a guy there that looked really sketchy and very off putting and the servers didn't really try to do anything about it. Giant Jenga was fun

The waiter is terrible took 30 minutes to come and take my order after I ordered she didn't bring my drinks till after my food got here which also was another 40 minutes food is great but the service isn't worth it

Maybe it was an off day ALL the food was dry and I we cooked. Stay away from the Fried raviolis no seasoning, wings over cooked the sliders all 20 of them burned.....bacon under cook and serve us 1 hr there and didn't receive any of our drinks

If u sit at the bar 100 he's cool and makes good drinks

It's a ok spot of you just wanna grab drinks and have some very bad food to as a way to spoil yourself. The place looks cool on the inside but has a vibe that screams " Underage drinkers allowed " ! Went here with a friend a couple of weeks ago and the establishment wasn't being ran well. No hostess greeting people at the door , only one bartender available ( bartender was cool btw) to serve drinks and the wait for food was awful. I had to speak to someone higher to get service. Overall this place needs to figure out who their customers are and serve them properly.

Yooo lemme start by saying that this was my first time at THIS location. I went to the one on 51st street a couple of times years ago. ANYWHO, my cousin & I came here randomly on Thursday and got the burgers and the HOT Mama fishbowl. Reasonable prices. Our server was super nice and accommodating. Shoutouts to him! He had glasses. That's all I remember. Lol. But definitely can't wait to head back & get some shots and more burgers. YUM.! They're so small & cute. Loved them!

We actually left before getting service. The host was rude and the bartender never actually came over to serve us. Further more at the door there was a period where they weren't even checking IDs although clearly they should've been. I wanted to give them benefit of the doubt, because I understand that they may have been short staffed but that doesn't mean that the staff needed to be so rude.

Great place to hang out and chill.. with or without kids...we were a group of 7, with children.  Food was actually really good.  The sliders were small,  but for $1 each,  you will need at least 5 or 6.. they were good and even better you can beef sliders or turkey sliders.. good selection of sides..
$2 shots, $12 drinks,  were on point... i think I had about 7 lemon drop shots...theyc were strong and very good...I was happy ....The $2 games were fun, we all played.. the kids loved it..I like the view right on the waterfront... we plan on going back again soon.. staff were cool...I recommend...

This place has the slowest possible service ever.  Considering that party boats doc here they should be speedier on their service.  The female waitresses are standoffish and never came back to the table.

This was my first time coming to 123BSB and I enjoyed myself. Our server Edwin was AMAZING!
I had the naked Hells Kitchen Hot Buffalo wings. They didn't exactly live up to the name lol they were moreso on the mild side to me, but then again I love spicy food. The waffle fries are also good. To drink I had a Hole in One , it was pretty tasty and I also had a  Kamikaze shot which was cool. Pretty subtle, nothing extreme. To end the night we had a Bomb shot, I had the Minderaser and it was eh. If you're into cinnamon flavored  liquors then this may be for you !

Now let's discuss the ambience of the place. We were there on a Saturday night and it was pretty empty in there. The music selection was absolutely horrible. They played "I believe I can fly" by R.Kelly. . .on a SATURDAY NIGHT. It's very clean inside and plenty of seating. My only suggestion would be to get a better music selection and maybe even a DJ for Saturday's, just to help liven up the place. I would definitely come back here

Listen, if you're looking for that dive bar, sports bar, college bar experience for a nice price, overlooking the beautiful Riverside Drive, then 123 BSB is it. Don't come here of you're looking for anything more than enjoyable cheap food & cheap drinks. Oh and of course great service.. Did I mention they have games? Come down and have a nice cool as time at 123 BSB.
Cheese Burger Sliders
Naked Hells Kitchen Hot Buffalo Wings

This place was like a hidden gem even though the lights showed a party. The place was empty when we first came during night but the waiter was so nice to us, had a fan set it up just for us, and treat us to their sample shots. It's a great great place to have some fun and even play UNO!!! The amazing service is worth going that's all we really want anyway.

This review gets 4 stars because our server Paulie was amazing! Very attentive, patient( we were all over the place), and fast. He had excellent service! The burgers were called sliders even though they are like a lil bigger than coin size lol so no they are not true sliders but they are tasty and they are a dollar each. $3 minimum per request. We got the Hennything is Possible souvenir plastic drink holder which was $32 and comes with two shots of Hennessy per holder. My friend said it was very icey and not smooth enough for her. They have two dollar shots and we all enjoyed the pina colada because it was not the mix but real pineapple juice, coconut milk and rum. Other shots were good just not very strong, I mean they are two dollars. We got coconut shrimp, I thought it was decent. My friend got a $2 hotdog and some onion rings. Music was very good also which made it memorable. We paid $170 in total for 3 people with gratuity included. Which is about $60 per person, not bad for a night in NYC!

Name says it all! Burgers, shots, and beers.

They also do ribs and waffle fries. Lots of beers on tap, and the shots are $2 each.

Just opened, will come here for a fun pregame.
A great spot to chill and watch the game Good bar food. My favorite is the sliders and Mac and cheese balls.

How online it shows ya open at 2, and when I called the number the time this place is open is 2 as well. But on here on yelp it shows 4? How about ya change the time online so people won't waste their time at all.
What a great experience I had here ..... brand is the best bartender. She's so friendly. Love the energy defiantly coming back

First time I've ever in my half a century experienced this situation with a restaurant. I call for the hours the machine said 1pm. I drive down pay for parking and they are closed, the guy cleaning outside said 2pm so we waited for an hour despite the sign saying "1pm" Saturdays and Sundays. Now, it's almost 2:30pm we're outside none of the chairs inside is down and I'm knocking on the front door and nobody is there. I'm never again attempting to come to this place...  Not how a business should operate!

Located in Harlem right by the George Washington bridge and Hudson river, this sports bar is super chill. Came here last night (Saturday before Super Bowl Sunday) around 830p and it was on the empty side. As the night went on, the crowd began to pack in and the security guard was checking IDs at the front door. The bar has many seats and tables for groups of friends to sit and enjoy themselves.
The food is typical, mediocre bar food. The price of the food and drinks is the main reason why people come to 123. Sliders are $1 (must order minimum of 3), shots $2, and beer $3. I was with a group of 4 people and we spent $40 each. I personally suggest trying their Rum Hooch punch its Delicious!
Negatives I would add are the bathrooms are unisex in the back of the bar, and the music was pretty terrible lol.

What's there to say, really, except that this place is all hits?  I haven't had a dud pizza here, though my clear favorite is the Bari.  The staff is so friendly and warm, it already feels like it's been here for years.

Just returned and had the 314 and the Bari pizzas.  They were both really good!

I noticed that the bigger sized pizza tends to be a little thicker... which is even gummier for my taste.

I was sad to see the porchetta gone from their menu.

There was lived band there tonight , great jazz . It's a cute spot for drinks and food! The food is really good ! The calamari is fantastic and the pizza was made fresh and incredible. The appetizer balls had cheese and risotto in them (I forget the name ) those were incredible!! And the salmon was cooked to perfection , I think the only thing I didn't like were the Brussels sprouts, they needed to be more crunchy. The drinks are great too! A must try if you are in the area

What do you do when you order a lasagna and it has too much heat and when you let the waiter/server know he says the put nutmeg in the spice????? I go on to say what? The heat is in the meat or sauce
. He goes somewhere and returns with confirmation that the meat has the spicy spice. Never offers to change dish as on the menu the hot spice in the lasagna dish is never mentioned. Worst experience ever.
To add insult to injury when he brings bill he stated that. Because we were a party of six the gratuity was automatically included. We were never a party of SIX we were a party of FOUR. Go to the video tape!!! Do you need money??
Very disappointed and definitely not what we expected.

My mom and I went yo 314 on Saturday for a pre Mother's Day dinner. We got seats quickly. I hear it's a popular place so sometimes there is a wait. The food was DELICIOUS!! We shared a seafood pasta dish, salad and a pizza. There was so much flavor in the food. I could have licked the pasta sauce bowl clean but I'm a lady with class so I used my pizza crust instead . The Sweet Cheeks Pizza was delicious. It's a white pizza that had prosciutto and Caramelized onions. The sweetness from the onions was a perfect balance to the cheese and prosciutto. I will be returning multiple times to try various foods on the menu.

I was a huge fan of the restaurant back when it was on Amsterdam so I was really happy to see them reopen on Broadway. Food and drinks were just as good as I remembered - the only difference besides location I noticed was that the service is much much faster here now. Additionally, I would recommend making a reservation here if you plan on coming Friday or the weekend. My friends and I tried walking in on Friday but the wait was well over 30 minutes.

We haven't been to the place but we peeped at their menu online and their menu had us wanting to try their pizza so we had it delivered. The margarita pizza was beautifully done made with a tomato sauce base, mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil leaves. The mozzarella cheese was gooey, and overall a fresh margarita pie! We can't imagine what their other pizzas must taste like.
I loved it here! It's insanely authentic, the drinks were strong, prices were reasonable and the service was great. It's such a great addition to Harlem and I'll be coming here a lot!
We had a great pizza birthday dinner with family and friends. We tried many different pizzas. We had a great server. We will come back for the other choices on the menu.

I could eat this pizza for the rest of my life. Great spot in the morningside heights area for some wine and pizza. I had a whole one to myself and it was great. Definitely recommend if you wanna split a few slices with friends. Sat outside in the summer and it was great.
We lunched here while visiting Columbia with our son and were disappointed by the over salted carbonara dish that the two of us had.
I am glad they're in the neighborhood. The food is excellent, service is great too. My favorite pie is the Barnard pie. Never a wait either.

People and food are amazing here. This place is like going back in Italy and then back in New York. The service is superb and the owner are very good people that really take care of the food and the quality of the products they used. This new location is even better than before and the ambiance is Italian. What you want more?

I stopped at this place for brunch and ordered the carbonara and egg Benedict, the food was delish and I loved the service. The host was was welcoming and very down to earth. I love to see this in Harlem and I will be back to try their pizzas and drinks. I went supper early so the place wasn't too crowded.

REAL ITALIAN PIZZA. Have been there with some friends since the opening, and we got addicted!
They make pizza margherita with burrata which is even better than bufala mozzarella. Frittura and pasta is great as well. Lorenzo takes care of his customers as a real friend who knows your taste. Same with his team.
One of the best Italian place to go and have relaxing time with friends/family.

Pleasantly surprised by 314. Admittedly, the surprise is a leftover from my grad school days at Columbia, when there was no truly excellent food in Morningside Heights. Imagine spending thousands of dollars on an Ivy League only to feel like you should have gone to NYU because they have better restaurants.

314 helps to even the score. Their fried burrata is an upscale mozzarella stick and the lasagna is about as good as it gets. Their salads and pizzas are good, too.

I've been going here once a week for maybe a month. I've had a few different pies. The vodka pie (I think it's called the Columbia Pie) is incredible!!! Ask for extra pesto sauce, it's so good! The NYC pie was great too. I

also have had a pie with gorgonzola on it. The taste was good, but I found it much too salty. I think they should add some sort of cheese or cream to it that isn't as salty to help balance out the pungent gorgonzola. It also had the least cheese out of the 3 pies that I tried. A good concept, but perhaps needs some refining.

The service is "ok". They are nice, but I had only been checked on during my meal ONCE in my several times being there! Still, the pizza itself deserves 5 stars. They also have a good drink menu and they offer coffee.

Pleasant looking dining room but pizza oven is noisy.

Service was fine.

Pizza might be excellent but the pasta paccheri was heavily salted with lots of salted breadcrumbs.   Very little cheese besides dry parmigiana, often in hard lumps.
Chicken parmigiana was bland.

If I return I'll stick with the pizza.

I have been a customer of Bar 314 since it opened on Amsterdam Avenue. The pizza from that location was always fresh and delicious.
Since they moved to Broadway I have yet to enjoy a delicious pizza and I have ordered 10 since the opening. The last one I received was a Margarita with Sausage. The misshaped pie was the size of a sheet of copy paper. Precious little tomato sauce and several lumps of uncooked sausage adorned the top (you know that you're supposed to cook the sausage before applying it to the pie).
This makes me sad because this place was one of the few in the neighborhood where you could order a delicious pie and especially sad because I know the owner. We went through the Pandemic together and I could always count on them for something delicious. That ship sailed long ago for places like Pisticci and Max Soha whose mediocre overpriced pasta offerings bear no relation to Italian cooking and aren't worth the time and energy.
I walk past 314 now and it is rammed every evening with loud drinkers who apparently don't care about the food. I see the owner smiling at his success and I don't begrudge him his good fortune. It's just a shame that they completely turned their backs on the food.
Too bad the last good pizza in the neighborhood is gone. I'll keep walking past looking for something better.

I am so happy to have found this place cus they have a delicious gluten free pizza. Which is so important to me as someone who needs to eat my pizza without gluten. The pizza is always fresh, toppings are the best, everything tastes so good. The crust is light and doesn't leave you feeling all heavy and overly full after. Perfect amount of cheese and toppings. I really cannot say enough about their GF pizza, it's my favorite pizza!
Best pizza and Italian food in NYC. Also do yourself a favor and ask Bruno or Lorenzo for a Negroni.
Delicious pizzas, pasta and salads and wonderful servers.  Looking forward to returning.
Great food! Pizza was delicious! Owners are fantastic! Only drawback is the elevated subway... but you get used to it.

They are now my go to artisan pizza delivery.

While I enjoy all their other pizza combinations, our favorite is the sweet cheeks pie.

We can't stop ordering pizza from Bar 314. The dough tastes great. Toppings are quality. Flavors are just plain good. We've tried 4 pizzas and while some shine brighter than others, all were great!

Delivery has been quick every time. Having such a great pizza spot near home is so dangerous.
Fresh pizza, authentic Italian dressings. Good place for business and causal eats. Right under the subway bridge so it could get noisy. Recommend the chicken parm and margarita pizza.

Bar314 (ha, always appreciate a  reference!) has delicious pizza and I'll be sure to be back! The restaurant is really cozy, and it's the perfect spot that can accommodate something casual to something more intentional.

My friend and I had the Bar314 pizza, and it was excellent! We also had the fried burrata which really hit the spot.

P.S. They're still open right now with 15% off take-out and delivery and a lot of great wine options!
The best pizza I have had in Manhattan! Freshly made with good ingredients and fast service. Amazing!

This place has great food. Well prepared and nice portions. The service is great. Very friendly and attentive.

I asked for two separate tables so my daughter and her friend could sit and have some independence and the servers were so lovely at each of our tables.

This will definitely be one of our regular neighborhood spots.

Great pizza! I served this pizza to a group & everyone agreed - this is really tasty pizza. Very thin crust, on the small side, but the price is reasonable & it's a nice way to satisfy your pizza craving without feeling guilty. Unlike many other pizzas I've had recently, the one from 314 wasn't greasy at all. It had just the right amount of cheese and sauce. Wish it had been a bit larger. Also, it arrived ice cold, had to heat it up again. Delicious. Suggest ordering 2 pizzas - one isn't enough !
This might just be the best pizza in New York and we have tried hundreds of the top reviewed places. The service is also top notch

Was sad to see Bettolona close, but tried 314 today for lunch and was blown away. We got a few pizzas and pasta dishes for the table, which were excellent. Price is also very reasonable. Will definitely be back!

Don't read my review, just look at that slight char on that tasty thin-crust pesto pizza, and make it happen!  The salmon also looked good. Pleasant service, they weren't packed and didn't rush me (dining alone).

Currently here it's 6pm. I got here at 5:20pm exactly this is DEFINITELY THE PERFECT DATE NIGHT SPOT. I came because pasta and pizza and WINE LITERALLY CAN NOT BEAT THAT so basically I'm taking myself out on a date I know. Since it's just me, myself and I still wanted to try as much as my stomach would let me it's super fancy but they play really great music... I was the only person inside I got seated by the bar table literally right next to the bar and then a couple got seated outside it's actually really dead for such a nice day on a Saturday but maybe it's too early who knows maybe Friday is there busy day and again it's really early still but they open at 4 and close at 10 so idk. Anyways everything is great here I got the red sangria and fried burrata as my starting appetizer which essentially in plain form a giant fried mozzarella stick in the shape of a ball honestly but it wasn't hot it was cold and the cheese inside didn't exactly taste like a mozzarella stick more like ricotta and mozzarella I'm not sure but I'm also totally not complaining. I ordered the 314 pizza in 12in because it's just myself and then as much as I really wanted pasta I couldn't decide so I ended up just getting another appetizer the meatballs to be exact and that's all this place is definitely a date night/ maybe even girls night out I want to be fancy upscale for the night or evening I will definitely be bringing my boyfriend here next time, trying some other things 10/10 recommend staff amazing, food amazing hot and fresh, vibe amazing.it gives Fumo vibes another great pizza, pasta, wine place but I guess you don't need to make a reservation or dress super formal

My hubby and I made reservations for Valentine's Day and they were very accommodating. I love how they have indoor (social distanced) and outdoor seating options. We chose indoors since it was super cold outside.

We loved the ambiance and the playlist was hitting. They were playing all the old school jams like Lauryn Hill.

I will rate what we ordered from 1-10 below.

1. Barrata: 7 (it was good but honestly too much cheese for me. Also the broccoli was a bit too burnt for me)
2. Gambero pasta: 9 (great portion and very tasty, wish there was a few more shrimp)
3. Margherita pizza: 9 (so yummy but have a few burnt bubbles on the crust that didn't taste great)

I'd definitely come back here again! Wonderful food and experience! Also pretty affordable !

the 314 pizza was delicious and great portion for the price! Definitely one of the better pizza places near morningside heights. My friend ordered the clam pasta which was good but the portion size was small.

Really enjoyed my meal here! Amazing service and very cozy/cute interior. They have a very nice big pizza oven in the back. As of 11/28/18 they don't have their liquor license yet but they are in the process of getting it -- after that they will be having another opening/promotional event.

NYC is littered w/ pizza places but this place is indeed one of the better ones. The ingredients are fresh, decent portion size and lots of topping options for personalization. The dough tastes great and was cooked crispy enough -- it light/airy but yet filling. Sauce was tasty as well; tangy and zesty. I had the margherita pizza substituted w/ burrata cheese -- BEST DECISION EVER! You could really taste the difference. I asked for caramelized onions but when it initially came out he forgot to add it so he brought out another pie for us w/ caramelized onions!! Really appreciated that level customer service - very thoughtful and a good move.

As an app we had the hot honey fried burrata which was incredible!! Very delicious and unique flavor. It was somewhat small in size but very yummy , probably would get it again.  

This is a great spot and they deliver as well! The ownership is the same as Babbalucci so it's certainly under good management. I would recommend this spot to anyone in that area.

This is the best roman-style pizza in the area. Maybe even in all of UWS/the heights. Dough is very thin but not too moist, toppings are fresh and well-balanced, recipes are all excellent and pizzas are consistent. Sometimes they'll burn the edges a bit here and there but honestly the pizza is so good I don't even mind. Delivery through Slice is reliable and affordable.

So fabulous! On a cold, windy day we ducked in to this new place and had the loveliest of lunches. Only thing that could have been better was if they had their liquor license already (fingers crossed they get it soon! they were supposed to hear about it the day we were there.)

Even though we walked in with 5 other tables and there was just one guy (Rick) running everything but the oven (also kudos to that guy!!!!!), we really enjoyed the service. Seriously, they rocked it. I don't think they were expecting so many people on a random Thursday at 1:30.

Rick was a gem. Calm, nothing but smiles, and good at giving suggestions. He was cool with our out of the box order of the Margarita pizza with the added pepperoni AND chilis. We literally talked about this pizza all day. It's perfection kept finding its way to our conversation topic. To quote my wife, we eat a lot of really good pizza all over the country (hell the world!) but this was either the best or second best we've had outside of Napoli--because Napoli.

The crust was everything you crave about Neapolitan crust and the toppings had you eating until you knew it was time to stop but you keep going and keep going because the cheese and the sauce and the lightly burnt pepperoni just will not allow you to stop.

If they had already been able to serve wine, we might have ordered some pinot noir until dinner and just started eating pizza all over again.

Go hungry. Eat too much. Love life.

Stopped in for lunch while uptown for a work meeting. Wasn't sure what to expect but good Yelp reviews assured me I was making the right move. Turns out this quaint little pizza/pasta/ small plates spot is quite the gem!

We decided to split a sandwich and pizza. The Pica pizza was delicious. Charred crust, very flavorful and not hard was topped with delicious sausage crumbles, onions and peppers. Had a nice kick of heat to it.

The Arturo sandwich was also good. A little harder to eat but the same dough from the pizza was used for the bread. Served with a small salad. All in all a really good $30 lunch was had ( for two people). I'd definitely come back when I am in the area.

Great pizza, good service! The place is located on the corner of 122nd Street and Amsterdam. During the lockdown, they do take outs including wine, which I find very thoughtful.
I have been there a few times, and am satisfied. Will return.

When I saw on Instagram that Babbalucci's sister restaurant had opened, I knew I had to try it. We were a party of 3 and decided to get 3 different pizzas and share.

We started with the Breasaola salad, it was fresh and delicious and easy to share.

For the pizza I have no pics simply because as soon as they arrived, we devoured them.

*314: our favorite, very nice contrast, perfectly balanced. Imagine pepperoni and hot honey.

*Babba: taleggio, guanciale and truffle paté. Decadent and delicious.

*Volta : fresh and delicate, with burrata, coppa, and marinated tomato.

I also have to say that 2 out of 3 of us are Italians living in NYC and we loved the pizza. The dough is very good and the oven makes it incredible. We later learned that they use their own Mother of Yeast, which makes a big difference. Wanna know the trick? If you wake up in the middle of the night and feel thirsty, it wasn't a good dough. And that one is an exceptional dough.

We also had mini cannoli that were the cherry on top of the dinner. Just look at my face in the pic.

Two notes:

1) the service is very good, everybody is polite, friendly, and attentive. Bruno explained to us the name of the restaurant (3,14 is Pi!) and the logo, a budding flower which is a symbol of prosperity in the region of Puglia.

2) We didn't have any drinks last night because they're in the process of getting their alcohol license, but they said it should be ready soon!
Freakin delicious and great staff! Make sure to try the brussel sprouts - they are UNREAL!

We ordered delivery from Slice and food was delivered before estimated time. Everything was packaged well, but not quite warm enough so we had to briefly reheat entrees in oven..

We had the lasagna which was delicious with rich, meaty sauce and wonderful fresh tasting cheeses. It was a substantial portion and a first rate representation of this dish.

The Chicken Franchese had a good egg-dipped style crust over perfectly cooked juicy chicken breast. The lemon sauce was thin and had perfectly balanced lemon flavor.  The side sauteed spinach was flawlessly prepared with wonderful mild garlic flavor.

The Carpaccio salad contained arugula,mushrooms,onions,braciole and grana cheese with an amazing truffle lemon dressing. The combination of flavors was wonderful. All ingredients were top-shelf and fresh.

Overall, everything was fantastic and can't wait to dine-in. Highly recommended.

Simply great food & drinks that's why people keep coming back to this amazing little restaurant.
A+ in my book.

Great restaurant for a more "upscale" pizza date than your average New York slice.

Atmosphere was cute, not a ton of space but we didn't have any problem getting a table.

My friend got the 314 and I got the 1260. Both were amazing, with the 314 being particularly unique. I finished mine and was quite full, so I would say that it's a large personal pizza. I don't think I would want to share one unless I wasn't very hungry, though I could see sharing one pizza and an appetizer

Will definitely be returning and possibly even getting pizzas for take out. Definitely a hidden gem in terms of restaurants in morningside heights.

Soooo delicious. Delicious thin crush pizza. I've ordered delivery through Grubhub and ordered take out. I always get the 314 pizza and add garlic and sometimes add extra pepperoni. Just a few blocks north of Columbia and there's a nice outdoor patio too. So delicious ! During covid, everyone working is wearing masks and it feels very safe

Reliably delicious starters and pizzas. Good that the restaurant is checking COVID vaccine documentation and IDs at the main entrance for indoor dining. Not good that diners at a large table for a dozen or so waltzed in through the outdoor dining area, seated themselves, and circumvented the checking.

I am really starting to love this place.
So far I have gotten tasty mussels, chicken parmigiana and the 314 pizza- no complaints.

And the staff are always so nice!

I have been in New York since ten years and frankly speaking this is the best pizza that I ever eaten. Soft, crispy and tasty. And overall they use sourdough instead of yeast! I used to eat salads and panzerotti, a sort of mini calzones. They also have gluten-free pizza.
The atmosphere is sober and comfortable. Courtesy and professionally staff complete this great location. Highly recommend!

A new halal cart in our neighborhood! I'm very impressed with this new addition, it's a lot better than Halal Guys. I got the chicken and rice, and the meat and veggies were super fresh, and the sauce was very tasty. Where has this been during all my drunk nights?!

Just ate here and I find some of the reviews on here to be crazy dramatic. Yes, it is more than a dollar a slice $1.09. Ever heard of tax?

The staff here was friendly and quick. My plain slice was okay, nothing to rave about but I've had worse more expensive. For dollar slice it's pretty good.

Seating here is limited, maybe 5 stools. No television or anything. It really is a get in get out place.

If you don't have money to spend come here for a quick slice.
Just your average run of the mill pizza slice, bland, a little dry on the sauce front. Convenient location in a pinch.

Came here to pick up a quick lunch. Tiny place. Wide variety of interesting looking slices. A small aside but is it just me or is it only in NYC you can get pizza by the slice on almost any block? Anywhere else, you're buying a whole pizza. Anyway, I got the teriyaki chicken and a plain. Always get a plain slice when you're checking out new pizza places. They were fine. Seemed a little cheaper than the other place I normally go to but I think I still prefer the other one. The staff seemed pretty friendly and they pumped good music while I waited.

Definitely some of the worst pizza I've ever had, and they apparently raised their prices to $1.50. It's clearly going to pay the rent for that prime real estate and not into the ingredients.

The sauce is overpoweringly sweet, the crust is soft and fluffy and undercooked, and the cheese completely comes apart from it when you fold it. They also don't care enough to warm the slices thoroughly.

No napkins, and the seasoning containers are all missing their tops so it's impossible to pour a reasonable amount of anything onto your slice. There are better, and actual, dollar slices in the city.

We were staying at the Hilton Garden Inn across the street and wanted to order NY style pizza for dinner. You can order online (delivery or pick up) and you get a special discount. We ordered a pepperoni and a mushroom pizza for pick up. Both pizza were pretty good. We recommend it highly.

This place is great! The pizza is much better than the majority of places in the city and the selection is extensive. Also a shout out to Caleb who is really nice and provides great service! He does a great job managing it especially when it is busy and filled with indecisive customers.

In the hunt of $1 pizzas I could have possibly found a real gem.

The first time I came here was after a fashion party at Soho Grand Hotel.

It not only did the trick but the guy handling the cash/making my pizza was very friendly.

Good people to talk with actually even at the wee hours of 1am-2am.

I had just beaten the crowd that will no doubt come in hordes from Canal Room for cheap slices.

The second time I came was during lunch for the Tribeca Film Festival.

The guys in the daytime not as friendly and the bottom of my pizzas came out burnt.  

But after some scraping and patting down it was Okay.

Come here at night for slices.

After splurging on drinks all night, your wallet will thank you.

Your stomach will too.

This establishment was 4 blocks away from where I was staying and I found it the eve before my flight home. Plain pizzas are $1. One topping pizzas are $1.50. Can you go wrong?!

As I walked in on my way home getting off the train, I was surprised to see a pizza for $1. It's like I was supposed to be here. The train took too long; or I lost my patience, and I decided to walk to my rental. My eye caught a glimpse of a sign that read "$1 pizza." Wasn't planning on grabbing a nite to eat because I had some leftover chicken and fries in the fridge waiting for me. But I did it. Got my go-to pizza, pepperoni, and enjoyed my slice walking home. Sweet way to end my last night in the big apple! :)

First off, slice costs more than the advertised dollar. Considering this is probably the worst and cheapest NY pizza I have ever had, that's just criminal. Weeks later, I still shudder at how badly-made the crust was, to the point that it actually brought me physical pain to consume it.

Your first impression as you bite it is sharpness; the crust fragments like a shard of glass and scratches up your mouth. Following this your crust will turn into a thick chewy white-bread-flavored paste that requires the full effort of all your jaw muscles to break it down into nourishment. This is only mildly complemented by the thin spread of ragu-tasting tomato sauce and such a weak helping of processed cheese that you won't even notice that it's there. As you fight your way through the slice you may notice the extremely unclean man pressing out the dough with no gloves, hat or hairnet, no proper place to store finished dough, or anything else that involves health standards.

Awful pizza, slow and awful service, not even worth the dollar and change. I'd sooner eat a gas station slice than try this again.

I ordered 4 pizzas for my office, and they came without pizza holder.  The cheese pizza got all messed up and cheese are all on the box.  Call the restaurant and asked for a replacement but they said it is the delivery guy's problem and delivery guy is from Seamless.  Kept asking me to call Seamless, and refused to send replacement.  Seamless refunded that one pie eventually.  But what we expect is to have 4 pizzas for people to eat.  Bad experience.  Never order again.

Oh my goodness - this was possibly the most disgusting pizza I've ever had. No joke. I know a lot of people stand by $1 pizza and say how good it is - but not this place.  The pizza reminded me of someone who just dumped cheese & sauce on white bread.

I'd rather eat Kosher pizza before torturing myself with this sh*t again.
Very great place for fresh pizza. Employees are really cool. Especially the cashier she had a great attitude and vibe.

Cool place, great location, and best of great pizza. The only thing I can really criticize is the service. Really wasn't thrilled with the workers here. I recently stopped by got one of their speciality slices and as I finished paying I noticed a sign saying it includes a free can soda. But as I asked for the soda the man behind the register said it was too late and that I had to pay full price for it. Didn't really think it was that big of a deal to just let it slide and get me the drink. Guy also almost always has an attitude. So for that I'm leaving the 4 stars. But other than that pizza is great, I think it's one of the best in the area.

This was another of those places that I zoom past on my way to and from work, deterred on good days because its name evoked images of dirty rental quad rollerskates and deterred on bad days just because I didn't have a single dollar of cash on me.

Yesterday, my weakness for pizza and the presence of a $5 bill in my wallet coincided so that I finally crossed the street to the curious triangular island on which this shop is located.

I kind of stayed back up against the wall, waiting for a new pizza to come out. Luckily, someone took the last sad cheese slice, so I stepped up to bat. The man asked if he could help me. I stared at the empty, crumby dish where the cheese pie was supposed to be and asked if another one was on the way. At the same time, my eyes darted over to the last piece of pepperoni. It, too, looked forlorn as all last slices do, but I wondered if I should just ask for that instead, even if I had to pay an extra coin or something. All other slices looked horrible, like trash on dough with puff paints squeezed on top. They may taste delicious, but I wasn't about to take a chance.

Anyway, it was too late to change my mind to pepperoni, because the man said, "Ah!" and reached under to some magical drawer, from which he produced a fresh circle of cheese pizza. He didn't even bother to warm it up, since I hadn't asked. I liked that. I just wanted to get my pizza, throw a dollar at the cashier, and GTFO. And that's exactly what I did, meaning that Roll and Go really does live up to its name.

While I was shoveling the folded slice into my mouth lest it grow cold from exposure, I burnt the hell out of my palate. I took a break, then finished the rest on the platform, enduring the stares of simultaneously judgmental and covetous Tribecans and lost tourists.

One thing of note was the dough. First, it had the crumbly cardboardish taste prevalent in low budget pizza chains throughout the Northeastern United States. But as I approached the crust, the taste actually got BETTER, and peaked at the soft, floury crust itself. This Willy Wonka-ish transformation was definitely unexpected, hence memorable.

Just like a mildly addictive substance ought to, Pizza from Roll and Go delivers minor highs and mild lows. I can't say I recommend it or warn people away from it, but all I can say is that the $1 pizza is really there. I'm sure I'll get it again on the way home tonight because I have $4 of cash left in my bindle.

The worst New York pizza I've ever had. New York pizza is a pretty hard thing to screw up, but they did. It tastes like high school cafeteria pizza or frozen pizza. My slice was also burned. Just generally tastes foul. Avoid.

It's one of those places that you go to just for a quick snack or something. Should I comment on service? You're basically being ignored for a few minutes while they talk with friends or do diddlyshit behind the counter. They can afford to though because it's $1 for cheese slices and people will wait.

Anyways, the pizza is decent and I did notice that the dough was thicker than normal pizza. Fine with me.

I've eaten here two times, and the pizza is great! Both times were around 10pm, so the service has been great since there were only a few people in the place.  Not sure if pizza gets any better than this for a buck!

Tip: if it's a pizza fresh out of the oven, give the cheese a little time to set. If it's a warmed up slice, you're good to go!

Another one of those New York pizza staples - come by if you want a cheap pizza that just is mediocre at best. Giving it one star would be a bit too much though - it's one dollar. What are people expecting? Pizza I had was slightly undercooked - would have like it to have a bit more of a crunch on the bottom. Like the other New York "staple" eats, you didn't come here to eat some amazing dish - you came here because it was convenient.

Came here last night around 3 am, service was quick, pizza was amazing. The employees working were very friendly. They threw the slices long enough that it was warm enough but not to long that I would have to wait to eat it. That was very big for me. In a easy location. I found my new $1 pizza spot in downtown NYC!

I was here around 5:30 PM yesterday on the way home after helping out a friend. I wanted to get something to eat but nothing too heavy so I stopped in here when I happened upon it.  For $1 you get a no frills cheese slice.  It's not that big and the crust could be crispier but for $1 it's pretty good. The usual spices are there to add if you wish- salt, oregano, red pepper flakes, black pepper.

The pizza is pretty good sometimes. They used to be better. Still pretty good. Prices went up recently, it used to be a dollar slice spot. The white slice is really good. Pay attention to the slice, sometimes if they're busy, it'll be a tad too crispy. Other than that, no complaints really. Still priced better than other pizza spots in the area. Definitely would recommend if you want pizza in TriBeCa

Don't go here!!! I used to love this spot because of its proximity to my job but they have literally been charged  three different amounts for a plain slice in a week.  The girl working today even admitted that the price had gone from 1.00 to 2.25 in the last few days.  This is dollar slice quality pizza NOTHING MORE.  Don't get ripped off.  I wish this was still a place for me to grab a cheap slice on my break, not somewhere trying to rip off tourists and drunk club goers stumbling over from haus late night.
Decent for dollar pizza. Beggars can't be choosers. Although I've had better I've also had worse. Definitely hits the spot when you're in a pinch monetarily-wise lol

I disagree with the previous reviewer Joshua M. The dollar slices are not really good...by a long shot. But they're decent, cheap, and filling. What more can you ask for? They also have topping slices for not much more - $1.50 - $2 I believe...

I also appreciated that they have a whole lotta other cheap food options including a $2.99 falafel sandwich deal that I'd like to try at one point.

Not as tasty as Two Bros pizza but a buck you can't go wrong
Friendly staff, place was clean.
Good pizza at an amazing price. $1 for a slice, 1.50 for peperoni. Wow. Just be prepared to wait online during peak hours.

This place is amazing!

$1 regular slices, they taste pretty good. However, it's not your standard New York Pizzeria because the pizza dough is thicker.

They also have topping slices for additional charge, but still cheaper than other places. My favorite there is Buffalo Chicken Slice. I have yet to try their Chicken Teriyaki Slice

1.50 for a plain slice.

3.50 for a chicken slice.

Quick service.

Friendly staff.

Highly recommended.

I totally agree. Beggars can't be choosers.
For a dollar, this is a steal.

Worst pizzeria to go to. Came in waited on line for 5mins asked for my slice to be heated up the guy said no skipped me and continued to serve the next person on line. How hard is it to heat up a dam slice. I even touched the slice to see if it was hot and it wasn't and he sold that slice to someone else. Very unsanitary.

Pizza was satisfying.  I enjoyed it I was a little confused as to why the charged me $1 extra for mushroom topping when he rang me up but still $2 for a pretty well made pizza in the city is still unbeatable.  Can't wait for passover to be over so I can go back and have another slice!

This particular review is based on my most recent experience. I received cold rubbery pizza and a room temperature can of soda. I had to laugh because if the slice was as warm as my drink it would have tasted less disgusting. They also couldn't accept debit/credit cards because the POS system was down. Above all this review is written not as a complaint, but in hopes they increase the quality of their food/service. I would like to be able to give a higher rating in the near future, but for now they are a 2 star pizza place.
Greasy, salty, sweet. The guy at the counter was rude. Another employee was mopping around my feet as I was trying to eat. But hey! It's 99 cents!

ONE DOLLAHHH! I'm a pizza king and I've tried thousands of pizza in many locations. I eat here bunch of times since it's close to my work. This $1 pizza tastes like $3 pizza and I was elated to see Sbarro gone out of business few blocks away. Speedy clean service. Has more sauce than any other $1 pizza places.
Not as good as "2 Bros" pizza which is the comparable $1 Slice. But still, it's hard to beat a dollar slice if you're in the area.

Better than Pizza Hut, not as good as pizzeria pizza. For a slice that's only $1, it definitely doesn't taste like you only spent $1. The slices I had were huge, service was fast, staff was nice. Worth checking out if you're looking for something super cheap but still good.
Love Roll n' Go, but recently they changed their prices due to taxes so now pizza is no longer a clean buck. Still a delicious slice on the cheap though.
The pizza crust is so soft and doughy that I called it cake. You will like this pizza depending on if you like cake or not.
$1 Pizza slices... Just two blocks away from my school... Who's complaining about that??? Slices are good btw... Really good...
On a interns salaries this place was a hangover life savior. Dollar slices? You can't loose!

Great $1 slices in my book. It's like Dominoes meets real pizza, for $1! It's really doughy and has a lot of sauce, and I was filled on two slices. Will definitely go there again.  I could  be without the middle school children screaming in line, but hey. I would have been there too if that place was a couple blocks from my school.
You get what you pay for, pizza is cheap and some people like it, but not me. This place left an aftertaste of straight up onions. I will never get pizza from here ever again.

I LOVE this place! It is two blocks from my school and pizza is nly $1/slice. Depending on who is working it can either be the greatest pizza ever (slightly undercooked doughy deliciousness) or it can be a bit burnt.I just tell them to make sure not to give me a burnt slice. For $1, you cant go wrong.
I visited roll and go yesterday on Canal. For $1 a slice, this was very good.  Much better than 2 bros pizza on 46th.  More sauce and lots of cheese. Very tasty.
Pizza is fine, but they leave the doors open in the winter.  You have to eat with your coat on and it's still FREEZING in there
This pizza is so good it has a 10-star rated I don't Papa John's can't even beat this pizza Pizza Hut can beat this piece and no other places can be this pizza

What more can you say! 99 cent NY Pizza.  A while pie for $8. Evidently each location is different but this one had been great both times.  I got 4 slices the first time because I didn't want to wait for a pie. The second time got a pie.  Wrapped each piece in plastic and ate for lunch. $2 bucks and an air fryer.  Lol

Ordered this on DoorDash when we got back to the hotel late around 3am. For the price and convenience, you certainly can't beat it. It's not the most amazing slice I've had but it certainly wasn't the worst either. It reminds me of IKEA pizza and I like IKEA pizza. So it's solid if you're in a pinch or in a rush, I would get this again.

Dollar pizza shops seems to be everywhere nowadays. It used to just be 2 Bros. But let me tell you something, even amongst the cheap $1 slices there are good, better, and mediocre.

This place sadly stands mediocre. The sauce to bread ratio is off. The cheese ratio is fine. The price, it's a dollar so no comments there.

I was already in the area and by area I mean around 12 NYC street blocks. But in hindsight I probably should have went to another $1 pizza shop.

If you are in the area, hungry and you aren't particular about your $1 slice, this place will do.

Not a fan.
Decent pizza. As of now 7/4/2023 the price is 3$ cheese slice and 8$ for large pizza. Only cash fyi

This was across my hotel and when I landed and checkedin I wanted to eat something after a long flight. The pizza tasted very plain and I should have chosen to walk further to get something else to eat.

8/16/2023. Great pizza for the price. 2 slices and a can of soda is $3. The slices are still $.99 so not sure why people are saying otherwise.
I live in the neighborhood and this was the first time I had this pizza. I would definitely go back.

I was craving a single slice after sipping some suds nearby with buddies. I popped into 99 Cent on a Monday night, and it was pretty dead as expected. I ordered a slice of the only pie they had, a plain cheese. I don't hate a plain cheese by any means, but a pepperoni option would've been much appreciated. Anyways, the slice came out quickly on a paper plate as it should. The napkins were the classic New York razor thin sheets of paper that are good for one wipe of grease out of the beard before disintegrating into the atmosphere. As for the slice, it was crisp with minimal flop and had nice overall flavor. The shop offered oregano and other free seasonings to spruce up your slice. This pizza was definitely a good value. The server was very friendly and gave me a squirt of hand sanitizer on the house. I definitely will be back with my sights on something other than plain cheese.

The best 99 cent I ever spent for anything in years. For
99 cents a slice of pizza which will beat almost any pizza slice sold in my hometown of San Francisco or any slice of pizza only place in the Bay Area. I was shocked that a
99 cent slice which tasted so good existed. Not even 7-11 can offer a cheaper slice. So this place is a great value by quality and quantity.
Pretty good pizza for $2.50. Sausage is packed on and the crust is decent. Not fresh but you can't be picky for only two bucks.

Food (4/5): It's not $.99 cent any more for a cheese pizza and instead it's $1.25 but for the value it's still good. There are other options as well, e.g. Sausage, Pepperoni for higher prices up to $5.

Venue (4/5): Small venue but does the job for you to stand and eat.

Service (5/5): Fast and efficient service.

Tried to scam me.. charges me $12 for a full pie..

It's $8 a pie dummy!!

Something changed.. management??

Today 99cent pizza really tasted like 99cent pizza.. very dry and bad.. bad bad!!

My wife and I visit this place every time we visit nyc.. after today we will no more!! What the hell happened?

I don't care about much about this place over charging me $4 which he admitted.. and refunded back to me after I called him out..

But pizza really tasted like paper..

Sad sad sad!! Buyers be aware!!

Couldn't leave new york without having $0.99 pizza.

I stopped by this specific shop for $0.99 pizza slice. They grabbed a fresh pizza right out of the oven right when I walked in. I decided to just try cheese without adding any additional toppings. They packed the pizza slices in a box, and you can sprinkle pizzas with oregano, salt, pepper, and chili flakes.

The cheese pizza was tasty for the price. The crust was crispy, the ends were a little burnt. There wasn't much tomato sauce but plenty of cheese.

If you're hungry or feeling snacky and have a couple of dollars on you, then this place is for you. They have a combo that includes 2 slices and a drink.

*Cash only.

A nice warm .99 cent slice on a cold winter night is always a good call.

I was walking by on my way to Little Italy to pick up a box of pastries and could not resist dropping in to get a slice. Not a bad pizza, more soft and doughy for my taste as I prefer a crisper bottom on my pizza. Still, pretty tasty overall.

They have a nice deal here too - two slices and a can of soda or water for $2.75. Cheese pie for $8, and a bunch others for only $10. Pretty cheap for a full pie.

Cash only and there is an ATM in here if you want to pay the ridiculous fee. Also, if you don't even have a dollar bill on you for a slice you had better start carrying around a few singles for a pizza emergency!
Really good quality pizza for price, no frills, highly recommend stopping by if you're hungry. There may be a bit of a wait though because it's popular.

You really can't beat a 99¢ slice from this place, it's so good! Perfect cheap drunk food too. The flavors of the sauce aren't cheap tasting and the slices are hot and fresh.  Do yourself a favor and check it out!
pizza was very good and easy to just walk in and get some.  it was not $0.99 which threw me off.  also, very greasy.
Omg!! Take it from a pizza lover....this place is banging. Cheap and the pizza was absolutely delicious.

When ever iam out on canal street .this is my go to pizza shop,you cant beat there prices over there for some quality pizza .usually pizza for this price wouldn't be this good ,there wouldn't be any cheese or sauce on it .but here you get just the right amount of sauce and cheese on it .the pizza isn't hard.it has just the right amount of crunchiness to it and flavor to match .

This place isn't that big at all but when you can get a couple of slices for 2 dollars and change it really  doesn't matter. So now and days when everything is so expensive these pizza shops are rare and if you come across one of them .take advantage of it.It is not ever day you come across good pizza for this price.

i want to know how they're able to make pizza not only- 99 cents but delicious.
there chili flake, garlic powder, hot sauce and other various free garnishes.

For only 99 cents, you can't really complain haha. I've definitely had worse pizza at a higher price. My expectations were exceeded. A greasy slice of cheese and a greasy slice of pepperoni. Flavors were there. Crust was pretty whatever. Did it satisfy my pizza craving? Yes! Will I return, probably not lol

These 99 Cent Fresh Pizza locations are some of the best things about New York City. Even if I am not in the mood for pizza I can't help, but stop into one of the 8 different locations around the city because it is just so alluring. You will find customers from all walks of life coming in and out of these locations. Nobody can resist a slice of 99 cent pizza!

I spent 5 days in NYC and used some of my time to sample as many pizza joints as possible.   My thought was... How can any place make $ at a buck a slice?  Easy... small slice, low quality.
I visited the one on Canal, near 6th.  The place was dirty & the 3 guys behind the counter looked almost mad that I came in for a couple slices. How dare I interrupt their conversation to make a purchase.

Coming from a fresh mouth on our visit I sampled quick slices for a week, and hands down these were the best slices I had on the trip. Nothing fancy, just a slice, not floppy, fresh always, and the staff were always cordial.
This actually slapped at 2am. Place was packed but we were in and out fast. Employees are super nice and attentive
Started selling pizza to the highest bidder. What a shit experience. Do not recommend.
Surprisingly good. For $1 pizza, this location is incredible.  It's simply but tasty.  I got pepperoni so it was $1.50 for the topping but best meal I've had for only spending $3.

Been watching a buncha pizza videos on YouTube. By chance, I came across this place while doing a search. Decided to try during my visit to Chinatown. Place is on Canal St., but closer towards the Holland tunnel. Not bad, decent 2nd to the quintessential ny slice. Take into account, the price, & this place is a solid choice, if in the area. $8 for a whole pie, & $1.75 for a beef patty. Small place, counters on each side, for stand up dining.

Great pizza for a great price. I ordered the mushroom and pineapple pizza and it came up to less than 20 dollars which I was surprised since were in the city as well. Can't beat that price on a budget. The delivery came and the pizza was still hot which I'm also happy about. It was quick as well

Canal has need a dollar slice place since 1999.

I can fuck with this pizza. It's a dollar slice. Just get the dollar slice, the other slices are topping thrown on last minute.

I'll have to admit that I rarely eat at any 99 cent pizza places BUT you definitely get your money's worth. A whole pie goes for $8 which is a little more than 1/3 of typical pizza places nowadays. The price reminds me of my childhood days when pizzas were cheap especially when most places don't have anything special about the pizza.

The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is the pizza crust is too thick like commercialized pizzas that you see on TV. Other than that, the prices are great and the pizza overall is good.
The BEST dollar slice in the city. Can rival any of the top pizza places in NY or anywhere. The plain cheese is fire. Akmed is the man. The topping are all halal and taste good as well!

Cheapest eating option in walking range....

$2.75, two slices of pizza and a can of soda...Good deal....Just don't expect for it to taste awesome...Just ehh when you're on budget.

This joint is new...Pics posted

CASH ONLY!

Awesome Pizza n cheap
Super nice b fun place to chill and eat your food n clean yumyyyyyyy
Super fast and fresh. Walked in and got 2 slices and a coke for 2.75 in about 30 seconds. Ate at the counter, it was the best dollar slice I've had!
Got a plain cheese slice and a Buffalo chicken slice and both were terrible. They were still bad even for the price.

I cannot stress enough how this is the best slice of pizza I've ever had. Walking back home at night and picking up a nice warm slice, it's so delicious I could literally eat it every day. AND it's only 99 cents. Which just beats out all the other pizzas out there.

This is some really solid New York pizza. You don't need toppings (yes, they do have them) because with a good pizza, cheese is all you need. This will be great for the kids while we sit for a half hour in the tunnel!

My go to spot for late night eats.  The guys here are super nice and you can't beat the price.  I typically call in my order 10 minutes before and then swing by to pick it up.  Haven't been disappointed yet. Thanks guys!

The pizza is 99c.

I paid with a dollar and they gave me 1c back.

Would recommend! Exactly as advertised.
By far some of the best pizza I've tried in New York especially for .99 cents. The guys there were welcoming and friendly. We will definitely be back here if we come back to New York. 5 stars!!
Day or night, these guys are a necessary pizza shop. Wishing I had a slice right now with some chili peppers, Parmesan cheese, and hot sauce.

Delicious and fills the bill. I almost think the name is a disservice.. these are some of the better slices in this area, but the name doesn't match the quality. No, it's not bougie... no burrata or farm fresh egg topping here. As advertised,  $0.99 per generous cheese slice.. topping are extra but I wouldn't bother. A solid cheese is the acid test for any pizza joint. Whole pies available too. Seeing these folks so efficiently dish up to the hungry masses late at night at such a value is a marvel.

In every pizza review I say I don't eat pizza... but somehow I have a few pizza reviews. Well in the grand scheme of $1 pizza this is my fave! Do not come here looking for anything more that $1 pizza...taste. It hit the spot when I want a slice and I'm excited that I'm only paying a $1 for in the world of $4 pizza. So the 4 stars are for the $1 pizza world
Happy cheap eatings

It's only 99 cents. In NewYork, it's too difficult to have a cheap thing, these pizza shops are helpful for an entrepreneur or a student like us. This tastes not bad but enough, and we have a lot of memories with my NYC friends. I really miss this pizza :)

It's not a bad pizza for a dollar a slice or 2 slices and a drink for $2.75 (includes tax)

It's not Rays pizza from back in the day and you could be paying $5 a slice elsewhere in NYC for a similar pizza slice.

One thing to note, cash only and they have an ATM in the store.

This is a solid joint. The pizza is better than a chain such as Domino's. I'd rate the pizza a 6.0-6.5 on the Barstool scale depending on the day. Unlike many dollar joints there are copious amounts of cheese and sauce. The sauce is tasty and has flavor, the cheese is of good quality, the only weak point is the crust is on the lower side of average for a pizzeria in Manhattan. It is still a solid crust, but a little thicker and doughier than I prefer. What you can't go wrong on is the price $2.75 for 2 slices and a can of soda. For a slightly better slice you would pay another dollar for a single slice.
   The pizza is a solid 3 stars, but the fast friendly service, the rock bottom price especially for such an expensive area, and the cleanliness of the joint make this a good 5 star stop for late night cheap  eats. Their long hours make it a great place for a city worker working early mornings or overnights.
I stumbled on the 2 slices and a soda for $2.75 deal walking back to the nearby Sheraton after midnight.  Fresh from the oven slices hit the spot.  Excellent QPR and fast service.
It's 99 cents. We had low expectations. Pizza was decent. For 99 cents, heck yes I'd go for another slice if I was hungry and needed something super duper quick!
Wasn't expecting much when I came across this place but it's really good pizza especially for the price. I always stop by when I'm on Canal. It's my favorite dollar pizza place
Great assortment of seafood. Fresh fish and amazing customer service! They get fresh seafood on a daily basis.

What a gem this place is!  Best Dominican restaurant in the area hands-down.

Prices are great too!  Seating is limited, and gets really busy around peak times, so be prepared to grab a number.  Have tried multiple dishes - all have been superb.

Personal favorite is chicharrón de pollo sin huesos, con arroz blanco y habichuelas rojas.  (Translation: boneless crispy fried chicken, white rice and red beans)
I don't know how they make rice and beans and chicken taste so good! They were closing up by the time I got there but the food was still impressive. It was also cost effective at $7 a plate
Food was amazing! arrived in timely fashion, definetly recommend,

We got there when it was closing but they still had food left. We ordered chicken. It was simply delicious and the lima beans went perfectly with the rice. Best of all, the prices were more than reasonable: $7 for each person.

Completely love this place. My wife loves it too! I always pull up in a brand new blue honda accord coupe!! I have never been dissatisfied with the service or food. Best food around! A+++ great job!! I would like to make sure I visit as much as possible for the pernil con gondoles and El mondongo  kid!! A1 the tostones!

Busy busy busy
Rushed service
Know what you want and check the order before you leave. Have some understanding of Bronx style Latin dialects as this will speed up your service. Prices are excellent and food is better then most Cuchifritos.
Morcilla is my go to!!
You can sit and enjoy a true Bronx experience here or sit in your car double parked like I do taking pictures of whoever grabs my attention
Enjoy
Pastele are also excellent

Lived in the Bronx years ago and love this place near Fordham Road.
They have the best take out Puerto Rican Food in the area.I think Ive tried nearly every dish and never had a meal that I didnt like and that wasnt delicious.
The food does have alot of calories but well worth the occassional treat
for the great food they make.
Always visit this place when ever I visit the Fordham Road/188th St area usually during the holidays.
Highly reccommend to all.

When you say mofongo, I say "Go to the Bronx". That's the only way you're going to get this Puerto Rican classic dish. And the tricky thing about mofongo is you have to eat it right away after pouring the gravy on it, otherwise it's just mushy goop.

But enough food facts storytelling. Growing up in the Bronx, I was blessed with the opportunity to have authentic affordable Spanish food: Dominican, Puerto Rican, El Salvador, Columbian and Mexican. This place is your typical neighborhood diner when growing up in the Fordham Bronx area. I would come here after school and get my yuccas, sweet banana plantains and rice and beans combo. The restaurant is in fact small with their stools at the counter dining style. But their takeout service is quick and right to the point. Food is amazing and no other neighborhood in New York City offers Puerto Rican cuisine like here. A must pit stop if you ever visit the Bronx Botanical Gardens.

The ladies here are so boss and sweet as my gal indulged my half slapped together Spanish. She told me I might as well order the cuchifritos plate since I wanted all the parts of the pig head and I said perfect.

Also alcapurria and morcilla. And the morir sonando- which she spent 10 minutes in the back making.

Authentic stewed and fried animal parts topped with picked red onions. A bit heavy on the ear and pliable chewy textures (even for me!) but all in all such a cool
Experience to be had again. It's all locals here.

Ridiculously delicious. Seriously, everything we had here was awesome. The morcilla was light and airy but deeply flavored and rich. The mofongo exploded with garlic and crunch. And the chicharron dominicano and pernil were perfect, just perfect. Such an incredible spot. Walk your food over to nearby St. James park if they're particularly busy, but do try and take a bite of anything fried as quickly as possible.
This place is a great. You will not disappointed when coming here. The only downside is the size it has very limited seating but other than that it's so worth the visit. Oh by the way they stay busy.

Full authentic Puerto Rican and Latin American dishes you can savor every bite .
I highly recommend this place although parking is bad it's worth the wait
Some of the best pernil and mangu I've ever had. Great atmosphere, clean and friendly, old school vibes with hand painted signs. Very reasonable prices and nice seating area. Highly recommend

6.6/10

Chiccharon: a bit dry; very crispy; not particularly fatty, which I prefer

Cuchrifritos: not very visually appealing, but was better than I expected; a very exotic dish, so definitely not for everyone; cooked decently, but very wet (6.3/10)

Rice: average rice (7.0/10)

A decent place for this kind of food, but it just seems they have far too many options and most things have been sitting there for hours or a whole day..

I'm definitely not a Cuchifrito fan. Yeah....I guess I can get by with Cod Fish, Yuca or other Root Vegetable Side dish- but between the steam, meat and pork smells all around, poor ventilation system all Cuchifrito's have- plus me smelling like food after, it's enough for me to seriously keep out. But hubby is Puerto Rican and grew up eating at cuchifritos. He decided on a Lunch pickup for us and eat in the car while we waited for our names to be called to do our taxes.

Really don't know what the place looks like- but hubby went all in for a Morcilla (Blood Sausage), 2 Alcapurrias (made of Green Plantains & Yautia Stuffed W/ Meat then fried- which he liked) and a Bacalaito (Cod Fish Fritter). I just settled on Yuca with Onions. Honestly, I'm so damn picky about Cod Fish Fritters- I can't eat them from just anybody. Plus Puerto Rican and Dominican ways of Cooking and Seasonings- differ quite a bit.

According to hubby, one bite of the Morcilla- threw him off and trashed the entire thing, the Cod Fish Fritter- was just like I imagined and still drenching in oil- ewwww. Yuca? Well...you can't mess up boiled Root Vegetables with Onions in Vinegar and Oil (can you?). Even my Passion Fruit Juice was watered down. Why??? Good try. But nahhh. Hubby hasn't eaten at a cuchifritos in ages and not even sure if he needs to back off from the stuff he grew up on. But listen- other folks love this place and has 4 stars for a reason.
I relly like this place. Cheap and tasty.

My first Anthony Bourdain moment which made me really happy and sad all at the same time .

Environment ;  it was overall what I expected except that it had no AC

Everything was very good especially with a cold beer but it is still nothing like it would be at home or in Puerto Rico . The only true disappointment was that ,  I tried the pastel ( I took this to go) and it was made of chicharron and I mean pieces with skin, fat( big fat chunks ; no pun intended )  and alittle meat ; I have never had it this way and I hope I never do again

This is the real deal. Almost too real. Cuchifritas is an acquired taste not for the faint of heart.

Basically boiled pig parts. Ears, noses and Tongues.

The chicharoni and yellow rice was fantastic.

The coconut drink superb.

Boiled pig parts? Maybe I'm not ready for that just yet.

Best Puerto Rican cuchifrito and all New York State all I can say is they have the seasoning is authentic the food is exactly what I grew up with I am not Puerto Rican but I grew up eating Puerto Rican food and I can honestly tell you that this is authentic the seasoning is to perfection the food the quality of the food is exceptional they are constantly continuously throughout the day bringing fresh food all day long because nothing sits there for not even two minutes so there's always fresh food fresh cuchifrito fresh squeeze juice is from fresh desserts to all types of drinks, So if you're up for some really amazing food freshly made the same day at an unbelievable price you can feed your entire family would like $20 and you'll have trays of food you won't believe it so you must hurry on to have authentic Puerto Rican food at this spot I always come here I want whenever I'm in New York City this is my first stop and I usually buy trays of food so that I can spend the next few days just eating my Puerto Rican cuchifrito's as you can see in my pictures there are many different types of things that I order from rise to our Alcapuria which is a crispy outer made of a route filled with meat those of the diamond looking ones the long shaped ones and then the potato bowls are made with a special seasoning on the outside soft potato inside and amazing meat inside the potato the black beans with basil leaf is a traditional Puerto Rican rice dish also the rotisserie chicken was truly amazing so my advice to anyone is to at least come up wants to come and get some of this really amazing traditional authentic Puerto Rican food you won't regret it and you'll probably find me here because every time I come to New York City this is the first place I come to oh and don't forget best coffee in town! They are following COVID-19 guidelines you must wear your mask to enter the place there is limited amount of people inside you have six people inside limited and then you have to wait in line outside but most of the times I've been there there is no line you can quickly go and get your items the ladies were quick and they're extremely welcome me and friendly customer service gets a five star for me they make you feel like you are part of the family

I went specifically for the chicharron and it didn't disappoint.  My Spanish is not up to speed, but a new "friend" helped me along with a good pic from Yelp!  And, I agree with others - very friendly staff and patrons.  Will definitely try to go back to explore the other offerings, as there appear to be a lot from which to choose.

Thanks!

My friends brought me up to Fordham Bronx one day so i can experience "the hood". We ate at Cuchifrito's. It looks like a dingy place from the outside but it's not that bad inside.

It was busy on a Sunday sometime between lunch and dinner, when most other places would be slowing down. We sat at the counter and our Spanish speaking friend ordered for us. I got rice and beans, a beef empanada, and shared an order of pork chops with my friend. It was really good and they give a lot. They also have a few aguas Frescas.

They're open late because my friends said they'd been here late at night after drinking. And apparently it's a date spot because one of them had brought a date here. It's not a typical first date place but to each their own.

I'd come back and try something else. They have a lot to offer.

This place has been around longer than my own existence. I distinctly remember coming here as a little girl with my parents and to my surprise walking in yesterday, I saw many familiar faces.

We were in the area for a local event yesterday and got hungry.   I have a pretty large family so cheap options are usually the best options.  This place is not only cheap but absolutely delicious, phenomenal in everything that they do. The menu is pretty overwhelming if you don't know what to expect or have an idea of what you want.  I remembered that they make some of the best Mofongo ever. Boy,  that hasn't changed.

Chiccaron de pollo was still on point. Black beans were amazing paired with the yellow rice.  Kids complained the roast chicken was dry and I'd be inclined to agree.  It was hella busy in there and it's like trying to get a bid in to order. It's easy to get confused or even a bit lost, it is The Bronx so a little aggressiveness will take you far in these streets, and this store. The beef stew was a hit.

Cuchifritos were delicious, though, I usually don't recommend them due to the way they sit out day after day. These however, were still fresh. My favorite is the alcapurria y empanadas de pollo.

WILL NOT BE RETURNING!
I traveled over 30 minutes to get what I thought would be good food. Not only did I have to wait 10 minutes but the server took the order of the people behind me knowing I was rightfully there first to then attend to me. I was greeted with an attitude and frustration which caused about $120 to walk out the door as your staff waved me off like a fly. Your staff is the reason a 5+ year guess will no longer come or recommend.

They also allow more than 5 people at a time without mask including the workers serving food. The mask was on the chin.

Wow! Delicious. Tasty rice with beans .. fresh and moist tasty. Had the half chicken, the chicken was moist and slides off the bone.  The Pina colada and Ajonjoli drinks were a fabulous addition to the meal. Please go. A wonderful meal. Clean and the ladies are a delight.  And I didn't feel stuffed which is great. Delicious plentiful and sabor!

I was impressed by 188 Bakery Cuchifritos. Atmosphere is very unique and fun. I have to tell you, their menu is so great, all of the items are really terrific, Cuban Sandwich was my personal favorite. All of the staff are super helpful - you truly feel welcome and taken care of. I will recommend 188 Bakery Cuchifritos to all my friends.

I was out of my comfort zone on this one. My Puerto Rican friend was raving and raving about this place since she used to live out here.

I was a bit unsure of how to go about eating here at first haha. I get social anxiety sometimes... I popped up at the counter and spoke in my rusty Spanish. They understood me well enough. The pernil was slightly dry. It was definitely different than my beloved Mexican food home in CA, but it wasn't bad.

What reaaally got me was morir sonando. I had never even heard of that before. It was amazing. The waitress was really friendly and told me how to make it as well since my friend was asking me.

Nowhere else I got that drink made it as good as here.

Came by for a Latin breakfast. I'm surprised the options in the neighborhood are slim but that's besides the point.

It's a very small restaurant with limited seating. You can either sit at the breakfast bar or at 1 of the 2 coffee tables set up.

It's not glamorous or fancy. It's a spot for cheap Latin food. It's purpose is food, not to please the eye especially with its overwhelming signs on the walls.

If you want to play lotto, there's a guy set up in a booth inside waiting to give you your winning ticket.

Now the food. I ordered, as Dominicans call it, mangu con los tres golpes which is a bed of smashed plantain with fried cheese, fried salami and eggs on top. The smashed plantains (Mangu) was salty. The salami and cheese carried that salt. The eggs had no salt - go figure. I did ask for egg whites which was at no cost. Overall it was a good dish - I almost finished it. Beware, it's incredibly filling.

There's a lot of fountain juice options but they are not freshly juiced. It's sweet water with a frozen packet of flavored lemon, parcha, mango, and more.

Tips: cheap, salty Latin food. Best as take out. Accepts cards.

Happy dining!

I found out about this establishment from my cousin, who lives in upstate NY. I've been there twice already and the food is authentic Latin cuisine. My sister and I ordered the mondongo and morcilla. I will definitely be recommending to family and friends.

Their rice and beans and plantain are always cooked perfectly even though you can tell when it's a different chef. Last year, they handled needing to socially distance pretty well and they're keeping it up now, so I appreciate that.

I'm from San Antonio Texas! And we went to NYC for a family trip... what drew me to 188 Bakery Cuchifrito's  was I seen a documentary with Anthony Bourdain and I had stop and this place! And man let me tell you! When I seen this episode my mouth was watery from the moment they started showing their food!!! Man and it did not disappoint!!! Geez man there is no place like it! That and NYC!!! Loved it! And now I find myself trying to find the sort of same thing here in SAN ANTONE!! No luck! 188 Bakery Cuchifrito's will forever be in my tastebuds and heart!!! Till next time 188th!

My sister wanted to go here since it's a spot where Anthony Bourdain ate. The food was very good but honestly not as good as my local joint, M&K.
