Would have been nice for more veg other than the lettuce. But let me tell you how good the dressing is -- it's a carrot gingery burst of flavor I wouldn't trade for anything and they give you two containers generously.

Edamame (4/5): Well cooked but no salt so this the minus one.

Vegetable Miso Soup (3/5): The blend of vegetables here was fine and the broth is nothing to write home about. Mostly lettuce (why?), some broccoli and carrot plus tofu chunks.

Spinach and Tofu Soup (4/5): This soup is exactly what it promises to be. The clear broth is tasty but plain -- which I guess this should be. The spinach and tofu are exactly what you would expect. Checks the box.

TL;DR: While this place doesn't have soups or edamame I would rave over, the rolls and fish (in the rolls and salad) are my new all time favorites in NY. 100% on the repeat list.

Every neighborhood needs a really good, reliable, basic Japanese place and 251 Ginza absolutely fits the bill. It's been around for many years but I only discovered it about a month ago. I'm not really a sushi eater so I've focused on the cooked dishes and they're all terrific. The lunch bento box is one of the best deals in town. Something as simple as miso soup can, at many places, taste like dish water. Not here. Delicious with lots of seaweed. The teriyaki and don buri and tempura - all excellent. Don't know why it took me so long to get there but I'm sooooo glad I did!

Wow new fav delivery spot. Fresh fish and good miso soup. I got 2 roll lunch special (shrimp tempura & salmon avocado) and 1 spicy scallop hand roll. The rolls were very good, good portions on the fillings.  But the spicy scallop was AMAZING. I am definitely going to save this store for my delivery sushi.  Too bad I didn't take a picture of the food.

Fresh fish, ripe avo, and the sauces were good too (eel sauce and spicy mayo)

It's a little home in the wall that has been there for many years. I order the lunch specials usual consisting of a few rolls with sushi or miso soup. The food is delicious and as I expect my sushi to be fresh and tasty. Their noodle soups are good as well in a cold winter day!
What a gem. Perfectly fresh sushi, prepared with great care.  Without a doubt, my favorite restaurant in Murray Hill.  And the  people who work there are so nice.

This is for delivery orders.

For two days in a row, they delivered my order within 10-15 minutes of placing it. Granted I am only 11 streets away, but the turnaround time is still impressive. Their rolls are pretty stuffed too. I wouldn't get the nigiri here as the white fish and salmon piece i had tasted kinda fishy. Other than that, it's a great spot to order some rolls for lunch or dinner.
I live in the area and this is my favorite sushi spot. Takeout/delivery only. Quality and taste is always superb!

This place is just down the street from my apt so I find myself wandering in here from time to time. I'd say this is a GREAT place to order take out. Always fresh, the prices are great, and the food is plentiful.

On the eat-in side it can be a challenge. This place is TINY. It has 3 bar seats and two 2-person tables. So 7 seats total. During lunch they are usually rushing to fill take-out orders so you will be sitting around a lot of bags and with the delivery folks popping in and out of the door every few minutes. But the food is delicious and they have lunch specials so its worth it.

Had a really poor experience the first time I ordered here on seamless, but decided to give it a second shot today for lunch (Thursday).

I went with the 3 roll + 3 piece sushi lunch combo that also comes with miso soup. The rolls and sushi were awesome and fresh! I went with spicy tuna, yellowtail scallion, and salmon avo. The rolls were neatly packed unlike last time and they are tasted great...no suspect tuna :) For the 3 pieces of sushi I ordered eel, white tuna, and octopus. I like the eel and white tuna; however, the octopus was rubbery so I wouldn't get that one again.

Would definitely try it again here for lunch!
The sushi tastes chewy and there was something inside of it (maybe from a hairnet?). Definitely wouldn't recommend.

Their salmon avocado, yellowtail scallion, & eel cucumber combo was really fresh. I noticed the superior eel sauce had some sorta wine-y effervescence to it.

The shrimp mango salad was ok, wouldn't get it again.

Best thing here besides their eel rolls are the fresh mild and grainy bright green wasabi granules. Yes I approve.
Ginza is my favorite takeout sushi spot in Murray Hill. Food is fresh, ready quickly and friendly service. Highly recommend for takeout if you're in the area

I've ordered delivery from ginza sushi multiple times before and dealt with the rude and obnoxious delivery guy cz the food was food but this time there was PLASTIC in the beef negimaki bento box. The beef was overcooked and there was a hole in the container as well.
NEVER ordering from them again!!!!

The fish with the sushi literally tasted and smelled like it's been sitting in a refrigerator for a whole day without electricity. I literally had one bite and threw everything out. Such a waste of money! Won't be ordering again

A small place but don't underestimate it!! This is the perfect place for a quick sushi lunch. Best to go by yourself or with one other person. There are only two tables and some seating at the sushi bar. Service is prompt and staff is nice. They have a lunch special which is reasonably priced. I usually get the 3 roll sushi lunch special with a salad. Love the sushi. Rice to fish ratio is on point but the best part is that it tastes fresh. Have been here about 5 times, definitely my go-to sushi place in the area.
I always love the roll combos here. They're so good! I got the combo with eel, salmon avocado, and yellowtail and also got a spicy tuna on the side.
Pretty good lunch bento boxes - usually get the chicken katsu. Sushi lunch special is also great. Takeout only. Fast service and the lady at the front is super nice.

This is our go-to spot in the neighborhood anytime we want a bento box. You can't beat the deal for the lunch specials either. $12 for a lunch special bento box which includes salad, miso soup, spring roll, gyoza, rice, entree, and California roll. As I'm not the biggest California roll fan, I love that they give the option to swap that for another maki roll for an extra dollar or two. Shrimp and veggie tempura bento box (pictured)  is my usual order if I'm not getting sushi or sashimi. Staff is friendly as well.
Best sushi in all of NYC... super fresh fish and friendly staff.  Awesome lunch specials

Great place for a takeout. Started ordering here about once a week a few months ago and have always been satisfied with the quality. Spicy scallop roll is very good! Wish the shared dishes (like sushi & sashimi for 2) were slightly larger but otherwise no complaints!

Phenomenal sushi place. I was distracted by the size of the place, but that didn't matter once I got my first roll, it was amazing. The proportions were really good, not too much rice, the rice was fluffy and delicious, the fish was so fresh and super tasty.

Had to order more rolls and also some nigiri and a hand roll too, all were excellent. Great service and highly recommended!

This is a small sushi restaurant, which takes online orders. The sushi is very good and is fresh. They have sushi pizza!!! The sushi pizza consists of tuna, salmon, seaweed salad on a scallion pancake with spicy mayo. It was delicious and enough to share among two people. I also had a salmon avocado roll. You can select the style for each roll, maki, inside out or hand roll. I opted for the hand roll. You might get slightly less with the hand roll, but it's so much more fun to eat.

Would definitely order from here again. Foot arrive promptly, portions were great, and there was so much flavour!! We got the ginza special roll, avocado roll, spicy salmon roll and the eel avocado roll. All portions were great, it tasted very fresh and flavourful. We also got the miso soup which arrived hot and was super tasty. And lastly, oh my goodness their calamari! It was so fresh and tasty! Didn't love the sauce it came with so we're glad we ordered a spicy Mayo too. Would definitely order from here again!!!

This place sells average sushi at best, I don't know why the rave of this place. We came to this place, well-knowing that this is a simple take away place, but I dismissed the prejudice that a mere takeaway couldn't do good sushi, but there I had my prejudice proven.

Actually, the sushi wasn't that bad, but it could have been better, but the woman serving us (not the young one, but the older lady) was quite rude and not hospitable at all. It made me regret my decision that we should have gone to the more-known sushi place instead. There you go, now I've learned my lesson.

It's a tiny restaurant with a handful of seats (as is common in Japan) that are currently blocked off due to COVID. I got four rolls (salmon avocado, eel cucumber, yellowtail, and spicy tuna) and a miso soup to go. (That's roughly equivalent to one of their combos, but the lady told me the combo has less fish which is why it's cheaper.) Everything was delicious and on point, much better quality than the average sushi place. Even the wakame in the miso soup was better than usual, thick and with good texture. o_O (I never paid attention to that before.) I haven't tried anything else on their menu, but for sushi I can definitely recommend 251 Ginza if you're in the area. I would certainly go back.

I've decided that this is my favorite takeout sushi in the neighborhood.. They're a little bit pricier, but you always get really fresh fish, big salad portions & they have the best brown rice.

I order on seamless and they usually beat the delivery time!

I highly recommend it here. :)

Love Ginza! I live around the corner and they deliver in 10 minutes max... everytime. It's insane! The sushi is fresh, I've never had a bad order. I usually get the spicy white tuna (the best hands down) and then some veggie rolls. Perfect for when I'm craving sushi!

Order food here for the first time and also the last time.
The food was ok, the rice is so hard to eat that I have to make my own rice and also the wasabi was fake. Like they use some powder paste to make it. The only reason I order here is because of the rating on yelp and the rating on seamless. What a disappointment!
We live right on 35th street. We order from here often. (Tip: Call in your order. Don't use Seamless). Good solid sushi, fast delivery and friendly service.

Although a tiny bit on the pricier side, the food never disappoints! The salmon is always fresh and great quality and I like that you can watch them cut the fish right in front of you so you know what you're getting.

My favorite go to dinner spot especially on those crazy work days! I usually get their sushi pizza, california roll and shrimp tempura sushi and it suffices for two. Their portions are pretty decent and the flavors are spot on. Love their fast delivery too! I could go on..

I attempted to find a replacement for Aji Sushi where the food is crappy and the service is rude and abrupt.

Here's how it went: I have been to this place many times...and it's getting progressively worse. They have two tables and a tiny bar. The first time, we had okay service and it seemed cute.

The next time the service was a little crusty. And it's rude to have ongoing conversation especially in another language that sounds like it could be negative conversation about the customers. (Business conversation is understandable to expedite order, etc--but, this is ongoing social conversation in front of...or behind the back of... customers.)

The next time I went, there was an employee with his head down sleeping at the table next to us...the whole time...and in the window too, so completely visible to people walking by -- potential customers...

The last time, the two tables were already in use by employees. The woman serving us is fairly impatient and rude, although she ignores you when she's talking on the phone (socially). She also wears a big puffer winter coat while serving you -- which is gross bc she dips her coat right over and basically into your food. There's a heater blowing hot air into your face--the lady in the coat should turn it on herself and wear appropriate attire.

If you weren't sure if they cared, they will make it abundantly clear that they really don't.

That said, the food isn't bad. I will do take-out from now on--or hopefully find a new place.
Got the lunch roll! Super yummy! There was a mix up with my order and they were so kind to come back to my apartment with the correct roll. Really appreciated that!
Ginza is really good sushi for a great price. The delivery is always very fast and consistent. We enjoy ordering from here

My new favorite sushi place in Midtown Manhattan! Ordered Miso soup, a California roll plus a few rolls. Delivery was very fast - the soup was as hot as if it were being served table side.  the sushi was fresh. Also, the prices at Ginza Sushi are very reasonable & the portion size is decent. Will definitely return!

First time eating here...recommended by a friend. Was a little skeptical due to the size of the space. But the service and food was up to par. Very nice host/waiter. Best day to come is from Mon- Wednesday. Lunch specials are great

I'm not quite sure whether it is because of the fact that delivery order in general underperforms, or I'm simply not at a good mood for fish, I did not quite enjoy my sushi box. Both the tuna rolls and the miso soup complementary were lack of flavor! Portion size was huge though, as I could only finish half of my box and already left pretty stuffed. The steamed broccoli with teriyaki sauce was at an OK level; however I would be really surprised if they mess up with a steamed dish.

Delivery speed was quite fast nevertheless.

***Delivery Review only***

Great delivery service. Food was delicious. Highly recommend for delivery service!

This is the best sushi in NYC, hands down.

If Momofuku and Sugarfish had a sushi baby, and Morimoto and Sushi Yasuda had a sushi baby, and those sushi babies were groomed from birth in the art of sushi and eventually had their own prodigy sushi baby that grew up and bought a small space in Murray Hill to just make sushi with ingredients so fresh that skeptics believe it to be dark magic, this would be it.

I am both ashamed and proud at how many times I have gotten sushi from Ginza over the past few years, and I will never stop. Ginza for life. FIVE STARS.

References available upon request - I have conducted research with friends and family and created a sample size that indicates within acceptable standard deviation that my claim is true.

I have order multiple times from this place for lunch and thought they were okay. Until today a Chinese delivery person offended me.

Today I ordered lunch as usual, received the call and came downstairs but could not see the delivery guy, so I called him to ask where he was(building has 2 lobbies) The Delivery person CURSED ME OUT  (f your mom) in Chinese while i asked him repeatedly where he was. regardless of what I asked about his location(are you in the lobby, are you inside or outside) he just said park ave south. And finally I saw him outside smoking with his bike, not even in the lobby. He then proceeded to give me attitudes and looks, handed me the food and left.

Although the order and the food were correct, the incident left a bad feeling in my stomach and I should never order from them again.

The sushi here is ok. It's super cheap, especially if you are ordering lunch specials. Their miso soup on the other hand is awesome if you are feeling under the weather or just enjoy it.

Their delivery service is very prompt.

Great for lunch in midtown during the workday.

Excellent Korean food! Try the kimchi, rice cakes, and dumplings. Delicious and thoughtfully made Korean food, with an elderly Korean couple running the deli.

Highly recommend

Sadly, I simply can not return.
I have been ripped off countless number of times, and disappointed beyond the price tag.

The woman is nice, her husband is bumbling, and the deli is slowly sinking.

It's unfortunate that it's so unsatisfactory
But I cannot waste another dollar here again.  Unless it's for flowers or snacks maybe, but I will never order again.

I've given them far too many chances

The food is delicious. Service is great. Very clean.
Also despite their young appearance the owners are a little older so sometimes they might have trouble hearing you so please be respectful and patient. The food is prepped from scratch so depending on your order it might take a little extra time but overall totally worth it.

This is a hidden gym for authentic delicoius Korean food. Me and a friend went after watching a movie. Two orders of Bi-bim-baps took 20 minutes as she made them from scratch. She then gave us some free radish kimchi as a side. Very nice woman, and great food that is reasonably priced. I would gladly go again.

They have an awning that says  "39 K FOOD ORGANIC DELI AND KIMCHI" (see left top of the page here)  Yet they have absolutely nothing on their menu that is organic.  I can't think of any other establishment has no clue whatsoever as to what "organic" means

This corner deli shop was a nice find during my recent trip to  New York. I was staying at pod 39 and this shop was my walkable breakfast destination from Pod.

The egg and cheese sandwiches were delicious. Customize them to your liking. I used to ask them to add some hot sauce and green chillies for some extra kick.

CHARGED ME $6 FOR A $3.50 BACON EGG AND CHEESE
i said "so you're charging me three bucks for two pieces a wheat toast?" and they tried to say i asked for two eggs, so on top of completely STEALING FROM THEIR CUSTOMERS THEY CALL THEM LIARS

and on top of everything else tey didn't even give saltpepperkatsup

DONT EVER GO HERE

IT IS AN ABSOLUTE DUMP..go to RiteNow on 38th between 5th and Madison.

Today I was verbally abused by one of the clerks. I have been a customer for years, spending considerable money. I stepped in front of a line to ask if they have postage stamps. I got yelled and screamed at but the bums who frequent the store and harass customers are treated like gold.

Crime in Murray Hill has gone way up and the bums congregate at this dump.

The place is also very expensive.  Sure it's convenient but I will walk extra blocks to go somewhere else.

The owner and clerks are nasty towards women.

I visited today and purchased 2 eggs over easy, double sausage (patties) and American cheese on a plate (solo/high & dry ... no potatoes or bread). Food was decent but nothing to write home about. Cost at $6.99 plus sales tax was about average for the area.

The good: One of the few delis in the area that's open on Sunday.

The bad: Store is cluttered and not appealing to visit.

The ugly: Plastic utensils look to be the smallest and lowest quality available! So small they look like they came from a children's play set! So small it's difficult to cut the sausage and eggs!

Due to high rent, space is maximized.  He has everything in here.  CANADA DRY in at least 6 flavors.  Twinning tea to Fancy brands in a tin.  Somehow my SCHWEPPES GINGER ALE is not as cold as it should be.  Nice man automatically gave me a straw.
The date on the milk I purchased was 3 days from date purchased but it was rancid and a cookie sold in a package was stale and old. Stay away from this place unless you want to get sick.

I don't know why I gave this 3 stars 3 years ago but I like them.  Maybe because it can be pricey and depending who makes you the sandwich they may overcharge.

Good options
Lots going on here
Nice Asian lady always gives me a banana in the morning because I'm obviously tired and don't take care of myself.

Lately the food has been terrible, the chicken cutlet hero was burn and the fries was over fry and hard...and the cook was rude..i was a big spender at this place but NO MORE...i am looking for some where else.....

From the outside it's quite unassuming, but inside I was surprised by the variety of hot and cold foods. Despite that, I was really insulted by the customer service.

I ordered my sandwich and got a small side of a few sliced tomatoes, lettuce, and TWO pieces of broccoli from another tray (full disclosure here). I realized that this isn't quite what I wanted. Instead of leaving it by the food area, I decided to go to the cashier and let her know that I would no longer like these and apologized.

She spoke very rudely and laid out my many sins: "I mixed up the items, the food is wasted, and now we will have to throw it out, there's nothing we can do with this food". ....do you really need to read me the riot act for a few cold veggies? Sheesh it's not like a took out a platter of chicken and rice.

If you think I broke your stores rules, by all means correct me. But there is a way you convey your information to customers. Whether or not a customer is in the wrong, berating them is not the right tactic. Honestly, this joint is no great shakes and my sandwich was bland. Keep the attitude in check...

This place is great if you want a variety of options for lunch. My coworker and I have stopped by a couple times now in the past week, and we've enjoyed both of our food.

There's a huge assortment of hot and cold food. A huge variety of salads and pasta salads, wings, beef, shrimp, onion rings, pasta, fruit, too many to name.

Beware, the charge by weight and it's easy for things to add up! Too many good options.

Card minimum is $8.

The food is pretty tasty, maybe a little too tasty (hello, MSG!) ....if health-conscious like me -then I suggest sticking to the salad buffet side. The cooked food contains lots of oil which you can see, especially when you let it cool.
As far as the food in general, it's pretty good as I said, but let's not take away the shitty attitudes that I get from the cashiers upon paying....

....I go here almost everyday since I work across the street, and nevertheless I get attitudes thrown at me left and right, -this isn't the first time it happens...

I am a PAYING CUSTOMER. I get that it's stressful throughout lunch time, but leave the attitudes and the underneath your breath grunting along with huffing and puffing when asked for things like "May I have extra ketchup" or showing my work ID for a 10% discount.

Lately I stay away from this place but if I need a quick meal with variety then I'd definitely go there since there's a good selection of food. It's why I have rated three stars and not two.

Leave the shitty attitudes at home ladies!

As noted in the other reviews, this is a good one-stop shopping spot for basic grocery needs, coffee, deli, and decent hot/cold buffet offerings.  Prices are reasonable, but some of the grocery items carry a premium over other grocers like Morton William and Food Emporium.

For breakfast, bacon, egg, and cheddar (I always request cheddar over American) sandwich and coffee can be had for $4.50.  Most places charge extra for the sliced cheddar, but they toss it in for free here.  Definitely a nice plus for the breakfast sandwich-goer.

Nestled right on the corner of second avenue steps from 42nd street, their location makes it a good stop in my morning commute, and I recommend to anyone else situated locally.

Pros:
- Open until very late
- Convenient. Reminds me of the bodegas in Spanish Harlem where they sell misc catch-all household stuff.

Cons:
- Options and quality of salad bar is below average. Also overpriced at $8.99/lb.
- On two occasions, bought refrigerated food that turned out to be spoiled when I got home. I let it go the first time (seaweed salad). Second time it happened (cantaloupe chunks), I called to let them know only to be told "Sorry, can't help you." Waste of money and poor phone customer service.

Nothing special in my opinion but I have had pretty good breakfast from them. I like the fact eggs are cooked to order but the bacon could be more crispy. I believe with a little more care and seasoning it would elevate their food.

Avoid this place at all costs--if you're used to buying things quickly and painlessly with your CC or with Apple Pay or if you don't remember your PIN- AVOID THIS PLACE. The florist (male, in his 50s) was incredibly rude. He insisted that my credit card had a pin number even when it does not and kept pressing me to put in my pin number. Do not buy flowers from them; overpriced and the service is horrible.

A good little go-to spot for a quick bite or sundries.  Nice selection at the deli counter and good selection of hot food and salad items.  I have stayed near here a couple of times and it's a good place to grab a decent lunch and take back to the hotel room when working in the middle of the day.

This week I picked up a Turkey Roll and a salad (by the lb) that was mostly fruit, berries, and melon.  Also grabbed 2 soda's a cup of ice (50 cents).  total came to about $12.

Sandwiches are not Carnegie Deli quality, but good enough.  and the fruit/berries were nice and fresh.

This is my go-to lunch spot. You either get from the buffet or a sandwich. The buffet switches up it's selections every day and the food is not bad. I'm pretty sure all these buffets get the food from the same places, it seems they all have similar tastes.

This place is highly recommended. It is pricey, so whatever you don't NEVER add Mashed Potatoes to your buffet box, weighs too much and it'll make you pay a fortune.

Good food selection and the price is not so bad. The food tasted great. I wish the surroundings were a bit more organized. They had empty pans out on the ledge of the buffet just sitting there.

Otherwise, great find!

DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE. Highly RACIST establishment. The workers and owner were RUDE AND RACIST to my group for no reason. Rushed us out because we were BLACK. Was threatened to have the police called on us because we wanted to sit in the dining area. Terrible group of people.
They received a "C" sanitation rating which was promptly removed from the window. Raw salad bar. Not a good match.

This is your typical deli in Manhattan. A bit on the pricier side, but they do have a great buffet lunch at $6.99/lb. As you enter, there's the cold foods, mix your own salad, cut fruits, jello, sushi, and LOTS more. Then as you go further in there's the hot foods, pasta, rice, noodles, dumplings, vegetables, fish, chicken, ribs, and all that good stuff. You'll also find soups, burgers, sandwiches, bagels, coffee, desserts, etc. What's really great is that they also have. All I can say is that they have A LOT of choices. Fresh fruits here are expensive. They do sell a nice variety of flowers too.

I really like how they make their pastas, nice light taste, a bit of oil, and the right texture and chewiness. Their mix vegetables are really great, cooked to the right softness. Steamed dumplings are just awesome. They know how to cook food. However, their chicken noodle soup is a bit oily and salty, but I think that's just how it usually is and they use spaghetti noodles. They have French bread cut and individually wrapped on the side, do remember to pick one up. Awesome breakfast, lunch, and dinner spot. I did see a sign that said 24 hours.

I think it's a good spot. I usually go for the salad bar for dinner, as it's close to my apartment. The selection is very good and it's fresh late in the day when I go. The cashiers are very nice. I had seen some signs indicating that the building may be for sale but I don't see them any more. I hope it sticks around. Good spot for the neighborhood.
The staff is extremely rude and everything is insanely overpriced. My friends and I have all boycotted this place. If I could give it 0 stars I would

I would give them no stars if possible,I was there a day before the lady was rude,I went back today and one almost bit me up for putting a chicken wing back!I don't see that with the white clients ..very troubling and disgusting!

Is there just one centralized gigantic hot buffet bar manufacturing plant that supplies all of Manhattan's hot buffets with food? I think so.

765 is great because of its location and consistent offerings. .5 additional stars because they make a good sandwich. Minus .5 stars because of their unimaginative name, iIts based on their address (said in Publizity voice)

So if you're hungry and in a 1 block radius of 2nd and 41st, hit it up.

Matt

This is the worst place for lunch or any meal. I wouldn't even buy a canned soda from these rude obnoxious a**holes! I've been here many times since I work across the street it's really convienent but the service every time I've been here is terrible!! This food is mediocre if that but the (dare i say) ladies that work the counter are rude and nasty!! They say nasty things about everyone in Korean and smile in on your face. And the attitude seems to be common in this place the guys that work the food counter are always rude and then they talk about in Spanish under their breathe.  I will never step foot in this place again and I wouldn't suggest anyone else to either!

The food is good. The price is average for the city. If you go early in the morning the guy at the register barely speaks English and gives me a hard time about needing a spoon for yogurt. Also I get the same thing every morning and the price is always different. Soon as the girls get there it's better but they seem rude at times.

I used to work in midtown east and this was my go-to lunch spot.  Great hot/cold food bar.  The food is fresh and there's a wide selection of items to choose from.  Be careful..it's easy to pile on too much, especially since you're probably there on an empty stomach.  The shrimp and ravioli pasta dish they have has to be one of my favorites food items in NYC.

There is some casual seating space in the back, a big help and rare for deli's in that area.
Very extensive range and amazing fresh salad bar! Could easily eat here for lunch everyday without getting bored of the menu!

Worst deli experience ever. I buy the paper to read on the train or a breakfast sandwich when I'm a bit hungover at this deli but today: I walked out. I grabbed a coffee at Starbucks and headed over to grab a lunch sandwich. At first, it seemed like there was no one behind the sandwich area so I went up to the girl at the counter to ask her about it.

She says, "oh he's back there sitting down," and proceeds to call him. "Chris! There's a customer waiting." I walk over to him so he can take my order and make me a delicious sandwich. No such luck, he completely ignored the girl and me. She called him again, "Chris there's a customer waiting for you. She's right behind you." Again, nothing but silence and him ignoring us both. I didn't even see him try to look back at me.

I walked toward the exit as I was clearly not going to get a sandwich from him. The girl apologized on the way out. Honestly there's kool bloo, subway, and another deli down the street (Anita's?) so it's not me you need to apologize to. I'm going to get my sandwich, just not from you. There are clearly bigger issues in the business if the guy who is supposed to be making sandwiches isn't doing his job. The business is going to lose a lot of money this way. Not just when he's working but people that aren't going to come back. Their food isn't so much better that I'd be willing to put up with not getting service.

As for me, I will not be coming back. Ever.
I always Grab a sandwich here before going back home to NH. Best Sanwiches I have ever Had. Ever. If there was a place like this back home I would go for breakfast,lunch, and dinner.

The buffet is excellent and it's far enough east that escapes the midtown madness plus unlike most of the buffets in the area they refresh the food through out the day so if you can't get to lunch till 2:30 don't worry there is still plenty of fresh food.  I Seriously Love this place but  unfortunately since the call themselves Produce Corp and not deli or buffet probably no one will ever read this review... but if you do stumble across it do yourself a favor and check it out.

I used to come here once a week for a bacon egg and cheese on a roll for $2.50.  Then one morning i came in and they charged me $4.50, even though the sign did not change and we did not get anything extra! WHAT A RIP OFF. Never again will I set foot in this place.  SHADYYY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  When I asked why this was, I was told they have always been $3.50, even though I had gone in just a few days before and got one for $2.50 and then on top of that they said since it was after 11:00am (it was 11:20am) it was ONE DOLLAR EXTRA!! SHADY SHADY SHADY PEOPLE! DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR BUSINESS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Love this place.  I work next door and I'm here basically every day for good food at decent prices.  The man who makes the sandwiches is certainly quiet, but he's never been rude, and is in fact very friendly from my experience!  I hate to see any bad reviews for this place because I've had nothing but great experiences.  I've tried every panini they offer and have liked all of them.  It's a deli so it's deli food--nothing spectacular, but exactly what I need to get me through lunch.  Love the whole crew working here!

Great spot for ppl who like to waste time and money and eat disappointing food. They took 20 mins to make 3 sandwiches. Of those sandwiches, two were made incorrectly. Not sure how they blatantly mess up an order when someone literally stands in front of them and tells them what to put in a sandwich.

I wanted to give this place a fair chance despite the negative reviews on the net.  Went down the narrow aisle and placed my order for a breakfast order.

The man behind the counter barely acknowledged me and took my order but that in itself wasn't a problem. Slow as molasses pouring out  thick clumpy looking egg mixture from a container then decided to take the order from
Someone who standing behind me and starts to make her sandwiches even before getting my eggs started.  I waited and waited while he is making half dozen sandwiches while my eggs are still in a bowl on the counter in front of him.  No apology, no acknowledgement that I was waiting.

Rude. I have a rule never to eat food made by negative people.  

Never again

This place has served as a beacon in the COVID pandemic. Solid sandwiches. Decent prices. Yeah, the guy making sandwiches isn't super friendly, but whatever. He gets the order right and builds you what you want. At the end of the day, that matters most to me.

Horrible customer service from the deli department. The Mexican man is so disgusting when you tell him to do something extra or correct a mistake he made on a sandwich. Wish the owner would realize that, pricing is good. But customer service HORRIBLE.

I have been waiting for this deli to open up near the 72nd St Q station.  I went by to grab a menu and the prices are very reasonable.  I ordered two egg sandwiches.  The person working the grill was helpful and quick with my order, while assisting two other customers.  Solid bacon egg and cheese breakfast sandwiches. Will be going back.

Great menu.  Delicious broiler chickens and sides.  They also have a wide selection for sandwiches and breakfast deals.  I come here every Saturday for my bagels.  Very reasonable prices and the cooks are the owners and really nice.

Ordered a bunch of sandwiches and an omelet from this place via Postmates and had a pretty bad experience. We asked for several of the sandwiches with "no mayo/dressing please" and all came slathered with mayo and dressing. I think this should be a pretty standard/easy request to accommodate. The omelet was also extremely small (like one egg's worth). Disappointed in the poor service. IMO, nothing gourmet about this place.

BEWARE!!!! Terrible listeners! Only care about your $$$

I am a hard worker and needed something to get my day started so I decided to order a spicy omelette and home fries ($9.50 don't think it's worth the price I could've made a better one at home myself with love) and I specifically asked for Hot sauce! Did not receive any hot sauce. How hard is it to put hot sauce in my bag? They could've even put it on top of the omelette for crying out loud! Plus the lady at the cash register was very rude to me! The managers always raise the price here and it's so not worth it! If I'm paying $10 for an omelette you can at least throw in a couple of hot sauces for me. Now I have to go out of my way to find Tabasco sauce while I'm on a time crunch!!! Please do better!!!!! Nasty service, careless and forgetful! Don't know if I'll ever come back here again. It is absurd.

Asked for a bacon egg and cheese salt pepper ketchup on a toasted bagel. A NYC staple. The order came out pretty quickly (not toasted). I asked if they put salt pepper and ketchup. The owner said no you can do that yourself. That's ridiculous. He threw a salt packed in the bag, no pepper or ketchup. I'll never come here again especially with york grill & juice bar around the corner.

72nd Street Gourmet Deli was a great find at the right time for a second cup of coffee. I wanted fast and cheap. I love the old building it's in and it's next to the 72nd Street Subway Station. I saw it from across the street as I was walking. The outside seating caught my attention as well as the beautiful old building.

When I entered I was the only customer. I was my usual happy to be there self. There's an older man and a younger one working today. Perfect so you don't have the employee preparing food also running the register. They both were so nice smiling as they were coming up to me. I said I liked the outside seating and thought it was a perfect morning to sit outside with a coffee. My small coffee was $1.25 and it was really good!

While I was sitting outside customers came and went. This appears to be a busy place early Sunday morning. I could imagine how busy it gets during the workweek when commuters exit the train station. Many customers I saw today came out of the train station. I'm recommending you get there early. It's a narrow space to line up to order and for check out at the register. Enjoy.....
A good experience and yummy Fresh deli sandwiches. They have a nice selection of sodas, ice cream, candy, etc. I'd definitely go back.

Buffet has a good selection of hot and cold salads , melons , avocado , tuna  bfast , sausages , not to expensive  
try it
I'm so happy this market opened in the neighborhood. We've needed an easy in and out but upscale deli that has everything you need. And the muffins are fantastic. I'll definitely be back.

Always a great experience when grabbing a bite to eat and a hot coffee. Bagels and sandwiches are bomb. Had the hot food once... everything was good but the chicken wings were phenomenal. The workers are busy but show a lot of patience and care. 5 stars and I will make sure to come again :)

Excellent deli with fast efficient service. I come here for a bacon egg and cheddar on a roll and it never disappoints. Ample crispy bacon makes it perfection. The coffee is not at all bitter and they have a wide assortment of foods in their  life much buffet that look delicious. Check it out!  Worth the walk if you are at Ny Presbyterian Hospital!

I've visited this deli a few times, It's decent
But at this point I am beyond pissed !!! I came here today and ordered a sandwich on a roll with honey turkey,honey mustard, lettuce, tomatoes and mayonnaise
I told the guy who makes the sandwiches LOUD AND CLEAR NO ONIONS ! And what does he do ? He slaps tons of red onions onto my sandwich and I didn't notice until I arrived to work !!! He's done this before the first time I ordered a sandwich with him !! It was a simple instruction that he clearly could have listened to !!!  I will be going back tomorrow and demanding my money back !!
IF YOU ORDER A SANDWICH HERE PLEASE CHECK IT AT THE REGISTER

Omg. Today was actually my first time eating at this deli. As soon as I walked in, I smelled all the different aromas from the hot food which looked delicious by the way. Too bad I'm not really a fan of buffet style served foods. I ordered an omelette with spinach, peppers and onions with pepper jack cheese and crispy, well done bacon on a roll. I know! Sounds like a lot haha, but it was delicious! When I pulled the sandwich apart, the cheese was perfectly melted! I ate it on my car ride to Zara and was completely silent! Lol, that's how you know food is good. Would definitely recommend and have all intentions on coming back!

Back when I last went, for a pastrami sandwich and a kneidl soup, I would have given it five stars. I had a few more things on the menu this time, all of which were very, very good, but not always as exceptional.

I'd give 5 stars for the free pickles, coleslaw, and egg cream, and for the potato knish. Mushroom barley soup was also excellent.

Less impressive were the baked turkey (nothing special, although to be fair, it's not a classic deli item), cured tongue (very nice flavor but on the dry side, and without the characteristic chewy texture), and baked knish (I ordered kasha but think I got spinach, and it was too open-faced). But still very good.

Still probably the best place in Manhattan for classic deli food!

"Like the worst sex you ever had"

- Is there any reason to go out to eat if you don't get service?!??  So annoying when it just isn't there.
-The sandwich -- their specialist, "hot pastrami" was like a limp d***. Bread was mushy.  Coleslaw was meh.

- Coffee was watery and tasteless

- Greetings from the host and waiter were far from
Enthusiastic.
- Food was dropped off like Laundry and the waiter decided go disappear again for a half an hour without checking on me or asking to refill coffee.
- super overpriced sandwich - $29

Other than that this place is fantastic

Light as a cloud matzo balls in a perfectly serviceable chicken broth. The derma was amazingly rich and unctuous in an almost smoky brown gravy. The wait staff was attentive and went above and beyond. When we said we were sharing everything family style, he had the kitchen split things onto multiple plates. Complimentary mini "blue and white" cookies after our entrees. Such a nice touch. I really, really wanted to give 5 stars, but.....

The pastrami sandwich. Oy. The flagship of any Jewish deli is the pastrami sandwich, and this one had problems. First of all, pastrami has to be cooked long enough to render the fat into tender, succulent, melt in your mouth amazingness. Katz's are the masters of this. At 2nd Ave, the fat was just chewy gristle. The taste was lacking as well. No flavor imparted from brining the meat, no peppery punch from the rub crust. Carnegie Deli (RIP) knew how to make a great tasting pastrami. This was just...bland.

In summary, great atmosphere, awesome derma, super friendly staff. But, shonda, skip the pastrami.

I was feeling a soup and sandwich today and I thought, ok, I'll splurge and order 2nd Ave Deli on Door Dash. It was a bit expensive but sooooo worth it. I ordered soup and half a sandwich-Matzo ball and Pastrami. I felt I needed a bit of veggies so I got a side of coleslaw too. My food arrived hot and included all the condiments, plus a small bag with two pieces of challah. The soup was a tiny bit salty but enjoyable, in fact, I only ate part of it. The matzo ball was fluffy and perfect. My half Pastrami sandwich was absolutely delicious. I love pepper but sometimes many delis will go overboard with crusting the Pastrami with too much pepper. It was the perfect amount of pepper and the rye bread held up and didn't become soggy. Of course I had my favorite pickles, crunchy new pickles. The coleslaw was good but I felt it needed a little more seasoning. Overall, I was very happy with my order and I will definitely have to stop by there and bring home food for dinner sometime.

Order was a delivery thru seamless. For close to $50 I expected generous sizes and received a dried out cake, over peppered kasha a much smaller than usual knish. 2 tiny pickles for $1 each. Matzoh ball soup was as expected and tasted fine. Not too salty.
Did I know the prices before hand? Yes. Did I willingly over pay for it? Yes. But the servings and quality of the food was not worth the over~priced price. This is 100% price gauging. No plan on ordering from here again. Disappointing.

Was surprised to again see low scores for such an iconic NY restaurant.  Has to be top 3 for an authentic corned beef or pastrami on rye in the city. I'm a bigger fan of the location in lower Manhattan over this spot though. The staff here are as salty as the meats! Not sure why, but anyone around the host/hostess station could care less about you.  Seem really put out doing anything.

Matzoh Ball Soup and half a Pastrami sandwich from 2nd Avenue Deli on the UES. This is one of my favorite Jewish delis. My favorite personally is Katz. 2nd Ave Deli is so iconic and has been around for over 60 years. Amazing food!

Went to the 2nd Ave. Deli on 75th and First Avenue, thinking that it might have some of the cache of its namesake originally on the lower east side, and now on 33rd street.
Took a friend from Cleveland to give her the experience and taste of a genuine  New York Deli.  What a disappointment!  We were greeted by a gruff guy pointing to a table and saying "sit there!"
It took a while to order, and a while to get the food.  When it finally came,  the waiter literally threw it on the table and walked away without saying a word.  The pastami was good (it should be when you pay $26.00 for a sandwich), the kasha was saved by the sauce you had to pour over it to make it edible.  The waiter disappeared and I had to walk up to the cashier to ask for mustard.  The apple strudel dessert was dry as dust.  Over all, a fairly unpleasant experience.

Stuffed derma (kishka) had no "derma" at all, just two big, shapeless glops of unidentified mush.  Corned beef sandwich was just a rolled ball of fatty corned beef with a piece of bread balanced atop it.  If they care so little about the food they serve, it's no wonder it's mostly empty.

Classic local Jewish deli that lives up to the hype. I had the pastrami platter with Israeli salad and french fries, and that was a perfect amount of food for two people to share. The pickles and health salad when you sit down and the chocolate seltzer when you finish the meal are nice touches. If you want an authentic deli experience in NYC this is a much more pleasant and laid-back experience compared to Katz's. One small request- I wish they had GF sandwich bread.
The place was clean. Prices are crazy expensive. Food was good. The service was slow.
Excellent matzo ball soup. Almost as good as my mom's; but just what my family and needed when we came down with respiratory infections.

On our last trip to NYC, my boyfriend insisted we stop by a deli or two because I hadn't eaten at a new york deli before and he knew I would love it. He was right!

My favorite thing we got was the meat platter - specifically the brisket! Their brisket is so flavorful and tender. We also had Katz Deli on this trip but I have to say that 2nd Ave's brisket wins! The sandwiches are good but as a meat-eater, I think I prefer the platters where you get more flavor of the meat as opposed to just a mix of flavors and sauce and bread. Also, the sandwich #3 was just alright - the tongue was too thin in my opinion and corned beef was great, but the soft salami wasn't very flavorful and quite baloney-like.

Their pate appetizer was really good though! I'd definitely get it again. Pricing was pretty expensive, but overall it was worth trying! I'd definitely come back again for the brisket! Will have to order less next time though because our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and we ordered way too much for two people!
Came here to see if they have cold cuts and they are so expensive, for example $45 per lb of turkey. The menu says $11 something but that's for 1/4 lb if you read closely.

Came to New York back in July and we stopped by here on our way to our hotel.  I was starving and was looking forward to a yummy authentic kosher meal.  This place was adorable and everything I expected a kosher New York deli to look like.  I had a matzo ball soup, chopped liver(mmmmm), and a pastrami sandwich.  All were very delicious.  They also gave us sauerkraut and pickles to pair with our food.  Next time I am back in New York I will definitely eat here.

I ordered a corn beef sandwich, lean,. It came with so much fat that it was inedible, and I had to throw it out. The restaurant would not provide a refund a credit, or send another sandwich. They were incredibly nasty.

Best in the city. The picture is of the #4 triple decker, with hot pastrami and hot corned beef on the bottom and thin-sliced salami on the top; it was outstanding. Love the matzo ball soup (with or without added kreplach) and classic hot pastrami as well. Service is great; complimentary slaw, pickles, and challah with your order (challah comes with soup), and a mini egg cream at the end of the meal. Expensive but worth it, and justified by the meat actually being kosher -- Katz's is cheaper because it isn't kosher, folks. Don't forget the cel-ray!

Sadly, this place has gone downhill.  The managers Sherwin and Joe are not decent people.  I had an expensive takeout order -- well over $100.  When I arrived with it at my destination, it turned out that the restaurant had failed to include important items of the order.  When I called to bring this to their attention (on two occasions), the response was, in effect, tough luck.  They said their policy is to say "sorry," but do nothing more.  In my view, this is not the right way to treat any customer, much less a longtime customer.  The founder of this restaurant, Abe Lebewohl,, would be appalled by the behavior of those currently running it.

We were 5 people for lunch and they would not seat us until all were present. Two in our party were stuck in traffic on a miserable rainy day in NY. They insisted that we wait. Needless to say we left. Very disappointed and will never go back.

We were at John Jay Park a few blocks away for an event and it felt like destiny had brought us to 2nd Ave Deli, which my brother had just been recommending to us not even 24 hours prior to our visit!

I'm embarrassed to say I am not very familiar with delis (this was my first time ever having pastrami!) so I was a bit overwhelmed by the options and decided to try a bit of a few things with a 3 Decker #4: hot pastrami, corned beef, and soft salami, with cole slaw and Russian dressing, to split with my partner. While I took in the thoughtful little decor touches, the guy behind the counter gave us generous tastes of each of the meats as he was slicing for our sandwich. This little gesture really endeared us to 2nd Ave Deli, so we felt really lucky to have stopped by when they weren't too busy and able to treat us to bites of deli meat while we eagerly waited.

It's an expensive sandwich but it is a hefty one too! Sine we're still not dining indoors, we went right back to John Jay Park to dig into our respective sandwich halves. The bites of meat fresh off the slicer were already so juicy and tender and delicious, and they were great stacked high in the sandwich with the addition of cole slaw and Russian dressing and mustard, with bites of half sour and sour pickles in between.

Definitely stop by if you're looking for a big sandwich and are a fan of delis! This location is particularly great if you like enjoying your meal in the park.

I was walking by and caught a glimpse of a table in the window, of all men, who looked like best friends, having what looked like the time of their lives.

Their energy is what made me go in. They reminded me of my Grandpa and his friends.

I ordered food to go and have to say, it was incredibly delicious. Nothing like a kosher frank and a matzah ball soup. They even threw in a poppy seed hamantaschen, and it was yummy. I really like the cookie part of it, good recipe!

Food was great and portions were xL. Service was spotty at its best with continued dirty silverware and glassware, we did have to ask for our drinks 3 times. We tried a little of everything and shared family style. By far the best was the hot pastrami sandwich.

If you order take out, ask to see a full menu with the prices. I thought I was doing them a favor by not ordering on seamless but nope, it's actually MORE to order in person than on an app.

28 dollars for a quart of soup. This place is on my hard NEVER AGAIN list.
Brisket unidentifiable as such. Pastrami too stringy to even attempt chewing. As a regular at tenth street,l wanted them to succeed here.  Sorry.

Ok. Vegetarianism went out the window. Had matza ball soup and a half of a pastrami sandwich on rye. They really hit the spot. The waitress was lovely. Please be patient as with Covid all restaurants are short staffed, our service was pretty quick, however.
The soup & salad combo was very filling. My dining art nerd liked their burger & fries, and turkey sandwich.
Can't wait to return!

Let's begin by saying that I don't believe everything I read. However, this time, the positive reviews did not fail me! We walked in, and the gentleman that greeted us was very polite. Immediately upon seating,  the bus girl brought us a carafe of iced water with lemon, four pickles, and the most yummy cole slaw.
I knew I  wanted to order the hot pastrami sandwich and the matzoh ball soup. However, my man Sol, an awesome and good-looking server, suggested the potato latke, which was just as delicious as the other two items. I have to admit that I was having a moment while putting the delicious,  moist, fresh, juicy, and tasty sandwich in my mouth.  The sandwich is a bit pricey, but between the excellent service and tastefulness of the food, it is worth every penny! We will definitely return so please have a table waiting for us Mr. Sol!
Disappointing! The food was mediocre (had a pastrami omelette and chicken breast sandwich). All dry and mediocre. Knish was good.

Second Ave Deli used to be my favorite Jewish deli in NY
What a disappointment now. How could it change so much ?
I can compare because I have ordered the same meal there for the last 15 years whenever I come to the city .
The pastrami , which used to be lean and firm to the bite is now thin , fatty ,soggy .
The potato salad is excessively creamy , no taste, with small pieces of potatoes instead of sliced potatoes
Even the bread changed , not to mention the service .
Very disappointed , last time I eat here , I must find another deli em NY

Placed order for delivery at 7:15pm on Thursday evening. Simple order; Hot dog, fries, macaroni salad, potato kanish and a pickle. It took over an hour for them to prepare the order. Delivery driver arrived at deli and still had to wait 15 minutes. Food finally arrived at 9pm - cold and flavorless.

My husband stopped and picked up a tongue sandwich on our way into Massachusetts. When we went to eat it we both took a bite and looked at each other. First of all we had ordered tongue on rye and it came on wheat. The tongue had absolutely no flavor and it was pure white, the picture doesn't do it justice. It tasted like we were eating pure fat! When I called the manager he wouldn't do anything to take care of the problem such as replace or refund the sandwich. This will be our last trip to 2nd Avenue Deli.
Very disappointing. Fatty pastrami on a small white bread for $27.

I randomly went here on a whim when my mom was visiting. I always like to take her to new different places. I had heard about 2nd Ave Deli before but I was pleasantly surprised when it lived up to its reputation!! The potato pancakes were God's gift to earth. We also split  Matzoh Ball Soup and a chopped liver sandwich. I don't even really like liver (mom's choice) and I've been craving that sandwich.

What's happened to the 2nd Ave deli?  No sour pickles!  We were told by our waiter " we don't have sour pickles anymore only half sour". Pastrami Turkey, we were told by our waiter " we don't have that anymore". Both things still on the menu which is false advertising !  Corn beef sandwich served cold!! Horrible!  This place used to be great. Nasty waiter.  Lousy service.
We used to love this place. So sad!!

We lunched here on a weekday and thought the food was put together well. We ordered the pastrami sandwich, which came with dill pickle, cucumber, and cole slaw, and the potato pancakes with apple sauce. Everything was delicious and we enjoyed our meal. I have to agree with another's assessment, though, in that charging $25 for a sandwich is unreasonable no matter how established a restaurant is. A pastrami sandwich only has two ingredients: meat and rye bread (mustard on the side, if you count that), so the price is hard to justify.
Excellent and ample brisket sandwich for lunch. Wait time after order taken was a bit long but with plenty of delicious pickles and slaw, who cared!

A friend recommended the 2nd Avenue Deli so we went without doing any research on yelp or even looking at the menu. Big mistake. Once we sat and looked at the menu we walked out. The prices are astronomical! I cannot understand how they can get away with charging $25 for a lunch sandwich. Make it a platter for $8 more ... not sure what the platter entails but 33 for lunch seems like a lot!

Prices are outa whack. It's ok to be expensive and have big servings and be a legend. But, the prices are out of what, the servings no longer iconic, but what kills me is the toppings.......a thirty dollar sandwich should not have a dollar or more upcharge on common veggies......that's over reaching.

Went for lunch place was empty and the nasty waitress sat 2 fat pigs behind us, they had to move the table so they could fit in and they still keep bumping the my chair. Reading the reviews they won't be open much longee

I had never been there but heard good things.  I was longing for a Corned Beef sandwich which was excellent.  Tasty, juicy and little fat.

My disappointment was with their knishes.  I took home two with me.  One was kasha and the other was potato.  They were so salty that I could not eat them and threw them out.  Don't they understand excessive salt is bad for you and does not let you taste the main ingredient of the item.  A waste of money and they were not cheap.  I do not recommend buying them.

It very much pains me to write this review because the 2nd Ave Deli is an icon.  It is so sad how poorly they now regard their customers!  The food has gotten so much more expensive and like everywhere the size of the meals have decreased and the quality has not improved.  Still good, but not excellent by any means.
The experience a couple of weeks ago cemented my sadness for what used to be a great establishment.  I simply asked for a couple of extra pickles with my sandwich.  I think they were about to give them to me when the manager literally flew over the counter and said NO!  Not only NO, but emphatically NO, with the caveat that she was not allowed to give me extra pickles and her hands were tied.  Remember this is the manager and this is a Kosher Deli that throws out (I hope) more pickles than I will eat in my lifetime.  I have never dealt with such a rude individual who should not be allowed to deal with customers.  Unfortunately, I was so shocked that I became ruder than I should have.  No excuses, but I just asked for a couple of pickles.  SHOCKED at her reply!
I then called the store on 33rd to voice my concerns.  I was told I would need to speak to Leslie, but she was not available and she would call me back.  I am steal waiting.
Very, very sad . . .  Especially from a place where Abe vowed to never let a customer leave hungry!

Jewish Penicillin = Best Matzoh Ball Soup Ever!  I haven't stoped talking about 2nd Ave Deli.  On a cold wintry night, not wanting to go far, I was in search of a deli in the UES.  Well, 2nd Ave Deli (which is now on 1st Ave) was recommended.  My, this is where you'll find me from now on for soup, chicken liver, and their complimentary chocolate shot at the end.  Amazing was the service.  Lively yet cozy and unpretentious ambience.  No more, no less. Times with me, myself, and, I.  This is perfect!

CHEERS!

Unfortunately this place has really gone downhill. I ordered a half corned beef sandwich extra lean. It was about 25% fat and also cut with the grain and so was very stringy and hard to eat. In addition they charged an additional $3 for this! Won't be going back any time soon.
Was craving a pastrami sandwich for a while. Was very disappointed when I received it. After spending almost $30, I threw it away. ugh!!  All fat. I will never eat here again!!

My favorite NYC Deli, the food is absolutely delicious and portions huge! The service is fantastic, shout out to Max!

My friend ordered her usual meat platter, half pastrami, half brisket. It would never have occurred to me to order that, but next time I'm there, it's exactly what I will get, except all pastrami. OMG, the flavor! It literally melted in your mouth. Dip it in 2nd Ave Deli's signature mustard and it's perfection on a plate.

For my meal I ordered a tuna salad sandwich and then realized, there is no way I could finish an entire sandwich. Max actually heard me saying this and came back to our table to see if I wanted to change my order to a half sandwich and a bowl of matzo ball soup. Why, yes, I would! Much better choice.

The soup arrived with carrots, egg noodles and a ginormous matzo ball. Max then poured the delicious golden chicken broth over the contents and I dug in. So satisfying, comfort food at its best! Served with sweet, soft Challah bread, it could be the entire meal.

The tuna salad was delicious, white tuna flaked very thin with mayo and celery. Served on rye with lettuce, tomato and red onion, a half sandwich was plenty!

We left no room for desert but did enjoy the shots of chocolate egg creme that came with our check. Wish I had bought some Rugelach and Kugel pudding to take home. It is prepackaged and lines the deli counter.  Next time for sure!

Prices are high but food is so delicious it's worth it! Btw, the 2nd Ave Deli is located on 1st Ave.

It's funny to go to the 2nd Avenue deli uptown  on 1st Ave. My son wanted a hot dog and this was the best place to go to! I ended up with mushroom barley soup because I just couldn't fathom spending $23 on a pastrami sandwich. That is highway robbery. Our server was very nice and brought us pickles (sour and half) and a certain kind of slaw (it had carrots in it). The people
who frequent the place are very friendly as well.

The service at 2nd Ave Deli is insanely good. Constantly checking in, making sure we got our coffee and water. Our waitress even warmed up my dad's soup after it was sitting for a bit. The matzoh ball soup is authentic and the pastrami is classic. Truly a magical place if you want to embrace your Jewish genes.

Classic Jewish deli with a really cozy  in the upper east side. Went on a Saturday at 10 am and they let me and my friends dine and hang out for 2.5 hours which was nice.

That said,
- the prices are ridiculous. It's minimum $20 for a dish, one can definitely find better bang for your buck elsewhere.
- Food was good though expensive.
- I got the corned beef hash, and the portion was tiny. For $20+ I was expecting a mountain of corned beef hash and had to poke around to see if there were even any potatoes in there
- Overall go for ambience and vibe, the portions are small and this place is expensive. The staff was attentive and very kind so I give this place 3 stars instead of 2.

If you have a hankering for a Pastrami or corned beef sandwich, this is the place to go.  The sandwiches are piled high, the meats melt in your mouth, and the flavoring is outstanding.  What else can you ask for ?  A sour pickle and good service?  They have that too.

I will be honest they just made my day, I ordered yesterday from pastrami Queen cause I was craving some pastrami sandwich but was dissatisfied, so thought trying from 2nd Ave deli today which was a good decision, presentation of sandwich was excellent better meat portion en pastrami Queen

This was one of the best lox bagels I've ever had! I usually get a lox bagel on the go so this was a unique experience being able to enjoy an entire lox bagel platter. I really liked that they gave us such generous ingredients to add to the bagel as we wanted. I was able to put the perfect amount of cream cheese and toppings for me. The fruits and veggies were so fresh as well. The salmon was also very fresh and flavorful. I'd definitely recommend this place for any lox bagel lovers such as myself. The service was also great and I loved the atmosphere of the place. Highly recommend!

service was fast and pleasant, cashier by the name of Barbara was very courteous with attending to my needs at the sushi bar. you guys should have more vegetarian rolls other than that food is great .
I know it's the Upper East Side, but considering the sushi is pre-packaged, it should not cost as much as it does. This is a good grab-and-go spot but only if you are truly craving sushi.

Good to have a sushi focused place nearby which specializes in grab and go type meals.
It's a small shop but has most of the items you would expect.

It's slightly expensive and my eternal dilemma is that one $10 pack of rolls doesn't fill me up, but spending $22-$24 if I get 2 packs seems excessive just for lunch.

This is a new branch of Butterfield Market on the same street, a few buildings down. It only has sushi and dumplings that is pre-made in a set that you pickup and pay at the counter. It's a small shop. No seatings. Great for picking up something quick to eat. Sushi tastes fresh, especially for pre-packed sushi. Satisfies the craving. Would definitely go again.

Not horrible but also not great. Quality is okay. What do you expect from a take-out sushi spot? Take note that the rice will be a bit cold because it is kept in the fridge. There are a lot of choices to choose from. The Tuna Poke Bowl (Donburi) was well seasoned - not overpowering. There were pieces of jalapeño (or green peppers) that had a nice crunch to it.
The poke bowls didn't live up to the average poke bowl expectations. Honestly, it was just sushi in a bowl. The actual sushi is good though.

Ordered delivery and it came within 10 mins which is nice but a bit concerning how fast that is since it doesn't seem like enough time to prepare the food. But in any case I got the chicken meatball platter and the meat balls were very flavorful and had a nice texture. It came with brown rice and broccoli too which made for a nice simple meal. Then I made the mistake of ordering the fruit salad...salad was covered in this sickly thick syrup that left a film around all the fruit. Had 2 bites and had to throw the rest out. The reason I really have to take down marks was this simple takeout came out to $25. That's absolutely insane. This place only stays open I suspect due to all the corporate lawyers and bankers in the area ordering off the company seamless otherwise it's waaay too expensive

Definitely overpriced for what you get. I got a salad with hard boiled potato, bourbon shrimp, and egg via seamless. Also, a side order of avocado. It came  up to over $20. I wouldn't even complain if the ingredients were top notch. But the potato was gross. oily, leftover home fries. Mixed with onions and other crap. Boiled potato is boiled potato. It was so oily and disgusting. The shrimp was too oily too. I guess they add tons of oil to days old ingredients. Should never market itself as a healthy place. Never again.

I was a little concerned before I went when I saw there were no reviews for this place, however it was previously called "Dardanel Mediterranean & Seafood" and recently has been renovated so I couldn't find anything about them!

I'm so glad we decided to eat here -- it was amazing!

The restaurant is pretty small. The front portion is pretty narrow and you have to walk nearly halfway through the place to get to the "hostess stand,  but it opens up in the back.  Regardless, I thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance. It's rustic, with wooden tables, chairs and leather booths.

Our dinner was awesome! The fresh bread was absolutely amazing, the food was fresh, and hot out of the oven. Per the recommendation of our very attractive waiter, we ordered the zucchini pancakes, shrimp caprese, hummus, and crispy feta.

So yummy! The only caveat is to ask for FRESH bread! Our first loaf was straight from the oven and it was so soft and tasty. The next one had been sitting out and it was not very good :(

Those 4 tapas (plus unlimited bread) was $30.00 + tip.

I'll definitely be back if I'm in the neighborhood!

I order 1 Bite for lunch at least once weekly. The shepherd salad is still one of my all-time favorite Turkish dishes, but most recently I opted for the eggplant salad, and it did not disappoint. Delivery is great for me because it's super quick, and they offer a few little one-bite add-ons like yogurt, some sort of eggplant tomato sauce, and a gelatin dessert with an almond in the middle. Yum.

It was called Dardanel before...Just read the previous reviews on this restaurant and you will understand....I do not recommend this place. I have to say that the service was good but the owner  was extremely violent  with one of his customers that day. He started to scream at her for no reasons. Everyone got scared. I will never go there again. Also, I am very sensitive to the decoration and cleanliness and I can tell that this guy prefer to go for cheap than quality... Attention to details hasn't been made and for this reason it is not a good restaurant.

Once our food arrived, everything was fine... but leading up to that moment we weren't really sure what we were in for.  The place was empty when we walked in.  We were told we couldn't order from the set lunch special menu because we were sitting in and not taking away.  Okay fine, but we were a bit miffed because the sit down menu was way more expensive than the take away menu.  I can't fault the food when it arrived though.  It was quite good.  I'll go back, but probably do takeaway next time.
Food was decent, but delivery very slow. Quoted 20-35 minutes and took an hour.
A very good local Turkish place.  Good, healthy food at good prices, and good service to boot.  Try the chargrilled spicy lamb platter for $9.50 or the grilled bronzini for around $19.

Just ordered the organic tofu grill.   It's great!   took close to an hour for delivery (versus 20-35 estimate), but so many restaurants run late, so not a big deal at all.   Delivery man was in the lobby when he called.  Will definitely order again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Tried this place for the first time.  I ordered it for delivery and the food was here within 20 minutes.  It was hot and fresh.  The food itself was very very good!  They even put in little mini candy desserts which were yummy!!  Can't wait to eat here again.  Highly recommend it.

I used to love this place - and some things are still excellent - i love the lamb adana wrap.  But, I always feel ripped off at the Shepherd Salad.  the past few times I've ordered the veggies haven't been fresh, and it tastes like the salad has been sitting around for three days.  Decent food, but definitely has gone down hill somewhat in the past few months.
The food is very good but the delivery and customer service is beyond lacking.  Delivery is always late and on more than one occassion the order was completely wrong.

I think the name of this restaurant fits it to the tee.  1 bite of the food is all one can really manage.  Actually, the food was just average, maybe below average when comparing to other great Mediterranean places in NYC.  But the owner or manager was a complete douchbag, rude as hell.  That's the reason why I would not be coming back and will advise my friends and the yelp community as well.

My Husband and I had dinner here approximately 8 months ago when it was Dardanel, the food was good, they served the entrees with grilled vegetables, rice, and some other shared sides.  The portions were perfect: one entree=one person.  Wait staff was attentive, but not overly fast.  I also would order their lunch special through Seamless - a nice lunch for $10 + tip.  Fast forward 8 months, a friend and I decided to go for lunch since it was good, healthy food, at a good price.  It has not been renovated, but the name and menu has changed.  All food is a la carte, lunch can easily top $20 for the same combination that I previously had for dinner for $13.50.  Quality was good, but quantity was lacking.  It was far from crowded and I can see why.  Also, the food took a very long time, considering we were the only customers for most of the time.  Considering that there are many other great restaurants in the area, I probably will not be back (unfortunately).

Owner is very rude. Restaurant was empty and he would not accommodate a request to make an item on the takeout menu. Told us to leave and lost our business. Terrible service!!  Do not go here! Will be out of business. Staff had attitudes and lost only customers in their restaurant. Many better places in the city.

Just ordered from here and I was very satisfied.  I wasn't very hungry so I just ordered cheese rolls and fries.  The cheese rolls were yummy and if I had a plate of them in front of me I'd probably devour the entire thing.  I'd want something like that if I was hosting a party.  The fries were a little soggy.  I'm a crunchy fries kinda girl but fries are fries. I won't ridicule them on their fries since today was a rainy day and with the heat from the food they may have turned soggy on their own.  I thought it was super cute that they gave me complimentary turkish delight.  It was the cutest thing and made me smile.  I think it was because when I ordered (I ordered on the phone) the guy asked if it was my first time ordering from them.  Regardless of the reason, it was well appreciated (and quite yummy!) and shows that they care about complete customer satisfaction.  All in all, I will be ordering from them again, hopefully when I've got a bigger appetite so I can get some of their food food.  But I'm sure I'll be getting cheese rolls on the side ;)

I am on a diet and went on Seamless hoping for a good salad...I ordered from 1 Bite Mediterranean and I am sooooooo beyond happy with my choice!! I had ordered an arugula salad with salmon, and instead got an arugula salad with delicious grilled salmon, dry apricots and fig slices, tomatoes, and sunflower seeds. The dressing was kept on the side, despite not ordering it this way, and a got a wonderfully large, and tempting piece of bread. The order came 10 minutes earlier than I had requested.  The salad dressing is light and perfect!! I am very happy and will definitely be ordering from here again (through seamless). Great lunch!!

i got the tapilia.  I was starving so practically inhaled the food. The sauce they gave with the fish was pretty spicy.  Unfortunately the fish itself didn't taste that fresh.  The rice and vegetable sides were yummy though.
Sultan's delight!  delicious!  eggplant puree  had a nice soft flavor and it complimented the great flavor of the lamb stew!.  Im a super fan!
Ordered the Challah bread French toast, this is not Challah bread... it's thick cut white bread.   DON'T ADVERTISE WHAT YOU DON'T SERVE!

Don't waste your money.  I ordered a simple egg sandwich w/bacon on an english muffin.  My request was on an english muffin not on rocks.  I would not serve this sandwich to an animal.  The english muffin was burnt and hard as though it were 2 days old.  The bacon too was disgusting and day oldish looking.  It's a shame a restaurant would serve something like this.  I'll never visit this place again and I advise everyone else to do the same!!!!!
There is no excuse for a dirty restaurant. People can get food poisoning.

This is the same as the palace house.

The cutlery was sticky, the table was sticky. So hygiene wise, not clean

Ordered house fries thinking its French fries turned out to be fried potato with veggies. It's an okay order but I asked for it to be replaced with French fries  

Chocolate chip Pancakes were burnt

Food is great. A huge hot plate or rice and meat and a banana for $10.

As guy below wrote the condiments are great, various salsas and hot sauces.

I walked in at noon for a bacon egg and cheese and was rudely told they don't serve them during lunch. Then, to my horror, I look behind the counter to find an employee lifting a mouse trap with 2 squirming mice! This place is disgusting and needs to be shut down!

I agree with the other reviewers that the gentleman behind the counter (presumably the owner) is not the friendliest but certainly not overly rude.  The place is near my office and every time I walk by during breakfast or lunch - there is usually lots of construction workers in line.  That is good sign!  The hot food bar is pretty damn good -- I've had baked chicken, pork chops and chicharron (fried pork belly) and it's as good as any Dominican/Caribbean restaurant place on the Lower East side.  I recommend the pork chops and baked chicken though - the fried pork belly while tasty was a tad tough.  The servings are enough for two meals.  Highly recommend if you are in the area and want a good reasonably priced hot meal.

TL;DR = yeah he's not super cuddly but you're not going here for the white glove service - just some amazing Latin food at incredible bang-for-the-buck (especially in midtown).

==== LONGER REVIEW BELOW ====
The sparse and mostly crappy ratings for this place is a Yelp anomaly / travesty.

Usually people figure out the good places and tend to write good reviews. This one is shocking to me.

Allow me to start at the beginning. I work about a block away but between Park and Madison. I thought my options were the Madison Ave ones (there's very little on Park itself other than food trucks and Pret)...

One day I finally got tired of those and ventured towards Lex, and I noticed every construction worker hanging around this tiny deli next to a barber shop.

If you know nothing else, you should know that construction guys always know where the best bang for the buck is.

When you walk in it looks like any other deli (and their deli stuff is solid indeed) but there's a corner with rice and beans, pasta, and few latino dishes - these are the real gems!

Depending on the day you may find some version of Carne Guisada (potato or not)... Pollo al Horno, usually some cooked fish dish, etc etc.

You pick your base (rice/beans or pasta) and top it with one of the above. And then they pass your plate over to the condiment station. The food is great but this is what puts it over the top! Condiment station has Salad, Pico de Gallo, Salsa verde (thick and heavy, like a runny guac), and Salsa Rioja that will make your scalp sweat (I kid you not, I can handle heat but this red sauce is quite something).

Back to the deli side - for a while I was getting the crispy chicken cutlet - delicious and fresh, as a wrap. One day I tried the above "Spanish" food section and never looked back.

So I thought I had this secret, and then I kept noticing more and more of the same silver trays at the office. And when I asked everyone would say "the place with the construction guys". Some would refer to it as the "Mexican place" and I know the food isn't Mexican.
