Now, back to the rudeness. The guy loves to bust b@lls like a typical New Yorker. He won't take credit cards (but has an ATM Machine there) - and he INSISTS on giving you a banana even if you don't want one...

But MAN - the food here is knockout.

One day I thought there was some chicken cutlet, I asked the guy serving the hot food in the corner and he said "it's Fried Fish" - and before I could even say anything he breaks me off a small piece.

I WAS HOOKED!!! Bad.

At least once a week I get this combo of Fried Fish with guac, green sauce, and red sauce over a bed of rice and beans. For $10 (I'm pretty sure he charges the construction workers less :) - this blows away a lot of the lunches you can get around here.

And then it hit me. Rents are cheaper as we you get further east of 5th Ave... everything just made more sense. This is one of the best deals in midtown.

Amazing place. The owner is so friendly and fun if you're nice when you come in. He'll give you recommendations, let you try things, and all of his food is great. We came for sandwiches but went back for the platters that we saw everyone else getting, and have been hearing the breakfast is good too

First time in NY and looking for the best places to eat and stumbled upon this gem in the rough with mike behind the counter giving samples and suggestions with great chipotle sandwich and many other options like Cuban and breakfast even. The only place I've been to twice in my week stay here.
Overpriced. The owner is very rude as well. I do not plan on going back. Also, they will only take cash. Luckily there is a reasonably priced deli right around the corner that'll take credit cards.

This place is great. Their sandwiches are well priced compared to many of the sub-par lunch spots around midtown east. The fresh Spanish food is amazing and the portions are enormous.

The owner has always been incredibly nice and is always letting patrons try different foods before ordering.

Best part -- free banana with your meal!
This is my favorite breakfast place to stop before work. Small family owned place. Always fresh and always delicious. Super fast service.

Even though I live across the street I promised myself to avoid this place. Yes it is a family run business. But I can't decide which member of the family wins the rudeness contest. One other thing is that although they aren't a cash only business, their credit card POS machine is broken several days of the week, something you learn about only when you're checking out. The construction across the street must be the only thing keeping this place in business.

Literally so good any time any day.

Open super late so great for a late night thing!

I worked all day into the evening and stopped by my local bar before going home to have dinner, sadly I didn't make it before the kitchen was closed. However, I stayed and had a couple of beers, and by that time, I was starving. So, I pulled out my trusty Yelp app and looked to see what was close and open- not too many places, but I saw 7th Street Burger and decided it would have to suffice.

I ordered my burger on their app, finished my beer, and strolled down Second Avenue to the restaurant. I was surprised as to how busy it was. I waited a few minutes and then they called my name, I grabbed my bag and walked to my apartment a block away.

Upon opening my bag, I found a juicy and delicious cheeseburger and fries, which I happily wolfed down. It was delicious and just what I needed.

Funny, I have walked by this location a hundred times but never went there. I am glad I did now, and I will definitely go back, especially late nights!

First time trying this place after hearing so much about it and it did not disappoint!! The beef is really juicy and freshly made. The bun is nice and soft and buttered. Service was also super quick for a weekend afternoon though we did some before the rush.

There are no tables, but you can eat off to the side or outside at the tall tables.

If I were to be picky and critique, I would like more pickles in my burger!! Definitely would be back and happy I got the double patty.

Not everything is great but their burger is something special.  I ordered the double cheese burger here. The burgers tastes a bit of homemade with a special kick to it.  It's juicy with the onions and soft bun, I'm in love.   The fries were a disappointment as there was nothing special the fast food restaurants actually makes better fries.  I'm not too sure about paying $3.50 for a Mexican coke as well. The Mexicans use cane sugar instead of the American version using high fructose corn syrup but paying more for a tiny bottle isn't worth it.  I'm a Diet Coke fan anyway which I'll run to the deli across the street for a more than double the size bottle for less next time.
I'll still give this place 5 stars because of how special their burgers are.   Next time I'm just ordering only the double cheeseburgers.

Went to 7th street for a quick lunch after seeing the MET museum which was fun and efficient. This is a super casual spot with fast service and no chairs so better to take it to go or eat outside!

We ended up ordering the cheeseburger - I like how the meat is thin and the cheese adds yummy cheesiness. The bun was super soft and I liked that the burger wasn't too heavy. We also got a side of fries and sauce which completed the meal perfectly.

Overall good burger!
What a delicious smash burger! The fries were very crispy and seasoned well. Love their special sauce. Very affordable prices.

Delicious and affordable burger in the heart of the city! I went here after stopping by the museum of
Natural history after hearing great things about this spot on Yelp. Upon entry, the vibe is cool and calm, old school hip hop was playing and there was a wood, open space aesthetic. I got a burger with the onion pickles and homemade sauce with a side of fries. YUM! The flavor reminded me of shake shack. It was a flatter patty on a potato bun with lots of diced onion and a decent amount of pickle... honestly reminded me of in and out burger. The fries were crunchy with the perfect amount of salt. Two orders of this, with a soda
And tip costed 30.

Chewy potato bun. Lots of cheese. Smashed patties. Moderate volume of generic burger toppings. This thing was satisfying. There's nothing groundbreaking about this burger. It's just good.

The inside of this place is cleared out and it's just a takeout joint for the most part.

One of the first places I ate while visiting NYC. I've heard locals are mean. The staff here busted that myth. They were friendly and struck up a nice conversation.

I also looked up best burger spots in the city prior to visiting. 7th street burger always was on the top 5 on lists of best burgers. It lived up to the hype and may be one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. Wanted to come back before leaving but just didn't have the time. This will be my first stop if I ever visit again. Reasonably priced too. Less than $15 for a burger and water.

Restaurant is tiny and narrow. There are standing only tables. No sitting areas here.

Lol didn't get a pic before i took a few bites but it was too good! The cheeseburger is so good. Super simple but absolutely delicious. And the loaded fries are everything as well. It's like all the cheese burger ingredients on the fries.. it's fire

20/10!

Great value burger spot that recently opened on the upper east side. Ordered just a basic cheeseburger and the loaded fries. Both were very good. Personal preference was the loaded fries, which are basically In n Out animal style fries + a chopped burger.

No frills.

Burger bun was pillowing and delicious

Looking for a juicy smash burger... 7th street fulfilled that for me. Fresh hot juicy burger cheese onions and special sauce. I felt like I was in Heaven. I enjoyed every bite with my Mexican spirit on the side it went down smooth. Service was quick and painless food was fresh and fast. No seating area but that's cool burger on the go... definitely coming back

What's not to love about a heart attack in a wrapper?!

Delicious greasy shplurger.  A little pricey for my taste though.

My husband and I came here for a Yelp Elite and man, we loved these burgers so much we were ready to pack up our things and move to the east side.

There aren't any frills here. They serve smashed burgers and fries (plus they have vegetarian options!). We have been on the hunt for the best burger in the city and we think we might have found it. The best part? It's affordable!

Would recommend this place highly, especially if you're in the mood to grab something quick. We went around 1pm on a Sunday afternoon and the vibes were very chill.

Finally had a chance to try this burger on my carb cheat day.

Menu is simple, cheese, double cheese, impossible. Got the double of course.

When I opened it, my initial reaction was that it was very greasy and mushed (photo). Also that it was kinda small. Definitely need 2-3 to fill up but I exercised self control.

Taste verdict - very tasty. Thoroughly enjoyed it and the comparison to 5guys comes to mind and my personal preference is that if I'm eating a greasy burger, 5guys wins.

Amazing, affordable burger spot. Was looking for my new go-to smash burger and have definitely found it. Service is always phenomenal despite being really busy at times. Huge line and cashier still took the time to double check what kind of sauces I wanted because they also had a spicy one (which was delicious!). No seating, more of a grab and go spot but also love the ambiance of standing at their metal counters and demolishing a delicious burger.

One of the best burgers that you can get in New York City. The site on 83rd and 2nd Ave. is a big supporter of healthcare workers. They offer a 50% off of the total. So healthcare come out and support them just bring your badge. Now on to the food. The burger is served on a soft and warm potato bread bun onions ,pickles and cheese. The fried are cooked perfectly ( I love a crunchy fry ). The service is fast and efficient ( everything is cooked to order ). There is a small stand up area to eat at.

Side note : banana pudding is available!!!! And it's outstanding!!! Check out Baonanas !!! It's Jersey based but located now in the city...... they specialize in all types of banana pudding.

Was treated to a comped burger, fries, and a drink from Yelp Elite and 7th Street Burger did not disappoint. The burger is the right amount of greasy, it's your typical hearty burger when you're craving one. The fries are crisped to perfection and I'm impressed that they serve Mexican Coca Cola (with sugar), a rare find. There was no line when we walked in around 7pm on a Sunday, and the food came out hot and promptly. There isn't much space to eat here but there's plenty of standing room for a quick bite before you're on your way.

A no-frills casual burger joint if you are in the mood. Wanted a cheeseburger after 2 happy hours in West Village and after reading positive reviews we decided to stop by.

So my honest opinion. Cheeseburger and fries were fine. Simple. Nothing amazing to rave about.

If you're in the area, worth a visit if you're craving it.

This place is good when you are in the mood for White Castle meets Five Guys. The burger is greasy and sloppy but really good. The service was quick and the menu is limited which is great and fits the "fast food service" vibe of the place. If you are starving you will definitely need to get double patties because the burger isn't a typical huge burger.
Again, it reminds me, taste wise, of (using this liberally here) White Castle where the meat just melts in your mouth and blends, which is the essence of a "smashed burger". The sloppy greasiness gave me Five Guys memories (which is good!) The fries were okay, nothing amazing but did what they needed to do !

7th Street Burger Upper East Side on Second Avenue at 83th Street
After attending a Yelp Event at this location of 7th Street Burgers I've decided it's in my top three fast food burgers. Everything about this burger reminds me of the burgers when I was in high school only better. The fries were the taste and texture I remember from high school too. The fries are just the right amount of salt too. I love their special burger sauce. It's a business that keeps the menu simple and sticks to what they do best. I tried the double cheese burger but now I'm sticking to the single. The double burger was too much for me. The loaded fries are a meal by themselves. I get two or three sides of fries out of my loaded fries order. I still want to try the grilled cheese sandwich.

This place gets busy with delivery and take out. Don't look to sit and relax over your meal. Their sidewalk seating across from the subway station just doesn't appeal to me. It's a high traffic corner with both vehicles and pedestrians. There's a counter inside if you want to stand to eat.
All I can say is try 7th Street Burgers. If you aren't into beef there's a Impossible Burger option. Don't forget to write a review cause I'm interested in what you think!

TIP: You can bring your vegetarian friends here because they make impossible smash burgers and my friend said it was delicious!

The fries are made fresh, crispy, and hot. Solid job.

DOUBLE CHEESEBURGER
Melty, gooey, buttery bread - it kind of all just melts in your mouth but not in a gross way. Kind of like shake shack burgers but oilier and less gross than the experience of eating a 5 guys burger (I said what I said). I wish it was a little burger but it also wasn't an expensive burger compared to what you'll see in Manhattan. The smash quality definitely does add quality and crispy texture to the flavor of the burger which I really enjoy. It's nothing that makes the patty crunchy, but you have these thin, thoroughly browned patties that are packed with browned flavoring.

TIP: get a mexican coke to pair with your burger, can't find these everywhere! Also, in the fridge, you'll find some dessert options from baonanas, a banana pudding spot that's blowing up right now, especially if you like Ube. Apparently, even if you don't like banana pudding, it will surprise you!!

Greasy smashed burgers done right.

No frills and no extra, just straight up simple burgers with cheese and onions with house sauce.

Burgers are made to order and fries are fresh and crispy.

About a 10 min wait for it to be done.

They only have one drink, Mexican Coke, which is pretty good. But wish they have Mexican sprite.  Some people like the dark stuff, but the clear stuff is just as good.

Another 7th Street Burger loc does not disappoint! I came here last week with my kids and we ordered some burgers and fries. Their menu is not huge. If you're looking for a customizable bistro burger, look elsewhere. These guys make simple burgers and fries really, really well.

We ordered all double cheeseburgers because, why not? If you're not as hungry as we always are, you can get a single, with or without cheese, and if you're not an omnivore, grab one of their impossible burger options.

I'm unsure of all of their locations offer this, but I was pleasantly surprised to find out that they now make a loaded chopped cheese fry side, with a spicy option. Their naked fries are very good, double-fried and crispy but soft inside. They top the fries with chopped ground beef, house sauce and onions, and it's just amazing. I ordered one of these bad boys and the whole fam loved it.

All of their burgers come with onions, cheese, pickles and house sauce, so if you don't want the extras, let them know in advance. I had the pleasure of being assisted by Dom and he was very nice. After ordering my food, I sat in the front of the restaurant on their little wooden bench. When my order was ready, Dom brought my food to me, which I appreciated.

The restaurant has limited space indoors, but they do have some table that they put out front, weather permitting. Inside, they do have a long bar where you can eat your food while standing, right next to the napkins that you're sure to use in abundance.

Their food is good. Plain and simple. I wish I lived closer. They need to open up a Bx location, selling those chopped cheese fries, and they'd make a killing. They're definitely worth a drive for pick up.

4.5 / 5.0 - My bf and I had been to the 7th Street Burger on Macdougal and it was great, so we were excited to try this location in UES.

It was quite busy when we arrived and we were told our order would take about 20 min. We just went for a stroll around UES while we waited, so it was fine.
Despite how busy it was, there was only one staff at the counter, who was friendly and on top of things.

They have a bar counter inside and a couple of tables outside. Spots open up fairly quickly and we were able to eat inside.

My bf and I both ordered a Double Cheeseburger and Fries, both of which were solid. Pricier, but also higher quality than your average fast food burger.

Always a perfect smash burger! Just the right amount of greasiness and fattiness. Gooey cheese and savory sauce. We just shared one burger but I'd be ashamed of how many of these I could probably eat. Also had an order of fries. Super crispy. Possibly fried twice or even three times. So good too. Service was quick as usual. Space for about a dozen people to eat inside.

I've been craving a good burger and this one from 7th Street Burger hit the spot! I came here for a Yelp Elite event.

My friend and I each got the double cheeseburger and we shared the loaded fries and regular fries. The loaded fries we got "spicy" - and you can taste a little kick for sure! The regular fries were good and crispy enough. The burger was good and filling.

I will definitely come back!

When someone wants to talk dirty to me, it's easy.

All they have to say is... a burger, melted American cheese, pickles, onions, and a special sauce - ooooooo, that's what will make me legs weak. And that's what 7th Street Burger is dishing out. I mean, it's a simple menu, but done extremely well. The burgers are delicious and so thankful for the humbleness of their purity and tastiness. And so glad they are in my 'hood. Welcome to the UES!

I am not a burger person in general but I love this place. The fries are extremely good and fresh. Since I am a vegetarian, my only option was Impossible burger which was very filling.
Also the ube pudding was so delicious!! Definitely visiting again.

Location opened up right in front of the Q yellow line station in front of 86 street.

Right when you get off the train at 83 you can't miss it.
Easy menu. Ordered the double cheeseburger fries and beef fries with Mexican coke with the cashier, very friendly guy. Kind of pack during dinner time so was counted a 15 minute wait. You can smell the aroma of the food inside.

There are seatings outside the restaurant. I wish they had stool so we can enjoy it more while sitting. We end up standing eating the food. When our food was up, the guy bought it to us.

The burger was nice but I think their other location had done it better. The fries with beef and cheesy was delicious. Followed by a good bottle of Mexican coke and you have yourself a full filled meal!
The in and out of nyc!!!! Burgers are amazing! Small menu list but it's easy to choose. Love the loaded fries as well, multiple locations around nyc. Just visit
Excellent burgers and fries franchise from NYC. Service is always friendly and fast. Ambience is small but to-go is always a good option.

Decent burger (though small) and fries for a reasonable price--about $11 for a single cheeseburger and side of fries. I always see a line out the door here so had to check it out! I could've used some more toppings on the burger (comes with grilled onions, pickles, house sauce) so maybe I'll have to ask for extra next time

Came with a friend on behalf of Yelp and let me just say this burger truly hits the SPOT! I got a cheese burger with fries and my friend got the impossible burger with fried and we both got mexican sodas

For starters this spot has a loooong line - rightfully so as these burgers really hit the spot. Expect to wait coming here. Prices are also so reasonable considering Manhattan standard prices.

The cheeseburger was the perfect amount of greasy and came with 2 patties to make me extra full. the cheese was perfdctly melted and the inside had onions and pickles - perfect burger toppings. A classic solid burger!

The fries were thick and crispy - again super classic french fries you cannot go wrong with these. Portion size of the fries was generous too.

10/10 recommend and will truly be returning

Hands down the best burgers in New York City. Big fan of their original joint in the East Village. And now a regular at this and their other location.

Great burgers. Great staff. A definite go to for all.

Must try: Cheeseburger and Loaded Fries!

Why: Love the simple mouthwatering cheeseburger! The bun was soft, the patty was juicy, the melted cheese and sauce with pickles and onions was on point, and the big sliced pickle in the middle added texture and flavor! I really savored each bite! The loaded fries - WOW! The cheese and sauce with beef bits on top of nicely crunch fries was so good and filling. Also had a light spicy kick to it! Needless to say, I was full and satisfied!

Note: The Loaded Fries are definitely shareable! I appreciate the simple menu. Also, the Mexican Coke was an awesome way to wash the burger and fries down. The restaurant has a side bar you can enjoy the meal or a couple tables and seats outside. Very happy that they opened this place on the UES - great addition! The workers were super cool too - friendly, funny and helpful. This will be my regular neighborhood burger joint going forward!
This spot is ode! One of the best burgers in town and the OG banana pudding goes crazy

Thank you for inviting Yelp elites to you business. 7th st burger is affordable, freshly made and always hit the spot. Definitely the best burger in NYC for the price (aside from In-N-Out in the west coast)

If you're a west coast transplant, this place will satisfy your In-N-Out cravings! All burgers come with special sauce, pickles and grilled onions. The pattys are thin and crispy, the buns perfectly soft and buttery.

The burgers take a minute, but it's because they are making them for real. Simple, high quality and well made!

The plain fries were not my favorite, but not bad. Service was excellent. Sunil was phenomenal!!

I normally do not like burgers at all but this was so good I would definitely come back. It was juicy and with every bite, it was so flavorful. The fries are also so good and did not even need ketchup with it. I would say this burger is just as good as smash burger!!

Wow. This may by my favorite burger place I've eaten at so far! They don't do anything fancy, just a standard burger, but they do it to perfection!

Their menu consists of a cheeseburger (can make it a double), an impossible burger, a grilled cheese, fries, and either water or a Mexican Coke(glass bottle Coke).

We got double cheeseburgers that come with grilled onions, pickles, and a tangy and creamy house sauce.

The burgers are going to be pretty greasy, but it's done tastefully. The burgers are smashed thin, allowing for the charred texture and flavor permeate the entire surface of the meat. The onions are so sweet, and the pickles add a great bite and acidity to the sandwich as a whole. Absolutely stunning.

The French fries are also incredible. These fires must be double fried because they stay so crispy even when traveling in a bag long distances. They are also salted well and have a lot of flavor.

I also really appreciate how they serve glass bottle Coke. Honestly, Coke taste the best out of a glass bottle.

The staff were extremely friendly throughout our arrival to the restaurant. This is a super small establishment that does not have any indoor seating, however it does have a small standing area with a long, narrow table on the wall. And there is additional outside seating.

Overall disposure in the absolutely fantasy experience that puts this restaurant as my number one burger spot in New York.

Ya'll. If I lived close to 7th street burger, I'd be very very big in a very very short time. I used to live in the neighborhood and I can tell you, the food options here are some of the best in the city. The bar is pretty high, so to find 7th street burger as crowded as it was on a Sunday afternoon is a big testimony to their carte du jour.

It's a short and sweet menu. They make five things but make them really, really good. We got the double cheeseburger, a double impossible burger.
, spicy loaded fries, regular fries and a Mexican coke. When we received our order, one came in a green checkered wrapper and another in a red one. We tasted both and I swear, I couldn't tell them apart. I had to go back and ask them which was which. The burgers had the perfect amount of finely chopped onions, sauce and pickles. The loaded fries have the same ingredients as the burger minus the bread. With such a high degree of overlap between the two, you would think they would both be overkill but no. They are both incredibly individualistic and incomparable.

Now, from what I've learned, 7th street burger is the new hot kid on just this block, not the city. It has seen a lot of success with their other locations in the city. Welcome to the UES, 7th street burger! You will kill it.

Loved these burgers. They were exactly what I was looking for! I was a bit tired of the gourmet style burgers that are about 6 inches tall, and too difficult to eat. 7th Street Burger knocked it out of the park. I like that they have a simple menu. We got a double cheese, a single cheese, a plain hamburger (for the little one) and some fries. The fries are super tasty, too. The flavor of the burgers was outstanding. Love that they include the onions, pickles, and their sauce on the potato bun. Can't wait for their UWS location to open (just wondering when and where it'll be).

I've come to this location more than once after the Yelp event in the summer. Their burgers are one of the best in NYC, hands down. The menu is simple so you're not stuck looking at a giant board wondering what to order. My go to is a single smash burger and fries. Wash it down with a Mexican Coke and it hits the spot!

Came here for a burger the other day and this was just an okay find.

Pros:
+ Decent impossible burgers - all burgers come with several toppings including lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pickles, cheese, and their house sauce.

Cons:
- Limited seating space
- No bathrooms
- Extremely pricey for the quality you are getting
- Rude staff

This place is really good but i wouldn't say it's the best cheeseburger i've ever had in my life but the LOADED FRIES BABYYYYYY 10/10 so YUMMY! The customer service was great and the manager was super sweet and helpful! Loved the music and how the workers were having fun making the food.

This was really amazing comfort food. You want a classic tasty burger and fries this is your place. Very simple menu but that's all they need, we got two regular cheese burgers and a loaded beef fries. The burgers were great, with cheese fried onions pickle and house sauce. The house sauce was ON POINT. The loaded beef fries had an entire patty on top of fries then topped with house sauce cheese and sautéed onions. They kept the patty whole which kept the fries crispy underneath. Genius. The place was small but clean with upbeat music while we waited, which wasn't long at all. The employees were friendly as well. I will definitley be back.

Burgers delivered. Delicious, no fuss, no muss, cheeseburgers. Whether you ordered the original, or the impossible burgers, it did not disappoint. The fries were crispy and well seasoned. Mostly a take out type of restaurant, with a few table tops, to enjoy your delicious grubs right away. The staff were friendly, jovial and courteous. The beats they playing were fun and made us dance! Lively and buzzing atmosphere, reasonably priced burger fries, what more can you want!

Yes, small menu, simple place, but very delicious food! You have your choices of a regular burger, double burger, or impossible burger, french fries, and even drinks so limited to Coke, Sprite, and a bottle of water. We both got the double burger with fries... burger on potato bread with the special sauce and pickles and onions was delicious! Fries were also delicious... Golden brown in the perfect amount of salt. Do you want your burger and fries fixed, this is definitely the place to go! My only complaint was the burger was a little small. I don't know that everything was great!

Some of the best burgers in NYC. Nice and greasy, melted cheese, onions, with pickles to cut through the heaviness all on a soft bun. Their fries are also super crispy and perfectly seasoned. You need to get the double patty.

When you move to a new place, I recommend that you go grocery shopping immediately. If you don't, you end up just going out constantly and spending a s**t load of money.
That is what happened when we moved. We had no food in the house for dinner so we kept going out. And I swear, between going out more because we have everything around us and restaurant week, and buying the occasional salad for lunch, I must've gained like 10 pounds (insert eye-roll emoji).
Anyways, there are 3 Italian restaurants right on our block, this place being one of them. We did try the other one, too, and that review will be released shortly.
Back to 83 1/2, the restaurant is a bit smaller but the food was amazing. I got the papperdelle with duck ragu and A got the trofie pasta, which was the trofie style pasta with short rib. That dish was really, really, good. I should've gotten that one. The duck ragu was really good too, don't get me wrong, but A's was super good. His short rib was tender and it was falling apart on his fork. My duck ragu was cooked well and there was a good amount of duck in the sauce.
The price is also reasonable, not too expensive. It's a place that you can go to more frequently than some of the other restaurants in the area. Service was good too. The waiter introduced himself and since it wasn't too busy yet, we got a better pick of the table. It started to get busy as time went on (we did get there really early).
And since I almost never go to Italian restaurant without getting dessert, we got dessert, which was the chocolate cake. It said lava cake on the menu but it's more of an actual chocolate cake. But it was very good, soft, moist, and the chocolate was rich but not too sweet.
This is a place I would return to, not only because it's right across the street but also because the prices are reasonable and the food is awesome!

The food was delicious! Their vodka sauce is so tasty and rich. Also, enjoyed the steak, brussel sprouts, and dessert, all excellent.
Service was warm and friendly.
Great spot for a date or family dinner.

Linguine al Frutti di Mare
homemade linguine, calamari, clams, mussels and shrimp

The seafood was fresh and delicately prepared, and the calamari highlighted the simply seasoned pasta. Tablecloth dining with attentive wait staff serving quality Italian food in a cozy, candlelit space.

Terrible experience...Stay away from this place! Dont waste your money! Came here with friends for dinner as it seemed like a nice neighborhood kinda place but, boy, were we wrong...the food is at best mediocre and over priced. Go somewhere else as there are plenty of good places in the area. However, the WORST part was the service. The waiter was extremely rude and made several comments to us about how we had to order all of our food at once as one person (out of a part of 7) was running 10mins late to dinner. the waiter also, told us that we have to leave after a hour and a half because "other people are waiting.". To add insult to injury, the waiter accused my husband of attempting to hide the credit card receipt that he signed for this $250 meal, that he left on the table but the waiter was too lazy to look for it. Needless to say we'll never come back and will tell all the people we know not to either!

After4 years, I would like to update my review of this awesome neighborhood Italian restaurant.  The staff are amazing.  David and Jose treat you like family.  I had a nice conversation with Vincenzo once.  They have a great outdoor COVID set up.  Eating dinner outdoors on a side street can make you forget that you're in Manhattan.  Last night, we were started off with some very good focaccia.  We split an order of fried artichoke hearts, which were perfect.  We have been through most of the appetizers at this point and they're uniformly excellent.  Our favorites include the Brussel sprouts and the salumi.  We had chicken Milanese and shrimp scampi.  The staff split our entrees in the kitchen, which is really helpful.  83 1/2 serves a definitive veal parmigiana.   Their trofi with short rib ragu is excellent.  All of their pastas are strong.  We lingered over cappuccino, enjoying the mild weather.  We were not rushed.

83 1/2 is one of our go to places.  Great food, great dining experience.   You won't be disappointed!

Nice little Italian place.  Good food.  Good wine.  Good service.  If you are looking for good food like Elios without the incredibly high prices with less noise x not feeling like a sardine, this is a great alternative
Great food at great prices. I've never had a bad meal here. It's our go to place for a homemade low key dinner

Yummy food. Small kitchen, it's crazy how they make all the food from it. They have a whole menu of specials as well. The Paccheri with vodka sauce was my favorite and the artichoke appetizer was amazing! It is a bit tight in the restaurant but it adds to the vibes. But if you like spacious, this may not be for you.

Came here with a group for dinner to celebrate our friend's milestone. We were very excited to try it because of the great reviews. Ultimately, we did not have a good experience.

Drinks: we ordered a bottle of the Barda Pinot Noir on the menu from the Patagonia region, and they brought out a completely different type of Pinot noir from Oregon instead. It was a good wine upon tasting so we stuck with it, but that kind of inconsistency with the menu shouldn't happen.

Food: Completely underwhelmed, which was unfortunate. We got calamari and polenta for appetizers. The calamari was truly horrible. Tasted like frozen store bought calamari (which i think it was), was extremely rubbery and tough. You could tell right when it was brought out that it was not going to be good. Polenta was not great either. For the entrees, we got various pasta dishes and the branzino, all of which were extremely average/not good.

Service: Service was fine, nothing to write home about.  Seemed like they were trying to do their best in there but just came up so short.

Comfort Italian food.
Have tried most of the menu. Each has been excellent.  
Will continue to return fore more.
Have always used delivery . Food always hot and packaged safely

Very very good pasta place. My favorites were the brussel sprouts and mushroom tortelloni. Superb. I like the 1 piece cheese concept vs cheese shreds. The duck pappardelle was also good, with many chunks of duck, but the pasta could have been a bit more al dente. Burrata was fine, no where as good as Rezdora's. Caesar salad was average, but in house sauce is good. Chilean sea bass was a bit too soft for me but good flavor. Overall, would solidly recommend.

A great meal in a charming setting!  We had a wonderful experience at 83 1/2 that reminded me of great meals we had last summer in Sicily.  The pork chop was terrific and the Spaghetti Bolognese was hearty and full of meat.  It was obvious that the pasta was homemade.  Our servers were friendly and attentive.  Noticing our fellow diners, we saw that this is truly a neighborhood restaurant that welcomed visitors warmly.  We were sorry that Vincenzo was not there.  We first learned about this restaurant while standing in line waiting for a ferry in Charleston, South Carolina, and wanted to tell him how much we enjoyed our evening.  We looked forward to our visit and enjoyed every bite of it!

Food is great and consistent but the service is consistently horrible.   Last time we were there was a week again and they were spraying cleaning products which made for an unpleasant meal - this was the 2nd time this happened.
Cozy neighborhood restaurant with great food. I had the fiocchi which were great. It's the UES so it's not trendy but it's still cute

This place was fantastic. Sat outside with my mom we got mussels and pasta. I didn't have any but the drinks looked really good, I would probably go back with friends and get the sangria. Pasta was delicious and the wait staff were fun and sweet.

I've been coming here for a couple years now- my favorite Italian place on the UES. Not even a question.

Was so excited they opened back up for take out. I never had take out from them before, and I was absolutely blown away. Just as good as dining  in.

Can't wait to get take-out again, and reallllly can't wait to go back in person.

We went there on a Friday night date night. The waiters were very nice. However, the tables are almost 1/2 sizes of the other restaurants and as soon as we walked in, our appetite got cut in 1/2 too. Drinks were good. I ordered a seafood pasta special - do not think they had the freshest ingredients. Overall, the highlights were the services and hard working and friendly waiters.

The food is fine but not really worth the price and the staff do not provide the level of service one would expect in a white table cloth "fine dining" environment. It was a Wednesday evening and completely empty between 5 and 8 - we were the only table there for the first few hours. Seems they have a later, local crowd. Perhaps the standard on the UES is lower than downtown but this place was recommended to me and I was surprised about the recommendation after eating there myself.

My seafood was completely over cooked and made ordering a dish with lobster sort of pointless, as I couldn't enjoy it. The sauce was fairly flavorless as well.

This spot has a great outdoor dining setup. I've been wanting to try this restaurant for a while now and so glad I did! The staff was extremely friendly and the service was great. We started with the Baked Clams followed by the Pappardelle Al Ragu D'anatra and Fiocchi 4 Formaggi. The Baked Clams were absolutely delicious, the breadcrumbs and seasoning were perfect. The fresh pappardelle was fantastic. I highly recommend checking out this restaurant!

Great food, but the one time we went there they didn't have enough staff. The outdoor server was also serving inside and he looked overwhelmed. The kitchen also was taking longer than normal apparently. We will try again since the food was good. Plus I loved their coffee came in a huge mug :)

83 1/2 is one of my favorite restaurants in the city and definitely my favorite spot on the UES. The paccheri alla vodka is phenomenal and one of my favorite pasta dishes ever.  I also love the veal parm. I don't normally like veal, but I dream about this dish. For appetizers, I'd highly recommend the eggplant parm - it melts in your mouth.

The restaurant is relatively small, so I'd recommend making a reservation.  Don't skip this place.

Nice Italian restaurant with good food and a cozy ambiance.

Ambiance.  Inviting, warm atmosphere.  Nice restaurant for a date.

Service.  Servers were attentive, and food arrived in a reasonable time.

Food.  
- Octopus salad was great.  
- My frutti di mare with calamari, clams, mussels, clams and shrimp was good but not my favorite.  This is a goto dish for me, and while the wine sauce was good, the clams and scallops were not as large as I like.  I also prefer less chewy calamari and more of the other seafoods
- First time here I tried stuffed artichoke which was nice. Light tasty stuffing enjoyed off the leaves of the artichoke.

Overall a nice restaurant great for a date.

Do yourself a favor and come here for dinner ASAP. The best Italian food I've had in the city to date, seriously. The owner, Vincenzo, is the best. He and his team make you feel like family. After a few glasses of wine, you'll be convinced you're in Italy dining with la familia.

MUST try: the eggplant parmigiana, polipo and the veal chop parmigiana. If you like lasagna, theirs will knock your socks off! The eggplant is a family recipe from Sicily- unreal delicious!

Small, friendly neighborhood Italian with great pasta and nice service. Packed to the gills on a Saturday night - glad we had reservations. The branzino would probably have been better without the mushy zucchini crust, but everything was fresh with lots of healthy vegetables. Chocolate lava cake was a great ending. (To add, the prices are pretty reasonable!)

El lugar es pequeño y acogedor, los camareros muy amables y serviciales.  Ordené para la entrada unas berenjenas ufff buenísimas y unos fettuccine con hongos y tomates secos  en aceite de olivas, estaba súper delicioso, me encantó! por supuesto mi Prosecco a temperatura perfecta para mi gusto. La comida no tardo para llegar a la mesa.

I discovered this gem a few months ago & all I can say is WOW. The food here is unbelievably good. I have ordered take out several times & everything we have tried is so fresh & delicious. Some of our favorites are the linguine with clams (all of their pasta is fresh/homemade) & the eggplant Parmesan ball appetizer. I had never given much thought to Cesar salads before - I've always felt they're the same wherever you go - but even their Cesar salad just knocks it out of the park! There's something about every dish here that is just indescribably better than any I've tried before. Anyone who I've gone with or gotten takeout with completely agrees. If you're looking for fresh, authentic Italian food, look no further!!

We recently were here. Table of 11.  Since the service was not so good, and since we were charged more for a scotch than what was shown on the menu, we just double the tax and left a $90 tip.

The waiter comes over and says he wants $12 more tip. This was very embarrassing, so to hush him up, we gave an extra $20.

I emailed the owner Vincenzo, figuring he would want to know we were being shaken down for nickels by an employee for an over $600 bill, with tip, for in essence pasta, with some drinks.

The owner, Vincenzo, calls me and says he was allowed to charge more for the scotch because he hadn't updated his menus. I knew this was not going to end well.

Vincenzo then said it is customary to leave a 20% tip for large parties. I told him no mention of a large party tip was on the menu and no tip amount was on the bill, so we didn't have to leave anything, but initially left $90, and then boosted it with the demands from the waiter.

With that, Vincenzo said a 20% tip is customary, and then hung up on me.

I thought this guy would want to know about our experiences, but instead, he was the one behind all this, including knowingly overcharging us for a drink.

There are Italian restaurant owners on the upper east side who would actually appreciate your business. This is not one of them.

Came here for a celebratory dinner and left very disappointed. While our server was very nice we waited so long for everything. It took over 30 minutes for our bread to be delivered and our drinks. It was then when we ordered the mozzarella appetizer (was not cooked, minimal prep) and it took way too longer to come out. Definitely understand it's busy but another 2 top table was seated next to us way after we were seated and they were able to finish their entire meal before we even got our appetizer... We ordered a medium rare ribeye steak and it came out well done and was mainly fatty, potatoes were under cooked and the spinach was unfortunately raw. Definitely not what I was expecting for the price tag of that steak. The four cheese pear tortellini was very good though so if you take away anything from this review definitely order that!! Again the server was so nice but the meal did not live up to our expectations in the slightest /:

I ordered delivery from here and enjoyed most of the dishes.
-Burrata wrapped with prosciutto: this was a great dish with so much flavor from the balsamic. I just wish that the prosciutto was cut a little thinner.
-salad with tomatoes and lemon dressing: this salad was very basic for the price and I was expecting more Parmesan rather than just a small slice on top. I probably wouldn't order this again.
-polenta with truffle oil and mushrooms: I really wanted to like this dish, but the polenta was very bland. I added some truffle salt at home and this made the dish much better.
-fettuccine bolognese: very good sauce with lots of meat and the pasta tasted so fresh. My husband loved this dish.
The only thing that was strange was that there was no bread that came with the delivery, which I'm used to seeing from most Italian restaurants. I would order again overall.

We LOVE this restaurant ! So glad we ordered for delivery. Food tastes exactly as if we were at the restaurant. The most amazing veal parm that is still on the bone, delicious sea bass and Chianti braised beef short ribs pasta were exactly what we were craving during these Covid times. Can't wait to visit our favorite Italian restaurant soon!

The food at this neighborhood restaurant is very good and staff is friendly. I have been here over 10 times.  The quality and pricing match, you get what you pay for and is worth it.  Their product is not something one could easily replicate at home. The pasta is fresh, they are consistent and every course is superb.  If you are looking for a delicious Italian meal, you should try 83 1/2.

Beautiful cosy restaurant in UES. Service was super and food was very delicious.
Highly recommend:
Grilled octopus- simply the best combo of octopus and veggies, I simply wanted to eat it endlessly and skip my entree:)
Linguine Frutti Di Mare- another dish that gets more delicious with every bite you take. I asked for spicy sauce and it worked well with sea food. The Portion is big so I recommend skipping appetizer if you plan on this entree.
I did not get a chance to try their dessert but next time- definitely worth going back.

Small gem neighborhood restaurant.  Food here is always great.  Start off with the delicious baked clams oreganata and  save some bread for dipping in the sauce.  The homemade pasta is on point with a great selection.  I enjoy the various linguini offerings.  Finally,  finish off the meal with probably one of the best expresso martinis in the city.   Delicious!!
Also, Wednesdays and Thursdays are BYOB.  Bring your favorite bottle of wine and enjoy!!

We had a reservation around the corner at Felice 83 but when they couldn't accommodate our reservation for outside in a place where would would have been dry if it started raining we walked to 83 1/2. Total serendipity: food was excellent (I had the pasta with duck ragu and my friend had the swordfish) and service was attentive and pleasant. Highly recommend!

Great Italian food, check, Great Service, check, Nice Decor, check...

Been to 83 1/2 several times..Consistently great. Food always tasty and fresh. Actually, delicious. Perhaps grandma is in the kitchen with her old world recipes slaving over the hot stove.

Definitely a  nice romantic spot to bring that special someone. Quiet enough to hold a good conversation, not overly dark but light enough to see the eyes reflecting your smile and a sense of warmness that you would get from sitting in front of a glowing fireplace on cold snowy winter night.  

Finally service.....Yes, there were other people in the restaurant but the service made us feel like we were the only ones there. Prompt, attentive, but not pushy.

1 block from the Q making it terrifically convenient, so there is no need to schlep to Mulberry Street and fight the insanity. A must go.
Ordered takeout and they got order wrong - had to wait 20 minutes for them to correct. When we got home they had given us GF pasta in order we did not want it in - so again they had wrong order.

Yes, a five star review.  Why?  Because it's our favorite restaurant in nyc.  Is it perfect? No.  But, the food is amazingly delicious and the service is excellent.  Been going regularly for five years or so.  Tonight I tried something new, the baby lamb chops.  Best I've ever eaten.  My wife had the stuffed clams and they are also the best we've had anywhere.  The stuffed artichoke is also so tasteful and cooked to perfection. Pastas are awesome as well.  And, if you love wine they have a great selection that's reasonable.  Plus, Wed. and Thurs it's byob if you want, and no corkage fee!!!  How can you go wrong?

Tried this place out the other day in search of another gem on the UES and had really mixed feelings about it. We showed up for a late dinner, probably around 8 pm, and the place was EMPTY. Completely empty. It made for a rather uncomfortable dining experience.

We were greeted and told we could choose to sit wherever we wanted. My boyfriend suggested a four-top booth in the corner, and half jokingly I quipped about how we shouldn't take up a four-top when we're only two people. The host (waiter? Unsure) stepped in and offered to make the booth a two-top. I mean, come on- the place is empty...I've worked in restaurants before and while not a huge deal, he should have told us it was no problem for us to occupy that booth. My standards for service are high, though, having dined in some of the nicest restaurants in the city, but I believe it's the component that separates the good from the great.

We were brought out menus. My boyfriend ordered a glass of chianti and I think I ordered the cabernet sauvignon if I remember correctly. Our waiter came back out and told me they didn't have the wine I ordered (it was probably one of 5 reds by the glass, shouldn't be that hard to keep in stock). So I settled for a glass of chianti as well which was a lovely, light red.

Now, the bread. It was served with olive oil and balsamic, and the balsamic was some of the most piss poor (excuse my language) I've ever had before in my life. It tasted like $2/bottle balsamic, to be honest. My boyfriend and I split the charcuterie and cheese board as an appetizer, which was fine- the prosciutto was nice. There were two different types of parm though as far as I can tell, which were mixed together in one pile.

This restaurant saves itself with the pasta. I got the Trofie Al Ragu Di Manzo, which was pasta with braised short ribs and pomodoro. My boyfriend got the pappardelle with duck ragu. Both were absolutely delicious and generous portion sizes, and really the only reason I gave this place even three stars. The service for the rest of the night was rather inattentive and slow. Total bill came to roughly $80 pre-tip. I don't believe the pretentiousness of this place matched the quality, unfortunately.

TL;DR: Pasta was GREAT, everything else was pretty inexcusably bad. Would maybe order a pasta entree take out, but do not plan on coming back.

This place is amazing! Decided on this restaurant to celebrate my birthday! Best. Decision. Ever. Ordered an amazing pasta dish, casarecci mangiafridda. Amazing!! Apps were also great. My friend till this day raves about the artichoke appetizer. The Brussels Sprouts were also a hit. Aside from the food, the waiter was attentive & always available & the owner even came by our table to greet us. Vinnie, thank you for your incredible hospitality. You formed part of making my birthday weekend very special. Your place is a gem .

Grazie!

Jose was such a great waiter, he is really nice and made me feel like home. Very attentive, helpful and funny.
Ordered calamaris and was not the best I had but good, however service was awesome, will definely come back to try other things... dessert was really good ( we had tiramisu)

what happens when you find a long hair in your Pasta? it was embedded in the pasta - not on top -  the waiter should apologize and take it back !!- well in the case of last night - the waiter said "well its not my hair"  He told the manager and the waiter said the manager wanted to see the hair - WHO would save it!!!  I then went to find the manager who was the rudest most arrogant man - He said the same thing that noone has long hair!!! I was with 3 friends and told him we were all in the neighborhood and would not come back - he shrugged his shoulders and said ok!!  When we got the bill - the pasta was still on the bill - the waiter was annoyed but took it off - Food was average - would not recommend and will never go back!

This is not only some of the best Italian food I've had in Manhattan, but it is also some of the best service I've had. I love everything about this restaurant and can't recommend it enough. Try the espresso martini, you won't be disappointed! And, Jose, our waiter, is absolutely one of the best.

We had dinner there on Saturday with our friends that are paranoid of eating inside.  Our friends made the reservation and thought they reserved a table outside.  Daniel told us that we booked inside and they were fully booked outside.  Needless to say I was SO disappointed as I love to introduce  my friends to my favorite restaurant. Long story short, Daniel moved a table outside to accommodate us!!! The food is over the top delicious but for me the big seller is the staff is the nicest we have ever experienced in the city and we dine out a lot.  BRAVO to 83 1/2!!! You bring such great food and good vibes to everyone who dines there.  Planning our next dinner reservation.....I will make it LOL

This is one of our favorite go-tos in the neighborhood and isn't unusual for us to go two nights in a row. The service is wonderful - very friendly and accommodating. The food is stand out. Love the veal chop, watermelon salad, paccheri alla vodka and baked clams. You also can't go wrong with any of their specials. Highly recommend for a quality dinner and great atmosphere!

The food was fantastic, but there were absolutely no COVID regulations. I was told their customers were "all regulars" so no need to check. I am a regular but never going back. Every other place is checking for vaccination status. Why should I eat and get exposed. They were extremely rude when we complained and accused my family of being unvaccinated.

Delicious food every single time! They have a great outdoor dining set up that is covered but not enclosed. The service has definitely been lacking during COVID, but they're doing the best they can. There were only two waiters total for all outdoor patrons each time I've gone. This leads to a very long and leisurely meal even on a weeknight. All in all it's always a good experience...I've tried several appetizers, pastas, and desserts and all are superb.

4 stars only because of the experience with our wait staff was not great. If this rating was solely based on the ambiance and quality and flavor of food. I'd give a 5 rating.

Great quiet ambiance. Smaller dining area so it's an intimate atmosphere. Great wine selection. We really enjoyed our cheese and meat plate (salumi e formaggio) but wished there was a sweet component (fruit or jam) with the savory.

The three main course dishes we ordered did not disappoint:
- the salmon was cooked to perfection
- fiocchi 4 formaggi (best dish hands down)
- ravioli al tartufo

For dessert (all 3 were great. Can't go wrong either way):
- creme brûlée
- tiramisu
- gelato

With wine, appetizer, main course, and dessert - it'll probably run each person in a group of 4 around $65. Worth it for the quality of food.
Heard great things about the food but they over book their tables and ignored our reservation time. Disappointing.

I have never written a yelp review before but this restaurant deserves it. We haven't lived in the area long, but 83 1/2 has quickly become our favorite restaurant. The pasta is such high quality and every type we've had is worth ordering (We've tried the spinach gnocchi, vodka, trofie, and bolognese). The eggplant parm app is also great and I couldn't be happier that they're still open. Can't wait to try more things and would 100% recommend to anyone in the UES looking for Italian.

Picture taken from my apartment as we did take out!

Do yourself a favor and order from one of the many other Italian restaurants on the Upper East Side that treat their customers with decency.

I placed an order at 4:48 pm via ChowNow and received a notification that my food should be delivered around 5:30 p.m. At 5:45 pm, I had not yet received my order, so I called the restaurant to check in. The man who answered the phone told me, "Your food is on the way, dear," and that was that.

At 6:00, my food still hadn't arrived, so I called to follow up on my order and still politely I might add. The same man who answered the phone was curt and raised his voice to speak over me before HANGING UP ON ME while I was speaking. When I called back, he clearly let my call go to voicemail. What atrocious customer service.

To be clear, I have zero issue with food delivery taking longer than estimated, particularly in wet weather; my issue is entirely with the nasty treatment by the restaurant. Last time ordering from 83 1/2.
Wonderful Manhattan based food truck that sells gyros, Indian kathi rolls and other delicious hot meals. It's on Lexington between 52nd and 53rd.

I absolutely love this bodega! The guys are so nice in there and it's open 24hrs. They have great sandwich options but you can DIY one with anything you want. It's also the one bodega where I absolutely love their brewed coffee.

Really upsetting to part with a corner bodega twice as a native New Yorker.

In a previous incident, approached the store owner for a bacon egg and cheese around 1am and he yelled at me that he was on break, scolding me for even asking when his lunch break would end, like I was an annoyance to ask to order some thing at his 24 hour store. God forbid someone want to buy something!

After forgiving him months later, I started getting sandwiches from here again, in the morning - the hungry man, after my night shift, when he was gone - and I'll say they are delicious.

But tonight I came around 1 am because I needed comfort food related to a family emotional grievance and planned to tip him $10 as gratitude for him working late at night, making me a sandwich when I was low and to make up for any beef we had before because, I too work night shift in my own line of work and understand it's not easy.

He barked away a $10 tip out of anger that he remembered I left a negative review on his Deli maintaining a vengeance.

I don't know if the Night Shift cook here is bipolar or suffering some other kind of psychiatric disorder but he doesn't understand how to interact with customers the way most bodegas do in the the city.

I've lived on the upper east side since I was 3 years old and after 25 years living here will never return here ever again. This is the kind of place that will spit in your food if you look at them the wrong way. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.

84th Street Corner Deli was okay but not the best variety of bread and cream cheese. The man behind the deli counter was the highlight of the visit. He was so friendly and teasing me for taking so many photos! He said he was charging me $5 a photo. I told him I was here to see what they had to offer and grab something to go. They would be a star business highly advertised. Haha

This place has a little of everything. Beer, Wine, Gum, Candy, Lotto, groceries, deli food and more! Since it's open 24 hours it's great for late night snacks. I grabbed a bottle of water for my travels today. I'm eating elsewhere so I'm passing on the cuisine! Try it, you may like it. At least I can say the deli employee is very friendly!

SO OVER PRICED been in the neighborhood for a while every time I go it cost more & more. TEN dollars for a sandwich on a roll that's ridiculous you were better off, walking two blocks more down and going to a Fresh Bites a new sandwich shop with a lot of options and way better prices
This is the BEST Deli on the UES!  You can find new emerging products and all of your old favorites.

Stopped by to grab a couple of chipwiches. They charged me $5 each for a frozen dessert that usually costs $3 at most. I was so shocked that I handed the man a $5 bill thinking it would cover them both. Was completely caught off guard when the man said that $5 wouldn't cover it, and they were actually $5 each. The chipwich was still good though.
It's really too bad. I've been a very loyal customer. Ordered ahead and paid via credit card and when I got to the deli they claimed they never got the order and refused to honor it.

TERRIBLE SERVICE  terrible food. The music is so  loud with profanity at night it's hard to even place your order without yelling.  The guy who makes the sandwich spited in my sandwich . Very unprofessional.   And  then he told me to go Fuck Myself also started Harassing to my friend, the man doing the sandwiches then said get out we don't need your business and then more profanity.   He humiliated me in front of some customers Very Dangerous place.  Some staff are ticking time bombs.   Especially the guy who makes the sandwiches we want him to get fire before it's to late.
No management nor owner in the evening  to complain .
Soon it will have a big law suit against this awful place.
I wish this place for good and come someone with better management.

Absolute worst staff I've ever seen. Walked in and guy behind the counter immediately didn't want to serve me. After looking at the menu for not even a minute he yelled at me for not ordering fast enough. Told him to piss off for being a dick and walked out and to the staff telling me to suck him off and other colorful stuff involving my mother. Spend your money literally anywhere else. I wasn't even inside for a minute.

I hate the fact I'm  have to give one star. I have been shopping there  for  at least 15 years. I have managed to ignore the prices, rude staff , and general  filth.  I went in last  Sunday and as  I was entering the store a customer came out not wearing a mask . I told the cashier ( who had his mask below his chin)  and he basically told me to mind my business. We started to argue and he told me to F- off . Since then I finally have the intelligence to shop at other delis in the neighborhood. There is so much out there they definitely will never get my money.

Terrible service, grumpy workers, and overpriced goods. During the pandemic they increased prices on basic things like pasta sauce over 50%! (Sauce went from $6 to $10). SIX PACK OF BEER COSTS $16!!

AVOID AT ALL COSTS

There's def no more Korean food here. Ignore those old pics. What we have now it's your typical NYC bodega. The deli eats are average, as are the BECs... that being said when you NEED (you know those times) a sandwich or BEC you are very, very happy this place is around and open 24/7. There are bagel spots within 2 blocks in every direction that have better coffee... well, everything else too, really... so come here for those last minute necessities (mixers) and lotto tickets (and if you're incredibly hungover). It's here if you need it. Feel good about yourself if you don't.

Garbage food with even bigger garbage people working there. The guy behind the counter is a horrible human being and got in my face when I asked if they were still doing sandwiches.  I wouldnt spend another dollar in this place and on top of everything it's the most overpriced deli in New York.  I would rather starve than give these people any money.
They served the best food with the best quality, no matter what you want it's the best food anywhere in the UES. 10/10 highly recommend

Dropped in here today to pick up some snacks and supplies in the wake of Hurricane Sandy's arrival. Fritos, beer, and candy bars should do the trick!

Pretty decent deli and convenience store. Lot's of inventory and winding shelf units in the middle of the store are fully stocked. Very clean looking and organized. Full deli counter with meats and salads. A bit overpriced but there were no crazy lines here like in the supermarkets today and I had no patience for that.

Now also prepares Korean dishes such as bibimbap, bulgogi, and kimchi. Open 24 hours and free delivery too. They have a B rating on their window so I'll stick with the packaged and sealed foods though.

Three times the milk I have bought was sour--- granted they changed but I've just bought ice cream and even that tastes sour.
Tuna wrap was also unacceptable.

As far as deli's go, not notable.

TERRIBLE SERVICE  average food. The music is so  loud with profanity at night it's hard to even place your order without yelling.    They turn it down to hear you and then up while waiting. Very unprofessional.   When I had trouble hearing over it I was instructed to go Fuck Myself then the Deli attendant started PROFANITY ABOUT MY MOTHER. , the man in the Deli then said get out we don't need your business and then more profanity about my Mother.  Very Dangerous place.  Some staff are ticking time bombs.  No management in the evening.

CASH ONLY

Everything here is more expensive than a grocery store, but not too bad if you want a pick up a few things and get in and out quickly. Large selection of dry Korean noodles. Has everything a local convenient store should have. I have yet to try the deli.

Been in multiple times to get an overpriced drink and have multiple people behind counter never more than one person helping make wraps salads or sandwiches. Don't waste your time better let management utilize employees before you waste time

The most expensive cup of coffee on the UES. $1.75 for a small, $2.75 for a large (and no, this is not Starbucks).  I mean you can get the SAME cup of coffee ANYWHERE for half the price.  

I boycott this place, their prices are ridiculous.  I have NO IDEA what they are smoking, but maybe they should sell it with the coffee.
Everything you need from a corner deli, now with authentic and yummy Korean food!

Their coffee prices went waaay up. WTF? We're not talking organic fresh-shipped from Costa Rica goodness. In fact, sometimes it tastes like the hazelnut danced in the same urn as the regular, and I can't go for that, no-o-o, no can do.

After just finishing what was a pretty sorry excuse for an egg sandwich, I'd really like to give this place two stars. Additionally, the A/C was off so it was hot as heck in there. Not as good as it used to be. Also, tip: cash only. Which is OK I guess, if you're spending less than $20. If you're spending more than that, do your grocery shopping at Fairway around the corner.

This place is cash only and way overpriced, but they pretty much always seem to be open and will deliver.  And I don't just mean that they deliver from the deli.  Last time, I ordered popcorn, a six pack of beer, and 6 of those long skinny popsicles we all loved as kids.  I'm willing to pay extra not to have out my shoes and socks back on.  That makes this place a keeper in my book.
Such a great neighborhood deli. They have all the basics I need. 24hr delivery. Very friendly staff and good deli food.

As of this writing (summer 2013), this deli no longer serves Korean food. Disappointing, since that's the reason I decided to check it out.

However, it's a perfectly fine deli. For BLTs or bacon egg & cheeses, I walk a couple blocks here instead of going to the deli right on my corner, since this place is pretty generous with the bacon, as opposed to my other deli which is quite stingy.

Also they have a pretty cool candy rack with imported & specialty brands.

So this deli is not like incredible or anything but it is perfectly satisfactory.
Great neighborhood deli/convenience store. I'm lucky to have it right on my corner. Has all the basics for your fixing and can be delivered on the lazy days in 5 minutes.

Fast and friendly.  A little hard to order over the phone (language barrier), and occasionally the order won't be 100% correct, but pretty darn good.  Have ordered at 3pm, 3am, and every hour in between, and always get fast service.

Wow, 52nd and Lexington Breakfast Cart was really terrific. Overall, I think this is a great, fun spot. Every thing that we have purchased was very fresh and flavorful. Workers are very courteous. They're attentive, polite and always on their game. Definitely recommended.

Indeed, fabulous big muffins for only $1!
Coffee was pretty good too.

Some time ago I had been craving for croissants for a while.  I had to try authentic French bakeries , and this ones you could not forget about it .
I got raspberry and Nutella croissants . They both had crispy out shells and so many layers inside, mouthful of buttery flavor and hint of each raspberry and Nutella as well.
Didn't disappoint me for sure !

Went here to pickup some hot chocolate and a cookie on Wed afternoon.
The place is busy .The ambiance is nice like a good coffee shop.
They have a bar counter,lot of hot food options along with the regular coffee,tea and pastries.
The hot chocolate is okay,not a big fan of. Maman has better hot chocolate next block
The flourless choc hazelnut cookie on the other hand was amazing.

We came here for a light 'breakfast' at their bakery/cafe.

Coffee was excellent...rich, robust flavor.

Pain au Chocolat was quite good.

We got two mini egg-cup/frittata type things.  They were good, but were given to us barely warmed.

We also got their 'avocado toast'.  While it was on a beautiful piece of crusty, sourdough type bread, everything else about the 'avocado toast' was pretty bad.  First off, it had an odd mix of toppings: avocado SPREAD (like something along the lines of 'Sabra' avocado spread...or something out of a squeeze tube...it was Not fresh avocado slices or chunks...); some slices of radish... OK that's fine...but then there were also ...snow peas/snap peas on top.  Very strange.  Neither of us liked the avocado toast.

Screams airport food court. $8 for a tiny (half-palm-sized) sandwich with a teaspoonfull of hummus and a few pickled veggies on it. And the sandwich is pre-made and self-served out of a cooler. The coffee is Lavazza. Not sure what the point of this place is other than it may be the only relatively quick place to grab food around Lincoln Center?

Pro: location (directly across from Lincoln Center), cleanliness
Cons: pricy, espresso machine out of order, everything served to go

Not a bad spot for a quick pastry or sandwich before a show, but tbh Breads Bakery is down the block and feels more reliable.

I've been procrastinating writing this review because of how underwhelming the experience was. My partner and I were in the Central Park area and decided to go for a quick bite after a long walk. We decided to stop by here because why not? It's Daniel Boulud's place so it must be good. But it was ultimately a letdown.
We ordered the breakfast sandwich, nicoise salad, ice latte with oat milk, and gazpacho, and MAYBE 1.5 of the items were good.
The best item was the delicious breakfast sandwich, which included gruyère, bacon, and egg. The ice latte with oat milk was tasteless (there was neither a coffee taste nor oat milk taste), and it weirdly made my throat itchy (I've had plenty of lattes with oat milk and I've never had a reaction before). Taste-wise, the gazpacho was decent, but was an absurd price for such a small serving (it was more like a sample size). And the worst was the niçoise salad. It was probably the saddest salad I've ever seen and had: a block of gray dry tuna, half an egg, overcooked (and flavorless) green beans, and tasteless tomatoes.
I don't think I would trouble myself with this location in the future.

We had the cheese plate with 3 cheeses. It was good, but felt it was a little overpriced for the amount of food. They did have a free pitcher of ice water. The area itself is open and filled with sun in the afternoon. There's also outdoor dining.

The food was good, but nothing to write home about. All-in-all, a good option for a chat with a friend.

Despite it being very busy on Christmas Eve the service was great. Everything tasted fresh and the flavors were excellent. I would definitely pass by if your shopping at the Oculus or waiting for a train there.
Great spot to get a hot drink and a yummy treat in between NYFF shows! You can't go wrong with any item here. On my last visit, I tried the chocolate pistachio pastry!

I love going here. You get the taste of Boulud, but it's cheap enough to go everyday.  Last time I had lunch here, I sat next to Rachel Maddow...then Lawrence O'Donnell showed up. Try the Cuban sandwich. It's amazing.  And the best thing?  It's close to my building.
Very good consistent " cafeteria!  " .  Many new items for picnic or outdoor activities at Lincoln Center.
Can not beat their breakfast sandwiches! Can't wait to try their other items. Service is also excellent! Very friendly employees.

I have passed Epicerie Boulud at least a dozen times, and I finally decided to give it a try. I ordered a Jambon sandwich and an assortment of Macaroon's. My sandwich was delicious, but a bit small. The bread was excellent, the Ham and the Gruyere cheese very fresh. I brought the Macaroon's to the office to share with my co-workers. It was unanimous that the Macaroon's were fabulous. Expensive, but worth it.
Forgot to make my sandwich after I paid. When it came it was nasty. Watched cashier be rure about same situation with another customer. Trading on brand. Avoid.

I have been patronizing this business since it opened about a decade ago.

Épicerie Boulud is that good!

Today I purchased an almond croissant.  It  only costs $4.50, which is reasonable for Manhattan.

The pastry is loaded inside with almond frangipane.  Most bakeries put skimpy amounts of filling inside their flavored croissants.  You certainly get your money's worth of product here!

I also purchased some Pâté Normand.  The first time I tried one was when I was in Normandy, umpteen years ago when I was a high school exchange student.  It is made with pork, chicken liver, bacon and apple.  

It is usually eaten with cornichons (pickled cucumber) and drunk with a glass of white wine.

The wine bar is closed on Sundays and Mondays, so I am taking home my pâté, today on the Fourth of July, and drinking a glass of MIP wine with it this evening.

MIP is a wine brand that is Made in Provence.   It is part of Épicerie's wine collection.  I plan to buy a bottle of it now from one of the many liquor stores nearby that sell that brand,  thanks to a Google search of  "Made in Provence MIP wine where to buy".

And thank you to chef/owner Daniel Boulud for providing quality French food and drink to French food connoisseurs like me.

I have been effusive in my praise of Daniel Boulud's restaurants. When I came across Épicerie Boulud, I was excited to try something better than an average deli.

I picked a sandwich, sat down...and had a sandwich was that maybe as good as that from any other grab and go place in NY. The bread was dry...really dry, turkey, bacon and mayo, a little lettuce. The mayo overshadowed everything and it was either easy nor pleasant to eat. For $12.

This is not worth the money and if I were Daniel Boulud, I would not want my name on it. Stick with any local deli.

Not what it seems.

it's not an épicerie (grocery store) - it's a coffee shop.

your outdoor seat? at 4:30 becomes a seat for dinner that you can't have anymore ("so sorry").

and the decaf iced coffee I had yesterday? not decaf, as I realized between midnight and 2:30 am).
I will give it 10 starts. Totally awesome and delicious place. Next time in the big apple will definitely be back. Excellent food and even better coffee and service. The ambiance it's also on point.

In typical Daniel Boulud fashion this is boujee spot with decent food. It is sort of like your standard grab and go cafe but expensive. They have different sandwiches in the glass case but I went with the Chicken salad sandwich with cranberries. It comes cold and they give you the option of heating it up. I enjoyed it cold so no big deal. Probably better heated up though. They also had Chocolate chip cookies on the counter so I ordered one of those. The cookie was full of chocolate chips but other than that it was pretty average for an expensive cookie. They have them sitting on the counter so they aren't fresh out of the oven which is always a problem.  

Epicerie Boulud is way too expensive for what you get. You might as well sit down somewhere and have a proper meal. Nothing stuck out to me about this place other than the prices. 3 stars all the way.

Nice atmosphere, the outdoor seating is great!  However, their menu is just glamorized cafeteria food - with a sprinkle of quinoa and gruyère cheese to keep it "gourmet".  For being self serve/grab and go service, it's priced a little high as well
This place has a nice location nice treats and good food but the coffee is meh. Kinda watered down if u ask me. But it's nice to have it across the steer from Lincoln center

The BEST place for an apéro, French style. Oysters are chucked right in front of you, the wine selection is impeccable and James is THE BEST behind the counter. Almost don't want to leave this review because I don't want this to get too crowded. But it's the best place to spend your afternoon.

Five stars for the food, one star for the service and ordering system, so I am splitting the diff and giving Epicerie Boulud three stars.
We had opera matinee tickets and a later dinner res at Boulud Sud, but had an hour to kill and wanted a snack first, so we stopped in at Epicerie Boulud.
The ordering system is a farce. We werent the only customers who couldnt figure out where to go on line to order, where to pick up our food/drinks, etc. The staff were unusually unhelpful, seemed to hate their jobs, and didnt even seem to recognize the names of some items on their menu. When we did get to order, we chose the Quiche Parisienne (with Jambon de Paris, gruyere, leek, mushroom & parsley, served with a side salad) and the Opera Gateau. We wanted wine, and they had a nice list posted by the glass of about a dozen choices, but they told us that none were available except the prosecco and sauvignon blanc. Really? What kind of place runs out of wine at 1pm? Then we wait, and wait. The quiche comes out. That's it. I ask about the Opera Gateau. Blank stare. Doesnt even know what it is. After talking to SEVERAL staff, someone brings out a dessert from the back fridge and cuts off a slice for us. It's not the Opera Gateau, it's the Basque Gateau. Oh sorry, they say, we dont have the Opera Gateau today and when you ordered, all I heard was "Gateau." Sigh. The wine is in little plastic cups (can't give us actual glasses?). Luckily, the Quiche is DELICIOUS, the side salad excellent, and the Basque Gateau, while not what we ordered, is lovely and lemony. It was nice sitting in the patio sipping and munching.
This place would be divine if they developed a logical, efficient ordering system, and trained the employees to know the food they are serving. Oh, and use real glasses, please.

Nice spot for casual French market food à la Daniel Boulud. I've been here a few times and it's all friendly service and fancy desserts. Lemon Yuzu Tart is perfection! Delightfully tart and sweet, the citrusy custard had whole pieces of yuzu inside. Light airy meringue sits on top and every forkful was dreamy.
