Quiche Parisienne with a side salad makes a light meal, though the last piece was a bit crumbled. It was heated up and tasted fine, but try not to come towards the end of the lunch rush. Another time the Java Chocolate Éclair had gone stale by the late afternoon. I still ate it because decadent chocolate and all, but the pastry shell was so brittle and sad. Lesson is, don't get savory or sweet pastries later in the day, even from Boulud.
Top quality Expresso and a reasonably priced breakfast sandwich on the UES!  I look forward to returning!!

A cute spot for pastries, drinks (boozy or caffeinated), lunch bites, and high quality market goods like cheeses and pate.

I stopped by on a busy Sunday morning with the brunch in front of the shop in full swing. Things were emptier though still a bit crowded inside the Épicerie but their line system moved fast and it was easy to distance from others.

There's a variety of sandwiches, salads, and pasties on display but I opted for just sweet options this time. I tried the almond croissant, original Madeline, and a chocolate tart. Every bite of each item was perfect.

The croissant was airy on the inside with a nice glaze and crisp on the outside. The sugary paste was delicious. The Madeleines were simple and classic, with a nice lemony touch and moist cake that stayed that way even the next day. The chocolate tart was so decadent. Each bite made me feel guilty because it was so rich and chocolatey. The whipped marshmallow-esque topping paired perfectly.

Finally I found authentic pate de campagne in the US. I guess I had to come to Manhattan for it. It does use liver and is not wrapped with bacon which for some reason seems to be done at many places. Then the baguette was great and Cornichons and the glass of Beaujolais.
What else could I want to be happy?

This was the only place open early in the morning that I could find other than Starbucks.  It was so busy and crowded.  There was no where to stanx.  The sandwich area was closed, so there was only two people taking orders for a crowd of people. I get up there and ask if I could order a sandwich that early and she said yes. The Vegetable Panini was $11, and The Breakfast Sandwich is 8.50 (it says $2 more if you want it on a croissant). So my total came up to $21.23. Unbelievable. These people are crazy. I go to give Ashley B $10 cash then card, and I dont know it seemed like she didnt understand what I was saying, then she said with attitude "no, we don't do that" - um I find that really hard to believe.

(They have no bathrooms FYI.  Best bet is to go to starbucks or the mall on the 2nd foor)

I walked over near the sandwich area to wait and i notice that the sandwiches are in display like starbucks pretty much. So its shipped in frozen???? Not sure. It sure wasn't worth my $23 dollars and neither was the service.

Hats off and cheers to the Chef!!  I used to pass by this restaurant because I thought it was too pricey but I have to say that their food is fabulous!  Being short on time, I stopped in for a quick, hot breakfast sandwich and it was delicious.  I just tried the hummus with little pitas, chopped olives and pickled red onion which was well worth the price.  I love this place.  My new Go-To!

Mannnnn I cannot wait to upgrade my review of this place because I love the almond croissants here. But this morning when I asked for one, I asked for a large one please, and the employees judgmental response, after looking at me up and down was: "those have a lot of sugar." Before begrudgingly ringing me up.

@management Number one tule to teach your employees- do NOT make comments about the orders of your customers, ESPECIALLY about the quantity of sugar and especially if you work at a bakery?!!!

Honestly maybe I won't come back to not deal w commentary like that again.

Our friends treated us to an entire Gateau Basque one cold early December. We sat at a table and cut large pieces and feasted, happily. It was delicious, ample, and fairly priced for such a pricy district.

Food delish. Service and ordering system is a nightmare. Really can do so much better. They don't call out by name or number. But by what was ordered which in general can get confusing when you order by description not by menu name. Or there are two similar orders. Or you order something that is in a fridge and not prepared and nobody tells you. I can go on and on about what a pain getting food for 5 was. Unnecessarily so. Food was good though. Change the system and you have my 5 stars.
Love this place, esp. for Lincoln Center events, if you cant get into Tatiana!

Just getting coffee-watched one person drop a towel on the floor then pick it up and clean the case where food is kept, then the cashier is handling money with one white glove on for "food handling"-going back and forth between food and money. Yuck!!

Very conveniently located in the Oculus building, this café had delicious food, and we found it reasonably priced for Manhattan. The service was very good, and the yogurt, croissants, and coffee that we had was exquisite.

Great little shop/bakery that was open late on a Friday night and surprisingly had great quality food! I got the beef chilli and let me tell you, this was so hot and fresh and full of flavor, I downed the entire cup in five minutes. The roof of my mouth isn't doing too well at the moment, but I can't blame anyone but myself for that. Also got the Mediterranean chickpea salad, and even though it was premade, I thought it was pretty solid. In addition, they have the absolute cutest football-themed cookies that make great presents for the sports lover in your life.

The stool seats aren't very comfortable. That was the only negative. Overall, great spot to grab a quick bite for a good price in the area.

The quality here just isn't consistent and the pastries often seem hastily/sloppily put together - one particular example I remember were tennis ball desserts for the US open where the components visibly didn't line up. I've had better luck with the full size desserts (pumpkin pie, buche de noel, lemon tart).

The croissants here are really beautiful and photogenic and indeed flaky, but I found them extremely dry and thick and did not enjoy them at all. The raspberry croissant is filled with chocolate ganache which I found pretty shocking - it tasted and felt like chocolate pudding, and was way too sweet with no raspberry flavor (the Eater article on the process of making these says they're 61% dark though). They also aren't consistent - a few months ago I got one with very little ganache but the one I got more recently was overflowing with ganache. In the same vein, the last cannelé I got here had an enormous hollow pocket that took up half of the interior - really different from the great one I had a few years ago.

The location and late hours are convenient though, and I still have a pretty high opinion of the full size desserts here (for now at least) - I'm just wary of the individual pastries.

A bit disappointed.  
I live in the neighborhood and pass by for a treat very often.  Unfortunately they've discontinued the savory scone and the Palmiers.  They are feeling less French and more like just a bakery. They have some very fancy desserts but sometimes you just want a 'grab and go' snack.  
A while ago I spotted a plastic lavender plant by the cash register...mon dieu!!

My friend ordered the restaurant week 2021 food : a cup of soup, baguette(about 1/3 size), a sandwich and a coffee macaron. Pleasantly surprised by its various tasting menu. My friend liked every food.

I only tasted half of a macaron - it was SO delicious and artisanal! I got why Boulud is so famous. The next day, I went there and bought a pack of macarons :-)

Heard the coffee is also good. I have feeling I'll be a regular from now on. It is so close from my apartment. Why haven't I tried this place earlier? So lovely a place. Oh, their staffs, all of them were very kind too!

There aren't exactly a ton of good pâtisseries that I've come across so far in NYC, which is why I was pleasantly surprised by Epicerie Boulud.

I have gone a couple of times now for light pastries in the morning and they did not disappoint. The croissant aux amandes, tarte tropézienne, and gâteau basque were all delicious and tasted fresh, and the hot chocolate was good too (also appreciated the availability of oat milk and other dairy-free alternatives.)

The service was great and quick in my experience, and the outdoor seating is great for enjoying some good quality viennoiseries and pâtisseries when the weather is nice out (they do also have heating outside.)

How does a place this good on prices exist? These are genuine French style pastries. They try hard to make it like the traditional stuff. In the traditional way. The cafe understandably gets very busy, But staff is still respectful and kind. I canceled my Amazon shipment of imported Madelines and Palmiers (pastries) now that I've found this gem!

French style food spot across from Lincoln Center; Perfect for a quick bite before or in between performances.
Their specialties go well with Breakfast, Lunch, Snacks, Lite Dinner.
Tables and window counter seating allows to be able to relax and enjoy your meal.

An Oyster Bar with Charcuterie & Cheeses, Wines by the Glass, Small Plates, and Beer. The bar has stools to be able to sit down.

An area with Sandwiches, Soups, Salads, Vegetables, Quiches, Breakfast, and Viennoiserie. To order in or take-out.

A Coffees, Teas, Hot & Cold counter, in or take-out orders.

I had the Soup & 1/2 Sandwich Combo. At $10 it's a good price for a light meal. Roasted Tomato Soup was rich and creamy. On a cold, rainy evening it hit the right spot, a good warm dish.
The Sandwich, toasted Jambon-Beurre with Gruyere Cheese. Delicious!
A bag of chips and Hot Herbal Tea rounded off the meal.

I need to go back to try the pastries.

Love their pastries! Love this place!
But the reason I write this review is Toya- the sweet girl behind the counter who always assists you with a big smile and makes you feel welcome! :-)
Nice cafe with outdoor seating option. Convenient location and good selection of pastries. Oysters are not bad either.

The service here is excellent. Attentive and caring staff who are efficient.

Had a lovely breakfast with a friend.

Great atmosphere, clean. Indoor /outdoor seating.

Delicious food. Their tomato soup and large side bread great. Friend had the veggie quiche & liked it.

Good spot to meet up for morning coffee /breakfast.

We stopped by for a coffee and a sweet treat after a beautiful evening at Lincoln Center. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I love coming here because service and food is great . They have a bar that you can hangout and have a drink. Sandwiches, pastries, coffee , baguette  pate ... exceptionally delicious!

The food is very good and their outdoor tables are beautiful and low key. Not cheap but still very reasonable when you compare other places in the area. Some people mentioned that staff people are unhelpful but I strongly disagree. They are kind and friendly.

Came by after the Lion King at the AMC a few blocks away (which, by the way - if anyone is interested in my layperson opinion - was a solid 4/5 and did justice to the original animation). Even though this was clearly a cafe with an emphasis on the pastries, I opted for the savory menu at the bar. Pretty decent flatbread, flavors from the spiced lamb felt a little toned down, but appropriate. I would give this a 3.5 if I could.

To the lady who gave me the free cheese when I was happy to pay for it, cheers and thanks ! I tried to finish the tuna sandwich... but just wasn't happy w the taste and texture.

To the "bartender/barista" who seemed to have thought it was "peasant" and rude of me to get happy hour beer a few min earlier, I'm sorry but you have a negative attitude. I also witnessed you rolling your eyes at the other lady who said the small slice of cheese was on the house. You're young, but now is the time to learn a bit of professionalism and ACTUAL hospitality.

One really quick way to get on my bad side is to serve me a poor slice of quiche--I mean, it's egg pie--can you think of a better food combination?

At any rate, the mealy, lukewarm Quiche Lorraine my wife and I ordered here was unbelievably disappointing. It was dense and and weirdly chewy and ultimately quite flavorless--just all wrong for a quiche. And did I mention they served it lukewarm? Those cold chunks of slimy ham really felt weird going down.

Coffee was acceptable and the seating options are fine--outdoor tables on broadway were a nice option. Too bad the food doesn't seem worth sitting there to enjoy.

There is nothing this place doesn't have.  Need limes for last minute late night cosmos? Fresh squeezed lime juice it is.  Need blue box mac and cheese? No problem. Milk? Laughing cow? Ice cream? Horny goat weed?

Oh yes, they have it all.

high prices. Neary twice as high as Gourmet foods at 67 th stret.My item wsd 3$ at Goirmet, 6$ here.!
Avoid this plavr with its high prices and  rude htslk!

This is the epitome of an outstanding NYC corner store. The staff working here are extremely efficient at the work they do. You'll surely be in and out quickly if that's your objective. The employees here ensure there's no hassle, account for confusion ahead of time, and provide consistent costly prices for items sold. I've always been treated with kindness, curtesy and respect while purchasing anything from Columbus Farm.

I live in the neighborhood and frequent this deli about once a day... unfortunately I will no longer give them my business. I came inside with my service dog and the man in the front during the mornings was refusing to let me purchase any items ... he was extremely rude and slightly aggressive towards me... and when I requested his manager he refused to call him. I will let EVERYONE know what happened to me. It's sad because this is a great deli please reconsider your staff. It is never okay to verbally attack somebody especially a regular patron and a woman . Shame on you .

I love this place! I live around the corner and it is my to-go place for any sort of stuff. The selection always floors me. They have even the most hard to get herbs. Very thoughtful place. Great organic stuff too. Everyone is really nice there. I go there often to support mom and pop stores!!!

5 stars from me! I'm only ever here to buy flowers but always leave impressed. Their selection is really diverse with many types I've never heard of and frequently only $5-6/bunch.  Love getting flowers here.

Tiny corner deli, which like Steven King's Needful Things happens to have everything in stock that you could need crammed into it.

On the outside, they also have a very diverse and healthy selection of fresh flowers, which are perfect for last-minute gifts on your way home.

Food is AMAZING! Cheeseburgers, turkey burgers, fries were perfect. BUT THE PANCAKES ARE THE BEST!! The place is a little small and busy, but they really keep thinks moving. Super nice staff who wants your experience to be the best.

We came once just walking in, than made sure to come again later in our trip.

I just wish they had Splenda for my coffee. They only had equal.
Friendly service, there is a bathroom, extensive menu. Seats on the inside and outside.

Emerging from the space formerly occupied by Columbus Gourmet Foods is 72nd Eatery which opened a coupe of weeks ago.  This fast casual restaurant is owned by the same people.

The interior has been wonderfully renovated to a bright spacious space.  There are plenty of seating inside and out with great views of Columbus Avenue.

Staff is so very friendly; I was greeted as soon as I walked through the doors.  Head chef, Chef Hollywood, was behind the counter the day I went for a visit and was busy chatting visitors up.  While not a lot of the food is out on display, the menu is somewhat extensive.  It boasts the usual American comfort food of burgers, sandwiches, soup, salad and heavily promotes their organic Rotisserie Chicken.  Initially, I was going to try their rotisserie chicken but saw that they had some nice salmon on display.

I ordered their Baked Salmon with 2 sides ($15.95).  For the sides, I got Sweet Corn and Mashed Potatoes with gravy.  The sides were good but clearly the salmon was the star.  It was nice and flaky with a hint of citrus.  It was cooked a little bit more well done that I usually like but I think that is because it was under the heating lamp for a while.  A pretty good dish that is filling but light.  Glad I tried it.

Will definitely be back to try their Rotisserie Chicken and other items on the menu.

I received a gift card valid for 90 days for this Eatery at 261 Columbus Avenue. It was dated July.
I went there is August, but the place refused to accept it. The response was: "We discontinued it".

Had a few egg sandwiches from this place, price changes every time, quality stays mediocre. Poor bread selection, too.

No real attention to customers, as their real business is ripping off tourists with bike rentals.

Better than in n out and five guys!

This is the best smash burger I've tried in Manhattan so far! The patty is crispy, potato bun is soft, and the sauce compliments the whole burger so well. The fries were also so crispy, just how I like it.

I ordered online, so pick up / service was fast and on time. There's no seats in there as it is a stand up and eat casual place.

Heard a lot about this place and decided to try.  It definitely has a decidedly Gen-Z (and onward) demographic, since most of the clientele were high school and college students.  On a Friday night, it was incredibly crowded, with a fairly long line and a 20-min wait.  They also don't have much seating, consisting of a few small 2-seater outdoor tables, so be prepared to stand or share tables while you eat.  

As for the food, it's quite affordable ... for good reason.  The burgers are tiny, barely larger than sliders.  They're also no-frills - you're not getting arugula, truffle fries, and ciabatta buns here.  A 4 inch beef patty, a pickle, a lettuce slice, sauce, and a flattened, sad-looking bun.  That's what you're getting for $6-8. I'm really not a big eater, but I still felt pretty hungry after wolfing down my burger (in about 6 bites).

That being said, the burger was quite pleasant and much better than expected.  It's definitely a "SpongeBob" experience where quality reigns supreme over quantity, and looks aren't what they seem.  If only it were double the size, I think I'd be more inclined to pay double the price for it.  My favorite were the spicy loaded fries.  They were delicious and absolutely worth the price.

Overall, I'd definitely return again (maybe during a less busy time, and maybe when I'm not especially hungry).

Not the warmest welcome awaits you at this super tiny location, where a small bench is all you have as a sitting option. Hence, come here for take out. No restrooms available.

Burgers are average. I think what makes people come back is the amount of sauce they put, which can make an ok burger taste like a good one. Still, I think that $9.50 for a small double cheeseburger is a bit much for the quality you get. I wouldn't come back anytime soon.

One of the best smash burgers in nyc. Great to stop in for a quick burger and a Mexican Coke. Moderately priced and quick service keep me coming back, Martin's potato buns are a must on smash burgers and 7th st does it right.

HIT THE SPOT

omg I was craving a good burger.

Frankly while it's a burger it's easy to mess up with dry flavorless beef most are meh

I wasn't sure what to expect but I really wanted a burger. This was amazing ascetically not commercial perfect but the taste was really on point.  I ordered a cheeseburger and fries. I really can't believe how good this was. Cheese, onions, ketchup really good and the bun was also good. I'm just sorry it took me so long to try this spot.

To start...the workers were nice and polite.

I ordered the double cheeseburger and it was so juicy and tasty. The loaded fries were plentiful..they do not skimp out.

I was so full after my meal and will be going back! I def recommend this place to everyone thinking about going here. The only "con" is that there is no indoor seating but you can take it to go or find a place nearby to sit.

This place is a must if you want a good burger and fries for an affordable price. Every other place we looked at was extremely expensive for a burger and fries, but this place was great. It's a very small establishment, but don't let that fool you, it's a great burger and I loved the fries so much. They have some of the best fried I've eaten. There's only one table to sit at and the other tables are standing tables only.

The employees were friendly and the food was fresh and hot when it came out. They have a big bucket of ketchup at the tables.
Not a lot of seating. Definitely good burgers for the price. Fries are good. Service busy a little slow but good.  No nonsense CB classic burger joint.

I asked my friend for recommendations for cheap eats on my New York trip, and she said this would be her "death row meal". I ordered a simple cheeseburger and it did NOT disappoint. There's no seating tho, so if you had been standing/walking for the past four hours, this place will nourish your stomach but not your tired feet

Not my favorite location but a 7th street grease bomb through and through!

The fries were drenched in salt which was a big upset but the burger sort of needed it, I just smothered everything in pickles from the fridge when I got home and wished I had more meat and cheese to put in my mouth.  So, I suppose they're still pretty damn good, huh?

Love 7th street burger. I hate the greasy roll. I hate the presentation of the whole thing but holy Toledo it's all so delicious! I get the double, it's perfection. The roll and burger,onion, cheese and sauce all meld together to form a slippery, finger curling, don't wanna put down piece of awesomeness. So good

I continue to frequent this place as they have some of the best smash burgers in the city for the value.

They always make fresh burgers and have absolutely excellent fries.

Their burgers are super crispy and the cheese and sautéed onions. Aiko on top of it are excellent. I especially like that they include pickles on their burger as well for a nice vinegar crunch.

Now, for the fries, those fries might be the best Fries I've ever had. They easily have to double fry them up or fry them in a special oil to get them that crispy, that well seasoned, and that amazing.

Hospital always, they have Coke in a glass bottle. You cannot convince me that there is any better version of Coke then in a glass. Such a perfect meal as always.

Every one of their locations are spot on accurate with their order and quality control is there.

7th Street Burger has been top on my list of places to try for a hot minute. I've seen people raving about it on Tiktok and noticed more and more of these popping up around the city. 7th street burger has a very simple meny similar to In-n-out making their service fast and delicious each time.

When I arrived in the staff was friendly and helped me make a decision on if I wanted a single patty or a double. I'm glad that I went with the double because once smashed they burgers get tiny.

The food came out quickly and as I took my first bite I was pleased with the burger mostly because of the house sauce and the bunnnn! So soft. So yummy. My only concern was the burger was very oily, so much that the wrapper was soaked when I went to eat it. I'm not sure if the burger still would've been good if I'd commuted with it and didn't eat it immediately. The fries were salted well and crispy... LOVED THEM!

I could definitely see myself eating this after a night out... good thing they're open late.

The location was good! I had a regular cheeseburger and fries. The I really enjoyed the fries. They had a good consistency. Not too airy but not to dense or cakey. The kind you get sad when you run out of. I liked the burger. I think the double cheeseburger would be my go to next time. I think having that little extra will make a difference. LOVE that they had orange soda as a drink option. You know I had to cop that.

It's a good spot for a little cheat day on your diet.

Was invited here as part of a Yelp Elite event. We ordered two of their double cheese burgers, fries, and Mexican cokes.

The burgers and fries were delicious, and loved the decor and space as well. It's much more spacious from some of the other 7th Street Burger locations in the city.

Staff were friendly and prompt, and would definitely come back here again!

Finally the UWS gets what it has long needed, Manhattan's bestest burgers within walking distance, 7th Street Burger.

The hippest of the hippest already know of the famed burger joint, which is a fan-fave in other parts of the city for awhile now. Named for its original location in the East Village that instantly gained a huge following before it became a TikTok sensation.

7th Street Burger it's a stand out on Amsterdam Ave and 80th Street where it is a refreshing treat among the bougie eateries, many of which can't hold a candle to the trendy and deliciousness that is 7SB.

What sets 7SB apart from all the wannabe fast food places that serve burgers among its offerings is that 7SB focuses on one thing and one thing only which is making burgers. It doesn't try to do 100 different things okay. It simply stays the course (pun intended) and gives 100 percent to making absolutely the best tasting burger in the city. That's no small feat. There are many that try to do this, but only a few succeed; and none do it as good or as scrumptiously as the people here.

Warning: Once you've put one of their double cheeseburgers to your lips, your lips will quivering from the taste of those bad boys; they are so packed with flavor. More often than not I find it better to order a couple because it's one of those things you can't get enough of. They are addicting in the best possible way. And for the late night crowd, OMFG, it's the thing you didn't know you needed but will be so glad you found to satisfy that craving.

There's a reason why 7SB has become so popular and opening up new locations throughout the city.

Welcome to the 'hood 7th Street!!

Better than Shake Shack and In-N-Out. Food came out so fast. Double cheese burger was messy but crazy good. Soft, thin, and buttery buns, juicy but not overly salty patties, COOKED onions, flavourful pickles, acidic mayos...it's the melts-in-your-mouth best thing. Out of this world. Must try.

So this fast food place has excellent service! Quick friendly and made ordering easy. The burger was good. I ordered a double impossible cheeseburger and it was small for $12.00. It tasted gooey from the cheese which I liked a lot. Would go back but compared to Bareburger not as good much smaller.

Excellent service

Super friendly staff

Busy, but quick and efficient

Delicious food!!!! Definitely try if you're in the area! Plus they're open til 3am.

This was my second time trying 7th Street burger (first was in the Greenwich Village Location on MacDougall), and I was still blown away (consistently delicious and filling smash burger). The value is a steal - with such a reasonable priced burger and fries (especially for NYC) that is also very tasty and will satisfy the largest smash burger craving.

What I really liked about this location in particular, was that the operation seemed super efficient (we got there with a pretty long line, but ended up getting our food well within the 15 min estimated window) and the folks working at the counter were super friendly! They helped us with questions and gave us recommendations on how much / what we should order based on our hunger levels.

Will definitely be back again next time I'm in the neighborhood!

Wow! Bomb burger for a bomb price. You can get 2 burgers, 2 fries and 2 drinks all for $25. For UWS prices, that's a deal.

The burger itself was sublime. I simple, no fuss burger with a punch of flavor. Add a side of delicious Fries and you've got yourself the perfect weekend dinner.

The service was fast, they were very crowded and cranking out orders.

Highly recommended.

These burgers are just sooo amazing. I got a double with everything on it, it was pure happiness! I also grabbed an order of fries which I love that they season with salt and pepper - most places don't put pepper.

There are spots to eat inside, 2 small standing tables and some benches at the front. I like to eat my burgers while they are fresh so appreciate that they have space to do so!

Standard 7th street burger experience - yummy food.

I came here on a Friday afternoon and it was quite busy. There were about 4-5 people in front of me with delivery drivers coming and going, so the food took about 15 minutes to come out.

I got the double cheeseburger along with the beef fries and both were so amazing. The burger is really consistent. If you've had 7th st burger at other locations, the food you'll have here is completely the same.

The beef fries are always my go to. They're the perfect amount of creaminess from the cheese/sauce and the patty on top adds another dimension. If you eat the fries right when you get it, the texture is super crispy, which pairs well with the toppings.

Overall, I love 7th st burger and would definitely be back

I would visit here just for their fries and their IMPOSSIBLE burgers. They also have an IMPOSSIBLE loaded fries.

I wish the place had more tables to put our food on but it gets pretty crowded and they just have two tables.

Love it how they have bottle openers attached to the walls.

7th Street Burger is hands down the best burger joint in NYC. And this new location is on par with the two I've been to in Lower Manhattan.

There are standing bars to eat at, which is better dining space than the other locations.

Cashier was friendly.

Double cheeseburger and chopped beef fries were both solid.

Note: ate here as part of a Yelp Elite event.
Quick & yummy smashed burgers. The fries are ok but I really love the coke in a bottle.

7th Street Burger is my go-to location for burger and fries. Their menu never disappoints. I'm so happy I got the chance to visit for National Burger Day. I had their double cheeseburger with loaded fries; its my favorite choice of combination

The burgers  are simple but oh so flavorful. Stopped in after a day @ AMNH and I'm so glad I did. The chopped onions and sauce go well together. I also like that the burgers are a bit smashed. I was surprised that  the  fries were also really good; crispy and not overly oily. I got the Mexican coke too. Lastly, I took off a star because the place was so hot & stuffy that it took away from the experience. We ate outside on some fold up chairs and shaky tables they have set up. However, those were a amazing in comparison to eating inside  The staff were neutral in their approach. I wouldn't say they were friendly or left me wanting to come back. However, they weren't rude. I'd def try another location. I love a good burger!!!!!!

In the last few years, 7th Street Burger has taken NYC by storm. New locations are popping up like smoke shops in the newly decriminalized haze. This location on the UWS is now the SEVENTH 7th Street Burger in the city. That's a location for each Harry Potter book, ancient wonder of the world, or deadly sin. Speaking of, let's talk about gluttony.

These are beautiful, archetypal, NYC-style smash burgers. Like our apartments and savings accounts, NYC-style smash burgers tend to be smaller and thinner than those found elsewhere.

The burgers are compromised of high quality beef with just the right amount of fat (and in the right place--your mouth). The grilled onions and pickle complement the juiciness of the meat, and the potato bun sponges up the drippings well. You might want to grab some extra napkins.

The menu offers no distractions. You're here for a burger and fries with a coke. The simplicity is refreshing, though speaking of refreshments, I did run across the street to buy a diet soda from elsewhere. The glass bottle coke from here tastes better, but diet soda preserves my delusions that I am a healthy person. And makes it easier to justify coming back here again next week.

The loaded fries here are alone a reason to come back. The burgers are affordable and delicious but the loaded fries have a whole cut up burger on them! So so so great! The menu is small so it is easy to order and service is pretty quick. There isn't a a lot of sitting but still 100% worth trying!

It's ya average burger spot.
Ummmmm the smash patty was very thin so I see why you would order the double vs the single.

The fries were freaking AMAZING hands down the best thing on the menu. I missed out on the chopped cheese fries but next time.
The customer service is on point and energetic at this location.

loved 7th street burger from my previous experience at their EV location but this one was just ok...

we got the burgers (single and double), fries, and the chopped beef fries. the chopped beef fries, which is a whole patty, topped with their secret sauce, grilled onions, and served on a bed of fries. it was kinda amazing. but all the beef patties were soooo salty, super heavy on my palette, and it made it really hard to enjoy them.

possibly a one-off situation but i will definitely stick to the EV location.

Don't walk, RUN to this awesome east side establishment. UWS now has a 7th St Burger and it's so amaze. Husband and I were doing a pub crawl and why not add in a stop here! Perfectly located around all of the great UWS bars on Amsterdam. Counter help was sufficient and friendly-ish but didn't matter. Stand up tables and clean interior. Will most absolutely be returning!
Nothing compares to a burger that smells like pig sh*t sandwiched between two filthy, gym sock sweat buns!

This place is completely worth it. Got two cheeseburgers with everything on them. Burgers are perfect size, taste great, and affordable.

I didn't get fries, but from what I saw they looked good.

More importantly, whether you need a late night hangover prevention meal, or a normal day-time meal, you can eat these burgers and feel great afterwards.

They "ran out of bread" and closed at 8pm. On a Sunday. How y'all ran out of bread the first day of the week? Judging from the other reviews saying the same thing, seems like an intentional issue.

Tip: Buy more bread and keep that shit in stock.

This place is SLAMMIN! It's no wonder they keep adding more locations across the city. The concept is simple with only a few options to chose from but they do it right! Ask for the crazy fries and prepare to have your mind and your arteries blown! The burgers are delish thin smash burger style and again the fries - NEXT LEVEL! This puts in and out to shame and I stand by that.

What 5 Guys Used to Be. Awesome burger spot. The epitome of a BURGER JOINT. In and out service with great speed and quality. You can grab a great burger at a more than fair price -- none of the hoopla all of the savory satisfaction.

Kind of small space, can fit maybe 10-15 ppl. One of those guilty pleasure burgers out there. One person takes your order while ppl are putting them together in the back. Friendly staff. Got the cheeseburger ~$6.50 and fries $4. These are pricier and a bit greasy, and unfortunately the fries were oversalted for mine. Pricier but I do appreciate they try to keep the menu and ingredients simple to let the smash burger patty shine. Very juicy, but still would prefer less grease. Overall not bad tho.

Such a solid spot! Honestly, I think this is my new favorite smash burger joint in New York and it's just steps outside my apartment! Lucky me. It's a tiny place with no sitting room; best to get them to-go. The menu is simple: just fries, single or double burgers, and drinks. They also have impossible burgers. Fries are perfectly crispy, burgers perfectly greasy. Staff is very nice. Not much else to say - 5 stars!

7th st burger hit the spot!! simple, delicious burger and fries with delicious sauce, YUMM!! Since this is designed as more of a quick on the go dinner spot, I wished the food didn't take so long to come out, we waited around 15-20 minutes for our burgers. The menu is very limited but all you need for a classic burger meal. Will be back

Yelp listing has it open til 10pm but it was definitely closed at 9pm.  Website conveniently does not list any store hours.

Wasted time, energy and money trying to visit this location.

I have been waiting for a 7th Street Burger to open up on the west side!

They have some of the best smashed burgers I have had in the city. The staff is extremely friendly and my food came out way more quickly than I had expected.

Unfortunately there isn't much seating and it's definitely a grab and go spot. However, they are open really late (3am!) which is super convenient if you find yourself hungry coming back from a fun night out. Overall highly recommend

The menu is simple and to the point. Their burgers are INCREDIBLE!!! Super no frills and wouldn't want it any other way. The people were so incredibly nice as well! But the BURGER !!! Wow I don't really like burgers but let me tell you, this place was DELISH
Great fries and burger! The loaded fries are definitely the way to go. Service was quick and the staff were friendly

Came to the Upper West Side location for National Burger Day! I have been to this and other locations for other events and I have to say the quality and price has been consistent every time. Probably the best smash burger I have had in NYC. The burgers were cooked to perfection with cheese and their signature sauce. The fries were crispy and just the right temperature upon getting home. Love the bottled sodas available too. The fact it took less than 5 minutes to get my order of 2 burgers, fries and drinks is amazing. Loved the speed, something a certain burger shack has failed to provide me countless times... 7th Street Burger shows what happens when you have a minimal menu and focus on flavor and classic quality over trends or fancy dishes.

Like all 7th Street Burger locations, this UWS hub has limited seating and a barebones menu. But, their burgers are absolutely phenomenal. Smashed, the outer crust gets super crispy and all the fat and flavor simply ooze out onto their soft buns making this a greasy delight. This is not a meal for the weak-hearted. Make sure to grab a Mexican Sprite to wash everything down after too.

My kid is a tough critic and they said this cheeseburger is better than McDonald's! I don't eat meat but this was also hands down the best veggie burger I have ever had. And the fries are great too. We live in CA and are hoping we can find this chain there, because YUM. We will def be back next time we are in NYC too. It's not a nice sit down place but great burgers, great buns, delicious fries and excellent service too.

Add some veggies, and it's the closest thing to In n out on the east coast.

Solid burgers, delicious fries! Can't go wrong. Loaded fries are def loaded and perfect for sharing! Limited seating, but good vibes.

No frill burger and fry joint. The food is tasty and the service was quick and friendly. Not a lot of seating in this place but don't let that keep you from visiting.

My only regret... I should have got the double cheeseburger instead of the single. Foolish mistake I will not make again.

One of the best Thai food. We had order thai fried rice, spring rolls,  wings, Tom Yum soup and drunken noodles. Everything was so good and kids loved it since it was not spicy.  I highly recommend this place.

Good takeout Thai food for a good price.
It's my go-to spot for when I'm craving some Thai curry or noodles fast.
The staff is always super sweet too!!

So thoroughly confused by the good reviews... I ordered the rice box and the food quality was absolutely atrocious. The chicken was completely unseasoned, and some pieces were so rubbery they were completely inedible.

Unlike every other restaurant in the world, when you order curry here the protein isn't cooked in the sauce, but presented dry and unseasoned with a side of sauce for you to add on. By that time, though, it is far too late for the protein to acquire any flavor (or moisture) from the sauce.

Unless their regular chef skipped town, or there's a lot of fake ratings, I can not reconcile the 5 star reviews on this page with the awful food I was served. This has to be one of the worst meals I've ever eaten in New York City.

Ahhhhh!! This is the only place that prepares my lunch in less than 15 minutes and always makes it perfect. I need consistency in my life and the service is excellent. I really enjoy the basil fried rice and I choose a different protein each time. I always add a creamy Tom Yum soup and I can't skip the Thai tea. This place is just perfect all around!!

I really wanted to like this place, not sure if it was because I went very close to closing time but my food was very bland. The crab ragoon was okay, the chicken pad see ew lacked flavor and the wings were okay as well. The workers seemed very nice , maybe I'll consider giving it another try earlier in the day.

Hidden gems!!!! Please try this small restauran if you have a chance. It's a little reclusive in a non touristic area, but the food is excellent.
We ordered fried chicken wings, Crab Rangoon, pineapple tied rice, rice box of Massaman chicken curry, roti matcha and Thai tea.
Chicken wings: flavorful 5 spices deep fried, super crunchy.
Crab Rangoon: no so crunchy. Can be better.
Pineapple fried rice: no too oily, simple but tasty. We ordered it with slow cooked beef (very similar to Chinese stewed beef). It comes with a lot of onion, if you don't like it let the staff know.
Rice box Massaman chicken rice:  the curry has a very balanced flavor, sweet and mild spicy level.
Roti matcha: regular roti with the sweet matcha sauce ( I like matcha so I like this a lot)
Thai tea: made by the restaurant. Medium sweetness but very smooth and milky.

Overall very good Thai comfort food. Nothing fancy but just make you feel better in a cold day.

* We were too hungry to remember to take pictures. These are taken after we finished the food.

The food was so bad Almost poisonous to me. I hate one bite and immediately it was the most disgusting food I've ever ever tasted my mommy try their pot see you and it was just so bland so salty at so much sodium. She almost  died of a heart attack. Never go here. Save your money these reviews have to be fake like this is not good for you. This is crap.

Definitely a hidden gem of a spot where you can find great staff and thai food. Upon entering they were super nice and very welcoming. I got the pad thai for dinner to go. The chicken was not dry or tough at all. The noodles itself were flavorful and had a good amount. They leave the crushed peanuts on the side in a little bag which you can add yourself which is considerate for those who may have peanut allergies. They were very receptive to any requests I asked of. Menu is very simple and on the limited side but that's when you know the quality will be on the better end. Definitely found one of my go to spots for something simple thai food and to support a local business in the lower east side.

7 Elephants is definitely a hidden gem located between Chinatown and LES. It's well-decorated with vintage & industrial furniture and combined perfectly with the poriginal buildings.

The options on the menu are limited but decent enough for a comforting quick-fix when we are craving for Thai food as a weekday lunch. We got 2 appetizers, Chicken Satay ($7.95) & Crab Rangoon ($5.95) and 2 Entrees, Drunken Noodles with Beef ($13.95) & Green Curry Rice Box with Salmon ($13.95). The price varies with different entrees.

We were impressed with its portion and the reasonable price. The portion of each is more than enough to share between two people. We ended up doing a to-go for our Rice Box and Chicken Satay.

The food was overall delicious, especially the Crab Rangoon. The filling is made with cream cheese & imitate crab meat, which is super creamy and satisfying with special sauce. We also love their salmon, which was juicy and perfect with rich & flavorful green curry.

The owners were friendly and passionate about their food, and introduced their menu in details. We had a great experience and will definitely try other entrees next time.

Tried this new addition to the LES/Chinatown Area.
Very friendly staffs. Huge portion with affordable price.

The liking:

Matcha Roti dessert- LOVE this combination. Never thought they would be a perfect match.

Green Curry- very flavorful Green Curry (not water down like many places) also spicy enough!

Creamy Tom Yum with Chewy Tofu - delicious and the chewy tofu is interesting. I quite like it.

The soso:

Pad See Ew with Beef - the beef was great and generous amount. The whole portion was huge but almost too huge that the noodle doesn't have enough flavor so sadly it becomes quite bland.

I'd def come back for the roti and try other curry.

Curry Roll- little confused about this as I didn't think there's really curry flavor.
My office got catered lunch from here and everyone was raving. I had the chicken basil rice and it was the best basil rice dish i've had in many many years. Highly recommended!

I walk past this place everyday and was very excited to finally see this place open. It's not common to see restaurants opening during tough times in the middle of a pandemic while others are closing.

The menu is very easy to follow. All entrees are 11.95 or 13.95 depending on the protein of your choice. You can either get a rice box or a fried noodle. My husband and I both box the chicken rice box. He picked the basil sauce with plain pad Thai and broccoli. The sauce was not too salty and had a kick of spice from the jalapeño. I picked the massaman curry with broccoli and mushroom. They give you enough sauce which is enough for you to save the leftover sauce for another meal. The massaman curry was creamy and flavorful, perfect when mixed with rice. Originally, I thought this would be a buffet style place but it's actually made to order. It was about a 10 mins wait for my food. Since they're doing a soft opening promotion, you get a Thai ice tea or coffee with every entree! The food was still good after a 10 min walk bringing it home in 20 degree weather.

The lady that served me was super nice and sweet. Possibly the owner. I would definitely order from them again. We need to support local business especially during these times.
Great food and super friendly shop owners!!  Great vibes and a good selection of gluten free options.

Worst Pad See Ew I've ever had. Instead of Chinese Broccoli -- I mean they're in Chinatown -- , they used regular broccoli. Beef came in a big chunk instead of thin slice. I'm not sure what they're trying to recreate. Chicken with Garlic Sauce was sliced chicken with some roasted garlic over rice with omelette side and bland mushrooms. Garlic sauce was packed separately and was so salty! I've never had Thai food served like this. I don't see why they had such high ratings....guess the people in this neighborhood don't know any better.

Emily from 7 Elephants reached out to me to apologize about my dissatisfaction with my Pad See Ew order and promised to do better next time. She even gave me a refund without me asking! The customer service is excellent, I would go ahead and give them another try.

Stopped by for a quick lunch. Picked up the pad thai with tofu. The tofu was extremely chewy, almost mimicking meat so it's a great alternative for vegans or vegetarians. The pad thai itself was delicious and tasted very authentic. We ate in the store, but the restaurant is more of an order-to-go.

5/5 Really delicious Thai food at great prices. Service was friendly and fast. Give it a try if you're in the area and want a quick, satisfying lunch!

We needed a place to grab a light bite before we went to the Van Gogh exhibit. 7 Elephants was perfect! We ordered two appetizers, fried gyoza and chicken satay! Both were plentiful, served hot and delicious! I wish I had enough time to enjoy a full lunch... price was right and it sounded yummy! I came back later to grab a bottle of their Thai iced coffee, sweetened, but not too sweet, so good! The place is a small place, you might miss it if you blink! They did have a table or two for outside seating. Check it out!

Ordered the family special on the app clubfeast and was slightly disappointed in the order. The pad thai became extremely sour as you continued eating it and the two chicken dishes lacked chicken. In addition the fried rice didn't really taste like anything special.

Great spot. Tiny but the food is amazing! I had the pad see ew and my partner the pad Thai and both were amazing. I would definitely return and make the trip. The worker who helped us was attentive and warm. Pad see ew was savory fresh and flavorful. Best one I've had in a while.
Delicious food (picky friend approved), quick and friendly service, and good prices too! The roti is incredible, and the Thai ice tea is a favorite at my office too!

For $13, the meals here are very filling. I got the massaman curry with stir fried broccoli and stir fried mushrooms, and I enjoyed having leftovers as the portion was large. I walked in and it was made fairly quickly with very polite service. This restaurant is a splendid addition to the neighborhood.

We stopped by to try this latest LES addition and ordered a pad see ew and drunken noodle and some Thai iced tea.

While I wasn't blown away by the food, it did have generous portions. The recipes seemed simple and a bit uninspired. With their current price point, I'd definitely like to see them step it up and experiment with fine-tuning their flavors a bit more. I hope the business takes it to the next level.

Decent. Not mind-blowing. Got the chewy tofu pad Thai and 5 pc crab Rangoon. Chewy tofu is a good idea in terms of not serving spoiled tofu Bc it keeps longer but it really doesn't take up any flavor in the cooking process, so it just tastes like you're eating soy/gluten. Huge portions for the price. Crab Rangoon was good- small delicate pieces. I like that the sweet and sour sauce isn't the usual gelatinous bright red goo some places give. Food did the job and filled me up. Will probably get it again when i crave Thai but don't want to walk to farther locations that have better quality.

Just discovered this hidden gem in lower east side. This was my first time at 7-elephants and it was absolutely amazing!

I ordered chicken with red curry sauce, white rice plus mushrooms and broccoli on the side and my husband ordered slow cook beef with white rice and same side order for takeout. Both sauces were delicious and unique. We loved the mushrooms so much. Their Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee were perfect compliments to the food.

The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The food is reasonably priced as well, highly recommend a visit.

My friend and I stumbled upon this hidden gem and were so pleasantly surprised! We were looking for a very quick and small meal so we ordered dumplings and spring rolls, and they were delicious. Also, the people at the restaurant were so friendly and nice :) I will definitely be back and this time will order an entire entree and Thai iced tea as well!

7 elephants is a new Thai place on the LES.
Lovely and welcoming staff, ordered to go. Curry sauce is amazing. We had green and red curry. I'm also obsessed with the eryngii mushrooms. Will be back to try other flavors :)

I got the drunken noodles with tofu. The tofu was surprisingly sweet and chewy. I liked the jalapeños that added a little kick to the dish. A good option for when you're craving Thai food and just want some quick takeout.
Owner is very welcoming. Food was delicious and brought out in a timely manner. The drunken noodle was very good. I would also recommend the Thai tea. Not too sweet and very refreshing.

This is the sort of place that you can't help having regrets. Immediately I had regrets about Ordering the curry with tofu and hoping not to experience food poisoning later.  For such a cute little spot,  I really was expecting better. Chewy tofu was sour. Curry was too plain just coconut milk and green curry paste. Omelette was too salty. Ingredients were not fresh nor complementary to the meal.

So happy to see this new Thai restaurant in the neighborhood. The portions are filling and the price is good- all the dishes are under 15 bucks.

The place is meant to be more of a grab and go - and good for a quick lunch or dinner. They have a fridge full of their pre-made Thai ice tea and Thai coffee in cute bottles. For pre-made tea  it was sooo good!! I'm so picky about Thai ice tea and this was super creamy and sweet.

For appetizers I got the crab Rangoon, satay, and curry rolls. Again everything so flavorful - love the crab Rangoons with the sweet yet spicy sauce. The satay was full of flavor and loved dipping it in peanut sauce.  The curry rolls were so unique - it was like a cross between a curry puff and a spring roll.  

For entrees I tried the pad Thai and the portions are so generous, it was filled to the brim, could barely finish it. I had it with the chewy tofu it's def an interesting texture and taste- my husband really like it.  When you order curry - it is accompanied with a rice box. The owners stated that in Thailand it's very common for people to have a rice box with protein,  side of veggies, and curry to dip for lunch. It was cute almost reminded me of a bento box. I got the green curry - again flavors were so good and blew me away and I couldn't stop sprinkling it over my rice.

Overall everything is amazing and the owners (husband and wife that work there) are super sweet. I am totally coming back to try more food .
Nice spot to quickly pick up some lunch or dinner. I've gotten the pad see ew and the drunken noodles... pretty decent portions and always a friendly staff.

Very Delicious and authentic Thai food for a great price. The owners are from Bangkok and are super friendly lovely people who provide a great service. I had the green curry, chicken satay and pad Thai and it was all delicious. Would leave 10 stars if I could

BUYER BEWARE. I love Thai food. Even mediocre Thai hits the spot. But this is NOT Thai food. It's below average cafeteria Chinese bargain food that calls itself Thai. (Not to ding Chinese food--I love it, and we great ones in the neighborhood.)
I ordered the Chicken Massaman and the Basil Tofu yesterday delivery from Uber Eats. :(
On the plus side, it was delivered super fast with a free huge Thai iced tea.
Upon opening the containers, which are huge and plastic, I see a ton of white rice with a good amount of bland-looking what I assumed was sauteed slices of chicken on it. No nothing else sauteed with the chicken. The rice was not jasmine rice (which is what Thai restaurants give you) but overcooked white short grain rice.
Ends up the "Massaman" sauce came in another plastic take out container. Just a brown sauce/liquid. No visible garlic, onion, or other Thai ingredients.
On the side were huge tough sliced "mushrooms"--like the cheap "king oyster" you get at a Chinese market. I will you spare you the details, but they are not what most of us expect "mushrooms" to be like. They take a lot of chewing to get down. And barely any seasoning.
My side of broccoli was OK. But nothing to write home about.
Same exact experience with "Basil sauce." It resembled nothing like was I would expect a Thai basil dish to be like.
I don't know what this establishment is trying to pull, but its food is worth about $4.95 (I am being generous.), not the over $10 they charge.
I think you could wander randomly into any establishment in Chinatown and get better food than this. There's a great vegan Thai restaurant just a block away. Of course, we have some other outstanding restaurants on East Broadway and of course Clinton Street that would blow your socks off.

I hate to ding a restaurant during these tough covid times, but with the
quality of the food, I'm not sure they're employing anyone who knows how to cook. No one here is taking pride in the food they're making.
The 7 Elephants logo is nice, but that's about it.
Drunken noodles with beef. The beef was really tender and the noodles was flavorful but after a while you dont really crave for it that much for some reasoning. But its good netherless.
Typically will order the Pad see ew and chicken wings for weekday dinner.  Both dishes taste great.  Really friendly service here as well!

These guys are the nicest team, and their food is so good. It's always hot and humongous portions. My new neighborhood thai spot for sure.

BIG fan of the basil fried rice and pad thai!

this place is brand new to the neighborhood and they are super nice and friendly.  The food is pretty simple but thats what i love about it
its simple and delicious everytime
i recommend the beef there
its different than the usually type of beef you get from takeout places
they slow cook their beef so its melt in your mouth soft!

simple menu but everything was good on it!

I was pretty disappointed by this place. It is not authentic Thai food by any means, so let's just level set the expectations starting there.

Curry sauces - good, average tasting. Not great but not offensive.

Tom Yum soup - I don't even know how on earth they thought they could call it by this name. Tom Yum soup is supposed a combination of hot, sour, tangy, and sweet. This soup was the right color, but it's the wrong taste. It was flavorless broth, did not hit any of the notes it was supposed to. Very sad.

Plain white rice - overcooked and mushy.

Broccoli side - large cuts of broccoli that are hard to eat in one bite, and slightly undercooked before being stir fried to death in sauce.

Mushroom side - large slices of mushroom cooked in sauce. It was okay. Nothing special.

Salmon - I got two pieces of salmon. One was pan fried. The other one was pan fried with some kind of batter or egg? Was this on purpose? Was I not supposed to get two pieces of salmon that looked the same and had the same texture? Mysteries.

Beef - with garlic soy sauce. Flavor was okay, but the beef was overly fatty and no balance in texture and flavor. Only took a few bites and couldn't finish.

Tofu - squishy and mushy. They call it "chewy".

Best new Thai in the neighborhood! Been here a Number of times and the food does not disappoint! The curries are flavorful and have great side dish options. The Thai tea and coffee are also great for on the go. Definitely recommend trying this place.

This is a small Thai restaurant that has a simple menu.  I like that because looking at a huge menu can be overwhelming.   Personally I like all their appetizers- curry rolls, chicken satay, spring rolls, gyoza - all delish.  The fried rice dishes have to much black pepper for me.  I have to try the noodles dishes next.  The customer service is always friendly.
So glad this spot opened during this time, excellent quality, consistently delicious pad thai, would recommend if you're looking for a good take out option!

Is this even Thai food? It's what you'd expect to get for $2 per dish at a street fair. Very disappointing. Traditional chicken in green curry is supposed to have vegetables in it. Not a side of one vegetable. The pad Thai was similarly barren. I don't get how this place has 4.5 stars. Yelpers, help me out here.

Walking by to get to the Subway. The curry was delicious. My daughter had the iced tea and that was delicious. The staff was very polite. I am so glad I stopped in to grab a bite. I would highly recommend grabbing food from 7 Elephants.

I was skeptical when I saw the place, but since we had 4 little hungry kids, we had to give it a try. The waitress was very friendly and helped us to move the outdoor tables and chairs so we could all sit together. We ordered pad thai, fried rice, drunken noodles , and spring rolls. The flavor were all surprisingly good! All the kiddos enjoyed their food as well as adults. I'll stop by again when I'm in the neighborhood.

Was desperately looking for a place to get a late dinner after finishing up on a cruise near the piers and was just about to give up but this place caught my eye! Luckily i went in and it looked all so appetizing. I got the basil fried rice with chewy tofu and it's been a serious obsession. I constantly crave this meal and for its cost it has great portion sizes! The chewy tofu is something i'd never had before because the texture is just out of this world for me. I've ordered here again a bit later and tried their spring rolls which were amazing and the Matcha roti was so so good. The thai tea is so delicious too! I live in brooklyn but will make the travel just to get takeout from here!

I will be ordering from these guys again tomorrow to share with others since it is so good! Tried out their Thai tea and pad see ew with beef.  The noodles in the pad see ew were yummy. Silky and packed with flavor, a bit on the sweet side. It had a healthy portion of braised beef that I shredded to incorporate better. The Thai tea came chilled, no ice and in its own sealed bottle, pretty neat!

I love this place! It has become a regular lunch spot for me and my family. I got the rice box with chewy tofu and massaman curry, plain pad thai, and the mushrooms. The massaman curry is peanuty and creamy and went really well with the rice and tofu. The owners of the restaurant are so sweet and thoughtful. We sat outside in their little seating area and they brought us complimentary spring rolls which were very good as well! I will most definitely be coming back and bringing some friends too!

This local Thai spot just opened up in my neighborhood. The owners, this lovely Thai couple, are there cooking and serving. Instead of a traditional take on Thai food, it is a modern twist that makes for great comfort food. I loved the peanutty, sweet, Massaman curry thats not spicy. I got it with the chewy tofu that had a great texture and bite. The curry was delicious.
Outstanding service. Congratulations and keep up the hard work  The lady who is in charge and her stuff is polite and amazing. God bless them all.

Delicious. We ordered chicken pad see ew, chicken massaman curry, spring rolls and gyozas. Great portions for 2 adults and 2 kids. We ordered online and picked up the order in 20 minutes. There's a soft launch special - free Thai tea/coffee per entree.

The owner was friendly and welcoming.
The egg and cheese on a roll here by the morning dude is sooo good, I believe it's $4 now, doesn't even need ketchup. They're a small deli but they have everything you need and an atm.

So for the past 5 weeks, I would go to this deli and spend between $35-$36 each day in the mornings and sometimes in the afternoon. Just off my morning visit for a week I was spending $175. On the first visit, I so signs up such as no cell phone use, no pictures, and Don't give your order until the worker asks. Not very professional but I brushed it off and tried to understand the reasoning. I respectfully asked if I could take a picture of a bag of chips I had never seen before and the worker that prepared the food said sure. I explained why I was asking because of the posted signs. For most of my visits, the guy making the food seemed okay. The guy ringing up the food was okay. Each time I came I was respectful and patient. One time a different guy made my sandwich and it was way too salted. I brushed it off. I brush off the duct tape on the ceiling right above your head when you order. I tried my hardest to brush off the big fly that was in the case with the food toppings. (This seems like the reason they Don't want customers taking pictures). I continued to go because my daughter liked her sandwich and I Don't have a deli in the upscaled area we live. However, after the worker made an error on my sandwich I politely let him know the next day to ensure he didn't make the same error that day. Now when he made the error there was a nasty AA NYCHA female trying to skip people as they order. My order was already in so I'm not sure if she was the cause of him making the error or simply himself but either way I did nothing wrong to him. When I informed him of his error the next day he wanted me to say my two orders one at a time so I did. He was very unwelcoming but I didn't catch on till yesterday 07/07/2023. The Hispanic customer asked me if I ordered and said no he still went passed and then greeted the worker in Spanish he said hi to him. Then he looked at me and there was no greeting just more like what do you want? (Yes, I was on the phone with the person I was purchasing one of the sandwiches for. I was not distracted by the call or holding up his line and he was the one that said I could use the phone. If I'm speaking with the person before him saying anything to clarify their order. So that's not an excuse. I looked right at him with no greeting and no thank you but in the past he did. Whatever his issues are is just that his issues). So I said the first order and then he didn't even let me say my second one he just called over me to the Hispanic guy and asked him for his order so I never got to place my second order. Then it was like here when he placed the one sandwich order on the counter. I turned around and walked right out. It's their loss, not mines that between $175 and $180 a week (not counting going in the afternoons because that would be over $200) they loss being unprofessional and having an attitude with a customer that has been nothing but pleasant, a high paying consumer, and stood up for him when the ghetto NYCHA female was being disrespectful. I will take my money somewhere else that probably isn't going to even charge that much for 2 heroes, 3 bags of chips, two bottles of Dollar Arizona juices, and two packs of peanut chews. Treat your customers right or you'll be OUT OF BUSINESS in no time. And it's clear it's not me because another review said they gave attitudes too.

This place renovated a little bit so now it looks cleaner and brighter inside. Plenty of things to buy from lotto tickets, sandwiches, chips, soda, etc. But don't love the customer service. I went 1 weekend and the pickles were $1 each. But recently the guy said they're $1.50. I asked when did they raise the price and he said "a long time ago," to which I replied that couldn't be because I was inside 1 week prior. I didn't like his attitude when he said he could put them back, I wasn't trying to argue, just getting clarification, but he came off snide. I paid and left, but will frequent the other place down the block.

This is definitely one of the most authentic dry hotpot restaurants in NYC.

The meat were super high quality, the seasoning were so on point! I had the medium heat and it struck the perfect balance between the authentic Chinese spice flavor and spicy numbness.

Staffs were also very friendly and helpful. I can't wait to go back again!

TLDR: my favorite dry hot pot in Manhattan!

I started coming here in undergrad several years ago and I've been a regular since. I've had other dishes beside the dry hot pot, and they were good, but the real star was always the hot pot. To order, you go walk directly to the counter and tell whoever is working how many people your purchase is going to serve and then they'll ask you what proteins and what vegetables you'd like in it. You can also indicate if you want more or less. Afterwards they'll weigh the proteins and vegetables and tell you your total. It's easy to order too much so be careful! They'll also ask you how spicy you want it. Keep in mind that "medium" means 4/5 spice at this restaurant. Try the fish! It'll be better than you think.

The restaurant is not a hole in the wall but it sometimes gives you that feeling. Super chill vibes I've come here in big groups and even just myself. It can get really packed especially during lunch and dinner so keep that in mind for when you go.

I'm a big fan of hot pot and absolutely love this place! I usually get the lamb hot pot with soup and it's so authentic, delicious, and very filling. It comes with many ingredients like glass noodles, cabbage, rice cake, etc. and the broth is quite tasty.

There's plenty of seating and note that they have a $15 minimum credit card charge. The food is also done quickly so you don't have to wait a long time to eat.

I would recommend this if you're in the neighborhood and looking for a quality, heart warming meal!

I have been here multiple times over the years and the food is always great. There are so many ingredients to choose from, including some less commonly seen meats like pig ears. My favorite is the fish filet which are fried prior to being stir-fried with a crunchy texture on the outside while soft on the inside. The prices have increased post-covid but still within average range for a meal in the area. A normal portion for me cost high 20s/low 30s now.

The restaurant has a good amount of seating and it is easy to do sit-down meals since most customers buy takeouts.

I went on the website and ordered one of the dried hot pots. When you order a dried or soup hot pot you can customize how spicy it is and add six toppings and it comes with rice. I ended up ordering the dried hot pot with the medium-high spice level with fatty beef, squid, baby shrimp, bok choy, broccoli, onion, and seaweed knots. The food was absolutely amazing, and I loved the flavor, and texture, and how quickly everything came. I also know that I could handle the medium-high spice level, so next time I'm going to challenge myself to try the extra spice level and maybe try some of their more adventurous options, like tripe, but I'll try not to get that crazy. This is a great restaurant. I'm happy that I ordered from here.

Pricey but hit the spot for my mala cravings. You know the food is good when almost everyone you see in the restaurant is an international student lol. Just be careful piling on all the delicious dry hot pot ingredients cause they add up so fast... before I knew it I was at $40 and it didn't look like thaaat much food rip. My fav items were lamb, pork belly, quail egg, and seaweed knots. The spice levels were not as spicy as I thought, surprisingly - I think the level right below medium wasn't spicy enough so I prob would go with medium (or even the highest level) next time. Food comes out pretty fast and I believe you can ask them to refill your rice bowl without a charge!
Meal for 2. The meal was on the pricier side. We chose level 2nd highest. A good range of ingredients. We ended up taking our leftover home since it was a lot for 2 people.
We ordered the dry mala, but there was no flavor and there was soup inside. I will not go again.

Maybe their dried hot pot is better but their regular lamb was a disaster to me. The lamb is super dry and flavorless. It felt like I wash chewing rubber. And the broth is spicy and also very salty. Overall, not a good value. It does include some veggies but not a lot.

I love the mala dry pot here! I typically choose a different array of vegetables each time I visit, and it's always fantastic. The base had the perfect blend of spiciness and numbing sensation, and the vegetables were cooked to perfection. I have only had takeout from here, which made for a seamless experience.
Outrageous price for very small portion!  All the dishes I ordered came with tiny portion, not even half of the standard takeout container.  Very unhappy!  Won't be ordering from them again.

I have been to 108 dry hot pot a few times and believe it is pretty good. They have a decent amount of options for meats and vegetables and the flavor of the food is delicious! it is slightly on the pricier side for a quick lunch, but I would recommend it if you are looking for dry hot pot since I don't know too many other places in the city. hits the spot and the boba shop inside is also a plus!

This food portion is much less than before. Pork in hot  chill oil, the price increased a lot and less portion, I can understand the inflation but I think i paid for 18usd and only 10 small piece meat. Do not recommend.

Bubble Tea & Szechuan Hot Pots are why I live in New York.  Amazing "impossible to make it all by yourself" kind of food is what I live for. And why I love NY for its incredible diversity & cuisine.  I've tried leaving but I'm addicted to great food - and my exercise machine...
This weekend I decided to try 108 Food Dried Hot Pot. I liked it so much, I ate here two nights in a row.  Both times were excellent, although the noodle hot pot surpassed the mushroom one. If you are a fan of eating mushrooms, you'll love this place. I requested medium spice level - although one order was less spicy than the other.
I had
* Dried Hot Pot - Bamboo shoot, chicken, woodear, king and oyster mushrooms
* Dried Hot Pot - Woodear, King and Oyster mushrooms with thin round noodles and marinated beef
I also tried the teas -
* Thai Milk Tea
* Lychee Black Tea
* Roasted Milk Tea
*Passion Green Tea

My favorite tea was a tie between the lychee black tea & passion green tea. The milk teas were delicious but the non-milk teas were very refreshing & complimented the meal nicely.

108 Food Dried Hot Pot - the place to go for a great spicy hot pot & tea combo. Agree it deserves more stars. Hope it stays that way !

So I come here religiously for boboa tea. They have a BOGO if you pay cash. So I buy two. (I have no self control) they have many flavors of milk tea as well as fruit teas. They also serve the best smelling dried hot pot inhave ever smelled. The have an assortment of ingredients to choose from. They draw in a decent growed of college students and couples so it can get crowded. The seating area is very clean and they clean between customers. The price is moderate and the food is weighed.

What I dont like: sometimes the workers go on break and smoke. They leave the side door open which goes to the dining area and the smoke comes in. I dont want to smell cigarette smoke while I'm eating, not sure about others but you have been warned. All and all I really like this and think everyone should give it a try.
I always love coming here, food quality is stable and delicious. I only get the dry hotpot because it's one of my favorite dishes, and they make it so well!
Have ordered several times of take out, always left message asking can it be normally salty but always only oily never add salt. I don't understand why. Is salt too expensive??
Terrible service and I'm Chinese. Food was not worth the price, and the price is outrageous. Ambiance is mid, if you're white you're definitely getting scammed.

I've come here a couple times now and am reasonably pleased with the experience. You can construct your own bowl here, which is the main feature of this place. You get a free bowl of rice (or two bowls, i think, if you order a certain amount), and the food all tastes pretty good.

They have a bunch of different options you can put in your pot. Some of my favorites are the fish fillets, the spam, the cabbage, and the fungus. For some reason, they also put prawn chips in the mixture as well, but it totally works, and tastes great.

The food here is not exactly cheap. First of all, they have like a $21 dollar card minimum (or something like that). If you come with a friend, it should be fine, since you and another person will easily be able to eat $10.5 worth of food. On average, when I eat here (I normally come with another person) my bill is like around $14-16 pp, so I would say you should have no problem clearing the $21 dollar hurdle.

I don't know what options are like here if you eat by yourself, but I imagine they must have some options for single dining. At the same time, I've only ever seen one person eating here by themselves, so I don't know for sure.

Great dry pot that satisfies the mala craving! Food is fresh and cooked to order. Surprisingly good boba too! Measures up to nearby Kung Fu and Gong Cha.

Recently they have streamlined their ordering process and have outdoor seating as well. Would recommend!

I love this place's dried hot pot, which is essentially just a stir fry. You walk up to the counter where they have all the ingredients on display. Tell them how many ppl are sharing a pot so they know how much to put in. Then just start picking ingredients! You pay by weight, and usually a meal comes out to ~$20 per person.

My favorite ingredient is the fish filet, which comes out lightly fried. I always get this with my pot. My friend tried to order a lot of meat but got stopped and was asked to move on to veggies! Didn't know there was a limit but I'm glad they were looking out for her health?

I wish they had little labels for what each ingredient was. I couldn't tell which meat was what, and as a line started building behind me, I felt too pressured to keep asking what each item was.

Finally, pick your spice level. The funny thing is "spicy" was 50% spicy and medium was 75%, which is counterintuitive. Probably makes more sense to flip the labels. The sauce comes with a lot of peppercorn, which I don't love and spent some time plucking out.

Overall, this is a fun and delicious place, since you literally get to pick exactly what you like instead of conforming to a preset menu.

Reasonably priced, large portion size, but bland flavors.

Overall, these hot pots are well priced for the large portion and numerous ingredients that were included. However the general flavor was weak, even after adding spice.

I'm curious to try the dry hot pot, which seems to be more of their specialty.

Lately I been craving for malatang hot pot. I been passing by to 108 dried hot pot couple times but didn't get to try until yesterday.

I have thought there was gonna be outdoor dining but the girl said starting next week there will be. I have thought to go elsewhere but it was gonna rain in 20 min and just brought food from 108 dried hot pot.

I probably should have left and came back next time because yesterday with the food was disappointing.
I ordered enoki mushroom hot pot, vegetable hot pot.
Also there was a promotion with bubble tea buy 1 and get on free. With the bubble tea promotion is CASH ONLY.

Two of the hot pot I asked for extra spicy they are just BLAND! I was eating that just drenched in oil, it doesn't have any taste in it beside just being spicy which i asked for.
This is not what I wanted, pretty much a waste that I end up eating all the enoki and the rest garbage. This could have been better!! Like flushing I constantly go to which is the BEST unlike 108 dried hot pot.

Oh yeah one more, I don't know if it's purposely they did it but they only PUT two napkins ONLY! Wow

This was my first time eating dry hotpot and I'm pretty much hooked on it. At this restaurant you order what ingredients you want to add into your "hot pot", it's pretty much like a Mongolian stir fry but with hotpot ingredients. They calculate the price based on the weight of the vegetables and meat. We got ours mild because my friend doesn't like spicy food that much and it had the perfect amount of flavoring, but I wouldn't mind it being a little spicier.

I shared an order with a friend and it ended up around $17 a person, which is pricy but worth it if you are only coming occasionally. They do have refills for rice which is nice.
