This place is super fun and interesting! You go and pick all the raw ingredients and they weigh them depending on veggies or meat. Then they cook it based on spicyness level you order.

I had read previous reviews which said the spice level was not high enough, but honestly I ordered an "80" level, labeled as medium, and it was PLENTY spicy and tasty.

The food came out very quickly, and it was a lot of food for $35! Almost could feed 3 people.

Their policy is 2 rice for orders over $30, and we were lucky since they gave us a refill for one bowl.

Only complaint I might have is that things were a little too oily and salty.

Decent dry hot pot spot with reasonable prices, especially for the area. Not so happy about the spice levels though - we asked for extra spicy and what we got was more like medium, and it didn't taste very ma (just la).

I shared a $33 dry hot pot with fish filets, peeled shrimp, quail eggs, rice cakes (nian gao), tofu skin, lotus root, enoki mushroom, broccoli, and leafy green vegetables with two friends. I liked all the ingredients except the fish - it was weirdly extremely salty and not very spicy. Favorites were the rice cakes, broccoli, and lotus root.

Overall it's more like a 3.5/5, but for the location it's a great option. Would definitely return if in the area.
Now the pricing is $19.99/lb for meat and $18.99/lb for vegetables. I am just really amazed at how much and how quickly they raise the price...and people are still going?!

The dried hot pot was SO EXPENSIVE! $17.99 / pound for vegetables & $18.99 / pound for meat? That's absurd. If it was that expensive then the taste should have been astonishing, at least. I ordered around 2 pounds of vegetables which came out to $37. For that price, I could have ordered almost 2 orders from Mala Project that serves amazing dry hot pot. I got takeout and it didn't seem like the amount I ordered upon checkout. It wasn't even spicy although it was a medium and it had little taste. Seriously, if you think Mala Project is expensive then this restaurant is even more expensive.

Pearl milk tea was horrible. The containers they use to measure and hold the milk tea & bubbles were dirty. They didn't look clean whatsoever. Although I got 50% sugar, I was expecting it to be sweeter because the other bubble tea places tend to be very sweet even at 50%.

Only positive thing was that they prepared my order really fast, otherwise, that's about it. Do better.

I order some takeouts of dried pot and cooked Mutton
However it was too salty for me, and smells just so-so.
While the others seem to like it, so you should decide by yourself. I think the spicy one would taste better.

Me at dry pot counter: "Let's do a little beef"

Server at dry pot counter: *Tosses in massive slab of beef*

Me: "Also a few pieces of sausage"

Server: *Adds huge handful of sausage slices*

Me: "And just a couple shrimp please"

Server: *Heaves a dozen shrimp into pot*

That, my friends, is how I managed to spend $25 on a dry pot for myself, in a place that only charges $10-$11 per pound for ingredients. But I'm not even mad, the pot was damn delicious, fragrant and spicy with Sichuan peppercorns and chili oil, and the big tray of leftovers will be too.

Yet another fine addition to the budding Sichuantown in the 100s on the UWS.

I came here about a month ago and the service was crude but as a Chinese immigrant who grew up in my parents' Chinese takeout restaurant, it doesn't really faze me.

But my background is also what prompted me to write my first review ever because I was shocked to have received a counterfeit $20 bill here. Cash businesses are notorious dumping grounds for counterfeit money and I've personally counted hundreds of dollars worth of counterfeit money through my parents' restaurant so I knew something wasn't right the second I felt this bill. It's hard for me to give them the benefit of the doubt that they didn't know any better.

If you're dining here, know that there's a credit card minimum and if you must use cash, please count and inspect it right then and there. I only found out after I got home and emptied out my bag from the day and the cash I had left was all entirely from this establishment.

As you can see from the image, the upper margin is significantly smaller than the others and the bill itself is 1mm shorter than real bills.

If you receive a counterfeit bill, I believe that you can claim it as a tax deduction so the cycle ends with you. Trust me, it's the worst feeling to be that sucker.

The food is good, however I'm really annoyed that the staff already grab a bunch even you specifically said it's only for one person. It ends up $40 just for one person and I have to ask them to remove some of the food in it. Finally I paid around 30 bucks, which is still a lot.

If you want to try the dry hot pot, I highly recommend to order it online and choose the $18.95 dry hot pot option, that way you won't be overcharged.

We ordered online a dried hot pot. It is very nice of them to give us a box of chicken gizzards as gift!!! 108 Dried Hot Pot provides various categories of ingredients to choose from. We had things like quail eggs, bamboo shoots, streaky pork.

The service was good. Host were really nice but the food is mediocre at best and slightly overpriced. There's barely any flavoring, and some of the ingredients tastes spoiled. Would not recommend their dried hot pot but the service is good.

This is the most underrated spot in morning-side heights. I'm so addicted to their ma la dry pot. I would highly recommend getting the wagyu beef, pork belly, or fish fillet as a protein. For carbs and veggies I always get enoki, lotus root, rice cakes, and tofu skin.

Before I start my review I want to address the people that leave a bad review because of delivery. People please remember that Grubhub drivers are independent and do not work for the restaurant. Please don't punish them due to the drivers. Now this was my first time ordering from here and it was awesome!!! I do not like tofu but ordered mapo tofu and the flavor, spice level was amazing. I hope they continue to offer delivery after this madness to Columbia Medical Center because they have new customers here and I will pass the word around!!! Food was so good I forgot to take a picture.  Next time!!!

Go-to dry pot in town, highly recommended. I like how easy it is to mix all kinds of meat and veggies you like. In other places, it is often harder to do so as they keep a certain set of portion with its price range.

If you eat in store, it's by weight, but it's different if you take out I think. Quite confusing.

We didn't really know how to portion out how many lbs or ounces of meat and veggies. The person working was really nice and helped out us; I was pleased with the amount we ended up with. Totaled $30 for two people with two bowls of rice.

The spice level was disappointing, the spicy tasted more like a mild-medium. Everything about the meal was okay, except I wish the lotus root was sliced a lot thinner.

I like Mala Project better, but 108 is definitely cheaper.. and one of the better options around Columbia in my opinion.

OK so I can't give this 5 stars only because I was a little disappointed by the dry hot pot experience. The food tasted great and the place was quirky. Found them on Yelp after a nearby taco spot had a 30 minute wait. I had never had dry hot pot and so I didn't know what to expect. I must say I missed having broth and cooking the food myself. Other than that though the food was great. If you're looking for a traditional hot pot spot, this is not the place for you. However, If you're looking for a cross between hot pot and a fast casual joint, this is perfect. The food came out really quick and the price for 3 came out to about $12 each. $

I love this place and the food is really good and authentic, like their Flushing counterpart. They used to charge you by the pound. I'm not sure if they still do that when you dine in, but it's my first time ordering delivery from them and I'm quite disappointed by the amount of food I got given the $35 price tag. I used to get so much more than a plastic container's worth (see photo) for $30 when I ate there. Again, I'm not sure if it's a difference between dine-in and delivery, but I think the value for money is lacking when it comes to delivery.

That aside, the flavor is still great! Maybe I'll pop in one day to see if there is indeed a change in the amount you get per dollar.

I love this hot pot place! I am surprised with the 3.5 stars as it deserves better recognition. I usually order online these days and usually get the $18.95 option for take out which gives you 6 choices of toppings which include meat! I like the tofu skin, squid, enoki mushrooms, tripe, and beef. I grew up eating tripe (cow stomach) but it's not for everyone but hey why not explore new options when you're in nyc!

Great flavor. Medium is SPICY!!! So recommend mild if you're not comfortable w the burning sensation in your mouth.

Also $18.95 comes with a bowl of rice (they could be more generous w a bigger serving though).

*tip I shared this w another person and added my own ramen and bokchoy and mixed it together!

It is so hard to find authentic spicy Chinese food around Columbia. I love going to this place as a treat for their delicious dried hotpot, which I think has more flavor than the normal soupy hotpot. The environment is chatty and the benches around the tables make it easy to come with a bunch of friends.

What makes this place stand out is the variety of veggies you can get here that aren't easy to find elsewhere. In my hotpot, I like to add lotus root, black fungus (mu er), and the four types of mushrooms they have. It's always super flavorful. I usually get it spicy but for people who are expecting ma la tang, it's mostly just spicy because they don't add many peppercorns. I personally like this better. I also add their homemade chili oil for extra spice!

The only downside is the price. It is a bit expensive compared to Chinese food from Chinatown or Flushing. They charge by weight if you do the make your own hotpot option. Last time I was here, my hotpot cost $38 which we split between three people. I would recommend getting more vegetables than weight if you're worried about price because they charge those separately and veggies are cheaper.

For those who are daunted by the make your own hotpot option, the premade dishes are also good. I've had the beef in chili oil & pork in chili oil and both are delicious!

This place is always busy! A good sign. The service is quick and they give you unlimited rice! I've never had dried hot pot before and you can choose whatever ingredients you'd like and you pay by the pound. The only thing I wish was different was that they had the serve yourself area for different sauces like peanut butter, sesame oil, green onion, and the like. We got beef, chicken, quail egg (not my favorite) and a variety of vegetables including lotus-so good. I'll definitely be back!

Wow I can't believe this place exists near Columbia - maybe three years ago the only decent Asian food around campus was Malaysia Grill and Jin Ramen (if that counts as close), but now you have Go! Go! Curry, Panda Express, this place, and even an H-Mart. All the Chinese food carts took over the void left behind by the burning down of Ollie's, but now they got some competition. Anyway I digress.

You literally can't go wrong with any of the selections here - no matter what you throw into your bowl, it will somehow turn into something extremely delicious. Highly recommend the fish fillet, which it seems like they deep-fry separately before stir-frying, and the ramen noodles soaking up all the spicy oil is literally crack.

Minus one star for being kind of expensive for Chinese food, but would definitely come here again and again.

I don't know where to start. I ordered delivery for Ubereats tonight. Since I really want to try this place for so long and end up so disappointment. Dried Hot Pot looked ok but not worth $18.50. Fish Hot pot was suck!!!The soup was not even have any taste, seem like water or I don't know this a regular taste they served!!! and Look!!! it has only 2 small pcs of fish for $12.99. Im not a picky person with food , not at all. But the food I couldn't finish because It is so tasteless.Never eat here again.

Saturday night delivery from this spot, which is only a block away. (But it's snowing!).

Dried Hot Pot ($16.50). You chose 6 ingredients and a spice level for this dish. I looked at the long list and went with: sausage, pork, ham, fatty beef, enoki mushrooms, and potato noodles. The sausage was cute and juicy. Pork and ham were both too chewy, and I think they were just boiled. The enoki mushrooms were a highlight - whole, meaty, and tender. Plus, there were over 10 in the dish. The fatty beef was really luscious and soft; glad I tried it. FINALLY, the potato noodles were al dente and served aplenty, though they stuck together a little too much. The medium-spice I chose was a 7 on a 1-10 scale and aromatic.

Pork in Hot Chili Oil ($14.95). A lot of the same chewy pork slices as above, in a spicy sauce- 8 on the scale. Fresh chili's and a bit too much grease. I'd have loved a fresh vegetable or green to cut the fattiness.

Roasted Milk Tea ($4.00). No tapioca!? I thought the drink would automatically include tapioca, so I skipped over the 50 cent addition (assuming it'd be redundant). But it did not. The beverage was creamy and sweet, and had a notably nutty flavor. I guess Starbucks charges more for less...

Delivered within the 45 minute estimate; nice!

Ordered the Szechuan style dry hot pot and some bubble tea (which never got delivered) but the hot pot was really good. The hot pot is a pretty good quantity which serves two. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because they didn't send my bubble tea, which isn't exactly cheap either.

I would also like to add to my previous review that the tapioca bubbles are very hard not like I've had anywhere else. I wouldn't order bubble tea from here again.

I dined in here Friday night around 6PM with a friend and our mild spicy dry pot included tofu, tofu skins, beef, sausage, shrimp, fish cake, onion, quail eggs. Since we dined in, we got unlimited rice.

There are a decent number of tables but the tables are first-come, first-served and as we were leaving, a woman almost got into an argument with a man to have our table...

Anyhow, I would definitely come back here but I recommend coming in a group of 3 or 4 since you pay by weight. For me and my friend, we paid $33 and we took a third of the pot home as leftovers.

Only one word to describe my feeling right now " disappointment ". The beef in hot chili oil is not as spicy as it's supposed to be and extremely salty. The chicken is just a popcorn chicken with some non-spicy chili in it then called it "spicy deep fried chicken". This place is totally not a traditional Szechuan restaurant. But to be honest I have never tried their dry hot pot which was all the good reviews about. Overall I regret so much that I didn't do more research before I ordered.

This place opened several weeks back to local acclaim.  At least it seemed to, as there was a line down the block their first weekend.  Since then the lines have subsided a bit but the place always seems busy.  I finally got to go in the other day; this place serves Chinese street food where you pick your ingredients and then they cook it with chili oil.  The line moved slow, I had 2 people try to cut me in line, and there was no labels on any of the food.  They also didn't really speak English, but knew enough to help out.  The food was cooked fresh but took awhile to come out.

I got the beef with a variety of veggies and medium-hot chili oil.  The portion was fair for the $15 price point, but unfortunately I couldn't finish it.  The beef used was very low quality.  It was tough to chew through, very fatty, and stringy.  It was also swimming within the before-mentioned chili oil which was less than appetizing.  It's too bad, as the veggies were very good and the spices used had a really nice flavor profile.  

Looks like they have enough business from people who do like it, but you can count me out on this one.  Go to Junzi Kitchen up the block instead.

I love this place. Buddha and Sammy are excellent dudes. The deli prices are the lowest you'll find, but the quality generally matches the cost. There are housing projects nearby so these prices are helping the community. Sammy is way generous with cheese and meat, too (sometimes to a fault). On the rare occasion that they have peppers and onions he makes an incredible philly cheese steak.

The flower stand out front gives color to an otherwise unattractive stretch of concrete.

If you're reading this review you probably already know this block is crawling with crack heads and all manner of seedy characters. It's not unusual to see people buying 40's at 9am - in fact, before they renovated a year ago, they had a bottle opener bolted to the wall for instant access. One time I watched a guy have some kind of crack attack and fall flat on his face. It's just an everyday thing for the guys at 94 Deli, and I admire their equanimity in the face of chaos.
They have good coffee but recently the hot cups have been leaking.  The staff is always nice and courteous.  The prices are reasonable.

Just had a philly cheese steak and loved it so much for the 5 dollar price tag that I made an account on yelp to review it.  The rest of the deli/market is fine, but I am impressed with this cheap and delicious deli.
Amazing fresh food !!!!!  Upper Westside cafe that serves it ALL! Reasonable prices and friendly staff. I love this place in my new neighborhood

I get takeout from here from time to time. The food is solid but not blow your socks off by any means.

I've tried the chicken pesto panini which was not much of a panini at all given instead of ciabatta a pita was used. Good amount of chicken in the pita at least.

Still is a pretty affordable option for takeout dinner.

I have lived in this area for over 10 years, but I have only visited 94 Corner Cafe a few times. Typically, I stop by to grab a quick snack for my children, such as pizza or a burger. Unfortunately, the poor customer service and inconsistent pricing have left me with a negative impression. During my most recent visit, I was hoping to celebrate the end of summer with my child by indulging in some waffles. However, the waffle machine was out of order, and the lack of air conditioning made the experience uncomfortable. Additionally, the prices seemed too high for the rundown condition of the establishment. I was even charged an extra $2 for my son's three pancakes, which were advertised at $7. This will be my first and last visit to this cafe. It is unfortunate because I enjoy supporting local restaurants, but this one does not deserve my patronage. I would also caution potential customers to avoid visiting on Fridays when there are often loitering and drunken individuals present.

94 Corner Cafe was on my "to go" list. It sounded delicious and was rated highly. Everyone that works there is very nice. The place was busy early in the morning. I went to check it out first and take photos. I walked up an appetite and I returned later after the peak breakfast hour was over. The first thing I needed was to use the restroom. They very nicely unlocked it for me to use.
I went up to the counter when I was ready to order. Since I already checked their menu I knew I wanted Spinach Pie today. I was pleased to see its a big slice. They wasted a pickle slice and carrot slice on me though. It was definitely delicious and I would get it again.
My total for lunch was $8.66. Such a deal! I left happy and full. In addition, I saw all the tables cleaned while I was there. This place is great. I just wish it wasn't hidden behind scaffolding! I'm recommending you visit.

The garlic knots were tasty and inexpensive.
The man at the cash register was very nice and welcoming.
I love the little windowed side room.
Blt sandwich was nice. Quick service and very reasonably price. Good food and nice people inside 94 corner cafe.

A very pleasant surprise! Admittedly our expectations weren't too high but when we stopped in for breakfast we were greeted with plenty of menu options and unfailingly polite service from everyone behind the counter (the place was empty at the time so we had 5 people waiting on us). Lunch may offer just as many opportunities: the roast beef is super rare. There could be more offerings regarding side salads, I guess, but it seems they are excelling given the limited space here. An unexpected gem.

A good alternate to my usual place for the area. The establishment is clean, offers a variety of fare, and can handle custom requests. 94 Corner Cafe offers anything from smoothies, juices and lattes to wraps, pizzas and salads.  Prices are affordable and the execution is spot on.

I'm not a fan of their rolls nor heros so I usually opt for anything not involving bread. They always have fresh avocado and a huge selection of most things.  Sometimes they can be a little slow in providing service but they are consistent enough to be reliable.
Affordable and delicious food. With a wide range of options to choose from. The staff is the sweetest and nicest. Go here if you want food that feels like home.

I have ordered from here many times, mostly burgers and sandwiches,
which I found to be good.  Tonight I decided to switch things up and or a cheese pizza.  When it finally arrived a good half hour late it was cold as ice
and flat as a pancake-never again!

I ordered from her for the first time tonight and got a deluxe cheeseburger.  The food was good, but the delivery man shouted 'Open the door!" at me when I answered his ring on the intercom.  He could have been trained better, is all I'm saying.

Fantastic breakfast....one of the best I've had in years! Their chocolate chip banana pancakes were out of this world. The bacon we ordered was perfectly cooked. And their portions were great. Super fast delivery. Plus everything was less expensive than our neighborhood diners. We'll be ordering from these guys a lot more often!

Don't ever order from this restaurant!!

I ordered a quiche that came delivered completely burnt and inedible. Restaurant refused to refund or give a replacement. How can they serve burnt food to customers?

Authentic crappy NY coffee!

Didn't love it but appreciated the experience.
Service at the cash register was friendly.
Food & drink came out in a timely manner.
Just wasn't tasty... :/ seemed healthy enough, flatbread with egg whites and onions and peppers... just not very tasty. Was kinda bland. Husbands breakfast burrito was also bland.

This place is amazing. Best Stromboli ever. Plus the 18 inch pizza, 2 drinks $20. Wow not only inexpensive. The pizza was amazingly good. In & out in less than 10 minutes. Great friendly staff. Place stays busy. These guys get ya in & out fast.

DO NOT EAT HERE!!! I am currently in the process of suing them. This place is horrible. It started by them getting every order wrong. They would fake apologize and then send me another wrong order. They once put a hair in my food and I honestly think it was retaliation. Order after order, there was always something wrong. Last order. The cook doesn't know English and breaks the egs so that you get them all over your bag instead of on your plate. I got so angry at my messed up food that I got up one morning and felt I had to go there. I saw rats, roaches and a very dirty restaurant. The Indian guy who is the manager told me that I complain too much and if I didn't want my cream cheese & jelly bagel with the jelly purposely all over the bagel on the outside and leaking out into my packaging, that I should just not order anymore. I am suing them for all the money I've wasted there, my legal fees and the stress they've cause me. Believe me, I'm not dramatic, I usually won't complain, let alone write a review but these people now have my full attention. They need to be shit down by the health department and honestly, they don't care. They will respond like they did to my Google review like they are concerned and say, call us... guess what, I was a sucker and I called them and they cursed me out for leaving a review. Now I will not stop and I'm taking them to court. They are going to be famous. No person should spend money on ordering everyday and consistently get food that is not fresh and destroyed all over the packaging. This is disgusting customer service and I'll never forget how the Indian guy said, "Go ahead my friend, you can write to the president, I don't care" ... I felt helpless and I'm a 6'1" man, I could have went there and punched him in the face, of course though, I will find a legal way to avenge the situation. I will not let go this time. I am suing them and I am going to stop at nothing to make them pay for what they've done.

I've never been so disappointed in a meal to where I was actually motivated to write a yelp review but this place did it. I wanted a gyro and this place made me mad. First of all it was tiny af and then it was overpriced almost 9 bucks. Did not come with fries or anything for that price. It wasn't on a usual pita and it was mostly lettuce not much meat. It was ice cold. The meat that was there was extremely dry and seemed like it had been there for ages.
Convenient and quick. I've only had eggs, coffee, sandwiches and salads and they've always been good. Ezy Pezy!

I have gotten multiple orders delivered where the food was flat out rotten / spoiled.. and then they would refuse to refund or deliver a new one... i had decided to give then a second and third chance and they were consistently terrible. Also i ordered just enough for one person, I live two blocks away and it took them more than an hour to deliver each time. Extremely rude on phone as well. Unacceptable behaviors.

I just moved to 94th Riverside and found this restaurant/Cafe and been going for breakfast 4 days a week with no problem and last month I started having there Healthy Breeze Smoothie everyday and I love it! Went in the other day and ordered one. Went home to get dress and do some work from home. When I started to drink my smoothie I knew right away something was off. Something was missing out! I called the cafe and they said bring it back. Took me over a hour as I had other things going on. When I get in the cafe everyone looking like they never seen me before and one guy who works there yells out that was 2 hours ago he gotten that smoothie! I just left it there as I just drunk a little and said I'm never coming back. As they handle this problem so badly $150 a week of business there going to lose. + TIPS (I just don't understand where customer service is anymore) I'm very disappointed and hopefully they improve there attitude there faithful customers

Ummmm were the other reviewers trippin'?
I ordered here on a weekend morning (worst time, according to reviews).
I actually called after I submitted my Seamless order. I wanted to customize the cheese and bagel for my sandwich. The guy on the phone was really pleasant and named every single bagel and cheese they had.
My order was delivered in 20 mins. And the delivery guy was super nice, too ("Good morning," "Have a nice day!") it's those little pleasantries that I really like, instead of the usual grunts.
Will have to stop by and see everything that they offer, since their Seamless page isn't too specific with condiments, toppings, etc.
My sandwich was delicious!! My only gripe is that my bagel wasn't toasted, even though I requested it to be.

Disclaimer: I've only ever gotten coffee & breakfast here so my review is for that.

Ok, you're not getting any gourmet trendy european bistro food here BUT - everything I've ever ordered has been reasonably priced and yummy! Simple doesn't mean bad, people! The coffee is fantastic, they always get my milk/coffee/sugar ratio just right, and they're fast. The place isn't "pretty" but for me, there's no better place for a grab-and-go breakfast. Glad this corner cafe is on my corner!

Bonus: shout out to the BOSS WOMEN who work here (run this joint). They're gorgeous, sweet, on top of their work, and attentive to their customers. In a city where positive human-to-human interaction is rare, these ladies are a real gem.

Love this place. Great food and friendly, efficient service. A rarity in NYC! My weekly egg, bacon & cheese on a bagel is always cooked to perfection. Pizza slices and sandwiches are also wonderful. I also grab a beer to go every Fri night on way home... Sonny at the register is a gem. Great place!

I have ordered from this place almost everyday for the past few years.

Over time their service has really declined especially in the evening. They have made errors in orders as well as decreased the size of their portions which has been really disappointing. I pay $7 for a chicken salad bagel with about two tablespoons of chicken salad. When I've tried to speak to the manager about it he just said, "I wont make any money."  Well sadly, you just lost more money, as you just lost my business. I will not be ordering from this place again.

One of those typical cafes that sell every type of food. I work in the area occasionally and come here to get breakfast or lunch. Most recently, I got a hot pressed panini "turkey bite" that advertised turkey, bacon, pepper jack cheese, guacamole and ranch dressing. It was false advertisement... I had no guacamole or ranch - nevertheless it was still decent. It's a small panini for $8.25+tax.

So I order from here at least once a week. They have a low delivery minimum and are usually much quicker than the estimated time on Seamless and my orders have always been correct. The delivery guys are usually quite friendly, so I suspect that previous complaints may be old reviews.

I primarily order breakfast items, but have ordered hot and cold sandwiches, salads, juices and smoothies. Standard deli fa, but with a massive selection of options.
I Really enjoying ordering food from here! It always comes fast and they are very accommodating ! I usually get a smoothie and a bagel sandwich or an actual sandwich and I'm always really happy.
Like any other deli in the city so really no complaints.   I usually come here for a breakfast sandwich and have never been disappointed
I've only ever ordered delivery from this place. It was on time and the food was alright. Not amazing but if your hungry and want delivery it's reliable.

Three and-a-half stars for this solid late-night delivery place. We've tried a good portion of the menu: falafel, burgers, spinach pie, lasagne, pizza, reuben sandwich, quiche, omelets, beef stew... The best was the tender, richly flavored, slow-food beef stew with two sides (in our case awesome roasted veggies and standard issue mashed potatoes). The worst was a tie between the spinach pie (microwaved and rubbery rather than crisp and flakey) and the lasagne (whose rubbery cheese smothered everything else). Many dishes are served with steak fries and / or spears of half-sour pickle and carrot.

We've never been to the brick and mortar location so I can't speak for the service, there. But in general, the food is consistent and fair, the delivery speedy. Whatever they lack in deliciousness, they make up for in price, variety, consistency and convenience.

If only they would stop serving hot food on plastic, this could become a go-to.

We ordered delivery from this place and I was not impressed. They're super overpriced for breakfast and their breakfasts are so greasy it was hard to eat. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere or order from someone else.

Huge menu and the quality of just about everything is amazingly good. Delivery is consistently fast.

The only reason I am not giving five stars is that the few times my orders were wrong (including very wrong), the men who work there were fairly rude, defensive and unhelpful. (It happens that the women were far nicer.)

During today's lunch of spaghetti with alfredo sauce, I found the metal insert to a twist tie hidden within the pasta and sauce!! Incredible scary and dangerous as I almost ate it. Immediately threw away the food and will never order from here again.

I decided to go to the corner cafe on my study break . As I browsed through the menu the lady at the registered continued to question/harass me in regards to what I was going to order . Which was very bothersome. When I finally decided on a salad the guy at the bar was a bit rude, but I proceeded with the order. As I started eating my salad ( which was good btw) I found a MOSQUITO on my broccoli! To make matters worst it was moving !!! I immediately went to the register. The staff barely said a word and tried to return less money than what I paid for . What really bothered me about this scenario is the fact that NO ONE apologized . A sorry would have been nice . So NO I do not recommend this place , they don't wash their vegetables, and they are unapologetic and rude.
Your regular corner cafe. The people there are always friendly and ready to take your order. Great for quick takeout dinners and lunches.

This was extremely small cafe on the Upper west side is very adorable.  I walked in on a Sunday morning,  and the cooks and cashiers  were so lively and kind.  There was an extensive menu with several specials on breakfast.  I opted for a grilled cheese sandwich and home fries with coffee. All was standard. Nothing stood out.

I will definitely return because the people were so nice. I do lo ok forward to checking out the other items on the menu.

Ordered an omelette but got a sandwich.  They are telling me the sandwich is an omelette. I beg to differ.  Besides the false advertisement the food is tasteless and when given an opportunity won't correct their mistake. Who needs this headache? Just wanted an omelette.  This was their second and last chance.  Moving on.

All I ordered was a roast beef sandwich on a roll. They gave me a sandwich and a weird gross side salad. I ate half the sandwich, didn't finish it because it wasn't very good, and now I'm horribly nauseous. Big time thumbs down.

Quintessential Upper West Side diner with a wide variety of all time favorites: pizza, bagels and sandwiches, complete with a hot entree line as well as pastries and other deserts. Service was friendly and prompt. The place was clean and the food behind the counter was colorful and neatly displayed. What could be better!

Two young ladies At the cash register greeted me and smiled when I came in. This was stunning. I have been in New York for six weeks and only a couple times have I been shown appreciation as a customer. I told them that they were very friendly and I appreciated it. I got just what I needed a hearty breakfast for around $10 with including coffee. It was as good as anything I've had in a diner for twice $ that much. Please visit these friendly people and hopefully they won't change or let New York change them, and tip them properly.

Ordered a burger. The website listed it as a 20-30 minute delivery time. One and a half hours later no delivery. Call up - completely non-professional response. They delivered my burger elsewhere. No apology, nothing. Told him to cancel the order and he said I'll call the company to cancel - and then hung up.

Go to some other store in the city. This place sucks.

These guys were kind & accommodating- they'll pretty much make u whatever you want, whenever you want. Delicious pastries, bagels, muffins and pizza.  Coffee was a bit weak & tasted watery but Starbucks is close
Lots of options, from healthy to munchie.
10/10 would recommend

Yelp needs to come up with a rating less than 1 star...

Yeah so I'm thinking that I might have had the odd experience out of everyone but even so, I pretty much think this has been the worst experience I've had ordering from a restaurant.  Not only is the order 1 hour late, but we have called the restaurant multiple times only to have them say "it's on the way."  

There are so many other viable, legit, good restaurants around the UWS who actually deliver within the time range it promises.  94 is a joke.

Order here on seamless ALL the time.  They have everything I want at decent prices.  Ordering around dinner time will push delivery times to 45min.  If you order past 9pm, you can expect it to come by in 30 min.  

The food is GOOD.  not amazing, but good for what it claims to be.  There are better deli's out there but honestly, i'm ordering from this place because I want something quick late at night.
$9.25 for a large coffee with almond milk and Egg and ONE Piece of bacon on a roll ....  GFYS
Very standard deli type -- I had a panini and it was very okay.

Great food! Some of the delivery guys are a little rude though + they've forgotten parts of my order.

Regardless, the food is great. I don't regret ordering from here; just wish they were more on top of things.

I'm pretty upset with myself for not walking the extra block and a half to little italy pizza. The pizza here is lame. Its barely cooked and doughy. Its not inedible but knowing there is really good pizza so close, its particularity disappointing.
Great friendly staff good food for value , sufficient seating and good deals on mix n match big dinner plates. Good coffee too.
Nice little corner cafe with a variety of food. Cashiers are very nice and sweet. They have been nothing but great during this hard times.

Appreciate the vibe. The music taste is superb, ranging between reggae, r&b, and alt r&b. It is also a great study environment, cause everybody is relatively doing the same. The Wi-Fi is a great plus. Favorite part is the people working the cafe. Sweet employees that take their time to get to know community members, especially the elderly.

The interior is not the largest, but they make up for it with the outdoor seating in front.
Small but cute spot! Great for a morning latte, or mid day stop. Pastry and food options. And a quick to go fridge of juices and pre made breakfasts and snacks.

The aptly named 11th Street Cafe was my Sunday morning stop and was a great spot for morning coffee and a pastry. This place is adorable and cute and they make a passable cortado. They also have a free wifi so I spent about two hours here writing Yelp reviews and thinking about when I would head back over to New Jersey and catch the train back to the van.

[Review 18384 overall - 382 in New York - 1906 of 2022.]
Absolute worst service, no manners whatsoever, food is good but not worth the horrible service of this place, WOULD DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMEND

This morning had intended to come inside the Cafe and enjoy a coffee as I had done many times..Arrived early w/ some bags ( as I'm traveling today)

The large Manfrotto the kitchen knocks Ontario  on the window: apparently thought I was homeless?
( funny,as I practice law) to offer tea  I told him he was mistaken + naturally was INSULTED,,,, He NEver Apologized

For His Obvious W. ERRROR...

Saying he was just trying to be Nice?

Small little  Cafe nothingspecial

Do the Math..Will NEVER Return

Such arrogance presumption can not go Unotic3d for all to see!

I was practically dying of hunger so I popped in just before my hair appointment. It was a hole in the wall kind of tiny cute coffee shop but the latte was great & the almond croissant was fresh & tasty. What a perfect place for a quick bite in the West Village in this cold winter day!

A small cafe located on 11th street in the West Village. The cafe had a small inviting atmosphere and smelt of fresh pastries. I ordered the breakfast sandwich on a buttermilk biscuit with bacon. The bacon was cooked nicely and the cheese was melted over delicious eggs. My only complaint would be that the biscuit was a tad dry. I tried the sausage egg and cheese on a croissant and it was perfect. I will be back and ordering that next time!

If you have a dog, don't come here. I can understand that ownership doesn't want to get in trouble, but it was handled so poorly, I'll never go back. I have a little dog I pick up when going inside somewhere. I got to the front of the line & was told I had to tie my dog up outside. I don't use a leash, and it was 20 degrees outside so I asked if I could place my order quickly then step outside to wait. They told me to go outside and place a mobile order.

My gosh. At least ask if it's a service animal. Given the neighborhood, where so many people stop for coffee on their morning walks, you'd think they'd have a better way of handling this.

The Elk has warms vibes & good food. Oslo has great beans. Blackstone is beyond friendly with a huge assortment of tasty food items. Hungry Ghost has great neighborhood vibes. Blank Street has the window seating. Cafe Kitsune has the people watching. All of them let me grab a coffee & go while holding my dog without incident. Spend your money elsewhere in the neighborhood.
Ordered takeout and had a good experience. Salmon bagel special and pressed wrap sandwich with sausage and avocado were both tasty, and the employee who helped me out was friendly.

I was craving Breakfast to go in NYC , so I used Yelp to see what was good. I picked 11th St Cafe because of the Yelp reviews. I ordered on Grubhub/Postmate from here because of how good it looked. It didn't disappoint.

This place was such a great find! Food was delivered on time and came piping hot

We ordered the entire menu it seemed liked. Let's see what's good here!!

Fried Egg BLT Wrap add avocado -

Egg and Cheese wrap. Bacon and Avocado -

Egg, Scallion, cheese, bacon egg scramble -

Egg, beans, burrito - Really good!

Avocado Toast -

Iced Mocha Latte -

Cookie - good

Side Bacon -

Overall - a very good place. The Egg wraps were amazing! Everything was so so good. The portions were big too! Absolutely need to order from here!

I'm cat-sitting in the area and wanted a sandwich for lunch.  This place popped up when I searched and it was great!  I got the turkey with arugula, blue cheese, etc., and it was excellent.  The price was in line with this neighborhood and the sandwich was large.  Nice staff too.  Highly recommend.
Stopped in for an iced coffee. Workers were very friendly and greeted me as soon as I walked in. Coffee was very good, and I definitely want to go back and try the food!!

This cafe is TINY, and COVID-19 restrictions meant everything packaged to go. We were dining in, so my friend and I sat at the TINY bistro table (one of only four micro-tables and were served up a deceptively packaged series of containers. My scramble was in a paper canister with a single slice of toast, wrapped in wax paper and placed on top. It was super yummy, although I had to ask for butter (Why on earth would toast come dry by default? Ask if people want butter, FFS). The experience was positive enough that I will come back after the pandemic is behind us and I really hope they stay in business. One thing we've learned is that there's always a risk that it won't.
Went here a couple of times during my stay in the neighborhood. The staff are extremely friendly and the coffee is delicious. I was a huge fan of the Lox bagel

DON'T COME HERE. There's better places in the area

Don't be fooled by the ambience and upbeat music of this place. Their service is terrible and they take THE LONGEST time to make simple breakfast bowls. There isn't many people here and we did not have orders in front of us so I seriously don't understand the hold up. Do not come here if you want something quick. Originally got their breakfast and granola bowls to stay but changed it take-away because they're slow.

Even worse, they gave made the wrong order an insisted that this is what I ordered... and the employee gave me the worst attitude when I said it wasn't. And argued back that I ordered something else..which doesn't even make sense because it wasn't on the menu. She gave me a cheaper version of what I ordered. This is ridiculous. Never coming back.

A chill spot in the neighborhood. The setting do the cafe was great and the staff was very friendly.
Got a fruit cup and a green tea latte. The quality was pretty good : fruits were fresh, and the strawberries inside were actually sweet - not that common. The matcha latte got skim milk option and the taste was a little bland to me.
A nice little spot overall.

Favorite favorite spot. Literally the best. Best matcha (and I am very particular), really great juices that are very large and cheap for the area and their size. My favorites are the Cucumber Chiller and the Cleanser. The wraps and sandwiches are AMAZING! The AM wrap is my favorite!

I ordered a pick up delivery from here today and felt compelled to share my experience because I had to show the staff some love. They are soooo busy and this is a tiny little place and it was packed on Sunday morning. I don't think I could hack it working a day there. There's barely time to breath but the staff still turns out great food in a timely manner. Props to 11th Street Cafe!
The best cafe in west village. The food is amazing (very fresh, healthy ingredients) and the staff there are the nicest people.
An almond latte.  Not only is this an amazing spot for chilling, reading, studying, whatever you need, but it also has the vibes that you know everybody chases after.
Great coffee and pastries. There are a couple tables indoors and more seating outside. Not a huge place but their coffee selection is top notch

This was my favorite spot for morning egg bowls. Living closeby, I love the egg cup until now. What is happening to egg+chive+bacen+cheddar bowl? I understand the price is rocketing up from 7$ to today 12$ over past 4 years if it is what it takes. However, I ordered one egg bowl today. It is not creamy as it used to be but dry and tasteless. Very very disappointing.  Change of the chefs is normal. But don't give a bump to the taste of the food!

The restaurant got to fix this. This is, at least in some sense, a neighborhood place. It doesn't feel like so any more.

This is indeed a cute coffee shop tucked in the corner in west village - well if you still cannot find it, it is just next to the Spotted Pig, that famous burger place. 11th street cafe was opened a couple years back, when the French couple owners returned after several years in France. I wouldn't be surprised as they had had stayed in New York before moving back to France.

Definitely go for that piece of cookie if you are craving sweet stuff; but do not feel bad about only getting a small cup of espresso, as their drinks are just equally good!

11th Street Cafe you are simply fantastic, I had an incredible experience here today. This place is awesome at what it does. Every single thing was fresh, flavorful, and very yummy. Every one was very friendly. 11th Street Cafe = Amazing.

Wouldn't let me order a coffee while holding my tiny dog.  I live on 11th st 2 blocks from this cafe in an apartment I've owned for 7 years.

That's a first for me In this neighborhood. Most will let you order inside and wait outside. They wouldn't take my order.
This is unacceptable. Why even serve this to someone. Would've loved a call stating you guys were out of avocado or something. Lesson learned!
The best place for lunch in West Village. The menu is really diverse, the food is amazing and the peple working there are the best!!! I totally recommend it!

It's a cute quiet coffee shop that is close by. The barista was very friendly and I enjoy a more homey type of coffee shop where it's not modern. The feel is very cozy which I really enjoy and my cappuccino was really nice flavor as well.
Its a small place. Has free ( fast!) wifi and outlet to charge your devices. Good place to work but has no restroom ):

great coffee! was working on set around the corner and came in for a traveler, morgan was kind enough to brew a fresh batch of coffee for me to bring back - a very sweet person! will definitely be back if i'm ever in the area again.

I really enjoy 11th Street Cafe. They have great food, and offer interesting choices as well as some more traditional menu items for the less adventurous. The coffee and tea are both top knotch, baked goods are delectable, and the staff is very helpful when deciding what to order. I have loved everything I've ordered here!

Blueberry muffin: yum!
Iced coffee: Delish...you know it's good coffee when it doesn't need sugar!
Lox Bagel: fantastic, and I love how they add sprouts.
Bacon Egg Cheese: Mmm, mmm

This place has amazing breakfast food, I go here twice a week most weeks. The AM wrap and the bagel breakfast sandwiches are INCREDIBLE and they don't skimp on the good stuff like other places. The croissants aren't great (a little hard) but everything else is amazing!

This place is a little off the beaten path, so that's a plus right there. When you walk in, it's small and rustic. It's cute. There isn't a lot of seating, but I have always been able to grab a table when I go there. I'm sure it depends what time you go though.

They also have a couple of benches outside so if you're able to snag them, it is a really nice place to sit outside on a beautiful day and people-watch. This is a great, peaceful street too.

I am giving them four stars because I really like the place and the atmosphere. (And most of the staff is nice, in my experience.) However, I had to update my original review because the coffee has not been good lately. I don't know why, but it's just...disappointing. I have not yet tried the lattes or cappuccinos. Maybe I should because the regular brewed coffee is just not "doing it" for me lately.

EDIT: (August 28th) They have changed coffee suppliers and they are now using Brooklyn Roasting Company! I was at 11th Street yesterday and MUCH happier with the coffee.  :) :)

The muffins, croissants, and other pastries have all been very good so far, and I had a really good egg sandwich on a wrap recently.

Another plus: they keep three pitchers of ice-cold water out on the counter (and cups), so you can easily stay hydrated while you're eating there and/or drinking hot beverages.

I love coming here!

I was looking for a place to sit outside on a gorgeous morning before work, where I could have my morning croissant and cappuccino. Yelp sent me here, and it was disappointing on all levels. Most importantly, the "outside area" that is advertised on Yelp is just 2 benches and NO table, literally nowhere to put your coffee. The SMALL cappuccino I asked for was a huge cup of milk, even bigger than Starbucks. The chocolate croissant tasted like plastic and there was very little chocolate. And of course this was EXTREMELY overpriced, even for Manhattan, at $9 for just that. 2 stars only because it's in the West Village and there are beautiful people walking on the street.
Best spot on my block, friendly staff, bit overpriced but that comes with living in the village. Egg scrambles are fire

I was hesitant to leave this review because I would not want to hinder the business of a small, local shop. However, I felt that the product I received was sufficiently bad to warrant my notifying other potential customers. I came in with one very simple drink in mind: an iced oat latte. I had checked another shops beforehand with no luck. Oat milk is currently burgeoning, but definitely still relatively rare. When I stepped in here, I was pleased to be informed that the shop does indeed carry oat milk! Unfortunately, that moment was the extent of my excitement here. My latte came out tasting dirty, as in the machine hadn't been cleaned in who knows how long. Having worked as a barista in the past, I'm very familiar with the taste. This is inexcusable considering coffee is a central product at this place. The extra star is for the friendly dude who refunded my money
Excellent food and really friendly service! The BEC is consistently exceptional and the people are absolutely wonderful :)

Avocado Toast with poached eggs and spiced almonds is great, I get it every time I go. Fresh squeezed OJ is actually very good, but a little pricy. The Egg Bowls are good but don't wow. Overall highly recommend.

This is my seventh Yelp entry of my Tuesday coffeeshop series.

11th Street Cafe, I would like to thank you for increasing my faith in Chelsea/West Village coffeeshops.

I will pardon the fact that you only have one vegetarian sandwich available (okay, I see there is ONE more option for the pressed sandwiches). I WILL say that my sandwich was absolutely delicious. Sandwich came with sprouts, tomatoes, cucumbers, beets, arugula and avocado.

After that I treated myself to a tasty treat, mainly a cookie, that was topped with apricot and dipped in walnuts. Gimme gimme. :)

The cafe *is* small. It is quaint and I am *so* happy it was not packed. At least three tables open during this weekday afternoon on my 1.5 hour stay. The internet is consistent, too! Yippee! :)

There are:
+ coffee selections
+ espresso selections
+ loose teas
+ special teas...wait...special?! ;)
+ salads
+ sandwiches
+ pressed sandwiches
+ smoothies/juices
+ omelette varieties
+ 7 scrambled egg varieties...seriously?! awesome. :)
+ bagels
+ buttermilk biscuits
+ beer! (Racer 5 IPA, Red Rocket, Stella, Hoegaarden, Blackhawk Stout)
+ red and white wine

9 tables available...or 18 seats to set your bum on. Also! a lovely bench outside.

I think I am in love.

I love this place.  Arguably the best eggs in the WV.  The egg whites, turkey and caramelized onions is my favorite.  Staff is always super nice too.  ONLY complaint is $4 for a small black ice coffee is WAY too much.  Not a big deal I'll still come back for the food.

More of a 2.5 star :(

Chocolate croissant - superb. Flaky on the outside and soft on the inside.

White mocha latte - meh. It tasted very artificially sweetened. A bit disappointed. Pretty expensive for what it is too.

I have been here twice now and am so charmed by this place. The staff is so welcoming and kind, the food is delicious and consistent in quality, and the atmosphere is perfect for cozying up and getting some work done.

I huddled up here on two separate occasions for hours, working and indulging and I really have enjoyed it. The egg scramble cups are a lot of food and really delicious, I've had the hazelnut coffee and vanilla chai lattes - both equally great. The wifi is strong and I haven't had any issues with my work itself, which was important to me.

I was the most touched by the staff not kicking me out as they close down from 4:30pm-5:30pm to re-set and turn from a cafe to a wine bar. I am now enjoying the wine bar atmosphere here and absolutely love it as both the cafe and wine bar. Please don't change what you're doing!

Cute neighborhood cafe. Very welcoming and inviting. They had a delicious fresh strawberry lemonade that was the perfect thing on a hot July day. The macchiato was top notch and the coffee was a good roast. I didn't get to sample their food but everything I saw looked delicious. Very cute place.

Window seat with cushions, check. Free Wifi, check. Available electrical outlets for laptops, check. Coworking in this cozy cafe on 11th Street is possible if you can find a seat.

No shortage of cold and hot beverages, and the staff are all super friendly and really, really nice. I'm glad someone recommended me this laptop-friendly place for my web worker needs.

First time here.  I'll be here again.

What you need to know:
*Free wi-fi.
*Good coffee.
*Cheddar and Egg biscuit with Ham was delicious --- ask for it toasted.
*Selection of wines and beer available.
*A total of nine tables... each seats 2 people.  So yes, it's tiny.
*Was here for two hours and there were always people in line; was almost always about five people deep.  For a tucked-away neighborhood spot, pretty impressive.  No fears though, service was pretty fast.

Only real downer is that there's no restroom.  Think it might be intentional; otherwise people like me would be here all day. :)

I'm an absolutely sucker for the biscuit breakfast sandwiches they have here. I could eat one for every meal of the day and not get sick of them!

However, the coffee is pretty disappointing. It's always kind of thick and tarry.  I haven't tried any of the fancier drinks, so maybe those are a little more palatable.

My go-to coffee place. They're doing curbside takeaway during the pandemic. The iced Mocha is beyond the beyond--my favorite coffee drink in the world. Love this place and the people who work in and run it. Please support them during these tough times.

This place is amazing. They have the best blueberry muffins but you have to get there early in the morning since they sell out fast. All of the food here is great the coffee is also amazing. A really nice spot filled with locals and really kind staff. If you're lucky you might catch Julian Moore or peter Dinklage.

So disappointing!  For years this was my favorite coffee shop in NYC.  I loved their biscuit sandwiches.  I excitedly went there for breakfast today and was disappointed to see that their quality has declined substantially.  The once delicious biscuit is now a smooshed, greasy, bun that looks more like a Mickey D's bun.  Not sure what happened here, but it looks like I'll be finding a new go-to in the west village.

Two stars only because they have good pastries and the staff is generally nice.  However, the BLT has really gone downhill.  It was dripping in grease and the bacon was just one giant glob of squishy, chewy fat.  When I called a few times to replace the order...no answer. A giant disappointment.

Was on my way for to get the Greyhound bus to Washington, DC from New York 9 A.M. Friday morning.  While I waited to meet up with the rest of the family that was going with me, me and my uncle stopped here for a bite to eat and some coffee.  Thankfully there was no line but the tables were packed and the only place to sit was the counter that was on the outside edges of the "cafe".  I wanted a roll but they had none so I instead ordered a plain bagel with butter and a medium coffee.  The coffee we got was very big for a medium.  The bagel was soft and chewy with a whole lot of butter (yum!)  It was just a bit difficult to balance on the high chairs by the counter without dropping my cane.  Not a bad light breakfast.

Great little coffee and boba stop right in front of our airbnb. The owner is very sweet and provided great service. Boba for $3.50 is great for the area! We had the milk tea, mango tea and passion fruit tea. They also had little packaged snacks you can find at the grocery store. Great for a grab and go as you travel around the area.
GREAT bubble tea

I'm liking my Thai iced bubble tea and thought Ms Piao behind the counter was great. I appreciated that she asked me if I wanted sugar or not. Her family is Korean but she was born in Northeast China. Might go up to 4 stars once I try a little more of the (very extensive) menu.

This was our first trip to NYC with our tween daughters who expressed an interest in seeing some Broadway shows. When planning/preparing for this trip, we knew this would not be a cheap vacation. Air fare to NYC from Honolulu = $$$$. Tickets to 4 Broadway shows = $$$$. Hotel in Times Square for a week = $$$$.

Given the speed that money was being drained from my wallet, 99 Cent Fresh Pizza was definitely the best find on our trip! 99¢ for a huge slice of cheese pizza!!! $8 for a whole cheese pie!!! Our daughters are 13 years old - they would happily eat cheese pizza every day!!! Win - win!!!

Can get busy (of course) so expect a line - especially during lunch time. Slices with other toppings (pepperoni, etc.) cost a bit more.

Good cheap late night pizza option. They have a lot of options for toppings apart from the classic cheese and pepperoni slices, such as sausage and ham. They also have some specialty pizzas like chicken ranch.

On their menu outside, it says $1.75 for the regular pizza slices, plus $0.75 extra per slice. If you order 2 slices and a soda/water, you are supposed to pay $3.

I ordered 2 pepperoni slices and a bottle of water and was charged $4.50, which is disappointing when they advertised a different price.

They are cash only but have an ATM inside. The restaurant itself is really small with no indoor seating.

Oh my gosh!!! Amazing pizza for an amazing price!! We got to our room at the Hyatt Grand Central around 11pm and we're like, "We need some NY Pizza!" So we did a search and found this was only about a block away. Couldn't believe how nice the workers were and how great the price was for a large cheese pizza! Don't hesitate to go! They're close late and open early!!
Hot, fresh and available after hours. Other than that nothing to recommend this pizza. The guy who serves it is such a  sourpuss. I can't even tell you.

Some locals said that this specific location served their favorite dollar slice. I thought it was a legit recommendation. I picked up 2 slices and a soda for $3 and it did not taste or feel like I was eating lower grade food. The pizza had good taste and structure. I was happy with the pizza and the service was great too. It's a super simple and small shop. There's no seating. I recommend them and I'll return.

Word on the street that this is the best 99c pizza in NYC.

Now I don't have 99c pizza often because I tend to dislike it, but I decided to give this place a try because I heard it was a bit of a hidden gem.

They still honor 99c pizza - you can get two slices and a drink for 3.00 which is a steal, esp with how inflation is these days (3/31/23).

I got exactly that and have to say that the cheese an tomato sauce are the winners here. It was actually kind of good, and beats all the dollar pizza I've had to date. The crust is a bit airy and not like super super thin or crispy the way I like my pizza, and does taste a bit cardboardy but knowing that it was just a dollar, I'm pretty happy and can see why people consider this spot the BEST 99c pizza in NYC.

Wishing this place all the success! Look for the green sign - and check out their menu listed outside, you can get whole pies and limited toppings are available for whole pies. I went around 2pm on a weekday and there were 3 people in front of me. It's a bit of a whole in the wall.
The best 99 cent pizza and the people are really nice. Quick easy and fast delicious meal

Before going on vacation, I was warned by my NYC colleagues to avoid the dollar pizza places since they mentioned it isn't great.  With that being said, a dollar pizza is still pretty intriguing since it kind of feels like a very NY thing to find a slice that cheap. In any case, I just happened by this place as I was walking to check-in at a nearby hotel.

The dollar slice is just a plain cheese slice.  I think since they sell so many slices, their cheese is hot and gooey since it never sits too long in the counter.  There's just enough tomato sauce on it to make you realize they did add it, but otherwise it's pretty skim.  In fairness, this isn't supposed to be a meal substitute.  It's good for a quick snack, especially at night when a lot of places are closed.  I picked up 2 slices and a canned soda for $3.  You really can't beat that.

The place is really small since most of the back is for their ovens.  There's probably only enough room for 4 people to wait inside.  When you get to the counter, you just tell them what you want, pay (cash only), and they hand you the slices.  You can add some pepper flakes, parmesan, or oregano at the side and walk out.  There's no place to sit or stand inside to eat.  If you're waiting for an entire pie, you'll definitely need to stand outside.

For the price, these places can't be beat. For $.99  the pizza is always fresh and tastes pretty good. Some of their speciality or additional
toppings are extra, but once again for $1.00 for cheese pizza I actually prefer this over some of the more expensive places around.

Was kind of shocked when I received my slice of "chicken ranch" pizza ($2.50) as it appeared to be literally a slice of cheese pizza with chopped up chicken nuggets and ranch dolloped on top. I was expecting a white sauce pizza but evidently not the case, and I probably should have lowered my expectations given the name of the place. Despite the appearance, I thought it was good, though I don't think I'll pay an extra $1.50 for the ranch and nuggets next time. Friend thought her dollar slice of cheese pizza was lovely and hit the spot. Our slices took a while to receive because they heated up in the oven for us so it was nice and hot upon eating it at the outdoor tables in a nook between the shop and a corporate building a few steps away.

The 99c pizza does not disappoint. Seems too good to be true but the price, quality, and size are all true and it is absolutely fantastic. Fresh pizza was ready, quick service, and perfect for a quick snack.

When you're hangry and only have a few dollars in your pocket and need a quick bite this will work.

Located steps from Grand Central Station this .99 cent pizza joint is the only dollar pizza place in the area. Pretty good deal of $2.75 for two cheese slices and a bottle of water or can of soda.

Nothing special here as it's a tiny grab and go spot. The pizza is pretty much like eating soft thick cardboard with some cheese and sauce on it. You basically eat this because it's cheap and will fill you up, but definitely not for the taste. Not horrible but not terrific either.

Oh, and it's cash only.

What can I say? It's only a dollar a slice. Huge slice covered in melty cheese. Decent crunch on the outside of the crust while fluffy inside.

This location is right next to grand central terminal, making it super convenient to grab a slice.

I got the cheese, pepperoni, and sausage slices. The sausage wasn't spread uniformly, but I mean its a dollar. The pepperoni was super greasy, so I wasn't a huge fan of it. But the cheese is a solid choice.

Definitely not the best slice of pizza in NYC, but I would come back for a quick, cheap bite.

This place is cash only btw.
Really good pizza.  I ordered a whole pizza of half cheese and half pepperoni along with 5 sodas for only $18!  Quick service!  No seating.  I highly recommend.

$8 extra large pie. You can't find that everywhere anymore. Tip these hardworking guys extra cuz this pizza is good and we want them to stay in business. Fast, reliable, delicious. It's not gourmet pizza- it's NYC pizza no frills.
Hole in the wall. Fast service. Decent pizza at a great price. Good for when you're hungry and many eateries have closed for the night already.

Was in town to see the sights and watch a baseball game. Got a pepperoni pizza from this establishment delivered to my hotel room. It wasn't bad, but given the reputation of NYC pizza, I was expecting better. Still, there was nothing wrong with it. A decent pie that helped refuel me after a day of walking around the concrete jungle.
The best $0.99 pizza in NYC, bar none. Thank you for providing tremendous value and good pizza to the neighborhood, we greatly appreciate your shop!

I knew I couldn't leave New York City without trying out a .99 cent pizza joint. It was my last night and this place closed very late. We got to our hotel, I got comfortable and then decided to walk here for one last quick bite for my last night in the Big Apple.

99 Cent Fresh Pizza didn't disappoint. It tasted fresh and was very cheesy. Could have used a little bit more sauce, but otherwise a perfect slice of just 99 cents. One thing thing that to have noticed in the NYC pizzerias is not only do they offer Parmesan cheese and red pepper, but they also offer garlic salt. In Chicago we offer oregano, but garlic salt makes the pizza taste fantastic. Will definitely be keeping an eye out for this pizzeria next time I'm in town.

This is one of the many 99 Cent Pizza Shops I've been to while I'm here in the city. As always, never disappoints. Ordered ahead and got my pizza on time. The gentleman working late night was friendly fast and accommodating for anything extra I needed to take with me back to my hotel. Pizza is always hot and crispy and has just a fresh taste. Never feel bad after eating it either it's almost like it doesn't just sit in your stomach like a brick. Will always show love to the 99 Cent Pizzerias! Thanks for the business!

Not only is the pizza cheap but it's the most delicious pizza I have head in a long time!

Thin crust, fresh ingredients, the pizza was not oily and it was amazingly tasty! I recommend these guys any day of the year!

Honestly I just wanted some good quick pizza and this place was walking distance from the hotel I was staying at, and the deal they offer seemed too good to pass up. You can get 2 slices any toppings and a drink for $5. They just make cheese pizzas and then throw toppings on them and reheat them. Still I thought, couldn't be that bad. Ive been to some shitty hole in the wall spots and the pizza has been great.

Long story short - it was not. It was stiff and hard and dry and not worth the $5 even - I would have much rather paid $20 and had good pizza. Disappointed!
Cheese Pizza by the Slice was pretty good for a 99 cent pizza. I would recommend this place for a cheap meal. Not far off Ground Central.

I don't know how this can cost just 99c.

Amazing to be able to grab a quick slice of great pizza for a handful of pocket change.
$2.75 for 2 cheese slices and a drink!  Cannot go wrong on a night where you need a snack. CASH ONLY. The pic is from the next day when we went BACK to get an $8 pie!

Really f***g good pizza. $2.75 for 2 cheese slices and soda. So so good!!!
We went at 2 am and wanted pepperoni slices but they only had cheese. Only cash as well.
There might be a better 99 cents slice in NYC but I don't know them. The dough is l dope.
Good stuff for a good price! 75 cent cheese slices.  Fluffier style bread.  Good sauce.
Better than the vast majority other pizza I've had and the cheapest you can get, too. Perfect if you're looking for a plain slice, but it's probably not as worth getting toppings.

Super good for a quick bite and so cheap. Literally $2 for to pieces of pizza. Was late when we went and it was fresh out the oven. Of course would love some flavor to the sauce and more cheese but you get what you pay for. I could easily eat a few pieces.
The space was tight and overwhelming, and the service was not good the guy was pushy and rude. The pizza was okay and nor worth the price.

This place has been around for as long as I can remember! Their 2 slices and 1 can of soda for under $3 is still the best deal ever IMO. Sometimes all you need is a dollar slice of NYC pizza to hit the spot--their hours great especially if you are having a late night!

Hole in the wall, cash only pizza spot. They were out of most slices except for cheese. But it was a good slice! It's quite greasy so be prepared. Best enjoyed on the sidewalk when it's freezing outside.

11pm - Just off a cross country flight - check into hotel and no restaurant open.  Staff tells me about a small pizza place 1 block away "99 cent fresh pizza" - BEST pizza I've had in a longtime in NYC. 2 slices / 2 drinks for under $5 bucks. 1969 prices and A+ flavor

Rating out of 10: 9

For a dollar slice, this place is pretty good. First time I went I got a slice of a freshly made pie. Not the thinnest crust or crispest bottom but for a dollar it's pretty good. The pie was sauce, greasy, and salty.

Second time: not as saucy and not freshly hot out of the oven but it was still fresh and better than the one up at 55-57th

I would come back and recommend to a friend.

Saw the good reviews so ordered while staying here from Florida.   Missing toppings on each of the 4 slices we ordered, even paid .75 for sausage to be added and it was not, also forgot one of 3 drinks.   Called to let them know and was hung up on.  They acknowledged they missed it and when I asked if they'd be bringing us our correct order they said yes, ok and never showed back up.   Taste was not all that great, should've looked for other pizza places near by.  Very disappointed
For a buck, you cannot go wrong. I've had 4 dollar slices that were worse than this place.
It was amazing pizza with a good price. Try it if you want a good pizza and not looking to go out to eat.

By no means is this four star pizza when you compare it to the great slices in NYC like DiFara and Joe's, but for a dollar slice joint where the equivalent of a subway swipe gets you two slices and a soda, it's among the better options. You get what you pay for, but I'll be damned if it didn't hit the spot after a day on my feet directing subway passengers during a service disruption.

the staff is very welcoming every time I come, they remember who you are and make a point of recognizing you. the pizza is quite good for 1 dollar, people definitely pay $2+ for slices like that at other places. a whole pizza is only $8 too, definitely worth a try
Incredibly fast service and tasty pizza. $7.50 for 3 slices, a soda, and a water. Best deal in Manhattan!

It's not NYC's best pizza, but it's plenty tasty if you're on this side of midtown and need a couple of slices. Take out only--this joint is barely big enough to fit the oven, the pizzaiolo, and the sales guy.
Delicious, fast and affordable pizza served right out of the oven - with toppings as you please. Fully halal. Well regarded. Just make sure you don't wait for the pizza to get cold!

Having walked around NYC all day, we were ready for pizza and relaxing in our room... this pizza was great and a great price!!  Perfect crust, thin... not too crispy, not too soft! Just right on the sauce and toppings too!  Excellent choice!

All I needed was a quick, fast, fresh pizza. Which I'm obsessed about.

I get pepperoni, and cheese. The pepperoni is $1.50 and the cheese is a $1.00, they let me put as much Parmesan cheese as I like. The employees are fine. All I care about here is the Parmesan cheeeeeeese.

Great service, love the pizzas and the employees are professional. Highly recommend this small business in a big city!

Yours truly,
Nick.

Good pizza place and especially good for the price you get a good size slice of pizza for $.99 can't really beat that it's close to my hotel in Manhattan and we stayed there it's open 24 seven and get it you tell me want to slice you get in you get out and boom done good pizza

A decently-sized slice of cheese pizza for 99 cents in NYC? How can I resist?

Before I left for home, I stopped by here for a snack as it was closest to my hotel. It definitely got the job done as something before the drive up. There's enough cheese to make it satisfying while the tomato sauce was savory and not sweet. I can't stand sweet tomato sauces in pizza. The crust could've used a bit more baking but it wasn't too raw. Plus the dough wasn't too dough-y but not cracker-crumbly thin either.

You can purchase an entire cheese pizza for $8 (I'll let you do the math as to how many slices does that consist of). Oh and the slices are just one size, which is about a large.

Not much to say, except they serve a ton of freshly baked, great tasting, classic NY style cheese pizza for less than a buck (tax included, adding toppings costs extra)!  

Despite what you might expect from the price, the cheese actually had a surprising amount of richness and depth to its flavor compared to the bland & cheap alternatives you'll find elsewhere, making this a fantastic value and worth going for anyone nearby with a craving.

Quick, fresh pizza for $1 a slice or $8 for a pie, you can not go wrong. I did not try the toppings, stuck with the cheese and it was good.  Not gourmet pizza, but good edible pizza ready in a minute that will not break your budget is a win with me.  Works great after a night of drinking also!
Must try!
It's been 3 times, yes you read that correct THREE times . My pizza comes ice cold & I mean it's like they never even put it in the oven

I have spent much time, and a fair few dollars, in desperation to find the best Deli in Manhattan. Thankfully, the thousands of steps and sleepless nights have not gone to waste. Just as I was about to give up all hope, I stumbled into 45 Deli and ordered the 'Reuben'. Believe me when I say, it doesn't get much better than this!

If you're round the corner, down the street, or even in the same timezone, I would thoroughly recommend this deli.

Good convenient spot that's not far from our hotel.

They have a bar of food items. Drinks and snacks and more.

We grabbed some carbonated water, OJ and some snacks.

Really nothing special going on here. Was hoping for that New York sandwich shop deli with fresh sliced "deli meats". Didn't see any fresh slicing going on here. Unfortunately they couldn't understand what we meant by remove bacon and put on side, they actually charged us for extra bacon. Weren't super friendly, tried to work with them? Inside is just a typical run of the mill place. Don't really recommend it. Food is mediocre at best.

Specifically went to buy flowers, they have a nice flower selection.  Usually there is someone working in the kiosk near the flowers, very pleasant and helpful, cuts the stems of flowers where I indicate and makes a nice presentation with cellophane and ribbons and raffia - and for that I usually tip him.  At 11:30 am on a weekday this person was at lunch and after cutting the flowers myself with the sheers provided at the checkout - I asked for help with the other wrappings - and "the manager" was sent to help me.  This person was surly, rude, kept saying he didn't know what to do, and did not seem to want to work at all.  I had to insist on all of the elements while he clicked his tongue and threw the ribbon and the flowers at me, and laughed as he walked away.  Utterly the worst service ever - for flowers I had already paid for - NOT going back.  They lost a loyal customer.
Decent little bodega for a BEC sandwich (bacon, egg, cheese). Traditional style, thick cut bacon, served on a nice thick roll. Great spot for an on the go meal!

Most mornings I can say that this is a solid spot for your best breakfast sandwiches for the area (this area has subpar deli breakfast sammies in general) at a decent price.   The rolls are normally the best and for the most part, they cook the eggs just how you order them.

There's only been a few times there's been errors and they've stopped allowing us to carry in the puppy while placing the order, overall I still have to give them a good review; I had a pastrami hero called the "Havana" last night and it was to die for at just under the $10 price point which is a good price for all the flavor they packed in there with delicious and super thin cut pickles, warm and juicy pastrami, sharp melted Swiss, and your standard spicy brown mustard all in a wonderfully, perfectly toted hero bread that was just to magical at 10:30 (so convenient to have this yummy deli here when I wanna pop out of bed and jump down the road and across the street to satisfy a quick craving)
Food was delivered 30 minutes late and the western omelette was cold. Coffee and bagel was ok

Ordered breakfast delivery, bacon egg cheese on a roll. Bread was soft, bacon crispy, strongly recommend. Consistent, reliable, quick. Coffee was pretty good too. People that work here are kind, hard working.

A fantastic spot for sandwiches. I was actually somewhat apprehensive at first..
