I don't normally order deli sandwiches and I never order tuna sandwiches, I don't know how long it's been sitting there, but damn it was really good. Just like how I remembered it. Also I ate it 5 hours after I picked it up at the deli. I was actually goin to eat it the next day but I was curious and took a bite really late and night. I normally eat dinner pretty late every night anyway. I ended up eating almost the entire roll, I gave some to L.. who doesn't love a good tuna sandwich. Chicken salad had a lil too much mayo for me, but L enjoyed it. He loved his Reuben sandwich. Everything we've tried has been great.
The lady was really nice too. We were really late coming in to pick up the food. Good prices, especially for the city, much cleaner than your typical deli. Come in if you're in the area!

A OK deli on 45th st and 2nd ave to grab a quick bite via a sandwich,  salad , drinks , sweets , hot food, snacks,Etc .   Its open 24/7  and not too many food joints are open during the witching hour . On my two visits I ordered just a sandwich  and its really hard to screw up turkey and Swiss on a wedge and thankfully the guy behind the counter didn't.  Nothing fancy at this deli is going on and that's just fine with me. P.s. try to avoid self service salad bar during covid and the flowers for sale are a bit overpriced.
Consistently good quality food, with fast and friendly service. A hub of the area for quick dining on the go.

MealPal:

Chicken Salad Wrap

Decent lunch portion
Full from eating two thirds due to amount of chunky chicken and lettuce
The mayo can be overwhelming

Wednesday, June 20, 2018
Thursday, July 5, 2018
Quarantined and needed a good breakfast sandwich this morning! The pastrami and cheddar was great and my bf tricked me into eating egg so yay!!

Just moved into the area and i decided to check this place out on a whim for dinner. Ordered the havana sandwich and a chicken salad sandwich. The havana was a little saltier than i expected but the chicken salad sandwich was great. They were also toasted! Would definitely come back again.

I'm a big fan of this place. They are completely NOT like any of the other deli spots in the area. They are friendly, they don't rush you at the counter to order or pay. Their prices are actually REASONABLE!!!! They have good bread, fresh bagels, and they have Boars Head Cold Cuts so that's always a plus.

This place deserves a medal for being the way they are around here.

I decided to write a review bcuz I've been coming here for the last 3 years since I started workin around UN plaza and stop there at least 2x a week.

Food is always fresh, the service is timely and the prices are very cheap for the area.

The couple that owns this place are always there greeting you with a smile or Hello!  & the workers are always just as pleasant.
Definitely the worst place to buy food. The cashiers are RUDE and the food is bad and overpriced. Stay away from this place.

My three roommates and I literally order from here for at least one meal every day. Been doing so for the past two years. Felt wrong not to leave a review. Egg sammys are awesome. Delivery is quick. They always get our orders right. People that work there are all friendly. Lots of deli bodegas in the neighborhood but this is the only one that will get my business that's for damn sure.

Keep doing what you're doing guys.
I go here at least once a week! Exactly what you want from a deli - friendly staff, great for both breakfast and lunch.

So I had to stand outside of the UN all night.  Yeah, I know boring.  Only this place and A Dunkin were really open at 4:30am.

It's a standard bodega/deli deal.  Sandwich counter, packed area with all kinds of snacks and drinks.  They had chapstick thankfully since I forgot mine.

They were nice and all.  My sandwich was good.  Good little spot if you happen to be in the area.

Great Sandwiches and service. I get the pastrami, Swiss, mustard, and add board head turkey sliced thin to it. Got to get that dark and light mix thang going on. If you heat it up your the real deal. Fries and onion rings are ok. Hash brown got to get well done.
Think of the local deli for the belly! Breakfast walk in is quick and so is delivery.
This deli has a nice selection of fresh flowers.  One of my favorite things about NYC is all the great delis.

My favorite part about 45 is the utilization of space.  It's not large, but every square inch is covered with something good to sell.  The healthy chip selection was very good, despite its size, and the chicken salad wrap was very decent.  Maybe a little bit too much filler, but the chicken was solid.  And it was cheap.  Like 3-4 dollars cheap.  And despite my total being $5.65, there was no bogus $10 and up credit card rule, they were fine with $5.

Quasi-generic delis have a lot of competition, but I'll be checking out 45 again.

A lot of people go here for lunch from my work. I'd say 3 days a week.

Plenty of sandwich and salad options, with your standard convenience store options as well.

I generally get out with a sandwich, soda and apple or orange for less than $7 when I go.

It's like any other deli I've come across while in NYC.  Go there enough and they'll learn who you are, go there once and you won't be able to tell if they are laughing with or at you.

This place is my go to for coffee before work... A solid egg bacon and cheese w hot sauce on a roll... And when I want to be healthy, some yogurt. Everyone that works there is very kind and their food is on point. Happy to support this establishment.
I came in here to get a cup of coffee. The lady behind the counter was so rude. I won't be back!

From my first full time job out of college to my current one, I have stayed in the Midtown East area and this is the deli that I come to for salads for the past 8+ years. If I'm in the mood for a salad, they have a great bar and no matter how many toppings I put on, I never pass the $8 mark. They also always offer a piece of bread for your salad. They have a really lovely selection of flowers for a corner deli that they will happily put into a bouquet for you based on your choice of flowers. I really don't come here for anything else but the salad and flowers so I can't review it for anything else.

It's the corner deli around my apartment and it's decent. I mean what do you expect from the corner deli?

It has the normal sandwiches, wraps, and goodies. The sandwiches are decently priced and sized. Actually, I might even say that it's cheaper than other delis that I've seen in the city. Breakfast is definitely better there.

My gf says she would rate it a 3.5 star place. I'm not sure if it's worth that it's still a solid deli. If you're looking for a quite bite, it's fast and cheap.
Worst service ever. Don't bother asking them to re do an order they made mistakes on. They only want money and will charge you double for the next order.

Generally pretty good sandwiches here.  Like other posters, I am a big fan of NYC's deli scene, so I am always on the lookout for new bodega/deli type places. This one is only 2 blocks from my office so I go in quite a bit.  Good range of sandwich options, fresh sliced meat and cheese, decent rolls and heros.  Overall, I would recommend it, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat a sandwich from there.  3 1/2 stars.

i LOVE this deli. they are an every day stop for me in my am weekday commute. The guy behind the counter, Antonio, is great, always remembers my breakfast sandwich and its ready within 5 minutes and I am out the door on the way to work.   The sandwiches are fresh and delicious, my breakfast wrap (eggwhites, green peppers and onions on whole wheat wrap) is delish :)
My group comes here all the time to get breakfast sandwiches. Efficient staff, tasty breakfast (our favorite is a bacon, egg and cheese on a roll), competitive prices for the neighborhood.

This is my go-to deli stop. The food is decent and the prices are fair. I think their coffee and bagels are the best deal in Midtown. The ladies behind the counter are the nicest and the main reason I frequent this deli.
one of the best deli's in all of NYC. Great sandwiches (for breakfast and lunch) and the staff is nice and hilarious! They deliver anything and know their customers.

Ordered the burger with fries for $4.25+ tax.  Portion size surprisingly good, especially for NYC and considering the price.  Estimate patty was 0.25-third of a pound.  The fries were hot and crispy.  Funny because I also tried the Five Guys fries (around the block) and the Five Guys' were soggy and lukewarm, not hot like I like them.  Nice fresh bun and lettuce and tomatoes.  Five stars considering the price; relatively good deal considering typical NYC prices and good quality.

I am surprised there is not a single checkin or review on this place. I happened to be walking over to the Chinese place next door but decided to try this place (glad I did).

Nothing fancy or special, its just another Deli. But yes there is BUT it a deli in its true essence. A Decent meal at a decent price, dare I say cheap price.
A sandwich special will run you $7 including soda or water.
Lunch platter 1 meat and 1 side $6.5
Lunch platter 2 meats and 1 side $8

Everything here runs under $10. I am so glad I decided to try them, every once in a while you want a decent meal without spending a fortune and Deli 129 is the rescue at least for me.

I got the Park Ave Special Wrap only reason i give them a 4 is because the chicken cutlet was too dry and not enough ranch dressing, but I saw with other customers they were very accommodating.
I'll defiantly come back A LOT you should too. Give them a try u wont be disappointed
Best deli in Manhattan. You know it's good when you walk in and the line is out the door. Guys are funny as hell too. It's my only "must stop here" place in the city.

I accidentally ordered from this deli thinking it was the one on Lexington that seems to be closed.

The guy on the phone was nice and happy to take my ordered. When I got there it was a small hole in the wall I've walked by a million times but never been to. The sandwich was soggy and not bad then on the second bite I noticed a chemically scent. Either a cleaner or scented plastic smell. But sure if they wiped down a surface before assembling my sandwich  if the employee had hand lotion that that transferred to my sandwich but it was unpleasant and took a few sips of tea to get the taste out.  Hopefully, this is a one off but I won't be going back.

A bunch of crooks.  They advertise that the chicken parm hero is $8.99 with a can of soda or water on the sign out front. At checkout, they charge you $9.99 plus tax for a total of $10.99. When asked about the special advertised they say "oh it's $9.99."  I told them about the $8.99 on the sign outside and they didn't care.  Also, the chicken parm hardly had any chicken in it and there was no sauce.  Luckily the bread was good, but unfortunately, it was all bread. Have gone there for years but will never go back. Shady business dealings.

Let me tell you, 129 Gourmet Deli was actually wonderful. The price is right. They have a terrific menu also. Staff are really nice and service is really quick. Overall I'll recommend 129 Gourmet Deli to anyone which I have.
Amazing hole in the wall deli with great wraps. Definitely the best I've had In the area!!! Don't bother going anywhere else

My truck died in front of the deli and the owner was super generous - gave me a jump, and when that didn't work, tried to find me a tow. Great food, great service, and a genuinely kind person. Shukran brother.

You're risking your health in this hole.  I saw the gap-toothed guy behind the counter pickup a handful of vegetables out of the bin with his bare hands and put them in a container with chicken and rice.  He is foul and infects everything he touches.  Expect to spend plenty of time in the bathroom if you do go.

This is based on my grilled xheese with ham that I ordered. It was good. One review says they have an expresso machine, I did not see it byt eho cares. There is a minimum of $7 to use a card.. I am not from the area and did not know, oh well. I would come back fir a sandwich or salad. Salad stsrts st $7 with romaine lettuce...not bad st all.

I've been to this Deli at least a dozen times -- and I'll probably go back at least a dozen more. Good prices, good food, friendly service. I also like how when you order certain sandwiches (like the Monte Cristo) they give you a little sauce on the side to dip it in.  Good stuff.

Was looking for a good deli near grand central and found this place next to Midtown Comics! The staff is very nice, they serve breakfast all day, they have an espresso machine and a large salad bar! Very underrated deli! Also they have seating Incase you aren't eating in a rush!

Custom, made on the spot sandwiches and salads!

The staff are friendly and happy to customize your sandwich or salad exactly to your preference.  They have a large display of salad bar ingredients.  Nice aside is that they are a market as well so serve ice cream, soft drinks and beer/cider.

A great grab and go with plentiful, fresh portions!

This is hands down the worse deli I've ever been to in NYC - and I've lived here for 10+ years! I tried to grab a quick sandwich here for lunch and was sent around to 3 different people, and was forced to wait in line TWICE. then I asked for a bag to put my food in and was told I'd have to wait in line  a THIRD TIME. Given the million other delis in midtown, don't waste your time and money coming to this place.

Simple first time order; egg on a roll with coffee. What was delivered?
egg on bagel with tea-REALLY?!?!  
ONE AND DONE for this deli!

Ordered a chicken club panini from meal pass today. I arrive with the mealpass sign on the counter but they have no idea what the meal of the day is or what food should be ready for me. They then make me wait in line with everyone else and order my food from the sandwich counter- which completely defeats the purpose of mealpass. When I ask for the chicken club they advise that they don't have any left. As a part of this program, the restaurant is informed of how many people will be comping to pick up a lunch that day at 9:30am- there is no reason they shouldnt have a sandwich or be able to make me one. I had to order a different sandwich with the owner taking no responsibility for the fact that he was wrong because I was getting a sandwich either way.
They are the best! First off the food is great. They are so polite and happy to help. Most places with a salad station just yell at you to order quick and they are patient!
They opened this month and have a nice clean shop with friendly counter help.  Food is good and affordable!  I love the salads.

Open late and cash only. It is something like $3 for two slices and a drink.

You get what you pay for. It isn't as good as people are saying here. A frozen pizza from the grocery store is much better than this one. The crust was really thin and reminded me of cardboard.

I will still give it five stars for being open late and being super cheap.

The only 99 cent pizza is the cheese one I am forewarning you all- good thing is I like cheese pizza only. If you want pepperoni or anything else it's going to be $2+. A whole pie is 10$+ depending what you get which is not bad because the pizza does taste pretty good. Service is fast and area is nice. Smaller store compared to the others.

HEAR ME OUT! It's not trying to be pretentious. It's not trying to sell you something it's not. It's 99cent pizza! I came in expecting to spit it out but nah if you walk in at 2am drunk, a slice of the pepperoni sprinkled with peppers, Parmesan, and garlic...well it hits the spot!!! Way better than frozen pizza or Costco pizza. DiGiorgnos got nothing on 99cent pizza!

I mean, can you really go wrong with pizza in New York? Jk, but fr this place was pretty good. 1. You get insanely good prices for 2. A very very good pizza.
The crust was thin and crunchy and you could tell the pizza was fresh. The location was also very clean and they have some stools where customers can sit to eat their food.

Coming from the west coast, I wanted to try an east coast slice of pizza, or as they call it "pie". It was late, I had a few drinks, and I was hungry lol I yelped pizza near me and this spot popped up. I saw it said 99 cent pizza, and I thought "how bad can it be". It was about 3-4 blocks from my hotel so I walked over there. When I say hole in the wall, this is a hole in the wall. It's literally a fridge, a over and a counter. I got 2 slices of pep and a soda for like 4-5 bucks. Not sure if the pizza was even 99 cents but I didn't care at that point. Was the pizza good? Eh it was okay. Not bad, not good, but worth what it was worth. Def recommended it once your drunk, it hits the spot.
It was ok. We went late and got a specialty pizza, so wasn't very cheap. We should have just stuck with a slice of pep or cheese.

Doesn't look like much from the outside but for the price in the heart of midtown lies NY style pizza for an extremely cheap price!! I always manage to grab some to bring with me on my train ride home back to CT!! For the price it is definitely worth it!! I got a large pepperoni, 4 slices of cheese (half a pizza) and 7 waters for $23 dollars!! Try finding another better deal in midtown!! The pizza is nothing special just a normal NY slice but the cheap price makes it taste a whole lot better!!

To be honest, despite low expectations to begin with given the price, it was still much worse than expected. Doughy, chewy, and oily with maybe a hint of tomato -- I ended up throwing it out. Even at this price point, there are better options. I hate frozen pizza but I'd readily settle for a pie from a CVS freezer over this.

I had this for the first time, and let me tell you, it was amazing. I loved the suttle sauce (meaning, it wasn't too heavy, but great tasting) on a plain cheese slice. Now, I want to walk around NYC and try other places to compare. It's a must try...let me know what you think.
This place is absolute trash.  Its the worst slice I have ever had in NYC.  Go anywhere else.

For the price what more could you want or ask for. Nothing else is this cheap to just stop in and get hot food. Service is quick as long as they have pizza available. While there's only room to stand and eat inside, it's great for a quick take and go.
Great inexpensive fresh cheese pizza. Owner was friendly. Very satisfied with the product and service.

We tried pepperoni , pineapple and mushroom slices. Simply loved the pizzas,
Yes they were greasy but very fresh and superb taste.
With toppings it was little more than a dollar. 6 slices only $9.
One thing to remember though - it's cash only
Definitely must try.

Well what can be said about 99 cent pizza.
Expectations low but food was pretty good.  It was literally 1 slice of pizza.
I was in there at 2:00am 2 days ina row. All the Uber drivers, cabby, night time construction workers and NYC police man where in there getting pizza.
I wound recommend for a decent late night snack/food.
12 dollars for 8 slices of pizza and 4 soda! Exactly what we were looking for, cheap, fast, easy and yummy

What's more iconic than NYC 99c pizza? Nothing....this place is a dying breed and a NY staple. I've been coming here for years and the pizza is always consistently delicious. The perfect meal for a quick bite on the run or the late night munchies after the bar. There can be a line, but it moves quick. These guys know what they're doing.
Some of the best pizza we've Ever had. Fabulous price. Don't let the price fool ya!! We will be back again on our next trip to NY!

I would give this place 0 stars if I could! The beef pattie was gross had no clue what the crust or dough was and it was undercooked whatever it was. I ordered Hawaiian with Pineapple and Mushrooms and they forgot the Pineapple! Also the crust is BURNT! Look at the photo. So disgusting.
Listen.... It's ..99 cents and it's open late and it hits the spot when you are craving cheap pizza
Great pizza and best of all, cheap. Not $0.99 anymore but still worth it. The online ordering is great and ready when it says it is.
Decent pizza served on a paper plate. Fast service. Very cheap.  Limited seating. Not much else to say.

Found hair in all slices of my pizza. By the attitude of the staff members I'd suggest it was placed deliberately. I Immediately became violently sick. I wouldn't trust this place, the cleanliness, or the service. Would leave zero stars if I could & suggest reporting to health department for possible public hair or purposely placed hair in food. Extremely disgusting & disappointing. Go. anywhere. else.

It may looks like a "hole" in the wall, but it's an excellent place for a good slice at a cheap price!! $1 dollar cheese slices and $ can of soda.   Located in midtown next to Grand Central station. You won't be disappointed!

About as good as it gets for dollar slices in Midtown. This location is a few blocks north of Grand Central Station, and features a long countertop for eating in (no tables/seating). It's $1/slice, or $2.75 for two slices and a sugary beverage.

For me, a couple slices makes for a cheap, sufficient lunch. Turnover is fast, I always get a fairly fresh offering. I like to add a little parmesan, some crushed red pepper, dried oregano, and a squirt of buffalo sauce. Make life easier by paying the exact cost. If you have to pay with a bigger bill, be sure to count your change closely.
You get good enough pizza for a few bucks.  It's still NY pizza and tasted great with an orange soda.

No way.

When I came across this place online I thought it might just be one of those rare places that kick a** and are cheap. The pictures aren't stunning, but the reviews are pretty solid. I considered it a novelty I just had to try.

I ordered a large pep with extra cheese and a side of ranch. Ranch didn't show up. I did, however, get a pizza box wrapped in plastic and taped shut. I ripped that off and found the box had been taped shut in four different places. COVID related? Maybe.

Unpleasant crust, flavorless sauce, and salty salty cheese. So weird this place gets such high reviews. Also, I'm not sure how my pizza qualifies as having extra cheese (see pic).

I suppose if you just need something in your gut fast and for as little as possible, this is your place. I don't think this represents NY pizza (at least I hope it doesn't!).

It's dollar pizza that is made fresh and tastes pretty good. How could you give anything less than five stars, especially if you are coming from outside NY? Even if they burnt the hell out of that slice, it will still taste better than any pie you'll get back home.

Just make sure to bring cash and a hungry stomach, although it also makes a great light snack in between meals.
Great deal for delicious pizza! We were wanting a late night snack and this pizza was so good we went back for more 2 nights later!

i mean 99cent pizza, one dollar per slice and it's good! i'm not sure what else to say. you can order a whole pie but most people come in and get it by the slice. look, it's not fancy. it's a hole in the wall joint (several in NYC). it's not the cleanest but it's quick, hot and IMO really good. it's thin-ish pizza. there are some toppings like chili or garlic. if you want additional pizza toppings it's like 25cent or something (don't quote me in that). no alcohol. it's in the city. they do have non alcoholic drinks. no sitting room, just standing. cash only at this particular location. i bet the rest of them are cash only as well. i recommend it. i loved it. hit the spot.

Best pizza for the price. Crust is good. They have nice condiments on countertop. Lines move quickly. Cash only accepted here. No frills place.

I come here when I have No idea what I want to eat and want to grab a little something while I decide, or need a quick bite, orrrrr am hungover and need something to fill my stomach

Storefront name says it all!

Why you line up +'s:
+ $1
+ Fresh
+ Fast
+ Thin crust with chewy levels just right

why you keep walking -'s:
- No seating find a space to stand
- Cash only

I was interning for New York fashion week and the first night I arrived in NY I was starving and really wanted, of course, some NY pizza! It was about 1am and most places were closed, but here was the savior which didn't close till even later in the night so I decided to try it out! My hotel was about a 8min walk so I decided to place a pick up order, which was super simple! By the time I got there my Pepperoni Pizza by the Slice and drink combo were ready and it was super affordable! Pizza came in a plate and wrapped up so it was still fresh when I got back to my hotel. Only thing that could have some room for improvement is maybe a larger drink rather than just a canned soda? Other than that I would come back again when I'm back for fashion week in the fall haha!

I am rating it 5 because it is great value and good pizza. Now of course this isn't the best pizza you will ever have, but for $1, you wouldn't expect that. I expected it to be low quality but I was wrong. Good pizza and good size. Good value. If you get pepperoni it will be 1.50 (add .50).

Good value, good pizza for the price. Don't expect best pizza ever (5-star tasting).

But this place is 5 star because of the value and quick service.
Couldn't have asked for better. Just wow. Incredible. Tasty cheese pizza cooked perfectly w a nice crispy crust. Incredible for any occasion. I wish they had these in California :(

I wasn't expecting much from a slice of $.99 cheese pizza. I was pleasantly surprised. The cheese to tomato sauce ratio was perfect. The crust had a light garlicky taste and the bottom crust was cooked perfectly.

I was so satisfied with the pizza, I went back the next day and got another slice.

There are several $.99 pizza places in the area. The one we went to is right down the block from The Lexington Hotel. If you're ever in the area, give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.

All I have to say is WOW. Not what I was expecting for an $8 cheese pie.

We were visiting friends on a Saturday night and thought to stop by for pizza. We browsed on Grub-Hub and every site was $50 for 2 pies. As we were walking towards the apartment we stumbled across this pizza shop. We asked how much would it be for 3 pies (one veggie, one cheese and one beef pepperoni). He said $30 cash and we were amazed!!!

The line was out the door, because who wouldn't pay $1 for a slice of pizza and $2.50 for 2 slices and a can of soda!!! The price are unbeatable. After about 15 minutes our pies were ready (we went next door for drinks because they didn't have 2 liter sodas)

Once we got to the apartment and tried the pizza, we were impressed. My favorite had to be the veggie slice. It featured mushrooms and olives and I topped it off with fresh oregano!!

For the value, $10 a pie is incredible and the best dish to bring to a casual hangout or study date! Will be back for more!

PS: They are cash only

When I lived here I'd always wondered how the $.99 pizza tasted. But I never tried it as I had my favorite spots and I didn't venture too far away from those.

Wanting a quick snack before dinner, and since I was passing by this place anyway, I thought this was a great time to try a slice.

Small, simple, and to the point this place was. A couple of plain pies we're on display and toppings were added to the individual slices at the time of the order. I ordered a slice of pepperoni and I waited a few minutes for it to spend a little time in the oven.

Obviously this wasn't the greatest pizza but it actually wasn't bad. The cheese was well-melted and the crust was durable yet soft. But it had a little bit of a burnt crust aftertaste that was off putting and there was a ton of grease, presumably from the pepperoni that I added.

At $.99 a slice for plain or $1.50 a slice for pizza with a topping, this is an affordable snack for almost anyone. $2.75 will get you two plain slices and a soda.

Everything you would expect from a hole in the wall grab a slice kinda shop! Cheese pies constantly cooking, they add your toppings and throw back into the oven for a few minutes and comes out fiercely hot! And like NY style no silverware so careful not to burn your tongue if you're impatient like me! I actually liked the simple plain cheese better than the pepperoni but either way it's pizza at it's simplest cheesiest, greasy and cheap fashion!

We paid for two slices of cheese pizza and we're eating it there then someone else came in to buy the same thing and they charged him less than us. When I said something he tried to tell me I was wrong and then stopped knowing how to speak English.

DONT GET SHORT CHANGED!!!! I gave him a $10, he counted the change under the register tray so I couldn't see, handed me back $6...then when I started counting, he gave me two $1 coins in change to cover his scam

Count your change!!!!!

Found myself stumbling into this fine establishment last night after a long night at the pub.

First of all the pizza really is $.99, second of all you can get a whole pizza for eight dollars. That's right, eight dollars. Did I mention that the pizza is just as good as most of the other places I've tried on my pizza tour of New York City?

The little guy in there working was so happy, he sliced his pizzas with pride... And I was one extremely satisfied customer. Don't judge a book by its cover, just because it's cheap doesn't mean it's not good... It's good ;-)

Excellent spot for a quick slice of pizza. Pizza was already fresh and warm, no need to reheat it in the oven. By far the best $.99 cent pizza in town. Has great flavor, robust sauce, and they are not stingy with the cheese. A must try!

The pizza was good , the can sodas were 1 dollar each , 1 got 3 can sodas and slice of Pepperoni and it's sad to say that it was better than the meal we had eaten that was 112 dollars for 3 people and it only cost 4.50 cent , we took everything to go because no one liked the food . Was it eatable ? Yes was it good not really ! That's why I stopped and got   pizza from here on way home !

this is the best incarnation of nyc pizza in the world.
-piping hot and crunchy yet tender crust
-tangy tomato sauce
-gooey cheesy cheese

there's always a random slice of new yorkers when i go to this place. it is what defines new york as a melting pot (as well, noone makes eye-contact).

go there. i cannot recommend it enough.

When you visit New York you know you're about to have great pizza. What makes this location great is that they are open late so you can enjoy fresh hot pizza anytime.

The crust was thin and crunchy, with plenty of toppings to choose from.

Great price... a dollar a slice for cheese pizza, extra for toppings.

They daily special is 2 slices of pizza and a can of soda for under $3 is a great combo.

I had 2 hot slices to go and added a little hot sauce to spice it up.

Their pizza is very good, simple delicious and always fresh!!!
If you want to enjoy NY pizza come to this spot

I wanted something fairly local. What gets more local in NYC than 99cent slice Pizza?? I ordered straight cheese.

Food:
Decent pizza. Nothing to brag about, but for $.99 it is freaking cheap. Semi crispy New York style pizza.

Service:
Very fast lines. Get your $ ready because they are expecting you to know what you want when you get to the cashier.

Environment:
Swamped it down right then and there.

Price:
$.99.......

Food: 3
Service: 4
Environment: 3
Price: 5

I have been coming here for years yet this is the first time I've checked in and wrote a review. There are others throughout the city but somehow I like this one the best. Excellent cheese/sauce ration on a thin and slightly chewy crisp crust. Where else can you get a slice and a beverage for basically two bucks. I usually order a whole pie, cheese, for 8 dollars and take it home with me. And by take it home I mean on a plane back to the West Coast. Tiny little place. Standing room only with counters to eat your slice. Lots of assorted bottled beverages. You can get other toppings including mushroom pepperoni pineapple etc. Pizza always seems freshly made. Cash only. Near corner of 46th St. and Lexington and several hotels. Makes it convenient for a quick meal or snack. No parking that I'm aware of. Simple. Basic. Delicious. Give it a try.
We wanted some pizza to watch a soccer game in our hotel room. This is exactly what you think it's going to be: decent New York style pizza at a reasonable price.

I don't know if the 99 Cent Fresh Pizza is a chain, but the one few streets further down is much better.

I guess the only perk of this location (if you can even call it a perk) is that it has a standing area where you can eat indoors. Otherwise, it's a hard pass for me.

This is my favorite place to shop for produce for my salads and smoothies. It's all in one place!They have great prices on avocados and bananas. Very often I find organic fruit for a fraction of the supermarket price!
Best in midtown good prices lovely fruit and vegetables fresh every day highly recommend it to anyone who loves fruit and vegetables thank you for the great service

I sometimes buy fruits and carrots from them in the morning. In this area, Midtown East, pricing of vegetables and fruits at supermarkets is expensive, but this vender's pricing is cheap. Their fruits and vegetables seems always fresh, too.

They are there except winter. Sales person changes by the day or the time of the day. I think I saw at least 3 people who work there. One person was nice, one person was okay and the other had a emotionless mask. One day, when my coworker wanted buy fruits during lunch time, the sales person was away and his friend or a stranger was standing there. He said he was asked by the sales person to watch the shop. My coworker had to wait for the sales person to come back. In the morning, there is no problem, though.

Update: In September, I passed by this area after midnight and the vendor was still there! I wonder what is there bussiness hours.

Thank God for this fruit stand...otherwise I would be at the mercy of Morton Willams located kittycorner.  I now get 90% of my fruits and veggies from this stand.  They are usually set up early in the morning and well into the night.  They keep the NW corner cheery and animated.

One minor quibble....they label everything as being "sweet"...when sometimes they are not.  sweet bananas, sweet asparagus, sweet apples etc.

It's probably weird that I'm waiting a review for a fruit stand but these guys are simply the best. They are open all night and on the weekends, which is hard to find in Midtown East since it gets pretty quiet on the weekends and they have the best prices. I've seen some fruit stand guys change their banana prices every other day and here it's 4 for $1 all day, every day. The fruit and veggies are always fresh and I love that they have a variety of items to choose from...asparagus to strawberries. Job well done. P.S. NW corner

the best thing about 49thst and 2nd ave is the near the corner fruit and veggie stand that opens from 6am to after midnight . you cant beat this north west corner stands prices and  variety of goods are delivered early in the morning by truck so freshness is almost a given. the selection from apples to strawberries with mushrooms, baby carrots, eggplant,tomatoes,etc gives us street consumers a nice option besides the over priced morton williams and grestides  a block away. the fellows who man the stand are friendly and when they are busy you can bag you own produce. the 4 bananas for 1 buck is a good deal and 3 bucks for a pound of cherries as well.  the giant red apples  2 for a dollar and two large containers of strawberries for 4 bucks is unbeatable price wise, if you go to any indoor supermarket you will pay double.  for fruits and veggies the outdoor stands  is the best bet.  p.s. i always see the same couple sample the grapes and cherries but never buy a thing.
Probably the most variety of any fruit vendor between 34th and 57th along 2nd ave. The fruit attendee is always willing to change out your fruit after purchase. He's also willing to cut you a deal!

A great no frills smash burger that's the perfect meaty meal to fill you up. I love that they have a vegetarian option for those that are vegetarian or would rather not eat meat and still eat a burger. Their impossible patties are every bit as good as their beef ones! I usually get a double cheeseburger and an order of their impossible fries and man does it hit the spot! Their house sauce is also AMAZING so definitely get it if you like your burgers with sauce. Their impossible fries have a patty (can be made with an impossible patty too!) cheese and is doused with their house sauce and grilled onions. Overall, it's a quick turn around with each burger made to order, great service, but limited seating similar to their other locations! It's quite greasy but sometimes it's just what you need!

Check out my foodsta @chiuventure for a closer look and more details of my dining experience here as well as other establishments in NYC and around the world!

the service is so kind here...even when i walk in 10 minutes before closing!

this time i added an order of fries and they are the well done, extra crispy kind.  they also overfill an order (ala five guys) so this is my go-to over shake shack.

they've since changed their closing time to 1 hour earlier, but i guess i really shouldn't be eating this kind of food at 11pm anyway.

Friendly staff
Price are perfect for what they bring
I really don't like the burger
They don't have Diet Coke
Just 2 sodas and 1 water

Great spot for burgers.

Pros:
+ Like any other 7th street burger joint in the city
+ Friendly staff
+ Really great beyond burgers
+ Crowded, but service can be pretty quick
+ Open late at night
+ Simple menu - but well thought out

Cons:
- Limited seating
- Pricey for what you're getting

IG: QueenOfAdventureNYC

Delicious, ate my burger in literally 30 seconds it was so good, melts in your mouth. Perfection wouldn't change a thing! Fries are bomb too. Highly recommend, also service was amazing the manager Michael was so kind and made the experience memorable

I have tried a previous location of 7th Street Burger and felt it was just okay but this time around, I was highly impressed.

Their menu is simple: burger, cheeseburger, impossible burger, fries, and loaded fries. You can make any of the burgers a double.

The loaded fries were amazing. Honestly there's so much to love, it could easily be a meal on its own. The fries were served extra crispy, topped with meat (can be regular burger meat or impossible meat), and drenched in special sauce. It was indulgent deliciousness. Would be great for a hangover meal.

I also got the double impossible burger. The impossible meat was very juicy and savory. A friend ordered the regular burger and it was honestly hard to tell which was which. The double burger is super filling and the smashed style makes for a perfectly balanced bite.

Though there were a few hiccups with incorrect orders (ours was initially wrong and we saw quite a few other customers with issues), the employee at the register was super kind and apologetic. She did a great job of keeping the restaurant clean and making sure all customers were happy.

The shop itself has a small bench, two high top tables, and a counter against the wall. Except for the bench, there is no seating so it's definitely a grab-and-go spot.

Everything was delicious and I'm now a huge fan of this place.

Nice satisfying burger with lovely onions, such a great texture in the patty, and a greasy squishy bun. It's not that big for the size, but it's a solid burger. Kinda reminded me of a Philly cheesesteak in some ways. Great as a late night bite.

Walked by and had no idea this was the infamous 7th street burger. Very simple menu. Single or double cheeseburgers with fries... you can also get it impossible style...that's really it. Cheeseburger isn't huge and I consider it more of a big slider. I guess you can't get much for $7 these days! The burger was very good though. The bread was nicely toasted. The burger was tender and just right around of cheese/pickle/house sauce. I can see why this place gets hyped up. Very good. 4 stars all the way.

This was my first time trying 7th street - saw great reviews on Insta.

My only complaint was the size of the burger for the price. The single is pretty small (Texan in me...). Both the burger and fries tasted great. Fries were super crisp!

Their menu is limited, but they have an impossible burger for those who don't eat meat!

New location of 7th Street Burger. Greasier than I remembered from other locations, but good if you're in the mood for indulgence.

Fries were actually kind of next level. Delicious, and definitely a whole burger hidden in there.

My friend had a Yelp benefit here and was kind enough to invite me to tag along. We both been to another 7th Street Burger location, so we had an idea of what to expect.

We got two double cheeseburgers, a normal fries, and a chopped beef fries. The burgers and fries were really good, albeit a bit greasy. The chopped beef fries was massive, and probably can just be eating by itself haha.

The location was a bit small with limited seating options. The spot was quite busy when we arrived, but the staff were responsive and orderly. All in all: it's a good burger place, and would recommend people give it a try.

Wow. This may by my favorite burger place I've eaten at so far! They don't do anything fancy, just a standard burger, but they do it to perfection!

Their menu consists of a cheeseburger (can make it a double), an impossible burger, a grilled cheese, fries, and either water or a Mexican Coke(glass bottle Coke).

We got double cheeseburgers that come with grilled onions, pickles, and a tangy and creamy house sauce.

The burgers are going to be pretty greasy, but it's done tastefully. The burgers are smashed thin, allowing for the charred texture and flavor permeate the entire surface of the meat. The onions are so sweet, and the pickles add a great bite and acidity to the sandwich as a whole. Absolutely stunning.

The French fries are also incredible. These fires must be double fried because they stay so crispy even when traveling in a bag long distances. They are also salted well and have a lot of flavor.

I also really appreciate how they serve glass bottle Coke. Honestly, Coke taste the best out of a glass bottle.

The staff were extremely friendly throughout our arrival to the restaurant. This is a super small establishment that does not have any indoor seating, however it does have a small standing area with a long, narrow table on the wall. And there is additional outside seating.

I really don't understand any of these "cult like" reviews. The burger is descent at best & the only reason 2 stars was because it's relatively cheap.
But, look at that patty. ZERO CHAR, one pickle & the supposed cheese is vaporized.
Oh & thanks for the 6 micro pieces of onion. Very generous
Let's not forget the one pickle per burger. Yum
Shake shack quality of meat & execution FAR SUPERIOR.
The patty looks like they got it from the kill shelter next door

If you're in the mood for a greasy smash burger that hits 7th st burger is the spot. This is a local chain that offers a small but delicious menu consisting of smash burgers, loaded fries, and impossible burgers for the vegetarians. There was no seating at this location. It's more if a grab and go or stand and eat type of restaurant. The burgers are juicy and the fries are crispy and salty just the way I like them. I also recommend the loaded fries cause they were yummy. The special sauce was sooo good! I definitely recommend giving 7th St Burger a try if you're in the area.

I had the loaded fries and it was AMAZING. It blew my mind. It had fries, onions, meat, secret sauce, and cheese on top of it. It was super tasty and delicious. But all this was bad for health, shhhh : )

This is one of the top burgers in the city.

Nice, greasy, and very satisfying.

They don't do too many things here. Burgers and fries, and they do them incredibly well.

My son, who usually is very picky, scarfed down his cheeseburger with ease.

If you have the choice between shake shack and 7th Street, go to 7th Street.  You won't regret it.

I'll definitely be back.

Thank you Yelp and 7th Street Burger for hosting a great Yelp week.

Pretty good burgers here - a little slightly oily than what I would prefer, and the burger lollllllll looks unassumingly on the smaller side. Beware, don't underestimate the portion, however. It was still quite filling!

The fries were pretty decent here with a nice crispy finish. I ordered the fries that came with sauce, cheese, onions, and meat - very reminiscent of In and Outs animal style fries.

It was quite a bit of food - burger, fries, and a drink.

Would come back if I'm near a 7th Street Burger if I'm craving a smashed style burger.

I ordered the Double (+$3) Cheeseburger ( $6.5), Loaded fries ($9.5) and Mexican Coke ($3.5). I ordered it without the grilled onions this time. It was not as good but still delicious like their other locations. This is now my go to burger spot. Their loaded fries is a must try if you never had them before.

Awesome burgers, on the same level as In n Out. Get the double patty with everything, the grilled sweet onions makes all the difference. Best part is the monster fries. Perfect deep fried, crispy and still moist, topped with a chopped patty, onions, and monster sauce. So good.

SO GOOD. I've had 7th street burger in the other location and this one was no exception! The staff is also super accommodating for any special requests!

I got the double cheeseburger which came with the sweetest chopped onions, two smashed patties, and slices of cheese. I asked for the house sauce on the side, which was a thick mayo based sauce. The star of the show was the soft brioche bun that was buttered and toasted.

We also got the loaded fries, which had chopped burger patty, onions, and house sauce. The house sauce was a bit overwhelming, and I wish there as an option to have the house sauce on the side as it ended up drenching the crisp fries and making it difficult to eat.

Definitely a greasy meal- but worth your calories for

Simple, good, semi-fast food burger joint.

Smash burger on a buttered and toasty Martin's potato bun, with chopped onions and special sauce
I recommend getting a double cheese burger because they're pretty tiny. The fries were pretty good, some were a little too oily.

Not much seating space inside. Service was good.

I almost gave 3 stars and said it was a little pricy for what it is but it's in between a fast food McDonald's/Burger King, and a 5 guys/shake shack. And it's a small business, so really I think the price point is fair.

Would come back for a quick burger!!

OMG! Greasy Hog heaven! This burger should be illegal...single or double, get it with the onions...the potato roll is perfect  What a guilty pleasure! Wow! Right up there with the great NY Burgers like Jackson Hole, and Paul's (on 7th street) this one is on 49th even though it's called 7th street. Go figure. EAT THE BURGER!

The burgers are fantastic. There's not much room for seating. Our family of four huddled around the back booth, really built for 3. Service was quicker than anticipated. One of the better burgers I've had!

Great burgers! I scarfed mine down minutes after opening it up. There's no seating if you're looking to dine in - only some standing tables and counter space. But the buckets of ketchup will certainly help keep your fries flavorful.

The wait time is between 2-5 minutes and the food is fresh. The impossible burger and fries are delicious. And the ambiance is like a typical burger spot with a place to sit and enjoy your meal if you want. I rate this place a 10/10.

1 word.  only 1.  AMAZING.  

These are delicious hamburgers.  High quality and great value.  Melt in your mouth.  A little bit on the greasy side, but OMG, so yummy!   And the fries are superb.   Pure deliciousness.

I am a HUGE hamburger lover and these are right up there.   Put the hugely overrated J.G. Melon to shame at almost half the price.

I work a block away from the 49th street location.  Super convenient and excellent speed and service.

Others in my office rave about this.  And with good reason.  And you will too.

Came here for the Yelp Elite National Burger Day and it was an overall great experience. Staff was friendly, service was a bit slower than previous times/locations but that's okay. I really enjoyed my burger and I will continue to support 7th St Burger! My first time at this location and I would come back. Thank you!

I stopped in not expecting much. But I was was completely shocked by the service and burger!! Please add milkshakes to the menu.

Late night indulgence!
Great tasting burgers, like big white castles but tastier. This is a good burger greasy spoon
Quality fast food smash burger, can't go wrong with it. Service is quick. Had fries also which aren't pictured, but also tasty.

I love 7th street burger!!! So thrilled that they opened a new location in midtown east. Much like the other locations, I would recommend getting your food to go. They do have a few tables if you want to eat in. The menu is limited but done well! The loaded fries are my favorite part but the burgers are also amazing. It takes ~5 mins to get your food but it's all fresh and hot. Highly recommend!!

Came here for the Yelp Elite Week event.  The food was delicious and service was very good but the venue is TINY and it was a bit crowded when I went on a weekday evening.  If you're looking for a dine in experience this isn't it but if you're just getting food to go and won't be traveling too far or are eating on the go, you'll be very pleased.  I'd go back if I were in the area and invited out.

This is the second 7th street location that I've visited and I can confirm that the food is consistently as good. The burger and loaded fries were bailouts Ku delicious. Also, I noticed the cashier taking the time to explain everything to customers multiple times while I was eating -- super friendly and inviting.
I've been to 7th street burger and it's absolutely delicious. Great for late night bites and they are both quick and friendly. Fries are also incredible, but the burger is definitely the highlight!

I experienced the rudest and meanest service during my stay in NYC. As soon as I walked in, I felt like I was interrupting their break especially the lady in the front who gave me the meanest look without any greeting. From start to finish, I felt a little disgusted to have to pay for this. I got the food and nope, no thank you or anything. I am extremely disappointed at the service which ruined the taste as well. As far as the food goes, it's so small, I actually ended up having another dinner afterwards. Probably the worst restaurant I visited in NYC.

Tried 7th street for the first time during National Burger day this year and it wasn't as great as I hoped, but still was a solid burger. The meat wasn't very seasoned so it was plain and the taste of the American cheese was overpowering. However, the rest of the bite was pretty great!

Second time at this chain, first time in this location. Everything was really good. Had the beyond burger and beyond loaded fries. Really amazing. I actually brought the fries back because I was sure they'd made a mistake and got me beef! Love the simplicity of this shop. Keep up the good work

Just found out they opened a new location of one of these in the neighborhood -- and a great move! Had always wanted to try but never did, from the fact that I didn't know you could customize the standard burger toppings. (You can.)  $6 for a single and $11 for a double cheeseburger is great for NYC standards and the fact this is easily one of the best I've had in the city.

Heard this place is good so we decided to try it. Uhmmm... more of hype than anything IMO. Cheeseburger was, dry, not much taste to it. The reason for 4 star, again burger meat was not impressive at all. It felt like I was eating. Cheapest fattest meat ever, I only had 2 bits of my cheeseburger. Back to reason for 4 star, their fries that too with their jour-là sauce was out of the world. Wish they weren't any burger meat on top which I picked it out. We ordered beef fries? Fries and their sauce was the key of our dinner take out. For that reason alone I'm giving 4 stars and recommend to go and try but no, not the burger. Sorry

and the award for best smash burger in NYC goes to....7th st burger. the loaded fries are a must-try, especially if you like in n out animal fries. fast service and this location didn't have the long lines the east village location is notorious for

So good!!! An old school, nostalgic "smash burger" with the perfect ratio of ingredients. The impossible burger is awesome - so much better than the veggie options at Bareburger, etc. Highly recommend.
Simple menu, fantastic food. We had the cheeseburger and fries both were cooked perfectly and the sauce the used on the burgers is very tasty. Highly recommend!

7th Street Burger is a nice spot for burger lovers. Although the burgers are on the smaller side, they are packed with flavor and cooked to perfection. The fries are also tasty, though they could have used a little extra salt. The prices are reasonable, with a burger and fries coming in at around $10. The atmosphere is cozy and unassuming, with only a bench and a few standing tables available. Overall, I would give 7th Street Burger 3 out of 5 stars and recommend it as a worth-trying spot for a tasty burger.
Wow - this is SUCH an amazing lunch time treat. Its the perfect size and so so tasty. I haven't had a great burger like this in a long time! Go asap!

a new burger joint opened in my area and i hope they make it cause very biz that has opened in this spot has opened and closed since 1979 but i have faith in this guilty pleasure comfort food joint .limited menu which is equal to the interior,  2 tables , front by the window counter area and small side area to sit and wait .menu is double burger cheese or without, single burger with cheese or not , impossible burger single or double with cheese or not , fries or loaded fries which includes chopped meat , cheese, onions and mucho calories. lets go with a double burger with the works well done and fries no salt me and banana pudding to go as i might get hungry again in no time. also limited beverages as in mexican coke and water. i must admit the burger was sloppy and delicious as the secret sauce has a tasty kick to it and the fries passed my better then decent test. not something i can eat everyday but glad 7th st burger has opened in my hood as we all need a good burger now and then. good luck guys.

Pictured: Halal T-Bone 28oz $69

Recently visited @212.steakhouse and loved our meal! The entire dining experience was amazing and everything was cooked to perfection. It's the perfect halal spot for a fancy or formal dinner in NYC!

Someone took me here for my birthday on a Saturday evening. When we got there, the restaurant wasn't busy so we got seated immediately. We sprung for the wagyu tasting, the t bone, mashed potatoes and the soufflé for dessert.

First off, the wagyu was divine. It was perfectly cooked medium rare and literally melted in your mouth. I cried that there wasn't a lot and I had to share.

The t-bone was a bit disappointing. Texture, it was great. Flavor was a bit off. Not sure if it's the way it's dry aged or the peppercorn on top but the taste paled in comparison to the wagyu.

The chocolate soufflé won us back at the end. It was so rich and decadent and I almost finished the whole thing without sharing. Wagyu is definitely worth coming for!

I've been to 212 Steakhouse before for their brunch which unfortunately fell flat.  Their dinner, however, is pretty great (if you order the right things)!  I returned back as my mom and I went to the city and she strictly eats halal.  Do keep in mind that not all of the steaks are halal such as the Kobe beef and other various steak cuts.  However, our server was very accommodating and specified exactly what was halal and what he recommended.  

At the end, my mom and I got the calamari, wagyu ribeye and lamb chops to share and it was the perfect amount of food for us two.  The calamari was decent but I've had better, portion size was more than adequate though.  The wagyu ribeye is more fatty than the wagyu sirloin but it is so good- if you're having steak you might as well indulge right?  The lamb chops were also great as well and I really like that they were pistachio crusted it was unique.  Both were cooked at a nice medium rare.  I've had better steaks but 212 Steakhouse isn't bad at all- as long as you stick to the meats here you'll enjoy your meal (seems obvious as it's called 212 Steakhouse, so lesson learned)!

I am not a person to write any review but, went here for my anniversary last Saturday my husband and I, were so excited to eat halal Steaks only to be disappointed our steaks tasted burnt our waiter was super nice tho we give him a 5/5 but the food is a 1 we also ordered mashed truffle and the French onion soup.

Also $72 for a piece a small piece of steak is not worth it and it doesn't come with any sides, sides are extra I am from Texas and we have a bunch of steak houses that are way cheaper and come with sides when you order an entree and taste a lot better.

And if your Muslim $72 for a small piece of steak is haram I'm sad we spent almost $240 for the experience from the Tik Tok reviews, Tik Tok reviews get paid for their reviews don't trust everything you see on Tik Tok lesson learned.

Took advantage of a free burger deal they had going on from their instagram page. Came in with a couple of friends on a Sunday around 2:30. Clean, nice place. We came in during slow hours. The server was nice. Burger was phenomenal though I'm not sure if I would pay $42 for it. I also ordered arugula salad which was very tasty and wine which was good too. My friend ordered her burger medium well done but it was extremely well done though she still liked it fine. My other friend liked her burger and salad too. A bit pricey but a good place overall.

I came here for dinner with a girlfriend and we had an good time. The drinks here are well made and they come out quickly. Lychee Tini was delish. The service was alright, not bad but not spectacular.

We ordered the 212 premium selection for 2. The Kobe steak was the best part of that tasting, so well flavored. The skirt steak came out over cooked and the kitchen sent out another one cooked medium (not pictured). We also ordered shrimp and lobster Mac and cheese. The shrimp was alright but the Mac and cheese might've been my second favorite menu item. My friend over the lobster bisque and enjoyed it. Overall a a solid 3.9/5

probably one of the best steakhouse experiences i ever had. we were there celebrating a birthday and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. our reservation was late so the restaurant wasn't very crowed. the food came out quickly. the arugula salad was delicious and the perfect starter. the skirt steak was cooked to perfection. can't wait to come back!

also great playlist playing

One of a kind service for one of a kind quality steak!

212 offers exactly the caliber of expertise and sophistication that makes it worthy of its area code. New Yorkers expect the best of everything and 212 delivers with aplomb.

I have been taking my father to this fine dining establishment once a year for Father's Day as a tradition. It's dim, dark wood interior make it a perfect setting for any elegant celebration or romantic evening for two.

The menu is impeccable and the 212 area code promises something you won't find anywhere else. The license to serve 100% genuine Wagyu Kobe beef. Worth every penny.  This beef practically melts in your mouth. This is the place to splurge, folks. You're guaranteed a memorable evening.

The staff are exceptionally kind and ensure your experience is exactly how you want it. My father is 86 years old and they treat him like royalty.

As for the food, any cut of steak you order will be seasoned so elegantly, the sauces are almost an insult to it. One highlight is their delicately tender skirt steak charred to perfection on the outside with a zesty chimichurri sauce. My personal favorite.

Bringing a date?  You cannot go wrong with their dry-aged Porterhouse steak for 2. Sides include truffle mash, seared Brussel sprouts, creamed spinach (so good you could order it by itself), and au gratin potato.

But my girlfriend is vegetarian! 212 offers a delectable array of high quality non-steak dishes and fine pasta. My vegetarian girlfriend raves about their famous French onion soup. Please order that if nothing else. You will be converted.  I had their delectable Mediterranean halibut filet served with a golden berry sauce and it was gorgeous. The sauce was bright and citrus-y, utterly unique and delicious!

There's a reason this restaurant has been legendary for a decade! The lovely staff will ensure your meal is one to look forward to year round.  They kindly noted that I was bringing my father for Father's Day and included a complimentary slice of soft Japanese cheesecake with strawberries with a chocolate sentiment. How beautiful! They truly made our evening an enchanted one.

As a native New Yorker, I could not speak higher of this establishment. It's hard to impress New Yorkers enough to keep us going back. Even harder to convince us to scrape our astronomical rent checks for a memorable dinner. But when I tell you 212 is worth it, I mean it.

Make your reservation now.

I've been here twice, and both times I ordered their burgers - once the spicy version and once the regular one. Let me tell you, it's absolutely fantastic! The sauce is on point, but what really stands out is how juicy and flavorful the burgers are. I love my burger rare and I'm glad they don't over cook it lie most places.  I'm blown away by both experiences, and I'm definitely planning to return and give something else a shot. Oh, and the drink options won't break the bank either! Gotta give a shoutout to Parco, who was my server on both occasions - he's the best :)

Went here primarily because it's halal. One of the rare fine
dining places that openly serve halal steak. The best one was the off menu A5 Wagyu striploin steak. We did medium and it was delicious. Service outstanding. Rib eye was a little too chewy compared to the Striploin hence 1 star down. Will definitely go here again.

Amazing! For a high end steak house i enjoyed the overall dining experience. Our server really helped us with recommendations on steaks good for two. I ordered the grilled octopus as appetizer, we then had the 3 oz kobe waygu steak and a dry aged ribeye steak with the truffle mash as a side. The grilled octopus was very tender and soft and flavorful. The kobe waygu was DELICIOUS it was quite an experience with the melting in your mouth. The truffle mash was perfect paired with the ribeye steak. I got everything medium rare and ended it off with the chocolate scouffle. our bill came out to 300$ after tip and tax. Definitely something to try once in awhile!

I heard so much about 212 Steakhouse online but I didn't really have much expectations going in. As soon as I got inside the restaurant I heard beautiful music and was warmly greeted by the staff.

I have to say everything was just perfect and delicious. I love how all the flavors came together and it was just so fresh and tasty. I highly recommend getting the mashed potato's, to be honest I don't usually order it but it paired so well with the steak.

Fried calamari was good but nothing special.

Creamed spinach was delicious as well as the lobster Mac and cheese where the cheese melted so well and had a rich taste.

Overall definitely coming again, had such a great time and the food was delicious!

The halal steak and and truffle fries were really good!! I wish they came with a sauce but we also ordered the chimmichurri sauce which was so good with the steak. This is definitely a once in awhile place because it's quite expensive.

I don't really think the ambience lives up to the price point as it felt a bit stuck in the past. Overall, I don't think I would venture out here if I was craving steak, but I came here for a friend's birthday and I think this is more suited for events like that.

We came because we heard they have some halal offerings which is true. Some options on their menu are halal.

To start we got the cheese plate and fried calamari. Both were good.

We got the lamb chops, braised chicken, creamed spinach and lobster Mac. The Mac was rich and creamy. The lobster was few in between but in general it was good. The creamed spinach was amazing. It is a creamed spinach with mushrooms and a cheesy top layer. Best creamed spinach I've had. Lamb chops were medium well and delicious. Paired well with the sauce it came with Chicken was full of flavor.

The service is amazing as well. Very kind and helpful.

Although it's a bit pricy, it's expected because it's a steakhouse. I'd come back again.

Travelled to NYC last weekend and got this exquisite feast at 212 steakhouse!

We got the following to try:

- Grilled Octopus
- Burrata
- Kobe tasting: Kobe Beef Ribeye 3 oz, Kobe Beef Striploin 3 oz, Kobe Beef Tenderloin 3 oz
- Wagyu striploin (halal)
- Lobster mac & cheese
- Truffled mash
- Broccoli rabe
- Crème brulee

After this meal you best believe we left with beyond satisfied stomachs!

Every dish was was bangin and the presentation was 100

The burrata was soooo creamy and fresh, the octopus was cooked perfectly (Y)

The Kobe beef omgggg I am drooling all over again writing this but it was so so delicious and melt in your mouth buttery, I was in steak heaven lol

My bestie got the halal wagyu striploin and described it as "a flavour explosion in her mouth" LOL I tried it too and I second it! The peppercorns added just a kick with the star of the show obviously being the striploin!

Even our sides were bursting with flavour! The lobster mac and cheese was cheesy af and filled with lobster! The truffle mash was creamy and delicious.

And last but not the least was the best crème brûlée of my LIFE !!! It was perfectly creamy not at all soft or jiggly and the top was so perfectly caramelized and sweet! 10/10

Overall dining at 212 steakhouse was one of the highlights of our trip to NYC, their steaks are next level and the flavours are to die for !!! We will definitely be back the next time we are in NYC

Don't forget they also have halal steaks on the menu, it is one of the only places in the city that does! My bestie was truly happy about that as not a lot of places cater to her so keep that in mind!

Thank you 212 steakhouse for giving us such an unforgettable dining experience :)

If you're ever in NYC make sure to check them out y'all!

We ordered lamb chops and the 8oz wagyu steak. Wanted done medium but we got extremely well done steak and chops that were pretty tough to chew through. The steak was extremely thin. Like-i kid you not- half an inch thin. Like half the thickness of a flank cut. The food looks nothing like the pictures. It was an absolute waste of money. The bread was stale. The calamari was soggy. And their desserts are horrendoussss. The cheesecake was very dry and the chocolate souffle cake which stated it was filled with warm chocolate had nothing inside. It was drier than the sahara desert.
The only good thing about this place was the servers. We had a very nice older gentleman serve us. And have absolutely no complaints there. Its not his faut the food was below par. He was amazing.

We went to a nice steak dinner at 212 Steakhouse while we were in NYC. The ambiance was beautiful with the Christmas lights up and holiday music. There were three Halal steak options to try from and we enjoyed our two selections! The truffle mash was a great side with the steak and we also enjoyed the chimichurri sauce with our steaks. All in all would highly recommend for a nice steak dinner!

The ambiance of the restaurant was beautiful. Came here on a Saturday night and it was fairly empty at the time. Staff was polite and very attentive. The drinks are fairly overpriced and water down. For $20+ a drink I imagine it having more alcohol but it virtually tasted alcohol less.

On to the food-- the ny strip steak was seasoned very well. Lobster Mac and cheese did not have a lot of lobster and the type of cheese used wasn't that great. The mashed potatoes were amazing although it was a small portion. Overall it was a good experience, but for the price and portion sizes, I'd probably go elsewhere.

We got the oysters as an appetizer and they were huge! Unfortunately my first oyster wasn't the freshest tasting but I tried another one which was very fresh and delicious. Then on my third oyster.... I got a mouth full of sand/ shell and had to literally run to the bathroom to spit it out.  My boyfriend on the other hand had the rest of the oysters and enjoyed all of them except one or two.
We waited a very very long time for our entree and they didn't come check in on us or tell us why during our wait. We couldn't even see our waiter during this time. We got the dry aged bone in rib-eye for two, which honestly wasn't amazing. I don't know if the dry age is supposed to have the "old" meat taste? Maybe it's just me but I didn't enjoy it much. We also asked for medium and got medium well so it was on the drier side.
For the sides we got the potato gratin, lobster Mac and cheese and the truffled mash. Honestly the sides were my favorite! I recommend the lobster Mac and cheese and truffled mash for sure.

After asking for our check, we had to wait over 30 minutes to even get it.

I think there are way better steakhouses in the city and wouldn't recommend the place. Especially when our bill was over $300, it was an overall disappointing experience.

Best Kobe Wagyu I've ever had. Will be back multiple times in the future. The service was outstanding and very friendly, as well as knowledgeable and helpful when it came to pairings and questions. Highly recommend to anyone looking to be disappointed by all other steak they purchase from normal steakhouses. Ask for Alex to give you wine recommendations, he is great.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at 212 Steakhouse in NYC for a quick birthday dinner with friends and was blown away by the experience. From start to finish, everything was top-notch, from the service to the food to the ambiance.

The standout dish of the night was undoubtedly the Australian Wagyu Dry-Aged Bone-In Ribeye 32 oz. for two. This was hands down the best tasting steak I've had in New York, and that's saying a lot. The steak was cooked to absolute perfection - juicy, tender, and packed with flavor. The dry aging process really brought out the rich, beefy flavor of the meat, and the bone-in cut added an extra depth of flavor that made each bite even more delicious.

To accompany the steak, we ordered two sides - the Lobster Mac and Cheese and the Brussels Sprouts. Both were excellent, with the Lobster Mac and Cheese being particularly noteworthy. The cheesy, creamy goodness was elevated by the addition of chunks of succulent lobster meat, making it an indulgent and delicious treat.

The service at 212 Steakhouse was equally impressive, with attentive and knowledgeable waitstaff who were happy to make recommendations and answer any questions we had. Our water glasses were never empty, and our plates were cleared in a timely manner.

Overall, I would give 212 Steakhouse a five-star rating without hesitation. If you're looking for a truly exceptional steakhouse experience in NYC, this is the place to go.

Food and service were okay. The BIGGEST ISSUE is that we saw the most MASSIVE cockroach sauntering it's way between the wine cooler and the kitchen. It was very unpleasant and shocking. Especially in such a nice restaurant where you're paying $300-$400 a meal.

Porterhouse for two - 3/5 not seasoned well. Very crispy sear though - that was delicious. Asked for salt.
3oz Kobe Ribeye - 5/5 best part of the meal, seasoned nicely
Truffle fries - 5/5
Mushroom side - 4/5 a little too oily but good
Service - 3/5 forgot our birthday request, sitting waiting for long periods of time

Edit: looking at the past reviews, seems like they've had a cockroach problem.

First off the hostess seems to have an issue with people. Completely rude to my girlfriend on the phone and condescending in person.  I don't think I felt welcomed at all. I will return to her.

First and foremost it took almost an hour to get our main entrees and when they were brought out they were cold. The price for this place is ridiculous so I'm expecting something a little bit more overwhelming than the garbage that they provided us as a main entree. When confronted with the late arrival of the food the only thing they could do is run around like chickens with their heads cut off as opposed to doing anything significant.

They provided a complimentary dessert and ironically the coffee that they offered was cold as well. Nothing in this place is worth the money you're paying for and I apologize to anyone who has been misled by their advertising or other reviews this place belongs in the heap of all overpriced garbage places you can go to eat. You could have simply gone to any supermarket gotten this food and cooked it yourself and done a better job.

With that said I noticed that the waiter was also a bartender which explains the fact that the food was late. The manager was an asinine individual who didn't actually hear my complaint but rather felt that telling me that he was going to warm it up again was going to be good enough response. I will never come here again I will tell anyone that ever brings this place up to never go here.

What the worst part was at the very end the charged us for items that weren't even consumed they charged us for four glasses of wine when there was only one. And two items that were never even purchased. While the waiting staff ran around in a frenzy the hostess and another female employee sat there useless doing nothing.

I want everyone to know that this place is not worth going to it's disgusting and I'd rather go to Kennedy fried Chicken and eat what is in the trash can then go back to this place.

I went to 212 Steakhouse after seeing it on alot of the Halal IG pages for some time now. Let me tell you, i would NOT go back (except for the oysters maybe).

The food was overall OK. Super pricey although we didn't cut corners when it came to ordering and each of us got steak.

The kobe beef was good but again for the amount we got vs what we paid for it i could have been alright without it.

The bone in rib eye was chewy and flavorless, we got sauce on the side and still was not doing it for me and this was supposed to be "WAGYU". Deff have had much better.

Now for the good stuff. The OYSTERS, man oh man i could go back and eat dozens of those things. SUPER fresh and tasted phenomenal with the cocktail sauce and lemon.

Spicy Rigatoni was also a hit, was done perfectly Al Dente so it had a bite and the sauce was paired well.

The grilled octopus was warm i was expecting a cold app but nevertheless it was phenomenal.

Overall gave it a 3/5 because you can't call yourself a steakhouse and just have good apps.

Steak underperformed.

This is one of my best dine in experience in steakhouse!

212 steakhouse is famous for their Kobe beef. So we have to try it. It's pricy but worth on every bite!!
The Kobe tasting has 3 different kind- ribeye, striploin, and tenderloin.
Ribeye is the richest in fat content,  you can feel the steak melt in your mouth. Strip-loin and tenderloin, you can taste the sweetness and juiciness of the beef.  
We also got lobster linguini, very flavorful, the fresh tomato sauce match so well with lobster!

For appetizer, I highly recommend the grilled octopus, the octopus was so tender! And the sauce was refreshing, not overwhelm the fresh ocean taste of the octopus!
Also the oyster just so fresh, you can go wrong with this!

Even we were so full, we still got creme Brûlée and chocolate soufflé for dessert! I like the portion is not too big. Both taste amazing, not overly sweet at all.

We went on weekday night, and it was full house. Make sure you make reservations before you
Their drink and octopus salad were really good! But the steak is just so so, overcooked. We also ordered their Kobe beef because not many places have that. But it tasted nothing like Kobe beef

212 Steakhouse offers exclusive steak including Kobe, wagyu beef and some Halal steak options. Unlike other steakhouses in NYC, 212 steakhouse lacked the upscale aura to match its prices. We ordered the following
-Porterhouse for 2: barely room temperature when served
-212 Premium Selection For Two:Kobe Beef 2 Oz, Australian Wagyu Skirt Steak 10 Oz, USDA Prime Filet Mignon 6 Oz: good selection but Kobe Beef was pretty much all fat. We mentioned this to the waiter and he served us another complimentary piece, which was still mostly fat. I know Kobe beef is typically fatty but these pieces seemed more fatty than usual.
-Truffled Mashed Potato: absolutely delish
We also ordered a glass of Malbec and a spicy margarita cocktail, both were great but overpriced. Although it was noted on the reservation that we were celebrating a birthday, waiter did not wish or bring out the dessert with candle/bday message.

212 steakhouse offers certified Kobe beef as well as Australian wagyu, your usual cuts of steaks, and also halal steaks. My party of 2 had a reservation for 6pm on a Monday night and were seated immediately. The restaurant offers a full bar as well as seating for larger parties in the back. A few groups were celebrating birthdays as well.

For starters we ordered their grilled octopus and black sea bass ceviche. The octopus was to die for!! It was grilled perfectly and extremely tender and flavorful. The ceviche was fresh, light, and refreshing, perfect to pique your appetite.

For our entrees we ordered the Kobe tasting where you get 3oz of the Kobe ribeye, strip loin, and tenderloin. Be warned that Kobe beef is extremely fatty and melts in your mouth but can be a bit too much if you don't share the tasting. We also ordered the 20oz Australian Wagyu T-bone steak. It was cooked the perfect medium rare and so extremely tender. It was a good balance after the fatty Kobe beef. Their truffle mashed potatoes were the perfect accompaniment to both steaks - it was buttery with truffle and melted in your mouth. The lobster Mac had chunks of lobster with each cheesy bite.

Though we thought we couldn't eat anymore, we were enticed by the offerings on the dessert menu and ended up getting their tiramisu, creme brûlée and passion fruit sorbet. Their tiramisu was soaked with a nice amount of amaretto and had a good balance of cream and coffee. Their creme brûlée was to die for! Not too sweet but the perfect creamy texture topped with the scorched sugar on top. The passion fruit sorbet was the icing on top! It was the perfect palate cleanser and helped break down the heavy meal.
