Big shout out to Paco who was extremely attentive and knowledgeable about all the different cuts of meat! Definitely a great place to go for a nicer dinner or for celebrations!

RACIST towards south asian. Very disappointing behavior since the owner is south asian, you wouldn't expect that.
We had a reservation and they still made us wait even though we came on time. And then they made us sit near the door (which kept opening and it was winter the wind kept making us cold). We told them to change our seats to the corner table. They told us they couldn't cause it was booked for a large group. After 10 minutes you see them making a white couple sit there (no large group was seated).
The white girls at the register or counter is so rude. They're only being nice to white or black people, super smiley and polite but very rude to us (south asian).
Messed up our steak order as well. so never coming back

212 steakhouse is definitely one of the best I have been to in NYC. It's truly a remarkable experience. Everything we ordered was delicious from the cocktails to the appetizers and to the high quality steaks.

Once we sat down I was already very impressed by the complimentary bread. It was warm and the butter they served was amazing. We ordered the strawberry mojito and mango lemonade and they were so fruity and paired perfectly with the food. We started off with the grilled octopus; it was amazing with a wonderful mix of flavors and textures; it had the crispy charred exterior but very soft inside. We also ordered the lobster bisque and it's the best lobster soup I've ever had; it was so rich with a lot of lobster meat; it's very flavorful with a hint of sweetness. We also got their signature Kobe beef steak which came with Kobe beef ribeye, Kobe beef sirloin and Kobe beef tenderloin. They were super juicy and tender. We also got the Australian T-bone and it was cooked to perfection! No sauce needed because it was insanely juicy and yummy.

Will definitely come back; great food, great service! Totally recommend this place!

Good, not great. Was able to make a same day reservation for 9pm on a Friday which was wonderful. Staff we're accommodating and steak was cooked nicely. Ordered the sirloin, filet mignon and sides of mashed potatoes and cream of Spinach. The mashed potatoes weren't that buttery and the spinach was abit crispy - would've been nice to cook down a bit more. Presentation was wonderful

We came to 212 steakhouse on a Tuesday night in time for their halal restaurant week. The atmosphere was absolutely fantastic and the waiters were very attentive. We got the grilled octopus, ribeye, lamb chop, mashed potato, and the chocolate souffle.

Grilled octopus: 4.5/5 - I loved this octopus, it was tender and full of flavor. My companion didn't like it as much as me though.

Ribeye: 4/5 - We got this medium and the fat that came with the meat was underwhelming and it was a little more medium rare in some parts than medium. The presentation was superb though.

Lamb chops: 4.5/5 - I asked for medium, and the lamb came out perfect and was super tasty!

Mashed potato: 3/5 - Our least favorite dish. There was a strong buttery aftertaste that did not pair well with our meats in my opinion. The texture was perfect though.

Chocolate souffle - 4/5 - A nice little dessert to cap of a great meal!

Overall a solid steakhouse experience - I absolutely love how they have halal meats as an option.

This place has been on my fiancée bucket list for quite some time. We finally made it for our early valentines date night !

We started off with a shrimp cocktail and Cesar salad which had a MOUNTAIN of cheese so delicious . He had the 212 experience which had skirt steak and the most delicious piece of Kobe wow, I had the half a lobster stuffed with crabmeat, incredible. We both shared the truffle mash and broccoli rabe. The drinks were amazing and strong I highly recommend this for a date night spot !

Outstanding service! It could have been a scene ripped right out of a movie: our waiter, a jovial man with a thin mustache, rounded featured, and a slight Latin American accent that added to the romanticism of the scene, welcomed us with smiles. He calmly and kindly explained the menu, was SO apologetic that certain items weren't halal (yet! They are working on getting Halal burgers), and when it came time for dessert, he so kindly had our slice of cake decorated with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate sauce on the side and a little candle in the strawberries too! This was old school, fine dining waiting and for this classy experience alone I would come back to 212.

Now the steak might be the main attraction but don't miss out on the seafood! The "Grilled Octopus" was the most perfectly cooked octopus I've ever had in my life. It was not rubbery at all - it was almost like a roast chicken. The tangy flavor of the sauce and capers accented the octopus well.

The steak was succulent, with a good combination of fatty and meaty bites. I loved the whole peppercorns - little bulbs of bright red that popped in my mouth with as much flavor as they had color.

The "Black Truffle Risotto" had a generous helping of black truffle flavor. I feel like I didn't know what black truffle really was until I had it in this dish. It made the price well worth it. I wish it had been a bit spicier.

The mashed potatoes were silky smooth

LASTLY! Don't leave without having some dessert. These are top notch. The "triple layer chocolate mousse cake" is like the one from Costco but - I can't believe I'm admitting this - even BETTER.

Although I have eaten here several times in the past few years, I never put up a review.  I must say they didn't disappoint. The food is off the highest caliber, perfectly cooked and presented. The restaurant is very cozy with wonderful ambience. The service is superb. Highly recommended!!!

My husband and I come here every year for our anniversary in November. This was the first place we ate as a married couple. To this day,they have the best calamari. The steaks are seasoned well and the the sauces are amazing. The service there is phenomenal and everyone is kind. The desserts are also delicious.

Terrible! This is one of those places that are hyped up simply because they serve zabiha steaks. We ordered two ribeyes and one t-bone that were very cold when they arrived to our table. We sent them back asking for new ones because warming them up would further cook the steaks. They did not make new ones because the one ribeye I had ripped off to taste was put back on the dish as a complete puzzle. Furthermore, they were still cold. We sent them back and then again the third time, sure the temperature was better but the sides were burned. The steak had no flavor.

We make better steaks at home. We asked for flaky salt and got table salt. What kind of steakhouse doesn't have flaky salt?

The sides are incredibly expensive and are additional pay, nothing comes with the steaks! Very disappointed! So much money down the drain. Don't waste your time just because they offer zabiha steaks and the food "looks" good!

We came here for Christmas Eve dinner and we were expecting a nice fine dining experience.

The restaurant was more casual than expected. We got the 212 selection, NY Strip, au gratin potatoes and broccoli. The Kobe steak part of the 212 steak selection was the best part of the meal. The remaining portion of our meal was mediocre at best. Not much flavor with the steaks and the sides seemed like something I could've made at home.

Overall, I would say for the price it was not worth it. For what we spent, I would've expected a fine dining experience and much better food quality.

Ambiance = beautiful
Everything we ate = beautiful
What we got:
-Kobe tasting platter: HOLY COW! they cut it up in front of you and it's the tastiest, most fatty yet tender beef I've ever had. Straight from Japan!
-tuna tartare: super fresh and delicious
-grilled octopus: super tender and flavorful, great portions
-truffle mashed potatoes: filling, super truffle-y, and yummy
-lobster Mac and cheese: a little bit dry, not that much lobster
-crème brûlée: THE BEST IVE EVER HAD
-chocolate mouse cake: decent
-cocktails were so good! And they paired the dessert with this super sweet wine. Very yummy

Went here for the halal wagyu steaks on a busy Saturday night.

Cons: They made us wait 30 minutes for our table despite having reservations, and weren't accommodating about reseating us when we told them about the draft where they put us (pro-tip: if it's cold outside, avoid the tables by the door if you can). And they made a mistake on my order, bringing my steak in medium when I asked for medium-rare. Service was generally sluggish -- they took a good 10 minutes just to bring out a salt shaker when we asked for one. Also I think it's weird that an order of steak doesn't come with sauce or sides, but that might just be me.

Pros: Nice ambiance if you get a non-drafty table! Also they were quick to take back my steak and bring me a medium rare when I asked. The food was really good. We had the grilled octopus which was well-flavored and tender, and truffle mashed potatoes, which were delicious. For our steaks we had a 16oz halal wagyu strip-loin and a 16oz halal wagyu ribeye. The strip-loin was one of the best bites of steak I've ever had; the ribeye was also pretty good, but a little tough. Definitely recommend the strip-loin.

Overall: good food, not sure if the overall experience is worth the price of entry. Good for special occasions, but probably wouldn't repeat tbh.

212 steakhouse had the highest quality and most flavorful steak I've ever had. We had such a delightful experience here and highly recommend!

Here's what we ordered:
~ Caribbean cocktail- dark rum, coconut infused liquor, pineapple juice, cranberry juice, lime. So fruity and delicious!
~Perfectly hot rolls
~Grilled octopus- sweet peppers, red onions, capers, red wine vinegar. The acidity went perfect with the char on the octopus.
~Lobster bisque. So rich, creamy, and full of lobster.
~Burrata- imported Italian burrata, tomatoes, pink truffle salt, basil. The flavors were incredible. This is a must order.
~Black truffle and wild mushroom risotto. This was so rich and cheesy!
~Kobe tasting- 3 oz Kobe beef ribeye, 3 oz Kobe beef strip loin, 3 oz Kobe beef tenderloin. This was truly the greatest and most flavorful steak I've ever eaten in my entire life. The beautiful marbled meat was so juicy and cooked to a medium rare perfection. I will have dreams about this steak.
~Wagyu Strip loin
~Lobster Mac- full of cheesy goodness
~Potato au gratin
~Truffle mashed potatoes
~Chocolate soufflé

What a spectacular meal. That Kobe tasting was truly the star. Thank you so much to @212.steakhouse for having us. You need to try this place!!

I came here to celebrate my friend's birthday and we had a great time. We had reservations for 6:30pm and were promptly seated. I had never heard of 212 Steakhouse but she said that she saw one of her friend's IG story about it. Of course, I took a look at the menu beforehand so I knew what I wanted. We started with drinks--she got the Caribbean, her friend got the Tropical and I got the winter blues--I've been on a bourbon kick lately. I loved my drink--as a matter of fact, we all loved our drinks. Her friend and I got another round of our drinks but my friend got a glass of prosecco. For starters, my friend and I shared the arugula salad. We loved it--perfectly amount of dressing, apples and walnuts. Her friend got the lobster bisque which she enjoyed. For the entrees, my friend and I got the New York strip and we shared the sides--truffled mash and creamed spinach. Her friend got the lobster linguini. When I asked her what she thought, she said that it was okay but thought it was something her daughter could make. As for my friend and I, we loved our steak--we got it medium well and it was perfect. You could smell the peppercorn--it was well-seasoned. The mash potatoes were super creamy and delicious as was the creamed spinach. The portion was perfect for two people. Since it was my friend's birthday, our server, Luis gave her tiramisu as well as shots (which they comped). The service was great and the food was exceptional.
Amazing staff, service, and steak! I always look forward to visiting Manhattan for this place.

It was my brother's birthday, and mine was coming up, so I wanted to celebrate the occasion by getting some authentic wagyu beef. Fortunately, 212 Steakhouse was taking reservations.

It's a fancy looking steakhouse in the heart of Manhattan. It's also certified to serve authentic Kobe beef. We were seated quickly, and given a breadbasket along with the menus. We placed our order and the feasting began.

For our appetizer, we split the Kobe Tasting, which came with Ribeye, Filet Mignon, and NY Strip. Kobe Beef is a type of Japanese Wagyu, and it is held to extremely strict standards. It is incredibly tender and rich with fat. Definitely some of the best steaks I've ever had.

For our sides, we got the brussels sprouts, mashed potatoes, and creamed spinach. All were good but paled in comparison to the beef sampling we enjoyed.

The main course was a dry aged Australian wagyu ribeye. It was not as rich or as marbled as the Japanese wagyu, which made it easier to eat more of it!

The place is pricey, but if you're looking to try authentic wagyu, it's a great place.

We decided to come here for our catch up dinner. This opulent halal steakhouse is beautifully decorated and has a subdued charm. We had reservations for 7:30pm and came a bit early. We were told that we had to wait until 7:30pm and that they were preparing our table.

When we were seated we were given a QR code that had the dinner and dessert menu. My friend asked for a drink menu and the waiter bought over a tablet with the drink menu preloaded on. While we were deciding on our meal, they bought out some bread with unsalted butter. The bread was tasty and I saved a roll for my lobster bisque because I wanted to scrap up every single bit of yummy.

To start, I ordered a Caribbean and my friend got a glass of red wine. I thought the Caribbean was on the sour side and not my favorite. Both of my friends enjoyed the red wine and got several glasses. However, I should preface this was my first time drinking in years and I tend to like things sickly sweet. This is not to say that the drink wasn't prepared well. It just wasn't to my liking.

We ordered 2x lobster bisque, burrata and grilled octopus. I thought the lobster bisque was rich and flavor with a hint of sweetness. The burrata tasted delicious with a bit of the balsamic glaze. I didn't have any grilled octopus but, my friends enjoyed it.

We ordered two glasses of Strawberry fields (I think that's what it was called). And I liked this one more than the Caribbean. It was sweet and pleasant on the tongue while refreshing.

I ordered the lobster mac and cheese and the lobster dynamite. My friends ordered I think the Wagyu and I believe either the T-Bone or Porterhouse. I personally don't eat beef so, I can't tell how it tasted but, they were licking their fingers and making bedroom noises...so I guess it was delicious.

I enjoyed the lobster dynamite. It wasn't what I was expecting but, I was pleasantly pleased. The sriracha mushrooms and lobster was a delicious and unexpected mix. The lobster mac and cheese was yummy but, I wished they added a bit more lobster as we had to dig to find pieces or if they added the pieces on top.

We also got mixed mushrooms, Brussels sprouts and potato gratin. Hands down, the potato gratin was the all around winner. The mushrooms and sprouts were tasty but, who would refuse creamy and cheesy goodness?

We got another row of drinks before dessert. I tried the Prosecco and I think it was marvelous.  It was the perfect level of sweet and bubbly. My friends got more red wine because they loved it.

For dessert, we ordered chocolate mousse, tiramisu, and creme brulee. All three desserts were delicious and decadent. None of them were sickly sweet  but, had the perfect amount of sweetness to end the meal.

The service here was impeccable and everyone came in and asked how we were doing. They promptly cleared away empty dishes and swept any crumbs. If you are unsure what to order, the servers do make great suggestions! This place is perfect for date nights or to celebrate a special occasion or for any night you want to make into a special occasion ;)

I don't normally splurge at steakhouses but came with a small group of friends and split some dishes recently. First off, the attention to detail and the service here is impeccable. They really seem to genuinely care about all of their customers having a wonderful experience. Food recommendations: Get the steak. Joking. But really. Delicious and high quality of meat. We split a porterhouse steak and it tasted like butter. But meat butter.

Appetizers/sides: Grilled calamari, scalloped cheesy potatoes, brussels sprouts, mushrooms, and that effing burrata that comes with heirloom tomatoes and some kind of balsamic reduction that I could drink for days. Desert - Tiramisu is always a winner to me but the chocolate mousse cake was also pretty fantastic. Recently tried tiramisu somewhere else within the same week and that other restaurant made it a complete fail. Here it's exactly the way it should be. If you also really want to go crazy get yourself a tiny piece of kobe meat and have no regrets over it. I have to say, this is definitely one of the best steak house experiences I've had in the city to date.

Short version: Friendly, knowledgeable staff especially Alex.   Their kobe steaks will spoil you and ruin you going back to regular steak. Amosphere + servers +  cleanliness + food = !

Saturday was my first time here with a few people.   As soon as i walked in,  i got a friendly vibe from the staff and it was a comfortable setting.  We were at the bar first for a little bit and the bartender was friendly and knows her stuff! There were 4 of us and our drinks were whiskey,  old fashioned,  lychee-tini and a mango drink.  Nice pours on all and they were all fantastic.
Our server, Alex,  took us through an amazing food journey like I've never experienced before.  Not only is a great server,  but he's beyond friendly,  completely knowledgeable of the menu and wine pairings,  and made us feel welcomed and like royalty.  
The seating is comfortable and it's a great place to go for good food and even better company,  as a group or even on a date.  
Now onto what you're all wondering about- the food.
The appetizers were as follows: freshly imported burrata with arugula, tomato and capers,  fried calamari with marinara and octopus.  These were all amazing.  The octopus and burrata were the stars.  The outside texture of the octopus was smooth,  almost silky, and it was very flavorful.  It was wonderfully cooked and i strongly implore you to order it.  The burrata absolutely tasted fresh.   You can tell it wasn't just lying around in a fridge for weeks.  It tasted fresh,  perfect consistency,  and the side arugula salad it was paired with was a perfect compliment.   I highly recommend this as well.  The calamari was good as well,  but it's the safe choice to go with if you're not too adventurous.  
The kobe steak tasting was seriously out of this world! They're certified and I've never had anything like it.  The marbling on the kobe ribeye made it almost melt in your mouth.  If you prefer leaner cuts,  the striploin just left me speechless.  The porterhouse was perfectly cooked and seasoned; best filet mignon I've had in my life so far.  All the sides went so well with our steaks.
Out of our 3 delicious desserts, the creme brulee did it for me! You could see specs of her actual vanilla bean in it.  The top was caramelized perfectly and it was crunchy and sweet but not overbearingly sweet.   I definitely recommend this to anyone who appreciates good food and top notch service.

Great steakhouse in Manhattan. I went with a friend for dinner and we got the octopus and shrimp cocktail to start. Both tasty, the octopus tasted slightly smoky. We then tried the Kobe tasting. It was really delicious and the meat melted in your mouth. The 212 Selection also came with generous portions and was also very good... I also loved the lobster mac and cheese as a side  overall great spot! The Kobe tasting is a MUST if you come here!

I had the pleasure of dining at 212 Steakhouse for my 41st Birthday on Oct 6th (sidebar...Libras Rock :) ) The food exceeded my expectations and our waiter Luis was extremely patient, accommodating and attentive. My friend and I both shared and started with The Arugula Salad which was absolutely divine and my other friend ordered the Lobster Bisque which she enjoyed. We then went on to both order The New York Strip Steak medium well which was spot on and love at first bite.....LITERALLY, and for our sides we shared the Truffled Mashed Potatoes and Creamed Spinach which were all superb, and my other friend ordered the Lobster Linguine. We also enjoyed some tasty drinks. I started with The Caribbean and one friend had the Winter Blues while the other friend ordered The Tropical. It was so good both friend's went for another round while I ordered a glass of Prosecco and let me tell you there is nothing better than a cold glass of Prosecco YUM-O. As my birthday night was coming to an end our waiter Luis gave us shots and my Tiramisu on the house which made my night even more special. I look forward to dining here again in the future cheers :)

Had a reservation for 6 pm and was quickly seated on a Thursday night. We opted for indoor seating, they have outdoor seated with heater lamps.

When seated there is a QR code to view the menu and desserts.

After ordering everything, we received warm complimentary bread with butter. It was really good and fresh.

We ordered:
Apps:
-Sea Bass Ceviche
-Mediterranean salad
-French Onion soup

Entrees:
-Kobe Tasting: Kobe ribeye, striploin, & tenderloin 3 oz each
-Australian Wagyu Dry-aged porterhouse for 2
- Bearnaise and Borderlands sauce for wagyu

Sides:
-Creamed Spinach
-Mac & Cheese

Desserts:
-24K good triple chocolate mousse
-Strawberry gelato

Everything was so delicious and want to come back for more!

Make sure you make a reservation and have vaccination beforehand.

I love this place! Always fresh, hot and tasty. Good portions too! Everytime I've called up with a question they are always super nice and helpful. I've only had one issue and have probably ordered from them at least 30 times. They were happy to give me a credit right away.

I'm obsessed with their dinner bowl with chicken skewers and lemon potatoes - def the best deal on the menu. Love their greek salad and their soup too. Even their burger is amazing.

Best Greek in the area by far - give em a shot, you won't regret it.

It's a tiny corner spot to get a quick bite for lunch or on the go. They definitely have the best gyro in the area hands down. Fresh vegetables and perfectly cooked gyro meat. Their taziki sauce is has perfect texture and taste. I also had their Greek iced cafe which was excellent. Service was great quick and fast.

a top notch greek restaurant in lic thats limited with the indoor seating but makes up for it with delicious greek food with a splash of middle eastern eats as well. my cuz told me about 3greeks grill and was our odering guide for us with a large greek salad , lemon potatoes,  3 plates of lamb gyros with rice and a bottle of wine. food is delicious and fresh as my other cuz wanted an order of grilled calamari and my hard to please cuz gave the 2 thumbs up asap. prices are fair and the choices on the menu are extensive ,so go traditional and keep it simple which we did. 4.5 stars on my yelp meter and we will be back to try some other tasty options.

We've now come to 3Greeks twice, once to sit down and more recently a takeout order.  The pictures below are from our first sit down visit.  The first time I got a zucchini croquets sandwich and a chicken shawarma platter with an Epsa lemonade drink.  The second time we ordered a falafel sandwich (with tzatziki and hummus), a chicken shawarma sandwich lunch special which came with fries plus an Epsa sour cherry drink.

Between the drinks, the lemonade was preferred.  The sour cherry drink was nice but is a bit of an acquired taste and I wouldn't mind sampling it or mixing it with something else.  It's not super sour so if you like the taste of cherries and don't mind a bit of tartness this might be for you.

For my sandwiches, the zucchini croquets sandwich was great!  The croquets were soft inside but had a slight crispiness on the outside.  For me, the balsamic glaze was the finishing touch it needed for the sandwich to come together.  Would recommend and definitely get again!  I really enjoy a good falafel and am not sure if the takeout impacted this though the falafel itself was a bit dry.  I also chose hummus and tzatziki together and I think the choice of these 2 spreads might have been a bit much in the sandwich itself.

As for the chicken shawarma, my bf felt that it was pretty tasty and tasted clean (not too oily, plus he got the chicken again so he definitely enjoyed it).  The second time, his order came with fries and those were absolutely delicious!

The verdict, it's great for a quick meal both seated or on the go.  They have some solid options though it may be good to not overload the spreads or ask for them on the side if getting a sandwich.  Get the fries and try one of the Epsas if you're up for something new.  Zucchini croquets was a hit for me and maybe pass on the falafel though we'll certainly be coming back to try out other menu items!

*delivery review
ordered: lamb gyro platter, melitzanosalata, small feta spread; comes with two pitas
lamb gyro: pretty good, soft and fresh, not too salty or greasy
greek salad: good, a lot of feta
melitzanosalata: good, a little bit too sweet
feta spread: I would skip this haha, smelly for me
tzatziki: a little bit watery, but flavor is fine
lemon patato: normal
the ingredients taste pretty fresh:)

overall I really enjoy the lamb gyro, would come back for it;also want to try their roka salad

So disappointed by the food. Not prepared well, missing ingredients. I will not be returning

Food: I ordered the falafel sandwich, a spinach pie, and a halloumi gyro. The halloumi sandwich was fine - but very salty and dry! The falafel sandwich had these really weird sweet flavor. The spinach pie was rock hard - I couldn't bite through the pastry - it was essentially burnt. They also mentioned fries  within the sandwich- which there were none. Especially with everything it her Mediterranean place in Astoria, I do not recommend coming here.

Price: for what you get- some dishes were expensive. Leaving quality aside, the spinach pie $9 and so small. The sandwiches were priced fine - around $9-$10 each.

Well...6 years later and I have to say this is the best Greek style option in LIC! The soups are always tasty...lentil and chickpea soups are my favorite. The salads are made with the freshest ingredients.   My favorite is the Spinach with chick peas.....Crispy baby spinach, chickpeas, avocado, scallions, cilantro, kalamata olives and homemade lemon vinaigrette. It is served with pita bread. Their dressings are tasty! Last I highly recommend the Bifteki (juiciest lamb meatballs) or the zucchini croquet appetizers.

Greek happens to be one of the many cuisines we're immensely blessed to have in Queens. 3Greeks Grill in particular ranks on the upper end of the spectrum, where the food is so tasty that even their off days are still considered pretty good.

They are primarily a take out and delivery operation. There is some seating, mainly inside along the counter where the aroma of grilled gyro meat is so strong that it's nice to get a front seat to all the action. Service is solid and so are the prices.

I love their Greek salads, especially with pork or chicken souvlaki on top. Their gyros are incredibly popular as well, as they're stuffed to the brim with plenty of veggies, fries, and choice of protein. I love watching the rotating spit of the gyro meat, as it glistens and looks succulent through and through.

Who doesn't love a halloumi cheese wrap or their super tasty zucchini croquettes? While I'm not the biggest fan of their lemon potatoes or the prassini salad, I would recommend to everyone to finish (or start) things off with their crispy spinach pie.

They might have all the bells and whistles of the prestigious establishments within the nearby hoods, but I think 3Greeks has a lot of potential to remain in the Greek food game for a long time.

Sandwiches were huge (objects in mirror are larger than they appear), messy to eat, but so so good. Felt like I was holding a lil bouquet! We got the chicken shawarma and lamb gyro.

Vibe of place was a tad too quiet for comfortable conversation, but we did come on a misty cold evening. Dude in the front was chill when I def butchered the pronunciation of the food names
The food is so good me and mother love it we order from here at least once a week and the service is very good and the staff is always so nice and polite

Carryout and delivery are the most popular choices. It has a dining room but I hardly have ever seen anyone eating in here. 3Greeks is a small restaurant. Delivery is convenient and they go to a  wide area. They have pretty decent prices.

Falafel is my favorite item. It comes in a pita or
on a platter. They have a combo meal menu that includes a drink and a side. Gyros are the most popular item. They have pretty good prices. It's about $6 for the falafel in a pita. This comes with a lemony tahini sauce and there's chopped vegetables. A falafel platter is about $12 and comes with several additional items. There's pitas, rice, and Greek salad.

I would get delivery if I was still close enough. It even delivers to Roosevelt Island. They're one of the few places to even go there.

I have been wanting to try this place for a while now seeing that it has such good reviews. I'm floored by the authentic Greek flavor of the Greek salad with lamb on top. It's the best salad I've had in a long time. Thank god they are not near me because I would be here EVERYDAY!
New to Astoria and this was my first Greek spot I ordered from. I loved my gyro and my girlfriend was absolutely raving about hers.. we can't wait to order again!

Their gyro was delicious but it is not your traditional gyro.
It is a hipster-revised with fries wrapped with my lamb meat; definitely not traditional.
I ordered the lamb gyro sandwich- overall it is pretty good. Not greasy, filling is fresh, and lamb is deliciously seasoned. Rated 4/5
The dining area is small with a capacity of 12 customer then it gets crowded. There is a table just outside with an umbrella.
Most of their business must be deliveries because they have 6 electric bike outside; I bet they get a lot of orders from people on Roosevelt Island.
Parking in the area is not easy during the day time because of all the car shops and apartment buildings in the area.
I definitely will return to try their other menu items.
Q102 and Q103 bus goes here.

Placed a lunch order for the office. The meat platter for 10 people. It came with various meats, rice, salad, pita bread & sauces. The food was fresh & plentiful. Customer service was just as good. The price was decent. I will be ordering from here again

I recently ordered catering through 3 Greeks and was so impressed. The food was great, there was plenty of it, and the guests all commented on how delicious it was. Maria was a joy to work with too! She was helpful in planning what to order and how much. Thank you!!

A quaint but very clean place with nice servers.

I'm not from this neighborhood, but this little corner restaurant looks newly redone.

Food was good and tasty. Grapes leaves weren't overly sour. Eggplant spread taste good in fluffy pitas. They were generous with more pitas when we finished ours before we finished the spread

Lamb kabob platter was delicious as well. You can choose between rice or lemon potatoes.

Walked in to pick up some takeout for the first time.  The counter person was super friendly and helpful.

Falafel Sandwich:  Served in a pocket pita.  The ingredients tasted fresh.  Chose the hummus as my topping.  The falafel was decent and definitely flavorful.

Side order of fries:  They're crispy and basic fries.

Next time I'll probably swing for the Chicken Gyro.  I'm looking forward to going back.  It's not easy finding a good Greek takeout spot.  This place is a great option.
This place never disappoints. The food is always fresh and the portions are generous. If you're looking for good Greek food in the area, this is the place to go. Highly recommend.

An unsurprisingly solid pork gyro in basically the pork gyro capital of America. The meat was nice and flavorful with a good mix of crispy bits and fatty bits.

Come to Astoria for the gyros. Stay for the gyros.

Used to love this place when it first opened. We ordered from them every other day basically.

Once a restaurant gets comfortable with you, they start seeing what they can get away with. Have ordered takeout and paid for extra sauces, only to find they didn't put any. And then it became overpriced for LESS food. They barely put anything into what used to be my favorite, pork souvlaki platters.. and last I checked, the price was pushing $20 for the same plate with items conveniently missing. When the place first opened it was $12. I get that they need to make rent, but I haven't gone there in almost a year now because they treat customers like customers are privileged to be treated like garbage.

They yell at you on the phone, yell at you in person too, and the deals they provide on seamless are a joke. ($5 off for orders over $60, that's basically 4 gyros.)

My first Greek experience in Astoria. This is a cute little deli style restaurant with limited interior seating on the corner of Vernon and 36th Ave, right by the Roosevelt Island bridge. I came and ordered to-go in person while my boyfriend waited in the car. The man working was very kind and let me order the lunch special although it was late afternoon. He made sure I had everything I needed before I left. He even offered to let me wait in the car and bring the food out to me, but I decided to wait inside. The only thing was he did not give me any extra tzatziki sauce when I asked for it and said it was already in the bag.

I ordered the chicken souvlaki sandwich and it was very tasty. A little underseasoned but lots of meat. My boyfriend got the bifteki and said it was ok. Tzatziki was not what I expected - a little more watery and underseasoned than I'm used to. Overall food was ok, but I would definitely be back for the service!

I'm a Roosevelt Islander () and this is right across the bridge. Their food is always fresh and delicious and delivery is fast. I went there in person once and couldn't get a parking spot and they told me I could wait in my car so I didn't get a ticket and brought me my food to my car when it was ready. My go to for take out Greek food!

We ordered for delivery. The food smelled great as soon as it was delivered. We ordered a chicken shawarma platter and a side of pork kebabs. The platter was delicious. It came with fries and a side salad. The fries were some of the best delivered fries I've had. You know how it gets all soggy when you get fries delivered. These were still decently crispy. The pork kebabs were good, nothing phenomenal. We are a fan though and likely to order again.

I gave 3 stars because the falafel was good but I ordered the avocado wrap basically avocado gyro with veggies.  If you look at the picture they gave me about half of a bag of lettuce.  The pita was cold, cold meaning tasted like it was in the freezer after they wrapped it.  The sauce had no flavor.   I basically ate the avocado and some of the bag of lettuce.  Threw a lot of it out.
My favorite Greek place in town! The Pork gyro is my favorite and the qunoia salad is always on point! If you want authentic Greek food this is the place to be!

Ordered online through Yelp tonight and didn't even know this place existed. Thank you Yelp for bringing me to my new Greek spot. Delicious and quick delivery.

I got the Souvlaki chicken pita with onions, feta, and tomato. Delicious!!

I'll be ordering again.

So I been hearing great things about this place for a couple of months and finally had a chance to try it.
I ordered the souvlaki platter which comes with a Greek salad, lemon potatoes, pita bread and tzatziki sauce. OMG this food was delicious and the delivery was super fast.

I'm a huge fan of Greek food and being lucky enough to have Greek friends and to live so close to Astoria I had more than my share and I have to say this place its great.

The chicken was juicy, the lemon potatoes perfect and the tzatziki sauce one of the best I ever had. The only thing I wasn't super crazy about was the Greek salad, It wasn't bad but I wished it had more feta and olives.

I can't wait to order again since I know I will be eating here often.

Pretty fast delivery. I wish they had lamb gyros, but the pork gyro was good(the French fries was old and dry). The classic Greek salad is way overpriced for what your get, only a few cubes of feta, some cucumber, tomatoes and a couple kalamata olives for $10.75. I had to add my own lettuce. My mom liked her gyro, so I added an extra star, but I don't think I'd go out of my way to order again.

Oh my gawwwwwwwd!!!!! This was AMAZING!!!!! Best Greek salad I have ever had! It was as if I had gone into the kitchen and prepared it myself! Perfect! So fresh and so full of toppings! Dolmades are outstanding! Everything was so fresh and quickly delivered. Definitely our new favorite spot!

This is my second time eating here. It's taste even better. The gyros are great. Bigger than most gyros I have had at others places for a great price. Very friendly ppl. I will be back again. Like a regular. They are a must have.

Huge fan of Greek food and because of the high caliber reviews of 3 Greeks Grill, I chose to finally order from their restaurant. I ordered a Spanakopita (spinach pie) and Greek salad for myself and my buddy had the Chicken Gyro Sandwich with a separate side order of the lemon potatoes. I ordered a Rizogalo (rice pudding) that we both planned on sharing (key word, PLANNED lol).

First off, A star is immediately deducted from their overall rating simply due to the delivery time. The order was placed on off peak hours so delivering to our location, which was 7 blocks from the restaurant, should not have taken over an hour. We called around the 50 minute mark and the woman who answered said it takes time to prepare the food. Ironically the food still arrived lukewarm.

As for the food itself, I was fortunate my friend had dressing in her house or else I would have just had a bland salad. They were extremely stingy with the feta to where it was barely visible. I could not take more than 2 bites of the spinach pie without having the feeling to regurgitate and proceeded to trash it. My friend ate her chicken gyro sandwich but stated it was just "meh" and "nothing extraordinary." Remember that Rizogalo we planned on sharing? I guess the restaurant had different plans lol because it never came with the order. I'm not sure if they charged us for it or if they deducted it from the total amount due, but communication is key. If our order was being modified in any way, we should have been contacted.

I was always taught to find the finer qualities in people, or rather establishments in this case. I chose to compliment them with an extra star simply on the basis of how delicious their lemon potatoes are. I will most definitely not order/dine from here again but for those who choose to, go with the lemon potatoes!
We have ordered few times from 3Greeks Grill. We love chicken gyro  (shawarma) from this shop. Delivery was on time. No complaints, we would order again!

Really disappointed. New to the neighborhood, ordered 100 bucks worth of delivery and completely forgettable. Falafel were memorably bad, everything else chicken, souvlaki, spinach pie... meh and barely meh.
I wish I had better news- but there are so many good Greek spots for delivery in Astoria - Zenon Taverna, Crave, Monikas cafe bar... I'll go with what I know.

I am 100% Greek and my family owns one of the best Greek restaurants in NY.
Let's say I don't think a lot of Greek food out there is anything to talk about. Well Well Well.  I order 3 Greeks on average 3x A WEEK. It is just SO good. Fresh, tasty , healthy and just darn delicious. It makes me happy! Staff and Owners are sweetest-delivery is quick.
They now have grilled haloumi cheese-YUM! I get same thing usually-chicken souvlaki, the Prassini salad is PERECT-They send you grilled pita-It's just delightful.
I recently had hawaiin party and needed catering for 50-I had full hawaiin catering menu and two nights before my party, I was eating my 3 greeks dinner and cancelled the hawaiin menu and catered from 3 greeks cause I just knew people would rave about the food. and they did. ITS EXCELLENT GREEK FOOD-trust me-I KNOW!
My fiance and I ordered lunch specials - falafel and a gyro. Both were very tasty as was the spicy feta spread. We will definitely be back!

What a rip-off!!! The Greek "salad" is just a bowl of shredded lettuce with 4 tiny cubes of feta cheese and it cost freaking $4.25 extra for a few tiny strips of cold chicken.

Never again.

Not to mention the Greek sausage that cost $4.25 and was a joke sized portion as well.

Trust me, this place is not worth the money. Astoria has way too many other good Greek places with great value to waste your money here.

By far the best souvlaki in NY.
The pork souvlaki is perfectly grilled and tender.
Try the biftekia (greek mini burgers) - to die for.
This food is the bomb.com. So glad I found this place. Filled my belly up real nice. Happy camper right here. I came with a friend. He like it too.

3 Greeks makes a mean chicken gyro. A little over priced but worth every bite. The real estate is prime on a major bike path at the corner of the Roosevelt island bridge, there's nothing really around so it's a good spot in a bind.
Amazing food and amazing service to match! Definitely one of the best Greek spots in NYC.

Great Greek Gyros.
Groovy Grilled Grub.
Generous Gifted Guys Giving Generally Grand Gold Graciously.

It was surprisingly hard to find all G words to write this review. What was not hard though was enjoying the food from 3 Greeks Grill. The food tastes fresh and delicious, which is basically all you can ask for when ordering delivery. The chicken gyro platter was great and they serve it with salad and your choice of rice, fries or roasted potatoes. They have Greek fries too which is great with their herbs and feta cheese.

Every so often you get lucky enough to discover a place near your home that has great food and can deliver to you. This was one of those times for me.

Every Monday I do catering for my team of 40. This week I wanted to try something different. Sliders and wings are great but become mundane. With that said, decided to try this restaurant using ezcater.com. WHAT A HIT!!! From the minute the delivery arrived it was top notch. They organized the food, brought linens and the gentleman that delivered was just extremely pleasant. Now onto the good stuff, the food! This was my first time trying Greek so I was little concerned about my choices but, let's just say, there wasn't a single tray left with food. Everything was delicious. Everything arrived temperature appropriate and each tray was so heavy in flavor. So glad I decided to try something new. This will be added to my regular rotation now.

We order from this place at least once a week and absolutely love it. We tried different meats (chicken souvlaki, chicken breast, chicken gyro, pork skewers, buffalo wings, lamb chops..) and everything is delicious. All platters come with a side (rice, lemon potatoes, fries), pita bread and a Greek salad. The spicy feta is to die for, we tried to make our own at home and it was such a sad attempt, not even comparable. Definitely recommend this place!!
Love this place! Food is always fresh and delicious! I usually order lunch for delivery and they have really great lunch specials!

We visited 3 Greeks Grill located at the intersection of 36th Avenue and Vernon Boulevard about a week ago. This corner shop, which flies both US and Greek flags from its sign, is a stone-throw from the Roosevelt Island Bridge and sits on the boarder of Long Island City and Astoria. Stopping in about 11:30 AM, we were warmly greeted by one of the owners who was gearing up with her crew for lunch. We ordered hallumi cheese and lamb gyro pitas before taking a seat. (We were lucky enough to snag the single two-seat table available for indoor dining. Additional seating was available outdoors.) While it took a bit of time for the food to arrive, we were pleasantly surprised by the freshness of the sandwiches.  The pitas were simultaneously fluff and crisp and the meat, cheese, lettuce, tomato and green pepper in the sandwiches were delicious.  See uploaded photos.  Serendipitously finding a place like 3 Greeks Grill has a way of making your day. Sas efcharistó
Good stuff. I like the location. Had a pork gyro. I realized that only in Astoria can you say gyro with an H instead of a G and not feel like a pretentious barleyhead.

Was staying nearby. Found on here.  Cant say enough great about this place.  Staff was amazing.  Very friendly.  Food was soooo good.  The falafel was some of the best I've had.  Lamb kabobs were also excellent

I usually go on 30 mile  bicycle ride today and in my way back decided to go through Vernon Blvd back home. I saw the lights of  3Greeks Grill on and decided to stop by as I was starving. Let me tell you this little spot on 36th Ave & Vernon is really good. I didn't have a lock for my bicycle so I hit in and ordered and went outside to the bar chairs. It was beautiful night out and it was almost 9 p.m. when I ordered Lukaniko ( Greek sausage) sandwich & Greek fries. Anastasi & Maria are the owners and are very friendly and accommodating. They brought my food outside where I was and waited for me to finish dinner as other patrons walked in they served them even though it was passed their closing time. If you bike or run in the neighborhood do yourself a favor and stop for a bite. Maria & Anastasi run great place that is friendly and the food is delicious , reasonably priced with outstanding service. I think I found my new fave spot after a workout. Oh and I took to go galapktobourejo & rizigalo ( rice pudding). I highly recommend this place! If you are bike rider you know how hard it is to find a spot for your bicycle and enjoy your dinner. Trust me this is a great spot! Thank you Maria & Anastasi I'll see you soon!

Seriously delicious Greek food -- fast delivery, generous portions, reasonable prices... To start, every component of my Greek Salad (without raw onions, due to my severe allergy) was perfection -- green crunchy lettuce, juicy tender tomatoes, crisp fragrant green peppers, juicy crunchy cucumbers. And the roasted lemony potatoes were amazing. And the pita with tzatziki was amazing. And the orangey-leeky grilled sausage was really, CRAZY GOOD.

Stopped there for a lunch while visiting NYC. Cheap lunch buffet and the food was really good. not sure why the other address says they are closed, but the place was open when we were there. Probably not worth a detour, but if you are in the area, its worth it.

The short guy that made my sandwich was extremely RUDE !!! he says disrespectful sexual comments. He should not be working in a neighborhood deli that everyone and children go to. Especially with a park and school across the street. NOT ACCEPTABLE.

p.s sandwich was made horrible ( just like the service ) cashier was pretty nice at-least :)

2W!ngz is an excellent find that I would have never found without yelp. They have great selection of items with reasonable prices for what u get. Everything I've tried until now has been superb. The team was extremely friendly and service is very good. 2W!ngz, so glad they're in town.

At LIC Flea when I saw wings with waffles and had to try.  Split an order of BBQ wings with waffles.  Wings were cooked nicely, meaty and well spiced.   The waffle was nice.  Only negative was smuckers maple syrup which is crap.  Nice people I'd come back again.

Expensive but I did enjoy the sushi.  The spicy rolls did have a lot of mayo in them but otherwise, I thought my rolls were good.  I thought the sashimi pieces could have been bigger for the price.  I did not have any specials rolls so I can't say anything about them.  I had some yellowtail sashimi, unagi roll, spicy scallop roll.  My friend had the spicy tuna handroll but didn't want to eat it all because the mayo in it was a bit overwhelming.  It appears to be annexed to the Korean restaurant downstairs.  (Chom Chom).

Very expensive for what is just mediocre. Sushi is just mediocre, rolls and entrees are just on average or below average. Nothing interesting or creative. Everything is too expensive and overpriced. I was excited that a new joint opened but turned out to be a disappointment.

Pretty chill, nice, quiet place to grab a quick bite/coffee/catch up lunch with friends during a work day.
The food was very good. Nothing over the top expensive just solid, low key, local ingredients.
I got the burrata salad that came with a slice of really good bread. I know only local bakeries can have such quality. You can add proteins to the salsa but it was very good on its own. I went there for a quick lunch with a friend. We both work in the area and it was super easy and not loud or too busy to have a conversation.
You can make reservation too.
Their coffee looks really nice as well.
Our server was friendly and attentive.

I really enjoyed brunch at 21 Greenpoint. They have a very cute outdoor seating area with greenery and disco balls for a funky, fun aesthetic.
The service was a little slow throughout brunch. The waiter took too long to bring more water and to drop off our check. However, the waiters and hosts were pleasant.
The food was really good. We liked the Broc Guac which was an interesting twist on guacamole. The jalapeño cornbread skillet was delicious! I had the personal quiche, which was very filling and came with a side salad AND hash browns. The hash browns were perfectly crispy and salty. I really liked the meal and felt like the portions were substantial.
I am a fan of this restaurant and would recommend checking it out.

The service was excellent but the food and drinks sucked. The chicken nachos sounded great in theory but were disgusting. For one thing they didn't have any cheese. I've never had nachos without cheese but to me that defeats the purpose. Also the gin martini was only vermouth and not gin so it was gross.

Yet another great new spot to open in Rock Center, this one is downstairs alongside the other more fast casual options.

Order at the register and they'll bring you food to stay - they didn't have much yet, but the Crab Toast and Kale Caesar we tried were excellent. Looking forward to coming back for the full menu.
Cheeseburger and Wedge Salad hit the spot. Highly recommend. Easy to get in and have table for lunch.

Great spot in a central location in the city.  The best part is the service, they are actually friendly, as in small town not big City friendly.  They all say hello and good morning.  And they are hustling and fast.  Place is clean (for a city shop).

Coffee bar rocks with lots of choices.

The deli counter prepared food is really good.  The small section in the back has all you need for the neighborhood, cold beer, wine, milk, cereal, water etc....

Its full service breakfast,  lunch and sandwiches.  Has fresh baked goods (cakes, macaroons, pastries, etc...).  Lots of sit down room but everything can be made to go as well.  

If you tap or use a card be sure to ask them to add a tip because they do not ask.  Something I thought was an oversight but I tested it out.  They never do.

When you are doing business in NYC and you can't be bothered to correct your operating hours?? Seriously? Complete clowns.

Says on Google and yelp they are open variously 24 hrs or until 2am. Nope! They closed much earlier.  It's a good thing NY does not have tourists in town all the time googling for local restaurants. Unprofessional af 's.

Best French Toast I've had! The fruit is plentiful and the meal is served quickly. A very fast paced eatery. Kind of small but they make good use of the space. The BLT was also a good sandwich. I'll visit again if I ever travel to NY again.

I have been to NYC often for work. Don't eat to much in the hotels I stay in. I try to eat at mom & pop places. This is one of the best! Had the Reuben sandwich which was more than I expected to pay but definitely worth it. Staff was very polite and friendly. The place was very clean and organized. I will be definitely recommending this place to my colleagues and coming back for more. Thanks guys!

So expensive !
2 burgers, fries and can of coke $37.
if you're going to dine in prepare to freeze half to death. Why they don't have a wind blocking shelter set up at the door baffles me.
Burger was served on dry bun, and burnt on the side they put my cheese - didn't realize till halfway through the burger.
Men behind the counter could be nicer.
Will not be returning and don't suggest coming here, obviously staying afloat because it's close to the tourist area

I have no idea why the ratings of this place are so low??? the food is DELICIOUS! You need to stop by for yourself. They do not disappoint! Huge selection of options for food, drinks, and desserts. Something for everyone's taste. Service was great! We ordered over the phone, quick and easy. Classic deli vibe and the people are super nice. Highly recommend the focaccia sandwich and the BEC (we added sausage too). Also do yourself a favor and get a pickle on the side :)!

Ordered the smoked salmon bagel here. For the bagels, the restaurant has no pricing for the bagels, so I was expecting that bagel to cost only around $8. Got charged $19.47 for a bagel that was bad quality and was overall unappetizing. Workers are extremely stubborn and are basically trying to scam you. They make you pay more money than you actually need to and are confused with orders.

Ordered the Original Hamburger.  Menu says with lettuce & tomato but when I got it, was was just bun with patty, no lettuce or tomato.  I had to go back to ask & they put them in.  Then the side of cold slaw that the order comes in had Saran Wrap in it.  See pix

I had breakfast here every day during my visit to NYC. The staff are cheerful and kind. The selection was very New York deli. There are plenty of tables toward the front, so great people watching opportunities. I even grabbed a half dozen bagels to bring back home.
I had the Reuben. The Reuben gets 5 stars. Incredible corn beef. The price was $25!?! I couldn't afford anything else.

Really overpriced and not great. The lasagna was $20 and definitely not worth it. The service was friendly but pushed for a fast decision. The turkey deli sandwich was very dry. My daughter liked her chicken noodle soup. My sandwich and soda was $20 and very much not worth that.

Food is overpriced and there is no transparency's to how they charge. I order a egg and ham only sandwich which should of been 3.95 according to their online PDF menu and they wanted $7.50. I asked how he came up with that price and he gave me a shit ton of attitude and started doing the NY chatter with his buddies so I walked out and said keep it. I noticed  they don't really start making your meal until you pay, good luck.....

The breakfast bagels are good, and a good price. However, we accidenty ordered twice, and they claimed they had made both and were ready to pick up. (They couldn't cancel the order). When we went, one of the orders weren't ready. We had to wait for around 10m total. The food is bussin tho

This place is such a rip-off and the employees there are rude. This sandwich is not worth $9........ maybe $5.50, and don't play the "we are in Midtown Manhattan card". This place is such a rip-off. I won't be going back.
SKIP THIS DELI - with so many other choices go to them.  This place is overpriced and not good. My salad was swimming in dressing, the cookies were hard and it was $50 for two of us.

While the bagel I had was yummy & did the job of being a NYC bagel, the prices were definitely higher than expected. The menu was impossible to read from where you order your food and so it felt stressful to order. Although, the menu had quite a lot of options, so if you are looking for a place with variety and are in the area, this is not a bad place to stop.

Amazing, with great service, staff is super friendly, caring, and helpful, other reviews are trippin. I got brisket of beef, staff told me I can make it a plate (mashed potatoes, gravy, veggies) no charge extra. Was hesitant but I don't regret it at all, super delicious and packed with flavor and seasoning. My bf got the pastrami sandwich and it is delicious. He mentioned the coleslaw is great (and he is super picky with coleslaw). Coffee (iced vanilla mocha) is 8/10. Will definitely be back when I'm in NY!

Like many have said. Over  priced and poor quality. I did not experience bad customer service but  it was very slow when I was there and I did not complain about anything.  I probably should have complained though.

My first choice, gyro  plate, off of the menu was not available and I was there around 9:00pm. I  had the chicken wings instead, big mistake. I received 5 microwave  looking buffalo wings and a medium portion of fries with a 16oz. bottle  of Coke Zero for a total of $19.  I also purchased a small container of  mixed nuts and a glazed doughnut to go. It came out to $15 and some  change.  My recommendation is to avoid unless you like to over pay for  mediocrity.

Ate one half, this half is cold in the middle.
Bread is soft and warm, not toasted.
Pickle is promising but not quite good.
Wasn't expecting much but not a fan.

Do not order food from here. Over Priced and not enough ingredients on the sandwich . I haven't been this disappointed in a sandwich in a while. I only came to this place because the deli I usually go to was closed . Maybe if you're not from nyc this place may "look nice " but the quality just isn't there . Luckily I didn't get the 24 dollar pastrami sandwich . Stick to the drinks and snacks but not food !

Stopped here for a non-breakfast sandwich around 9am. Huge selection of breakfast items and made to order or pre-made sandwiches.  We tried the Americana sub and the grilled euro ham and cheese.  Big selection of drinks, snacks and baked goods.  Staff was friendly and food was quick. Great stop if you don't need a fancy breakfast or lunch.

Prices at this place are absurd.  I ordered egg whites and a coffee and was charged $14.  When I questioned the price the cashier mumbled that it was midtown Manhattan.  I think he thought I was a tourist and seemed like he was making up prices.  As someone that works in the area I know the same thing would have been 1/2 the price at my normal deli.

We looked for a fast, good, no froufrou takeout place after seeing Music Man tonight at the Winter Garden. Found this all-nighter and the food looked pretty good. Had an Italian sub (Caprocolla?), corn/avocado salad, a slice of strawberry cheesecake, a Doctor Brown's soda and a Lagunita's ale. Everything hit the spot and service was good. Yeah, super expensive but I rationalize the price for them having 2 employees on staff we while staying open until 2 am. Well played 810 Deli.

The carrot cake was so bad that I would give it a zero, buts that's not possible so I give it a one. It tasted like someone put it in the microwave to cook. The cookie they gave me was dry and old and when we went in there to exchange it the man at the front said "All our cookies are fresh". We showed him the cookies and how the chocolate chips were dry, light tan (this is a sign they are old, my boyfriend worked in a cookie shop in his younger days lol) and cracking and the cookie itself looked like it has been on the shelf for weeks and when he looked at it he was like "oh yeah...". He exchanged the cookie so that was good but I would not come back here again. This place was overpriced and serves bad food.

Place is dirty ... the food is stale ... and when a customer ask u to warm up their mod warm coffee by pouring the equivalent on 6cents worth of coffee... don't tell them u have to pay for a new coffee ...

The staff got my order wrong due to not understanding what I was asking for. They charged me almost $40 and then tried to make me pay another $10. There was a huge problem with communication because we didn't speak Spanish. To top it off after the whole ordeal we could hear them mocking us while we were eating at our seats. We also saw that they got the order for the lady behind us incorrect. All around it was an absolutely horrible experience.

The food we had was great deli fare.  The bagel with lox was loaded & fresh.  Their Ruben was on a very good Rye bread, lightly toasted.  It had plenty of corn beef & was not "over dressed".  The chocolate mousse cheesecake with a great cup of coffee will keep you coming back for more.  We enjoy the guys who work there.  It's a hoot to listen to them barking out orders.  They always remembered us every time.  It does get crowded due to limited space.  Get a table near the back of the deli to escape the cold wind coming in every time the door is opened.  We will ALWAYS return to "our deli" anytime we get to NYC.

I was totally shocked when I saw my receipt. What? $19.19 for just a takeout plate of mashed potato and chicken deli?! I felt I have been robbed or cheated. Definitely OVERPRICED!!!! When I asked where is this on their menu on the wall, they were making an excuse saying the menu keeps changing so this one is not on the menu. So they just made up the price I guess?! Please don't go!!!!!!

They don't make what their menu says. $12 for a grilled portobello panini with roast peppers arugula goat cheese. Was actually made on smashed French bread with romaine lettuce instead of arugula. Didn't see this until in room with no time to go back. There's also a 2% charge for using a debit card.

3.5. Whew, big portions from your standard NYC deli shop.
Located right across the street from Sheraton Times Square, so it's a perfect bite if you've got the late nite munchies.

Like the standard New York deli, I feel like they've got a LOTTTTTT of options, and you'd be hesitant to think that anything is done well. It's like a Chinese restaurant that also serves pizza and burgers. Except that it's a deli that has fried rice, meatball sandwiches, and lasagna.

Portions are huge. If you get a sandwich, share it. The meatball hero was actually quite tasty, and it's plenty of food for two medium eaters.

Gets a bit breezy in the winter as the door opens and closes. Brrrr.
Got sick after eating here, bad enough it's a complete rip off even for the area but definitely do not go near this place, majestic deli down the street was way better
It's closed it's not midnight yet it say they are open until. 2am. The sign says they are open but the lighting and the lack of people in the streets say otherwise.

Filthy men. Filthy store.

Pleasant grill master hence the one star is justified. But still...unhealthy conditions. Take a quick look around to make sure you're comfortable before ordering.  These are not service-oriented people.  Low lives to be specific.

We didn't find the tuft (!) of hair in the sandwich until after we got back to the hotel. Bringing the item back proved to be a waste of time. Having waited quietly to avoid a scene in front of other patrons, this mobster-wanna-be owner started threatening my husband once he saw the hair. He knew it wasn't ours -- but rather than acknowledge and/or apologize, the owner reverted to hostility and threats...taking his mask of...getting in his face. Threw the $7 egg sandwich on the floor. He must have assumed we're clueless travelers from out of town. Still not okay.

This place is right outside Times Square...close to multiple major hotels chains.  I love my city and it breaks my heart that scumbag like these make the Big Apple look bad. They have a good business because location location location. But customers don't deserve to be treated so disrespectfully and the standards for their health so easily disregarded. Shame on 810 Deli and Café.

Yelpers get it right again.

Three stars.

A New York Coffee House from back in the day when coffee house meant diner and not lattes to go.

New York diner-style coffee houses are more or less the same. There are awful ones and exceptional ones - but most are pretty similar.

* * *

On the plus side,

Exceptionally good lox and eggs.

Huge servings.

* * *

On the minus side,

Boars Head everything.

(Friends don't let friends eat Boar's Head.)

You order from a counter and bring the food to your table. Speeds up service to be sure, but lacks grace and charm.

They take your order fast (hooray) but cook what you order slow (not so hooray.)

From the huge servings, you gain weight.

From the slow delivery of food to your table, you gain wait.

But my biggest gripe is that housekeeping is an issue.

The place is clean enough for food inspection purposes. No need to call the health department.

But they are slow about bussing tables.

The floor accumulates a modest snowfall of napkins and other discarded stuff.

I don't like eating among other people's dirty stuff.

But the food is okay and there is a lot of it.

That counts for something.

I don't understand the bad reviews. This is such a convenient place with nice, hard working people! They have all kinds of options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, whether you want to eat there or take it to go.

They have coolers with refrigerated items, fresh pastries/bagels and snacks, sandwiches, salads, fresh fruit, beer, wine, and a grill where cooks prepare the  hot dishes. They're right across the street from the Sheraton, so a lot of their guests come here for a more reasonable meal. I just had a bagel, a side of bacon and a coffee this morning for $10.72, and I'm wanting to try one of their sandwiches. They sound great! Like a real Jewish deli. I noted regulars coming in too, so they must be doing something right!

I'm totally disgusted! Ordered matzo ball soup because wasn't feeling well. Cut open the matzo balls to find green mold. Ordered through grub hub. Let them know I could not nor would I eat that soup or anything else that would come from this place. 810 deli and cafe refused to refund me. Now I'll just file a complaint and call my card company. They can keep their moldy food.  
DO NOT CHANCE IT! Stay away from this place.
The only reason I'm giving it 1 star is because it's making me in order to post review. They wouldn't get any from me. They only thing great was the fast delivery but that was because of Grubhub not "moldy food are us"!!!

I am being gracious with one star.
Found lock of hair in my egg sandwich. Place is not sanitary. Denied that it was hair! Not good...

NYC Delis... How I miss you!!  They can call just about any place outside of NY a deli, but it doesn't even come close!!  Come here for a quick, easy breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack, etc.  In a city of high pretense and sometimes sadly low expectations, a true NY Deli will NEVER let you down!!  I came in to the city early to visit a friend and browsed for about a half hour or so as I made my way uptown.  I knew I'd find someplace, just not sure where or what I wanted for a late morning snack.  This place wound up a perfect choice!!  Plenty of choices, for everyone from the big eater (some breakfast platters would serve a whole family!!) to the humble nosher.  I was just a few hours away from a big lunch with a friend, but wanted "something," so I chose a bagel and egg sandwich (made to order) and cup of coffee.  Quick service, BARELY enough time to DROOL over their extensive display of lunch and dinner platters and TONS of specialty items.  A bit pricey at $9.50, but that's just because I've been STUCK in Ohiooooo too long!!!

Most seem to get their food to go in places like this, especially on busy work days, but they do have a good bit of seating, so I chose to stay, warm up a bit, and take in the ambiance!!  They were still open when I passed by on my way back to LI.  Grabbed a few tempting pastries to go (YUMMMO, hamentaschen in November!!) and made my whole family happy!!)  Don't miss this place if you're in the area!!
Super pricey.  Quick ok good.  Not a lot of help just pricey alcohol and food is ok not a lot f seating

The owner physically assaulted my friend and i after telling us we cannot eat our outside food. We had no problem with that request however the owner would not offer us a refund on a beverage we had bought from their facility, which resulted in him becoming very verbally and physically aggressive. I felt in fear for my safety, and would not recommend this place to anyone. In a video i had taken during this interaction you can here shim admit to the fact that he physically assaulted my friend with no remorse! absolutely disgusting, and then he would reassure the other customers that he wasn't crazy.

I ate here frequently on my last visit as we were staying at the Sheraton and the food there is very mediocre and exorbitantly expensive.
Egg salad sandwiches tuna sandwiches and hot pastrami and rye are delicious. They lose a star for dirty bathroom and a tad expensive, but like I say visit the big apple grab your ankles and pray they lube up because you are gonna get reamed this city is a total rip off but it's the taxes and politicians man not the hard working folks trying to make a living like the guys at this terrific deli.
Their food really hits the spot!
Friendly and super fast!
Great food. Yes maybe a little expensive but you are in New York.  To be expected but excellent service and friendly staff
First time coming over here and yet they looked intriguing so therefore I can try it out and I am very happy that I tried lasagna plus potato soup which is so good I recommend is to get a five star

We stopped in on April 7th, 2021 - it was their 2nd day open, as they had been closed for 13 months due to the pandemic. The owner and staff were SO helpful, friendly and accommodating. We ordered hot paninis, pastrami sandwiches, bagels and drinks. Everything was delicious! The sandwiches were made to order, hot and fresh. Everything was very clean and orderly and I hope that these guys are able to stay in business, now that they've reopened. I am a native New Yorker and live on Long Island now, but we came to the city to support some of the local businesses and we were not disappointed! Thanks, guys!

Wide variety of options for a deli. I had lunch at 2PM so it wasn't very busy but the staff was very eager to assist with choices. Greek sale with lox tasted great. Prices were pretty good, considering we're in Manhattan...

Not sure why these guys have such a low rating - it's a very solid NY quick serve deli. They're open late and they serve a mix of sandwiches and hot foot including pasta, burgers, and hot sandwiches.

Really appreciate how late they're open - the guys are friendly with that touch of NYC attitude.

They heat the sandwiches using an oven and not a panini press so the sandwiches toast nicely and the cheese melts. I haven't had a bad sandwich here yet and I'm aiming to come back for the hot brisket.

Also - their burger grind is pat lafrieda, if you appreciate that

UPDATE: The hot brisket au jus is a great sandwich. It's pretty large and they're generous with the amount of brisket. The brisket is perfectly juicy, fatty, and gelatinous. Perfect in a sandwich really. Comes with some very solid coleslaw that is a nice crunch counterpart to the rich sandwich. The sandwich also has some cheese in it. It is a little on the salty side.

Also, I don't know how many people care/appreciate this, but they've got great pickles to go with the sandwiches.
Paid $13.95 for a wrap which took 20 mins to make and my sandwich comes with paper INSIDE!

Visiting this weekend and after leaving the Ain't Too Proud to Beg musical on 45th & 7th I google for a deli nearby that's open late. 810 Deli pops up as nearby....a mere 8 minute walk...and they're open to 2:30am...and the menu is huge with some good described sammiches.

Well we walk and we walk. We hit 7th and we walk and walk. What is it about NY storefronts not having the building number in front? I don't know if I'm going up or down 7th. If I'm getting closer or further away from my destination. I finally stop in a hotel and asks the desk guy where am I? Luckily I was going in the right direction.

We finally get there and to my major disappointment, all the sammiches are premade sitting in the display case. I was hoping for a made to order sandwich piled high. Instead I get a thin bland American sub on the toughest roughest bread ever. Dam near pulled out a couple teeth. I thought NY was famous for delis? If this is what they're like, I may as well go to subway. Eat fresh...not premade.

I made the mistake of not checking Yelp before going in. We came here for a quick breakfast since it's across the street from the Sheraton Hotel. The guys behind the counter were friendly but I felt like we might have been overcharged. We only had 4 items and it seems like he rung up more than that. I couldn't tell whether the charge was for food tax or another item since they had an old school cash register without a receipt. The actual food was ok. With so many Deli and Cafes in NY, I would skip this one.

Food 6 of 10
Treatment/ Customer Service 0 of 10

Hey guys, when we step in your business is because we are going to spend money. I don't know if you know that who pay our and YOURS bills are the customers!

I'll NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

I was just watching an episode of "The Best Thing I Ever Ate: Burger Edition" on the Cooking Channel and it brought me back to this place. I have to admit.... I had the BEST burger in my entire life at this place! No joke! And I have been to a lot of places in my life. It was the jalapeno burger with pepper jack cheese & bacon cooked medium rare. OMG! This was a few years ago (I no longer eat red meat and this was the one time in over 12 years I decided to eat meat) and I still dream of this burger! If I still ate meat, I would go get one tomorrow.

Now the establishment is a little pricy (but that's midtown Manhattan for you) but the burger is reasonably priced and the accompany fries are also incredible!

I have to admit, 53rd Gourmet Deli was definitely terrific. It's a fun atmosphere to be in, and the menu and service is pretty great. Each and every single item that we have purchased was incredibly fresh and yummy. The workers were very friendly, smiled a lot, felt genuine. 53rd Gourmet Deli - I'll be back, i hope sooner than later.

Prices are good and there is good variety. There is a deli station, salads, Japanese station, groceries, and ice cream. There is also a buffet to top it all. The place is not cheap, but reasonably priced for NYC.

Breakfast - I got a vegetable omelette for breakfast here this morning. It came with potatoes and toast. While I liked the price, the food itself was not great. Breakfast potatoes were mushy and sloppy. The eggs were tasteless and I couldn't find the mushrooms though they were supposed to be a main ingredient.
It was not the best quality breakfast I had. There was also a long line to order and I waited close to 30 minutes for my breakfast to come. On usual days, I don't have this much time.

I do have a lot of food restrictions and this place has options for me - which is nice and not always the case. Freshness could be improved. It is hectic in the AM but I didn't walk out hungry and I didn't break the bank buying food. I will probably be back because I work in the building but wouldn't travel far to get here...

Large selection

Not terribly filthy

Prices for midtown not ball-achingly expensive

To whom it may concern:

I'm sure misunderstandings happen all the time, and I'm sure the sign on your lavatory/bathroom/washroom is true to however the sign says it is.

The story goes like this,,, we (7 of us) eat at Halal Guys,, we eat the food by the public seats that are located right next to the halal guys. After eating out meal, i tell my cousin, i know of a spot where we can buy drinks and share it in the deli.

So we proceed to enter your establishment, i make a bee line for the beer selection,, i pick a big giant can of Asahi beer and he takes two long cans of  Guinness for us to share. We approach the cashier which seems to be of asian decent, judging by the accent the features. We pay for the drinks and my cousin beats me to the laying down the credit card game. While this is all happening, the others were busy buying ice cream at the gelateria in the same premise. So we all sit, make a toast for the great vacation we've had here filled with sight seeing and shopping in NYC.

Before we go back out to Time Square to get one last soak in on the atmosphere, we decide to use the "Customers Only" bathroom which was just used by my cousin who beat me to the lay down the credit card game. My boyfriend was the first to ask, and I approached him, "I asked the cashier and he just giggled and walked away." So I try asking him since CLEARLY we were just in front of him purchasing beverages for the group. His response was, "The bathroom is out of order."

Ok,, I get it,, I guess we have clearly overstayed our welcome. We clean the tables, throw away our trash and leave to enjoy the rest of the night in time square.

Sincerely,
Rodrigo Torres

P.S.
This letter is not by no means defame or demolish your fine establishment, this is to clearly show that "MISUNDERSTANDINGS DO HAPPEN"

Thank you for taking time to read my letter.

Ok average food. Desserts look good... Did the hot food buffet bar... Mac n cheese tastes like marshmallows or sweet potatoes w marshmallows... Chicken tastes like wine... A bit bizarre...

Poor seating as well .. we got lucky as someone was just getting up.

It could be better but I wouldn't cal gourmet ... Also wasn't sure about our bill ... I think at 8.99 their scales are rigged lol
Who's guy just charge me $18.51 for a pack of cigarettes. I guess he needs the money. $75 for two plates food . Crazy
Great food, and great variety of different vegetables, meats, pastas, etc.  Love this place.

No Sandwich for you! said the deli Nazi.

My first deli spot in NYC and this one was right across from the hotel.  I've never seen such rude customer service in my life!  I thought Seinfeld was just a show!?  

While standing in line looking at their menu.  I can hear the main chef yelling at customers to call out the order and arguing with other patrons.  I'm not sure if that's the way it goes around here, but if you asked me it's unfortunate.
