Needless to say, I ordered the pastrami, egg and cheese sandwich, while scurrying away like a child hoping not to feel the wrath of the deli Nazi.  Yeah he was eyeballing me for ordering slow!  The sandwich was actually very good.  On a warm toasted bun oozing cheese, while the saltiness of the pastrami added kick to the egg balancing each other out.

In the end, the poor attitude of the sandwich chef really bothered me.  Maybe I'm being bias about this since I'm not from around NYC, but treating other's with respect is important to me.  Eating out is an experience and I rather get treated right than eating well for a day.  Sorry gang only 1 star even though food was good. - Enjoy!

Since my office moves from midtown to uptown I have been frequenting this deli quite often. I must say that I have had all pleasant experiences.

It is ALWAYS busy but the service is pretty fast so you're in and out depending on how you move. I haven't ordered any sandwiches or wraps just yet I usually just get something from the buffet table. I believe it's $8.00 a pound and I always manage to get enough food and it's always under a pound.

Usually, I get fruit, lowein, rice, salad and chicken. It has always been very well. My food is always cooked just right and tastes amazing. They also sell sushi and it is FRESH. Usually, I never get sushi from any small places because you just never know what you're eating and he to be careful with fish. However, my experience here has been good.

I'm not the only person that likes this place. Almost all of my colleagues frequent this business for lunch every day. It's definitely worth it. Unless you want to eat from a cart then there aren't many other great options nearby.

They do accept credit card but there's a $8 minimum & there is seating but if you're going to take a seat then eat fast and leave because there's always a lot of people waiting to grab a chair.

One the way to MOMA from hotel this place caught my eye - selection was huge, with a long cold salad and a hot items buffet.  Grabbed a giant shrimp wrapped with bacon, a rib and a couple of bites of fish, then loaded up with veggies, five noodles of lo mien and 2 fried plantain bites.  With a bottle of water the bill comes around $14.  Guess those veggies are really heavy!  The worst part is the shrimp is artificially compressed and taste like msg.  I should have known better!  Picasso's sculptures really got mind off the track...

Stopped in after work to get something kinda quick.  Pretty big assortment of different foods.  I grabbed a rib, some chicken, potatoes, fried bananas, crab salad.  Nothing too special, but I'd go back if I need something quick and can't decide on something specific.  Sandwich options too.  They do shut down parts so not everything is available if you go too late.  Seating fills up quick too.

Best place in midtown New York.
Resonable price and taste good.
Panini.sanswich.sushi.buffet table.
toss saad.smoothie.wine.

I tried this place b/c some guys at my office eat from here at least once a week, and they recommended it.

The quality isn't the best, but the (cheap) prices make up for it. They also have a huge selection, and a pretty giant self-serve buffet. I really wanted to like this place.

My major gripe is in the service and layout. The way they have ordering set up is unnecessarily confusing. They have 2 pieces of paper taped to the deli counter, telling you where to order deli sandwiches and where to order hot food. To top it off, the items on the menu above the different areas do not coincide with where you should order it. For example, hot items might be mixed over on the left menu, but you order on the right. Ok so what about something like corned beef? Technically it's hot, but it's also a sandwich. Ambiguous.

Well, I guess deli item and I guess wrong.  Waited in one "line" for 10 minutes (not really a line, just a bunch of people standing around and you have to guess where the line starts/ends), only to get up to order and have the guy point to the other line. You order that over there. No apology, no offer to get the order for me, nothing.

After waiting another 10 minutes, they forgot the fries. Those took another 5.

All in all I spent about 20-25 minutes getting a sandwich and french fries. It was a terrible experience, even for someone who is used to Midtown lunchtime madness.

Note to owners: Put some ropes or something. Not even ropes. Just one single rope. Ordering a sandwich and fries shouldn't be this difficult.
I called and the guy literally didn't let me speak a sentence before hanging up on me... seriously?? Was about to order lunch for my office

The "DIRTY DELI" is nothing special, except for the name.

The food is average to below, service above average, and the decor/ambiance is grotesque.

This place is so dirty I SHOULD GIVE IT A BATH MYSELF, ever heard of CAPEX baby? reinvest your cash flow?

They also messed up my sandwiches a few times, not a fan.

Beware of scary crowd sippin 40s in their outdoor seating area, they are not a fan of top-siders and popped collars, who would of thunk it?

UDON UDON UDON.

I have tried a bunch of places in this area for Udon for lunch. By far the cheapest and nicest.  Chicken can be a bit dry but overall great value.

I GOT FOOD POISONING HERE, DO NOT COME HERE.

If I could give ZERO STARS i would.  

I know for a fact that it was from here because I hadn't eaten that morning and I got sick almost exactly 8 hours after eating this food.

It didn't even taste good, so it doesn't even get a star for that. I got a chicken parmesan panini and they didn't heat it enough to melt the cheese. Disgusting.  

EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN PERIL.

This place is just across 53rd from the Hilton New York and is quick and convenient.

They've got a great selection of salads on the salad bar, all fresh and tasty, with tons of options for vegetarians.  Some examples: all manner of salads caprese, Greek, olives, pasta.  The prices are reasonable, and there is plenty of seating if you'd like to dine in.  They've also got some good-looking cupcakes and other baked goods.

There's a great selection of beverages and other sundries; the beer prices are less expensive than those I've seen at other delis in midtown west.  The ladies at the counter are efficient and friendly enough.

Found this place when I stayed at a nearby hotel.

Service was good.
Food was good.
Open 24 hours is good.
Decor - not so good.
Group of guys with 36 beers on the table in front of them - not so good.

Interior: NA/10, Food: 10/10, Service: 8/10.

This is the best sandwich place! Great food at a great price.

I had a corned beef on white with the peanut slaw. I was planning on eating half and saving the other half, but it was so good I ate the whole sandwich and was stuffed afterwards.

Would I go back? YES!

This place is a breath of fresh air in the  hectic overpriced places that surroundings. We stayed at the hilton and when hungry and couldn't leave or wanted a snack we had to get the incredibly overpriced herb n' kitchen or the gift shop. Or we would be hungry late and want real food.

This place is open 24/7 for your snacking enjoyment. We had breakfast and snacks here.

Let's start with breakfast. Can I say NY bagels are not exaggerated. These are the most amazing chewy, soft and flavorful and with multiple flavors and flavored cream cheese you could have a new one each morning  of your stay.  I got an omelet it came with toast and home fries for only $4.50 and no that's not a typo. The food was good but the toast was soft and soggy. There are so many options. The line is a bit long but worth it. There is some seating available.

The deli Sammie's,called heros in NYC, looked so good and rye had paninis and wraps as well.

The store is full of options for snacking and meals including full salad bar, hot food bar, drinks, gelato and coffee.

It's a must go if your in the neighborhood

This is 5 stars for the quick service and 5 stars for the good and quality of food,which is fresh and full of flavor!! And 5 more stars for the guy behind the counter who is always smiling and polite at me...I am looking forward to visit this place every time I come to newyork.

Clean, "new" (as in, recently renovated) deli/restaurant. They have a smoothie bar, a salad bar, a pasta section and a grill. They also carny snacks, incl healthy packaged snacks like dried peas and fresh fruit. Place is very organized and they move the line quickly. Ample seating for dine-in customers.

I had their pasta and it was pretty good - the sauce wasn't too filling and the ingredients were fresh. The only issue I had with the taste was that the sauce tasted a little bland, as if there was no salt in it but I guess that's to keep it healthy? The food portion was good for the price - only $9 for a large dish of fresh-cooked pasta.

Will be going back to try other items.

Came in here yesterday for a breakfast sandwich and friends, the wait was LONG. This seems to be mostly due to the construction worker ahead of me in line who ordered about 10 sandwiches, so I can't really fault the deli for that. They made my bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel relatively quickly and it was a warm, cheesy delicious sandwich experience! And at $3.50, pretty reasonably priced.

I went back today for lunch because I noticed the plethora of choices while I was there yesterday. They have freshly made sandwiches, wraps, quesadillas, panini, etc, etc, etc in the deli counter and if you can't find something there they will make whatever you want to order. They have hot and cold food buffets, sushi, gelato, tea, coffee, I believe I saw smoothies,  and all the snacks and drinks you'd hope to find in a store. The options are really endless. Prices on some things seem a bit high ($2 for a 20 oz bottle of coke...oof) but it is midtown, and nothing was outrageous.

I went with the buffet and got Greek salad, chicken,  and mashed potatoes for a little over $8 (buffet is $7.99/lb) and I wasn't disappointed. There are chunks of feta on the salad, and being a feta fanatic, I was in heaven. I'd imagine this place gets quite busy during the week, so keep that in mind. But if you have time and want a crazy amount of things to choose from, this is a good bet.

This place reopened after renovation and food is so much better. Added a Korean section and spicy pork is to die for! Cafe Duke was my spot but I have been converted! I will definitely be one of the regulars.

What an awesome deli!! Their salads are super fresh with great quality produce, their fruit is always ripe and sweet, and their hot foods are really good! I love the variety and their sandwiches, breakfasts, and even their sushi is great! The soups are always hot and full of flavor and their dessert options are wonderful! I wish there were more delis like this around!
Rude!!!! I feel sorry for the nasty lady who works the cash register. She must be so unhappy.
Walked over from the Hilton and had a bagel and lox.  Very busy place with lots of blue collar patrons.  Very good sign.  Great food, great prices.  Highly recommend.

We were visiting the city and stopped in for a quick bite. There were 3 of us and we got 3 chicken noodle soups. The noodles were mushy. Since the soup was so bad we opted to get something else so I grabbed some bean salad. While purchasing the bean salad I mentioned the soup with mushy noodles and the guy at the counter said in broken English "soup done". I took that to mean they are not serving it anymore.
As I ate the chickpea salad the beans were frozen. I was hungry and starting to get upset. The soup cost $17 and so did the salad. I wanted my money back and the guy at the counter gave me a hard time but didn't want to make a scene in front of the other patrons so he reluctantly gave me $3 back.

This was the worst soup and salad and service ever! They do not deserve a star but you can't submit a review without clicking on a star.

The lunch buffet wasn't great-- stuff had been left out for a long time-- but if you're just looking to fill up this place is fine. Also sells paper towels/kitchen supplies, snacks, sushi, juices, etc. Seems to be for the working crowd. Sushi is made on the spot. Run by a Korean couple. Has a decent amount of seating.

Extortion when it comes to the food on the weigh-in plates.

Almost $20 for a few mouthfuls of chicken! Decent food just prices are nuts.

Food is average for the price BUT I really like their bibimbap. Well, today was the last time II went there. The attitude of one of the sushi/Korean food chefs was the last straw. The guys is just overall nasty. Doesn't look at you when you are ordering & ignores your questions. A piece of advice to the owners - invest in employee CS training.
If I could give this place zero stars I would have. I mean how do you screw up a bagel not toasted with butter? Tasted like onion. Not in the good way. Repulsive. Inedible. A freaking shame.

Do not recommend eating here, worth walking 100 yards to somewhere else.

One star for serving me breakfast food past the posted 11am breakfast curfew on a Sunday morning. Seeing that I still go out on Saturday nights I like to sleep in on Sunday morning. This does not bode well for my love of breakfast food whenever I want breakfast food.
Its located across the street from the Hilton Hotel so if your staying there like we were for a night its a quick walk back and forth across the street. There is a little place to sit down outside as well as inside. There is a whole mini-market inside ranging from fresh olives to cereal and milk if you're needing some groceries.
They do not police the outside seating area so be weary of homeless people staring at you like we did.
Here's the catch the old spanish man making your food grunts at you as you order and doesn't actually acknowledge that your food is ready. The last thing NYC needs is another jerk, especially when your paying. He is hard to understand because he speaks in broken english in loud bursts. Not good at all for hangovers or morning grogginess. I understand that is how deli's have to be when they get busy, but when its not there is not reason to be in "pushy deli commando character". Its my money and I'll order when I'm ready. Don't expect any answers to your questions at this place.
If you order something that is not listed it is very difficult to get a price. I assume that they don't care because I asked twice for a price and got a no response other than repeating what I had ordered. I got a toasted bagel, loxs, and cream cheese that cut me back $6.45. I got the price when the old, rude, latino man physically wrote the price on the wrapping of the cream-cheese, loxs, and bagel. I understand this is Manhattan but this deli is not "Gourmet" in any sense of the word. The fact that it has a buffett that is not exactly fresh, smells suspect, and when I went almost empty is a very bad sign.
Save your money for the Halel Cart outside, they're definitely not gourmet but they'll treat you with respect and are light years ahead on being polite.

The deli sandwich had lox that were a bit fishy tasting. There was a good amount of meat, say 2oz lox for a closed bagel and 3oz of heavy cream cheese. The bagel was soft and par for NYC deli. Again there is nothing Gourmet about this place and I would go elsewhere before ever returning here again. I did not give any other stars because this deli did not even try to earn them.

I had my first New York pastrami sandwich here. It was pretty good - better than any other pastrami sandwich I've ever had! Nicely toasted and full of flavor, it was a satisfying sandwich at a fair price. I wouldn't know about other pastrami sandwich places, but this was pretty solid!

I can only review this market on their beer selection.  We were staying in the City for one night & no effing way am I gonna pay $8.95 for a bottle of lousy Heineken at a diner (not my choice of dining establishments) - freaking Heineken which I can get anywhere for heaven's sake - it's CERTAINLY not anything special in the least, it was just their least crappy cheap-ass beer.  So we got back to our hotel after a "meh" meal without a good beer (grrrrrr) & ask the concierge where there is a package store nearby.  They recommended this place, literally a block from our hotel - 8:30 pm at night in the Winter with two kids in tow, thank you, one block is about my patience level.   So we found a few beers we've never even seen at our local craft beer shops before & at $2.99/bottle the price was right.  The cashier was nice & the location was great.  

Both my husband & I were eyeing the salad bar when we left, wishing we'd eaten here instead, & wanted to come back for breakfast but we saw a tip about food poisoning here & he was scared off :( but on the word of Yelp went elsewhere & were CRAZY disappointed so maybe we should have just come here for breakfast!  ;)

This place has everything! Take a stroll around this wonderland. They have things you didn't even know existed. Pre-peeled clementines? Check. Twix ice cream bars? Check. More beef jerkies than you knew existed? Check. You can also just buy beers and snacks and have them right here.

I recently stayed across the street at the Hilton, so this deli was quite convenient to pick up up a quick breakfast.  They have a wonderful selection of fresh fruit and berries and delicious bagels, coffee and teas.  
I also went there for a quick dinner, and I was pleasantly surprised to find a wonderful array of healthy vegetarian dishes;  sauteed greens, sauteed portobello mushrooms, caprese salad, and many other salads.  It made it easy for me to eat healthy while away from home.
Unlike some of the older reviews of this establishment, I found this deli to be clean and very nice inside.  No sandwich nazi to be found.  
I recommend this place for anyone who is a vegetarian or just wants to eat healthy food.

I used to love this place when I came to New York for an annual industry trade show, but on this latest trip I found the food to be a bit lacking in the tasty department -- which of course might be related to my choice of sandwich more than anything else. Taste aside, if you're staying at the Hilton and in need of just about any sort of quick food you can imagine, then this deli is for you. Or if you're like me, you'll wish you just went back to the halal cart on the corner.

I believe this is a case of an establishment getting a "B" rating and then attempting to improve things.  I really did not notice anything being "dirty" as a previous reviewer suggested.  It was well kept and neat on the 3 occasions I was there.  The service was also good and they sell Boar's Head cold cuts on their sandwiches at VERY reasonable prices.  Their Ruben was very good, as was their Italian Sub.

This is a true NYC deli, very fast paced.  If your ordering from the counter be ready with what you want or they just skip you.  I have eaten there twice, first I had a Hot Pastrami...  This was great!  It didn't say it had Jalaeno's on it on the menu, so I was a little surprised.  But it really made the sandwhich!  Second time I decided to try breakfast, which was an egg sandwhich with bacon, and cheese on a roll.  Which started off good until I got towards the end and found that the last strip of bacon wasn't cooked all the way.  Yuck, appetite gone.  Sometimes too much speed is a bad thing.  So I am 50/50 on this place.
There is nothing special about the food here. Just run-of-the-mill deli food. The hot buffet food is not made with any interesting spices.
Quick lunch before catching cab to airport. Really good salad from make-your-own bar and really good sandwich.
Kind of a greasy-food place, but it's very close to my job and they have a large selection. Importantly, they sell 5-Hour Energy shots.

Muenster cheese is not a substitute for fresh mozzarella I'm sorry. I was really famished and looking forward to the Balsamic chicken wrap as described but I guess they need an Italian behind the counter to teach them which vinegar or cheese is what. Not balsamic, not fresh mozz.
Great selection. Open 24 hrs. Panini sandwiches are great. Things are pricey here. It's like a convenient store w/ extras

Its dort of lije the Joans on 3rd in LA in that it has everything. The big review goes for such a huge variety of selfserve  comfort food like;  Orange chicken, marinated avocado and heirloom toms, balsamic lime and honey dressing. Baked ziti , creamed spinach with aged cheddar. .only disappointment was the Reuben panini. .it could have used a specialty mustard perhaps.... I tasted 7 items and can't wait to go back to taste the other 200 or so. A real find if you are not qite sure what you want.

Grabbed a turkey sandwich here before getting on the LimoLiner to Boston. Fresh ingredients, good bread, imaginative toppings. Plus a good cookie to top it off at a reasonable price. Manhattan has lots of Delis- this one is worth visiting.

This place had everything! Which, considering I was traveling with a diverse group, was important because it meant everyone could find something they liked. I tried a number of the items on the hot buffet, as well as some sushi a friend got, and everything was tasty. Would definitely go back again.

Best pizza you can find in midtown for unbeatable price. I came here as a broke fordham student and it is still my favorite til this day. Very crunchy crust and reasonable cheese to tomato ratio!

Come with cash!

This was an amazing must stop. The pizza was the definition of NY pizza! This place also takes cash only which may be a turn off for some but is plus to me in this case. The wait was about 5 min to order and 5 min for fresh hot pizza.

The prices are great and unbeatable in this overpriced city 10/10 would return! The only negatives for me would be the place could be a lot cleaner sanitation wise, the fact I didn't receive my change and the line to place your order was really disorganized.

Just down the street from our hotel, 99 Cent Fresh Pizza serves pizza by the slice for a fantastic price. $1 will get you a slice with toppings added for an extra $0.25. I recommend getting a topping because your pizza slice will be baked a second time with the toppings to get a wonderfully crisp crust. The staff was friendly and service was super fast. This might not be the best pizza in Manhattan, but it's very good for the price.

You can check out more of our experience in our travel video: youtu.be/h3Nop7qaKqs

Amazing cheese pizza for 99 cent! What a steal. I went to visit while visiting Times Square and decided to check out pizza spots whilst in the area. Upon arriving, this place had a long lineup and joined in.

Cheese Pizza: Super fresh and great for the price point. No complaints. They only take cash so make sure to bring that.

It's a must visit spot whenever you're in NYC, and looking for a quick bite to eat. The place is more of a takeout place with no actual seating.
I kept seeing a fat line out the door here so I decided to try it. A whole cheese PIE was only EIGHT DOLLARS! So good! I highly recommend.

Literally $1. Cash Only! Just hand them cash, they give you change and a slice of pizza. Turn cash to food

$1 = cheese
$1.5 = pepperoni
$2 = specialty topping pizzas

Cheese pizza is great! Don't be expecting the best pizza of your life, but it won't be disgusting either. Plenty of oil to satisfy you, and the crust is still hot and crunchy. The line at this place moves quickly, but I was lucky to come when they were not too busy. Where else can you buy legit food for $1? Almost nowhere else in the US. I'm very satisfied with what you get for literally $1, when people easily pay $20 for something that's tastes worse, that won't fill you up.

Come hungry without the highest expectations, and you'll be very satisfied.
Best pizza at the best price! Fast and so so so good! Willing to move to New York just for this pizza
True 99¢ Pizza slice! Great taste, and the hot sauce makes it that much better!  Super fast service, and lots of fun people in line to talk to.

NOT $1 slice. I repeat NOT $1 slice.

No one would ever argue about $1 for a slice of pizza but if it isn't $1, you shouldn't advertise it as such. I would have been fine with the extra what 25 cents, 50 cents if they had just advertised it. Because truth be told I was hungry and I would have bought it anyway.

But to false advertise as $1 pizza when it's not. Gave him a $20, received $17 back.

Shame on me once.

Coming here later in the night at least an hr before they are set to close, I wasn't expecting much. But cold pizza slices when the oven is literally right behind you. Had I known the pizza slices were cold I would have told him to heat it up.

Their only saving grace is that they are open real late in an area that often has limited or no late night food presence.

And from others reviews, it isn't the first time this business has charged more for other things while advertising a different price.

NOT a fan.

99 cents pizza is one of the most popular $1 slice restaurants in New York. This pizzeria is known for its extremely cheap prices and has one of the best deals that anyone can get in the city. For just $3, you can get two slices of pizza and a drink.

Not only is the price unbeatable, but 99 cents pizza also offers shakers with various toppings such as oregano, parmesan cheese, chili flakes, and hot sauce. These shakers allow customers to customize their pizza to their liking and add a little extra flavor to their slice.

Despite the low price, the quality of the pizza is surprisingly good. The crust is crispy and the sauce and cheese are of decent quality. For the price, it is quite impressive how tasty the pizza is.

Overall, 99 cents pizza is a great option for anyone looking for a cheap and quick bite to eat. The quality of the pizza may not be gourmet, but it is still satisfying and enjoyable, especially for the price
What's to say about $3 for 2 slices and a water? Just so affordable and pretty decent pizza. Probably the best deal in NY and fast.

Yes yes and yes. Bring cash because they do not take card. There is an atm inside but who wants to agree to a $3 service charge when the pizza is a buck?

Thin crust, New York style and pipping hot! Need I say more?

Honestly, you can't beat the price of this place. We got this as a little late afternoon snack and it was the perfect thing to satisfy your cravings. I didn't expect much since it's such a small store but it still tasted fresh out of the oven. My only wish was that they put a bit more sauce...however for 1 dollar this is a great find.

It was late night NYE and obviously everyone was craving for some late night pizza. The line was very long and since pizza churn out was incredibly fast, we realistically only had choice between pepperoni and cheese.

I mean... for 99 cent... I really didn't expect much, but it tastes about as good as a frozen pizza. But did it satiate my craving? Yes to a certain amount, which is why I gave it a 3 star.

But it does not compare to joes pizza or scarrs

So not technically 99¢, the basic cheese slices are actually $1.  Pretty big line so they must be doing something right.  Very no frills, but gotta keep costs down, right?

Cheese Slice: Adequate.  It did have a crispy bottom, but the dough seemed a bit fluffier than normal pizza, almost bread like.  The sauce was extremely skimpy; barely saw it or tasted it.  The cheese was fine, not overly generous portion but not too skimpy.  And the slice itself was smaller than a regular slice.  You can't get much for $1 nowadays, so that's something.  But if you splurge on a $3 or $4 slice elsewhere, it will probably taste better.

5 star pizza.. 1 star ethics. The previous reviews about them pretending you owe more are true! I'm glad the Yelp community prepared me to push back!

I got a slice of cheese pizza with a bottle of water. It rang up on the register as $2, I gave a $5 and he gave me $2.25 back. I said, I'm supposed to get $3 back (I was planning on tipping a dollar but because of this that was a big fat nope). He pushed back and said, "It's $2.75 for your meal." I said, "No, it's $2.75 for 2 slices and a drink.. I got one slice." He finally gave me the correct change back.

That's bad business right there.

However, the pizza was incredible!! They only accept cash. There is an ATM machine in there. I'd still recommend going, just don't let them take advantage of you or anyone else in the line if you want to be a Good Samaritan!

2 slices and a water/soda for $2.75! What a deal! Pizza was tasty and they offer oregano, red pepper flakes, pepper, and parmesan. Even had a good choice of drinks. Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area and want a slice.

Bomb. I got a cheese slice for ONLY A DOLLAR! You'd think that the pizza would be sketchy considering the price, especially with the small storefront and lack of reheating, but no, it was delicious. Somehow the pizza crust was still crispy, which I love, and it was super cheesy. I do wish they reheated it for the sake of more melted of a cheese texture but I didn't try to ask, so I don't know if it's an option.

It's cheap, it's comforting, it's open late. Perfect combo for pizza :)
Affordable, quick, and tasty! Cash only, but $3 goes a long way. Slices weren't incredibly large, but were worth it. Line moves fast, and if you want authentic NYC pizza, check it out.

Not too bad. Thin crust tasty cheese pizza definitely 99c. Toppings would cost $1.75 but is worth for the taste. The pizza turnover so high any slice is fresh usually. The deals are pretty good too, $2.50 for 2 slices and a drink. Perfect

Don't let this place fool you. They are out there to make a quick buck.

We were drawn in by the 99 cent sign. Knowing that only cheese would be that price.... But boy were we wrong.  

There are posted menus with prices outside and inside. They all state that cheese is 1 dollar. One toppings is 1.75. And specialties are 2.50.  

After ordering and getting our pizza. They over charged us by a lot. What should have been 12.25 order was 18. When we questioned it they said "we haven't updated the signs, slices are 4 now."  They had another family arguing about the prices too.

Not only are they lying to get people in the door, the math doesn't add up to the price they stated.

To top it all off the pizza wasn't that good. Lacked flavor. And the service was very rude.

DO NOT RECOMMEND. There are plenty of better options out there

The pizza is actually $.99 a slice for cheese only. There was a line, but it went pretty fast. Getting a whole pie is not too expensive. We got pepperoni with half pineapple and it was delicious. I loved the crunchy bottom crust.
Fast and good pizza for the price! It only took about 3 minutes for the pizza so pretty quick service! And it's almost in the middle of Times Square so the ambience is pretty wild . 7/10

Arrive late. Ice cold. We're at a hotel so can't reheat. Understand it'll get a little cold during delivery but ice cold? No thank you. Read the negative reviews about too little sauce so requested extra sauce.  No sauce on pizza or on the side was provided. I would have paid extra. Now I know what the others meant. Their pizza doesn't stand on its own at all without sauce.  Especially cold. No napkins, no red pepper flakes, no parmigiana cheese.  No updates on status. No notification it had arrived like DoorDash or grubhub

So many better pizza places in the city. Skip this one.

A quintessential NYC experience! Stopped here after a run in Central Park & got a slice of dollar pizza. Not the stereotypical extra crispy NY slice, but very enjoyable nonetheless! Make sure to bring cash, because they don't accept any other form of payment! What can you expect out of a dollar pizza slice? A fluffy yet chewy crust with a light crisp, topped with a sweet tomato-y sauce that was much better than I would've expected, and a good cheese ratio that isn't oozing over the edges every time you take a bite. This was a very pleasant experience, and when you consider what it costs, I don't know how you can be anything but satisfied. It may not be the best slice of pizza you'll ever have, but it's far better than many other pizza places that charge far more. I'd highly recommend a stop here if you're looking for a quick & cheap bite to eat!

Is there more to say than $1 for a slice of cheese pizza? It was so crispy and delicious. I ordered the pepperoni so it's 75 cents more for a topping, but still so cheap! Quick service and open late. Def will go back.

FYI - cash only.

Can't argue with the price point, but our first pizza experience in NYC was definitely a miss. We came here around 2:45am after a long Friday night out at bars. 99 Cent Fresh Pizza was located right next to our hotel, so it was super convenient. We had walked past this place a couple times earlier and noticed there was always a line. While I'm happy I checked it out, I would not really recommend eating here. My friend didn't even feel comfortable finishing the piece that he ordered. That said, it is cool that this spot stays open so late. I'm not sure how many other food options are available in the immediate area around 3am.

I'll BeReal, phone did not eat first!! But this pizza was everything I could've asked for after walking around nyc for 20k steps and lying for overpriced bagels and pastries all day. The staff was friendly and quick with getting us our order. The most basic cheese pizza was $1 but if you wanted certain toppings, the price increased slightly. They also had deals for 2 slices and a drink. I would definitely recommend this spot for anyone exploring nyc who wants the authentic late night dollar pizza experience
This place is great! Popular for locals and tourists! Food was fresh and cheap. This can't be beat.
What others said, better than it should be by far. 3 bucks at 2 am on the way home from bars and the flavor, crust and ratios are all correct. Can't beat that
Crazy enough and hard to believe but my husband voted this place one of the best pizzas that he tried in New York. $3 for 2 slices and a soda

$1 slice, you really can't go wrong. Crust is pretty thin, pizzas are cooked fresh by a one-man team, and service is speedy.

Small inside space. No bathrooms. Cash only.

Truly very little pizzas compare to the value and deliciousness that 99 cent fresh pizza has to offer.

There are many of these babies sprinkled throughout Manhattan and we were fortunate enough to have this near our hotel at Conrad Midtown on our way to Central Park.

God was shining down on us when we visited as we only had one guest ahead of us. The moment we blinked, we found that about ten more people lined up behind us. Guess the secret's out and everybody wants a slice, you feel me?

The place is absolutely no frills. You pick your slice (or pie) and whatever toppings you want, you pay, they heat up that baby for you, and you enjoy.

It's standing room only in this little joint and you'd best be prepared to be shoulder to shoulder if you're trying to enjoy your slice in here. They have condiments on the walls of the place and nobody's judging you for how many red pepper flakes and Parmesan cheese you load up on there, but with how delicious these slices are you may not even need to overcompensate.

Seriously, they're just that good.
They say you've never had a pizza until you've had a New York slice. Well baby, from one anti pizza lover to the next, I'm officially converted and can't wait to come back for more.

(14/100--2022)

The pizza here is quite good.  Two slices and a soda for 2.75.  

Other noted this too, they overcharged me, I got two of these specials so it was 5.50.   I gave them a 10 and got 4 back.   6.00.   Don't be afraid to correct them and they will honor it

So they make good pizza but are dishonest.
Pretty good pizza and very inexpensive! Cash only place. The local on the side of the street told us about this place. If your looking for something quick and cheap, this is it!

Good pizza. Quick service. No where to eat in. Basically a Togo place but if you're out and about moving around it's perfect. If you just get cheese it's quick. If you order any kind of topping it may take a while.

What is better than a $1 slice of pizza when you're craving it in the summer? It's cheap, inviting, and satisfies your hunger.

I'd come here if I was drunk af, craving pizza and am in the area again.
For 99  cents it's steal for authentic  New York pizza . Crust crisp, sufficient cheese and  the  is just right !!!  I usually get two and it hits the  spot !!!!!!

5 stars for flavor, price, freshness, speed and consistency. We've been in New York for 3 days and have eaten here 5 times. It was breakfast today. Place is usually packed but the line moves quick. Cash only and make sure they charge you correctly. Seems like depending on who is working, they charge different prices. Also, don't plan on sitting down to eat here. This is a grab and go type place.

This pizza is delicious. One dollar for cheese slice, 8 dollars for a whole cheese pizza (it's a large pie) it's 1.50 for one topping slices. The cheese pizza is excellent. I would recommend this place for sure.

Can't beat the value and quality of this pizza. It was always the perfect "hold me over" option for us. We'd have brunches and dinners but needed something in between or as a nightcap. We took advantage of this and went here. 2 slices and a soda were perfect to take back to our hotel and watch some Netflix.

One of the last remaining dollar slice shops in the city. Fast service, accepts card for orders over five dollars. Huge, classic New York style slices, with thin, crispy (but not crunchy) crusts. It's greasy, but in the way you want and expect a dollar slice to be. Great location as well-- between Penn and Times, and across the street from a public plaza you can eat at. There's no seating at the restaurant itself, but the tiny shop is how I imagine they're able to keep prices low.
Perfect for a late night snack while roaming the city. Excellent crust that holds the sauce and cheese very well. Cheap.

Pizza here is decent. I don't think it is the greatest ingredients, but can't really complain when the price is dirt cheap compared to other pizza places. This is good if you are looking for some late night food and are on a budget.

I have to say I was pretty skeptical when I heard that I could get 99 cent pizza in New York. I was pleasantly surprised with how good this pizza was for the price point. The workers here do not mess around; they churn out fresh baked pizza as customers order. Every slice is fresh.

I really liked that the crust was not too thick. There was a good amount of cheese over the entire slice. AND you can add chili flakes, pepper, or garlic powder while you're there. Highly recommend adding chili flakes and garlic powder. It really kicks the plain cheese pizza up a notch.

You're gettin what you payed for. Nothing spectacular nothing awful.

If you're in the area I would get it due to the price, business hours, etc.

Let me start with the disclaimer that I am NOT the target demographic for this establishment, aka I do not normally frequent late-night pizza joints. But after a night out with other people, I found myself here. The pizza really was $1 a slice (we paid in cash) for the basic cheese (and as my friend said, at places like this, you just get the cheese pizza -- it moves the fastest and is the freshest). The taste was not that good compared to standard NYC cheese pizza. The dough is bready, thick almost like a focaccia, and the cheese doesn't have much flavor (though they do have chili flakes and various sauces you can add on the side). But maybe I have too high expectations for late-night pizza after the club. Thank you for coming to my TED Talk.

The pizza here is fine, but I have to bump this review down because they tried to charge us $2 for the "99 cent" slice of cheese pizza! I paid with a 10, and only got $8 back in change. Almost didn't say anything, but when I asked if it should've be $9 in change, the guy at the register didn't say a word and just handed me another dollar!? Made it seem like they were hoping I just wouldn't notice....

Anyway, the pizza itself was standard, sauce was tasty and the slice was fresh and thin. The experience though was certainly sub-par, so may go to a different location from now on

I've tried a lot of dollar slices in New York, and I've got to say 99 cent fresh pizza gets the crown. I mean, how can you not like this place? You might not be able to find a bag of chips or a bottle of water these days for $1, but you can get a hot, freshly made slice here for $1! Is it going to be the best slice you've ever had? Probably not. But when you factor in the fact that it only sets you back $1, it's pretty amazing.

The pizza is has the right amount of tasty cheese, the crust has the right balance of fluffy chewiness and crispiness. It's everything I want for a quick snack. And again, it's $1. So you have to ask yourself, do you have room for a slice of pizza? Probably yes. Do you have $1? Yes. Then 99 cent fresh pizza is for you!

What a great place, please don't change.

Pizza definitely hit the spot  cheesy gooey, nice crust , open late and last but not least we all know I'm frugal the slices were a dollar no tax no nothing even all the beverages they had in cans in all were all only a dollar how could u go wrong they also had plenty of condiments to dress ur pizza  the way u like reminded me of home (Buffalo) no shade to nyc but we own the pizza  game and as far as chicken wings we can't be touched ijs!

This restaurant is a jewel of New York!! The ambiance is relaxingly nostalgic, and the food is consistently good. I've ordered the same dish dozens of times on various days, and they have it dialed in. The staff is very attentive and genuinely courteous, but the main draw is the owners who are there to ensure a memorable experience.

We did not have dinner here! This review is just for the service and cannoli.

We were walking around Brooklyn waiting to go to a friends so we stopped in for a beverage and were inspired to get a cannoli.

We were helped by Julia, and she was so sweet. We then got a cannoli and it was so freakin delicious. I moved away from NY about 7 years ago and boy have I missed a good cannoli. It was very satisfying. We just had our normal mixed beverages. From what we saw other people eating, their food looked delicious.

It's been quite a while since my last visit figured it was time for an update!
After walking around the area we wanted to
Grab some food & decided to come here, since it was a nice night we sat outside.
Once seated we grab some Moretti beer good beer, nice taste.
They start u off w some bread & butter not bad , appetizer we tried the Burrata & tomato this was very good , great tasting burrata.
Main dish I had the Sautéed boneless chicken minus the mushrooms, this was good nice taste to the chicken came w some veggies & potatoes decent overall. Hubby had the Spaghetti & meatballs this was ok, meatballs kinda tasted like they are frozen, spaghetti was not bad.
They have a nice set up for outside dinning, inside u get that old world classic feel , service was good, menu is pretty limited.
Price wise it's not terrible, doable we had a decent meal.

What a lovely evening at Old Fulton Restaurant! Julia made us feel welcomed and started the evening with the best French Martini's. I had the salmon Dijon with capers and vegetables! Perfection! My friend had Linguine with white clam sauce and the smell of garlic and wine made my mouth water. The ambiance inside and outside is beautiful! Love the portrait on the back wall with the waterfall! The Tiramisu keeps me hooked! I could not think of a better place to enjoy with my friend! Julia thank you for just being a warm, caring host with real martini skills

Fantastic! We stopped in for some dinner after taking the Ferry to Dumbo and were NOT disappointed. The ambiance (we sat on the beautiful patio), the service, and the food was excellent. We had the Vodka Sauce with gluten free noodles, mussels, and tri-color salad. All was to die for! And the bread is wonderful. A must-try in Downtown BK!
PS: we brought our dog and they gave her water and were very kind.

Where do I start , Very clean , nice location , good space. The food was a little on the no flavor side. They are high priced. Heard a lot of people telling me the lady is really rude at times, But I don't know how true that is. For a nice cup of wine I wouldn't mind coming here but maybe not for the food.

Came here recently with my s/o. Thought it was a little suspicious that it wasn't packed, even tho the area has high foot traffic. Even though it was a hot day, there was barely any air-conditioned/cool air circulating the establishment so my s/o and I just tried to make due -- ate as fast as we could and pay so we could leave.

The food was very subpar and underwhelming, we only ordered a mozzarella caprese appetizer which was meh and the entree was a seafood pasta. It definitely had an off smell to it, but I thought it was just my imagination. Thankfully it was not a big portion and most likely it was the clams that came in the dish that were either not washed properly or foul. Again, thankfully it wasn't a lot of clams.

Post meal my stomach definitely did not agree with the meal and I have been having frequent soft & liquid bowel movements aka diarrhea. Thanks 7 Old Fulton! I'll definitely come back again if I am in need of some help in the bathroom.

Excellent food, excellent service, the best Italiano ever.
We eat at this place every time we visit New York, and we will be there for lunch tomorrow....

We had a lovely time here during a weekday lunch. We were the only ones sitting outside and felt like we had the whole place to ourselves. The staff was friendly and attentive. We tried their clams and mussels as an appetizer. The flavors were great, but the mussels were on the small side. I also wish they gave you more bread since the sauce was so yummy. The pizza came with a generous portion of arugula. It's not thin crust, so adjust your expectations accordingly. It was a good size to share. We ordered two pizzas for three people. This was a great place to recharge after walking around the park.

DO NOT COME HERE - FOUL

My girlfriend and I came here for lunch on a sunny lovely weekend when the place should have been packed but it was soon clear why it was empty. The front door was closed and when we stopped to look at the menu outside, a woman who I assume is the owner or one of them came out and looked at us and asked if we wanted something. I asked if they were open to which she said yes as if I had inconvenienced her.

Against our better judgment we came in and were seated at a dirty table next to, as another reviewer mentioned, a fish tank that usually has meat in it?? The owner woman was very rude and there was only one other party there - another red flag. I ordered an old fashioned and she ordered an Aperol spritz, two very simple drinks. The old fashioned was disgusting and what I can only assume was mop water and sour mix. The Aperol spritz was red and tasted like grenadine and water. I figured mine was a lost cause but I asked the owner woman if this was an Aperol spritz to which she said obviously and showed me a no-name bottle of red liquid which clearly was not Aperol and told me I didn't recognize it. Both drinks were disgusting so we abandoned them and I got a double Ketel One since I figured that would be hard to mess up (and to numb the pain), even that tasted off.

The food was a mess as well. The bread was dry and bland. Entrees took ages to come out and no one checked on us. My girlfriend ordered the lasagna which ended up being lasagna noodles with a couple tiny pieces of ground beef and a weak bit of sauce. Horrible. My linguine with clams was a wet mess of parmesan and what seemed like tap water with flavorless clams and overdone noodles.

This is the most disgusting place I have ever eaten, with attitudes to match. I wanted to warn the group who came in as we were leaving but lucky I didn't, as they seemed to be family of the owners.

NEVER COME HERE. Absolutely heinous.

If u like water this is the place to be, btw it's warm tap water w no ice wth. We went July fourth, only restaurant open w availability. Looked nice so after looking outside menu thght prices weren't bad for NYC. Waiters were fighting n not smiling. Took 20 min for my beer wth. Wasn't that busy. Like I said warm water. Three of us we ordered calamari appetizer. Not bad n nice portion. I had calamari clams mussels fusilli. What fusilli not even quarter lb. come on restaurants u get that fr 99 cents. Pour it on. Fish was plentiful n tasty. One person had brazino. Tasty btw extremely bony. Got caught in her tooth. Asked waiter for toothpicks. Five min later he asked for picks back. Another customer wanted them. What no other picks in house. Third person had shanks rice said delicious.  Bill came xtra six dollar charge why credit card fee. Is this legal. Haha I paid cash after reading other charges of being overpd. Julia unacceptable against the law to change a bill. While we are waiting mops of people using restroom bc of fireworks. Hello sign says for customers only. Enforce it there was security. It's pandemic. Let them use shake shack. One woman used men's room. No wonder staff was fighting.
Near closing waiter said I need you to pay n standing over us. I paid promptly then he allowed us to stay thirty min more wth. I'm dying for water w ice that's not tap water where can I get it PLEASE HELP ME., WILL I BE BACK IDK MY FOOD WAS TASTY BUT SERVICE LACKS. HOW LONG TO DRAW A BEER TWENTY MINUTES!

While I have not eaten here for brunch, lunch or dinner (but always wanted to), an accidental stumble at this venue was cause for a good time.

7 Old Fulton, like other businesses (and since it is summertime) has set up an adorable floral oasis outside their restaurant.  We felt very comfortable, choosing our own table (actually secluded) and enjoying the visual/pretty display of their garden patio.

Service was attentive (staff in masks; water glasses always refilled) and keep in mind, food must always accompany a drink order.
Not feeling too ravenous, we both chose the crab cake appetizer. A very delicious Rose accompanied mine while my friend ordered the Mint Julep (singing its praises).

The crab cake, just one and at $14, was small but tasty and accompanied by a side Mesclun salad which had a nice citrus like dressing. Selections from the menu was limited.
The Rose was very, very good. I was tempted to ask for the brand and snap a photo to look it up.

All in all, this place served as the perfect venue to catch up and enjoy the gorgeous sights that DUMBO has to offer.
I'm not sure how to rate an establishment based on a first time, no proper meal visit, but when you check off all the boxes---good appetizer/drink, being in the company of a wonderful friend and a calming visually gorgeous atmosphere, I'd have to say that that means a lot and merits the 4 stars I've given it.

To me, it does.
Try it before the cold weather sets in.

Came here for lunch with coworkers and all of us were disappointed. The burger was not bad but my friends Mediterranean salad was all iceberg lettuce, 3 tomatoes and 3 olives. It was the worst salad and not worth $13. Ceasar salad with grilled chicken was very bland and flavorless, and the chicken had way too much pepper.

This is my second time coming to 7 Old Fulton Restaurant . This time , I bring my family to celebrate my 91 years old mother's birthday!  My mother has a wonderful time . She loves the charming Italian vibes , and the amazingly delicious high quality food .
Food:
-Tomahawk steak, tender with a rich buttery flavor , perfectly cooked ( again , as I mentioned previously in my first review-- it is so much better than some of the so called famous steakhouse!!) .  
Absolutely splendid pairing with a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon
-Lamb shank extremely juicy and tender
- mussels and clams : The well balanced sweetness, acidity, and Umami tomato sauce accentuate the flavor of the mussels and clams ( we asked for more bread to finish the sauce!)
-beef Lasagna: Believe it, this beef lasagna is A-m-a-z-i-n-g!
-Grilled salmon DiJon:this is probably some of the most delicious salmon I've ever had ! The Dijon mushroom sauce tasted so flavorful.
-Crab cake : my sister and my mom call it the "Best-Ever crab cake"
- Barrata Mozzarella : My favorite! The Burrata Mozzarella with prosciutto Di Parma paired with a glass of cool Moscato ,Ooh-la-la !!
Service: Julia and her staffs are extremely friendly and attentive .
My mother and my family really have a delightful time because of you guys. I could not be more thankful of your hospitality . Mom has a wonderful birthday!  Love you guys
Food was okay, service was okay: I expected more for being a traditional Italian restaurant
This was a great spot! We had an amazing time and some delicious food at the bar with Julia. We grew up in New York but couldn't ask for a better place with better bread!

Mal servicio. El restaurante no estaba lleno. Habían meseros suficientes, por lo tanto no se explica la mala atención. Tuve que levantarme a buscar al mesero, y nuevamente para pedir la cuenta. 0% propina.

This place looks cute on the outside and everywhere else had a line. That should've been our red flag but we went in anyway. To start the bread was pale, and tough and was given after our appetizer came. Then my $28 chicken entree came. It was a thin fried cutlet with a half a handful of arugula. That was it. My friends $22 pasta dish was the size of a lean cuisine. The portions and prices were a joke!!! I wouldve rather made a mean out of gas station food. The only person at the table with a decent portion got a burger and fries and felt so bad for us starving he shared his fries with us and they were awful too! All to sit next to a George Washington painting and a fish-tank full of meat. What on earth!? I had to order another beer just to fill me more. Please don't go here. We left starving and mad!

We were walking around dumbo and wanted a quick bite to share before we biked back to Manhattan. This place was open, friendly, and ushered us quickly to a seat on their adorable patio.

Bread and butter were good, food was DELICIOUS! Pasta was al dente.

Nice ambiance drew us to this restaurant, and we enjoyed our meal here. The manager came around and asked us how things were, and she was a lovely old lady. The waiters are a bit quiet and perhaps introverted, but they were nice and helpful to us with the menu. They were also very speedy about refilling our waters. Food was well cooked and filling - the lamb shank was tender, and the pork tenderloin was very juicy.

Look, I get that restaurants have a lot to improve on and I have no doubt there were bad experiences here. But I genuinely believe that the point is for businesses to read these, improve, and do better. And I'm thankful we had a pleasant visit here and we hope they keep up the good work!
This is a Beautiful place. The staff was very friendly.I had the Lamb Shank was extremely juicy and tender it was yummy.

I feel terrible giving any bad reviews during covid. But this place is pretty horrible and the attitude of it is very weird and off-putting. The first interaction, I was in the area because my friend works around the corner and he wanted to get me a belated birthday lunch. We had pizza a few doors down at Grimaldi's and we were looking for desert and a cocktail. We inquired with whoever was standing out near the entrance and he was like "well no, we can't get you drinks", rather rudely. "But what if we ordered deserts with our drinks?" "No, you'd have to order either entrees or appetizers." "We just ate actually but we were looking for desert and drinks since its her birthday, but thanks!" So that transpired.

Stupidly we decided to come back the following week for lunch when I needed to pick up keys to watch my friend's cats. I think we were sold on the margarita sign. Never get suckered in with signs. We sat down to a nice area. Though it was windy and whatever cotton seed plants were nearby kept getting into our food and drinks. I ordered a mango margarita and my friend got a mint julep. Both of the drinks were non-drinkable. It didn't taste like mango. It tasted like lemon dish soap and just an over-pour of tequila to try and compensate the horrid tastes going on. I have no idea who bartends but they don't know how to make a mixed drink. I've actually never sent a drink back in my life but my friend insisted and we switched to beers.

Don't worry . . . . it gets worse. I thought if the drinks were bad the food has to more than make up for it. Boy was I wrong. The best part honestly were the french fries. I like that they give you the option of sweet potato and regular both together. Although, they were actually a bit soggy. The sandwiches (which are hard to eff up) were both incredibly bland. Thin layers of prosciutto and mozz slapped on a dried out stale hunk of baguette with no flavor, no dressing. The steak sandwich he got since we swapped halves and I got to try both was equally as bad. Half of the portion of steak had chunks of inedible fat grizzle, again no sauce or flavor on a stale baguette. The best part of the entire meal were the mushrooms from the steak sandwich and my over-priced Brooklyn lager. Service was friendlier this time around. I guess that only happens if you're buying an entree. But there are some serious kinks that need to be worked on. From glancing at other reviews, I'm definitely not the only local that feels this way.

I had a wonderful time celebrating my birthday at 7 Old Fulton. Julia and family were extremely accommodating to my party of 11, and made this first timer feel like I was at home! The food was extremely delicious, and made fresh. The red sangria was amazing. Great hospitality and lovely people. I will definitely be back again. Thank you for everything!!

Terrible . Went here on Saturday 1/28/23 for dinner at about 5:30 . We walked around DUMBO looking for place for dinner and couldnt find anywhere that didnt have a long wait .  This place was empty , no surprise . The food was terrible and cold and the menu was very limited . At exactly the same time my companion and I noticed a strong scent of marijuana only to realize it was no doubt coming from the kitchen . Stay away from this place . It was empty on a busy Saturday night for a reason

The ONLY reason they got 2 stars was because the staff was really nice.

Burgers were like frozen patties.. dry and overpriced.

Cheese ravioli was maybe a 4 out of 10

Drinks = TRASH! We got watermelon, mango, strawberry, 2 pina coladas and a mai tai..... the only decent were the pinas

The best thing here were the fries and TAP WATER

..... if you have any tastebuds left after covid don't destroy them by eating here

I've been coming to this place for 2 years now, and it's all you can ask for a nice bar, restaurant with a TV, and an outstanding, and amazing  patio. The outside it's beautifully decorated with flowers and it's smells Amazing.

The food was great and not pricy at all. I had fried calamari to begin with and then I had Salmon dijon which was delicious.

Our visit during COVID was fantastic. We went for lunch and was seated promptly outdoor which was a beautiful bright floral set up. Ordered the steak medium and seafood linguini. The steak was superb, absolute deliciousness if cooked medium. The pasta was a bit salty and al Dante - wish it was cooked a bit longer. Good experience with awesome street view.
Update: so I get a message at midnight from someone named Julia U. Is this how this place operates? Sending DMs instead of publicly responding to my review? Will NEVER go back.

Worst service I experienced even wrote it on the receipt.
So I ordered a fruit salad and lamb shank and moscato.
My daughter ordered calamari and beef lasagna
My sister ordered crab cake and cosmo. She wanted to see how  big the crab cake before ordered more.

We got the appetizer but no drinks.
They took our menu.

Almost an hour went by no drink. My sister had to remind the waiter of her drink.

Then we realize no entrees.

When ask the waiter claim he thought we didn't want anything.  Red flags should have been when they took our menu.

I ask for the bill. I was charge for the moscato.
Try to speak with the manager, she was even worst.
Treat me as if I was begging for food.

I have been to many restaurants including vegas and montreal and never been treated like a subhuman being before.
Highly recommended for food(traditional farm/home cooking style), service is good, decor is historical for 40 years old restaurant. We had a very nice meal and evening.
I come here all the time for the friendly staff, the tasty food and the great views.  What else could I want?
Great food, attentive service, small but good ambiance. Would definitely eat there again.

The service was good but The food was mediocre. The calamari was stale. The Greek salad was ok. I had the ravioli which was pretty decent. The drinks were pretty good. I liked the decor as well. It started getting busy around 8:30 ish. I feel it would be more popular if they redo the menu .

Did not like this place at all. My noodles were super hard and I had a hair on my shrimp. And when I notified the waiter he said "ok want a new one?"  ‍

What does that tell you about a place?

I gave one extra star because the lady waiter was very nice.

However the food?

spazzatura

Nice ambience, outdoor dining, scenery  is awesome, one block away from Brooklyn Bridge Park. Just amazing food, a Brooklyn treasure! Thank you for your hospitality and your attention! We love you guys!

Wonderful experience! Went for weekday lunch and had delicious appetizers and drinks. The atmosphere is really lovely with a very old school charming Italian vibe. The service was spectacular and the whole staff was very kind!
The atmosphere is very cozy. Astrit the bartender recommended me the pistachio martini it was very delicious. The staff is on point and very friendly. Definitely coming back.

If your looking for great cozy place to grab a bite, I recommend 7 old Fulton Delishhh.
And don't forget tto grab a drink or two. The bartender makes a divine Mai tai!

MY FIRST TIME THERE OMG! SERVICE WAS SUPERB! My mother. Sister and I were all accommodated gracefully. Both server & busser were delightful to speak with.

THE MENU : beautiful family photo of the owners on menu cover. I recognized & spoke with them in the restaurant! Julia, ah that's a timeless woman & her stylish husband is what keeps BROOKLYN'S food industry needing them!

We ordered the margherita pizza, (it was more than enough for us [6 slices] delicious. DELICIOUS! the wine was perfect, we ordered both white & red! (I prefer the white; my mom prefers red)

Our dinner was ready in literally 11mins.
ALL workers were taking the health code seriously! All had masks! For a few slices of pizza we took a pretty long time enjoying ourselves, laughing, enjoying life. 10/10 RECOMMEND! YOU MUST STOP BY & dine in, because god forbid the world ends, You know?
Anyway follow Me on ig: @kaymydear
Beautiful historic spot in the heart of Dumbo. Delicious authentic food. Handcrafted beautiful cocktails very professional staff.

This restaurant was so amazing.  What a beautiful place with outdoor seating with little white lights and a beautiful view of Brooklyn and just a gorgeous place inside and out.  Ravioli was so good!  The service was amazing and far exceeded our expectations.  Just a special place and I highly recommend it!  Can't wait to come back next time we visit New York.
They serve a good portion of steak good for 2 people.. ok world ambience.. a nice Italian place in dumbo.
Wonderful customer service. A nice getaway from the crowds. It's like visiting an old tavern. Wonderful bartender. Hospitable host. Lots of history on display.

How do you know if your in the right restraunt? It's simple when you walk in your greeted by a professional waiter and when seated you immediately feel at home.  

My wife and I are visiting from Los Angeles California wanted to take sunny day walk of the Brooklyn Bridge.  

Unlike other years we wanted to see what was underneath the bridge on the Brooklyn side. So we took the R Train to the Jay St - Metro Tech Station.  

We found our way to the Brooklyn Heights Promenade and truley enjoyed our walk towards the Brooklyn Bridge Lookout.

Walking east on Old Filton Street towards the Brooklyn Bridge entrance (Brooklyn side)  we passed by 7 Old Fulton restaurant.  

7 Old Fulton reminded me of the Italian restraunts I saw growing up in Chicago.  Being  from Los Angeles where there are very few traditional Italian restraunts, I knew that I had to at least try this one.

From the moment we entered to the moment that we left the service we received, the food that we were served, and the selection of desserts was absolutely fantastic.

Lastly,

How do you know that you are in a fantastic restaurant? Simple when they show you the dessert tray you can't select one desserts you select two!!

Thank you Jeemy for having us at your table and for providing us such great service.  You are a consummate professional.

Amazing drinks (especially the mulled wine!) Julia is the best - friendly, personable and makes great drinks! This place is so cozy and Christmas-y, I can't think of anywhere else I'd rather hang out this winter in New York :)

Had my first outdoor dining experience here since Covid started and I wish I would have just saved my money. The waiter was nice but took a while to take our order, however, almost all of their outdoor tables were occupied and they only had 2 servers working--I'm assuming because of Covid or something so I let it go. We ordered drinks and they were terrible! No alcohol in them whatsoever. I got a mango margarita and felt like I was drinking a slushee from an ice cream truck. Then when the food came out it was decent--nothing great. I was definitely not impressed by anything here and do not plan on eating here again. Wish I would have seen the reviews on here before deciding to walk into this place.

Horrible service. Went for an office lunch. Our food took 2 HOURS to come out. One of the waiters was extremely rude & disrespectful. Literally told us it is not his job to check our order as he is not a waiter but clearly waiting on tables. Several parties around us came and went. Half of our party got meals, dined and got their entrees packed to go before the other half received theirs. So some of us waited almost 3 hours. We have been here several times and had a great experience, not sure what happened this time. Never again. The rest of the staff was pleasant but 30-40 mins to get a menu and glass of water after being seated is insane. The only reason we waited the 2 hours was because we were a large party and trying to be considerate, although we had a reservation, and always have had a party that size and never that kind of service. Definitely will not be back.

DO NOT GO HERE --

From the moment we arrived, all the staff were unwelcoming, anxiety-inducing, and flat out obnoxious. I ordered an appetizer and the waiter kept getting defensive asking when I wanted it brought out. I said "bring it out whenever it's ready" and he rudely responded "that's not what I'm asking." I repeated myself and then he said "so you're just going to eat the calamari while everyone else just sits there hungry and watches you eat?" Also, the waiters kept pouring water for us, touching the neck of the bottles to all of our glasses, and then proceeded to the next table, making the same unsanitary and disgusting mistake. That is gross as it is, let alone during a GLOBAL PANDEMIC. Their customer service and interaction skills are atrocious. Because of this, I decided to tip 1 cent. A couple days later, I looked at my credit card statement and they had the audacity to charge me $11 for the tip. Also, not to mention, the food is average at best -- and severely overpriced. While it looks cute inside and outside (a flowery porch with outdoor seating), it is a complete tourist trap. 7 Old Fulton Restaurant in Dumbo should be embarrassed.

-- And no, this review is not an exaggeration.

yeah this was disgusting. the only thing that was good was the bread and butter. I ate maybe 5 bites of my pasta and asked for the check -- they didn't take the barely eaten meal off my tab but I really wasnt in the mood to care & my waiter was nice so I let it go. Def should've checked Yelp before going but i  was so hungry
Won't ever go back

I hate leaving bad reviews but I should have paid attention to the bad reviews about this restaurant! Although the indoor and outdoor seating are great, I did not like anything else about this place. I stopped by this restaurant after spending the day in Brooklyn and it wasn't too busy. We ordered our meals, and one hour later, the waiter came up to us and asked us if we had ordered yet. At that point, without ever getting our food, we decided to leave. I can't say anything about the food but the service is not worth coming here.

Came in here on a cold Saturday morning looking for a breakfast sandwich. The store is narrow but it has the basics--hydration of choice, snacks, a sandwich making area, and a few seats. The options were limited so I was skeptical, but was happy with the sandwiches I got! They have bagels and bread, no english muffins. Got a sausage egg and cheese and bacon egg and cheese, and both were what I expected. nothing fancy or memorable, but got the job done.

at $4.5 a sandwich, it was a steal in the UES. for fast service and good cheap food, it's a solid deli.

I need to update as I stopped by today. They are as sweet as ever. The cleanest spot. The kindest staff. The Covid friendliest. And today for the first time in my life I tried Colombian coffee. I heard it was stronger than normal coffee but leaves you without the anxiety and jitters the heavy stuff does. And they would be right. I need energy but caffeine makes me paranoid. So I keep experimenting with different coffees. I'm a new fan of Columbian coffee and luckily for me, I know just where to go. I recommend the small with French vanilla.

They also have an assortment of home cooked and delicious deli foods, desserts, and a smoothie bar. Order for delivery or better yet, stop in, so you can experience the good vibes first hand.

A large menu with pretty much everything you can think off. A big section devoted to avocado sandwiches too. Unfortunately, the chicken cutlet sandwich we ordered left much to be desired. The people ahead of us got a mango smoothie- which looked amazing.

Got chipotle chicken sandwich and falafel sandwich for $7 and they were both so delicious! Fast service and they both had such great flavor. Really enjoy the crispy on the outside and soft inside falafels mixed up with other things so it was a good mixture of everything in a mouthful (not just dry falafel). The white sauce went really well with it and the hot sauce def had a kick. Gonna try the other sandwiches!
I may have also been really hungry when I ate the sandwiches.

1st Ave Gourmet Deli @ the Corner of 90th Street.

Definitely a Five Star experience. The employees were so friendly and dressed professionally with their Boar's Head Caps.They sell Boar's Head so that's four stars right away! I took photos of the delicious displays. I scoped out a seat at the window to eat my second breakfast for the day!

I proceeded to ask the man behind the counter what the drill was to order. "Where do I order, as this is my first visit here" he said he takes my order while he was smiling at me. I asked what bread selections he had for a Bacon Egg and Cheese and he called off about seven! I figured I would have Rye today. He let me order exactly the way I wanted it prepared. He got my order exactly as I specified. I was amazed at the price for the sandwich and coffee! I'll definitely return for breakfast.

They have a lot more offerings. I am tempted by the Cheesecake! I saw muffins too. I took a lot of photos. I can't wait to go back! The cashier was a very nice smiling and friendly young lady. Everyone I spoke to made me feel welcome! Everyone wore masks as well as the customers. I felt comfortable there eating away from everyone else that was going in and out. I'll return for sure! You can call in advance to order and pick up also. I'm recommending!

Pretty nice new deli/bodega that was recently renovated and reopened duing the pandemic months in 2020.

Typical of these kind of spots, plenty of sandwich and breakfast items. Good in a pinch if you need some milk or household items.

So far I've only picked up some tea and coffee here,  but need to check out some eats soon.

Had an egg, ham and swiss on a hard roll.   Nothing special - but this store seems to have a lot to offer so that makes up for the lack of flavor and awards them at least 3 stars.   Wouldn't go out of my way to come here again though.

I love this place. Close to home and they never disappoint. I usually order breakfast from here but have also tried the cheeseburger and Mexican panini and both are delicious. They always honor what I write in the comments and call if they are out of stock with a specific item or have questions regarding my order. 10/10

Very clean and well stocked. I've been here several times and I'm surprised by one of the other reviews because I've never had anyone been rude to me. The food is okay an fresh only bone I have to pick is wit one of the cashiers she stuffs all the things you buy in a small bag. When I got home the sandwich became a little soggy because she has placed it under all the juices I got. I always get like 4 Snapple's ( don't judge me lol )

This place is great. I came here for the first time for a quick breakfast wrap. Bacon egg & cheese with a hash brown party inside. I've had this a million times but for whatever reason, this one just tastes so much better. It wasn't all mashed together. Every ingredient stood on its own. For something so simple but be done so well is appreciated. Checking out I saw they have a juice bar. Went back this afternoon to get a fresh green juice with beats. This is my new go to deli for sure.

Everyone in there is super friendly and fun to chat with.

Don't bother. This is about the most miserable group of workers I've seen gathered in one location. They're always something between flat and straight up rude. I've been here a half dozen times, and today was the last. Counter food and coffee is average, what you'd get in any deli. The staff ruins it, every time. Convenience to my workplace is no longer justification enough.
The coffee  is great  and I really appreciate the extra cream cheese on the everything bagel . The staff was friendly and pleasant , the great customer service here really makes them stand out!

If you asked me to review this place when they opened, I would have given it five stars. I've only seen this place gone down hill. Every time I try to order something, salad, no croutons or Parm cheese, sandwich, no grilled chicken, general things, no Red Bull, no White monster, no white claw, no popcorn, nothing. They NEVER have anything here. I don't know why I waste my time popping my head in because at this point I know I'd be lucky if they have dirt. Of the five years I've lived on the Upper East Side, this is the most massive disappointment by far. Fuck this place.

Was staying in a hotel close to this place, so stopped by to pick up a quick lunch. The sandwich I ordered ended up being incredibly dry. When I paid at the counter, the cashier was extremely terse for seemingly no reason. There's a million of these little delis in NY, one every corner. I'd go to a different one.

The food was 5 star!! We ordered the vegan chili fries and the grilled salmon. The chili fries were not over topped with chili and the chili wasn't too saucy. For us, this is perfect because we don't like soggy fries. The salmon was cooked to perfection. I requested to not have the chimichurri sauce because I prefer a naked salmon. It was divine. Then, there was the broccoli. The charred broccoli was the BEST broccoli I have ever had. Ever. It was so good I ordered a second side of it.
The only reason I did not give a 5 star review was because of the lack of friendliness with the staff. The hostess appeared put out by us. The server was totally disengaged no matter how hard we tried to dialogue with him.
Despite the service, the food is worth going for. You will also love the ambiance whether you chose to sit inside or out.

Good restaurant for family. Burgers, sandwiches, fries and milkshakes. Everyone can have something.

Nice setup. Lots tables (indoor and outdoor). Overall the food is good. Only Pancake is on the dry side.

Waitress is very nice. They all help each other out for tables.

Gorgeous restaurant in Upper East side neighborhood. During Sunday lunch hours, we were able to get a table without waiting. There are both indoor and outdoor seating, and a very beautiful large bar area.

We got pancakes, wings and Patty melt. Pancakes were little dry, wouldn't have nice if they were moist and softer. The wings were on the decent, would have liked that to me moist as well, but the salad and garlic parmesan  sauce were good. The Patty melt was the best item. Really nice toast, with lots of paddy and cheese.

We ordered the blueberry mint lemonade and strawberry milkshake as well. Both were excellent.

Throughout the dining, we had a tough time finding our server, but thankfully other servers were around to help us.

Every time I'm in the area I eat here!! Constantly good
Impossible Burger fan!! Truffle-fries  to die for

Not all sushi is made the same here. It really depends on who is making it. If you're lucky the person who made this plate a few weeks ago, is outstanding!  But most of the time, they don't care too much!  This day was an exception!
This is a pretty cute burger place. They have some nice veggie burger options and they also serve sushi!  The overall ambiance is super nice and their service is also quite good
I now look forward to their Thanksgiving burger every year. A really great and satisfying combo.

Came for happy hour and had a great time! The menu is huge and the restaurant curiously has a pretty fancy looking sushi counter inside (???) but we just ordered off the HH menu this time. My friend and I got $8 frozen watermelon margs, which come with choice of salted or sugared rum. Nothing out of this world (kinda artificially sweet as frozen margs can me), would've loved a mint element to this drink, but this isn't some artisanal organic smoothie shop. The margs were great for a hot summer day and tbh I only had one and was probably a little dehydrated at baseline because I FELT it. We also got an onion ring tower, which came out very quickly and piping hot. It's served with two sauces - blue cheese (ew) and five napkin sauce (my preferred). The onion tower evoked something very nostalgic for me, as I used to indulge in them at Red Robin as a high school orchestra kid in the midwest. These onion rings are battered, not breaded, which is not my preferred, but they're still pretty good. Also service was extremely timely! We got our food and drinks within 5-10 min of ordering.
