Would come back to try more food off the menu, and maybe milkshakes! Apparently their veggie burger is one of the best in the city.

This place is a joke. The food is so mediocre for the price and the portion size is SO small. The so called "jumbo wings" on the appetizer menu are the smallest most shriveled up wings I've ever ordered. It actually hurt my soul to think that 1 of these wings were $2 each... we got the Nashville hot sauce which was super bleh and not flavorful either.

I got the Cali Reuben which again was soo tiny and comes with nothing in addition. The best thing I had was the sweet potato fries which also was not worth...

All in all there's literally no reason why you'd come here bc the food is nothing special, the prices are high, and there's literally a maison's pickles next door that's significantly better.

We were seated upon arrival without reservations at a booth for a table of 4. The milkshake came out first so I was done with it by the time the food came out. It seemed that tables that arrived after us received their meals before we did. The patty melt was good but the Parmesan + truffle fries were my favorite part of the meal.

Delicious food, expensive, terrible service. I sat by myself at an outside table. The burger was delicious, and they have gluten free buns. The burger came with a pickle. The side of fries was good but expensive for the portion size. I ordered a club soda with lemon or lime and it came without either. What really surprised me was how little attention my server paid to me. Maybe it was because I was only one person and  they were busy with more lucrative tables, but I sat for quite a while before anyone noticed I had finished and I had to ask multiple people to help me get my check. I'm certainly aware that everyone has a bad night so I would try this or another location again, but maybe not by myself next time.
My son loves to order the Just Beef burger with crinkle fries. He orders from here several times a week.

No matter how often we go, or the season, or the time - 5 Napkin never fails to please!  Went last Sunday with a 3 generation family group - from 9 to 79 years old.  That's the kind of place it is.  Welcoming, attentive service and the happiest vibe!  We'd been to a matinee, so we arrived at the odd hour of 4PM.  It is a perfect menu for that time.  They even serve a large all-day brunch selection.  
Highlights:  Tuna Poke Bowl over homemade potato chips (amazing), Pattymelt (unctuous), Bacon Cheeseburger (the bacon is actually inside the beef!), fresh, delish Greens & Grains salad, classic Fried Chicken & waffles, yummy Artichoke Spinach and Guacamole dips...and the perfectly crispy Tower of Onion Rings.  Festive cocktails, juices and wine.  The dessert menu looked great, but we were so full - a Carrot Cake was shared and loved by all!

Came here on a Sunday and was lucky to be treated by Michelle the bartender - she was so lovely and warm, welcoming, etc. Truly a fantastic person and should be recognized for that. I'll be trying to contact them separately to let them know bc she genuinely deserves praise.

Michelle's drinks (I got martinis) were fantastic. She was an excellent bartender. Exactly as I wanted them prepared - and I'm picky when it comes to my martinis!!

The food was unfortunately just okay - the fries were good but the boneless chicken wings were bland and I found both of the sauces to be too spicy without much flavor to back them up. With that said, I ordered everything off the happy hour menu so it was like half price.

Would I come back? Def not during regular hours but happy hour sure.
Deilvery was warm and in good condition. Arrived soomer than expected. Delivery guy was actually polite - so unusual these days in ncy.

Their impossible burger is the best one I've had. I crave it all the time, and travel all the way across town for it now that the one on the upper east side has closed. Their house cocktails are also very good, albeit not very boozy but that is sort of typical for restaurants like this that want to cater to every palate. French fries are also good, especially with cheese sauce hehe. If you're a vegetarian and craving a meaty burger I highly recommend the one from 5 napkin!
Great, thick, juicy burgers.. happy to eat here when I'm in the neighborhood. They will accommodate those on a keto diet.

I come here a lot for lunch in the summer because the salads are so filling and refreshing. I'm sure the burgers are great too, but in these temps, the hamburger salad with the grilled salmon on top will fill you to the brim without giving you any meat sweats. Great outdoor seating, very friendly waiters, perfectly cooked fish.

Delicious burgers and vegetarian options.
Quick delivery!  One of our UWS favorites!

Decent spot for burgers. I had the 5N veggie burger, fries, and a black and white malted shake. The veggie burger had good flavor, I enjoyed the sauce they used on it. The fries had nice texture, and I loved the malt flavor in the shake.

Good Margaritas and delicious tacos ..
Shrimp tacos are loaded with guacamole and mix of veggies
A bit spicy ..
very full filling !!
Great food

My son and I came here for his birthday in June of last year. I wish I remembered our servers name, (she's a dancer) but she was great! So friendly, attentive and hospitable, with great conversation. I think we both got truffle burgers  and the drinks were delicious as well. My only disappointment was the brownie sundae. I was expecting way more brownie. Otherwise everything was perfect. I think it's time for another visit
Not worth your time or money. The food is okay, service needs to improve. No one checked on this once our order arrived. Needs better menus and services.

Picked up some takeout the other day and was pleasantly surprised.  

The reviews are all of the place for this location, but it's so convenient being located right on 84th and Broadway, it's right in between my sons apt and my hotel.

Tuna Poke nachos came packed with lots of fresh Tuna, tomatoes, avocado, Hints of fresh lime, ginger and soy sauce it comes in a separate container so the fresh chips don't get soggy.  This dish was surprisingly good.

Roasted Brussel Sprouts take the prize! These were to die for!  Sautéed in a Thai vinaigrette, with peanuts and sprinkled with red chili flakes.  These are totally worth a try.

Everything was packed nicely including silverware and napkins.   The menus pretty extensive for s burger place. A nice choice of good salads, and creative burgers.  I heard the impossible burger is amazing.  I'll be back and the have nice outdoor seating with heaters.
The veggie burger was delicious. The tuna poke was a little bit too salty but also very tasty.  Delivery time was excellent.
Best burgers on the Upper West Side. Perfectly cooked. And the crinkle fries are soooooo gooood. Quite expensive, but definitely worth it once in a while.

Me and my friend visited 5 Napkin Burger in Upper West Side during NY restaurant week. We made a reservation just in case, even though we went on a weekday afternoon. It wasn't busy at all and we were sat quickly. Our waitress was SUPER sweet and attentive. We scanned through the restaurant week menu but preferred the selections on the full menu. We ordered the guac and chips but the guac really wasn't so good. It lacked flavor entirely, especially salt. I ordered the 5N Burger with crinkle fries and it was very good. Kinda dumb that the fries were separate. My friend had the 5N Patty Melt and she enjoyed it. All the drinks we had were great! We had two rounds. I don't really remember the names but I will try to recall. I tried the Rum Swizzle Punch. It came in a cool tiki cup! I believe my second drink may have been the Sparkling Mojito and it was made well! Overall the experience was nice and it's a good place to chill and have a bite.

This is my second time at a 5 Napkin Burger location...

I do not know what it is, but I feel like the burgers are missing a little something! The burgers are just bland.

The service was not there. Guest who arrived after us were greeted and attended to immediately... not us! After I brought it to someone's attention, I was getting better service.... Awkward!!!

The only thing good about this visit was the rum punch... It came in a nice cup. Good job bartender!
I loved the place it's very comfy. The staff was very friendly and attentive . Burgers and Truffle Fries was delicious.
Great food and service. Watermelon margaritas are great. Highly recommend for good burgers

Best burgers!
Never disappoints unless it's not done to perfection but that's never the case.

whenever we go in person they're gracious, supportive, try to be fast if it's really busy and always willing to bring your kids' food first. best of all their menu gets better and more diverse (for me) as my child continues to eat the same meal off the kids menu be it in person or delivered. But a great local place for a meal yiu can always count on.

Friendly service, the food came quickly . The burgers are fantastic!
you can also get something  healthy!
They should call this place Mid-Burger. The décor is nice. But the food is totally mid, barely above Applebees.
lives up to its name, the burgers are very saucy. Looovved the tuna burger and broccoli side
Good burgers.. surprisingly great vegetarian burgers too.  My family are big fans of their food.

Cute place but the food is overly priced and not even tasteful to be the prices they are.  I went to this spot only to waste time until the movie started (since the movie theater is across the street from here) & what a mistake.  I could of just went to get a slice and enjoy that more then here.  I bought onion rings, a patty melt, fries and a cheddar bacon burger..... the total being in the 70's!  That's crazy!

We love the kaleidoscopically vegetal 5 Napkin salad with a perfectly cooked slab of premium tuna. This is perfect food. Needless to say the burgers are beatific. All around culinary satisfaction awaits the seeker of down home vittles. No one does it better in this category.

Staff was nice enough, even though I was brought the WRONG order; 3ventually,manager brought the correct one: " 5 napkin burger". Nothing sp3cial + OVerpriced!

Marketing 5 napkin= presupposes much burger juice anrtico. Anticipated deliciousness  = Not thecase.the case..

​

Honestly everyone hyped up this place and the food was trash like the burgers were not even slightly good. Deff don't come here and for everyone that lied on these reviews YALL really must not have taste buds. Although our service was excellent.
Boujee-esque Burger place (almost diner like feel) with pretty filling meals and shakes that makes up for its higher end pricing. $25 a meal. 3.75/5 stars as a dinner spot.

Wonderful experience! Kudos to the manager, Greg- for first being a great person in general and expecting the same from his team! We ate at the bar, and Michelle made sure we were taken care of 100 percent- I suggested you get the toasted pineapple margarita, those hatch chili fries and the impossible burger! Delicious!!!! I can't wait to go back! Greg.. Texas, loves you! Bless your heart!
Always love eating here! Definitely recommend. Will be sure to come back again real soon!

Who says Monday is the worst day of the week?
Not me! Especially when this Monday kicked off the start of restaurant week in NYC. It's a great time to check out some places that you've had bookmarked for a while at a lesser price. Though some menus are a bit limited I'm sure these something for everyone.

My first stop was 5 Napkin Burger on the upper west side. The restaurant menu option includes your choice out of 10 burger options , a drink and a side of crinkle, sweet potato or corn battered waffle fries for $21 dollars before tax.

I chose the Bacon Cheddar Burger with the Corn batter waffle fries and a lemonade as my drink. Here's a tip mention the restaurant week menu or you will pay full price as it not listed on there website or QR code ordering option. I also ordered the watermelon margarita because it was a hot day.

The drinks came first. The watermelon marg started off good but towards the middle all I could taste was salt so I didn't finish it. The food game out fresh and hot! The burger was cooked just how I liked it medium well and was juicy. Nobody likes a dry burger. I think my favorite part of the meal was the corn battered waffle dries. I've never had it prepared like that and it was crispy and warm. Dare I say better than Chic Fil A fries. I would come back just for those because I couldn't get enough.

Definitely try this place out. I left with a full stomach.
Small burgers. Not as cheesy as I thought it was going to be from an online photo I seen. Wouldn't go back.

So I decided to give 5 Napkin Burger a try today. Upon my arrival i was offered seating immediately but the booth i was brought to was extremely dirty. Food particles on the seat and table I requested to moved. I ordered the brunch chicken egg waffle and 2 for 1 mimosas. When the mimosa's arrived the glasses were dirty with a black smug mark, not even a finger print so that left me wondering what substance could have possibly touched the glass.

When my entree arrived i was a bit more impressed i would definitely give the meal a 10 for taste and presentation. Highly recommended

Overall i give this restaurant 4/5 stars for food and interior design but not cleanliness.

I'd skip this place. Expensive burger that doesn't come with a side and is just okay. Service is a little strange - they tell you to order on the QR code and then as we got everything entered in a server came by to take the order. Better, cheaper burger that comes with fries at George Keeleys a block over.

It was underwhelming experience to say the least. The food portions were quite small for the price; we ordered "jumbo" wings and they were far from Jumbo at the price of $12 for six wings.

The service was great by the servers, however, the hostess lacks common sense. My girlfriend and I went and we were placed at a small table when more than half the tables including most of the booths were vacant. Then thereafter, every other couple was placed at a booth. And to end a not so great evening, as we left the hostess was coming back in from seating someone in the outdoor tables, she nearly attempted to open the door and go through first rather than let my girlfriend and me leave first and hold the door open for us.

Again, service was great by the servers and the busboy, service was subpar by the hostess. Food qas very underwhelming.
Homophonic they made us wait way too long for the rainbow pride cake. Also this bitchy waitress served us but still love the place
Food , Services, Staff, were outstanding .Great Service , Food Delish ! A restaurant you can feel like a local and be comfortable

560 ny

I was back in NY for a quick trip and my first in the the morning was this deli! My favorite on the UWS. I can't believe I'm the first to review.  This is one of the best and cleanest mini-markets / delis in the area.

W 87th & Amsterdam it's always open making the best egg on a roll.  IMO the best in the city.  Coffee is always fresh and hot.  

The inside is spotless offering not only breakfast, deli foods, sandwiches and salads but a full convenience store too.  The cast of characters who are regulars are like an episode of Seinfeld. Total entertainment while waiting for your food. Owners and employees are nice, friendly and helpful.

Great food, great people, great 24 hour deli!

Loved this place when I lived there.

Ice coffee and sausage egg and cheese is a must in the AM.

Great deli cold cuts for any other time of the day.

Has everything you would need from the supermarket.
Deli is permanently CLOSED, this was a very convenient Store for the community to bad it's permanently Closed.
Always open but always busy with really gross people. Owner is very hardworking a good businessman but never wears his mask over his nose/mouth. I hate going in here.

Thanks for being one of the few food places open at 7:30am on a Sunday!

Traditional bodega with hot menu items including a bunch of breakfast sandwiches. Also includes outdoor flower selection.

3 star deli is one of the best store I've been going to for years!! Food is great prices are fair, staff are vary respectful, deliveries are on time, and deli is clean..
Honestly my favorite deli in Washington heights.. so if anyone is in the area stop by and grab something to eat or place an order you won't be disappointed.. oh yeah I forgot the beer are ice cold so grab a six pack while you at it!!

They are awful , get your orders wrong and rude!!!! It took them almost and hour for a delivery 2 blocks away... it was wrong.
I called they said they would deliver another.
I called an hour later and they told me it would be at least another hour for delivery!

I ordered food took forever to be delivered the first time ordering, guy that picked up the phone completely screwed up the order. Someone else called me back to correct the order, when the food arrived it was very good. The next time ordering, I requested another person to take my order since I noticed it was the same gentleman that had messed up my order before, he yelled at me told me there's no one else there and that their not doing deliveries (which was a lie!!!) than he hung up the phone on me. I called back, requested to speak to the manager he than told me there's no manager and hung up on me again. Definitely won't be ordering from this rude, incompetent establishment again!!

I had a BUG floating in my hot chocolate!!! OMGSH I am freaking out. I unwrap this super wrapped up cup of hot chocolate and took a sip only to feel this thick substance going down my throat I look in the cup because it was odd and inside floating in my chocolate was A BUG!! Please people check before you drink or eat. The delivery was on time but the moment I looked in the bag I realized they messed up my order. I had ordered a blueberry and banana muffin and had received two corn instead. I did not complain because I had read the reviews and knew there was a chance in them getting it wrong, but this, a bug in my hot chocolate is just unacceptable. I have a huge phobia of bugs and now here I am sitting wondering if the thick substance that went in my throat, may have been a second one. No one should have to go through that when ordering food. I honestly am so disappointed and disgusted. I will not be ordering from this establishment again but to the owners and workers of the 3 Star Deli Grocery please pay mind, take the correct food safety measures and put more care with the food that you deliver.

Nonna's Pizza lives up to its motto - The Best Hidden Pizza in the Bronx. Now, I'll admit I don't eat pizza frequently, and I'm not often in the Bronx. But this was seriously the best NY style slice of pizza I've had in years. I'm still drooling about it and I finished eating my slice over an hour ago!

1) $3.50 for a huge slice of Supreme
2) Perfectly crunchy bottom crust, chewy in the middle
3) Generous toppings
4) Fresh vegetables - onions, peppers, mushrooms
5) Very little on the orange oil that drips down your shirt
6) Friendly neighborhood service - they're especially nice to the regulars
7) Clean restaurant, bright lighting
8) Seats about 20 people

The name isn't posted outside - it looks pretty nondescript. But the food speaks for itself!

I honestly think between 161-170th in the area of the concourse at least there isn't a better neighborhood pizza shop. There veggie pizza is always good. The crust isn't extra doughy it's exactly what thin crust should be in my opinion.
We I do check them out it's never a disappointment.
Awesome pizza for the area.  Prices can be a little heavy but it's worth it.  Ingredients taste fresh and service is fast.
I called to order. When I gave my address, which is less than a mile according to yelp he said it was too far. I was going to tell him I would pick up but they hung up on me.

I called this place to place a delivery order. I live exactly 1 mile away. In fact this place is next to my closest subway station which I often walk to. I gave him my address which is 167 and Washington and he said too far and hung up. Considering the lack of customer service, I'm glad I didn't get their food. Lack of professionalism and courtesy. Pretty tragic.

Nonna's is quality pizza, and not just for da Bronx. Rivaling not only Arthur Ave, but also downtown and Brooklyn havens, the cheese slice at Nonna's is a classic New York style slice - enough stiffness in the crust to fold, but soft enough for your next bite to drop down. Not too much grease, thin, and sauce that has a sweet and distinct taste. This is not, however, "the best Italian pizza in the Bronx", as the front window proclaims - this classically New York slice is far from true Italian pizza - something that seems to be lost on all Americans...
